reviews.review: Wonderful!. So wonderful to sit at a cafe and people watch! Loved the history and the beauty of this square! A must see and experience while visiting this beautiful city!
A busy spot with lots to see. We enjoyed our time in Old Town since there was so much to see and do. Prague is a beautiful city and old town is the high light.

Great City, Great time for family or Singles. I have been to Prague four times and each time there are things you missed before. Old town is a nice place to stay but normally more expensive than staying in new town or surrounding areas, The Holiday Inn at the convention center is totally reasonable and located within 5 minutes of the Subway station. A few great places to eat near the hotel if you want to get away from hotel food. The hotel has a great breakfast buffet and reasonable cost. Old town everything is very close and walking distance. The one important site to see that you would have to catch a bus or trolley #22 due to the palace is located at the top of the hill and its pretty steep. You can walk down but not advise walking up if you have a family or not in great shape for walking.

Old Town. My husband and I just spent a week in Prague. It was such a beautiful city and great to walk everywhere. The buildings and history around Old Town are wonderful. There are many excellent restaurants, great street vendor food stalls, local pubs and bars, shops, statues and people galore. The weather was perfect and we don't have one bad thing to say. It is truly a beautiful old city.

Great scenery. Don't by food here. Great views and the clock is spectacular. I would recommend that you don't bye and food here. They will rip you off at the food huts as it's done by weight and not the price on the board. The restaurants here are way to overpriced for food and drink. Just go down one side street and you will get better food and drinks at a much better price.

Pavements in Prague. This text is written in English:It's easy getting impressed by buildings and bridges and statues and people and food and drinks while visiting the beautiful city of Prague, my my advise is never to forget looking down.I am talking about the cobblestones.Walking on the pavements in Prage is like walking on pieces of art. The pavements deserve stilettos but that's the last thing you put on your feet when walking around in the streets and the alleys and some places not found on google.On my latest trip to Prague I was talking to some of the real heroes turning the pavements into true art, - they gave me the best souvenir ever, three cobblestones reminding me to stay happy at my primary home in Norway while missing the home keeping quite a large bit of my heart.
Great place to visit when in Prague. A nice place to visit!.. the Astronomical clock is here!.. rings every hour with a mini show!. Go up the tower to get a birds eye view of the square and Prague!

Classic old town. I love the Old Town square. Have visited several times but always venture back. Plenty of restaurants and yes obviously you pay a bit more for the location but it's worth it. If the weather is lovely have your lunch and watch the world go by.

Must visit location in Prague!. The Old Town is a must visit destination if visiting Prague. Packed full of culture and interesting sights - definitely pay to climb the tower as the view of the City from the top is worth it!

Another Must-See while in Prague. Wonderful architecture, shops, views, churches, and the astronomical clock is not only intricate, but very entertaining as well. Again, go there early to avoid the large crowds.
Prague history center. Nice tourist attraction for getting overview about Prague and Czech history. Good connection to more historical tourist assets.

Beautiful city of Prague . Old town is where you want to be in Prague. The buildings are meticulously well preserved and very picturesque. The clock tower gives you a nice panoramic view of old town and is definitely worth the entrance ticket. There are stairs to the top but an elevator is available too. The mechanical clock on the outside rings every hour, you'll know by the way the crowd starts to form as the hour approaches ;)

Take you time to see all those historical and beautifull places.. Too much in 2-3 hours to see. Öots of tourisst in the same place. Try to find the time of the day, whwn it is easier to move there. Note that there are concerts an happenings you may get tickets even the same day.

Amazing Square. What an amazing experience to visit the Old Town. Astronomical Clock is a wonder of its time, all the buildings around the square take you back in time. Grab a coffee, sit outside and soak up the culture that is around you.
Very nice palace. It was very nice and full of tourist, At night was so live and safe place for walking, I liked it so much.

Historic old town. Of the different cities we visited on our trip to Europe, this was probably my favorite. The historic old town actually is an old town with structures that go back hundreds of years. It is easily walkable and there are a few subway stations within walking distance. Nice aerial view of the main square from atop the old townhall. Wish I could have done the townhall tour but it was shut down due to a private event. And of course there is the famous astronomical clock that gets loads of people to watch it every hour on the hour for the moving display of characters.

go for the atmosphere. Old town square is a central hub..meeting place for travel in Prague...views are spectacular in every direction. Make some time to climb the tower, and enjoy some of the best views of Prague.(especially beautiful at night)
Worth the visit. Old world charm. Cobblestone streets, Wear good shoes for support. Tour the museums On green street in the upper levels.

The heart of Prague. The variety of architecture, the clock and the people make a visit to the town square a requirement for any visitor. The variety of architectural styles in Old Town make it a marvelous walk. Remember to look up at buildings while walking carefully.

Beautiful old buildings, the clock tower is a must see. Great area to explore surrounded with many beautiful old buildings. The clock tower is a definite must see and plenty side streets to make you want to explore more.

The heart of Prague. Incredibly beautiful spot, history is in every inch. Lots of tourists at all times though. Make sure that you read about this place or take a tour and you will see how rich your visit will become. Little bit of mystery, do not step on crosses laid in cobblestone, it indicates that someone was executed there, respect the dead.Absolutely recommend to stay till clocks strike any full hour, the clock play is great. Munich clock is better, but it is much younger too. Nice to seat in the restaurants and watch the people, but beware that menu is twice as expensive than ones on the next street.

In old town after many years. Welcome back....it's a great experience for any traveller to visit the old city of Prague, especially, if you up to take on some long walks and explore many of the old structures dated back to medival times...large museums, beatiful river views from the old bridges, many murals to admire...statues to take pictures in front of... and do not forget to taste some local cousine and .Not cheap to visit , but worth to do it , at least once.....Great times
Beautiful architecture!. Absolutely loved the Old Town in Prague. Stunning buildings and plenty of bars and restaurants - of various prices!

very nice although very crowded. This place is very nice but a bit crowded as it is one of the main things all tourists do. once you look past the annoying memes and street artists though you really will appreciate the beauty of the czech architecture, particularly of course the astronomical clock tower.

Beautiful Old Town. Prague old town is very quaint. This really sets you back in time. With the horse drawn carriage taking people around the square. There are great places to eat, listen to music, run and see the clock tower when it chimes .

Beautiful. The square is everything you imagined before visiting. It is beautiful but busy. There are lots of bars and restaurants around the square and it is the ideal starting point The square is the ideal starting point to visit other attractions. The Astronomical clock is also in the square.Lots of booths selling drink and food and horse drawn carriage rides

Beautiful. This part of town is just lovely. Lots to see, churches, the Astronomical Clock, people everywhere. There are lots of cafes where you can sit outside and enjoy the views. Definitely make sure you see it at night as well.

Beautiful old town. The old town would be one of the most beautiful I have visited and very different from many other old towns in Western Europe.The archecture is beautiful and so elaborate and most of the building are in a similar style with most of them painted pastel colours.Great place to wander about.

Historic. beautiful!. This was my 2nd visit to Prague. The city is vibrant and never ceases to amaze.Everything's reachable by foot (depending on how far you're willing to walk). Excellent transportation system - buses, trams, metro.

Astronomical clock, old square, great restaurants dotting the square. Hear the astronomical clock chime every hour, the puppets come out of the open window. its a marvel that the entire clock - a mechanical model - works perfectly. Moonfaces and everything.

A Must See in Prague. Old Town is a must see and an easy walk. Although with many narrow streets and the crowds, it's best to do it first with a tour. We were on a Viking Tour and our guide was excellent. Many churches, squares, synagogues, great old buildings. Remember to look up, as the buildings are really interesting. Even if you get a little lost, mixed up (as we did), it's easy to find your way around by just walking.

A Majestic Beauty Built A Long Long Time Ago. Prague is full of Beauty almost everywhere you go, But Old Town Square just takes your breathe away .Because of all the twists and turns and narrow streets it isn't easy to find for a beginner..we found it on our third try (i asked for directions this time) But wow is the word that comes to mind when we did find it.The Square was surrounded by one building or church that took your breathe away.Its always crowded during the day and there are lots of different tour groups to help you out if you choose.Lots of nice Resteraunts to eat out,So food shouldn't be a problem and every hour a certain clock in the Sq goes off.So allow about 2 hrs to explore all of its splendor

The heart of any visit to Prague. This is the old town square and is a site of 360 degree Gothic architecture statues and memorials. Beheadings in front of the town hall are marked by crosses in the pavings. Churchs including the famous astrological clock which on the hour has some moving parts. The square is busy all day but in particular the area in front of the clock is always blocked on the hour by tourist groups. Take a seat in an outdoor cafe adjacent to the clock 5mins before the hour and order a coffee and watch from there.

Best part of Prague. I believe if you are thinking about visiting Prague, it's impossible to miss this part of the city and most likely it will be also the only part you'll actually visit. In Staré město (=Old Town= Prague 1= City centre) you find almost all sightseeing places you would like to visit very close to each other so there is no need to use public transportation once you get there. You can enjoy Old Town Square and its beautiful astronomical clock+ 2 churches there, cross Charles Bridge and get to Prague castle, Petřín hill etc... Enjoy your time! Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in the world!!

Many people!. Very crowded, especially on the hour when the Astronomical Clock does its thing. Many small streets to meander around the Old Town. Great bar, Black Angel, located in the basement of the Prince Hotel
Old town Prague . The astronomical clock is a must see when in Prague, Tyn Church is beautiful just across the square.
Lovely. A fantastic old town with a huge amount of interesting features, culture at every corner but beware, it's different at night.

Such a beautiful city. It is not for nothing that the city is nicknamed Golden Prague. Not for its glitter but for beauty. To absorb all that old town of Prague offers, at least several days or a week is necessary. But even a day or two walking in its narrow lanes, admiring old houses (including the smallest house of Prague on Anezska street), churches, open and hidden squares, tasting beer, coffee, trndeliks or anything other of what numerous cafes and restaurants can offer, will make the travel to Czech capital unforgettable. The only problem is that, apparently, half of the rest world thinks same, judging by the numbers of tourists.

Every bit as good as the publicity. I've been visiting Prague since the 1970s. There have been quite a few changes in that time, but one constant is the magic of this wonderfully preserved old city. The Old Town retains the feel of a truly old place and recent renovations have been undertaken tastefully and carefully in order to preserve this gem. There are a lot of pedestrianised streets, but traffic does still use the city, so one needs to be cautious. Stout shoes are a must to handle the cobbled streets. A bit of patience also comes in handy, as tourists flock to the city highlights, and walking tour groups abound. If you can get out and about before 10am, there are fewer people on the streets and the city is more peaceful. one caveat - Prague has become a bit of a party place for tourists, and things can get a bit exciting at night-time. Give any revellers a bit of space, and there's no trouble. The public transport (trams) run in the wider streets and are regular, clean and cheap. Don't even think about bringing a car into the centre of the old town! It's compact enough to walk, with the trams as a backup if need be. Visit. It should be on everyone's bucket list.

Fell in love with Prague. The center is beautiful, everything is clean and restored. Very charming. We went at the end of the year were still some leftovers of the Christmas markets were present which only added to the atmosphere.
non-stop views and history in very direction. Prague is beautiful. prepare for cobblestones. every step you take will be on them! leave your high heels at home!
Prague. The square is full of history from the execution of Jan Hus, Kafta's home, architectural significant buildings, the astronomical clock, cafes and street performers. .

What a beautiful place!. This square is mainly from the 14th though 18th century, and everywhere you look is something beautiful and colorful. The astronomical clock was entertaining with figures coming out of doors every half-hour and rotating around. There is a memorial statute in the square, which is charming in itself with cobblestones and buildings of every design and color. It is totally pedestrian which is great for walking around. There are plenty of good restaurants and cafes lining the square, including some great pastry stops!

beautiful old section of Prague (Praha). This portion of the city is just amazing to walk around, for hours, and discover so many cafes, restaurants, churches, museums, and marketplaces to visit. We spent two and half days in the old city and could have spent even more time to explore this section of the city because the atmosphere was truly charming old world.

Historic. The old town of Prague is up there among the best I have visited across Europe. It is steeped in history and culture as well as the odd street performer. A series of narrow streets all lead to/from the Old Town Square.The old town square can be used as a central point to plan visits to surrounding attractions. It gets very dark at night though...

Lovely location but too crowded. The Old Town is a must if you're visiting Prague but like a lot of tourist sites it is spoiled by the sheer number of visitors. The Astrological Clock is an amazing sight and people watching from one of the many bars is great fun. Don't let the volume of people deter you - it's a great place to visit.
It's looks like it straight out of a fairy tale. Such wonderful landmarks to visit and you can walk or take the tram everything is just minutes away from each other
nice place. It is a beautiful place in prague. You will find a few street artists, a lot of restaurants, pubs, etc., and some stalls. If you go to prague, go there.
Plenty of place to see. Plan your visit ahead, cause there so many places to see. Though its October, Prague is full of tourists.

#1 Place to Visit. Love the Old Town Square! This place is definitely on the short list. Great architecture, shopping, restaurants and history. Love the astronomical clock and be there on the hour to watch the show. It can get very crowded in the square so try to visit early in the day. The evening is great with the lights and performers in the street. Sit down and enjoy a cafe or cocktail in the square to really take in the culture and ambiance.

One of best in Europe. It's all been said in previous reviews, if you like architecture, quaint streets and alleyways, some of the best restaurant prices in Europe (not in euro so great for Brits) you'll love Prague. Definitely "a bucket list city".

Full of Life. Old town square is typically European with cobbled streets and old mansions. All the life of Prague rests at the old town square with quaint cafes, souvenir shops and the eating places. The whole area can be covered on foot all the way to the beautiful charles bridge. All the sight seeing tours start from here, and as usual atleast one walking tour is a must. Abundance of Pork and pork knuckles. Be careful of money changers and the taxi drivers at the train station. Find out the approx fare before you try and negotiate with one.

must visit. Visited the old town of Prague last Christmas. At that time of the year you can find there a huge Christmas market, lost o typical winter drinks and foods, as well as lots of crafts. Lovely walk and time spent there.

Great place . Loved it lots to see and do plenty of people. Plus be careful when buying food from stalls with cocked bacon on spit it goes by weight charged me 900 koruna for somthing I did not want. But other than that it is a charming city with lots to see and do. Will be coming back in future as they say in SLAN go foil. Goodbye for now.

Historical, Old Charm and Beautiful!. Old Town is the most beautiful city in Europe with its architecture spanding across generations. Tightly packed city with two town squares to visit, Old Town Square and Wenceslas Square. One of my favorite cities.

Food, vendors, astronautical clock and beggars . This is a busy place most of the afternoon and evening. There are vendor stands selling all sorts of trinkets, outdoor restaurants, various acts (musical, jugglers, mimes, etc) and the famous astronomical clock that chimes every hour on the hour between about 9am and 9pm.

Fabulous. We have been fortunate, over about 25 years, to visit many wonderful and/or interesting cities.Budapest, Paris, New York, Boston, Venice, Rome, Dubrovnik and more.In my view Prague is the most stunning of them all.We stayed only 3 nights and it should have been at least 7.The history, architecture, people, sights, restaurants ..... A privilege to have had the opportunity to visit.

A must do!. Quite simply - a must do. Thats why you go to Prague so really a no-brainer. We caught trams to and from but area is very walkable. Trams cheap - get a daily pass but validate it or else - we were checked daily!
Amazing in everyway.. Very crowded, but not oppressive. Feels very safe, and lots of fun. Architecture is totally amazing. A fabulous place to people watch.

Beautiful area and fantastic restaurants . In town on business and looked forward to walking through Old Town each evening. The restaurants were wonderful. The view in the evening is spectacular. Every night I found new places to browse and shop.
Amazing city!. Beautiful city, great views and sights! Full of architecture and culture! Highly recommend a visit!!

amazing old town. our tour guide who was terrific in explain the history of the old town of Prague and pointing out the history of the Czech Republic. The city of Prague was more than I expected in architecture and history

Gorgeous views around every corner. What can I say? The old town dates back to 800 AD and is full of great sights. It is very crowded during the day, but once the sun sets the tourists clear out and it is amazingly open and scenic. Lots of bars, restaurants and hotels all in walking distance. Great atmosphere and evening lighting as well.

Go often, still plenty to see and do. We go to Prague often, 4 times a year. There is still new things to see and do in Old Town. Every day is a good day as long as you try the Kozel beer. Have a walk around, check out the outdoor market for souvenirs, try the Beer Museum on Dlouha then have bit of Honey Cake (Medovnik) on the way back to your hotel.

Interesting. we walked through old town and there are plenty of places to see. Old Town Hall, Charles Bridge. St Nicholis Church(free). Nice just walking around but watch out for locks trying to sell you old Russian currency, Use the legal exchange places to exchange money...not the street people.

The most amazing trip. I could hang out in this square all day. From the candy shops, to the crystal, to the pastries, and last but not least, beautiful architecture. I learned a lot from listening to people on the streets providing tours. It's so much to take in. The clock tower was so wonderful to see. You could easily spend some time here. They offer buggy rides and a lot of other tours that happen right in the square. Don't forget to check out the underground city!

Pretty as a Picture. You can take a Tram 22 to Charles Bridge and stroll all the way through the little streets to the Old Town Square, to the Yellow Metro line. Beautiful little shops all the way and Restaurants all the way.

Beautiful. Prague is an absolutely stunning town and a must see on everyone's list. The only shame is the amount of tourists that now flock to this city and the overabundance of similar shops catering to them. This however does not detract from the beauty of the old town.

Historic pulse of Prague. Even if you are in Prague for a day or two, you should plan to spend few hours walking around the old town. Beautiful buildings with historic significance and amazing street food. And many key attractions, such as the astronomical clock, Charles Bridge, few museums etc. are in walking distance.

This is exactly what you saw on Rick Steves!. International crowd roaming the old streets. Quaint restaurants with patios to sit and eat local and Italian food and (sausages of course) with plenty of choices of cold delicious beer.

Amazing buildings, but best to avoid the touristy parts. The old town has some of the most amzing architecture that you will see anywhere and it is beautiful. At the same time, it is like thre are a variety of good and bad within a few minutes walk of each other. The old town square is very touristy and not very appealing. Then a few blocks over is an interesting jewish section of the city, a blocks from that there are the same high end shops you will find in paris and New York and then some of the smaller streets have amazong pubs and restaurants.

Overpriced . Oh dear, had I not been jet lagged and in full command of my faculties It would have been a lot harder to prise the equivalent of 15quid from my sticky palms for a sausage and piece of bread served with a weird tasting potato bacon dish and a pint of Prague's finest lager. Enjoy the architecture but avoid the fast food merchants and eat slightly off the central square.

Old town. Old town is a beautiful blend of archetectural styles. I love going there on every visit to Praha. The towers, churches and fountains add to the atmosphere. During fall often times there is the harvest festival and live music

The Heart of Prague. If you have seen Vienna, Paris, and Rome then Prague might be the next on your list.Prague is as beautiful as the Old Town can get, and to miss it would be missing Prague.It is a succession of narrow streets, churches, museum, reminders of a rich history but also of restaurants, eateries of all kind, pubs, pubs and more pubs where Beer is tasty ... and cheap.This is the place where you start your walk to the Castle or the other magnificent quarters of the city, and of course to Charles Bridge ...Actually you have might not that much of a choice ...Because you are there :-)You can take a look at some of the many pictures I have attached to see what I mean ...You're in Prague ... so go, walk and visit it ... It is not by chance that it is rated the Number 1 attraction in Prague.

Breath taking and very historic.. A must see if you travel to Prague.The restaurants on the square are wonderful. Make sure to go and see the Tyn Cathedral in the center. The Astronomical Clock was the most fascinating part of the square.

Don't miss this. Charming heart of prague. The old town square in the heart of Prague is a tourist pedestrian zone. It is lined with wonderful shops and restaurants and key attractions. It is just a few yards from the powder tower and features the old Town hall with the astronomical clock. The top of the town hall tower offers wonderful views of the old city and even Prague castle. Don't forget to visit the tyn church and take n an evening concert there.
Very pretty. This was a great place to visit and enjoyed going to the top of the old town hall tower to get a great view!
Beautiful. Old town Prague is gorgeous, lots to see and amazing history. Great market in the square, beautiful food to enjoy.
took a cab. way up on top of the hill...walked back piece of cake . beautiful and historic and breakthtaking views of the city below

Awe Inspiring Prague. I cannot stop thinking about how beautiful Old Town Prague is every corner you turn brings another beautiful castle or church or city square or view of the bridges on the Vlatva river..this city is a fairy tale for adults, you must take a guided tour of the city, and a cruise on the river go to the Jewish quarter ,eat at the market in the New town very good street food...Live the Fairy tale...enjoy.

Pudding and coffee. As the title suggest pudding and coffee was had! Apple strudel is to die for if you love desserts as much as myself..... Plenty of cinnamon for those who indulge in that powdery goodness. Then you can wash it down with a lovely hot chocolate as my friend did or a classical cappuccino like myself. Ideal place for a warm beverage while you people watch on the square.

A human zoo!. I had been to Prague in 1991 and had very positive experience with this crown jewel of Prague. It is a historic square with magnificent buildings and statues. However, this time, the place was just mobbed by tourists, and it was October, not summer. There were numerous tour groups being herded by leaders carrying umbrellas, a bunch of folks on Segways zooming around, a number of Japanese ladies getting photographed, several American tourists taking selfies, and even a Hare Rama Hare Krishna group singing and dancing along. If you are in people watching, this was fine, but for appreciating a historic place, it was less than satisfactory.

Bustling Prague. Old town is windy streets, beautiful buildings and churches, along with lots of tourist shops. What I enjoyed most was the variety of architecture from so many eras. What surprised me most was the number of tourists there. Once out of the main highlights, the crowds do thin out.

Beautiful old city! Remarkable!. Great place for walking, shopping, eating and drinking. So many beautiful places to see that you will be be constantly taking pictures. Take time to step away from your phone or camera. Don't miss the clock show at the top of each hour. (Watch for pickpockets during the short show). Great place day or night!

Loads to see.. This place is absolutely amazing and you'll never tire of looking at all the beautiful buildings. The astronomer's clock, St. Nicolas' church and Church of Tyn are all worth a visit, and when you need a rest there are plenty of restaurants and cafes to choose from. The square is lit up beautifully at night and it's usually bustling with street entertainers and stalls selling 'trdenik', a very tasty sweet bread rolled in sugar.

Wonderful history. The town squares in European cities are so very interesting. A great way to meet people, chat, take in the local flavor, dine, people-watch over coffee, etc. We never miss visiting the town squares.
very cool. Must see this place. A hub of activity and great architecture. Lots of good people watching. Arrive half past the hour to get a good spot to see the Astronomical clock in action.

One of Europe's true gems. A major European capital for over 1,000 years, Prague may not be at its height as an international power centre, but its historic glories remain largely intact. Justly famous for it's splendid art and architecture, and distinctive house signs, even the mosaic sidewalk pavings are magnificent.

An experience. This place has got some absolutely unique charm. Could spend entire day around in the square just gazing amd admiring the streets, buildings, architecture etc. This place is full of tourists and people performing all sorts of activities.
Heart of Prague. All the ways end in to old square. Unique place with a panorama view. Being cautious about Segway guides you can enjoy real feeling of a historic place.

It is like stepping back in time. Narrow cobblestone lanes seem to go in all directions from old Town Square, which is the Centre of Old Town or Stare Mesto. Some of the landmarks in Old Town are the Astronomical Clock, the Old Town hall, Church of our Lady Before Tyn with its Gothic Spires and St. Nicholas Church. The old buildings are amazing, just wander around and lose yourself in this old medieval City. Or sit down in one of the many restaurants / coffee shops and soak in the vibe over a coffee or a very tasty Czech beer! But be aware, there are always huge crowds. If you want to avoid these, you have to go very early in the morning. It was our first trip to Prague, but we will definitely be back.
Go off season. Unbelievably crowded in September 2016. Boat trip up the river wasn't worth it. Don't keep your valuables in front or rear pockets.

Culture up the wazoo!. We were in Prague last January, and found ourselves, every day, wandering through old town and it's stores. The architecture, including the castle, and the clock are amazing. Everything else outside of Old Town is rather plain and "communist" looking...very ordinary and almost "dark." But Stare Mesto is wonderful! Colorful (even in winter) and full of things to do, especially eating, drinking, and shopping. Occasionally you can find an interesting "museum" to visit.

Best of Prague. My favourite part of Prague. Beautiful architecture from many different artistic movements. Lovely restaurants, shops and bars. The tower in old town square has fantastic views. The church's are lovely and everything is easy walking distance from each other. Prague at night is like a fairytale. Just beautiful

A two square mile museum.. My 21st trip to Europe over thirty plus years and there is no other city one can enjoy so much just walking around. Shops, street vendors, small, quaint eating and drinking places where one can usually get a pint of the world's best for less that two dollars. Every building is a masterpiece of the architecture of centuries ago. We bought unlimited three day tram/metro passes for $12 each. Easy to navigate and you can just hop on and off at will. We use #9 to Weceslas Square and it runs every three minutes all day.

So much to do, need another trip. Have been here before but this was a wonderful renewal. How can one "review" one of the geographical and cultural centres of the European land mass? Beautiful, fascinating.

Interesting area. Old town has many, many stores and restaurants and of course lots of touristy shops as well. Great for wandering around and grabbing a hot wine while checking out the establishments and architecture.

A busy spot on the hour beside the clock.. This is a busy popular spot, particularly so when the clock does its display on the hour. Lots to see in the area, buildings, sculptures, people, ice cream. The cafes are not too expensive in the square and we enjoyed a cold drink whilst people watching. The walk to the Charles bridge and the river is a nice stroll from the old town square.
Crowded. This was a must since it encompasses the charm, but be aware that no matter what time you go it will be crowded.

Must see but much construction. The famous clock should be seen but the square is mainly restaurants and street vendors, entertainers. The side streets have nice shopping but a bit pricey. Lots of plaza repairs so crews were everywhere. Fifteen. Inutes should do it unless you have a bite to eat.

Just go see it!. Beautiful.
Medieval gothic style building in the middle, clock tower on the other end, beautiful old European buildings on either end, absolute magical feel.
fabulous. fabulous, love the old buildings and the way they hve been maintained, very clean, love the food and drink stalls around the square
Atmospheric. Old Town Square houses the famous Astronomical Clock which is a "must see" Lovely cobbled square with cafes and shops.
Great. We had a great stay in Prague. The architecture is amazing. The Prague castle looks beautiful at night.

Spacious. Crowded.. Always crowded with tourists. Surrounded by loads of stores and eateries.
A "must-see" place in Prague.
good pork in the old town. nice streets witha lot of people .police are around and a lot of street artists .we ahd avery good time wandering around
Amazing Architecture. A little crowded in September but still worth the visit. The architecture is breathtaking. We wandered for hours and were never disappointed.

A must see in Prague. When in Prague i definitely suggest you find your way to the old town square and just hang out for a while. Choose a nice outdoor restaurant and have a coffee and dessert. Sitting across from the old clock, which is the main attraction of the square will increase the cost of your drinks and food by approximately 150%.....but maybe its worth it! :). This place can get crazy and crowded with tourists at times, but provides adequate historical intrigue and interesting people watching when only moderately busy.

Beautiful Prague. You can't complete your visit to Prague without visiting the Old Town. The Astronomical Clock is definitely something you don't want to miss (especially as it chimes every hour), and the square itself is just lovely when you are into people-watching, or just ogling at beautiful buildings.

Impressive Architecture and Must Visit. Having visited a number of European cities and town squares this must rank amongst the most impressive. Wonderful surroundings and buildings. Plenty going on and very (very) busy. Great to grab some Czech 'fast food' from the many stalls....very tasty. Wash down with a good beer.
Beautiful. Last time i was here was 20 years ago. Apparently they have started to clean up, repaint and maintain these beautiful buildings. And what a difference. Just beautiful! Highly recommended!

Nice buildings. Imagine walking through a crowded market. That's what its like in Old Town Prague.1000's and 1000's of tourists at any single moment. Prices reflect the fact that most customers are tourists. Not the place to go with a bladder problem as all the toilets are charged for even in places where you have already bought coffee and food. First time I ever saw a pay turnstile on a McDonalds toilet! I don't want to say that tourists are ripped off but you do get that feeling. Having paid to go up the town hall tower you then have to pay again to visit the cellars. Pay again to see an exhibition of Lithuanian photography and pay again to use the toilets. In the evening street vendors appear selling the most gorgeous sausages and roast pork. But again be warned. The advertised price is per 100gram not for the portion you are given. My portion weighed in at nearly 500gram and cost nearly 20 euros. I spent three days mostly in and around old town and that's more than enough to last.

The Town of 'Wow'. Old Town is just a lovely place to visit. Full of beautiful old buildings, lots of shops and restaurants. Easily walkable, you can wander around enjoying the sights. There are also food stalls in the square selling traditional Czech food and beer. Everywhere we looked there was something to look at. We also enjoyed a walking tour, on which we learned a bit about the history of Prague.
Stayed in Old Town. Great area to stay; plenty of restaurants to chose. Walking distance to Old Town Sq., Main Train Station

Wonderful place. Prague is a wonderful city! Specially if you walk around the city centre you can see many wonderful buildings and many bars and terraces to enjoy a beer. I recommend to take a camera with you because it is very beautiful.

Crowded but still a great city. Even in October the streets of the old town were very crowded.Despite the crowds, this is well worth a visit. There are so many beautifulbuildings and when you need a rest, there are lots of restaurants andpavement cafes, where you can relax over a coffee or one of the excellentCzech beers. The variety of small shops add to the pleasure of visiting theOld Town. However, prices are better if you walk down some of the littleside streets. We were looking for some of the blue cut glass and were offeredmuch better discounts when we moved out of the central area.We found the astronomical clock, but it was a bit less impressive than expected.However, the main square and the Tyn church were well worth the visit.
free guided walk. We did a free guided walk with a Czech called Gavi. He was informative and interesting. A good way to see the city and learn about its history and culture
Great beer. Be careful, some places are expensive. Try to find a local to show you best places. Beer was truly amazing.

Picturesque. The architecture and the atmosphere is amazing. Full of surprise in walking through alleys, arcades, and streets. We talk several hundred colorful pictures. The walk toward Charles Bridge is enjoyable and that bridge is a must see.
Old Town. A must for visiting Prague, there is considerable history here. Very old churches as well as Albert Einstein's residence.

A must see.. A must see. Do yourself a favor and go here early. Plus, come back at night. The square is lighted and well worth the visit at night. The police are always near, not that I ever felt the need for them. Plus, all the performers were entertaining.

Quaint winding streets. This area is filled with winding streets, little shops, restaurants and ice cream shops. It is easy to get lost if you don't know where you are going so make sure you know the names of the streets you need to get back to your hotel. I think Karlova is a main street through the Old Town. There are little squares and it is pleasant to stroll through the area.

Really Nice Square. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit here as its the hub of Prague. It has a load of restaurants, the Astronomical Clock as well as all the spires from the Cathedrals. We went down nighttime and the place was heaving and what a delight to see no drunkards but everyone having a good time

fabulous place to watch the world go by.. This is an exciting place to sit and watch the people. There are plenty of eating places with outside tables to have a meal or just coffee. Up the little side streets there are hundreds of shops for local fair or souveniers. There is a great shop full of marrionettes that is just near the square. In the squaree you will find the astronomical clock. There are lots of buskers.

Europe's top 5. Old town of Prague is probably the best, or among top 5 preserved medieval city centers in Europe.The buildings and their layout are majestic. On the main square and around, you can notice Gothic, Renesaince, Baroque, Art Noveaux,...all perfectly mixed, with renovated facades, hard to tell which is more beautiful.Countless cafes and restaurants, great atmosphere, safe....the only odd is naturally...huge, very huge crowds of people.Make sure you visit it at night time also.
Underground tour. There is a tour of the city under the square. Entry from the astronomical clock and it's reasonably priced.
Don't Miss This Experience. Great walking area with nice shops, food stalls and restaurants. Go early to avoid the crowds. Lots of little shops that are unique but on the pricey.

An architectural playground . There are days and days of things to see and do here. It took us a while to find some places because of the narrow winding streets, but once we figured the ways out , all was easy. The architecture is amazing. The churches were gorgeous. The synagogues were beautiful and at times deeply moving in their honor of the victims of the Holocaust. The city square is a treasure with THE clock, the tower, old city hall, important museums, and more. Restaurants abound. Wow.

Definitely a must see but careful of fraud money changers. Lovely vibrant Prague culture! Buildings filled with lots of history and beauty. Amazing city! Avoid changing money with people offering lower rates outside the money changer.. they give u other currencies that have almost no value- cheats!! And the locals know about it! Where is the law! Should have read carefully previous posts on this!! Lesson learnt!

Historical town square with the astronomical clock. Old Town Square is a historic square in the Old Town quarter of Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. It is located between Wenceslas Square and the Charles Bridge. The astronomical clock is a big attraction among the tourists

Like from a fairy tale, but with a lot of tourists.. The old town is really pretty, especially at night. It is quite crowded, but if you ignore all the tourists, you can see how beautiful the place really is.
Fairytale spires. Wonderful trip back in time and so quirky. Really popular place for the tourists, but a total must-see when staying here.

Spend as much time as you can. Walking around the old town is an amazing experience. Restaurants galore, shops and bars as well. A chance to experience the old Czech culture and great Czech food in many of the restaurants. Take your camera and many photo opportunities will present themselves.

Beautiful Square where all the action is. You can't help but love this beautiful square. Right in the center of old town where the astronomical clock is located. You can sit in one of the many restaurants and people watch, have a cheap Thai foot massage, shop, it's endless

Transport. Great transport system, easy to move around.You must validate the ticket,if you don't know,you will be fine 800czk even you have bought a 3 days ticket and only stay in Prague for 3 days! The transport officers and police officers are the worse l have ever encounter as a tourist!
Beautiful old town. One of the nicest parts of Prague, great for an afternoon stroll and with many nearby attractions to explore.

Old Town-Full of fun & culture. I have taken the Old town tour organized through my hotel. I must stay this is the most fantastic visit one would feel in Prague. There are so many place to see, most interestingly Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn, Astronomical Clock, Powder Tower & many Synagogue.

Becarefull . Just be shure when you start on this adventure. You have to have a litle condition and no hart problems. The stars are long and going up or down from the up to the down Town. Is really nice to do it.

Beautiful Romantic City. The old city of Prague provides so many beautiful attractions to the tourist. It's a very colorful city, clean and exciting to walk along with short distances between the attractions. A very lovely livable atmosphere.

Beautiful Prague. The place was crowded with tourists all over the place. Groups can be seen taking pictures, walking, sitting and chatting, or plainly standing and looking in awe of the mind blowing splendid Prague. The buildings and its old, unique and spellbounding structural design were a sight to behold. Its a safe place to roam around even at night.One of the best place worth a 2nd or more staycation.
Beautiful and crowded. It was very nice to sit outside at a restaurant, covered, and people-watch, with pivo and a good meal!

Always Fabulous Square. Old Town Square is a great place to wander, haver a meal or contemplates the history of this beautiful city. So much to see and learn just in this one area, both from medieval history through WWII to the present.
Wonderful historic area. We just wandered round this area of Prague simply to soak in the atmosphere and, of course, take plenty of photos!
History everywhere you look. A must visit on any trip to Prague! History everywhere you look. Anyone with even a passing interest in history or architecture will love it.

amazingly beautiful. Old town is like the soul of Prague - Amazing architecture , lovely restaurants and cafes , cute little shops . One cannot stop falling in love with this place. It was amazing to just be there and keep walking on the lovely cobbled lanes or sit in cafe sipping wine
SUMMER FUN. This place would be great to go to during summer time, pubs everywhere and if you are a photographer, you have a lot of great structures that you can take pics, specially at night!

Prague was the highlight of our Central European holiday. And Old Town was the heart of Prague. We spent hours wandering through the streets, many shops, coffee shops, restaurants, buskers on the Square. Just so much to see.
Old Town. There were lots of old architecture with lots of interesting history. I was impressed by how clean the place was.
Impressive! . Old Town is the heart of Prague. Narrow streets with charming small shops and plenty of restaurants with incredible good food!
Old Town is beautiful. Even though you have to work your way through the streets and people, Old town Prague is worth every step. Just Magnificent at every angle!
amazing plaze . this is one of the most popular place in Prague, it's absolutely amazing and suggestive!! really good tour to do in this and amazing story!

The heart of the city. Similar to other main squares in Europe you will find a number of the city main attractions here including the Astronomical clock, and Jan Hus Memorial to name a few.You will also find many bars and restaurants and of course hundreds of tourists. Best time to visit is 8.30am to 9am as the square will be almost empty and you can enjoy what it has to offer whilst watching the place come alive.Only a few minutes away you will also find the Estate Theatre with the Commendatore Statue and the Powder Tower. For those of you who like to shop the Palladium shopping centre with its 200 stores is also only 5 minutes away. So where ever you are the Stare Mesto side of the river the square is never far away so acts as the perfect place to gain your directional bearings, and of course offers plenty to see and do.

Beautiful City, worth a visit. It was my first time in Prague in October '16 and I was staggered of that city. We only stayed there for three days but there are so many different things you can do there. I will be back soon :-P

Beautiful historical spot. I came to Prague in August for the first time and I was amazed by its beauty and deep history. This square was one of the most beautiful places in Prague and unfortunately it was very crowded. That's why I give only 4 stars. If you come here, make sure to come on time to see the clocktower. It is good to take a tour because you learn a lot more about the city than if you just wander around. I took a segway tour and it was nice

Picturesque area of Prague but too crowded with tourists. This a lovely area of Prague- no question about it. When we were there in July, however, the place was practically constantly crowded with huge tourist groups and their guides, Segway tours, religious groups, etc. I'm not saying you shouldn't visit it but you should know what you are getting into, especially at busy times of the year and day. We found it most pleasant early in the morning. Prague has many other beautiful areas that are less touristy.
Good place. Good place to visit and you can walk. Take map from hotel and you should be able to visit all these places

Enchanting . Old Town is enchanting , packed with little streets full of stores, cafes, souvenir shops and little boutiques. Have dinner at one of the open air cafes where you can have the most amazing stroganoff! It gets crowned so wear comfortable shoes to stroll around!

Lovely Prague . One of the nicest cities in Europe, Prague is always perfect to be visited. Maybe a plus would be arround the winter holidays :)Many locations with great buildings architecture, perfect for romantic visit. Also good place for beer drinkers and meat eateries.
Lovely. This is a lovely place. It is good to just wander around taking everything in. The shops,cafes and the buildings.

guided tours are excellent -- but get there early!!!. Learned ALOT on guided tour. Took guided walking history tour of Old Town -- the main emphasis was WW11. Wonderful tour with pictures of events as they happened -- and what we were seeing today.

A picture perfect square very nice. It gets very busy but well worth going early in the day less crowded
Tin church well worth a visit and you must see the clock

Didnt want to leave this beautiful area. ,Would recommend Prague to everyone, so much to do and see, Lots of walking involved, but weather in Sept/Oct was 22 degrees and blue skies and l lovely. Good time to visit

Lovely place to stay. Best place to stay to explore Prague,lots of bars and restraunts,lots of hustle and bustle around the square but lots of quiet side streets to meander down to escape the melee,the old bridge is beautiful,especially at night.
Beautiful!. There's not much to say, other than this is maybe the most beautiful city I've ever been to. It's well worth the trip!
History. Prague is history from the moment you arrive till you leave. I wish to walls could talk so they could tell me more.

Great area with so much to see and do. Old town is a great looking area with plant to see. From the statues, the towers and the people, you can easily spend a few hours here. Food - there are plenty of food stalls and restaurants around. Great tasting but be weary of prices. I got a sausage and bread with drink for 120czk while my friend got pork with bread for 550czk. Atmosphere - bustling with tourists and people trying to sell you things. Great for photos but if travelling with a group, expect to be approached by promoters of Segway rides, pub crawls and other little tours. We actually witnessed the pub crawl promoters fighting over business which was shocking. Tip: watch out for pick pockets, we noticed a few people standing near the food stalls watching other people's pockets and bags.
interesting architecture. Dont be frightened to stop and have a drink or meal here -its not cheap by the rest of the city standards but its not rome or paris prices either.

Traditional, beautiful and magic!!. I visited Prague in November and it was a great experience. The Old Town is a MUST if you visit Prague. Traditional and so beautiful with the big square and the nice bars and restaurants around. It is always full of tourists.
Lots to see and worth a visit.. Although the Square is busy you can take photographs easily, the architecture is lovely and the Clock well worth a visit.

Beautiful. It was such a picturesque place - I was honestly gobsmacked as I looked around for the first time! Just beware of the restaurants in the immediate square, they're very overpriced. Explore the backstreets for fabulous beer and food at a reasonable price.
Perfect old town. We love the atmosphere this place has. Definitely one place to visit when traveling in Europe. The people are friendly and the helpful
Beautiful . A must. Old classical buildings, plus good food, souvenirs, tours. Nice Place to take nice pictures, and to feel in Europe.
So interesting and lots to look at.. Early in the day is the best time to start sight seeing, less people around and more chance of securing a seat on the Hop on Hop off buses.
Nice Plaza. very busy, safe and nice open space. If you have time to relax and sit and chill, just go here. Very nice and picturesque. Night and Day

Beautiful. It's so worth the time in the square - you have to see it, but don't spend too much time there as there are so many other things to see within minutes. I would highly recommend going a group walking tour
A walk in Prague is a walk in history.. We walked everywhere. Every time we turned the corner there was a beautiful old building with a wonderful story.

Fantastic Historical Place!. We only got to spend one day in this area so we just barely scratched the surface. There is so much to see and do that you could easily spend a week here. Make sure you plan enough time for this area.
Bucket List. Prague is a city that is a must visit at least once . The people the food the views are just amazing.

Unforgettable place. What else is there to add to numerous reviews of Prague's Old Town? It is one of the most beautiful sites in Europe. You can go up the Old Town Hall to see the view of the square and take numerous pictures of the city's view. Don't forget to see the Astronomical Clocks which are fascinating. The place itself is like the heart of the city and standing there you can feel its life pulsing. Absolutely wonderful and unforgettable.
Stunning architecture. The Old Town is a mecca for tourists but the architecture, cafes, bistros, shops and clock tower are all worth seeing.
Very nice place to check out. This is main tourist spot in prague. It worth to check out to see astronomical clock and St. Vitus Cathedral. There is alot of souvenir stores and restaurants on square.

Epicenter of touristic Prague!. This is the place where you can admire Prague architecture. This is what makes Prague so unique. You can sit in a cafe or restaurant and just watch people go by and you can have the highlight of your trip!
prettier at night. pretty during the day but prettier at night. enjoy watching the clock tower do its 20 second show every hour, but read about it first so that u can make sense of it

Busy, crowded, but fun!. Beautiful restored/ original area. Full of tourists. Many to see the astrological clock and visit church there. Many entertainers. Fun to watch. Great place to get lunch or a coffee and people watch
Beautiful Place. You can sit back in the square, relax & enjoy the so many restaurants and pubs there in the square. Nice place to enjoy the evenings.

Energy boost of old and young!. A fantastic old town preserved at its prime!Everything is walking distance, scattered with great street music performers, traveller groups mixed with loving couples, young mixing with elders.Besides all the beautiful landmarks, sit back in the old town square, bite a Czech delight of your choice and let the echos of history mix with the vibrant energy.Enjoy!We did

Stunning. So much to see and take in. Such a mix of things, from the imposing gothic Týn Church and Old Town Hall to street food vendors, shops are restaurants. It's bursting with people during the day, almost chaos at times as everyone soaks up the atmosphere, which almost adds to the charm. But it's equally beautiful at night or early morning where an eerie quiet allows you to truly absorb the history all around you. A must visit.

Breathtaking-especially the church of our lady resembling Gargamel's castel. Prague is indeed a very special place to visit with its main cathedral in the center resembling the Gargamel castle from the smurfs. There is so much going on there in the neighbourhood that one simply has to enjoy it:D

Love Old Town. Everyone should visit Prague and the Old Town at least once in their life. One our favourite areas to visit in Prague. Always something going on there. Never get tired of watching the clock chime on the hour!
Lovely place. Lovely place to enjoy your free time and evenings.. Many eateries, bars , currency exchange shops. Astronomical clock quite interesting.

First time in Prague. Prague exceeded any expectations and was amazing at every turn. There was so much history to explore!! The Palace, the bridge, lots of amazing churches, the river - wow. I wish I had scheduled more time.
One of the most fantastic places on earth for me!. Amazing architecture and historic place! One of my suggestions of must see in the world! A lot of music in the air!
citytour ng. Best place in town to be. wonderful. incredible smart and lovely. you will it at his best . the world famos cock will be ring.
Sight seeing. Awesome place lots to see easy walking distance to different sights museums, shopping and lots historic buildings

Amazing vista but way too many people. we found that the best way to explore Old Town is on foot at around sunrise, as no one is around. Seeing sunrise on the Charles Bridge is very rewarding as there are few people about and you can get some great photos.
Center of everything. A wide variety of restaurants encircle the square. Astronomical clock, town hall and Jewish sites and Charles Bridge are all here.

Marvelous Architecture, Great Food, & Wonderful People. This is generally the first place I go when I visit Prague. A quick trip to Old Town to eat some Hungarian Goulash with Czech bread dumplings and a glass of Czech Pilsner beer, followed by poppy seed dumplings topped with whipped cream. Many of my favourite restaurants are in Old Town. I also collect Czech glass flowers and other glass products, which the Czech Republic is world famous for producing. Then I walk the streets of Old Town to see what other interesting things I’ll find to buy or look at. New interesting things keep popping up. Although most of the locals are wonderful and friendly, beware of the taxi drivers who charge triple the normal rate and those who push a switch to speed up the meter.
Charm to spare. Worth hanging out for a few hours while you eat, visit churches or museums, shop and of course check out the clock.

Amazing place to visit!. One of my favourite places to visit in Prague, the churches and buildings are extraordinary. Truly unique place to visit.It is always busy and hard to find a space t sit down.

The clock is absolutely amazing. A visit to Prague should include two things as a minimum. A visit to the old town square to see the astrological clock and the buildings and the church (take the time to go into this church, it is incredible) in the square, and a trip to Prague castle area (including a visit to the Cathedral, also amazing inside and out). If you get these two in, you are off to a great start. I would allow at least 3 days to really get a flavor of the city and more time if you really want to understand this cities hear. The history in this city is so deep that you need much more time to really take it all in and properly understand what the city has experienced over so many years and cycles in history. It is like visiting the history of the modern world rolled up into one city. Tip: Read about the astrological clock's history and mechanisms before you go to really appreciate it. Also read up on Prague castle and go with a tour guide or audio guide as there is little written materials to read when you are there. Also, keep a good hold of your wallet when you go to the key tourist spots as we were told pickpockets are active in this city. Tip 2: read up on taking taxis in this city to help prevent you from being ripped off by some unscrupulous taxi drivers.
Nice. I visit this place with my friends today . I came here in the morning and now I am going back because of tired walking . But it's a nice place . Nice shops around.
Quaint, beautiful, lively. Visit the old town on business trip. Lovely place that can be walked, full of history, full of life. Highly recommend it for a 2 day trip.

Amazing square with a charming feel.. This square is simply gorgeous from all directions. Everywhere you look, it is stunning. I love the architecture in this square. Obviously, this is a must see for any trip to Prague.

wonderfully rich architecture. Prague is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful cities in the world. That there were leaders who deeply cared for the place and wanted the betterment of the city in all areas clearly shows. Old Town Square is a big outdoor square, a bit of a tourist trap as there are overpriced outdoor food stalls, horse & carriages for hire, classic cars to ride around in. This is the location of Franz Kafka birthplace, the Astronomical Clock and other sights, so it really is unmissable.
Great medieval city. This is really one of the reasons why you'd visit Prague. You will share this with the other thousands of people wanting the same experience.
Amazing place to visit. This is where you start. Amazing place to be. All your surrounding are so historic and beautiful. I can spend hours on this location.

Astronomical Old Square.. This old town square is incredibly busy day or night. View the incredible historical buildings, Church of Our Lady & astronomical clock, watch out for the horse drawn carriages and street performers, or people watch in the many reasonably priced restaurants and bars.

Absolute must in Prague!. You haven't seen Prague if you haven't been to the Old Town, particularly the main square - the variety of architecture is just astounding. This is how every European city should be, if it weren't for Hitler and WWII :( The only reason this gets 4 stars and not 5 is that even in late September there were just SOOOOOOO many people. Prague has definitely been discovered by the tourist populations of every continent, you hear languages from everywhere!!

Just so much to see and enjoy. Give yourself plenty of time to wander, look round the little alleyways as well as the big sights. A real delight of a place, it has got the richness and variety of London but it is small enough to walk everywhere (in the central area at least)
Genuin buildings. Fantastic atmosphere in Prague old town.Very much like the old town in Stockholm.I recomend to walk around a lot.

marvelous place for a walk. On the one hand, the streets are narrow and noisy because of all the tourists. The cobblestones also make walking difficult for walking in places. But the architecture is amazing and the buildings are colorful and wonderful to gawk at.

old square is great - choose a nice cafe and sit and watch the world go but. This must be one of the greatest places to be in the world - great architecture, shops, cafes, art - this is life at 110% + at least!
Worth a visit.. Beautiful square, the astrological clock is a little bit disappointing, nice to sit in one of the cafes and look at all the tourists passing by.
Prague is an incredible city!. Such an easy city to walk around and explore, and it's affordable! Couldn't recommend it more highly.
Beautiful, well preserved heritage city. One of the many bridges in town, but this bridge connects the two parts of Old Town and Square. Stunning views from the bridge of entire city.

Beautiful - visit in the night as well as in the day. Gorgeous historical architecture and really easy to get around from sight to sight. The show at the astronomical clock is good fun. Make sure to eat trdelnik (Hungarian chimney cakes) at a stall!Lots to see; take a map + comfy shoes for the cobbled streets.Definitely worth a visit at night time too as the buildings lit up are simply stunning.

A feeling of being in Hogwarts. I visited Prague with friends on my birthday. The old town square was amazing and when you get to the centre and look around, you feel like you are in a different time, like some scene from Harry Potter movie. It has lots of shops to buy souvenirs, pubs and for this obvious reason there are many tourist hanging out there. It is a must visit spot and you will not regret it!

Great to walk around and get lost. The old town is full of quaint restaurants pubs and shops. Gets really busy at sunset but it copes. By some of the local street food and beer. Rather use local currency. Not always a great exchange rate for Euros. Count your change. If the ice-cream vendors shortchange you they have an explanation and might try and bully you. There is so much fantastic architecture around every corner.

Good enough. We went late at night and it was still quite crowded, which is actually good as it creates a good vibe. It's quite large and there are a lot of very nice architecture around the square. It's a good place to hang out and people-watch.

An ancient impressive city. Prague is probably one of the most impressive cities that I have visited. It is filled with ancient and beautiful buildings along with modern architecture almost seamlessly. The taxi drivers in old town are cheats and cut throats. Use uber because you know what you are getting for a reasonable price.
A beautiful must!. Prague is beautiful to visit and this square is precious. A must if you visit the city. In December it was decorated with a Christmas market. Adorable!

Very nice place for citybreak. I really liked the old town of Prague, there are a lot of tourists of course, but it's not so disturbing than for example in London, because there is something interesting and worth visiting on every corner and on every narrow street. Very good place for kids and for adults as well.
Return visit. A wonderful city, full of Gothic buildings. It's easy to get around the sights, whether on foot, bus, or tram, and there are plenty of great restaurants all reasonably priced.
Old Town. Very quaint with loads of eating places. Total history, make sure you take a camera.Prices much lower away from old town square area. Use hop on hop off buses to see most areas quickly.
Great place to get lost.. This is a great place to wander around and get lost. Quite small an never really lost. Might bump into an 800 yr old building.

A day in Old Town. You can start early by going over the Charles Bridge. You must see the Jewish cemetery and Synagogue. Spend some time and enjoy a refreshment in the Old Town Square. So much to see a do here.
Very interesting. Loved this square. Many historical stories to be told here. Lots of shopping and restaurants, although they are tourist priced
Whole area is beautiful. Old town is a most attractive places, so many things to see, park, church, restaurents, bridges. Everything is so beautiful

overpriced and very busy. was dissapointed. the astonomical clock was not partic exciting. the cafes were over priced and full - go down a back street off the main square and get better cheaper food. the cobbles are very uneven - I tripped and went flying. beware the segways -they are not legal! thought krakow was a much more beautiful square.

Beautiful place to spend a few days. We walked everywhere! Don't think there was a side street we didn't explore. However we sat and drank beer too! Plenty to see and lots of attractions to visit if you want to spend the money on entry fees. We mainly just absorbed the atmosphere :)

Historically interesting square.. Probably Prague's largest number of interesting historical buildings all in one place. The old town hall on one corner, the Church of Our Lady before Tyn on the opposite side, and the Church of St.Nicholas in another corner. In between, allsorts of other interesting buildings. And you can climb the townhall tower for good views.

So much to see - need a week!. The guide books say it all. The crowds can be oppressive at times - perhaps we will go out of holiday season next time? There is much to see and enjoy - just move away from the centre of things to get a drink or eat - normal sensible thing to do!

A glimse of history. Visited as part of Rick Steves audio guide tour (excellent by the way) and we managed to see all of the key sites. Not the busiest day when we were there but imagine if it is full would take some of the gloss of the visit, especially in the narrow streets

Fun to walk for a couple hours. Interesting narrow streets with many dining and shopping choices. Beautiful architecture, great access to Charles bridge and to Wenceslas Square. Streets go from very busy with lots of people and tour groups to nearly vacant. Ez to taste three of CZR best beers, Urquell, Budweiser(Czech,started before Anheiser-Busch) and Staropramen.
old majestic and beautiful.... what can i say about prague.. its old majestic charming beautiful city every corner has a history and i really loved it :)
Lost. Having got lost in this area numerous times on our four day stay. I couldn't think of a more astoundingly beautiful place to get lost

suberb city to visit and mingle with people. Friendly and good environment. Good restaurant and services.
Many menu options. all international cuisines are found

Lovely. Lovely but very very busy full of tourists but very beautiful day and nite. Lovely bars and restaurants be careful though the "u prince chain part of hotel doted about are a tourist trap rip off same menus and very poor service which they automatically add 10%. There are much nicer resturants and off the square. There is even a hard rock cafe there if u want a good burger etc and debt want to eat local.
must see but not too long !!. I think this is overrated by "agencies". It HAS to be visited but once is enough for us ! Astrological clock, for us, was overrated !

Celebration Time. The Stare Mesto is always alive with activity! Attend a concert, sit at a café and people watch, take a carriage ride, or just walk around the historic area. Something is happening day or night to catch your attention. It's filled with wondrous and beautiful historical buildings, churches, and cobblestone streets.

Old Town Square. Prague's central tourist attractions. The square has famous churches with marvelous musical programs, the oldest Astronomical Clock, a taste of Prague with architecture and food (although tourist tastes), and the Hard Rock Café.
nice. beautiful place to be. A lot of restaurants, good place to relax with friends, of to get new friends

Beautiful!. Old Town is busy and bustling. Lots to look at and if you love architecture, the buildings won't disappoint. Very easy to get to and felt pretty safe walking around as a solo female traveler. Might be a bit different feeling at night though, but nothing more than most cities at night.
A must-see in Prague. Amazing buildings, totally worth a visit. A bit crowded though so mind your pockets. Between 9 and 23 every hour the 12 apostles appear so you're in for a treat.
A must do.. Obviously this a part of the city you have to visit. Do twice at least, day time and at night to see the buildings illuminated..
Great place to sit and enjoy the view. We sat in the square a couple time during our visit. Good for people watching and enjoying the day. Prices are reasonable.

Interesting and beautiful, but quite crowded with tourists. In the 5 days we stayed in Prague, I walked through the old town at least 6 times, but still had not gone through all the streets. It was a town full of beautiful old historical buildings, many shops, cafes, etc. We were up early one morning and it was a joy walking through the old town because there were not many people. Good time to take photos.

Best tip for Prague first timer.... just take an hour without running anywhere, without planning where to go, and simply sit in the main square, maybe with a hotdog or something else (but not inside of the restaurants) and just watch this amazing beautiful square, the Astronomic clock, the statue, the almost taking from a fairytale towers and the people. .never done it before, but it was amazing.

Sadly Overcrowded. We first visited Prague Old Town 25 years ago, and it was wonderful. It was a great introduction to Prague and all things Czech. Times have moved on and Prague is now one of the major European tourist attractions and when we visited mid this September it was wall to wall tourists. No sign of ordinary Czech life at all. The Square was equally crowded and we were swamped by foreigners.I would suggest a winter visit - there should be a bit more elbow room then. The run up to Christmas should be seriously cute...

The center of old town. There's no avoiding Stare Mesto, as it is the central square of old town Prague. And it's a lovely center. Saint Nicholas church (where one can enjoy clasical music concerts very often), the old astronomical clock (ex-libris of Prague) and all the cafés and restaurants around the square. Plus, in certain times of the year (Christmas, Easter) there are colourful local markets, showcasing traditinal food and artscraft.

Touristy but beautiful. Because it is a "must see" in Prague, it will be crowded with tourists, but still beautiful. Cafes in the square are expensive, but on nearby side streets you can find good authentic Czech food at much lower prices.

Beautiful. Old town is beautiful, spend atleast a day walking around and admiring it's beauty.
I will say if you are young, or with a young family there is not much to entertain them.
Great traditional place. Very nice place to see. Has also nice restaurants and shops around. Sometimes they even have nice events there. Also a good place for nice pictures

Get lost in the streets and keep your head up. Everywhere you go, you'll see gorgeous architecture that cannot be pinpoint to any one style. Every building is uniquely gorgeous especially if you don't forget to look up. This is my second visit to Prague and walking through old town streets was like discovering city all over, so town has a great revisit value.

Its an excellent, very beautiful place! Very serene and beautiful!. The old town square is a very beautiful square! Its a musy, must visit. It has good shopping and eating joints along the pavements and the food there is awesome! You can just spend hours and hours in complete solace, just sipping on some good wine / beer and grab a quick bite either at the finest restaurants, or at the joints along the pavements!Overall, an awesome experience and it is the heart of Prague with its beautifully maintained buildings and carefully guarded monuments and culture. Simply beautiful!

Where the action and crowds are in Prague.... Prague is a beautiful, unique city and Old Town is the epicenter of all of it. The architecture and gothic towers of the astronomical clock and church in the square are a must see and why most come to Prague (well, and the Charles Bridge).I have to admit, however, that Prague was a bit of a let down relative to my expectations. Maybe it was because we were there in late August fighting the crowds during a heat wave but I found it overly touristy and crowded. This is amplified by the fact Prague isn't really that big of a city (at least the Old Town, Charles Bridge, etc. tourist areas).It would have been great to have seen Prague during or in the few years after the end of the Cold War. I heard things were more unspoiled then and even the Old Town area wasn't overrun with tourists and so many souvenir shops selling the same things..

Follow the crowd!. You wont be able to miss it. Busy busy busy. Prague is a beautiful city. The Old Town Square is very busy with tourists. You can simply walk around, hire a segway, an old vintage car or a horse and cart. There are bus tours also. The old city streets that lead to the Square are interesting, lined with various shops and bars.We were here a couple of times, walking from side to the other to visit other sites; The Charles Bridge

Walk back in Time. Beautiful old town square, There are many old buildings restored in a beautiful fashion. There are many places to sit outside and enjoy your evening meal. There is usually sometime of live entertainment.
Just walk around . One has to walk around the historical Prag. Visit monuments, buildings, museums, restaurants. Winter or summer. A lot so see and feel. The world meets here.
Old town. Fun and interesting place. I was there more for the sites rather than shopping. I enjoyed the food and atmosphere and especially the Pilsner.
great. it's recommended to arrange visiting old town, castle and Charles bridge at one time due to the locations are close to each other.

Just wander.... Beautiful historic heart of Prague! A great place to just wander and get lost. So much to see, some fun shops, great restaurants, bakeries and history everywhere you look. Touristy but so worth it!

Relax. We was in Prague for a wedding, as a couple old town is a must see, a great place to sit with a good Czech beer or coffee and watch the world go by. If your lucky you may find a spot in a restaurant with a view at the astronomical clock. I'd recommend the square to anyone visiting Prague
Hidden strrets. Many old winding cobblestones streets and hidden spaces Don't be afraid to explore its stunning The foods are lovely and shops bohemian

Well worth a visit . Very scenic square. Definitely worth the price to go up the tower for the views if it is sunny. The clock is interesting, learned a load just hanging around overhearing tour guides speak of it. Worth timing being there for the hourly display of the clock figures.
A must visit place!. Carry a map, and walk around the old town. Its the best way to explore. A must visit place in Prague.

Graffiti,Graffiti,Graffiti.... It was disappointing to see on some of the oldest building in the world that survived 2 World Wars and a Cold War and to have no respect for them Yes, there is Graffiti in all big cities,but this was overwhelming.
Gorgeous, but overrun with tourist.. I walked through at 7 , and it was like I had prague to myself. However, if you are there that early, you won't get into any of the churches.

The best of Prague. Big place of lot of narrow crooked streets, old houses, churches, awesome architecture. Lot of restaurants, cafés etc.
Main spot is the Oldtown square with atronomical clock, temple of "Týn" and lot of picturesque houses around the square :)
A must in Prague.. Don't miss taking the time to explore this beautiful city,all the sights are clearly marked on the tourist board's handouts and are not expensive to visit.

Just go for a walk!. This has to be one of the most picturisque and beautiful streets I have ever stepped foot on (Trust me, I have travelled). Just walking in this area you will see countless shops, restaurants street entertainment, churches, museums, statues, bars and everything else.There are far too many places that you would want to visit or things that you would want to do. Chocolate museum or absintherie? Candy making workshop or Astrology tower? Wax museum or art museum? The list is endless!

Stunning place to see all the lovely architecture.. Been to the square a number of times and still keep going back. The architecture is amazing. So many different buildings with wonderful facades to admire. Many have been restored and look just beautiful. There are always street performers around and it's lovely to spend time watching the entertainment. Just be careful you don't get run over by a segway!You can't visit Prague and not visit the square.
Nice place. If you are interested in visiting the historical places here is your place.you feel history in this area. Full of historical building and architectural scene.
