Delightful. Obviously being the main tourist area it is very crowded however, that can't take away the splendour of this square and surrounding area.We spent a couple of hours marvelling at the wonderful buildings and the sights and sounds of the area.
Beautiful buildings. We enjoyed walking around the old town and viewing the many beautiful old buildings. The owners have to be commended for the expense and care in restoring these buildings.
Very nice to walk though . This is a must when in Prague to walk through the streets as these are filled with with history, however Id recommend a map so you dont get lost.

Bustling little streets lead to the old town square. The old town is ideal for a good wander taking in the beauty of the architecture. Stop at the square and climb the tower for an impressive view . Stand and listen to some of the street entertainment. Winding lanes and cobbled streets seem to go on for ever. Easy to get lost, but usually you can find a landmark to get back on track

Old Town, a medieval challenge. I chose the Czech capital for a mega city break (4 nights and 5 days) organized its own purposes, because both deserve to stay in this city.To beat him on foot to explore it and feel it in a season when tourists are not smothered in exhausting tours through Central Europe.

Magnificent. Most beautiful city I've ever seen. I've been there for 5 days and I still want to come back to enjoy and discover more parts of this capital city. There is so much to do, so much to see and participate. Definietly worth visiting!

Lively and beautiful . One of the must-visit place in Prague. Full of people and restaurants. There are a few attractions at the old town. Also, one of the popular Czech restaurant - Mlejnice is also located here. Lovely place to visit!! Highly recommend!

Great place to walk and see sights. Prague was our favorite city on a 14 day vacation. A good part of the appeal was due to the charm of the old city. It is very walkable. Lots of shops and restaurants and plenty of things to experience (Jewish Quarter was very interesting).

Night time is alive on the square.. Besides the men blowing bubbles for the children to chase, the city lit up at night is beautiful. Got to see a Jazz Festival show for free in square. The square by the shopping center two days later had Brouci Band (Beatles music, sound and looked just like them.) Loved the sounds and bustle of people as well as the shops.
Beautiful square.. What a beautiful square with shops and restaurants. You can walk around and enjoy all the views. It's even nice at night time.

must visit. a great local experience with liveliness and history Many people from all over come to visit here and there is always something to experience from the market shops to food and some entertainers too.
Charming. The oldest and most beautiful square in the Prague surrounded by historical buildings,Baroque churches,shops and restaurants.

Magnificent!. Beautiful, full of history and very well maintained, this area is not to be missed. It is also quite overrun by various tourist groups pretty much all day. Still, loved the experience and would highly recommend it.

Beautiful city. This city is beautiful with lots of interesting buildings. It was very busy. We walked a lot as you would miss a lot if on the bus. Definitely worth a walk round - good comfortable shoes a must.
Lots to see. Too many tourists for my taste but a must see nevertheless. The astronomical clock and St. Nicholas Church are a must see.
Beautiful Square. This square was most beautiful without the throngs of tourists. We headed there on a rainy day and could enjoy 360* uninterrupted views!

One of the best places I've been to. Seriously, Prague is such a beautiful city it's unreal. Especially the old town. I have to say they have taken care of the old buildings and houses marvellously. Many of them have gone through a facade renovation while honouring the original style of the building. And it's clean! I've travelled a fair bit and nothing annoys me more than dirty cities. Prague was very clean compared to many other capital cities in Europe.Don't forget to try out the chimney cakes while in the old town. They are lovely and well worth the price.

Beautiful history mixed with unrivaled culture.. This entire portion of Prague is unbelievable. As soon as you step foot into the Old Town you are taken back in time. Everything is extremely walkable, although there is quite a bit of cobblestone/uneven pavement, so proper walking shoes may be a good idea. There are a ton of great places to eat and drink. Beware (as always) of the tourist traps right in the center. Walk only 2 minutes away from the square and you will find local restaurants tucked away serving delicious food and drink at very reasonable prices. Suggestions include; Tyn Church, Town Hall Tower, Astronomical Clock and the Charles Bridge.

A lovely, lively town square.. We spent a fair amount of time in the town square which has some beautiful statues and a town clock that they should be very proud of. It is so interesting to see the movement of the clock.

Old Town, Prague. Beautiful historic square in Prague.Unfortunately always crowded, especially at the top of the hour when the famous clock goes off!!But essential for any visitor to Prague.Don't miss it.
Lovely city. We spent hours just wandering through the old town taking pictures and admiring the architecture. Lots of good small shops, restaurants and cafes and the ice cream was unreal.
beautiful place. the old town of prague is a unique place with beautiful buildings and churches, and with very nice bars, pivovar, and candy shops,
Nice place. Nice area beautiful architecture with lots of nice shops and restaurants. A very nice summer afternoon .
The center of Prague. you will fall in love with the old city with its history,shops and street vendors. Bring comfortable shoes, walking is the only way to discover the city
Beautiful Buildings. Really beautiful buildings here. Everywhere you look has an intricate carving or painting on the facade. I found it a great vibe here too.
Prague - a city with a picture at every turn. The heart of Prague where you can can take a 1000 photos while drink and eating good food. This is a must stop in your visit.
City Gentre. Beautiful, a feast for the eyes. Everywhere you turn there is something historic to see. Pity about the crowds and Segways should be banned.

A must in Prague!. Old Town is such a fun spot for getting a glimpse of Medieval Prague mixed with current day. The buildings have been well preserved here and the architecture is just amazing! Plenty to do and see and eat in this part of town!

Back in Prague. Took my husband to see Czech Rep. One of the first stops was the Old Town square. Beautiful!!! We loved the old buildings, cobble stone streets and also climbed up the Clock Tower. Make the effort to see the Saints trudging around when the clock strikes on the hour....so worth it!
Amazing. The old town is just amazing. Beautiful cobblestone streets, small lane ways and great architecture.. Wander around, have coffee and soak up the ambiance of it all.
Really nice. We really enjoyed the walks and the nice feeling you get from this amazing place. It's historical scent gives it a particular charm.
Wonderful. Wonderful, if the light of the afternoon is expected, you can achieve spectacular photographs from the tower, the clock is also something spectacular.

walk full of surprises. Walking there is really very nice. you see lots of tourism, different languages, different cafes and restaurants, nice shops,everyone is just walking and enjoying this old city.. It is really full of culture and history and ambiguity. There is really something special in Prague, very romantic... smiley faces everywhere..some play music on the street... The person is always tempted to come back for a walk..

Great vegetarian restaurant. Over pork knee and cabbage then go to Maitrea address Tynska Ulicka 5 Prague. Great flavours and cheap. We are not vegetarians but the choices and tastes were a pleasant surprise. Needed to book As very popular with locals. One street back from old town square

Wonderful Medieval town. Prague, is romantic, beautiful architecture, cozy, in general a city where you will enjoy walking slowly and capturing every detail. There many things to see and best is to start by getting one of the many tours agencies or even free tours to walk the city. This is the bohemian capital and crystal is famous, but for the more live environment make time to take one of the beer tours at night, with nice underground bar with craft beer. I enjoyed a concert at Saint Nicholas church and was very nice. Finally visiting the Charles bridge and Castle are a must do , but those should go in separate reviews.

so many things to do in this square. There are about 14 restaurants around this square, all with good food and the shopping was endless. We never got tired of the view. The clock tower is across the square, it's astronomical clock going off every hour. Worth seeing and also climbing up.
Simply breathtaking!. Amazing architecture that everyone should see. I recommend to walk through the Old town in the evening. The lights are amazing!
Fantastic architecture. So much to see here. We enjoyed the opera at the Estates Theatre, but there's something cultural for everyone here.

Prague's Epicenter. Amazing and beautiful. We walked through here a dozen times but its fun to sit back over a nice Czech beer and people watch. It's a bit crowded with people at times, especially tour groups which tend to meet here.

Of in prague u can't miss . Don't afraid to walk in the small alleys. It as beautiful as Venice alleys. U can spend half a day der. On wkends der are many activities like magicians show, bubbles show, horse riding any many more. Definitely segway.

Beautiful Town Square But Crowded. This is a gorgeous town square, very large and actually a bit overwhelming to take it all in at the first visit. It is the central meeting point for most people and it has been a market square since the 11th century. You really need to see it in different lights at different times of the day It is even more romantic at night. To best enjoy the square and the ambiance, sit at one of the cafes and enjoy an authentic Czech beer!
Piece of history. Old buildings, very nice.Try to visit small side streets. less tourists .Walk, not car or sagway , so you can see more and enjoy it.

Beautiful but crowded.. A must see while in Prague to tick off your list however it was very crowded and this took away from the buildings themselves. We took a walk away from the square into quieter, less touristy areas and these were much more enjoyable to walk around.
Beautiful Architecture. Beautiful architecture. Near Charles Bridge. Decent choice of restaurants. Many shops. Walking distance from the Square. We spent many evenings hanging out there.
Absolutely stunning, you just need to go theer to see for yourself. It was like going back in history, with so many old and quirky buildings, one of which was the same!

Busy but great for people watching and fans of architecture. Its expensive and busy and the crowds near the astronomical clock can be a hassle every hour . Best visited in the evening when the city lights up.

The heart of Prague. There are many hotels, money changes, museums , churches , restaurants ,cafes and souvenir shops. To get to move about the area efficiently, head to the tourist information centre for advice. Do visit the historical Old Town Hall, the impressively Gothic on the outside but baroque interior Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, Prague Jewish Museum.

Great place. Very crowded but a beautiful square with lots of nice cafes/restaurants. We spent a few hours with a bottle of wine just watching people. Very pretty at night with the lights on the building. Olivia Verde is a nice restaurant right by the clock
Old town Prague. Amazing place. The surrounding buildings and Tin church are incredible. Very safe place to be at every hour day or night.

Awesome city. Lots to do in this old city. Castle is nearby, lots of good local eats, and a walk down St. Charles bridge. Enjoy a local chimney pastry at one of the local pastry shops. Even if you are not a fan of the Beatles, the Hohn Lennon wall is a must see. Can't wait to visit again.

Lovely but crowded so go early. A must see area of Prague with amazing architecture. Your neck will tire but there is much to see that that is worth looking up all along the way - but watch out for the dreaded Segways careering about the place and escape to the emptier side and back streets when you can for the best experience of the old city. See the City Clock performance on each hour.
Amazing place, with great views.. This square was amazing, the buildings and architecture is stunning. it is very busy, but we always felt safe.

Beautiful . This is the heart of the city. Surrounded by cafes, none expensive, and many serving traditional Czech food. There are several art galleries, places to join tours and get carriage rides. I enjoyed the impromptu street artists, particularly one from Belfast, who did a glorious Tommy Cooper like show. It's worth eating early as there's so many tourists
Greta Place. Very popular attraction in Prague and host many attractions within the vicinity including the astronomical clock

A place to watch the world go by. We visited here on our first morning in Prague. It was buzzing with all sorts of interesting things. There were horses and carriages for hire, street musicians, tourists, street entertainers etc etc. The square itself is surrounded by beautiful buildings, not least the astronomical clock. We just loved the atmosphere.

A must see in Prague. A very nice square to visit while in Prague. Lots of shops, café, and local variety. Has several glassware and jewelry shops as well. A great area to walk around to check out the architecture, local foods.
Loved it!. Absolutely beautiful buildings and cobbled streets. Many good pubs in the area with wonderful (and cheap) Czech beer.

Simply Stunning . If your visiting prague for the first time like I did, then this is the place to be, as it has a whole host of historic sites all in bundled together. Astromonical Clock, Frank Kafa House, St Nicholas Church, Old Town Hall and the stunning Church of Our Lady Before Tyne.If you have booked a walking tour then youll probably find your guide here also its the main pick up point for most of the hop on hop off tour buses. Only downside is its been taken over by commercilised restaurant that charge a fortune and not that great to eat in. Head further a field if your looking for places to eat and drink. All in all a great starting point for your trip in prague.

Day or Night its beautiful. I prefer this at night , where it very atmospheric , take time just to wander around ,cafes and restaurants are expensive , a couple of streets back you find much better value

Magic allover. Prague is the city you can visit many times and still enjoy. Walking through the streets, buying souvenirs or watching the different talented people who are singing or playing music is so enjoyable.
Beautiful place. Amazing gothic city with beautiful views and a fantastic atmosphere. Absolutely loved this trip with twelve friends for a hen do.

Beautiful architecture. It was a beautiful and hot day as I decided to walk up to the old town. Beautiful buildings surround the square, good views across the city from up there. Several galleries to visit or just sit and take in the sites.

so beautiful. very very beautiful square, amazing. so much history, very nice cafes and restaurants. many tourists, but not too bad. but the segway dealers are a bit too annoying trying to push on a rented segway all the time and wont take no for an answer

Simply Get Lost in the Old Town. Plan the place for a day. There are so much to see and enjoy. Some of the attractions need time to appreciate. First timer should find their way to the Old Town Square and take it from there. Once equipped with proper orientation, then started exploring the surrounding areas. With the Astronomical Clocks and the churches around the Old Town Square, that alone take time to enjoy.
Great must see the big clock.. You can not miss the old city, note pickpockets.Huge variety of restaurants, you can also take a tour with horse and carriage.

Worth a stroll or two or three. Great place to take in the sights and sounds of Prague. Wonderful buildings and plenty of great people watching. Many unique stores and a wide variety of food options - from street vendors to posh restaurants.
Very Crowded. This is probably the most crowded spot in Prague! But well worth it...the clock tower, the church and just the beauty of the place.

Beautiful Buildings. Every tourist is here at some point and it can get very very busy. The square and surrounding streets are full of history, interesting and beautiful architecture and well worth exploring.There are many tourist attractions in this square and nearby including the Astronomical clock. If you want to see how crowdwed it can get, be there on the hour by the clock in the morning.
Great . Very beautiful place! The view is great and the atmosphere is amazing. A place u must visit! Very romantic at night

Historic Site With Shopping. A good way to spend the day looking at the architecture and exploring the many shopping venues. There is a wide selection of shops and restaurants to satisfy anyone's vacation needs.

Old Town Prague. The Old Town Square in Prague is where it's happening. By day, the crowds are thinner and one can admire the old buildings and the clock tower. But by night, the square is filled with tourists and locals alike along with the smells of delicious things to eat and the various street performers.

Beautiful historic Square. Go early to avoid crowds. Beautiful to stand in the middle the square and look at the view all around you. Of course your time in the square is not complete without waiting for the chime of the medieval astronomical clock.

Do a walking tour for the history. Take the time to learn about the history of this town. And why it is still so beautiful even after WWII. You might find that it's beauty will change. A big mix of gothic, rococo, classic and other type of architecture it's kinda cool to see! Take a walking tour, there's some free

Absolutely worth your time. I sent an entire day here in 9/16. Of the many trips to Europe I have taken, this was one of the most enjoyable. I recommend staying near the Charles Bridge and going north to south along the old town. Prague is one of the best central European experiences, and you won't regret a minute of it.

Popuar, but beautiful. Old Town is crowded with tourists, but you should expect that. The town square is surrounded by beautiful buildings and there are a number of restaurants where you can enjoy a meal or a pivo. The Tyn Church is a must see too,
Beautiful buildings. It is a must in Prague. Beautiful buildings and fine restaurants. I recommend to go up in the tower.

Absolutely stunning, a must-visit Central European metropole. Pointless to go in detail about Prague - you can find more in any tourist guide or on the internet.What I can recommend is to visit it during the Winter (even better, during the Advent); with snow on the ground, long nights and possibly fog from Vltava, the authentic medieval feel of the city comes to the fore, but increased manyfold. Viewed during the night, some of the architecture starts looking as if it was straight out of the Lord of the Rings. Take a stroll through the town, eat at the food stalls and visit the local restaurants to sample the local cuisine (especially the beer - Prague is famous for its alehouses). Also, the Prague Metro is excellent: affordable, accessible and very clean.
nice but busy. beautiful place to visit but can get very busy and congested. fabulous buildings and architecture and the local food is wonderful.

A Great Town with a Magnificent Square. This is probably the best place to visit in Prague, filled with beautiful buildings and statues. The main statue at the center is of Jan Hus. The place is always teeming with tourists. They come mostly to see the Astronomical Clock which chimes on the hour with figurines going around.

Words are not enough.... Me and my husband fell in love with Prague, the Old Town is so well kept although is constantly flooded with tourists, felt very safe any time of the day and night, the history and views were incredible - it is amazing how they preserved and maintain the inheritance they have, definitely very romantic and informative at the same time :) Highly recommend to visit!
Worth checking out. You have to go to old town. A bit crowded so be careful not to get lost in the crowd. There are lots of restaurants around old town, and a good shopping mall just nearby.
Old beautiful Prague. Amazing buindings amazing street shows. You can stay nMore than 1 hour just relaxing. From the top of tower beautiful views
It's a must see but the crowds are unbelievable. Wander the square before the tour groups get started (before 8am), when it's raining or during the dinner hour. Otherwise, it's too crowded to bear.
The clock tower. Whatever you do when visiting the Old Town, be sure to stop by the clock tower when it chimes on the hour. I don't want to give away the treat you will enjoy.

Beautiful and full of History. When you go to Prague the first thing you'll notice is the beautiful Architecture. Its everywhere you go and it is one of a kind and amazing. It is perfect Gothic style european

Sandeman free tours. Wonderful 3 hour tour with great tour guide,Ryan Hume. Thorough explanations of the buildings,history and locals lives. Only tip guide what yu want,and no pressure. Guide was friendly, professional and knowledgeable.
Stunning. Stunning town, totally spectacular town with the old charm. The vibrant colors and the musical buzz makes you worth spending lot of time. Be happy to return back!

One of the best city..... Charming, romantic and history.....we enjoyed our four days .
Economical shopping and food, a must visit city.

Old but not forgotten . The old City of Prague and it's main square are full with beautiful buildings, statues and the planetarium clockwork in the tower. The crowds during high season are enormous but nevertheless go and take it in. Apart from all the tourists and their smartphones one can still get a taste of a City as it was centuries ago. Another must see in this great City. One of my new favorites in Europe.
Beautiful. beautiful place to see, but very very crowded of course. lots of restaurants and cafes to sit down and enjoy the view.

Beautiful architecture . Visited several times during our stay in Prague. The bars, restaurants and shops give the place a magical feeling..Lots of tours start from the square and it's a good place to meet up.
Fantastic. Must see. . A must see when in Prague. Always busy with Tourists but still great. Lots of old buildings and the Old Clock is amazing.

Stunning architecturally; crowded "human-wise. This ranks with the quintessential European "old towns" we've visited...cobblestoned, ringed with ancient structures, adorned with evocative statues, beset with cafes....and with tons and tons of visitors (at least in sunny September). It's truly a human carnival and thus very interesting, but a tad overwhelming at times, making the scenic and historic sights difficult to internalize. However, if one ventures out in the early morning, one will share the space only with workers and other visitors avidly photographing everything in sight!

Buzzing with life!. Beautiful part of Prague, so much to see, the architecture is just amazing! While everything looks so old, there are still the most modern of amenities. It never ceases to amaze at every turn and corner!
Crown Jewel of Prague!. My wife and I got lost for 2.5 hours in Old Town our 1st night in Prague...I recommend walking around with a map, but by all means do go. The highlight of our trip to Europe!
Beautiful location!! Historic!. This area is breathtaking. So much history in this town! The only negative is there are a ton of tourists!
A must see!. Any visit to Prague would be incomplete without at least one visit to Old Town. It was quite crowded with tourists even in shoulder season but very quaint and should not be missed.

Wonderful architecture. Didn't realise how beautiful Prague is before I came. Holds its own with any capital in Europe. The Old Town is street after street of beautiful buildings. It is crowded, though, so be prepared to work your way through the crowds.

Back to the past. Is a beautiful square in a beautiful city. This is my second visit here, but the magic atmosphere is always around. The best time to go around is early morning, the store are all close but you can really enjoy the beautiful towers and notice small detail of the surrounding buildings.

The most beautiful city. I have seen a lot of capital cities but I still think that Prague is the most beautiful of them, although I live here (actually nearly). Old town is really beautiful and everybody should see it. I really recommend!

Quick business visit but impressive . Just few hours in this part of town makes us to return for the second visit.
An evening to remember.
Must visit this one if you planning your tour!

Lovely square...shame it is so tawdry. The architecture around the square is lovely and so is the open space. Sadly when you look at street level it is taken over by cheap and nasty bars and cafes. This spoils the atmosphere.

Great views . We went up the tower in old town square at night time and could see what looked like the whole of Prague. A beautiful setting and a very well designed lift inside however it is worth walking back down as all the history information is on the stair case.

Like something out of a fairytale. This has to be one of the most picturesque places in all of Europe. Multiple Gothic buildings and churches, surrounded by Renaissance and Baroque sturctures, with the astronomical clock at it's core. Come early in the morning for good pictures because multiple tour companies meet here starting at about 8am. In the evening there are cafes all around the square which we didn't try the food at, but sat and had coffee and pints while we people watched as the sun set. In the side streets around the square of lots of places for souvenirs and food. There is also one of the best (lowest fee) exchange places right behind St. Nicholas Church.
such a lovely place to visit. once you find it and remember how to get back its a great place to go most nights as there is always loads going on all day and night

Absolutely Beautiful...however a warning for tourists.... What a beautiful place to visit. Prague is adorned with such magnificent gothic & baroque architecture and the Old Town square is magnificent. Be prepared though, the crowds can spoil it. We are here currently in mid September, and whilst not the high season, the crowds from 10am onwards are nearly unbearable.The best advice we can give is to get out early (pre 7am) and cross the Charles Bridge and go into the Old Town Square, and you will get some wonderful photos with a minimum of tourists. You will be surprised by how many people have the same idea however if you return in a couple of hours, you will know you have made the right decision! Forego sleep, get out early - it is worth the effort :)Now a BIG WARNING! We were severely ripped off and want to let others know so that he same does not happen to you. At the back of the square (directly opposite the Tin Church - the one with two spires), alongside yet another church, you will find a series of wooden stalls selling Prague Ham off a spit, and a traditional potato dish. You will not be able to miss it...BE WARNED, do not make the same mistake we did.....We noticed a large line of people queuing for this traditional experience, so like all tourists thought 'if there are so many people it must be good'. We ordered 1 x ham, 1 x said potato dish, and 2 beers. We were then told the price was the equivalent to 36 euro / 40 USD!! What we did not realize is that they charge by the gram.What is even more interesting is that they pack as much as they possibly can in of the potato dish into a bowl, and when weighing, also add on the thick piece of bread that they include with your meal - all charged per gram! We were given quite literally closet half a pig on a plate for 2 of us - we have never seen such 'doorstops' of meat - we then discovered why, as 'doorstops' weigh a lot and therefore they can charge what they like!We told the guy taking the money that we did not have enough money on us, so he cut us down to one beer; scooped off some potato muck, and miraculous the price was 795 koruna after we told him we only had 800 koruna cash on us.We quite literally felt sick after being ripped off so badly, and did not enjoy one bit of the meal. In fact we took a couple of bites each and the rest went in the bin. We would rather have given the money to charity. Please, do not patronise these people and do not be fooled by the long lines!
Nice experience . We traveled to Stare Mesto on our first day in Prague, so everything we saw was just incredible. The buildings are so impressive, you can't imagine!
Beautiful. All roads lead you eventually to Old Town Sq....great atmosphere...on the negative side too many people trying to get you to rent Segways

Enchanting and intoxicating. What to say about The Old Town in Prague, like stepping back in time, in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere, looking at the beautiful historic buildings that were built in the 13th century, simply stunning

Afternoon Stroll. Very crowded place with lots going on. Restaurants every where and people selling tours but the architecture is well worth a look. Plenty to see to keep busy for an afternoon. There are a couple of wax museums nearby, Chocolate Museum and Swarovski Crystal shop. Plenty of attractions to keep you busy if the weather is not good. Well worth visiting at night we it is lit up.

Breathtaking Old Town!. The best town square I have ever had the pleasure of seeing! Always so much going on, talented street performers playing everything from violins to water glasses. Tons of restaurant and people watching options. Incredible architecture! So fortunate it was not destroyed in the war, a well preserved, charming area.
what to add? just go there !. Must go when in Europe/ CZ. On the world heritige site for a reason, just avoid high season, winter is just as beautiful

A lot of interesting things to see. An incredible number of historical attractions within a small area. The river provides a good point of orientation and walking up and down the river banks (either side) allows you to get acquainted with some of Prague's many landmarks

Fantastic experience. A wonderful experience sharing the joys of the old city with people from all over the world. Walk around this square at ten in the morning and you will hear 10 languages spoken. A mecca for the start of tours and a great place to kick off your Prague adventure.

Got 2 b here. What a beautiful city.many greate places to visit, planty of restaurant, musium, monuments, structures, gardens, side walks. Have to be in a good wethure because is not the same when it's hot in here....
Impressive architecture. As you wander the narrow cobblestone streets you emerge into this impressive square filled with beautiful buildings of all types. Not to be missed is the astronomical clock.
good for walk around. old towns are always good place for me to wlk around...so many people...narrow roads...n so many owkward museams too..
Beautiful . Beautiful town and streets to wander off with plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. Easy walk from the Charles Bridge! A definite must!
Great area. We enjoyed a leisurely walk around town. There were plenty of places to window shop. The architecture was lovely.
Lovely cathedral .... This entire square is so beautiful... Easy access to the statues, clock and buildings. Within walking distance of shops, cafes and restaurants

Wonderful place to visit, but too many tourists. It is probably one of the best things to visit in Prague. Actually the best thing to do is just going around and feel the atmosphere. The only problem is that this atmosphere is often broken by so many tourists around you and from all restaurants, 99% of which don't have Czech food

Great place for people watchers!. Old Town Square is a great place to sit at a bar and watch the world go by. Sit at a bar and watch the street performers in the square. The Square also houses exhibitions, churches, restaurants and the obligatory tourist shops.
Very nice! Must see.. Rent the hotel in walking distance and make sure there is parking in hotel!!!! There is no way to find parking in the town.
Lovely area for a wander. The heart of Prague, pretty winding streets with lots of tourist attractions, gift shops and food opportunities. Don't miss it!

Treasure!. One of the most beautiful squares of Europe. Everything in harmony and beauty that makes our soul happy and in peace. Naturally trasform everyone's thinking for joy and romance. Powerful place !
Amazing square. Beautiful to stroll inside the small streets too....big monuments around... One of the nicest squares u can ever see
Astonishing.. I did really enjoy there. Although, is pact with folk all the time but I was very pleased by visiting there.
Very nice place for wandering. Just great to wander through the streets of the old town and of course the main attraction the market square.

magical old town. its the hive of activity,al fresco restaurants,,town hall, clock tower you can visit, fine architecture, music, horse and buggy rides , statues and awesome buildings,Soak up the atmosphere that is Prague,a fine city

The best place to just 'hang out' in Prague. Wonderful place to just 'hang out' in Prague and absorb the city and the culture. Don't be afraid to eat someplace right on the square. People say it's a 'touristy rip-off' but honestly it only costs less than $10 more for the same dinner that the 3 of us had at a 'local hotspot' down a bunch of far sidestreets and it certainly didn't offer either the amazing ambience of eating on the Square nor the views nor the service provided here.

Beautiful. The Old Town is very interesting place. You can see all people at the one place at once. The Old Town is always full. I saw like old school buildings, church's..very nice place. Have to visit it
memories of a lifetime. you could just spend the whole day here.. the astronomical clock tower, the cafes, the bohemian crystal, the church of tynn.. the list is endless.
Great history, architecture and food. Very busy with tourists but worth the time to stroll through. Even better with a guided tour ( i recommend tiptrip.eu ).
Loved Prague. This city is absolutely beautiful and a wonderful walking city. The old Town was the most inspiring because we both love to see the old architecture.

Amazing place. Atmosphere and surroundings are superb. Prague is a wonderful City and so much to see. The best thing to do is get the Hop on Hop off bus for 2 days, it goes simply everywhere and also includes a riverboat cruise it is so picturesque and the buildings are amazing.

Loved it!. We were there for 4 days and went everyday. Great shopping for souvenirs, many choices for food and just so beautiful to walk around there. The twin towers are awesome to see day and night. Highly recommend.
Great square. Wonderful old town feel. We were there during Easter and there was a market which was great. the surrounding buildings are beautiful too
Beautiful. Stunning square, everything going on! Lovely shops, cafes, restaurants surrounded by wonderful spellbinding buildings. Even more stunning at night.

Wow, one of the most "magical" and beautiful place I've visited. Took the greenline metro from my hotel at Flora station to Staromēstská stop. A very short walk from the station is the old town square. Wow, one of the most "magical" and beautiful place I've visited. The architecture was gourgeous and looks like they came out from fairy tales.
must 1. don't afraid to be lost in little streets it's really nice to walk and find new places again and again

Crowded but lovely buildings. Crowds tend to make for a procession but take your time find a niche sit back and admire the lovely old buildings particularly the upper facades. Segways a real menace you even have tour groups on them

Easy walk, beautiful square. The old town area of Prague is very beautiful. The area is very clean. There are a variety of small cafes and restaurants to go with the typical shops selling Prague items. Like any main square in Europe it be very crowded.
Vey nice, neat and secure. We suggest you ti visit both on day and night. If you want to take pictures without tourist crowd, we recommend you to get there a bit early in the morning

Visit to old town with kids. This is the happening place in Prague if you are a tourist. Lots of hustle and bustle with the attractions. At times it is insanely crowded. But it has a festive feel to it, and there are nice places to eat and hang out. Definite to do in Prague.

A key part of any visit to Prague.. This is one of the most scenic and interesting historical squares in Europe. The historical buildings and towers are well preserved, the clock is fascinating and the shops and restaurants around the square add to an unforgettable experience.

Must see in Prague. I love everything about it. The buildings, the churches, the restaurants and the stores. It is too crowded but i expected it to be. You can go see concerts in one of the churches, climb the tower or watch the astronomical clock ( on the hour, the apostles come out and the statue moves)

Amazing. We where 8 family members travelling together and went to Old town.Plenty restaurants to choose from and good food.We went in to see the astronomical clock which is a must if you visit Prague very beautiful,lots of stairs but you see a very beautiful view .

Not so Nice. We were here on our Tauck tour. I found the square to be overcrowded and filled with not so nice people. Seemed like a gathering place for young and dis-joined people. Touristy non value shops. Not going back.
Beautiful. Beautiful historic area, easy to get around on foot don't forget to look up at the roof lines to see statues etc
Beautiful area steeped in history. vibrant town, with loads of wonderful sites. It has a real buzz to the area and local people are friendly and relaxed

Fun and beautiful location. The Old Town especially the square is of course the thing to see in Prague. Beautiful architecture and of course the astronomical clock. We happened upon a free concert in the St. Nicholas Church which added to our enjoyment. Being a very touristy area it's not necessarily a centre for inexpensive or haute cuisine. But there are plenty of good restaurants and places for a coffee or quick drink.

So Many People That The Entire Square Was A Bit Uncomfortable. This square is very popular for tourists. Our first day the square was very, very crowded to the point that it was uncomfortable. The weather was very hot, which made the experience a bit less enjoyable as we had hoped. One individual was trying to get people to visit a restaurant that was not on the square. This person was very pushy and when my husband and I declined the offer, the woman said that she "was not a terrorist" and called us "stupid Americans". This was not at all what we were expecting and it was a very bad first impression of the square. We did eat at one of the square restaurants, which had average food for a bit above-average prices, that is typical of most eateries on the square.
Cool. Very cool place and even better at night when the old buildings are all lit up. Food here is very expensive. However you can easily fins somewhere else to eat on one of the many nearby streets.

A beautiful spot to spend a few hours.... The Old Town Square is full of history...beautiful buildings, restaurants, street performers , and more...Make sure you are there to see the beautiful old clock strike the hour....and be prepared to line up for a photo shoot...allow an hour or two.
Heart of the city. Unforgettable place - the heart of a great city. People, shops, buildings, restaurants, churches. Don't miss it!
Gorgeous historic town!. Bustling with people, pedestrian friendly. Many places to get authentic cuisine. Lots of nightlife, horse drawn carriages and historic sights!

Ideal place to stop and people watch. Very busy area with a variety of different activities. Ideal place to stop for a drink and watch the world go buy. Lovely architecture and good. Variety of eating stalls/cafes available and some local crafts available to buy

More beautiful than expected. Architecturally impressive with something for everyone. Lots of bars and restaurants line the square, get there early to see the astronomical clock movements as it gets very busy. Try the ice cream in the strudel type cone.

Simply gorgeous!. The town square is quite large, filled with tourists, street performers and tour hawkers. Along each side are gorgeous old buildings all painted up and looking marvelous. Restaurants are lined up along the edges, great for people watching.

Wonderful square, exquisite buildings, relaxed atmosphere . Visited a number of times during the day and at night.The town hall, the astronomical clock, the church with its particular spires, the restaurants, horse drawn carriages, street performers, people from all nations create a wonderful environment. Would strongly recommend a visit to the top of the tower, from where you can see the bustling activity below as well as most of Prague 's landmarks .

Tourists and more tourusts. Very atmospheric in early morning and late evening. Definitely avoid any time after 8 am and before 9 pm. Bus loads of tourists arrive during those time frames. A very busy square with musicians, magicians and arts and crafts are sold on the square. Also noted were a lot of wedding couples taking pictures. Come early or come late.

Heart of Prague. a must visit and check out the astronomical clock which rings every 1 hour. Lots of shows taking place in the square as well as lots of restaurants to dine or drink as well as shops for souvenirs

A place to walk. If you would like to explore this part of Prague which is intact since medieval time, you have to walk. After having passed the obligatory route from Charles Bridge to Old Town Square, I would suggest you might visit the very old Jewish City with its Synagogues and Cemetery. Than just let the time flow a trail on the small streets. You will enjoy.
Brilliant destination. Really worth a visit. Beautiful architecture and very historical. There are many cafes, bars and restaurants in this area.

A must boring visit . The place itself is a prague must but it is quite boring, and very crowded after 10 am. Better to take a tour, some are free (tips). We took the prague royal walk free tour (yellow umbrella) to get the info behind the buildings.

Nice Square. Very nice square in the centre of the old town. There are a lot tourist and that is a good sign.Also you can eat and drink around the square everywhere and it is not that expensive.The astronomical clock is a nice to see once, but not that spectaculair.
interesting place. sit around. relax and enjoy the old world charm. don't miss taking the ride on the heritage cars or the horse cart.

Great passing parade with food and drink. a wonderful old square surrounded by really old buildings, full of history and restaurants. look out for the markers that show where the 26 protestant lords were executed after the thirty years war. see the remains of the buildings destroyed in the last days of WW2.most of the walking tours/carriage rides/bus tours depart from the square, which is easy to reach on the subway, as well as being walking distance from the main railway station and Wenceslas Square.most of the restaurants have kitchens and dining areas set up in the ground floors of the old buildings, and in warm weather spill out into the square for open air dining. once you grab a table, you can stay as long as you wish. but do buy something to "pay the rent". do NOT sit in the tables near the clock tower, just to wait for the clock to strike the hour, without purchasing. it is rude, and offensive to the waiters, who have to earn a living. easy walking up to Prague Castle if you have any level of fitness, or take the tram or sub-way.a great buzz, the buskers are not too offensive, and a subtle police presence ( they are very friendly, most speak a second or third language, and they run a tourist information centre) keeps the pickpockets away.

Great for people watching! Great shops and restaurants.. Lovely walking around Old Town, especially the old square which holds the clock tower, some lovely restaurants, street entertainers and great for people watching. A few street food stalls which are very expensive, but it was all part of the experience. Great tree lined street leading out of the old square full of designer shops and lots of smaller streets with small bars, restaurants and boutiques. Great atmosphere.

Untouched since war. Prague's Old Town is quite gorgeous, almost comparable to Krakow in Poland. You can take a nice stroll, admire the buildings, and breathe in the history. However, there are way too many tourists. Prices are very high (water in Old Town for $3 vs $.4 outside of the Old Town). Food was not impressive at all --- we found it difficult to find a good spot with food.
Spetacular!. So much to see on every step! It's amazing oldtown and especially on the night time- restaurants and city vibe is just worth every minute!

Great for a walk but it could be dangerous . The old town square is so beautiful to walk around and admire the sights and the towers especially the one with the clock.There are a lot of restaurants around to sit and eat but be aware it won't be cheap.The only things you will have to worry is the thieves that are all around and can take you wallet without noticing it.

It is so nice before the Christmas. I've visited Prague just before Christmas. The square is so nice. Little shops all around. They roast big pieces of pork on real fire and slice a small pieces for you with glintwein and cnidelic. It was like in magical sory.
So much to see. Take your time, walk thru the streets, get a drink, have a meal, shop the shops! Enjoy Be ready for a thousand tourists thinking the same thing.
A step back in time with decent restaurants/sidewalk food vendors. Fun place to visit for an afternoon with lots of history, good beer and some great people watching!!

Straight out of a Disney movie. Old town square is the attraction at the center of Prague that lives up to the hype. In different directions, visitors can look at the astronomical clock, Tyn Church, and St. Nicolas. The mixture of architecture, cobble stone streets and restaurants creates a lovely environment that can only be found in central Europe.

Historic Jewel in the city centre. The square is surrounded by houses that were built in the Middle Ages and recently beautifully refurbished. Gothic town hall, burned during WW2 is not completed and its torso acts as a memento. Well known astronomical clock is however fully functional and attracts tourists. Square area is full of cafes - in the summer on the sidewalk - and many streets and alleys lead from it to the Prague's Old Town.It is easily accessible by public transport and/or on foot.

Spectacular - even if you don't like being a tourist. Something for everybody here - from the exotic to the modern, horrible history to 21st Century chic, there's more to discover every time you visit. Great local cuisine, more history than you will be able to cope with after several visits, Czech beer and wine you will fall in love with - this place is the perfect city break. Go back with friends and with family - simply spoiled for choice.
Peerless. Always stunning architecture and views. Old Town Square never fails to impress despite the crowds, and there is usually something going on.

Point of reference, beautiful Square, but overcrowded. wherever we would go, we would always end up back to the old town square. Sometimes multiple tomes a day. Nice spot, plenty to see on that square mile, restaurants, souvenir shops (glassware), etc. The negative point is, it gets crowded easily... and i mean really crowded by tourists especially when o'clock which everyone stands next to the astronomical clock,.. really doesn't have much to see. More annoying is the Segways and these guys approaching you for renting if not almost running you over.
Excellent place. Must be seen if you visit Prague! it is a little bit full of tourists, but charming. you can meet peopole from over the world.
A visual treat. The old town has has amazing charm and you are taken back to historical times. The architecture is good and well preserved.

Cant Miss. Title says it. Few places in the world provide the feeling one gets walking through Prague's Old Town. Spared from a millennia of war destruction, experience the real thing, not something reconstructed!

An Icon of a great old city. Looking for a place to sit down and taste the famous Prague sausages or just sit down and have a glass of wine al fresco style, this is your place to go. Relax and enjoy the crowd.

Very lively. Crowded and full of life at all times, the old town with its square and astronomical clock will attract you every day of your Prague stay. This is where a tourist starts and ends his day usually because Stare Mesto has it all: old churches, souvenir shops, glass and crystal shops, inexpensive restaurants and cafes, a multitude of artists, traditional kiosks roasting pork all day long,... and much more. In one word, it is the beating heart of Prague.
A wonderful old town square. We enjoyed trdelnik (chimney cake), the many street performers and the delicious local foods. Lots of music and lovely churches to visit.
The BEST!. Got to see this place --great restaurants and shopping. every hour the clock tower which is Astronomical has a special attraction--go and see!
The Hub. What I imagined as a medieval town square, beautifully maintained historical buildings in a large public place.

A non stop place of interest. Just go and enjoy!. We did the WWII walking tour and felt very educated. Our guide started off at Republic Square outside the Municipal Building - he had a black umbrella and what he didn;t know was no one's business.

Avoid Old Prague Ham stalls at all costs and do not eat in the square!. Prague is probably one of the most beautiful cities I have ever visited, cobbled streets pastel buildings and a rich history. However, our trip has been somewhat ruined by the rip off prices and dishonest vendors in the Old Town. There seems to be an attitude that because the place is so beautiful and in such high demand that it is acceptable to be rude to customers and then charge them ridiculous prices for pretty average food. The first day we visited we wanted to have a beer in the sun so we sat at one of the pizzerias in the square, the waiter who served us was obviously already flustered because he was busy and decided he was going to rather unprofessionally take it out on us. He made it quite clear he wasn't happy that we had only ordered light food (bearing in mind that it was lunch time and 30 degree heat) and then offered to bring the bill before we had finished eating (!) needless to say we didn't tip which by the way isn't compulsory and IS included in the bill by law even if they insist it isn't. Only tip of you receive good service which unfortunately is rare in Old Town. My biggest gripe of the trip was the Old Prague Ham vendors, we went there expecting a cheap meal as it states on the menu it's 89 koruna for 100g of ham. We made the mistake of not specifying how much we wanted and they gave us 500g slab, that and some bland cabbage and bacon came to 750 koruna!! I asked him to repeat it because I couldn't believe it. These idiots are the biggest scammers and pray on tourists and I found this incident particularly upsetting-we went to the vendor on the far left; avoid that particular one at all costs. The only half decent experience we had was at Kotleta; a grill bar in the Old Town square. The waiter was really polite and attentive and the food was decent, however, the waiter then ruined the experience a bit at the end by asking for a tip. Which I thought was cheeky, we were planning on leaving money on the table so were put in a bit of an awkward position and as a result gave him less than I had intended. All in all, visit the Old Town, it is beautiful but do not eat at the Old Prague Ham vendors in the square, have a beer there and admire the views but if you can find a quieter side alley restaurant, we will be doing that instead next time, lesson learnt.
Definitely worth for visit. Prague is simply stunning! Definitely visit THE PUB bar, where you can draft your own beer:) You will love it!
Good !. Really nice architecture, great to wonder around and stop off for a drink. I went in Sept and it was busy - I can imagine this being packed during peak times !

Stare Mesto. Very unique! Best in the evening. Always a lot of people and youngsters. The clock show if not much to see, its 20 sec figures moving but attracts crowds of people. Go on top of the tower, fantastic views from above
Love Prague!. We just love Prague - everywhere you look in the square is amazing - the buildings are kept so well and the clock is just sublime. Our second time here and we love it.

Antiques shopping. I go to Prague every year. Not just to visit my family, also visit Old Town. It is not going out of style. Every year I am eager and eager to go there again. The atmosphere, the people, stores and buildings are unbelievable. I do not know anyone on the street, but I have a filling I belong there. Everything is so close to you so friendly, that creates a filling, this is your neighborhood .But there is a warning if you need money exchange. Never exchange on a main road. Shop around, go to side streets or a bank. The exchange rate is very similar almost everywhere. Where they will get you is a commision. I had seen 19.9% commision what I thought it is worse than anything else. Until I had see a small store close to main square- Vaclav's square with commission of 29%. Some one would expect there are not people exchanging money there. Wrong it was a line, because it was so convenient.Otherwise if you want to have a cup of coffee or glass of beer, go 30 yards further from a main street and you will save 30% or more.Happy trip.

Nice. You won't miss it cause it's like the whole old city centre. But if you are reading this sight to determine if or not to go, I can say it remind a lot of Budapest but Prague has much more houses still intact.It's not expensive and easy to get around.Nice for a weekend stay
Beautiful. The Old Town is interesting and historic. The free walking tours from the astronomical clock are a can't miss.

One of our favourite cities. Pragues old town is rich in history and beautiful artitecture. Everywhere you look buildings are adorned with statues and paintings. Plenty of bars and restaurants although we walked out of the square for a lot of our meals and ate down by the river. People are friendly and always something going on. I would highly recommend a stay here in old town

Take your Time. The Old Town Square is a must visit. Bustling with locals and tourists, it is also the best place to try local snack foods like roasted ham with sauerkraut, potato dumplings and crepes with plum jam. An easy walk from the Charles Bridge, the main features of the square are the old town hall, the Astronomical clock. There is always plenty of entertainment with a seemingly endless array of buskers.

Quaint narrow streets lined with historical buildings.. A relaxing stroll in the Old Town is a must when in Prague. You have not seen Prague without it. Although it is a very touristy place, you may still find some quiet streets to explore without hundreds of tourists trodding over your feet. Observe the fine details in the facade of buildings, and when you feet are weary, enjoy a cold drink in one of the cosy bars and cafes, while watching people pass by. Choose however, the smaller establishments and far from the tourist attractions as drinks and food there tend to be more expensive. If you need a few presents to be bring home, try the smaller souvenir shops in one of the smaller streets, as prices here are also cheaper than near the main tourist attractions.

Beautiful Old Town. It's a beautiful old town ... Full of little shops selling souvenirs and local Czech traditional restaurants around. A nice place to stroll around but it's crowded with tourists The astronomical clock Old town is beautiful. I love the place !!!!!

Eclectic Gathering - Dixie Land Bands Playing Jazz in Midevil European Square. You have to visit this square (but beware pick pockets). It's beautiful and so full of people, restaurants, cafes and music! A wonderful band played dixieland jazz, and we had a great time listening to them. Then a capresse salad at a local cafe, followed by ice cream at another one. Then a walk to the Charles Bridge. It was a great day.
Quaint narrow streets, very busy, quite commercialised. An interesting pedestrian centre. Narrow streets, lots of people but quite safe feeling. A lot of touristy shops.

Fascinating. The old town of Prague is a mixture of wide streets and narrow alleys, and is a lovely place to explore. It's not huge, so you can get around it comfortably without wearing yourself out, and there are plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants to ease the pain! Masses of souvenir shops, many of which sell exactly the same stuff - glassware, amber and very distinctive jewellery. Not far from Wenceslas Square, which is well worth a look, and there is a Jewish Quarter, with a fascinating cemetery that you should visit.
Beautiful!. One of the top places in the world, comparable only to Krakow, Barcelona, Paris or London. Beautiful, majestic buildings, charming streets, good restaurants, and beer everywhere!
Beautiful. Just pay a visit! It's adorable and beautiful and great to see the old buildings and cozy cafés. When in Prague.

nice place to visit. The old town square was within walking distance of our hotel. There was a little market going on and it was a fun visit. There are lots of shops, food places and restaurants around the square.
Magic. Another beautiful part of Prague, must see part of the city, always busy with tourists but that just adds to the experience.
Amazing.... Prague is just a beautiful city and so much to see and do. Visit the old town where you will find stunning old buildings. It is a tourist attraction and therefore gets very busy.
Come and see the town and the clock!. This place is full of happenings and crowd. People gather here at every hour to take photos and videos of the clock chiming!
Crowded. September is high season so very crowded but still enjoyable. Suggest getting a tour then coming back for more leisurely stroll

Beautiful. Wow, Prague is a great surprise. The Old Town square is a great place to hang out, to have a glass of wine or beer or coffee at an outside cafe, to watch people, and to look at beautiful buildings. Not just the church and old town hall, but all the individual buildigns surrounding the square. Each has great details and painting.
very intersting w/ astronomical clock tour every hour. Absolutely to see and free of charge for tourists!The hearth of Praga must to be seen. Don't miss it and stay up to see the hour clock...

Beautiful square!. Give yourself time to stroll around this beautiful area and be transported back in time. Amazing that this place has survived the violent past, but it has and the buildings are well maintained.
Absouletely magnificent!. The town is very nice and it does bring you back to when the times it was the original town. I would love to explore more when I go back to Prague again <3

Quick town walk about!!. We only had 3 hours to spare so we took a taxi into town and walked around. It was ABSOLUTELY beautiful. Spotless streets ,friendly smiles and many shops . The buildings are so old but are so well kept . I will definitely make another trip there for a longer stay !!
amazing. Full of history and culture. Everybody who is I visiting Czech needs to visit. Old Town is well restored

Nice buildings but insanely busy. The Old Town was absolutely heaving when I visited. You need to be constantly looking up to appreciate the buildings. There is some marvellous architecture but you need to tune out all of the tourist shops at ground level. Most of the shops sell standard souvenirs but if you look around there are some interesting shops selling marionettes or lovely handicraft products.
excellent. dont forget to visit oldtownhall and tower and also astronomical clock.at night it in more beautifull
Pretty scene. Well worth visiting and lingering around to watch the clock chime. Surrounding buildings makes for pretty photos.

If you're a backpacker you might want to shop somewhere else.. I love this part of town, it's so touristy and have a lot of good restaurant! Every corner of the street seem like an adventure, make sure you to explore it when you're there rather taking the touristy route!

Very interesting old and new. Old town square is lovely but unfortunately extremely crowded. We went on a Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday. We went in the morning, afternoon, and night. Mid day, as expected, was the worse congestion. As in most tourist areas you need to overlook the the people and the shops to see the true beauty. The architect is amazing on the old buildings. The restaurants and shops are jammed into every nook and cranny so if that is your thing, you will be thrilled! Speaking of restaurants, food is expensive there compared to most of Czech so be prepared. English is spoken almost everywhere and charge cards are also accepted almost everywhere. While I had heard rumors of pickpockets and danger, I never saw it or felt it. Be prepared to walk. Every street offers something to see. I brought my own water and snacks in a back pack to save money. There is no subway directly into Old Town but it is within several blocks. Trams also offer transportation. You can see most if it in several hours but to really enjoy the experience allow more time, or go for short periods of time over several days and nights.
NIce atmosphere. I love Stare Misto. There are a lot of restaurants and tourists. Very active atmosphere. Beautiful building and a sense of history
Old town. Beautiful place to hang around. So much things to see and places to relax. Highly recommended +++++ Prices are pretty high in the center compared to other places a little bit futher.

Amazing. Just returned from three days in Prague. Not city people but Prague is breathtaking. So much to see and amazing architecture and history. Old Town in the sunshine even with the crowds was very special and memorable. Great place to people watch from the cafes which because of their location a lot more expensive than away from the main hot spots. Location for trips either by brilliant open top vintage cars and horse and carts. A bit different to the normal bus tours.Not to be missed.
Loved Prague. A real revelation, the city is somewhat like a museum and thus man, many tourists, but so clean and feels safe. Will be back!

Simply beautiful but busy!. So many things to see and do here. Old Town Square with gothic and baroque architectural style buildings with many cafes and restaurants, Astronomical Clock, with a skeleton ringing on the hour, on the Old Town City Hall, the Church of Our Lady with high towers, Charles Bridge with beautiful statues to admire and street vendors to shop, Old New Synagogue, Jewish Cemetery, Powder Tower, another Gothic tower, Spanish Synagogue etc, etc. Take the walking tour offered by some companies at least for 2-3 hours for the first day.

A must see if you like historical buildings.. There is so much to see in the old town ,the buildings are truly beautiful .There are many buildings you can go in .The clock tower gets busy on the hour and its best to view it from a surrounding bar .Up in the tower you get a great view of many of the old buildings and a view of the rooftops of Prague .
Beautiful city buildings. All the architecture in this square is stunning. You must continually look up to see the roofs because there is the beauty. lots of cobbles so flat footwear only ladies!
highly recommended. Very beautiful old town. Highly recommended. Ever aging. For a september wednesday a lot of tourists. A lot of cool buildings to see. Especially the John Lenon wall ;-)

A fairytale moment. I have never met anyone that has been to Prague and be disappointed ... It was much more than I had expected ... I absolutely loved loved it.. It is definitely a place to visit.. Highly recommended
So many tourist traps. The area is very nice but the segway people will get on your nerves. Apart from that its definitely worth a visit
Wonderful and historic. Lots of interesting and historic buildings to look at. Free guided walking tours from the Old Town square
Very romantic and impressive architecture and atmosphere. If you're visiting Prague which is probably one of the most interesting and beautiful cities in the world, you must go to old town square.

Romantic walks. Really romantic square, it has maintained its old and traditional character that indicates Middle Ages. It was Christmas and there was beautiful decoration all over around. Plus there were lots of vendors selling traditional food, sweets and souvenirs. Romantic place for a couple.

Lovely place. A nice place to visit, some good photo opportunities, go up the clock for even better pics. We were a bit disappointed with the clock on the hour, not quite what we were expecting. Just be wary of a small amount of beggars.

Can't miss.. This was one of my most favorite places in Prague, yes despite being incredibly touristy. It's a quaint square with lots of sights to take in, and lovely architectural buildings and details. You can easily spend a whole afternoon or most of the evening here, people watching or just taking in the view (try from above the Tower) In the evening it has a fairy-tale magical appearance with random bubble blowing and entertainment.
walking early morning. Nice zone to walk with kids, at first hours in the morning. Small restaurants near, nice to take lunch.
Choose your hotel in this area. We have been in a nice apartment in the heart of old tow, havent ssen car sound for a week, only horse ride, long walk between the beautiful house fasades...

Story book town. Get lost :-) Walk till you drop. It's beautiful and you will see something around every corner. It's crowded, but it's worth it. We never had a problem finding a good place to eat, drink or just wander

Absolutely Beautiful! Favorite European City.. Prague and Old Town were so beautiful! The square offers great shops and restaurants and is surrounded by the gates built hundreds of years ago. There are great walking tours and river cruises offerered throughout the city and since it's not on the euro, everything is quite affordable.
Excellent walk. Convenient town to walk and visit a variety of historic places. Good terrain--not too hilly, so it is an easy walk and there is always something interesting to see around the corner.

Beautiful Old Town Square. Prague may be the most beautiful cities in Europe. Old Town Prague has some of the finest examples of architecture in the world with gems from the Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque era. Buildings remain intact because the city was not rebuilt like most European capital cities during the 18th or 19th centuries and wasn't bombed during World War II.The town square is almost always buzzing with activities. Street performers abound and there are many restaurants and cafes to sit and people watch while sipping a pilsner or coffee. Be aware that cafes right on the town square tend to charge more and the quality of the food can be questionable. However, given the atmosphere, spending a few extra crowns is definitely worth it.The astronomical clock is always a big draw. From 9 in the morning until midnight, large crowds gather in front of the clock on the hour to see it in action. It's really a mechanical marvel as it was first installed in 1410. It is the third oldest astronomical clock and is the oldest one in the world still functioning. Go up into the clock tower for a picturesque view of the city. Also not to be missed are the Tyn and St.Nicholas Churches, right on the square.
Fantastic. I found this city to be one of the best experiences I've ever encountered. The religious history is beyond words.

So much in such a small area. All the main sights and sounds are within a relatively short walk from each other. Do rake a boat trip as this will show other places to visit. Great city, great people and a wonderful mix of history to enjoy.
Atmosphere. The Old Town is really impressive. It can be a long walk on the streets with old houses and new restaurants. Very lively atmosphere

Enter fairytale city. Just walking around the old city has a majestic feel to it. You cannot go wrong. Bring good walking shoes because the stone streets are, well...just that and not easy on the feet. If you can hook up to a tour - great! The stories in this city are terrific! If not do some reading or googling previous to your visit (i am not saying trip adviser because if you are reading this then you must be in the app already. Let yourself get lost in the city its great fun. I cant go into detail but after your day you'll understand why.
Amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed the time spent in this absolutely nostalgic and beautiful square. So much to see and do...
Really cool... And historic!!. Just strolling the place is already fun there is so much to see and so much to do it's very rich in historic sites we had a great time!!

Wonderful !!. Old town is the top destination on every tourist's list of places to be visited. Old town of Prague is absolutely beautiful with amazing buildings, lovely architecture and you feel that you have stepped back in time some 600 years back. The city is best explored on foot and you will love to walk on its cobbled streets with roadside cafes. It offers great food and beer at reasonable prices.
Great place to visit. lots to see and places to eat or just hang out - we spent 3 days in and around Stare Mesto and with we had spent a few more
Buzzing with history and places to eat. An absolute must place to visit, with the astronomical clock and great views of imposing architecture. Plenty of places to eat and more importantly drink.
Main tourist attraction. Must visit for all travellers, close to all attractions. Take your time to explore at your own pace.

Fun place with centuries of history.. When you're in a place over 600 years old, you must be in awe of what stands before you. Parts of the square are that old, with history to match the age. An area of town that was used by the Nazis during WW2, partially destroyed and rebuilt. A beautiful and fun place to visit with many good restaurants and plenty of shopping to enjoy. The old town hall with the tower at 230' above the square. Great for pictures and general sight seeing all over Prague. If you've never been to Prague, put it on your list of places to visit!

Wonderfully atmospheric. A classical mid-European city with wall to wall points of interest, both ancient and modern. Ancient churches are close to high end shops, without each disturbing the other. I felt very comfortable and unthreatened at all times. Some folk begging but not many; good street musicians instead.While I've said below that the town is free, there are entry charges for many places, including some of the finest churches.

One of the best. Cobblestone streets, colourful facades, interesting shapes, ancient yet modern, there's no better place to come to enjoy people having fun, shopping, busking, drinking - you name it. Great during the day and night.
Wonderful architecture. If you love architecture and history this is the place for you. The detailed buildings and murels are all around. Remember to look up to the top of the buildings.

Most of the attractions can be found in this area. It all comes to life in this part of Prague. What do you need, attractions, tours, shops, restaurants, entertainment, hotels and most importantly....local transportation. The biggest pull are the amount of easy to find attractions here, I will explain more in further individual reviews.
lovely!. lovely and magic city! St Vito's Cathedral was amazing! Take a trip in the big botes (not the small ones), it's very nice in a sunny day!

Wonderful buildings. A must for any visitor to Prague is a wander round the Old Town. Some splendid architecture, interesting bars and restaurants and quiet little streets if you want to get away from the crowds.

Breath taking Old Town. If you love history, architecture, art, gastronomy and walking, then Praha is the city for you. You can find good food and drink options at reasonable prices.In the case of the Old Town, you can't help wanting to have a seat and enjoy a coffee or beer while enjoying the great atmosphere this place has to offer. You can walk through different path ways around the square. Great cafes, cosy restaurants, very nice shops, open markets and more! And if you happen to be an Art Noveau lover, then you can't miss Mucha Museum. It is amazing!

Insanerly busy during the day, but beautiful and empty at night. Depending on what type of traveler you are, chose wisely when you go to see the square.It is beautiful (as is everything in Prague) but crazy busy during the day or on weekends. There are so many people that it can be hard to stand and enjoy the old buildings.If you love the hustle and bustle of large crowded squares full of tourists, then it's great.We saw it in the daytime, ate some wonderful food from vendors, tried to look at the astronomical clock, but it was just too busy.Came back at 10 at night and it was almost empty. and the view of the buildings is fantastic. There were some musicians sitting playing and a few people gathered in a small group and it was really nice.
Old town trip.. We spent a day wandering round the side streets and the square, lots to see and do. Plenty of shops from inexpensive gifts to top name labels in fashion can be found
Beautiful square. Try and time it so you see the clock display on the hour. Get there around 10mins before to get a good view spot.
WOW!!. this is like traveling back in time! What an amazing and beautiful place. If you hace the chance try to stay walking distance from it.

BEAUTIFUL is an understatement. One of the most beautiful cities we have visited - decorated with great architecture and castles and cobblestoned roads all around is simply amazing. walking around the city is the best way to get around, you will find something amusing on every street.
Beautiful, friendly and easy to navigate the city.. So much to see and do in such a lovely and historic city. Street vendors, churches, shops, pubs, music, museums. Jazz tonight!

Beautiful architecture, lots of tourists!!. I love the architecture of the Stare Mesto but in the summer months, it's going to be packed with tourists so go early. It's obviously one of the best attractions of Prague so I don't blame everyone for wanting to see it. I would say it's worth visiting at least once when you are in Prague. I suggest paying rent (a beer, cup of coffee or other drink of choice) at one of the overpriced cafes in the square and just relax and watch people go by. It's not going to be cheap but it's definitely worth it for a short time. There's also a lot of food stalls with different traditional Czech snacks worth checking out.

Unbelievably beautiful. Prague's old town has the most beautiful architecture I've ever seen. The astronomical clock is spectacular, and the pastel building make the square look like a fairytale. There are great restaurants, shops, art galleries and small museums surrounding it, as well as government buildings and churches. Put it on your bucket list.

Wander and enjoy. Besides the Old Town Square and the clock there are many other buildings. Wander around the streets and you can find some very cute shops. If you're looking for something touristy hit up Karlova Street.
Full of history. So much to do in this area, many shops and not far from places like Charles Bridge. Always buskers around and great to people watch
great place. one of the best attractions in PRAGUE! the old town tower can give you a view of the entire attraction so definitely not to miss
Impressive. Really beautiful old town. Here you can feel historical atmosphere. Buildings in the old Czech style are impressive. The main tourist area of Prague

AMAZING CITY. The Old Town is a must see, if you love architecture you'll love the old town, all the churches are free to enter, they are definitely worth a visit, the skyline is just a plethora of spires.
Nice atmosphere . The old town is one of the main attractions in Prague. Many small alleys with handy craft shops, coffee stores and more. Nice area to stroll and enjoy. One of the must do in Prague.
Wonderful! . There's a reason why Prague is titled the most beautiful city in all of Europe! Easily accessible by any modes of transportation. Recommend walking the streets but having a map!

Beautiful. So beautiful. I just loved every minute of Prague, the buildings are wonderful, the food is delicious and the people are reasonably friendly. The Old Town square is just lovely. The astronomical clock was in it too which was so cool to see!

Amazing space, stunning Architecture and vibe. A visit here is a must. Stunning square with amazing church towers plus the old astronomical clock. Cant say it was a must do to see it chime the hour but its fun. At night loads of musicians playing on the square and the place is really even more gorgeous all lit up. Cafes and bars around the square very touristy and somewhat expensive. Suggest places a few steps away (eg Tynsky 9 bar at the prague siesta apartments or a great little pizzeria on Tynska that has great live jazz music and very good pizzas)

Heart of Prague . If u plan to visit the city pls take a hotel closest to this place, it shall save u loads of money on cabs n their scams, its the most lively place of Prague, always bustling from early morning to late night.

Very picturesque. This is a very beautiful square in the heart of the old town so bring your camera. The are all manner & style of shops leading off the square including various types of restaurants & cafes. However I really enjoy the klobasa sold by the venders on the square, cheap cheerfull but very tasty.
Much people. Intresting place and it was easy to get in but the queue to the church was so long that we could do not have the energy to stand in the queue.
Great place to meet friends. This place is a good meeting spot! Heaps of plaaces to eat and drink. It can get very busy during the day and Jacks church is close by which is always fun!
A Must See while in Prague. Definitely see the clock and Old Town Sq., but also wonder the side streets and alleys in this unique jewel.
