Stunning. Our student tour group spent two days in Prague. Everything about it was stunning. This is by far one of my favorite places. The architecture is breath taking. Wander the streets, sample the food, and shop. I loved it!

Always busy. This place is always packed. The only real time I saw it slow during my visits is when it rained and also early in the morning. While busy, the place seemed safe to me. Everyone just having a good time
Great old city vibe. Everything you would expect and more. Restaurants, bars, beautiful old architecture, tours on horse & cart, old timer cars or even Sedgeways :)
Great but crowded.. If I return to Prague, I would go in a month other then July or August. The crowds were everywhere! Still enjoyed the sights.

Good old town. Good sites to see. Architecture Akim to other European capitals. Took an old car tour of the city. Was well worth it. Clock was cool, much like Munich. People watching in this city is great.

Old, big and interesting place to see. Countless streets and little stores or manufactures are the main decor of the Old Town. No supermarket nearby, so prepare several bottles of water or 3 EUR/little bottle. Try some absinthe ice cream or some draft bohemian beer or handmade chocolate candies.

So Fantastic Its Almost Hard To Describe!. So we booked a long weekend in Prague after having done Rome, Paris, Barcelona etc and wanting to experience something a bit different. Having not had a lot of friends visit Prague with their significant other it was a little hard to convince mine to begin with that visiting was a good idea but none the less after some research we booked and were on our way. Then came a whole different set of thoughts neither of us had ever learnt a word of Czech and we were sure of the currency etc but....then we arrived.Prague is beautiful, in so many ways it really is almost hard to describe. The Old Town is the most charming and captivating area within a capital city I have visited, almost like something out of a fairy tail with its old architecture so fantastically preserved. Walking through the old cobbled streets (not for the high heels ladies) really sets the scene for the glorious backdrop of buildings awaiting around each corner. It is very easy to walk a fair distance without realising when in the Old Town so be sure to have a map and be keeping an eye on where you are walking as it is easy to get a little disorientated.Stare Mesto is host to some fantastic restaurants and bars so be sure to check them out for some traditional Czech cuisine. I've seen a few people writing saying not to buy food and drink in the area but it is most definitely safe to do so just don't fall prey to the tourist traps. However I must say getting a pint of Staropramen in the Old Town Square in the evening isn't a bad idea! The area doesn't live up to the typical expectancy of it being full of stag do's like everyone may think. Ironically we saw 3 groups whilst out there to celebrate in this sort of way and most of them were from the Czech republic!All in all if you are thinking about going just do it, you won't regret it! Make it more magical and visit at night when its all lit up as well!
Inspiring. What a square!!! Great architecture, lovely atmosphere, a lot of cafe, restaurant and shops. Lovely especially near sunset or in the early morning.

So Old and Pretty it hardly seems real.... The town square is just a hub of great vibes and a mass of tourists, tour groups who are all looking around in awe at the beauty of this magical place. Its kind of Disneyland but its all real.

First class people watching square.. This is the place to go to chill out and watch the world go bye whilst enjoying a coffee in one of the many restuarants. The buildings around this large square are decorated by statues and figurines.
Lovely, romantic. Lovely architecture, romantic atmosphere, plenty of restaurants around and shops with typical czech items - definitely worth visiting.
Magical!. Prague is one of my very favorite places in Europe. Old Town is a magical place. Grab a seat and a beer next to the astronomical clock and enjoy watching time go by.

Prague Old Town was spectaclur in every respect. A must to see and explore when visiting Europe.. We stayed for 2 & a half days and visited most of the Old town surrounding the town square, Republic Square, the Jewish quarter,, Charles Bridge area and the Prague Castle. We loved all areas and would like to return one day to see it all again. We found everything was close by and easy walking distance. We visited in late July. The weather and temperatures were just right and although everywhere was busy with many tourists like us, this added to the atmosphere and an enjoyable stay.
beautiful . so pretty. feels like a fairytale. would avoid eating or drinking anywhere in the area, but great for a walk around

Awesome ...Like from a fairy tail book..... Highly recommended , the US dollar go a long way here. You can can have lunch by the river before going to Castle, and Starbucks at the Castle (nice refreshing)

City tour. Most interesting. Suggested to take a walking tour whether guided or just using a map. The Old town Prag is most interesting and beautiful. A lot of interesting buildings, historical sites, nice and good cafe shops and restaurants. One should take a tour at day and night, since the city offers different views day and night.

A place must to visit. There a lot to see on the square and if you explore all of the thoroughly it will take you easily half a day.
Just a lot of good and beautiful things.

Gorgeous Square. This is a beautiful part of Prague. Lots of gorgeous things to see! A must visit when in Prague. There is a nice vibe, but it can get quite busy so if that's not your thing, be aware.

Lovely place. Lots of beautiful buildings to see. Nice little cafes but most are very touristy. We definitely recommend doing a walking tour when you first arrive as they gave us lots of tips about where to go and at what times. They also gave us some good advice for how to avoid petty crimes and being scammed when using ATMs and the money exchange places etc.
You need to visit, but crowded. An essential vision of the evolution of the city from the Middle Ages to modernity, in a well-preserved ensemble.
Trip to the past!!. Great way to visit the past of the city. A lot of street artists and great shops in every corner. Great to walk with your family and friends!!!!
A beautiful city. A beautiful, picturesque city with lots to do. Can get really hot and crowded in summer - if you want to eat, avoid the main square and go down the side streets.

A One of a Kind Destination... Go!!. We just went to Prague and Vienna. Thought each city would be better than the other. When we saw Old Town Square and the rest of Prague... nothing could compare. If you have a bucket list, put Prague down now! This city is historic, safe, clean, and mind blowing... and it all starts here at the Old Town.
Stunning views.. Focal point of the city. Go up in the lift of The Prince Hotel for fantastic views and lunch. The clock-well,it's not that exciting!!

Step back in time.. The Old Town of Prague is like stepping back in time. If you visit the castle you can see the medieval town and the buildings. The old town is quieter than you would expect as The Charles Bridge is rammed with tourists. There is a lovely park and some pretty shops. You can get a boat trip from here too. Stare Mesto is the quieter more reflective side of Prague and definitely worth a visit. You don't have to walk over The bustling Charles Bridge any of the bridges will take you there, it depends on how much walking you like!

Vibrant old town square. Prague is a lovely city, nothing is too far away, you can walk everywhere. The old town square is great during the day with jugglers,living statues and fellows making giant soap bubbles for kids, but to my mind it really comes alive at night. Lots of people just hanging out or eating at one of the food stalls or restaurants that ring the square. At the top of the hour the astronomical clock is the place to be. There are all types of buildins around the square from medieval to gothic. Fantastic place.

Authentic town rich with history !. Walking around this town really brought me back glimpse of its history. While there are the usual trinkets shops all over the place, the cafes and restaurants served great food with value for money. More importantly the towering old buildings brings the mood of a majestic and grand architecture to let you feel the medieval times. Great to walk in the evenings !

Nice square full of bars. Visited last year with friends on a weeks getaway. Square itself is nice and clean. Didn't see any dodgy people apart from the pr staff from rubbish bars but you get that anywhere. Bars on edge of square are alright but more expensive than surrounding areas. Nice place for pictures with friends and food etc.
Historical Architecture is a must see. Did a 6 hour walking tour with lunch and boat ride it was the best. Saw so much glad I did it. They have car+ tour bus options

I have never seen so much lovely old architecture per square meter.. Beautiful city. Very convenient and swift public transport, especially the metro. The only negative is that the streets are loaded with tourists.
Beautiful. I have been here twice at christmas and it is amazing. So beautiful and full of christmas stalls.We are going back at the end of november and can't wait!

Magic. We are travel to Prague last december.When we decide to visit Prague Christmas market we didn t expect to be so nice.It is a charming place.A lot of people are here every chrismas time to enjoy,to live the magic time of christmas.Realy beautiful.
Beautiful atmosphere. the Old Town have a beautiful atmosphere, fully rich of shops and historical spot all over the place.

Trio. What a fabulous place to visit full to the brim with history, something to see at every glance, great places to eat and people watch, architecture is beautiful and interesting we could have spent more time there. Lovely places to eat selling traditional dishes. We loved the old town. The people were so friendly we will be coming back
Simply incredible. Amazing historical site with some great stories behind it. Highly recommend visiting when crowds are small.

Walk around the old town. The old town area of Prague is very accessible for walking - very steep in places but with reasonable level of fitness you'll be OK. So many things to see, great cafes & restaurants - meals are so cheap here. Definitely visit the Astronomical Clock & the Churches. Plenty of great shopping - especially jewellery - Czech garnet is beautiful. This city is beautiful everywhere you look - a must visit in Europe.

Perfect!!!!. Was there in 2014. Will go again soon. Perfect city in all. We were there on Valentine's Day. Was relaxing, enjoyable and romantic. Absolutely recommend this city if you like see nice streets with old buildings, sight seeing and taste a bit of night life!

Busy but Beautiful. The buildings are amazing, untouched by the wars, Prague old town square is truly breathtaking. It's busy in summer, but worth a visit and a coffee at one of the ridiculously overpriced restaurants just for the experience.
one of thing's what should be seen. If you are passing buy, save few hours (for short visit you need at least 3 day's), but come and see - it's hard to explain, this place just have soul.
Astronomical clock. We visited all over Prague including the old town,you can go to the top of the clock tower and get a good view, lots of steps though but worth it! and not too expensive
A place to just look around. The whole old city in Prague is awesome. It is just to walk around and look around, every street, every corner are full of history.

Magical European "old town" square. We just had to visit this famous location and watch the Astronomical Clock. We took the opportunity to have lunch on two separate days in this locale. There is a huge variety of casual dinning all around the square great for people watching as well

Best Part of Town.. If you are looking to grab some food or see the sights thisnis it. All of it. New Town is a dirty, disgusting tourist trap. Old Town hs breathtaking views, delcious food, and everyone I met was unique, friendly and helpful. the top of the Astronomical Clock at night os better than during the day! Its open intil 10pm.
Astronomical clock. nice place to spend time, there are several resultant and bar with good view. Food may not be good but the location to have drink or snak is perfect.
really a golden city. wonderful architecture / nice cosy restaurants / a lot of small and big shops / you reach every spot by feet

You have to go up. Amazing view from up there, just go next to the clock and there they sell the tickets to go up to the tower, it's a must.
You will see all of Prague from there.
Fantastic square with amazing buildings.. The clock was beautiful, however it gets extremely busy there. I would recommend going early morning or late evening to miss the crowds.

Stunning views. This is full of beautiful architecture and a must to visit in Prague.No need for directions as the crowds will carry you there. Recommend going before 12 or after 17:00 if you want to have time to enjoy it. Be warned that everything closes after 17:00 or 17:30.
Classic buildings. To visit the square is a must if your in Prague it is a classic location with years and years of history. Just go !
feel the past. nice old town, with lot of atractions, crowded streets, good public transport, streets performances, good food, cheep beer, expensive coffee, in total must be seen
Something for everyone, food, souvenirs, lots to see!. Had a great time walking around and looking at so many beautiful buildings and lots of things going on at the Plaza.

Simply stunning. Old town in Prague is simply stunning. It is a great example of architecture that survived the WWII. Gorgeous by day, gets even better visited by night, full of lights, people, music, smells etc. Prague is a must see city in Europe. A bit overwhelming, but mesmerizing.
Interesting and Historical. We did a lot of walking and loved coming back again and again to the Old Town Square. Lots of people watching and good eats.
MUST SEE!. This is the pinnacle of Prague, if you don't visit this,you might as well be planning your next trip back to Prague so you get to see it!
Prague Old Town. The old town in Prague is delightful - beautiful buildings, bridges, large pedestrian squares and plenty of open, green spaces and parks.
beautiful. Amazing square, lots of lovely pavement cafes and restaurants, beautiful buildings, gets really busy, clock tower is a must
Life, this place is full of life!. Amazing place: music, tourism, bars, restaurants, amazing buildings, lots of history... You should spend time here!

Walking during the day. Very busy place during the summer time,
If you visit Prague you must walk around old town. You will get ripped off 100% if you buy food or drinks, especially if u pay by cash in the small shops
We paid 7£ just for two bottle of water
So do be careful!
historic architecture. I guess when it comes to historical buildings in Europe Prague is a definite must visit, with its old cobbled roads and traditional buildings

Culture and fun. Its just such a wonderful place and which I loved and would return. Its a very hilly place and has lots of restaurants and the famous clock and its full of tourists and entertainers on every corner. The locals shops were not the most friendly but the culture here is wonderful. It has some horrible toilets though and not nose friendly at times. I think its very interesting here and very different. Its full of culture and its great to take a tram which are very frequent. It also has lots of tours with lots of locals speaking in lots of languages to tourists. Its full of fun.....

Make sure to visit in the evening, when it's quieter!. This square is so beautiful, the various archietecture that surrounds you is mesmerising. The lights atop the Church of Our Lady before Týn are like something from a fairytale.

Stunning . We were staying right on the Old Town square and we found the location to be perfect. Yes, it is touristy but it's also ridiculously beautiful and any trip to Prague wouldn't be complete without a wander around the Old Town. Spectacular.
Nice buildings. A nice place to wonder day or night, loads of restaurants and atractions, i realy don't know what else to say so now i'm out of space

Very Colorful. This square is bustling with activity till late evening. A lot of charming cobblestone alleys that lead you through mysterious old buildings of an era long past... Follow the never ending paths and get lost in this fairytale town. Lots of beautiful restaurants with outside seating but be sure to reserve a table for the evening as the place really fills up at night. Also, good walking shoes are recommended since the cobblestones can be hard to walk on.

Amazing. There is no way you can go to Prague and not visit the old town square, it gets very busy in the day but is quite magical. If your an early bird it would be lovely to see before all the crowds arrive. But beware of the Segways!
Nice. Nice place to visit. Crowded especially in the afternoon. Good place for souvenirs shopping, nice beer places to drink with friends
OLD TOWN. Beautiful buildings , fantastic views , lovely bar , particularly J J Murphys Great bar staff / food

Very pretty. The buildings surrounding the square are very impressive. Lots of tourists are in the square at any given time so it's pricey anywhere around that area. Also if you are vegetarian, or like me vegan, it is pretty hard to find something to eat around that area. It's a very meaty city! The Archeological clock is here and it's fun to see it on the hour when the little figures come to life.
Gorgeous view. Truly is gorgeous. The view is just breathtaking, you can't get enough. We were there for only 3 days & the time just flew by. So much to see & all within walking distance.
A very happening square with lots to look at!. Enjoyed this square with lots going on - enjoyed the Baskers, especially an elderly jazz person rocking on to his own music...

Unique world treasure but becoming very shabby.. Great treasures, a lot of original architecture, so much history and so many well preserved historical buildings concentrated in a relatively small area, easy to explore on food.On the other hand, too many obscenely overprized businesses,too much unnecessary street entertainment, noisy music, shabby tourists and locals, some walking almost naked in summer, a lot of drunkens at night, urine smell in many streets, unhelpful and arrogant police officers, no interest in maintaining a minimum of urban decency. And pickpocketing, in Prague, is a real plague. Another plague is the huge number of segways: dangerous for the pedestrians. My feeling is that Prague must have a very inept city government.
Charming. Lots of restaurants and small kiosks nearby. The astronomical clock is a major draw but kind of a letdown.

Like stepping back in time. The old town is a beautiful place. It feel like travelling back in time. The buildings are well maintained and have kept their authentic character. It is full of tourists in the summer but the shoulder seasons should be better. The people were very friendly. It sis very easy to explore on your own with a map since public transport (metro, tram buses ) is very well designed. The street are filled with statues, musicians.

Nice, but many thieves around!. Many nice things and places to visit, parking zone up to 6 hours, so take your time. Watch out for thieves and restaurants where will rob you if you don't ask for menu to see prices. Especially avoid restaurant with gulash in bread at Loretanska 3, they are robbers!

Charming. Old town was charming. We had a blast exploring! Part of the charm is the Eastern European feel. It's like a time capsule. I feel like I'm back 50 years. It is a little sad to see the poverty and the buildings that need better upkeep. But, it is also charming to see things maintained as they were and not replaced by chain restaurants or modern building. There is something to be said for preserving the classic architecture.
Magical mysterious Prague Old Town. The old town is a mixture of magic and mystery and has several wonderful shops and restaurants. There is something different everywhere!

LOVE LOVE LOVE. I could live there for my whole life! What a place! Things to enchant your eyes..things to tame your hungry stomach.. things to shop...easy access to every where! I am definitely going there again not once but as much as I can make it to Prague again.

Teaming with people. We were here during a very hot period and it was about 94 in the afternoon. This is a great place to stroll in the morning when it's cool and less crowded. Nots of beautiful buildings around it, a huge statue in it and lots of open air restaurants and tourist stores. Good reference point for the city touting!

Living in a fairy tale city!. Prague is without doubt one of the most picturesque cities in Europe. The sights are sensational, the people are friendly and all around you there is fantastic shopping, great cafes and bars and wonderful places to dine. A truly magnificent destination. Allow at least a week to do it justice.

Beautiful. Old Town is beautiful with a great atmosphere. The buildings are large and have delicate architecture. The area has restaurants all around. People are seen playing music, having drinks and smiling from ear to ear. This is a great area for photos! Mid day and dinner are busy times but if you go early around 9 the square is quite empty. It is nice to take the beauty in without the swarms of people!

Another must visit site. Everybody should go here. And everybody does. there are buskers of all types and visitors enjoying the atmosphere. It is warm in the evenings and when the street lights come on it is stunningly beautiful.
Interesting. Full of tourists, of course, but very beautiful and interesting.Lot of entertainment, street artists and Music everywhere.Unfortunately a lot of beggars, too.
great view. I was here during the Christmas market. Everything looked so nice and the old buildings add a plus to the location

Lovely place to walk around. Beautifll and historic, worth walking around more than once, lots of restaurants and caffes also completly different and even better at night when all lit up. Lots of tours on offer explaining the history.

An absolute must stop and enjoy. This was a remarkable place. All around are very old, beautiful buildings but at the same time, there are lots of places to eat, shop and street entertainers. It has a high energy vibe that makes it a lot of fun to visit, eat, shop and play.
Beautiful !!!. It's worth the trip. Behind every corner is a new suprise. Every building every house is amazing. But try to visit Prague outside schoolvacation.

Too many tourists during the day!. Too many tourists travelling in large groups hoarding in front of the astronomical clock every hour for the bells.. Its a shame that such a beautiful piece of art is mostly unenjoyable due to this crowd.. But evening and night time is amazing.. when the day time tourists leave.. great to just grab a beer and enjoy people strolling around and the lively atmosphere..

Something for everyone. Not only are you walking amongst the most gorgeous architecture and historical buildings, there is also a million things to do. museums, spas, restaurants, shops, bars, underground clubs, crazy themed clubs, themed museums, the list is never ending. there is something for EVERYONE here. 24 hrs a day. crazy late night party scene in this town, as well as educational day time experiences to be had as well.

Festive place to spend the day!!. You will find many quality places to eat dinner or supper and a multitude of vendors in walking distance for shopping. Great for taking photos and visiting historical monuments close by.
Czech it out. Really worth your time to walk around and see all that this area has to offer. Lots of places to people watch, eat, grab food, and enjoy the architecture.

What a wonderful, well maintained old city. Prague is beautiful and it all starts at the old town. The buildings are treasures that are well maintained and protected. The streets are all cobblestone so where sneakers. You may need to stop for a foot massage at one of the many little shops that offer them because you just can't stop wandering all of the winding streets.If there is one drawback it's the proliferation of Segways in the city that can be invasive when there are so many people walking.
Beautiful!. It was our 2nd visit in the Czech. And we were so happy about walking this place. Lot of to see. Old town is very interesting with nice history. Recommended

Definately worth visiting. The square has a number of sites including the famous clock tower. The fountain in the middle is worth a visit all by itself. The square is surrounded by several decent restaurants. The city museum has a rotating collection of art.

Wishful thinking... Old Town is as beautiful as ever. The history and the architecture draws people in. It is a must see in Prague. It is recommended as a 'must see ' to every tourist. So no wonder everybody is there. At all hours. We make a quick walkthrough and usually end up in one of the side streets or cafes nearby. While there visit the Tyn Church, go up the Town Hall tower for some of the best views, stop by St. Nicholas church and check out Orloj. Jan Hus monument in the center of the square. The horse drawn carriages, just like the ones in Vienna and New York complete the picture and add the old world ambience. The Old Town in Prague is as crowded now as the centers of Florence, Venice, Vienna or Paris, where we visited recently. It was not always like that. But as they say - it is what it is. I just wish the Old Town was not as crowded and so popular...Wishful thinking...
Beautiful. Lovely square with amazing buildings all around and delicious food everywhere. Great place to start your Prague adventure.

Go early to see the buildings, go later to enjoy the crowds. Great place to walk around and explore. Every building is amazing. Many reasonably priced food options. Keep some Czech change handy (10 Cz) for using public toilets (WC). Wear comfortable shoes and enjoy. From Hilton you cross through old town to get to the bridge. Across the bridge and to the right, up the hill (20-30 min walk) is Prague castle.
Best place in Prague. Go up the Old Town Hall Tower (there's an elevator), the view from there is spectacular especially at night!
Architecture was stunning. This is the heart of Prague. You need to walk around and experience it. Lots of entertainers in this square.
Especially beautiful at night. We were lucky to be in Prague for a full moon, and the Old Town was so pretty at night (as well as in the day).
A must for anyone visting Prague. Old Town (Stare Mesto) is a must for anyone visiting Prague. Everything is so beautiful, it's a photographer's dream.

Medieval splendour. Although it was extremely crowded with tourist groups, it is still worth seeing. The town hall with the famous Astronomical Clock is a must see as well as the Tyn and St Nicholas cathedrals. Well preserved medieval architecture is simply amazing!
Hub. Good starting point for any adventure in the city. Everything is within easy walking distance and there is no shortage of options of places to eat and things to see/do.
Fun and unique. What an experience. It's a lot of fun but a bit couded. The astronomical watch and the jun Huss statue were great
Beautiful. It was a real joy to walk around this beautiful town which was a maze of narrow streets and courtyards, the Astronomical Clock was amazing !!
Prague Old Town. Very easy to get to, and a collection of past buildings to see as well as numerous places to eat and drink. The street entertainers also added to the fun.

The history behind the clock piece is intriguing. Prague is filled with wonder, history and passion. We took a free tour guide that lasted four hours and it was incredible. You meet at the Old Town and you are taken everywhere - with a break in between to recharge the batteries. Check out the clock and it's history in the square and wait 'on the hour' for the chime.

Get relaxed in Prague. This place is undoubtedly the best place to go and chill for a moment. The surrounding is amazing and you can enjoy the time without getting bored with lots of different activities which is happening regularly around the square.
Old Town Square. Enjoyikng to visit nearest museum of Dali, a few nice works of his view for Dante¨s Divine Comedy /plates collection/.

Could've explored for longer. We wandered the streets of the old town looking for eateries and enjoying the architecture. Very busy on the streets leading towards the square with the astrological clock but lots to see so we didn't mind ambling. Plenty of bars and eateries catering for all budgets and tastes and enough galleries, architecture and museums to keep you occupied for weeks!
Must see place. This is just one of the must see places on your travel, dont pay attention to tourist attractions or have overpriced tourist meals here, but just have a look.

Gorgeous place. This is a definite place to visit on your trip to Prague, the place is gorgeous to walk around. Always busy with lots near by to shop and eat. We went and Christmas and the place was just gorgeous with markets and the tree! Can't wait to visit again

A trip wouldn't be complete without old town. Plenty of bars and restaurents litter the outskirts, and often there is a great market in the square. Plenty to do for all ages/groups. Whether you're there as a family a couple or a stag/hen do. 10/10.
Beautiful. Learned about the sad history of Prague during a tour we took. Loved to see and understand what we were looking at.

A very busy place!. People from around the world gather there to eat, be entertained, see the famous "clock" and old world architecture! A must is the volcano - a "v" shaped pastry rolled in cinnamon/sugar and filled with ice cream, chocolate, or fruit and fresh whipped cream!!!!! Wonderful!

A Wonderful Place to Wonder Around. It makes sense that Staro Mesto is the most popular touristic area. The beautiful narrow streets and alleys full of old colourful buildings, lavishly decorated and awe-inspiring churches and cathedrals, museums, historic music halls and more - all those make it an excellent place to spend your time while in Prague. Many of the "Must-See" sites of the city are located there, within a short walk from each other, there are a lot of restaurants and food places, souvenir shops and bars.Being the most popular touristic area also means that it is mostly overcrowded with tourists (almost no locals), so it is advised to visit it in the morning. I would suggest to visit it again late in the evening or at night. Then it is much less crowded and has a different vibe than during the day.

Great. I stayed here when I was in Prague. I think Prague is the most beautiful city I have ever visited. I enjoyed the food, the beer and the history. I did do some side trips but stayed in Old Town and simply enjoyed the city.

One of my favourite places . We kept revisiting the old town because we enjoyed the feel of it so much. Lovely places to grab a mint tea and a bite to eat, our favourite being opposite the clock. Not to be missed

In love with this city... and especially with this part of the city ! Go up the clock tower in the old town hall... :) The views are breathtaking. We went there early when they just opened the doors and we did not have to queue ..When we go down, not even an hour later... the queue was huge..

This is basically what you want to do in Prague. The absolute heart of Prague. You can easily spend 2-3 days just exploring this place. Full of churches, monuments, tourist spots, old buildings, shops, cafes, restaurants, bars... You name it. Old Town is amazing and unforgettable. Just wear good shoes, enter it and walk where your heart takes you. You will enjoy every moment of it, I promise.

Beautiful Square. Step into the Old Town Square in Prague and journey back in time, 600 or 700 years. As we stand in awe, the dramatic history of Prague permeates the air. To fully appreciate the beauty of the Old Town Square, we had dinner at one of the pavement cafés lining the square. It's a great feeling and experience.
old town square. lovely place to wander around, went in August so it was hot but plenty of cafes although expensive in the main parts, worth it for the atmesphere
Beautiful city. Beautiful and unique city. In summer (august) is crowded by tourists, but anyways was very good. Inside the old town you can find the best choices for food.

It is almost a time travel. Prague's old town is one of the most beautiful cities I've ever been. It is worth just to hang around ramdomly enjoying the medieval atmosphere, grab some food and drinks in one of the several restaurants and bars that you will certainly find in your way.

Step away from the main square!. I guess such a beautiful and diverse display of architecture ought to be crowded and touristy, which ruins it a bit in my opinion, but still very much worth it! If you ignore the tourist shops and expensive cafes, the streets of the old town have kept a lot of their magic, and if you avoid the main routes, you can still find some charming an quiet back street, with a sense of authenticity.

Lovely to walk around. Lovely old buildings, beautiful place. Lots to see and easy to just wander around. Don't buy any water/ ice cream etc in any of the small 'mini market' shops. They're a rip off. Look for a bigger supermarket/ shop, there are some around.
beautiful. Had a nice walk and a beer in the Old town and looked up in awe at the amazing architecture of the buildings

Beautification As It's Best. The place old town square is one of the wonders the buildings are like the best monuments from history.
The Best place visit in prgaue specially Castle.
Very interesting. I could spend hours just walking around Old Town. Between the people and the buildings, it is fascinating.

Love the atmosphere and energy. I just loved the everything about Prague! The old town is wonderful with cathedrals and places to sit outdoors and eat, when we went the weather was perfect. It is a wonderful bustling atmosphere - but at the same time serene - perhaps it is the beauty that makes it so!!! GO! GO! GO! It can be as expensive or a inexpensive as you want it to be.

Nice to just wander on side streets as well. No one can go to Prague without visiting Old Town can they ? So no need to say that this is a must see area.It is nice to wander around in the early morning before the throngs of tourists fill the streets. Walking in side streets can help in midday if you feel overwhelmed by crowds. I was there for the International Marathon in May which is a spectacle in itself but was told it is a busy place in general.Don't be afraid to go down the side streets... lots of little shops and nice restaurants.Of course you must not miss seeing the Astrological Clock go through its movements.Enjoy and wear thick soled shoes, the cobble streets can be hard on the feet after a full day of walking.

The nicest place . The best place in burgas.. Lovely restaurants and very beautiful shops, you need two days to enjoy it as you should. There is the old walls and old ruins of a nice church.. It is the fishermen town..seafood restaurants fresh and delicious.. The mill..the train to take you around..all good

Interesting shops and easy walking.. Lots of interesting sights and places to see , very easy walking around Old Town , Also the restaurant in the city centre Hilton Hotel is excellent with very impressive service
Great view of history and architecture.. A wonderful place to see magnificent architecture and to people watch while enjoying a wonderful beer and lunch. Astronomical clock a must.

Amazing!!!. Another stop to see during your time in Praha! Highly suggest coming here and checking out Old town. There are hidden gems around every corner. Make it to here and around the corner you can find the famous Astronomical Clock.

Beautiful City with lot of history an Scenic beauty. Excellent trip. will love to come back to Prague. you can visit most of the places on foot if you get down to one of city metro station. lovely people and very helpful. Be careful who might offer you excellent exchange rate on roads. they might give you belarus or some other currency instead of local money.

Breathtaking!. It's like being back in time ... Hansel and Gretel Country! we watched people get married, while drinking at one of the many outdoor cafe's and restaurants. The clock chiming in the square is well worth the wait.

Beautiful part of the city. the old town of Prague is a very nice place to visit.
there is a lot of history to see and a lot to learn about the city.
it has some beuatiful buildings, very nice square and a lot of good restaurants
Beautiful. Great Square, with a lot of history and amazing buildings. I just recommend not to eat on kiosks on the square, but walk a little far to restaurants (it's cheaper).

Packed with tourists. The square is full of people and when the Astronomical Clocks chimes on the hour you can barely move. It is prettier than the Little Square in Malmo (and better than Copenhagen) with magnificent churches surrounding the square. The view for photographs does clear in between the chimes so stick around for your opportunity. The area is a bottle-neck to the narrow alleyways of boutique shops leading to Charles Bridge, so be prepared to jostle for position.The area also has a few beggers, annoying buskers who cannot sing, and some crazy human statues (eg. Michael Jackson). I think they detract from the historical significance of the site but I guess they are just trying to eke out an existence. The Old Town has a pretty exciting vibe in spite of the latter, and is a bit of a light show at night. Worth a visit if in Prague.Tick the thumbs up if my review helps.

A fairytale . Absolute must-see. Walking through the streets is like being in a fairytale story. There are winding little streets that open out into bigger squares. You could spend hours just roaming and enjoying the beauty.

Typical Prague. Easy to call this the heart of the city, as the majority of attractions and famous restaurants are in this area of the city. I would avoid staying here, as the majority of hotels and restaurants in this area are overpriced. I ventured here only for nice dinners / to enjoy the attractions.

Old town. If you arrived in Prague , a must see is top view from church. You need to buy ticket and go up. You will have very nice landscapes and you can see entire Prague. Very nice !! Highly recommand you.
Grand!!!. A walk around the old town makes one travel back into the medieval times. The astronomical clock is fascinating as is the Prague castle and the vie from the city from there. Must visit.

OT. One of the most beautiful old towns in Europe , in my life I visited a few capitals, but the old miesto really captivated me , I was there for 3 days , but I plan to go again sometime , maybe in the winter , the views are breathtaking , meal prices very close , a huge kind of meals to choose from.
Beautiful. Beautiful old buildings in different architectural styles. A treat to walk around in. I recommend a walking tour. Easy to get around.
Amazing area of the city!. So relaxing, lots of great places to sit and just watch the world go by, or to try the local food and sights.
Amazing!. Highly recommended! and don't miss the little shops along the way and try their ice cream and native pastry too!
Absolutely beautiful . If you are in Prague, you cannot miss this spot. You will be transported to centuries ago and feel like in a fairy tale. Beautiful place!
Beautiful. If you're close to the area, this is a definite visit! The scenery and atmosphere was just truly magnificent. Plenty of great restaurants to have breakfast, lunch or dinner!

Lovely week. The great city of Prague is a must see, beautiful architecture around every corner along with pubs, restaurants and shops. Also found Prague to be a very open friendly city - especially at night. Do get a Thai foot massage, very reasonable as they often throw in neck and head massage and you get a 20% discount on next visit. did wonders for my legs after lots of walking

Wall to wall tourists. I know it was August, but still.... It is like a tourist trap, the whole old town. Mediocre food places, terrible service, horrid wine. Walk through a couple of times, but really...
So much. So much to see and do in the square all day and night. Music entertainment food and historical buildings.
Beautiful. The square is the centre to everywhere. You can go to wenceslas square and all the big shops. And the astromical clock was there too. Very lovely also very touristy

medieval centrum. Prague is a quite small city and you can walk around the whole city. But I do not recommend it, while there are trams everywhere. Stare Mesto is the best part of the city. It is crowded in the weekend but you can still have time to take a photo of the astronomical clock tower with the picturesque old town square.

WONDERFUL BEAUTY. THIS square is just Old World. Its surrounded by beautiful historic buildings and theres a wonderful fountain in the middle. There are a lot of Segways on the square and some great traditional Czech eateries around the edges of the square. I cant wait to visit again.

Bustling with activity day and night!. The told town square is a fantastic place to visit, it is full of activity all of the time.There are the people painted in gold or silver quacking at you as you go past to try and get your attention, horse and carriage, music, escapologists and probably fire dancers too, but we didn't see them.It's a great place to just hang around and see what is going on, and there are plenty of shops nearby to get something to eat.The view around this place is amazing, there is the old Astronomical clock in the centre, which hundreds of people just stand by and watch it as it chimes every hour (worth watching), then opposite that is the most spectacular view, of the Church of Our Lady before Týn. A most impressive looking building. I don't know if you can go in it, we didn't.You can book ghost tours to go under the Astronomical Clock too, it's a fun tour but great to actually be able to go under it.Come back at night too, it's still full of activity and looks even better! Just watch out for people wizzing past on Segways, whatever time you go there!

Center of Prague. Take in all the history at this beautiful square. Be sure to see the Astronomical Clock. Notice when you look at the towers of the church - they are not identical. It is a symbol that man is NOT perfect. Lots to see and learn about the architecture of Prague.
Superb Views of the New and Old town. Charles Bridge is a must visit and we took a 1 hour long stroll on this one sinking in the amazing views, music!
Part of a 4 day visit. Thoroughly enjoyed the walk across and back. Lovely bridge with its statues. Lots of artists and buskers. Very lively and atmospheric.

A Must See. This area has a fun night life, great food and is loaded with history. I would HIGHLY recommend that you find a hotel that locks up you car and watch for pick pockets! Typical big city stuff.....
Wonderful walk through history. It was a great feeling walking with hundreds of visitors through streets that have endured through ages.
Beautiful piece of Prague. Wonderful buildings and quaint streets. It gets busy but it is not surprising as there is so much to admire.
Very nice and atmospheric. So much happening in the old town you can spend all day there just wandering around and drinking in cafes

You can watch this every time. Never boring.. It is fantastic to walk this part of Prague. As a local citizen I can tell you what local people like and what not. Segway groups aren't liked much. They are seen as little bit arrogant on pavements. When you are taking selfie ask locals to be part of it. You can buy lot of russian stuff like a cap or badges but it has nothing to do with local nor authentic culture. What would you help is to have look at local potscards and try to take similar picture with you phone or camera. One of best view is down the Strahov convent particularly in the evening.
So much activity and sites to see. The Astronomical clock of the Town Hall, the Church of St. Nicholas and the many colorful buildings all add to the adventure.
Amazing view of the square and city. Really amazing the view of the City...you will not stop to shot photos. the Red Roof are very caracteristic
Walt Disney could not do better. This Square both day and night offers the most spectacular views I have seen in my 40 + countries travels. Night time after the crowds have thinned is best.
One of the best city centres worldwide. Amazing architecture, famous bier and food, still safe evening and night walks, friendly atmhospere. Everything you can enjoy in Prague city centre.

Beautiful part of Prague.. Based around the marketplace or square this is an easy walking area with lots musicians and performing artists, beautiful gothic buildings and great bars and restaurants. St Nicholas baroque church is a major feature and a definite visit.

Crowded. Very crowded with many souvenir shops in main square. Also many jewelry shops. Building styles very interesting. Suggest you visit clock in morning when it should be less crowded. Lots of cafes.

Historical, but very touristy. We really enjoyed Prague. It is a modern city, but with amazing architecture dating back hundreds of years, it has a very medieval charm. Beautiful city, but very popular with tourists.
Wonderful to wander. Go and enjoy Prague. The old town is lovely, interesting and fun. Great shops, spontaneous entertainment and nice restaurants.

How could you not adore this place?. Simply stunning, every bit of it. Could get lost here for hours. Loads to do during the day and night. Old Town Square is like a Disney fairytale land - one word of warning, though, the restaurants directly on the square are outrageously overpriced. Better off walking 5 minutes and getting a cheaper and often better meal!

Charming!!!. The old town of Prague is really where most of the tourists attractions are. This is a gorgeous place that really takes you back to the medieval time! You feel like you are in the middle of those medieval movies! Since it will take you to the palace and the famous church... Get prepared to hike... Because walking up is not easy!!! And of course, during summers... It gets packed with tourists!!

I love it so much I could live there. I have a thing for European old town centers --- the architecture, history, walk-ability, socializing, cafes, etc --- but Prague's old town has just replaced Vienna's old town as my favorite. You can walk or take a tram, eat delicious food, shop for art, visit the sex museum lol! (you should), have a coffee or a drink at an outdoor cafe, even in the winter, all wrapped up in the fur blankets provided. You simply must wear flat, comfortable shoes in Prague -- the streets are rough, uneven cobblestones, and daily you will see a tourist woman attempt high heels, and see her snap them office at least, or at most, fall down and hurt herself. You will look like the biggest tourist ever if you wear heels. Prague is a casual, laid back, beer drinking, charming city.

Always a pleasure to visit.. It's a stunning place to visit in Europe.Try to time your visit to the square as it gets unbelievably busy during the mid morning to early evening. If you want photos (you definitely will) then go when it's quieter.
beautiful building. the best memory in praha is walking in the old street. because every building is so beautiful.
agic. At night, is such a fairy tale. during the day is very crowded with tourists, guides, shops and so on, but at night it is simply magic. for sure we will return, maybe in wintertime

Walk with a free tour guide. We did a free tour with Mikhail. He is a great fellow with lot of information and witty jokes. The walk was very informative. Old town has lot of history. The lanes are beautiful. You can eat there or just sit and relax. Must go place because other attractions like astronomical clock and church es are nearby. This place is the epicenter for tourists.

Beautiful and busy!. This place is defo worth a visit and get your cameras at the ready, however be prepared for it to get packed out. You can get yourself a tour guide to take you around everywhere and explain a lot more about the history. Even a Segway tour if you don't want to walk xxxx

Romantic, atmosphere-breathing, 100-tower and pinnacles.... There is nothing even similar ot Old Prague Town in Cetnral Europe. You shall see a lot of very romantic places, do some shopping, hire a cab for sightseeing. If you travel with and agency and use public transport, that!s perfect. If you use your car, you are not going to enjoy your trip very much for the whole Old Town is restricted "blue-zone" area (parking only for residents, deliveries and taxi cars with special parking cards). Hotels and restaurants are expensive, for the Old Town is the very heart of Europe.It is definitely worth visiting,... even once in life!

Fine.... Very over-rated tourist attraction with not a lot going on. The clock is interesting, not a lot else. The bars and cafes in the square are very expensive, i recommend venturing down a side street to eat or drink for better prices!

A Buzzing Place. A large public square in the centre of the city. The place was alive with all kinds of tourists milling around the many shops and bars. Loads of little side streets and alleys to explore. The architecture all around was stunning and the astronomical clock is a must see.

So Beautiful. Definitely my favourite part of Prague, there is so much to do and see, a whole day can be spent uncovering the Old Town. Lovely restaurants with some amazing local dessert specialities, churches, synagogues and interesting buildings everywhere.

Mystique and still living in full. Usually crowded but when the astronomical clock stops its show at 10 P.M. the narrow twisting streets of Old Town, lit by gas lanterns after fifty fears of popular demand again, let your imagination loose. You need not worry it is a safe town and you won't get lost, just little bit more walking.

Beautiful for a walk in any weather. Went to visit Prague for my Birthday with my sister, even it was rainy thru out the day it was still nice trip walking around the Old Town, passing other tourists between many interesting little stores and places to eat/drink, enjoy the atmosphere and just he beauty of the historic place.

Too crowded. A shame that it is so touristic and crammed with people everywhere ( us included, of course) By 10 am is sort of ok. Later on it gets fully packed.Worth visiting at night, to enjoy lightnings and nice atmosphere. Quite surprised that € are accepted almost everywhere with very good exchange rate.All in walking distance. A must if you' re in Prague.
Beautiful. I had no idea just how beautiful Prague was. We started with a walking tour which helped our orientation. The buskers were very entertaining.

Beat. Prague old town is beautiful. You will be surrounded by loads of tall beautiful ancient buildings. The architecture is stunning. Loads of similar streets full of street food and goodies that I really didn't mind getting lost in for a few hours
Beautiful old town square and side streets.. There was a concert on when we visited but it did not detract from the feeling of history the cobbled streets and building exude.

Good spot, very busy during summer though. . Good spot, plenty of things to do and see, some great photo opportunity spots. Few dodgy people at night trying to sell drugs but if you keep to yourself you will be fine. The clock always draws a big crowd on the hour and it's a good meeting spot. Got a foot massage from a Thai place that was quite good after a long day walking around town.
Impresive. the Stare Mesto is the most busy square in Prague. The magnificent building around make this place magical.

Wonderful architecture at every turn. As you would expect it's the hub of Prague & always very busy, but well worth a wander and pause for a drink at one of the many bars/restaurants/cafes lining the main square. There is wonderful architecture at every turn, ornate churches and hidden treasures up little alleys. Illuminated at night the historic building are stunning.

Lovely. Very touristy but lovely houses. We waited for the clock to strike o'clock to witness the little display on the clock. Restaurants and cafés around the town square are expensive but walk up a little side street and you will find cheaper alternatives.

Beautiful Old Town. No trip to Prague is complete without walking around the Old Town. Its so pretty and steeped in history, it's almost like going back in time. You can get a great view of the square and surroundings from the top of the tower in Old Town Hall.
Magnificent. Views are amazing. Do a free walking tour - they are offered twice a day at least, from more than one company and in many different languages. Learning the history makes it even better!
Old town stroll. Must see when visiting Prague. This,area brings you back in time. Sit and have a cup of coffee or a drink and people watch.

Visit to Old Square. Fantastic place to visit. Wonderful architecture and a real feel of how Prague must have been like over many hundreds of years. Lots of boutique shops and coffee bars to choose from. You do need to head off the main square to the many lanes and alleys to find lots more and also offer better prices even just a short walk from the square. Worth spending a bit of time just sitting with a drink and watching the crowds walk by.

Charming Old Town. The famous Charles Bridge is the connection between the Little Quarter (Mala Strana) and the Old Town (Stare Mesto). The Mala Strana Bridge Tower is the smaller of the two; the entrance to the Old Town is through the State Mesto Bridge Tower, which used to be part of the old town's fortifications. As soon as you walk through, you are in the Old Town and you will continue walking down the royal way; you will see crowns in the walls of the streets so you know that it is Charles IV's famous road. The Old Town is beautiful, and the culmination is the famous square with the Astronomical Clock. You might want to see St. Nicholas Church, which is really beautiful, and Kinsky Palace. Also there is a house called the Storch House that has a painting of St. Wenceslas on horseback, so it's pretty hard to miss. The Old Town is also filled with houses with various carvings over the doors that used to identify them before the houses were numbered; one of the most famous is the House at the Two Golden Bears.Also, the Estates Theatre is there; this is where Mozart premiered his opera don Giovanni in 1787, and it was used for the movie Amadeus. They were performing Don Giovanni when we were there! It's just chock full of so many things to see, that you really need to make a list of what you want to look at and hunt it down, because Prague, especially in August, is very popular with tourists. This is my favorite part of the city.
Beautiful but terribly overcrowded . The old city in peak season is probably worse than Rome. Just too little main streets for too many tourists. Better explore other sections if the town!
Nice walk. Very pretty. A must see. It really helps to get a guide. You could never see what we did without one.
Great atmosphere. A good choice of bars and restaurants but can get very busy at times especially on the hour when the astronomical clock strikes but great architecture

Beautiful but crowded in the middle of tourist season in August. Been there before in June and it was less crowded. Chri. Historic, interesting, multiple things to see and do. If you wander south to the Josefov neighborhood you will find some neat less touristy bars and restaurants where4 food is good and pricves are much less than the square itself.
Enjoy the evening . . .. Not far from Charles Brige and one of the lively places in Prague. A nice place to spend the evening and enjoy the artistes . . . bubble blowers, street acts, musicians, etc.
green walking tour. this was an interesting walk -it was easy going but we were certainly given lots of information and lots of tips about prague

AMAZING!!. Prague is an enchanting a fairy-tale like city! I was so happy to finally take a trip here and we stayed for 6 days total so we got a very good feel for the layout of the city and a lot of different places of interest... The Old Town is very cool and typical of an old city centre.. Very touristy, for sure, but very beautiful and full of lots of restaurants and shops... I would definitely recommend it as a place on the list to visit in Prague!
Breathtaking . If this isn't the most beautiful square in Europe then we don't know what is. Take a seat and just take in the view.

Stunning Prague must do. Beautiful old buildings, came here a good few times just to sit and soak everything in. Great for sitting and enjoying some lunch. The best part was climbing the town hall, the information and images (especially of the destruction of parts of the old square) were fascinating, and the views from the top were sublime. Beware though, there was a 30 minute before the stairs for the hall which are indoors, and we didn't know it was there when we bought the tickets. Don't expect much from chiming of the astronomical clock, it's very overpacked on the hour, and although the clock itself is amazing, the little figurines going round is a bit underwhelming.

Possibly the most over-rated attraction in all of Europe.. There is indeed something wrong about a tourist complaining about the tourists. But Old Town just gets too many visitors to enjoy, and I don't feel bad saying that. I've visited Prague a few times, my first in the early 90's. Prague is proof of two things: (1) capitalism works, and (2) capitalism can be tacky. Parts of Old Town are truly tacky. Feel free to disagree.
Very busy. The old town was very busy when I was there. There was a good atmosphere around the area and there was plenty to see and do.
Old town special time. It is lovely in the Old town part of praha... People are walking around here at all time of the day... You can just sit here for hours and contemplate the history of it all
Delightful. Prague truly is a beautiful city. A visit here makes a great city break. Plenty to do and see. I recommend a tour of the city - 6hrs incl visit to the castle, lunch, boat trip
Favorite old town. This is a must see and you will feel like you are in a magical fairy tale from long ago. Be ready to stay longer than you expected.

Most See For Any Trip to Prague. This is such a wonderful spot to stop back multiple times and at different times of the day to see the sights of Prague. The entertainment and crowds and views are different throughout the day and worth multiple stops. Also, the city tower stop is an important thing to do on a clear day to see well beyond the square. ADVICE: Avoid the long line for tickets and get a better price if you buy your ticket online (can use your cell phone) using the QR code at the office directly below the tower just off the square (not the ticket collection point on the second/third floor of the building).

Beautiful but unbelievably crowded. We walked through in both the early morning and early evening and it was so crowded. But at night, the crowds dwindle a little and you're better able to stop and appreciate the beautiful buildings. A definite must see.
City break. This is my favourite part of prague .so much history and amazing buildings on every corner. Excellent choice of shop bars and restaurants. Great entertainment and market stalls too .

Charming square, amazing architecture. A must-see in Prague. Everywhere you look the buildings are charming and the Astronomical Clock is a true beauty. The hourly "show" is nothing much but doesn't take much time anyways so might as well watch it. The murals within St. Nicholas's church is amazing. Food is overpriced and as we weren't big fans of Czech cuisine, we tried the only Mexican Restaurant there, which was also disappointing. So go there to be surrounded 360 degrees by amazing architecture and probably eat elsewhere. We heard the view from the tower is amazing but the queue was too long so we had to skip it. There was a notice though that you can buy tickets online so worth looking into.

Fabulous place to get lost in the side streets and explore!. Love the Stare Mesto. Very quaint part of Prague. My wife and I just explored all the side streets, finding restaurants and shops off the main street.

Charming place with plenty beautiful buildings. Visited Prague for my birthday weekend. Had done some research and was looking forward to seeing the old town and wandering around the cobbled streets. It is busy and bustling but it still maintains a charm with its beautiful buildings and breathtaking sites. We wandered off the main streets and found some fantastic little courtyards off the main square and around the old town. We walked for three days without using any public transport. Except for a horse drawn carriage tour and a boat trip. Both were worth the cost. Wear comfy shoes and get wandering you won't regret it!
beautiful. really magical, like a fairly tale. however would avoid 90% of the bars and restaurants as they are very overpriced. much nicer places nearby!

Such beauty and amazing. The astronomical clock is an amazing thing . Surrounded by the most beautiful buildings and churches one can imagine. A city not to be missed. Such beauty and amazing history to reflect upon. The clock was truly a treat a 'must-see' when visiting Prague!

Romantic Place in Romantic City. Needless to say, everything in Prague are romantic and the best of all is Old Town. Strolling between old style building is worth the time spent, especially if you are coming with your special one.
Very nice town. Very nice with a lot of history and picturesque architecture. I particularly enjoyed it during a walking tour.

Lovely but heaving.... Wonderful old city centre but don't go in August, as all the world is there: try early spring/late autumn (we had no choice this time). Find cafes at some distance - we recommend the 'Choco-Cafe' in Liliova Street -because the pavement restaurants look expensive.

Awesome Very Busy. Lots of history shopping and restaurants very busy at this time of the year. Be prepared with lots of water and a backpack is a good thing to have when Travelling around this beautiful city .
Beautiful Old Town Square. From Charles Bridge to Old Town, everything was amazing. The architecture of the old medieval buildings are indeed stunning...A must do sightseeing when in Prague...

Exquisite history - like a fairy tale . Architecturally I think Prague is my new favourite city. You can stroll into the town centre and be amazed by the detail of the astronomical clock or the Tyn Church but a tour will give you a much greater insight (see my review on paid vs free tours). You could spend 40 minutes rushing past or a couple of hours. Grab a savory sandwich snack from one of the food sellers near the clock, and enjoy the buskers. The quality of the music - jazz yesterday - was great. We also spent about an hour in the Alfons Mucha exhibition at the Trcek House in old town. He's the Czech Art Nouveau painter - think Absinthe fairy. Also on show were Dali and Warhol.

Beautiful place full of activity. It was very nice to walk around the place. Gave a relaxed and enjoyable feeling. Nice to see people from all parts of the world roaming around and sitting in restaurants enjoying beer etc.
Incredible architecture!. A must to see!!!!!The buildings, the culture, the food, the shopping, the churches - all incredible.
Spectacular!. Prague is a UNESCO site definitely worthy of its designation. Jawdropping sights everywhere you look. And easy to navigate!

Old town square. Very nice to see, some very old amazingly built buildings.The only problem with this square is that it is a obvious tourist trap to the extent that it becomes not a nice place to visit more than once.

Well worth the visit. Beautiful streets, interesting shops and many sites to explore. So much to experience here. Slight problem in finding a decent restaurant if you're not a meat eater. A/C is harder to find in shops, and even the malls keep it to a minimum.

Old world charm with plenty of eating joints to sit and while away time !. This is one of the mystical places with huge architectural marvel and a big old town square where you will see lots of tourists. The place is very lively even during the night as there are multiple restaurants around this placeNot to miss are the people creating huge bubbles and various other musical/other activities.
Very busy. Very very busy but a great atmosphere. Well worth a visit. Nice outdoor cafes and restaurants. Check out the clock tower.

Most Beautiful Old Town Visited. One thing we all agreed was that Prague old town was one of the most amazing city centers we have visited in our Eastern Europe trip. The free tour by Unity Tours made a great explanation, which meeting point is at celentine street number 3. Do not miss the astronomic clock neither the old town square. Strongly recommend Prague as a destination in Centre of Europe.
Very atmospheric. Interesting old town. Well worth going on one of the walking tours, and learning more about the communist past. A rich history.
Woow. The old town is absolutely fabolous. Everithyng is so nice, the architecture, the people, everithying...the town is full of guide busses wich is also great.
Mesmerising The View. Have seen lot's of parts of Europe but Old Town Square specially of Prague is the best i have ever experienced some positive vibrations always their which touches your heart.
hub of activity. Lots of cafes, shops and street food; very busy area full of activity; spotty wifi; central to everything;; great views from the Tower

Bustling square with stunning architecture. Full of life day and night - tourists, locals, street entertainers -a hive of activity and interest. Beautiful historic buildings basking in the sun by day and bathed in light at night - all-in-all the most beautiful city square I have seen

Revisit at different times throughout your stay. More than just a beautiful square filled with history and interesting architecture, the Old Town Square is an ever changing sight that deserves several revisits at different times throughout your stay. The time of day changes the light and atmosphere of the plaza, making each visit a unique and worthwhile one in its own way.

A bit of a misnomer, but it still delivers - lots of tourists, though. The Old Town is not the only old part of Prague, and probably not even the oldest. But it is a beautifully preserved urban quarter with a nice variety of architecture and interesting structures. Prague is a fairly compact city, so take some time walking through it.

The view from the Old Town Hall Tower. Definitely a treat with a wonderful aerial view of the city. Placards are well placed to point out the sites. Would suggest that better signage to direct visitors to move in one direction only on the narrow perimeter walk. There are problems when it is crowded and some people think they can be a salmon swimming up stream.

Fantastic stop.. Stayed in Prague for two days and spent most of it in the Old Town. It is a lively place with a great many restaurants and shops. Stay for the people watching and make sure you try a Trdelnik. It's a wonderful treat.

Never Wanted to Leave. Prague is just magical; it captures your soul and you don't want to leave.The main Old Town is stunning in its architecture, busy and thriving. The tour guides and locals have this wonderful welcoming quality, and they love to share their history. If you ask them genuine questions and are interested in learning about the city, the opportunities are endless.The tours are a must, to get the low-down on everything, but if you're short on time - just go to the Old Town. Soak up the hustle and bustle. Let your eyes feast on the beautiful architecture. Have a local beer and find a place to just experience everything around you. I loved every second that I was here, and I think that would be the case night or day, rain or shine. Go for a weekend away, or indulge in a longer stay. Just make sure that you go, because it's really the kind of place that you don't want to miss.
A nice place with cathedrals and cafes. Can be reached easily by walking from the Wenclasas square, a good place to hangout with lots of cafes, beautiful architecture and a hub for rickshaw urs

Wonderful walk in sunmer. What a beautiful walk in old town with terrace restaurants all around and lots of pretty people. Outdoor cafes and sausage and beers make for a wonderful sunny day. Would want to come back just to visit old town again :-)
Authentic city. In this place you can feel the authentic Europe. It reserves the old architecture and you can feel that you are in the city of dream.Charming Prague
Nice. nice to visit, to walk and to eat. There are very good choice of all range restaurants. Heart of Prague.

Meandering streets. Lot of historical buildings and churches, many shops and restaurants. Found streets confusing, but had several serendipitous moments exploring!Suggest start early in the morning, very crowded later in the day.

It is simply amazing how beautiful the Old Town is. You are just passing one facade more beautiful than the other, small cobble stone streets, huge market places and the buildings are "simply to fall in love with!"Absolutely beautiful!!!

Re-living history . Well, I have to say: Prague is an amazing city, full of cultural events, has lots of history, has some sort of life of its own that makes you want to stay a bit longer and enjoy it more.It is at its Old town square that one must go and stay and enjoy. Don't go and stare for a couple of minutes! No! If you go to Prague, take a little of your time to sit and walk around, enjoy the animation (music, acrobatic performances), the sounds, the buildings around you.. everything. And don't forget: the astronomical clock! Yes, every hour it displays some figures "dancing".. but don't get so excited, for the show only lasts about a minute. After that, stop recording, since you will only keep recording the stroke of the clock, nothing new will happen.However I hope you enjoy it as much as I did and that you get to stop for a few moments to enjoy your time there. Ah, don't forget to go up the tower! The view is very nice as well!
beautiful castle. excellent castle with great history. St Vitus cathedral was fantastic with its gothic architecture. The treasury room and golden lane were nice.

Plenty to photograph . This was the first thing to see on our to do list, and we weren't disappointed. It's easy to find using a map and once you're there, there's plenty to see. The buildings are beautiful and easy to see, although there are large groups of tourists which we had to wade through to get anywhere. People say to spend a day just looking around here, but after a couple of hours there's not much to see or do. I'd definitely recommend going up the astronomical clock tower, as you get views across the city which are breathtaking. It's fairly cheap too so it's well worth the money.
Full of charm. Perfect venue for a vacation with something for everyone. Real 12th and 13th century town centre with history around every corner!!

Nice Area. The Old Town Square Area is a good place for a family to walk through for quaint bistros. Beware of the shops selling souvenirs and off course - the stag/hen troops traipsing through the area.

Great architecture. The Old Town looks great. Streets packed with shops, bars, restaurants, street food, nice architecture. The whole city is better than Vienna, Budapest, Bruges or other historic city you can think of.
Lively!. A temporary Mucha (plus Dali and Warhol) exhibit helped prevent this from feeling like a touristy overload, which is rather is. I don't get the sense locals hang here.

The highlight of a Prague Vacation. This is the main square for Old Town. Spend some time exploring the square and the streets around it. Go up the Tower for a great city view. There are elevators to get you to the top. Come back in the evening for a lighted view.
Wow!. never got tired of visiting this square....just plain gorgeous old world charm.... always felt 'safe'... loved people watching

Amazing View of Old Town Centre. Old Town Centre is a good place to see the diversity of city with a great angle of view from the top of Clock tower. It is worth to spend money to see the top view from Prague Astronomical clock tower.

Lots of beautiful architecture! . Travelled with some friends. Lots of beautiful architecture. Tour guides trying to sell tours on segways, which if you like that sort of thing is good. They try to attract you by giving you a "free" try on the segway. It can be quite expensive.Becareful of exchange places! I got badly burnt by going to the wrong exchange place (there is a blue/white logo on right on the square - avoid for GBP exchange!! The general exchange rate when I went was £1 = 31/32 koruna's. When I went to exchange at this place, the guy didn't give me the correct info, pretending he didnt speak englist very well and I signed all the documents to say I wanted to exchange - I lost out about £40 worth of money wish he refused to refund! Just make sure you ask the exchange people to confirm how much money you will get if you exchange £X etc. We visited the Astronomical clock in the area - lots of tourists so can get busyNice place to visit
A fascinating square from all sides. We loved the square with it's beautiful and colourful architecture. The beautifully lit Christmas tree just added charm to the square.

Love it. The Prague is quite a unique city thanks to the old town, the prices are a bit high considered it's the Czech Republic but nothing crazy. Plenty of places to eat and drink, best go out at night to explore and ask locals for places to go depending on preference e.g. as a motorcyclist who travelled far I went to Harley's bar which was great - rock music was a nice touch to past taste :)

Best side of the city. The Old town is by far the most interesting part of the city, but (there is always a but).... It is absolutely covered, and I mean covered in graffiti which really spoils the place.
First visit. Beautiful and picturesque totally blown away. Very crowded but worth it. Full of culture and inexpensive coffee bars.

History preserved!. Great place to visit and take in the old history of Europe! Wonderful tourist destination! City is very friendly and easy to get around! Pretty much able to do everything by walking if you are in decent physical fitness. Had a great time!

Walking tour. We booked into a walking tour which covered the castle to the old town and included trip on the river and a meal. Well worth the money as the guide Thomas was extremely knowledgable and gave us a great overview of city and its history.
So Much to See. This area is so full of historical buildings, great restaurants, good cafes, shops, and photographic opportunities. Lots of fun to just wander around and take it all in.

Living a fairy tale. The old town of Prague is, undoubtedly, one of the most shocking and beautiful places i have been ever. You will believe, you are not in 2016 but in the Middle Age, same feeling as if you were in Venice or Brujas. Mesmerizing...SIMPLY.
Beautiful.. What an enchanting square. if you are traveling to Praha, you can't miss this sight. Try not to eat at the square restaurants because you will not get a great deal nor great food.

Rich in history. Many tour guides,some live on donations, very informative. Teeming with tourists from everywhere, so it's good people watching. If you hear your language spoken by a guide, linger and learn.
Tourist center. Quaint tourist site with a great variety of very unique looking and historic sites. Lots of visitors when I was there.

Beautiful Old Town. Old Town Prague is beautiful, the buildings architecture is amazing. The astronomical clock is a must see. People will begin to gather 30 mins or so before the clock strikes the hour which you do not have to do. If you are there a few minutes before look up and you will see splendor of the clock. To fully appreciate the square take a walk through it early in the morning. During the day and evening expect a lot of tourist it gets very busy but great to people watch.

Lots to do. We were based around the Old Town, lots to do! Restaurants, shops, bars, the clock tower and a lovely church - a big must! I would definitely recommend on your trip to Prague! We went almost everyday.
#1 in Praque. This is the #1 to watch in Praque. Fantastic narrow streets with shops, cafes and restaurants everywhere.

An afternoon and an evening in Prague would have been enough. I'm not sure what the people in charge of Prague's tourism have in mind, but if they are not careful, it's going to turn into another Ibitha. Prague is a must see destination, especially after-dark when the lighting on the buildings is spectacular. Not so sure it's a must stay destination, unless large groups on drunken pub crawls are your thing. Oh, and if you are vegetarian or vegan, you may want to pack sandwiches.

Stunning square. Gorgeous architecture . A truly stunning square from every angle. Nothing to dislike Busy as you would expect between 10 and 10pm. If u get there before is quieter.So many gorgeous buildings to look at.A must not miss.
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere and wonderful, fantastic architecture. Entertainment, outdoor restaurants and take away food. A must visit

A modern place with an ancient look and lots of history. Its an amazing place to hang out. This view is great, crowds r awesome and many many things to do. Do visit the astronomical clock and the tower on top. To view from there is second to none in the world! Its a paradise for those who love history and ancient buildings and architecture!
lovely place. Loved the liveliness. Lots of people around, lots of things to see. Like the square a lot. How beautiful it might get during snow!
Get up early.. Beautiful but packed with tourists. Get up early, 5am, and visit before the crowds (of biblical proportions) arrive.
Fab Architecture . The whole of the city is lovely. Old town provides old world charm and history. A must when in the city

Beautiful! . This is one of the few old towns in Europe that hasn't been rebuilt. The buildings are amazing. The people watching and entertainment in the square is wonderful. The astronomical clock is a must see (even if you're a little disappointed that you wait for the show and it only lasts a couple of minutes). Great shopping, great beer, grab something to eat at the sausage houses along the way and just enjoy the fantastic atmosphere.
Beautiful place. Perfect for sight seeing, dinner or a drink in the evening. Must see in both day and night! A spectacular place
a bit busy. Go in the off-season during our stay it was a bit crowed, takes away the magicial beauty of the season.
