Awesome. Awesome place to visit. Totally I liked it. Definitely it is worth seeing .Lots of history behind it .

Every block has beautiful architectural details. Go up the clocktower, best views of the city!!... In fact, did an oil painting of the red rooftops :)...Cubist museum and cafe, very cool...take advantage of the free walking tours..well worth it
Absolutely beautiful. The old town of Prague is really beautiful. It has a nice atmosphere, amazing architecture and plenty of nice places to eat or have a few drinks.
Visiting Old Town, Prague. Very crowded but oh so elegant and historical. Tour groups were kind of a pain but wandering with them was ok.
Beautiful place. Nice architecture, cobbled streets, such a wonderful place. So different from where I'm from, so naturally I'm amazed by this city.

Time Square and New Year's eve.. Time Square and New Year's eve. Crowded to the point of incapacitating, with college students on summer break, drunken bands of German and other Europeans on bachelor party/guys weekend parties.
Beautiful!!!!!. The Old town is definitely worth visiting. So much culture and history. Definitely don't do a tour - just stroll around at your leisure and take it all in.

Picturesque. Every corner is a postcard view, the colourful buildings and the narrow cobbled stone streets make this little city a popular destination for all around the world. Around the river and the historical backdrop of past history, tourists crowd the street and with winding streets, the old town gives charm and fond memories of fairy tales.Also in the old town is the Astronomical Clock, practically next to the old town hall and the market, which sells handicrafts and food. Street entertainer, musicians and artists display their talents. Lovely city and lots to see..

Bustling but still a nice place to be. I first visited this bustling area in 1968 and it was charming ..........and very quiet! Not any more, but the charm is still there even on a chilly damp August day! Perhaps over commercialised and the prices in cafés are high and service tends to be surly.
Old town. Loved Old Town, our hotel was in a great location. You could walk to just about anywhere. Very scenic. Where comfortable shoe because all the streets are cable stone

Simply stunning!. Probably the best place to hangout after Charles Bridge. Beautiful buildings. Very lively though sometimes a little too crowded. The astronomy clock tolls every hour and its definitely one of the things to see. You can also climb to the top of the tower for a panoramic view of the old town. Lots of cafes around if you want to relax but there are much costlier than at other places.
Ĺot too see. Lots and lots to see. Manny fantastic buildings and nice resturants in this location.Make sure you have plenty of time to walk around. Lots to see

Beautiful. The city centre is amazing - able to experience the beauty of Old Town. Beautiful sites and many restaurants and shops in this areaThere are many tours on offer here - even using Segways around the city. However I opted to go view the city without a tour guide. I saw all the attractions, at my own pace.

A place of beauty. What a quaint and attractive town center! Great walking around and through the off-jutting streets. You must not miss the astronomical clock! Amazing piece of work. The architecture is simply stunning. A great place to get in a lot of photos.

Favorite part of the city. Really enjoyed our time walking around the Old Town, it feels like this is where all the action is, with lots of locals and tourists both. Great people watching, wonderful food and drink and all the history you can absorb!

Beautiful Place. I want to live there. This is a beautiful city as a whole, but this area is just amazing. Truly worth visiting, worth making a trip to Europe just for this. You can walk and take it all in. My favorite place of all the many cities in the world that I have visited.

Old Town Steeped in History. Beautiful buildings, lovely narrow cobbled streets with lots of different cafes and bars make for an excellent atmosphere. At every turn you find small squares with plenty of local shops selling beautiful jewellery, glassware, and many other trinkets. Well worth a visit.
Wonderful. Simply a stunning part of the city to visit, would highly recommend. Great atmosphere, a must see in Prague!

Love Prague!. Simply beautiful. Grab a coffee and walk around, grab some lunch do some shopping. Super affordable! People are lovely and felt super safe. Prague is a must see. Go to the top of the clock!

A lot of joy in a little square . It's amazing what things you get to see just randomly walking around in Prague. Depending on the day there are people playing the instruments, people dressed up as golden statues (you need to pay then to take pictures with them) and restaurants all around. This isn't a place you need to plan unless you have a certain place you want to visit whithin the Old Town Square since you will most proapably pass by it to get to different places in Prague. Definitely worth it

A gem. The Old tow and Jewish quarter is a gem of architecture. You can wonder around through tiny lanes for hour, sit in many cafe or restaurants and people watch and the night life is plentiful. Some fantastic restaurants, gorgeous architecture, great shopping and everything is in an easily walkable distance. Plus the city is finally getting rid of segways so you won't be in danger of getting run over.
Amazing. Its amazing. Peoples of different countries come in groups and sing songs and dance. Had a good time.

Fantastic area, a must visit (try an early visit). What a great area. Did not know what to expect when I went to Prague, but this exceeded all my expectations. There is more to see around the square than I can list here - lot of bars and restaurants. Mimes, jazz music, jugglers and just young people hanging out.A fun thing to do is get up early (7am) and go to the square.. Lot of couples are showing up in wedding dresses for pictures with few people in the square..

Don't miss . If you go to Prague and you don't visit he Old Town, is like you don't visited Prague.Is a great place with imposing building from the golden age of the Austrian Empire, when Prague was the second capital of the empire.

Beautiful!. The center is amazing! Many beautiful newly renovated houses. Really reccomend going and taking a wak around. The main square is my favourite. There are numerous great restaurants to eat at where you can observe the passerbys.
The heart of Prague. If you are traveling around Prague the old town square is a required stop for every visitor, you will get int touch with the very best of Prague.
Get lost.... In the old cobbled streets of Prague. So much to see and round every corner something new to see. Take the opportunity to veer off the tourist track and you won't be disappointed.

The best medieval city in the world!. The best medieval city in the world! (Prague-1). The excellent classicism (Prague-2, Vinogrady). The excellent meeting of the new and old (Prague-5, Andel). The real pleasure- in total.

most beautiful central Europe city. Prague is one most beautiful city I have seen in Europe. Old town square is the heart of the city, its more crowded every hour because of the astronomical clock tower

Just Stunning. Visited here on a sunny day and the place was full of people living and loving the sights of the Square.
The area is great to walk around and just watch everyone looking at the sights.
The smell of the food. A cold beer and its a good place to sit and relax for an hour.

Charming but crowded. A beautiful place to see at all times of day. I was lucky to see it in the morning, afternoon and evening. The evening was special as the lights come on. The crowds are big but the space is large.

Beautiful Old Town. Beautiful historical setting, crowded most of the time with tourists. It's fun to people watch here. Lots of shops and food vendors. There are many sights within walking distance of the main square.

An amazing place. This square really is the hub of the city. With the Tyn Cathdral dominating the skyline and the Astronomical Clock demanding attention every hour, on the hour, it really is a place to soak up the atmosphere.
beautiful cuty amazing buildings. Prag was an excellent city to discover. Kind friendly an astonishing. Check food was not so god but the rest was fantastic

Celebrate History & Humanity: Family Fun. This is a delightfully unique public area that will be accommodate and be of interest for entire families, couples or individual explorers. It's surrounded with historical buildings such as the Astronomical Clock Tower and churches. There is a vast open space where you can watch street artists perform, let the kids run around, eat at one of numerous food venues, along with shopping opportunities to your hearts content. There are walking, segway and old car tours, concerts and other activities all day/night long, including wedding parties taking pictures in the middle of it all. There are roads that head out in every direction to help you explore the city from a central point. An excellent old town square that you must visit while in Prague. It's the heart of the city in many ways.The only negative aspect is during the high season, this place can become very crowded. Yet, this is part of the life of the city and it's charm. You can take photos of the clock tower and churches without waiting for people to move as it's above everyone's head. Early morning or evening are great times to visit.

It's not that special. Although it's a historical place it's so crowded that one can not move around. The worth part was when we tried to exchange our money. They buy dollars half the price they're selling it!! It was crazy. If you go there don't trust the them.

Hustle, Bustle, and History. The hustle and bustle of this area is neat. So many people, many performers, folks waiting on the astronomical clock to chine...etc. Of course, the Old Town square places you in an area with many sights and many restaurants.
Underground-walking trip. The most amazing tour- a city below a city. Pubs, restaurants, etc underneath the ground while another teeming city rocks upstairs(overground)
Make this the focal point of your trip to Europe. Perfect long term visit to Europe, a great walking city with a great variety of interests and locations.

A stroll in the evening . Well the guide books definitely did not dissapoint. This is a beautiful but very busy part of Prague. The only downside was the street entertainer, the same act 2 nights in a row! Definitely worth a trip during the day and evening.
Nice and most beautiful place . This is the old city center with the famous clock there , a lot of Restaurent and all attraction take place there , you can have all the day there .
A must see. Beautiful old town square. Lots going on and plenty to see. A must see when visiting prague. Make sure you stop to watch the clock on the hour.

Birthday celebration. What can I say, so much to see and do here where the old meets the new. Walk along Charles Bridge and get a lovely view of the river.We stayed at the Astoria hotel which was literally five minutes walk to the old town and also just round the corner to the new town. Everything is really cheap and although there are restaurants in the square no one is in your face to go inside like in many other cities. Just off the square are many restaurants thats aren't much more than the size of our sitting rooms. Food is delicious. It snowed whilst we were there but nothing ground to a halt like it does here. Would recomment to young and old alike but do take your walking shoes

Must experience. Lots of people are in the Old Town area but you must experience this. There's lots to look at here. Street performers, statues, architecture, etc. The information centers had helpful tourist brochures and maps. Lots of places to eat outside and grab a cold drink.
Old town still preserved!. Majestically beautiful square, there are performances to keep you lightened up. Romantic destination and food lovers will surely enjoy this place ever more.

Old town with nice building. Enjoyed walking to prague palace and Charles bridge which located in Old town. Have a nice restaurant for those want to try the local food or dessert, and you also can find halal kebab restaurant nearby the old town centre opposite Starbuck.
Old town hall. This place is amazing. Both daytime and evening - try both. Try to go to the city a little bit outside the season as it it tends to be crowded in highseason

Lots to see and very picturesque.. All of the old square is lovely, so many buildings you can see and all worth seeing in my opinion. Especially the first church which is a brilliant piece of architecture.

Spectscular. We recently spent a week in Prague and this was our favourite part - beautiful buildings, a feeling of space despite being crowded, steeped in history and bohemian culture....it really had everything you could ask for! We particularly enjoyed the Astronomical Clock and climbing the stairs to the top of the Town Hall tower (there's s lift too) for amazing views over the city. The Dali exhibition was good but left us both a little disappointed - wish we had gone to see the Mucha exhibition too. Lots of food and drink on offer in restaurants and street food stalls - try a Trdelnik pastry filled with ice cream - just delicious! St Nicholas' church also well worth a look.
wanders down the street. let yourself go, dispenses with the locals for typical tourists from all cities, comes into the alleys, discover corners
magnificent. just one of the many beautiful old but elegant building in Prague, all in just walking distance from the hotel we stayed,

Best place in Prague. This is actually the area most people go visit Prague for. It's amazing, the renovated buildings, the streets, the shops, everything looks great and the atmosphere is relaxed. However, in August is too crowded. Way too crowded.

Plenty of bars and restaurants . Enjoyed visiting this square. Plenty of entertainment going on. People with bubble machines for the children and street entertainment. Some great restaurants to choose from. Prices slightly more than off the beaten track but to be expected. Regularly kept clean. Very pleasant
Old town. Great place to visit. Great restaurants on or near the square. The clock is fun but go up above and get a 360 degree view of the area
Charming part of the citz. The oldest historic part of the town, cannot miss!!! Bars, shops, souvenirs and interesting historic buildings .

Old Town ..Great place to have lunch. In Old Town there are many types of restaurants.. Most places have the menus in English and also speak English..Great place for lunch/ dinner and for people watching.
very beautiful. we kept going to this square every day of our stay there , just to hang out at morning or night and enjoy the attractive atmosphere of the square
Beautiful. Amazing place to eat, to walk around or just sit and relax. So much history with such beautiful architecture. Can't miss this

Great sites history and culture all rolled into one. Lovely part of town full of culture and history best to have a guide with you so you can really learn all about the history.
Easy to navigate around just follow the directions that the crowds are heading
Spectacular architecture. We stayed at the Intercontinental and the minute you step out of the hotel and walk down the street towards the main square, it's just one beautiful building after another.

Amazing part of the beautiful city of Prague. This is a real must see if you are on vacation in Prague. You can walk around in this part of the city for days and find new and gorgeous houses and streets, and interesting places all the time.
looks beautiful but nothing much to do. You can walk and click some pictures thats it...nothing much to do which can be interesting..you can come back in the night to enjoy clubbing

Beautiful!. This is perhaps one of the main parts of Prague - you can't visit Prague and not go. The old town is home to the Coat of arms at the Old Town Hall, Prague's famous narrow streets, famous gothic-style houses in the Old Town and Old Town Square itself. On first second day of our trip, we took a walking tour of the old town. It's nice to get the 'touristy' parts first and then have more of an opportunity to explore independently. There are some lovely places to eat there too!
Nice place. A must visit place to soak in the atmosphere of prague. The hustle bustle and lively people and all kinds of road shows going on give us a feel about the city. A definite must go place
Everyday visit. I am probably seeing everyday the astronomical clock which is on old town square since i got here.Its been 2 year and every time it looks new to me.

Step Back into Time......... This is my first time in Prague and the minute I set eyes on the Old Town Square I knew I had made the right decision to visit Prague. The square is magnificent and is certainly a hub of excitement. The architecture is incredible and you truly feel like you're in some sort of fairy tale. Being a keen hobby photographer I spent many hours here with my camera. There are countless photo opportunities from the entertainers singing and dancing, the incredible statues and the general architecture. Needless to say a visit to the Old Town is a must if you're in Prague.
Nice place. Nice place but ruined by a terrible restaurant called Caffè italia. If you don't leave a huge tip they see you as enemy.
Amazing atmosphere !. You must see the old town of Prague it is unforgettable. This is like huge museum. There are many cosy outdoor restaurants and it is very inexpensive in Prague.

Amazing architecture! Go back in time!. This is a wonderful area to walk around. Travel the small and winding cobblestone streets and alleys that interlace Old Town. Quaint outdoor cafes abound. This is one of the best areas of the city. Enjoy!

Gorgeous. Another stunning piece of Prague's history! The astronomical clock tower is the main attraction for obvious reasons, but there are plenty bars, shops and restaurants in this massive old town square. A must see if you're in Prague!
What you come to Prague for. Probably the highlight of Prague, a very picturesque part of the world, the only problem is that it has become too touristy which spoils it somewhat,
Lovely, lots to see. Lots of little lanes, arcades etc. Some very nice bars and restaurants. Beer prices vary from bar to bar. Take your time to explore.

One of the most beautiful and amazing places I have ever gone!. This square is so fantastic, all the days I spent in Prague I stayed some minutes there, appreciating its beauty and inviting atmosphere. A must go destination, for sure!

Beautiful, beauty and history of Prague captured in the square... . The old town square beautifully captures the essence of prague , all in one place.From the churches, castles, historical buildings, monuments commemorating the architects of the social , political and religious revolutions in prague to the branded shops, food stalls and mime actors serenading tourists, its a lively vibrant space to spend a leisurely 1-2 hours absorbing the sights, sounds and feels.Must visit.. check out the photographs to get a feel of the place.
The one of the most beautiful cities. I was totally shocked of the beauty of this city - everywhere, where you go you find a miraculous views, a super nice buildings, a story of the city.
Fun Area of Prague to explore. Loved this part of Prague. It is crowded and busy but it is worth every second of it to see all the sites.
The place to be in Prague. Inevitably the most wonderful square I've ever seen. Amazing during Christmas time with the markets and decorations

Amazing Place. I Loved Prague's Old town..Beautiful architecture on every corner and we had a great Free tour which I've reviewed on this site!Amazing place, words cannot describe this. just get lost in all the roads....

Beautiful and well animated. One of the places to discover in Prague! A lot of little streets with many beautiful buildings. I highly recommend the old town square, and -of course- the visit of its tower!
Must go. If you are in Prague then obviously you must go visit the old town, anything else would really be waste of your travel time. Must go

Amazing!. We visited Prague as a group of friends. I would definitely recommend it. The Old Town is much cheaper than other areas of Prague, although it is all cheap In comparison to the UK and Capitals around Europe. Definitely glad we went and will be back again in the near future.
Historical place. Nice place to take pictures and rest and snack in a many cafes and bistro. Taste national dishes and for sure bear!!!!!!!!!
Exquisite in all ways--but horribly crowded. Go early or else you'll contend with crowds. The Old Town--both square and neighboring streets and squares--are exquisite.
Wonderful area. A great place to just walk and take in the sights. The buildings are magnificent and the small lanes and streets a delight. A great way to spend an afternoon. Highly recommended.

beautiful place. decided to go here one afternoon to have a look around and was shocked with how beautiful this place is,such a good afternoon there walking around looking at the buildings and in the shops,after looking through the town we took a stroll across Charles bridge and then up to Prague castle they are all very close together so its an easy walk! there a few restaurants around for people to eat,would recommended this place if your going to prague
Very nice place. U have to visit praha 1 very lovly place with nice wether and nice trinklet every where in praha my recomandation to take it only with chocolate
Beautiful. Fantastic places. Every corner there are places to catch your attention. I took several shots and regret why did not bring a professional camera.

be inside the postal card!. It's just a perfect trip.Old town is beautiful, romantic, amazing sometime, clean, safe, easy to discover within a couple of days.Start before 9 AM to avoid the mega overcrowded hours.And wear good schoes, the pavement is hard!
One of the most beautiful places in Europe!. The Old Town is a medieval settlement of Prague. Its architecture is truly magnificent and photogenic. Very worth seeing!
The heart of the old town. Always something going on here, lots of nice eateries nearby, love the Czech food especially the duck dishes. You can see the famous Cuckoo clocks here. Very busy at dusk.
Lots of activities. This is a great people watching area and lots of different activities, restaurants, street buskers, tourist shops. A must when in Prague

Beautiful town. We returned day after day, such a beautiful place. Lots to see, quirky shops to find, get lost exploring the side streets it's amazing what you will find. Top tip - comfy shoes, you will walk for miles.

Nice but crowded . The old town square i a must see in Prague.
The surrounding buildings are amazing. There are pleanty og nice restaurants around.
The place is pretty crowded so watch out for Pick-pockets!

Fabulous, as only such places can be.. The Stare Mesto in Prague is extremely beautiful. It's a wonderful place to grab a drink and simply sit watching the passing parade and absorb the atmosphere. There's always plenty to look at and dozens of places to eat & drink. It really doesn't matter which you choose as long as you're looking into the square. It felt very safe and the people are wonderful. Don't be surprised to find yourself incorporated into a neighbouring conversation (mind you, they're often tourists of course) and you'll find the level of service invariably very high. In the summer, with the sun not setting until around 10pm, the increasingly golden glow of the sun on the ancient buildings adds to the wondrous feeling of being a part of history.
Absolutely Wonderful. Stayed two nights in Prague and loved it the people were friendly. The Old Town centre was full of life great restaurant to go to day or night.

Lovely. This is a lovely area and gas so many old gothic style churches. Very easy to while away a few hours. Is really busy and is full of places to eat. Compare the varying prices as to eat in the main square is costly however you can find nice cheaper food around the corner.

Crowded and a Little Crazy. Everything in Prague pretty much funnels into the square, so it is unavoidable. There are street performers, so if you're into that, great. Lots of people walking to and fro, so good people watching, but not really all that much to do. You can go up to the clock tower, but it is crowded and stuffy up there and the views somewhat limited. Most of the walking tours begin from the square, but quickly scatter.

One of the best cities in Europe. Yes this is one of the most touristy cities in Europe as well. I challenge you to find an actual Czech in this city. The food is great but nothing super unique czech style. There is a reason for so many tourist...the city is magical and full of character. Architecture, Jewish ghetto, castle, churches, cobblestone streets. Truly the land of a thousand spires.

Prague - the Best of Europe. My wife and I spent three days walking around this wonderful old city. Cobblestoned streets reflect the history and charm so lacking in many other cities. Basically the same for centuries - not affected by WW2 at all. Castles, churches and abbeys showcase the distinct character and ambiance that take you back to better and safer times. There is an abundance of restaurants to choose from - try the local Czech food which is very tasty and portion sizes are always large! Shops galore to browse or buy from - even the department stores blend in well. Getting around is easy by foot or on the trams. Take a ride up to Prague Castle for a wonderful look over the city and enjoy the gardens and buildings. Old Town has a unique feel and more restaurants and a large outdoor market with wares of all sorts. The astronomical clock is a favorite when the bell tolls on the hour. Prague should be on the top of your list if you want see "old" Europe.

Old world flavor with a lot of touristy shops. A combination of city and history that cannot be missed. Many glorious old buidings from different eras, nearly all in very good condition and worth seeing and photographing. The central areas of Prague are full of tourists shops (and full of tourists), but they are not overly intrusive.

Best part of Prague. This is the historical heart of the city and is my favorite area after three visits to Prague. I cannot get tired of the apostles in the clock every hour, the sidewalk cafes, the walking streets, the many churches, synagogues, and art everywhere.

Beautiful area of the city. Beautiful area filled with wonderful gothic and baroque architecture, squares to have a beer, people watch. See the astromomical clock ( small 1 min show on each hour) and the beautiful churches. Highly recommend the free airport transfer walking tour ( meets every day at 11:00 in old town square by Czech tourism office--- look for red umbrellas and a tour guide named Ross or Margaret)

Architectural gems on every street!. Old Town can be really busy in the summer, but walking is easy, and trams are simple as well because you're near the river. Prepare to spend a lot of time on foot to really enjoy yourself, and take a guide with you to get the most out of your visit.

Medieval City Square. A central square with a maze of winding streets full of character buildings, restaurants and shops. Very busy all the time with crowds of tourists. Some interesting street entertainers and nice (but expensive) restaurants. Walk away from the square and plenty of places to eat at a lower cost. All the streets are cobbled so ladies avoid wearing heels!

Nice, yet crowded. Prague is a gem. Unfotunately this is no secret any more: tourists everywhere and with the tourists come the hunters. Don't take a taxi from here. They use special rates for tourists. I would also recommend restaurants and bars outside this area. And a stamp for a postcard doesn't cost 40 czk.Besides, the old city is very beautiful indeed. But perhaps it's even more beautiful not during peak season.

Easy walk from metro. We loved Old Town! It is close to a metro stop, and there are lots of great places to see and experience close together. My son ran through bubbles. We watched cultural dances and took amazing pictures. All with minimal navigation needed. :)
old town Prague. Really a gem in Czech Rep. Nice to visit both day and night. Lots to see and do and the ice cream is to die for ....

One of the Great Public spaces of the world. The old town square is a 24/7 kind of place. There are people assembling hourly to see the astronomical clock go off. Cafe life watching the world go by is something America missed out on.
Must see. I love Old Town in Europe and OT in Prague was a great step back in time. Don't hurry through and enjoy the scenes played out in front of you.

Probably better visiting in extra season. Lovely market but very crowded during holidays season. We loved the cathedral and the huge open space. The ornated clock is a must to see, as well as the Tyn church In order to fully appreciate it, it is probably better to visit in spring/fall.

Gorgeous. A very historic location with beautiful features surrounding it. There is so much going on, and if you listen in you can hear all the different languages from all the different people from all over the world. In the evening after about 9 pm the square becomes more quiet compared the afternoon. You can enjoy its beauty thought the lightening and under the moonlight. A great location to reflect.

A don't miss part of Prague. The Old Town Prague is a must to see. The beautifully ornate buildings & churches are amazing. The Astrological clock is a wonder to see and a boat ride on the river goes under the Charles bridge. It is a short but steep walk to the Castle - but worth doing as the church there is inspiring. There are lots of good restaurants in Old town so you can eat in a different place each meal.

Quaint buildings everywhere . A very interesting part of Prague with a maze of winding streets full of stunning buildings, restaurants and shops. Plan a few hours here but prices for food are high on the square Much better values and great places to choose from on surrounding streets. Be prepared for large crowds!

So beautiful!. This is one of my favourite places on earth now I think. It was a magical couple of day we spent here. The atmosphere with the cafes, and the tourists and the street performers with the whole scenery was just mesmerising. We also had a 25 minute tour in a horse and carriage which was just lovely as you got to see a lot of the back streets. Don't forget to hang around here to see the astrological clock chime, it's a memorable moment and it's so much more beautiful when you see it in person! And of course eat plenty of goulash, it's delish!!

History, street performers and expensive food shacks. You could waste entire days in the Old Town of Prague. Beautiful buildings and architecture. This is also where the free walking tours start, highly recommend you do this as it will tell you what you're actually looking at and all the history behind it. They have lots of cool little street food stalls, but beware prices are very high comparing to some more moderately priced restaurants. We paid 800CHZ for two people and one of us ended up sick for 2 days from the food. I recommend you take pictures of the spit roast but skip the eating part until another venue with better value and hygiene. There's lots of street performers here so take lots of coins, most of them are rather entertaining. If you have young kids, there's a man with a GIANT bubble maker who is at the Square all day and kids LOVE him. Tip him generously, we all enjoy the bubbles after all!

Old Town Square. a lively place full of restaurants and pretty architecture, open till way after mid night. great place to get a free tour with Ryan you will find him at 2pm infront of the information office.
Lovely site. These towers are on the town square and are magnificent. There are art galleries and restaurants in front of the towers. They were closed when we were there .

Beautiful gathering spot. The Astronomical clock is not to be missed. Neither is the view from atop the tower. There were hundreds of people when we're there during the day, less at night. From this square are routes to many other sights in the old town that fan out from the square.

One of the Most Beautiful Squares I have Ever Seen. It's such a stunning square. It is buzzing with life and Segways so beware and make sure not to stand in the middle. People visit here to see the infamous astronomical clock - but do not put your hopes up to much because I was left disappointed when I saw it in action. The cathedral is really beautiful as well. Everywhere is beautiful and I can sit and people watch all day in it.

Walt Disney's inspiration for the Magic Kingdom. The Old Town is delightful, truly a magic kingdom long before Disney created his own. One can wander around for hours on the main street and so many side streets. One of my favorite walking places in the world. Romantic for young and older couples, fun for kids, rocking for young adults...Prague has it all.
beautiful. beautiful large open space, you can find many spots for seeing. have restaurants but not enough. need more cafés. you have to set and order food. they wont let you set for only coffee.
Historic charm!. Very well-maintained old historic town with some stops for architecture-lover and fun things for kids (Golden Lane)
Christmas Markets. What a place, friendly people and so cheap, we couldnt believe how cheap the place was. The market place was fabulous.

Very Historic, Very Busy. The sheer amount of history crammed into this square is just staggering. And so are the amount of tourists. Everywhere you look are tour guides with flags and masses of people from all corners of the Earth looking at this building, or that clock. Plus there is a thing about Segways now that has become a popular mode of transportation. That said, it is a wonderful, memorable place. On a small side alley, I found a tiny shop selling hand made linens and bought a beautiful dining table throw. Even negotiated a more than fair price for it. There was a really cool Mexican bar/restaurant underground run by Mexicans who spoke fluent Czech and served excellent margaritas. Wild! Can't wait to go back. It's an area regardless of the amount of people one should make a point of visiting if you go to Prague.

Expensive place to eat.. We decided to try the hot sausages and bbq ham from the stand at the side of the square. Didn't realize they charge by the weight, and of course they anticipate this and loaded our plates with far more than we could possibly eat, and so over half of it went in the garbage.
Never grows old. While it's the OLD Town, the sites here don't disappoint. After several visits we still enjoy just sitting in the square.
Good. I've always dreamt about visit this city and it's Old Town. It is very touristy and finding a spot that is more 'local' is almost impossible, but that is to expected. A must see.

Must see in pragye. Lovely big square with the old astronomical clock. Lots of bars restaurants etc. The area is very busy with tourists, groups etc & had to explain to children that the people were not protesters but groups singing etc Police have a van in permanent residence. We had no problems

Busy heart of the Old Town in Prague. The Old Town square was busy morning, afternoon and evening when we visited in July time. The architecture is good and includes the old town hall and astronomical clock. The plentiful bars/restaurants are pleasant with good atmosphere but if you walk a few street away you will find food and drink that is as good but cheaper. Be on the lookout for individuals and groups who have hired segways and are moving around the square.
Beautiful place to take photos!. Very nice area, beautiful views, very cozy atmosphere allows you to dive into a Czech Capital lifestyle world.
Worth visiting. Pretty central to the city, lovely architecture, street performers and good atmosphere make it worth seeing.

Great place. Great place during the day for a stroll and sightseeing. During the nights it turns into a huge red light district so I do not recommend night visit if you don´t want to be approached by soaking drunk stag parties :)

Breathtaking Square. This has to be one of the most spectacular town squares in Europe! Surrounded on all sides by amazing architecture, the square has a buzz all of its own - thanks to the throngs of people gathered to marvel at its beauty for themselves.You have to check out the astrological clock - it's a masterpiece of old time engineering & be sure to grab a coffee & cake at one of the many street cafes that surround the square - you'll pay a bit moe for the pleasure but it's really worth it, just to be able to sit their and watch the passing parade!
Village market place. The pretty samll square is covered with restaurants all over. You are constantly approached with offers to change money or eat.
lovely. all historical places are close to each other so it was easy to move around and enjoy the walking tour
Dream . Amazing!Looking around and nothing is wrong. Beautiful architecture, monuments and nice market in Easter .The church has beautiful concert in the evening and very nice Restaurants.

This destination is a must for travellers. Walk and explore the old part and old town of Prague. It is senseless to name all points of interest. All of it is beautiful. Do not forget your camera. Take enough time for your stay. 2-3 days should be the minimum stay.

Crazy busy and overrun with tour groups. If you go in summer, expect the main square to be crazy busy and overrun with tour groups. The best places are really off the square. There are shortcuts through buildings and quieter side streets if you want to get away from the mayhem. And you will.

Red roofs and pointy edges. It looks amazing. Everywhere you looks there's another tower or palace or something beautiful. There is no place in Prague where you look and the architecture won't take your breath away. One of the most beautiful towns i've seen yet.

Stunning small square. Possibly one of my favourite squares in Europe. Great street food. Interesting history and beautiful buildings.
Lively both during the day and night!
Prague 2016. Incredible old town with a new town feel. The historic significance of this area is astonishing. How this town was not destroyed in WWII is beyond me.

Beautiful but TOURISTY. A must see for everyone visiting Prague for the first time. However, you should NOT stay at any of the restaurants or bars there, they are touristy, bad quality, and super expensive. Instead go a few minutes away to some of the minor streets and find the local gems.
Just beautiful. Strongly recommend visiting, people are nice, however, old generation is not as nice as the young generation (I wonder why)

Stunning architecture. We walked around the square a few times; the sights are amazing. It can be very full of tourists, but apparently not when it is raining - it started to fall while we were there and everyone ran for cover; we stayed and took in the empty square! A rarity.
I wouldn't eat in the Old Town - very expensive.

life and amusment. One of the most beautiful squares in EU, from early morning to late night every time something happens there, lots of cozy cafes and restaurants. Not as pricey as it is usual in main squares in other places, but still if yuo are budget traveler and want to seat near square, every streets connected to square offers cheap good restaurants, you just need to walk 20-50 meters and that's it.

Old but Gold. The architecture in this site is unique from the other cities of Europe. The smell of roasted meat and potatoes in the air. Lively ambiance in the center of the old city and just a couple of walks, you will see the old Astronomical Clock, and nearby are a lot of good restaurants with really good beer! In fact, Prague offers one of the best beers in the world!
Very nice place. Just walking around and enjoying the surrondings is great. The small foodplaces are awesome, the beer is good. The churches are very nice. Don't forget to visit the old jewish parts.

Beautiful City, Spectacular Buildings. Walking around is the best experience. There are many old beautiful buildings, so many it is unbelievable. Lots of markets, shops and lots of people. Secure personal items well.

Beautiful and buszzing with activities. Prague is a very beautiful city, even if you dont do anything and just walk around the town you will be amazed byt he beautiful architecture. Old town is always buzzing with activities. There are so many good restaurants, beautiful astronomical clock tower, the bemost beautiful cathedral building.
Lovely, and touristy, but you have to see it. All types of dining available. Have a seat at one of the restaurants near the clock, order some food and beverages, and wait for time to tick away.
Beautiful!. The Old Town is quaint, and while there were a lot of people, it never felt too crowded. we loved walking around seeing all of the beautiful buildings. We fell in love with Prague!

Beautiful, busy a bit of a price hike but worth it!. A great place/space to visit and experience but expect crowds particularly around the Astronomical Clock which is beautiful but over hyped for the few seconds of the chime and the procession!
Great history. Although it was very crowded the days we went, it is a beautiful place. Just watch out for pickpockets. We were warned that there are many in this area.

Nice Square to have dinner in. Try and get a seat to watch the bells chime, its worth it to avoid the stand. The restaurant's aren't that expensive and well worth the price just to take a seat in this nice square.

Beautiful and a very good expereince. A place to spent lots of time in strolling around, sitting and watch people and just to enjoy all the fascinating buildings and scenery . The building in the surrounding is so beautiful and the more you focus the more detail you see. The only problem I have and really a sore eye is all the cigaret butts between the beautiful paving stones !!! Just another example of smokers not having respect for the environment and other people. I must mention that the Czech people are heavy smokers and don't care about the people around them. This is a most if you visit Prague, even only for a few hours.

Don't eat at street side stands. The history and buildings are distinct and impressive. People hang out in the city square at all hours of the night. You can go into various buildings, watch the astronomical clock at the hour and climb the tower next to it to get a better view of the city. Worth a visit, but don't eat at a stand with unmarked prices. We ended up paying 800 CZK for a bowl of potatoes, 2 beers and a piece of ham...all because we didn't ask about price.

Great Views!. We visited the square to see the Astronomical Clock. While waiting, we were able to walk around the square and found many interesting sights. The old buildings, locals displaying their talents and wares, and the tourists strolling through made for a delightful morning.
Great atmosphere. Spend time here soaking up the atmosphere, make sure to buy one of the fab ice creams and enjoy the entertainers
A beautiful view. It was cool and comfortable place to stop after walking all morning. The rates were reasonable and the staff was polite and efficient.

Tourist Mecca in Prague. Let's say that here is a tourist Mecca in Prague, a lot of people !If you stop to take some photo, from somewehere will came somebody and will propose you magnits, picture, tours ... Be carefull there a lot of thief, but there are a lot of police - they are dressed like tourist and you could not recognized them , but you need to be carefull.
Old Town Praha. It's a medieval settlement of Prague. Best: Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock.
Skip the map!. It doesn't matter how careful you look at the map, you'll end up getting a bit lost anyway. However, thay is the charm of it, and it means that you alwayd find new and exciting places!

Beautiful City. It is such a beautiful city and very clean. Something new and breathtaking around every corner. I recommend going at Christmas time as the Christmas markets are amazing and go on forever!! It is also very cheap in Prague
AMAZING PLACE. so much to see so many eating places and bars. fantastic for all ages. The old town is full of life full of wonderful smells of food all around you and so many beautiful shops.

My favorite place in Europe, excellent starting point for visiting Prague. Everything is nice about the old town of Prague. I didn't anyone going there and not wanting to revisit. The people, the architecture, the shops, the city life is just perfect. And in every direction you go from the old town there something beautiful to see: The Jewish Neighborhood, Charles Bridge, the Sex Museum, the Prague City Gates, Vltava River, Letna Park .. everything is in a walking distance from here.

Great old town.. Its wonderful to walk the streets and see the hundreds of peopleenjoying, eating, drinking taking photos etc. You will see people from all parts of the world. Its lovely to see, also the weather being so kind.Radford.C

Back in Time. I was mesmerized by the beauty and size of these old buildings and pretty much everything around this city. I know that of all the places my wife and I have visited, Prague will be high on our list to go back some day. 4 days isn't nearly enough to begin to see and enjoy the history and the experience Prague has to offer. Great food and just fun walking everywhere. We stayed close by in "The cave" which was awesome. We were close to so much activity and all of the Christmas Markets. For me, the only thing that could have made it even a little better would have been some snow. Oh well, we'll just have to go back.
Really nice. I really liked the Old Town. Lots of beautiful houses, statues, and most of all, full of interesting people.
Easter. We went during Easter and it was fabulous! The whole place was decorated for Easter with eggs and ribbons. There was live music and people selling their crafts.
Great place. Visited this weekend with friends , the old town has plenty of activity and great bars . Nice architecture and lots to see
Absolutely stunning. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Take full advantage of your time there and simply walk around taking in the sights. You won't regret it!
Architectural gem. Lovely old square with some fine buildings. The astronomical clock is a must to watch it chime the hour. Very crowded and plenty of street cafes to take your Czech koruna!

Prague old town- must see!. Beautiful place to visit, and a must see. The astronomical clock is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen, and being immersed in the cities culture, being absorbed into its old architecture is a wonderful life experience. Do be careful of pickpockets as they do frequent the square.

WOW - just like a postcard. If you are visiting Prague then you can't miss OLD TOWN. So much to see that you won't know where to start. So much culture and history - take very comfy shoes so that you can stroll down the many cobbled lane ways. It will take you about two days to see most of it - a tour guide us a good starting point. When we visited in July, there were many festivities happening across the town square and throughout Old Town.
A must......... A very fun experience! Lots of activities, lots of people and a whole bunch of fun! Never entered a cafe that I didn't enjoy!
Amazing atmosphere. The place is historic, well maintained, the atmosphere around is just brilliant. The best way to explore the city is through long walks or guided tours

Cobblestone streets of Prague. This is Prague's most popular attraction with huge number of buildings of special architectural interest. In 1992 the historical center of the city was listed in the UNESCO World Cultural and Natural Heritage Foundation. The World Famous Astronomical Clock is situated in this Old town square. Don't miss the Walk of the Apostles performing on the hour. Another point of interest is the Powder Tower. There are quiet a few architecturally and historically important houses, such as the White Lion,At the Minute, the Black Sun and the Black Madonna. There are plenty of restaurants, pubs, shops and museums around. The old town square is around 20 minutes walk from the main Praha metro station. Most of the streets are pedestrianized except for local residents or taxis, so walking through the cobbled streets is the most common way of getting around.

Breathtaking!. When visiting Prague, Old Town is a must visit and even recommend staying in this area. The architecture is simply breathtaking and amazing to look at. In and around the square you will find it bustling with people and tourists alike, and find yourself taken back in time. There is so much to see and do here including the famous astronomical clock where you can go to the top and take some amazing pictures of the view from above for memories to cherish for a lifetime. You will find a lot of segway tour companies soliciting your business, but don't fret, and I highly recommend chatting them up. It was a great way to see the city and visit some really cool spots in a unique way. I highly suggest Cool Segway Tours as they were awesome setting up our private tour and you can't beat the value. But again the square and entire Old Town area is a happening place with plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes to enjoy and take in all scenery has to offer. Don't miss walking around out of the square and going down all the side streets too as you you'll find lots of interesting places and more of the same to enjoy. Certainly a great place to visit.

Good... Worth a visit....UK Boy Here. Hi am from the UK and I do recommend this place is worth a visit. It does look like the city centre as all the places for eg like Vienna, London, Sydney etc. Pretty much crowded all the time. Cool place go for it u will like it

Simply Gorgeous. Give ample time when visiting the Old Town. There is the main square, but then there are countless small streets with shops and things to see. You could easily lose your way, but I've found that everyone was more than happy to help with directions.

One of the most beautiful of European town centres. I can say that I know so many lovely town centres in many lovely locations across Europe and the rest of the world and this one certainly is in the top 5. Love the atmosphere the quality of buildings, the colours, the architecture. Certainly I understand why Prague is so popular

A Prague Requirement . Luckily my hostel was close to this spot so we got to see it quite a bit. It has everything you could want to see, from Prague's infamous Astronomical clock / amazing architecture, to some of the city's best restaurants and bars. Definitely go, as this is one of the liveliest and most dynamic areas around.

The one Must See in Prague. Arriving late evening in our hotel, we visited next drizzly morning. It was jammed then, and still jammed three more times we walked there.
The astronomical clock was a bit underwhelming. Easily we could spend a whole day here but the crowds make it less than ideal

Impressive. The impressive thing about the square is the surrounding buildings and setting. It gets pretty crowded and you need to be alert to the threat of pickpockets. There are loads of bars and restaurants around and they are all a bit pricey compared to some of the back streets. However it is one of the must sees of any Prague visit

Busy. As expected the area was teeming with visitors. There were lots of groups of young people in the area singing and dancing. Assuming from the banners and crucifixes that they carried they were part of some religious gathering in the city. Prices once over the bridge increased dramatically as opposed to those in the new Town.
Old, gorgeous but full of tourists!. Very busy place! Very touristy. I preferred the smaller out of the way streets. Look for the small hidden laneways and shops and you'll be rewarded.
Aesthetics on point!. Me and my friend went on walk about around Prague. The architecture is eloquent and unique. Get out there, see and appreciate this historical and beautiful place.

Old Town. Wow!! Words can't describe the emotions and thoughts that go through your mind when you enter the Old Town. With Cobble stone streets, historic and architectural buildings, statues and memorials, you can image the presence and impact this has on you. It is an amazing experience day and night!!
Lively square. Many people visit this beautiful square to see the beautiful architecture and the astronomical clock. Plenty to see....shops, restaurants, and a lively scene. Don't miss it!

The best. After touring many of the beautiful cities of Central Europe, the stare Mesto of Prague is the most special in my opinion. The market tower, astronomical clock, Jan Hus statue, beautiful buildings and churches that outline the square and general feeling of being in a fairy tale make it amazing. The only thing that bothered me was the incessant annoying Segway renters. We just told them we had already done it and they began to leave us alone. This really needs to be stopped and I saw them speeding around, in and out of people walking.
Prettiest part. Probably the prettiest and most interesting area of the city. Mix of Gothic and Venitian architecture surrounded by old town houses.
Beautifull. wery beautifull and a lot of atmopher. it is like a walk i history. A guide is a wery good thing. there is so much to see.

Stunning. Hands-down the numero uno spot to visit during your visit to Prague. It's full of tourists so try to visit early in the morning or late in the evening. Also lots of restaurants, cafes and ice cream stands in the area. Just sit and people watch, that's my best recommendation (oh and don't forget to watch the clock chime at the top of the hour!)
Good to visit . Interesting area. Vibrant with tourist though. You wont appreciate it until you know the history behind it. I will advise you get a local guide to explore it.
Old Town History. A beautiful historic old town. Fabulous buildings and lots of character. A climb up the Tower is worth a trip to get wonderful views of the town.

Great point to make your way to all tourist attractions. The twin towers of City Hall in Old Town Square are a great beacon to determine your location. It is a great point to make your way to the Jewish Cemetary, Prague Castle, riverboat cruises or anything else on your list of things to do and see.

A labyrinth of surprises!. Old Town Prague is full of twists and turns! There is something around every corner that will interest you. The shops are quaint, markets full of great items and beer EVERYWHERE! We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and can't wait to return. It was helpful to have our GPS with us, otherwise we might still be travelling around in Old Town!

History, architecture, music, art and of course shopping. You can immerse yourself in the past here, just by taking in the lovely buildings, their history, and the way the centuries stand next to each other. Then you can relax and have a coffee or meal and watch the people go by. We wish we had time to take in an opera, but that will have to wait until the next visit. Be sure you have a guide who can tell you the history, as it makes all of this so much more alive.
Lovely. The whole city is beautiful you can't be disappointed every turn you see a beautiful building although was very busy and take comfortable shoes them cobblestones tell after a while
Magical Place. Everything about Prague is gold! And this one is one of them. This old square is a must see. A lot of thing happen in this place.

A great square with lots to see. A great place to head to take in local architecture of all styles and people watch. There are lots of street performers and restaurants as well and historical statues and churches. Nice to walk along small cobbled side streets.
Prague Anniversary trip. Visit early in the morning to avoid the crowds, there is a lift which will take you all the way to the top.

A must do. There is just so much to see in the Square and its surrounding streets. If you like architecture there is plenty from all eras and Czech history in plenty. It is also near some good retail outlets if shopping is your thing (but go early in the day as the good shops get over-run with large tour parties later on). You can get coffee and food, of course, but the places are generally pretty expensive and oyu can do better for yourself elsewhere.

Vibrant!. Old Town Square was not far from our hotel (Intercontinental) and many of the things we did started and/or ended in this square. The first night I climbed the tower and took photos of the city at sunset. The photos turned out amazing and I would highly encourage you to walk (or take the elevator) up to the top. There is a lot of activity in this square with the clock chiming on the hour. There are lots of vendors and tours. Be mindful of your personal items here.

Hearth of Prague. The old town of Prague has his own spirit. The architecture is perfect and takes you in another time. There are a lot of streets that can be explore and where you can enjoy.There are a lot of cafe's and restaurant in this part of the town where you can enjoy in the food, drinks and atmosphere.

The clock and relaxation. This is an excellent part of town to take in the history, a casual sit down drink and people watch. Take your camera to record the movements of the clock. Fabulous archeciture. It is a must see.

History!. History and beauty at the same time. This Old Town is beautiful as in Hollywood Movies! A fresh and cold beer you will find at every corner. The only negative word to this part of town is the high number of tourists walking down the streets..

Magical. Arguably the finest square in the world. Just the right amount of lighting at night to make the square feel medieval and magical.The architecture in every quadrant is compelling viewing. It is easy to spend a couple of hours just walking around the square.The one thing that is lacking is clearly marked signs to different public transit stops. Although it is a small area, it can get confusing. Having a smartphone with gps helps.
An endearing tourist trap. I was a little shocked that all shops cater to tourists but the location was so enchanting. I love the narrow walkways paved with cobblestones.

Prague old town. Obviously one of the main points of interest in this city must be the famous old town square. The astronomical clock is huge draw card and it's obvious to see why. The clock is huge and tourists flock to it in their numbers!! There is also an ancient church... From the 1300s which is a dominant feature of the square.... Church of Our Lady. It is a huge meeting spot for your groups and the square is surrounded by cafes and restaurants.

Step back in time. Cobblestone walkways on a pedestrian only huge square, beautiful buildings from centuries ago, Astronomical Clock, St Nicholas Church with a gorgeous crystal chandelier, sidewalk cafe's everywhere. Stores, museums,monuments- it is amazing. Very crowded in summer. Spent several days here.

Lovely place. The Old Town is actually a really nice places to be for both younger and older. The buildings are interesting and it is easy to find cheap food. However, there does happen to be a lot of tourists.

Such a beautiful slice of old Europe. Medieval town, with surrounding Renaissance and Art Deco architecture. You will fill up your phone with cityscapes, pictures of arts, churches, palaces and castles, panaromas and shots of interesting street scenes. Prague's focus on making tourism work economically is an obvious success story. While I have heard rumors that the citizens are cynical and only motivated by money, I sensed an honest friendliness and desire to help others experience this beautiful city. Would go back in a heartbeat.
Crowded. Pretty yet super crowded with the tour bus crowd. I would love to go back when the weather is cooler and the crowds have subsided.

Mobbed in July!. Same as the Charles Bridge, you can't blame this place for being completely crowded with tourists, but it does get rather hectic and not very enjoyable. Worth visiting once, very early in the morning if you're visiting during July
This was my favorite. Something really spooky about this city and a good feeling spooky So dark at night and all the high cathedrals light up and gives out a haunted feeling Cant wait to return
Storybook!. Loved Old Town! Truly a magical place. Everywhere you turn is another beautiful structure or scenic, narrow street. So much to explore. A must see while visiting Prague!

Historic Prague at its best. The heart of Stre Mesto. You cannot be impressed by its buildings. The area is very photogenic but is a tourist trap. A cool drink or a cup of coffee at one of the cafes fronting parts of the popular areas can be expensive.

Fabulous and vibrant. Totally amazed by this place, so much to see and do here with plenty of affordable restaurants and bars. There are so many courtyards and alleyways to explore in the old town. Well worth a visit!
Fantastic views. Beautiful area! Lots to see. VERY hot in July and crowded with tourists but truly a stunning location.

Must have been something before the restaurant invasion. This is an outstanding area to visit if one can ignore the zillion tourist restaurants that clutter every corner and offer the same insipid menu. The building architectures are just amazing.

One of the most beautiful old town squares in Central Europe!. In a class on its own with other European Capital Cities, the Old Town Square sports examples of architecture from the 8th century to the 20th.

5 nights zagreb. Stayed at best western astoria superb good breakfast apart from the cremated bacon every morning very good staff .due to 2days of rain had 2meals in hotel buffet style very good inexpensive plus free coffee in reception10minute stroll city centre good choice of bars and restaraunts nice to have a meal and drinks at reasonable prices not like rip off Britain all all a great few days without breaking the bank

Love love love. Prague is an amazing city. Take a while to settle into Old Town and take in the sights. Street vendor and performers. A definite place for the kids to run around and have fun. Amazing architecture.
Don't miss! . Beautiful buildings, streets, nice atmosphere, visit the Jewish quarter and Synagogues, old Jewish cemetery. This is a must.

out of the world Architecture in the old town. St. Stephens Cathdral & Astronomical clock which is 1 of the oldest in the world is worth seeeing Lot of very old buildings with beautiful architecture. Shopping Street worth all items especiallly of Crystal Glass which is very famous of Prague..

a dream place. Old Town at Prague is one of the places I always am happy to come back to. It's Europe in it's best - the beauty, the architecture, the food and drinks and surely the crown (not a July, when it is really overcrowded!)
Beautiful . Such a busy place. Lots going on. Lots of bars and restaurants plenty of choices. The astronomical clock is a attraction that a lot of people come to see every hour.
So much energy here. Great place to hang out. Nice shops but compare prices they vary Nice restaurants can walk all over from OTS. Great night views with lighted buildings

Like any other European town.... Living in Europe last 4 years, I've been told Prague is like being in Paris. NOT!!!! Went there on a day trip and it is nothing like Paris. Yes, some streets are cleaner, but it did not have the "love" feeling. I felt like everywhere I went I was getting ripped off, either cash exchange (exorbitant commissions), or the hot dog stand charging ~30 krones for ketchup per hot dog. Not impressed whatsoever.Russian gang like folks walking around everywhere. I did not feel safe at all. Way over rated. Rather would have returned to Paris.

Get lost in Old World Prague. No cars, no buses, no cares but lots of side streets to wander through and many great eating places. Thankfully, this place is one of the few in Europe not ruined by World War II. The cobblestones are rustic and welcoming.

Christmas season delight. We traveled to Prague as a family and found the Old Town Square beautiful at Christmas time. It was packed with food and gift stalls. The nice touch for children were the petting zoos.

The astronomical clock and christmas markets were amazing. Easy to walk around, stunning views wherever you look. Just incredible. Make sure you try to check out the clock as it chimes- it's a real show!
Unbelievably beauty. It's picturesque, lively and vibrant. I will go back to Prague only to stay in this location once more.
Beautiful area of Prague. Has to be one of must see areas of Prauge. Splendid architecture and history with lots of bars and restaurants close by.

Brilliant. Some much to see and do! Large square with many entertainers. Easy access to the astromomical clock, restaurants, shops and much more. Walking distance to Charles Bridge. A must see while in Prague.
Long weekend in Prague. Old town charm lovely and worth a visit at night when lit up. Make sure to stop and see the clock. Flat shoes a must in this cobbled city.

High score on WOW. Beautiful square amazing buildings.. Makes Prague something special. More impressive than Budapest or Vienna perhaps. Various buildings worth a visit. was really delighted to see THE Hare with the Amber Eyes and its Netsuke chums on display hear.

What a surprise!!. We, my son and I, did this tour based on Tripadvisor and it was great. Ryan Hume was our guide and made the tour a real special tour. He even managed to find shadow in a very sunny day just going in the right places. Really worth it and you pay what you think is right. We will do it again

Stunning. Everything I expected and more. We were advised to eat and drink away from the main tourist areas but failed to heed this advice and did not feel overcharged even so.Prague still delivers excellent value for money.
So much history. Everywhere you look the architecture is stunningly beautiful. The history is never ending and goes back for hundreds of years. Not nearly as crowded as other top European cities.

Charming. Lots of great architecture and old-world charm. Highlights include the Old Town Square, the Municipal House and the Powder Gate (great views). Very busy with tourists however it's possible to find quieter areas off the beaten track.

Simply Beautiful. Old Town with its astronomical clock, they serve these tall circular donuts cooked on coal & wood and with a layer of chocolate melt and ice cream was yummy. The Indian Jewel Restaurant had the best breads & butter chicken and not to forget Asian Wok's fresh & amazing food.
interesting, crowded. We were there in summer so it was very crowded. Lots to gaze in wonder upon. Lots of buskers also keep things lively and there are plenty of places to sit to drink and eat.
A walk in the Old Town is a must!. Walking around in this district you can really feel Prague's atmosphere, you're surrounded by buildings that reflect perfectly the long history of Prague.

Beautiful and stylish. Great time. In 2015 we spent a few days in Prague. It's a really beautiful place. The old communist flavor seems to be almost gone. The center, the Hradchany Palace, the brigdes.... It's a must. Romantic and beautiful, one of the best examples of Austro-Hungarian style and grandour.
Awesome. Its simply picturesque and lovely, spend hrs walking & getting lost. Dont bother with maps just stroll around
Very busy. Lovely to see the old buildings but at high season it was quite unpleasantly busy so we didn't stay long
Grasp the past!. Old Town square is full of history. Poke about at your leisure or grab a seat under shady trees and watch the world go by. Interesting old book shop and some art to be seen.
History. lots of little places if you go of piece ,lots of interesting corners,do make sure you look down the back streets.

Visit to astronomical clock. Lots of hustle bustle area... not to mention to beware of pickpockets... astronomical watch is in the heart of old town... great foodies area with lots horse cart and Segway activities....
wonderful place. beautiful, fascinating and a delight to expore. The people are so friendly and helpful and the architecture is incredible.

A Must on any trip to Prague. I lived in Prague many years ago, so was familiar with the City, but the first time for my daughter so did the touristy visit of Old Town. That said, I still enjoy seeing the historical architecture.

Easy to walk around.. Lots of old buildings to see, small lanes to explore with there various shops to find some different, the old square is always fell of activity, and of course there is the Astronomical Clock. Lots of restaurants to try - the usual touristy ones around the square but you can always find an excellent one a bit away from this area.

Picturesque street, large square and untouched history.. Prague Old Town is beautiful and really worth-wile. The whole town-center is rather large and consists from 99% of historical buildings. I would suggest off season visit, to avoid crowds of tourists, or at least off-peak hours (early morning), such way, you can enjoy places in a very peaceful atmosphere.

Gorgeous but crowded . It was my 3rd time in Prague this Summer and while it is still one of my favorite cities I can see why going in October might be much better than during July. As I am a tourist myself I cannot complain about the crowd, still it is sometimes difficult to navigate trough the Old Town (especially with strollers) during the day (except early morning and very late evening). Aim to see the square before the party people start getting out early evening, it'll be a much better experience. Prague will put its magic spell on you too for sure, it is a city not to be missed!
3 weeks in europe. Old town Prague was great. There was so much to see an do I did a lot of walking. There was just so much to see and do. A must trip

Classic tourism visit.... Stunning scenery, amazing history and architecture. Every corner is a treasure. Scary prices, tough!!! :-/Be cautious! Surroundings are plenty of handcrafted beer. Enjoy those experience are worth!

Absolutely beautiful!. The Old Town is a beautiful and interesting place, there's the Astronomical clock, a must see and lots of restaurants and shops around the square. It's very quaint but also has an updated quality about it. Down the road a bit there's the Charles Bridge, another absolute must see if you are in Prague. We have been there twice, the first time was in the spring a few years ago and it was not over crowded at all. We were there again in June, 2016 and it was quite crowded. We did enjoy our visit but less crowds are always a plus.

Old Europe at its best. Definitely one of the most beautiful cities in the Europe. Amazing geography and excellent preserved medieval structures- once capital of Holy Roman Empire during Charles V deserves, due to its history and peace-loving people, to be capital of all Europeans (not only EU!) again.
Beautiful. So beautiful. Anywhere you move you can take great pictures and do shopping Many stores on offer.Always filled with crowds of people
Town hall tower. Unless you´re scared of heights, climb the Town Hall tower, the entrance is right next to the astronomical clock. The view is magnificent and shows Prague from different perspective!

First place to visit. It´s a lovely place, the first you need to visit in Prague. Full of tourist, really beautiful buildings, you can see the marvelous clock. Some times you find concerts and you have nice restaurants around it.

Too many tourists. Beautiful buildings but too many tourists in this spot. Apparently they gather to watch the astronomical clock. My general impression of Prague was that it wasn't too crowded with tourists, with the exception of this square.

Charming European jewel. Prague is one of the best European city to visit. The old town is very well preserved and there are some Free Guide tours.The gothic style and the rest of architecture is simply amazing!It is also one of the party capitals of Europe(especially for single men).
holiday. loads of lovely buildings and very friendly people who spoke to us in English which made it so much easier when ordering food and drink

Old Town, Czech Republic. This was our 1st time to Prague, and we couldn't believe how beautiful the whole city was. We felt completely safe and just loved the city. The old world charm is amazing. The architecture and history is so beautiful. We were in Prague for 6 days and we had something new to tour and visit everyday. The Christmas markets they have out in Dec made it even more beautiful. They had gift to purchase, hot wine (highly recommend), beer, food and more. So beautiful and would go back in a second !
nice walk. The Old Town is fun. It is stuffed with tourists. Fun to be in but stay on the other side of the river. It is quieter.
Real European charm. Do visit to experience old charm. Enjoyed ice creams. Lots of shopping options and Charles bridge nearby.
Find a seat. Clock chimes on the hour and gets v busy. We perched on stools at El toto negro opposite half an hour before with a drink so we're in comfort waiting and enjoyed a good view

What an amazing place to be.... Granted it is crowded with tourist, but the energy is amazing! People milling around, sitting in the streets, drinking, eating, laughing. We took horse ride carriage (personally I do not like horses working in the streets), but was nice drive thru old town, with its restaurants, bars, cafes… Views amazing from every point, Czech people helpful and friendly.
Charming prahue. I lived in Prague for 6 years and used to go to the Old Time Square regularly, and it never lost its charm. Always packed with tourist but still a must to see

Beautiful, but crowed. Just like many capitals, there were many tourist. It looks like a recreationpark. museum. It attracks a variety of people. People who really are interessted in the history, museums, buildings, etc. And a large quntity of youngsters celebrating with beer, drinks and lots of noise. A cheap weekend.
But it still is amazing to see such a great cultural inheritage.

Fantastic architecture, history is everywhere.. go in the morning to avoid the crowd!
dont eat near old town sq, instead fond some morelocal places nearby.
Go through UNGELT on the left sie of Tyn church through the arcade.

Famous destination for longer weekend. Prague is a must visit in in your list. Beautiful architecture and several museum to be visited. Old square is brillant. The beers are cheap and good. I recommend during spring and summer.

Crowdy, but beautiful!. The Old Town cannot be missed while being in Prague. It is simply beautiful, but as many have already wrote here, it is very crowded as well. I guess the most impressive part is that the buildings around have been preserved for hundreds of years and the medieval-like atmosphere still lingers. It is a great place to be! I) Watch your pockets and your gadgets!! Being so crowded it is very easy to be stolen. II) We were a bit surprised, but not in the good way, about the many people who are presummably trying to sell us tockets to concerts. In Prague you will see many like that going on the streets, trying to persuade you to buy such tickets. We personally found it expensive and there was a guy very insistatnt, fact hich we did not like. When we said "it is expensive", he said he could make a discount. So we immediately realized it was something wrong about it. Please, be aware of these guys as you will see them around in the whole Old Town.
Beautiful City. I had never been to Prague before, and my stay was too short. I must go back because this is an amazing city with so much to see. And the people were wonderful.

Most Visited Tourist Attraction. This is the most famous square with Astronomical clock, Jan Hus sttue and the street artists.. You'll be coming down from the road starting from Powder Tower, amd enjoy the rest of your time :)

Very quaint, but packed with tourists (like us!). Its the old town centre - you have to go there. Buzzing with tourists and some street entertainment. Great atmosphere. Good meeting place - central to the ready of old town.

Old world Europe. It's beautiful. That simple. Prague wasn't bombed during the wars, so most of the historical buildings remain. The old town has magnificent architecture. The stores are very touristy and, by and large, I would avoid them. But you can wander the old town for a full day and not get bored.

Totally Amazing. Really loved my visit to Prague and the Old Town is the icing on the cake, its beautiful and hosts great restaurants, that serve great meals at great prices. A weekend here will cost you less than going to a venue in the UK ,so no reason not to treat yourself and not take a trip to this amazing city.

An exciting place to visit in Prague. It is the most visited and busiest area filled with tourists and locals. Lots of great atmosphere and street performances. However be aware of pick pocket when everyone is gathered around to watch the clock.
The best old town in the World!!. This old town is wonderful. You can walk all the way, drink excelent beer, nice restaurants and good food. Finally yo can see the historic watch, spectacular!!!
Europe in Europe. You might see other cities in Europe, but Prague is the most european among them. Because the city is the only one who didn't get bombed during the World Wars.

The most beautiful medieval city I have been so far!. This is definitely a MUST-GO place if you ever visit Prague. Once you are in the square, you will surely see a crowd gathering in front of a building. That is the amazing Astronomical Clock! There are many other places like palaces, the Charles Bridge and etc. Don't forget to grab a Glue Wine when you are up on a small hill (where the Prague castle is located), and enjoy the beautiful old town view.
Beer with a view. We literally bought a beer and sat and chilled in the square basking in the sun. It was such a nice experience with the churches and scenery around us
sightseeing. a beautiful place so full of splendour and character so worth the visit, the building is magnificent

Beautiful buildings, fantastic history.. Prague is city that will make you want to give up your job and move there. From old castles to the Velvet revolution be prepared to be awe struck by the city, its beauty and its people.

Walking around and missed special pastries. I was took a walk several times in this region. There are many artistic (old) building which interesting to see. I also missed to buy and eat special pastries in which I regret until today. Take a walk and don't miss eating local food
Lovely Old Town. Prague has one of the best Old Town's in Central/Eastern Europe. The architecture is stunning and it hasn't been ravaged by war like so many others. Prague is a must visit!

Beautiful City. If you're into your architecture, then the Old Town is the place for you.
Some great cobbled lanes with shops bars and restaurants a plenty.
