Fascinating City. We had heard frequently that Prague was an interesting city and without going into too much detail the two nights we spent there as part of a European tour was wonderful.. Our local guide for the city and sights tour including a walk from a restaurant to the city was a highlight. Moreso because this particular guide was entertaining and knowledgable and quick with a repost or quip. One of the best we had on our 14 day tour of 'Classical Europe'.It is a city that we are possibly looking to revist again another time.

This is what makes Prague special. We loved strolling around the winding narrow streets lined with old buildings, many with small statues or plaques above the doors telling about the original owner. There is a tourist route that's always busy and where most of the souvenir and other shops are, but take adetour onto a sidestreet and you can have it all to yourself even on a hot July afternoon. We found some great bakeries and coffee shops away from the crowds that way.

BEST in Europe!. Have been to several European cities and Prague is simply magical. Beautiful architecture, building colors and must see at day and night. The view of the palace from the river is gorgeous! You will want to keep on walking!

Beautiful place, great for walking by. The old town is a special place, full of attractions, like the astronomic clock, the tower, the churches. It has a very pleasant atmosphere. I recommend going there during Christmas, the Christmas markets make it even more special.
Magical at night. Beautiful area of town. You can walk forever and not see it all. But even if you do it's fun to do that t again.

Old Town Prague. We were here for 5 days, walked and walked miles every day. So much beauty everywhere, can't begin to describe the gorgeous architecture and cobblestone streets.This is now my favourite city!

Prague. Prague did not disappoint!! In my short 3 day visit I was able to walk the highlights of the city and castles with Nicolas from Good Prague Tours. In the Evening I participated in the laid back beer tour to several local pubs and enjoyed the delights of Czech beer.
To be seen . Stroll around and enjoy the atmosphere of Prague. However today it is getting more and more touristic with shops and restaurants
Perfect!. It just takes your breath away... charming, quaint, so much history. The locals are very friendly and seem happy to share their stories. Put it on your bucket list!!

Prague is beautiful. The old town is beautiful, lots of historic buildings, churches etc. that are interesting to explore. It is easy to navigate and the old town is compact enough you can do it in a day or less. Fun to sit at a sidewalk cafe and people watch.

Unmissable!. You shouldn't miss this square as it was the the heart of old prague. From there you'll have easy and quick access to most of the most important landmarks of the city :)
Keep in mind, however, that it will be constantly crowded!! Lots of street artists there thou.

Stunning Prague Old Town. I adore Prague, it's a beautiful city with so much dark history. The Old Town is beautiful, I was there over Christmas with friends, and it was truly magical being in Prague around this time of year. It's a must see area of Prague.
One of the main highlights of Prague. If you visit Prague, you have to visit the Old Town. Great buildings only spoiled by the touts on segways

Busy but interesting. Very busy place! Lots of places to eat and things to do here, including tourist attractions (the clock), musical concerts, an art museum, and you are surrounded by beautiful buildings. Definite place to visit.

Keeping an 18 and 20 year old engaged ! . Wandering through the old town we came into the square and frankly it took my breath away. We arrived around 5 and seemingly so did every other visitor in town.
Might be worth getting up early to take in without the crowds.

Great to see for a second time.. We stayed at a hotel that overlooked Wenceslaus Square and had a great view of the city area from the balcony that overlooked the square. The view was very pretty at night with the city lights and we could see the castle a night which was floodlit. The city was very crowded and getting around was difficult at times but we were able to see and visit the places we intended to. The changing if the guard at the castle gates was good to see despite the huge crowd and a thunderstorm that preceded it. The walk through the old town and Jewish area was interesting as too was the walk over the Charles Bridge and the streets up to the castle. It was our second visit to Prague after a gap of about 8 years. It was still as interesting and quite a lovely place to see despite the crowds. There are plenty of good eating places there also.

Spectacular. Such a beautiful place to spend time. We enjoyed lunch along the river, a private walking tour, buskers in the squares, the Charles Bridge in the evening and strolling the cobblestone streets.

Beautiful, must see. It is worth the $ to get a guide when touring the old town. there is so much to see and learn. We spent most of two days here and still didn't feel like we did more than touch the surface.

Heart of Prague with plenty to see and do.. The old town area is a great place to spend some time on a visit to Prague.It is rich in history and culture. After crossing Charles Bridge head over to the Astronomical clock which tells not just time but the season, zodiac sign and moon cycle. Then you can stroll through any number of shops and restaurants and then return to the Charles Bridge or head over to the Jewish quarter a short distance away.
Nice Square. Nice square there was a festival the week we were there and people were out enjoying the music. Lovely buildings. Visited the clock. A must visit.

So much history so little time. While in Prague we went to Old Town twice, once on an Early Thursday morning and then again late morning on Friday. Thursday was a better time as it wasn't as crowded as Friday. We were on a city tour on Thursday and all the historical buildings were pointed out. Many to choose from to take a deeper look. Also Old Town provides one the opportunity to window shop crystal, garnets, marionettes. Or taste Czech specialities or their round pastries with fillings like whipped cream or chocolate. If you need a restroom, their is a Starbucks across from the Astronomical Clock and it's free.Speaking of the clock don't miss the "Walk of the Apostles" every hour on the hour. But be careful, we were warned this is a place for pickpockets while everyone is looking up.Old Town also has concert halls and even an Apple museum. Lots to do

Nice, but crowded. We went for a short walk through old town - was nice, but very crowded. Many tourist attractions and souvenir shops available, if you like it. Can feel many similarities with other old towns of Central & North Europe
Must go. This place is so vibrant clean and beautiful, so much heritage all around I got to see the bells in the square that go of every hour, it's s must see
Great architecture. Beautiful square, really lovely - best time is earlier morning before mobs of tourist fill the place

Stunning architecture. It is a great delight to walk around the Stare Mesto and take in the wonderful buildings. St Nicholas Church offers regular free concerts and we enjoyed listening to an early evening mixed voice choir and organ concert before heading back to our hotel. Very pretty at night as there's no traffic and the lighting is sympathetic to the architecture.

Lovely Church. This is my favourite in Prague, and this was the main reason of our trip :) Gorgeous, beautiful, wonderful... I love it!To find the entrance is a little bit difficult, but you will not be disappointed if you can find it finally... ;) It is breathtaking both inside and outside!

Beautiful city!. The old town with its astronomical clock and plaza is definitely one of the best places to visit in Prague. It gets crowded near the clock about 10 minutes before the hour. The plaza has nice restaurants and shops.

Stunning...full of history. I love Old Town Square, always lively, full of happy people exploring the square, surrounded by beautiful buildings. The square are surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, street food is just beside astronomical tower. We watched nice/cheap high quality opera show in mirror chappel close to old town square, highly recommended to watch opera in Prague if you get a chance. Do not miss the old town Square and spend little more time if you can.

Nice place to visit. As we were going around Prague in a leisurely way, this place is a nice place to spend time in. It has a lot of people, food stalls, and the well-known astronomical clock. It has a small park where people can sit and rest.
Can't miss if you are in Prague.. We spent a half day walking around this area and then the new town looking for the Kafka head. It's just part of the Prague experience that can't be missed.
beautiful scenic history. we loved all of the beautiful old architecture in Prague! :-) One of our favorite cities in Europe! Yay!
go early in the morning.. Beautiful square. Please avoid the food sellers in the huts - outrageous price. They don't have any prices up as well .
Beautiful City!. Don't miss going to Old Town and the Charles Bridge. They are magnificent! Give yourself plenty of time to just wander the streets and soak up the atmosphere.

Explore, explore, explore. A labyrinth of winding streets and alleys this area is great experience. Break it up over a couple of days to let the magic of Old Town sink in. One minute you will be surrounded by people, turn down an alley or go through an arch to the next street and it could well be empty of people.Tons of shops and restaurants to explore and tons of history to soak up of eras long gone.

A trip to the padt. It's just that! A trip to the past. Time has been kind to Prague unlike many other European cities.. no destructive wars have been fought here . Therefore things were just as they were in the entire Old town of Prague. Everything is within walking distance, even though the town is largish. One can start in the Old town square where the astronomical clock chimes dramatically every hour. The Jewish quarter is nearby. The place is filled with restaurants and heritage structures. And to see it better, one can avail of the various tours on sale. One can walk, cycle, Segway, ride a bus, horse buggy or even a vintage car. Beware- it can be crowded though

Took a Great Walking Tour. Our walking tour took about 2 1/2 hours and was while somewhat tiring was very comprehensive. Walking on cobblestone streets everywhere was tough on the feet. The architecture was fantastic and the colors of some of the buildings were very impressive. Loved the churches and cathedrals. Some great stained-glass windows in the churches. The squares were full of people and restaurants were everywhere.

Something for everyone or nothing for anyone. The architecture in the old square is definitely breathtaking, and the statues and adorning sculptures are so numerous it becomes dizzying. If you steer clear of the crowds there are some great restaurants tucked in beautiful niches. We found that the ones that were a must see from an architectural or historical basis tended to have the worst food and the worst service. The shops are mostly overpriced and repetitive. Walking in the evening feels safe and pleasant except for the too frequent tourist pub crawls. Worth visiting but don't follow the crowd.
Amazing town square. So much going on in this square and very impressive when you enter it. Splendid church of Our Lady before Tyn and the Astronomical clock on the Old Town Hall.

Very nice architect. It is a must see when you come to prague because of how beautiful and unique each building is. There is a clock tour that moves by the hour, and lots of restaurants nearby. I gave it a 4 star because old town is full of tourists traps where they enjoy over charging you for food! So id suggest you guys to go to the outskirts of town if you guys are on a budget. i thought it was great area for a nice walk and i enjoyed just getting lost in the streets of old town. Things did close quite early so I made sure i got alot of my site seeing and shopping done in day time! Old town is walkable by foot, so there is no need for a taxi!

Very Interesting Location. Full of character, the Old Town teems with tourist groups doing their walking tours. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants, amidst the grand architecture. Cobbles can be a bit hard on the feet, but with so much to see you don't mind.
Entertaining . The square is well worth a visit with lots of entertainment going on day and night. Very multi cultural.
Beautiful. Take a camera and ensure you take lots of pictures. A truly special and beautiful town. Will 100% be returning.

History all directions. The old town square is a crowded place packed with tourists You will find a lot of local performances going on the the open area of the square The Astronomical clock is around The State maestro is there tooMany souvenir shops Ice cream stalls And restaurants

Nice place to walk around and explore. We visited Prague in June. Stayed in a hotel near by old town. Its a very nice place to visit.I was amazed to see Prague has retained its old architecture buildings with a touch of modernisation
Spacious, nice, renovated. I love Prague and lived there for 7 years so I visited plenty plenty of times with family and friends. The old town in a must see.

Lovely architecture, but Touristy. Beautiful architecture, some neat shops, and good for a nice walk, but was very crowded when we visited in July, and much of it was very touristy which detracted from the overall atmosphere.
Travel in time. This is a place that will take back some centuries.You can feel the atmosphere of those times.And of course is full of tourists. Maybe at 6am is a good hour to go there.

It never ends. I have been to many old towns in different cities around the world, but I'm not sure I have been to another as huge as this. One street after the next, it just keeps on going. Not only that, but every street has its own identity and its own charm. We can just walk around for days. Unfortunately, the prices have adjusted to the number of tourists, and everything is much more expensive than elsewhere.
Beautiful!. Strolled around Old Town. So many people and tourist walking around here. Its a nice place and a must visit for everyone in Prague!

Great place, very touristy. The old town is absolutely gorgeous and your will be awed by the Astro clock and the large bell towers of nearby churches. Everything in the old town is a bit more expensive than other areas, which is to be expected given location, however it is not over the top. Very crowded area, especially with large tour groups, and gets very hot and humid in this area because of narrow streets just as in Rome. All in all, good place for one afternoon.

Old town square - Staromestske Namesti. We spent 3 days in Prague, and seemed to be drawn to this quaint, beautiful square time and again. For us, together with the Charles Bridge, it presents the best feel for Prague as an ancient, historic city in Europe. We must have taken hundreds of pictures in the square, including of the Tyn Church with its 2 spires (beautifully illuminated at night), the Old Town Hall with its Astronomic Clock, the Jan Huus statue in the middle of the square and so on. It is great to sit at one of the Coffee shops or restaurants in the square and just feel the vibe. We did also go up to the top of the Old town square and get the view from there of all of Prague - worth the ticket. The square is full of Segways, in particular of sales guys trying to sell you a Segway excursion.Don't miss it and spend as much time as you have.

Lose yourself in this beautiful part of Prague. Old town in Prague is definitely among the beautiful ones that I have visited. Buzzing with activities and restaurants, I really enjoyed walking through these cobbled streets ... getting lost mid-way and getting back on track. Be sure to catch the hanging statue of Sigmund Freud in one of the streets opposite to the Astronomical clock. Lots to see and a super foodie place!

Gorgeous. I love Prague. Old town is great in summer and in winter. At Christmas they have stalls and a huge Christmas tree so you can get into the Christmas spirit with a hot drink and a treat. In Summer, sit at one of the restaurants and enjoy the atmosphere or just have a wander. There is a Church in old town that was used in the Mission Impossible film. Make sure you watch the clock as it strikes the hour, but get there a bit before to make aure you get a good spot to watch from.
Amazing. I have been to Prague 4 times! This square becomes more amazing every time I have seen it! It is very busy with tourists but is still stunning! I sometimes can't believe it is real!
Great place to chill in Prague. groups of people hanging out, singing till very late in the night is the norm at old town square ... one can spend sometime everyday at his/her stay at Prague
The whole view of Prague. It's good that there is a lift directly to the top and you can walk the stairs when you leave. It's just a square and is difficult to walk as it's quite a small path.
A walk to remember. just walk by the lanes and u will fall in love with the beauty of the city the cafe's /bars walk in ur own pace
Lovely old building. One of the highlights of Prague...a must see. All the buildings are so special and built so long ago.

Charming medieval town.. You almost feel like you're in a fairy tale walking through the streets of this gorgeous town. Unlike other cities in western Europe, Prague is not as commercialised and still has the charm that you expect. The locals are so lovely.
It was very crowd when we were there, especially walking from Charles Bridge.

Old Town is the best place to enjoy this enchanting city!. There is always something to do and see in Old Town. The street entertainment was wonderful, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere completely enchanting... especially at night!
look up!. A little cosy quartier with beautiful painted buildings and special athmosphere. A magical place where You can feel the history.

Fairyland. Beautiful city with great restaurants and shopping! I felt like a walked into a Harry Porter book! The ancient buildings were spectacular, Hotel U (right in the square) has a gorgeous rooftop bar and restaurant that I loved, and all of the people were great!

The heart of the city!. Vibrant area and old town square in the heart of Prague. Very touristy but worth a visit. Plenty of restaurants, bars, and tours to pick up from the Old Town Square. Great street performances in the square, Segway tours, bubbles for the kids to chase, horse carriage rides, and more! And don't forget, the Astronomical Clock is located here and well worth the visit.

There is no other square like it!. This square it's fantastic! No matter where you are standing you will have an astonishing view! I am not sure if it was the rain, or time of year, but we anticipated it to be more full. Of course it's packed, as its the main attraction, but we noticed it wasn't like any other square. The churches and their architectures, the clock, or just the beauty of the cobblestones, no matter where you can stop to get a great picture. Although be aware you will be stopped to take a Segway tour, as they are everywhere. From the square you can head really anywhere and get lost in its beauty. Part of being in the square is to hear the sound every hour of the astronomical clock. Start your Prague adventure here! You will not be disappointed!
lovely old city. This place has lots of really old interesting buildings, shops, bars and restaurants. Its one of the safest feeling cities I have ever been to.
Grandiose !. Many beautiful contrasting styles of architecture with annoying segways and mostly useless police hanging around trying to look useful.

romantic. Romantic place. You can also find souvenirs and it is not too expensive. There is near by caffe bars with free wi fi so you can have internet also. But no public wi fi at least not when we where there.
INTERESTING.. The place gets crowded but it's an interesting place to be. there are all sorts of interesting things in the area. There is a museum,
Beautiful. Absolute amazing town. Delightful for all senses. Take a walk by their streets and find an enchanted city.

Busy with tourists and Korean couples taking wedding pictures. Beautiful historic town centre with many churches and other attractions. Gets very busy after 10 am. Churches and cathedrals charge an entry fee for the most part. Don't bother with art museums, best views are from the outside.
Great place. Nice view, lots of people, entertainment for kids also, lots of restaurants and boutiques, i recommend a tour, even a free one you can get there.

Nice and noisy . This is a must see in Prague. And it is definitely full of beautiful sights. But it is also full of noise and young people all the time asking if you would like to buy Segway tours etc. I was happy we went there and happy to get back to Prague area 8 with a much more quite atmosphere. I would highly recommend to go here and eat at Proti Proudu.

very well preserved. loose yourself in this tiny beautiful old town. you will see yourself wondering from one street to another but all will end up in the same square. small but very impressive and mostly very well preserved

Vibrant area with great architecture. The Old Town of Prague is a very vibrant place to visit to enjoy spectacular architecture and history. We visited Old Town a couple of times each day of our three day weekend in Prague before embarking on our Viking River Cruise. Be sure to see the chiming of the Astrological Clock and go up the Tower to see the panoramic view of Prague. It is only a short walk to the Charles Bridge. Old Town is a must see when visiting Prague.

The Spirit of Prague!. Feel the spirit of Prague walking through the old town square! Souvenir shops, restaurants, bars, museums, street entertainers accommodated in the old city center surrounded by amazing buildings make a unique blend of modern and traditional. The most beautiful of a Prague.

JOIN THE CROWDS. This is the place to be if in Prague. It is full of beautiful buildings and so much history Never bombed in WW2. Very crowded in July and I understand why.There are plenty of terraces, pubs, bars, and restaurants to visit. Prices are cheaper than in other parts of Europe.Make sure you go up the tower of the Old Town and Astronomical clock, it is definitely worth the 360 degrees view over the city. The Czech people are super nice. It is an excellent place for sightseeing and walking.
Fun square. Great for catching a beer and people watching. The side streets have many interesting restaurants and a lower price.
Fun square. Great for catching a beer and people watching. The side streets have many interesting restaurants and a lower price.

Magic, Crowded but Like Stepping Back in Time. An amazing city! My 3rd time. Photographer's dream. Postcard shots everywhere you turn. Thanks God it was totally preserved during WWII and dates back to pre-medieval times.

Brilliant square and amazing atmosphere. If you are in prague you simply have to visit this square and you can't miss it really. It has very nice restaurants and coffee shops there too such as starbucks
The life of Prague. A huge square with the huge astronomical clock makes this the most visited by the tourists and indeed its filled with shops, cafes, salons and thai massage centres.
Beautiful City Beautiful Place. Prague is enchanting. It is an amazing city. The old town is not to be missed. It is also a walking city so there is much you can do on foot.
Iconic views from tower. Nice view from clock tower cross old town. Morning times are little quiet so be there early. Nice restaurants and bars can be found everywhere
Must visit. very centrally and happening place to visit in prague, you can take carriage ride, vintage car ride etc from here

Beautiful place to wander about taking in the sights . A must do.A beautiful place to wander around taking in the sights of all the buildings. Very busy at night.A jazz festival was on when we visited.I prefer the old town the best in prague

Magical and Old!. The spires, the architecture, and even the lighting at night! There is nothing much like this left in the Western world, and it deserves its UNESCO heritage ranking. Really took my breath away.

Beautiful Old Town. Because Prague was mostly untouched by World War II, it remains one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. Old Town is just full of beautiful architecture and cobbled streets. Loved it.

A must-be place with great atmosphere!. Prague Old Town is a great, must-be place for anyone visiting Prague. It is full of history and artsy buildings, it is lively, colourful, always quite crowded (especially in high touristic season). There are plenty of terraces, pubs, bars and restaurants, some of them quite pricey, as it usually happens in all touristic hot-spots. Make sure you go up the tower of the Old Town and Astronomical clock, it is definitely worth the 360 degrees view over the city. It is an excellent place for sightseeing and walking.

This place will capture your heart. For more than 25 years I have been working in Prague. However, since I have a family house in another part of the Czech Republic, the weekends I spend mostly outside Prague. But I am always looking forward to make time for an evening stroll through the Old Town Square. Again and again I stand amazed in front of Tyn Church and trying to saturate the surreal sight of the beauty.I travel around the world and admire the sights of foreign countries. But believe me, nothing will impress me as much as the evening view of the illuminated Tyn Church. I highly recommend you to do the same. I´m sure you will love the look as well as I do.
very interesting place to visit & a lot to see in a short time. good tourist spot, the astronomical clock, the town square, the church of Our lady before Tyn and tredlinks.. all in one place

Small, Accessible and Dripping with History. Such a beautiful area--so much to see and much smaller than I expected. The Astronomical Clock cannot be missed and being where it is missed will not be missed. The Church of Our Lady before Týn is not quite viewable at least in the front section as there are buildings built in front--I have never seen a church quite like this. The hours can be tricky--worth visiting not just from the outside--the interior is quite beautiful.

Something Out of a Fantasy World. This area is so beautiful. It looks like it came out of a Fantasy world. Topping it is an array of museums, attractions, and above all the warm and welcoming Czech people. It truly is a dream vacation area for all who are lucky enough to visit.

The heart of Prague. Old Town is the heart of Prague, a beautiful city! Enjoy the architecture, people watching and, of course, great street food. The grilled sausages were superb. For dessert, try a trdlo, dough grilled over open coals then covered in sugar with the inside filled with a hazelnut chocolate spread. Awesome!

A great place to walk & visit local businesses. I booked a beer spa at Pivni Lanzne in this area, no idea what to expect. Great experience Jimmy Choo's shoe store is in the area I did not get shoes but the sales lady was very helpful in assisting me to find the spa

Plenty to see and do, full of history, and absolutely beautiful. Tour of the Old Town Hall was very interesting, and definitely recommend going up the tower. The Church of Our Lady before Tyn was amazing, and only 25 Kc (approx 1 euro) donation required. Plenty of places to eat around, but pricey enough.Make sure you have a look at the astronomical clock when it chimes on the hour.

Weekend in Prague. Nice place for walking , sightseeing and eating . We were at the time of Christmas, everything was fantastic decorations. The food is excellent . Restaurants are excellent garden sitting outdoors with heaters and blankets . All in all an excellent weekend . Prague is great for a trip with friends .
Nice and lively. Nice and very crowded area .... You can just sit and relax and watch the view and many people going around ... Many souvenir shops ..
Great under lights.. a safe magical experience both in the day and night. Plenty of good eating places too or places to sit back and relax with a drink or 2
Prague Old Town visit. We spent many hours wandering around this amazing, historical place. Lots of different roads led us to even more amazing places which all made for a fantastic weekend away.

Must visit. If you're in for architecture and want to experience a buzzing surrounding, this is a must visit place. It's heart to the astronomical clock and it's one of the main attractions in the city.
Old town Prague. Fun time. Crazy with tourists. Amazing city with unbelievable architecture. Nice and safe. Crazy streets, find a hotel that will cart you around - Residence de Agnes is our favorite
Beautiful Prague, Beautiful Old Town. This is a must visit place in Prague. If you got 4 hours in Prague. Just go there and roam around. It has this old world charm and yet its very modern.
Fantastic Area. Beautifull, romantic, classic area with great architecture. Nice hotels, cafe, restaurants and pubs are everywhere. Many shops are around for shopping. Will come again for sure.
Nice square. Nice place .. lost of people about an stalls to buy things ...loved it ... when the weather is good it is packed
Stunning . Beautiful part of the city full of shops and restaurants! Must see part of Prague. Free tours are a great way to see the city centre!
Town square. There is a lot to see! Cathedral, astronomical clock and the tower and the way to get these is so good! Amazing experience. Long queues!

Packed with Tourist. Though there a lots of tourists, the architecture and history is definitely a draw. Check it out during the early morning. If you are lucky, there might be a performance or other activity.

Amazing architecture . Gorgeous old town square with just so much to look at. A great place to sit and admire the scenery and people watch.Most of the restaurants/bars were more expensive here but if your looking for food and drink I would recommend some of the side streets off this.A short walk from Charles bridge and the astrological clock is here too, on the old town hall.
Charming European Town. Charming historic area with plenty of shopping and restaurants in addition to the lovely historic buildings
Just like in the movies. The Old Town is filled with things to see. There are churches and museums and a wide variety of shops and of course plenty of restaurants and good food.
A beautiful place. Old Town is a great place to spend time. It is vibrant and exciting with lots going on. There are many great places to eat and things to do.

Great old town. Loved it I would have gone there plenty a times every year . Great to visit and fantastic places to visit and see.Make sure you have nice sneakers to go around as you need to walk a lot in Prague to be able to see everything and make sure you do as it is a fantastic city to visit

Magical, medieval and very crowded at any time of the day!. Like most visitors to Prague, Old Town Square is most likely to be the first place that you hit up when here. You cannot miss it - literally, all roads lead to it! We visited during Easter and the Easter market/fair was in full swing right in the middle of the square. There were horse carriages, food stalls, souvenir stalls, hot wine stalls, etc. This is also the place from where most guided tours start. There are also free walking tours from here. The only con of this area is the massive crowds at any time of the day, along with the guided tours vendors on their segways in front of the Astronomical Clock.Must do: Do visit the viewing deck at the top of the Astronomical Clock tower for amazing views of Old Town and Mala Strana. Do wait for the hourly clock ceremony at the Astronomical Clock. Do drink the hot wine and eat the freshly made potato chips, fried break or potato pancakes, if you happen to be there during the Easter markets.

Walk, walk, walk!. "Walk, walk, walk"!!!If you want to admire this open air museum called "Prague's Old Town", simply walk, everywhere and anytime...You will thank me for doing it even though your feet might be in sweet pain!!!
Must do. Can't imagine going to Prague without being there.It have everything there you want to see. Take your time and take your camera.

Fabulous monumental square visited every day. Walked from our hotel every day there and back never get tired of this wondorous sight but missed the magnificent christmas tree that appears in the festive season. Annoyed by the segways they have no place in the square and go way too fast for both young and old novices. Had to dodge far too many far too often.

One of the best town squares with great atmosphere!. The atmosphere here is awesome. Very historical and breath-taking. This is our first stop on our trip in Prague and there is a good Czech Tourism info centre on the square with all the information on Prague and the Czech Republic in general.

Dreamy. Every where you look the sites you see must be photographed and remembered. It is so beautiful. There are many restaurants, outdoor cafes, churches and historical buildings, statues, shopping opportunities.

Beautiful. It was lovely to spend a few hours here, looking at the buildings, people watching and eating some Prauge ham and those pastry on a spit covered with sugar things...
It was busy and full of tourists but it was clean and had a lovely atmosphere all the same.
magnificent square. We could have spent days in this beautiful square alone. Plan to be there on the hour to see the Astronomical Clock.

Something around every corner . My friend and I walked around Old Town almost every day during our stay. One day we devoted ourselves to this area and every time we thought we couldn't be more impressed with an area we were surprised anew. The area is easy to navigate, but wear comfortable shoes because the streets are cobblestone and you can easily spend a day walking over bridges, through parks and squares, and up and down church and tower stairs.

Lots of tourists. The square is really crowded so I suggest a quick visit. Lots of nice buildings and statues, the clock of course and plenty of places for a beer or food. Beer is really cheap, it's nicer to sit and watch the people instead of being among them.
MUST see in Prague. The most beautiful square in Prague. Amazing castles, famous building, galleries, shops and world clock. Don't miss the Christmas or summer atmosphere here. Really breathtaking.

Midieval Character Meets Lots of Tourists. Once you get a way from the masses of tourists on Old Town Square and take the time to wander through the narrow passages, you will discover many charming little nooks and crannies. Most stores and restaurants are geared towards touristsbut changes as you get further away from the square. Look up - a lot! The upper story architecture of the buildings is stunningly ornate.
just awesome place, loved it. one of the best old town squares i have ever seen, beautiful, clean, great people watching and crowded.

This is the Place Where I Want to Live Forever. Everytime I visit Prague, I spend most of the time in Old Town. I love the atmosphere here. It is historical, interesting, romantic, and breathtaking. I saw many cities in Europe and Old Town in Prague is simply the best city square. You should go there early in the morning, during the daytime, and in the evening. You feel different things in different times.

Very interesting tour and full of history. We opted for a free walking tour where we normally tip the guide at the end of the tour. Its really interesting & a MUST SEE. Include the Jewish township including the cemetery, the township is entirely redone by the french and very lovely. Our guide Givi was marvellous & being born, brought up, studied there, gave us lot of interesting stories about the place, Cafes, tips for the tourists, the Charles University etc
I love Prague. To enjoy Prague, you have to be able to walk - I mean walk a lot - on cobblestones - bring your most comfortable shoes. It's a fun place.
Very nice old town. We just love to be in the old town in prague with all the nice houses and buildings in the middle of the old city.
Great place. So many different things to see, architecture, quaint little shops, restaurants and pubs. Take your time to take in all the views.

Beautiful streets and buildings. Strolling the streets of old town is a wonderful experience. Lots of narrow winding streets filled with beautifully coloured buildings. And the town town square is similarly beautiful. We followed a Rick Steves walking tour that started in new town before heading to old town. As long as you plan to see both old town and new town (as most visitors do) I would recommend arranging your walk in this order to maximize the impact.
Beautiful but crowded. This time of year there are always armies of visitors. But many things to do and see. We were fortunate to go with a tour guide, who was very knowledgable.
Sit & enjoy. Very historic area. Make sure you watch the astronomical clock. So much to take in, so find a place, get a drink & sit & relax. People watch & take in the view.
Superb . Love, love, love the old town in Prague is so beautiful and scenic. A most do if you visit Prague. The whole area is just amazing. One of my favourte cities.

Beautiful place over run with tourists. A incredible place full of amazing architecture and incredible sights. Old town is a bit of a tourist trap with lots of yours trying to get you on a Segway tour. The segways in a small area filled with pedestrians is a bad mix. There are so many tourists during summer it it became a little crowded but it was still ok. As the Segway tours come towards you just say no thanks and most go away. If you want a good Segway tour go over the bridge to the lesser town and do a trip there fewer people more space and a better experience

People watching and street theatre at its best !!. Taking in the amazing architecture whilst having a coffee or beer and watching the streams of people go by is one of life's simplest pleasures.Add some entertaining street theatre and you have the perfect recipe for a relaxing couple of hours !!
Stunning. Old town is beautiful; every block you walk brings new sights. It's very touristy, but that doesn't alter the fact that it's a wonderful place.
Art Nouveau Architecture. The architecture in the Stare Mesto and Nove Mesto is spectacular. Just wander through the streets and absorb the beauty of the architecture.
Beautiful town. Beautiful, colourful area. Full of charm! We enjoyed sitting in an outdoor restaurant enjoying drink and people watching.

the first to do things in Prague. When you come in Prague, then put your stuffs in your hotel, take a break for 15 min then go immediately to the old town. it's the best square of all cities we visited ever. I feel it has a soul and special smell. All people are happy. The buildings around are breathtaking specially the astronomical Clock.
The place to be in Prague. We were here in early July, and after about 10 am, the place is filled with tourists. It's the heart of the city, so find a hotel nearby and everything is walking distance.

A must place to visit. I am not into history, churches and such but this place is fascinating, we started each day here, every building is different, each has its own story, it's just a really nice place to visit. Walks across the bridge to lesser town was lovely, be sure to take some decent walking shoes because you will need them. Explore as much as you can, we found in the side streets a brilliant artisan cafe and superb bohemian restaurant, mixed around Hard Rock Cafe etc. You will never be stuck for somewhere to eat and drink, places to suit all budgets and we never had a bad meal anywhere. You will feel very safe here, and get a great buzz from all that's going on around.
beautiful. very impressive and worth the visit. enjoy a horse and carriage ride from the old town square. Always something happening here.
Great for a historic walk. This part of town is most known for the clock tower which is something to see. I would suggest going early to avoid crowds, and the segways which I hate.
Tourists . Walked round old town and loved every minute of it. Small quirky streets with lots of restaurants. Loved every minute of it.
Take your time and enjoy the walk, see the history. We walked the area ourselves, reading a guide book. It was sufficient to understand the area and enjoy. Stop where we want, take our time.

Beautiful and welcoming area of Prauge.. We stayed in a hostel right in the middle of old town and it was PERFECT! We had a bunch of little restaurants right around the area and a very close walk to the square and the water. It is quiet enough to feel like you can relax, but close enough to action to not feel like left out! Highly recommended it for both families and thrill seekers!

Definitely the heart of Prague... Wow is the word. Enchanted. Cannot think of a better word as the words do not do justice to the experience that you have here. I would recommend that you come and see for yourself.Quintessentially Europe. Cobbled streets, marvellous buildings, quaint cafes, restaurants and above all...unhurried people with a contended look on their face. Above all, rocking weather to accompany. You need to plan at least 70% of your time in the old town area as there is so much to explore here. Like I have mentioned earlier, this is the heart of Prague, and it beats just right.

Beautiful but crowded. Wandering around in the old town on my first day in Prague. It was nice sitting in the square enjoying all the colourful building which each has their own character as well as the clock tower. You must come here if you are visiting Prague!!!
Praha is beautifull. We enjoyed walking arpund and sitting on a terrace on in old town, it's crowdy and alive, beautiful place
your typical eastern European old town.. Been to Vienna, Bratislava or even Helsinki? Then you've seen it before. Nice, but nothing new or spectacular. Safe and clean.

A minibus tour... on feet!. "Prague tour all inclusive";We were supposed to see 32 points from the Castle to the old town.We were left by minibus at about 1km from the castle, then all on feet all the day. Very poor informations guide support. We had to wait 1h for taking the boat, and whent to the restaurant at 2h30 pm.Very tiring trip, expansive and without interest.
The most beautiful part of Prague!. Very crowded but worth it! Sit down and observe the buildings around. This is the most beautiful part of Prague.

a hub of activity. a lovely central place to visit. expect events and crowds, buskers and vendors, tours and tourists alongside pubs cafes and shops set within historical references - always something happening and full of atmosphere - worth visiting multiple times.

Till 9:00 in the morning.... ...it's a heavenly place, after that till late at night it could be hell on earth. Haven't seen such tourist masses in a city before. As a local living/ working in the old town I would go crazy.

Great City - Pearl of the East. Prague is a very nice and romantic city in Central Europe. A true pearl!There is a lot to see for every visitor, e.g. the famous Charles Bridge and lots of historical building. But I also would recommend to visit of a play in the opera. There are so many good restaurants and other places to be, such as Petrin Hill with its observation tower.Just make sure that you pay for public transports ALWAYS, otherwise you will have an unpleasant experience.
Beautiful!. Beautiful buildings and historic things to see. Plenty of restaurants and easy to walk through the town.
Just great. Just great, great great, full of tourists, cafes, pubs, and very nice atmosphere. Worth to visit severeal times a holiday.!

the religious center. the churches the catedral n the jewish centre a bit further inside were very interesting places.missed seeing the jewish quater n spanish synagogue from inside it being sabbath(saturday).
so important to plan accordingly
the clock tower with its hourly show of cuckoo clock type movements is a must too.

Another tourist attraction. This was worth a visit, in with Prague Castle and Charles Bridge. Essentially it seemed another tourist spot, but offers the usual architecture and history I came to expect.
Wow!!!. What a great place. So much to see, so many attractions. Beautiful buildings, lots of history, many stories. A wonderful place to visit.

Amazing . amazing place..
Prague in general is very very nice..
as they say.. old but gold..
just walk there and around then you will know what I am talking about.
the streets, the buildings, ... everything is absolutely amazing..
believe me.. you will love it..
P.S for girls: Do NOT where high heels shoes because of the cobblestone streets..
One of the best places to see in Europe.. It is central attraction in Prague. Requires quite a bit of walking. The best way to visit is probably by crossing Charles Bridge and then going gradually up

Want to buy almost everything movable and photograph the rest. Very charming part of town. It feels like walking around in a Disney movie set. The houses are adorable and the monuments inspire awe. The shops are full of amber, crystal, glas figurines, and jewelry. One can just stroll around in fascination for hours. Then it is advisable take a break at one of the plentiful cosy cafés.

Great old town with complex streets and laneways. A really beautiful old town, with great hidden and winding laneways that kept us interested for days. The history is palpable, and we found Prague's old town to be enchanting and magical.

Great Day. What a wonderful city! Vibrant and so full of life. Old town is great and the street performers, music, it really comes alive. The outdoor cafes are great and the crowds give off their own energy. Truly a special place. Hope to bring the family in the near future.
Beautiful and Intimate!!. The BEST "Small" town we have ever been to. Great restaurants and people watching!! Only complaint....SEGWAYS everywhere. Get rid of them!!

Great place, very crowded though. There is everything happening here: street performers in the middle of the square and at every corner, good stands on one side, a few (way too few) benches by the big statuary group off-center and a lot of tourists. The architecture is amazing, Prague has done an amazing excellent job at restoring all the glamour of the buildings around the square. It's a magical place!
Unique Area. Old town is a great site to see. It is a busy area but def worth a visit. Buildings are stunning. Would recommend.

Lots to see. Lots to see around this area. Small streets to explore down with lots of shops. Main square is nice to relax in and people watch. There is the moving clock which goes on the hour and there is also a nice church to look in. Beware: do not buy food from the traditional food vendor beside the horse & carriages- total rip of. Nicer food can be found throughout the area. ALSO BE AWARE of men who appear to be alone trying to stop you & ask do you need help. This men are working in groups & are only up to know good. There is police situated in the square that you can make these men known to. Overall definitely worth checking out.
Amazing architectural place. The old air this city has makes you feel like you're living in the medieval times, with all the well-preserved buildings, streets and very, very nice local people.

Wonderful Late Christmas Experience. Christmas markets were still open in January (first few days) so the Old Town Square was still beautifully decorated with Christmas decorations, markets and a huge tree. Great place to get some street food (I liked Trdelník, a sweet pastry) and some mulled wine.

This is what you come for, very pleasant save for the maddening crowds.. This is what you come for however, the tons of people make sight seeing a bit difficult. Food places have higher prices then out of the area. (Like in Venice)
Good. A great area full of life different activities on road music,pubs,cafe & eateries.Tourists flowing on road,Horse carts,cycle rickshaws,vintage cars
Wonderful area. Really lovely area, loads of things to see and do. Many areas to walk through and plenty of restaurants and drinks stops
Wonderful. The busiest place in the city full of restaurants Caffè and the street where the designer stores is close by it is nice to spend a day or half day walking around specially in the evening

Great Central Gathering Place. It's a very festive place with street musicians and vendors. There are multiple restaurants with patio seating. Of course, there's a clock tower and tons of shopping. It's definitely more interesting there at night.

Amazing. Not really much to say about this. If you're visiting Prague, then obviously you'll be checking out the Old Town area, and you'll see for yourself how just absolutely incredible it is. Definitely the most beautiful city in Europe.

toooooo much tourists. If you like lots of people watching as the astrological clock shows its show, you should go there. I was not that interesting. You really should prepare in advance to get to know Prague better!
Intresting. Its on very prime location and very beautiful i visited there with my friend i am happy to see that old buildings

Quite an amazing collection of buildings, churches, restaurants, street performers. In early June, this place was really hopping. There are MANY nooks and crannies to explore. It is more than a bit confusing, though, become some buildings and entrances are masked by other layers of buildings. The huge church, for example, has to be entered from a corridor between restaurants in the white buildings that now stand in front of the church. The fantastic clock is on the side of the town hall, not facing the square. We went to this square repeatedly, and had fun each time. Lots of food choices, too, including tasty kiosks offering home-smoked ham and sausages.
Old town Square. Lots to see and do here. Clock is a must to check out on the hour. Lots of lovely bars and restaurants in the square but can be a bit pricey Look out for Pick pockets!
Very nice place to visit. Very nice place to visit for different travel experience on leisure and on business. Fantastic for a romantic week end
Major tourist attraction. the place is bustling with tourists. The astronomical clock, the town square, the buildings and most of all the ambiance just make Prague a great place to be in.

Old town square. It is absolutely worth going, and of course that's where most of the tourists are located if you are visiting Prague. The astronomy clock is located here, get a ticket to go up there and you can see it up high. Also there's an art gallery for Dali and Andy Warhol. Overall it's a place worth a visit!

All you have to do is just show up!. We were rushing around the city for our one day in Prague, but we stopped in the old town square for a minute and took it all in. Beautifully place! I regret not having the time to explore more so if you have got the time do a free walking tour. The guides stand around in the square with umbrellas so they are easy to find.You can also find out how to join bus, segway, and other historical tours from the company reps who stand in the square ready to assist you.

Spectacular buildings. Awesome is a really good way to describe this square. My husband and myself sat for over an hour just looking at all the buildings. We absolutely loved the paintings on the buildings and the statue in the middle. A must see in Prague.
very charming. Absolutely beautiful. One place is more beautiful than the next. Breathtaking scenery for pictures. Very romantic, yet filled with energy.

Such a bustling, beautiful square.. The old town offers thousands of photo opportunities of beautiful buildings. There are your typical tourist traps, restaurants, souvenir shops and cobbled streets. But the streets and buildings are really somethings else!!

Great experience, enjoyed the atmosphere!!!!. Old Town in Prague is a fascinating place. The sights and sounds are clearly old world Europe, and you can see all the things you want, from street vendors and performers, to all kinds of tourists. Watch out for the pickpockets, the appear to be everywhere, but it is really not that hard to protect your valuables. Go, enjoy some coffee at a sidewalk cafe, and remember you are in an old city, with loads of charm.

A beautiful place to while away a few hours. What a gem of history, a beautiful huge square in the old town, with lots of (expensive) places to sit and drink, eat, take in the atmosphere, watch the world go by. (We never did find the way into the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn! Any clues anyone?). The views from the top of the tower containg the Astronomical Clock are wonderful.

Great!. Great choice for a half term break in May/June. Lovely by day and by night. Street entertainers and horse drawn carriages add to the lovely atmosphere the fantastic buildings give to the Old Town.Plenty of restaurants to choose from and spoilt for choice for classical concert venues. Will definitely come back with the family
Our holiday. Beautiful place to sight sea with very friendly locals and the sights around are too beautiful for words to describe.

Best views of Prague from the Tower on the Square. Beautiful old square. Better to go earlier in the day. It gets very busy later. Good to get a feel of the old city, despite all the shops and restaurants targeting tourists. The square is a good place to use as a starting point to walk to other main sites and restaurants. The Tower behind the Astronomical Clock is definitely worth a visit. There is a tour which takes you into the tower, from where one can see the inner workings of the Astronomical Clock. The best views of Prague can be found from within the Tower.
Nice place. Very beautiful place where the pragues authentic church ate situated restaurants and some shopping stores are on the place , you can't pass by prague without passing by here

A very youthful place. Aside from the many stores selling crystal, garnet, teeshirts, and all of the junk made in china, and available at any tourist destination on the planet, the architecture itself is enough to bring you back. Did i say that beer is less expensive than water!

Beautiful, interesting part of the city. Much prefer the traditional Old Town area of Prague to the modern side. Beautiful architecture, great restaurants especially in the side streets, and lots to see and do around the Old Town.

Beautiful architecture, pedestrian friendly. Staro Mesto was everything the photos show and more. Easy pedestrian walkways, grand baroque, renaissance, and gothic architecture abound. Small alleyways and passages are a delight to follow. Lots of great eateries and outdoor cafes.

Simply stunning. . Without a doubt this will be one tourist site that you visit on any holiday to Prague. Be it day or night this place is always bouncing but with the amazing architecture and its plethora of pubs, bars and restaurants it's no wonder that it is a major tourist destination. I have been going to Prague for over 20 years and this square is still magical to me.Go at night and it's a fairytale setting as all of the buildings are illuminated. Walking around the many winding streets in and around the Old Town you will encounter English,Irish,Mexican,American,German in fact every type of pubs,bars and restaurants and all cuisine types,it is that good.This is Pragues most photographed area and is also the most popular and with the big tourist crowds come the usual criminal element such as pickpockets,fraudsters and the like so take sensible precautions but that said Prague is a really safe city and crime is at a minimum. A great area to visit and well worth checking out.
Full of life and beauty. From the amazingly beautiful buildings to the street entertainers and horse drawn carriages it is a great spot to watch the splendour of the square

Great place to walk around and take in the sites!. Just walk around, lots to see, large number of sidewalk cafés and stores; high priced all the way to little tourist gift shops. Take a tour first though as good to know what some of the places are. 3 hour Naked tour really good but also many free tours from the main square are available

Astronomical Clock. Old Town Square is a big tourist attraction. Big crowds. The Astronomical Clock and Tower are the important attractions. With the Clock, the 12 Apostles put on a good show, at the top of the hour.

So many beautiful buildings you'll get a sore neck!. Building after building with such detailing it's like a Disney movie. There are restaurants, little shops, bars. It does get busy but you expect that. Plenty of places to try the Czech chimney cake. The shops are a little repetitive, but I guess you get that in any tourist main street the world over. There are little cobbles side streets with more shops , little museum and attractions dotted here and there, the black light theatre, galleries, museum of medieval torture! Sex machines museum! It's all within walking distance. Easy to get round, be aware that there are very few benches around, so you'll need to go to a cafe, restaurant or bar if you want to sit down :)

Very pretty. I think it would be hard visiting Prague without finding yourself in Old Town at some point whether it be to have a meal, see some street performers or on your way through to Charles Bridge or even if you decide to trek to Prague Castle on foot. It is a beautiful square that is buzzing with character and people. The streets leading up to and around it are gorgeous to walk around to soak up the beauty of Prague.

Great . Wonderful place so pretty we are having a wonderful time and the food and beer are excellent also lots of interesting history our 15 year old son even thinks it is one of the most interesting places he has visited
Really nice! . At the Old Town we were able to experience different games, bubbles which the children liked very much , local singing and dance, old clock, and souvenir shopping .

A real-life fairytale. the old town square was where we ended up spending most of our time. we kept returning, as it was so beautiful. the astronomical clock is worth watching, as crowds gather every hour to view the chiming of this very early clock, but the entire square was completely beautiful, I'm excited to go back again as soon as i can- it's somewhere i could live my whole life quite happily.
Amazing. Very busy there's lots to do and see there very much worth a look around the area. There's less people about the early you go
Day out. Lovely place to visit, and a very busy place all round. sometimes can be relaxing as well a bit more expensive than other places but that's what's expected...
Jan Necekal. Stare mesto is wonderfull with beautfull and slilm streets. Interesting place is Ungelt, close to Old Town squere.
Astonishing place. Just can't say a word about the place... you gotta go and experience it! Summer or winter you can find good food, nice people and marvelous beer by the square.
very nice..... a bit disappointing seeing all the beggars and homeless people...but the history, attractions and value for money is great in regards to meals and souvenirs
Nice place. Beautiful and nice place. Many beautiful and old buildings. Really nice walk around the old town. :)

A must to visit. Prague s a city that reflects many other cities in the world. So much to see and an interesting structure as you turn each corner. We only had three days there but could easily have spent many more. People are friendly and try their best to overcome the language barriers. Just make sure you wear trainers or flat shoes as it is not easy walking on all the cobblestone streets.

People, people.... Old town is a "must place" in Prague. It´s of course old, big - and in someway beautiful. And there is always happening everything: you can hear music, see artists and so on. But there is too many people - tourists - wandering around. Restaurants are expensive and food almost poor.
Retro. The old town is well preserved. Walking through the streets give retro feelings. The structures are large and very beautiful.
The most photogenic city in Europe. Filled with tourist, but such a beautiful city. The Old town is stunning so many unique buildings and sights.

Central part of a visit to Prague. Very historical and superb architecture. Take the time to go up to the top of the clock tower the views are best from there. Plenty of places to eat, shop and just enjoyable to walk around. Be sure to visit after dark as well.

Historic, gothic and a must see. We really enjoyed our time in Prague, especially around the old town. The architecture of the surrounding buildings is amazing and I really wish we did a guided tour of the old town to get a better understanding of the history. It is a very busy location with hoards of people, bikes and segways. Many places to eat and drink but from what we saw, the prices are very inflated. If having a drink or an ice team then this is a perfect place to people watch.
Beautiful . The old town of Prague is simply stunning and true reflection of its culture through its traditional architecture and houses. A must do !

Interesting architecture. No matter where you walk there are interesting old buildings with intricate stone work. Windy streets and cobble stone roads and footpaths mean shoes are much better than flip-flops. Well worth the time. Best to find food a block away from the tourist areas - save a small fortune.
Time Warp. You can spend hours walking and relaxing ; time stands still with amazing beuty and old time splendour

Heart of Prague,. Everything begins from here. Prague is full of art and details on every corner. From a bell, to a sculpture on a facade, from building doors to the handles. Everyting is ART and Culture

Always something a buzzing in the square . You can sit here for hours and enjoy watching the people go by, the performers, families, friends meeting, lots of restaurants and shops as well as many tourist "musts" all within a few metres.
Nice Bustling square. A very popular place to visit, it has entertainers such as musicians, singers and impressionists, has pubs and restaurants and a few gift shops.

Quaint and fun to wander through. We enjoyed staying near the Old Town and wandering through to see all the activity. Many cafes, a bit pricy but fun to sit down at one with a glass of wine of beer and just watch the activity.
Must see place in Prague. Standard attraction to see. Square is fool of people from morning to late night. Be careful with your belongings!

beautiful historic sites. So much to like about Prague, especially the old historic part of the city. It's what everyone pictures in their mind about old Europe--cobblestone pavement, winding streets, beautiful roofs with picturesque spires. Plenty to see with shops, restaurants, and historic buildings; and it is safe and clean. We were warned to watch out for pickpockets, but we didn't have any problems, not did we observe any. (Though watch out for being charged the wrong amount in shops/restaurants or being short-changed--we did experience that. And apparently the taxis can be crooked at times too.) You can drink the tap water, but the beer in restaurants is even cheaper than bottled water, so that was our drink of choice. It feels lively, with plenty of people around--mostly tourists probably, but still it's fun. You hear many different languages in the streets. Be sure to have a map, because it's easy to get lost in the old part of the city. But on the other hand, don't be afraid to venture off the main streets, because there are lots of little shops and restaurants hidden away.

Stunning, what a great place at which to spend a day. Great architecture and history, fab vibes. Spend at least a day here and explore the side streets. Obviously you need to look out for people trying to rip you off, but that is just common sense. Also, for a Londoner, prices were very affordable

Great photo opp!. Go to take photos, stay to people watch, leave when you're hungry. In the past six years this area has experienced terrible price hikes. I would never eat or even drink coffee at the square!
Watch the world go by!. Great to just sit and watch world go by over a drink or coffee - and the street entertainers are good fun!

weekend with friends. The Old Town Square is a lovely area to visit. Be there at midday and you will see the special chime of the clock. There are plenty of restaurants and bars for you to relax and watch the world go by.
Historic and beautiful. Beautiful Old part of the Prague with a lot of monuments and interesting architecture, simply must see if you are visiting Prague.

Stunning. I have fallen in love with Prague. It's the most beautiful city I hv come across. Old Town square is the main activity area. The hustle bustle starts early in the morning and continues till wee hours at night. It has a lot of eateries around one Is spoilt of choice. Lots of individual performances keep happening throughout the day. Lot of tours start from here. The historic astronomical clock is also here.
Enchanter and cozy!!!!!!!. City not to lose a visit, history, food, beauty, hotels for any budget. Lovely and delightful. Shops. And mainly cosy people.

Walked around Old Town and loved every minute. Most beautiful city in the World. . Walked around Old Town and loved every minute. Most beautiful city in the World. The buildings are gorgeous. Try The Lippert restaurant for traditional Czech food.

MAGICAL AREA. We have traveled all over Europe and this is one of the best old towns we have been to. The Old Town Square is the center piece of Prague. The buildings that surround this square are 600-700 years old and are dominated by the Old Town Hall Tower (great view over the city), the Astronomical Clock (a major tourist photo opportunity), Church of Our Lady Before Tyn and St Nicholas Church. There are also large numbers of restaurants and shops that encircle the square. While we were there, Prague was having a music festival so we were also able to view and listen to the folk music and dancing from our room at the Grand Hotel Praha which was directly across from the Astronomical Clock and with a clear view of the stage and parade area. The parade consisted of over a hundred costumed musicians and dancers from all over the Czech Republic, surrounding countries, Mexico (a mariachi band) and even a large contingent representing Vietnam. This square is also where you can get a "free" 3 hour walking tour of the city (you pay what you feel the tour was worth). I highly recommend that when visiting Prague, you stay in or around the Old Town Square. The rest of Old Town is equally fantastic as you can go down almost any side street and find restaurants, shops and historic architecture. Visit the many small markets and outstanding churches. Allow yourself plenty of time to just relax and take it all in. We were in Prague for 4 days and could easily spent another day or two exploring.
City break. Great place, a must see, so much to see and do, reminds me of Disney land at night ,just gives you that feeling, great food at all the places we went to.
Gorgeous. Now I know why people rave about Prague. It certainly is exceptionally beautiful. We were there in the evening and it was quite crowded.

Old town. a very cleen and nice town with good athmosfhere. So many thing to see, you need a long tim eto see it all. Very nice streets with many small nice shops. Very friendy restaurants, and exellent food.

Pretty Square. The Old Town Square, is surely one of the prettiest places to be .... Beautiful buildings set around a cobblestone square.Street entertainers and musicians abound.Horse drawn carriages line up giving tourists rides around the back streets, there are numerous bars and fine restaurants.Especially pretty when lite up at night.Whether just for a walk, or a drink, the atmosphere is lovely ..... As usual though keep an eye out for the pickpockets etc!

Quaint. Visiting here was just very interesting and enjoyable. There is so much to see. You also have loads of eating places and prices are mot high. We really enjoyed the sites and different types of architecture.
Beautiful architecture. All of Old Town Prague is a beautiful place, the architecture is stunning. Bridges, cobblestone streets, churches, the opera house are all well worth the visit.
Good walk for a half day. Great view from the castle, great walk in historical area, a lot of interesting shops will get your intention and entertain you.
Just beautiful. My words wouldn't do it justice, so I won't try. There is a lot to see and fall in love with. Recommend a tour if it's a fleeting visit

Beautiful and historic. The old town is beautiful full of shops, cathedrals and the jewish area. Unlike other mid-European cities, Pragues old synagogs were preserved even through the holocaust, so that alone is worth seeing!There are a multitude of free walking tours available, which are a great starting point to exploring te city. They really help you to find your bearings.Be noted that along the old and new city centres the stores and restaurants are about 4 times more expensive than other places. So try walking a few blocks from the square to eat.Also, be very careful of pickpockets!! They are good at what they do!
Beautiful. It is really a beautiful old town, with lots of shopping and beautiful old buildings. Be prepared for crowds, but take some of the side streets, you can avoid them.

Beautiful historical square. This is an essential place to visit when in Prague. People gather around the astrological clock every hour to watch the chimes and climb the tower.
There is lot of music and entertainers throughout the day and lots of nice restaurants to sit and have a drink and people watch.

Awesome!!. Love this place!!! It vibrates with rhythm, all around you can hear music coming from all places! . From piano, violin, saxo, violoncello, percussion and so on. It's full of tourists day and night, stores are open till 11pm. Astronomical clock is set to open it's "Windows" on the hour where big crowds meet for a minute or so! Love this place!!!!

Go not during the peak hours!. Awesome old town square. Can walk around exploring the old structures and the churches. Take time off and go and I would suggest avoid going during evening time, as its crowded with visitors!

One of the very best parts of Prague!. Standing in the middle of Old Town transports you back centuries! You are REALLY in Europe - not just standing in some large European cosmopolitan city that looks like every other large city. There is so much rich history - make sure you take a tour and learn. Save an entire day (or three!) for sight-seeing (churches, museums, galleries) and have fun shopping.Wear good walking shoes for the cobblestone streets, and enjoy the great cafes and restaurants. Make sure you see the astronomical clock on the hour, and don't hurt your neck constantly staring up at the amazing buildings.
Interesting buildings, allt the time heaps of people.. Very busy on “whole hours” as the astronomical clock came to action…many fascinating buildings full of history
beautiful. the old town is the best part of prague, you could walk here all day and i loved walking in these streets in the evening.

Beaver Scout break. Spent alot of time here. It does get mega busy but nothing we couldn't handle. Loads to see and do. The clock watching does only last 15 seconds but it's fun! We went back at 5am but it didn't do the same thing another church helped us navigate around the square. Never went the same way more than twice, so much to see.

Beautiful Preserved Architecture. Prauge was not destroyed like so many other cities in Europe during WW II, resulting in the preservation of various architectural styles, built over a span of 600+ years. The Old Town area is stunning.
Old but gold. Tiny streets and corners with old Charm! Many people from different countries. U can have great impression about the history of Prague while Walking through the old town.
Beautiful. Some many beautiful buildings, quite breathtaking .... lovely to stroll around and some many places to visit
Superb. The Old Town is lively and vibrant, and such a delight to walk around. This so, despite a whole lot of tourists.

Touristy. This place is full of tourists - good restaurants and one can just spend hours sitting there. This is a starting point for many tours...we tok a segway tour form here. Also the nuclear bunker tour.

Beautiful city. Prague is undeniably a beautiful city, but the crowds of tourists during the day may be a little annoying. Try to take a walk in the Old Town during the night and you will see a whole different city!
Old Town. Best to explore on foot. Wear comfortable shoes, carry an umbrella or raincoat and be ready to be amazed. Must try their local cuisines especially their pork knuckles.
Lots to see and do - a must visit in Prague. Fab square with lots of activity and great for people watching. Check out the Astronomical Clock if you go!

Beautiful but crowded. Huge crowds on the main square, especially every hour for the clock. Have a look from the tower terrace on the square : beautifull and inexpensive. Restaurants are average, expensive and busy. Try somewhere else.

Very unique old town with great architecture. The buildings around the Old Town are all unique in their style. I recommend going to see the astronomical clock (a must see) close to an o'clock time so that you can see the "show" of the little figures in the clock when the clock strikes at a round hour :)
Surrounded by lovely old buildings. An interesting area which is worth the visit. There are many shops to poke around in and they are more 'local' than the large stores found in any city world wide.

Very busy. Of course, when you visit Prague, you visit this place. You have to pay an fee to see it. It is very crowded and small and narrow. No problem, it was build like that. But to crowded for me to be honest.

Busy yet retains its charm. Always something going on here! Really traditional feel to it, gets very busy on the hour due to the astronomical clock but nothing unbearable, we went many times during our stay in Prague!

Old Town. This is the first city break that I have undertaken in the summer in quite a long time. I think we grossly underestimated the sheer volume of tourists. It was insane, so so busy. Old town has so many streets and avenues sprawling off from one another, a friend of mine said that next time we do a city break we should pay for a walking tour. I've never tried it but he said for day one basic navigation they are second to none. Maybe next time! The old town square has the astronomical clock - the third ever to be built and the oldest to still work. There are street artists and segways everywhere. Food in the area is more pricey. A beautiful old town square as I have become accustomed to in Europe.
Wonderful Teyn Church. When you visit the Old Town Square you og back in time. In the middle of all is the wonderful gothic Teyn Church.
A Must See. Walk the old cobblestone streets and take in all the sights and smells. Wear comfortable shoes. Stop in one of the many restaurants for an ice cold beer.
Just stunning. A must if you are in Prague. Just jaw dropping and full of character. Get there early if you want to miss the crowds.
Beautiful area. A must see area, just beautiful in the day and in the night. We had a wonderful lunch in the restaurant in the middle of the plaza.

Worth several days walking tour. I really enjoy just walking through all the areas of the Old Town. It is a unique and beautiful city with a combination of small shops and the big expensive chain stores. There is also the Jewish quarter to see. We spent 4 days here and enjoyed each one. It is definitely set up for tourists and there are lots of opportunities to separate you from you money :). Do not worry about food - there are a zillion restaurants available.

Lively at night. The square was very crowded and a large crowd had gathered to watch a couple of street performers with flaming batons. The buildings were impressive as they were illuminated. We returned the following day and saw the Jan Hus Memorial [Jan was part of the protestant reformation.]

Free Prague old town tour . Great tour of the old town with Tatiana. Very knowledgeable guide with lots of historical tidbits. Fast paced and covers a lot of ground, but there's a break midway. Excellent introduction to a fascinating place.
Amazing Prague. Its our second time here. It always amazes us. The whole square is full of centuries old building, statues and monuments.

Lovely Square. Our hotel was close by so finished up walking through the square most days. Good selection of restaurants around the square and street performers come and go during the day and evening. Very photogenic
so quaint and beautiful. it was so easy to walk around and the architecture was breadth taking. lots of lovely cafes and food available. The bridge was stunning with vendors selling little artefacts

Beautiful . Of all of Prague the old town has to be my favourite part. Winding through all the old streets with the mix of people all smells and site's are truly something else. We walked miles and saw something different everytime. Its definitely a place to keep returning to see the whole thing.
Great place for people watching. Enjoy a pilsner at one of the restaurants in town square and take in the atmosphere, enjoy the buskers and people watch.

Wonderful architecture. Such a romantic town, relaxed even though it is busy. A pleasure to wander through such historic buildings..the weather was perfect for us. Cobblestones are a bit tricky to walk on in high heels but we were amazed to see young girls doing it with out breaking their legs.Crowded around the clock on the hour and watch your belongings at this time..pickpockets can be a problem. We had no problems but did notice signs everywhere.If using the trans, which are very cheap,make sure you get your ticket validated correctly. The thin line needs to go into the machine, if an inspector checks and its not validated correctly, there us a 800 cks immediate fine or 1500 if you cannot pay at the time. It seems this is an extra fund raiser for the government. Tickets cost 24 cks fir a 30 min fare, 90 mins for a little mire and if you are in Prague fir longer it us much cheaper to buy a weekly ticket for 690ckz.
A must see in Prague!. You cannot visit Prague without visiting the Old Town. Make sure to take a free walking tour to understand the history behind this beautiful square.

Just like OZ without the witch and wizard.. The Stare Mesto, or old town is the true charm of Prague. With the medieval towers and churches, the spires are calling out for witches on broomsticks to write "Surrender Dorothy" in the sky. Where the clock strikes, the figures twirl at the top of the old clock and then the golden bird crows. The cafes are a great spot to watch it, but you will probably need to stand to see over the crowd that gathers each hour. Try breakfast in the square for a more intimate experience.
