Awesome, loved it there. I got a two day ticket on Hop On Hop Off Red bus and also a river cruise. Then got off where I wanted to spend more time.
good place to explore. good pace to start your trip with eateries and stalls as well as the astronomical clock and beautiful churches
Historical. Many beautiful buildings, history, shops and alleys . The most amazing is the famous astronomical clock who i am sure nobody could missed.

Nice, apart from the Segways. Lovely old town square, but the constant hassle from people whizzing around on segways really gets annoying after a while. We got asked over 10 times in the space of an hour. Plus the speed they whizz around is dangerous. Its a pity Prague authorities dont ban them from the square. Apart from that, very nice place, make sure you go up the old clock tower.
Beautiful!. Enjoy horse ride, get segway tours, and drink hot wine in winters. Preferable time to go is evening.

Beautiful but.... The Old Town is so beautiful but it impossible to enjoy because the masses of people. I wish I had gone very early in the morning or later in the evening when I could have appreciated the sites without getting bumped into and almost run over by segways! I was there over a weekend so that probably added to the numbers of people. I just was not expecting that!

Beautiful architecture. Nice and busy atmosphere and has the famous astronomical clock at the square, which was nice to look at. Been to the square several times and recommend to go before 9 am if you want to avoid the crowd.The Jewish quarter is nearby, which is a great area to walk through to appreciate the beautiful synagogues museum. Recommend to visit the Spanish and the Old-New synagogues.

Wonderful Area. Old town is full of beautiful buildings, history, and shops. You will walk till you drop!. Ladies, do wear sensible shoes. I gave out about 7 band-aids to gals with "cute" sandals and blisters! The streets are all cobble stones and the hoards of people can make walking a bit challenging at times, not to mention avoiding the segue riders, tour groups and sales people. Get a guide book and do your own walking tour. If not you can tour by train, bus, horse, segue or vintage car...there are no shortage of tours! A guide book helps or you will wander from the Jewish Quarter to Little Town and not even know it. Charm abounds!
Great picturesque town!. This place is amazing all the buildings and streets are so beautiful, specially the famous astronomical clock.
Lovely place for a walk and Lunch!. We were here during the summer and the weather was just perfect to walk around and then enjoy a wholesome lunch sitting outside in the sun! Must visit.
Lively. Wonderful square, full of life and wonderful restaurants . The astronomical clock is beautiful and a must for all visitors, especially on the hour
Wonderful buildings. When you are in Prague, you surely have to visit this place. Guards are standing at the entrance, but you can walk in to the nice place between the buildings and the church.

A unique Old Town with impressive features and architecture.. Prague has definitely enchanting places to visit. One of these places and one must not miss is the so called Stare Mesto (Old Town) square.

Lots of beautiful architecture. So many beautiful buildings to take in, history to absorb and wonderful shops to enjoy. Allow yourself at least a day to enjoy and take a sightseeing tour if you can as there is so much to be told about the area.

a bit disappointing. way too many people, unless you go late at night, but then there are a lot of shady people hawking goods or services. yes it's old, but not very towny. overall a big letdown. oh, there's a big clock if you can push past the crowds

Old Town. Visit here in early June. it is truly a very charming setting, but it is full of tourist because of that reason. I would suggest visiting at twilight or in the evening because it isn't quite as crowded and the lighting on the old building is wonderful. Watch out for the Segway cowboys during the day! Not a real big problem, but occasionally crossed my path and had to dodge a few more aggressive operators. But all in all I just love this place with its charming buildings and cobblestone streets....and sitting at one of the cafes enjoying a nice meal and beverage watching the people go by.
Beautiful architecture. Northern Hikes tours took me on a guided tour of Prague's old town they were amazing, knowledgeable and professional, it was beautiful

The place to be!. This is literally the center of the city where you will find several church buildings and monuments. Very picturesque at all times during the day. You will find all sorts of cafes, restaurants and pubs here. You will almost certainly past through here to get to the Charles bridge. Great area to people watch!

Must see!. A truly magical place, ESPECIALLY recommended to see at night when there are few tourists around! In the soft lantern light and all shops closed, you really feel like you travelled back in time.
Something for everyone. Lots to see for everyone, lots to shop, lots of people. Nice restaurants in every price range. Excellent food, nice bars.

Beautiful. The old town is absolutely beautiful. The astronomical clock is worth a visit and walking around this part of the city is extremely cool. Don't eat near the square or clock, restaurants are busy and overpriced! Other restaurants are close by for way cheaper and more reasonable service.

nice historic city. The big advantage of the city center of Prague is that nearly every street is a pedestrian zone. I definitely liked the shopping possibilities with the combination of historic sightseeing.
Great city space. Great place with amazing views and wonderful place to sit and people-watch and eat and enjoy the sights and sounds of artists and other performers.
Best square. You have to pay the old town square a visit. There's lots of bars restaurants here with plenty of going on. A really nice place to go. A must on your visit

The center of the action in Prague. Well this IS where all the action is. We stayed in Old Town - I recommend the Arcadia Residence. It's crowded, noisy, touristy and FULL of the places you'll want to visit, the must see locations, and much more. Make sure you visit some of the outlying areas too but this will be the place you start your visit to Prague.
Great views.... The views from the top of the tower are very interesting and it was a great way to kick off our week's holiday to see how the town lies. I took loads of photos from there.

A million shops--beware of gimmicks and hucksters . This area can be charming, but it feels a bit like a blend of carnival and Times Square. It is safe for families, but the sales staff are aggressive and the wares are cheap and not high quality.
A Must See. With great street performers and food all around.. restaraunts in this area are more pricey but well worth it for a good view of the clock tower while you have an amazing local beer.

Lovely place. The Old Town was one of the highlights of my trip. The architecture is stunningIt is very crowded and busy, especially as there was a festival. There were many tourists during the day and night on segways. It is a close walk to other attractions as such as the Charles Bridge and Wenceslas Square.

One of the most beautiful old towns of Europe. Prague is one of my favorite cities , gorgeous buildings, magnificent churches, beautiful history. This is also a place full of romantic spots, wonderful restaurants, boats ride and beautiful parks.It is a clean and well preserved city, a pleasure to walk all over in a safe environment. Many historical places to visit.

very pretty and very busy but adds to the atmosphere!. Definitely worth a visit. Its bustling with lots of places to eat and drink. Great architecture. Prices are a bit higher here but it is a tourist attraction. Lots of guided tours going on.

Old Town is a feast for the eyes!!. The Old Town of Prague is one of my best trips yet!! I visited for the first time this June and I can't wait to go back. Every building is so colourful, ornate and different and I could easily have stayed another week and not visited all there is to see.

Beautiful. Beautiful City. If you like architecture and historical buildings then Prague is the place to visit. The Charles bridge is fabulous, with interesting statues all the way across. Mulled wine sold in the streets was a warm welcome and delicious, Although people begging throughout the city brought you back to earth. They beg in a different way, On their knees with their hands out over their head. Not making eye contact, even when money dropped into cup. Heartbreaking. I spent the last night popping money into cups all along the road. So SAD!

People-watching was fascinating here. WE wandered around the Old Town section pr Prague and, while we enjoyed the churches and shops, the people watching was amazing Street performers were very entertaining and just seeing a varied crowd was fun. I liked the big clock when I struck the hour - but somehow I thought it would do more. Kept waiting for the rest of the show ;-]
Beautiful Architecture. A wonderful vibrant city full of new and old buildings an eclectic collection of styles over the centuries well worth a visit. Very friendly people and something for everyone.
Lots to see. Great architecture! A bit crowded though. Lots of steps to climb to go up the tower. Might not suit everyone

Prague vacation. Old town Prague was a beautiful place to visit. We stayed in a near by hotel and wrre able to walk and see all the sights the area had to offer. We walked the St. Charles Bridge and to the Castle. Went to many of the old churches and did much shopping.

One of the most charming place in the world. It's been my 3rd visit to Prague. I love this city. And the best is roam it's narrow streets in Old Town. Don't forget to try a Strudelnik, it's a flavour festival in your mouth. Really, really don't think it twice. Visit Prague
Beautiful place. Beautiful place , great architecture! Plenty of pubs , restaurants for relaxing and enjoying the view of the church and attractions
Nice for a walk around. Gets a bit crowded but nice for a walk around and viewing the clock tower. Very close to Charles Bridge

a beautiful part of the city, can get very busy. Go here early in the morning or later in the evening to avoid the crowds. Gets very busy with visitors watching the astronomical clock. Restaurants in this area are more expensive than other areas but it's lovely to sit and watch the views with a hot wine or large beer!

Fantastic. Prague Old Town is really nothing like anything else. It is absolutely stunning. We only spent four days in this great city and we were gobsmacked at all the beauty. Prague is really unique. The Old Town is the jewel in the crown. The architecture, the buildings, the rooftops, the lovely streets, the river, the amazing bridges, the restaurants, the cafes, the shops of all kinds and descriptions, are all simply brilliant. One example in the Old Town square is the Old Clock which is hard to describe, but it is made of two different types of 'clock', and you simply have to see it to truly appreciate it. Thousands of visitors just stop and prepare to watch as the time arrives for the special clock presentation every hour on the hour. Oh, we cannot wait to revisit this city in the near future.

Stare Mesto. What a surprise to walk into this magnificent square and be part of times gone by. The buildings and enthusiasm of the visitors was contagious. So many photo opportunities set off by the beautiful buildings. Have great memories from the visit.

Very nice area. Old town sq. is one of the most beautiful squer in central Europe. Lot of tourists, lot of monuments, ale buildings are historical and in good condition. I would recommend visit view tower here. It s wonerful view from there.
Fairy tale Super Beauty and scary at the same time. You feel like the old Dracula Disney cartoons when you are there at night. during the day is also magnificent, a must see in Europe..

Beautiful!. As everyone seems to agree, Prague's old town is very charming and we enjoyed our visit. There are cobblestone streets & sidewalks everywhere that hurt my feet. It is a walkable city just hard on your feet.
Must see when in Prague. The old town area the castle and the Charles bridge are the main sites in Prague. Quaint little city. Doesn't take a long time to get the feel and see the main areas.
Good stroll in the Old Town. Had a very good impression of the Old Town, light clothes and comfortable shoes, we enjoyed the afternoon in this beautiful and well signalized historic site. ☺️

Great Architecture and Yummy Treats!. Old town is really fun with its twisty turny streets. And the buildings are really beautiful - but beware it is a crowded touristy spot filled with souvineer stores and ice cream stands. Don't forget to eat the kiurtosh A Czcheck pastry roll baked on a wooden stick and then filled with fruit, cinnamon sugar and or ice cream.
Beautiful! Crowded!. The square is beautiful! You have to stay and watch the astonomical clock do its thing (every hour, on time). Beware of pick pockets, watch your stuf.

Great . Prague is such a beautiful place, this part is really busy and always full of tourist which is nice to see. The architecture is amazing and simply beautiful. There are loads of restaurants and buildings to see. Recommend for people to come here.
Amazing. This part of Prague is absolutely stunning with so much to take in a very interesting area to visit friends or couples

Very nice town. Almost one of the most beautiful i've seen in Europe. Very Nice City.
Prague is a must to be seen (as are Paris and Rome).
The old city is wonderfull.
Try to book an hotel not far away from the city as you cab walk for hours and hours and really be impressed on each street corner by the beauty and the harmony of the buildings.
Loved it!. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. In the old town square. Just amazing, like from a Cinderella fairy tail.

worth a look. This is in the Old town opposite the astronomical clock, so you can't miss it. I down graded it because of the front doesn't match and spoils the look. Sadly my mobility scooter wouldn't go up the step so I didn't go in. The architecture is beautiful and a great photo op.

Come for clock, stay all night!. My favorite spot in the city. The clock is the attraction. The later the hour, the more people cheer! Was in square at noon on Sunday. The chimes and church bells were magnificent. Lots of food, drink, shops, activities. Be sure to wander down side streets!

Scary :). Yes. Gothic architecture will make you think about history of Prague. I highly recommend to get a guide. There you'll get free guide as well. You can optionally pay them tips if you like it.

Amazing . Very nice and historical.
unique atmosphere.
Very busy place.
We walk for 12 hours with breaks for beer and meal. Still haven't seen everything.
Must see.

Rent a bike and easy move around. Rent a bike for a day and move around with your friends. This is the best way to explore the old town and also a bigger part of Prague. It's not difficult on a bike, just follow the flow.
strolling Old Town. So many beautiful old buildings and quaint alleys to explore with great pastry shops here and there. Too many for the waistline.

Tons of things to do. The Old Town neighborhood is simply beautiful. There's no limit to what you can do here - you can go shopping, you can get food (specifically Chimneys - fried dough with sugar, cinnamon, nuts and anything else you want), see museums and other sights and more! I would really recommend going to the Charles Bridge, seeing a short concert at the Clementinum, visiting the Jewish Quarter, and going to the Old Town Square to see the Astronomical Clock!

A must see in Prague. Many cities have old town-parts that are just stunningly beautiful and full of architecture that is unlike everything else. Prague's old town is a must visit for every tourist wanting the see the city. You can get to the square by walking, the metro, trams or taxi. There is also taxis waiting at the square if you need to get to a place quickly. Around the square there are shops, restaurants and stalls that serves various local - and not so local - quesine. Like the Czech smoked ham. I would recommend sitting down at a restaurant and watch as life unfolds.
Stunning architecture.. Beautiful buildings and a working astronomical clock attracted many tourists..guides speaking all languages in the square to answer any questions.
This is where it is. Nice to see. Many old buildings and restaurants and shops. Yes. It has a Starbucks that has a free restroom. Others charge to use. Don't miss.

Go see the Astronomical Clock. And while you are there - stop in one of the many coffee shops on the square and relax - and maybe even catch the clock twice. The Old town is fantastic - churches and beautiful architecture to admire and wonder over. Naturally it is full of tourists doing the same as you - and I suggest not buying any trinkets here - as you will get them further out for a quarter of the price.

Exciting, steeped in history, Czechs are proud people love their beer and food. The Old town represents the real Czech. Royal legacy, cultured background, warm people, worth being there. The fun is in the air. The castle, the 12 o clock cuckoo and the large clock. Don't feel like leaving it behind.

A typical medieval town. The Old Town has at its heart the Square which began as a Market place. It is full of imposing municipal and church building as well as many cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops.

Lives up to its reputation. The Old Town, and the surrounding streets, are architecturally stunning, and among the most beautiful in Europe. It tends to be crowded, particularly when the market is is session, but one can still move around freely. There are also free performances from time to time; when we were there, there were some charming amateur (e.g. children) acts on the makeshift stage. The surrounding streets are also beautiful to walk down. There are some churches in the area, worth a visit, while the surrounding museums are of lesser quality and can be skipped, unless the exhibits really catch your personal fancy.

Relaxing walking experience.. Enjoy the old town rellaxing walks through the winding streets. Lots of places to visit and enjoy. Belgium chocolate factory/cafe a must see. Astronomical clock is worth the visit. Overall a great couples pllace to visit.

Restaurants, Architecture, Lots to do! . You can eat, shop, see several churches, the Clock, there is so much to do in Old Town you will need more than one day to really see everything it has to offer. Fun in so many ways, but can be very crowded. Evening and early morning are less crowded, but choose one of the several restaurants around the square have a beer, and people watch. That was perfect for a tired feet stop.

Bday 45 . 9th century, Staré Město ... Old town praha!! Fascinated , full of history, spacious marketplace on the bank of Vltava. .... ( which happens since 1100AD ndicate that every Saturday a market was held on the marketplace, and large military gatherings also took place there!According to ancient records, the city had around 13 gates, and a huge moat, providing strong defenses!! Recommendations : take the walk tours .

Must See!. If you want to avoid the crowds, get there early (8am or so). When the bell rings at the top of each hour there will be a HUIGE crowd of people in front tofu the astronomical clock. Be sure to get a sausage and you Must go to the Brewcoff café for FRESH lemonade, great coffee, and amazing pastries/dessert and free WiFi.

Beautiful architecture and atmosphere. The Old Town quarter of Prague is a gem of Art Nouveau architecture. Almost every building is beautifully decorated at doorway level and on every floor and often crowned with statues, domes or turrets. Despite the number of tourists the atmosphere remains welcoming and calm and there are so many excellent restaurants and cafes. Take the time to just wander the lanes and arcades, always looking up to see the beauty of so many buildings.
Lovely . Enjoy a walk through Old Town. Expect a lot of tourists since this one of the main tourism districts. There are a lot of restaurants, bars and things to see.

lovely medival place. i always love exploring the old town of every city. the clobbered stoned pathway, the quaint shops along the alleys, the bustle and live of the people, the restaurants and alfresco-co dinning area never fail to amaze me. the facade of each building is different and one can take a long time admiring these architectural designs. lots of choices for restaurants and of course shopping. it can get too crowded so be careful of your belongs.

Sit, relax and enjoy. The old town square has much to offer from restaurants to shops, dessert and much more. Mostly where walking tours gather around and tell the cities history. Careful with the restaurants in the square which are more expensive and charge more than enough. Things here are mostly more expensive since it's where most tourist have lunch, dinner and other things.
lovely part of prague. street entertainment sometimes beautiful buildings, nice cafes and restaurants, this is where the astonomical clock is

An absolute must see while in Prague!. Old Town is absolutely amazing, the architecture, the atmosphere, the history! Old Town captures the essence of Prague! No visit to Prague would be complete without a visit to Old Town.
Great time touring the city. Beware of pickpockets and conartists that hang around atms asking to change small bills for larger bills.
Must see. This is the heart of all action. So lively and starting point for walking tours , Segway tours.It's a must see. The beauty of this square is amazing

Beautiful old town square . Go early in the morning before the crowds arrive in the summer. The free Starbucks bathroom by the clock was helpful though I had my coffee stolen right off my table when I turned my back to tend my baby in the stroller for a minute. Too bad the thief got a decaf!

Beautiful architechture !. Vibrant busy place full with tourists. The architecture of the buildings is incredible. Must visit if you are in Prague. There are lots of shops as well if you want to do some shopping but may be a little expensive.

Relatively original medieval and gothic townscape. The old town of Prague is a rare experience compared to other European cities. Very little was damaged in the two World Wars and most of the buildings are still in fairly pristine condition. Because of this there are lots of tourists in peak season but it's still a wonderful experience - and quite safe at all hours (except for the pickpockets like everywhere in Europe). Just be sensible. Not to be missed!
Beautiful Prague. Great to meander around the old town to marvel at the architecture, old buildings and closed synagogues that are now used as restaurants and the like.

Beautiful . The weekend we spent in Prague there was a music festival ongoing with a stage set up in the old town square. While it showed a nice liveliness to Prague we never got to see the square as it normally would have been. Beautiful part of town however.

Beautiful town. I seem to be walking past the Astronomical clock everyday on the hour, it gets very busy but is worth the view. There are plenty of great (and cheaper) places to eat and drink off of the square. Avoid the tourist traps. I found the best place to avoid the crowds was the U Prince Terrace Bar amazing view of the clock and square. Make sure you go down all the narrow streets you'll find lots of gems hidden away.

Amazing. The old town square in Prague is beautiful, The architecture is beautiful, the atmosphere is good, very friendly, there are lots of good restaurants surrounding the square and interesting streets running off the square.There are often markets in the square, I have been several times and it is worth Googleing the events in this area, I have been to the famous Easter markets here, and a Tim burton exhibition in the old bell tower, so it's worth doing some research into what's on!

Unmissable. Quite a breathtaking and beautifully kept place. In June there was plenty going on, with street entertainers and, due to the very hot weather, lorries spraying cold water to help tourists keep cool. Many nice restaurants here, the priced reflect the very picturesque location, but seemed no higher than many European City Centers. The old town clock, which I understand has been ticking away for hundreds of years is a highlight as is the Art Exhibition that had works by Warhol.
Kitty Club in Prague. We went there first night we arrived and just loved the buzz and athmosphere and had dinner there while watching the people go by.

Must see spot in Prague . If you are in Prague be sure to check out the Old Square. It is bustling with activity, has a lot of beautiful buildings (as does most of Prague), and if you go in the evening it is a great place to grab an outdoor seating dinner. While you are there swing by and see the clock but I wouldn't recommend waiting around for it to ring because the 30 second show isn't really worth the wait. There are also a lot of tours guides in the square if you want to book something. As an aside if you are looking to book a tour Sandeman's is a great company, you can find them with red umbrellas by the Cartier shop. We went to Kutna Hora with them and would highly recommend them.
Great . Restaurants, hotels, vibrant place to be, beautiful architecture Lots of little souvenir shops to browse and little side streets to meander
Beautiful, Touristy as Expected and Worth a Visit. Very busy at Christmas time. A lovely, pretty and festive place to visit. As expected really and worth a visit.

Nice square. This is a wonderful place to visit, you get to see the old and new Prague at the same time. Prague has done a wonderful job of mixing old and new buildings. The city is one of the few that survived WW2 without damage.
a little gem. I absolutely fell in love with this city. Prague is a wonderful town, full of hidden gems. The old town is full of little streets and beautiful architectures. I completely recommend it.

Busy Place. Astronomical clock - try to time your visit for the hourly "Walk of the Apostle" display. It is awesome.
Take time to visit the Tyn Church and Jan Hus statue which is in the middle of the square.

Amazing . Never fails to impress me. The place us truly amazing and a must see on anyone's list. People are friendly and prices are reasonable. Everything is within walking distance and there is also a very good team and underground system

Old town squre. We stayed just off the old town square
And we found everything we needed close by
We could have spent another week right here discovering all the hidden jems
It's very pretty after the sun sets
Touristy. There are many tourists and shops selling junk to them but take a quiet turn and it is easy to see the old Prague. Well worth the visit

Stunning . Amazing architecture and lively place. Be prepared to be surrounded by tourists like yourself. Here you can find for instance the astronomical clock and a cathedral that is built right next to other buildings with no separation at all. If you want to see the clock show (every hour and lasts a few seconds), be in front of it at least 10 minutes to.
Good for a City Break. There is plenty to do which will fill a weekend. Very pretty but (ironically) far too many tourists. Very crowded.
Happening Place. The old town square is the most happening place in the Prague city. All the best monuments are near to the square. The square gives a feeling of 15th century architecture & looks

Very nice architecture, a lot of old buildings,for each recommendation. We paid 60 EUR to travel through town with big cabrio, with very kindly driver who show us everything and explained, and also answered on all our questions. This tour was about 55 min (and we were 4 persons).

Visited in February. Delightful part of Prague. Not Too busy either!. We visited in February. The weather was cold but dry. We tend to visit every year at this time. The Stare Mesto is a delightful part of Prague with many places to visit and a great deal of history to absorb.

Amazing. Been here during the day and night - just as busy at 11am as it is at 11pm. The buildings are amazing, and is worth looking during day and night as the contrast is amazing. The history and architecture is simply fantastic and well worth wandering around just looking and listening to the bustling crowds. Felt perfectly safe walking late at night, but had been warned about pickpockets (didn't see any evidence of this, but that probably just means they are really good?).
Beautiful Area, Must visit. This area is very beautiful and is a must visit when in Prague. Also try the Segway tours. Very nice

Fun stuff. Its a lively place full of young people and tourists with great food stalls for the smoked ham and lollies. The souvenior shops are good too, but a bit expensive. The town cafes are pricy so better to have coffe from the stalls

Like a painting, but with too many people. Prague is always my favourite city since I visited it in 2012 so I decided to go back again in 2016. Everything is still there, the charm of the ancient buildings and its pastel little alley. However, I think the city became too touristy and too crowded that it loses some of its charisma. You'd better come out in the early morning to avoid the crowd and to be able to capture beautiful picture of the Old Town Square. In the area you can watch Astronomical clock show every hour and visit the national gallery, the pink building next to the Tyn Church

City brake . Good atmosphere, very nice architecture, animated city, Praga is offering you a good occasion to charge your battery. You can visit and enjoin about every perimeter of building, museum, peoples. Highly recommended!
Historical Old Town Sector. Ideal location to view the old ambiance including the astronomical clock tower, St. Nicolas Church and a massive monument.
Great pre stay for river cruise. Loved walking the streets of old town. so much history. beautiful architecture scenery .perfect temp in November!

Beautiful town square. By far the nicest place in Prague to see. It has the most ornate buildings and an unusual clock tower. It was decorated for Easter when we went and was so pretty, the trees were decorated with Easter eggs. But the architecture was spectacular. Took a horse and carriage around the city which was great and got to see a lot of Prague that way. A must see.

Lovely area to visit. Like all cities the centre is busy, and this is one of the most busiest areas to visit, but there are lots of different attractions and shops to keep you busy looking or shopping, the more expensive areas are heading towards the Jewish sector, but in the main tourist areas you will find meandering streets leading to Charles bridge and down to the river, lots of places to have a snack or just a drink, take the weight off of your feet (cobbles take their toll after a while)and watch the world go by we found the prices not too expensive and most were attentive, friendly and polite, the only down side is lack of toilets so head into a restaurant, you may have to pay a small fee for this unless you are eating or drinking there. My big bug bear is the amount of Segway riders and they swish in and around at speed so keep an eye open so you don't get in their way

King of Bohemia. What an experience! Architecturally magnificent buildings surround Old Town Square, and all of the Old Town area had the streets converted to pedestrian malls and paved with stone, giving a medieval feel, especially when viewing the twin-spire Gothic towers at the edge of Old Town Square. Prague has an excellent subway system, but in Old Town there is limited access to Metro. Prague is designed for walking, and what better way to experience the spectacular architecture? Throughout Old Town you’ll come across old buildings, some dating to Medieval Times: Charles Bridge and its two tower gates, Powder Tower that has an arch over the pedestrian street, and was one of the original 13 gates/towers leading to Old Town, and many other buildings. Sidewalk cafés line the cobblestone streets, and pubs sell draft beer for about $2. I recommend an early day visit, as tour groups, tourists, and locals gather in Old Town Square later in the day making for overcrowded conditions—and an easy target for pickpockets. Stare Mestro (Old Town Prague) is now my favorite European city.☺
It is beautiful. Prague's Old Town (Stare Mesto) is a beautiful place. Every traveler or tourist will stay you this. But thousand words are useless, if you never go there. Just go and see.

Pleasant. Was very pleasant walking around the old town, which I felt safe in for the most part. I do agree with other travellers in that you are a prime target for petty theft, so usual rules apply ... keep your possessions safe !
History at its best. Walk around and your eye will be caught by endless details of these old buildings. Try to get there in the morning, as the afternoons are extremely crowded.
fantastic. Plenty to see and do here you can even just sit and chill watching everything that's happening eat drink or even go on a horse and carriage ride
A delight to visit but watch your pockets. The Old Town is a delight to visit - so much to see and do. The cafes and bars are wonderful - Dont miss the Old Town in Prague

Lovely place to hang out. Old town is a lovely place to hang out and people watch with a drink. Lots of good places to eat but you will pay more in the square itself. There are other places just off the square for cheaper drinks and food but sitting and watching the world go by is worth the extra in my opinion - you are on holiday after all!!

Gorgeous Old Square. Such a beautiful, historic old part of the city. Cobblestone streets (warning to ladies in heels!) all around the Clock Tower and old square. We happened to be there on a Friday night while there was a concert being set up. Stop for a beer on one of the great rooftops!

beautiful everywhere. This area is super nice with lots of attractions, history and rich architecture from 12, 13 centuries. It is worth walking around and learning about many buildings in the area. The entire old town is super charming and beautiful! Filled with shops and restaurants all over. Wonderful to visit and safe.
Just keep walking!. There are different sights and sounds and shops down every street. It's worth exploring over several different evenings!
Gorgeous!. The whole area is just beautiful with amazing buildings. Be sure not to get food near the top as it's super expensive.

wonderful part of Prague.. Old Town is a beautiful part of Prague where the buildings are really beautiful from medieval buildings. The little shops dotted across the narrow streets are very nice to visit and buy your souvenirs from. In the old town one can see the square, the church of Our Lady before Tyn, the hussites church, and the astronomical clock. Also the town ends near the Vltava river and the Charles bridge.

Beautiful, so much history.. It will always be crowded but worth it. Their are plenty of outdoor cafes and pubs to sit and enjoy an excellent Czech pivo (beer) and watch the crowds. Food and beverages are reasonable priced in the entire area
No Police. The city is gorgeous, crowded with tourists and no policing. Many thieves taking advantage of this situation. Take care of your wallet, there are pickpocket everywhere.
Front view of castle. Enjoy the view of castle, Top view of city and change of guards which is unique, this is entrance to castle and looks beautiful o sunny day
step back in time. It was a very nice square with the old astronomical clock and the old buildings. Very crowded at times but that only makes it better!!

Great place to Wander and Marvel!. I just put away the map and wandered around! I was happy to "get lost" as there are numerous little secret streets to discover! The ancient buildings are amazing - so glad Prague was not bombed in the war. I would highly recommend spending a day...and maybe a late evening here! There was a concert on at the square...but the music stopped to hear the chimes of the clock! Great.
Must visit area but very busy. Busy but fabulous architecture, not on any of the tram or Metro routes you will need to walk but not far from Wenceslas Square

Beautiful my favorite spot. This square is so beautiful and charming. During the day it's bustling with people and vendors. At night is my favorite the food vendors are a must stop. The astronomical clock is the highlight by all the buildings and monuments are fantastic.
Architectural brilliance. Beautiful architecture. Excellent connectivity with places with tram, metro and buses. Camera must. Try eateries outside. Good to visit by foot.

Lovely Prague. I love Prague. To me, this is one of the most beautiful European cities. The old town is full of charme and fascinating. Try to experience it without a map, just following your instinct. You'll fall in love with it...
Beautiful. Very different from New Town - the historic city keeps you on your toes. Better seen during the winter period as the whole city lights up.

Beautiful!. This place is like right out of a movie! There buildings surrounding the square are beautiful, and there is always something happening around here. There are also great little food stands to get a snack or meal including those potatoes on a stick.

Magical. The old town really is quite magical with its beautiful buildings, lots of little cobbled streets and the lovely astronomical clock. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes, entertainment in the large square and lots of shops. You could visit the old town everyday and still find quirky and interesting things to do do and look at. It definitely pulled at my heart strings and l would love to visit again.
Magic city.. Amazing city. Beautiful building makes you felling so alive. I was there with couple of friends and we had very nice time.
medieval settlement. Great medieval settlement ! But the squre was full of scenes, and loud music :( you can´t enjoy it at its best !

Beautiful old town. . This is one of the most beautiful cities I visited. There is a lot of tourists and the streets are full from people from all over the world. Of course, we all want to enjoy the beautiful architecture and history.

A well preserved 'old' town centre. Prague has done something with us. We enjoyed every day of our trip and spend loads of time exploring Prague. The old and little Streets, the river, the urban islands, the parks and gardens etc. We still haven't seen it all and yet only 1 hour and 15 minutes flying from Amsterdam. All the more reason to go back again. While being there the best place to stay is Hotel Klarov.

Beware, 'tis the season of extortion . Old town square is still as lovely and stunning as usual, but the experience can be tarnished by the charlatans which abound with their so called "old Prague ham" which is sold at around 900čk a kg. (only if you ask) if you don't ask, they slice huge chunks off the roast on the rotisserie and do their bloodiest to bankrupt you. I expect they also charge in excess of 100čk for a beer, because if you ask how much, they give you an answer like "this and this is 430čk. " very vague and non specific. If you don't allow yourself to be done in by these tourist targeters, Hey, old town still one of my favourite places on earth!!!

Pleasant place. This is only slightly off the beaten track, but it makes a world of difference. Lunchtime was quiet, the beer was excellent, Czech food was inexpensive and good (large portions). The waitress spoke very good Englsh, and was friendly and amusing. You might give the "egg liquor" a try. It's like boiled custard with a kick.
Beautiful views from the tower!. A must see of Prague is the clock tower, and going to the top, which gives you spectacular views of the city.
Beautiful buildings. Beautiful architecture and attractive pastel coloured buildings. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from in this area serving a range of delicious food.

Beautiful Historic Square. Wasn't expecting much from this super touristy area but was pleasantly surprised by the surrounding buildings and the square itself! Lots of cafes and side streets with great shopping and food. A must see if in Prague!

Fairytale. This place has a wow factor of 10. Put it on your must do list it is magic.At night you will see fire eaters,jugglers and many other entertainment. Do not miss the automated clock at midnight. Please note it is impossible to book a dinner table in the square,buy plenty in the surrounding area.

Beautiful architecture. A must see in Prague with the old buildings, churches and restaurants. One of the key sights is the astronomical clock that is 800 years old and does it's theatrical performance every half hour. Historical atmosphere can be felt everywhere. Sit down and enjoy a cold beer or glass of wine at an open air patio and just watch the people go by.

Quaint and lively at the same time. Don't miss on trying out those little nondescript streets. There is almost something no matter where you look. Also, keep an eye for statues and symbols at the entrance of old houses that were prevalent before the numbering system started.

What a view! . Great view from the top. If you don't like tight places don't go up. Very tight with all the people included. Great area for food. Christmas markets were amazing. The smell of all the wines and foods could be smelt from atop the tower. Very cheap. Highly recommended
BEAUTIFUL CITY. We took a city tour and learned a lot about the history of Prague. The bridges, buildings and people made the town so special. It is a must see location.
Beautiful!. Words can not explain how wonderful this old city is. We had an amazing time and got some amazing photos. YAOU CAN NOT MISS visiting the old town of Prague!

Stunning buildings. Spent best part of a day walking round old town admiring the buildings, done some homework on trip adviser before going and proved worthwhile, no need to pay for guided tours and gives yoy the freedom to go at your own pace and stop of at coffee shops etc.
Good for an evening stroll. One of the most impressive town centre areas we have visited, with impressive architecture all around.

Must see. If you're in Prague you kind of have to walk through old town. It's filled with tourist shops and overpriced restaurants but if you're not in the city for long eating here could be a good option for you. Beware of people on Segways and pickpockets

Nice feel. Lots of towns have old squares but this one has a very nice feel. The whole Old Town area is a great place to walk and get lost.
Loved Prague

Highlight of Prague. This is the coolest part of Prague. Old Town took very little bombing/damage during WWII, so the entire area has 1000+ year old buildings in excellent condition. Check out the Astronomical Clock, Hess church, Jewish cemetery and multiple sites. The cobblestone streets and sidewalks are amazing. This entire area is the highlight of our trip.

Very Beautiful. Old Town Square has lots to see and perfect on a good weather day to just sit at a cafe and people watch. There are several sights to see within the square. Watch out for mopeds they are everywhere!
Dramatic space. Your best bet is to go early in the day or late in the evening to enjoy the beautiful buildings without the crowds.
Favourite part. Definitely favourite part of prague. Beautiful buildings. Great cheap food, look down alley ways. Amazing street entertainment. Could wonder around for hours through the side streets.

Lovely old buildings and street food/ entertainment. A great part of Prague, just sit in the square, view all the beautiful old buildings, visit the church and watch the gorgeous 12 o'clock display at the clock tower

Great Place, Very Crowded. Old Town is definitely a must see in Prague. There is much to see and do. The problem is that during tourist season, it is very crowded. But the major sites are all worth seeing despite the crowds.
beautiful place. beautiful place , this is a must for any visit too Prague, very busy , lots of bars , restaurants but be aware pick pockets paradise

A step into times past. There is something comforting about a beautiful baroque square and spending a minute or two in another, more tranquil era. go early morning and you will miss the 'selfie' crowd.
Beautiful and great food!. Prague Old Town and surrounding side-streets has some of the best food to offer. The traditional restaurants are especially great and tend to be good value for money.

The Old Town square really is the heart of prague.... ... and the starting point for many of the tours. It's also the place where you can browse the many shops of all types or stop for a meal at one of many types of restaurant and cafe. There are often buskers and street entertainers which can entertain you while you marvel at the historic architecture. Off the side streets are more restaurants pubs shops and cafes and although it sometimes gets busy you never feel intimidated. There is plenty to see and do and any trip to Prague would be incomplete without visiting the square. There is the odd bit of graffiti which is a shame but the locals are surprisingly house-proud and do not drop litter (except cigarettes). Subsequently the streets are very clean and tidy. You often see the Czech people picking up the rare piece of litter and putting it in the bin. Now that's a part of their culture I wish we had in Britain!

Old town. This is a lovely part of the city with lots to see and do, the buildings are beautiful with frescos and statues and gargoyles every where you look, we felt our heads were on stalks swinging from one side to the other trying to take it all in!! The best thing is to literally get lost down the side streets and just enjoy the views and the ambiance, stop in one of the cafes or bars for a break and then you will soon find your way back to the main streets.

Magnificent architecture, but very crowded. I had been looking forward to visiting Prague for many years, but it was a mixed experience. The anticipated pleasure of being able to wander around the old town taking in the sights was spoiled by the thousands of people all crammed into a small town. If that was not enough it was quite dangerous to look up at the exquisite architecture, because then you wouldn't see the dozens of segways ready to trip you up. They are a menace and should be banned. Walking along the river was pleasant. I deliberately went mid-week so as to avoid the even more intense crowds that arrive for a weekend visit. Maybe you need to get up early and stroll around the deserted streets very early in the morning.
Amazingly beautiful and mystical!. Prague exceeded my expectations. It is a very beautiful place and with friendly, trendy and young people. Will definitely come back for more!

Harry potter anyone!. Cobbles everywhere, so ladies No high heels, wedges ok.During day whilst sight seeing wear trainers I wore sandals and my feet killed!! Absolutely stunning buildings make sure you look up.Fantastic to look at at night as well.Eat and drink in restaurants and bars in the back streets.So much to see , you will need a guide book and map!
Amazing . I very like the old town, very romantic and cute town, there is cheap food and pretty houses, definitively a must be in Prague
Strolling the beautiful streets of Prague. Within walking distance approximately 1.5 miles strolling through the sites and shopping areas while watching beautiful happy people
Beautiful Classic City. Prague has a rich history. Beautiful churches, Good restaurants, Cobbled stones streets and sidewalks
Buildings are amazing! . The buildings are a must see, but there is an unsafe "vibe" at night. During the day the street advertisers were less aggressive and the entire area felt safer.

Charming beautiful and magical. The Old Town of Prague is simply exquisite, but worth visiting at different times of the day. I was in Prague with my Dad for a short break and we would regularly have an early morning walk before breakfast - across Charles Bridge and through the Old Town. Not only was it cooler weather but it was really uncrowded allowing us to get a real sense of the history and charm of the streets and all its sights and fantastic architecture. We visited during the day and in late evening as well, and the different times give it a different character - my favourite was the early morning but I enjoyed all of them. Just be prepared to be in much busier company as the day progresses and the tourists and tour operators gather.

History and architecture . Around the old town will grab you definitely the architecture and the history of the area. The astronomy clock, the cathedrals, hus monument, the cotiyard. It's crowd whit people all the time so make sure y git your pictures and move on! The near market you can enjoy the halba beer and the Czech pork. And enjoy the relax in the cotiyard!

Beautiful place to be on Christmas. I was in Prague just before Christmas and the place was a Christmas Market and it was divine and more beautiful in my opinion than the one in Vienna. I was also in May and the place is beautiful in all seasons. A must place to see if you are visiting Prague!

A delight to the senses!. The Old Town Square is a beautiful congregation of buildings of religion, mercenery, memorial and of science. Here stands one of the three Astronomical Clocks in the world. The other two are located in Lund Cathedral in Sweden and one in Strasbourg, France. Fascinating thing to watch really as it chimes and does its magic every hour. It is the third oldest astronomical clock in the world but the first oldest to be still functional up to this very day. In this square stands St. Nicholas Cathedral with that glorious crystal chandelier and the Church of our Lady before Tyn with those two uneven towers to represent Adam and Eve. The memorial of John Hus- founder of the Hussite movement is also found here.
Very Beautiful. If you can deal with overwhelming number of tourists, you will enjoy visiting this area. I prefer peace. So, this wasn't the most enjoyable place on our journey.

Medievel and beautiful. The old city is a nice place to visit. One has to consider that prague was the imperial capital of the HRE during some years. The buildings and statues here are magnificent. The shops in this area are a bit pricey though .

History at a distance. The area is vibrant, lots of restaurant local flare and international. Stores around fabulous to shop or browse. Museums around the area wonderful. Walking is absolutely delightful and able to walk around. Parks in the area absolutely great.

A place you must go~. As everyone said, it is a place you can't miss.Can spend a whole day there. All nice arhitecture , all buildings are nice, you can take a lot of nice pictures. a lot of nice restaurants and cafe around. Can also shop a lot.Which we highly recommend to buy some glass product.
Nice Architeture. Old Town Square is busy with tourists. Great architecture and nice cafe/bars. From the top of the Astronautical clock you get a great view of the city.
Nice place. Nice old houses and special clock. A lot of restaurants and bars. Good Northern-Easten- European feeling
nice but busy. great little food stalls and the usual street performers. Watched folk dancers one evening on the plaza.

Must see in Prague. If you're making a trip out to Prague, you have to visit the Old Town. It's really a fantastically preserved medieval town right here in modern times. The modern and ancient are blended very nicely.

This is the right place to start the tour. This is a good place where you can form the first impression of Prague and later confirm it. Do not waste your time on wait for the clock and perform. You will be disappointed. Be sure that any café there is more expensive than if you take a small side street. But it offers the best choice of souvenirs to me. Also, mind that the old churn maybe closed. But if open, any church charges the entrance fee not less than any museum (in my experience).

Great place to visit. If you are going to Prague, make sure that you stay in Old Town. I would recommend the Inter Continental or Four Seasons , if price is not a problem. Make sure to stop by the Astronomical Clock on the hour to grab a snack and watch the show.

Amazing . Prague old town is simply amazing especially on winters evening has a really buzz about it. Loads of bars and restaurants to cater for all ages. I've been to Prague 3 times so I think that days enough to you.

oldie worldie. To get here by public transport you need tram 17/18 or underground Line A Staromestska. it's very close to the Jewish quarter. Here you will find the Astronomical clock. Plenty of shops and places to eat.

Mystic surreal place . Lucky to have the opportunity to see something mystic, surreal yet magnificent. Being a Franz Kafka fan, the psyche and ideas were gradually developed to see the prague in a different aspect. This place is the best of post-Renaissance Europe.Go,see and immerse yourself in the Stare Mesto.

Beautiful old medieval touch !. We visited Prague in easter 2016 and this square was lively with stalls of different local delicacies and trinkets and souvenirs. The sound of musicians playing in the background would be interrupted with tour operators trying to sell their segway tours.Its adorned with restaurants and bars. The architecture , colors give an overall uplifting look to the square. The small bylanes surrounding the square are also a treat to the eye. But beware of crowds every hour near the clock. It would get insanely crowded when the procession of apostles would start in the medieval astronomical clock.

A Tourist Mecca. It is hard not to be impressed by this part of Prague as it has everything from restaurants to sidewalk cafes, bars, souvenir shops, clothing shops, jewellery stores, souvenir shops and much, much more.All the roads and walkways are of cobblestones and it certainly adds to the atmosphere and character of the place. Little alley ways dart off here and there to unearth another set of restaurants and more and it really is a gluttons paradise if that is your want. For those who wish to see the area in style you can hire antique style sports cars or even go by horse and cart. This will help you take in all the historical places in around this area and there really is a lot of history to take in.You could easily spend up to a day here and is really worth a visit.
Awesome place, enjoy it during the afternoon. beautiful place, better to go late or early to avoid the crowd so you can have space and time to enjoy it.

A storybook town. Has always been one of my dreams to get to Prague - finally did it! Felt like I was in a story book - amazing architecture! My only complaint - way too many tourists!! I would love to be alone in the town to explore all by myself but alas we live in a world much too large.. Just one gorgeous place!

Nice part of Prague to visit . Very nice, touristy area to visit. Lots of nice little cafe's, souvenir shops, restaurants to explore. There are also some boat trips you can do. I didn't do one personally but other travellers we met during the course of our stay there said they were well worth the money.

Fun and crowded. The old town is fascinating. Great shopping, dining and sightseeing!! The major problem is so many tourists! Most are very nice and I will add, my experience with the Chinese tourists was very negative. Very rude and pushy!

Sit in a cafe and people-watch. All visitors to Prague should see the astrological clock on the hour. The square is always packed during that time, but it's still a must see. The square has beautiful architecture and cafes, restaurants, and shops abound. After sitting to watch the world go by, stroll the square and the surrounding areas.

Starting point of your visit. As most of European cities, I believe the best way to start is walking around the old town. The beautiful thing about Prague's Old Square is that it is actually real, with original buildings and a story behind them.

Cliches do apply. Prague has a beautifully preserved historic old city that survived the ravages of WW2 pretty much intact - though it's easy to save a city from total destruction if you throw up your hands at the first sight of an enemy and hand over your capital - which makes it somewhat unique in this part of the world (Central Europe). It is laced with beautiful buildings and scenic alleys. Be careful though, not all you see is historic and original, Czechs notoriously add buildings, statues etc. that look like they were built two, three hundred years ago, even in the middle ages, but are in fact 20th or 21st century products. At the end of the day its a beautiful city and a must see for any world traveler

Christmas markets. We visited the area for the Christmas markets. While I didn't think the markets were particularly good, the square is lovely to look at with beautiful buildings and architecture. Filled with lots to see and do (and even the obligatory Starbucks which, yes, we visited). However, the people on the segway contraptions all trying to flog tours or whatever to tourists, got very annoying, very quickly!We actually visited in December 2014, but I was unable to select that far back.

Just Get Lost. There is so much amazing architecture an things to see, taste and experience that it is best to just get lost on the streets. Recommend also taking an early morning or late evening stroll after some of the tourist groups have departed as makes for much better pictures and experience.

Compelling & Seductive to ALL My Medieval Senses!. After more than 25 Years since my 1st Trip to Prague Old Town, I still find the streets both Compelling & Seductive with the Spirit of Medieval Europe. I feel the presence of history within the tall merchant houses, whilst the 21stC Boutiques are filled with treasures that are a feast to the eyes! The Northern Boundaries of the Old Town around Valentinska Street are also rewarding since they are close to the Old Jewish Cemetary, and there are various attractive Antique Shops too! I'll be sure to tour these fascinating streets again during my next trip to Prague!

Walking in history. Walking down Stare Mesto is like walking in a medieval town. The buildings are lovely with stone artwork and paintwork on the outside. Lots of eateries in main squares which are large where one can sit and watch the world go by

Must see. If you're traveling to Prague this is top of the list. This area gives you a real taste of the area, culture, and history. Give yourself a few hours to explore and shop, you won't be disappointed!
Such an amazingly beautiful town. Every time you look, turn around or even see it the following day, it is more and more amazing. The colors, architecture etc. What a treat to visit.

An amazing, visual experience . This is truly one of the top places to visit, on any "bucket list". The history, coupled with the overwhelming visuals is amazing. Given this, it's not unexpected for it to be crowded, especially in the high season. So, plan accordingly and scout out the area earlier in the day, and then go back later and take enjoyment in people watching the crowds.

One of THE places to visit. Great place, the old square is buzzing Plenty to do and all everything is walkable. Loads of cafes, pubs and restaurants (spoilt for choice). Just make sure you check the prices before ordering drinks (they and vary quite significantly between establishments right next to each other
A must see. This should be on everyone's must visit list. It's charming, scenic with good restaurants around and a lovely feel of old Prague
Interesting. Busy area but very interesting. Lovely buildings and saw the astrological clock. Wear comfortable shoes!

Climb the tower. Ofcourse the heart of Prague. Always crowded ( be ware of Pickpockers!!), and the clocktower is the main attraction of the city.You can also climb the tower. something you really should consider when the weather is nice!

Prag old town is just perfect to visit no matter the age. Prague old town is cosy, full of culture, has beautiful buildings, great stores, great food expecially bakery, wonderful churches and interesting museums. The old town is fun at every age and there is always not enough time to discover what Prague has to offer.
Compact history. My tour started here and now I completely understand why. Every building on Old Town Square has been hugely influential to the shaping of the Czech Republic
Stunning. It is an amazing square to visit both day and night. Lovely, lively, amazing vibes, stunning architecture, etc... A MUST!

Beautiful architecture, ruined by stag parties and bloody segueways. So many beautiful things to see, but you are constantly on your look out for idiots from all over the world on their stag weekends, as well as people on bloody segueways, powering up the pavements. They are a menace and a nuisance, cause all manner of near misses and deserve to be knocked over, especially when they are in pedestrian only areas. They ruined it for me.

Easy to walk, good shopping!. The little shops are delightful, and many streets are pedestrian only. Good places to eat, and very reasonably priced. Right now, the Czech Republic is a great bargain in Europe!
synagogues. visited various synagogues and found the guides to be informative and helpful. did not realise that the tickets for the synagogues could be used over seven days.

Gothic splendour at its best!. Prague has been a political, cultural, and economic centre of central Europe during its 1,100-year existence. Founded during the Romanesque and flourishing by the Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque eras, Prague was not only the capital of the Czech state, but also the seat of two Holy Roman Emperors and thus also the capital of the Holy Roman Empire. It was an important city to the Habsburg Monarchy and its Austro-Hungarian Empire and after World War I became the capital of Czechoslovakia. This of course all shows through the splendour of its Churches, squares and public buildings, not to mention the many smart town houses and residences.The place has a real Gothic atmosphere and a true old world European feel.In recent years it has become more expensive, so choose wisely and make sure that you are are upfront of what you are paying for,As with most places, a good local guide is well worth the investment.
Beautiful. Every streets lead to Stare Mesto. Great area to book your tour, Very busy, lots of people, bars restaurants and the clock. You somewhat always fond yourself back into that square.
friendly people. everyone is determined to make your holiday a great one. Very friendly locals and no hassling from sales pitches
Get lost in the small streets around the Old Square.. We really enjoyed walking around this neighborhood, discovering the little secrets the streets offered, by day or by night.

Quintessential European Square. Good mix of buildings, a lot of history all in one place if you visit with a tour guide, great people watching. History behind the church and clock are very interesting.If you get a block or two off the square you can find lots of shopping, cafes, and places to eat.

Beautiful Prague!. On our recent visit to Prague, seeing the Old Town was on top of our list. Being in the Old Town Square was like being in the pages of a classic fairy tale! What a beautiful place! The place was full of tourists and very busy especially near the Astronomical Clock. Would love to visit again!
Love Prague . Awesome time in Prague Can walk forever Lots of café's, bars and shops We as spent hours walking around the streets Great time -day or night

Stunning. What a fascinating place. Baroque architecture, churches, quaint alley ways, pavement restaurants and monuments are everywhere. A great place to wander. Nice large, and busy square. The restaurants here are more expensive so wander a little further for better prices

Prague City. Nice walking tour to have a feel of the city; amidst the crowd that gets into the photo
A must to walk through if you're in the city :)

the original europe. if you want to see the real history of Europe , then you must be in this part of Prague , the building are built from more than hundreds of years , the designed will take you back to the history , it is relay the best heritage in Europe.
A fantastic atmosphere!. We had just a short stay but felt we were able to fit so much in and spending time in the Old town was almost enough as it had so much to offer.

Certainly the best part of Prague ......and one of the best to see in Europe ..... take a tour to know about all the monuments , otherwise you will spend 2 months to recognize and read about them into the Michelin. This is spectacular and crowded . Come early and not in July or August ....

Beautiful view, overpized. It is really beautiful place which you will fell in love with. But when buying something, there is many many places and most of them in centre are really overprized for tourists, so try to look for something like a local place and you will be suprised that you can pay for example just one third of the price what you would pay in the "tourist places" ...
:). Where central place. It is recommended to keep your stuff there thefts. There are food stalls very cool. Expensive restaurants in the central region

Very croudy place, but good. Old European towns are all have lot of common things, Stare Mesto is not an exception. Many tourists, lot of shops, restaunts, cafes, mix of gothic and barokko architecture styles... Chech, English, Russian, Polish, Chinese, German, French, Italian languages... But ovreall very pleasant impression.
Beautiful. Old town is lovely lots of street entertainers , plenty places to eat, the Catherdal is stunning on a night when it is lit up.

This Old Square reminded me of Seville with its horse drawn carriages, upmarket sports cars to rent .. Lots to see and we walked around through all the little cobbled streets, enjoying the ambiance of the Old Town square, stopping for refreshing Czech Budweizer, the original Budweizer! Then took advantage of a two hour bus tour of the highlights of the surrounding area with a headphone commentary which came in a selection of some fifteen plus languages. Watch out for pick pockets though.
Beautiful city. Only negative side I hated is a lot of drug dealers on streets and guys grooming you to visit brothels

The spirit of Prague!. Visiting the old town of Prague was one of the most amazing experiences I have ever had. This part of the town is special and speeks a lot about history and way of living in Czech Republic.
Cosy area . I could walk around in the old town every day, and so we did. Every house is beautiful and the atmosphere is great.

Nice atmosphere. Nice atmosphere. Lovely place to hang around. Sit at one of the cafes and soak in the atmosphere. Lots of eating options around . However full of tourist though. Went in the morning on a wet rainy day for a jog in the old town . Completely empty and completely to your own self

what a place. a lovely place with lots of places to eat
shopping is next door
lot of monuments to see all tours start from here
Crowded, too many Segways.. Beautiful buildings and lots of history! But very crowded and the segways are annoying. Nice ice gelato stands. I would visit this place early morning.

Nice to wander round, but go off track for food. Don't pay massive prices for square watching - you get better and cheaper food by going away from the Old Square. Head for the bar which is just south of Charles Bridge but on the actual river.

Very nice and lively, avoid restaurants. This is truly a lovely square! The adtronomical clock is worth waiting for, strikes beautifully every 00. Yoy will find better restaurants at half price 3-4 blocks away.

Enjoying . Well , you will be entertained by the poeple passing by, the living statues , the crowd.
It is a special place , filled with life and history.

Amazing centre of old town, magical atmosphere . This is a must-see in Prague. The square is full of beautiful old buildings, with plenty of restaurants & cafes, many with outdoor terraces, so you can sit and watch the world go by. I recommend the roof terrace of the Hotel U Prince. The astrological clock chimes on the hour & is quite magical to watch. There are horse & carriage rides too, and sometimes live music events in the centre of square. A great place by day or night.

My favorite part of Prague!. I couldn't get enough of Old Town. It was so beautiful with all the old and colorful buildings, restaurants, shops, cobblestones, narrow streets, and people. It is always packed here, but with good reason. When you are here you remember why you wanted to visit Prague in the first place. Old Town is at the end of Charles Bridge, close to the Jewish quarter and New Town. Just keep walking and take it all in!

One of the worlds most beautiful Town Squares!. This has to be one of the most beautiful Town Squares in the world! The buildings, the clock, restaurants, churches, horse-carriages, interesting people! Just an amazing place to see and be!

Spent the most time here. Totally live the atmosphere this part of Prague. The many crystal stores, cafes , restaurants, souvenir shops, ice cream stalls all make this very charming.
Highlight of this us the Astronomical Clock in the square.

Picturesque and stunning . Old town square is just magical. Lots of things going on from street entertainers, hot food stalls. The down side sedways continually annoying you to have a try. And people trying to sell tours or nightclubs. It's very busy so not really any seating which would be nice to sit and take in the atmosphere. But overall loved it

Watch out for the cobblestones!. Venturing around Old Town is a treat, but should be done with a map, and with careful attention to the different sized cobblestones beneath your feet. This is not an area for walking in spike heels! However with a good pair of walking shoes it is not to be missed! The streets are winding, and the street signs are on the buildings at the corners. However, not all corners have them, so carry a good map! The buildings are old and vary in structure, so that the skyline is beautiful. There are lots of shops to poke your head into, and street performers all over.

Very beautiful . The old town is the place to be in when in Prague. The best restaurants, hotels, cafes and activities are all in and around the old town the famous charles bridge is also in the old town
Beautiful. Amazing place and good people. You can buy some souvenirs with good price. It's a great place to return

Nice city for tourist. Had 3 days for training, served as local guide for foreigners. Prague is impossible in less than week, but we had at least some taste to inspire. I am confident, that they will return soon to explore one of europe gems.
Great part of Prague. It was a great pleasure to go through old city center. Bigg enough to be "lost" and to imagine how people lived before centuries.

Beautiful Architecture. Of course, the first place to visit when you are in Prague. The Old Town is steeped in history. Just get a drink and watch the world go by. Beautiful buildings all around with quaint coffee shops and bars. Price less.

Sooo beautiful!!!!. This area is very beautiful! All the buildings are colorful. It is the centrer of all. You havr the shops the musumes the gallerys there. You can eat trolo and enjoy prague at here best:)
Beautiful!. Lovely city , easy walking! Fabulous food! Many restaurants markets and shops . Lots of things to do and see and wish we had more time there .

Crowded...but great. Great spot! My only piece of advice: avoid being over-run by drunken bachelor and bachelorette parties and stay away Friday and Saturday if you can. Early mornings and later afternoons and evenings are best.

Never a dull moment. There's so much to see especially during the weekend when they have a cultural show in the square. There are a lot of quaint shops if you would just explore the side streets. There's a wide variety of food to choose from. Restaurants are pretty decent and clean. Do be careful in changing your money. Go to reputable money changers and avoid individuals who approach you offering to change your money to local currency.
found on a long hike. Actually found on a hike to Hard Rock Café. Spent many hours here and the activity makes you want to stay longer than possible

The centre is where the heart of the city is. One has to visiy the Old town for its great architecture, the buzz, activities, restaurants , cafes and local shopping. One my even do a nice segway tour here.

Make sure you go there. Actually for sure you will go there. All small streets lead you to that wonderful place with a lot of history. But make sure you go there to catch a sharp hour to watch the parade of apostles at the Clock.

One of the GREAT sights of Europe. This is one of the few places around where you really feel like you are transported back in time - like 500 years ! Too bad that tour groups try to ruin the experience. Best viewed early in the morning, before they arrive.

Where the story begins.. For me, I love to start my trip from the Old Town area where ever I travel. Because it seems like that's the place where the city has been growing from. So in order to see the core of the city's history along with the culture and the foods, I believe I have to start my trip from the Old Town. The place is surrounded by beautiful and historical architecture buildings. Uniqueness of each buildings and tone of colors of these building seems like I am in the middle of children's story book. Bright colors and the floors that are built with bricks were definitely made me feel like I am in different world. Then you can start smell delicious foods from almost everywhere! You can go any direction and still find foods and beers that will definitely satisfy your journey to this beautiful city.
Beautiful Old Town squer. we were in old town squer and it is so amaizing place. one of the most beautifu place in Prague. was nice weather and we enjoyed
Lots to See. Lots of interesting sights in a very walkable area. This is a must see when visiting Prague. You can quickly learn a lot about this area by taking one of the free walking tours.

Magical old town. This would be one of my favourite places. Winding roads leading through the town with lots of quaint shops, beautiful old buildings, plenty of places to stop and have a drink or food, and lots of great photo opportunities. Recommend you take a tour of some kind to learn the history of the town and see all the unique sites that you could miss without a guide.

One of the best in the world. I recommend slow stroll around the Old Town, especially through the streets which don't lead to any tourist attractions. Just few steps off the beaten track you find quiet streets and well kept amazing buildings. So just grab the map and take the parallel route wherever you go instead of the crowded one.

Nice but overpriced. Old town is nice for a stroll or some souvenir shopping. The restaurants are however overpriced and it's better to eat elsewhere. But definately go here for a stroll and to watch people.
wonderful. The old town is wonderful, every street and palace is stunning. Everywhere is clean and well- finished. Food is wonderful everywhere, also in the stands along streets

Great for walking around. Loved the old town!! Definitely one of the highlights of this amazing city! Great to walk around, admire the wonderful architecture, browse through the quaint shops or just sit at one of the numerous Cafe-bars enjoying a drink and taking in the vibrant atmosphere.
Beautiful . Beautiful square in the old town, shame about the crowds of tourists everywhere that kind of spoil the place in my opinion. Best to visit early or late on in the day I would imagine.
Great atmosphere.. This is a busy squares surrounded by cafes etc. Be there on the hour to watch the astronomical clock. There were also a number of live entertainers around.

Prague Old Town as a Biggest One Buzz Plaza in Central Europe !. To describe in brief essays all the impressions of the Old Town there is absolutely impossible! This motley mix of Catholic and Protestant cathedrals, large and small areas with a variety of cafes and restaurants filled with tourists from all over the world. It is place where you can find the most surprising number of people of the Art, various freaks and gays. My advice to those who came to the Old City a second or third time - drop all Tourist Attractions and simply breathe the magical air of the Old Town on its small streets !!!
Old town . This one of most important land mark in Prague that must be visited, it skyways busy with people most of the time with many selection of restaurant and coffee shops.

Best town square in all of Europe . After visiting many cities in Europe on a tour, this town square stands out as the best. No cars, beautiful buildings on all sides, well policed, entertaining street performers, wonderful and inexpensive restaurants, and so many shops your head will spin. It's just a lot of fun to visit but not overwhelming.
Worth a visit. Lots of history and traditions here. Well worth stopping by for a visit. Got up to the top of the Astronomical clock of your time allows.
historical with so much beauty. Visit Prague with a tour guide (Radek Cizek) as there is so much to see in and around Prague. It can be crowded so a guide is highly recommended.

Bring your walking shoes. This is an amazing city best seen on foot. So many sites, so much history, wonderful people, great beer and food. Be sure to just stop and look around, it is so easy to miss some beautiful spot or historical site.

Old Town Square a buzz with activity. We stayed at a hotel on Old Town Square and everyday was a beehive of activity. Especially when the Astrological Clock was to go off. Try to dine or have coffee on the little side streets as it is much cheaper than in the square itself.
So Beautiful.. The most Beautiful city I have ever seen. And I've been lucky to see a lot of them. We stayed at the K+K Hotel which was the perfect location.

Czech it Out!. Prague is one of the few cities that wasn’t bombed during the war making it quite a cohesive city. Put on your walking shoes and explore! The Old Town Square was one of my favorite locations. The Astronomical clock is the centerpiece and we went up to the top of the tower where we could see why Prague is called the city of 1000 spires. The Charles Bridge is a pedestrian walkway across the river full of people, artists and street performers. And an interactive wall dedicated to John Lennon is forever changing as people come and paint their thoughts and memories of the Beatle. Every café serves a multitude of beers which seem to be consumed more than water.

Intricate gorgeous details. The square is surrounded by gorgeous buildings all with intricate details and architecture. There are stalls along the edges selling street food and market goods adding to the hustle hustle feel to the square

Loved it!. We had a guided tour, which I recommend, her name is Bela Veselá, and she showed us lots of interesting sites off the beaten path as well as the main sights.
