She also explained lots of things in detail and provided insight to other sites to see... As for Old Town... Very worth the time... The architecture and history is wonderful hear about. The astronomical clock is fascinating and amazing given when it was made. Try the warm trdelnik even if you are on a diet.... Nummy and no oil!
Amazing. We were staying quite close to Old Town and would advise to visit early in the morning and then again later at night to see it in lights.

Beautiful Architecture. We saw Old Town square several times throughout our trip to Prague. The architecture is amazing and it can be a wonderful place to just walk around, take pictures, and take it all in. We particularly enjoyed visiting at night, all the buildings are lit up and it's very pretty. There are several restaurants all around, so if you really want to be a tourist, you can walk around the square and eat while you take in the sights. It is true-the square is FULL of tourists, absolutely full. But really, it's part of the experience. Expect to pay to use the bathrooms (about 10 crowns) anywhere on the square. Yes, it's touristy, but you just have to see it in Prague!

Lots to do. Lots to do and see in just this little square. Sit down at a cafe or eat at a restraunt, watch the performers in the center or read a book in a quiet corner. you will never be bored, has something for everyone

Bautiful!. A beautiful, majestic, and clean district. A bit overcrowded in summer but it did not matter since the square itself if wide enough and everybody fits in. The little shops are attractive and more importantly, the sales persons don't try to persuade you to buy anything.
Make the effort, Battle the crowds & enjoy!. Well worth all the Hassle & Crowds- just completely awesome. Please make the effort to visit the Golden Street
Incredible. No words for this fantastic place. Prague it's a beautiful city and the center is rich of story, i will come back absolutley.

Unfortunately tourist-flooded. Even though tourist-flooded, the old majestic buildings belonging to the flourishing aristrocratic period of Prague are always worth a walk. Yet, if you can make it to be there under the week, even better.
Beautiful architecture,. As an architect I really appreciate these history buildings. Prague is a beautiful city to visit and take hundreds of photos.

Great buzz around the bridge. I paid a visit to Charles Bridge a few days ago, the atmosphere was fantastic, The local traders offer great value for money. It was great to see so many people enjoying themselves.

Beautiful city. Go to the top of the astronomical clock and see the beautiful views of the city. We went on a beautiful evening and the sunset and sky were amazing. Very crowded so get there early to avoid being pushed around when the clock chimes.

Beautiful and interesting. Really worth a walk around. Especially at night it's like a walk back in time. During the day there's lots to see. Great original architecture; lots of places to rest and have something to eat and drink; and plenty of shops to scout round, if that's what you want.
Holidays. Nice, beautiful, perfect and historical. Yo have everything in one place. It has such a history so I recommend to get a tour so you dont miss a thing!

beautiful historic building. It looks beautiful from the ground and from the top of clock tower.
amazing views ...must see when in Prague.

Magical Old Town. Go up of the astronomical clock and 360 degres of Praha old town spread out there. Not just the famous Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, I could see the powder tower, Karluv Most, even Prazky Hrad accros the Vlatva river.It's absolutely beautiful yet crowded so be careful with your belonging while admiring the art and architecture. You can sit at a cafe and do people-watching.

Beautiful sights with lots of others. The town square and all of old town Prague are like they were years ago, it really is so well preserved. You can enjoy the sights with lots of other tourists! It's pretty crowded, but I understand why, it's all so great.

Ancient charms. Old town is one of or planets’ greatest time machines.Only a few places on our planet are so well preserved that one can easily imagine traveling back in time. From the moment we walked to the old city and its lovely squares (namnesty in Czech) we were immersed in the ancient world that somehow miraculously survived wars, plagues, famines, and other calamities. The magic of the old Europe, the great Bohemian civilization that was shaped by numerous rulers is lovely preserved by the Czech people. I had a similar time traveling experience on the streets of Jerusalem and ancient streets of Jaffa.We felt very safe thanks to the large presence of local police and Army. Prague is generally is a very safe city and we felt comfortable walking late at night. Atmosphere was festive and the crowds were tolerable.
A must see!. So many beautiful buildings to see in one square, it's difficult to know where to look first. Don't forget the astronomical clock!

Beautiful. Myself and my other half stayed in the old town in an apartment. Old town is absolutely beautiful though my other half did describe it as a 'tourist trap'. The roads are thin so a lot of cats don't try to go down them, there are multiple tours available through the old town, lots of restaurants, lots of bars, lots of tourist shops, a little market place and loads of little land marks! Does become very busy on the weekends though and can become difficult to move around
Worth a look around. Worth a look around but would prefer less Segway sales representative attempting to show off and attract customers by dashing around square.

Beautiful. Old town is simply amazing. I was here on a sunny day and enjoyed a walk from the cathedral down to old town and across the bridge. Next to an amazing walk it was also nice to explore all the different structures and statues which are all unique and give old town both its charm and it's beauty.

Great architecture.. A must is the old clock, which needs to be viewed on the hour, as it 'performs'. If you do this as part of a tour, as we did, and are there at any other time, do a reroute back to it to see it in action!
Magnificent!. Although twice visited this awesome city before, I had forgotten just how magnificent and beautiful this place is. The Old Town encapsulates it all.

Beautiful part of town. Take some time to amble around the Old Town part of Prague. There are many beautiful sights such as the churches and the clock tower. There are also many restaurants facing onto the square which is great for people watching but be aware that some charge extra for sitting outside and meals/drinks are generally more expensive in the main square.Beware of pickpockets particularly while watching the clock or other entertainment around the square.
Magical. Went to the Xmas market. Beauitful setting. Will be going again. At night all lit up, Huge Christmas tree. Lovely stalls great atmosphere with our lady in he back ground

Walking Tour of the Stunning Old Town and Prague Castle . We arranged with our hotel (Hotel Paris) for a private walking tour of the old town and Prague castle early in our visit and it was well worth it. Our guide, Eva Kubatova, was very knowlegeable, friendly and customized our 4 hour tour to what we most wanted to see. We felt she really maximized our tour. She showed us the highlights of old Prague, gave us a fascinating insight into the history of the city and recommended specific places we could consider further exploring afterwards. In fact, we followed up on her suggestions and by the time we left Prague we felt we had experienced the wonder of Prague. As beautiful as the old city is, it was so much more interesting having some background and having our guide explain just what we were looking at! Great tour, wonderful guide!
Like any European town square--wonderful!. Walking around and people watching, eating lunch at any of the outdoor cafes---a great way to spend a few hours taking fin the culture.

Lovely old town. Steeped in history, with a blend of buildings from different periods. Miss easy to imagine bohemian life here. Lots of restaurants and cafes around the square, as well as lots of street food outlets. The square is lively and appears to attract street performers as well as municipal events such as small concerts. A great buzz here.

Lots to see. Beautiful bustling square with lots to see at any time of the day or night.LOts of places to eat but be careful eat inside as often are charged more to eat outside with a view of the square.

Old world charm. Prague is a small but very beautiful city. The old town has an old world charm like cobbled streets, small souvenir and eating shops. You can walk through or hire a buggy like vehicle.
This is also a must see in Prague. Strollign around in Stare Miastois a interesting thing you must do in Prague. Cross the Charles bridge. Beware of pickpockets here.

great place to go sightseeing. walk around, stroll & take in the sightschurches, synagogues, & just the sights & peoplestop for a snack, if looking for less expensive food/mealsmove out of the square into the side streets

So much to see!!. This place is amazing. So much to see. So much history in one spot. It's thought provoking when you hear the years these building were built. You must see this if you are in the area.

Lovely square but let down by poor restaurants. With visited during a 4 day stay and the architecture of buildings around the sq is amazing. We arrived at 2pm and wanted just to sit down and have a drink. However , the first restaurant insisted that we have lunch( so we left) the second we decided to share a pizza. What a mistake , it was the worst margarita I have ever had... Wafer thin base with the thinnest tomato & mozzarella topping one can imagine ( I think it was sprayed on!).. A pity that this lovely Sq is let down by poor quality
Good walking . You will have a fun time walking the maze of cobblestone streets and alleys in old town. Plenty of shops, places to eat and get a beer. And the view is free.
Stunning views. Everything you could wish for. Lovely eateries, views and entertainment. The old buildings are very lovely, its a photographers paradise.
Cute cobbles . The old town is just as romantic and special as the rest of Prague. A visit here is a step back in time. Just lovely to amble along the streets toward Charles bridge
Great Entertainment. The square provides a great opportunity to see performers, local sights and food and beer all in one area. It a great culmination of what Prague has to offer.

Lively and quaint!. There are lots of interesting sights to be seen around the old town but it is very busy. I would recommend if you are looking for somewhere to eat and drink, move away to the side streets where you will find great service, great food and all at a very reasonable price.

A must visit while in Prague. Walking through old town, be sure to stop and really look around. We walked through a number of different times while here and every time went a different way and saw many new sites. So many shops, restaurants, etc.Of course you need to see the clock! We were lucky enough to be there at 10;00 am and were able to see the little windows open and watch the figurines change in them.The evening before there was a performance going on and the music provided a great atmosphere!
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture. You have to walk to really appreciate the beauty of the place. Wear clothing and comfortable shoes. This is essential.

Great atmosphere and clean !. The atmosphere between the old buildings of Prague is just fantastic. Every main atraction is within walking distance another good thing about Prague is that it's very clean thanks to the army of nightmen you see everywhere.
Best location. I was very lucky to stay in a hotel in thee old town. This is an amazing truly historical part of Prague with so many things to see
Central for old town. Great place for starting to discover little streets. Some really interesting buildings, sometimes a few too many Segways, but other than that was good.

Wonderful. As you walk round the old town you get neck ache looking upwards at the beautiful buildings and all the different architecture you cannot come to Prague without falling in love with the sold Town

Dallas teachers love prague. On our Third visit to Prague we spent a week with our daughter and loved every minute Hotel was within walking distance of the old town square.we traveled all over the city went to cjesky budjvoice and to a nearby concentration camp, all In all we will be coming back next year for one more visit

DONT VISIT THE FOOD STALLS. The square is absolutely beautiful! Great place to visit. However don't get sucked in by the food stalls around the square- the ones selling old Prague ham and potato. They charge based on weight, it ends up costing the equivalent of a fancy restaurant in Prague. Most expensive street food we've had anywhere.

Old Town Walks. Be prepared for large groups of people, despite the open spaces for pedestrian traffic in the Old Town Square. Everyone waits to see the Astrological Clock. Be mindful of your belongings. If you are interested in group tours, this is the place to find different companies. Also, look out for people on segways. Now, you can walk and enjoy the history of Prague. Be sure to see the Memorial to Jan Hus, Havelska Market, Celetna Street with Powder Tower, the "Czech Art Nouveau" Municipal House, and the Klementinum. The shops here may not be the best bargains, especially on Karlova Sreet.
Sight seeing. First point, wear comfortable shoes as the ground is cobble stone.Fabulous architecture, well worth a visit.

History and music. This place in Prague is suitable for every hour of the day walk - all day long, late evening or during the night. Its vivid, yet peaceful, one can get coffee, wine, wi fi, pictures and music. Nice buildings. Dont forget about concerts in St Nicholas church - every day around 7 pm.
Beautiful quaint square. Lovely place spend lots of time here. See the old well maintained buildings all around. Many cafes in the vicinity. Take a metro to this square.

Advice. Just thought I would offer some advice on my first day in Prague I wondered why everyone was wearing plimsoles and trainers regardless of their outfit 24 hours later I found out.Most of the streets are cobbled or uneven I had wedged sandals or flip flops so I reverted to flip flip as my feet were very sore after one day on the pavements so advice take very comfy sensible shoes for days out.
Amazing. Amazing architecture but avoid the food stalls. Tasty but really expensive. Wander a couple 0of streets away from all the tourist traps and find cheap eats and drinks

Culture Vulture Visit. The architecture is beautiful. The shops are diverse and interesting. The ambiance is lovely.
Definitely worth a visit.
Amazing. Such an incredible place. Make sure you see the astronomical clock at the hour! Lots of great shops and food options around!

Love this Old Town. This medieval old town built beside the Vltava River, dates back to 1100 AD. The town is filled with old town charm. Attractions include the Old Town Square, Charles Bridge and Prague Castle. I visited all of them and enjoyed them all. If you can stay around the old town area, you can walk around and enjoy the night life.Happy Travelling!

Beautiful . The square is very picturesque and is lovely to walk around during the day or night. The astronomical clock is worth a look at, especially as the hour strikes as the doors open and wooden apostles make an appearance. Whilst we were there there was a large stage in the centre and people performed traditional dances and music in the evenings (I do not know if this is a seasonal thing). The restaurants are reasonably priced, but be warned that many charge an extra 50% on your bill to sit outside in the square opposed to inside.

Nice visit. Nice place to visit but a lot of tourists even in May. We spent few hours there and went up to the town hall to see the whole view of Praque which was really worth to go, beautiful scenery.

Exploring. This is such a beautiful place, these two towers are really special. If you look close you can see that the tower on the right is fatter than the left. That is because it is a love story behind. The tower on the right is the "maskulin" and the tower on the left is the "feminin". IT is fatter because the "maskulin" is supposed to protect the "feminin" from the sun. I think that is so cute. If you are in prague you should visit this awsome place

Beautiful Old History. This city has become quite the tourist attraction but it's beauty is not lost. Beautiful Architecture everywhere you turn, lovely little coffee spots around each corner and great bargains if you go a little further out.

Unbeatable Locatio. We spent 4 nights in Prague. I cannot imagine of a better location than this hotel to visit every worthy cathedral, museum, monastery etc. etc. The rooms overlook the place which is alive from 8am to 11pm. After a long day of sight seeing (we were walking 15-18km/day) we had everything we needed at the hotel or the restaurant all around the plaza.

The Best. Old town is a wonderful part of Prague! I could sit there all day and watch the world go by! There are food and drink stalls, restaurants, beautiful architecture and history! Everything you would want for a perfect place! I have visited many times and it is definitely my number 1 place!

Wonderful old World charm. Went during december so the Christmas Market was in full swing. There are many Christmas markets in and around the old town square and the setting just transports you back in time. Its like being in a Christmas Card

lots to see. it's like a little paris without the high prices and people stealing your wallet and Iphone Great czech beer and pork. Get some gelato at the U Prince hotel kiosk outside the hotel, the coconut is amazeballs!!

Wander the Side Streets - Step Back in Time. The side streets emanating from the Old Town Square are filled with shops - everything from Cartier's and Patek Phillipe, to Clark's Shoes and Hard Rock Café; you can find anything your heart desires that your wallet can afford. But, traverse a little further, along the side-side streets, and discover the quaint eateries, the local beer joints, and the craft and artisan shops, enroute to museums, synagogues, countless churches, and architectural wonders that occupy each nook and cranny. BE Sure to bring small euro-change for WC's (public toilets are few and far between, and typically cost 25-50 eurocents). Feet tired of cobblestone? - the sidewalks and streets become progressively modern, but the history continues, and you are never from a bus, tram, or underground station.
Prague city centre. It was quite busy end of May. I imagine it will be unbearably busy in high season particularly around the Astronomical Clock and Charles Bridge

" Old Town Square - Amazing ". Its a very busy square, always buzzing, day or night. I loved walking around the narrow streets and looking at the amazing Architecture, the Astronomical Clock. Prague is a great city to visit ans is simply beautiful, and this square is the epitome of that beauty. It's a must see place on your visit.

Prague the pride of Czech Republic. Beautiful and well preserved and maintained historical old town.. It was a very pleasant experience cruising in the river Vitava. The town square is place to enjoy food and surroundings.The astronomical clock is a place of great attraction.The 16th century clock chymes every hour and displays the Priests going round in a circle for a minute. The Charles bridge on the river gives a beautiful view of the city.

Energy. Whether you're an early morning riser, an afternoon stroller, or a late night prowler, Old Town is an awesome place to be. There is a lot to see and experience in this little but big nook in Prague. In every season, there is always something special to be here for. A spring sunrise at Charles Bridge, Christmas shopping at the markets, or a cold brew in the square on a summer evening. Old Town is definitely one of the best places to be!
Sunny Bank Holiday in Prague. Lovely walking around the Old Square, seeing the historic Astronomical Clock, horse drawn carriages, street entertainers, traditional market.

Busy day at the Old Town Square. We visited the Old Town Square around noon on the first warm Saturday in Prague. It is very busy as they were preparing for the Prague Marathon the next day. Several outdoor restaurants were teeming with locals and tourists. In and around the restaurants were abundant shopping venues. The square in very large with numerous kiosks. Prague is a great city to visit and the Old Town Square is the center of activity.
Good walk . One of the things to do is to go to Old Town it's beautiful with history. Architecture and lovely photo opportunities.

Overwhelmingly beautiful, must see. Prague is simply beautiful, and this square is the epitome of that beauty. It's a must see and is so close to all of the other squares be sure and take the time to go there. It's a visual blend of centuries, back to almost the earliest buildings. Some of it's side alley's are more narrow and very fun with lots of shopping and eats.

Beautiful city, drowning in us !. Very beautiful city, very clean and safe. Some really nice bars and places to eat. Essentially it's an outdoor museum, with a stroll round the city over a couple of days a very rewarding experience. Lots of cultural diversions too, but bear in mind the national art collection is spread over several sites. Taxis can be a bit hit and miss unless you get the obviously regulated ones with a green livery. Only drawback......us, people and in particular large numbers of stag parties on drunken benders. Having said that, they are easily avoided

Great evening Buzz. Perhaps the sunshine helped, but his place was always buzzing, day or night. Plenty of entertainers, too many Segway people though. Great for people watching, and all the restuarants overlooking it are NOT expensive as most people seem to think. Its a great place to chill.

Perfect spot filled with shops and cafes. Our hotel was less than 5 minutes walk away from Old Town Prague, and we made the short visit every night that we were in Prague. Their are food stalls with delicious local foods(sausages, haluschki, hams) and their are also cafes, lounges,and shops all around the immediate area. The scenery and feel in and around Old Town was wonderful, and we placed it right behind Rome out of all of the places we've visited throughout the world. Its definitely worth a visit if in Prague in our humble traveler opinions.

Private Tour. Prague is an amazing town. The building, streets, attractions are full of political significance and history. If you are really interested in learning facts, tales, and legends, I totally recommend the services of Radka Vocetkova. She is knowledgeble, excited about her work, willing to share all she knows, and most of all a very pleasant person to be. My husband and I had a very enjoyable time strolling the streets of Prague and attractions with her. She gave us tons of super useful tips. It was a really wonderful experience,
Very pleasant. A quick visit here but very pleasant, clean, with a huge selection of bars, restaurants and shops. A lovely atmosphere and very chilled- such beautiful buildings here too!!

Worth a visit despite the crowds. As famous as Prague's Old Town is, you find the narrow streets and large squares overrun with tourists at all hours. Go visit anyway--it's worth it! Beautiful churches and buildings are around every corner. Besides the obvious visit to the astronomical clock, we tried to peek into side streets and smaller squares and corners. We discovered a magical puppet shop and brought home some great gifts. I can also recommend getting some tickets for a classical concert from the Via Musica office by the Tyn church.

Fun area!. We thought this was such a fun area. We ate at several restaurants on the square and were able to have a great view of the astronomical clock. We also took a tour of the City Hall which was very interesting to see the rooms below ground. They had an area where people were selling food made right there - we loved the spiral pastry things on a stick.
Beautiful architecture. The cubism architecture is a wonderful sight, so many well designed and attractive buildings. Lots of cafe's and eat on the street food.

Impressive. As soon as u walk in you are meet with this giant church, it's so large I could not stand far enough back to get a photograph, We spent hours here walking around and we could have spent more. We found a little shop inside that sells jewellery and brought a beautiful pair of handmade earrings. The views of Prague from here are the best.

Old World Charm. The cobblestones, the clock tower, the church, the square, all of Old Town is amazing. The first couple days were very hectic because we hit the Prague Marathon weekend, but after things quieted down it was easy to navigate and beautifully charming.
Best Place!. This place is amazing! I would recommend to do it with a tour guide to learn and know everything about the old town.

Amazing Prague. The old town is amazing!
That can walk an hour. There's a lot of souvenirs, cafes, restaurants and an amazing atmosphere. Mily Everywhere there are people willing to advise. Prague has its own atmosphere.

Beautiful Square. I loved my visit to the old town square in Prague. The buildings are so beautiful and the square has a fantastic busy atmosphere with music playing and street performers. I could have spent so much more time there. A MUST visit when in Prague.
beautiful plaza. beautiful plaza .me enough world list of CLOCK .kalyteri hour visit after dark .pera of the big hotels in the area for eating out to look for closely spoil the small CZECH haunts
Beautiful old town. Prague old town is full of extremely beautiful renoavted buildings and I absolutely loved those pretty stone walkways. Everything is at walking distance.
Quite buzzing. The old town is quite buzzing and good to spend time in the evenings. There are many stalls and lots of things to eat.

Always beautiful. Definitely a place you must not miss when visiting Prague. Although it's obviously a tourist area the locals are very welcoming and the area is always very lively.
We were lucky to visit during a 3 days festival period. There were performance and various shops on the streets.
Loving prague!
So Beautiful!. Unbelievably magical, beautiful city, and so affordable for Americans. Plan a trip in spring or early summer and see this gorgeous place!
Anniversary . Old town square is beautiful always something going on . We went in May and there was lots of dancing and singing with loads of places to eat
Busy and brilliant. You cannaot visit Prague and not see this area, lovely architecture loads to see, just pick a seat and people watch. Lovely

Great Place to Visit. I returned for the 6th May in a row with 15 university students. Everyone always loves the OldtbTpwn square. Don't miss it! BUT A TIP: DO NOT USE CHEQUEPOINT to exchange your cash for Czech koruna. The gave us half of what they posted as the X change rate. The exchange rate was supposed to be 23 koruna to the dollar and they gave us 12. Avoid them at all costs!

An amazing mix of architecture. The Old Town of Prague has the most impressive collection of architecture, from the medieval to Art Deco, with plenty of Baroque. The beautiful contrast with modern amenities is fascinating.

Beautiful. If you go to one little street where you believe nothing will be in, you will be surprised because there will be a lot to see. I recommend for you to explore everything in your own speed. You can possibly find everything by walk.

Allow for getting lost. This is a varied neighborhood with historic buildings, attractions, and squares, dozens of tunnels and alleys, tourist stores and restaurants. Allow time to get lost and be armed with a good map. Orient yourself with the large buildings and squares as well as the river.

Wonderful area but crowded. Everyone seems to enjoy the Old Town area which along with the castle complex is the most visited area of Prague. However be prepared for large crowds all the time. For us it made spending a lot of time there impossible as we find walking through very crowded narrow streets less enjoyable. Still it is what sightseeing in Prague is about.

One of the best in Europe . The old town has to be visited, if you come to Prague full of interesting things to see and experience. You have to try one of the cones of ice cream and then head down to Charles bridge to eat and watch the world go by. Depending on where you have come from there will be lots to see if you start at the powder tower and then down to the bridge you won't be disappointed.
Charming square. Open, large square with many restaurants in the area. The astronomical clock is a must see when visiting here. Street performers gather here, and gives a good vibe in the square.

100% can't miss. This is easily one the most beautiful European urban focal points I have ever seen. The combination of architectural styles with the rich historical landmarks make this square stunningly beautiful. Charles bridge is also just a short walk away through some of the most beautiful cobbled streets you will ever see.

Absolutely Wonderful Area. It was amazing to walk around old town Praha. I've been here about two weeks and know all the metro stops, trams, buses, etc like the back of my hand. I think traveling through old town, you need a plan. A few people speak English, especially in that part, but try not to get overwhelmed if you dont' find someone that speaks English. Go to the bridge, the clock tower, walk through the square. Get Trdelnik and some slabs of ham! Such a beautiful place.

A hub for culture.. Unsure if I was lucky but when I wandered through to old town there was a lot going on. A stage was set up, cultural happenings had been occurring and were continuing into the evening. I found it an excellent spot to enjoy the grand buildings of different designs and a fantastic way to feel the true history of European culture.Some businesses may be out of place but with an open mind you can enjoy every second spent there.

Old town is the place to experience. We stayed in an apartment in the old town and loved every minute of it. It's a beautiful part of Europe never mind Prague. The history oozes from every vein of this cobbled part of the city. Lots to see, plenty of places to eat, drink and shop. Whatever takes your fancy. Gets very crowded at peak times so maybe one to dip in and out of as the mood takes you. Lots of tour groups, stag dos and large parties.
Quaint Area. Lovely place to stroll around as this area does not allow cars. You get an old world charm with cobble stone streets, a nice market place and friendly people.

Definitely go up the City Hall tower. Nice square with the biggest Christmas Market. The place to be in the evening to enjoy the sights and sounds. Definitely go up the tower to look out over the old town. Don't just stay in the square though - walk through the winding streets and marvel at how close the buildings are and the mix of all the different styles of architecture. A unique thing in Europe since this part of town was never bombed.

Gorgeous gothicly influenced city. For those who love history and those who don't, being in Stare Mesto will win you over. It will make you feel as if you're walking on the set of Game of Thrones or something. The city has a wonderful gothic influenced architectural style, it gives off an almost old world romantic vibe that is much different than Paris. Although Paris is the city of love, Prague is the city for those who have old souls, those who love getting lost in books, art and history.
Awesome!. Wonderful to be visited during the day, but at night is awesome. You can party, or even get lost in the small streets, and if you want just a drink, there are many squares.

Great city with special flair! . A great city with special flair and locations! It's perfect for shopping, sightseeing, historical places and buildings! It's perfect for cheap food and restaurants! We still paid for 5 days inclusive 5 stars hotel only near 500 euro! Prague iyou should visit once in lifetime! If you have possibility you have to stay more days not only one!

Must see when in Prague. We followed a guide to do a loop in Old Town. It contains some of the best historical spots. We stopped at the Cubism Building for lunch and would have sat out on the balcony except for a sudden rain shower. The tour takes one to the Old Town Square and several churches. Don't miss.
Amazing Prague. Loved every minute of my time in Prague. Excellent city.Buildings are amazing and the people are so friendly and helpful. Cheap to eat and drink. Will definitely be returning.

Heart of the town. There are lots of attractions in the main center of old town. All the attractions align their timing to the astronomical clock because when it is time to ring all the people at the center runs directly across the astromical clock. You should also visit the church.
Too much tourists. Our trip to Prague was spoiled by peoples with monopods. They where in every coner of this city. It was in July

Beautiful. One of the more beautiful cities I have visited for sure. The old square has many historic buildings but also us a hub of life with patios bars and shops. It was a little too crowded but still an amazing place to visit

So much to see and do. Old town square is just beautiful. We spent most of our day around this area. With lots of side streets with shops and museums and so many restaurants and bars. Lots going on in the square, music, entertainment. The clock chimes every hour with a beautiful feature with moving characters. The square gets very busy but is still really accessible.

Beautiful Heart of The Old Town of Prague. A must visit and not just for the architecture and the Old Clock. Sit at one of the many restaurants surrounding it and unlike other world tourist hot spots, you will not be ripped off. Yes, prices are higher but not over the top. We had a litre of wine and shared a pizza for only £20.

Magical atmosphere. It's great just strolling through the square on way to other sights or just sitting at a table in one of the bars surrounding the square people watching. There are people on 'Segways' offering tours but it wasn't for me...but I can imagine they are fun.

you begin your trip here and your trip here. center of everything touristic about the city. Everyday, You walk here first and you walk here last (if you dont count the the walk you have to take to the hotel back)

best place to be in. lively and very energetic place , fun loving peoples all around,a must visit,
shopping ,music, games ,fun

A great spot to have a drink and people watch!. Lively as well as a beautiful and historic spot. Always plentygoing on and a good variety of places to have a drink and a bite to eat. Whilst prices are a little higher than elsewhere they are not exorbitant and the entertainment factor of the square is worth the extra.

Great picture. Lovely Square. It was a very scenic Square with great buildings around we could take a drink take knickknacks and really enjoy your day hanging around.
All Top luxury brand stores are just few metres away
Very interesting. Would recommend Prague to visit excellent.people very friendly & great restaurants & culture.weather was good so helped in sightseeing too
Great sights. You could spend days here. Food, shopping, history. It's all here. Don't miss the clock. The food vendors have some great grilled meat. Everything is very affordable.
Living history . Lots to see and discover most of the locals are friendly. The church is well worth a visit the painting's are amazing

Cultural shock. A very beautiful and interesting city with a lot of history ! Many bar and restaurant are very good.. Good moment to share around a beer or a glass of wine... The Famous and oldest Synagogues of Europe.. Very passionate.. We spend intense moment visiting the past...

Old town charm. The architecture is beautiful, everywhere you look is a picture. The buildings are mainly medieval however new buildings have been created using the same facade and cleverly painted to appear authentic and blend in to the surrounding buildings.
Prague is a city of surprises as around each corner you are confronted with yet another spectacular edifice.

amazing charm and archetecture. Just stand, turn around and around and stare. So many grand buildings right there in front of you. Buildings and churches to visit and marvel at. The famous clock tower to climb and take photos from. The jazz musicians to listen to. The 'gold people' to laugh at. The horse drawn carriages to ride off in. The vintage cars, the mini train, some small tour coaches all to take you further to explore this fine medieval city. The many restaurants and cafes surrounding the square complete with heaters and blankets to keep you cosy. And I'm sure there's more in this cobbled square
beatiful place. Great place to start visit in Prague. There are a lot of churches, monuments, attractions and places to stay and eat or drink beer.
Amazing Architecture.. Lovely area, just make sure you look up to appreciate it all! It us quaint, & lovely to just sit down at one of the many restaurants & take it all in.

Check for the lunar clock tower. One of the most picturesque place in East Europe, lovely and always alive, good and interesting for visit, not so if you are looking to be lonely:) Watch for Clock tower at Stary Namestny and place where the J. Guss was executed and it has started the 30 years war in Europe. Nice and always worth a visit place.

Heart of Prague. Loved the place for its unusual atmosphere! Both wrapped with historical sights, buildings, and original open-air market, in the last could be purchased more than enough, both souviners and useful staff. With many cosy caffees and happy people all around! ))
A top 10 sight. If you're visiting Prague, you definitely need to go here. Look at the astronomical clock, climb the tower, and eat at one of the restaurants for the ambience.

Nice :). Beautiful and well preserved architecture. Fairly easy to navigate, provided you have a map. Quite a lot of people about but definitely worth the crowd. Unmissable if you're in Prague for any considerable amount of time

Old Town. A must see, the history is incredible , we went with our travel group and had an excellent local guide.
Crowds are heavy but not hard to get around.
The cathedral is worth the trip if you see nothing else .

Better Than Expected, Prague Casts a Spell. This visit was my husband's idea; I gravitate towards France and Italy. So I was quite unprepared for the charm of Prague and the crowds who swarm here even in May. Just sit at any sidewalk cafe in the Old Town and you can watch an endless stream of people, mostly European but also Japanese. The Moravian white wine is excellent, which more than makes up for the heavy Czech cuisine. And the architecture is unique--Gothic with a Czech twist. I could happily spend a week here.

Richness in architecture. One of the most beautiful and enchanted squares in Europe. There's a variety of buildings, colours, styles, restaurants, palaces, churches (Thýn and Nicholas Church), the Astronomical Clock, and also the monument in hammage to Jan Huss, the predecessor of Martin Luther, who was burned by the Catholics because of his beliefs.

Beau. The Old Town Square in Prague is fantastic day or night. Lots of positive energy. Great vendors in booths and regular bricks and mortar stores. Great street food. Fun to walk through at night with all of the historic building lit up. Magical!
Must see, easy to walk around. This small area is full of history and fun places to visit. Lots of cafés and stores as well. Touristy at times but worth the visit

In the heart of the city. This is high on the "must see" list for tourists. The astronomical clock, church, shops, restaurants, and street performers make it interesting when passing through. The cobblestone streets all through old town are hard on the feet (especially for people with sensitive feet). It would be nice if there were some benches for people to sit and rest.

must see on european travel. went on warm sunday. very crowded. lots of history in compact area. shopping good. clean safe. what else to say. history galore. architecture galore. Outdoor dining. Had a fairly large Starbucks.

Beautiful but quite crowded. We went after dinner time so that's why it was so crowded. I noticed a couple of pick pocketers so be warned! Other than that, the buildings were well maintained and it was a beautiful place to take pictures or to just sit down and have a cup of coffee.

The heart of Prague!. Old Town quarter; Stare Mesto is literally the life of Prague. With its Old Town square it is one of the most beautiful urban spaces in Europe! There is a maze of narrow streets to explore.This is also the area through which the "Royal Route" passes from the Powder gate along Celetna to Old town square through Karlova and Charles Bridge to the Prague Castle.Eat ice cream; try small pizzerias; window shop; walk in to many designer shops; see the art work; drink beer and soak in the placeHighly recommended.

Wonderful Prague. Loved this town, loved meandering the many cobblestone streets, loved the restaurants, loved the history! Only problem is that at times, it gets overrun with tourists and we felt like one ant amongst a million!

Nice square with many restaurants.. We had the pleasure of hearing the Prague philharmonic orchestra play in the square it was a highlight of our visit. I do think the clock is over rated, but very nice to see.
Magic of mystic. Amazing architecture and awesome construction. This part of the town transports you into another era. Looks like a lot of effort is being made to keep it in the same way.
Beautiful architecture . Old town looks beautiful. It is truly an architectural marvel!! Loved the buildings, the clock and the music played.. wonderful vibe the place has.. but very overcrowded.

Lovely Place. The Old Town is a buzzing hive of activity with lots going on. There are restaurants, bars, cafes, shops, horse drawn tour vehicles, street food vendors, churches to visit and the wonderful ancient Astronomical clock. Everything is lit up in the evening giving a magical feel.
Great atmosphere!. The old city has a great atmosphere with many old and beautiful buildings and small streets. The area is crowded with tourist all the time.

Blown away!. We had a hotel right around the corner of the clock. It was so cool. The clock is amazing. There are so many details and figures on it. There are sometimes festivals in the area and the food is great. I really enjoyed it and recommend it. August 2013

most gorgeous yet fun place in prague. its like out of a fairytale - the cobble stone streets, the architecture, the buidings and its extremely lively with people and bustling with energy - cafes bars etc.
Pretty buildings oozing with history. The square is as impressive in real life as in the guide books. Full of tourists of course, and this was only in May! Nice street food to be had.

must see!. It was an overwhelming experience. Personally, I feel that this place is perfect. They combined a bit Italy, Paris, and Australia in the small beautiful portions. The street is old and artistic. The old building is amazing, you can see lots of iconic place (powder tower, astronomical clock, many churches, etc.) in around! Must try the Trdelník, the Prague iconic food. Try it with the modern touch or not, still delicious!

Beautiful Culture and Landscape. Rich in history and beauty, my favourite way to wind down after a busy day of sightseeing and walking was to settle in at a pavement cafe around the square for an ice cold frosty mug of Pilsner Urquell.
Stunning City. Completely unspoilt city in the old town, beautiful building and an abundance of restaurants to choose from, all mostly very cheap. Fantastic.

Better than expected. This trip was my wife's idea but I found I enjoyed it immensely. Lots to see and do. We enjoyed the architecture, the jazz clubs, te food, the drink and the general buzz. 4 to 5 days was about right for us but we may well go back for a visit in December for the Christmas Fairs.

Amazing Architecture. It is hard to fathom the variety of architecture in the Old Town Square alone. Side streets converging in the Square are fun for shopping, eating, and enjoying a brew or glass of wine. Comparing architecture from Gothic, Baroque, Rococo, and Renaissance in one place. Wow.

Enchanting square. A lovely square full of entertainment, photographic opportunities and the big clock. It seems time stands still as the crowd stops moving mesmerised by the figures above the clock appearing in the windows as it chimes each hour. Soak up the atmosphere and enjoy the many cobbled streets each with their hidden delights.
Must see in Prague. Hard to miss, but worth a walk through. Tons of shops and restaurants. Be prepared to pay Tourist Trap prices, but can't beat the atmosphere.

How old it can get? very... This old town made me wonder... how people used to leave those days?
How they passed the day..and do they appriciate the beauty of those building like we do?

back in time. I was lucky to be in the square thrice in four days.
loved to stand and view the astronomical clock.
not very crowded... colourful.. lovely place... old buildings.. restaurants .. artists performing.. u can easily spend an hour or two just wandering r gazing at passers by.

Great little place . Full of history and a number of landmarks and safe for solo travellers. Lots of things going on in the square. Lots of tours happening throughout the day and lots of nice bars and resturants to suit everyone.
Must go. Prague is very small, so is the old town. Great place to see beautiful architecture, cute tiny stores, etc. Dont miss going down Nerudova ST
You can´t go to Prague and not go here.. Very busy tourist square, but fun to see! Take a few photos, enjoy the views, then move on and enjoy quieter parts of the city.

Lots to see on these winding roads. We really enjoyed wandering through the small winding roads of Old Town. Yes, there are plenty of tourist shops, but there are also nice small boutiques and lots of great buildings to admire. You could definitely get lost - bring a map!
enchanting. Endless twists and turns- a warren of historical alleys and buildings. Plenty of eateries and beer halls. We got lost all the time and loved it!
Loads of places to eat and drink. Nice area of Prague, with plenty of restaurants and bars, would definitely recommend if visiting the city.

Splendid attraction. Magnificent piece of architecture work some years ago and still showcasing well to this generation. Everyone should visit Prague and the hidden gems in the city, there are many more places to visit within the city and can enjoy the local traditions, local people, wonderful food and so on

It stays with you..... What a wonderful place. WOW. See it in day light, you feel mesmerized. View it in the night, you will be completely lost. If you visit Prague and miss this place, you have not visited the country at all. With so many food options available within the square, be it roadside or a good restaurant, the place gives you an option to experiment with different cuisines. Should be in MUST VISIT places... atleast once in life time.

Too full. I have been living in Prague for some months now and this square is one of the places that i try to avoid and circle around every time. Even though, at first sight, the buildings and astronomical clock seem (and are) very historical and architecturally interesting, it is just full of people most of the time. This includes tourist groups, youngsters on segways, party-ticket sellers and weird strip clubs salesmen or drunk foreigners at night. It loses its beauty very quickly when a person starts noticing all this.

Stunning ans atmospheric. This is a beautiful bustling place to visit by day or night. We particularly enjoyed strolling through early morning before going back to our hotel for breakfast. Not much was open at that time but you can really appreciate your surroundings...look up at the buildings as you wander through
Absolutely wonderful!. Metro from the hotel to here took no time at all. Spent all day here, as we had our bags, and just took turns wandering about. Sooooooo much to see!

Wonderful area. The reason to visit Prague is for the history and architecture, which is epitomised by the Old Town area. Just lovely to stroll around taking in the sights: however, it does get very crowded.Try to stay somewhere in or near the Old Town, so you can also visit around dusk when the lights come on and the buildings light up. Wonderful.
Gorgeous part of Prague. Wandering around the Old Town is an incredible experience. It's like stepping back in time. A map and a good pair of shoes is highly recommended.
Beautiful and historic old square. A large square surrounded by charming old buildings. Built prior to 1350 when Charles 4 built the new town. Its well worth walking around for at least a half hour.

A time travel to medieval times. a must if you visit Prague. Just follow the crowds.Ypu will enjoy every minute of it. The astronomical clock and the old town hall and Tyn cathedral is a must see and just to sit in a cafe in the square and enjoying the surroundings would be lovely as well
Gorgeous architecture. Prague is a gorgeous city and easy to navigate. Don't miss taking in an opera at the beautiful opera house while there.

A Unique Sight. The Square is not that unusual for an older European city but the clock in the tower is amazing . Each of the Apostles comes to a window, bows, and moves on. The multiple facets of the clock and the accompanying carvings, symbols, etc. are incredible, I can't imagine the sophistication and the technical expertise for the time when it was constructed is just incredible. Many warnings about aggressive pickpockets, especially at the hour when the clock is in motion and everyone is looking through the lens of their camera . .
Great place to walk around.. Old Town has many beautiful buildings, restaurants, shops, and street vendors. There's something for everyone! The Paladium is a large, indoor mall for shopping.

Busy. Absolutely loved it here, a must see is the clock in the main square. architecture is stunning.A plethora of Cathedrals, Churches to explore each with it's own history and tales to tell.a rather macabre Museum of Torture, if you are in to that sosrt of thing,a chocolate museum.Just something for everyone
Great historical square. Really busy town square with a historical feel and the astronomical clock. Nice walk around and enjoy the atmosphere of Prague.

Full Immersion in Czech Culture!. It's a large square with Old Town Hall Tower in the middle.It feature many nice buildings and the very famous Astronomical Clock.On the top of the Astronomical Clock Tower there is a 360 degree view of the city.Be aware of the Prague Ham street vendors, some of them cheat tourists giving them wrong change or very small portions of the famous smoked and flavored pork meat.
Just stunning. Everywhere in this area is a beautiful building to be seen and admired. Keep looking up too as there is so much beyond eye level

Beautiful. What a clean, fresh and friendly place to be. Just don't look guilty in front of the armed police and military who are clearing off homeless people... The square is the hub of Prague and has lots of things to do! Go see the clock, climb the tower and do the usual panorama.Try the twisty doughy food with Nutella - divine! And also go to the wooden huts and grab a honey wine. When I was in Prague I was suffering from a nasty throat infection - honey wine did the trick!Go to Cafe Mozart for a private Jazz night - separate review or see the Salvador Dali exhibition whilst it's still there.Definitely go see this place, it's a must. Plus it's a UNESCO world heritage centre. Architectural cladded perfection!
Beautiful. :-) :-) :-) :-) it's wonderfull and have good restorants :-) There is a astronom clock and great weuw on town from old town catedral.
Beautiful buildings. Prague has the most amazing number of beautiful buildings. Of course you do have to share them with the other thousands of tourists !! :)
Prague city week. Nice city with pretty old city and polite people and excellent cuisine and beer. We can recommend a visit.

Good place to soak up the atmosphere . The Old Town square is a great place to go to eat, people watch, see the sights & the street entertainment. It's the heart of the city for tourism so gets busy but can also be empty if you time it right. The astronomical clock draws crowds every hour so be warned!

Prague sightseeing. . Simply breathtaking. There is not a spot in Prague you want to skip out on!
The architecture is amazing and make the effort of taking guided tours. There so many tidbits they have to share.

Magical. I've been in Prague at Christmas, it was completly magical. The Old Town looked like a fairytale, the beautiful mass and the christmas lights, and of course, the DELICIOUS hot wine (!) made it to be pure magic. A beautiful place to just stroll around and get lost.
Shops and shops. Not my kind of thing, way too many stores trying to sell everything and restraints not so authentic. But if u like a lot of people
.. beauty.... Simply beautiful...our tour guide was excellent with its history and fine details. Weather was perfect for walking and photos. WEAR comfortable shoes.

A World Heritage Site not to be missed. Stare Mesto is a UNESCO World Heritage Site not to be missed and worth a trip just for itself. Well maintained, with many wonderful historical monuments and great museums, terraces and restaurants, it is a perfect place to wander and get lost, although even when you try hard, you always get back to the Old Town Square where the Astronomical Clock strikes every hour.
walking tour. Good walking tours are available and is a very good way to see the city and learn about the history.

ATTRACTIVE ICON. Old town is a place to visit as a must when visiting Prague. It shows real history of the town and era and style of living of the residents of that time. You feel as if you are living in that era ,this is the beauty of this place.
Beautiful area.... Beautiful pedestrian zone, with a lot of architecture to enjoy, you can get amazing pictures! There are very good restaurants, too.
Central point. Lots of stunning architecture, street artists and excellent bars and restaurants - Astrological clock not to be missed in the hour.

Photo ops at ever turn. Old Town Prague is one of the most picturesque and walkable cities I've been to in Europe. Architecturally, it reminded me a bit of Vienna, without the hustle bustle. While none of the sights are "bucket list" items, they are there waiting to be explored or just observed while enjoying the local cafes.

Unspoiled old town. Definitely worth visiting before it is "westernized"!. A precious jewel, Old Town Prague is a well preserved area with beautiful buildings, plazas, churches and really, really nice people.

This will live in my heart. You can't visit Prague without visiting the Old Town. It's beautiful, historic, and filled with fun. There are food vendors on the periphery, or full-service restaurants. Pickup for many tours are located here, as well as horse-drawn carriages for romantic excursions. Visit at night for optimal photos, as they light it perfectly.

Turn back time. This place is very very nice.. My heart skipped a bit when i first got here. It feels like you are in the old time. I salute the people who lives in this country that they were able to preserved their old city. The roads are all cobble stones. You will be really amazed how the people before were able to build those castles, churches and buildings especially in the golden times we know that there are no machines to help them build. They are very artistic when it comes to architectures. Mosaics walls and ceilings. prague is really a must see!

Giant square with amazing views. Awesome open square with a surreal feel. Has everything from restaurants to street performers and an excited buzz in the air. Even if you don't stay long this is a must see in Prague.
Lovely architecture. The old town of Prague is really nice with all the amazing tall buildings,the Gothic church, the fascinating astronomical clock and the several synagogues.I loved it.
One of tourists spot. Prague old town is one of the busiest spot for tourists in the city many shops and restaurants and great buildings and sights to take pictures.
Wonderful. Enjoyed the astronomical clock and people watching. Also several food vendors to choose from. One note - most vendor/smaller restaurants only accept cash in Kroun.

Beautiful old buildings and hoards of tourists everywhere. The Old Town is at its best early in the morning before the hoards of tourist commence their days. At noon this place is already too crowded. Beautiful buildings all around and the history is present everywhere.

One of the most beautiful city center. This is the most beautiful city center I visited in the Europe. Astronomical clock, old town hall and tower are all worth every penny and watch. Street food and restaurant food is awesome and very cheap here.

a must see. crowded, lots of coffee shops and good restaurants
You feel the vibe of the city
local touristic shops

Of Medieval Architectures and Art Nouveaux. "It almost never rains in Prague," I heard on tour guide say as I was slowly getting wet from the morning downpour on the 4th of May 2016. Despite the unforgiving the old town square was flooded by a sea of people, oblivious to the rain, everyone eager to immerse themselves in the heart of Prague. I was among those people. Standing on the epicenter of Stare Mesto, I could not help but feel euphoric as I gazed at buildings built in the baroque, renaissance, art nouveaux and medieval styles. Prague is not Prague for nothing. Prague is Prague for everything. Come, hither!
Full of history. The place is full of history, old historical buildings I spent 4 hours walking tour I enjoy the story of area, the tour guide was informative.

Gorgeous must see!. There is no coincidence that Prague is so extremely popularIt is a no brainer! Prague Vienna Budapest the 3 Imperial Pillars are essential to uppreciate old Europe and its history and culture.

Remarcable well preserved for a former communist capiral city. Even in a weather that varied from icy storm to burning sun in a few hours, visiting Prague old town was a wonderful surprise. Obviously old buildings look as they have been renovated yesterday, a long walk in the company of a local guide being a real delight. As soon as the sun is free of clouds, old town will fill your camera memory card with beautiful images to remember!

The heart of Old Town. So much to see here! We found ourselves back here many times over the 4 days we were in Prague. The square is big enough to hold a lot of people so can be enjoyed by many at once. Plenty of places skirting the square to rest, relax and have a bite to eat.

Wow. The is a must see... The place is just lovely and the people too. Take a trip down to Charles bridge it's so beautiful.. The is a street with some lovely designer shops too if you want a little treat.. The bars and restaurants are good and cost can differ in the old town it's cheaper than the popular parts..

Tourist Attraction. Lovely area, small bust streets full of character and lots of options for dining, drinking etc.
Visiting the clock tower should be one of the first stops to help find your way around the city.
Had it all. Old town had it all...shopping, dining, sightseeing, history, and crowds. Although it was crowded, the people were friendly and the shopkeepers helpful and spoke English well.

Great Place - Historical and Beautiful. A must to visit when visiting Prague. The old town square is beautiful and there is a ton of activity there (people in the promenade playing games, cooking awesome food, and having fun. Take a panoramic of the square too (360 for the best effect!!).
Crowd central. Very picturesque, you just need to put up with the crowds of tourists...but then that's what we all are...

Not to be missed.. The old town square and the astronomical clock are "not to be missed" highlights of any Prague visit. And there are plenty of options to sit, have a beer, and people watch if you need a break.

Very crowded, however there is much to see!. Lots to see in Old town if you can stand the crowds. We did enjoy going to classical concert in the Church of mirrors. The church is lovely and the organ and violinists were excellent. We took the tour of the Klemantaruim (sp?) and the view from the top is excellent. Also wait til the top of the hour to see the clock change. Good shopping at the small scarf stores . Also loved The Mucca Museum.
lots to see. So many things going on. A group of people sitting on the ground looking at each other because people don't do that any more. Artists. Acrobats.

HISTORICALLY RICH. Very charming area....lots to see and do...friendly people and great buildings to visit as well as the Charles Bridge. The outdoor food kiosks were a joy to experience and we felt very safe walking about by ourselves.
A Must. So you can't go to Prague and not spend time in Old Town. It is all beautiful and a must see. On the down side, the square itself is very busy and crowded.
Amazing buildings. Lots of lovely twists and turns stumbling across tiny streets and courtyards . So many lovely gothic style buildings.

Must to have a walk. The lovely and photogenic, unique atmosphere, walk, breath and enjoy the magic of the streets and corners. Dont miss the tiny streets bringing a long history with them.. Just browse and feel the spirit

A MUST SEE!. Great for the family, great for friends and just yourself! Christmas in Prague is one of the most amazing experiences of your life. Vendors all over the square, hot wine, sausages and lots of other great stuff to munch on - not to mention the gorgeous Christmas tree.

Relax, unwind, enjoy.. Lots of people, food, entertainment. Sit back and enjoy. Make sure you enjoy the clock tower (read about it before you go to understand what is happening and how to read the clock). You will get so much more out of it. Climb the tower for great views. You can take an elevator if needed. You have to see Prague from this vantage point- incredible! Buy your ticket at the office just to the right of the clock. You can purchase early and avoid the short line.....then climb the tower anytime. About 8 minute climb with a few breaks.
The Highlight of Prague. We had a lovey time here, weather is always great in my opinion and Old town is certainly the place to be while in the Czech Republic!
The Square. Its a must to see the square be there on the hour to see the amazing clock ,lots of atmosphere and plenty to see and lots of eating places.

Old Town has its charm --- and mostly crowded. Notable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. Little wonder that it is busy all the time! Still, a must-see place especially the CLOCK!
Beautiful. It was nice and vibrant. The small shops buzzing with people and really worth a visit. The hot wine is amazing on cold days accompanied by their local TRDLO!

Prague is fantastic!. I could have used weeks in Prague there was so much to see and do! I stayed at the Downtown Hostel & Pension which was great - perfect location right by the National Theater (Narodni Divadlo), lots of assistance from the wonderful staff, free tours - everything you need including a nice big kitchen. Can't wait to go back! I would also recommend the Sandemans New Free Tours - excellent - you just tip at the end according to the value you received which for me was great! The only thing I hope for is that they realize in Prague how having Segways flying in every direction - the most I have ever seen anywhere in the world - is destroying it. There are way too many and no regulation so you are constantly watching out for them.

A must do. The Old Town is home to Prague's major tourist attractions. The buildings are very impressive and interesting. It is very clean and despite it being busy with tourists, felt relaxed and easy going. The market in the main square provides opportunity to buy food and drink, but you are probably better off going a bit further afield if you don't want to pay a premium.

Old Town (Stare Mesto). It's a good central place to meet people or start your solo tour of the city. They have food but tourist prices. There are cool buildings to see. Fancy shopping, walking distance to Jewish Quarters and to New Town. There are Starbucks with WiFi too.
Central location. Centrally located for all tourist easy to getaway anywhere in the prague.ideal place to change our currency with best rates and to hire a segway
Happening. Always something going on on the square. You can drink and eat out in the open, on a restaurant or just walking around looking at street artists or other tourists.
Very interesting place to visit. Fascinating place to go to lots of interesting buildings. Check out all the history which is extensive
Lively. Went on Friday night. Very charming and lively. One of the nicest area I have been in Europe. A lot of restaurants with terrace, numerous boutique for everyone, nice atmosphere.

GREATEST ARCHITECTURE AND CULTURE AND EASY TO NAVIGATE AROUND. Great City easy to walk anywhere top culture and great architecture friendly folks and good value for the buck like less then 50% cost on anything generally it was 4 times USA value:
good food great beers wonderful desserts love Prague will go back
Anthony Morrocco CEO

Very enchanting. The Prague Old Town is incredibly well preserved, clean and neat. It is so nice to browse through the old narrow streets and passes. There is a lot of street entertainment, shops and restaurants.

Outstanding - Beautiful - Amazing. We loved the character of Prague's Old Town. The Town Square is beautiful; the clock tower an amazing technological feat for the 1500s' and delightful to watch on the hour. The architectural details of the surrounding homes and shops are pretty, unique, varied. We spent three days in Prague and walked to the Old Town every day because we enjoyed it so much.
Beautiful but over crowded.. The architecture is wonderful. However this place is very touristy so it is packed full of restaurants, shops and bars.
awesome pictuesque setting. the views were stunning and entertainment outstanding lots to see and take part in as part of out short break
Weekend trip.. We walked around in the old town each day. Always discovering some new sights , more shops or exiting building. Plenty to see and do.

Nice place. There are lots of nice buildings in the old town with nice shops, cafés and restaurants.
Went for a "ghost walk" which was very nice.
Great . Great city to walk through. I had the time of my life walking through the old city of Prague . Make sure you have enough energy we had walk 16 km. No regrets as we had a fantastic time
Nice Square. Some lovely buildings both on and just off the Square. The clock gathers the crowds every hour for its show but be warned that pick pockets can try take advantage of this.
must see in Europe!. Amazing! I was there n May, during the weekend. I reccomend to visit it in the early mornings, when there are not so many people :)

Just lovely. It is impossible to visit Prague and not take a walk through this beautiful part of the city. It is amazing to see culture and nowaday life coexist in this part of the town. Also, the famuous astrological clock and tower is located here. Absolutely amazing!
Busy during bust times. Visit here late or very early in the mornings it's beautiful but can't see the beauty through the crowds

more tourists than actual interest.. one of those musts you hear of and go to but ask your self why you bothered.the other part of the river is much more unique.
of course we saw the clock exchange the hour,but taking in account that we live in an electronic world,the mechanic system that thrilled 200 years ago is not so exciting in 2016.

Heart of Prague. Old Town is beautiful to walk and eat, nice cobblestone roads and cafes. From 10AM onward the old town square gets really crowded till late night. Early morning is the best time to visit the square. I went there around 4:30 early morning to take photographs and still could see lot of people/groups hanging around..some returning after partying. Having said that, it is a must visit place if you are in Prague, very electrifying atmosphere in the evening and very calm and relaxing in the early morning.

Watch the Clock Strike but take time to expore history. The striking of the Town Clock is well worth waiting for,with its figure of death nodding as time towards the end passes, and the other figures shaking their heads in disagreement and the upper windows open to show the saints in the tower. Our guide like every other city dweller we met rejoiced in the freedom from communism and expressed .such national pride.Take the time to find the plaques to Kepler, Einstein, Smetana... Look up to see the baroque facades of buildings. Look down to see the brass tiles that record the homes of Jews who were taken to the concentration camps.And stop for a beer and wonderful apple pie in one of the many restaurants. Hire your own guide (like everything in Praque it won't cost you too much) for a personal exploration of the Jewish Quarter with it museum Synagogues and the still in use one - but remember Shabbat starts at sunset on Friday and Passover and the High Holidays are times you can't see as much.

must do!. We went here numerous times in three days - all roads lead here! Whether to watch the clock - eat - shop - or experience life in Prague, the square and surrounding streets were fascinating to visit. Great time.
charming old town. Lots to see, lots to do in this historic area and with the current conversion rates, prices are just right.

The astronomical clock. Turn up just before the hour to see the astronomical clock operate. On a weekday at 10am we were able to get a great view. Don't miss the grand cafes lingering from the 20's, especially the Imperial and Slavia.

Plenty to see. Don't just check off the astronomic clock in the Old Town Square. Do look up, there's an extraordinary range of architectural decoration, as you wander round the cobbled pedestrian area. Don't spend your money too quickly, as it's well said that the closer to the Old Town Square you get, the lower the quality and the higher the price!

Beautiful buildings. If you are into taking photos and making great memories you must visit this old town.
Buildings are parts from history and its breath taking.

Beautiful architecture. The big square is filled with beautiful buildings from different eras. There are few cities with such a high concentration of lovely, old structures. Tourists like to gather around the Astronomical Clock at the hour. A trip to Prague is incomplete without wandering around here.
Probably best in Europe. Old town is just awesome. Its huge and classic. Visit it on weekend to enjoy the crowd the activities and the attractions.. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Crowded but nice place. The old town of prague is one of the nicest and oldest historic areas in Europe. Of course there are a lot of tourists but you can really see a lot of intersting buildings, churches and plaes.
Awesome. The heart of Prague where you get the true experience of Prague. It became the centre of our universe
Must See. Could not get tired of strolling the old town. So much to do! enjoy a concert in one of the Churches, its inspiring.

Historic and atmospheric. Despite the constant throng of tour parties walking pass you following their tour leaders' umbrella, this is a place worth visiting. History is all around you and the architecture takes your breath away. Find a good coffee and take it all in.

A must do with teens . We visited Old Town on our first full day here. We had signed up for a free tour and saw many of the historical sites as well as people watched during intervals. We saw St. Nicholas' Church, the church that the astronimcal clock is on and learned of its history. We will be going back in another day to get a closer look. Such a beautiful setting and interesting history. Great for teens.

A step back in time. It's such a beautiful place to sit in a cafe, have a drink and just take it all in. There are a lot of people but you just have to make it your own. This is such a magical place, it's just like a fairy land!
Nice place. Very nice and beautiful. Everytime we passed by it it appeared new. This type of architecture takes one back in history.

A Well Preserved Example of Old Europe. I love this part of Prague. It is one of my favorite squares to visit in Prague. You can get a real sense of the heart and soul of Czech history. The different types of architecture really is interesting. Gothic. Baroque. Neo-Classical. The astronomical clock is a true marvel for its time. If you are interested there is a good explanation of his it works.

Definitly add to your visit schedule . We visited this area by April last when winter was over. The place is very lively with lots of restaurants, guides, individual and team performances. All major places are walkable from this place including Prague palace , Charles bridge, synagoue s, churches.

Beautiful. I would loved to have had 3 weeks instead of 3 days to see this beautiful city!! So much to see. I really wanted to see the old Jewish cemetery but the lines for tickets were too long and not moving.

The Marvel of Prague. This is a must visit Place in Prague. This is fully crowded on the weekends. The Old Town square is basically a place where you see a lot of historical monuments which are interesting if you are a History Lover..Total time needed is around 45 min to spend there but it all depends on your interest.The hop on Hop Off bus operates from here & you can easily move to other places of interest from here.The recommendation is to walk through the streets of Prague's from Old Town Square to the Charles Bridge.. This will give you a chance to taste the local food & the desert on the street.. An enjoyable & a memorable walk !!We visited this place on almost a rainy day of Springs but it was not at all a problem..
One word! other worldly!!. Maybe I haven't been places, but the first time I saw this setting I only wanted to sit down for a bit

Great for getting your bearings!. The old town square is in the heart of Prague, therefore it makes a good place to head to if your unsure of your bearings. Beware cafes, restaurants and bars in the square charge top prices, better to get down the side streets where prices are more realistic.

Nice place for a walk. Plenty old beautiful buildings and restaurants and pubs. Be there at full hour to enjoy the 'performance' of the clock ;) And be careful when buying things in small shop around - price may be 3x of what you would pay in supermarket

My favourite place on earth. When you're not young anymore, not yet old and that your friends are spread all over the world, there's a place where to meet and to party and that place is prag
:-))))))

Must see!. This is Prague at its finest. The square is clean and safe. There are many cafes within the square to eat and people-watch. Lots of quaint stores for shopping. Tower tour looked really interesting, but I didn't have time. Be sure to visit in the day and at night. Both are beautiful!
Beautiful. I'm in love with this city! 3 days is definitely not enough to see even a half of it. For sure i will come back.

Stunning architecture, magical place.. Beautiful both at day-time and early evening when the illuminations come on, Old Town is a must for a first visit to Prague. However, restaurants around there are more than reasonably priced due to the amount of tourist interest and as always it's important to own a money belt or something to keep your belongings hidden away from any opportunistic pick-pockets (but this is the same in any capital city) Architecture is magnificent, and it's free to just walk around and take in the magical atmosphere this ancient place offers. We found it archaically romantic! Wear comfortably shoes and can't account for what it's like walking around it in the rain as when we were there is was sunny and warm.

Lots of people watching from cafés and restaurants here. Typical European square. Enjoyable to eat, drink and watch the world go by however we were a bit disappointed by the astronomical clock's hourly performance.. given the number of people each hour who you hear say "is that it??" after the automatons perform

Beautiful sights and fun shopping. Definitely spend some time in Old Town Square. The clock tower is worth the trip alone, but it's close to many of the other sights as well and has many restaurants and shops to visit as well.

Must go!. Top prague tourist destination. If you havent been to the Old Town, you havent been to Prague. Its a must go for everyone visiting Prague. There are so many importants building and monuments here.

Stunning but unsurprisingly Very Busy. Shockingly enough it was very busy but to be expected when going to tourist hot spots, Be prepared to wind your way through the numerous amount of Tourist Groups who without fail always seem to stand in your way. :)

Beautiful place. This is such an unspoilt place in terms of architecture. It reminded me of the square in Bruges. The only downside is the bars around the place with the usual hordes of stag parties and their endless drinking.
Beautiful old buildings.. Before going to Prague on this trip, I knew nothing about this city. I could not believe the hundreds of beautiful old buildings!! I took many pictures!

Hundreds of years of history.. I just looked at a painting from the 900's in a church. And bones, and an enormous silver statue to mark the grave of a Saint and more. St. Vitus Cathedral is a repository of artifacts from so many ages. Your feet walk where so many have gone.

Old Town Square. The heart of the Old Town of Prague. Make sure you get up the tower with the Astronomical clock. You get great view and you can either use an elevator or walk up the ramp (no staircase here:-) ), worth of visit is also the Tyn Church with beautiful decoration inside.

Beautiful. I love Prague! And I know you will love it too. You will find a big crowd, so be patient when taking your pictures.
If you want to eat something, you could buy a Klobasa... they are very good.
Beauty. Prague is a must visit if you are on euro trip. Loved the old town square, rich in architecture with so much happenings.

Lovely place to eat and shop. I loved walking across the Charles Bridge and into Old Town. There are some amazing restaurants and shops to check out and you absolutely should not miss the astronomical clock or climbing the Old Town Hall Tower to get an ariel view of the city.
Beautiful city. Visited Prague in December 2015 and experienced the Christmas Markets. The trees and stalls were all lovely.
