Old World Charm. This is one of the few large cities in Europe that escaped being destroyed by bombing during World War II. It has wonderful architecture and that typical Old World charm that one travels to Europe to see.

You must visit the Old Town square. Simple as.. The pictures don't do it justice, go and see it for yourself. It's an impressive area filled with impressive architecture, with the Astronomical Clock, history and oozing culture. There are a number of pleasant restaurants around the square, but check the menu's first. There is quite a difference in price between them, ranging from pricey (but then it is the #1 attraction in Prague) to completely stupid prices (like £6+ for 0.3l of beer!).Couple of things to keep in mind: - Some might find how busy the area is to be a little overwhelming though - Watch out for prices; a number of restaurants are far too pricey. - People hiring Segways, constantly darting in between tourists can get annoyingEnjoy your visit, it is definitely worth it!
Lovely area. This is a lovely part of Prague, especially at night when the buildings are tastefully lit. The astronomical clock is in this area as are many restaurants and lovely old buildings.

The heart of Prague. The heart of Prague, definitely a place where you can spend a couple of days browsing the streets, enjoy the beautiful architecture and the local beers on the terraces. Be careful though, between 2 places one next to the other the prices can double or triple!Don't forget to take a map with you, those old streets are like a plate of spaghetti, it's very easy to get lost.
Busy. Very crowded and pricy. All the vendors were significantly more expensive than other places we have visited.

An amazing centre. You will definitely hit the spot, it is really amazing, though we found it much more expensive than other parts of the city. We were not lazy to walk out toward the Prague 2 district, that we also found beautiful, so i suggest to walk the old town, but to eat out somewhere out of the crowded areas.
A life experience. Be sure to visit the astronomical clock and go up the tower to marvel at the beautiful views from the top!
City break . Beautiful buildings.... Lovely buzz and so much to see as well as loads of places to eat and drink..., relax and watch the world go by

Focus on the history of the square, not the Clock Tower. The free green walking tour was led by Kevin, a U.S. expat. He was knowledgeable of Prague's history and culture. This walking tour starts at the Clock Tower of all places, and goes through Old Town and the Jewish Quarter. Look for the man with the umbrella.

Heritage Place. This is most known in the Old Town of Prague include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. The Old Town is surrounded by the New Town of Prague. Across the river Vltava connected by the Charles Bridge is the Lesser Town of Prague (Czech: Malá Strana). The former Jewish Town (Josefov) is located in the northwest corner of Old Town heading towards the Vltava.

The most beautiful part of Prague. Walk along the streets around the old town square and you will see many nice small restaurants. Ensure that you go in the by-lanes and get a bit lost to find the best places in Prague 1. Some lovely cafes in these lanes.You might find people here offering you cheap forex. Please do not entertain them. Many cases are fraud and in some places you might have to pay hidden commission.
Old Town. A really beautiful historical place to visit. There are quite a few museums in the square. it's worth to spend a few house to browse around.

Authentic place. The town is very well preserved, has great atmosphere and is definitely worth visiting. You can either select some route or walk around without any specific aim and enjoy the atmosphere.
the most beautifull part of Prague. If you visit Prague, you must walk Old Town area to feel the check history and arquitecture style.- Nice houses, square, shops.-
Amazing place. This is a very vibrant and interesting town square. The old clock is one of the most unique in the world. You must stay and watch and listen on the hour.

Our hotel was in this area. Prague is a beautiful city let down by lots of graffiti.I really don't know what else to say about it some really nice buildings with lots of restaurants and bars. Not good for late night food so if you end up getting drunk which you probably will don't rely on finishing your night off with a good kebab we had to settle for a really bad hot dog which was very expensive by prague standards

Charming square featuring Astronomical Clock. If you're in Prague for a short weekend, put the Old Town square near the top of your list of things to see. The vast square is bordered by charming Czech buildings, with lots of cafés, restaurants and bars. The dominating feature is the beautiful Astronomical Clock. Make sure you're watching it as it strikes the hour to see the figurines of the apostles moving through the windows. It's even more impressive when lit up at night.
Nice place. A very nice place, however my fiancee who is a historian didn't like it very much for the historical reasons. But we enjoyed the park near the hill
Be ready to walk!. So much to see here. Vibrant. Lots of shops and overpriced souvenirs can distract from the rich history. Best enjoyed on a sunny day.

So amazing, the view the history just everything . I must admit I was not excited to be on a tour, because I'm in a country on my own but let me tell you, my gosh a 7 hour tour was the most amazing thing I've ever paid for. Not only did I go to all amazing historic places but also was on a boat tour after the foot tour was over and lunch and dinner was included. Plus the tour guide was just awesome definitely go on a tour. You won't regret it

Certainly a must in Prague. The tour books/guides are correct, as are the comments in these reviews. Crowded but this is the Old World that we came to see. VERY crowded and everyone warns of pickpockets and scams but exciting and worth the issues associated with visiting a tourist area like this. Charming and lovely.

Go at 7:30am. Hordes of people at times...we so enjoyed the early morning to avoid feeling squashed....we loved having leisurely coffee, wine, meals and dessert at the various outdoor restaurants in the square...loved taking photos.

Beautiful city. Spend two beautiful days in Prague one of the most beautiful cities I have visited in Europe. The Old Town is filled with beautiful architecture with lovely cafe and bars and restaurants. It is a great to walk around getting lost in the side streets enjoying the charm of this city!

Fun place to watch around, check out the sites and people watch too! . Great place to visit as it is so old and the architecture is really cool to see. We are planning to go back to old town tomorrow and do a couple hour walking tour as we enjoyed just walking it on our own.
Loved it. The Prague Marathon started and finished in the Old Town square and they did a great job getting it ready for the 10,000 runners.

Old town is a must!. Old town is a must on any itinerary. Great area to walk around, eat, people watch, and learn some history. Its VERY busy, however. Lots of tour groups, segway tours, etc. Get off the beaten path and walk some streets that are quieter.

at night, perhaps the most beautiful square in the world. a truly breathtaking sight and not to be missed. if you're in prague, walk across the charles bridge from the mala strana, then mostly straight until you hit it. you can't miss it in any case, and must go here at least twice: once during the day and once at night. watch the people milling around and take in the view. it's unparalleled.

Magnificent. I have lost myself on the streets discovering the shops and attractions. If here visit the jewelry store Zlatnictvi/ Perolli s.r.o. on Jilska 20. Here I got best deal and there are 4 beautiful ladies who will present attractive prices and sell policy.
Beautiful. Great place, but kind of crowded :/ Loved the sights and there were awesome musicians when we were there!
Very walkable . I love this part of town. Always something to see although very crowded with tourists. Several nice cafes and restaurants that offer outdoor seating.

Must be seen. Impressive. Lively, vibrant place very touristic. A combination of what we call modern life: restaurants, bars, pubs with breathtaking historic buildings, which you can admire while taking a stroll around the square. I was there in May. The weather was sunny and a really enjoyed the beauty of the Old Town. Don't forget to try czehish food grilled pork and for a dessert trdelnik (chimney) with fillings of your choice.
great spot. good location for people watching, shops and food, We wandered around for hours stopping for snacks and drinks
The perfect place. Prague is one of my favourite place and The Old Town is special not only for its history but also for its restants and small local shop. I trully love it. It worth a visit.

Expect it to be busy..... A must see, but it is always crowded. Worth visiting by day and in the evening. If you don't like crowds or passing 'bar crawls' then make it a quick visit and explore other areas.

Crowded. Beautiful buildings and architecture. However, the square is so crowded with tourists it's hard to take it all in. The restaurants in the area are over priced too. I suggest walking about 1-2 blocks away to find more places to see.

Ancient and beautiful square. The old town of Prague is marked by its square, which contains the old town hall building, the astronomical clock, the statue of Jon Huss and numerous cafes and restaurants. The architecture of its buildings is awesome and the square is full of tourists regardless of the season, along with local artists. Be sure to walk also in the streets around the square, full of interesting locations, like the house where Franz Kafka lived.

It's nice to return there. The first time when we visited the Old Town in Prague was over 40 years ago. Since that first visit we returned there several times still finding it as a nice experience to scroll in those old streets. Obviously the surrounding has been changed noticeably over all those years – mainly the number of tourists considerably increased but also much more new attractions appeared like new exhibitions and new museums (e.g. Museum of Love). Some popular places can be really overcrowded but it is still possible to find a place to sit down to drink a beer or coffee. New trends we observed during our last visit there were 1) a big number of “old-timers” driving tourists around the Old Town and 2) a lot of Segway vehicles offered for rent.
Beautiful. We loved this area. You can't see enough . Every corner is a great site. Shopping was fun and unique and nice beer and food everywhere. Enjoy.

Most beautiful City. Flew in from Paris. Thought the comparison might be a let down. It absolutely wasn't. The two cities are very different to be sure but in terms of stunning beauty, Prague may have an edge.Never thought I would say this, but the food is better too. Not to get into comparing specific gourmet spots, the average restaurant in and around the tourist strips, Prague's food is more honest and higher quality.
Old town. Lovely Church well worth visiting. Good restaurant opposite. Church beautiful inside. Popular tourist attraction and rightly so.
Great place to visit. The old town in Prague is full of great buildings to look at as well as great restaurants to stop and have a coffee, lunch or dinner.

Christmas Markets. Great atmosphere with the Christmas Markets and the most enormous Christmas Tree. It had a regular light display and live bands. Got us really in the Christmas mood. The city is very gothic but some how still has charm. We hope to return in the summer months and see it in a different way.

Amazing architecture and tranquile if you get up early enough. You have to see this part of Prague if you are comming over for a visit. It is usually busy with tourists waiting for the big astronomical clock. From here you have an acces to the Parizska street - most expensive shops in Prague. You also have plenty of small pubs, cafes all around and also nice vegetarian restaurant (where they dont accept cards unfortunately).
Fall in love with this City. Prague is definitely on of the most beautiful city in east Europe. Never bored to be here especially in winter. Love the atmosphere and ambiance.
Nice place to see.. When in Prague you need to see the old town and new town to fully appreciate what this place is about.
this is the most romantic. the old town is completely anew with its new design and recovering efforts, should be visited always when you come back here.

Great experience. We toured the Old City as part of our visit to Prague. Buildings and especially older synagogues. Active and very beautiful. It's full of Jewish culture. Exciting and interesting. great experience. It is highly recommended to visit.

The clock and Einstein. Except for the famous clock and a plaque showing the building where Albert Einstein often hung out with his colleagues, this square looks and feels pretty much like any other big square in any European city with its street artists, cafés and restaurants with outdoor seating, vendors, beautiful old buildings, pick-pockets, tons of tourists, and no benches (probably to tempt you to buy a beer at one of the cafés just to have somewhere to sit). But, that doesn't mean it wasn't fun to be there!
Marvelous. It is a bit crowded but it is for a reason, the tower and the clock are interesting and worth to time so you can see them moving. Do not miss it out.

Ole Town. Like entering a town centuries ago. Watch out for those rolled dough, cooked over charcoal and slathered in chocolate.... Up in the tower, you gets a sense of one of the few cities not bombed during WWII of what it looked like.

Wonderful Experience!. A real historical & architectural visual delight, with pleasurable oddities to enjoy, such as the famous clock and the various examples of `street theatre`. Can strongly recommend it.

Visit multiple times.. When in Prague you find that you will make many visits to the Old City Square. Each time you visit will be different because the performers and Street artists are changing all the time and that keeps you interested and invites you to return.There are many cafes, Street food stalls, and restaurants around the square so that you will have multiple choice food both she and high-end. Food there generally costs 50% more than outside the square.You need to take time to identify all the buildings around the square and the most prominent is the astronomical clock which attracts large crowds every hour on the hour when it Chimes.

A Beautiful Place To Visit. This is a very busy area of town, whether it be one of the many performances that are going on by up and coming artists or simply going into one of the many museums or restaurants or bars that the "Old Town" offers, you will have plenty of options to choose what to do.You don't need any transport to explore this place just a good pair of comfortable shoes (Plenty Of Walking To Do When In Prague), although there are Segway's that are available to hire, like-wise you could have a ride on one of the horse-drawn carriages that are available or even try the EKOExpress train.The Astronomical clock is adjacent to old town square, the Old Town Hall is nearby also.

Beautiful architecture. Prague has become one of my favourite cities, easy to get around, a pleasure to walk around and the old town is so very pretty. Make sure you take 5 minutes to find a place to stand or sit and look above your eye level because there is some magnificent detail in the architecture.
Really Charming. After about seven hours we realized we probably didn't allot enough time to this trip. There's just so much to see. Highly recommended.

Beautiful old buildings . Visiting Prague means you are not alone. The old town is already crowded in the morning after three it is even more busy. Do not let this stop you as there is so much to enjoy. The central square has a nice ambiance and with good warm weather lots of terraces to enjoy the people, the buildings and the local food.Must see if you are in town.
Worth a visit. Interesting bustling square. Astronomical clock is the highlight. Gets busy on the hour, but doesn't really do a great deal.
Well preserved medieval town. A beautiful well preserved medieval town with many great attractions and architectural buildings.The locals are very frindly and the town was surprisingly clean.
Multicultural place. Besides the fact that it is a place full of history, I noticed that you could hear at least 5 foreign languages being spoken. Its cleanliness recommend it as a tourist attraction

a step back in time for the eyes,but up todate for all else. a beautiful city every where you look theres something to take in,when any where is as brilliant as this you expect to be ripped off ! Then when you look round the price for local food and beer is not just reasonable but cheap.An average just off the square for 2 local meals and 6 beers costs between 17 and 20 quid .Although wasn't piping hot was thoroughbly enjoyed.Back soon as can fit in.

Most beautiful Old Town in Europe. To be able to admire all of its wonders, first, you should visit Prague between October and April. And if you want to see it from the best perspective, visit the tower of old town hall building. The view is breathtaking. For people with Acrophobia: there is also a built-in glass shelter on top of the tower so you shouldn't have problem with having great time there.

Still my favorite place in the world. This is my second time and it is still the most beautiful, city sites I have ever seen. Everywhere you look there is a beautiful building or structure. A bit crowded this time of year, but still stunning, especially when the church bells are ringing.

So charming. Old Town was the most charming location on our tour. Interesting little shops, cafes and a great market. The atmosphere was very friendly and we really enjoyed every minute we spent exploring.
Lovely place to visit. One of the cities that everyone should visit at least once in your life. Amazing buildings and lots of bars around to taste every kind of beers.
Very nice place, mist see.. Very beautyful place with plenty of historical monuments, a lot of great restaurants with view on old town squere.

Very good place to spend your whole day. It is a very lively town where one can enjoy plethora of performances by budding and upcoming artists.You dont need any transport to explore this place.I would suggest to explore city on feet as moat of the important places are nearby and can be reach by tram also.Astronomical clock is adjacent to old town square and the square became deserted in night.
The Spires at Night. Don't forget to go to the river and view the lights on the bridges, cathedrals, palaces, and government buildings....inspiring!
Interesting place to see. This is an interesting place to visit, with lots of historical buildings. There is always something happening in the square. A short walk from the main square

Beautiful. The old town is so beautiful, the buildings are all so different and unique. I would recommend a guided tour so that you can learn when the buildings were made. Even if you're not too interested, you'll be amazed as to how old and long they took to build. There are many restaurants and street entertainment!

Awesome place. Loved it here would go back in a heart beat! It was a great experience and I would recommend this trip to anyone who loves old countries and great people who all came to explore Europe.

Must see in Prague. Old Town square is a mandatory stop when in Prague. It is one of the first places that was restored after the fall of communism, it has the Astronomical Clock (Orloj), the statue of Jan Hus, Old Town Hall, St. Nicholas Church and during winter there is the Christmas market. Must see!!1
Just amazing. All the buildings are just spetacular. I didn't get enough of the small details in them. And they were in good shape.

Gorgeous Area. This area is beautiful, but very crowded, even in off season. Bustling and plenty of shops for buying gifts or keepsakes. Jewelry, puppets, etc. Also, plenty of restaurants to choose from. You must walk along the streets if you're in Prague. I can imagine it's crazy crowded and hot in the summer. I suggest early May or early October. I took a little Alfa Romeo tour for 1 1/2 hrs and highly recommend it. I wouldn't normally do that, but it was a wonderful way to see the city and helps you to get your bearings. I should add that the people of Prague are extremely nice.
Fantastic architecture. We love this downtown the most of all European cities. It was a little bit overcrowded whenever we went there, but still, you should not miss it4

Very romantic classical place surrounded by amazing buildings. A must visit place to feel the historical abundance of Prague and be mesmerized with the sculptures, buildings, churches adjoining the area.

Just amazing! . This city is just amazing! I was blown away by the beauty of all the buildings surrounding the entire area. The cobblestone roads are awesome. I would recommend going to Prague for this alone.

Great place to visit!. I'm so glad we decided to visit Prague before our cruise in Germany. It is a beautiful city with lots of history. Loved seeing all the architecture and paintings on the buildings. Give your self a few days to visit this wonderful place.

Old town of Prague is fantastic. Old town have a lot of small streets with cafeterias and bars where you can taste fantastic Czech beers.
It's a good place for walking around and viewing of the interesting buildings
Cool place. Really cool place to go, very wide, and if you're lucky, you get to hear somebody playing some music, plus the smell of the foods (sweets) around it
Lots of shopping and great people watching. Love this part of the city with its restaurants, shopping and people watching. Just a short walk to the Charles Bridge, but be aware of pick-pockets.

A must place to see in Prague. I have been here many times and you never get enough. Atmosphere is special and old buildings are spectacular. Go to round the corner where all tourists are and find local restaurants and lower price level. Never miss this if you are in Prague.

Walk to get lost. You can not really get lost in Old Town. Old Town is a small area. Try walking some streets that you might think are alleys to discover some architectural gems. Lots of history and visuals here.
Excellent!. Images from a another time,buildings nicely preserved that give a sense of a fairytale!!Wonderful,unforgettable Prague!
A nice place to relax. In the Old Town you can see the historical view of Prague. Further more, you can relax in there, by having a cup of coffee.
A must in Prague . A very interesting place to visit. Morning is the best time as during evening the crowds gather. Clock towers and statues are very nice to look.
Super busy, super beautiful . Most central place in Prague. You cannot leave the city without visiting it. The old astrological clock is just there. Make sure to watch your bag :)

Busy but a must see. Very busy place but still a must see! Lots of different options for food and shops to explore. Great variety of stores to check out and beautiful buildings to admire as well as other landmarks. Must check out the astronomical clock when you're there!
Unique History. the beauty of the city and all of its history is a sight to behold. Very interesting but you really need a personal tour guide to share the history.
The Beautiful Prague. The old town in Prague is an beautiful and a interesting town to visit. I will hopefully be there again soon.
Exquisit. Was there on a sunny day, they have some nice terrases and the views are also great. the castle is a must-go if you're planning to go there.

As others have said, Amazing.. Prague is a very walk able city and very enjoyable.
Everyone we met was very friendly.
The Old Town area was very nice with all of the old buildings.
The place to be.... A great place to stroll and walk...close to the river and all the restaurants and eateries...take your camera
What a sights!. This is one of the most romantic, classic city centres i have visited worldwide. Great sidestreets, galleys and squares with awesome stores and restaurants.
4 days in prague. Beautifull, nice and gorgeous buildings all around like any street or Area in Prague. This city is a "Carte Postale"
One of the best medieval cities in Europe.. An amazing town square. Wonderful churches and views. Good street food including Prague ham, potato dumplings and charcoal roasted pastry!

Amazing!. Old Town Prague is absolutely amazing, especially the various vendors of Czech foods, the Prague Tower with its Astronomical Clock and old world architecture that makes it seem like a fairyland!

Rating can vary with taste. We visited here several times, as our hotel was adjacent to the square. It's always busy, with lots of street performers and tourists. I was surprised at the number of Asian tourists, mainly Chinese, in groups with selfie sticks. Our hotel said that direct flights from China and the higher earnings have generated larger numbers of Chinese tourists. The square is vibrant and lively, probably to the liking of the younger crowd. An over-abundance of segways and tour venders makes it less appealing. But if you can look past the selfie sticks, the venders, and the bubble people, it's a beautiful place.
Must see . Good Food, old buildings. A little tourist but they dod a great job maintaining that old world charm. Make sure you visit across the Charles Bridge l. Great neighborhood
Excellent place to chill out. You will have to wait till the clock's every full hour to see the historical Astronimical clock in action, but it worth waiting for!

Must visit . It's a nice place of course fulled with locals, tourisms, resturants, bars and cafes ..You can go there and sit for hours .. you will see Prague from the heart ..Just adjust your time and be close to the clock to see how did they welcoming every single hour Worth visit of course

Beautiful buildings. There is actually an elevator up to the very top of the tower, so don't be discouraged by stairs. The viewing area is naturally very small given the age of the building. Selfie-sticks should be banned from this location!

Full of life.. After visiting a few bars in the area we joined a guided tour that took us all around the old town.....we saw the astronomical clock(did not have time to go up to the top)lots going on including old fashioned car and customised car tours as well as segway tours however the area itself was delightful and was our favourite part of this fabulous capital. Visited 2nd may 2016
Prague is Truly an European Jewel. Granted Old Town is a tourist trap, but you cannot miss it - just beautiful day or night. The architecture is more beautiful than anything I have seen.
Nice place. Nice place to visit... Especially on sunny days... It is always crowded with tourists but still one can enjoy the view of the old town...

in the middle of history. the old town offers you a variety of monuments (mainly syngaigues and churches) that revive the history, narrow streets, cafe all around and a space to sit and watch the place and the visitors.. enjoy

Nothing special inside . The whole route from the clock to Charles bridge and up the castle it's the whole point of your visit! The castle is great to take pics and has it on your backround but when you get up there its not smth special to see. You can get in the line an wait to see the inside of the enormous gothic church which is really! !! A waste of time ! You can walk around the castle but you have to pay for every door you open. We only visited the doll museum cause we weren't impressed to see smth else. Well if you go to Prague and you see the castle from the distance you will get the tickle to go and see it from closer but it's really nothing to see for me at least

A lot of beautiful classic buildings.. Maybe a little crowded but pleasant.A lot of museums!!! (Visit the shop of chocolate museum!) And a lot of bhoemian crystals and czech granat shops (but pretty expesive).Interesting astronomical clock.Big square in the middle.Beautiful view from the Powder Tower.A lot of places to eat.
2016 Old Town. Old town is a trip back in time. It is so fairy tale like that you think you are in a cartoon movie. Spend time in this area
Old town. Very interesting. Many old buildings and history. Also a lot of entertainment. Best to see on a sunny day.

Fascinating but busy!. This is a lovely place. It was very busy when we visited in Spring. Beware of the 'Segways' on the Square. Plenty of eating, drinking and wyling away the time places round the square as well as churches and interesting buildings. Be sure to use one of the free walking tours.

Coolest ever. If you are in Prague, you need to visit this place without thinking twice. The views and street life is alive here. The astronomical clock is so awesome. Everything about this old square is phenomenal. Just to think that in 1968, tens of thousands of Russian troops stood in that square during their invasion of what was Czechoslovakia.

Must go. Amazing, phenomenal, beautiful, gorgeous, etc. Just line up the superlatives, this is the cradle of beautiful Europe. Art, architecture, history, food, girls....if you don't find it there it's because you didn't go.Prague is beautiful to the point of indecency and it will humble any north-american with it's grace, charm and soulful history.Even better on rainy days, fewer people will be there and you have more for you.
A beautiful square . It's a great place to sit and people watch. The astronomical clock is nearby and other attractions. Great place to shop high end items.

Throngs of tourists cannot be wrong. The Old Town is the beauty of Prague, in a nutshell. Just walk around, inhale the atmosphere, enjoy the views. Look up, look around, look down - the beauty can be found anywhere. Just stunning.

a fairy tale city. wonderul experience beauty on every corner clean and friendly
despite the many visitors crowding the main sites
a segway tour is highly recommended as well as a boat trip on the vltava

Touristy, but a must go nonetheless. The old town is filled with shops and restaurants and architecture. Of course it's a tourist trap as well, but there's nothing you can do about that. We spent a whole day wandering around in old town. It's pretty cool at night when everything is lit up. I would definitely recommend blocking off a chunk of time to get lost in the streets of old town.

WELCOME TO THE FAIRY TALE. A fascinating twist of small streets and alleys, shops, cafes, bars, restaurants, houses, full of character and interest. Some is now touristic but not spoilt, buildings have been restored in keeping with the rest. Most of it is cobbled, all of it is beautiful, around every corner there is something else to photograph, it is like stepping through a door into the fairy tale.

Must-visit!. Everyone going to Prage has to visit the Old town square, where the Astronomical Clock is. You will inevitably end up there anyway, but make sure you do. It's the centre of Prague in my opinion.

Beautiful Square. This is a beautiful albeit very busy square in Prague. It has the beautiful Church of Our Lady before Týn and the Astronomical Clock there. Also some very beautiful buildings as well as Saint Nicholas Church there. There are other attractions around the square as well as ample amount of restaurants and places to snack or have a drink. Of course you would be missing out if you did not see this square during your stay in Prague.
So much to see!. I really enjoyed walking around old town square, live performances, food, and things to buy.. And watch the clock , it is very cute

Gorgeous. Just keep walking on the street, stop în a cosy caffe or eat your lunch or dinner in one of the many restaurants spread arround, admire the building, the statues and the paitings that are everywhere.
Amazing. So pretty quaint town nothing has been spoilt. This has to be a must to visit. Very clean so much to see
Stunning. Amazing range of architecture, lots to do - town square and the astronomical clock were the highlights, though exploring the little alleys and finding hidden gems were fantastic
Exquisite Square!. Perfect Square with wonderful buildings and the fabulous clock - which you need to see for yourself! It is stunning!
Old Town great to wonder. Lovely area but can be very busy. Loads to see . Restaurants can be pricey. But great to watch the world go by. Lots of great live music and buskers. Loved this area.

Walk around and Enjoy. Who hasn't been here? Frankly it has a wonderful atmosphere with many different things going on in each corner. The main think to do is simply walk around Prague but stop here for a while. The main area has got a little crowded with folks selling Segway rides but just ignore them. Everything from here is a short walk including Charles Bridge and the Castle. There is a choice of food places from local stalls to fine restaurants.

Unique!. What is unique about this city is the unmatched number of unspoiled buildings from the Gothic, baroque and Art Nouveau eras. Add to this the iconic view of Hradcadny castle (the world's largest) from Charles bridge and you have something very special - indeed a not to be missed visit which can be adequately completed in four days. Although the city's psyche has still not entirely recovered from the lengthy Soviet occupation it arguably saved Prague from the worst efforts of the 60s building boom which has vandalised so many other European towns.
Medieval gem! . Beautiful and historic! Go see everything on foot. So old, with so many stories. Beware of pickpockets!
beautiful. excellent, a must see in Prague and find a time to visit to wonder through the streets around the castle and the gardens nearby.

Coolest city in Eastern Europe. Prague is a jewel in Eastern Europe. Very manageable in 3 or so days and extremely walker friendly. Looking out over the city from the Prague Castle gives you an idea of why they call this place "the city of a thousand spires." Actually got to see the Infant of Prague which I had heard about 60 years ago from my elementary school teachers (nuns, of course). The Charles Bridge and surroundings are incomparable as are the local eateries which serve great food at terrific prices. Took in a concert at the Municipal Building so got a dose of culture as well. Don't miss this city!

fantastic baroque architecture. This is a great place to people watch at night and to see really nice old architecture that wasn't destroyed during conflict. There are several restaurants in the square and easy signage to get to where ever you are going. there are police on hand to answer questions and the area is very safe.

Stunning. Stunning, very busy, plenty to see. Thousands of places to eat, something for everyone. Beautiful buildings, plenty of shops, cheap places to eat and expensive so look around as the square will double the prices.Ghost walk was interesting.

Old Town Prague. We highly recommend taking a guided walking tour with Sandemans New Europe. The old town is beautiful to see but meaningless if you don't learn about its history without an experienced guide.

History lies within. By knowing, or learning about history this square has a lot to offer. And for those who believe that food is the true way to experience culture, well theres a lot of that there as well.
Nice walks through the old town. Walking all around the Old town is very pleasant - nice streets, with lots of cafés, different souvenir stores, restaurants, candy shops, ice cream, you name it.

Fantastic Old Town Square. This is a great place to visit. Sign up for tours, tour guides, and several beautiful churches to see for free. Many great restaurants are available with out door seating. If you want something cheaper to eat or drink just check out some of the side streets. Hurry while the beer is less than $1.50 for a half liter.

Wear good walking shoes. I totally fell in love with this story book city. The quirky cobblestone streets and the medieval building decor were more stunning that anticipated. Number one tip: proper walking shoes! My feet were mangled after spending a day exploring this part of Prague with my go-to flats!

A lovely picture. Our hotel was on the square and I did wonder whether it was going to be a bit noisy. Have to say it was fun walking around as there were buskers, horse and carriages, restaurants quite a mix but it made the atmosphere. After the square you are very near some nice shops so time for a spend up!

Lovely. Kind of crowdy place, but lovely :)
Take a guide here, there is more stories in this buildings that you can imagine :)

Good . Very nice. A lot to look at. Many people in the area, so it can get tight.
Trevligt plats med mycket att titta på. Mycket folk i omlopp kan göra det trångt..
Amazing. Amazing architecture and amazing place. Full of interesting things to see. Restaurants and shops are very nice as well.

Join the throng and enjoy people watching. A biog square with streets off that will lead to your ultimate destination. As you would expect there are the usual suspects to be had ; horse carriages, tourists, street entertainers, tourists, traps for tourists, a plague of segway touts, and a couple of decent restaurants too.... Tremendous architecture and of course THAT clock ! It does help to read up a bit on the history of the square and its buildings. Youy cannot miss the square if in Prague.

Old Town Square - Well worth the visit. The Old Town Square is rich with history and has a wide variety of architecture to appreciate. We enjoyed walking around the square, taking in the sights, and sitting at a café watching all of the visitors.

Place to walk. We like old town as place to walk and looking old buildings and architechture. Afternoons and evenings streets are rather full of tourists. You can find in every visits something "new".

Stunning Buildings. Wonderful old buildings all around the square which make great photo opportunities. It gets very busy with tourists so an early or late visit would be best if you don't like crowds. Plenty of restaurants all around this area so its great to stop and grab a bite and a drink.

Really crowdy. Amazing city... truly beautiful.. and worth seeing!Quite good value for money.. although old city shops are a rip off, so shop outside... Loads to see in Prague, and choose late spring or early summer.. so weather is on your side. Restaurant staff not that nice, and EVERYONE in Prague asks for TIPS! Unbelievable.. even lady at the airport duty free shop had pot for tips! Also, check your receipts.. as restaurants, bars...tend to add little something to it.. which as you find out later on, you never ordered.. Bizarre...

Tourist trap but lovely nonetheless . Good for a mooch about and if your canny you can find reasonable priced food and beer. The 'museums' (mirrors and sex) are an expensive gimmick but funny after a beer or two and good way to escape the rain.

Nice place. We visited the Old Town three times for two trips to the castle and one classical music concert. It is worth hunting around for a local restaurant avoiding the tourist traps. Buy some chocolates while you are there.

Great cultural experience but stay away from the hordes of drunk bachelors. While I thoroughly enjoyed the cultural and architectural experience of Prague (especially the Old Town), it was disgusting to see the entire place being taken over by hordes of British, Irish and German drunk bachelors and bachelorettes celebrating their stag and hen nights. Prague used to be a gem of Eastern Europe - it has, unfortunately, declined to a cheap fake.

Surprise around every corner. The Old Town in Prague is a delight. Very clean, cobbled streets and marvellous buildings. Some are even hidden behind other really lovely buildings. The Old Town Square is a must, huge and full of interesting and entertaining things happening. We watched a fellow with knives lying on broken glass, people making clouds of bubbles, living statues, talented musicians and lots more. The Astronomical Clock MUST be seen on the hour - huge crowd. A wonderful part of the city.

Lots of places to eat. Decorated for Easter the Old Town square looked picturesque but very crowded. No shortage of cafes and restaurants but we tried three while staying in Prague and weren't really impressed with the quality. Also difficult to escape cigarette smoke if eating outside.

Interesting. There is plenty to see here at all levels! The architecture is wonderful, but so are the narrow streets. The astronomical clock in the square was worth see in, by beware of pick pockets in this area.
Unbelievable Place. Lots of tourist, lots of activities, lots of restaurants, you would not like to leave the place. You can spend whole day just hanging around.
Husbands birthday visit. Lovely place to wander round. Plenty of things to catch your eye and lots of restaurants to choose from.
As pretty as a picture. Do all your sight seeing early if you want to avoid the crowds, who can really spoil beautiful sights. Enjoy ambling round the cobbled streets (don't wear heels!).

The spirit of old Prague. A very interesting town square. Walking is recommended but carriage rides are also available for short distances.
A wealth of architecturally fascinating buildings, including the Tyn Cathedral and Clock Tower.
Old Town. Just wandering around is interesting. We liked walking along the narrow streets, looking at and admiring the architecture We did not try any of the bars or restaurants.
Nice for a walk through maze of streets. Had a partially guided tour with our Trafalgar group. Also walked about shopping and looking for the moving Franz Kafka bust.
the best. it is just a wonderful place that I never got bored of, it is so historical yet full of places to eat, drink and party.
I love this city. There is something magical around Praque. I've been there for 3rd time now and it is really very nice.
Interesting and Amazing Old Town Square. Take Segway Tours and explore the beauty of the Prague, Don't miss this town square as it is the place to get to know the Prague cultures and history.

Well spent holiday!. I could not have chosen better then to go to Prague and walk in this beautiful city and enjoy the atmosphere. It is also good idea to go to smaller towns which are also beautiful but not so many tourists like in Prague. I was in Kutna Hora and Cesky Krumlov. Both very nice. but Kutna Hora is closer and it was a long trip to Cesky Krumlov. But I can´t wait to comeback!
So many people. We did a nice walk to the castle, but didn't go inside. If you wanna go inside you have to buy a entrance ticket. Be prepared as there are many other turist.

With great exchange rates for foreigners why not stay in the heart of Old Town?. We flew into Prague in late Nov 2015 for the Christmas markets. I want to say 'Thank God' we did not rent a car while in Prague. We did not pay very much for a cab and it was a 30 min drive. Weigh the expense of a car, parking and yes put a huge price tag on stress of driving in the city and finding parking never mind your hotel. If you pay ahead for the cab, it's a bit cheaper. Since the exchange rate has been very good USD-EUR we stayed in the best locations we could find and stayed in 4-5 star hotels. 5 is too ornate for me so I went with the 4 stars more often than not. Since we flew into Prague, we stayed in Old Town for a few days at the front of the trip and a few on the tail end of the trip. There is plenty to see and do and an Information center right there to help. Prague is a gem worth visiting.

Beautiful. I thought Old Town was gorgeous. There a TON of people everywhere but it's worth it. We walked around the entire area in the few days we were there. There was some kind of concert going on in the center of the town while we were there which was cool to see. The architecture is so intricate, which makes you appreciate Old Town even more.

Lovely and lively. A beautiful square, better to visit during off hours to avoid bus tours and crowds. The view from the Town Hall is the most beautiful in Prague. If you are senior, try for discounted tickets. Restaurants on the square have high prices and guests are not appreciated, usually bad service and you have to check the bill before you pay.
Beautiful square. Very attractive square with its famous clock and some beautiful buildings. Everyone gathers just before the clock chimes on the hour to see the apostles inside the clock.

Truly outstanding. Few cities can boast such a rich, varied and old architectural heritage as Prague. The epicenter of it all is the Old Town Square. Every angle is worth a photo, and the colorful baroque facades are particularly charming. Thousands of tourists have discovered that, but try to ignore them and simply take in the astounding beauty around you. Admittedly, there is a dark side to this square's past, but you can read about that another day.
So laid back.. Such a lovely, safe, happy atmosphere here, loved it.Have a beer and giant slice of ham hock, bliss!

A fairy tale. I am living in Prague for 17 years already and I never get tired of Old town square... It has fascinating atmosphere, it's so fairy talish, so buzzing with life... I just love it... And the expression on the faces of tourists, seeing it for a very first time is priceless and adds to the charm... Jump for a quick bite or good coffee about 100m off the square at Prague Bake shop, and get back for more :)

Piece of history . Prague is just beautiful, u find surprises on every corner. Old town is must see. If u wanna dine on budget move couple streets out. Typical czech taverns carrying czech tap beers and national food are to die for.
Stunning. A number of sites to visit,busy but well worth it ! Beautiful architecture and some great places to sit and watch the world go by!

Not to be missed!. Fill the heart of Prague, wonder around its old streets, go back and forth and enjoy the beautiful building, shops,restaurants and atmosphere.Don't go only once: the evening appearance is totally different from the one to see on day light, don't be lazy and go back again and again on the same streets.
Enchanted . Just lovely! A bit cold and few snow flurries still on April but dress warm and enjoy this enchanting place.
Beautiful!. A beautiful place to walk around and get lost! Go up to the top of the clock tower for some great history and views!

The castle was incredible...... Loved this place......The castle was awesome, The entire trip was inexpensive from the accommodations to the food. The people were friendly and I felt safe everywhere I traveled in and out of town.

A must to visit. A beatiful historical place with lot of nice old historical buildings - specially intresting during old traditional Christmas market as well Eastern market. The historical clock is a must to see. Lot of restaurants around the Old Town Square and shops to visit.
A place not to miss out when in Prague.
Old Town. incredible city with a beautiful architecture. You can walk hours in the town an din each street you can see magic

Stare Mesto View. A place to be memorized with beautiful narrow streets with sovineer shops of left and right and Bohimia Chrystal art work galleries ... Till you reach the top of the town ... Enjoy a cup of Cuppacino at Starbucks and view the entire Prague City from a highest point, visit the old castle and amazing Barbie Doll museum

Beautiful tourist trap. Fascinating place, very evocative and atmospheric...... If you get there early enough. It becomes a packed tourist hive from around 10am - hawkers, touts, guided tours, hundreds of people, shuttling around in groups. Still unmissable, though.

Very crowded, stay away from this square in the weekend. nice square, lots of restaurants and terraces along side of it, definitely worth a visit. Lots of entertainers on the square but stay away from the square in the weekend..during the weekend it's very crowded and also full of groups of extremely loud drunk visitors, vomitting, shouting, falling over etc. While on a terrace for 1 hour we saw 3 ambulances having to deal with drunk people..

Nice. Very impressive all the history around this place, I would recommend you take a guide, but specially if you can find a guide with art history backgrounds will totally improve your experience here, there is a lot of thing to tell about it!!

Very crowded. Very busy but picturesque. There are an enormous number of Segways which are annoying when you are trying to stroll around and you need to beware of pickpockets, so you never feel very relaxed.
A fairytail. Prague is for me one the best European capital with Budapest. The old town is full of colors and attractive places to visit.
Must go!!. So many amazing things..vintage buildings..cafes and restaurants..winding lanes ideal to explore and get the local feel of the place!
Tourists. The square in central Old Town is stuffed with tourists, so when you have seen that, continue into the smaller streets of old town. That's just great for walking around.

Lovely historical area. Interesting city with many historical sites. Wonderful restaurants and museums. The entire town can be accessed by walking and don't miss the Charles Bridge and Castle as well Petrin Hill for the view.
Amazing. Clearly the focus of Vienna. People, stores, music and gelato. Streets are clean and pleasant to stroll.
nice to see, great view of the city. A nice old place with old buildings. The height is great for a view over the city of Prague. That view is magnificent!

Old World Charm. Not to be missed. Gather for the clock a bit early, as it gets crowded. Beware of pickpockets and Segways!!! There are plenty of places to sit and drink & eat, and the buildings in the area are worth some (photographic) attention.

Old Town - a must if you are in Prague!. Old Town (Stare Mesto) is beautiful. If you are in Prague, make sure you see St. Charles Bridge, the cathedral inside the castle, and save time to walk around Old Town. It's beautiful.

Charming to walk around.. Don't miss Old Town Hall clock on every hour and also visit top. It's great just to wander through the ancient streets and soak up atmosphere, stopping ffrom time tio time for a coffee, beer and cake - very reasonably priced

One of the best old places and central city in Europe. The old town is one of the best old places and central city in Europe. Many architectures, foods, museums and other unexpected things are waiting for you. Highly recommend a visit to this wonderful city.

Old Town. Stayed not far from the old Town which was a very busy, lots of shops as you would find in UK and restaurants
if you want a Lunch or Evening Meal. Price are very reasonable

Picturesque but BUSY. Saw the old town in bright sunshine but we were amongst lots of people. That wasn't the case when we visited 20+ years ago. It was still nice to see again. Worth a visit but imagine Jan or Feb best time for fewer crowds
Lovely!. Definitely one of our favorite old towns. We took the free walking tour, which was very interesting. Lots to enjoy in this area!
Wow !!!!!!!!!!!!. Great place to go see, as must if visiting Prague.....But don't eat there, restaurant are pricey ....hunt around

Remarkable. This is definitively the best attraction in Prague. The Post Card. I have been here before in Summer and Winter, both times, enchanted. Now during Spring, the same beautiful and charming " Old Town Square". Relax, drink a Pilsen Urquel and enjoy this unique atmosphere.
Magnificent!!!. What can someone say about Prague. City is amazing. Prague and Budapest are the most beautiful cities of Europe!! at first chance visit Prague

Beautiful Day - Gorgeous Place. When you see pictures of Prague this is the place most often depicted and for obvious reason. It is beautifully impressive. We were there the day after the Easter markets closed and the Easter decorations were still up. I did not enjoy the people constantly pressing us to take a Segway ride but everyone needs to make a living I suppose!
We love it!!!. So far the best old town we have visited. The architecture. The colours. The atmosphere. The culture. It was magical. Fairy tale like experience. We love it!!!

Central location busy old town square. Whether you want to visit the clock tower the little market stalls or drink or eat at the many restaurants and bars , there is something for everyone lots little shops and chocolate museum, loved the excitement and history of the square
Crowded but fun. lots of action going on. Lots of people and street entertainers. Fun to be there on a sunny day to enjoy the architecture and all the people.

Graet Food Stalls in Beautiful Setting. Old Town Square is very large and filled with Segway companies setting up tours with tourist. We never saw so many Segways in one city before. There are tourist cafes on two sides of the square and along the side with the horse carriages and the churches are several food stalls that are well worth a visit. They are roasting the meat on spits throughout the day. For a reasonable amount of money you can eat very well, very heartily. Behind the stalls on the square is a walkway lined with more stalls, some selling souvenirs and crafts and some selling food or hot wine. One stall sells potato chips on a stick that are wonderful. They aren't like anything sold in bag. They are hot and just out of the cooker. Try them. You'll probably do what we did, shared the first stick in case we didn't like them, then went back and all got our own sticks. Yummy.

The old town has something for everyone whatever age. we visited the old town square several times, the Astronomical clock is well worth a visit and waiting to see the clock chime on the hour, but be prepared for crowds, if you are feeling fit climb inside the clock tower the views are spectacular. the best time to visit the square is after dark when the buildings are illuminated, great ffor the romantics

Beautiful Architecture. There is a lot to see in this area. Wonderful architecture, lots of nice restaurants and shops. Interesting statues. The old Town Hall with the famous astronomical clock mustn't be missed. Make sure to see the clock strike the hour both in the daytime as well as at night. The whole square is beautifully lit at night.

Fantastic square especially if you are there for Easter wkd!!. I happened to be working in Prague for the weekend after Easter and the markets, stalls and street entertainers were still there - such a stroke of luck!! It was a gorgeous sunny day, there were stalls serving food on a rotisserie (all types of meats and sweet donuts).The atmosphere was amazing, the little touristy shops interesting and the glorious sunshine on the first weekend in April.Definitely worth a few hours strolling around and photographing the church, clock towers etc etc

High historical background - a must!. Great place, very interesting and a key monument of the European history!!!The only thing... very very crowed of tourists.. so avoid the big holiday weekends.but a must to visit and stay a couple days aroung.
very good. The square is great to people watch loads eating places lovely shops and just being in amongst all that's going on love prague second time my friend and I have been we will return.

The best old town in Europe. This old town is very beautiful, interesting, every corner of it breathes with its own stories and mysteries! I advise to take a guide and see the old town with him, a good guide will create proper impressions!

Must See. You can't really avoid going to the Old Town Square as early as possible after arrival, as it's more or less the centre point for so many of the activities & sites you will visit. Best enjoyed wondering around with one of those doughnuts filled with ice cream.
Back in time. Stunning Architecture beautifully renovated. You feel like back in the old days of the glory of the Habsburg Empire. History that can be physically touched all over the City Centre.
Old Town Square. Best visited early in the morning to avoid the hoards of tourists. A beautiful square packed with history, food stalls and street entertainers. A one off experience

Wonderful area...magical architecture!. Beautiful Old Town Prague should be experienced both in the day and at night to see the changing of the light on the buildings, the people watching...wonderful!
Lots to see. There is lots to see - architecture, the astronomical clock, historic buildings like the old town hall, craft shops, statues. Quite crowded and be aware of pick pockets.

The Old City was nicely renovated. The Old Town became even better than during my last stay. The quality of the shops has improved, while prises also being increased. Nevertheless its worth to pay a visit to this Area.

Beautiful!. Beautiful buildings, great food, if you wander a little off the square itself you will save yourself money when eating drinking. Hotel Prince U has a lovely roof top restaurant with great views over the square.

Nice Architecture Neighborhood . Great area to wandering around while in Prague. The architecture was just stunning. Compared to other old town in Europe, this one is way bigger.
A bit too touristy, but what do tou expect in place like Prague

Must see. I feel like it's obvious but of course you must go here! It's gorgeous and historic. I live in Prague and make sure I go here at least a few times a season to see how it changes throughout the year.

Beautiful Prague!. This is the centre of the city and it's a must to visit.
Very close to Charles bridge, it's a beautiful representation of the city architecture.

A place full of character and tourists!. The old town is one of best areas in Prague, IMHO. Its full of beautiful buildings and historical places surrounded by small and cosy restaurants and cafe everywhere which serve different varieties of food..! A must go for anyone visiting Prague

Beautiful old town centre.. This was a brief time out from a business meeting and worth every second.
The town centre of old Prague is stunning,and has an amazing assortment of lovely old buildings.
There are lots of bars and restaurants around the square,but be prepared to pay tourist prices,and share the space with thousands of others all doing the same as you.
Beautiful.
Great Experience. My advice to anyone visiting Prague and wants great experience, stay in Old Town. It is a very exciting town. Watch when your are exchanging currency.

Beautiful nostalgic feel.. Stayed in apartments here for a friends stag do at the end of March. Everything is a short walk away, from shops to bars to restaurants to food stalls to tourist hot spots. The buildings are wonderful and the almost Disney-esq church in the centre gives the place a magical feel, particularly as sun sets.It can get pretty busy in the day, but it's to be expected. Also if you are not a fan of being stopped by people, just prepare yourselves first. Every bar/restaurant/business owner will be out trying to get you in to their place of work, but it didn't bother us as they are only looking for custom!A must see if you visit Prague.

A must . Nice! A must in prague! Take a Beer on the Roof top bar at u Prince hotel. Old town has a lot, from the square to the bridge and Also vaclav square! A LOT of different Tours available, breweries, good restaurants

Center of Europe. Lots of history, lots to see and a must see while in Europe.
I highly recommend taking the '' Free Trips'' available all around Prague. You get your history background filled and a good review of the city, allowing you to pick, based on your preferences your visits.

Beautiful. Location was near our hotel and was beautiful! Lots of restaurants, tour information and links to attractions.
A must see when visiting Prague.
A visitors Must. This is the most touristic part of the city. . Take your time to walk through the many small streets offering interesting fews to the many highlights
The old town is well worth a visit. Lots of cobbled streets and alleys running around the square, lots of bars and restaurants and if you steer clear of the chains very cheap too.
Farytale. This city is like dark side of farytale. Everything is gray or black, the catedral is like gigant goust. Everyone must go and see this town. It is unforgivable experience.

Buzzing!. The Square was absolutely buzzing when we were there. The Easter Market was on. Lots to eat and drink and free live entertainment. (Beware the Old Prague Ham, it is lovely but sold by weight and very expensive!)

Beautiful old streets and squares to wander round and pass the time of day. This area of Prague is our favourite. Lots of cafes and bars in small and large squares. Steeped in historical background. Stunning architecture and beautiful buildings

Wonderful place, incredible architecture. From the beautifully painted building where Kafka once lived, to the moving sculture that stands in the center of the square, to the fabulous clock that strikes on the hour, each way you turn reveals another wonder.

A pure delight when not overcrowded. The Old Town is delightful and a nice walk from the Charles Bridge. There are also plenty of tram stops available in any direction. There are great shops from local places to super high-end. Avoid mid-summer as crowds are huge.

Lovely place. A lovely place to visit and you do not get hassled to buy things.
The restaurants are not expensive and a great place to people watch.
Beautiful Place. I've seen many Travel Shows on Prague. There is nothing like being there. I'd have no problem living in this beautiful city.

Old Town. Amazing place,every street you walk down there is something different,the whole town is full of its amazing history,we found ourselves going off the main roads and getting lost on the side streets,I would advise doing that as you see a lot more interesting building and interesting sights that way,there is too much good to say about this area of Prauge well worth seeing

Quaint old Prague. Old town in Prague is milling with tourists but has great atmosphere. Full of little shops and restaurants. No traffic. Strolling around and admiring the old architecture is very enjoyable.

Many more interesting buildings to see than in Spain.. You can walk down small streets with vendors and historic buildings side by side. All the amenities of the current world while experiencing architecture from the 1400's.Everything was very clean and all the people are friendly.
Beautiful. Beautiful area, lots of history, beautiful buildings. Do a walking tour, and eat some old Prague ham.
So medieval. It is mandatory to spend time there, since it is located in middle of the city and there you have few of the most important atractions
Walking Tours. We took 3 tours while we were there. Be sure and get the ones with the yellow jackets and umbrellas. They were great!

A must for tourists. Lovely place to visit and a must for all tourists. A busy square but lots to see and do including art galleries, Segway tours and restaurants and cafes. Also a central meeting point for most tours and trips.
Beautiful place . Our favorite corner in Prague, so many beautiful things to see, monuments are so great to see, great pictures to take everytime you turn your head....great place to walk all around

Family European vacation. One of the place places to visit in the world. The beauty of the old town, with numerous restaurants, pubs and clubs. There are things to do for all ages. The cost is very reasonable. The churches, castle and scenery is absolutely incredible.

Beautiful architecture. Definitely must walk around, me and my wife were not able to leave the district. Wonderful architecture and ambient. I will always remember the place like one of the most romantic place I have visited.

Journey to the Past in the Old Town. In my opinion, one full day is enough to go to all of the main attractions in this old town. That's why I love this town because I could get whole for little time. It is perfect for budget traveller like me. Everything is by walking distance. The best currency change is near the staromestka underground station, near KFC. That little shop always has the best rate and I recommend you to change the money as soon as possible because they use Krona (not Euro). Some place still accept Euro but you will get Krona as change.
Nice place but really touristic area. Great for mid-day break, looking at the clock movement every hour, and bargain for a Segway renting. Apart from that, pretty much crowded.

Romantic getaway. Stayed at a hotel located 100m from the Powder Tower. Stare Mesto ranges from wider streets with different kind of shops as crystal and jewellery, to cheaper tourist goods. Also located a variations of museums i.e. Chocolate Museum and Torture Museum.Allthough a lot of tourists during summer, you can indulge the romantic atmosphere and enjoy the nicest part of Prague.
Nice market, restaurants and food.. Perfect place. Excellent food on the market and restaurants. I will even not mention the beer- a lots of varieties.

Old Town Prague. Rich in architecture, few façades are the same, a great variety, a sight for sore eyes, compared to modern, caracterless, glass-fronted skyscrapers. Very little war-damage, so buildings well preserved and great vistas! Town square is well worth the visit.

The most beautiful place in the world. The old town is breath taking, full of monumental & architectural wonders, especially the centre of the old town square where you gaze up at the Old clock, the quaint cafes dotting the periphery, the stone paved alleys bustling with shops and activities including Bohemian glass work.

Great Old World Ambience!. WE spent two weeks in Prague from Easter Monday for two weeks. We found ourselves wanting to return to visit it once more. Not surprising since this area dates back over 1000 years..it is dripping with history and most of the architecture is original. It was even more fun during Easter with the Easter Markets and their huts, the crowds, the performers...great way to spend numerous hours there! Looking forward to returning next year!!
A must see!. It's the Old Market, you have to see it. Try Karlove Oplaty (kind of a sweet, very thin wafer with brown sugar) or Trdelnik (a sweet dough).
square. this is where you will find the clock and much more shops eating places entertainment plenty to see and do

About Money Exchange with WESTERN EXCHANGE. We were in Prague last week.We had really bad experience with Western Union (Money Exchange) They charge 28% as the Commission and making people fool.We changed Euro with them without any question as they display better rates on board (display) and when you take money they deduct 28% commission without any knowledge.When we shouted and raised the issue they said to remove the commission, but that's not the way to work.So be very careful in exchanging money with WESTERN UNION.
vintage and beautiful. Beautifully preserved historic building. Everything breathes history.In the old town you can spend the whole day there so many places to explore.
Heart of Prague. Loved experiencing the Old Town Square during Easter weekend it was filled with stalls selling arts crafts and yummy food

Beautiful town square with lots of scenery . Beautiful town square with lots of scenery, lovely food being cooked at the stalls aswell at a very reasonable price, it would definitely recommend this to be seen.
Stunning. Beautiful, chocolate box building that go on and on. Check out the back streets for surprise squares and statues. Very clean area too
Beautiful. So much to do and see, great atmosphere, the clock tower pulls in the crowds, great food on all the stalls around the square, something for everyone.
Easter Markets. Visited when the Easter Markets were set up. Lovely square. Recommend having a drink at the Hotel U Prince for the view over the square.
Amazing Historic gothic feel. Highly recommend a visit to this wonderful city.Reasonable prices if you go one street back.Lots to do and see and the clock tower is a must

Probably the best city Old Town ever visited. Enchanting.. The Old Town has plenty of bars and restaurants in which (weather permitting) you can sit and browse outside whilst admiring the beautiful old buildings and of course people-watch.
Magical. We stayed in a hotel right on the Square with a fantastic view of the Astronomical Clock. Such a charming area with lots of shopping, dining and just pure fun. A MUST visit while in Prague.

Beautiful place. I am here for a business travel. From the hotel situated on the river bank we came a short 10 min walk and it is just a stunning view. Coming here yesterday during sundown was also a fantastic experience. The dark and clear contrast coupled with the architecture and the dropping sunlight was just fascinating.It is my first time in continental central europe and I am fascinated by Prague. I really advise you to stroll around sucking in the history of these places.One piece of advise: inform yourself on the history of this city before visiting and everything will have a more profound meaning.

Easter Market in full swing. We were very fortunate to visit Prague during the Easter season and the Old Town Square was filled with a market. There was also live music and dancing at a pavilion set up in one corner - it really added to the atmosphere of the place. So much to see, eat, and buy. Because we were always getting lost, we became very familiar with the square (all roads seem to lead back to it!). I would recommend going to a concert in one of the churches surrounding and adjacent to the square - so well worth it.

Beautiful square with great atmosphere and lovely bars and restaurants. We were only ten minutes walk to Old Town Square from our accommodation and made full use of the proximity. We ate dinner here several times and also took every opportunity during our 5 night stay in Prague to have a drink at one of the many bars and restaurants on the square to watch all the happenings. In addition the square has great historical significance in this beautiful country and the buildings also have some magnificent architecture.

Must do. Great place to visit and fantastic cobblestoned side streets everywhere.. The jewish museum was disappointong however but the cemetry was nice. we did most of the jewish quater and found there really wasnt enough history to read up on so although we were there.. We still felt we left knowing little about the history but we will definately be reading up on it.
Neat area to walk - lots to see and do. We stayed in this area. Close to shops, restaurants, music hall and a huge shopping plaza with over 200 stores and restaurants.

Weekend Visit. Had the opportunity to act as tour guide for my wife's colleague from Mexico. He was in Poland and wanted to visit somewhere different, historic and beautiful . . . Prague fitted the bill perfectly. He was not disappointed in the least.

One week after easter, that's when to go!. The entire city of Prague is so amazing that even just thinking back on it brings a sentimental tear to my eye. The Old Town is extremely beautiful so you have to give yourself time to get lost in its small streets at least once during your trip. I went there in April and it was amazing. The sun was shining every single day and the tour guide told me that this is the time to visit because in summer it is so packed with tourist you won't even be able to stand on the main square. The reason i suggest you go there after easter is that Prague is an easter town and many visit during this period HOWEVER, if you go there the week after, the cute little easter shops on the square are still there, but with a lot less people! Inside tip. Remember where you heard it first ;)

Beautiful Old Town, Prague, Czech Republic. I loved going to Prague in mid-March, right before Easter where they have the Easter Market booths. It seems to be a hopping part of town, complete with old-world charm. So many things to look at!

Simply wonderful. Many architectures, foods, museums and other unexpected things are waiting for you. The price is more expensive than other area of the country, but is still cheap compare to other part of Europe.
Place to be. Nice area to see and be seen. Some nice places to eat or just sit and have a drink. Downside is too many bloody folk on seg ways or trying to get you on one.

Stunning!. Stunning architecture, lovely cafes and restaurant, the astronomical clock is fascinating, you need to be their on the hour to watch it chime and see the characters in action. View from the top of the clock tower is definitely worth the climb.

lovely !. This area is fantastic . It has keep all the old charm characteristics despite the hoards of us tourists! It is extremely clean and a pleasure to visit. The buildings are all fantastic and picturesque. The only down side on this visit was the emergence of the segway reps, who get in your way and are generally a nuisance, there's loads of them everywhere, and are like glorified "looks looky" men . They need to be stationed at a central point rather than moving among the crowds. However it won't spoil your trip .
Best place . The old town is one of the best old places and central city I visited in my life . Enjoyed walking and having a coffee in the best cafe's in the world .

Nice!. We were in Prague for 5 days and every day we walked in old town - little streets and so many old buildings call back again.. What we really liked (and it is not so usual in big cities at all) that all streets were very clean.

Beautiful. What an amazing area! There are plenty of places to eat or drink. The surrounding buildings are beautiful. The square has many street performers. You can climb the clock tower for a beautiful view and to learn about the fascinating history of the area. Make sure to find time to watch the clock on the hour. I loved to relax here and people watch.

beautiful . beautiful place just nice to wander around there is a little market where you can get the local treats and hot wine; the place is actually huge and there are so many things/buildings to observe
Love this city. |Prague is an absolut must visit and OLD TOWN is a must go for any traveler. Thank you Prague for welcoming us

So atmospheric. You can easily imagine the Middle Ages here.. Prague is a great walk though history. Go to the top of the tower. It's a great view of the city and the surrounding area. There are so many little restaurants and bars to enjoy in the square and down the little streets. A lovely day can be spent just wandering the city center.

Fantastic square . Like many European mideval cities, the city has an old square where all the center if activities once occurred. This square has beautiful churches, astronomical clock, and shopping area.
beautiful. this square was my favourite. Went nearly every day. On the hour the clock does a little show. lots of different food to eat lots of shops

Food and entertainment and you'll never know what you'll find!. A classic old-style square, surrounded by beautiful architecture and shops selling pretty much everything and anything. The square has all sorts of access-way-alleys to explore, with their own little market streets.

Majestic astronomical tower and market place!. Views from top of astronomical tower are breathtaking especially because of the view of nearby cathedrals! You will have to spend a lot of time to go up the astronomical tower but the view is worth the inconvenience.
Many sightsees. Prague has so many churches, each with different history or legend. Old town is must see for any tourists visiting this gorgeous city!

Especially nice a night. One of those big European squares where restaurants tourists and beauty Collide! Especially beautiful at night. There are plenty of restaurants and picture taking spots. Most are a bit touristy
Must-see in Prague. If you are visiting Prague, you will definitely want to visit Old Town. The food and shopping alone worth it. The architecture is amazing as well.

Second Visit. We so enjoyed visiting Prague last year, we returned last week, it is a beautiful vibrant city, with outstanding architecture and an old world charm, but with modern amenities.
Well worth a visit if you havent yet been.

Old Town Square. We visited Prague in March for the Easter weekend. The Old Town square is a must see with interesting buildings and lots of food stalls set out for Easter. Whilst here we also went up the clock tower which had great views over Prague. We did find the astronomical clock a bit underwhelming though but it seems to draw crowds every hour on the hour and it is free to watch The cafes around the square are expensive but it is a lovely place to people watch on a sunny afternoon.

Straight out of Beauty and the Beast - gorgeous at night!. Old Town has to be seen to be believed. The architecture of the castle and surrounding buildings makes it look straight out of a movie. I expected to see Gaston, Belle and Beast strolling the streets! Very clean area. Worth taking the time to stroll the area to see the sights and people watch. Check out the area at night when everything is lit up!

Very good but very crowded and lots of tourist traps. The square and old town is a really nice historical site with lots of feature to see expecially the astrological clock.. However in most weather it is crowded and full of tourist traps. It is hard to get off the beaten track and away from the tourists but there are some nice side streets and ways to avoid the crowds.
A Must SEE. We are there on Easter weekend and there were a lot of booths serving food. The Old Town Square was decorated and everyone enjoying themselves.
Interesting hisotirical site. The old town allows for multiple interests including history, architecture, art (mostly religios). Especial mention to the mucha musseum.

Architectural feast . At every turn in the Old Square, there is beauty and rich history.Outdoor cafes abound and ancient churches. Almost daily concerts are available for about $15 in the neighboring churchesProbably the center piece of the square is the 800 year old Astronomical Clock. Huge crowds gather every hour to watch the clock figures move. FascinatingThe side streets off the square are filled with restaurants and shops.Some areas are still paved with cobble stones.I can understand why many travelers say Prague is the favorite city in Europe.
Beautiful area - do not miss. It is always a pleasure to walk around and enjoy the Old Town area. Many interesting cafes and shops, along with the historic buildings.
swarming with tourists. Beautiful architecture, but way too many tourists, even on a cool day in early April, tacky souvenir shops and mediocre restaurants.
Great place to hang out. This the old town, always filled with people. Great energy and amazing old structures. Nice place to hang out when the lights are on.
Lovely atmosphere. Great place to wander around and look at the sights. Pedestrianized, good stalls selling hot wine, great astronomical clock, all in all a must visit place.
Picturesque. A beautiful picturesque area, full of beautiful buildings, lots of sightseeings, could spent days there.
spirit of the past. a very beautiful building, wonderful designed, feel the spirit of the past that still lives, a great place
