historical & beautiful town. A must visit if you are in Prague. We used the 3-days Prague card and visited all the sites included with free entries. Worth the value ! and save from queuing to get the entrance tickets !

The most charming place. If you are visiting Prague on christmas, you have to visit the old town square.
The square is very quaint and full of wonderful christmas markets and local food kiosks.

Stunning. Fantastic views of old meets new. Amazing architecture, street artists, cafes and bars. Nothing better than sitting in the square with a beer and watching the world go buy. One of the best places to soak up the atmosphere and relax. Can recommend walking tours with Discover Prague Tours (Yellow Jackets). Met Dean in the Old Town - explained what was on offer and were to meet. Did the free waking tour with Callum (very informative and funny) and Kutna Hora & Bone Chapel with Czech David (amazing !!) So glad we did both with Discover Prague/

Beautiful city. The square at Christmas time was beautiful. The tree in the center was lovely, and the aromas from food and drink stalls was mouth watering. There are cafes and restaurants all around the square and all seem to offer excellent food and value.
Great. The Old Town is just so atmospheric and friendly. The eating and drinking weren't bad either! A must in any trip to Prague.

So much history in such a beautiful city. We hired a tour guide to take us around Old Town in Prague. It was worth every penny. She explained in detail so much history we never would have been able to find on our own. We went to all the synagogues in Old Town. The most notable of the synagogues is the Old New Synagogue. It was an amazing place to see. Don't miss see the Astronomical Clock in Old Town. Every hour on the hour you will see the clock come to life. It only lasts 30 seconds but it's definitely worth waiting for. Spend some time walking around and going into the shops also. They have beautiful crystal and blown glass made in the Czech Republic. The Old Town is such a beautiful and amazing place to visit.

Don`t miss another great panorama of the city and/or city square !. The Old Town is located right on the city center.If you want to enjoy a great panorama of the square, you have to pay. There are 2 ways of reach the tower:1) by stairs2) by elevatorThe cost is around 10 EUR.
I loved it. Beautiful, just beautiful! All kinds of stores, mainly tourist shops but there are some hidden diamonds among them.

Walk!. Prague is an amazing town full of history with amazing buildings across many ages. Unfortunately, as many touristic cities in the world, the center is full of tourist trap stores anyway you have to see it and then walking around the city you'll taste the local feeling.

Relaxing and Atmospheric. There is a peacefulness to Old Town that seems to largely stem from the fact that there do not appear to be any annoying scooters or motorcycles zooming around.I guess Prague is a lousy city for bikers, because the streetcar (tramway) rails provide a dangerous obstacle to 2 wheel vehicles. the advantage is no mad put-put or zoom zoom sounds to annoy and spoil the mood.Crowds can be a problem during certain times of the year, so pick off peak seasons to enjoy this location.

Sightseeing holiday. Views were spectacular and the history and architecture of all the buildings was fantastic. Very pricey in the Old Town, just step back a bit to the vast amount of other bars / restaurants and it is so much cheaper.
Great Town. Very nice town to visit with lots of great building around. The Astronomical Clock is just amazing not to mention the great view of Charles Bridge

The hart of prague. Nice place superfull..everywhere is people asking u for tour car tour Segway bike running horses tour...if u can manage to say no 10000 times u ll be save.but anyway nothing to see with this amazing place

Unique. This is one of the icons of Prague.
try to arrive 5 mins to the hour and get a good position clos to the tower in order to see the clock
Looks historic! . It looks histories with several pretty building... The time I visited it, it was not very crowded and there are some activities you can do around.

Beautiful old town. I love the cobble stone streets! Filled with beautiful bohemian buildings. I'd have probably appreciated it more if it wasn't so crowded, but then I was there during new years, so only have myself to blame. Don't miss the bridge with padlocks.
lovely at night. busy but lovely didnt eat on the square as it was expensive but at night the towers and churches are stunning

Climb the tower!. The old town square is the highlight of the old town area, but even outside of the squre, it's nice to walk around the sidestreets. They're cobblestone mostly and narrow and beautiful. I definitely recommend climbing to the top of the town hall for a fantastic view of the city, especially the church across the square. Every hour when we were there, a girl came out and played trumpet from the terrace at the top. It was awesome. There are nice markets, food, and of course the astronomical clock right there as well.
Medieval town. If you love medieval style Prague old town is a good place to start. Look around and you will see impressive builddings

Just the place to be. I cannot imagine beingi in Prague without visitng the Old Town. The best way to do it without so many people is the early morning. At 8 you can have a morning coffee and great photos
Christmas Market. Fun visit to the Christmas Market at the Old Town Square. Plenty of good food and spiced wine. Saw the Clock for the first time.

Go up the tower!. The old town and the architecture is beautiful.
You must watch the clock in action and
If you get a chance I would definitely recommend going up the tower, the views are fantastic!

Beautiful Old Town. Certainly the highlight of our city break, Old Town gave us culture, sights and great dining. Going up the clock tower is a must and we were lucky enough to be at the top when the clock struck the hour to see the immense crowds below! It was busy during school holidays but we didn't have to queue for too long. The square hosted everything from cafes and restaurants to shops and market stalls. A great place to spends the day or the evening!

A fantastic experience. The Old Town during the Christmas Period is one of the most magical places we have ever visited. The hotels are very well priced and everywhere is within easy walking distance. A trip up the clock tower is an absolute must.
High end shops here. This is a nice area with great history! Also known as the old Jewish area. This is now where Prada, Rolex, Tory Burch, Brietling and LV is.

Awesome Architecture. Spent significant time wandering around the Stare Mesto admiring the wonderful architecture. Building are not well marked so it's best to have some type of guide book to make identification easier.

Heartbeat of Prague. The true centre of Prague, and a wonderful place to soak up the beauty of this city. This square is surrounded by beautiful, old buildings, an old monument, gorgeous churches. We visited during the Christmas Markets, and the atmosphere was fantastic - tourists and locals were all about, tasting local cuisine and soaking it all in. A great place to visit upon your first day of Prague and get your bearings from here.

Totally in Love with the Architectures. This city has been stolen many tourist's hearts because of its architecture. I could spend an hour relaxing in the cafe just staring at the buildings here. Old town has a lot of restaurants but I didn't recommend it, since you have to be super careful with the price, there might be a hidden pricing there.
Fab views from the church with the astronomical clock!. Fabulous views of Prague from this historical place in old town square! Has excellent bars and restaurants with heated outside tables!
Large interesting square . Lots going on. Massive crowd to watch the astronomical clock at midday. Attractive buildings. Plenty of restaurants with outdoor areas to take in the atmosphere.

True European feel. Strolling in this part of Prague gives you a very European kind of feel. It was the first place I visited in Europe and am glad I started on a great note. It is always lively and walking through the streets feels amazing. Can be seen from Prague castle as well. And yes it looks beautiful during rains.
Beautiful . Beautiful view worth the walk even if we didn't.. Highly suggest to jump on a tram or a public transport o like us we jumped on the tourists tram

Hive of activity. We spent quite a lot of time here in wandering up side streets and it's central to all the points of interest; Charles Bridge, Jewish Town and walkable to Wenceslas Square; although we just found this a rectangle full of shops.
Great history❤️. Lots of great history and information everywhere you look there's something different that catches your eye! Also there is great tours up there
Romantic and Magical. This is a magical spot in a magical city. At times it's too touristy and cliche, but there are spots of memorable moments, and it makes you want to slow down somehow.
Great atmosphere. Lots going on, lots to see and do, the old town hall has underground cellars which are well worth a visit.

Beautiful!. Just walk around the streets, take pictures, enjoy the street food, and breathe the athmosphere. Of course you also should visit the astronomical clock tower to see the view from the top. Amazing!
Mysterious Places. Great area to explore at night or during the day, there are many interesting monuments, which are famous for its history!!!

A Walk through History. If you have always been a medieval ages fan, than this place is a must see !
The castle and whole area has been kept at it's original state, one of the main attractions of Prague and definitely a must see.
Charming and beautiful. The Old Town Square is a charming and lively. spot of Prague. Great architecture and many cozy restaurants and shops in this area.

Best place I've ever been. I've been in prague for 2 weeks and I spent 4days in old town and I can tell that this is the most beautiful place in prague. You can find a lot of different artist and simgers that made me so happy. Also there is a lot of different stores such as paris fashion store. And whole street of stores called french street
Beautiful and a must for visiting Prague.. Beautiful and a must for visiting Prague. Fantastic entertainment, beautiful views. Friendly people. A lot of activities.

Old Town. Old Town stayed in the Hilton which was much better than expected. They did let us check in earley as are rooms were cleaned so bags dropped and away we went breakfast great . Boat trip was brief but enough.The hopper bus lived up to its name the roads arnt great . Castle tour informative go inside the church .Irish bar bit of a walk but was well worth it, looks grubby but we had a laugh and good food and beer very reasonable prices.

Magical. This is a beautiful Old Town Square that reflects what Prague looked like hundreds of years ago. It is very crowded, so beware of the Segways, Bikes and the Large Tour groups, but all in all, a must see in Prague
Lovely. Came here in Dec 2014 for 1st time - Christmas market and lovely Christmas Tree in the square. Great bars and night life as well as busy days shopping. Came again in April 2016

picturesue squere. lovely place to hang out, have some beer, have some hot dogs and enjoy the beautiful buildings.loved it !try climbing the tower when everyone are eating lunch - can save you lots of time.
Old world style. The Square is a must see. Amazing architecture - a style for everyone. Side streets range from typical tourist traps to quiet cafe and bars. Great place for an explore.

Good place to visit but very busy. A visit is a must if you are in Prague to see the famous clock, take a moment to absorb the atmosphere, street acts, food and drink stalls.Can't imagine how pack this place would be in the peak season as it was pretty busy when we visited in April.
Beautiful walk. We left flat and took a long walk crossing the bridge and exploring at night. LOVELY the other Paris!! You have to do this.

Lovely area. Lots of lovely bars and restaurants and things to see lots of little and unusual museums and churches don't think I have ever seen so many churches!!! Go to bars and restaurants of the main streets they are more reasonable though eating and drinking in Prague is very cheap.
Great city centre!. Old town offers a lot, from bars & cafes to musicians and festive gatherings. A must visit place otherwise you haven't seen Prague.

This is the heart of Prague. Old Town is the heart of Prague and you can walk the entire area in a couple of hours. Start at the Old Town Square and walk to the river at the Charles Bridge. Lots to see, shop, eat and drink all along the way. This is the main old town area with all the medieval town square.

BUSY BUT PRETTY. you will this square amazing, it is a busy place with lots of touts looking for tourists to take their Segway tours, walking tours etc. nice smells of food from local restaurants and hometo lots of nearby attractions.

The best bit. Old town hands down was the best bit of the towns for us. We found loads to do, shopping, sight seeing, eating here. Take a trip to the clock and pay the fee for the underground tour to see the sunken first City of Prague, use the ticket to get ur discount to the top of the clock where you can see the apostles from the inside, there is even a lift up there and the view is great.

Stunning. We were staying in Hotel Rott just around the corner and loved going round a lot to take photos, even in early morning in the rain was beautiful and the night when lit up was stunning, it was like a magnet for everyone to converge on - wonderful!!

Amazing Area of Prague. Staré Město is by far the most beautiful area of Prague that I got to visit. My hotel was based there (Hotel U Prince) so I got the opportunity of touring the cobbled streets by day & night.The more common attractions would be the Astronomical Clock; Old Town Hall; Old Town Square & Powder Gate. The impressive Charles Bridge will also transport you over from Old Town to Malá Strana (Lesser Town) and to Hradčany (castle district) but you do have the option of two other bridges to get you over the Vltava river: Legion Bridge (Most Legií) & Mánes Bridge.There are an abundance of shops, restaurants & bars around the old town including Marks & Spencer; Hard Rock Café; TGI Fridays & the amazing AnonymouS Bar (Michalská 432/12). The area comes alive at night & I would recommend you take a walk towards Charles Bridge to get a view of it all lit up!I don't think a trip to Prague would be complete without a visit to the Old Town. There is something there for everyone.
Enchanting old Europe. A great slice of old Europe. Safe to walk about in even late at night. Plenty of old European style with modern shops and a wide selection of restaurants.
Very interesting. It is a very historic and interesting place. The history of it is good. Don't forget to get the Astronomical Clock

History but too crowded and too touristy. The Old Town square is impressive. With the astronomical clock, the St. Nicholas Church or the gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn... it's worth spending time there just admiring the buildings. But the amount of tourists and tourist "attractions" (people doing things, people trying to sell you to go on a Segway....) makes the user experience not that good.

Beautiful old buildings..plenty to do and see.. All sites easy to reach on foot and plenty to look at and things to do.we recommend the tower and square for horse carriage ride. Plenty of lovely restaurants down the side streets. Food and drink are cheap and good quality.

Absolutely stunning... The Old Town in Prague is magical.. It is like one of those hand painted pictures in fairy tales.. The Tyn Church and the Astronomical clock are certainly the biggest attractions.. Do visit it after sunset when the lights are turned on..

Fairytale town. this is probably the most beautiful part of Prague, with the town hall, chronological clock and the enchanting turrets castle, surrounded by traditional old building, restaurants and small hotels especially in Christmas time is simply a crowd puller of this city.
Easter. We visited Prague during the easter holiday and the Old Town square was full of small shops and barbeques with easter products, sausages and tredlnik, it was really nice!

Beautiful. Very commercialized and filled with tourists. Only change currency at licensed money changers and not those random men on the street who offer better rates. Possible to find many money changers who don't earn commission, or simply make a purchase at a shop with good conversion rates, eg. KFC in Euros to receive krowns as change.Locate the free walking tour in the area.Definitely a sight to behold

Just wonder around. What a treat to walk throw the old streets of prague. Full with character and full with unique stores. For me the brat time to see the old city is in the evening. Its full of life and speacil magic in the air

Charming Location but....... Plenty going on and visually stunning surroundings.High end designers located very near and nice places to stop and have drink or eat, great place to head for.But why oh why do the Tourist Board & Local Government allow for those Segways (battery two wheeled monstrosities) to go weaving in and out at high speeds throughout literally thousands of tourists, accident waiting to happen.

Best part of Prague. After spending five days here, we really got to know the area well and had a fab time exploring. Lots of opportunity to buy souvenirs and gifts, loads of museums to visit and lots of cafes and restaurants to stop in along the way. Old town square was especially lovely at night all lit up

Wish I could go back today!. Old Town is an amazing area with so much incredible history. The buildings are beautiful and you could spend hours walking around, sitting at a cafe, and simply enjoying this wonderful place.
Essential. You really can't go to Prague and not visit (or enjoy) The Old Town. It is one of the most beautifully preserved areas of any city in Europe.
Takes your breath away. There is so much to see in the is part of Prague, just to walk around the old streets and stunning church
Impressively preserved old buildings. Very nice stroll along the narrow streets, full of cafes, little shops and restaurants. I got in love with Prague.

Wow!. Had one day in Prague. Definitely a beautiful area to see.
Busy with people. Really enjoyed seeing this, in the day and
in the evening.

heart of the city. Lively town square, lots of bars, restaurants, great place to sit and people watch. I went over Easter and there were lots of Easter markets with live music playing and local dancers, great fun

Beautiful buildings.. As we arrived in Prague on Easter Monday, the city was still celebrating. The square was filled with wooden cabins selling food, drink and crafts. The clock is obviously a crowd puller but must say I was a little disappointed, expected more of a show!
Beers in the sun . We loved being in this square, there was so much going on all of the time! The bars were fun, all of the places we are were lovely and the views were fab!
Nice old town. Worth the visit. While walking you feel the history in the places. Nice to walk around and see the several monuments all around the corners!

Great place . Great place in the heart of Prague.
Architecture is amazing. Great little bistros and bars to eat and drink. Leads to many other attractions.

Amazing Buidings. Lovely to walk around all the old cobbled streets and see so many different buildings, if you take a walk along each small street of the main square it is a good way to see everything

One of the most beautiful squares in the world. Amazing square, you can come back here a few times.
The buildings surrounding the square is very beautiful and colorful
It's recommended to climb to the top of the clocktower to see the view.
Food Costs. Prague is still a lot cheaper than the rest of Europe for a meal for three, costing about 45 euros. However go off the beaten track and you will pay half of that.

Old Town. We visited old town several times during our stay. It was always entertaining and there were plenty of food choices to pick from the many little booths as well as the restaurants surrounding the square. There was musical entertainment as well as mimes etc.. We enjoyed just sitting there and taking it all in.
Romantic walk. I truly recommend this place for couples and for family. Great variety of shops, local stores and great food. Prague Castle...

Truly a Favourite!. I never get tired of walking in the old town square! There is just nothing like this square anywhere in the world. This was the second time we have been there around Easter so the square was a lively place with the Easter market going on. The only thing that is annoying is the people trying to sell segway tours! You will find yourself drawn back to this square!

Old square, praque. Fantastic atmospheric place to visit which was helped by kind weather and Easter market selling all sorts of traditional trinkets ie painted eggs, wooden toys, the old town hall's clock is a magnet for tourists as it chimes and is rather magnificent to see. Prices 195 chicken soup, 90 for small beer, more expensive here but great place to suck in atmosphere. If you go to exchange money please be aware to check they are giving right rate and notes. Also if you use metro tickets have to be validated beforehand and beware bogus train inspectors which spoiled our lovely stay. We're quite frightening in their approach and attitude. Wanted us to pay 800 each fine but when we refused to pay and asked for them to phone police just left us standing on the platform like lemons! Lovely city to visit though and most attractions in walking distance to each other.

Easter In Old Town. Multiple red roofed stalls selling traditional Czech fare ( mulled wine and heated cider, grilled ham, sausage and noodles, chocolates and dough chimneys with sugar and cinnamon or nutella), large Easter egg trees and livestock on dispaly with horse ridden carriages nearby and traditional music. Very festive
Old town. Old town at easter very much beautiful place many stores and restaurants and coffee shop an the church very beautiful
Beautiful old town. One of the most amazing experiences ever, I see now why Prague was so important in the past. I am very impressed.

Fell in love with the place on day one!. Lots of culture and things to see. Love the old clock in the centre of the square, but remember it's often full of tourists so can get quite busy. Friendly people and great food with lots of variety to suit all types of pallette. Can't wait to go back!

An unique place to be. Ancient atmosphere is unique. Throngs as well. Lots of souvenir shops, glass crystals ans traditional food. And beer. A lot. Many different tastes, most of them great. Be ready to spend lots of money. If money is not a concern it worth visiting this place. At least once.
beautiful buildings.. The Easter market was in place...plenty to see. Try a quieter side street for a relaxing drink. The people watching cafes on the square have more expensive beers.
Wonderful Place To Visit. You are walking through history when you are here. Yes, there can be crowds; however, we were there in early April and the crowds weren't bad at all.

Old Town - Don't Miss It!. We spent most of our time at Old Town. It was within walking distance of our hotel and there was so much to do and see and eat. Beautiful architecture and a myriad of places for coffee or drinks to enjoy while watching people go by!
tourism. Lots to see and do. Good restaurants. Must try cafe _ 22. Really nice people and good food.Beautiful churches.

Just Go and Stroll. Visited in early March so crowds were not too heavy. Fortunately had time to just wander and explore and although the featured buildings and tourist hot spots are wonderful there is architectural delights wherever one looks.

Old Town Heart.... Beautiful - just walk around and see the way it has been set up and built - just amazing heart of old town. many shops and restaurants and nearby places like castle to see...see the best view of old town from one of the tower and you will not disappoint. If you get chance to stroll at night then do so and sit in one of the restaurant and explore the beauty of it. Lovely place not to be missed...
Loved it. The old town of this city is very nice. The architecture is quite classic and impressive in particular near the center of the city.
Well preserved. Many buildings remain in their original condition. Cobble stone roads and footpaths. Like being transported back in time.

Ace location.. We stayed close to the Old Town and visited the Jewish quarter and the Old Town. Walked to everything and it was so close that we walked over the river and up to the castle. Great location.

Fun market areas. This is a fun and festive market area with street/market food and trinket shops during the day. Very Crowded at the top of each hour as tourists flock here to see the astronomical clock tower chime.
Beautiful city with lot of stories. Enjoy the old town, take one of the free tour that start at the square, at Easter there was a small make that made it even more entertaining
Beautiful!. Not much to say it's just so so so beautiful :) you need to definitely walk around and explore it. Best attraction in Prague.
Beautiful . The old town is beautiful,very clean lots of places to eat and drink not overcrowded good range of shops all the staff very nice and friendly.

Save your money. if the view is very interesting. you should know that to visit some parts of the castle you will have to pay. and when I say a few parts is parts are empty there is nothing to see,except reproductions . and to take pictures of empty rooms you have to pay extra charge . the most interesting is really outside without pay. Golden Lane is also without interest, it is only made for tourists.

My Visit to Old Town, Prague. This is definitely one of the prime locations to visit in Prague, the most popular tourist attraction, lots of restaurants, souvenir shops, and gets really crowded in the afternoon & evenings.
original style. Nice place to be, very nice city with a lot of history not known. Every building has its own story. Enough means of getting to know the city.
Old heart of town. Lovely, but overcrowded! A great many tourists, indifferent market stalls. This was early April - imagine it would be best avoided in summer!
Prague's most beautiful district. A charming district with lots of romantic alleys and cute cafes.Every building looks differently, the houses are all colorful and the atmosphere is great.
Lovely area. Once you're here you feel the lovely atmosphere, there are great stalls, shops, restaurants. The freshly made food on the stalls is just divine! It's a nice walk from most of Prague.
Quaint and gothic. The tourist hotpot of Prague so super busy at all times. Nice to wander round and enjoy the architecture.Alot of the tours leave form here too.

Fantastic city and Old Town. We were lucky, the Easter setup was still in place with stalls in the Old Town square selling all kinds of neat souvenirs and food! I had the sausage (paprika) twice (awesome) and beer many more times, also awesome!

Fun and fun. It is where you feel you are dreaming!History plus fun and nice food. There are lots of shops around and the area is very safe. There are sometimes entertainment groups performing on the stage. This is a must visit even if you have short time in Prague.

Fantastic Place to Visit. This is a definite must-see when in Prague. I was lucky enough to visit Prague in December when the square was full of Christmas Stalls and decorations. The area can be a little busy so I would recommend visiting early in the morning but there are many, many restaurants / bars / shops to stop in during the whole day or evening. We really enjoyed this part of the city and I would definitely recommend it.
Amazing architecture. Stunning buildings with a lot of history that we really enjoyed visiting . Read up on the history before you visit so you can really appreciate what you are seeing .

Old town square. This is a fabulous spot for architecture , drinks and food. It also is magnificent when lit at night. Busy obviously and plenty of people trying to get you to have Segway tours etc but not in your face

Beautiful square. It is full of history and breathtaking architecture. If you are in Prague I recommend taking a tour so you get the most out of this historical area. It is a must to visit this vibrant and beautiful square.

You must to see it !!! BOHEMIA. Really Enjoy this place , Old Town squeare. It shows Prague itself. The Astronomical clock it amazing , how they figured out day, night , months and years . You can go to the top and appreciate the magnificent view of Bohemia. You must so see it !!!

A fabulous place to wander around and relax for a leisurely drink.. A must see sight. You could wander around the shops and historical buildings there for a couple of hours. Lots of restaurants on the square where you can have a coffee or excellent check beer.

Never tire of Prague's Old Town. I've visited Prague's Old Town over a dozen times and never get tired of it. I doubt if there's any other city in the world where you can find 600 years of architecture styles in one area. Almost everywhere you look, is some architectural feast for the eyes. For aerial enjoyment of the Old Town, go up (1) the Old Town Hall tower, (2) the Powder Tower and (3) the Astronomical Tower in the Clementinum.Even the crowds lend an atmosphere to the place but if you have had too much, just take some detours from the main tourist routes and you will be spared from having to jostle with hundreds of others to get to your destination (prior study of the map of Old Town needed of course or, get a good local guide).
Best in europe?. Been to many Old Towns. This is probably the best, With Nice buildings and history, lot of shops and relaxed restaurants. Yes a lot of People, but still worth it.
Can't miss it. Beautiful architecture--- stunning history. We have purchased the Prague Card which allowed us to enter many of the sites.
Beautiful. Breathtaking architecture. Very clean city and affordable, safe. Great food selections. Charles Bridge a must

So charming! . The Old Town is a great place to walk around, the streets are narrow and contain a myriad of shops to investigate as well as places to stop for refreshments. It does get busy but still it doesn't feel to crowded, especially in March.

Easter stalls. The main square of the old town was a good start point for lots of wandering about. There was some great views of the architecture and as it was Easter there were lots of seasonal stalls out - a bit like the Christmas markets.

Breathtaking. This is the only town i want to keep visiting throughout my life and not only once as a tourist. The history, the buildings, the street artists, the food, the people! If you only visit one city during your life, this should be Prague. You fell like you woke up in a fairy tale.

Cool Place. One of my favorite places in prague. at time of visit there was the prague eastern fair with lot of local food attraction. we stayed most of the time near the place in the nearby pubs and restaurants

Old Town. amazing atmosphere
the astronomic watch
a lot stands with all kind of food, try the tzci hot dog very good and cheep

Beautiful Prague, such a pretty square. Love Prague! Beautiful buildings, great shopping, cheap beer and food very reasonable. We had a great weekend here, just very crowded with tourists, including us! So much to see. The square is so pretty with lots of restaurants and bars to sit and people watch.

Easter in Old Town!. If you like markets go at Easter or Christmas for the outside markets. We enjoyed shopping for Czech hand made Easter eggs and eating many kielbasas. Yes there is now a Starbucks located across from the clock, I guess that's supposed progress.

Family Tour Of Old Town...walking & seeing sioghts. Prague is a great walking city...compact..my favorite city I have visited in Europe...many beautiful,historic buildings..not damaged in World War II..Wonderful place to visit
Wow. Got to love the architecture and history, amd the fact that everything is within walking distance. Beautiful beautiful beautiful
very touristic, but interesting.. just walk around this interesting old town, of course your are not alone. walk from the Sataromesske namesti via the Karlova, pass the bridge and up to the castle.

Like being in a fairytale!. A really picturesque place, full of incredible building and churches! The only negative is that in high season there are a thousand of tourists making the walking through the narrow streets hard.

The Golden Prague!. Breathtaking. I come from Krakòw, a beautiful historic town, so I'm used to seeing monuments and sites, but Prague brought me to my tourist's knees - she's definitely the most stunning town I've ever seen! Splendid, golden, picturesque, romantic, historic, sentimental, a must-go on Europe's map!
Great markets . Great markets! Unsure if they were just for Easter or not but they had beautiful arts and crafts along with great local food. Square can get very busy so watch your belongings!
It was very crowded in the easter. The astronomical clock and the church are the most attractive but the sqare and the buildings are also beautiful.

Leisurely. Old Town is a place where one may find any number of surprises: a fair, shops, cafes, people watching, interesting architecture, photo ops. Take your time and meander through the square and the streets - no hurry, only your own pace.

Must visit if in Prague. This is where everyone ends up if you visit Prague. The Astronomical clock, St Nicholas church, Church of our lady before Tyn and loads of other fantastic attractions are here. Fabulous in the day but even better all lit up at night. Lots of nice bars, restaurants, shops too and lots of places to book trips and tours etc.
A must see. Great place to visit, the old fashioned architecture is amazing! Definitely go up the astronomical clock tower, the views are incredible.

Beautiful, eventful and full of history. Super beautiful square, with different street preformances throughout the day, lots of things to see and explore, and plenty of local street food stands. Don't miss the astronomical clock. Across the square from the clock there's a small art gallery which we highly recommend as well. Great place to stroll around and have a great time at :)

Fantastic Bohemian architecture. In this square you are surrounded by intersting old buildings with the focal point being the astronomical clock with its hourly walk of the saints.Very crowded for this display.

Easter Fair. Visited this area of Praha every day while we were here on holiday. Fantastic Easter Fair, great shops, sites, history, atmosphere and lovely street fare and drinks. Can't imagine visiting Prague when the Easter Fair is not running.

Lovley old town! . The old town in Prauge is really lovley! It's old house and old churchs evrywere!It's so beutiful! In evry corner you have a nice café or a great restaurant, but don't go to a place where they serve traditional czechish food, because it's really bad!!I recommend the old town to evryone i Prauge, even if you're just there for one day, you must visit the old town!Remember to keep an eye on your phone and moneys, there is a lot of pickpockets! Take the metro or the tram to Stárometska (line A) or Mústek (line A or B) and then you're in the old town! Enjoy your stay!

beautiful. old town is really beautiful, there are some lovely restaurants and shops, it can get very busy though. Don't seem to get hassled from anyone selling things which I liked. I felt really safe walking around it.

Beautiful place . Place to come once and then return. Lively place with plenty to see, eat and drink. The ambiance is happy and you will enjoy simply people watching and strolling in this beautiful area.
Heart of The City. This place can offer everything you need or expect - beutiful, famous buildings, souvenir shops and very nice cafes, street performers... you'll enjoy old town very much...
History Everywhere. What an experience. The old town square is the Center of Prague. With access to all of the major sites and the best restaurants not far away, this is the center of the city.

Sightseeing must!. Visited here with a group of friends. There is lots to see and do! Lots of nice buildings and old churches and synagogues. It might be useful to take an information book or map with you.There is also lots of nice restaurants and bars.

Wow !!!!. This place is like a setting in a fairy tale, very picturesque and fun. The smells coming from the stalls selling various foods make your mouth water, would love to come back and see it in winter. Definitely a must see if you visit Prague.

Amazing town. This beautiful town will take you back to an enchanted city with many unexpected surprises that will fascinate you. Praha is one of the most majestic cities I've ever seen. It is famous worldwide for its cobbled streets, the Jewish quarter, the genius Kafka and David Cerny's awesome art, and it treats you with spectacular samples of Gothic and Baroque architecture. We have two days left and I'm planing to come back already!

So much to see, so little time .... Old Town is wonderful for sightseeing, entertainment, dining and just walking. Plan on spending hours here over the course of a few days and mix up the sights with the experiences. Mostly pedestrian street to explore.

Not what expected, or perhaps should have planned! . I was excited to visit old square, look at the history and old Jewish synagogues and cematary etc but ended up not seeing anything, let's of people about didn't understand or get how to book or where any of the attractions were, well the entrances. All we could find was how to book tours which we did.t want to do, couldn't find out individual tickets, not much English information about!!? We tried :(
Magical!!!!. It's amazing place! You can walk here all day and it won't be enough. There is a feeling that you are in real fairytale. Every corner of Old city is filled with mystery.

Very nice.. We prefer Prague to Paris. Prague is more beautiful with less people but is also much smaller and is beautiful almost everywhere. The food and shopping is better in Paris though but it is much more expensive as well.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful place with stunning architecture. Easy place to fall in love with and I certainly did.
Stunning!. Just the most amazing architecture! Lots of quaint street. Eccellent shops and the stalls in the centre so inviting.

Walking through the history. There are plenty of notorious places here such as Old Town Square, Ungelt or Jewish Quarter but it is worth it to safe some time and explore smaller streets. One nice area is among Karlova street, Bethlem Square, Narodni street and the river, another one is among Parizska street, Dlouha street, Revolucni street and the river. There are nice restaurants and coffee shops there, interesting houses and churches as well. The best time to explore is in the morning or in the evening. Both areas are quite safe.

Beautiful. Definitely beautiful and one of the best preserved and nicest old city centres in the world. Take a good guide (Sandeman's new Prague tours is a good choice) and you'll learn about the interesting and rich history of this city! The city is also full of nice restaurants and bars (Czech beer is famous and, especially if non pasteurised, delicious!).
need to see this. We really enenjoyed the visit .it is an must to see and see all the churches to.and nice place to eat.

Amazing City. I've travelled to many European cities, and Prague by far is the greatest, with exquisite views, and wonderful sites. The city is so cheap compared to other European cities. I recommend you go!!!!!
Amazing buildings. Visited for the Easter market. Very busy. Stunning buildings, fair range of stalls and amazing clock. Good restaurants and stalls serving very reasonably priced food.

Festive atmosphere. The first time we walked into the square was about 20 minuets prior to the Astronomical Clock chiming, even then you could feel the crowds excitement building waiting for the top of the hour, will never forget the sheer joy everyone showed (no matter the nationality) for this true work of art.

Highlight of the eastern side of the river . To get the best view of the old town go up the town hall-(small fee, less for student with ID). Definitely go for the Easter market where they sell things like painted paper mache eggs.
Magestic.!. Beautiful old town with an Eater market where they had easter eggs, trdelnik, souvenirs, etc .Bit crowded being Easter but the awesome architecture and cobbled roads was really good.
Easter in Prague. Very beautiful. Easter Market in progress with many varied stalls of food and local product plus a stage for music and dancing

The first thing to do in Prague. It is really nice to visit. The good thing about old town square is that you can visit a lot of things at the same place. And many of the sightseeing places are far from each other just a few minutes by walk. I recommend to do it twice if you are staying a couple of days in prague. There are a couple of companies that run free guided tours. They are really good because they do a good job in these tourse for getting your attention into their paid tours. So, you will get many great information about prague in general. So, you can find these free tours easily by googling them. I did with a company that i forgot the name now. But they held orange umberellas in old town squar or in front of Rudolfinum. They are quite good. Ohh! Be careful so much about pickpockets. they know their job very well. They stole me 5000 CZK and I realized it when i came home.
Pinacle of Prague. The most interesting part of Prague with delicious cuisine, stunning architecture and full of history and Czech culture.

Out of a fairy tale!. This part of the city feels like pulled out of a fairy tale... specially at night! The castles like cathedral, the clock tower, the restaurants around the squear.... everything amazing!

Beautiful and enchanting Prague Old Town Square!. With its ancient buildings and magnificent churches, this is one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe! Experience its dramatic beauty during the day and night when all the sites are illuminated, awesome!
So beautiful!. This is beautiful, maybe the thing i loved the most about prague is that it is a small city but full of beautiful things all together.
Superb architecture but disappointed Easter market. Very beautiful building all the way round the square but the Easter market was a little disappointed . Many of the same stalls .
Historic. If you are into History then come here, lots of things to see and the buildings are absolutely stunning.

Beautiful settings in a scenic town. I was here during Easter when there was a festival. The festival included many local Czech foods and unique items, such as handmade Easter eggs and local chocolates. The churches surrounding the area are beautiful. I highly recommend a visit to the astronomical clock tower. The views from the top are incredible.
Very Nice. Old town is the place to get lost in, lost of shops and lots of stores, plenty of places to check out. Probably the most touristy area of the city I would think

Very nice place. summer, winter spring or fall, there is never a bad time to visit Pragues Old Town square. its allways full of people, and there is much to see around. even more if you will visit the attractions that it has to offer. just keep an eye open on your belongings.

Third time at Stare Mesto, and still enjoying it!. This nice old town has tons of charm, and you can spend the entire day walking around watching nice buildings and town squares. It can crowded in the middle of the day, so if you want to shoot nice pictures, you should go early in the morning.

Beautiful atmospheric city. Every direction you look in has a beautiful building. The cafes and restaurants cater for tourists and locals with a variety of tastes. I loved discovering the stunning churches.

What a beautiful city!. We really enjoyed our stay in Praha. We can recommend walking up to the castle and also to the tower where you have even a better view than from the castle!
Just take time for discovering also the small aspects of the city!

A must-see!. The Old Town Square is a beautiful part of the city, with gorgeous architecture and many things to look at. Surprisingly it is very quite, due to a lack of traffic, but this helps you to relax and just take in the atmosphere. We visited over the Easter weekend and it was a wonderful experience, looking at all the pretty stalls and listening to the traditional folk music being played by a small orchestra. We found all the local people to be very friendly and they were always willing to help us with directions!Try and visit the astronomical tower on the hour, as you will see the small characters come out of the clock, but if you can't get there then it is still worth a look at other times because it is such a gorgeous building. The cobbles and the old buildings give the place so much character, and it just looks simply stunning when the sunlight hits the golden paint on the buildings - well worth a visit!

Wonderful architecture, Charming Side Streets. The Old Town of Prague, aside from the Old Town Square itself, is just as charming. It's quite easy to get turned around in the winding streets, but it's fine because there are innumerable restaurants and shops to enjoy. It's not actually annoying touristy as soon as you break away from the square (which, for Europe, isn't nearly as touristy anyway). The Jewish cemetery in the Old Town is a gem, as are the various churches spread around the city (interesting fact - the majority of Czechs consider themselves non-religious, but the churches are a beautiful reminder of when this wasn't the case). We never had a bad (or overly expensive) meal in the Old Town, which our hotel had warned us would be more expensive than the rest of the city, but honestly was shockingly reasonable. It's one of those places were it's just fun to walk around in circles on a sunny day enjoying the buildings all day and stopping for coffee when you need a pick me up. Make sure you try the Slivovice and Becherovka at some point (local drinks).

A fairy tale. It is essentially Disneyland that has come to life! The view from the Old Astronomical Clock is second to none. You will pay 110 czk for the entrance but the ticket is valid for a full day. So you can view Prague from above in the day and in the night. Both are equally stunning.
What A look.. This place is allways Worth A visit. There are allways Many people. Like to go there and get some of the atmosphere. Would go there again.

An unforgettable trip!. My husband and could easily spend a whole week exploring the Old Town!
Loved our trip! Everything heard about how amazing the historic Prague is was true: the historic buildings, underground city, clock tower, the chapels!

Beautiful town square with great shopping. This is a beautiful part of Prague with lots to see and do. Climb the old town hall tower for a great view. I went in March and it was pretty crowded so I can only imagine what this area is like in the summer (probably packed with people). Lots of fun side streets off the main square to get lost shopping in and there is a fun flee market in close proximity. A great place to check out.

Highlight of our visit. You could easily spent a full day here without seeing all there is to see. Many streets, alleyways, grand buildings and a magnificent square. You must see the astrological clock, visit the many bars and restaurants, see the street artists and visit the many market stalls.It can be very busy, and you must look out for pickpockets.Prague at its very best
Busy and vibrant . A busy and vibrant place which is well worth an explore and has some lovely market stalls perfect for gifts
The old town is very compact.. The manicipal house, national theatre, national museum , old astronomical clock. Jewish cemetery, synagogue are very close to each other.,

Beautiful Square!. I stayed in the Old Town Square on my recent visit and spent a lot of time around here. There are so many lovely buildings to look at and lovely restaurants too. It is such a beautiful square with the astronomical clock and Tyn Church looking over it. The stalls in this square were lovely too, selling Easter gifts and local cuisine!

A must see. Beautiful place. Good for strolling around and stopping for a beer to people watch. Astronomical Clock worth standing by on the hour. At Easter time they even had markets and an Easter Tree - so lovely.

history and art with good commerce and food places. a pity you can't take pictures in the our lady of tym church. don't miss the garnet jewelry stores and "crosta " cake . be at astronomical clock at sharp hour.

Feel like go back in time. It's such a charming city! It feels like going back to medieval century. The square is full of surprises. Street artists provide great entertainment and I feel like I'm the Game of Throne!
Europe April 2015. This part of the town like a magical or fairy tale. Lots of tourist were waiting for the old clock to ring it bells just around the corner.

nice neigborhood. Our house was on the old town, therefore I have spent 3 days around oldtown. I really liked that part of the town. There is everything you need close by. It was extremely crowded due to easter and the Chinese president was going to be in Prague after a long time.

Fairytale Square. Old town Prague has the most spectacular old town in all of Europe. It was untouched by World War II and has many outstanding buildings with great architecture. The astronomical clock, Tyn church and more are in this square
Beautiful. Such a picturesque city, and really easy to get around. Locals are friendly and happy to direct you. So many beautiful sights to take in.

Auld toon. Lovely old square lovely buildings. They had a market on loads stalls food and drink.
It can get very busy so maybe go early to enjoy the views. Pubs and restaurants can be expensive around here.
Nice Christmas market . We really enjoyed the old town square. Lots to see especially with the markets. I highly recommend to stop by

Beautiful Great location. Great , beautiful and historic! There so many shops and stores but our tour guide said its cheaper to eat outside of the center. I love how everything is within walking distance and i recommend parking in a parking garage because we saw lots of cars with Boots on them so you don't want to get stuck with that.

Inhail the inner city and it charm. Walk the city, enjoy the buildings, the squares.
We had the pleasure of Easter market and tasted specialities both sausages, fresh made potato chips, traditional cakes and of course Czech beer
Like a postcard!. This square in so beautiful that you might think you stepped out of an old European dream sequence. A must see!

Stunning City. A stunningly beautiful city! Unfortunately all the sights are in a small geographical area. This makes for a very crowded tour area. We were there in off season "October" and felt a bit "squished" but hear that was nothing compared to summer months. In spite of all that, it's a must see! We also took a Segway tour, which I highly recommend. Don't be afraid, it's easier than you think (was my first time on a Segway). A lively city center with lots of restaurants and bars. Very international.

wonderful city. incredible architecture dont forget to look up ,carvings and frescos everywhere old cobbled streets and squares,take comfy stout shoes though very uneven cobbles and pavements in places places
Amazing architecture.... I cannot believe how magnificent this building is. Breathtaking whether close or admiring from a distance.i hope to be able to have this experience again.

Excellent :). Every time I visit Prague, I go this place. I love the atmosphere: street musicians, the architecture, pubs and restaurants. You feel how Middle Ages meets Nowadays. Enjoy the dynamic vibrations, be ready to get free hugs or to take a part in a little show of street artists. Love this place, that's it!

Good place to visit. Good to walk through it, always crowded. Too many tourists for a small area, you can't do much on your own. Locals are not too keen on the tourists but just to get your money, if it is not you, someone else will come, poor service to tourists in all the city.
Beautiful!. Lived here! It was a very nice area and sights were amazing! Make sure to visit this place! Take a tour!
Wonderful!. Beautiful old town there was an Eater market where they had easter eggs, trdelnik, souvenirs, etc i loved the Tyn church and old town, awesome arquitecture! coming back soon.

Beautiful buildings . The old town in Prague is amazing. There are many old and well maintained buildings in the city. During the Easter time it is possible to visit the Easter market which happens in the main square. There you will find numerous local specialties, as the Trdelnik.

Gets very crowded later in the day, but that is when the action is.... The old town square is a great experience both very early in the day before it get crowded and later when the vendors open their stalls. Try both.
Lots of cool shops, history, and architecture . So much to do! Everything is so neat with all kinds of architecture, and so many kinds of cafes, restaurants, and even special museums.

Everything's there!. You haven't been to Prague if you haven't been in the old town square.Watch the astronomical clock animating on the hour change, and wait in line to climb the tower for the panoramical view, it's worth it. While at it, enjoy the delightful elevator that won a design award.Street performers are always setting the mood with good music, and many balconies sell hot food and amazing sweet Trdelnik! Try one with Nutella!Many museums are just around the corner, I advise you to visit the Chocolate one!

Who said Paris is Romantic??? Go in Prague!. One of my favourite places on earth! In my opinion, this part of Prague is one of the best in the world, with a really nice atmoshere! Really glad that I could see this on day, and night as well. I cannot decide what was better! The small streets give you the perfect romantic atmosphere!

One of the prettiest parts of Prague. There are many brilliant (and less tourist-crowded) places to visit in Prague. This one is like historical classic. You won't be disappointed, but expect really large numbers of German/Russian/Chinese tourists.

A must see in Prague! . I loved the Old Town Square! It was very busy and crowded but we went around Easter and it had so many little markets set up. Lots to see and do, it's easy to spend half a day in that area alone!

Circle of life in Prague. A place where all things meet, the center of Prague. This is the one place from where you can go anywhere. This place has many churches and lot of restaurants for keep your taste bugs ticking. The astronomical clock will give you a swirl of and the pub right next would twist your mind. Overall a very beautiful and happening place.!!!
Atmospheric. Great to be there during Easter Week and share in the celebrations. The decorations everywhere were lovely.
Lots to see and do but always super busy. . When in Prague you have to visit he old town. However it is a tourist trap and chocked block full of people. You have been warned.
Amazing!. This is the place you want to visit when coming to Prague. So beautiful and full of history. You should do the Free Walking Tour while you are there.

Busy . This is an amazing square. There was traditional live music and dancers which was very entertaining. There were also street artists a bussing Easter market and lots of food stands. The square was packed with tourists but not so much so that it ruined the visit. A great atmosphere.

Great Atmosphere. A great place to eat and drink with a busy atmosphere, as it was near Easter the stalls were out in the square which made it even better, it can be a little expensive to eat in the restaurants though, worth a visit as it has loads of history

Old Town Square. This square is full of bars restraunts and little huts selling things. It also has lots of shops around it. It is worth going to see the culture as it sells authentic czech food and it can be really cheap. In the day time bands can be playing or local folk trying to earn money which is really nice to see their culture. Be careful when eating in some places as they can add service charge to your bill so you do not have to tip!! Its a must when visiting prague.

An Old European place. We were there twice. First time on Easter when there was a national fair with the traditional eggs and cookies. Second time were there last summer and again the place was full of joy and there was that beautiful atmosphere of an old European capital city.
Food market. I'hv been during ester many tourists there especially in the evening, nice to walk around and try some local food, variety of food and resturant, souvenir shop around

Minimoon . Having been to some of Europe's most popular city squares this has to be one of my favourites. Very clean and spruced up. Decent easter market stalls with goods at a fair price and no one trying to rip u off(unlike Rome)

Facinating area with many photo ops!. The central plaza has many interesting places and the architecture was amazing. While cold, there were many stands set up in the square offering shopping and dining. Live music was on stage every time we visited. Be sure and see the old clock tower!

Old Beauty. If you enjoy sight seeing then Prague is in no shortage. You will be on your feet all day finding new places to visit and Old Town is the heart of Prague, full of beautiful views and plenty of visitors.
Recommended for architecture. its free, its pretty, good for camera happy people and those who appreciate detailed architecture. Do take a walk down the cobbled streets and explore!

Must See. Cant really miss it, its where its all happening. We were there in run up to Easter and there was an Easter Market set up, this is also location of the Astronomical clock, Town Hall and many beautiful buildings, very picturesque. Can get very busy especially around the clock, everyone waiting to watch the clock on the hour, beware of pick pockets. Also take care there are Segway's whizzing about, they are a nuisance.

wander to your heart's delight. I am just in love with this place. The only thing that breaks the spell are the business peddlers trying to get people into their establishments and it can, at times, be so full of people (more a problem for the Charles Bridge). If you are looking for a good wander, this is definitely the place to do it.

Beautiful. Such an amazing atmosphere, beautiful buildings and lots of nice restaurants and bars around the square. If you walk a little further down the back streets, there are so many nice shops and restaurants that are a little bit cheaper than the main square.

Spectacular plaza!. This big, impressive plaza is filled with historical building, cute little traditional stores, food stands with typical Czech food and wonderful places to grab a seat and enjoy a nice beer. All site seeing locations are close by too, making it easy to go from one place to another by walk.
Amazing!. While incredibly crowded, this is a "must" if you are visiting Prague. Avoid the crowds and arrive as early as possible!

Disneyland for adults. This city, especially its old part, is a well preserved or rebuild wonder, that each person that appreciates architecture should come and enjoy. Go to Prague, you won't be sorry !

Nice little square. The Easter markets were on when I was there so it was very busy. I really enjoyed getting a pivo and watching the world go by. The beers are obviously overpriced, however it was worth it for the scenery.

Great atmosphere, amazing architecture and fab street food. We were staying near the Old Town Square area, so had a stroll most evenings down through Wenceslas Square to the Old Town Square. It was quite busy, but not overwhelmingly so. Ate at a very good Czech restaurant just before reaching the Astrological Clock. Very good food and great value for money. The street food was good too - especially the freshly cooked potato crisps and also enjoyed the hot wine (the evenings were quite chilly and this was a great way to warm up). There were lots of stalls selling souveniers, but we didn't feel hassled by any of the stall holders, as we have in some other cities we've visited. All in all this felt like a vibrant, safe place to spend the evening.
Easter markets added to the magic!. Amazing place to experience the culture and history, need to wear sensible comfortable shoes all the time, every street is cobbled!

Where it's all happening. . In old town square you have all the bars, market stalls (this maybe be temporary for Easter, so do check)The Astronomical clock, the churches and much more. It has beautiful passage ways with history on every corner. Beautiful buildings.But be warned. It does get very busy and there are so many tour guides there offering you their services including segways, boat trips and walks that it gets slightly annoying. Sometimes you want to be left to it and don't want to be bothered constantly. But I guess that's part of their job. Also we were warned about pickpockets but as I've mentioned in other posts this happens in all major cities and you just need to always take care of your belongings.

Impossible to miss. Great place, full of nice old buildings but also packed with tourists and people trying to sell you tourist attractions. The astronomical clock is really more beautiful than the photos, that's why you have to go. Great point to find companies that offer free waking tours, one day tour outside Prague and other different tours. Be careful with pick pockets and avoid eating. The prices are outrages, instead walk a little further. Also be careful when exchanging money here. This is the main scam in Prague. If you have to change money, make sure to ask if there's no commission and also confirm that is you give them "X", they will give you back "Y".

Great atmosphere . We visited the square on more than one occasion. Amazing location with both the old town hall, Tyn church and the andstronomical clock. Lots of surrounding restaurants but they are pricey (tourist trap) cheaper and nicer options down side streets. Look where the local eat! Amazing atmosphere in the square it's self, we have about 30 photos of just the square.
Lovely square!. Great part of Prague, but we never experienced a bad part all the city was fantastic! We will return!!!

Beautiful architecture. Fantastic buildings, ornate churches and clocks with a story to tell - Prague's Old Town is a lovely place to stroll around. Plenty of curio shops and cafes are dotted around the cobbled streets. Although it is easy to lose oneself, you soon come to a recognisable landmark.

Average. It has loads of shops around the side roads. The square itself has loads of food places in. The clock itself was disspointing considering this is there selling point of the town. It rings and don't move bar two ppl coming out above. Thought the clock would move considering the mechanics people show on the clock for tourists to buy. Wasnt impressed. But the square itself wasnt too bad.

Gorgeous Tyn Church. Walking around Old Town is cool but what I personally love most is the Tyn Church. A true dominant of the Old Town square together with other beautiful buildings around incuding lots of cafes and restaurants. You cannot skip this place when you are in Prague.
Real history. I am impressed like many of the tourists of Prague. The city is reflecting the history in each corner and the street.

Quaint but not cheap!. A great way to start off your visit to Prague - there are loads of free walking tours but we decided to mooch around ourselves. We were lucky that the Easter market was on but keep an eye on your bags - with all the people we were warned about pickpockets. The clock is a great meeting place and you have to see what happens on the hour. I wouldn't drink here - way too expensive - you just need to walk off the main square to find a more reasonable drinking place. The square has a brilliant atmosphere and is a great way to start your day. Not signposted too well.

the highlight of this location is, of course,. the clock. with a parade of characters, human and other animals, making their appearances at the appropriate times. so to speak...it doesn't take all that long to see this but it's worth sticking around for 15 or so minutes if it isn't yet 'time for the show'.

Fairytale. Beautiful place, very fairytale. Real hustle bustle place full of tourists (especially around the astrological clock) but do not be put off by it, lovely cobbled pavements/roads. Has a very magical feel about it and looks even prettier at night when the church is all lit up. Love this place
Simply beautiful. Baroque at its best, Old Town is a wonder to visit. Buildings are a marvel to gaze at, and there is no shortage of bars/restaurants to visit.

Did not disappoint. On our first day in Prague we were advised to visit the Old Town first. So my advice is - don't bother with a map, just go there; wander about and if something takes your eye go and see it; don't make a plan, just go with the flow; take your time and look up frequently; enjoy the little shops and the narrow streets.If you have any preconceptions about Prague these will be met by a slow wander around the Old Town. Don't worry you can't really get lost.

Picture Perfect. Even though it was quite cold we really enjoyed walking through old town. There are many great little restaurants and shops. The best is if you can timeIt during a festival around Christmas or Easter. Don't expect one of a kind sort of goods there but still worth taking a look. It is very touristy but hey, you're a tourist right ? :)

Beautiful and historic. A must see if you are visiting Prague. Since Prague is one of the only major cities that was not bombed in WW2, the old town center is still intact and beautiful. Just walk around and enjoy, but be on the lookout for pickpockets.
A hive of activity.. Just prior to Easter. The square is beautiful and was alive with visitors, food stalls and an entertainment stage. Great atmosphere but watch out for the Segways.
Be sure to see this!. It can get very very crowded. But go first thing in the morning and crowds are MUCH better. Be sure to try a sausage at one of the vendors there!
beautiful!. Great for walking around. We enjoyed the concessions and the clock tower. perfect town for tourists.

Fantastic to stay in Old Town. We found that by staying so centrally, it was much easier to get around, especially in the evenings, when we could literally step out of the front door of the hotel, and start exploring the streets and restaurants
Must see. There is so much to see in the Old Town. Check out your guidebook and make sure you don't miss the clock in action on the hour

Easter Visit. We did not plan on our timing to Prague to coincide with Easter but it did and we were pleasantly surprised. The square was full of little shops and markets. The smell of fresh baked food was everywhere. But so were the tourists! It was very busy in the square but there is nothing to really complain about it was still a nice trip. The square is a definite must place to visit and make sure to go during the day and at night when it is lit up with lights.
Nice and quaint. Busy Found help taking teamNeed more indications in English like big signs showing direction and "you are here " indicatorsNO ENGLISH SIGNSGREAT SHOPPINGCROWDED

Wonderful. Such a nice city. Beware of the small shops run by foreigners. They rip you off like nothing and tell it to your face even. Never ever paid so much for a post card and stamp in my life. Avoid the souvenir shops, I would say. Never ever again. Enjoy the town! Great scenery etc.

Magnificent. I like visiting Midieval towns in Europe but Prague tops them as the only preserved City. It has wonderful (and unique) architecture but unlike most Mideval "villages" its a real City in which ordinary people live and work. That said, the old town itself is mainly aimed at tourists in terms of shops etc. but the "new town" is only steps away.
Must see. Well, i goes this is one of the primary reasons to visit Prague. It is full of churches, castles and other buildings that will take you back to med evil centra Europe

Cute town centre. So much going on here, there is street entertainment, lots of bars and restaurants and pubs! Also lots of little shops and some many side streets to go down a perfect place to people watch from one of the many restaurants with out side eating area! Definatly worth spending an afternoon there and going straight into the evening!
Must see while in Europe. Old Prague, City of Prague after all, is the places that you HAVE to visit at least once in your lifetime! Every building, every street is picturesque!
Amazing place. The place is refreshing and full of energy and history. If you ever stop in Prague you must stop by this place.

Beautiful architecture. Visited this area a few times during our stay, busy area particularly at nite and during the day held an Easter Market. Beautiful at night time when the buildings were all lit up. Prices to eat slightly dearer in this area as obviously a tourist attraction but we found a quaint little restaurant just up an alleyway leading to the square where we had a fantastic meal and paid around £15 for two of us for main course, a side of veg and a bottle of wine.

Funny legend behind unequal size of the towers. This is a place with full of history everywhere. Although it is little difficult to realise the remaining small part of dark red old Parliament building, it is still standing to remind us the world wars. And I really love the legend behind the unequal size of towers. It is said that the slim tower represents Eve and the other one is Adam :) They are watching the town all the time :D
Lovely spot. Beautiful buildings. Great atmosphere - especially all the small wooden vending booths. The restaurants and cafes are quite pricey.
Great view at night.. First we walked over the bridge at night and this was a fantastic experience. We did it a second time by day.
Beautiful!!!. What a lovely town, architecture is stunning, great atmosphere, it was Easter celebrations this week, therefore markets and stage playing various acts. Very central of Prague.
Very nice town. We are in 14.18.3.2016 and peoples was very nice and town is very nice to. A lot you can see, museums, views from towers, chocolate museum,...

What a charming Old Town Square !!!. Old Prague is just one of those places that you HAVE to visit at least once in your lifetime! Every building, street, store is picturesque and worth to visit ! You could spend 5 months in the city (just as I did) and you would still discover something new every day. Prague is a living museum that brings us back in the past while making us feel more alive than ever.

Many things are happening there. The obvious visit is to the Clock Tower - you need to be at least 15 to 20 minutes early - the highlights are every day time hour - you could see the clock moving objects with medieval characters around - it is free to watch - but if you want to get inside you only have to pay a very small amount - another thing is the churches round the square - paying a visit to each church could last from just 3 minutes to 3 hours - depending on how many things you want to dig up. For short and quick visit, buy things - crystals are native produces there - if that's too expensive even a t-shirt is worth a purchase - don't forget to pay a visit to Kafka's birth place / now called Kafka square. Worth sitting around - yes, the coffee there are over priced - but how much could they over price when a coffee is only USD3.00?

Delightful. You can spend days in the square and walk around the surrounding streets. The food choices are marvelous but it is always more exciting to find places off the main square. We were never disappointed. Wonderful city.

Fabulous maze!. You can spend hours wandering the winding streets which are full of bars, restaurants and shops. If you find somewhere you want to return to mark it on your map as you may not find it again!
Nice to see. The Old Town is like a Landmark, you can see it everywhere you are in the town. It's bizarre because the Old Town is behind new buildings.

Indescribably beautiful!. Stare Mesto in Prague has got to be one of the most architecturally beautiful places in the world. The clock chimes every hour, the bustle of people, the cobblestone streets...it's just magnificent. There's something to be discovered around every corner.
Definitely worth a visit. Must do. Unable to miss it really. There are lots of alleys and roads off it, where it is fun to wander.
Simply beautiful. Very interesting place for walk. So many beautiful buildings, very animated town full of people from all around the world.
As I anticipated. I was expecting a grand old city & was not disappointed. The architecture & civic amenity is truly inspiring.

Beautiful Old Town. When you are in Prague, you must visit this stare mesto or Old Town because this area is so awesome. There are so many bohemian buildings which will amaze you. You will not be tired of walking exploring the Prague because everything you see there is really awesome. I will be staying in Prague till 22 March and continuing my trip to Budapest.Btw, there are many other magnificent building you can visit while you are in Czech or Ceska Republik. This city is really nice.
Stunning!!. It's the most attractive location in Prague. The Tyn church and the arrangement of the buildings, takes you back to the medieval times. The Easter markets were just out of this world!!

Great Location. One of those must see sights for the character of the square and surroundings,especially the Astronomical Clock. Lots of cafe/bars and restaurants to just sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

Street performers, artists, and great restaurants.. Old Town in Prague has cobbled streets with many places to shop and eat. A giant astronomical clock strikes every hour. Many artists and street performers made the area entertaining. We sat at a side walk cafe and watched the people pass by.

Beautiful area to walk around.. Lots of lovely buildings in the old town, variety of small shops plus designer shops, loads of pubs, restaurants. Lots of side streets come off Old Town Square to explore.

Beautiful town . We spent hours wondering the cobbled streets. We had a few things in mind about what we wanted to see but I'd recommend just spending an afternoon making your own way around.
Only complaint is the amount of times I almost got run over by someone on a Segway!

Busy, but beautiful. Visited today. Was very busy, an awful lot of people about.however the area is beautiful, lots of restaurants, street food, bars, shops, and attractions to see. Some of the restaurants in the old town square are a bit more expensive than others round the corner but still very nice. Worth a visit for some nice street food and photo opportunities.
A must in Prague. The buildings are interesting to see. We were there close to Easter and there was a nice market with some food to chose from.
Great atmosphere.. Great atmosphere. Lots to see and do. Lovely outdoor cafes with heaters and lap blankets where you could sit and people watch, or wait for the astronomical clock to do its thing!

Fantastic Atmosphere. The Old Town Square and the connecting walking street to the Carls Bridge is an area with a fantastic atmosphere and amazing experiences. You find excellent restaurants and cafes, and all sorts of folk lore, shops etc.
You must experience this fantastic area!

Cheap Walking Tour and free if you are tight with the cash. We took a walking tour around for a really cheap price, a guide adds to the whole information gathering and we actually went underground to see some of the older places and how they were used in the 2nd WW. Interestingly ta lot of the old town was untouched by the occupying force as they were keeping it for a Jewish museum after the war!Nice place to spend time, and not too big to do on your own.

Wonderful maze of cobbled streets with delightful baroque buildings. This myst surely be one of the most beautiful cities in the world and a delight to walk around but i cannot help feeling rather sad for this city. It appears to be crumbling under the weight of graffiti (its everywhere) and the constant menace of litter. The former almost probably the result of a minority of locals, the latter the result of tourists. Go out on the streets early on a Saturday morning near Charles Bridge and the amount of litter is almost biblical. What a real shame.

Beautiful Town Square. The Old Town Square is absolutely beautiful and full of vibrancy and interesting people. The square is surrounded by beautiful old buildings and a varied selection of bars and restaurants, which whilst maybe a little more expensive than elsewhere in Prague, do make an excellent vantage point for people watching.
Stunning. Stunning location, charming, full of interesting history, good food and beautiful unique restaurants.
Magical. It was like stepping in to a fairytale. Lovely but very busy. The segways are a bit of a pain too! With Easter next week there were some lovely Easter decorations too.

Stunning!. Around every corner os something exciting for your eyes to feast on. There is a good reason that it is always packed with droves of people taking pictures. When in Prauge this is an absolute must see, but I cannot imagine anyone coming to Prague without seeing this beautiful area.

Great place to visit. Great square to visit, lots of restaurants with terraces outside but a bit crowded with tourists. Expect to pay western prices.
Tower clock is worth going to, you can see the whole of Prague from the top

Fell in love with it. Walk down the cobbled street with ur loved one with a piping coffee in one hand, absorbing the old world feel and drooling over the architecture around u...on a chilling day - The perfect setting to spend the afternoon in Praha.

What a great area of the city to tour. Walk everywhere you can and climb every tower available. The Old Town area is full of beautiful sites and a vibrant atmosphere throughout the day and night. Look for the clock tower on the hour to see the wonderful workings of this beautiful clock.

Beautiful old town of Prague. Always worth to visit, but not on segway,,,which is not recommended anymore, due to the limits.. Perfect conditions are only last 20 years, before the place was sad. Now this small square offers the history, nice buildings that you can see while drinking bear or coffee in the outside restaurant. Just recommended. The trip for 3 days enough. Enjoy.
