Picturesque and a must-do. Great place to walk around and look at the buildings. Whilst we were here there the Easter markets were on which meant it was easy to get a tasty snack and hot wine for cheap whilst walking around. It was beautiful here durning the night and during the day.

Classic square with old world feel and New world people watching. One the hour with noon being the best hour, the clock delights the crowd. Shopping, dining, pictures, and people. Sunny days are the best here.
Amazing city centre. Many things to see and to do during the day or by night, museums, coffees, restaurants, open air kiosks etc. Must to see place in Praha.
Amazing!. This is definitely one of the most (if not the most) beautiful city in Europe! A walk down this part of the city is just so special! Views are to die for.

An obvious place to start your trip in Praha. What can I say that everyone else hasn't? Not much. The square has the heavenly smell of burning wood and cooking meat. Walk through the stalls, get a beer, walk some more, eat a cinnamon baked circle thing that is a national staple and enjoy the fantastic locale.

Beguiling city with so many historic buildings. Do a tour to get the full story and marvel at the buildings. So much to see, but beware, it is very busy, with tourists! Not much traffic and those in cars travel slow and with car, which was great, unlike many city centres.

Beautiful old city. Absolutely loved the Old Town. Lots to see, especially the Old Clock. Beautiful in March with a good few inches of snow. Plenty of touristy things as well as a huge number of bars and pubs to sit in and whittle away the days and nights. If you're from the UK be prepared for the prices. I did see a beer for 28CZK, which is nearly £0.80 for a half litre so that was a VERY nice surprise, as were the food prices. Loved every second of it. 10/10 want to go again
Beautiful buildings in great condition. Just meanering around you will appreciate the architecture and the scale of the buildings. The warm wine on offer at stalls will keep the cold at bay.
Pleasant enough. But so many large tour groups! They are so rude!There are many shops, mostly selling the same things. As are the stalls scattered around
Beatiful sights. Prague is full of gems and the old town is one of them. It is easy to reach and although we had heard stories about pickpockets we had no issues at all and never felt unsafe.

The magical beauty of old times. I would recommend to read some information and historical facts about the Old Town before visit, as there are so many things to see and do. The Old Time Square - always full of people, with the Astronomical clock tower, where every hour the twelve Apostles do their round with the Rooster crow and the Death rings the bell at the end. The Jewish Cemetery, the theme markets, tiny shops where could be found almost everything one can think of, the most expensive street in Prague, long, narrow streets with the cobbles, horse and old car rides, nice restaurants and small homely pubs, but most of all, the history jump at you behind every corner.

Wonderful, historic sights. Walk around slowly, look at everything, and have a good Guide--such as one from ThinkPrague.All historic sights have plaques or signs in English and other languages which add to the enjoyment.
Beautiful place!. Really vibrant square, lots of places to eat and drink, the Astronomical clock is lovely and it is all lit up at night, nice vibrant place to be.

Super Experience. We really enjoyed our time in and around the Old Town. It's busy with tourists, of course and still manages to retain its character and variety. You're never far from a remote, quiet street and there are so many options to eat too!

Yet another "a must"!. "I've been in Prague" means that you walked the streets of Old Town. Enjoy countless buildings, museums, towers. Mediaval, renaissance and baroque architecture and history all around you. Many restaurants, viewpoints, mini-parks. Thanks to Prague's world top public transportation, Old Town is reachable from everywhere. A night visit will bring to you spectacular views and lights. Totally safe, just use common sense. And enjoy :).

Shouldering Through to See the Sights. Prague is a beautiful city that every tourist should see. I just wish there weren't so many tourists there at once! Explore out from the main streets, though, and you'll quickly leave the mass tour groups behind and find more of the real Prague. Look for small pubs down side alleys, and just get lost!
mr valentines. very nice place.worth visit.lots of turists from whole the word.I recomended the place to sightseenig and eat something in restauranst located around the square

Enjoy the surroundings, resist the tourist traps. Try visiting in off-hours or off-season to enjoy the beautiful setting and sights without hordes of tourists surrounding you. A climb up the tower provides some beautiful views but, again, try it when there aren't many people around and it will be far more enjoyable!

Great atmosphere. This place has the magical atmosphere. This place is full of energy that give a feeling that the past is so close and a lots of things happened here. It is amazing that this architecture is still present. The story behind this buildings is pretty amazing too.

Great square with plenty going on. I was lucky enough to get here while the Easter markets are up and running, and it has been one of my favorite spots to visit daily while visiting Prague. The markets have all sorts of souvenirs and some really affordable, delicious snacks. It's been a great way to start my morning each day before heading off to other sights, considering it is so central. You have to swing by when visiting.

Walk a timeline. Visit this part of the "Mother of cities" and you will walk a timeline - looking at it from the point of view of architecture, history... Incredible mix of styles beginning with medieval times houses built in the 12th and 13th century, some keeping almost the original look, some rebuilt in renaissance or baroque styles, pictoresque Art Nouveau buildings on Parizska street (Prague's 5th Avenue), and many more. Collection of churches, beer cellars, quiet corners and busy streets.... what else to wish for?
Real feel of Prague. Old town is one of the most happening place in Prague. Easter markets near by old square are fantastic.

Old times charm. The best time to wonder around is early morning, during the sunrise...quiet, only gulls above the river...lonely walkers heading home, to work...great scale, walkable, friendly My secret tip: Strelecky ostrov - one of the best spots on the river
Best place on earth . For me it's the most beautiful place on earth. Everyday is a surprise and everyday thousands of tourists meet there. It's simply amazing
Impressive. Highly recommend that you just take time to walk the back streets, there's something different around every turn, all of it good

Stunning long weekend. What a concentrated mix of gorgeous attractions in one place! Sitting having a beer, hot chocolate or beer whilst people watching was just fab.
Highly recommended.

The added bonus of the Easter market.... We visited the old town square with its amazing architecture. It is so beautiful. We enjoyed the added bonus of the Easter market which had lots of stalls selling crafts and snacks. All fairly good value and we easily spent two hours walking around.Popped into the hard rock cafe for a coffee break and to use the toilet for £2 a coffee. Very reasonable and free wifi.

Prague Old Town. Prague is one of the most beautiful city. Historical center is very wide and will can spend here several days.When you will plan visit Prague, be sure you have in plan this attractions:Orloj (Astrological clocks)Karluv most (Charles Bridge)Prazsky hrad (Prague castle)Vaclavske namesti (Wenceslas square)Tancici dum (Dancing house)Staromestske namesti (Old Town square)Zamek Troja (Chateau Troja)Clnkovani na Vltave (boats on Vltava)..

Walk with history hand by hand. Absolutely fantastic place with history all around and great atmosphere... you can enjoy it in many restaurants / gardners with excelent food, but unfortunatelly prices are on higher level.

Great area for tourist. The old square is a must to visit with the old time lock chiming on the hour with figures , however be carful for pick pockets espically 2 blonde girls with male spotter aged in their 30yrs

Beautiful. This is a beautiful part of Prague and definately worth a visit. There's some lovely bars and restaurants around the square but they are quite expensive in comparison to those just a short walk away
Incredible architecture. Incredible architecture from many ages. A busy, bustling tourist area to wander and enjoy. Pavement cafes, (with heaters and blankets) to sit and watch the world go by.
Lots of history. Historical city hall with famous clock, nearby Jewish quarters with several synagogues, church with daily concerts
Beautiful square in the historic centre. Great place with lots of interesting things to see. Nice terraces and lot of people around the squash giving it a nice touch.
Old Town Prague. Wonderful and lovely part of Prague, nice view from Prazsky Hrad to Vltava and Old Town, nice old architecture...
Miracle place. Walking in Old town is like travelling in time. Very beautiful little streets, many houses from 18th ct, great atmosphere

An overwhelming blend of old architectures and beautiful view. Just find any cafes and dine alfresco.
The feeling you have in this place is very overwhelming.
If you come for shopping, you won't find much. But if you come for a cultural experience, all the restaurants, the old buildings around the place and traditional shops will offer you rich cultural experience.

Look forward to the next visit. I have visited many cities and towns in Europe and the Old Town in Prague is one place I shall definitely return in the future. The centre of attraction is of course the old town square where the action is and where you can easily spent a day nosing around, There are plenty of historical attractions to visit and plenty to eateries to satisfy your palate. Things you would not like to miss are the old town hall, its observation deck which gives one a panoramic view of the surrounding areas and its famous astronomical clock, the Klementinum ( save some time for a concert in the Chapel of Mirrors in the evening ),Tyn Church, St.Nicholas Church (unfortunately closed for renovation during my visit), Powder Tower, Muncipal House .... And rememnber, the night scenes of the town from the old town square all the way to the Old Town Bridge Tower and Charle's Bridge are a feast to the eyes and the dream of photographers. Still miss the cobble stone streets and the ambience of this well kept cozy town!

Perfect . The region of old town is a must to visit. When you are there the square will impress you. Check the astronomical clock and tou should see all the streets starting from there.. impressive clubs, bars and restaurants.. also perfect for walking

Lively and fun place!. There were crowds of people everywhere enjoying the architecture, the restaurants & shops and people. It's a must see area in Prague to experience the lively walk through to take in the sights, sounds, tastes and smells the old town during the day and at night. What a feast for the senses!!!

Best place in Prague . To me this was the best place in prague. We visited during easter markets and it was really a fantastic place to hang around. The astronomical clock is really impressive. All the buildings including town hall looks impressive. You can eat and shop traditional czech items.Expect huge crowd especially lots of tour operators. One thing that is annoying is all those segway tour operators trying to lure people.

Most lively place. This square is the most lively place in Prague. Full of active people and so many activities, performances and cafes! You can easily spend hours here and feel energetic. This place has an awesome vibe.
Endless walk . We strolled around many times in the city and we never got bored. Quaint streets and buildings all over us create a magic scene. Do not miss it!
Great stayat Mesto. A beautiful place to visit. Check people are very nice and they love taking care of visitors. I highly recommend visiting Check republic. It is a unique experience

Beautiful but busy! . We visited Prague in June 2015, the Old Town square was booming with tourists. There were street food vendors, horse and cart tours and tons of other things happening. Although it was almost too busy to take the place in I loved the hustle and bustle of this beautiful old square.

The place to be. The old town square is the place we always started and ended our day in, the architecture, the atmosphere the restaurants and the people selling and buying were wonderful, the easter market started the day we left and was absolutely heaving a+++
perfect. its a wonderful and magical place.like fairytales.you will stay speechless and so i prefer simply to suggest you that you have to go there certainly.

Vibrant. This is where everyone seems to congregate, Very vibrant area with street performers and stalls selling food and trinkets of all kinds.The square is surrounded by street cafes a tourist trap much better value a few streets back.The square always fills up on the hour by tourists waiting for the astronomical clock to strike.When the Christmas markets are open it is a wonderland for families.
Old Town Square. Beautifil place to visit ,Orloj its a czech name for special astrological clock ,the third oldest in the world and th only one still working,lot of restaurant and antique,gift shops

Vendor Festivities. I liked the square. There was a lot of fun vendors with food, candy and typical souvenirs. We visited a couple weeks before Easter so there was a lot of decorations and traditional Czech performances. There is also the astronomical clock and Church of Our Lady Before Týn as seen in the photo. This is where we met also for our free walking tour. Free walking tours (before gratuity) are amazing! In general, I highly recommend them (and bike tours and bus tours..well any tour..learning is fun :oP)!
a memorable place. One of the most beautiful Old Towns ever with hidden gems and gates to the neighbouring streets or nice pubs. It's good to have a local person to guide you around.

Start of Christmas Markets. They were finishing up all the Christmas decorations when we arrived. This was a really cool place to visit. A lot of charm at night. That is why it is rated #1 attraction. It takes you back in time yet with all the luxury of today! Have fun. Stay at the Ventana if you really want the best of both worlds. We did and could not have picked a better combination.
amazing square. eat off the square - it is so much cheaper. Lots of shops including c and a, Debenhams, h & m. Designer shop area is very expensive.

Street shops and Great views. There are lots of squares in Prague, Old Town Square is around the corner from New Town Square. This is a good place to just wonder around and enjoy looking at old mixed with new buildings, get some Prague food, find souvenirs, but it is very touristy so things are more expensive in this area. If you walk about a block past the Square you can find cheaper but better food and souvenirs.
The Gunpowder Tower, Old town Squair. Every one goes here to see the clock (this is a must) but you must go up the tower (there is a life) as the views from there are 360 degrees -wonderful
Great for photography. We visited in March and we were fascinated with the varied architecture which made for brilliant photography. Would recommend it.

Beautiful Heart of Prague. Stand in the central square and just turn around. Everything starts and ends here. Beautiful architecture and constant buzz off people. Maybe a little too crowded at times but always seemed to find our way back to the center. A must visit while in Prague.
A must visit. One of the best old towns I've ever visited. You can walk all night just stairing at the buildings. Too many pubs and restaurants around.

Stunning, and 10,000 other tourists agree. This setting is exquisite, but unfortunately the rest of the world will be sharing it with you. New to me this visit - the Easter market (similar to the Christmas one, slight variations like a petting zoo and an Easter Tree). The architecture is at its finest at night with brilliant illumination.

Just Enjoy It. Enjoy the lovely narrow streets, nice squares, old churches, towers. Walk through the large pedestrian area, feel the vibe and admire the architecture. The crown of all is Old town square with astronomical clock.
Hub of the city. lovely square in the heart of the old town. drinks and food dearer here than rest of city, but you would expect that with the location

Pretty. The square is very busy but well worth a visit. Lots to see and do, streets weaving off in all directions. The architecture is stunning. A lot of stalls selling food, be careful if you buy anything from them as they are very expensive.
Stunning architecture. Great architecture which can be appreciated without knowing the history behind it (although it does make it even more awesome).

Nice well preserved old town but bvery touristy. In general I liked the Old Town of Prague and across the Charles Bridge lesser town. This amazingly well preserved example of old architecture is worth the visit for this reason alone. However there is a lot to see and do in the old town. The astronomical clock draws a huge crowd so get there early to get a good spot. In found the Czech people very accommodating at the restaurants and pubs and its easy to get by whne speaking only English. Most will understand what you want. Outside of prague less english is spoken but usually not that much of a problem. As with most 'touristy" areas there are scams all around and the big one is changing money. Only change money at a bank is the rule. All in all I like Prague a lot and will go back hopefully soon. P.S. in a restaurant if you order a pizza it means you have ordered a whole pizza so be hu\hungry if you do.

A magical place. For gothic architecture lovers , this place will be there favorite. On the main square you can see a lot of live performances , funny entertainers . Also don't forget to try there chimneys with nutella filling !

Walking through the square. A good travel experience visiting this historic place, best to walk around, cobblestone paths, fantastic Shops, good places to eat. Can easily see most places within a day or two by foot.

Amazing variety of architecture. Take an hour or so to explore the old town which includes the Jewish sector, a guide is recommended as it's more interesting when you are told the ancient history and modern historical stories (break away from communism)

Beautiful square. I went back to the square multiple times just to admire and people watch. It's lovely, though somewhat crowded, even in lower season. The food in the square is overpriced, though the location is great. If you walk further out from the square, you'll get much better value for your crowns. Beautiful place, though! Not to be missed!

Beautiful place!. If your in Prague then Old Town where you need to be! Night or day this place is always buzzing with people. The buildings are stunning, loads of churches, castles and plenty of places to eat and drink. You will not stop taking pictures, it's just the most beautiful place.
Amazing. Great great !The most beautiful city i have ever seen.If u r going.dont go 2 or 3 days.stay at least a week.its worthy

Worth spending day and night. Not only the astrology astronomy clock tower, but the town was very beautiful with the ancient bliss. In the day time, there were Bohemia shop and hundred of souvenir shops all the way from street to street. At the night time, the set up lighting of the town was stunning. Walking in the cool breeze, sipping hot wine with a hot local snacks created a memorable experience here.

A photographers heaven. So much to see and do in the Old Square from the Astronomical Clock, Tyn Church, St Nicholas Church the start of the most expensive street in Prague the Parizska. Can be crowded and the introduction of Segways are a real nuisance the only downside to Prague itself
Stunning. What a beautiful place very picturesque and amazing buildings. Lots of street characters and places to get food on the street. Bars with outside seating to people watch and drink Czech beer

TRULY OLD TOWN EUROPE. This square is so beautiful with churches, shops, restaurants, and hotels surrounding the area. It is especially wonderful if you are there during the Christmas time, with shops and lights and people wandering through the snow. Stroll through the area and stop and take time to visit one of the cafes for food or to enjoy a drink. Do not pass up the lovely churches that also offer concerts from time to time.

Wow Factor!. What a brilliant place. The old town square with its restaurants and out door seating is lovely to just soak up the atmosphere. The buildings in the old town are lovely and have been lovingly restored and there seems to be constant restoration going on somewhere.We will definitely be back
Nice historical place. Beatiful place with taste of history. There are a lot of attraction and you have to taste Prague´s trdelník !
Amazing architecture . The old town of Prague is so beautiful. The buildings are nothing like what I'm used to and I was just in awe walking around! Loved it
its amazing!!. the old town its really amazing, there are restaurants and cafes around and during christmas there are people there and selling different traditional food and sweets!!

Exactly how you'd imagine Czech Republic!. This is a must see whilst in Prague....very typically Czech Republic! Very buzzy as tourist visit and congregate here.....very near to other sights in Prague.
Breath taking. I was lucky enough to be here during the Christmas markets. On a good day it is truly stunning and the streets are full of life and history.

Nostalgic look back in time . A very nice place o visit the ease of the tram system to get around is great.Just be aware of beggars on the street but it's like any major city. The place is lovely to look around but you will pay a premium for anything you buy here. If you go into the new town area things get a lot cheaper. I enjoyed the visit if your not on a budget then spend to your hearts content, if you are then wait and buy in the new town over the river. The astronomical clock is well worth a look.

Always Lively . It's happening here -souvenir shops etc. ...the aroma of freshly roasted Prague ham and lots of tourists. Plus beautiful views of the churches etc....You can't come to Prague and not come here.

Just fantastic at Christmas. We were blessed with dry weather so made the most of walking around the old town comfortably. Beautiful old buildings, great assortment of well known high street shops and a large quantity of diverse cafes and restaurants.

Beautiful visit. We have thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Prague old town - there are so many things to do - the castle is a must and remember to buy your ticket at the office as you are very limited to what you can see without one!!
Great place to visit. This is a must place to be visited while in Prague. Architecture is great. There are a lot of small shops around that sell classic chandeliers.
Beautiful, Historic but overrun by Tourists. Beautiful and historic place but spoiled by too many cheap souvenir shops and the tourists are everywhere!

Lovely . Beautiful Square, we arrived at night and with the lights it was magical, we strolled and the sat for food and drink in the square under the famous Astronomical Clock, and watched the world go by. Loved it
Lovely. Really pretty place. Lots of bars and cafes. Very busy in the main square and lots of segway tour sellers. Plenty of things to keep you busy and about a 15 min walk.up to the castle.

Amazing. This was my 1st visit to Prauge, I was amazed at the grandness of all the buildings. Every building was in amazing condition. Every thing from the castle, Charles bridge to the famous clock was just out of this world. There was a surprise around every corner. I will definitely be making a return journey.
Clock tower. Ther is a lot to see in the old town but the highlight for us was a trip up the clock tower where you get a view all over Prague and it is amazing

Beautiful!. Very beautiful buildings, a lot of people and the astronomical clock are only a few things of old town of Prague. You can have a nice walk there, relax in some of the nice and cozy coffee places or restaurants, visit thematical museums, get a lot of photos and buy suvenirs. We had a great time!
beautiful square lots of activity. lots of tourist fill the square, and stand waiting for the featured astrological clock.A great view from the clock tower.

LOVED IT!. This is just one of those cities you have to visit before you die. A M A Z I N G !
So much history, amazing architecture, styles, people, everything... Incredible... The most beautiful square in Prague for sure!
beautiful!. The old town is the most beautiful town I have ever been to! I loved the way the buildings are all lit up at night, and has a great atmosphere!

Quaint & Adorable!. Prague has done a wonderful job of keeping the buildings attractive and inviting as well as true to experience as possible. While it's 'touristy' in general - it's worth spending time there. Enjoy food and a drink. (Watch prices and tip charges!)

How many times can you say wow!!. Old town is simply stunning! Take your time to slowly wander the cobbled streets, soak up the atmosphere and enjoy the many cafes with their fabulous cakes!! I loved every minute spent here.
Besutyfull old City. This city is amazing. Its just beautyfull with the old buildings. There is have a lot of museum to Visite and to see.

Glorious. Never have we failed to be surprised by the romantic historic nature of this place. Just love it. Always safe and interesting. Every Time we visit this place it shows a different side to us. Love it everytime though.
Beautiful. We wandered around all the streets lots of shops and cafes. Plenty of places to stop for refreshment. Beautiful and stunning city

A city with a rich Jewish history. A city with a rich Jewish history.
Highly recommended for those looking for the history and roots of Jews in Europe.
Must do¬!. Amazing views of the stunning old town from the tower. Crowds looking at the astronomical clock on the hour.

The place to go!. Make sure that you visit this square as it seems to be the heart of the tourist industry in Prague. Yes it gets crowded with tourists, but he architecture of the buildings is absolutely stunning. The bars are plentiful and offer a place to sit and people watch.There are several street entertainers, but make sure you see Creepy Baby Man as he is really freaky!

beautiful Prague. We visited this beautiful city in December for the Christmas Markets. Great food and very friendly people.Lots of places to see. Had the dinner cruise and had a wonderful time and we were lucky to have a guide for just the two of us.We feel that Prague is a must see place

A nice medieval town. A really well-kept nice old town with all the pebble street that I think shall be kept from the similar from the Medieval times. A pretty big square at the center of the old town were the great church is located. Really nice to see the center of the old Bohemia.
Old Town is Beautiful.. So much of the city revolves around this area. A great place to just sit and people watch. Or partake in the food, drink and the history.

An atmospheric place to start in Prague. Use the landmarks to get your bearings and soak up the architecture
Great place to people watch.
Prices around the square tend to be higher than elsewhere and quality not generally as good. Walk a little further for the real taste of Prague.

Best in Europe?. Of the many cities I have visited around Europe, Prague is my favourite and this is due to the Old Town. Lively, great food, great places to drink, great tourist sightseeing and great people. Oh and some of the best beer around at the best prices, what more can you want?!

What Prague is all about. Great bars, great food, amazing architecture. If you come to Prague and don't come to Old Town then you're daft as! Only thing I'd say is avoid restaurants in the square, much cheaper and better food just off the main streets.

The centrepoint for tourists. In my opinion, it is not the best town center that I have seen in Europe, but certainly charming and full of life. The interesting part about the town center for me was the people. The artists, mimics and performances. Ofcourse, the astonomical tower situated here, is certainly not to be missed. Also, you should go on top of the tour to get a brilliant view of the city!
Travelling back in time. The old town was the best in Prague, really happening with lots of shops and bars and clubs and eateries. The astrological clock was a little overrated.

Very beautiful and happening place. Must visit and you'll be stunned by the beauty of ancient architecture. The cathedral is peaceful and amazing. The street food, Astronomical clock and many more attractions!
Leisure trip to Prague. The Old Town is outstanding, very historical and very nice to walk around. Since I visited in Jan, any part of the day to walk around was good and pleasant.

Am I in middle ages?. I felt like I had traveled back in time to a medieval town when I was in the Old Town of Prague. The medieval music played by the buskers were also great.Neither words nor pictures can describe how "Medieval" the Old Town of Prague is, go there and you will feel it!
Great place to walk around. Just a great place to walk around, albeit that it is a bit too touristy. Nice cafes to stop in and in general just nice to take in all the historic architecture.

Heart of The Old City. One of the most fascinating areas in the city, both day and night. There are lots of scenery to take photos, and if you are lucky as per the season and the time of the day, you can make the moon to come behind the towers, to make your best ever gothic night shot. You can watch lots of shows performed by the street musicians, singers, dancers, jonglers etc. However, Old Town Square sometimes gets very crowded, and it may be advisable to the first time visitors to be careful for the pick pocketers, happily though I never became a victim.

Stroll around this mideivial market place.. Spend an hour or spend a day, just looking at the massive humanity of people in this place. I went there in winter (Feb 2016), still the crowds surprised me. From the curious astronomical church, to the gothic spires of the Tyn Church, to the statue dedicated to Jan Hus. the amount of history in the square is tremendous. A must read guidebook is by Rick Steves. Don't just go here for the tourist attraction, and the tacky souvenier shops, but go here for the embedded rich history.

Beautiful Old City. Love the old town that holds true to its Bohemian roots. So many historical places packed into one area. The gorgeous old Towers, Cathedrals and bridges black and weathered with that medieval look. We spent 2 days here but it was not near enough. We cannot wait to come back.

Amazing!. This was my favourite part of my trip to Prague. The buildings were amazing and there is such a lovely atmosphere here. There are so many attractions to see as well! While we were in this area of Prague we saw the Astronomical Clock, went to see a play called Aspects of Alice at the Blacklight Theatre, went to Charles Bridge and went to the Jewish section as well. We also spent some time at a lovely little restaurant there a couple of days. It was reasonably priced, the staff were friendly, it was in a prime location and they had warm blankets for those who wanted to brave the outside. The Astronomical Clock was amazing! Every hour you find a crowd outside it waiting for it to chime. The story behind it and the architecture of it are amazing. Time it right so that you can see the clock chiming on the hour!The Blacklight Theatre was amazing and reasonably priced. The play was a silent play and was very enjoyable. There were good actors and actresses and they included every emotion possible in it. I would thoroughly recommend it to you (if you can find it....)Charles Bridge was breath-taking. It had good views over the river and had numerous statues over it. Each entrance to it was rather grand as well.The Jewish section could have been a day out within itself. We bought tickets to all the museums there - the best exhibition for me being about the Second World War era. There was lots of information and some of the exhibits were extremely emotional. Definitely worth a visit!Overall I would say you cannot visit the city without seeing this area of it!

Walk, look, enjoy... don't buy!. Narrow streets, twisting and turning in unexpected directions... interesting olld buildings...shops selling crystal, gems, chocolate, spa products, souvenirs (a.k.a tourist junk), original products... cafes, restaurants, bars, sausage stands and "trdlniks"... street performers and "living statues"... concerts, dark light theaters and Thai massage cabinets... little museums - Chocolate museum, Wax Figures, Sex Machines museum... everything is there, and most of it unreasonably expensive. It's a great place for a wander, but f you want to eat/ have coffee/ buy souvenirs - better do it elsewhere (a few hundred meters away are often enough), unless you have a specific place/ product in mind. Also, there's a cute little marketplace on the corner of Melantrichova and Havelska - worth a visit.

Must see. Went here recently whilst in the city. The old town square is full of history and character. The astronomical clock is a must see and you can climb the tower which gives abasing views over the city.Be sure to visit at night aswell for an amazing friendly atmosphere and local food and drink stall with reasonably priced item.Would love to go back someday. This square is the heart of the city in more ways than one.

Beautiful. Beautiful buildings surround a cobbled square which is bustling and busy until the early hours. There are lots of activities on offer including tours by bus, foot, stretch limo, classic car or Segway. and there are also museums, souvenir shops and restaurants.

Nice to see. Very nice to look around nice shops bars and resteraunts selling local beers wines souvenirs especially shwarskie crystal items thirst hats and jumpers tru the local produced trad link with chocolate inside very filling

Beautiful city to walk around. We were there when the Christmas market was set up, huge Christmas tree in the center square! It was absolutely gorgeous. Great breaded treats and some warm wine to enjoy.
Good king wenslas. Having lived 20 years in the new world, 10 years in the Arabian desert, to go somewhere where history wacks you around every street corner is just great -- we loved it

My lovely City. I'm patriot so it's my duty to review the most beautiful part of my city. When you live here you love it and when you're just a turist you will fall in love with it. I recommend to have a walk here at 6-9 a.m. nobody is here and you can enjoy the magical atmosphere of this historical city of Prague

beautiful. this was a great place by day and night. the atmosphere was great and the little food stalls sold some beautiful little treats. if on a budget do not eat at the resturants as they were expensive compard to some of the local resturants in the side streets which sold great food
Magnificent!. Such a beautiful place! Just walk around, explore, get lost, eat, look, remember as much as you can.

Great place to visit early in the mornig. The old town has a lot going on and is very scenic. Avoid the touristy activities by visiting in the morning. At around 10am, crowd starts building up and tour company starts peddling their tour package which can be off putting.

Attractive and Safe. I am pleased to feel so safe in Prague. The old town square was charming and active with many people. There is a variety of food and different shops for all types of people. I never felt harassed in the square, or the city.

lovely town square. it was very cold when we arrived but its a lovely town and easy to navigate. Lots of people on segways are very eager to sell you tours!I'd recommend staying at the hilton in the old town.
Beautiful scenery. Excellent views, great place to visit. Bit of graffiti but that's Europe. Trams are cheap n easy food in the town is reasonable, tea, coffee and a cake £6. Not bad
Beautiful City. Perfect city to wonder and get lost in. Beautiful old buildings, and friendly locals. Well worth a visit!

Interesting worth a visit. this is the second time I have visited her and it was very much busier this time, I think due to the Christmas markets. It was well worth a visit with the clock being the main attraction. Nice Christmasssy stalls with lots to choose from.We also stopped for a hot wine and coffees and were pleased to find the cafes had hot air and blankets to keep you warm.

Christmas markets. What a beautiful place in the world. My only recommendation for this place is to go at Christmas, I'm sure the other months are just as beautiful, but during Christmas there are hundreds of tiny wooden huts spread all over the place and the atmosphere is the jolliest I've ever felt anywhere in the world. The people are lovely and there is a huge, beautifully decorated Christmas tree at the beginning of the square. With so much to see and do this is a hot spot and not far from anything!

Beautiful - we kept coming back!. A truly gorgeous Old Town - no matter the weather or time of year. We kept finding ourselves coming back (partly as a way to figure out where we were and how to get back to the hostel), but we always found ourselves lingering to take in another beautiful detail of the architecture and to watch the street performers.
The place to be i. In evenings and the most hapening place in prague, you have at least 4 to 8 points in a round this square just be there and forget the world

Probably the best place to visit in Prague. A must visit in Prague. A lot of attractions and good foodie around that area. The best view of the old town would probably be the view from clock tower (requires admission fee) Spent my whole day there exploring all the nearby attractions and for some food hunting. Day view of the town was great, sunset was better but nothing beats the atmosphere at night. Very happening at the square with lots of street perfomances.

Too touristy. Very pretty to look at, but the old town was very tourist in parts, and this was in February. Too many Segway touts and restaurant PRs trying to entice you in. I was glad to leave after a while.
Beautiful and picturesque. So much history and the views from the top of the clock tower were fantastic and accessible to everyone as there was a lift as well as stairs

Rather crowded but still fun . The Old Town its self is great. Lots to see and lots of fun little shops and eateries. However some rather questionable characters lurking around so look after your belongings. But overall easy to relax and have fun. But watch out for the Segway's.

Thoroughly Loved Praha. Prague is right up there with my Favorites !! A Great City with a bit of everything for everyone and something different at every turn and after a couple of days I know we only scratched the surface ! So might come back on a River boat next time ? Who knows but I do know would love to walk the streets of Praha Again !!
Use the free tour guides and see it. We walked around with the guide and she explained a lot about the city and how it evolved. A must do to see the changing architecture of the city.

Historic Buildings or People .... lots to see. A great central location from which you can take off in many directions to view the various aspects of Prague.Sit back and enjoy a beer and just watch the world go by .... a bite to eat if hungry, you'll love just sitting there and soaking up the atmosphere.

Beautiful . In the evening you get all your street performers doing their thing while you sit outside drinking....what more do you want ?? So nice and relaxed. Apart from the people whizzing round on segways trying to sell you tours, but I guess that happens everywhere you go.

So much to see, so little time! 😊. There's so much to see here, the restaurants are expensive, but it's worth it if only so that you can say you have done it. Blankets are provided on cold days. There is a lot of live music, street performances, and maniacs on Segways buzzing around. Also the orange/yellow hop on hop off bus stops here, so it's a good starting point for a 90 minute ride around Prague, giving you the opportunity to see all the main attractions, and get your bearings.

Fabulous shops and things to see. We only had a short time in Prague but took in the old town and loved it. So much to see and lots of shops, restaurant and bars. Lots of people around so it is crowded especially if there is an event on like the time clock (glockenspiel) at noon. But nevertheless, worth the time to visit and walk around especially over the bridge.
Lovely town. Prague has many old buildings having survived WW2 relatively unscathed. Art Deco exteriors and interiors. Old streets , bars, cafes, churches and so on. Great to wander around.

Typical European old Town. After visiting several cities in Europe, it is not difficult to notice that they are very similar. It is actually very very beautiful, but for me it really looks similar. One difference is that it is very obvious that the city planning has tried all their best to preserve the historical buildings.

Great place to start. My friend and I started our Prague trip by joining a free walking tour at the old town. It was a great way to know about local history and culture, as well as getting some tips to make the most out of Prague. Most of the must-see tourist spots are located here. So, you will pretty much tick your list when you start your visit here.
Beautiful old city. Wonderfull city walk, nice square whit lot of people. Everyday somebody is performing something and the atmosfere is amazing.

Old town Prague is a joy.. Prague is a city that people say is a "must see", and they mean the Old Town. There are many small streets and alleys to wander, and lovely architecture abounds. It is busy of course, but quite lovely, especially at night when lit up.
Beautiful. Plenty of things to do here. Lots of winding cobbled streets with shops, plus the old town square which is a major tourist draw. Quite crowded though!
LOVE OLD TOWN!!!. This was the coolest part of Prague. It had so much character and so many places to eat! It really was a charming, European town and I would recommend it to anyone!!

Tourist atraction. Packed as most all tourists and groups gravitate here. Clock on corner is the big draw, watch out for the odd pick pocket though as most folk are crammed together for the hourly extravaganza.
A must see in Prague. Lovely town square, the Astronomical clock is a must see if you visit Prague, its lovely by day but better at night.. Haggle prices of trips ect before you accept any.

Majestic. Once u reach the cathedral, all the attractions are around it!!!!!!!
If u love walking and love exploring , then prague it is !!!!!!

The most beautiful place. Such a scenic place - lots to do and lots going on!
They have so many restaurants and my highlight was going up the tower and seeing the view!!!
The necessary. There is no Prague visit without it. It's a starting and ending point every day. Avoid the crowds. Avoid late nights. Watch your pocket and bag. Enjoy the open museum in front of you.
Beautiful.. What a lovely area, full of beautiful buildings and history. Lots to see and explore. Musicians and wooden stalls add to the atmosphere.

Breathtaking. The old town is a fantastic range of very old buildings with a history in most of them. If you are fit enough take advantage of the guided walk; bus ride and boat trip. It takes about 6 hours but well worth it to see all the places of historic interest

Must to see when you´re in Prague. This place has its history and you can really feel it when you´re there. It is true that it´s a bit crowded by the tourists but it is a place worth to see when being in Prague.

Unforgettable. Some memories will always remain in my heart, and one of those itakes me back to Stare Mesto late in an hot Summer afternoon, I was taking pictures, children were playing, a soap bubble performer was also there. When you think nothing can top that,all of a sudden a street musician shows up out of nowhere, unfolds a piano and starts playing the opening theme of Game of Thrones... I had tears in my eyes. You have to go there at least once in your lifetime. The architecture is to die for, it has one of the most beautiful clocktowers and the atmosphere is superb.
Fabulous place. Breathtaking area, so much to see around every corner or just sit in one of the many bars etc and watch the world go by. At night it is just magical with entertainers etc.

Beauty of Prague~ with its beauty, architectural buildings, cobbled stone walkways, vibrant and celebratory. Old Town square gives a celebratory feeling, it captures the pulse of Prague. Its beautiful and buzzes with artisans, food stalls and tourists. Evenings are colourful and the ambience is so uplifting. There are food stalls serving local delicacies like Langose and Trdelnik which tasted really good. There are restaurants around the town square that serve authentic local cuisine and famous beer. Walking around old town square is walking down a date in history. The astronomical clock gathers crowd in large numbers and is a treat to watch when the clock strikes each hour. There are several shops selling authentic ceramic pottery which is significant to this city. You can never get more of this place, if nothing, just sit around the benches and soak in the beauty of Prague.

Old Town Square. Great place to spend a good few hours at any time of the day.Don't miss a visit to the Town Hall with its Astronomical Clock, climb the Clock Tower and take a guided tour through the rooms and lower cellars. Visit St Nicholas Church and Tyn Cathedral. There's lots going on including snacks, lovely restaurants and British Bars to watch some sport in the evening.You can be pestered by Segway sales and worse still, hit by one.From here you can walk to the river in less than 10 minutes.
This is Prague.. Lots of old medieval buildings and a lovely clock and square. Lots of little tourists shops and lots of places to eat. A must see. This is Prague.

Stunning . Go at night and go during the day, it's stunning. Admittedly I went in winter so not busy and no doubt it gets very busy in the summer but to be surrounded the the beautiful architecture is a must see. Walk through at various times of day - you will fall in love with it and the city at your first encounter

Great!!!!. It’s just a great place, go for a walk or have a meal, for every occasion this place it’s one of a kind. Prague it’s just too beautiful for everyone, definitely a must go. The pork in a food stand near a statute it’s incredible, they have combos with a Pilsner beer and pork. Just Great!!!
Nice. old town has the aura and beauty , the people are nice and friendly , restaurants in the vicinity of very good quality food and excellent .old town is nothing irreplaceable , I love this place.

What a place. The old town is full of so much character! Obviously it is full for little tourist traps, but the architecture and the feel is incredible. So romantic and relaxed for getting lost in, with towers to orientate yourself with should you get a little lost!
Heart of Prague. Amazing views, astronomical watches and tower, living music on the square, but expensive restaurants on the square.

Very impressive. We stayed in a hotel nearby so exploring old town on foot was very easy. We just loved it food on the main square can be a bit expensive so it's worth walking a bit to find a restaurant. Otherwise absolutely great

Can't miss it. One of the main attractions of the city. There you can admire the town hall with the famous astronomic clock , the church of Saint Nicholas and other buildings of traditional czech architecture. There are also many restaurants where you can taste different plates of czech cuisine and a lot of beautiful small cafeterias. Don't miss the chance of going to taste one (or more) czech beer. Finally in the Old town there are many stores where you can buy anything you want, i suggest a famous bohemian crystal in reasonable prices and a visit to one of the many little traditional toy stores .
impressive. Impressive place, which you must see during your stay in Prague. We recommend visiting the Spanish synagogue which is really very beautiful.
fascinting Prague. I love to watch the gorgeous architecture of the impressive buildings all over .... They are amazingly beautiful.

An amazing space - almost too good to be real. The Old Town Square is so amazing that you could almost think you were in some Disney park and Tyn Church is a Cinderella castle. But no, it is real and hundreds of years old.
Make sure you watch the astronomical clock, climb the tower and wander around the square.
History all Around you. . A must see, history in every corner. From the Astronomical clock to St Nicolas church to The Church of Our Lady before Tyn.

Stunning . Beautiful scenery especially at night when all of the spires are lit up. There are a lot of people whizzing around on segways trying to sell you a tour which can be irritating but they roll off when you tell them no. Street performers at night have always been incredible, we stopped and watched one young man on his keyboard and his friend on a cello for half an hour in the cold. The restaurants on the square can be expensive compared to the back street pubs but you pay for the view I guess. A must see in Prague.
One of the prettiest town squares in Europe. Worth a walk around, clock, two major churches, shopping on side streets, excellent restaurants. No reason to miss.

Very pretty. The call Prague the city of a thousand spires for good reason. It's a very pretty city at any time of the year. And of course the Old Town has oodles of atmosphere in the form of narrow streets, cosy pubs, picturesque historical buildings etc etc.
Beautiful buildings. Beautiful buildings and lots to see. Lots of cafes and restaurants in this area and not always steeped up prices.
good. What I can say - you have to see it all - view, cathedral, parks,... On of the most beautiful places in Prague. Good for runner early morning
lovely Old Town. It is great walking in the old town of Prague, called Stare Mesto, although many tourist are around.

Plenty to see and do. There's a lot going on in the old town. In the main square especially at the weekend there's street performers/artists. There's a few cafes/restaurants. There's the astronomical clock that's worth watching on the hour, but it does get very busy and crowded as a result. There's a few stands selling warm wine which is great on an old day. Call me a killjoy but the place is ruined by the amounts of people trying to flog Segway tours. Really ruins the feel of the place as well as being an absolute menace!

Only the best part of Prague. The old town square includes the amazing historic buildings of Prague. Designs from medieval times up till Art Nouveau, the buildings are brightly painted and most have fully intact murals on them. Very beautifully preserved. The old town square also contains the iconic Astronomical clock.We spent New Years Eve there. What a charming setting it was! A full crowd of people, fireworks everywhere, kiosks of food and beer and mulled wine, the lights; it also started lightly snowing during the fireworks show....Magical :D

Beautiful and historic. Beautiful buildings, lots of culture, enjoyable. Smaller than Krakow. More crowded than Krakow. Loved the live music and people watching. I was very disappointed but the trash. Prague needs to empty cans more than once a day or install bigger cans or more cans. That part was very disappointing.

Enjoyable Christmas market. On a business trip, I managed to spend half a day visiting Prague city. The square is surround by historic buildings with beautiful architecture. It is definitely worth a leisurely walkabout and my visit was made more enjoyable with the Christmas market being held in the Square.

Fantastic buildings. Very easy to walk around city. We took a bus tour but if your going to do this, pick one with a guide rather than headphones as ours was very boring. Charles bridge is a highlight.

This is the place to head first!. On our first strip to Prague, you always wonder where to head. Well this is a good start, and within easy walking distance of Charles bridge and then onward to the extensive caste up on the hillside. Making your way here at any time of the day or night will always be an experience, with the hustle and bustle of people, musicians, the inevitable seaways (!!) and plenty of eating and drinking available. The famous clock of course needs to be seen, and you can climb to the top of the tower for views all around. By heading off in various directions, you can reach the Jewish quarter and the famous named shops (keep your credit cards at bay!), or off into the small streets with a host of eateries and interest. This is a must to see, and a great basis to work from.
we had a great day here. Prague really is a romantic city. Nice bars with outside dining and drinks are available. To visit the old town is a must when u are here.
Great old town. The old town district is a very interesting area to see if you love architecture. I was fond of the building colours.

Absolutely Stunning. The old town square is incredible. I am writing this four months later and still have vivid memories of the square at night, the lively music, the shops and shopkeepers, the students practising their violins on the street, the smells of the food being cooked, the diverse crowd of people milling about. The astronomical clock and tower was worth the walk up to view the square from above. This was one of the highlights of the trip!

Prague Jewel. This place has an amazing vibe with all its classic old buildings and narrow pathways.The square is lined with cafes, restaurants and the occasional street performers.You can climb to the top of the astronomical tower for a birds eye view of the square.After all that walking and dodging the segways head to Black Angels bar to quench your thirst.
the most amazing fairy tale place. i think that Prague's old city is one of the most fairy tale place int he world. I recommend it to all.

Vibrant . The heart of which is the Square with its cafés and restaurants and not forgetting the famous Astronomical Clock. Jewish section is of course the oldest part and no visit complete with a walk through.
Lost in..... Lots of streets around the main old square. Many beautiful nooks and crannies around with pubs with beer and local restaurants.

Prague is an extraordinary city!!!!!. I have been to Prague many times!!!
And with family and alone and with my wife and always found for myself something new. This stunning city. It is impossible not to love.
Wonderful people. Ghost stories.
Wondeful feed and of couse BEER!!!!
I love Prague !!!
awesome walk. Great walk, lots of ancient buildings and fun people watching. You can see a lot in just a day or two. Plenty of food optioins
Lovely.. A beautiful part of Prague, the architecture was amazing and the street performers were very talented and friendly
So lovely. It is full of street singers and very ameteur performance artists.But it was so lovely to sit under the 3 and drink your coffee.

Genius loci. This place is jsut amazing. Never mind that I live in Prague since my childhood I always enjoy the visit of this square. It changes its face in every part of a year with its traditional faires, festivals, street artists etc...

More than just one plaza or building. Old Town Prague is more than the Old Town Square, the Astronomical Clock, Charles Bridge or other well known landmarks. Take time to walk the side streets and look at the architecture, the shops, and talk to the locals to find some of the hidden treasures of Old Town Prague. Study the house symbols of various objects and animals used as addresses at the intersection of Karlova and Liliova streets. Check out the Iron Knight statue on the corner of the Prague City Hall. Plaques to Albert Einstein, where he lived while he was a professor at Prague University in 1911 to 1912, and a plaque where Johannes Kepler lived while staying in Prague. A lot of history and beauty in Old Town Prague.

Simply nice, day and night!. Take your time, walk about. Admire buildings, don't pay attention to hordes of summer tourists. Ignore some of the posh shops which crept in. Stop for a meal. Sip on a coffee. Simply be there and enjoy.

On part of the history. Old town of Prague is culturally rich area where is number of places for history, culture, entertaiment, food and drink. Area is quite large and historically remarkable places are quite a lot. Commercial tourism business had take little bit too disturbing role here. Tip: Good shoes for walking.

The Place to Be. The Old Town is the hub of Prague's old town. This is where most of the tourist activities are centered (for good and bad). You can grab a cup of gluhwein to walk around (which was great on the cold nights that I visited.) It's also where the street musicians play at night. (Though apparently this is going to be illegal starting in March 2016). It can be a bit crowded but is well worth a visit.
OLD TOWN PRAGUE. The Old Town Square has very nice buildings, street performers etc. It is a nice gathering place for people.
beautiful, crowded. Beautiful huge square. Surrounded by beautiful buildings. Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock and Our Lady before the Tyn church.

I could spend all day in this square!. This square was absolutely beautiful, every where you looked there was something interesting to see. I especially loved the church behind the modern facade. I spent hours just sitting on the bench beside the stature reading and people watching. One of my favourite spots in Prague!

Business trip . Perfect area to eat , shop , and appreciate the beauty of this historic city. Square has the astronomical clock built in 1411 which remains in operation. Only a 5-10 minute walk to Charles bridge.
Charming city, amazing architecture. Take walking shoes and a camera and enjoy browsing the sights on foot. Be careful not to be run over by the ubiquitous Segway tours though!
View from the clock tower.. Tour the astronomical clock tower and add on the surprising basement medieval streets and stone houses below the surface.
Look up, look down, - everywhere there are interesting details!. Stare Mesto is a must. You can walk around for hours and days and always find new things to amaze you!

Characterful and bustling.. Walk through the old town and enjoy clean streets with fabulous buildings. The wonderful clock in the old town square is a must to see. We wandered along the beautifully clean streets admiring the architecture and painted murals on the walls. Eating and drinking choices are numerous and vary from street vending stalls with hot drinks and barbecued snacks to an Irish bar and 5 star restaurants. We picked local Czech food which was very good quality and excellent value. A lunchtime snack with a couple of drinks cost us £10 in a cafe style small eatery off the square. A more substantial meal with drinks about £30. Use Czech currency for best value but many places take euros.
Beautiful area. Full of all tomorrow the usual tourist things but a lovely area to spend some time and the shops and restaurants aren't hugely more expensive than anywhere else.
Beautiful. The whole place is filled with architectural beauty. With vibes from the 16th-17th century, it feels like you have gone back in time!
Amazing!. Spent a lot of time in the old town as everything is simply beautiful. Perfect place for architecture lovers!

Stare mesto - charming. There is so much to see here and enjoy this is a must for anyone visiting Prague. A wealth of pubs, bars, restaurants, shops and interesting places to suit all tastes. Everyone gathers for the town clock to chime which gives a great atmosphere. The vendors at the side of the market serve an awesome sausage and roast plate. You won't be disappointed here and take your video camera as there are street players a plenty.

Pretty area. Lots to do.. Make sure you ask the restaurants to remove any food items on the table when you sit down (eg: pretzels, peanuts) as they often charge for them even if you don't have them. Naughty!!!Lovely gallery on the square worth a visit.The clock is gorgeous but the "hourly show" was a little disappointing.Lovely area but can get very busy so go early to avoid the crowds.
the heart of prague.. 2 minutes on foot and a great picturesque walk. everything to do is right there and accessible on foot from the hotel only in minutes.

Wonderful square - Great Xmas Markets. We visited the old town square daily, enjoyed the wonderful historic buildings there, in particular the Astronomical Clock and the old Church. As it was Christmas the whole place was a buzz with pretty lights and decorations, a gorgeous big Christmas tree,free musical events on the stage, buskers and the wonderful Xmas market stalls! This was the best Xmas market experience we had during our recent Europe tours - great things to buy, some homemade plus delightful food stalls with very cheap food. Such a Christmas atmosphere which extends beyond the Christmas period to early January - very crowded early evening, found the best time to visit was before 5pm to avoid ques. Highly recommend the square, lots of history, great cafes and shops, advised all year round there is something happening to see.
lovely. very nice place lovely buildings etc plenty to do here weather a day or a few hours and dont forget your camera

Wandering . We had a gorgeous crisp subbing day and decided to just wander. Beautiful to walk around , loads of little places to see . Hidden away gems down side roads that all seemingly lead you back to the same place .

Magical place. Sitting having a glass of wine looking out to the square, people watching and looking at the architecture, is one of the most relaxing things you could do in Prague. It's like stepping back in time to a medieval square. Really lovely to wander around and soak it all up. Can be incredibly busy, but is quiet early in the morning when the sunrise is beautiful.

Arguably one of the most striking facade's in the world.. Old Town square is a beautiful spot to while away a few hours with performers and vendors, or simply sit and enjoy the magnificent architecture.

Beautiful architecture . Great to see in the city and its a very good base to see the area from. Be aware of pickpockets and pricey bars and restaurants around and if you can get a chocolate donut thing from one of the little stands dotted about you definitely should.The clock is wonderfully underwhelming and there was an almost omnipresent danger of being run over by a segway, but I liked that!
lovely to just wonder around. Stare mesto is beautiful place with old cobblestone streets, lovel for a stroll, lovely to just get lost here and wonder around

Captivated by the look. Ignore the crowds, sense the flow of the years, the ages, as you walk past buildings that have seen wars old and modern, felt the suffocating blanket of communism and now stand free to welcome open communication and a blend of old and new.

step back in time...... Step back in time and wander the Old Town Sq. Brilliant to see the Astronomical clock with special mechanisms and dials to display astronomical information, such as the relative positions of the sun, moon, zodiacal constellations, and major planets.Climb to clock towel for a fabulous vista of the City... was a little push and shove as you fought your way around the clock tower. Possibly might be best to put a one way system up there? lol should not miss the clock striking the hour..Brilliant !

The heart of the action. A large square with lots of street performers, a few tourist attractions and lots of places to eat and hang out. Many of the tours start at this square and its always busy so staying nearby would be ideal.
Look for inspiration. If you happen to know what an "awe walk" means, you should practice it here: amazing views, amazing weather, amazing people.
Something interesting round every corner. Prague is very attractive and spending a little more time mooching rewards you with great details and some beautiful architecture.
Great Atmosphere. What a lovely central location that gives you the real flavour of the old town. Great buildings and generally, interesting architecture

City break. Whether you are in Prague for a day or more, this is a definite must to round up your trip. We were fortunate to have a hotel yards away from the square and there spent a lot of time wondering around the old town. The main square is a must see but there are many lovely and varied buildings throughout the area. We did not have a guided tour but managed to see most of the attractions using the guide books.
Nice for a wander.. Street entertainers, astronomical clock, food stands, cafes (go to the first floor ones a rounds the square, they're cheaper).

Beautiful. As a more mature couple am glad that we booked to go to Prague from Tuesday until Saturday, On Tuesday and Wednesday the city was quiet and had a lovely feel to it. On Thursday it was getting livelier but Friday night it was the "stag night" city. The whole of the Old Town seemed full of groups of English men which gave the place a totally different vibe. My recommendation to anyone going to Prague, who does not just want to drink at extremely low prices, is to go nduring the week and avoid the weekend.

So interesting! . Yes, there's a lot of tourists here, but they're there for a reason: they all want to see the beauty of the old town. And it truly is beautiful! Amazing architecture, details absolutely everywhere. The big, open square is nice. Lots of interesting shops and small streets around the area too. A must see, when in Prague.

Gorgeous!. Do not leave without going here! so much beauty BUT dont eat around the area, they rip off foreigners and do not for the love of pete exchange money around here. Ask someone where you are staying for a reputable place or you will get RIPPED off.That aside everything is beautiful and people are kind, take the walking tour of the area or you're missing out!

Beautiful Prague, its soul is here. Many small streets, old houses, restaurants, pubs, very alive place.Prices in cafes and restaurant on the main square is much higher so try to find places in small streets around.

This is a historic and immaculate town. A lovely city to visit with vast range of places to eat and drink with great culture and history to take in along the way. Not bad for a bit of shopping along the way.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning. Need to visit Old Town Square if you're in Prague. Would recommend a walking tour if you can, to find out all of the history of this fantastic square. There are many free tours available. Wouldn't recommend eating or drinking around here as you'll pay a premium as it's so touristy. Walk a couple of streets down and food/drink is half the price and just as good!

Absolutely stunning!. This old town square is now one of my favourite places in the world! It's just so beautiful! We visited midweek, can imagine it to be HEAVING on the weekend but defo not to be missed!food and drink tends to cost more on the square, but it is worth it at least once or twice to sit and enjoy what Prague has to offer!
Perfectly preserved. Don't make complex plan for sightseeing - just wander around, that's how you'll find best pubs in small alleys!
Worth a look. Nice place to go for a look and have a coffee and sample the local pastries. Plenty of streets to take a wrong turn and get lost and find shops.

Crowded but the main area to access other places. Place is crowded and full of tourists but architecture is beautiful, atmosphere is great and there are many good restaurants and bars in the area. Charles' Bridge is a walking distance away.
Fairytale. The whole city is magical, so beautiful that at times it seems unreal. Wherever you look the views will make you reach for your camera!

Old Town Square. Great place to take your time and wander around checking out the architecture and old buildings. A lot of history to be seen as well as a good place to buy a souvenir. Must see when in Prague.
amazing walk across the Old Town of Prague. You cannot visit Prague without seeing the Old Town. The walk across the Old Town is very pleasant and I reccomend it to each visitor of Czech capital.
Touristy. There is beautiful architecture here. However it is full of tourists and full of tourist traps. It is in the city center so it is hard to avoid.
Just lovely. Its worth just wandering around and getting a feel of the place. The astronomical clock is in the corner, buy a hot wine when its cold but check the prices they vary greatly

Beautiful but very touristy. Be prepared to see a lot of people advertising to you and a lot of tourists in your way. Go early in the morning or late at night to admire the gorgeous surroundings. And don't worry about catching the "show" at the Astronomy clock. It's not a big deal.
Old Town Square. Really beautiful place with fantastic architecture. Make sure to see the Astronomical Clock and to go up the clock tower for beautiful panoramic views of Prague.

Took a tour around the old town - central place to view all major historical attractions within Prague. One good thing the old town planners in Prague did achieve was to centrally locate all the major tourist attractions in one single place which they called the "Old Town" (or Stare Miasto which basically means the same thing in several cities of Czech Republic and Poland). The major attractions accessible from this area include Charles University (a very reputed college in central Europe), old Jewish synagogue and cemetry on a hill, a Franz Kafka statue, the Town hall and clock tower and the best place to approach Prague Castle. Best time to visit this place is probably during winter when there is snowfall, as I have been told many times.
Very pretty. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe, with its old well preserved old buildings and full of diferent kind of stores.

A lot of people!. This was where most of our time was spent. We used this as our meeting point for tours too. There are a lot of restaurants and stores around here and this is a main square for tourists. It has the famous clock. There are always performers here and it's always a good time. Get some food and beer from the outdoor vendors. You'll enjoy it!

Beautiful town. Very old town, just like it's name says.Very beautiful and easy to walk around and get lost down the little streets. Easy to find your way around.Very pleasant. Warnings of pick pocketers, but we had no trouble.Lots of restaurants and tourist attractions around.

Just Wow!!. Old Town Square forms the centrepiece of this area. All around the Square there are bars and cafes/restaurants for people to sit in and watch the world go by. Around the square itself is a maze of little roads and pathways, if you take a stroll around then you could get lost, but find some unexpected delights. There are a lot of crystal shops (obviously!) which offer many different gifts for the traveller. One final thing is to definitely visit the square itself on a Saturday when there are lots of different entertainment for both adults and children alike.
Must see if in Prague. Very touristy, but must see if in Prague. The architecture is amazing and there are many things to see.

So much character with so many characters!. Possibly the most relaxing place we've been.... Surrounded by beautiful architecture listening to the sounds of a jazz quintets busking in the background whilst sipping hot apple juice with cinnamon.... perfect!
superb. be careful of beggars and paying for toilets!! we had our last day with snow, superb views and stunning bridge

Magical in the off-season. One of my favorite memories of old town is a later evening in January, standing in the middle with huge snowflakes falling all around us, sipping mulled wine and taking in the wonder of a mostly empty square. I have visited Prague both in the summer and winter, and think I would only go back in the winter... it is so much more intimate and beautiful...
Prague. Had a lovely time in Prague 13 wedding anniversary plenty to do good food beer sightseeing people lovely would definitely go again b+b great weather not to bad

History in every brick!. This Historical square is located in the midst of Wenceslas Square and Charles Bridge. It used to be a huge marketplace during the twelfth century, when it was called Big Square. Later, it changed many names and forms until 1338, when a Town Hall was built here. This square has witnessed several historical events of Czech history. Jan Zelivisky, the leader of the Hussites, was burnt at the stake here. In 1915, precisely 500 years later, his statue was unveiled in the middle of the square. Another event's marks can also be seen in the form of 27 white crosses on the pavings on the floor before the town hall. 27 Czech gallants were slain here, in the 17th century, when they rebelled against the Habsbourgs. During the twentieth century this square saw the universal suffrage movement, the demonstration of independence, WWII Nazi raids, occupations, destructions and eventually communist party takeover. This square features a myriad buildings like beautiful churches, the Prague Orloj or the astronomical clock and a palace. Medieval themed Christmas and Easter markets are set up here each year.

OK for a few days, then it gets boring.. Its ok to see the building and street acts, but then it gets boring.This is just a tourist trap full of tacky shops selling fake goods.I had a new few days, but would never return.

Stunning View, Stunning Architecture. The view is very iconic and beautiful. I have been to Prague 3 times, and I always took the same picture every time as well. The surrounding are is very touristic area, plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes.. A lot of tourists from all over the world visiting this place.

Wow!!!. The Old Town Square itself is worth the trip! This is one of the most fascinating place in Europe, absolutely gorgeous! It pays to study up on the history of this ancient city center since it shows facades from different periods in the history of the Czech Republic; of course there is the historical clock where different figures come out periodically to the delight of tourists. The square becomes a big party site when there is some sport event or some other big celebration. fun for young people of all nationalities.
Lovely mix. Great mix of old and new without disturbing the atmosphere. Colorful, nice shops, beautiful buildings and a variety of food and drinks. Worth returning to.
Very picturesque. The old town square is extremely beautiful but full of tacky touristy attractions, however this is to be expected in a tourist heavy area

One of the finest towns in eastern europe. This is one of the finest of places I have visited in Eastern Europe. A very historical old town has many restaurants with the finest of foods, local beers. Must visit and see old town and the astronomical Clock. Avoid winters if possible if you plan to walk around this town.
Walking in the snowy old town square. I had a honeymoon trip with my wife to Prague and we were so lucky to see the snowy old town square! It was just amazing and stunning!

Prague Old Town - fabulous!. Walking through Prague city center can literally make you travel in time. Nice buildings decorated with stone statues, old street stone underneath and culture on every corner!
Really beautiful. Such a gorgeous old town. The colours of the buildings are amazing- couldn't stop looking at them!!!!

Lovely at Christmas time. We visited Prague early December for the Christmas market so it was full of market stalls selling local food.beer and goods.So in the evening with all the xmas tree lights and atmosphere it was a great place to walk around in the evening.There is also a great selection of restaurants around the edge of the square where you can people watch to your hearts content.The beer was a lot cheaper than here but you never got a full pint. Worth going up the clock tower but be prepared to queue.

Wonderful vibe. The day I was at the old town square was a wonderful sunny day in spring. The Old Town square was bustling with life, entertainers, buskers and people seated at the surrounding cafes 'people-watching'!
Stunning buildings........ The old gothic style buildings were beautifully preserved with influences of Russia dotted intermittently. It was a delight to walk around this beautiful city.

Seg-ways, parrots and angels?. Old Town Prague carries Prague's omnipresent sense of the strange. As witches, goblins, trolls and torture chambers of horrors past peep from toy shops next to stalls of bright berries and ice-cream, the surreal vistas of seg-ways and busking angels with tethered parrots rival passing costumed figures - a white shark, a giant balloon, Prague feels Kafkaesque. The majestic clock towers, cobbled streets and elegant buildings are the surface of strange, hinting what may lie beneath.

Loved this place,Stare Mesto.. This place is just buzzing,street entertainment,amazing choice of food,great to sit outside in the sunshine and enjoy a cool beer.Come night time when its transformed by lighting,the buildings are breathtaking.
Amazing town!! . So buzzing and full of fun! Great architecture & photo opportunities! The astronomical clock is beautiful! Well worth a visit! Get a Segway too!!!
A must in Prague. It is hard to avoid and has scenic buildings and statues that will leave you breathless. Restaurants are numerous as are bands that play in the Old Town Square.
Beautiful. A really beautiful town centre - with lots going on - the astrnomcal clock with the 12 apostles, resturatrants and buskers - not to be missed in Prague
fabulous. fabulous by day and night to wander the streets and great little shops - Art nouveau beauty everywhere - remember to look up

Very nice to walk by and enjoy. A nice place to visit and walk around as well as take some pictures. Visit on a sunny day and walk around until lunch time.Brilliant for calm walks but not so much to do for kids.
Historic walk across a historic bridge. Beautiful landmark, worth the walk across. Best to get there early as can get very busy. Good place to start your tour of the castle from.

A beautiful centre . Visiting the old town centre in Prague is like stepping into another world. With its beautiful old buildings, cobbled streets and centre, the astronomical clock takes one into a different world. There is a buzz in the atmosphere with music and other performances. Lots of places to eat and quaint shops with modern ones
AMAZING CITY. Loved all in Prague- the atmosphere, the architecture, people, culture...what a nice place to visit again and again!
