One of the most stunning squares in Europe.. One of the most elegant and photographed squares in Europe. The Gothic architecture of the Our Lady before Tyn church, the 400+ year old astrological clock, the beautiful architecture of the surrounding buildings and the shops and restaurants on the square make this site must see stop.
Very picturesque. You could just end up spending a lot of time here especially during winter when the christmas market is still going on and they are selling many delicious sweets
Stunning. Great place to roam around. It will melt your heart especially on night time, so magical! Highly recommendable!

Great Christmas market!. This is a very lovely part of the city. There is plenty to look at in this area and we enjoyed walking around the Christmas market. We were also able to pick up a tour of the city in a private car here which was a great time!
Well known!. Nice architecture atmosphere. Refreshing to walk by all seasons. Christmas market is fun. Day time under the sun. Different flavor in each season.
Beautiful . Just has to be seen to believe how beautiful the whole place is. Loads to see, culture, architecture. Choices of restaurants.
Beautiful. I absolutely loved Old Town Square, there was always something going on (street performers, music etc) and the church and clock tower really are beautiful. A must see when in Prague.
scenic and entertaining. a must to visit, during the day its busy always something to see, at night it is enchanting great street food always entertaining
must see. Lovely part of Prague, but can get lost easily, some people are happy to help some are a bit moany and UN helpful

Stunning & historical. . The Old Town Square is absolutely stunning. Everywhere you look is gorgeous historical architecture! There are street performers, tour touts, food stalls, and the area is surrounded by restaurants and shops. Don't miss it.
Great place to visit. Great place to visit. Beautiful, one of the "must see" if you're in Prague. Go there and you'll find out.

Beautiful . The old town is beautiful, the architecture is stunning and there is a very traditional feel here. We did not have a walking tour, as it easy to walk around and nice to go at your own pace. We went up the clock tower for 120 crowns and was definitely worth it. The views were amazing as was seeing the town stop when hearing the clock bells. Recommend this area and clock tower highly, just be careful with children whilst visiting the clock tower due to the viewing deck being very narrow and the stairs up are very steep. Wouldn't really recommend at all for young children. Additionally, we found the staff in the restaurants in the old town square very unwelcoming! A bit of a shame, but still a beautiful area overall.
Good to visit. A good place to visit, but dont eat on the square, find a restaurant a few streets of the main route.
Nice to see. Take the time time to walk around the square and look at the work, it is amazing and there re some any things see and photograph
Simply amazing. Prague is still fantastic, be prepared to a lot of tourism and a bit less atmosphere (if you have been there already) but simply stunning...

Jewish Quarter in the Old Town with outstanding guide. Old Town was a beautiful and unforgettable experience. I loved especially Jewish Quarter. Don't miss it! Pinkas synagogue with all the names of Czech victims of holocaust and cemetery should not to be missed while visiting Old Town. I recommend to have a good guide as we had Anna Kristyna Sion. She is an incredible specialist in the subject. I recommend her very highly.

Wonderful Medieval downtown. Stunning old town center. I couldn't even imagine how beautiful results to be as soon as I set foot in! Especially the view from the top tower and the charming big square where a lots of artists perform during the afternoon and the evening entertaining crowding tourists. It is quite easy to find most of the typical pub and restaurants. Such a nice, charming place to visit!
Visiting Old Town. Free to walk around and see the street entertainers. Astronomical clock is interesting to see when the hour chimes.
Lots to see. Pragues old town have lot to offer. This is nice place to enjoy sunny day. If the other tourists dosent bother you - this is great place to visit.
Sightseeing. Stroll around pay the 120 Kronua (family) to go up to the top of the astronomical clock and enjoy the views! All the side streets have great little shops too!

Beautiful, historic buildings. The area is not too big so easy to cover in a day or so. We were lucky wth the weather as it was very mild and Spring like (having been here before later in the year when it felt more like the Arctic we really appreciated it).Segways everywhere which is good if you want to use them...not so good if you don't!

Beautiful architecture all around.. Many old beautiful buildings, nice restaurants, shops and tourist attractions. There's a small market full of pretty souvenirs, fresh bakings and flowers . Almost always there are street preformers in the old town square.
There is something for everyone in Prague. Plenty of things to see and do and you are not hassled by anyone to go to their place or buy their products
Beautiful architecture . Amazing architecture with lots of interesting street performers! Few restaurants dotted around but our experience with a restaurant was bad due to rude staff.
Beatifull city center square. As a relative young person with a taste for history, I really loved and enjoyed prague. The Old town has beautifull buildings, towers and church.

Iconic Town Square!. The old town square is home to the beautiful astronomical clock and imposing church. There are an array of restaurants within the square and some food stalls too. The restaurants were very busy so we ate from a stool which seemed very expensive in comparison so other places in the city but was tasty all the same!

A great place to hang out in the evening!. The Old Town Square is always buzzing with activity with street artists and people from all walks of life!Some amazing food stalls too!Here you can meet a lot of the people trying to sell the Pub Crawl tickets to you!Be very cautious to choose the right ones and don't pay more than 20 euros!All in all a good place to be while in Prague!
Beautiful!. Such a cool square with so much interesting history. There's a TON of really cool bars and restaurants in that area too.

you have to go really. its a must and it looks amazing, there are however lots of people there its very busy and there are lots of people asking about tours and selling things, but its to be expected as this must be one of the top three destinations in the city. it has so many amazing buildings, and its also worth seeing in the morning early when the crouds are not there yet. there is however a lot of graffiti just round the corner from the square even on the walls of the cathedral which was a shame.

Breathtaking. We booked on the ww2tour which took us to the square,the buildings were amazing ,so much going on on the square itself was amazing,places to get food ,BBQ ham fab and a drink we loved this place

Historically Interesting. There are always wonders to be found in these old European cities. Some are better cared for than others in terms of the buildings and streets but that aside doesn't prevent you from marveling at the engineering feats and architectural wonders of bygone centuries.

Stunning in the dark . Loved this square & it's amazing buildings architecture & surrounding areas. The hustle and bustle of the square day & night. Please be aware of pick pockets I caught two young girls chinese origin red handed.. Plenty of restaurants, bars /stalls etc.. clean, lively. This square is picturesque in the dark

Fantastic place if you love history and architecture. Be prepared to walk for a very long time but it's so worth it, Prague's Old Town has so many touristic places and just wonderful narrow side-streets where everyone would find sth to their taste. Very beautiful but avoid sitting down in cafes and restaurants right in front of Astronomical clock or surrounding as the prices are tripled and food is not so good, beware of roast pig scam as well, the price is per 100g and they cut you out a half-kilo piece, try elsewhere.

The heart of Prague. The old town of Prague - where to begin, there are so many amazing buildings all around, everywhere you look you can see something from past. Be sure to see main square next to the great clock!

Great area with amazing building. Prague is an amazing city with architecture that is somewhat unparalleled.The old town is a great sight to see. Those pictures you see on the internet are real.I suggest going in summer.

First time in Prague. If you like or love quaint little streets and shops then you'll like the Old Town. The streets have quite a mystery to them and you'll not sure what to expect when you turn the next corner, worth a few hours looking at the several crystal shops and what not.
Old Town Prague . Beautiful historical part of beautiful city Prague with long history. Must not miss it. Every building is amazing.

a trip to the old town a must. During the day a great busy feel like Covent Garden with its street performers and music this is a very busy tourist place the old town anatomical clock is a big draw avoid 12:00 midday try and get there early 09:00 or 10:00 grab a coffee and wait to see the clock Skeleton and chicken dance nice to see there are loads of eating places to choose from spoilt for choicesome lovely pics of a magical church and its spires

Sit out and watch the world go by.... The Old Town really is the place to be as a visitor and there is so much going on. We spent a lot of time wandering around the square and sitting outside watching the crowds go by.Fantastic must see
Spectacular!. I absolutely loved it and would recommend it to EVERYONE! From street-performers, to restaurants (with outside heaters and blankets) to bars, everyone catered for.

Lovely spot, but avoid the restaurants. As a cultural city centre, this almost makes it in winter - perhaps in summer it exceeds expectation, but it's a bit dire when it's cold. See the clock, climb the tower, dodge the wheeled transport, avoid the bars.
Good. beautiful architecture, lovely cafes and restaurants, lots of tourists around, street artists were amusing

My favourite place in Prague. Stare Mesto is full of tourists day and night, but still extremely attractive. Not a great place to eat, but sipping beer in an outdoor cafe and watching people around is a lovely entertainment. I go there every time I visit Prague.
Really really love it :). I love the guy who sings with piano at the middle of the square. I enjoyed it so much and of course the view is beautiful. The lively atmosphere was so impressive.
New Year celebration. Too many russian people on new year holidays... But good hot vine, natural Christmas tree, and atmosphere.

Wonderful place. This square is always full of people, the amount of visitors and locals, and people riding segways trying to get you to take their tours. Good food, wonderful sights, it is the place to hang out in Prague.
A lovely city. Prague is one of the most lovely cities I have been. The Moldova river is so nice and quiet and peaceful. Food is great too!

Happy walking. Walking around the astronomical clock square, drinking Svařák (Mulled Wine), nibbling on a fresh Trdelnik (the famous cinnamon Pastry), Crossing to the Charles bridge, admiring the goth architecture, checking the local store for overpriced souvenirs...
You gotta love the old town of Prague.
Nice!. Prague is such a beautiful city and of course, the old town is the best part of it. You can admire the beautiful architecture of some old buildings and of the cathedral.

beautiful place!. beautiful place deff worth a visit. the buildings are outstanding they all look like they are made out of paper! there are so many little roads off of the old town which have fab restaurants with genuine Czech food!

Beer in the square. A nice place to sit and people watch.
Also to see the clock , entertainment by various artists and wonderful buildings.
A little expensive compared to elsewhere in the city but still good value.
Crazy amounts of different beers. They seem to have a beer for every flavour. If your a brit be careful as the beer is Prague is a lot stronger than back at home, felt pretty jolly after a couple.
Lovely place to be. Old town in Prague is amazing. No matter where you look at you will fing good restaurant, souvenirs shops. The best is musicians who are making this place unique
Lovely. Lovely area. All very old, hence the name. Some Great churches/chapels and the astronomical clock, all there. Lovely atmosphere around there.
Such a sweet spot. Very nice place, typical of eastern Europe with beautiful buildings to visit. Get on top of the church, the view is breathtaking :)

Quaint!. Wonderful walking around this historical area. Felt we went back in time and we relished each moment.You cannot miss the Old Town Hall with its very famous astronomical clock. This dates back to the early 1400s and is well worth admiring. If you are thinking of dining..try the restaurants on the periphery of the Old Town - not only will you get better prices, you get to hangout with the locals and the food is ,we felt, made with greater care.
Amusing. It was like an open museum, with nice lights, you can walk for hours without getting bored , many restaurants and cafes and it doesn't affect the atmosphere as well
Beautiful and with so much history. There are so many beautiful detailed buildings and so much to see. The Christmas markets were a must to visit also.

Love it. just love this place, a little sorry that it was a raining day for me, but better than not be there at all. my shots of this place were little dull, but again, it was better than not be there at all. loved it.

Great at night. The old town is a brilliant place to wander round, with its large square and little alleyways. Lots of restaurants and shops. The ones in the square can be a lot more expensive, so search out some in the back streets, and you will be rewarded with some good local food, beer and wine. The number of people trying to get you to hire a Segway in the square can be a bit of a pain as they tend to get in the way.

History, but many pubs to sit :-). At first sight it looks this is only a place to make sightseeing. But if you come closer there are so many great restaurants to visit and sit in the middle of all this history town.
Day out . Lovely place with great entertainment. Bars, shops and restaurants just a stone throw away well worth a visit.
Love it. Well what can we say about this, you must go there and they are so many café, shops, markets, performance and so on, I am not going to spill the beans.

Prague is beautiful. Every tourist attraction in Prague seemed to be within walking distance of the Old Town. Every corner we turned seemed to bring another architectural delight. Whether you are into beer, food, shopping, classical music, opera, architecture, history or just having fun this would seem to be the place to come.

Lovely but can get crowded. . Old Town and the square is a lovely area of Prague. One of the most fascinating and filled to the brim with spectacular architecture and historic buildings. There's a plethora of street vendors hawking a variety of local food and lots of cafes to choose from (albeit the ones on the square are a little over priced). Bare in mind however that this place gets PACKED. Full to the brim with tourists and also with "tour guides". You will certainly get asked by at least 5 or more of these whether you want a tour. It's a tourist trap. But a lovely and fascinating one.
The Charles Bridge. We walked around, and took the Street car, so we could see all the nice old houses, the wencles square was very nice.
Incredible. Awesome square and fantastic architecture buildings mainly the o'clock but service in restaurants are poor
Great feel and lots to do or just to sit and watch life!. Lovely place great ambiance entertainers and street food. The clock is amazing don't forget to watch it strike on the hour!

Great for a walking tour. The Old Town is great for a walking tour. We found a free one online and did it at our own pace, reading about the monuments we saw along the way.Be aware of pickpockets as you're walking around (especially around the Old Town Square). I had an inkling that someone was trying to target me - I felt a tap on my back pocket and looked around and there were two suspicious looking men.

Very Old and Quaint. The town square has everything a tourists is looking for food shops and culture all very closely located to each other
The food is great offering all different selections right down to Hard Rock Cafe which is always a winner
It is great just to sit and watch the crowds

Beautiful. Small street, open squares and so many gorgeous buildings. Most of the buildings were unaffected by the war so it is like stepping back in time. Very busy with tourists and so many places to eat, drink, buy souvenirs or have a massage!
Exitating The Senses.. The crowds know what they see and fill. The balcony of the old city hall is must. Do not miss a tranquil walking between the narrow alleys.
Great place. What a lovely square. Lovely buildings with good restaurants andva great meeting place.Good street entertainment
Beautiful . Beautiful and charming square! Beautiful buildings with their history. The small roads and the architecture of this square is very romantic!
Great Enterainment. We really loved the square. The buskers were great. The music was fantastic and the food stalls wonderful. Building around the square are magnificent.

Blows Hogwarts Away!. Old Town is a highlight of Prague. The square, with Astronomical Clock and Tyn Church, is another place you simply cannot spend too much time enjoying. You must see it in day and at night. The lighting on Tyn Church is something to behold.. under a full moon it is unbelievable. The only thing missing is a dragon flying out of the pointed spires - I think if you wait long enough you just might see one. I love Prague.

Like stepping into a fairy tale.. All the buildings and architecture in this area of Prague are amazing. I would say almost every building has something unique about it and has some kind of old fashioned charm. The Charles Bridge is a must see.
lovely place to vist. Beautiful architecture everywhere. A very attractive old city. Great variety of restaurants and cafe's all over choose from.

Beautiful Old Town Square.. What a beautiful square with lots of lovely old buildings of all different styles, gothic, medieval, rennaissance etc all around it!There is a lovely atmosphere as there are so many tourists visiting from around the world wanting to see and take photos of this beautiful square.

Must see,especially on the hour. Great busy location with many sites to see contained within.If you are there to see the clock be sure to arrive 10-15 mins early so you have a good view as this is a very popular attraction.There are many museums and galleries as well as great places to eat around the Square so no shortage of choice.Grab a coffee and sit in the square for a while it is a very interesting,diverse and busy place.

Place for creating life lasting memories and history/architecture lovers. I never gets old. Any season. With friends or loved ones. With dogs and kids. At night or during the day. We love, love, love it!

Magical at Christmas time!. What fun to stroll through the stalls all around Old Town at Christmastime. The tree was just beautiful. Trdlos, Langos and the mulled wine are an absolute must. Great to experience during the day as well as at night. Very family friendly.

I spent hours there and could have spent longer. Prague was... I don't know what I expected but it was simply amazing. I never dreamed after so many years of communist occupation it would have retained such a religious backbone. the architecture was stunning and I wandered for hours just looking despite the chill. There were plenty of opportunities for hot spiced wine which warmed me up.
5 day trip. Amazing. Take a long look around and wear very comfy and sturdy shoes. It's breathtaking at night too when it's all lit up!

Bucket list must!. Old town is a treasure. The Astrological clock is very unique piece in the world and its worthy to take time and watch it in action. During Christmas Old town have a lovely Christmas market, where you can buy roasted chestnuts, have mulled wine and buy some typical Czech Christmas decoration. Go for the glass blown retro ones, you can only buy them in Czech. Also Parizska street is connected to Old Town square with the best Prague luxury shops as Prada, Louis Vuitton, Ferragamo etc...There is also Tynsky chram (cathedral) which you can explore and have a nice coffee in Ebel Cafe....you can spend days in this area and its tiny cobbled streets and never get bored.

Amazing Praha. Prague is a city you will fall in love with ...so please keep an extra day just in case you want to laze around in old town square sipping local brew and watching the crowd. The town centre is beautiful and there is lovely church to see and view from the astronomical clock tower is amazing. Go to Charles gate which is mesmerising and then once on the other side take tram 22 to the castle district . Tickets can be bought at any mini mart and short trip is enough as you take the tram to go up the castle area. Once you finished walking down hill is easy and you can cross over the bridge again to old town. TheJewish quarters has a very old synagogue and one can do window shopping in the high end shops . The garnets in Czech are beautiful and every lady should buy something and they not too expensive also the bohemenian crystal. Overall I found food and drinks in Praha avg around 30 to 40 euros for two people at reasonable restaurant and it is quiet cheap compared to other European cities and very good quality. Best way to see Prague is walking and once can leisurely see it in tow days at your own pace and there is no need for tour bus etc. Please visit the Czech underground rest in municipal hall and the beer factory nearby for some excellent brew. My opinion of Praha beautiful city with ancient architecture and lovely historic and cultural significance. However the Czech people take time to talk with tourist so don't be surprised if you do not find too many friendly faces, but once you break the ice they are fantastic. My last tip is if u do shop and have to claim tax free please make sure you fill up the form in your name, add and valid credit card and submit it to the tax refund centre in the city...the shop will explain it to you .Beware any mistake they will send you back to the shop. Once you flying out of and eu airport make sure you stamp the forms from customs and post it back to the tax company in the reply paid envelopes else you will be charged if they do not get it in 21 days. Please try the local krusta and creeps very tasty sweets.hope this helps. Thanks
Great fun with lots to do and see. Make sure you check out the little street performances all over and the clock that has been operational for about 600 years, accurately!!

Fantastic. One of the better old town that I have visited. Well preserved and yet is well-functioning a modern city. Great shopping experiences, good restaurants and good street food. Don't forget to enjoy the local beer, which has an excellent aroma.

a must on visit to Prague. just enjoying walking around looking at all the architecture. Plenty of restaurants and shops to keep you entertained. center area usually has some sort of free entertainment going on and of course you have the glockenspiel. beautiful colorful buildings.
to see the clock. a wonderful place to sit, eat, drink and chill, very smart well looked after buildings to look at and photograph
The most beautiful place in the world if you love architecture!. So much has been said about the Old Town Square I am not sure I can improve on it has beauty, history, it really is a wow!
Well worth seeing. Oozing with history. Found it difficult to move due to volume of tourists. A must see. Equal to anything in Paris or London.

Beautiful !!. We wandered around here for 3 days, no matter where we went we always ended up in the old town, stunning buildings and great atmosphere , much more expensive to eat and drink here than the surrounding area but still relatively cheap compared to home. We walked about 30 miles in three days, now back home with very sore feet !!
Stunning. This is a must to see. Beautiful Old Town so many varieties of buildings, Gothic, Baroque, etc.. Amazingly Beautiful. Word of warning. Wear very comfy shoes for the cobbled streets.

This is the place to be in Prague. i spent a good amount of time around the main square and just checking out everything in old town in general. everywhere you look it's great. it was close to paris level of amazing for me. if you go to prague you gotta go spend some time in the old town and see for yourself the very close to disney castle type buildings
old town. Don't eat or drink in this area..watch and talk with people and just walk around the area and smell the history
It is nice to be there.... In very hour of the day and night, you can find something there. Street musician, artists, nice cafes and restaurants, astronomical clock...

Lively Place. Classic Buildings.. Great place to visit for food and a beer. Lots of street performers, but no pressure. Can be a tad pricey in the square, but it's all about the location. Make sure you wander through the connecting streets.

Gorgeus. If you're going to visit Prague then visiting the Old Town is a MUST! Absolutely astonishing! Most of the days I spent in Prague I ended up at the Old Town square. The only minus is that the prices around that area are fairly higher compared to places a bit further away.

A Must when in Prague. Beautiful place with the famous Astronomical Clock , nice restaurants or street snacks , great buildings and two churches. Plenty of space and great street musicians adding to the atmosphere. So much to see you will visit several times if you have the time. Definitely go to the top of the Powder Tower to get a panoramic birds eye view of those wonderful Prague rooftops

Love this square. This is a great place to visit. I really loved just standing and looking at the different architecture, absorbing the history, people watching. Some good places to eat on and near the Square, too.
Beautiful Town centre!!. Amazing both day and night - we travelled in winter - just before the christmas markets came to town but it was still was very festive and joyous.

Historic center of Prague, must see. It gets crowded but so does everywhere in Prague. I prefer to stay in this part of town even though the restaurants are a bit hit and miss and the prices are higher than in outer areas. It is just easy as you can walk to all the areas you want to see.
Beautiful city. Must see area. Beautiful scenery. Lots of restaurants, bars, shops. Musicians in square at night. Don't take taxi unless pre booked with hotel or reputable place. Very expensive.

Best Medieval Old Town. The old town is amazing and full of character, without all of the tourists the city wouldn't seem real with all the medieval buildings and cobblestones which make it feel like you're in a fairytale. People say Prague has gone expensive but there is so many pubs and restaurants to chose from that I still found it cheap in the old town as long as you dont go in the main square.

Beautiful architecture . Beautiful place would recommend a few tours to be done so you could get to hear the history behind the clock and how prague has been used for filming various war films over the years, buskers generally very entertaining too

Beautiful square, too many segways.. Very nice square, beautiful medieval buildings. Too bad there are so much people trying to rent you a segway, some are really pushy. Overall nice place to visit when you're in Prague, but not for too long.
Lovely part of Prague. Lots to keep travellers entertained here, from architecture to street entertainers.Not a cheap area to eat and drink in, but it is beautiful!

Beautiful buildings, interesting city. The Old Town is the tourist hub of Prague, where everything seems to emanate from. the buildings are stunning and varied, the streets around have interesting shops and attractions. Just soak up the atmosphere, it's Prague's equivalent of Covent Garden.
Go Early. I visited, so there wasn't many tourists which was pleasant, could easily walk around everywhere, plenty of opportunities to do segway tours and it feels very safe!

Full of life . Full of life at day filled with street performers, hot food stands, restaurants and bars. The tower was also fun to go up and had a great view all over Prague.At night be careful walking through this area, my phone was stolen the first night i was here by a blonde women and a man who was dressed like a club promoter but was loitering around the girl like he was her back up.
Very pretty. This area of the city is very pretty at night and there are a range of cafes etc to choose from. There are also a number of shops close by in easy walking distance.

Lovely. Visited Prague during the spring, right in the middle of the Easter festival that takes place in the Stare Mesto main square. Lots of overpriced restaurants on the main square, but if you walk around a bit you'll find some nice little places to eat. Walk around the little shops as well, take in the architecture -- it's all gorgeous (try to ignore the fact that the bell towers are not the same width). Also try a free tour. Czech people are all super nice, the beer is amazing. Watch out for the cash exchanges, lots of them overcharge.

Fun. Every time I turned my head I had a different view: magicians, singers, a castle, a church, trolleys, people, clowns, restaurants, shops. Old town square is a vibrant place, full of life, full of culture, art, beautiful buildings and then, the king of the square: the Astronomical Clock!! So exquisite, impressively made and still working to perfection!! A Master Work!Old Town Square is a Prague MUST!!
Don't miss it!. This is the most charming part of the city! This is definitely not an area to miss, especially for the Christmas market. The food vendors was AMAZING

Beautiful city. The old town is really beautiful and we visited this many times and took loads of Photos. Watch out for the market traders selling food, they state one price (per weight of 100 grams) and when you get the food they weigh it and tell you massive slabs of meat are just one portion and are unwilling to reduce the sizes. I paid just over 700 czk (£18.00) for a snack. It wasn't worth it really and I just felt robbed. I had paid less in restaurants for better food. Other than that everything else was great.

Prague has it all. Did you know that Prague Is The 5th Most-Visited City In Europe ? Only four other cities in Europe attracted more visitors than the Czech capital: London, Paris, Istanbul and Rome. I really love this city and especially the Old Town. As the first city that was rediscovered after the Iron Curtain fall, Prague has long since found its natural place as one of Europe's top destinations. A central European beauty, architecturally and culturally. Find yourself a cafe and let your creativity take control. Prague in the Czech Republic has grown to become one of the most popular tourist destinations in Europe, with many exciting things to see and a low cost. Prague was spared especially bombing during World War II, and thus appears today as one of Europe's most beautiful cities. If you also live at the "old East European prices" so we are left with a breathtaking nice feeling when you're back from vacation.Prague is a wonderful and well-preserved city with great architecture and a large amount of magnificent old houses, winding streets and famous sights such as. Charles Bridge, Old Town Square, Prague Castle M.M. In 1992 came the historic center on 886 hectares with a world heritage site. Prague's beauty is almost magical. Communism autocracy in the city lasted more than 40 years and until 1989 used only few tourists come to Prague. But although Prague was the capital of an Eastern Bloc country, the city has not been affected by this time in the same way as for example Warsaw or Bucharest. Magnificent buildings in Baroque style, royal palace, rich cultural life, small beer joints with good and cheap local beer as well as international fashion houses with stiff prices. Prague has it all.
Lively and historical heart of Prague. A very lively part of Prague ,cafes,bars,restaurants the central area for street performers ,a great meeting place to while away the hours

The most beautiful!. Prague's Old Town is the most beautiful place of this type I've seen up to now. You should visit it at least once in your lifetime, to experience yourself its old, almost medieval feeling when walking the narrow, cobbled pavements.
Beauty with the best. The best place to get the ice on the toppings... We were amazed to see ... The sculptures, buildings and architectures... Marvelous ...
Amazing.. The square is very beautiful and charming, with its restaurants and buildings. The streets around indeed resemble medieval times, and are a pleasant walk.

a highlight of prague. Beautiful architecture in the old town, and surrounded by a host of restaurants and bars.This part of Prague is great both through the day and in the evenings, as it is always remains lively! Many fantastic picture opportunities to be had here, including the anatomical clock which you can take stairs to the top of and experience a wonderful view of Prague.One thing i would recommend is eating just outside of the old town however, as you will be paying top prices in restaurants and bars, whereas if you continue just out of the old town prices are much cheaper and there are some lovely restaurants to eat at.
good day. by a "hollow donnut" and a coffee and sit and enjoy the day, I went to the church and then saw the changing hour of the clock
Beautiful. The old town was beautiful. This is where most of the meeting points are for the tours. So, there was a lot of people there when I visited.

Short stop, will go back. . Went for an hour will be going back, the clock is beautiful to look at but the show as it chimes well blink and you miss it and it is a bit if a damp squib.the buildings are amazing and lots of food and shops, the chocolate shop is a must. We think it's called Viva Praha there is a museum as well all about chocolate. If you are using the hop on hop off service be warned NO SIGNS for were to catch the bus the same can be said all over Prague the signs are very bad and many of the maps miss leading.
Like a Fairytale . The main hub and meeting point surrounded by restaurants, bars and shops. All father at the Astronomical Clock on the hour to see what happens.
Beautiful Prague. An experience not to be missed. We were here for the Christmas Market but will return one summer. Just loved Prague and the people.
entertainment. Old clock eating out English pub with very large meals and not high priced very nice shall be back for 5th visit

Amazing part of Europe!. The Old town is the old part of Prague, the capital of Czech Republic. In the fall and in the spring, there are a lot of people there. Prague is most beautiful in winter. In summer is very hot. In Old Town there is a big castle and Karl's bridge. If you are in Prague you can't miss that!
Charming!. The Stare Mesto of Prague is magical. The medieval architecture is stunning, but the cobbled streets are not good for high heels!

Central place. Lovely buildings surround this square. It is a great location to go explore the town, a few minutes to the old bridge and the castle side of the river. Nearby to the new shopping area. There are little cabins serving food around the town hall side. They sell fast foof such as sausages, pastries and gammon. (for about60-80ckr or £1 ) If you are tempted by the old prague ham and bread, tak enote, that it is sold by the weight, when its cut off the roast for you, put on a plate and weighed, and you charged. Make sure you point out how much you want. In the evening the square fills up as buskers sing, segway riders buzz around and statues make noises for your donations!!

Don't miss it!! . The old town was one of my favorite attractions in Prague! In the main square you can see a lot of interest things happening, from street artist to markets passing through other tourists!There is also many others atta near the main square of the old town. Is a great place to take pictures and enjoy your time alone or with friends!
Sun going down on the Old Town Square. 5pm on the square and catching the last sun. Loads of history and lots of stories if you know what you are looking at.

Beautiful and idyllic Stare Mesto. Prague old town is definitely a worth to visit. The narrow streets leading to old town square are idyllic and full of small shops and restaurants. The Old town square is beautiful. There is a Gothic and Baroque Churches, National Gallery and Old town hall with the Astronomical Clock Prague Orloj, which is very detailed piece of work of art and engineering. From the old town square there is only a short stroll to Karlův most (Charles Bridge). If you have time, I would recommend to visit old town both in day time and in the evening, the ambience is different in different times.

Absolutely beautiful!. So much to see. Beautiful architecture; a city with a great feel to it. Give yourself an extra day to amble back through the streets. It's very relaxing, and you'll notice things you hadn't seen before. Definitely not a one day only trip.

Beautiful architecture . A place which is a must to visit in Prague, lots of lovely architecture and street performers. But beware the bars and restaurants in this area charge more than double for food and drinks than others in the very near vicinity!

Beautiful square, vibrant and full of history. Bustling square in the heart of the old town with the "interesting" astronomical clock tower and some beautiful buildings. The guide book I had, described the clocks display as "underwhelming" but a must see and eventually we got to see the clock chime the hour. It is touristy but to go up the tower offers a great view out over the city. There is a lift which has been sympathetically installed into the centre of the tower to take visitors to the top.

Breathtaking!. The greatest thing about Old Town Square is that the view is free. You can pay to climb the clock (I recommend it, the view is spectacular) and to go into the underground (also recommended, the incurred knowledge is beyond cool), but you can go into the churches, see the spires, and gawk at the architecture all without opening your wallet.

Wander About. Stay off the main square and you can find many lovely cafes and bars to chill and relax in at very reasonable prices. Bring good walking shoes as the streets are cobblestone in many areas.

So much to see. There's already so much to see just in this section of Prague (Astronomical Clock, Jan Hus Memorial, Tyn Church) . But, if you also just want to sit in one of the many outdoor seats of the restaurants on Old Town Square, there's a lot of options for that too. Beware however, as I did notice a lot of sketchy individuals around here so watch your belongings.
A must see!. Beautiful baroque architecture, lots of little shops, cafes and bars and very friendly and relaxed. Watch out for Segways!
Old town meteorological clock tower. If you have time climb or take the lift up the Old town meteorological clock towerGreat views of the city and Definately a 'must' in my book
Good and very interesting. This is worth a visit with lots of very interesting places to eat - other than that its a tourist attraction that is part of any visit to Prague
Square of plenty. George and dragon pub on the square cheap beer and live acoustic music was very good and yes the Twn towers and astronomical clock were great too !
Good cafes.. Try to go on the hour to see the astronomical clock chime. It's not as expensive to eat around there as you might think.

Worth the visit!. You cannot visit Prague without going to the old town square. There is just so much to see and many markets to visit. Easter is the best time to visit as they celebrate and there are eggs everywhere! Definitely buy a few eggs to take home for your family.
Incredibly Beautiful!. Prague is a city filled with history, medieval, gothic and modern architecture. I think it is definitely the most beautiful city in central Europe!

Fun Shops and Beautiful Buildings. We took Rick Steve's Walking Tour (audio on iPhone). We started at the Powder Tower. It was fun to wander around Celetna Street, see the Astronomical Clock, pass through Karlova Street towards the Charles Bridge. There were street performances on the square. Lots of cafes for you to rest and people watch. (Husband added: "with outstanding Czech beer". lol)

Just magical. We arrived in the square and the Christmas booths were set up, the lights, the cathedral and the clock tower were towering around us and then it began to snow. Could not have been a magical spot.
Beautiful historical center. Took a weekend off to walk through the old charming streets, full of antique and modern shops. Truly European in nature.

Great square but to many seg way's. It's a very nice square with a lot of restaurants and pubs. Middle of the city sorta say so from there you can get anywhere. Only problem is you get attacked by a segway tour operator offering segway tours to you every 5 seconds.

Don't miss Jewish Quarter while visiting Old Town. Old Town is definitely the best part of Prague. Don't forget to visit it's northern part which is Jewish Quarter with one of the oldest still in use synagogue in the world called the Alt-Neu Shul. You will need a really good guide to explain you what you see around (if you want to know what you see around). We highly recommend Anna Kristyna Sion. She is excellent and made it really unforgettable for us.

Love old town . Old town is another reason to visit Praha if you have never been! It's beautiful and full of interesting shops and lively places to eat and drink. The actually square is the best bit for me with street acts and the food stalls. Watch out for scammers and pick pockets (you will never feel in safe)
Nice buildings. Will recommend to take a trip around these small and nice streets. Lots of things to see and of course to buy! Prices are low
Great Location and Atmosphere!. Great Medieval Atmosphere and very interesting location! Don't miss the old clock and plays every hour!
So much going on. There's a little bit of everything here. Bars, restaurants, souvenir shops, historical sites, street performance, etc. definitely a very busy tourist area.
Magical. 10 mins walk from our hotel. A must visit at night also as is the whole of prague for the illumination of the buildings. Magical

always super crowded and actually no really special without the clock. We were there before Christmas. With Christmas market it is really lighted and good from the atmosphere. However, it is so crowded at the main square that we almost had no place for walking.
Good place to visit. It is a nice place to visit, but be careful of the pickpocket. Along that area also have a lot of shop to shop and food.

Old Town Prague - Everything you could want.. The main square has everything. Wonderful restaurants, fabulous shopping, museums, the best gelato in town.
Be sure and take in the Astronomical Clock and one of the many music concerts in the Cathedrals that have been turned into music venues. The acoustics are perfect. Lot of street performers to entertain kids and adults alike.
Incredible architecture. a visit at the top of the Clock Tower is a must! Amazing view of the city! Strolling the old streets is full of great surprises!

City break . Beautiful city and outstanding buildings that you could stare at for hours, The streets were busy with tourists but when it came to finding somewhere to eat or drink we found it quite hard as everywhere was pretty empty, I'm putting this down to time of year because the meals we had were lovely and at times me and my boyfriend were the only ones in the whole restaurant at prime times. So I think Don't let empty places put you off.
Old Town. Beautiful by day and night. Great place to sit and people watch. Great for wandering and widow shopping.

Thsi is my favourite . I was amazed by the view, church of our lady before tyn beautiful in day and night time. The detail church is jus amazin. Also nice view from top of the astronomical clock (orloj) which is standing just opposite
Its amazing!. Definitely the place to go in Prague- Old town square with the Astronomical clock are to most popular places in Prague along with the Charles bridge!

Sad how turism can destroy spirit of city. It is one of most popular and nice old towns of the world cities, BUT, it s madly overpriced, it s very dirty (graffiti, garbage etc), in shops you can mainly buy only crap from russians and arabians (i dont know if its traditinal to have thai massage and russian dolls), there are no citizens making true spirit of old prague, there are old buildings but most of them just walls with stolen inside history..
Take time to stroll. Every detail of Old Town Prague is like a set from a fairy tale. We loved the old buildings, the history, the clock and we had an excellent guide to give us all the details.

Wow! History Galore!. It is so colourful as well as preserved. Make sure you check out the Kinsky Palace and don't forget the Church of St. Nicholas they are on the north and east sides....just some of my faves!

Beautiful Place . Stayed just off old town square, loves walking here every day. Segway guys can be startling just flying right up to you as you walk was funny though. Learned so much about all the buildings in old town on our free walking tour. Loved old town more than new or lesser town

Gorgeous. Old Town Prague is absolutely stunning! There is so much going on in the streets and the culture is so unique compared to other places in Europe. Walking around the square really helps you soak it all in!
Fantastic Buildings. Walk around the old town to experience all of the fantastic building in Prague. Highly recommended. Definitely spend some time in the old town square to see the clock.

I am in love with Staré Město and with Prague. This city and its Staré Město is the most romantic and nice. I definitely recommend you to go there and visit it. It is really nice to see it from the tower above the big clock.
Such a lovely city. Lots to see, safe to walk about in day or night, great atmosphere. Lovely tourist shops in little cobbled lanes.

Fairytale. Old Town is a beautiful touristy area. There are lots of bars with heated street seating so that you can people watch to your hears content.
The astronomical clock is in the heart of the square and is a must see.
Very cobbled so good comfy shoes essential
Like walking through a fairy tale. Do take the time to stroll all the lovely little side streets in Old Town and admire the pastel buildings and magical, fairy tale ambiance.

fascinating city and buildings. This is a must see city the architecture is amazings and must be seen. i would recommend going during the week if you can as the weekends have lots of stag and hen parties

Beatiful place for a walk. The Old Town square and the streets around it are a great place to walk and admire Prague, stop for a quick bite and listen to music, as there is always some band playing there. You can see the Astronomical Clock and across the square you can visit the church of our lady before týn, or enter one of the art galleries.

Old Town!. What's not to love, it's old town and there is tons of stuff to look at and visit. I was there on the coldest days of the year and it snowed one of them and it presented an interesting look at the how Prague operates in the winter. Had a great time!

Well maintained. Prague has one of the best maintained city centers in Central Europe. It is a genuine pleasure to walk around and see all kinds of building styles, from Gothic to Renaissance, Baroque, Rococo and Jugendstil. When you cross over Karl's Bridge you have an astonishing view to the Castle Hill. Once up there the view over the city is even beautiful. I saw it with the last, almost golden light of a winter afternoon and it was breath taking. Will come back, preferably late spring...

Must see. A must see on your trip to Prague. Climb the clock tower for fantastic views over Prague (there is a lift but the climb is fine for the able bodied).
Watch out for touts on segways constantly offering you segway tours. Theyre not aggressive but there are a lot of them.

Amazing. It was very cold during the visit but old town square welcomes you with so much warmth. Indeed very touristy, but I am not complaining as I was a tourist. The astronomical clock is right these to mesmerise you and tell you how time has passed by. The square had a lot of cafes restaurants. Dec - Jan will let you experience music as well as there is some band or the other playing. Walking around is amazing and you feel the air mixed with touristy chats, music , food everything. Must visit definitely. Important:- One thing that nagged me was the currency, if you pay in euro your change will be in czec crowns making you lose a lot of money. I don't understand why cant they follow euro when they are in the euro zone, this is one thing that makes life a bit difficult for a tourist.

Lovely spot for a stroll. The old town square is gorgeous. Some lovely buildings and churches. The astronomical clock and our lady of Tyn cathedral. Lovely cafes and restaurants. Although they are overpriced compared to other places away from the square.
Enchanting at night!. The old town square is right at the heart of Prague City. It is surrounded by hotels and theaters! A good starting point for walks around the city!
lovely area,apart from the tacky side!!. This is a lovely place with amazing architecture and some lovely shops, but it has an area just by the bridge which is very tacky and should be avoided!!
Gorgeous in the snow. Lovely touristy square which lovely old buildings. Make sure you are there when the astronomical clocks strikes. Its quite magical

Very nice but do not change your money. Very nice place but do not change your money in the office facing the Clock. They claim that they take 0% commission but it is tricky ! Instead of changing for example 100 € at the normal rate giving 2500Kr, they change with a far lower rate to 1500Kr. When they give you back the money, they ask you to sign, do not do it ! WHen you sign, you can not complain and they are very agressive.

Really enjoyed walking around the pretty streets. Some friends and I spent a few days in Prague and really enjoyed the ambience of the old town and the streets around the old town square and the little cafés and shops.Would recommend.
Beautiful buildings. We walked all over the old town, and everywhere you look there is something to see. We were amazed how much of the town you can cover on foot.

Heavenly experience. Prague is definitely my favorite city (to visit).The city has simply stunning architecture! Lots of museums, monuments, cathedrals (St. Vitus Cathedral my favorite). Charles bridge was my favorite attraction with a very beautiful view of Prague. It’s a very lively spot with lots of musicians & artists performing. Just a great cultural vibrant atmosphere. The old town square & new town are simply stunning! There’s lots to see and do, very lively city! My only negative point is it was very overcrowded & sometimes very difficult to get to places or take photos.I love everything about Prague and I couldn’t have had a greater experience

beautiful. i loved prague! You can walk everywere to discover new places! Old town is amazing, easy reachable and full of life. I went with the snow and it was charming. i am planning to go in spring to taste another atmosphere!

The Astronomical Clock isn't worth it. This old town is fancier than others I've found in central Europe but still beautiful - the gothic style church are pretty fanstastic. Not as busy as I expected when I visited in the middle of the afternoon, but many tourists milling around. I'm not sure if everyone is being serious on how cool this astronomical clock is, but my favorite part of it is definitely seeing everyone's disappointment on their faces when they aren't impressed by it - definitely second to Munich's, but if you think about how it was built several hundred years ago and still works, that's pretty cool in itself I guess!
beautiful. Nice to walk around. Lot to do, beautiful buildings and a lot of towers worth climbing (if you like walking up many stairs). Not too many nice typical shops, like i was expecting
A Beautiful City. We took a trolley ride through the old town, including a warming glass of wine and snacks. The trip was a lovely start to our trip

Fabulous Architecture. I have had the pleasure of visiting Prague on business several times and always make a point of visiting the Old town. The architecture is magnificent and never fails to delight. Seeing the Astronomical clock when the hour strikes is a must.Sometimes having to run the gauntlet of the restaurant staff hawking their menus and the different tours can be annoying but I guess hey have to make a living too.Do not miss the Old Town if you are in Prague.

Touring Prague . You cannot visit Prague and not stop off in the old town, one of my favourite places the old buildings, entertainment on the square it was so beautiful.. make sure your check out the famous old town hall and watch the clock on the hour

European Paradise. What a city! The best of Europe. Great sights and attractions from the Astronomical clock to the Charles Bridge to the Prague Castle. All the churches and museums are beautiful and opulent. We went to the State Opera house (magnificent) to see Il Rigoletto (Verdi). We took local bus service to the Castle and toured that fabulous structure and then we walked down to Mala Strada and had lunch in a local cafe and toured that part of the city on the other side of the Charles Bridge. Finished the day with a Chamber music concert. The food is not expensive even in the best of restaurants. The streets are fairly safe (occasional pickpocket) and the taxis you should get a price beforehand. You need at least three days to see most of the city but I would not hesitate to stay longer.
Very nice. Like in many other European cities, this old city center is beautiful with a mix of the old and new. Obviously it's a must visit place when in Prague.
Beautiful. Very beautiful place in old town, very good trip in Prague. I recommend to view this city. Very great view at the summit of the tower.

Prague City Break. Prague is a great city withe some interesting landmarks. We went there with a stag party and it was really enjoyable with plenty of decent bars and clubs. I went back for another visit a couple of months later and checked it out, without looking through the eyes of a drunk and could see why women would find the place intimidating with all the drunken groups in the streets and main square. Its got fantastic architecture, but Rome is better. More suited for stag & hen parties than couples!

Prague á cultural center.. The square is a must if you visit Prague. difficult to avoid :)
It's always fun here.
Life here varies m. Seasons.
Wonderful
A great place to relax. The focal point of the city.. use this as your base to relax and nip out to watch the amazing astronominical clock

You know you'll go anyway - so enjoy it. Who goes to Prague without going to Old Town? Of course you'll see the astronomical clock. Do try to be there on the hour. We didn't even know it did things on the hour but saw the crowd staring so we did as well. That was fun - the apostles come out, music plays, etc. The square itself is festive and beautiful. And the stores in the surrounding area stay open until 11pm so you can take your time wandering the cobblestone streets and alleys knowing you will miss nothing. Be sure to pay attention to the architure - every building is unique and gorgeous in its own way.
Awesome. It was very beautiful!! I loved the old town and the Astronomical Clock. everything there is so nice!
street performers, carriage rides. It's a general location for people to gather. Nice for people watching or catching a carriage ride. Most people watch for the clock to chime.

Very crowded as in Christmas period..... The square was covered with Christmas stalls, mainly selling food and drinks, less like in Germany where you can get all kind of goodies. Although very crowded, not suffocating. A visit to this square should be done at least twice. Once during the day, and once with the evening lightning. In front of the old clock tower, it is each hour pushing and pulling to get the best place at the moment the apostels appear. Watch out fro pickpockets at that moment ! Visit the square very early in the day to avoid all these crowds.

Impressive. The Rococo Kinsky Palace, the Gothic Tyn Cathedral and the Baroque St. Nicholas Church, all of them impressive! Plus everchanging vendors make the square as colorful as the buildings that surround it.

Beautiful!. It you don't have too far with travel I truly recommend coming here. Nice restaurants around the area and the castle-like Church is so enchanting. Loved the Towers. You can get up at one Tower for 70 or 90 CZK and you'll get a good look at the city. Worth the Money!

Full of atmosphere . Loved walking and eating around the old town. Very busy as there is lots to see. We visited a glass blowing demonstration and we received a small gift afterwards. That was really appreciated. The astronomical clock is amazing. There are walking tours that take you inside, and explain the history. We sat for ages and just watched what was happening around the square. Give yourself plenty of time.

Amazing Place. Prague has a wonderful well preserved history. The Old Town shows the beauty of the architecture of the city. The astronomical clock is a must watch one time, but after that you'll see it's a lot of hype and not a lot happens. The buildings can be admired for hours.

Must-see . Old town square was probably my favourite place in all of Prague. Especially after dark, the atmosphere was just amazing. Personally, I thought the whole city was like a Disney movie in general - the way the castle is visible in most parts of Prague, at the top of the hill - that's what the settings are like in fairytales! In the square are plenty of food stalls as well as restaurants with terraces offering nice views of the city. I thought it was quite nice to simply sit down in the square with a hot drink (lots of seating available) and people watch! Located in the square is also the astronomical clock, which I visited. It was interesting and I don't recall having to wait long in queue for tickets to climb to the top of the old town hall tower. Directly opposite is the tyn church which looks very pretty when lit up in the evening.The chocolate museum is also in the same area which is worth taking a look at, as well as plenty of shops including Swarovski, Cartier etc. I'd visited Prague during winter of 2014 (TA will not enable me to choose the appropriate month/year). In my opinion, winter is probably the best time to visit, especially during Christmas.
Busy!. Lovely area to sit and watch the world go by. And you will see a lot of the world go by - exceptionally busy area, especially around clock chiming time!

Great. We visited in December when the Christmas markets were on, so that was really special. There are lots of things to see here at the square, it's just a fabulous place in Prague that really makes you feel part of it all.
Amazing . Prague a fairytale town from top to bottom. I think that said it all .Full of colour,guiet, clean, violence free just a perfect place for a holiday or city break. Will definitely return

mesmerizing. everything you expected and more ,culturally and very christmasy , everything open on xmas eve and xmas day ,alyjough advised by hotel it wouldn't be ,but all was open fabulous atmosphere

A Dont Miss Destination When in Prague. Spent plenty of time wandering around in Old Town on my visits to Prague and it will take plenty more visits to discover all the delights this city has to offer, what a place!
Dreamy place - fairy tails are written here. Excellent place, full of medieval atmosphere.A nice place to walk... in the square... the churches... sight seeing or wandering in the small streets.
Must visit. Nice place to walk around and feel the atmosphere of the city. It is recommended to go up to the tower, it is a good view about the city.

Fascinating area, great tour of Jewish Quarter. We stayed in Karlova and walked all around the Old Town over 4 days. We loved the narrow, car-free streets, pretty and historic buildings, haphazard unplanned street layout reflecting its ancient historical development, and the constant busyness. a favourite location.We had a great half-day tour of the Jewish Quarter (Josefov) with Anna Kristyna Sion of Terezin Private Tours (details on their website). A very personable and pleasant person, she met us promptly at our apartment and led us on a well-paced walk through the district, including visits to the major sites such as the Maisel, Pinchas and Spanish synagogues and the Old Jewish Cemetery. Her English is very good, her knowledge is clearly very extensive, and she was able to give information and explanations very well and to field questions on what we were seeing as well as broader historical and Prague-wide questions. Her discussions conveyed her passion for the people, place and history while maintaining a good balance and lightness of touch. The synagogues, museums and cemetery have their own power, but she was also very good is providing an introduction then letting us experience each for ourselves. We were later told by another tourism operator that her fees are very reasonable and that a female guide is very unusual. One of the best private tours we have taken. We highly recommend Anna as a private guide.
Beautiful. Could get lost in Prague any day again. Worth going and damn cheap beer.. Wouldn't think twice if someone offered me a ticket.
busy and packed with tourists. busy street; crowded with tourists. Nice atmosphere and definitely a romantic city worth visiting once a lifetime
Very picturesque. Lovely square. Plenty of places to get a hot drink or a cold beer and sit a people watch. Even on a cold day.
WOW incredible city. Every building is magnificent, and all in close proximity and walking distance, advise you to have a street map, otherwise you can go round in a circle!
Stunning!. As this was a Christmas trip, you could not have been anywhere more Christmassy! Just a perfect place to be in December. Loved the architecture and the churches were beautiful.

Calm, tranquil and at the same time hectic ... this is Stare Mesto - a place for every age and interest.. You cannot feel Prague without visiting Stare Mesto. This is a place where history and modern art meet and merge, where people relax and find themselves. It is a must for people of all ages and interest.
Wedding anniversay week in Prague. This a typical Czech square with a great many sites to see and a great many people, a surprise for January in the rain. Brilliant atmosphere.

Beautiful, well-preserved and lovely to visit in Winter. Prague Old own is very easy to walk around (watch the cobble paths with missing cobbles - always look down when walking around) and the town is so beautiful especially to photograph. No matter what the weather, Prague as beautiful light which makes for some breath taking photos. We missed the crowds travelling in mid-January and that was delightful and the weather wasn't unbearably cold but I do enjoy the cold weather.
A place to be. One of the most beautiful squares in Central Europe, specially in winter. Full of places to have a traditional czech beer.
Pretty. Pretty touristy area of Prague beware of the selfie sticks! good place to hang out and have a drink and watch the world go by!

Stunning!!!. One of the great squares of Europe any time of year but especially at Xmas when the markets are in full flow. I've visited Prague 6 times now and this really is the focal point of a beautiful city.
Old town. This a beautiful area. We enjoy admirating the beautiful architecture. We spend the day walking through this area/

Can't wait to go back. Prague was as magnificent as I had imagined before arriving. Lots to see and do in Old Town, and get lost due to the unplanned nature of the streets. Wasn't overly crowded due to the cold weather...must be packed during the summer months.
Amazing Town. That was the amazing experience to be in Old Town of Prague. It was like a town from a fairy-tale. Very beautifull.
Charming. Would definitely recommend any visitors to take a trip to the old town square and the old town in general. Beautiful buildings and beautiful food!
What an amazing place. We walked for hours exploring this part of the city and it was wonderful seeing all the buildings, watching the clock and just taking in all the sights.
Great place to go,,. An amazing place to go, everything around is beautifull, loved walking around, also lots of resturants and shops
So much to offer. Old town is a beautiful location based on buildings alone but there was so much to offer for everyone. Souvenir shops, bars, restaurants, cafes, art etc... Worth a trip

Richness of Sophistication. This square is a highly qualified symbol for the Central European Society reflecting all the classes from the Aristocracy to the Bourgeoisie. Astonishing is the richness of the handcrafts that embroidered the whole square through different periods.
Beautiful!. Old architecture, culture and Prague is simply a very beautiful city. Perhaps not the best for shopping clothes etc but here you have culture around every corner! Old Europe.

Iconic - Must go. The structure is just magnificent - and standing in the old town square with a full view of it is breathtaking. This is iconic of Prague, definitely have to go see it when you're there!
First time visit. Excellent city. Very easy to get around on food and by metro. No language issues if English is your only language

Atmospheric setting, fab buildings. What a lovely place! We spent many an hour sat sipping a beer & mulled wine watching the world go by!
Beautiful buildings and great to be near so many attractions and cafes / bars.
Nice. Very easy to find it and worth it. Go and visit if you are in Prague don't miss this sightseeing !!!!

Too see. Full of hystory makes you feel in another time!
You should visit the tower from inside and do a guided tour of the old city council very nice!!
So much to see. The Old Town and Square is packed with interesting shops, bars and buildings so you will never be bored.
Intresting walk. It was quite different walking in the old city. It has different historic building with story attached to it. Day time it is very crowded, but that will not stop you roaming around.
Interesting. A must! Lots of walking to see around the Old Town. Very historical and lots to learn. Lots of lovely places to eat and drink.

1st trip to Prague . Beautiful cannot describe this city. The architecture is so amazing. The allie ways. Don't need to hop on and off buses go with the flow take your map and information book and go. I planned to have tour guide but so much more fun on your own. Enjoy prague so magical.

Gorgeous city!. I can't recommend Prague enough.We visited in the summer and it is now one of my all-time favourite cities. The architecture is jaw-dropping, the people are friendly and the beer is ice cold and dirt cheap. Spend your day wandering aimlessly through the Old Town - there's a gorgeous new surprise around every corner. Hire a paddle boat on the river! The central "tourist" area has become pricier in recent years, but head a block or two out of town for €3 pizzas and €1 beer.Prague is an incredibly good destination if you are vegan or vegetarian - there are so many vege-friendly restaurants!
A MUST!!. The astronomic watch something to see, plus all walking tours start there, a lot of history in this neighborhood
Who can resist this beautiful town?. The old town is as you would expect. It is old. It is bohemian. Just be prepared for a huge amount of people traffic. Early morning is best!
Beautiful historic place. Old town holds the history of prague and would recommend going there to see the old town hall, the astrological clock and well the list goes on and on. Definate must

Beautiful!. Straight out of a fairy tale, the atmosphere is great, the architecture is outstanding, it is even fun if you only want to stand and marvel at the crowd! Fun for young kids too since they can run around and eat from the stalls/cafes.

Beautiful city. Wonderful, especially over New Year with all the markets and historical things to see. We were there for 4 days and didn't need public transport as everything is within walking distance

A beautiful city. We really enjoyed the old town. It was fantastic for walking around and looking at the old buildings. In October there are hot wine sellers everywhere and this adds to the excitement. Don't miss the clock (it's not long but good). For garnets maybe wait till you are closer to the castle. There are one or two nice places on the way up there. A wee bit cheaper, good quality.

walking in Old time squaer. Prague is magical in the winter, very moody and charming. Old streets with small little pubs everywhere. I live in US and Canada. I was born here but I come here at least ones a year and it is always special.
wow. we had e great time the entertainers were realy good music every where so much to see the churcher ,oldest clock tower shops try there food yummy and hot wine
Plenty of life here - restaurants, towers, entertainment. Ideal spot to have a coffee and watch the world go by. Street entertainers, weddings, clock tower and churches
nice and busy. Very busy square - day and night. Great experience and lovely to sit and watch Prague go by. Hundreds of restaurants and tiny shops abound by the place.
The Centre of Prague. If you come to prague there is noway that you are not going to this amazing square...must visit in prague

Great Architecture. The buildings in this area are a sight in themselves and it is well worth a visit here just to see them The astronomical clock and town hall is in this area which is a must see - look at reviewThere are also plenty of restaurants here to stop for a bit to eat which is ideal - just so many to choose fromWenceslas square (see review) is not far from the town hall square but the signs can be rather misleading and is something that they need to improve uponThere is a hub of activity around the area with the various shops as well so just go and immerse yourself in it

Awesome architecture. We visited recently for the Christmas Markets and we were captivated by the architecture and the history of the area. A must see is the Astronomical clock where a huge crowd gathers on the hour for the show where the characters come to life. We did a walking tour which took in this attraction also and it was good to hear the explanation of what we are looking at. We also did a horse and cart ride through the town, it was an experience in the cold but well worth it.
a must visit. the heart of prague and the attention of all the tourists. i enjoyed the place and the cafes there..the churches and the allies are amazing
Old town Prague . The old town has been retained in its original form with very little changes to its architecture and overall structure. Great food available.
Where everything is. Get the hot wine and enjoy.. Astronomical Clock, church, music, all the cool stuff. Great food in the center. You have to walk through here everyday.
A beautiful city and beautiful people. Had the most wonderful time in this beautiful city I hired a mobility scooter which made the impossible possible for me everyone was so helpful a fabulous city.
Lovely. Bring your camera and climb up the tower to see the best view of the city, and try and get a concert, great value

Amazing. All visitors to Prague should make this their first stop. Just to stand in the square and to take in the architecture from all the wonderful buildings. Visit at night too to see it all lit up.
Beautiful area of the city! fantastic sights. this is a fantastic area of prague, perfect for picture taking and lots of nice shops and restaurants around the area.

Prague is amazing. What can you say about this city? It has its old world charm while still having modern amenities. It's easy and relaxing to walk around, the restaurants are everywhere - not cheap but good value and huge portions, and the restauranteurs are welcoming. Not speaking the language wasn't an issue here. There were plenty of classical concerts happening when we visited, although we didn't manage to check them out. The view from the castle was stunning. I would return here again and again.

very busy. I travelled alone to here and found sitting having a few beers watching the world go by a pleasure and not daunting at all. They had seating outside which was good - did a lot of people watching

Must visit. Many small streets with shops, restaurants and caffee´s. Usually very busy. Get a coffee or a meal and ejoy it. Be careful with all the people who try to sell you something/pick your pockets though!

Olde Europe. No trip to Prague is complete without a stop in the Old Town!
Fabulous people watching.
Phenomenal architecture
Amazing character

Nice!. Gets fairly busy during daytime. Make sure to bring water, as it can get really hot in summer (we where there in may and it was 27c). The view from the church towers are great! you can see the whole city from there! if you are a student, bring your student ID, as you get a nice discount!

The Heart and Soul of Prague. Beautiful place. Has a great buzz and feel. The Segway companies have become a bit annoying, but that doesn't take away from the beauty of the buildings, the cafes and the astronomical clock.

"Overseeing Prague". By walking up many steps of the astronomical clock, you are able to see basically the whole city. Prague old town includes many great restaurants and cafes. During Christmas, visitors can also enjoy a Chirstmas Market.

Fantastic. The old city was very beautiful
We walked there 4 to 5 hours and enjoyed watching the old building and we were listening to the music from the street musicians.
wonderful amazing great view. You're in Czech republic, you MUST get into the clock tower and go up to see this beautiful scenic of this city.

Words can hardly describe.... The Old Town was absolutely amazing! Prague's Old Town received very little damage during WWII, so you will really be walking back into time. The architecture, stores, restaurants, cafes, and museums nearly overwhelmed us. We only had an afternoon to spend, but we made our way all around the square and enjoyed every minute of it. From live entertainment in the main square, to an excursion to the bridge, it is a must see if you are anywhere near Prague.

Breath taking. The old town is beautiful and the buildings are something that must be seen. Disappointed I didn't get to capture the apostles appearing and the struck of the hour so make sure you don't miss this every hour
Great. Nothing like Prague Old town! You can spend half a day and up to 2 days exploring this area of town, a must see!
Travelling . Nice and clean place.I really recommend to see it.you can really experience the atmosphere of town and see lots of historical buildings etc.

Amazing. I've been all over Europe and can say that it is one of my favourite cities ever! The Old Town is really cozy and has it's special medieval vibe, just great for walking and breathing in the atmosphere! Very picturesque and is highly recommended!
old world interesting. Very old area, dating from 1400+ many beautiful buildings to consider. Good bus and tram links to the area.

Amazing. All the area is fantastic, the atmosphere is romantic and so chilling, the buildings, the history, the people and maybe even the 2degC weather made this a lovely area. We were lucky to have beautiful music from the street musicians to add to the atmosphere.

Christmas markets, magical lighting - totally wow. I was lucky enough to visit when the Christmas markets were in full flight. The real magic was the night lighting of the surrounding buildings and church. It was crazy busy with people and this was difficult however when we visited later in the evening (like 9pm) it was absolutely fabulous. Everywhere was a visual delight and a wow.
Fantastic. Prague's Old Town has been on my list of "must do" places for several years. It did not disappoint, a beautiful, charming place to visit.

slow down and relax.. arrive with empty pockets, chill out. just look around you. Then, take a 10 min stroll and have a beer, or maybe two because it's lovely, and cheap approx €1.50. great music and Segway tours of that's what you fancy.
Fantastic. One of the most amazing old towns I have ever been. The architecture absolutely beautiful:bridges, cathedrals, squares, towers and buildings are fascinating.

Fairy Tale Town!. Old Town Prague is the quintessential "Fairy Tale" town, full of history and great to start your adventure. Take your time to stay in the Old Town for a while, let's say at least two three hours before moving to the other attractions, there are performers, history buildings, museums, the famous clock , cafes, restaurants and souvenir shops. During my visit, I took the Hop On Hop Off red bus for two days and they start the tour in the Old Town square and walk the old town explaining to you part of the Czech history, then, outside the Old Town you take the bus and proceed with the tour.

Great Place, not as cheap as you think tho!. Prague, great place, very chilly at this time of year! lots to see and do, plenty of nice resturants and bars, but didn't find it too cheap, so don't expect because its eastern Europe to be cheap. Nice to see

Charming cobblestones streets, eye catching art nouveau.. Although like many old town areas in Europe it is oriented to the tourist, in both positive and negative ways, the streets are lively, and the art nouveau architecture eye-popping. Restos in the area generally higher priced and very much oriented to the vacation traffic, go outside this area for more reasonably priced dining options. One, less desirable feature, in common with tourist areas in cities like Rome are the touts in front of select restos trying to sell you on dinner in their establishments--Prague has thankfully far less of this then say Rome but they are a distraction when wandering about...

Beautiful if not so busy. During my last visit of Prague last summer , I visited the entire city on foot. Overall a stunning city but the tourist masses are enormous. I don't think there is really a low season so I guess you just have to put up with it !
crowded but worthy. we were there during christmas. nice christmas market but perhaps way too many people.the astronomical clock was the most fascinating for me.
