A must seen . The old town is one of the best spot of Prague. The area is warm, despite the cold weather, it is a beautiful location. I've been there on New Year, as you can Christmas decorations is great.The old town is good to visit during the day & the night as well. You will be having 2 different experiences
History. Praque is one of the nicest cities in the world. Visit the kafka museum and a have a real budweiser on one of the pubs on the roofs is superb.

Beautiful Town Square. The Old Town in Prague is amazingly old and rich. It evokes history, architecture, and art in just a square! Lot's of little shops, cafes, and bars to enjoy. Take your time and explore!
great walking city. The old town of Prague is charming as are the shops, restaurants, river boat tours and street vendors.

Traveling on Time!. Beautiful walk through this segment of the city, a must, you can enjoy traditional architecture, combined with new modern building being upgraded due to natural evolution of businesses, you can breath the city customs as well a lot of shopping and Czech republic expertise glass craftsman.

Meeting Place. Great restaurants with lots of shopping and tourist attractions like Gastronomical clock and war memorial. Lots of bars and cafes with outdoor seating . Very busy but enjoyable. You can spend all day there and walk to see everything you desire. Then take a break for a nice lunch at many local eating places at various price ranges.
A Trip to the Past. There is no way one can leave Prague without visiting this area, which is rich in history and cultural beauties, associated with plenty of shops , restaurants and cafés.

Stunning!. No trip to Prague is complete without s stroll around the old town. Bask in the architecture - have lunch - take a drink in one of the many bars nearby. Be sure to be there in the hour to listen to the astronomical clock! Beautiful place!

Old Town. Prague is such a mix of the old and new. I just loved the old historic buildings and the cobble stone streets. The streets do become very narrow in parts but that's what makes the old town of Prague.
Beautiful. We were here for Christmas so it was really beautiful with all the decorations and the Christmas market. It's such an old, gothic yet lovely feel to it. Gorgeous at night!
Plenty to see and listen to in Old Town. Sat in any one of the many reasonably priced restaurants or bars in Old Town Square people watching, what a great pastime.
A beautiful and happy place. It was fun to wander through the pedestrian mall with all the small shops. Great walk for children. Beautiful sights. Many little attractions in the shops.
A must visit. This is their main attraction.. Sometimes can be very crowded. Be there earlier, to take picture with less people. But please be here at least once when you are in Prague.

Center of Activity in Prague. A lot to see and do. Various shops, restaurants, tourist attractions, and coffeehouses/bars. The astronomical clock in old town was my favorite sight in Prague. The restaurants around town square are a bit touristy and a lot of the shops are just souvenirs, but still an excellent part of town to spend your time.

Beautifull old town centre. A really old authentic city centre, lots to see, lots to do and very alive even during the late hours.
You can wander around for hours

with Christmas stalls. Busy busy with thousands of fellow travellers but no sign of crime and nothing detracts from the beautiful experience. Keep looking UP!
The Christmas stalls and huge Christmas tree added magic!
Stunning. Old town is simply stunning....gorgeous architecture and true charm...have been here many times....gorgeous at night and much nicer off season.....a must visit when in Europe

Beautiful square. Lovely Square with fantastic architecture and the clock is well worth seeing. The Christmas tree and lights were still up during our visit (4-7 Jan 2016) which really made the holiday for us, especially as it snowed too! A lovely city.

Beautiful in WInter. My Wife and I were in Prague for our honeymoon and we were blessed to have our visit during a very snowy week. One of the benefits of this was that the Old Square was even more beautiful than usual (I'd visited Prague before, during the summer). Between the Astronomical Clock, the Winter Market Stalls and the Food Venders, the Square was magical covered in snow.
charming .... i loved everything in this city ,and especially the old town , soo perfect..the only bad point is :the people from prague are not so nice either helpfull with tourists
A neat little town center. In the winter, there's a really cool Christmas market here! Try the hot honey wine at one of the stands to keep warm!

Absolutely amazing!. Any visit to Prague must include a visit to the Old Town Square. We visited in early January and the whole area was very festive with a beautiful Christmas Tree and Christmas Market stalls. There is easy access to the Astronomical Clock, Town Hall tower and Cathedral. There is a real 'buzz' in the square which is surrounded by street cafes, restaurant and bars. It is well worth visiting the square at night because there is a wonderful atmosphere. An absolute 'must'!
super. amazing square you have to visit it is very very nice I highly recommend it.There is only one word to describe our visit at the place . - Amazing!I
Great. After 1h of taking photos, we just stopped, cause every building is worth a pic. One of the most beautiful Old Town in the world.
Fascinating old city. Step back in time when you visit this charming old town. It is full of narrow cobbled streets, quaint bars and restaurants, querky shops and much much more; A fascinating town!

Xmas in Old Town. Old Town Square was beautiful at Xmas with all the markets, fairy lights and the amazing Xmas tree. There was also entertainment on at certain times. The astronomical clock is here and is a very popular sight. It was the amazing gothic church that attracted me the most though. It is a spectacular piece of architecture and looks incredibly atmospheric at night when lit up from the outside and in.
Festive Christmas market. During Christmas time, the square is filled with little wooden huts selling different products from crafts to sausages. The atmosphere was warm and festive.

Beautiful. One of the best cities I've visited in Europe. The town square is beautiful, but I just have to comment on the Czech people. Every last one of them has been great. But back to the square, very beautiful.
Fantastic Prague. Great city. Do the bus tour. River tour. Underground metro efficient clean cheap. Visit 3violin restaurant but book first. Crystal fab
Great winter markets. We visited between Christmas and New Years and the city had an incredible vibe. The markets have a selection of Czech food, the Chimney cakes are a must too.
Lovely View. Visit the monument, allows to see the panorama of Prague is beautiful, the architecture of this city is breathtaking.

Can't miss it!. A walk in the old town (pretty much the whole town), is something that everyone should do when in Prague. Despite the perfect means of transportation, try to walk as much as it gets, cause the old town is filled with every kind of things, from great buildings with amazing architecture to small caffees where you can have a hot chocolate.

a must visit place in Prague. You should start your exploring Prague from the Old Town. It is beautiful and looks untouched during the thousand-year history. You can simply get lost here, becouse streets are narrow and generally have no logic. Be carefull with restaurants in the Old Town, specifically those on big squares - they can be overpriced.

Nice decorations during Christmas . I was there with my wife during Christmas. It was nicely decorated with a huge Christmas tree with lot of lightings. There are lot of shops around making it a nice place for couples to walk and must see in Prague :)

Gorgeous. The Old Town is so nice to just walk around at. So many shops and little things to do around here. Great restaurants, souvenir shops, and local foods. Around December and early January you'll find Christmas Markets too!!

Steeped in history with the unmissable Astro clock. Good things to do on old town square:People watchDrinking a coffeeVisit the Xmas stalls in seasonWatch the Astro clock on the hour showWatch street performers

Beautiful at Christmas!. Wandering around the Old Town is one of the highlights of visiting Prague. We went just after Christmas and the central square is beautiful with Christmas markets. There are plenty of things to look at - though beware of the tacky souvenirs.
Great!. Great views all around, nice to visit when in Prague. Easy to find and withing walking distance from city center.

Focal point plus location of The Church of Our Lady before Tyn. The Old town Square provides a focal point to explore outwards to other attractions, including restaurants and theatres. For me however the main attraction is at night when the two gothic towers of The Church of Our Lady before Tyn dominate the skyline. Easily my favourite sight in Prague and the one with which I associate Prague and Bohemia.

Something you just can't miss. There's not much to talk about Prague without the Old town. It's the center of the old town areas and attractions, so you won't miss it for sure as long as you are strolling around the old town area. Unlike other old town squares in Europe, the one in Prague is the most exciting one was well as one of the most crowded one, so be prepared!
Nice old town. Nice quite small old town to walk around in. While visiting there was a christmas market which was ok, not really anything special though.
Just wander.. Great place for just wandering around and getting lost, great little restaurants and cafe's to quench your thirst and hunger, don't have an agenda, just go for it.

Very beautiful place to visit. Visited here on Halloween 2015. Weather was very sunny, bit chilly. Lots of lovely restaurants, can't beat the Hard Rock Cafe, very tasty. Buildings are pretty and lots of beautiful churches to visit. Bus stops can be quite confusing, but if you like walking, then walk lol. Very busy tram lines, which you need to be careful when crossing. Lots of charm to Prague. Great for a city break

Fabulous history, go visit early in the morning. We were in Prague from Christmas Day until Dec 29th - the crowds at the square were pretty big during the day/night, but in the early morning the square was just about empty. That's the time to go. It was so cool to a) take photos with almost no one around and b) watch the light start to hit the cathedral towers. The X-mas markets were nice, but a bit too tourist focused for our tastes. The restaurants around the square were also clearly focused on the tourist trade, so again, not to our tastes. The main attraction of the square are the sites surrounding it, not the square itself.

Nice place to be. The Old Town of Prague has got amazing architecture including the Gothic Tyn Cathedral, the Rococo Kinsky Palace and the Baroque St. Nicholas Church which you can admire when eating alfresco.

beautiful square to wander round. The old town is a great place to wander around. There are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants and wonderful buildings to look at. It can get busy so an early morning trip is a good idea

Cozy place to stay most of the time. I've been there in the Xmas and it was a cozy and exciting place to stay in for many hours during day and night. It has lots of xmas markets full of goodies, and a huge tree full of colors. It's the beating heart of the city. Must see.

wow so many tourists. i have never seen so many tourists in one place.
do thisonce then get outinto the real republic.charles bridge
Beautiful at christmas. Lovely to wander around. Beautiful Xmas tree and markets. Just stunning. Can get rather busy when the clocks about to strike but that's only to be expected!

Charming old town!. I have travelled Europe extensively and had kind of given up on coming across something new or better than what I had seen before! But the old town really surprised me with the energy.. Even at the height of winter, full of people, tourists & locals, making the place very lively. Local artists performing in the middle of the town square add a unique fairy like charm to the setting. Beautifully kept old buildings all around lend a magical touch to the place.. A definite must visit! Do walk up to the Old tower.. A fantastic view of the city awaits!

It's like going back in time. This is definitely one of my favorite cities and this area especially. It is literally like going back to medieval times. I didn't stay out all night but it looks like it can get pretty crazy.

Gorgeous. If you can...go in Christmas- The plaza was decorated nicely with a big Christmas tree and the market- Although it was really crowed it was not annoying. On the back you will see Tyn's church with the two beautiful towers (they look like the Disney towers) and in the middle of the plaza you can see the astonishing astronomic watch. It really does not matter where you look, everything is beautiful and extremely well preserved. Each building is from a different color (pastel colors)- Just gorgeous!

Lovely city. Old town is lovely place with a lot of small streets and coquete stores. here and there you can find small caffees hiden in secret gardens. Breing on the streets I felt like living in one of Kafka's stories :)

Charming. Jednou bych chtela byt turista, abych mohla udelat dlouhe wooow, kdybych Prahu videla poprve. Once I want to be a turist who sees this view for the first time. ANd I would like to do woooooow as they do.

Amazing historic centre. With the beautiful buildings that oscillate from new-modern to historic, a walk in the heart of this city is always advised. Many attractions inside the old town are breathtaking, with also a magnificent panoramic view from the tower of the astronomic clock. Definitely advised, and if you are staying for a couple of days consider to buy the Prague card: offers a lot of entry for free to the main museums and places across town, as well as a 2 hour bus tour that was very well done.

Heart of Prague. The beautiful heart of Prague that houses the unique astrological clock and Tyn Church (which resembles a bit of a darkish fairy tale castle!). Highly recommended to spend time here wandering around.

A must see, but oy, the people!. To really see and enjoy cities like Prague, you must take in their older sections. That said, every single visitor to Prague has exactly the same idea and does it at exactly the same time. Narrow streets, really old buildings, great restaurants, uniquely Czech culture, and the sense of being in such a historic place awaits you, but be prepared to see the sights with thousands of your closest friends.
Old town Prague . Beautiful and full of culture . Lots of history and full of b ars restaurants bars and shops will definitely visit again in the futre☺
Too commercialized. Full of tourists and similar souvenir shops, and restaurant people asking passengers to come, which is quite annoying if you just want a relaxed walk.

takes you to another place. The Old Town really is something coming out of a fairy tale. The fact that it was snowing peacefully really helped set the atmosphere, as we wandered around the cobbled streets, taking pictures of all the buildings. It is unbelievable how everything can be so well preserved. Take care, though. As almost all the streets are cobbled, they tend to get quite slippery when snow sets on them, so make sure you have adequate shoes, such as boots, or rain boots. I suggest to not wear trainers or especially high heels. After I bought a better pair of boots, everything was perfect and I could enjoy Prague without slipping every five seconds. Well worth thinking about it in advance!

Charm has been surrendered to hordes of tourists and tacky souvenir shops. I remember the old city with fond memories. A charming and beautiful area where you could get lost in the side streets, while away hours at a cafe, and find locally made products in small shops. Now Old City has been over run by tour groups en masse, congesting the streets, and all of the shops are either chains or selling tacky souvenirs. It is a shame that the city has not controlled this and surrendered the charming old city into something akin to NYC Times Square.
Charming. This square has a lot of charm to it. I really liked that even though it's the main spot of the city it is not overcommercial. Clean and beautiful

Disneyland was modelled on this surely!. What an incredible town. Every street cobbled. Every building old and in good condition. Every retailer modern and yet charming. The whole place is just something to be seen for your own eyes.The history here will spin you for ever and change you.On the minus side, don't change your euros or dollars for CHK here - expect rip offs. Pay by card. Remember, this is tourist central so prices are accordingly rated to this.I recommend you check out ally ways and roof top gardens / restaurants. Pay the money - you can't get this at home!

Fantastic Guide for Jewish Prague!. My mother and I chose Anna Kristyna Sion to show us around the Jewish area of Prague. Her knowledge of the history of the Jews dating back centuries is amazing and we both learnt so much as well as enjoying the many visits to the synagogues, cemeteries and museums with Anna explaining everything along the way. We never had to worry about admission costs either as all included. I highly recommend Anna, you will not be disappointed.

Fun Christmas market. We visited in early December when the Christmas markets were up. Lots of flavors to try! At night there was music. The Christmas tree was beautiful. It is a great setting for the market with the old City Hall with its clock tower on one end and Tyn Church at the other end. The Jan Hus statue is more difficult to see with all the stalls around, but it is still visible.
As an old town square should be. Beautiful old town square,as is Prague in general!! You must have been here once in your life!The town just breathes history!!

Pleasant square with plenty to see.. If you're visiting Prague, you can't really miss the Old Town. The atmosphere is pleasant as is the architecture of the buildings located on the square. The astronomical clock is worth going up with great views all around and whilst we didn't visit the church, it really is a beautiful building from the outside (which is unfortunately obscured by other buildings). Plenty of good spots to take photos from all around.
Loved narrow streets and hidden cratf shops. In addition to all touristic places, just turn to passages and use other routes, you'll find much more intriguing things and unique craft shops.
Christmas Markets. Fantastic atmosphere in the Old Town Square during the markets..... don't forget to stand a while in front of the Astronomical Clock and capture the magic...

History and beauty!!. One of the most lovely squares in Europe. Definitely a must-see for any one visiting Prague. The architecture and colors are beautiful. And it's so full of history! It is touristy, but you can see why! That's no reason to stay away.

relaxing in winter time. We spend a wonderful in Prague in February. Old Town was half empty. Very relaxing walkings. No crowds in museums, monuments and in restaurants. Many stands with warm wine if you cold. And warm and friendly people around. Also prices of the hotels are much cheaper than in the high season. We recommend to go there in winter.

Focal point of Prague. The old town square in Prague is the centre of the city and a lovely place to explore. There are lots of bars and restaurants around the square most of which have outside seating areas (heated in Winter). There are a number of attractions around the square including many churches and historical buildings.

A must See. The square is great during the holiday season It is well lit with the local holiday market and local food and great music we traveled during new years weekend and had a great time. Visit early in the day and at night for the best pictures.
Fabulous at Christmas. A must visit during the festive season. Christmas tree, stalls, smoke roasted hams and the astronomical clock. Great friendly atmosphere day and night.
Magestic views. So much to see if you are into architecture. Take a trip up to the tower near the bridge and see the city skyline.

Vibrant City Centre. Despite the obvious tourist visitation, the Old Town maintains a charm and ambience second to none! Praque is a classic beauty, and the people are humble and kind. Don't leave it off your bucket list!

Christmas Cheer. My visit to Old Town made me feel like I was in a different time period and I loved it! Visiting between Christmas and New Years the square comes alive with Christmas markets, music and cheer. Rows of shops fill the square and good, cheap food and drinks are easy to find anywhere in the square. Even if you want to get out of the cold there are lots of restaurants surrounding the square. I loved being here during the holidays!

Magnificent night view of Chrstmas markets. My wife and I stayed in a hotel, near the Powder Gate, and close to the historic Old Town Square. We loved the Astronomical Clock, Tyn and Hussite churches. It was often a challenge to walk through through this extremely popular and busy place because of the number of people milling around. The most amazing view for us, was at night, after ascending the astronomical clock tower and looking down on the Christmas markets and across to the Tyn church. Unforgettable.
Lovely city. Lovely city with beautiful small streets, little coffee places ,a lot of history ,good restaurants to eat!
Beautiful Sq. Beautiful old town , so much to see, lots of market stalls and places to eat....Lots of smells and sounds..

Graphic town hall. It is a graphic townhall that offers a scenic view of the old town of Prague from the top of the tower. If you want to go there and have more space and time to watch the view, try the late evening hours.
Nice old town. Basically the centre of Prague - you won't miss it! Definately worthwhile going over Christmas time as the whole square is set up with an enormous Tree/Lights and Markets

Perfectly preserved. Prague is beautiful any time of the year, but Old Town Square is best during the Chritmas Market season. Buy hot wine from vendors and walk around enjoying the stalls of craft vendors.
Beautiful. Worth visiting - beautiful area with a lot of history. Easy to walk around and a lot to see. Wear comfortable shoes - the streets are all cobblestone.
Try early morning. By getting there around sunrise, with the birds chirping, you really do get that eerie medieval sense. It's a charming, and architectually amazing town centre
Beautiful. Just breathtaking! I've been to Prague twice and I'll be back again, it's the most beautiful city in the world.
Nice !. Highly touristic spot, full of souvenirs boutiques and other stuff. Worth the visit. Avoid buying there. Try the lateral small streets.
Great to walk around and spend New Year's Eve. The Old Town has many shops, also friendly restaurants and christmas markets. Never felt afraid, the architecture of the city is beautiful.

I absolutely love Old Town Square. This has to be one of the most beautiful squares with stunning architecture and lots to see. At Christmas they have a big market with fantastic Christmas Tree and a stage with all kinds of entertainment. At other times just be amazed by all the different building facades.

Continues to thrill. The old town is one of the most untouched in Central Europe and takes in the brilliance of 18th Century architecture which is of the same style as Southern Germany, Switzerland and Norther Italy (which migt account for the large numbers of Italian visitors you encounter with their selfie sticks bobbing about).The usual hotspots are always busy, so take your time, soak in the atmosphere and try not to get too distracted by the all toomany dinky tourist trinket shops, which is really the only downside to this remarkable tourist mecca.

Great at Christmas. The square at Christmas is a delight. Massive Christmas tree, market stalls, mulled wine and all manner of snack foods. Don't go until after dark, about 17:00 at that time of the year as when everything is lit up it makes this a very special experience. The people of Prague are very helpful and friendly, so you will enjoy looking around something like 100 stalls, and don't miss the mulled wine. Prague is not expensive, so you will get good value for money.
Amazingly beautiful in the Holiday Season!. Really beautiful during the holiday season, everything clean and all the sights highlighted. But so many people here...

taste of EU. I would say Old Town in different cities of europe (Krakow, Warsaw, Torun, Prague, etc) would be similar. Despite that, it has its own feel to it. They have their own unique architectural/historical structures which always make it beautiful. Prague is one of the beautiful cities I've been to
Beautiful area.. Lovely place to see, plenty of gift shops restaurants, cafes and bars as well as the beautiful architecture.
Worth the visit. Great place to visit and take in the famed astronomical clock and the magnificent church spires/ rooftop

Bustling streets with great architecture everywhere. When walking around old town, be prepared that it is busy but it has a good vibe. You can easily walk from place to place and there are good signs to guide you
There are so many lovely sections of Prague...this is just one.. The restaurants around the old town are expensive...and crowded. Get off to some of the side streets.
Must do. One of the more common parts of Prague to visit. Great pictures. Have to see the clock. During christmas time the markets are up and the hot wine is available. GO go go go! :)
Amazing place. One of the best square in Europe, very well kept. In the middle there is an intriguing clock, that I still have to understand the way it works

Christmas market is so exceptionally beautiful. This is where all the tourists come running to ! Besides the remarkable history of the place and buildings surrounding it, most of meeting points for free tours, and all types of activities are. Try to be in front of the famous clock 10 min before a full hour to see the show everyone talks about, its kinda cool. A very nice place to start or finish your visit to Prague.
Very very beautiful!. It is very nice to stroll around the streets. We went in December and the main square with all the huts selling stuff were very charming!

Mrs. The old town square is a must see for visitors to Prague.. It has so much history you can feel it.. There a plenty of shops beside it & the restaraunts are all delishous & reasonably priced... Its located right in the middle of all the attractions so wherever you are , your always a 5 mnt walk away..
New years eve is a blast. Crowded in high season, choose off season for a more intimate experience. New years eve is a blast. Lots of fireworks that seems to go on for ever. Did I mention crowded!

Gorgeous! . Without question old town Prague I'd one if the most picturesque places we have ever visited. It looks like a fairytale. Gorgeous buildings, ions of cute shops and great food.We were there over new years so the Christmas Market was still set up. I would like us see it without everything set up. We did find the city was fill of rowdy young people but that a could of course be because it was the holidays. If you can get a hotel downtown you will not regret it.

Enchanting - especially during the Christmas season. We loved walking around the Old Town Square. Every building was enchanting. We felt as if we were walking around in a fairy tale. There were restaurants (that offered both indoor and outdoor seating) and several shops surrounding the square. The views from the clock tower were incredible. We especially loved our visit during the Christmas season because of the dazzling lights and the beautiful grand Christmas tree.
Extraordinarily busy!. Hold on to your children and keep checking your pockets. Whilst this place is beautiful, you will be sharing it with 1000's of others.
Great eastern European city with great food and sites. The clock tower, the castle, the tours, and gift shops are a must see when you go to Czech Republic!

Old Town trip. The town is very neat and clean and people are friendly and helpful, and very cheerful.
Public transport is easily accessible.
Beautiful and large. Intresting bildings, many place to visit, i like this place, I want to visit it one more time. Autumn was wonderfull and yellow

Lovely at Christmas. Only seen this square and christmas time but it was magical. All the market stalls, christmas trees and lights had a lovely theme to it. Lots of history here also with the Astrinoical Clock in the square also. It is surround by cafes/bars/restaurants so always nice to sit and people watch.

A must-see gorgeous old European area. This area was just absolutely gorgeous to walk through! There were many cute shops, the architecture was just stunning, and there were several tours offered in this area to learn about the history, or just walk through to feel like you're back in time. I toured the Astronomical clock and it was amazing to see from the inside. I highly recommend this. I traveled in Nov 2014 and the Xmas market had just been put up in this area so it was stunning, like a postcard.

Prague. Nice place. I visited it last year , some three year ago and five year ago. Also have lot of bussiness trips in to this town. My opiniun - every year flow of tourists increasing and because of this is difficult to feel this place. This year with my family we visited this city and stay in it for three days and still left feelings that we dont see all what we want to see, this is because big traffics of tourists everywhere. My recommendation visit Prague in not high time. Also during fev years price on food increased.

Amazing to see such and old city with various building styles within the square. The oldest clock in the world, amazing story to it. do the free tour found 20 m from the square next to madam to sau on every hour from 11am to 3 pm daily. the square itself is big and had so much Christmas markets.

Rich in atmosphere. It's always very nice to be at the old town square no matter day with friends or night after party or even during the dawn! Old town square is stunning! You feel the elegant atmosphere and peacefulness of the middle age. Although I have to suggest guys not to buy the street food from the square, its all over priced and not that tasty at all!Enjoy your time in Prague!

lovely place. this is amazing place , very romantic with very old clocks close to the Parizska street luxury brands shops many nice restaurants with local cuisine , the most popular place after the Prague castle

Beautiful architecture, great ambience. We visited the Old Town Square on Jan 3rd. We were there around twilight and I'm tempted to say it was the best time to visit this area, as the setting sun was painting the historical surroundings in a wonderful glow. The Christmas tree was still up and beautifully illuminated. The Christmas market was also still up. There was a wonderful smell of cinnamon, sugar and Christmas punch wafting in the air. There was an open air opera-esque performance going on too !! Even though it was really freezing cold, we loved our evening out in old town square... Must see area in Prague.
Great Town. We had a short but very exciting time in Praha. The old town is especially nice to see in the dark time because the lights there are impressive.
The Old Town Square Doesn't Disappoint. Great place to see and be seen! Loved the Christmas markets. The food and the shopping were great fun. Wonderful over the holidays.
A fairy tale trip.. Most of the time you feel like you walking in the streets of medieval times. Congrats to city development and managers cause they kept the uniqueness perfect.
Like walking through a fairy-tale.... We had a wonderful time exploring the Old Town. Beautiful buildings, cobblestone streets, interesting shops...

Magical. We were visiting Prague just after New Years,and it was lovely. The Christmas Market was still up! Kiosks and a giant Christmas Tree.. Many many tourists still however. I was surprised at how many there were at this cold time of year.
Buzzing. The old town is buzzing with tourists having a great time. Go and try some of the sausages and hams roasting on outdoor grills, see the big clock and shop til you drop.

Tale of Prague!. Old Town of Prague is amazing !! There you can walk and get lost in the old streets for days, finding all new and new experiences! The city's architecture is gorgeous! City-tale dream city!The friendly people, delicious food, excellent beer, souvenirs and shops!All this will leave a good impression about the spent New Year's holidays in the Czech Republic!

Christmas Market on Square. As we visited during December, the square was the setting for a big Christmas Market, fun, lively and filled with traditional fare, hot wine and handmade Christmas decorations, artisan crafts and many more things. The square is very large and at the time of our visit quite filled with people. Majestic and magical like most of Prague, with wonderful glasshouse like cafes with gas heaters and blankets to observe the wonderful array of people sightseeing while drinking a nice coffee or wine. Definitely a must, plus you must pass it to access Astronomical Clock and 2 very nice churches.

OLD TOWN SQUARE - The hisorical center. One of the most beautiful part in Prague with many historical buildings and tourist atractions. Huge selection of restaurants as a local and international. Dont miss the Christmas or Easter Market!!!

An area that must be visited. Since my hotel accommodation was very close to the old center, I visited several times. As I visited during Christmas holidays, there were a number of Christmas Markets around, tempting one to buy and try all sorts of local articles and food. Definitely an unforgettable experience.

Fantastic buildings and more... Great part of Prague especially with the Christmas markets running.
Plenty of places to eat and fairly reasonably priced.

The perfect place to see the New Year in.. Our first trip to Prague and the Old Town Square at this time of year just took my breath away. Besides the beautiful architecture that surrounds the square, the festive additions of a huge Xmas tree fully illuminated and the Xmas market stalls made for a wonderful scene. Restaurants and cafes surround the square but the stalls provided substantial sausages, massive hams being spit roasted and mulled wine, mulled cider and czech beer to wash it down with. On News Years Eve we ate in one of the restaurants on the square and emerged just before midnight to find it snowing. In addition to the brilliant atmosphere and the fireworks, the snow finessed the event. Wonderful.
Beautiful town. A very scenic town with lots of shops around! Food and souvenirs ships are all just around the corner. During the winter time, the Christmas markets compliments the town.

beautiful old town. arrived on new years eve,the town looks amazing at night,christmas lights,markets,wonderful atmosphere,didnt have a booking in a restaurant,it didnt matter we just wondered around,got a bit to eat and stood in the square under the clock to see in the new year,awsome!didnt want to come home yesterday.
Quaint and Lovely. There are lots of unique and quaint little shops and restaurants, as well as old Cathedrals, and other historical sites to visit.

Magical Christmas. My spouse and I spent 10 days in Prague over Christmas. The Christmas markets, choirs, performers and magnificent historical monuments surrounding the Old Town made for a magical Christmas.

Jewish Quarter tour. I took a tour of the Jewish Quarter in Prague with Anna Kristyna Sion. She was excellent. Anna was incredibly knowledgeable about the Jewish quarter and was so friendly. I didn't want it to end. I highly recommend a tour with Anna.
A must if you visit Prague. A beautiful square with the buzz of a city and stunning buildings.The home of the Astronomical Clock.

Like a fairytail. So old and charming, don't miss the astronomical clock show that is happening every hour. Enter St. Nicolas and Tyn church, climb the astronomical tower for a great view of the square.
Romantic place. Old town of Prague is one of the most beautiful places of the world. Do not miss it while in Prague.

What is it about the old town that just doesn't do it for me?. The wire to stop the pigeons crapping on the statues or the tourists? The really AWFUL food at awful prices served in an industrial fashion at all the bars and cafes? The throngs wandering around aimless and the sure sign of twenty first century idiots - selfie sticks! In fairness it is impressive, but it just didn't do it for me. I wish it did as Prague is a nice city. Easily walked in a day (bar the cobblestones which hurt like hell at the end of the day). There was loads of activity in the Old Town but no life. Very few musicians or buskers (controlled?) It seemed exclusively the preserve of the tourists, and as such lacked any charm. Go, see and move on, quickly.

Center of Beautiful Prague. The Old Town Center Stare Mesto, is the place where you have to see, feel, smell and experience, before you plan to go anywhere else in Prague. You will meet almost all the tourists, see the beautiful doves hovering over you and all the churches in the area, lights at night on the beautiful buildings and the music players on the side walks...

Best smelling place in the world. This place is just amazing, if you're not just soaking in all the beautiful sights, and sweet smells of wine, cinnamon and wood you can grab a bite (Tredlo's, Sausages, Potatoes, Prague Ham.... just about anything really), down it with some mead and listen to some amazingly talented street performers that are always present here
Markets were buzzing. Great christmas markets. Also beside astronmical clock and some lovely food places around their also.
Beautiful!. The Old Town Sqaure is so beautiful with so many cute market stalls. It is very picturesque and definitely worth a visit!
For old times sake!. Prague and its rich history and architecture. This is one of my favorite places so far, for sure! :)
Fairytale buildings. A place buzzing with atmosphere, great restaurants and bars, fantastic architecture. The Christmas market was not very big and had mainly stalls selling food.
WONDERFUL CITY. We enjoyed staying in Prague, it was our first visitChristmas period was wonderfull, we also visited Kutra Hora which I can recommend
Full of culture. Everyone who wants know about Central European story must visit old town of Prague, deferents buildings stiles, deferents centuries and manny thing to discover.

Beautiful. One of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe.Enjoyed the Old town hall, the tower, the clock. Do take time to go up the tower but wait until later in the evening as many tourists tend to go earlier and long lines form.

What's special there! . Pretty happening place with lots of historical and old monoments. Everything is close (Charles bridge) clock tower, restaurants, tourist shop and local restaurants too.
I still feel it on a walking distance to jeweish head quarters which is a must to explore.
Living within the town will be ciotic so choose a place little far from the main touristic spots.
Amazing city. You will feel welcome, happy and amazed. It's amazing and it's the heart of Prague. You must walk around and see everything!

beautiful. from our hotel the old town was a short walk away. we went up the astronomical clock for a small fee and having a lift to get to the top was an added bonus! views from the clock were stunning. Restaurants around the old town in the centre quite expensive so do walk out of town a little to get a good deal. lots of bars, shops and restaurants. Christmas market also very good. loved it.

Fascinating. A really lovely square always filled with interesting street musicians and artists. You can catch a horse-drawn carriage ride through the city from here and many festivals are held in the square throughout the year. You can also find free walking tours leaving from the square every few hours all year round (look out for the guys in red t-shirts.) You want to avoid buying souvenirs in this area as the prices are ridiculous! Don't catch a random taxi from this area, & if you do, make sure they start the metre at the beginning of your ride or you may end up being cheated. The restaurants in this area are not very good, & the prices are pretty over-inflated.
Magical with the xmas lights. First visit to Prague, but magical for the xmas market. Watch your change from some of the street food sellers.Just magical

Perfect harmony. We spent 2 days in the Old Town and liked everything. These places' mood is not just good but gives a lot of positive experience. Try it to see the perfect harmony between old and current, history and modern.

Beautiful Christmas Markets. One if the highlights of Prague during the holidays is visiting The Old Town Christmas markets. Rated one of the best in Europe. Lots of great food, drink and decorations. Highly recommend visiting anytime of year, but especially during Christmas.

Stunning!. We were here for the New Year and the Christmas market was still on. What a beautiful setting! The buildings and architecture are breathtaking! Lots of shops and gift shops and just a short walk from some great bars. Beware of eating here as some of the restaurants are not as good as those on surrounding streets 'tourist traps'Would reccomend the 5 minute walk to the municipal house for great food in a wonderful setting
Awesome. The city center is perfect in december.A lot of shops and many possibilities to visit. We liked it.

Touristic but nice setting. I've been here on a number of occasions. During winter it is full with Christmas markets. There is a large statue in the middle and a number of old buildings around each side. Most of the stores and restaurants are touristy, but the old buildings make it worth a wander and good for a meeting point. Just beware of pick pockets.

Old Town (Stare Mesto). Prague has something for everyone and therefore is always busy. It is very old world in the old center. There are plenty of pubs and restaurants. I always take a walking tour with a guide round cities on the first day then I can see where to go at my leisure. I you like to take decent photos without tourists crowding you then get up at sunrise get a taxi to the castle quarter take your pics and walk down into the old town and there wont be many people around the old town comes alive about 0800hrPrague has a good metro bus and has a tram service so getting around is easy.
Lovely Christmas Market. Lovely food and some nice stalls to browse - although very crowded... The buildings are stunning all around the square and there are lots of tourist stops and sights nearby.

Speechless in the Old Town Square!. This is the absolute meeting point in Prague!There are some of the important sights as well such as the old town hall with the astronomical clock as well as Tynem Church. All the important sights are in walking distance between one another. If you start walking the Powder Tower you come by the Old Town Square and by here you can walk through narrow streets through Charles Bridge and then Mala Strana and Castle District!
Lovely - as expected. The old town is a must visit place as the architecture is stunning. Looks even better when lit in the evening. Truly magical.

Amazing city - so well preserved.. A great place just to explore on foot. Small enough to do in a day but could spend longer if you visit the attractions. Very relaxed city and you feel totally safe. Great fun. Lots of really good places to eat very cheaply. Three of us were eating well with wine for under £40. A bargain and good food.

Old Town During Christmas is the best!. So many things to eat!! Just watch the booths that weigh your food....they will pile it on and it will end up costing you more than you realize (they advertise a cheap price per 100 grams, but 100 grams is nothing). The clock is worth a visit, just to snap a few pictures. Tons of cute shops and restaurants. Super touristy, so if you want to eat/drink away from the crowds....go waaaaay outside the Old Town.

Beautiful Place! It's not Paris, but it's very cool. It's THE must see of Prague, you can learn from different times in history from architecture, and statues around, since they reflect very much of what happened during times.There are wonderful restaurants and pubs nearby! Very nice place!
New Years Eve. Lots of people and fire works, with a fun time to be had by all. Everything was open all night and the prices were comparable to any other city.

Prague New Years Eve Impressions. It is a pleasure to stroll through the old town centre, over the charles bridge toward the castle. There are numerous small Restaurants serving good traditional "Bohemian" food, especially catering for meat afficionados and offering good Czech beer. At the various town squares a cup uf mulled wine is a must, as well as tasting the famous "Trdlnik" (baked sweet dough with cinnamon) or a serving of smoked Prague Ham. On new years eve a reservation in a pub or restaurant is mandatory, otherwise you have to brave the cold to see the fireworks at the main Town square at midnight. Should you miss this fireworks for some unspecfiied reasons, there is another on 1st of January at 18:00h, best to be watched from "Stefanikuv Bridge"

Pretty even during winter time. We were there during Christmas season. They have Christmas market all over the old town area and of course the big Christmas tree. The decoration was beautiful and you can enjoy it better with some hot wine too. The area was crowded with tourists, but it's holiday season, so it's quite expected.

Impressive!. Emblematic square of Prague. Always packed with tourists, specially there to see the clock tower. Also there are street artists performing. Very close to other important sights in Prague.

Prague -a Magical Odl Town. Red roofs and spires, winding streets with the smell of mulled wine and roasting chestnuts! We spend the time between Christmas and new year wandering around this magical city!

Better than Paris. We visited Prague and Paris in the same summer vacation, but we all liked this old city better. First of all you find all the points of interest close to each other in walking distance. The old houses are better preserved, not spoiled by advertisement for high class fasion and perfumes. For a small fee you can visit one of the countless concerts of classical music. Lots of small restaurants offer great food and drinks for low prices. You can spend a whole afternoon on the old town square enjoying street artists and musicians.

Christmas market. Old town square is lovely ! If you're planning a trip to Prague, I suspect it's at the top of your itinerary. The clock, the churches, it's gorgeous day & night. We had the pleasure of visiting at Christmas - the tree & Christmas market were particularly nice. We loved the Trdlenik & Klobasta & of course, Czech beer! The clock is a must see as well ! Definitely worth visiting at holidays
Midieval Gem!. This area is quintessential Prague. Every street you walk is beautiful. The architecture is beautiful and the ambience is magical.

Fab. Christmas stalls where you can purchase food drinks beautiful presents etc.Huge Christmas tree beautifully decorated have a drink and something to eat in one of the many lovely restaurants and watch the world go by .Expect to pay more for drinks and food here though but atmosphere is great.
Amazing. What a wonderful, Historic, Beautiful place. You should go see it before the Russians come back and take it over again.

We love the Old Town!. We visited the Christmas Market and it was fabulous! We had trdlik which is a roasted dessert that is coated in cinnamon and sugar. We also saw the astronomical clock on the square. Highly recommended!
The tourist mile. Full of people, yes. Full of tourist, also yes. Beautiful, historic architecture, most definately yes. Five stars for the latter.
Absolute must. Simply beautiful, one of the most beautiful old towns I've ever seen. An absolute must when visiting Prague. Great for just walking around and enjoying the feeling.

Old Town Square at Xmas. THE place to go if visiting over the Xmas period. Great atmosphere , lovely Christmas market stalls , beautiful huge tree , surrounded by wonderful historic buildings. Looks sensational at night when all lit up. Cheap street food and mulled wine , a magical place to visit. Beware though , it can get very very busy !!

Loved the square. Lots to see ate at the restaurants despite reviews that say this can be expensive , I found them to be reasonable. Beware of the exchange bureau's in the centre of the square with the yellow frontage, they charge extortionate commissions-daylight robbery!.Look for the blue and white signage and 0 percent commission.Also beware of people approaching you as you leave.
Beautiful. I fell in love with this area of Prague. You can appreciate it at any age and be wandering around for hours.

Beautiful part of Prague. Whilst the square is busy it is simply beautiful and unique to Prague. The architecture is wonderful and different to anything I had seen before. Restaurants in the square are expensive so just walk a couple of minutes away for really cheap and fantastic restaurants. It is busy so keep an eye on your things, as long as you are aware you will be fine.

Lots of Churches. This place has a lot of very old and beautiful Churches. During Christmas there are fairs, selling food, hot wine and trdelnik (Czech round hollow bread with sugar on top of it). You definitely get the Christmas atmosphere. Try it all! :)
Just astonishing.. Go. Look around you. Look up. The square is more than just the astronomical clock. The architecture is magnificent. Go back at night. Not to be missed.

Cool and eclectic place. Old town is cool place to visit. Nice restaurants, bars and vendors and shops. It has an old world feel with some modern twists here and there. The astronomical clock is really overhyped in my opinion. It's cool to look at and take pics but it's not a must see.

Beautiful buildings, too commercial. I was shocked to discover just how commercial Christmas was at these markets in the Prague old town square. The buildings are incredible. The art and statues are amazing. There are some great shops around too, but there are a few that you can assume are tourist traps. I always get off and away from the square to eat, as you will pay far more the closer to the square you get. A great place to visit.
Beautiful architecture!. Beautiful houses! Really nice during Christmas with all the decorations. Way to many guys trying to get you to buy Segway tours from them, they will not leave you alone.

New Years Eve Snowy Splendor . The Old Town of Prague is without doubt beautiful. The crowds can be intense, especially in some of the narrow street around the main squares. We were there for New Years Eve and the Czech people live their fireworks. Enter and enjoy at your own risk. A lot of fun and I highly recommend a visit.
Weekend break. Our second visit to Prague. Loved it. So much to see and do. Lots a wonderful restaurants. My waistline took major strain! Will definitely be back
Very popular!. It gets very bussy, crowded, during the Christmas markets with plenty of options for the street food lovers.
Fairytale castle. When you see that castle you believe that comes directly from the fairytale. Very beautiful, very romantic. Hard to believe that exist in such good condition...

The place to visit in Prague. This is the main place to visit to see anatomical clock, a couple of impressive churches, climb the town hall tower and take in some fantastic architecture...I'm sure this is what Disney copies!

The earlier the better. Old town (which is not as old as the Mala Strana) is truly fantastic. A journey back in time to medieval days (with sufficient imagination to block the modern influences). Each building, each narrow and wider street, are so perfectly well conserved and maintained that this part of the city is historically charming. I suggest a) read about the history before getting there or take a tour, it is most interesting and revealing b) start very very very early and avoid the crowds. This city is so popular that it get heavily crowded after 11:00. All imaginable nations are amongst the visitors. Every corner is worth to visit.

Christmas market. Lovely square all lit up..real christmasy with all the views and smells..but dont just go for the market..what a big let down..ok if you just want pork or muled wine..no nice crafty stalls etc..was so let down and others said the same

Beautiful especially in the evening. Great architecture, a great array of restaurants and bars which is all complimented by the street performers, market stalls and hustle of tourists. we had the added bonus of the xmas market still being in place and the beautifully decorated and lit xmas trees. You cannot do Prague without going into the Old Town and square.
christmass market. plenty to see and do lots of stalls and the buildings are wonderful ,we were there for the christmas market ,and it was very nice worth seeing

Christmas Markets. Beautiful square in the heart of Prague. Plenty going on when we visited as the Christmas market was in the square. Walking through the square and you came to a street of designer shops which were lovely. The food also at the market was great and very cheap. In Wenceslas square at night time there were singers to entertain and they were very good. The Charles IV bridge was also worth a visit very picturesque.

Old Town Square - the epicenter of Prague. See the Astronomical Clock. Watch the stylish people walk by from a cafe. At Christmas buy hot chestnuts from one of the stalls, eat fresh sweet pastries, listed to live music. Fabulous atmosphere. Stay at Prague Stay who offer great apartments all nearby. We gave our apartment at 55 Zanecke, near the Jewish Cemetery 5 *.

Perfect at Christmas. Visited the square in December and it was the most magical place ever. Gorgeous Christmas tree and everywhere is just lit up with Christmas lights. Made me (the biggest Grinch of them all) really get into the Christmas spirit. I'd definitely recommend going up the astronomical clock tower in the evening to get a great view of the whole market and square in all its glory (can be busy though so take some patience up to the tower with you!). The market itself was busy but bearable and very dependent on the time you visited (we visited at all hours and found it was quietest just as it started to get dark).

Just beautiful. The square is just beautiful. We visited just after Christmas and were very impressed with the market stalls and the enormous Christmas tree. Each building around the square is something special, not least the astronomical clock.The crowds were as big as expected so make sure you visit more than once so as not to miss anything and to really be able to take it all in.
Christmas Markets!. We were at Old Town for the Christmas markets and had a great time, food was delicious, toured the tower for a great view of the city. Take time to visited the Cathedrals.

Magical Christmas Experience. Beautiful square in the heart of Prague, it was wearing its best Christmas regalia when we visited. Enormous tree, beautifully decorated, located next to the old church and clock, the square was our number one experience in Prague. Surrounded by shops and restaurants, the square was filled with a Christmas Market, selling every type of snack, drinks and trinkets. Very, Very busy. Loved it.
Picture perfect. Every corner you turn there are photo opportunities, beautiful buildings, cobbled streets, the markets at Christmas time just added to the old town atmosphere.

Lovely. Loved the old town. Plenty of character in all the old buildings. Lots of narrow streets to explore and get lost in as we did many times which adds to the fun. Great metro links that get you to the heart of the town. The Christmas markets that are here are so nice with food galore everything you can think of. Very safe to just wonder around day or night.

Beautiful place with beautiful buildings and lots to do !. We regularly frequented old town during our travels in Prague. It was absolutely beautiful with many old buildings and frequent Christmas Markets. Anyone in Prague simply has to visit the Old Town.
To view all of Prague. I suggest getting here early for it gets really crowded lunchtime. Maybe use the Segway yours for it is a good uphill to walk, depends how much trednik you already ate!
Xmas interest. The social centre thousand of people pass through but crowds not oppressive No drunks good food lots to see and do great Xmas market and high end shops just off square
Lovely little place. Such a great atmosphere. Lot's of little shops, street performers, bars, restaurants. Great to visit both during the day and at night. Enjoy!!!

Lovely Old Town. The Old Town is pleasant. It has a few places to eat and relax and during our visit in February it was reasonably busy. Typical Old Town architecture with lots going on with respect to stalls and street entertainers. If you can be there on the hour to witness the Astronomical clock. We saw it at 14:00 one Sunday and there was a great procession which preceded the clock striking the hour.
Disney scenery . The castle type building at one end, the towers all around, the markets in the middle. Just an exceptional square!

Must!. In Prague you can visit a lot of sights and great old streets. Many church's and castles invite you to travel in the past. Just a walk around the city is amazing. It was my second visit and I'm happy about it like the first time.
Extraordinary, beautiful place. Beutiful clock and the Church of Our Lady before Týn is amazing. We visited during Christmas and the market is just beautiful and tasty.
People Gathering Place. Nice place for people watching, shopping, eating or just walk around to see the very old and historical buildings.
Beautiful spot. Just walk around. Shops tend to be touristy but the views are spectacular and not to be missed. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in all of Europe.
Classic tourist site. It's good to walk around here...Lots and lots of souvenir shops... very expensive food and drinks... tourist trappy...
Wonderful - there is not more to add. Its wonderful. Highly suggest to get a hotel nearby. Came right before new years and had a wonderful time.

Beautiful Old Town delights at every turn. Old Town is an amazing rabbit warren of streets, each of which provides architectural wonders in every block. A beautifully manageable scale, most buildings under six or so stories, the stonework and sculptural embellishments are jaw-dropping. I think you cannot choose an uninteresting street to turn down; there's something interesting and marvelous to see at every height, from streetside eye-level to cornices and rooftops. I used to think Vienna and Paris were the architectural peak, but Old Town Prague has what they do in spades, without the crazy-busy traffic and endless overhead grid of wires spoiling every photo op. I'd go back in an instant, just to wander the streets and gape.
A great place. I was there in December and truly enjoyed all the stalls and the Christmas tree. Beautiful spot in Prague and I would love to see it again when its spring or summer.

Amazingly beautiful decorations for the Holiday Season!. A trip to Prague during the holidays would not be complete without visiting Old Town and taking in the sights and sounds. From the Astronomical Clock's hourly show and the gorgeous Christmas tree to the yummy offerings of the vendors in the Christmas markets you can't beat it. We loved every moment of it and would highly recommend a visit to anyone who asks!!!
Beautiful. We spent hours walking round today, the markets and little shops are great, the traditional food stalls are yummy and the buildings are beautiful, a def must visit

Beautiful, even nicer at Christmas time!. I was fortunate enough to have the beautiful old town at the doorstep of my stay in Prague. I stayed here during Christmas time so the old town was full of Christmas decorations and spirit. It's busy but a must see in Prague!
So much to see. There is so much packed into this small area. Recommend a free walking tour to see it well and get a sense of the history.

A very magical Christmas ambiance!. A wonderful place rich with history and culture. We get to experience the Christmas Market during our visit and it was simply magical! There were plenty to see and eat - take a photo with the nicely lit Christmas tree or simply enjoy the freshly cooked local food. If you're heading to Prague, do take a stroll down to visit the Old Town! :)

Amazing at Christmas. Prag at Christmas is just amazing. The Christmas markets in the old town the lighting the old buildings the restaurants and bars and Caffees all was great. We will come back for sure.

Beautiful city of Prague. The Old Town has many beautiful buildings. In fact there are also many such buildings all around Prague. There is so much to see and I had regretted that my stay is too short. The food is delicious too. Don't forget to try their beef goulash and beer. There was a Christmas market and the place was packed with tourists and locals. It was a wonderful experience.

Busy Market Place, great for Christmas shopping. This is a very busy place with a lot of little shops in the market place (near Staromestske Namesti or Old Town Square). A lot of people, including tourists will be around. If you are here during Christmas period, the Xmas markets will be there as well selling various kind of Czech food and souvenir items. The astronomical clock is nearby and the Apple Museum isn't very far away. Various tourist rides like sightseeing bus / segway tours start from here as well. You can easily spend a day here and this is not to be missed!
Lovely and historic. Old town Prague is a lovely area. It is always crowded, but there is never a lack of things to see or do. There are many places to eat and get a drink.

Beautiful. Visited during Christmas period, which I believe is the best time of the year to visit this place as it was beautifully decorated and well-lit. Christmas market added to the charm, with not to be missed street food including Trdlo, a traditional Czech doughnut.

Never get tired of walking through here. . We pass through this area a couple of times during the day, I still enjoy walking through and taking in the buildings. The area does get very busy, so if you plan on climbing the tower next to the astronomical clock get there early as the lines are huge.
Old Town at Christmas. We recommended to go there at Christmas, outside food is great and all bars and places open till 1am :)
Beautiful and well worth the visit. Old Town is the tourist mecca but well worth the visit during the day to see the clock tower and entertainment and during the night to see the old town lit up.

Christmas Market. Like being in a Disney film set. The bustling Christmas market set in the beautiful surroundings of Old Town Square is an experience that will live with you forever. The spicy smell of mulled wine paired with the warming smell of the local food speciality Trdelnik cooked over hot coals provided a perfect Christmas sensory experience. It does get busy but it's an experience not to be missed.
It's just old.. Honestly. It's just old 5/5 would visit again... Quite literally an old town... very old. Wouldn't quite go ancient though.

Magical Christmas Feel. Old Town Square is architecturally and culturally rich. The history and pride of the Czech people is palpable. I strongly recommend travelling Prague during the Christmas holiday season. The Christmas markets are full of local trinkets (and every item imaginable written with the words Praha). A must to accompany your stroll through the square is Trdelník - a traditional sweet bread and a cup of hot apple cider or Svařák -Mulled Wine.Be aware the crowds are astonishing, especially on the hour when the clock tower rings. As Canadians, we are used to being polite but this doesn't go far here in Prague as each is seemingly out for themselves. However this didn't bother hinder us from going back to Old Town Square on multiple occasions. The Christmas tree is absolutely brilliant in more ways then one. Be there for half past the hour to watch the tree light up in rhythm to music.

So much to see and appreciate. Just wandering around the charming old town is a delight. Architecturally there is so much to see. Every building has one gazing upwards to appreciate some new feature. The varied frescoes alone are worth spending time on.

Fascinating city. The old town is a great place to visit, plenty of history, plenty of restaurants and very busy. Watching the clock chime is a highlight or climbing the actual clock tower has amazing views

Heart of one of the most beautiful cities. Stunning architecture as you stand in the middle of the square and do a 360 spin. We visited during the Christmas market season and the Christmas tree was stunning. Packed with tourists and locals even during the cold winter months. A must see if you are in Prague.
beautiful. loved it here with the Xmas markets. Drank far too much hot cherry wine but very deliciousTry one of the round doughnut things they are delicious
Best town square. Easily one of the best main town squares in the world. With all its architecture, views, colours, history, activities, crowded and alive. Go and let it consume you with magic.

Cant miss it. If you are in Prague for touristic purpose, you will definitely come here - you plan it or not. Located in center of town - all road lead here in someway. Very typical European square, full of restaurants and street performers. Great place to hang out.
Christmas 2015. The old town it magical at this time of year. All the bars are family friendly and well worth a visit for all ages
The Fairy land. I have visited many historical neighborhoods across Europe, and I do believe that Prague old town is one of the most beautiful ones.
xmas market. beautiful area- cobbled roads and footpaths. very pretty especially as everywhere had christmas lights and trees up. quaint town

A must visit for Christmas. The architecture of the two main churches and the town hall is stunning and the astronomical clock fascinating. Be sure to visit on the hour to see the wonders of the clock. The Christmas village is wonderful and the stage with performers adds to the delights.

Christmas markets were something special. Fantastic buzz around the Old Town with bands playing and a large selection of craft and food stalls. Only downside unlike other European countries is the fact the mill wine is served in foam cups rather than in returnable mugs.

Just Fantastic. The Old Town Square has so much to see and enjoy its hard to put into words, we were lucky enough to enjoy the Christmas Markets and the were sensational, however be warned some of the stalls were you can purchase wood fired Prague ham will rip you of as quick as look at you, the advertise a price for the ham etc by the 100 Grams then when you ask for a 100 grams you get a massive portion that costs a small fortune. Just like any major tourist city in the world if you wish to sit and enjoy a coffee or beer at one of the numerous outdoor cafes you are going to pay for the pleasure. Eat and drink in the back streets its much cheaper and if you dinning you will find much better proper Czech cuisine.
Its like a fairy tale!. Its so beautiful being in this centre that you truly feel like its a fairy tale. Its nice during the day and night. The Xmas markets here are the best.

Fabulous Christmas Market. The Old Town square in Praha is beautiful, lively and fun anytime of the year... But it is completely breathtaking at Chtistmastime. The Prague Christmas market was one of the best and biggest that we visited. The huge tree with the Old Town church as a backdrop was a stunning site. So many fun and festive stalls and activities. Loved the grog and Terdelniks. The dough wrapped around a wooden pole and cooked over a fire then sprinkled with cinnamon sugar. This simple sweet treat was my favorite thing to eat here. Awesome Christmas Market.
historic city. great place to see old Prague wonderful churches and public buildings, take your time to explore the side streets and grab yourself great deals on the local chrystal glass wear
A cozy square with awesome Gothic architecture. This square has an essence of medieval Europe. A mute witness of hundreds of events that changed the course of history.
Beautiful old town. Definitely worth spending some time here, taking in the fantastic views, picturesque buildings and enjoying a drink outside watching the world go by!

Beautiful christmas markets . Visited during mid - december. There was a real buzz around the square with all the market stalls and the massive christmas tree. Beautiful buildings.Would recommend a visit for the Christmas markets.

Christmas Day. An unbelievable vibe in Old Town on Christmas Day. Is is an amazing place to walk around in and just enjoy the beautifull sceneray and buildings and soak up the atmosphere. This is what Prague is about. Go and enjoy.....
Card Postal. Is it very excellent, the old town of Prague. You can see it only in the card postals. There are enough shops and restaurants for everything. The best pictures I made here.

Going back in time. Bit crowded over the Christmas holiday with the Christmas market but this is an impressive Old Square. You can image what life was back in Medieval times with the ornate buildings and church's all around. The narrow lanes leading from the Square are equally inviting.

Lots of stories cant missed. The town square is bustling with activity and ppl trying to sell you stuff the first chance they get. IF u dont like walking like absolutely appalled by the thought walking around then you could opt for the uber costly segway tours else take the time and walk it is really very beautiful. If u can join one of the many free walking tours coz it is quite fun to have someone educate you about the history of these beautiful buildings.
A lot to do and see within walking distance. Old Town Square is a must to see - very busy place at night and do expect jammed alleys. Spectacular views from top of the clock tower.
Beautiful. Yes, Prague is full of tourists but it is a beautiful place to visit. I would fully recommend coming here. Fantastic atmosphere, good fun and good prices.
Beautiful!. Fantastic area, Xmas Markets etc. Loved it and will come again. Lots of great sights, restaurants, bars etc. Friendly people a treat too.

Beautiful square. The colors around this square were out of this world. According to my free guide, Prague wasn't destroyed in world war 2 so you can see the restored, ancient beautiful buildings. I can just sit in the square for hours and not blink!!! beautiful

Old town.. Brilliant! . Excellent location. Great atmosphere day and night . Very close the everything. Bars, restaurants, chocolate shops and of course the Xmas markets! Everything you need is within walking distance. If staying in Prague I recommend the old town!

A must visit. Here you will meet all the citizens as well as tourist at the same time - it's crowdy but good experience. We got in solid Christmas mood by walking around letting the atmosphere sinking in.

Wonderful views . It's always very crowded especially the peak time, the buildings are wonderful. It worths walking through the alleys, cobblestone roads are everywhere so it'd be better to wear good shoes :-)

Definitely a must for any visitor to Prague. I had the fortune of having an electronic friend in Prague before I came over for the Mind Sports Olympiad in 2001, so he was able to show me so many things that tourists might miss. For example, the average tourist visiting Old Town will find the restaurants that charge "tourist prices" but he knew where to take me so that we could both pay the "native prices" instead.Do not decide what to buy on the spur of the moment. Remember the items and prices that most interest you, then don't be surprised if you find a better item for a lesser price somewhere else.My visit was before they adopted the Euro, so I really got the "native advantage" in some places. I remember a pint of beer costing fifteen cents US equivalent, and over there, beer was a better choice for a drink with your meal than was the water.It is a beautiful place, and I hope to visit it again someday.

Awesome architecture!. You must save time for this place. Beautiful during the day and amazing at night. Mainly with Christmas lights! Astronomical clock, palace, church, cathedral, market with local meal and hot wine. You'll find an untouched architecture since the 10th century. You can not leave Prague without to know this place.

Beautiful. Visited mid December for the Christmas Market and was absolutely beautiful. I would highly recommend to visit at this time of year. From the gorgeous Christmas tree to the Christmas stalls. Made for a wonderful Christmas break!

Action all day. This is one place you will not get bored of. There is action in this square all day long. We went there during the Christmas season and it was even more fun. You will probably end up passing by this square every day if your visit in Prague.

Great views from the tower. Climb the tower either by foot or take the elevator! The views are worth the cost - around $6. Cdn. The Astronomical Clock is located just at the entrance and is quite something to see from both side.

Europes best Christmas marked?. We return to Prague early December to let the Christmas feeling settle in! Stare Mesto - OLD Town square is a beautiful sight - but perhaps even more breathtaking this time of year. See the beautiful Christmas tree - explore the marked - and watch it all with something to drink at one of the many restaurants. Every hour the astronomic clockwork awakens with hundrends of visitors to see it.Enjoy!

Beautiful but stay away from the tourist traps . Lovely to stroll around the old streets with their beautiful buildings which are well kept. The restaurants and cafés at the busy streets and square are way overpriced, keep away from these tourist traps and wonder off a bit to get much more value for your money.
WOW. Most beautiful city in the world. we had amazing time here. everyone was so kind. Very nice architecture and history.
Like a fairy tale. This must be one of the most beautiful squares in all of Europe. We were here during the Christmas market ava it looked like a fairy tale, absolutely amazing.
Heart of Prague. Real heart of Prague. Starting point for every visit. Christmas market, lots of people, surrounded by old and interesting builings and churchers.
everything at your finger tips. Awesome location for everything as a starting out point. IT has the Church and is walkable to Charles Bridge as well as being a main shopping area

Beautiful Christmas market . Despite thronging with tourists you have to join in. Great atmosphere and fun, day or night. But it really comes alive after dark to see the colourfully light tree and listen to the bell ringing playing piano

So romantic, the whole town is a gem. I love Prague and everything about it. I have Czech origins and really feel proud when I get to visit this splendid city. The Old town is my favourite and the Christmas markets are just beautiful. Certainly worth the trip just to sample the atmosphere of Czech christmas in the Old town.

Old Town (Stare Mesto). Prague is a beautiful, historical city, and the Old Town was one of my favorite sections. It is easy to get around by walking, and there are a wide variety of cafes & restaurants for eating, having a coffee, etc. I would highly recommend visiting the Old Town section of Prague.

Amazing, animated!. This is the best place to come at Christmas time. There is such an animated feel to it, with the Xmas market, the different food stalls, with hot wine in case you need to warm up, great sausages and slow cooked ham. It's an open air museum, each building has so much character and history. Cannot get enough of this square!
spectacular. A must be seen place in Prague. Beautiful and interesting Old Town Square. You can take lots of incredible photo.
must be seen. the most famous place is here. If you go to Prgue, you go there willy nilly. Every important place where to go starts from here.

Absolutely must visit. Absolutely romantic and lovely place with great sightseeing on every step, delicious food and great drinks,a lot of street attractions BUT be careful because of pickpockets. Just be safe!
Great xmas decorations. The town square had all the xmas markets set up which was beautiful. The lights were awesome and xmas tree magical.
Atmospheric . Beautiful and historical, with lots to see. Highlights include the astronomical clock and surrounding church towers. The Christmas market is excellent!
simply beautiful. a charming area in a charming city. if you like narrow cobble stoned streets with gorgeous well preserved buildings then this is the place for you
Excellent. Better than Wenceslas Square by far! If your accommodation Is near here, then your spot on. Excellent, beautiful views - with various shops and restaurants around to choose from.

If you didn't go here, you didn't go to Prague. One of my personal favourite old town squares. Great restaurants and sight seeing views. This place should be the centre point of all your Prague plans.
Pure magic. This is the most Christmas card place I have ever visited at night the square is breathtaking with its giant tree and stunning buildings
Stunning.. Just beautiful cannot believe it must be the most beautiful City in Eastern Europe. You will not be dissatisfied.
Fabulous interesting vibrant location. Bustling, vibrant location with fabulous architecture to see everywhere you look. The heart of the city.

Beautiful but boy is it touristy. Lovely square, though expect tons of tourists around the square and especially when the clock is about to chime.
Do watchout for pickpockets. I saw one trying to eye my wife's bag.

Christmas Markets. The square is quite beautiful with its historic buildings. At Christmas it is filled with market stalls and decorated with Christmas lights and a truly beautiful tree. The decorations are really something to see. The markets, however, are a disappointment, especially the food: potatoes, sausages and ham ..... and very little else, and at a premium price.
Stunning tree with lovely surroungings. Fabulous Christmas light and music display. Live carol performance really enhanced the Christmas spirit
Nice!. A must see. Where here at Christmas, it was FAB. Goats, stores, and shows. I really liked the whole feel of it. Recommended!

Cosy, old, beautiful, clean.. Everywhere you go, you are surrounded by beautiful buildings, here more then ever! I went around christmas, which resulted in a very nice christmas market with good food, live music, christmas lights....

Highlight, check!. The Old Town, though touristy is a must see on your visit to Prague.
