There are churches, shops and restaurants, numerous incredibly old buildings with distinctive period architecture, the memorial and the Powder Gate. All very unique and fairy tale like. Oh yes, and everyone's favorite, the astronomical clock on the town hall's tower. It is a fantastic time/astronomical piece where every hour the 12 apostles visit in a glockenspiel like procession. Also, it it well worth climbing (or taking the elevator) up to the top of the clock tower for incredible views of the square and the city. As a bonus, since we were there around Christmas, there was one of the best Christmas markets going on with seasonal food, drink, shows and one of the largest most beautifully decorated Christmas trees around. Must see!

A must see for people visiting Prague!. The Old Town is interesting because my historical sites are within waking distance of each other. Try to stay within the Old Town neighborhood for easy access to it.
Christmas markets are magical. Wonderful architecture and history, beautiful city. Some pick pocketing to be aware of. Astronomical. Clock in the square is fun.

Rich History. The visitor is fascinated with the number and types of buildings. One of the great attraction is the intricate clock on the gothic building of the Staromestska radnice. Another very important item is the statue of Jan Hus.

Christmas. Absolutely loved old town at Christmas! The Christmas markets are nice to be around even if you aren't buying. The food and drinks are worth a try and the chocolate and biscuit crepe was amazing!! The Christmas tree was also wonderful to see and they play music while the tree does a light dance! Is worth a trip up to the astronomical clock as the views are spectacular!

Many attractions, wonderful restoration of buildings & churches. The old town is the heart of magnificent Prague. Rich in wonderful restored & well maintained houses & churches, plenty of various restaurant.

Oh, the architecture!!. Christmas market stalls galore! But look at the buildings around you - there are cherubs, gargoyles, lions and then some ... the buildings are absolutely stunning! The Astronomical Clock is an absolute MUST SEE! On the hour , the crowds gather to see the clock chime, setting the 4 outside statues into motion, with "Death" striking the time.
looks like its from Disney land!. Right in the center of old town this beautiful church is the center piece of the magnificent square. donation to enter must see if you're in Prague
Christmas fayre. Went in December big busy Christmas Market under a massive Christmas tree right at the side of the twin towered church loved it

A beautiful place to walk and stay amazed. every day.. we made our way through the alleys and little streets. Letting ourself ti get "lost" and finding new treasures of beauty - hpme, little steues, painting on walls etc. etc.Love it
Expensive, but beautiful . Art galleries are very cheap, but food is more expensive. The most impressive Christmas market that we found in Prague!

Loved it. I love old time Europe, so anything related to history will attract me. The Old Town of Prague is a medieval settlement of Prague. It connected to the Vltava river at both of its ends. The moat is now covered up by the streets (from north to south-west) Revoluční, Na Příkopě, and Národní—which remain the official boundary of the cadastral community of Old Town. Notable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. The Old Town is surrounded by the New Town of Prague. Across the river Vltava connected by the Charles Bridge is the Lesser Town of Prague. I visited in Dec. The Christmas market is all overy Prague, but of course, the biggest one is located in the old town. It has very good ambience and Christmas atmosphere, traditional roasted pork, traditional Czech dessert---Trdelník, hot wine, etc is all over the market. My husband and I really enjoyed it.
Amazing place to be!. This place is a must when visiting Prague especially at Christmas time with the markets, Christmas tree and the whole atmosphere of the place.

A place you must visit in Prague. In December this is the place where you find the largest Christmas-market in Prague. The square is filled up with small shops, and the smell of roasted almonds and chinnamon is more than you can stand! In summer there are so many people in the restaurants that finfint a table, could be difficult. Love this place with the magic astronomisk clock and tower.
Brilliant atmosphere . I visited in December so the atmosphere from the beautiful christmas markets was brilliant. The sights to see is also great offering a wide range of things to do.
Gorgeous. Absolutely worth visiting, plenty of shops and the town hall clock is absolutely amazing, if for nothing else a great photo opportunity!

The place is "a must" for visiting in Prague. When I was a little girl and visited Prague with my parents I started to cry on that place. And my mamma asked me why I was crying. And I answered that it was really beautiful.
Stunning square at Christmas . What a beautiful tree and surrounded by astonishing buildings. Definitely worth visiting on your trip. Nothing more to add than what's below!

A worldwide favorite place with Christmas market. My third trip to Prague and the magnificence of the Old Town square remains fresh. This time, the Christmas Market was in full swing and made the square very crowded. The crowd was friendly despite the tight fit.I sampled much of the street fare and had mixed results. The beer is a given and amazingly cheap. The spiced wine was varied in quality. The best seemed like a warmed port rather than a spiced version of red table wine. The worst went right in the dumpster. The ham and sausages were tasty but the ham a bit pricey. And, do not use the bread as a roll (you will see). Only one cheese monger but stationed by a friendly woman who should be running the company. Some of the craftwork was very nice and I especially liked and purchased some amber/silver jewelry from Poland (Tomasz Debski).Nightlife went way later than I could handle being on a business trip. The food available surrounding the square and specifically behind the Tyn church is excellent. Everywhere walkable and Uber got me to and from the airport with ease. By all means, visit here.

Heart of Prague. Must visit in Prague, lovely at Christmas time with markets and many places to eat and drink! The cathedral is also very wonderful to see and the astronomical clock, not to be missed!

Heart of Prague. It is an amazing place to be,I loved it.I kind a regret to leave Prague as one of the last city that I visit in Europe.However,do not take a cab and be careful while you change your money they put %19 commission.
Great. A must, particularly before Christmas with all the local shops of the Christmas market. The clock looks great though the movement is not that great
Crowds, fun, hot punch, music and a sceleton on the clock.. Crowds, fun, hot punch, music and a sceleton on the clock. I love Prague, its people, food and architecture.

Pure Christmas Magic. My daughter and I visited during the Christmas Market period and it was pure magic. The huge Christmas tree, lights and holiday crowds all added to the atmosphere. This square is a vibrant and essential part of any visit to Prague but at Christmas, it is even more special.
Beautiful buildings, The upper crust end of Prague.. Had a brilliant time exploring Prague, There is so much to see and do. The Old Town is full of the " Posh Shops "

Magical Prague. This old town centre brimming with life is a pleasure to visit. There is a lot going on the streets and a lot to see. During Easter there were markets everywhere and the squares nicely decorated. Everything can be visit by foot, but public transport is easy to use and good available as well.
Wonderful buzz. Prague is a wonderful city and Old Town Square is definitely its beating heart. Lots of sights nearby and plenty of coffee and beer to be had

Magic Place in the Heart of Europe. Old town in Prague is a magic place; place with huge history and very nice architecture. It is a must to walk through the old streets and soak history and old atmosphere of the place.
Old Town wonderful. This was atypical mid 16th century square. The astronomical clock was great. The Christmas market was fun food and crafts
Old or New, Prague is beautiful!!!. Spent 4 wonderful days walking Prague, from old to new, from one side of the river to the other. Anywhere we went, we loved it.
Beautiful, magical old town square. The Christmas tree and lights were impossibly beautiful, and have to be seen to be believed. Christmas markets in the square were good fun too.

Love at first sight.... Our apartment was wonderfully placed in the middle of Old Town, and we spent many hours wandering around. The cobbled crooked streets and beautiful architecture stole a piece of my heart. Everywhere you looked was another beautiful building or quaint square. Try to get off the beaten track away from tourists and souvenir shops and find the cute little restaurants and cafes where the locals are.
sunset. amazing photo opportunities. Very busy but fun at christmas time Markets add to the charm Do visit the Jewish quarter and museum , it is a very moving experience
Uphill. Impressive architecture and interesting background this is a must-see for history buffs but apart from the Cathedral there's not much to it.
Don't miss it. We visited , numerous times it is the centre of town , lots to see just wondering around people from all around the world

Cozy streets for strolling. Loved walking through the cobblestone streets of Old Town. While there are lots of touristy shops it is still a beautful palces with many historic and decorative buildings. We were here during the Christmas markets making it all the more charming with live music, tons of lights, craft and food booths and xmas decorations. You can try some of the local traditional food items and just enjoy the scenery. Ther are also lots of restaurants in Old Town so you can find whatever appeals to you.

Fantastic Christmas tree!. If you are disappointed with the tree in Trafalgar Square, London this will make up for it! The square is filled with Christmas market stalls selling appetising food and attractive gifts and decorations but the jewel is the beautifully decorated tree with lights that flash in time to music at intervals. The square is surrounded by beautiful buildings and a climb up the town hall tower lays the vista out below you. A wonderful place to spend some time with lots of restaurants to refresh you but naturally, as location is everything, prices will be higher.

Great atmosphere, loved it. We have visited the markets during the week, we arrived around 3:30 and left after 5. I would say 1-2 hours is sufficient. We tasted some lovely food like langos, trdelnik, sausage in a bread roll and our favourite freshly done potato crisps, they were absolutely amazing!!!You can buy quite a few local souvenirs made out of wood and glass and of course traditional gingerbread. The huge Christmas tree is amazing, really pretty and with the surrounding buildings you can take some amazing photos.We will visit again before the markets close down.
Beautiful xmas market. Beautiful during Christmas season, the astronomical clock, the cafes, the shops and alleys. A very nice place to stay as its centrally located

Tourist trap with style. Obviously, this is where everybody goes, so expect busy streets and plenty of souvenir shops and "traditional" restaurants. Yet, the old town is one pf these places with countless alleys and narrow streets, where it is fun and lovely just to wander around, maybe going for a quick drink in one of the pubs on the corners.

Charming and quaint. It is charming with plenty of beautiful places to explore. One can visit Old Town several times and will never get tired of its beautiful architecture. There are churches and buildings filled with history. Old Town is simply beautiful!

Wonderland. The most wonderful christmas market I've ever seen, I can't express the experience and feeling that you can feel there. Christmas lights everywhere, music, fragrances, horse-drawn carriages, this city knows what christmas is, I felt like I was in a fary tale, in the empire of Sanat Claus.

Christmas Market . Best of Prague! Museums, Art Galleries, food, drink and craft on the square! Beautiful Golden Sunday! Great photo opportunities and classic Christmas Market entertainment- enjoyed craft demonstrations, music and people watching! Wonderful day overall!

Feast for the eye and tummy. December is a good time to visit if you want to have both of sight-seeing and food tripping. The night market offers plenty of local delicacies and a romantic ambiance. The surrounding buildings are a sight to behold.
Beautiful . Not enough time to take it all in. Christmas galore! Wonderful restaurants. History and architecture that boggles the mind.

lovely, lovely old town <3. ihana, ihana vanha kaupunki <3Meidän hotellimme oli aivan vanhan kaupungin lähellä, joten vanhan kaupungin ihania pieniä kujia ja katuja tuli käveltyä paljon. Varsinkin iltaisin täällä on kaunista. Pieniä kauppoja ja ravintoloita tuli eteen aina joka mutkan takaa, välillä huomasi eksyneensä umpikujan ja piti kääntyä takaisin. Varaa aikaa vanhan kaupungin tutkimiseen :)*lovely, lovely old town <3Our hotel was located just outside the old town, so the old town of lovely small alleys and streets came we walked a lot. Especially in the evening here is beautiful.Small shops and restaurants came forward who always bend ensures the cul-de-noticed had gone astray and had to turn back. Please take the time to study the old city :)
History in your hand. Fantastic Christmas markets, food, drink and gifts in the heart of Paris of Central Europe. Spent 4 great days in Prague
Moc krásné a úžasné!. Very beautiful and amazing.. I was very pleased I really enjoyed it and I get back there again. Thanks!

Centre of all good things. The most lively, activity packed and happy place in Prague. Packed with amazing restaurants, segway tours, people showing off their music and dance acts and historical sites

Nice sightseeing. We spent last weekend in November in Prague. In old town you can spend many days walking around looking at amazing buildings and many nice restaurants. If you like bohemian glas you will be in heaven, there are shops in almost every street.

Plenty to see. Beautiful buildings and plenty to see and do. Excellent choice of restaurants and bars in the square and surrounding streets. You can pick up a Segway tour /mini bus/boat trip from here
Love Prague!. So beautiful and festive at Christmas time. You won't regret spending time in this city. Visit the Christmas Markets and explore the amazing restaurants.

The ONE place you MUST visit. Oustanding town square. Many restaurants. Great area for outdoor beer and people watching in the summer or dining indoors in the winter. We were in town this time for the Christmas Market held in the square. WARNING: We went to the square on the opening night. It was packed with too many people. We were shoulder to shoulder and could barely move. We returned the next night and the crowd was comfortable. Be sure to watch the clock in action and try out the fabulous WHITE HORSE cellar restaurant across from the clock.

Christmas markets time. Busy around the week before Christmas. Lovely atmosphere. Lots of markets to choose from. Food and craft markets. These markets seemed to have more variety than ones in Wensceslas square. Walking distance to most hotels. Loved the cobbled roads. Mostly pedestrian with only some roads crossed by cars and trams. Good Street entertainment on Saturday. Careful in large crowds as easy to have bags pinched or pick pockets.

Cozy yet lively corner of Prague. Very similar to the piazas in Rome, this area is full of restaurants, historical attractions, and vendors selling mulled wine, roasted chestnuts, trdelnik, and souveniers. Great place to unwind and people-watch.
beautiful and clean. thoroughly enjoyed our short stay in Prague, the old town having wonderful buildings and some great shops
Very crowded. But beautiful like any other Old Town that I've been to. I really liked this year's Christmas Tree there!

Christmas Market in Old Town. Very nice selection of food and items for sale. The vendors seemed very nice and spoke enough english. The area was very crowded at night but police were there. Taking pictures here can be be interesting since different times of the day had lighting on different buildings which is nice. The clock tower is best visited early so you can avoid crowds and take more pictures.
'. Always crowded around 'Astronomical clock' but nice place to snack or have a friendly get together in any of the bars.

A mid december celebration. We visited Prague mid December. many buildings were decorated, many wooden booths on the streets, selling Christmas and traditional Czech items and a festive atmosphere all around. The streets were clean and the people were friendly.

Tis the Season. This place is magical!! From the amazing food to all the fun Christmas shops it is a must see!! My wife and I could not get over the beauty of the square and how festive it is. A real memory and experience we are so glad we went.

Christmas market. Very festive Chistmas market with good variety of goods and foods and drinks! The tree is beautiful and of course the surrounding buildings, shops and restaurants are fantastic! There was sweet music and many joyful people. We had a wonderful time.
Stunning. Beautiful architecture very festive Christmas market well worth going the smells of mulled wine spiced cider road ting chestnuts lovely choir fantastic Christmas tree and much more

Christmas Market. In Decmber the Old Town has a Christmas Market in the square. There are vendors selling all types of gifts in addition to food. This is a good place to try traditional Czech food and drink. There are areas for children to play and take photographs with cutouts.

Absolutely beautiful.. Fabulous Architecture, beautiful buildings and just magical. Some wonderful Restaurants where you can sit and watch the world go by and enjoy the ambience of this wonderful City.
Christmas. We were there in December the place was deck out with lots of Christmas trimming and a very big Christmas tree it was a very good tome of the year to be there.

Amazing Architecture. Christmas Markets filled the streets in the Old Town which only added to the enjoyment of this amazing town center! Lots of shopping, restaurants and cafes fill the area! Fun place to hang out!!

Such a fun square in this amazing city. The Old Town is a great spot and had an amazing Xmas market. It is conveniently based just next to the Astronomical Clock and not far a walk from Charles Bridge.
Magic!. NIce Christmas market, magical athmosphere and one of the most beautiful chirches rising above.... vist here is worth any minute, do not miss it!
Amazing place. Historical amazing place! You feel as if the time turned back and especially in winter it's a beautiful place where you can enjoy your hot wine in a snowy weather.

Stunning. We have visited Prague at least a dozen times -and we never get tired. Visiting stare mesto is like walking through centuries of European history, narrow alleys, majestic bridges, religious monuments, as well as the intense happiness of crossing The Charles' Bridge. Do not hesitate , og there, now!
Kristin and Hakon

Beautiful Square. Visited this square in Prague this week and it was lovely. Stalls set up for Xmas, trdlnik everywhere and hot wine! Yum!
Very busy but lovely atmosphere :)

Very picturesque. A lovely square with lovelybuildings around. In early tomid December there are the Christmas stallsand decorations which help to make it homely. Also pretty busy though. Needles to sayit is a must see.

Beautiful, but crowded. Old Town is the heart of Prague and very beautiful. It's fun to watch the clock once or twice, but it does draw large crowds. If you go right before sunset, you can get amazing photos of the sun making some of the buildings glow. We loved wandering through, down all the little alleys and found several cute shops! I can't imagine visiting Prague without wandering through Old Town!

Do not miss it!!!. Went there every day of my stay in Prague! Went in December, so the Square was bustling with activity, filled with the Christmas Market and typical food vendors, there was a giant Christmas tree, there was a stage with performances, people everywhere. One of the most amazing experiences I have ever had, so beautiful and so much fun. Go at least once at night, to see the Christmas trees all light up and the Christmas lights, to drink a hot apple cider and see people celebrating and just having a good time. Go there, and if you can, go there in the Christmas season. You will not regret it!
Stunning. Truly magical at xmas time. This place is absolutely up there with any of the cities in Europe in terms of its beauty and overall charm.
favourite part of prage. Its a must to visit the old square, go of the main streets and you will find some good cheap places to eat :)

Definately worth a visit. Historical area well worth a visit. Lovely atmosphere around the Xmas market. Great views from the tower in the old town hall but not recommended for vertigo sufferers. Majority of visitors seem to use the lift thereby missing the story of the building that is documented on different levels on the stairwell.
Christmas market. The Christmas market/tree in old town square was magical surrounded by old churches and buildings probably the best we have seen in recent years around Europe.
Love this city!!!. I love this Old Town Prague! Its amazing, full of various houses, secret squares.. You should visit it :)

Nice Christmas Market and hugeChristmas Tree!. A really nice place to take a walk and drink some of the Hot Red Wine which is really cheap and abundant! The astronomical clock is worth a look however don't get too excited as its not worth more than a 5 minute wait.

Culturally rich and bustling. At this time of year the Christmas Markets are in full swing, so wherever you go there are small huts selling an assortment of trinkets, mulled and honey wine, sausages, chips and pancakes. The Castle District aside, most of what you want to see, as a tourist, is situated in and around Old Town. Everything is close by and easily walkable. The primary thing is the architecture which is simply stunning, along with a wonderful sense of history. Take your camera, take your time, wander and just indulge your senses. If you want to eat or drink, find places off the main square where prices are hiked.
Beautiful old town, just be wary of scammers at night. Beautiful architecture and very well designed lighting at night to highlight the building's features

Charming. Full of life, lovely cafes, Starbuck's for WiFi and for good tips form a young hip staff. We walked for hours, saw the Astronomical clock, ate way too much, laughed at all the offers for massage, rode bikes and got lost in the crowd. We ended the night at the opera and loved every minute. If you are into to shopping there is plenty of it.

Christmas Markets. Great place to visit for Christmas markets, architecture was varied. Place was full of tourists and very busy, but not to the point that it was too busy to move freely. Wear comfortable footwear all the streets and roads are cobblestone.
Touristy, but fun. Loved the famous clock and we were there just as the Christmas market season started, so lots of offerings and activity. The Christmas tree there was stunning, too!

Fab Xmas market. Beautifully lit at night, the Old town market square is a great location for the Xmas market. Saturday nights (in December) are, understandably very busy but noticeably quieter and more civilized on other nights.Worth paying £4 per head to go to the top of the Astrological clock tower for a great view down onto the Xmas festivities. We visited at 9pm on a Monday night and it was blissfully quiet

One of the best historical place in Europe. Very nice place for day & night relax, great place to see the history of Prague, the history of Czech Republic...Square full of people - Czech residents, tourists - together.

Explore the Old Town. You have got to explore the cobbled winding street of the Old Town and take in the magnificent architecture. It is quite easy to get lost but if you head back the way you came all the little alley ways lead back onto the main square. There is so much beauty to see on the superb buildings. It is truly amazing. We spent hours just strolling through the many streets taking in all the sights. Prague is such a magical place to be especially during the month of December.

Old Town. Lovely area. The rooftop terrace at Black U Prince hotel is well worth a visit, whatever the weather.Also a must is the cellar bar at Black Angel. Fabulous atmosphere with their own pianist.

Mystical and beautiful by day or night.. We have been to Prague many times and still find the Old Town Square the magnet that pulls the tourist. It has architecture and charm and so many thing to see. It is here where the astronomical clock chimes each hour and you can go up the bell tower. In the square they have the xmas market stalls and it is surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars. From English, Irish bars and local restaurants. Walk one way through to Wenceslas square, another towards Charles Bridge and another up to the Powder Tower. When in Prague you must come here especially when illuminated at night.

Gorgeous during Christmas. Great place to go for everything you're looking for! Great food and restaurants, plenty of souvenir shops, beautiful streets full of people, bars, etc. The Christmas markets are wonderful and even enchanting. I would wander around at dark to see the lights and Old Town in the evening. The Astronomical clock is really cool.

Christmas Delight. Beautiful setting and Christmas market. Some of the goods on offer were pricy but the hot honey wine is a must. If you can visit the square during the day and again after dark for two completely different experiences.
Christmas delight!. Beautiful tree and colourful market stalls. Worth paying to climb the tower for the views. Great fun to watch the astronomical clock do its thing on the hour.

Stunning. The old town square with its market stalls, Christmas tree, churches and astronomical clock was a sight worth seeing. There is a real buzz about the place but beware of pickpockets - they hang around the clock, waiting for everyone looking up and taking pictures.

Unnaturally beautiful!. The old town of Prague is perfect for wandering through the streets, checking out the beautiful buildings, strolling through all the shops, stopping for coffe, lunch, beer. It is a wonderful place to be.
Lovely Square full of Christmas Market stalls. Very busy heart of the tourist area, but understandable as it is a magnificent space. Filled with Christmas stalls and decorations

A Magic Christmas Place. A wonderful place in December, full of Christmas Market stalls selling great food, drink and every sort of Christmas decoration you could think of and the biggest Christmas tree ever!!
beautiful place for couples. old town is a beautiful place for romantic trip. very many nice shops and restaurant. good pubs with many kinds of beers! best recommendations!!
Worth visiting. There are some great buildings in the square. Got incredibly busy during the Christmas market season, so just make sure you don't need to rush around anywhere!

Wonderful Square. Perhaps one of the (in my opinion) most beautiful places in the world. You can feel the magic in the air. Mandatory contemplate all the beauty around. Just one more thing: I just want to go back :)
Sept 2014
Stunning architecture. Best Christmas tree ever! A must see. Lots of Christmas market stalls and cafes surround the square. A wonderful place to sit and watch the world go by.
visit. brilliant. it is worth a visit there is soo much history in this place, and it is suitable for all ages. highly recommended.

A must to see for visit to Prague. Christmas time is so beautiful in the Old Town Center. Many places to eat and drink. Lots of art figures in the open on the back streets. Be prepared for allot of tourist traffic.
nice. It is right in the center of the square prague. With a eclet tourism around. Feeling alive with the heart of the culture. so so nice

a must visit when you are in Prague. This Old Town is really a must although every tourist will be going there anyhow. But the beauty of historic Prague is well kept and gives you fantastic views and inside information in history of the city. Prague itself seems to be one big museum !! What a superb city to visit.
Christmas Markets to remember!. The old town is stunningly beautiful and the Christmas markets just topped it off perfectly. One of the most beautiful cities I have ever visited!

All styles at one place. It's a magnificent place and most probably the most beautiful historic center of the world. The most unique feature is its mix of styles, where you can admire buildings starting with Romanesque, going through Gothic, Renaissance, Baroque, Art Nouveau up to 21st century. You can spend days here and still find something new. I recommend looking not just to the street, but also a bit higher, where you can find different ornaments and decorations.

Lovely and walkable - perfect for exploring. Of course, we got lost on the meandering cobblestone streets every time we went out, but it was fun to finally come to a known spot quite suddenly, and then laugh & have more fun. Do be careful of the crowds when watching the "clock" since there are so many who want to see the display. Across the square from the clock at an Italian restaurant we had some excellent mushroom soup, duck & Caesar salads. On the castle grounds, St. Vitus stands out as one of the finest churches I have seen -- gargoyles, beautiful stained glass and exquisite architecture, and that amazing silver coffin. The Treasury has unique objects & reliquaries and they are perfectly maintained & displayed. Go to Prague in November if you can. We were able to walk right in to exhibits and enjoy them. Busy, but not overly crowded anywhere. And BTW, we stayed at the Four Seasons. The Four Seasons is, yes, a very nice hotel in a great location as expected, BUT, we best thing about it was that the service and hotel staff were perfect.. Have to say, we were very, very impressed - we were there 5 nights and every single day the service was perfect. That is a rare experience. (Well, except that they did it again at the Gresham Palace in Budapest!)
Old Town square. Old town square has beautiful architecture which provided a magical backdrop for the christmas markets.

Disney in Reality. amazing amazing amazing Prague by night! I am a Prague lover, yes! Old beautiful city-center, young friendly peoples, excellent food, drinks - I enjoy living in Prague every minute of my life! If I am walking in Prague - I find every time new exciting sites...Prague is like Disney World for me, his Castle, The old market square... by night... amazing amazing amazing..

BEAUTIFUL. One of the most beautiful places in Prague and the world. Nicely lighted at night Possible to see the famous old Prague clock and there is a clock show every sharp hour. You can also climb the stairs and see the place from the top balcony. It is also possible to visit, the Museum of famous Czech painter Mukha.
Fantastic square. It is always full of tourists but I mean FULL. Go there early morning if you want to take some nice photos.

Amazing!!. The old town is just amazing with so beautiful buildings all around, the whole town is preserved very well. There is a type of art everywhere in every corner of the old town including great performances by talented folks. You could just walk there day and night without getting bored.

Very clean, for a city. The architecture was great. Lots of historic preservation. Plenty of places to sit for a brew (beer was less expensive than soda,)and people watch. Lots of shopping too, if that's your thing.

Beautiful, must see. Just perfect and beautiful , the perfect place for a Christmas fair but it comes to life at night . It's gorgeous and a place where you really feel those goosebumps and time just slows down . Just take a walk and enjoy.

Beautiful Old Prague. The old town area was amazingly clean and safe with many outstanding restaurants and bars. There were many shops for virtually all your needs and desires, as well as lots of great places to park your tush and watch the people. The people in all the shops and restaurants were very friendly and often spoke very good english. Take your camera! We also walked around the area, which was a couple of blocks from our Marriott hotel and the Charles Bridge, early in the morning when the streets were totally deserted--beautiful!!
Beautiful. Stunning architecture, great bars, restaurants and shopping. The astronomical clock is stunning....get there to see the crowds gather when the clock strikes the hour and enjoy the show :)
beautiful biuldings. right on the square where some of the Christmas market was lovely for photos and the history of Prague

Magical. We visited during the Christmas markets and the atmosphere was magical. Fabulous tree, a variety of stalls selling goods as well as food and drink, and an open air stage where there were numerous concerts. Wonderful.
Pretty town. The main square in Prague is very pretty, it has an old town flair and especially now with the Christmas market it is pretty! Loved it !

"Kings way" is beautiful at any time of the year. In my opinion it is the most beautiful historic center of the world. I suggest you to stay there few days and walk around. There is so many places that you must visit more times to discover its secrets.

Buzzing and how!. My husband and I love to travel as a local would in any new city we go. Old Town Square in Prague lets you breathe Prague in its truest sense. There is always something happening. Street acts, beer being guzzled along the sides, people going along on segways. Must watch here is the clock show that happens at a particular hour of the day everyday.
Christmas Markets in Old Town...fabulous!. Beautiful old town square with lots of gorgeous sights...no matter which direction you look. Find accommodations near by and enjoy!
A Fairytale Land. Can't beat the Prague magic! If your aim is history and culture rather than pub crawl you will never forget this place! Full of character, atmosphere and beautiful architecture!

Christmas Markets and History in one. Old town square was great, lovely atmosphere with the Christmas Market Stalls. The historical building are good and interesting and the bars and cafes have good food and drink.
Full of Life!. The astronomical clock is just part of the charm in old town! The architecture, people watching, photo possibilities and history all combine to make the area a sensory overload of fun!
Prague. Great place to visit!! Combination of old world meeting new world.We had a great time sightseeing eating and enjoying the people.

Went up the up the clock tower. The views at the top of the clock were fanatstic well worth the 120k each to go up. Lots of stairs to climb but there was a small lift. The market stalls looked lovely from the too and the views of the roof tops.
Prague is beautiful!. Although very touristy this is a can't miss! We are here in December and I was excited about the Christmas markets, they are a disappointment. But everything else wonderful!

Stunning. You absolutely must spend time in the Old Town if you are in Prague. The main square is one of the most beautiful in all of Europe, and it's always buzzing with activity. Try to explore some of the back lanes in Old Town, not just the main streets, to get a feel for the city.

Beauty and atmosphere at Christmas. There's plenty to see and do here. The atmosphere during the Christmas period - with the lights, wooden huts, the smell of hot wine and cider, and trdelnik - is welcoming and electric.
Watch out for the segways and make sure you stand face on to the Astronomical Clock or you won't see the saints in the windows!
Great center of old town. Very nice "square" with lots of shops, food stalls, restaurants, mimes, and crowds. Beautiful old church in the center and museums all around.
Beautiful Xmas market and relaxed atmosphere. Good pair of walking shoes will reward you with spectacular architecture and stunning views in and from the castle. People so friendly so relaxed!

Beautiful. Just came back from Prague and we must say that this was one of our highlights we loved walking through the stalls and everything is all done up for Christmas! So much to do in this area that you can come back more than once and you won't do the same thing twiceThere are a few people walking around trying to sign you up for things like bar crawls and Segway tours but they are very polite and when you say no they respect it and walk away
Stunning City. Well worth going. Must be a highlight of any trip to prague. Climb up to the top of the tower (go in through the tourist information centre) for stunning views of the whole city

Magical weekend. This was a trip we wanted to make but were not sure whether it was overhyped. Its not. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great weekend break. Everything is in walking distance and each turn is another surprise.

Old town Prague - just beautiful. We spent a day walking round Old Town Prague on a recent visit to the city. It is a really lovely city and full of history. We also took an hour out to enjoy a river cruise. If you enjoy old buildings then you will be in your elements as there are just so many to look at. Would defntely recommend a visit

Amazing square!!!. at first we were lost and i kept looking at all towers with clocks and think it is the astronomical clock , then we went through a narrow street straight from the Main shopping and cafe street , we were able to find the astronomical clock and the whole square!it was fun with a lot of dancers, singers and talent shows and alott of resturants at night it is very nice to hang out there but resturants usually close by 11 PM.lovely lovely place
lovely place. great place made even better with the Xmas market there, can get a bit busy but we found ourselves back here often, the market is lovely especially at night, well worth a visit.

Beautiful Prague. Great atmosphere at any time of year but leading up to Christmas the experience is even more atmospheric with the stalls and activities in the old town square.Very touristic but full of nooks and crannies to explore not to mention the clock tower and to take one of the tours of old Prague.Have fun .....
Great views. Amazing views from the Astronomical clock tower. The queue time could be better but it's expected...

Great Christmas Market, great atmosphere. It is great place to be not only during the Christmas time. Sip a hot wine while observing christmas decoration and market surrounded with picturesque streets and beautiful old buildings.

Must see in Prague. We were in Prague during the Christmas markets and this was thee place to be! Lots of crowds, all happy holiday things to see and eat, and just beautiful at night with all the holiday decorations.
great central square. at Christmas time it is wonderful - with big Christmas tree and market - a lot of attractions for tourists, at the same time at weekends - overcrowded.

Beautiful Christmas Market. Love the big Christmas tree and all the market stalls. The Hot Wine and Trndl were both delicious. Gives you a great Christmas feel wondering through the market stalls and stopping to watch the astronomical clock.

Bonboniera. Very interesting city. It is presrved and only one bilding was realy bombed.
The clock is somthing you shoud not miss. It is important to tour the city by foot and i would recomend you to take one of the free tours... The guides are very dedecaited
beautiful buildings. Great architecture and historical buildings! Absolutely worth visiting and also great to do some shopping.

SUPERB STAY. A really pleasant place just to wander around buy some souvenirs take in a cafe or two and watch the world go by - easy walking although he cobbles can be tricky when wet, best seen on foot although you can hire a car for 1220 czn to take you round but much more interesting to wander down the alleys yourself
Worth it. Nice for a walk around. Beautiful christmas markets. Be careful of the prices... not what you read on the labels

This is an impressive area!. The architecture and feel of the area was great. We seemed to have gone at the perfect time. The middle of the day gets a bit crowded, but still not as bad as many European cities. The shops are fun to look through. The restaraunts are great, and the prices aren't as bad as many might say. Compared to Paris and London, there was nothing expensive about Prague.

Walk through History. Lovely place to walk and get to know the history of the area. There were shops and restaurants to visit.Keep an eye on your bags as I swear the young people are trained to pickpocket the tourists. I was there in 2011,but could not pick that date.
Wow.. Short and sweet, came here to visit the christmas markets and it was staggaring, the first time you walk into the square your jaw will drop and you will gawk at the beauty.

Magical Christmas atmosphere. During December the Old Town Square is impeccably decorated with Christmas style. Groups of stalls are really authentic with a vast range of gift ideas, many of which are hand made. You can eat smoked cooked ham and brown bread or taste local honey wine. The array of stalls is really impressive. There is a large beautifully decorated main stand where musical performances take place. A truly Christmas experience and in the evening it gets even better with the many lights adding even more atmosphere.

Absolutely Gorgeous!!!. We must have walked ten times through that area has it is so spectacular, especially during the Christmas market time of year. It dos get a little crowded though especially on weekends, but totally worth it. This is by far one of my favorite places in all of Prague!
Must see. If you're in Prague you simply can't just not visit Old Town. Sun or rain its stunning and a must see. Especially at night.
Christmas Market. Very pretty square with fabulous Christmas tree. Astronomical Clock, lovely to see, arrive around 15 minutes before the hour to get a good view.
Beautiful. A fantastic wander through the streets.great and lots of-places to have a coffee & mulled wine as there were huts at the start of the Christmas markets

Beautiful Christmas Market. The Christmas tree and market stalls in the square are lovely, lots of local crafts on offer such as the hand painted glass baubles. Great food and mulled wine to get you in the Christmas spirit!
Christmas Fair. We were very fortunate to visit the square in early December when it was hosting a great Christmas Fair with one of the largest Christmas tree that I have ever seen.

Good old town . I went with my wife and daughter to old town to look at the square.
Very good time looking at the stalls and having a few drinks.
Some bars open very late which was great. Giant Christmas tree in the center of the square was spectacular.
All in all c good time.
Nice stroll. Greart fun - Nice stroll between beautiful buildings and tourist shops ... don't miss the hot dogs stands :-)

Christmas market. Old Town Square was full of brightly lit christmas cabins sellingdecorations, wooden toys,lace, baubles, sheepskin products and food,food,food with a beer or hotmulled wine thrown in..................SUPERB!!!!!!

Beautiful History lesson. Absolutely lovely view! A cultural and historical lesson. Amazing what the Nazis did to this lovely place and how it was so well restored. Loved Prague dressed for Christmas!

A nice city, grumpy people and pickpockets. The city is nice during any season . The architecture is nice, the public transportation is great (cheap, on time, not very crowded).People in general are grumpy, don't know why but they mind their own business so it's ok. A lot of pickpockets in the town centre and during the night it gets worse . Was kind of funny to see in Vaclav Square the police on one side and the prostitutes and drug dealers on the other side of the street that goes to the national museum . Avoid the restaurants next to the main tourist attractions, go 100m further on a secondary street and you will find better food for a better price . Keep your eyes open and you will enjoy Prague .

Just OK.. We came to Prague specifically for the Christmas markets. The magazines and internet reviews hyped it up but we were a bit disappointed.The old town square market was one of the better ones.The market we enjoyed the most though was a little Saturday morning one, just off the main square. It was half the price of the main markets and the people were very friendly.All in all we won't be coming back to Prague for the Christmas markets!
Awesome. We were lucky to be there when the Christmas market opened, so beautiful! The clock tower and buildings are something you need to see.
Xmas in Old Town. Traditionally the Old Town during Xmas time is very nicely decorated, there are the Xmas markets where you can buy drinks, food and some Xmas presents.
Amazing. Well worth a visit, fantastic buildings. The lights and the Christmas Markets were brilliant. Lots of restaurants nearby
Farytale... . Really a good christmas spirit. Tourists, christmas songs, hot chocolate, traditional tastes...Old buildings, lights, clocks, marvellous views... all these in a square.Wow...
On the hour. Amazing old square in the heart of Prague,but gets very crowded on the hour with tourists looking at the clock, try getting there at quarter past the hour
Christmas Markets. Amazing Square at Christmas.... Tree was beautiful, as were the Churches etc. Lots of stalls and everyone seems really friendly.

Lovely in December. Visited in the run up to Christmas. The markets and buzz around the place was lovely. Great array of foods and hot wine, chocolate and the usual array of touristy gifts etc. Nice, but wrap up warm!
Christmas market. Wonderful to walk about the Old Town at Christmas. I suggest anyone looking to come at Christmas not to miss the Old Town Square with its markets, its spiced wine and snacks.
the Best city in EU by far. Prague, CR is the only city in the heart of Europe that was survived during WWII. It is a heaven with a rich culture, nice people and awesome cuisine.
get the free tour. we got the free tour from sandeman's europw, it was great. we ended up learning a lot of history and hidden jams..
ChristmasFeels. I visited this December so the Old Town was filled with Christmas bazaar. It was full of holiday decorations, sparkling lights and shops selling snacks & Christmas ornaments.

Christmas Market and a lovely Christmas Tree. Very pleasant surroundings and not too crowded in the week. Beautiful large Christmas Tree to add to the festive spirit. Nice small Restaurants to pop into for a coffee or snack.

Great town. I stayed at Hilton Prague Old Town hotel which is very close to the clock tower. I went to the square during both day and night. The feeling is different, it is better to shopping and enjoy the scenery during the day and better to eat dinner and chilling during the night. It is a long walk around the square but with the gorgeous buildings and roads I didn't feel tired.
Wonderful time of year. We were there for the Christmas Markets and St. Nicholas Day. What a great time. The town of all decorated for the season. Crowded for this time of year but manageable

Beautiful area. This whole area is full of old buildings and churches. We walked around there numerous times during our stay and always discovered something new. Walk slowly and enjoy the surrouindings.

An absolute must. Very attractive place to while away the time surrounded by beautiful buildings, with shops, restaurants, a pub etc. We were there for the start of the Christmas market and this is the best place to see it. Plenty of hot mulled wine to keep you warm!
Stunning. a definite must as there is some stunning architecture and places to eat. cobbled roads and pavements need to watch out for loose ones.

Ahh Prague - a wonderful tourist trap :-). I'll start by admitting I love Prague, it has history, fun and is easy to walk around, even at night. I was at a conference at the Hilton which was on the edge of the old town, so I walked into the old town on a sunny afternoon and on a cool but dry evening. The town hall, the old church and the grand buildings around Stare Mesto are a photographers paradise.
Architecture.....!. Fabulous old town centre. Everything is easy walking distance and safe. Beautiful buildings and lots of interesting things to do and see.

Beautiful views. The Old Town Christmas market is beautiful, get a mulled wine to warm you up whilst walking round! There is so much to see.
Watch out for service / table charges even if you are only having a drink!!.
One of the most beautiful cities in Europe, maybe the most beautiful.. History, sightseeing, culture, food, fashion, shopping, fun. Simply amazing! Mix of modern and historic.

Simply Stunning. Old Town Square was one of my favourite places in Prague, it has some stunning buildings around it, together with shops, restaurants, an English pub, an Irish bar, Hard Rock Cafe and much more. An absolute must do for any visitor.
Christmas. In the run up to Christmas the old town square looks amazing. Many many stalls added to all of the really nice decorations makes it a must see and do.

Magical. No visit to Prague would be complete without visiting this wonderful location especially with the Christmas market stalls selling an array of gifts and the welcoming hot drinks including mulled wine on the cold winter days a large Christmas tree erected is perfect setting the festive scene and a viewing of the astronomical click is a must what s master piece well worth a visit

Very cool. Spent time here for a few days and its very interesting. Little shops and cafes all over to please any budget. Very economical place to be. It is a common area, so be aware given the activities of terrorism lately
must see. We came to visit the Christmas market and were not disappointed, a great lively atmosphere with loads to see and do

Very interesting area of Prague. I'm sure that the Old Town Square is one of the first places in Prague that visitors head for but the wider Old Town area has so much of interest. We saw quite a bit of in during our recent visit ranging from designer shops, through to restaurants and historic buildings. Well worth strolling through.

Very pretty but somewhat comercialised. Old town is made up of windy cobbled streets and the square itself. The buildings and history are spectacular,this time of year there is a christmas market which is very pretty particularly as it gets dark.

Just beautiful Old Town. The Christmas markets were on and the Christmas tree in the centre was the best Christmas tree I've ever seen. The two towers were lit up and the astronomical clock draws lots of visitors on the hour. Close to bars and restaurants.

A small area packed with history. The old town of Prague is relatively small, but it contains most of what there is to see in the city. It contains the famous Astronomical Clock, Old Town Square, Jan Hus's Monument and the old church, as well as many other interesting attractions. Due to the amount of historical events that took place in that area it is highly recommended to take a guided tour in Prague, which should also cover the Old Town square. In the same square there is a tourists office where you can find daily free tours in English and Spanish (very recommended). There are many restaurants there as well, but I do not recommend them because they are touristic (high prices).

Beautiful but beware at Christmas Markets when buying food!. Be careful if you are at the Christmas markets! I had the Prague old ham on the spit, they charge by weight so it cost about 15 quid and far too much for me. Stick with the hot dogs or ask for a very small portion, I could have fed half the square!
A must when in Prague. Charming old town. Take some time to just sit and relax in the main square with a drink, beer or coffee.
Christmas market. Very popular with tourists but we did not feel pressurised by tourist touts. We also felt very safe and enjoyed the ambiance.

lovely aatmosphere and well preserved. This is my second visit to Prague and I enjoyed it as much as the first.The old town has a lovely atmosphere with beautiful squares, nice small alleyways and well preserved old buildings. It feels and is cultured and has great cafes at really good prices.

Christmas wonderland... :). We enjoyed in the Old Town. We were there during Christmas market and enjoyed eating langos, trdelnik and drinking mulled wine. Christmas tree was amazing. Wonderful music, relaxed atmosphere, great street performers and incredible architecture (astronomic clock) contributes to this amazing atmosphere.
Prague Old Town. Very picturesque and worth a visit. Lots of bars and eating places within the square. Christmas Market late in the year.
Fantastic buildings. It was the biggest (but most expensive!) Christmas Market. Go up the Astrological Clock tower for a great view of Prague.

Great Xmas market in beautiful old square. A great starting place to explore Prague from. With the old town hall clock and incredible St Nicholas Cathedral set amoungst the numerous bars and cafes along with the fabulous xmas tree and xmas market stalls in December this is a great place to while away some time.

A must when visiting Prague. The Old Town is generally the first visitors to Prague visit, unless he or she stays in Mala Strala ( Lesser Town). In this case after visiting the Lesser Town, the Old Town is there on the other side of Charles Bridge. Many landmarks and interesting things to visit. The best thing is to join a walking guided tour. Some of them are free, particularly if you have used the service of Airports Transfer Services. Most of them start at Old Town Square.

An Amazing History. Old Town is the heart of Prague--a great mixture of history and modern, shopping and dining and people watching for days! We spent much of our trip wandering through Old Town and enjoying the sites. Definitely make sure to take time to explore this beautiful section of an amazing European gem.
Old town Prague. Prague is beautiful. It's hilly but worth the breathlessness, good fun especially if you are with someone to share the experience with x

A must for Christmas. We visited for the Christmas markets and we were not disappointed, we ate roasted chestnuts and drank hot chocolate and mulled wine, visited the catacombs by night and climbed the clock tour at dusk.You could hire a Segway, an open top car, horse and cart or just wander around as we did. The new Square, Charles bridge and the Jewish quater are all a short walk away. Get of the Metro at Mustek
Long weekend. Amazing Christmas tree and market with great bars and restaurants all round the square . The astronomic clock is magnificent along with all the buildings

Christmas markets. We enjoyed strolling around the Old Town, browsing the Christmas markets and enjoying the lovely Christmas Tree in the Old Town Square. There is a very good atmosphere - nobody is hassling you to buy.

Lovely place to wander around. The architecture here is fabulous. There is an abundance of Art Nouveau and Art Deco in the area and as you wander the streets you end up with a crick in your neck as you are constantly looking upwards at the wonderful facades. If you go in December as we did the Christmas Fairs are on and you can eat local delights and drink mulled wine as you listen to musicians and watch street performers. Watch the famous clock on the tower in Old Town Square as the hour chimes. Climb the tower for views over the city if you are fit enough. It's a lovely place!
Lovely. Full of charm and even more lovely at Christmas time. The clock is wroth a look and you must see it move every hour.
Very good with Christmas markets. Enjoyed the Christmas markets, with lovely buildings especially Tyn church at night. Astronomical clock interesting.
Beautiful Place. We loved the Old Town - it had loads of atmosphere & bars/restaurants with fantastic heating outside

Charming Christmas . Came to see the Christmas markets and were not disappointed. The town has a lot of character and there is plenty to keep everyone entertained. A multitude of shops, museums, cafes and restaurants.
You won't be bored

Great morning run venue. If you love running, do yourself a favor. Wake up early in the morning and do a run though this area. You can't really get lost because the district is small and there are lots of visible landmarks. Finish the run around 8:30 or 9 and you can enjoy a cup of coffee in one of the local bakeries. Highly recommend it for runners.
Living museum. Walking throughout the streets it feels like walking in a museum with all the great houses and churches
Beautiful. No matter what we were doing we always seemed to end up here. Lots to do, especially at Christmas with the markets.
Beautiful Praha. Remarkable place, beautiful architecture, accessible with public transportation, lots of monuments to see, lots of exchanging offices, lots of restaurant, lots to see :)

Beautiful, full of life and ideal for a weekend trip. I spend first weekend of December in Prague visiting Old Town and Jewish synagogues. The buildings in the Old Town are beautiful, the place is full of people, the churches attract with the classical music concerts. The place is magical both day and night. I would recommend anyone to visit the Prague and if I have a chance I will go there again.
Must see. This is a lively and great square with amazing buildings all around and great Christmas market. Lovely food and of course hot wine, punch and cider

Lose yourself in Old Town (Stare Mesto),Prague. The Old Town, Prague is a wonderful, almost medieval, maze of cobbled streets and alleys, each of which brings new delights from shops, cafes and bars. Many major attractions are contained in this part of the Czech Republic capital all of which will entertain and amuse. The Christmas markets abound, all of which are full of temptations and treats such as mulled wine, trdel ( Czech pastry), koblasa sausage and Prague ham roasting over log fires. Don't be concerned about getting lost - it's part of the enjoyment of a visit there and never lasts long.

Very crowded and busy!. I had always heard great things about Prague and decided that it was a place I wanted to visit for myself. When we first step out into the Old Town Square, I was overwhelmed! It was late morning and jam packed with people. My first thought was "What have I gotten us into!" but just walking around and soaking it all up, was really fun! It was busy, but you can get away from the main Center by walking down one of the many streets that extend away from the Square. We took a guided walking-tour and that really helped us get to know our way around. We did get food on the main square, big mistake. It is awful and pricey. Gave the leftovers to a homeless person. Go elsewhere to get better food.
Magic City. The prague is a historical city. It is magic and beautiful. When you walk in the old city, you feel yourself in past days, not just years but centuries.
Sparkling Christmas lights. Visited during the day and night, but enjoyed it best at night with all the Christmas lights. And enjoyed the Christmas market for the food and craft stalls.
The most beautiful part of city. Old town is the most beautiful part of city. Historical buildings, mysterious lanes have the magic atmosphere.
Medieval beauty. Probably the most romantic spot in Prague. We were here for 4 days in December when Christmas markets filled the area. Wonderful sights and sounds and smells and tastes!

The architecture!. Old Town Square is a great place to stop while visiting Prague. The architecture that surrounds the square is fantastic. It does get packed with tourists but I felt it was just as enjoyable. The seasonal Christmas market has tons of stands to buy locally made crafts and good food for relatively little money. And I suggest stopping at each and every stand that sells hot wine :)

Disneyland for grown ups. Went here beginning of December. The whole are is beautiful with amazing medieval buildings.made even better by the Christmas tree and lights everywhere. A couple of animal mangers and food and Christmas market completed the picture. It was very busy, but could always get a seat in a bar/restaurant.the whole city is walkable and very interesting. It was my first visit and It exceeded all my expectations
Fascinating place . Especially when you see the building across where Albert Einstein lived you travel back in time My favorite place...
Magical place. Old town is the most wonderful place for me in Praga. Is like to be in a fairy tale!! I woul like to return as soon as posible

Beautiful Old Town Square. They had a huge Christmas Market and all kinds of winter festivities in the square. The food unfortunately was not very Veggie or Vegan friendly there! Great atmosphere. Can go up one of the towers and get a birds eye view of the place. Check out the Astronomical Clock there as well.

BEWARE of exchanging money on the street. While everything was going right during my Prague visit, I became victim of organized cheater gang. I went to the currency exchange store and due to long line I came out .Someone approached me and told me to come to his store for exchange. He also quoted similar exchange rate (to avoid suspicion). After few steps, he said Let me give you money right now. So without thinking anything I gave him USD 50. In exchange he gave me around 1400 CZCrona (that is what I thought).It turned out that it was Belarus Ruble (Exchange rate 1 USD = 18000 Belarus Ruble). So I got 10 Cents for 50 USD. I was told about this by restaurant waiter when I confidently put the money I got on the table. He also told me that I was not the first one to be cheated like this.So Enjoy your visit to Prague but NEVER EVER exchange money on the street. Always go to proper currency exchange store (there are plenty). I hope my loss will help you all save your money.

Beautiful but very crowded with tourist during the weekend. The whole area is beautiful and the Christmas markets elaborate (although when you've seen one..) We were lucky with the weather and there's plenty to do see and drink everywhere so you don't need to get bored for a second, regardless of what you like. Downside is there are MANY MANY stores that are only focused on tourists with souvenirs etc which makes it feel a bit unauthentic and doesn't invite the non souvenir people to shop a lot in the old town area
Gothic Old Square. went for the Christmas markets....beautiful.....lots of stalls selling food, drink and goodies.....well worth a visit
Beautiful & walkable. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities we've visited. The Old Town is filled with wonderful sites. Watch out for the cobblestones.

Fantastic . My favourite place in December. ..as always it never disappoints... obviously getting more and more popular due to the crowds...We been visiting for 7 years and love it more and more each time
Xmas in Prague. Fantastic in December with all the market stalls,street entertainers,decorations & Xmas atmosphere so this time of year is most definately worth a visit.
Spectacular. This is an incredible square, especially at night. The Christmas markets were on and the smells and atmosphere just made the square that much more enjoyable
Charming. Prague is like a Fairytale come to live city, the view of Old Town is beautiful at any time of year, but specially in December

Beautiful streets. The old town in Prague was lovely to walk around looking at the old buildings and the lovely cobbled streets the only downside to this place was the over priced souvineers in nearly every shop there the Christmas market was nice to see as well but they were also overpriced all in all its a beautiful place but be careful you don't get robbed
Old Town. The beautiful heart of old Prague...all tourists must go to the centre during their visit...well kept and felt safe.

Came for Christmas markets. After experiencing 5'different German Christmas market, we were pleasantly surprised at this market. Great atmosphere, great food, great people, beautiful location. The pamphlet people as always do my head in but the smells and sounds are worth it

Simply Stunning. Out of all Prague's wonderful sites, we always kept going back to the old town square, as well as having the best Christmas market it had lots of atmosphere and even after we had strolled around again and got our crepes it was nice to pick a spot around the outside and just sit outside - under heaters or blankets with our hot wine and people watch.

A must!. There are only a handful cities as beatiful as Prague - This is a must! Greatly preserved - Make sure you´re not in a rush so you can see both the locals and the tourist and some Street shows!
Christmas markets. Pretty scenery ,atmospheric Xmas market , scents of mulled wine and smoked sausage fill the air mingling with the twinkling lights and magnificent Christmas tree
Great place. There are really interesting architecture around here and various shops and places to eat, great area for vistors and metro isnt to far either :)

Great spot to vist. Must visit location in Praha and the Christmas markets are on right now: forget the restaurants and have a casual dinner in full view of the clock and markets while eating from the vendors. Prague Ham!!!
sights, eating and drinking. lots to see. plenty bars and restaurants. must go up clock tower and visit churches Visited during Christmas market, very good.

Happy to wander around didnt feel over pressed. The old town is a very interesting area to visit, many shops and cafes stress free.We wandered around a lot went up the clock tower and looked down on the Christmas Market Preparations whyich was very interesting. There are so many shops in thyis area that you can easily spend a day there.

busy and crowded with a mini Christmas Market. The old square buildings Re magnificent as are the shops. We va,e for the Christmas a Market which is small. Be prepared for rud3, pushy crowds, and pickpockets
An historic walk. If you like historic buildings, good restaurants and great beer; Look no further. Prague has everything and is perfect for a weekend away from home.

Winter Wonderland. The square is tourist-central but should not be missed. In winter, it has a charming holiday market and the biggest Christmas tree I've seen. On St. Nicholas's Day, the locals bring the kids in for a traditional talk with an angel who happens to be hanging out with the devil. The 2 figures team up to have frank discussions with children about whether they have been naughty or nice, and dole out sweet rewards to kids who were good that year. There are also daily holiday shows and entertainments. That said, I recommend skipping the square on the weekends, too crowded.
avoid crowds going early!. if you add tourists to Christmas market, you have a recipe for crowds. If you want to enjoy the real old town, don't visit in december...
Magic Place! Your own Fairy Tale.. Old Town is a beautiful place. The best is the astronomic clock, the old church and the statue of Jan Hus.

Crowded all year long but always nice and interesting to see. Whenever I come back to this part of Prague I am amazed bij the amount of visitors who are enjoying themselfs in and arrount the town that has so mutch to offer

Fairy tale place with some thieves:). The Old Town is amazing with all the historical buildings and the great atmosphere. A lot of restaurants, bars and museums. The astronomical clock is beautiful and the visit to the old Town Hall very interesting. But some things are upsetting, that you always have to be careful with your belongings, you have to look twice when you exchange your money because they have a bad rate or a big commission, like 28% ( there is a fare exchange on Narodni street, close to Karol Bridge, a blue one, but always ask how much CZK you get in exchange for your money, before you give them your money). It is better to pay with your credit card rather then euros, they have a bad exchange rate in shops. If you are on a budget, don't go on restaurant on the main streets. There are some nice restaurants in Jewish quarter too. If you can overlook the bad exchange rate ( and I suggest you do) you can have an amazing time in Prague, its a magical city!
Christmas markets. A beautiful square which looks just magical all set up for the Christmas markets. It's like another world, pure magic. Beautiful

Stunning ...as ever. Quite simply one of the most wonderful wandering areas in the world, justifying the trip from the UK alone. The last time I came in December it was -5c. This time +5 and more with beautiful winter sunshine and no wind to add to the bonus. Just a fantastic place to spend a few days in December. Christmas so much more tasteful that the UK festival of greed. a wonderful Christmas market.

The Allure of Old Town with the Festive Mood of the Christmas Holidays. The Old Town exemplifies the beauty of Prague. Rich in architecture and history to be enjoyed by all. The many Christmas Stalls adds to the festive holidays which make it a "Must See" for any one visiting Prague, Suggest going in the evening to fully appreciate all the Christmas Lighting and Decor...Magnificent. Take you time to enjoy the many sights...
Christmas Markets. Beautiful architecture, with the added delight of the Christmas markets made this a very special vacation.

Awesome Old Town . There's nothing like this anywhere else in the world. I highly suggest you stay near this place bc that is where everything is happening for the most part. I wouldn't eat anywhere near there bc they are super expensive. Venture out of that area for food.

Must see.. Feature attraction in old town. Everyone must go here and look at the churches the Square and of course the clock. We went during the Christmas festivals and there is a wide variety of food. Shopping is excellent and entertain is very good

just WOW!!!. i felt in love with prague by the moment we entered the old town square...incredible well preserved..we visited during the christmas market, you MUST go to prague at least once in your lifetime...
So beautiful. It was decorated for Christmas and was stunning even without the decorations this area would be beautiful.

The most beautiful building I have ever seen in one city. Seeped in history Old town is such an interesting place think I had a crick in my neck looking up at all the tall beautiful buildings, it was a short walk fro our hotel and we were surprised at the vast selection of shops including M & S , C & A , and others to numerous to mention. Plenty nice café to sit and watch the world go by , and all fro free

Great architecture but Christmas market not the best. Fantastic architecture everywhere plus the unusual Astronomical Clock. Nothing special about the Christmas Market - German ones much better (larger and higher quality)
Xmas markets. Very nice the clock is a must to see on the hour very clean plenty of places to eat and drink if a bit prices
Christmas market with all sorts of fare to be sampled,. Gets rather crowded, especially as the hour is about to strike. School children sang carols and performed a nativity play.
Magical. Not to be missed at night. The Christmas tree was magnificent and the atmosphere was wonderful. Absolutely stunning.
A compact town. Best seen by walking through the many side streets. Many unique houses and shops. The crystal seen in some of the shops is mind boggling in variety and quality.
Amazing. Breath taking vicinity, beautiful surrounding arcitechture and is the epitomy of Eastern European beauty. Various elite (but very affordable) restaurants surrounding

Christmas markets. Old Town has beautiful architecture and most of the attractions are close together and within easy walking distance. Some of the street have loose cobblestones which can be hazardous. It is cheap to eat out, but I found souvenirs to be much more expensive than other cities.

Beauty. I am happy, that I can live in this amazing city, but on the other side, as I am Czech I have to admit, that sometimes too many tourists there... I can recommend Terasa U Prince, which is very nice for drink with amazing view.
Christmas Delight. Lovely big square decorated for Christmas with large central tree and loads of stalls selling festive goods, food and drink. Terrific atmosphere puts you in festive mood.

Same Old, Same Old. Never been a great fan of European Old Towns and this was no different. A mixture of Blackpool-style souvenir tat and tourist-priced food and drink rescued only by some nice buildings and good transport links to quieter parts. Caters for the 24-hour stag and hen trade which probably tells you all you need to know.
Like stepping back in time!. The Old Town is beautiful...however we had my mother in a wheelchair, which does not mix well with cobble stones!
Romantic. Definitely one of the most beautiful historical sight in Europe, between the ancient buildings and magnificent churches - experience was out of this world.

Lovely. Old Town is everything I love about Prague: it has an old European feel to it, with lots of cobble stoned streets to explore and get lost in, dozens of cafes and restaurants to discover, gorgeous architecture (you have to look around, above you, and sometimes even behind you to not miss some amazing building or house), and loads of charm. Don't rush yourself through here - take your time, walk around, and take it all in. (It's obviously more fun when there are fewer tourist crowds).

Visiting when it was the Xmas markets, truly memorable!!. When considering where to go for this years city break my wife and decided to go later in the year and for an xmas markets. Having conducted some research into where we should go we decided on Prague.On arrival at the old town square you are not disappointed. Stalls a plenty, xmas spirit evident in all locals/travellers, giant xmas trees. It is something that needs to be seen/experienced.
The actual Prague. Prague is never complete without visiting the Old Town. It will take you to the era of Royals and elegant architecture.

Great place to wander around. As others have mentioned it does get very busy around the old town square but you have to wander off in any direction for a couple of hundred yards and you find relative calm. There are plenty oo places to eat and drink around the square but be aware that you will pay almost double for food and rink there. Walk 5 minutes in any direction and you will be rewarded by one of the many small bar and restaurants that exist in hidden little alleyways. Prague is a great place for a weekend getaway. I can't wait to go back again.

A wonderful place to sit and have a coffee and watch that amazing clock. The Old Town is fantastic. Take the time to wander and preferably take a walking tour. There are plenty of places to stop and have a drink or a coffee and watch the world go by.

Beautiful. I have loved to walk with my boyfriend in this place. We have been lucky because the last weekend of November the Christmas markets opened and made the atmosphere perfect in this ancient city. Each hour is possible to see the tower clock's show.

Place to be . Must visit location when in Prague
One shud be ready to walk a lot
Very authentic and good shopping place and eat some of the authentic local dishes.

THE top one touristic place in PRAHA. a nicr place to spend a full day cruising around
Full of tourists so watch out and keep your money hidden.
Too touristy.. Too touristy. We did not get a good feel for the city, even though we stayed three days. Perhaps outlying areas of the city might be more engaging.

Old medieval times are felt. The view of Prague from the top of the astronomical clock in the evening was amazing. The astronomical clock was nice to view being the oldest (still existing) and functioning astronomical clock especially the way the skeleton rings the bell and the others nod their head. The meaning of it can be read when you come down the astronomical clock along the stairs. The Christmas market was nice and had different things compared to what I see usually in Germany. The Christmas tree was very very beautiful. The feeling of Christmas was everywhere because of the people singing Christmas songs that could be heard around.
Amazing Clock. Very busy area but a stunning clock. Great square for food and drink even better when the Christmas Markets are on. Stunningly pretty.
Beutiful landmark. This is a bit of a walk uphill but its a beautiful part of Prague. The parliament building are there and worth going if not just to see the changing of the guard.
Beautiful around Christmas!. Beautiful area full of cute shops, nice markets and beautiful buildings. Especially during Christmas time this is very worth the visit.

It's definitely Chrismas. Visited for Christmas Markets with friends, very festive. Brilliant atmosphere, stunning Christmas tree and decorations. Market stalls very similar food, Christmas baubles and crafts but what can you expect at a Christmas Market. The Old Town is worth a visit any time of the year but it's particularly stunning at Christmas.
Wonderful buildings. Architecture is beautiful, visit for the Christmas markets you will not be disappointed. numerous small streets and shopping, food and drink for everyone.
Stunning Architecture. A must do is to climb the clock tower for great view. Bar prices in tourist area are low compared to uk, but far better value if taking a short walk to get out of tourist area.
lots to offer. The old town has lots of interesting buildings, sites and statues. Also the restaurants, bars and terrasses offer a good Place to rest Your feet while checking the cultural sights

A place to go for everybody. Prague is a great place to go with friends or family. The Old Town is very pretty to wander around the small streets, go shopping or stop for one of the great Czech beers. The prices are quite cheap and you can find very cool pubs and bars and restaurants in between. I love going there from time to time.

Exquisite. Worth exploring day and night. The view of the astronomical clock is best from the 2nd floor Mozart cafe int he hotel directly opposite. Get a table by the windows, timed for at least 20 minutes before the hour strikes....and enjoy with a hot chocolate unlike anything you have ever tasted!

Bustling Old Town Square. . The churches, astronomical clock and Christmas market in the town square create an old world feel and ambience that make for a pleasurable outing with friends and family. There's something for everyone- history, shopping and loads of great food and drink.

Beautiful place!. Prague is lovely and this is the heart of it; great things to see and do, and lots of interesting people performing. There is also lots of great things to eat!!! This includes the czech dumplings (like bread) and the tubular donuts.
