Super Christmas Market. A lovely tourist spot in the Old Town. Christmas Market was super - lots of traditional smells, stalls and food!

Prague Old Town... A must see. Different from the many other European countries, this well preserved old town part is a must see... You should take a walk through the streets, visit the local shops and smell the magical atmosphere!
Christmas Markets 2015. We enjoyed the square Christmas Markets and seeing the Clock! Unfortunately we didn't have time to go in the town hall.
Christmas. we went when the Christmas markets where on it was magical, plenty of restaurants and Bars, lovely little cobble lanes and beautiful churches
A classicial city. Smell fresh air....walk till you break....some beer or hot chocolate. Nightlife is the best here. Don't miss to walk here.
Charming and historical. Old Town, history-laden, maintains its charm and reverence for its storied past. A good tour guide can tell fascinating stories behind the sights.

Beautiful town hall and church tower.. Please pay the 120 czks to go up the clock tower. The views are worth it and there are lifts if you don't want to tackle the stairs. It can be very busy once you are up there but well worth it for the pictures.
color full. The place is buzzing with Traveller's always and place is so color full and has amazing ambience with horse ridden carts and old vintage cars to take you for a ride around old town

Very beautiful town!. Loved walking around the streets enjoying drinking hick hot chocolate and gluhwein! think it perfect visit Prague at this month enjoying christmas atmosphere, did segway tour highly recommanded
Must visit!. Tha whole city is a jewel! but this sqaure takes your breath away! one time to visit is not enought!
Picturesque Square with heaps of history. Visited several times during our stay in Prague. It is the heart of the town and all roads lead to it. Great atmosphere.

Charming charming and more charming. Prague is such a beautiful city, full of history and varied architecture. The heart of Prague is Old Town, and it's certainly a must. It can be crowded so start early and of course be careful for pickpockets: we had been warned ahead of time that the crowds and pickpockets go together; better to be safe than sorry.

Great place. Great place to be full of tourist and their was a Christmas market going on there you can walk through and buy there stuff. There were loads of things around to keep you busy. Well worth a visit.
Lovely to walk around but keep hold of your bags. Nice enough bridge but overrated. Any of the bridges will give you a good view of the river but nice to walk down and see everything.
Best architecture I've seen. Old Prague has some of the best architecture I've seen. Much of western Europe was destroyed during WWII, Prague remains much the same from the Renaissance. Amazing

Christmas market. We visited old town at the end of November, just when Prague Christmas market begun. It is a beautiful place with tasteful decorations and nice things to buy. If you are in Prague a visit to the Christmas market is a must.

Wonderful day and night. This is what you will remember about your trip to Prague. The buildings, the people,the smells and sounds of the Christmas market. The tree is one of the best you will see anywhere in the world.
I just can't get enough of this place!
Absolutely beautiful in every way
Beautiful!. Old town Prague is beautiful, especially at night when the buildings are lit. Great place to stroll around and take in the city!
Lovely place but very busy. We visited for the Christmas markets but could hardly get near the stalls as the whole square was chockablock.

Go for Christmas!. We were lucky to be here while the spectacular Christmas market was in full swing. The food and mulled wine were to our liking. We climbed to the top of the famous tower and were rewarded with the best view of our trip. Stay for the show at the clock tower. This location is not to be missed.

Stroll through well preserved history. Lovely day walking through various parts of Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. The castle is well preserved, but is empty of furnishings. It would be great to see it refurbished to former splendor, and that may come with time.
Great Christmas feeling. We had a great time in the square,especially because the christmas market was there and you could try the local goods.

Romantic city and Friendly people. Prague, a beautify city is suitable any kind traveler who is leisure or business. you can take half days route tour at old town and visit castle at mountain side. if you have more time I suggest walking on the river side in the early morning . I wish have a long stay on future. I plan to visit Prague on April 2016. Really like the city. 布拉格，一個美麗的城市，適合任何類型的旅客誰是休閒或商務。你可以採取半天遊覽路線，在老城區，參觀城堡山腰。如果您有更多的時間，我建議走在清晨的江邊。我希望有一個長期留在未來。我計劃訪問布拉格月2016年真的很喜歡這個城市。

Quaint little narrow streets with wonderful cafes, restaurants and bars tucked away.. We loved just wandering around the narrow streets of Old Town. Its a great place to get lost in! Lots of interesting little shops and cafes to explore and great for taking photos.
City Centre..!!. Its the very centre of the city..lively..nice restraunts, and pubs, the astronomical clock, shops..everything from here..!!
just stand and take it in. magnificent buildings and places to visit, only becomes better at night making some towers look like fairy tale castles

Beautiful Old Town Square in Prague. We first did a walking tour of the Old Town of Prague and were so fascinated by the beautiful old buildings that we decided to go back to the square for lunch at the Christmas market that they had just set up. Lost to see.
Beloved City. Great place, happy, full of people. Street performances, street food, good restaurants beautiful squares

Beautiful at night. Very beautiful in the day even more beautiful at night with everything set up for the Christmas market it truely is a stunning place,
Pay the £3 to go up the clock tower for amazing views (there is a lift)
Also an great pizzeria called Giovanni's is just off the square amazing pizza and cheap between £4 to £6
romantic and unforgettable. just throw away your map and get lost here, best way to experience prague old town. we come here and never got bored.
heart of the city. its a wonderful square which makes you mad about the beauty of Architecture.i spent 1 hour here. to feel it. a must visited place. top view of the old center can make you crazy.

Amazing. The Old Town is the main focal point and meeting place. Most walking tours start from the tourist office here.
All the restaurants are busy and the street stalls selling food of all kinds.
Very good. I loved it. It was filled with beautiful buildings and surprises around each corner. The atmosphere was good too. It was a great place just to roam around.

Visit here! Girls... NO HIGH HEELS. Beautiful area to visit with lots of little side streets and spots of history. I'd recommend going on a free walking tour (specifically the HostelCulture one) to find out the history of the area and local buildings. TOP TIP - Ladies... do NOT bring high heels to Prague. It's unavoidable to be around cobbled pavements about 90% of your trip. Because of this, hardly any women wear heels so you won't stand out. Don't ruin your trip trying to look good as you will injure yourself and will frankly look pretty silly trying to walk.

Very nice place in Prague. Old town in Prague is really nice place with many pubs and sightseeings, but many tourists mean big prices in pubs (sometimes is better to find pub not on main street, but small side street) and I afraid of snatchers. But it´s not Prague problem, it´s problem of all places with many people.

Cold but Warm. Prague is incredibly beautiful and old town is I think the place to be. If you like music from Vivaldi to cover bands playing Beatles music. Or street bands playing monk music Prague is all about culture and music and a culinary scene. It's a bit chilly so bring a scarf but get prepared to be warmed up by Czech hospitality.

Can't visit Prague without seeing the Old Town. I don't think you could really visit Prague without at least walking through the Old Town. It's very pretty and has some beautiful buildings. Nice to sit in a cafe with a mulled wine and watch the square. Just missed out on seeing everything set up for Christmas, as they were testing the Christmas lights on the tree on our last night - I can imagine how lovely that would have been. Recommend doing a tour if you have a chance, to learn a bit about the town.
Beautiful achitecture. Clean streets, helpful locals, when wandering, keep looking up to se the 2 black towers and they will always guide you back to the centre.

Your Eyes will Thank You. This location is truly a visual overload. The architecture is absolutely stunning and this time of year there is a wonderful Christmas village and Christmas tree setup! We visited at night and it was so beautiful. The cobblestone walkways are unreal. No cars to deal with through this area so it's very safe for walking.
The Old town area is very interesting.. I suggest taking a tour to fill in the questions you may have. There is so much to see, you won't know where to look.

I love the Astronomical clock!. The Astronomical clock was the reason I visited the Old Town Square everyday I was in Prague! It was built in the 11th century, and the history behind it is just fascinating! I am so glad it is still here til this day!

Prague is beautiful. The town is full of history and the old town of prague in the middle of europe brings it all.if you like to walk you will love it as it very big and you have a lot to see. there are many typical restaurant the I would have loved to do but not enough time next time.

Xmas preparations. This time of year was perfect to visit the old town square as the christmas market l, decorations and tree were being put up. To see these without the hustle and bustle of the Christmas market tourists was great. There are many beautiful buildings in the square aswell as some great restaurants with outside seating that allows for some amazing views whilst having a drink or bite to eat. The restaurants in the square are more expensive than those on the outskirts however food and service are always.to the highest quality. It would be hard not to take a visit to the square during your visit to Prague!

Incredible!!. One of the most beautiful things I've ever seen, it's amazing during the day and even better at night! It tells you the time of the day and also the position of the sun and the moon since 1410!! Definitely a MUST see in this incredible city!

Let yourself wander. We found it best to enjoy the Old Town by just wandering around without a destination. Just experience it and imagine what's like in the old days. The streets are lovely. Look up from time to time to appreciate the buildings.

Amazing architecture and atmosphere. The view from the square to Kostel Matky Boží před Týnem is the best. Its my favorite church in Prague and perhaps Europe. Its spires seem magical like something from a fairy tale. Also from Nov 26-Dec 25 there is a great Christmas market here. Urs a definite must-see in League.
Magic. Walk around the old town is a magic experience, but you have to avoid all the tourist. The city is full of magic and the architecture and the history is still alive in there.
Tour. Great place to visit while in Prague, and you can walk, no need for public transportation. A must visit

Lovely time of year. Lovely square especially at this time of year now the Christmas market stalls are up and the amazing Christmas Tree is alight with huge star on top. Recommend a hot mulled wine with a spicy sausage from one of the market stalls to keep out the chill.

Love the charm. This was my first visit to Prague and I will miss it. I love the charm, the energy and can't wait to visit again. Great atmosphere with cafes, shops and disappointed I will miss the Christmas market.
quite a busy place. The square was busy when I was there even though it was raining a bit. It is a social gathering place with plenty to see, do, and eat. Have your camera ready at all times.
Worth visiting!. The most beautiful part of the town! However, crowded with turists. It is worthy to look in side streets as well.

Beautiful square - featuring Xmas tree. For late November the square is still packed with tourists.
Large Xmas tree in place due to be lit soon.
Square surrounded by many restaurants, cafes, street entertainers
A must see in beautiful Prague

Must see in Prague. A little like going to Venice and not seeing st marks square. This is a beautiful sight especially at night. Safe area to walk around, great views and worth the walk from your hotel
Beautiful place. well worth a visit lots to do and loads of places to eat/drink. can get very busy..... because of recent troubles lots of police presence

Enchanting Square. We visited 4 times - twice during the day and twice at night and managed to see something new each time.
An enchanting square!
Fabulous. Already done. Read my review of grandior hotel. It should help you to decide. Prague is a great city.
Great old town. Very impressive as well as full of everything you'd expect - history, food, street artists, views, etc. enjoy.
One not to be missed. Very easy to access. A few old churches to visit. Historical astronomical clock with a moving figures every full hour.

Busy Place. Busy square, plenty happening in and around the square.
walking tours meet in this area. Plenty of restaurants all around the square.
A must to see. Everything about this city is beautiful and well worth a visit. Don't think you could do it in 2 days though

When in Prague, surely allow time to visit.. Excellent place, history could be felt here. Come to see the astronomical clock, head up to the tower of the City Hall, enjoy the buskers performing...Surely visit for Xmas market.
What you come for. Excellent architecture and worth a second visit as you see more each time you come. It brings old Prague alive and you can image what life must have been like then.

MAGICAL!!!!!!!!. This was my favorite section in Prague. The architecture is simply breathtaking with Medieval charm. The structures include Gothic and Baroque design. Felt like I was in fairy tale heaven. Tyn Church, the Astronomical Clock and Old Town Square are a few of the elements in Old Town. The very clean and winding cobblestone streets were bustling with very fashionably dressed people, creating such a wonderful rhythm to the city. There are many places to eat, shop, tour or simply watch street performers. Be sure to take your camera!

Lots & lots of tourists.... But a definite must see in Prague. If you avoid the middle of the day it's less overwhelming. Much easier to walk around, visit shops, sights etc. Easier to find tables at cafes/restaurants etc.Do take in a concert if you have the time - this is Prague! Land of music...the Segway tours are hugely popular & a great way to cover a lot of ground, especially if you have trouble walking for extended periods. We saw all ages on segways - wish we had tried it.
Meeting PLACE. It all happens in the OLD TOWN it seems 2 be a meeting place for ALL from early morning 2 late in the evening lots 2 see then people move on then others meet and move on A MUST VISIT
Amazing!!!. This is a must see in Prague, we didn't use a guild because we just missed the last tour. Guild would have been very useful.
stunning. beautiful buildings everywhere clean tidy and not a beggar insight and great metro system to get around easily
Beautiful. Like a fairytale city of old, the old town is amazing with so many sights, sounds and colours. Loved my visit.

Wonderful og magic Old Town. With wonderful old buildings, a lot of restaurants, many museums, great hotels, a lot of people, shops and attractions all mass. You need minimum 3 whole days to come around. Dont forget the jewish quarter! In the evening: Enjoy a blues concert at the jazzclub Reduta or a classic concert in Rudolfino!

Sights and life. For the tourist ,old town!
Easy to navigate,history all around and good resturants at a price!!
Try to explore,drink and eat!

So beautiful!. I loved to spend the day in the city! every corner is special and magical!
all the small shops , restaurants and cafes are so great!

Wonderful, gothic, bohemian place to see.. This is just a lovely place to walk around. There are great shops, bars, restaurants and most striking are the buildings and landmarks. Quirky details and architectural/structural mistakes make this unique and just add to the special mix. The astronomical clock tower that doesn't quite work, the mis-matched towers, we just loved the old town and just can't wait to go back. Segways horses and carriages, Paris Street and eating dinner at midnight in the square with blankets draped over you. Entertainment, people from all over the world. Just a beautiful, thriving city.
Of course you have to come here!. Beautiful spot which is the center of Prague. Incredible history, buildings, along with food and often musicians or other performers.
The center of Prague. The main plaza in town. A lot to see and eat and absorb. The astronomical clock is in this area and a must see.
Beautiful. Stunning architecture and plenty to see and do. Very clean given the volume of traffic. Definitely take a look around.

The Heart of Town for Tourist. It is mostly tourist here but you can feel the heart of the city beat here. The buildings are beautiful. You can walk around and have a drink in one of the many cafes in the square. I enjoyed just absorbing the ambias.

Beautiful place to while away a few hours. Excellent spot to sit and watch the buskers. Lots of places to eat and enjoy the local beer!
The architecture in the square is remarkable with one of the most beautiful church towers to be seen, truly out of a fairy tale! A must see!
Beautiful city. I think this was our favourite spot in Prague. Easy to get to and not hilly so ideal for walkers of all abilities.

What an interesting place. Our river cruise started with 3 days in Prague, about which I knew very little before our visit. The old town is fascinating. Lots to see and do. We ended up going to concerts every night. Wanted to go out on a boat ride on the river but ran out of time. We were advised to avoid the taxis, as drivers likely will take advantage of tourists. We found Prague to be very walkable.
"Breathtaking at night.". Wonderful square, a must see. Particularly beautiful at night. I enjoyed sitting in one of many coffee shops just enjoying the view.

WOW!!. Really loved this part of Prague! You can climb a lot of stairs to get to the top to see this view in the picture. Definitely worth doing. very touristy. Some great bars and restaurants surrounding
Old Town (Stare Mesto). There is no shortage of food to eat, people to watch or things to do in Old Town. The buildings are beautiful and it's a great place to just walk around.

Beautiful square. Lovely square with some beautiful restaurants with outdoor seating and heaters which are perfect for people watching. The astronomical clock attracts large crowds every hour and you can go up to the top of the tower for great views of the whole of Prague. Lots of street entertainers which give it a lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful architecture, vibrant atmosphere. Everywhere you turn you're faced with beautiful architecture. Vibrant, friendly atmosphere. Cafes are more expensive in old town square - be sure to check prices before you sit down.
Nice walkaround. As any other historical center, many small streets, a lot of tourist traps and stores. Nice to have a walk until the Charles bridge and get lost on this narrow streets.

Magnificent. We walked round the old town and were in awe at some of the buildings. Not only were they very nice to look at but architecturally very good. Even though the weather was not very good the Old Town was well worth going round.
One of the top beautiful cities in Europe. Always been on my to-do list to visit Prague and I definitely do not regret it. we had a major time there with perfect weather in november!

A must see. Can't go past this place while in Prague, one of the best Old Town Squares in Europe....but just be careful of the all the ripoffs, every store in this area and surrounds are basically tourist traps and as such you can expect to pay triple the price for food drinks and souvenirs
Love this City. Love this city and every time I visit I learn more about it and find some more hidden history and places to see.

Secret in city hall. The square is beautiful. Get to the top of the clock to see the town and around. If you want to see the apostols from inside go to city hall and pay a little fee. Nobody knows so it's just you.
Beautiful typical European Old Town. Prague's city center has this typical European old town look and feel. It looks very clean and feels safe.

Just to stay.... One of the wonderful place in Europe... a lot of restaurant, people, and the historical buildings all around. For taking a drink or just sitting not so far of the Hus' monument... More than 500 years of history...

Marvelous Staroměstské náměstí — at Old Town Square, Prague. This is one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe. Crossing the Old Town Square we loved its ancient buildings and magnificent churches last October. At the centre of the Old Town Square is the Jan Hus statue, erected on the 6th July 1915 to mark the 500th anniversary of the reformer’s death.To fully appreciate the beauty of the Old Town Square climb the Old Town Hall Tower for a stunning view over the square. We had a great time there, admiring the buildings and churches over a hot chocolate at one of the pavement cafés lining the square. Amazing place to visit.
Full of energy place. a very active place as we was traveling around and we entered one of the wax houses we had a good time there

Very beautiful, atmospheric, full of history.. We spent a week in Prague and visited the square every day. It is great to see at different times of the day and evening. Beautiful buildings and churches, great buskers (jazz, classical violinists, etc) and wonderful to just sit and soak up the atmosphere. The square has a huge place in the history of Prague,even to today, where it is still a place for citizens to rally about issues. It is a tourist hotspot, but the people selling horse and carriage rides and vintage car rides are not too intrusive. There is not the hard sell that you Se in other places. The square is the number one must see place in Prague.

marvelous city!. It impressed me with a big number of old architecture of different periods in one place! Gothic, baroque, modernism and post-modernism, cubism, etc. - it is even hard to innumerate. And all the buildings are in a very good shape. Definitely, it is one of my most favorite places in Europe now.

Magical Place. One of the most beautiful places we have ever visited. Beautiful buildings full of character and a lifetime of history. Each one individual in its own right. Fabulous atmosphere from all aspects with good food and drinks on offer from cafes restaurants and street vendors. Beautiful aromas from hot wine and local delicacies.
Quaint old town. Shopping, restaurants, winding cobblestone streets, crowds, smells of cinnamon chimney cakes, and glittering Bohemian crystal displays. Of course you should go.

Lovely, but spooky at night.... This is a must for everyone who comes to Prague. But avoid climbing (yes) the streets at night. Prague is somewhat spooky at night times... or least don't go there alone :)
magical. If you love travel and even if not, drop everything and go to Prague. its that simple. have been there only twice but I plan to return.

Favorite. My favorite square in Prague. At night, it seems, that all magic and fairy tales are alive. And in early morning there are nobody, ans you can enjoy with beauty of architecture of buildings. I wanted to return and return again to there...
Like a box of sweets !. Beautiful town and beautiful view . Everywhere you look you can see something interesting . Not to be missed!

Fun location with great history. We initially visited the Old Town Square on a tour and stopped to learn about the astronomical clock, which is very cool! We made several return visits to check out the restaurants and to pass through on our way to various locations. Definitely a must see on any visit.

What a place! Don´t miss. We got it at nigth due to other appointments, but it was open until 23:00! Very nice to see, unfortunately not so good to take pictures, mas all in all an impressive piece of art and engineering. It is a must see, if you have only 2 hours in Praga: Carlos Bridge and Old Town!

A Very Walkable Old Town. The Staré Mêsto district in Prague is not too compact but small enough to navigate round by foot in one day. If you start from the Powder Gate (Prašna Brána) a Gothic tower which separates the Old Town from the New Town, you can work your way down Celetná Ulice with its rows of 17-18th century large Baroque buildings. This leads to a large square, Staromêstské Námêsti, which dates from the 12th century. The Square's standout feature is probably the 600-year-old Astronomical Clock with its hourly demonstration from its apostolic figures. From here you can walk further north to explore the Jewish quarter (Josefov) or west towards the Charles Bridge, passing many fine Baroque buildings & the magnificent Charles Tower itself.

Stand on paving stones laid in the 10th century. To stand in the Old Town Square is to stand in the center of a condensed form of the history of this wonderful country. Everything from the horror or the slaughter of the Protestant aristocracy in the 17th century to the majesty of Tyn Cathedral and the monument of Jan Hus, who led a reformation which pre-dated Martin Luther's by 100 years. The sense of history here is palpable--you will be standing on paving stones that were laid in place in the 10th century.

Best of Prague. Top place to visit in the city. Here you'll find all of the biggest sights as well as unique shops and restaurants. Beware big crowds and scammers around every corner. Just ignore the others and enjoy the history.

what a beautiful place to be in and spend your time. just being there makes you feel energised. so much vibe and goodness all over. a fashion parade of all sorts with people dressed up in the finest. Morning to night. its just buzzing with people, GOOD FOOD... hmmmm , oh just remembered my meals with the cold weather being the cherry to my cake. breathtaking architecture and the lovely tonga's ... cant wait to get back...

Beautiful City. Old town Square is surrounded by beautiful Architecture and history.there is something for everyone weather young or old.For those less physically able don't let going to the clock tower put you off as there are elevators fitted for ease, it is definitely worse a look.
Saturday Delight. really enjoyed the Saturday town squared filled with locals and tourists. There was all types of local entertainment.A safe and pleasant day.
Lots to see. Old Town is beautiful.Lots to see. Would recommend getting a Prague Card which gives free entry or discount to many places.

Highlight of a trip to Prague. This is a must see for any tourist to Prague. The astrological clock, charming cafes and historical buildings are not to be missed. Go back after dark to see how beautiful it is when all lit up.

Very impressive. The old town is so impressive, the buildings are amazing and the clock tower is great. Its easy to find. There are lots of restaurants around the square. There is also lots of tours available, street entertainers and Segway tour guides. In the evening it is really pretty all lit up.
buzzing with people. watch the clock at midday, the mummers and try not to get run down by the guys on their segways whilst eating smoked ham and drinking mulled wine.

Outstanding City Square. Our first visit to Prague was most enjoyable. One of the highlights is the Old Town Square. With the astonomical clock, town hall tower, Tyn and St. Nicholas churches, there is plenty to see. Many restaurants surround the square with others a short distance away. Street performers are numerous. The square is a must for anyone visiting this wonderful city.
This is a must. In Prague Old Town is a must to see. Old Town has many historic sites along with lots of excellent restaurants.
A MUST!. Its like stepping back in time. I have been here 5 times over the years. I cherish these walks in the old city.

family trip. it is so beautiful there with the gothic arcitecture and cobblestone streets. so many amazing places to eat and to shop and if you go around easter or christmas they have so much more to do in the square. we were lucky enough to go 2 years ago for christmas and it was amazing. i have been there 7 times now and this may 2016 will be my 8th.

panoramic architecture. A must see. Such a beautiful place, the architecture is amazing as well as the history. Fantastic panoramic views from the top of the clock tower (tip, take the lifts up and walk down). Visit St Nicolas's church the interior and Chandelier are breath taking.There are lots of entertainers in the square and they are all very good. People gather on the hour to see the Anatomical clock (watch out for pick pockets) which is hyped up but at the same time worth a look.

Relaxing en fun. The old town is like being throw back into history. The astronomical clock, Tynchurch, townhall, everything within walking distant. There are many different kind of restaurants and bars so if you don't like local food you can have a pizza, pasta or a burger. Different kind of streetartists make the OldTownsquare a great place to stay for a while.

Just beautiful. Beautiful Prague here at its best. Just stop and stand and take it all in and if you are able visit during the day and then again after dark when the sights are breath taking. Very often some kind of street performance going on as well.
Excellent. You must go here. Its in the city centre where the real Prague exists. You can walk to other parts of the main attraction from here.

This is the beginning. Any tourist to this beautiful city of Prague (pronounced as Praha in local) should start the visit from here. It has a huge square in the middle surrounded by breathtaking buildings of different architecture. There is a large statue of Jan Hus, a famous religious reformer. You will find most of the guided walking (free of paid) tours beginning from this place. Be ready to explore unique on-street entertainment. The square has the world famous (though amazingly complex) astronomical clock located on one of the corners of the place. Best time to start is early morning when it will be generally less crowded. Or you can come to this place during the close of trip, where you will find some benches to sit, relax and watch beautiful monuments and buildings surrounding the square.
Romantic scenic and lovely.. One of the lovliest places in EU. clean, easy to navigate, the atmosphere is amazing, and there are many places to visit, eat/drink and shop.

Holiday trip fun but icy. We had a great time as this was our 3rd trip to Prague but the first during the Christmas time. There were multiple markets and events for the season. We arrived by train with an easy transition to the old town. Excellent signage with little to no language barrier. While there were other guest, it was not as packed as it is during the summer. In addition to the glockenspiel which I love to watch, with pre planning you can attend multiple events from the ballet and concerts, many of the churches had free holiday and classical music concerts. The town square was full of small displays and vendors. My favorite was the Christmas Tree with a fantastic light system which was enhanced by the twinkling of the lights on the ice. As the people left due to the weather, I found this one of the most enjoyable times and made you think you were back in time. We had expected snow and it started out as that but it changed to sleet and freezing rain. Merchants and businesses were focused on meeting the needs of the customers from rugs and external heaters to lending umbrellas with the request to drop back off when it was not needed. The only challenge was the train system. Due to the ice, trains were significantly delayed. It was a challenge to determine what was happening I can not wait for my return. I do have to say that Prague holds a special place for me as my family is descendants of the Hussites and going there help me to understand the religious history of my family.
Short break Prague. The old town is full of old and magical looking buildings with lots of market stalls ,shops ,cafe`s, lots of great photo opportunities here.
good. typicall old town in a city that wasn't destroyed by WWII. You can see the astronomical clock there..
Amazing sightseeing . One of the most beautiful places in Prague. Must to see, especially if you go to the tower nearby, because the view is breathtaking.

Open air museum. The old town of Prague is an open air museum. Succession of buildings of different architecture: renaissance, gothique, baroque, new baroque etc. It is full of various attractions: churches, cathedrals, museums, bars and restaurants, etc. It is one of the best historic districts that I have had to visit in Europe.

State Mesto. There's just so much to see and do in this historic part of Bohemia. Every street has history written across. Best to walk through Old Town, soak in the atmosphere, sit in any of the restaurants or street side cafes or bars to rest your tired feet and be ready for more. Its an experience of a lifetime!
A nice walk. The castle surely worth a visit. Old spirit, nice views over the city and Vltava. The only suggestion - avoid the restaurants, as they are overpriced and not interesting/tasty at all!

Beautiful during the day, breathtaling at night. A beautiful city to walk and enjoy the sights and people, small compact and easy to navigate. Be sure to spend some time at night to view the city lights and share a cup of espresso or a glass of wine! A very relaxing venue

The most beautiful old city center. A huge square with many restaurants and shops. Lots of activity in the square and people playing music and doing juggling and figures dressed up. Clock in the square is hundreds of years old and works perfectly

Beautiful, historic Prague. The astronomical clock mesmerizes, if you can get past the crowds. This is a great walking city, and you can also take convenient trams up to the Senate and the other sights on the hill. Excellent restaurants of every stripe, and almost everyone in the customer-facing tourism industries (concert hall, restaurants, hotels, tours) speaks excellent English and is both warm and welcoming. We cannot wait to return.

Must visit. If you are visiting Prague you must have a wander around the quaint streets of the Old Town. Everywhere there is lovely architecture and nice little shops.
The area feels very safe and easy to spend a couple of hours just wandering.

Busy square. Walk up from Charles bridge, lovely churches to go into . Astronomical clock worth seeing but look for the crowd of people the clock does not face the square and go up the tower to see the square .
Beautiful and Interesting. One of my favorite parts of our trip. It was very crowded but the buildings and architecture were well worth the people.

So nice.... The old town is so nice. Beautiful architecture, art, small craft shops, authentic restaurant will bring you back into the past. At every step you will feel the aroma Trdelnik, traditional cakes. Be sure to try :) The streets covered with cobblestones lead you to many squares and show you unexpected beauty of Prague. An atmosphere is very relaxing. It is particularly nice view on the city from the lookout above the astronomical clock.
Really amazing place. I live in Prague for 14 years and I really recommend everyone to visit this place. There are many street actors and mims and different simply fascinating things to look at.

Stunning. All Old Town is stunning; to the buildings, the atmosphere in Old Town Square you have to experience. You cannot visit Prague and not go here, day and night it is magical. We made several visits and enjoyed every moment. It is very crowded.

Beautiful part of Prague.. The sights in the area were beautiful with many restaurants and shops. The cathedral was beautiful especially at night. It was a short walk from our hotel so we were in the area many times.
Beautiful.. Harbouring the awesome Astronomical clock and many other breathtaking landmarks, the cobbled square itself its a must visit for anyone in Prague!

Just perfect!. Narrow streets, small shops and historical buildings - all things that I love in cities. One of my favourite capitols with beautiful old town. Of course a little bit crowded but still nice and worth of visit.

Lucky to land here. We came into this stay in Prague absolute innocents, but we stayed a week and still didn't see it all! This is a place for walking, and if you plan correctly, you can take a bus uphill to the castle and then meander downhill the rest of the day, there are plenty of places to refresh yourself, including a playground we happened upon with a pump to refill our water bottles. Much to see!
Best travel destination!. Charming, beautiful and every attractions are in walk-able distance. Great for visit, loving the weather as well.
Old Town Square. Stunning, beautiful and rich in history. Soak up hundreds of years of Czech history standing in one spot. Recommended to take a free walking tour
Beautiful old town. Love the buildings and history about the old town. Lots of restaurants and shops in the old town, and there's always something for everyone. Will definitely go back there again!

Glorious Architecture. The square is so full of people, endlessly entertaining. The buildings in all direction are worth a careful look. So much to see. You have to keep coming back and it's a joy to do so.

Fascinating from every angle. The buildings, shops and churches take you back in time and you believe you are in the 15th century. The shops and streets are inviting and the shopkeepers are welcoming and helpful
Good. Really beautiful place. It's the heart of this amazing city. Lots of bars, restaurants, nightclubs, churches, museums. As a tourist you will have to visit it.

Knights of the Holy Cross Square: Charles IV. George Washington is known as the father of the United States. Likewise, the city of Prague claims Charles IV as the “father of the country”. The bronze statue of Charles IV in front of the Charles Bridge. It is erected on a 13 foot pedestal and the statue itself is 13 feet tall. On the pedestal are carved the faculty of theology, medicine, law and philosophy. At the corners of the monument are the first archbishop of Prague, the successor to the first archbishop, Charles friend who accompanied him to Rome for his coronation, and the builder of the St. Vitus Cathedral. Charles was King of Bohemia and a Holy Roman Emperor. While Charles did a lot for the city of Prague, there was also a dark side to him. In 1621, there was an uprising against the Hapsburg Dynasty where 27 leaders of the revolt were beheaded and their heads displayed on the bridge’s tower. Charles IV is buried underneath the main altar of St. Vitus’ Cathedral. Because if its shear size, you cannot miss this monument.

Beautiful atmospheric square lined with cafes for people watching!. Take a seat in one of the lively bars and cafes lining the square and do some relaxed people watching under the shadow of the towers. Street buskers compete for attention of passersby, and the seats with views of the clock get very busy close to the hour.
A beautiful city. Prague is a very compact city, the old town is simply stunning. The buildings are beautiful. Lots of shops, restaurants, churches and squares.

Lovely Square surrounded by the past. Fantastic, didn't know where to look first. a Truly special place in Prague. Very busy, particularly make sure that you see the astronomical clock on the HOUR... crowds will congregate 5-10 mins beforehand. This is a great video opportunity.Street performers and nice restaurants all around, catering for everyones budget and taste from fast food stalls to expensive al-fresco eateries.
The historic center of Prague. On my trip to Prague, this is where we spent the majority of our time. The combination of beautiful squares and historic churches makes for a lovely visit in the city.
A lovely open square to people watch. Loved the great vibe on the square. Great scenery, horse drawn carriages and gorgeous buildings. A super place to meet and people watch.
Pure history. Its like walking back in time, with a beautiful view of the Castle. A stroll across the Bridge by day or night is impressive. It's as Prague as it gets.
The heart of Prague. Surrounded by many great sights and attractions and restaurants. Very easily accessible. A bit crowded on the weekends.
Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe, and rather cheap even in the tourist areas. Definitely worth a visit!

One word sums it up VIBRANT. Old town square in Prague is a lively place with so much going on. At the time of my visit there were Easter market stalls all over the square as well as food cooking here and there. It's a great atmosphere. There are all sorts of side shows to watch such as jugglers, fire eaters plus music. The square is packed and beware of the dreaded Segway, they are everywhere. It's worth a visit just for the vibrant atmosphere. Packed but fun :-)
One of the highlights of Prague. Steeped in history, lots of architecture to look at, the astronomical clock. A Must see for all who visit Prague

Amazing City Walk. Just walk around town and look at the beautiful buildings, breath taking. You would recognise most landmarks from the movies. You'll easily find somewhere the eat and drink and it is so cheap. If you are having a budget holiday and love strolling around with no plan, Prague is the place for you.

Beautiful buildings and a hidden surprise. What a lovely square! We've seen it both busy and quiet and loved it either way. It happens that there was a large and loud football crowd there the day we arrived and the atmosphere was electric but early the next morning it couldn't have been more different. Beautiful with a light mist and nobody to be seen.The clock around the corner is a lovely bit of fun.

Mid week break. Everything that you need or want can be got here, the architecture is beautiful , people are friendly, no hassle. It's also part of the Jewish quarter with a large Jewish graveyard with the dead killed in the war

Beautiful place. The old town is very beautiful, with beautiful architecture, lots of interesting little shops selling a variety of souvenirs, chocolates, clothes, etc. Great to walk through both by day and by night

Fantastic full of life.. This was a great place to stroll and find cheap eats. The crowd collected for the hourly show from the astronomical clock on the church. Great fun and the churches in the area were awesome. The big red bus stops here as well. Easy access from the river and Intercontinental
Nice place to watch people of Europe. I love street show and people are always walking around. Summer was hot but not that bad. Good place to watch people of Europe

Great historical place.. This place is so historical and beautiful, a single visit is not enough to take in the beauty and architecture of this town. Watching the astronomical clock at the top of every hour is worth watching and drinking mulled wine while doing so is an added bonus.
Old Town- History and mystery. Old town is a must. So charming. And the astronomical clock is also a must. Every one hour they have a show.
Excellent place to visit. The Old Town is an amazing place which is full of history, cafes, and the location for the astronomical clock. Free walking tours go from here

So beautiful. The Old Town has a lot to offer. It is the perfect size not to get bored but also to be able to get anywhere on foot. Plenty of dining possibilities, shopping, cafés, sights...Just some to Prague, you won't regret it.

Pretty sites around the old town. Spend a day walking around the old town. Avoid the crowds, walk through the narrow streets behind the theatre and head towards the charles bridge- you'll see a very nice face of the old town.

Very pretty and lively. There is a very different charm about Prague that is hard to explain. Old town is the best pace to start exploring Prague. There is astronomical clock and tower, city hall, Tyn church and a beautiful square which is full of musicians and performers. One suggestion please go up the city tower. It gives some amazing views of the old city and seriously don't take too much pain to see the clock at hours. It's really not worth the pain. But surely read about the clock. It's not easy to read it without knowledge

Great square. Perfect town.Be sure to visit the two churches (St.Nikolas and Tyn church) the astronomical clock and the tower beside the clock for the best views of the city .Another must is to eat traditional food from the cantinas in froom of the old town square
Lovely square. We enjoyed our trip to Prague so much and this square was a stunning reflection of the history of this area.
Interesting. We enjoyed walking through the old town & seeing the sites. Noting that Prague was taken early by the Nazi in World War 2 & only lightly bombed by the allies.

Classic tourist destination. If you went to Prague and didn´t see the Old Town area you missed it! The absolute epicenter of the city, always full of tourists. A must see but other areas are worthwhile as well.

Icon of Prague!. Quite obviously, a must place to wander around in Prague. I had heard so much about it and I must confess that I didn't think that it could live up to all that hype. But the visit to the old town proved me wrong. The architecture, cute alleyways, bars, coffee shops, the overall vibe is unique. For a complete experience, one must visit both at dawn and dusk.

How you picture Prague. Old Town is probably about what you're expecting Prague to be.I'm not saying that in a mean or condescending way. It has gothic building, cobblestone streets, and small shops on narrow streets. It's fun and beautiful and lives up to its reputation.Unfortunately, because of this, it also tends to be crowded. So, expects people everywhere. Expect to walk slowly and take your time. But, if it starts to get to you, there's probably going to be a coffee shop, pub, and/or restaurant on the next block to take a break.As picturesque and pleasant as it is, I'd recommend seeing the other parts of the city as well. Prague is a pretty unique city with a lot to see and do. People are friendly, most speak English, prices are affordable, and it has a ton of history and sights. Unless you're moving here, you're not going to have enough time. Plan accordingly.

Just a square to be honest. You can go to any country and see a square. There are loads of places to eat, and it's very easy to find which I suppose is a great place as a central location, loads of restaurants, there is the astronomical clock which is fine just to walk past. Nothing special.

Nice 3 days. You must be careful where to exchange your money. Many exchange offices have different exchange rates, so you can get the local currency in rates from 1:17 to 1:32. Nice town and always crowded. Local cuisine is excellent, beer cheaper than water.
fantastic architecture. see it by day and night , lovely atmosphere and truly breathtaking architecture , cant help but be amazed
So beautiful. You should visit old town when in Prague. Lots of sights to see and pictures to take. Tons of shopping nearby and cafes to sit and relax with a coffee/tea or like most Czechs, a beer.
Beautiful. Please be careful the restaurants are pricey, we got overcharged for a beer and coffee, beggars harassed us, pick pockets etc
So much Life. Great place to be anytime of year. There is always something going on or something to see in this centuries old town.

Old Town square in Prague. Fantastic.... I have been here more than 4 times and the feeling is always fantastic... The Church of Our Lady before Tin is beautiful in every weather or day light...but I like it at night...And the clock Orloj-Astronomical clock is interesting with many details and 12 apostles and Death(skeleton) ,Vanity,Jew(with bag of gold)and the turk.....There is always a hundreds of people waiting the full our and counting seconds.....
Street map essential. If its your first visit, make sure you have a street map. It is easy to get lost but easy to find your way with a map.

Wander in the morning and wander in the evening. We wondered Old Town at different times of the day. First thing in the morning it is peaceful and you have time to enjoy the beauty and quiet of the streets and appreciate the history and architecture, later in the day enjoy the wonderful honey or mulled wine as you stroll around listening to musicians or as you take a carriage ride. As the day progresses the area gets pretty busy, but it is fun to watch the crowds while sipping a warm bevvie.

Had a great time. Like any visit to a foreign city, you are always dubious about walking down the wrong alley and get clumped by some opportune crooks, I tend to have a few drinks when I am out and aboiut, so in my drunken state, I am always aware of this.Prague is an exceptionally safe city, I didn't feel in the slightest threatened by it.Look at the pics, it's a beautiful place, lots going for it, very clean in the old town, but can get a bit grotty when you venture away from the tourist centre, though that is the case with most cities.Lot's of history, lots of expensive shops, restaurants and bars, great at night as well as day.Worth a visit.
A walk in the past. This is an amazing place to wander through with the buildings steeped in history. The buildings and churches were definitely worth a visit.

I love this square. A wonderful place to wonder, spend ages sitting in a café, people watching the buzz the atmosphere, both at day & night its a great place to spend some time. Don't forget to watch the clock
Must visit in prague. The photos say them all. Don't forget to try the Old Prague Ham. However, it is served 600 grams for a portion n too much even for two person.
Lovely romantic place Must See. Cobblestone streets, historical buildings and romantic cafes and restaurants. Does not get any better! Bring your walking shoes and prepare to max out your Fitbit!
Lots to see. There is so much to see in Old Town from the popular tourist attractions to small side streets. It's a beautiful place to walk around leisurely.

Wonderful Experience. Of course a must see place if you are in Prague, very crowded but a wonderful atmosphere. The crowds wait expectantly, looking up for the glockenspiel to open up and perform. Keep you hand on your wallet or handbag just in case.

Wander there every day. We would find ourselves wandering through here every day, several times a day. Prague is just a walking city and this is the heartbeat of it. The mulled hot wine is amazing and cheap from the street vendors. Do not miss out!!!

Rating says it all, must see tourist attraction. Walking through here on our first day in Prague we were able to find a good place to eat, visited some unusual stores and also enjoyed the ambiance of the crowd where everyone seemed to be in good spirits

The jewel of Czech Republic and beyond. Can't really be missed since all routes lead to the old town square. That said, it's worth a look at, hanging around, getting lost in the small streets close-by and going up in the astronomical clock tower to enjoy the 360 view
Architecture is awesome. There are so many different building styles with narrow streets it is wonderful to walk around. Keep looking up so you don't miss the best parts of some of the buildings.
not to be missed. When in Prague you must visit this area. The buildings are unique. There are many restaurants and stores. A nice place to wander and experience the city.

An icon of Prague, a must see for visitors new and old. An icon of Prague, a must see for visitors new and old. The town clock is really fascinating, but watch your wallets and bags!! Looking at weirdly dressed stag and hen groups enjoying the local beer as they sit looking out from their sozzled eyes is also part of the fun

Simply amazing . This place never failed to amuse me, day or night. I was captured when I first saw it daytime but that was topped up when I saw nighttime. The lights and the town vibe was incredibly fascinating! I could spent the whole day just wandering!
Beautiful :). If you come to Prague, you will go to Old Town for sure! A lot of people, street food, great architecture...
Great walking city. A great city to walk around. There are many public transport options: bus, tram, taxi, train, metro, but to see the city, you have to walk
So pretty!. Old Town is so pretty! Definitely take the time to stroll around and get lost in all the little streets.
Magnificiant. Almost crowded but Everything in the old Prague city has its own magnificiant atmosphere. Dont care about turist and enjoy!

Must do in Prague. This is where the tourists gather. Lots of restaurants and bars, lovely old buildings to look at and loads of atmosphere. Always seems to be some sort of musician/singer entertaining in the main square day and night. Can get rather crowded.

Prague. DON'T GET THE PRAGUE CITY CARD!The old town is lovely, but crowded with tourist-many, many tourists! Watch out for the Segways; they're all over the Old Town. If you decide to get a slice of the roasted pig (sold in stands all around the Old Town Square) you will pay by the gram, and our slice came out to around $30 (US equivalent), Ouch!The people are nice, and the streets are clean of trash. Be prepared for the beggars, they can pull at your heart strings. All that said, it is a lovely city, it certainly was worth our time visiting. The Prague Card is expensive compared to what you receive-so many of the sights are only open a short time, and MANY only offer a discount at the sights. You still have to stand in line if you have the card (like a credit card) and get a ticket for all the attractions. Decide what you'd really like to see, and pay for it. If you still decide you want the card, buy it early in the day. A 2 day card is only good for the number of hours left in that day, and then the next day.

Alive @ Night. The Old Town is rather busy in the morning as it is with many tourists stopping by the infamous disappointing Astronomical clock. However, when you pop by here at night ... it's bustling with activity when the market stalls attract more customers and street performers captivate inquisitive onlookers like me. However, just a tip: as it is not as well lit as some other cities in some parts of the Old Town, don't forget to keep your valuables safe!
Wonderful Atmosphere!. The square is the happiest place ever!! I felt like I was part of a gigantic family. So many great street food vendors to choose from, and friendly locals and tourists alike!!

Old town . If you like architecture in old EU land its must see place. Atmosphere similar to one you can exprericence in German or Polish cities, like Berlin , Wroclaw or Krakow. They also mush worth visiting
A must see!. If you are in Prague and have limited time go to Old town and esp. visit the main square and see for yourself why this city is so beautiful
A must!. Walking in the Old town it's a must in this lovely city! History, landmanrks, shopping, good restaurants, outside terrasse...
Great and a busy place. Architecturally magnificent, plenty to see and do. You can walk around all day in the square and not get board
Beautiful city. One of the best cites than i ever been, clean, with so much monuments and history to know :) Wonderful, very cheap city
Worth a visit.. Our hotel was close, just a few 100 meters from there. The place is worth a visit. Nice city. Great beers.
not my fav. too busy and crowded and very touristy; not my cuppa of tea and much better places to hang out in this lovely city

Best Place for Shopping, Restaurants, and Sight-Seeing. Old Town is a must-see when visiting Prague. There are many great shops (everything from local shops to Prada), bakeries (try the trdelnik - Czech pastry that looks like a tube with chocolate cream filling), restaurants, historical buildings, candy stores (try the cinnamon chocolate covered almonds), the Charles Bridge, and of course the Astronomical Clock.It's a great place to wander and people watch and you may see some interesting street performers. Just watch for pickpockets. We didn't see any but were warned by our tour guides to be careful.

Open-air museum. Every corner, every piece of the Old Town is a Museum itself. When you walk around, you can feel its history, its culture (its tourists) and ambiance. Take your time to see this beautiful piece of architecture and culture.
Excellent. Stunning old town square in the heart of Prague, second visit to this city, and well worth it, we came during December whilst the Xmas markets were on.

Stunning town. Old Town is beautiful with it's little side streets off the main square. With the clock tower in the main square you can then ferret down all the side streets. Amazing how many different cafes, bars and restaurants you can find and most at half the price of the main square restaurants and just as good quality if not better.
very pretty. I loved the Prague Old town- it is truly a gem of European architecture. we spent a wonderful couple of days getting lost and absorbing it all :)

Nov01-Nov07 2015. Prague has an excellent Tram,Subway,and Bus network. Very efficient and extensive coverage. Highly recommend to use public transport to and from Airport. Cheap and operates from 04:45 am to about 1:00 am. City is clean, and walkways are not at all crowded. Restaurants are aplenty. The infrastructure in this city is geared more towards tourism. Plenty of historical sites to visit. Most are medieval period, and if you are a history buff, then this is an ideal setting for you. Lots to see, and appreciate. Czech Republic has a lot of history. The locals are friendly and very helpful. They go out of their way to help tourist. Every nook an corner has touts (mostly refugees) who intend to hustle tourist for currency exchange, and tour rides. Stay clear of these people. Otherwise your holidays can be fun and within budget.
Beautiful city. The city was absolutely stunning! With a different street off the every angle you easily found yourself wandering around, but never bored!
Beautiful, must see. Absolutely gorgeous architecture with a lot of history. Take a walk on this bridge and admire the beautiful statues or go on the side of the river to feed the swans.
Old Town Square. Lots of fun - there is so much activity going on at once that one is not sure where to look first! Plenty of restaurants, food vendors, busters, and innumerable sites of interest.

Old town is wonderful for shopping and cafes.. Enjoy old town's shops, bars and restaurants. The astronomical clock is amazing. The crystal shops have one of a kind gifts. The outdoor cafe's have wonderful desserts, coffees and light fare.

Really magic . Really nice atmosphere!!! Magic architecture with unaspected Italian influence. We walk around and we lost our self in thousand of small street. Sure I will come back with my girlfriend ! :)

Christmas away.. We spent Christmas in Prague where an amount of time each day was spent at the market on the square. It really was amazing with a huge variety of fresh food and beverages to be enjoyed. There was also a fair amount of live entertainment which helped us enjoy a different way of celebrating Christmas.

Such a beautiful place!. This area is full of beautiful cobbled streets and old buildings. You can wander round exploring the alleyways for ages, popping in and out of churches and museums. It is a touristy area but not overwhelmingly so. There are plenty of nice little shops and cafes to visit.

Beautiful. Rain or shine you have to go out and see the old town and the old square. It's surrounded by beautiful architecture and lovely restaurants. Crowds of people every day I have walked through it. There are quirky street acts from mimes to local bands playing. It is beautiful.
Brilliant old construction. Interesting that this magnificent bridge was built so long ago, good statues, lots of good artists and traders, good jazz combo but very busy with tourists

Prague Old Town is double blade sword. This is absolute wonderful square in Prague, but one must be careful of pickpockets, since they all know that there are lots of attractions that will distract you. Being careful will ensure a smooth troublefree vacation. Cheers!

Great athmosphere and food stalls. Market square...great athmosphere, nice smells coming from everywhere. Happy people and lots of different music and entertainers. There is a small italian coffeeshop on the far left corner when you walk towards the square from the clock. They have great coffee on the go.
Autumn is a great time to visit. We loved the Stare Mesto - beautiful architecture, fab restaurants and we had lovely autumn weather. Also fewer other tourists than in the summer
The Crystal glass showrooms. So much fin around there. You could do bargain shopping at Crystal glass showrooms where they have a variety to offer

Stunning city. It's my 4th Prague visit and will never get tired of it. It was 13 hours walking tour and cruise on the river. We did 2-part Prague. Religious Prague and Bohemian Prague. No doubt this is a very attractive place but i didn't give it a 5* for 1 reason. My sis-in-law was pick-pocketed )-: Fortunately the passport was not stolen but the whole wallet was. None of us noticed it. So sad but be very careful here.

Full of old world charm. The main square in the Old Town is magnificant - I can't think of any other way to describe it. Even with hundreds (maybe thousands) of tourists and local alike in the square, it takes your breath away. When you first walk into the square (we did it at night), you feel as if you have been transported back in time. Take your time, ignore all the people around you and just stand and soak it in.

One of the best Prague highlights MUST SEE*****. Beautiful buildings, the architecture here is fantastic and also the history of the city. There is so much to do I can guarantee you won't be disappointed!

Feast for the Senses. An amazing combination of old world style and new world excitement. This is one spot you will want to spend some time. Check out the astrological clock on the hour. Sip coffee or enjoy a meal outside. Watch the people. And just enjoy!

Incomparable to anything else!. Words cannot describe the beauty of the place. Nice renovated old buildings, in the Christmas time the magical atmosphere makes you not want to close your eyes to miss a single moment! Very nice cafes, bars and restaurants nearby.

Great city break. Beautiful place to spend a couple of days. Really good value for money and authentic city. Easy to walk around and lots of options for bars and restaurants for all age groups and sizes. Walk to the castle and the Charles Bridge are beautiful. Great to spend 2 or 3 days.

Beautiful . Try to be there in early morning, and then come back when the sun goes down, look at the difference of color in front of the dark grey building. The clarion on the watch is nice bit nothing very amazing, go on top of the tower, it's really worthing!
Historic city. This is the heart of historic Prague and well worth spending an hour or so just wandering around taking in the sights and atmosphere.
Too broad a title. The old town is great - make sure you try as many of the pubs and cafes as you can, eat tapas style order a few dishes to share often to get the most of all the places
House at the Stone Bell.. After dark this Gothic building takes on a spooky atmosphere. It is just one of the attractions in the Square.

Beautiful historical place . Visited old town looking for a free tour. Met up with Vit, he gave us a 3.5 hour tour that included the astronomical clock, old city hall, Paris street, bridge, up to the pavilion to view the city, the palace and cathedral grounds, palace gardens, and golden row. He was very in depth with the information, some was a bit political but we just ignored it. He works for tips, we tipped him 900 crown which translated to about $36, this was close to what we would have paid for a tour that was not that personal or in depth. Vit was passionate about his city. We found him standing in front of the clock with a sign that said "free tours by a native prague citizen". His tour was really helpful once we toured the palace and could put things together, we were even able to purchase the short tour of the palace and cathedral.

Not to be missed.... Amazing to stroll through. We did take one of the free walking tours. This really gave us perspective and insight into the city of Prague and it's history.Wonderful food stalls and shopping at every turn.
interesting achitecture. many of the buildings in prague are very beautiful ,such interesting and charming architecture .the old town is full of all kinds of interesting places to visit .
Lovely place . Lovely place in the heart of Prague! Some super restaurants nearby too well worth a visit! Look out for street performers too!

Dilip Berry . Lovely scintillating architecture beautiful square leaves one in awe of the place. Lots of small cafes all around filled with tourists. One can spend hours chatting and drinking Pilsner beer. A very vibrant area.Prague is definitely must visit place in your bucket list.
Ms. Very nice pretty lovrly restaurants views but dodge restaurants who have pictures not prices we were charged .more expensive than I remember
Waiting for the clock!. Our first visit so didn't want to miss the famous clock striking the hour.Nearby restaurants expensive but much cheaper in the backstreets.

Beautiful day/night for a stroll. Stroll through the old town and take in the atmosphere and beauty. Even late at night it has a special charm. It is very safe during the day and night. Bridges, buildings, museums, chapels - what more do you want in one area.

beautiful location for food and drinks. Some stunning scenery and a lovely place to sit back and watch the world go by. Would recommend coming in the evening as the lighting on the towers really does compliment the features of the buildings

Vibrant old town. Old town is a lot of fun, there are lots of artists doing their stuff, playing at being statues and blowing bubbles. There is a lot of space in the twon square, restaurants where you can sit outside and have a beer, Segway tours, and the entrance to the church. The astronomical clock is around the corner and the hard rock cafe a couple of minutes' walk.
Stepping Back In Time. This really is like stepping back into medieval times - really interesting and well worth a visit. So glad that we made the effort to take this time out

Stunning. What an amazing place...filled with beautiful buildings and full of atmosphere....grab a coffee and watch the world to by...from here you can take a ride on a horse and carriage...we did this at night and it was amazing...get round the little cobbled streets and explore

Easy walking from hotel by bridge. What a friendly accessible city. Architecture, people, crafts, signs, all made for easy trip, fabulous photos. Easy to ID tourist restaurants and shops, history all around you.
Vibrant atmosphere. Lively square with lots of great restaurants and street entertainment, not to mention th Astronomical Clock - a must see on the hour

Wonderful architecture. Just must have in Prague! Great building, nice atmosphier, historical place and culture. As suggestion to visit it in the sunny day to have posibility to observe the old city from it.
Wow. This is a beautiful old square with amazing architecture and loads of shops and restaurant's. Really something to see at night also.

Wonderful place. Busy, beautiful and big. A gorgeous old square with loads to marvel at. The restaurants are overpriced and I wouldn't really recommend but amazing for a walk around and gaze at the astronomical clock. Watch out for the segways!!! They are everywhere!
Old Town Square. The ambience is slow pace and calm. I love the area, there were varieties of food. People are noce and cool. They got a lot of things to see in one place.

prague is amazing. old town, new town, castle quarter. Prague is almost perfect. Beautiful. Safe. Friendly. There's a lot of stuff about crime and russian car theft gangs....heck, i feel mmore tension in Baltimore.

Marvellous, mesmerizing, enchanting. Absolutely lovely...try the late evening walk if the weather is okay - go up to the castle, watch the birds screeching over the Charles bridge, enjoy the coziness of the streets, watch the river..it is impossible not to fall in love with it!
Visit it early or late in the day. The old town is dominated by tour groups during most of the day. Most of the groups will not be there early in the morning, or at night.
Historic and Elegant. What a beautiful, romantic and fulfilling place. Rarely is somewhere so promoted as good as the hype, this square was better than all the promotion promised.
Lovely. Enjoyed many a walk around this area stopping for drinks and food. We took the little train around the town on Monday evening which was a lovely start to our break away.

Full of character and history. Our first evening was in Prague and we ended up in the Old Town Square. We sat at the restaurant right by the old clock, expecting to get ripped off with location but we had we main meals and drinks and the perfect view of the clock and paid less than you would if you have 2 coffees and a cake at starbucks in the UK. Loved it.
What a nice place . This is a very old town and nice place to spend a while day there with a lot of cafe Arround and some musicians and activity around . The big clock show every hour .

Took Your Breathe Away. The Old Town is simply beautiful and breathtaking. The grand architecture coupled with the warmth shown by the Czechs are simply enthralling. There were many tourists flocking to the Old Town but this added to the excitement of being in a beautiful place. There are many shops and restaurants to fullfill one's desires.
Jaw dropping. I love, love, love everything about Prague. Old Town is like traveling back in time, but so much to do & see everyday was a new experience.
A walking tour is a good idea. The street are charming in Prague but bring reliable shoes. Everything is cobblestones and they make walking a challenge. You need to look up And look down.
Stunning. Beautiful and moving. Go early if possible, the crowds can approach a Disney level of density - one of the best squares in Europe.
Beautiful Architecture. Don;'t miss this gem of an area. it features wonderful architecture that reflects Prague's history. It does get a bit busy and cold in the winter but worth the visit.

fairy tale like. Every building is breathtaking and beautiful, a truly magical place.Very very busy area, take care of your valuables, We joined a little train here in this square that took us round the major parts of Prague, in style !!!!

couples holiday in Prague. great holiday in Prague not exoensive shopping excellent from designer to Tesco who had a great range in clothing .all tourist attractions in Prague within city is walking distance .tram service is excellent.weather was mixed when we went end of may people friendly and helpful

Amazing. I was so fascinated by this part of Prague, so much beauty & history in such a compact area, I so loved this place & would recommend everyone who comes to Prague to go here & preferably with a guide so you can find out more about it...... so worth it!! So want to go again!!

Gorgeous!. We loved the Old Town; so beautiful and full of people and life !
I recommend for everyone, is an inspirational place!

Come in winter. I see that many people complain about crowds in the square, so my advice is to come here in the winter when there are less people about. We came in November and did not experience masses of tourists, or get jostled, or meet any 'hucksters'. It was a lovely old square, with fabulous historic buildings, all worth seeing, especially at night. As for expensive meals and drinks in the square, please walk a few blocks away from the tourist centre and you will find great deals on food and pilsners. You just have to look!

Must see and if possible stay here. We stayed for 4 nights in old town area and simply loved the atmosphere of this place. We spent most of the time in old town only. It has everything shops,malls,restaurants,bars,wax museums,thai massage parlors everything. This is the best part of prague.
Interesting experience. Visited Prague for the first time in June and we weren't disappointed. Beautiful Old Town is easy to walk, with interesting architecture and lots to see and do. I

Many things to explore . The old town is a typical Czech style architecture Buiding area.The whole area n under UNESCO. The good thing is the history is maintained a lot & then . People who love history should definitely visit this area best time to visit is in morning.
