Heart of the city. An amazing place.. Full of activity and performers. Go there spend some time eat tTRDLON. Don't drink beer.. Pricey. The place has lot of history. The square also houses the astronomical clock.

Great fun here !. Came with my brother on holiday , not knowing what to expect really , but came first to old town , great tourist information centre , very helpful. Alot of stuff going on its full of energy , but its a good energy , great food being sold on the side streets , all the salespeople on the street s are great to talk to and there's people from every corner of the world gathered here. Great place to chat away with strangers !
Old Town. Absolutely lovely architecture, lots of art, many chances for attending some lovely music concerts, plenty of restaurants to choose from and museums to see, plus outdoor food and drink.

Bring comfortable shoes and enjoy a pleasant stroll. The old city is a pleasant and attractive place. The building facades, courtyards and squares make for a really nice place to go for a long wallk. Nice stores for shopping if you like. The streets are all bent and short so plan to get a bit lost from time to time.

A must see in Prague. You can't go to Prague without visiting the Old Town, everything is here. The astronomical clock and The Tyn Castle are so beautiful and full of history you'll feel like you've gone back in time. There are lot's of restaurants and souvenir shops around here and prices are great.

Gorgeous City!. We only spent 2 nights in Prague, and know we will return for a longer visit next time. The old town has such charm and character, with amazing architecture around every corner. We easily spent more than half a day just wandering around the streets and of course taking many photos. Yes the place is crowded with tourists, but that is only to be expected in such a marvellous city and indeed country.

Lots of tourists.. They say Prague is the new Paris. One Saturday, we have an exceptional day weatherwise and the world and his dog was out. We had coffee and cake at one of the restaurants there. The attitude from one staff member in particular was 'another bloody tourist!'.Best to visit here early in the morning. Don't bother eating at any restaurants on the square.

very lively at night. We only visited the square at night but there were a lot of people there to get a glimpse of the clock going off every hour which was a nice sight. There are a lot of vendors and outdoor areas to eat/drink. Definitely check out the clock tower which you can also climb for a beautiful view.

Super place to hang. Good restaurants. Avoid photographers in the restaurant .really crowded so better watch for pick pockets &other tricksters. Nice thai place to get a massage .wear comfortable shoes. So much walking unless u want find another mode of transport.

A city area full of history and many interesting people and tourists.. A city area full of history and many interesting people and tourists. We visited this summer and loved the area. Old Town has many shops, points of interest, musical artists, restaurants and churches to hear organ music playing.

Lovely old town for wandering.... Lovely old town for wandering around. Cafe food cheap and average. Loads of shops selling much the same stuff but look out for 3d photo in a paperweight and Swarofski crystal which is good value in its home country. Hope the review is helpful.

Beautiful. The old Town of Prague is very beautiful with interesting architecture and statues. Take a free tour ( we went with Jana with the green and white umbrella) to hear about the history of this area.
There is something to see around every corner.
Lively Square. Very picturesque, surrounded by beautiful buildings and lots going on - buskers etc which adds to the atmosphere.
place where travellers must go. Astronomical clock, the square, churches are gathered here. Why not come? There're street performances there everyday.
Lovely. It one of the best old towns in the world, it is must in Prague, only recently its crowded by tourists, so it is not that authentic prague spirit

Charming City. Beautiful architecture, amazing history and cosy atmosphere. A lot of souvenir shops and places to eat. Prices are screwed up for tourists, but still affordable. It's mostly crowded as well, as every other tourist place, but it somehow adds to the atmosphere and doesn't bother that much.
Marvelous!. I like architecture so for me everytime when I'm visiting Prague is paradise for my soul, very lovely, beautiful, medieval building, nice smell from bakeries just excelent :)
been there and should go there again. U never get tired of Old Town, just take a stroll and look at all the buildings, it is free and really good entertainment.

Totally Stunning location. Yeah, Prague. It is an amazing city center -. something that really, truly is out of a fairy tale and almost not real. So go and hang out, grab a Pivo and enjoy the atmosphere.
Nice urban view. It was very nice to walk through the old town , great atmosphere and not too Crowded. It was even better to see it at night

Absolutely stunning. What I loved most about the old town was the architecture. Everywhere you look there are beautiful and unique buildinhs. The astronomical clock is really beautiful and interesting too. Be aware though that there are a lot of tourists and it can be difficult to navigate through. We were surprised at how many people were there in November but we did find it better to be out early before the crowds.

Old Town Square.. The main town square with the prominent steeple and towers of the Gothic church of our Lady before Tyn is a landmark pf Prague. At the entrance to the main town square is the Town hall building with its World famous Prag Orloj medieval astronomical clock. This clock was first installed in 1410 which makes it the third oldest astronomical clock in the World and the oldest astronomical clock still working in 2015.In the centre of the square is a statue of religious reformer Jan Hus who was burnt in Constance which led to the Hussite wars.This statue was erected in 1915 to mark his 500 th death anniversary.There is also a memorial in the centre of town square for Martyrs beheaded by the Habsburgs after the battle of White Mountain in 1620 AD.The Town square was crowded with tourists and horse carriages for carriage rides to tourists.There was a rare art exhibition in the "Gallery of Art" in Town Square featuring the works of two prominent World household names Andy.Warhol and Salvador.Dali with local Czech masters brothers Jan and Kaja.Saudek.If in Prague a stroll around "Old Town Square" is Mandatory.
Real buzz in the square.. Lots of street entertainers, restaurants etc.Astronomical Clock is nice but not spectacular.Beautiful buildings.
Amazing. Must go up the Clock Tower! Beautiful views at night! Oh and don't forget to be in front of the Clock Tower on the hour for the little presentation! Very nice!
beautiful town. our first visit to Prague and we intend to visit again. Beautiful buildings, friendly people and a whole variety of great places to eat
The representation of Prague. Musicians jugglers, old town hall, an ancient clock, a church, statues, restaurants, cafes its got it all!!

Must See. Old town square is worth a visit. The Astronomical clock is fascinating. It is worth paying to visit the top of the clock tower to see the views of the city. There is also some beautiful architecture including the church of our lady before tym. Do beware that a lot of the restaurants on the square are very expensive so it is often best to go slightly out of the square for food and drinks.
Amazing . Such a pretty place. Lots of little winding streets with so much history running through them. We spent hours just wandering around absorbing it's beauty.
Must see. Well worth the time to explore the area - a couple of churches that are free and the view from tower is well worth the price.
Will make you fall in love with Prague. Stunning area of Prague, amazing architecture, so much to see, many museums and great restaurants.If you visit Prague, old town is a must see.

such a beautiful city for sightseeing. Second visit to Prague in 6 months mostly because we wanted to see more of this beautiful city. We had downloaded Ulmon Citymaps2go app and were able to use it very well to get around the old town,such an enjoyable day, a few steep hills but plenty of places to stop for refreshments. There is so much to see it is better to try and work to a plan as nearly every corner you turn there is something of interest. The Jewish town was worth seeing as was the area across Charles Bridge, didn't do the Castle this time as we had been before but there are so many small streets, alleys and shops to explore it took a full days walking. A little map reading and preparation goes along way but everything seems well sign posted and even well after dark it seemed a safe and relaxing part of Prague.

lovely square with lots to see and do. the gothic tyn church is on one side of the square, lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from. the astronomical clock is also just off the square. there are horses and carriages to take you for a sightseeing trip if you wish to do so.

Dissapointed. When i told to my friends that i was going to Praga, they told me that it's a really nice place. First of all, i was disappointed. This place, especially the Old Town is too crowded, there is too much tourists. Yes, it's beautiful but i won't come back again, for sure!

great place to be out and about. Walking through the old town is very nice. Plenty of shops/tourist attractions. For those visiting the area DO NOT change money from people in the street - they use fake money.
Romantic city I love it. Romantic historical city with very kind friendly people .with different cultures really it was one of the best country I would like to visit it agene and agene

Lots of sights, less parties. From experience I would say this is the better part of town in terms of sights and relaxation, more of the parties were in New Town. Excellent sights, go for a walk and enjoy!

Puts London to shame!. What a place to get lost in: picturesque buildings all around, interesting shops and friendly people. Whether mid-morning or late at night Old Town feels alive and vibrant. Comparing it to our own capital of London is almost embarrassing - it feels clean, alive and perhaps most importantly: welcoming.

Love Prague!. This is an amazing place. I would recommend you stay in center city which is walking distance to everything. It will only take you a few days to see everything but you may want to stay longer since the people, food, pubs, architecture, etc. are so nice.
stunning. A stunning area of Prague. So many beautiful buildings. There are always a lot of tourists, for good reason. A great area for wandering.

unforgettable christmas. When we went to Prague for the holiday it was the most memorable trip! It was gorgeous during Christmas time- the decorations and lights were just seemed surreal, especially at the top of the clock tower. Looking over the city with the red roofs and lights was an amazing experience. We went as a family of three- great place to travel to with children, ,y daughter was 7 at the time and enjoyed the views, Christmas market, and food just as much as us. An experience that I will truly cherish forever. People is Prague are very friendly and helpful. The trip exceeded my expectations! I can't wait to return someday.
Beautiful city. What a beautiful place to visit. There is so much to see and enjoy. The old town square is a lovely place - very pretty and picturesque.

Get Lost!. The narrow winding streets allow you to get lost easily, however each turn reveals a bit more of the Old Town. For me getting lost is the most fun, you never know what sights you may discover!
lovely at night time. lots of street performers day and night. lovely just to stroll around and soak in Prague atmosphere.
Cool Architecture. This was an awesome place to visit as there is always something to do here. The Astronomical Clock is extremely worth the wait.
Nights are simply magic. The atmosphere is awesome, so many people enjoying the square, the shopping is bountiful and the restaurants are open until very late

Worth 1 trip. This square is extremely crowded from 10am to 11pm everyday! There are several historical buildings here - the Dali museum, Kafka's childhood home, 600 year old astronomical clock, buildings build in the 9th cent - read up a bit before visiting so you don't miss something in the crowd.
Interesting Buildings. I enjoyed learning the history and seeing the beautiful architecture. Lots of interesting around to see like the atomic clock and viewing all the old buildings and shops.

Great Place to Wander!. Prague's Old Town is a great place to wander around with no particular destination. Many of the streets are very old and tiny. There's a fascinating mix of architecture -- look around for amazing little details on buildings, both old and new. It's particularly nice early in the morning or in the evening twilight. All of that said, it's also a great place to find interesting cafes and restaurants. Several small museums are located here, and there's plenty of interesting shopping.
Lifetime experience to see Prague. Old Town at Prague is one of top rated scenic destination with lot of monuments . historical clock and excellent place to eat, relax & hand-out.

One of the best old town district in the world. I have visit so many old town (altstad) in European cities but for sure Prague is the best one; Nice colorful buildings, fantastic sculptures and nice shopping full of handmade crystals. At the end you reach to nice river and you can go to this rout every day and every time find a new nice things.
Town square. Main attraction of Prague. Lots of activities available. Best to spend time in the evening so that you can see the entire area in the daylight and in the dawn as well.

SO BEAUTIFUL!. This is as beautiful as I have heard. The buildings are an architectural amazement, and the square is a visual delight: the astronomincal closck, the church in which you can climb up to the tower are must see's and do's. Sit at one of the restaurants and enjoy the lighted buildings. So beautiful and romantic.
Lovely. One of the best old towns in Europe. You should probably start your day around this area. Contains main attractions in Prague, in addition to various shopping, food and entertainment.

Gorgeous History!. Do stay near this area in Prague1 if you can. This was our first stop after getting to our vacation rental a mere 3 minutes from this large, bustling plaza. Don't be afraid to choose accommodations in this area; especially if they indicate that they are a 2 to 4 minute walk to Old Town Square, as that area will be calmer and quiet. We came back to this area every day, day or night, to see the Astronomical Clock, shop, have a drink at the open air cafes, or just enjoy the fun entertainment or food offered at the little kiosks in the area. Beauitful photo ops, and this is where you will find those tours you might want to take, as well. Just don't change money with those who hawk here, go to a bank or atm, and choose the British flag icon on the screen, for English, and get the best and safest rate. There are lower prices at the stores right off the square, as well as better dining options, all close walking distance in every area near Stare Mesto. This is the lively hub of Prague, don't miss it!

Old town square. My husband and I stayed a few minutes walk from here. The square is beautiful, there is also street entertainers daily . You can hire a horse and cart from the square and a segway. The astronomical clock stands in the square and on the hour the 12 apostles appear. You can also climb to the top of the tower. This is a must.

Stare Mesto. The most iconic landmark of Prague. The Old Town is a mix of pastel colored buildings and fine Gothic architecture. A few notable buildings in the Old Town include the Astronomical clock, Convent of St Agnes, Church of St. Nicholas and the Art Nouveau Municipal Hall
Perfect way to start our stay in Prague.. Best to visit off season and on weekdays, as it gets busy weekends. Lovely shops, people, restaurants, and streets.
Amazing.. great architecture, great restaurants, bustling with life, great street entertainment, great street food and hot wine.

Great to see that many places are restarted. I visited Prague 10 years ago. Many of the greatest sightseeings were not in the best conditions those days. Now I am really pleased to see many of them well maintained and cared of. Well done!

Easy walk. We had a guided private tour today and it was very walkable.. We enjoyed watching the atomic clock and viewing all the old buildings and shops. We plan walking back tomorrow and having lunch and do some shopping .

Very good. The old town of Prague is absolutely fantastic. The bulidings are exceptionally beautiful, and the astronomical clock is a sight to see. We really had a great time in Prague. We stayed really close to the Old Town: at The Marriott. It is close to the Municipal House which is a beautiful building, and has great concerts in the Spring. There is a Hilton close by as well. Both hotels are nice. If you stay at either place, you will save on any bus tours, since most of Prague is enjoyed by walking through it and the hotels are close enough to do it. There are also malls near by (palladium) that have good shopping.
Majestic buildings. Very scenic and beautiful. The cobbled streets provides a rustic charm of the old ages...the square is nice too
Romantic Escapade. Old Town Prage is really a great place.Try the old ham with a beer.I love the place with all the romantic places to go to with your loved ones.Great place to do the shopping.
One of the best squares in Europe. This square is so magical, like a fairytale scene. You can spend time just admiring the architecture and meandering the surrounding streets. A must see destination.

Praha .. City of God. Heart of Bohemia .. Eighth Note of Bohemian Rhapsody .. Here I experienced the most glorious moments of my life .. Praha gave me the essence of poetry in 2003 and went away from me for 9 years to give me the woman I love, with whom I visited Praha for the 2nd time in February 2013 as a bride and groom on their honeymoon. My poem (The Story of Pavla) once went all over the Arab World in 2009 as I recited it on the TV show (Prince of Poets) and it's to this day my most well known poetic experiment. My wife and I had a photo by the closed doors of Prazsky Hrad in remembrance of Kafka's parable (Before the Law)! I hope our beloved baby girl will appreciate one day why her parents fell in love with this piece of the earth, and will love Praha herself.

Should be the highlight of any visit to Prague. This is the old city center. It's bounded on two sides by the Vltava River and on a third by New Town (Nove Mesto). It's full of historic sites, churches, squares, and lots and lots of shopping! Full of nightlife and good fun. Expect prices to be a bit higher here than other sections of Prague.

Old Town, Prague. Incredible architecture, well preserved and clean. The highlight is the astronomical clock at every hour on the hour. All areas are clean and require walking. A lot of tourist traps in this area,and require vigilance for keeping valuables safe. Police patrol the crowded areas very well. The most photogenic area of Prague.

loved it. charming, fun, vibrbt, always something going on, I could watch the mechanical clock over and over, Watching the crowd watching the clock is even more fun. I visited the square any times a day
A long weekend in Prague. Lots of interesting bars and restaurants as well as museums and sights. Well worth a visit and not too expensive. Try to stay in the centre
A must see. Lovely big square with lots of street food. Plenty of shops of all kinds. Tourist tat and others with really nice stuff
Strolling on the bridge.. I enjoyed the view and also did some geocaching. There is one Geocache at the side of the bridge and one on the bridge.

Exquisite environment. We were transported back in time when we visited the Old Town in Prague, it is so meticulously maintained and each building has its own charm and particular beauty and different colour. The horse drawn carriages and vintage open topped cars that troll the cobbled streets lend to its character. The town square is very busy and quite beautiful with its Jan Hus sculpture dominating the central area. We enjoyed visiting the John Lennon Wall, Beethoven's house, the Jewish quarter, the various synagogues, churches and monuments.

Beautiful!. This is a beautiful old town center, and my friends and I had a great time here. There is so much history to discover, and it was very clean. I definitely recommend exploring here and doing some people watching!

A 'must see'. If you go to Prague and don't visit this place, it's as if you never actually visited it! It's definitely a square that offers a lot of facilities and other various entertainments. Visiting it at night is just romantic. You can stop and enjoy the relaxing, different types of music that pianists and guitarists love to get out there.Tip: avoid stopping for a coffee in he centre, the prices are too high.
One major highlite of Praha. Although it was cooler than we expected that didn't keep crowds from showing up each day we were there

Beautiful place in the morning. This is such a beautiful place, every street invites you to wander along further and futher. But I realized that the best time to be here is in the morning. I went out at 8 am, and that was perfect. I had all the streets to myself, except for a few pigeons and street cleaners. Perfect. When I came back a few hours later, the place was crowded with tourists. So try to be out as early as possible, and don't have a plan, just walk. Behind every corner there is something to discover.
just an amazing place to visit "stunning". it really is an amazing building to look at,its like a scary fairytale,would love to see when covered in snow.

Excellent place for people watching. I love coming here and immersing myself in the action. There's always something happening here - from bands, to singers, to acrobats, to soap bubble makers - you can pick and choose. In the summer evenings you can see people just sitting around, chatting, enjoying a drink and the warm weather.You are constantly surrounded by people unless you wake up really early!Tip: if you do get there early enough, you will have the square almost all for yourself!

really really liked it |!. what a cool place to be . beautiful cheap , and nice architect,
good night life , good food , great cheap drinks ,
Beautiful even on the rain. It was raining but I enjoyed the view! I had very nice dinner in the restaurant just underneath the chrch. It was a bit cold, but we got blankets

Amazing. Prague all over was amazing especially the old city. We loved the astronomical clock, the Gothic Church, St Giles Church.. Went to the old town square twice at noon and night just to take pictures. Lovely place

Good area for spending time in. If you visit Prague then you will end up here even if you didn't mean to. Prague is quite easy to get disorientated in but no matter which way you walk you always seem to end up here which is no bad thing.There are plenty of nice buildings to look at, shops to peruse, food to eat, drinks to be had.Prague is a really popular destination so this place is really busy at all times even in the rain.Wander down here and enjoy.
clean , nice building. very good walking instructions , lot's of pubs , restaurants , coffee shops and souvenir shops.main attractions near by
Just beautiful and clean. it is great to sit in the square, have a beer and watch the street entertainers, listen to the music they offer and just watch the world go by.

Amazing Experience. We jumped off the hop on hop off bus here while visiting Prague. Are we ever glad we did. From the street performers to the food vendors everything made a great experience. When in Prague make sure you visit this place.
Brilliant. A great place to visit. Vibrant, bustling and plenty of restaurants, bars. Old Astronomical Clock worth a view. Chimes every hour between 8am and 9pm. Live acts and music.

Beautiful city setting. Old Town is a must see in Prague for all travelers. Lots of stores and restaurants line the streets but the historic structures, churches and steeples make this one of the most picturesque places in Europe.

Wonderful Old Town dating back to medieval times. Classic old-town feel with narrow cobblestone streets, wonderful old buildings with lots of baroque architecture. Lots of shops and restaurants and can be crowded even in the "shoulder season" (October)

wonderfull. Fantastic buildings, so full of culture, and the details on the sculptures are fantastic, works of art, every thing is so well preserved, like walking back in time, very busy area. You have to take a camera with you when you visit Prague.

Holiday. The atmosphere of Prague is hard to explain if you haven't been here before. Although I really loved Vienna which I visited in August I never thought that Prague would top it but it has. Strangely enough the town isn't as beautiful as I'd expected but it has this crazy feel of old and new and music filled cobbled streets with horse drawn carriages and old timer convertibles and the tourists all look so happy. The people here are not the friendliest and appear grumpy most of the time in fact some of them are quite rude sometimes but even this doesn't destroy the charm of this place and rather adds to the character of Prague.The buildings are spectacular, the Charles Bridge beautiful. The old town has a lovely market filled with wooden toys and marionettes that have all been Hand made in the Czech Republic.We've walked these streets so many times in the last few days and done over 50 km in just 4 days but I could keep doing it. There are so many artists here especially on the Charles Bridge which has been closed to traffic and is only accessible on foot. Street musicians and performers, fire eaters, magicians and large bubble makers. Unfortunately so many homeless people begging too, which is sad because nobody in this world should have to do that! All in all Prague is top of my list for a holiday and I would return here in an instant

crowded. Beautiful area which we had visited before. This visit it was very crowded 9/28/15. Nice entertainment in the square and the astronomical clock draws large crowds. A few young people with too much to drink in late eves. Try to eat away from the square to keep costs down.

A fairy tale city. Prague old town comprehends all the most interesting buildings and squares in the city. You can walk randomly along the streets and you will always find some outstanding piece of architecture. The views from Charles Bridge to the castle area are one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen.

Awesome. The old town square was the most amazing place in prague! Totally worth to visit it and check around the whole atmosphere. The only bad thing is that there are too many annoying people there trying to sell anything to tourists.

Great history...but try and avoid peak hour. A great place to see, with lovely architecture all around. The astronomical clock is great to see and an amazing bit of engineering.We lunched just in front of the clock and waited for the hour to tick over and see the figures come out. Worthwhile, when you consider the age of the clock

Clock is magical. Love this place! The architecture is amazing, the clock turns into something magical at certain times of the day. Lots of tourists but still dont turn into a tourist circus. be ready to take lots of pictures in this area and experience Europe.
Incredible. One of the best urban spaces I've ever seen. It oozes with history. The street entertainers adds it's charm.
Must-see place. Lots of beautiful places. We love walking around this lovely square in cold weather. We would definitely be back in some day.

The heart of Praha. A must by day and night, here you find the Our Lady of Tyn Church, Astronomical clock, musicians , walk through on your way to Charles Bridge or the Jewish Quarter. Some good restaurants and many tourist ones as well there are several food stalls that are awesome for regional food and a beer at a great prices
A Gorgeous City. Walk slowly through the Old Town. Enjoy the cobblestone streets, winding through an older city that reaches out and grabs you.

A fairy tale castle to beat Disney. The best way to see this place is at night. The town planners have done a fabulous job at lighting the place up and showing it off to it's best.
The surrounding area gets very busy with tourists, but it's worth the grief. If you think romance is dead, go see this place. Stunning doesn't begin to cover it.
Old town. Lovely walk about worth it for scenery and places to visit, clock is worth it. There is a few street entertainers which are good plus a few beggars, though not a hindererenous.
Beutiful City. The whole of Prague is a beutiful city but the old town with its baroque architecture and astronomical clock is a must
I loved Stare Mesto. The old town part of Prague is wonderful! A treat for the eyes, places to visit, eat, shop and walk day and night !
Beautiful Prague. Old town is DEFINETLY a "need to go place" in prague. There is so much history and architecture to see here!
Another world. Cobbled streets old public houses, restaurants and interesting walking areas a must for anyone especially in the winter
Very Walkable incredibly BEAUTIFUL!. What an amazing city. It has so much beauty and history. The only city in Europe that was not affected by bombings from World War one or two. A must see!

A "must visit" in Prague. No trip to Prague would be complete without a visit to Old Town and its famous square. Great shops and cafes, but also the markets with local food, produce, cheeses and sausages. Of course, being in the Czech Republic, there's the smell of local hams roasting over open coals everywhere.As my wife shopped for local handicrafts, I enjoyed a local beer in the open market, with ham and sausages. A perfect way to spend an Autumn afternoon.

Wonderful old town. The old town in Prague is beautiful, well worth a couple of hours of wandering around. Try one of the tubular pastries that they sell, they are delicious. Cafes etc are a little more expensive in this area but great for people watching.

Beautiful Place. This place is magic.
You will enjoy having an evening walk through the small streets of the old town.
Prague is easy to learn and hard to forget :)
Amazing . A must go for tourists and travellers!! Definitely recommend climbing up the Astronomical Clock for a panoramic view!!

Lovely old buildings, steep climb up to beatiful views of the Old Town. Came by tram from the Wencenslas Square, by changing once. You can take vintage car up to the viewing point or climb up. Lots of lovely small shops and restaurants.

Excellent walking city. Pros:
Lots of nice sights. Great architecture, lots of history.view from Charles Bridge nicer than view of Charles Bridge
Well developed tourist infrastructure
Cons
Tourist crush
Uphill climbing
So delightful. I love this beautiful square. Something for everyone. An amazing clock, horse-drawn buggies, live music, food...
Looks like a fairytale. Enjoyed walking around, gets crowded but worth it. Lots of young people - seems to be a party place for the 20-somethings.

Unique, fun, food, caffes and souvenir shopping.. Must see in Brahe. Endless photo taking views. When hungry lots of restaurants , if you get tired there is a lot of massage shops for your feet. It's not enough to come only once to this area.
Good for families with kids.

Beautiful. The old town really is beautiful. Filled with old buildings it is a site to see. I wish I had taken a tour of the old city so I could have learned more about it. But just walking thru it is a must do. Keep the camera ready because you will want to take a lot of pictures. My only complaint - due to the popularity the streets here get very crowded and this is a big meeting place for tours. Other than that it is great.
Beautiful City. Totally worth a visit. It's one of the most beautiful cities I've visited. There's lots of places to visit and lots of things to do.
Beautiful Buildings. The ambience and atmosphere is great - just spend time soaking it up, and don't miss the astronomical clock, the music, and the street food.

The fun is the people. The Old Town, specially the square has lots of interesting places to visit. The architecture is marvelous. Visit he Cathedral, the Astronomic Clock Tower, and wander all around the small streets.
Beautiful but Touristy. If you can look past the tourists, the large groups of Chinese men and women carrying selfie sticks, architecture and history is phenomenal.

Beautiful, but too popular . One of the most charming old town in Europe - besides Salzburg or Bruges -, so simply a must see for everyone. There are too many tourists, especially groups, so after a while you feel that you should to look for some hidden places... and fortunately Prague has them too.

Gorgeous old city but very crowded. My last visit to Prague was in 1996, and I don't remember there being very many tourists at all at the time. Fast forward to Oct 2015 and the place is just infested, especially in the vicinity of the Charles Bridge. That said, there's a good reason why there are so many people visiting and that's because Prague really is a beautiful old city. It's worth making the effort to get up early to try an minimise the crowds though.

Wat amazing sculptures. Could not get off my eyes from the buildings in the old town .. Walked around 10 times in 3 days in the amazing streets of the old town and if given a chance can do it whole my life

The most beautiful old town in the world. Prague's Stare Mesto is for me the most beautiful old town in the world.Historical houses with wonderful facades, interesting squares, many cafes and restaurants, shops with souvenirs and rich local food offer. The Jewish part nearby is also worth to visit. There are some pleasant private boutique hotels. I stayed in one of them some years ago and it was great, even if the prices are probably not the lowest ones!
Who doesn't love Stare Mesto?. Beautifully maintained, charming architecture, good restaurants. Very crowded because everyone loves Stare Mesto!
scarey. we found Prague dangerous. we were there in Nov 2014 and wanted to be inside by nightfall. I would NEVER go back.
Step back in time. Prague is just amazing there is so much to see in such a small area that most things are walking distance. Great range of restaurants and shops we loved it
Fun!!. The architecture here is like no where else!! There's so much going on in old town an so many great places to grab a drink and a bite to eat!!

Architecture sublime. We spent a whole day there artiving at the astronomical clock at 10 then went up the town hall tower for the city view which is perfect to see the whole city and also to orientate yourself in the city! We spent the rest of the early afternoon with the kids enjoying shows of soap bubbles and traditional music. The kids loved it and we came back the next day for a short visit. The church of Our Lady before Tyn is more impressive from the outside. St. Nicholas Church was closed for some maintenance and we couldn't go in. All in all, a nice experience for the whole family.

Old Town and Prague Castle. We did an excellent walking free tour of Prague with David (Czech) in the morning. He is very knowledgeable and funny. Joined him again in the afternoon for a visit to Prague Castle. Goa great overview of the city. Thankl you, David.

Beautiful. The old town is amazing to walk around and explore. Lots of lovely small shops and cafes and such beautiful architecture. Be sure to see the clock tower strike as this feature is one of the best Ive seen worldwide.

Amazing, Breathtaking,. There is so much to see, do, and enjoy here. The history is all around and its a photographical city. The market stalls is a must for your lunch/dinner snacks, the one we used was excellent, see pics. This is an amazing place to chill-out in, and this along with other areas to visits is a must for everyone, cant wait for my next visit.

Awesome area!. The square was so alive anytime of the day. In the evening we were treated to a nightly concert by street performers which was incredible! The clock itself, however, was its own show!!!

Prague at its best. The atmosphere, architecture, people, shops, and restaurants....this IS Prague. Go off the Square and wander around. You might get a little lost, but you can always get back to the Square, and who knows what you might find along the way?
Sunny day at Prague. Unforgettable time spent in Prague. Old Town Square needs to be visited to feel the atmosphere - music, sweet smell of chocolate and barbecue.

Sandman Walking Tour Prague. We seem to be becoming Sandemans Walking Tour groupies because we look to do them whenever we arrive in a new large city. They always begin at a central location that is easy to find via public transport. Half way through there is a coffee and toilet break and they can still be held in the rain as long as you go prepared.Martin was an amazing guide, making our tour interesting, factual, entertaining and almost reducing us to tears with the personal stories relating to his family and political oppression which forced some difficult decisions to be made.If you want to find out more, you'll have to do Martin's tour to hear how these sagas unfolded!The free walking tour was so good that we booked to do the paid Castle tour in the afternoon and that was equally good.We have now done 5 Sandemans tours and recommend them to everyone. We're heading towards retirement and are fit and able, so they're not just for youngsters and are definitely the best way to see and get to know a new city.Their payment is in the form of a 'tip' - you decide how much you think the tour was worth. We've always felt inclined to be generous with our tips as we have had 1/2 day of entertainment, exercise, good company, photo opportunities, plus geography and history lessons, without the boredom of a classroom!Thanks Martin from Prague.
Best part of old town!. So much to do and see in Old Town. So much history and beauty. Plenty of shopping and restaurants too.

So special and monumental!. We keep coming back to it. Climb the clock tower for a better view, visit the churches around, check out the meridian traced on the floor, walk around and enjoy! Avoid being there too late at night, the crowd changes a bit.
Very nice town. Some lovely sites and architecture. Very medieval and quite romantic. Avoid eating in the restaurants on the main square as they can be 50% dearer than those just off it.
Old Town Square. Beautiful...breathtaking....go to the top of the tower for spectacular views...in the summer go early due to crowds and tour groups...buy water at local Penny Market
Fun and lots to see!. Great area and lively square. Lots of good restaurants and bars around here. Have to see the Astronomical clock when it strikes on the hour!
Photo ops galore. architecture is amazing, lots of historic buildings, many buskers especially a night in the Old Town Square, some excellent,restaurants galore, shop till you drop, it is all here

Fansstic winter vibe. The great thing about Prague, is, unlike out her tourist hotspots, there is never any pressure to buy from sellers.
A great are with history, food, shops and locals.
Cool place. This is where I went to start the free walking tour of Prague at 11am. A very cool group of local musicians were performing here the day we were here.

nice place to hang out. the place i stayed at is located within walking distance from here. gets very busy during peak hours but nice place to hang around and people watch. wouldnt recommend eating in the restos in the area though, coz its too pricey for the taste i think. just do a bit more walking and you'll find a much better place for eating.

Very crowded with tourists and entertainers. Beautiful city of Prague. You will walk through here many times to go anywhere. There are LOTS of entertainers. Beware of the food stalls. They show a price, but it is per kg, and you may be shocked at what they charge you for their heavy potato dumplings, sauerkraut with minuscule pieces of Old Prague Ham
Unique place. The old town is a special place, always crowded though so if you want to enjoy it with less people and see well the astronomic clock, go in the morning like 9-10 am.

Best part of Prague!. This is the most popular, most happening part of Prague! You'll find everything here, local food, Czech garnet shops, cafés, souvenirs, tour operators, segway tours, you name it. There is SO MUCH to do! And its connected to every other part of Prague. Walk up to Charles bridge from here, or the Lennon wall, or the opera theatre. It's all a walk away!

Cobblestone streets . Loved walking along these streets, loads to see with buildings, stores and people watching.
Many courtyards as well, which don't show on the maps but sometimes held hidden treasures worth exploring.
Prague old town is one of the best places to visit in Europe.. It has all the activities that suits all age groups. general siteseeing, to all night parties, to food varieties and of course - BEER!!!

Not sure there is a point in reviewing it. You are not really going to visit Prague and not walk the old town? Why even review it? If you don't like the idea of walking through the narrow streets with the beautiful architecture (and ok, the tourist crowds and all the tourist shops) why did you even visit Prague?

Beautiful Gothic and Baroque architecture. My favorite small city in Europe. Unscathed by WW II. Great food, people. Hotels are good; a little hard to navigate since all street signs are in Czech, but you van figure it out. Palace, Charles Bridge are awesome.

Fairytale scenery with fabulous ham and hot wine!. If you love cobblestone, ornate facades, gorgeous buildings in easter egg colors to look at while you sip hot wine and eat Prague Ham at a lovely stand up table in the middle, you'll LOVE Old Town. There is nothing here to critique... it is perfect.
Like being in a fairy tale!. One of the most beautiful squares in Europe, with castle-like turrets & clock towers & charming buildings everywhere!! Not to be missed!!

Romantic little town center, market square and astronomical clock. The town center of Prague is really romantic. It also had a romantic story behind the two towers as one is bigger i.e. the man and other one is smaller i.e. lady. The market can be pricey. The astronomical clock is a bit of disappointment, but its amazing when you think that it still works accurately. It does a little clockwork during each hour.

Heart of Old Town. The square offers a beautiful 360 view of Old Town architecture and is a pleasant place to simply sit and watch the tourists pass by, especially after the hourly astronomical clock show ends. Food carts offer great snacks and soft drinks and cafes with outdoor seating line the sides of the square.

You must not miss the clock. One of the main parts of the old town square is the clock, A must not miss, On the hour and every hour you get to watch the astronomical clock's mechanical figures of the apostles move around the windows.

nice and clean. Wondeful city, very clean ,well organised, relaxing and charming , full of shops and attractions or just for walking around and get lost in its history. In general very romantic and indeed one of the best capitals in europe
Nice square!. The astronomical clock isn't that exciting at all but overall it is a really nice old town square, you should really go there as a tourist!
Wonderful Stare Mesto. Wonderful part of Prague, lots of narrow streets with lots of hidden shops and restaurants. Also a lot of people. A must visit in Prague.
great atmosphere. I loved the restaurants and ambiance in the old town square. The food and level of service is excellent.

funtastic day and night time. i was there day and night time. it was great to see many tourist ariubd day time . we went to segway too. and fansinating at night. many artist singing dancing and some exhibition. lights at night makes all the building more nice.

Go for the free walking tour. The city itself is beautiful, but even in the off season I found the old city to be extremely crowded with tourists, which is a turnoff for me. The clock tower is the most disappointing national treasure I've ever seen. There are are some fun restaurants and bars nearby. The free tour I took was fantastic. The guides for the english tour guides hold yellow umbrellas at the old town square. Our guide was funny but was really pumping us for tips throughout the tour, which I felt was a bit of a turnoff.
Beautiful architecture. Nice place for stopping and having a refreshing Czech beer and people watching, lots of street entertainers
Must go if you are in Prague. Its the central area where everyone goes full of shops and eateries and nice to have some pics taken.Very lively especially at night!

Beautiful Place, filled with tourists from all around the world.. Old town is beautiful, the buildings are remarkable, and I enjoyed it very much. However, be warned it feels more like a tourist destination rather than a historical site because just about every shop is a souvenir shop selling the same 'Prague" branded t-shirts, mugs, and glassware. But that is common and not a big deal to me. If you enjoy old buildings and a diverse atmosphere, then this is a must see for you.
Fun people watching. Very busy with a lot of people. We were constantly warned to be careful of pick pockets but we didn't have any problems.

It is so beautiful, I thought I was on a movie set. I could spend hours there, so much to see. The jewish area, the oldest 13century synagogue , the lovely elaborate facades of the buildings, places to eat.

Great place to spend some time. Prague is a beautiful city especially the old town and of course the square with the astronomical clock. The square is where the tourists are so it can get quite crowded. It is a lively place filled with street performers, segways, and tourists with selfie sticks. It is also heaven for pickpockets so beware. There are many cafes and shops and there are also stalls selling delicious street food such as Trdelniks, ham & cabbage, and sausages. All of the streets leading into the square are lined with shops. There is some really great architecture in old town so take the time to walk around the streets.

Charming . Area is bustling with activity. Beatific sites. Street venders selling "Trdelniks", cinnamon covered dough, tasty treats. The Astrinonomical Clock and several church's and Synagogues. Upscale shopping.

Amazing buildings. Because of where our hotel was located, we basically had to walk through here several times a day to get to most places in Prague. Not really a bad thing to have to do! The architecture here is amazing! I think you will be hard pressed to go to any other square in Europe to find more architectural types in one place. There is a nice wide open space in the middle where street performers usually end up, especially at night. And of course, the astronomical clock is over to the side. There are plenty of cafes here and even some directly in front of the clock. There are also some shops to wander through (but there are better places to shop). Don't miss out on see the 27 crosses at the base of the tower that the clock is on. They are located on the ground near the small park with trees facing the square. They are a memorial for the Protestant nobles, merchants & intellects were beheaded in 1621 after the Battle of White Mountain.
Bustling with musicians, tourists and segway salepersons. Nice busy square packed with tourists. Nice to visit at night too because the ambience is so different when the sun is down.

Lovely place. The square is very lively with tons of people, vast variety of restuarants, and these awesome foodcarts with local food. The sausages are very good. We sat down in the middle of the square and had some food and some local brewed beer and enjoyed the night admiring the old buildings.

Beautiful buildings, street performers and restaurants. If you are visiting Prague this should be on your list of places you should see. The buildings are gorgeous. It contains a clock that dates back to 1410, the Church of Mother of God Tyn which started being built in the 14th century and was finishedin the early 15th century, the Kinsky Palace which is a museum and St Nicholas church and many more buildings. The statue of Jan Hus is a fitting tribute to a man who was burned at the stake for his beliefs. It's also a lively place with restaurants, shops and street performers. There were lots of tourists when I visited on a Tuesday afternoon but you could still move around freely.
Nice area, very crowded. This is a very nice place with lots to see. Unfortunately there was lots of people when we visited, making it a bit to crowded.

wonderful. Just watch the world go by,grab a coffee in cafes in square,and admire the building,the clock is brilliant,recommend a guided tour the city is beautiful,watch out for the bad minicab drivers they will do you,hurry and visit as it was getting commercialised, please try bohemian dumplings they are brill,hope you enjoy.l did!!!
A must see!. Take a short walk through the Old Town and experience the performers, the clock tower, the little shops and arts and crafts. Marvel in the restored buildings and church towers.

Nice place but gets packed. We wa dered round here alot during the day and at night, it gets packed with tourists and street artists, watch out for pick pockets, i heard that they operate in this area but did not have a bad experiance myself, at ine end of the square you have the astonomical clock which i cant explain you have to go see yourself, wonderful piece of engineering for 600 yr old clock, around the edge of the sqare are bars and restaurants, inside the square are various venders selling trdjelnik ( im sure thats not how you spell it ) and pork rolls, the smells are great and will make you think of the old town square whenever you smell woodsmoke, a wonderful place with interesting architecture.
very interesting. All the buildings were magnificent, interesting mix of people and good restaurants. Many souvenir shops but also some Thai massage and a chocolate factory.

Architecture... WOW. This is a pretty amazing site with lots of history.. I advise in taking a guided tour as there is so much history , and you won't want to miss it . The Architecture is truly amazing throughout..... Enjoy.......
twin towers. those towers are located in old town, and in nice square that you will find full of people. you can get up and have view of the city.
Beautiful. A wonderful collection of beautiful buildings, all much loved and marvellous to stroll around and admire
GOOD PLACE BAD PEOPLE. this is a nice place to stay, stop and sleep. The problem was that it was overcrowded and 1 or 2 I found myself in admiration for the locals hatred of the red army

Center of the tourist area!! Fun, interesting, and diverse!. There are lots of neat areas in Prague but the Old Town Square is the obvious center of the tourist area. A few blocks from the Old Jewish Quarter, surrounded by grand cathedrals, churches, and picturesque buildings, and adjacent to the Astronomical Clock (with wonderful views from the tower), it is a great place to spend time. It is frequently livened up by street performers, and a great place to view the hustle of horse-drawn carriages, classy tourist vehicles, and segway tours. Indoor and outdoor cafes abound and the streets around it are filled with opportunities for interesting photos. It would be a mistake to visit Prague and not spend some time relaxing and taking in the beauty and energy of the area!

Worth a look. Always busy, but worth going to as there is some good street entertainment on offer and stunning scenery and architecture. I wouldn't bother to eat out or go for a drink here as it is all very overpriced. Just stroll 2 minutes away from the square and the prices drop dramatically.
Great street food. Visited this square multiple times during our two days in Prague. Had sausage&inert and grapes and coffee. Some interesting entertainment at night.

Old Charm. Old Town square is a must visit for any tourist to Prague. It is amazing to see old buildings with beautiful architecture testimony to great abilities of people who lived here long ago. Variety of food including authentic Czech food also available.

Pragues expensive must-see. Pragues old town with all it's little streets is a beautiful work of art.Just go out and explore it on your own, you can't do anything wrong.You won't see a lot of Czech people because the old town is just full of tourists from all around the world.Watch out for the prices - it doesn't matter what you want to bis, everything costs less when you take a 2 minute walk outside of the oldtown. Especially the money exchange houses are all expensive and try to trick you.Another suggestion : Enjoy the traditional "Trdelnik" (Baked Czech bread) on your way through the old town.
The reason for visiting Prague. If you are visiting Prague as a tourist this area is a must. Great architecture small shops and restaurants and containing some of the key toursit attractions.
Certainly the "heart" of the city.. So much to see. So many choices of restaurants or food stalls. Loads of shopping both on the square and around side streets. A must if visiting this charming city.
Great Historic Walk. This is a great place to begin your historic tour of Prague. Lots of great sites to stroll through on a sunny day.

Festival of Lights. It's festival of lights in Prague at the moment and the Old Town Centre is packed to overflowing. There are buskers of all sorts from Jazz, to violin to African druming and didgeridoo playing. Also lots of street food and of course all the restaurants and tourist shops. It's great fun.
Loved the Old Town! A must see!. We walked all over Old Town. Filled with shops, cafes, and beautiful history. I especially loved the old castle bridges, cobblestone streets and all the little shops.

Hard to believe its 21st century. The history is omnipresent in Old Town (and other places in Prague). No disturbance with modern architecture. Very harmonic and welcoming place. Only bad thing is overcrowding with tourists. Next time, we will come off season, and I would recommend it to everybody. And get yourself in shape - it is easy to spend hours and hours walking around.
Nice. Fantastic trip over old town, a lot of variety of shops and markets, you can find different tipical food and beautiful items to buy

Beautiful..... It was a journey of joy from architectural point of view. Every building, every corner and monument worth a stop to look at. It is the most concentrate Architectual travel one can wish to have if he likes this type of buildings. Add to this all the characters one can see around and this is a best place for any photographer to visit. I will be back :)

Beautiful part of Czech history. Visit old town and explore all of the historic buildings and churches. Along with all of the other tourists, enjoy the old town square and all of the statues and restaurants. Nice place to spend some time and money and enjoy the outdoors.

Magical&romantic. So magical beeing there! We absolutely loved it! Exellent place for couples coz it's so romantic. When you're in old town you forget about the time, you don't see people rushing somewhere, no stress, just enjoying. Like time stopped
Fun to be there. soo many restaurants around. its a nice view/walk and fun to be there. Try to go in eve as well as in morning. This place demands 2 rounds.

Gorgeous town square . Being in the square during the day was a really cool experience..there's a lot to see and food stands all over to grab a bite to eat and the astronomical clock is close by as well so that made it pretty cool. I was a bit disappointed though when I returned at night, although it was still a very bustling atmosphere, I guess I felt the area kind of shut down early, or maybe it's because I visited in October and not July?

Free Walking Tour. There are many free walking tours to choose from but it will be nice to register before your trip so you don't have to be put on a waitlist. The tours start from the Old Town. We spent 3 hours walking with a local guide and learnt some history of the country. The walking tour is free and you may tip any amount to the local guide.
nice. the architecture is nice,each palace has its own history.a lot of shops for crystal and granat jewels.negotiate the price
Great place to hangout. A lot of places located around here to explore. Easy to find out. Many food courts located. Many artists are performing many skills. U will enjoy ur time here.
Beautiful town square.. Watch the clock on every hour when it starts moving. See the rooster sing, and the figurines move. Lots of restaurants and plenty of action at night.

Center of Prague. Wonderful meeting place and center of old Prague! There are food stalls on the east side of the square selling sausages, ham, and other finger foods. There are also restaurants on the south side. The square is always busy with street musicians and performers. Definitely have to check it out. And what makes this the most spectacular sight is the old cathedral at night. Definitely check out the Old Town Square at night! It is the most beautiful at that time!!!!

A real highlight, especially at night. A beautiful setting for a late-night walk, meal or drink. There is a wide range of restaurants serving all kinds of food from Italian and 'grills' to delicious, local Czech specialties.

Prague....a city to enjoy. Wonderful to walk thru this place in history with my students marveling at the architecture. It is a pleasure for a teacher to be able to show students the real thing, not just photos in books. There were many people enjoying the mild weather. At home in Massachusetts....snow and ice and cold! We loved Prague....
Heart of Prague. Grab a table at a sidewalk cafe and watch the world go by. This is where all roads cross. It can be a little hectic sometimes with visiting groups but in a good way.
Always fun to wander around in Old Town Prague. Good pedestrian access through all of old town. Public transit though is more on the edge of old town so bring your walking shoes

breathtaking architecture simply everywhere. breathtaking architecture simply everywhere, every building has it's statues and monuments. like going back with a time machine 100 years back. 200, 500, 1000 years back. and all in very short distance walk. A very beautiful town indeed.

Beat the crowds if you want to see anything. Full of historic buildings etc etc but if you want to experience its magic and take some photos without the hoards of tourists doing peace signs and jumping in the air go early.
A beautiful sight. If you are a history buff and like old architecture, this is perfect. Plenty of street vendors and shops. Good for people watching.
A piece of history. Wandering through the streets of Stare Mesto is like going back in time to the golden age of Europe. Hugely atmospheric and highly recommended.

Magical. Very much like fairy tales and walt disney movies. Lots of street arts , street food And indeed local Beer. Dont forget the wooden toys and dolls special to CZ republic. One can have a visit from vaclavsky nemesty and blvd which is 10 min walk from old town Sq. While in old town Sq you may climb top of the clock tower to have a nice view of prague. All together , a magical city in the hart of the europe. Dont miss a chance for a visit

Excellent Area. The area is full of charming streets lined with shops, cafes, restaurants and of course beautiful buildings, churches and squares. Full of people, each happily clicking photos of their loved ones against several sites. Enjoy walking the area. Must, must visit when in Prague.

beautifull is not enough. An absolutely amazing cultural place ,the structures scenery have history oozing out of every nook crany and sculpture.we shopped we ate we drank we walked (miles) we were surprised and amazed by everything
Just a nice place to walk. Well, all in all you can find many things there, included shops, old house and building, restaurants and cafe shops.

You must visit several times. We stayed within a long walking distance to Old Town, at the La Boutique Hotel. Wonderful stay. Old town is a marvelous, awesome experience. We went there daily, sometimes repeatedly at different times of day. The atmosphere of Old Town is something not to be missed. We loved dining in the various cafes, drinking beer, taking photos, people watching.. we ate at the food stalls, terrific food. Yes, the cafes directly on the square are a tad more costly than cafes a few streets over. And we visited the cafes on adjacent streets as well. it's all good. it's all about having an experience and enjoying the sights, sounds and atmosphere of the place. It was all-around goodness. If you are a photographer of any level, you will adore Old Town and the adjacent streets, all of them. And you'll want to walk them repeatedly. You just won't be able to help yourself.It gets crowded by the clock. But even then, it's an experience not to be missed (at the top of the hour). From Old Town you can walk to the Opera House area, and have tea and goodies at tea time...or eat in the outside cafe at all hours of the day, and the food there is fantastic. There are just too many good things to say about Old Town and the adjacent areas. Again, you won't be able to help yourself but to want to walk them time and time again.

Beautiful old streets and architecture. Wonderful old streets and buildings. Unfortunately like so many other tourist draws it is swamped with people and touristy places. But go a block or two off the main streets to walk around and it's a whole different world much calmer and easier to walk around.
Orloj. We visited this place mainly because of astronomical clocks but entire square is awesome. Shopping centers are near
Amazing walk worth the time. Most stores are the same repeate. Repeat but great street ice cream, great local beer, buy local wine really good wine. The bridge Charles bridge great .

Bustling square with great history and beautiful architecture. Loved hearing about the history behind the famous clock tower and cathedrals in this area. Located right near Charles Bridge it was lovely to order an (overpriced) beer in the courtyard while people watching. Loved our time in Prague, this is a must-see for the city.
Stunning!!. There are just not enough words to describe just how breathtaking this city is. No matter what part of the city you're in, you just can't help standing in aw of it's beauty.

Incredibly beautiful and pleasant. Prague is incredibly tourist-friendly, apart from the fact the streets are sinuous and may get you lost easily. But even getting lost is not bad at all - you will always end up in a beautiful little alley that will finally lead you to one of the main streets. The architecture is fascinating, the medieval atmosphere is enchanting, and the food (specially sweets) are gorgeous.

Very beautiful . The old town is the prettiest place in Prague with its lovely cobbled streets, impressive square and buildings, plus it's many lovely restaurants and bars. Like any old town the best way is to just let yourself get lost and you never know what little gem you will stumble upon. Another must visit while in Prague day or night
Very busy. Very busy watch your belongings plenty to se and do.lovely bars and restaurants. Some restaurants are over priced shop around first.

Must See Part of Prague. Old Town is full of tourists so it is best to visit in the morning, but in doing so, you must come back at night too. Its very pretty, and you can see architecture spanning several centuries lined up all around Old Town Square. Excellent people watching, and some good but also pretty pointless street performers are common. Watch out for Segway tour companies around the square, they are the most annoying thing you will find. Good food is everywhere in this area, the food stands set up in the square and the markets nearby are a must visit. Don't miss trying the tredlink. Enjoy!

Beautiful Architecture, Mysterious Paths, and Lively Streets. Our time was limited, but we thoroughly enjoyed our walk over the Charles Bridge and exploring the streets of Stare Mesto. Lots of great window shopping, street musicians, cafes, and just wonderful old buildings and walkways.

Beautiful area to sit and relax. We stayed in Prague for only 3 nights and most nights came here. The square takes on a new life at night, entertainers, buskers and flame dancers to name a few. Plenty of eating places to choose from and reasonable prices too. During the day the shops are terrific, you can get anything you want and the souvenir shops are good value. The Astronomical clock is there too, crowds are thick but it's tall and you get a good shot of the figures parading around the tower.

PleSure. An ex citing place very dynamic.a lot of tourists especially at the astronomical clock.the city is clean.old monuments are mingeled with new shops.the pricrs for the tourists are good. Recently,we visited Budapest.close citirs sharing common history.Prague,however as the old saying,is the Psris of central europe.highly recomended.
All w. Most of what you will seek when travelling to Prague are located in the old town, monuments, restaurants, nightlife, shopping, all accessible by foot.

The reason we went.. On our list of places to visit. We experienced such helpfulness from the locals and shop owners. Prague, Salzburg and Cresky Kumluv. My sister and I traveled by "the seat of our pants" with no electronics and only two reservations in 10 days of travel. Marvelous.

Picturesque!!. It's a must visit if you're in Prague.The buildings are well preserved and looks exactly like potrayed by the street artist.I would suggest all of you to take the Night/Evening Cruise along the river as it gives you a good view of Prague.For that, visit the Czech Republic version of Groupon as they have many cruise to offer at a remarkably low price but REMEMBER TO EMAIL THEM AND ASK ARE THERE ANY AVAILABLE SLOTS on the duration of your visit before paying for the coupon online.

Beautiful to go there. Use the underground to go in Prague to all kind of places. That metro is sometimes very deep down in the city with very long escalators, very special. Als visit the jewish cemetery and the Bridge Carols Brucke.
Pretty. Great buildings and the astronomical clock is definitely worth a visit. Would suggest that if in Prague you should visit the square and take in the atmosphere. Quaint.
Great walking tour. The Old Town Square is beautiful and full of things to do. So many shops, eateries and the architecture is amazing. You can spend all day in the square.
Very busy at most times of the day. Always very busy, some great street entertainers but watch your valuables.Plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from.

Very well preserved. Even if it was off-season, bad weather (rain and cold), the streets were everyday full and there are lots of things to do, especially after 6pm, when almost all attractions close in October - but not here!
unforgettable. fascinating buildings, cathedrals, shops .... Best in Prague at night, when lights in all its beauty.
Trip avoidance. Great scenery but beware of organised trips. They are a nightmare, pushing and shuving. Visti in evening or early morning.
Great atmosphere day and night. Amazing at night with all the Gothic building lit up. Jewish quarter interesting and atmospheric. Some great musicians playing in the square. watch out for seqways!

Must Do. we spent several hours roaming around the old town square and watching the various artists performing their acts.
a definite must do when in Prague
It's alright . Nice buildings, lots of people but to be honest there are many places in Prague that are just as nice so why focus here?
Great walk. Being in the old town and just meandering around is a great experience. Just soaking up the atmosphere was great and watching the various street characters was interesting.

We sat in one of the many restaurants and listened to lovely music from random entertainers.. Such historic buildings Lovely shops, many restaurants and lively entertainment constantly on offer in the main square.

Great place to people watch. You can hear 20 different languages at any give time. So much to see, some good places for a drink as well. The Segways are fun, try to stick with level ground areas if you can, much easier.
great at day too crowded at night. I loved the architecture, really beautiful but hate that is so much people, make it difficult to walk. lots of nice places to eat
Old Town Fun. numerous cafes, restaurants. all the beer is good. many walking tours available. Did a ghost tour at night - very fun

A constant buzz.... This is where you go to be entertained. Lot's of very good street theatre and there is a great buzz about the place from morning until night. Mind you don't get run over by the many Segway riders trying to get you to book a tour.

People watching place. Just a really interesting place. Cathedrals, cafes, people watching. The astronomical clock is here and a lot of people wait around to watch it do it's "thing". Don't waste your time unless you just happen to be there when it goes off.
The Center. Great place to be day or night. There are restaurants, shops, tourist attractions, tourist info center next door to the Astronomical Clock.

Prague Winter Holiday. During my winter holiday into Prague, I was amazed of the beautiful scenery and magnificent building. Prague, capital of the Czech Republic, is bisected by the Vltava River. Nicknamed “the City of a Hundred Spires,” it's known for its Old Town Square, the heart of its historic core, with colorful baroque buildings, Gothic churches and the medieval Astronomical Clock, with a popular show. Completed in 1402, pedestrian Charles Bridge is lined with 30 statues of saints.I would definitely will come back again on my next holiday vacation. Prague is one of my favorite spot in eastern europe.Love Prague!Rgds,John De Ignacio(Sabah East Malaysia).

Wonderful old buildings and towers. Wonderful area to wander around, eat in a sidewalk café and see the old clock with the twelve apostles on the hour. Be sure to watch your valuables as it is a crowed venue. Lots of crown producing spontaneous entertainers.

Unique Experience in Stare Mesto. Great place to watch people, hang out and sample all kinds of food. Also try the Thai massage place where you can dip your feet in the fish tanks and have the small carp nibble all the dead skin off of your feet. it is quite relaxing and costs about $20 US for 30 minutes.
Lively place. Must see this place esp the Astronomical clock. The place is filled with activity of various flavors. Lots of cafes nearby.
Heart of Old Town. Heart of the Old Town in Prague, seasonal markets, galleries and churches, a must when you visit this beautiful city!

Most visually amazing historic city. Of all the places in the world we have visited, Prague is the most visually stunning of cities. We stayed in the heart of Old Town where we arrived by train from Berlin. The train ride from Berlin is worth the trip by itself almost, because the sightseeing from it is excellent.The sheer volume of ornate Gothic and ancient buildings is stunning. There is something to see at every turn in Prague. There is something to eat at evergy turn also. A walk across the bridge to the Prague Castle is more than worth the effort. We spent two days walking around in Prague and could have spent several more. Prague should be a "must see" on every international traveler's bucket list.
LOVE PRAGUE!. This is the heart of Prague with so much life and people watching. I loved spending time here night and day.

Lovely but very crowded . The old town is beautiful for sure. However i thought prague would be full of gothic architecture, it isn't! Yes there are a few spires etc but it's far more like vienna than I expected. It is however like stepping back in time and it's completely full of history where you can imagine life centuries ago.

Beautiful Prague. Just gorgeous and well worth a visit. The architecture is stunning and the views from the bridge breathtaking.
I would recommend taking a boat trip.

Stepping back in time... Prague old town ..medieval narrow cobbled streets lined with grand facades and spired buildings,restaurants,bars and numerous gift and souvenir shops.Good walking shoes are a must due to the cobblestone streets and the tram tracks that intersect the main roads.Its busy day and night and it seems all year round ..we visited early October and it was rammed..It's a history buffs dream, but above all its a place of staggering beauty for all to enjoy ..from watching on the hour the animated figures of the astronomical clock,to the majestic main square surrounded by cafes with backdrops of spired buildings straight out of a fairytale.Cafe culture and its best.Prague is a gem of a city ..and now top of my recommendation list...
Nightwalk. Wonderful view, lively square with a lot of opportunities for having some food, drink or coffee. Also some street performance for entertainment.
Central square. Best place to meet people arround the world and also to be entertained and have fun by public artists.
Nice place for sightseeing. Good place to walk and buy souvenirs. A lot of restaurants and small shops. Many street musicians and other performers.
Stunning. The old town of Prague is absolutely fantastic. The builστdings are exceptionally beautiful, and the astronomical clock is a sight to see. We really had a great time in Prague.

One of the best town squares in all of Europe. Large square with many sighs, beautiful clock that is a must see, plays on the hour. Plenty of street venders and a monument to the start of the reformation
Worth visitting. Be aware there can also be a lot of tourists at times so avoid high seasons. Lovely atmosphere and scenic buildings.
Heart and soul of Prague!. This tis the heart and soul of Prague. One simply must experience it! Thoroughly beautiful and enjoyable.

Easy to get to all the "towns". We stayed in old town for 3 nights. We walked everywhere. Everything was within easy walking distance except the castle. Wear good walking shoes if you plan to explore.

Enchanting. Beautiful architecture and interesting stories all around. I recommend getting to know a little bit about the history of the buildings because it makes them even more inspiring and wonderful.
Great vibe . Lots of stuff going on. Feeling safe at night. Definitely worth a visit. Good ice cream and hot chocolate places too
it is ok. It is ok. It is certainly not the best old town square that I visited in Eastern Europe. It is overcrowded and filled with lots of tourist traps.
Worth a visit. A lovely square to walk around, lots of history and a lovely walk around this area of Prague. The building are lovely.
Great Architecture. This place has amazing architecture and is always buzzing . Love the feel and markets around the area.

An enchanting world. We loved The Old Town. It's beautiful impressive architecture to its quaint side streets with shops & restaurants. By day or by night you will be enchanted by its beauty & history.

Lovely Large Square. Large Square in the Old Town part of Prague. Lots of attractive buildings everywhere, and stalls selling food. Street performers are in abundance in the good weather, however it does get very crowded. Watch out for Segway riders swooping around, as they are a bit of a pain.
Prague Old Town. A beautiful center of the Great city of Prague. Everyone should see this place at least once in their lives. Even more so during christmas holidays.

magnificent architecture everywhere. Essential Prague, walk everywhere an enjoy the buildings, pastel colors, sculptural decoration and eat lunch at Bakeshop, dinner divine at Casserol, and stay at Residence Agnes.
Pretty, easy to get lost.. It's hard to be and Prague and not see this. Bring your map because there are many ways in and out so its easy to get lost.
Maybe not as crowded as in mid-summer, but still pretty busy. A must see as this includes most of the important tourist sites in Prague. Take a free city tour to get oriented.

A visit to old town in Prague.. Another beautiful place not to be missed when visiting Prague. Every part of Prague has history and culture. The castles, churches and the people are all inviting and interesting.

Historic area with awesome places to visit..... Travel back in time several centuries in this magnificent place.Old narrow streets,cathedrals,spires reaching up to the sky and a sense of history hard to match anywhere else in the world.
Must see. A great place to soak up the atmosphere of Prague. Good shops and street entertainment. The food was very reasonably priced for a central tourist trap

The town square you cant miss. This is the view I woke up to every morning. I was staying at the Old town Square. There is the Astonomical clock over there and a lot of cafes and restaurants. Great place to hang out.

Great area to wander around. This is a very picturesque part of Warsaw with a lot of beautiful architecture and buildings to see studded with lots of little stores and restaurants with a beautiful market place in the centre . There are also some live entertainers around . I would recommend that this is a must do visit when in Warsaw .

Beautiful atmosphere. Atmosphere is very lively, loads of musicians/street performers etc tend to be around. The Astronomical clock is beautiful, and worth a watch on the hour. Very pretty, open space with lots of touristy shops.

Well worth a visit. As tourists in Prague, the Old Town was a central point in our holiday. Incredible buskers and the general feeling of excitement in the area created a great atmosphere. There were many shops and tourist attractions (a highlight being the clock tower, which is well worth climbing), and the many side-streets in the area are interesting to explore, though easy to get lost in. Make sure, if buying beer at the stalls in the square, not to wander off with the beers - they have to be consumed at the tables in front of the stalls(!).

Wonderful Prague!. After years of travelling around Europe, my conclusion is this: Prague is my definite favourite capital! I will return and return here as long as I am fit to travel, as simple as that!
Fun. Fun and touristy area. The restaurants may cater to tourist, but they are very good. And I love that they put out blankets for restaurant patrons sitting outside.
Beautiful city with nice old town. Beautiful city with nice old town. We also took a dinner cruise with Sightseeing Expert Day Tours and food was excellent

Needs to be on your bucket list. Prague old town is a must see on your trip. There is do much going on and at night it has a real buzz. Some fantastic restaurants and street artists. It feels like everything is so close
