prague. i love this place. it is the best place for shopping, and the evening are the best time you can rome over there.
on the streets many people will performing their stunts and there art work.
the best thing is the olden arches they have created
Different Flavor. Old Town of Prague has very special flavor. It has a lot of different shops , restaurants, historical places , activities and much more ...

Wander off the main touristy streets. Yes, it's full of tourists, but still, old town is still beautiful - especially if you avoid the square on the hour (everyone there for the clock) and the streets with the souvenir shops. Wander off the main streets, find the smaller squares, look up (especially at night when it's all lit!). Buy and eat street food and just wander.

Old world charm. My home base while in Prague, a beautiful open square with vendors, musicians, great restaurants and shops. Be prepared to see herds of Segway tourists making their way across the square. Beautiful views of the Tyn Church, Astronomical Clock and the Jan Hus memorial.
Old town square. Obviously needs to be seen but it is full of tourists and though we didn't try we would guess that most of the establishments around there are tourist traps

Busy, beautiful historical site. The place is a must-visit - unfortunately, that means crowds of tourists at all times. Still worth it, though, and you can always take good pictures if you point your camera up to avoid the people.
Great place to be. Great place to be. A wonderful and living city. You can't get bored even if it is the middle of the week.

One of the best old town I ever seen.. Great and impressive with lot of nice Prague peoples.
Nice and a lot oft choise of Restaurants and coffeshops and bars.
Just great and fair prise

Must see in Prague . Nice thing about Prague is that the attractions are all in walking distance...use the old town square as the starting point of your exploration and better to start earliest as soon as the sun raise... that way you can take pictures of the magnificent building without crowd...and move your way taking pictures all the way to Charles Bridge...

Everyone who goes to Prague will walk through the Old Town. Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful architecture. The streets and facades of the buildings are so gorgeous that it catches your breath. So interesting to roam all of the streets. I would recommend getting off of the main drags and walking on some of the lesser travelled streets. The crowds on the main drags are brutal. Just one block to the left or right and you are walking around on your own.
Old Town. Many cafes, sites, shopping this area. Hard Rock Café is also in this area. Everyone is friendly and very helpful.
classic old town. classic old town square with the famous clock tower. plenty of buskers providing entertainment in the evenings and a good selection of pubs and resturants.
Hub of Prague. Happening part of Prague. Restaurants and entertainment on square. Great fun. Must see part of town. Lots of tour groups in this area
Great trip. Atmosphere lovely, as were the wee shops and the great cafes and restaurants. I took advantage of the benches to sit back and enjoy the views and people watch.
Small enough to walk everywhere.. Fun to walk around. In fact the entire city is easy to navigate on foot. It is small in comparison to Budapest and Vienna.
heart of the old town. Very crowded but a must see especially the astronomical clock. Plenty of places to eat but you will pay a prmium

Crazy!. Quite the square.,teaming with people, can barely move. Good cafes in square but pricey compared to dining off the square ( understandable if you like the throngs).buskers are very creative and food stands are interesting and tempting.It's easy to get lost in the maze behind the square. The clock is a must see for the 27 seconds of amusement. The surrounding architecture extends from the square for blocks and blocks.Don't be in a hurry!

worth visiting. The old town has all the major attractions of Prague. The Town hall, the famous Astronomical clock and all the famous buildings and towers are here. The area has numerous restaurants serving all types of cuisine. That is the reason this place is so crowded . It is a must visit area.
Must visit- day AND night. No visit to Prague is complete without visiting the square. Particularly at night - a beer and a meal is just part of the Prague experience. Sit back and feel the history.

fairy castle in real life. the title for this review comes to life after dark and the building illuminated it really is a lovely sight and like the square it is situated in a must for all travellers this is just one many buildings in the area then after looking at the church outside a tour of the inside is well worth some time
Great place to walk. Everything breathes out history here, every building is a masterpiece and there's always something special about every one of it.
Well worth seeing. Well worth seeing although very crowded. Huge crowds to see the clock on the hour. Plenty of restaurants to choose from.

Old town - a must!. The old town of Prague is beutiful! Take your time to walk around and stare at the buildings. The main square with the astronomic clock and the Wenceslaw Square are a must. Of course, Carlos I Bridge and the old castle also. I would suggest just to walk around Prague and enjoy the landscape.

No.1 Tourist place in Praha. Old town square is the most touristy place in Praha, its very lively and nice all the day around.
There are lot of place to eat and drink, live music shows are on all the year. A must visit place if you are in Praha.

Unmissable!. You havent visited Prague if you have missed out on visiting the Old Town. The place is abuzz with life at all hours of the day. While the day is full of camera toting tourists trying to capture the abundant architectural beauty and street performers trying to make a living by entertaining the tourists, the nights are full of groups of people hopping from one pub to another. I suggest visiting it during the day and the night. Absolutely in love with it.
Courageous Czech Citizens. So much history left us impressed over and over at the hardship the Czech people have overcome. They are courageous.
Old town. Simply breathtaking. A little over the top with touristy stuff but still amazing. Definitely an unforgettable place.

A nice place. The old town square is a very nice and lively place to visit. There are very nice restaurants and eating places located here and there is live music played at times in the evening. It is crowded with tourists . A fun place
Stare Mesto. Easy to access by tram or foot. A lot of things to see and do. There are also a lot of artists around which perform for young and old

MUST VISIT . This is a must visit, YES. This place is nice visit at your first coming to prague, during your time at prague, or before leaving prague. This is a place which always alway almost everytime morning, day time or evening. Surround by the main buildings : the church and astonimical clock , at this square you can get anything you want from historical tour, food, shopping, museum, and many many else. Visit the tower aside the astonomical clock then you can enjoy the city view from above. You can see the castle, petrin tower and charles bridge from here. It is a magnificent view. Come and get lost in the alleys around the square and find surprises there like chocolate museum, unique shops or small cafe. I really enjoy my time in prague and at this square
well worth it. worth the walk, beautiful, romantic, certainly much to do and see, spend more than a weekend, we will definitely return

24 Hr life in the heart of old town. We enjoyed walking around the old town square watching the people from all nations. So much food to taste and buildings to admire, a wonderful experience. So many nice places to take a break at and enjoy the local food and drinks. A lot of shopping for souvenirs in all the side streets. Don't miss the Astronomical clock in the old courthouse. It strikes every hour on the hour. The doors open above it with the 12 Apostles moving from left to right while a skeleton rings a bell. from there you can go in all directions to museums or bridges over the Moldau river.
as seen in pictures ... so picture perfect ! medivial experience ! old town is bustling with tourists . tyn cathedral , charls bridge , powder tower and asronomical clocks are worth visiting.

A must do in Prague. The Heart of the City. Crowded, but a must do. Great cafes with drinks, desserts, etc. The heart of Prague. Old Town Square is a bit congested, but staying close by is a good idea. We stayed right there and did not regret it.

The astronomical clock. Prague is the most beautiful city we have ever visited. There are so many well maintained and elegant buildings, you need to ration your phototaking. Several days would be necessary to do it justice

Place to don't miss . Center of prague with animation restaurant bar this is the place to go to the main horloge and the top of churches week end Very popular during the week tourist from morning early until late

Give at least one whole day to this part. The old town has a lot to offer - starting with the old town square which has a couple of churches and plenty of cafes to the jewish quarter (museum) which has several synagogues, a cemetery and then the impressive Rudolfinum and the Klementinum along the river finishing off at the Charles Bridge.One can easily spend a day within this area starting with breakfast in one of the cafes in the old town square, touring the jewish quarter and visiting the Spanish synagogue, followed by lunch in the old town square again and then proceeding towards the river to finish off with wonderful views of the Castle District by night before heading to Hemingway's Bar.

Old Town Square. LOTS OF THINGS TO DO. Prague is a very very nice city, esp the old town square. Great looking buildings, very tasty streetfood and the ambiance was really nice and laidback. Spent hours walking around the city square and exploring the diff buildings around it, including the Astronomical Clock, Tyn Church, etc. Also worth spnding time is walking in the alleys and streets outside. The only thing is, expect a LOT of people. It can get Very crowded at times. Nevertheless, it was still great.

Prague Old Town Square. Old Town Square is a must, must, see place. Plenty of shop and eatery's, all resonably priced. There is so much happening at the Square it's hard to explain. It's very charming with lots of activity.

Fantastic place.... A must to go an visit!!. I went here with a group of friends on short visit and came to the old square every night!Great bars, great atmosphere, great scenery and architecture! There's plenty of good shops, souvenir places, great markets and plenty more.If you are staying in Prague this is THE place to go. Cannot recommend it highly enough!Just a tip... when it gets dark and busy, just be a little wary of people putting their hands in your pockets or bags. Keep everything close to you - Its not too bad for this but thieves like busy places and this place can get very busy!

Beautiful but busy.. Really beautiful old town. But also very very busy. Lots of interesting attractions including the astronomical clock, Charles Bridge and the main square. Worth a visit early in the morning before the tourists get there.
wow. Incredible.. Just an awesome place to visit. Great shops, buildings. Did some walking toursand saw the sights. Highly recommended.
old town. The old town was buzing with people of all nations, with street peformers stalls food drink was amazing. We either started our day here or ended it here.

Great, just to wander. Plenty of crowded streets to wander around with a plethora of shops, cafes and interesting buildings. When you get tired there are horse drawn carriages or vintage cars to see more of the sights.
Interesting lots of narrow lanes to explore. Gets very busy so get here early & have breakfast/brunch or join the throng as it gets later.Lots of eateries to chose from.

Just wander the back streets. There are so many interesting places in the Old Town that most have their own reviews on Tripadvisor. So this review relates to the old town "in general". My recommendation is to just get away from the Old Town Square and ramble around the back streets. You'll find little alley-ways and fascinating shops and places to eat at prices lower than the Old Town Square itself. So throw away the guide book and just wander! You won't get lost.
Beautiful!. Just go! always buzzing and a great place to peopl watch and some good musicians, acts to keep one and all amused!
The magic Prague Old Town. Very nice part of the city! The magic of history and culture radiates every step. Every time I visit this place, it surprised me.
Christmas magic. This is a lovely square, dressed beautifully for Christmas. Entertainment from local children and great stalls, food and drink.

Love the Square!. We loved the square so much we went back the next morning again before we left! Wanted to take more photos and we did! Lesser crowds in the morning as people start coming at about 10 onwards. The shops only open about 1030 to 11am. There is also a Sunday market but its really just 2 rows of carts selling chocolates, souveniers and fruits. We definitely will head back!
Amazing & quaint. Lots to see in the square , lots of little streets shops eating places great atmosphere it's just charming & beautiful.

Great place to spend some time.. The Old Town in Prague has more to see and visit then we had time. The Old Town is an area that is full of history, tremendous shops, excellent restaurants and museums.
Must See. Very busy and bustling. A must see on any tour of Prague but also a great place to sit in the sun and sip a beer!
Just loved the architecture. You just cannot miss this. If you are in Prague, then visiting old Town square is a must. Great Architecture!

Charming, beautiful city. The buildings in the Old Town are beautiful. Stresses are closed to traffic, so walking is easy. The cobblestones are set in patterns on the sidewalks. There are many shops and restaurants. The old clock is amazing. It has a very different feeling at night than in the daytime and the buildings are beautifully lit. It is good to go both at day and again at tnght.

Loads of history and places to eat in one place. A great place to start your sight seeing tour around the historical old town and Jewish quarter. Loads of eateries in the area (Hard Rock Cafe, being one of my favourite places to eat) Watch out for those pick pockets in this location!

charming but crowded. loved old town. just wander around and enjoy the atmosphere. shops everywhere. the area goes on and on. lots of places to quench your thirst or have a bite to eat. many restaurants to have a nice lunch or dinner. don't forget to stop by the astromonical clock to see the show. you won't have a hard time finding it, you will see the crowd. it was so hot that day men were spraying people with water to keep them cool.

Fairy Tale. We visited Prague in the winter time, around Christmas, and it was like a fairy tale.Old town has a special spirit which comes to life when Christmas lights shine up the big tree in the center and small wooden cotages with souvenirs, food and beverages open up. Nothing like mulled wine to warm you up!Everyone should visit Prague at least once in a lifetime.

Overrated. I was pretty underwhelmed at Prague's Old Town. It's absolutely jam packed with tourists, to the point that you have to navigate a sea of people to get anywhere. The architecture is nice, but a bit run-down. Direction signs for major sites are only in Czech, which is remarkable given the number of tourists the city gets.

The Heart of Prague. This is one of those free European walking pleasures. In the US, the local government might charge an entry fee. The oldness of the place is in every cobblestone, every statue, every church. You stand in the center and look around, amazed. The Astronomical Clock tower is right there, but the clock itself is on the west side. Vendors offer pamphlets for a Mozart or a Dvorak concert that will be held that evening. Cafes have outdoor seating. the Charles Bridge is minutes away, as is the Jewish Quarter.
Worth to see. It would be great loss to be in Prague and don't visit Old Town, the place is full of life and interesting monuments, buildings to see.
Breathtaking. It is hard not be be moved by the sight of this at night. It seems so magical and historical all at the same time.

So beautiful!. we stayed at the beautifu Ventana hotel very near the Old Town Square, so we had the pleasure of walking through this lovely place daily. Very lively, fun, lots of music and entertainment.

wonderland Praha. it is like a dream , a land with beautiful and fairy atmosphere.specially at night wen you see the old town monuments it seems that you are a part from story and your mind will fly in space . beautiful lights , sensational architecture , happy people and a live experience , this are a part from all that you will achieve.
The heart of Prague. This is the heart of Prague, with its Clock Tower, two beautiful churches, lots of cafés and it's the starting point for most of the "free" guided tours.
really costs to see. wonderful architecture,beautiful paintings,historical site and amazing place to see .one of the most beautiful cities in Europe
Medieval life below clock tower. Do a tour of the underground below the clock tower. It gives a picture of life in Prague through the ages.
Worth seeing. Even though this is a very crowded area, it is worth visiting. The buildings are beautiful and very different
Worth the trip to Prague. This alone is worth the trip to Prague, While there are many reasons I would return to Prague, the Old Town area is number 1.

Heart of Prague. The center square is huge and a three ring circus every day. The old town spreads out in streets like spokes and there is a treat or a site in ebery direction. Get to the clock just before the hour
Great city to visit any time of the year. It was great to just walk around and visit all the local caffees and restaurants. Great architecture of the buildings makes visiting Prague a true pleasure
Must see the old town square.. Fun to walk around but really crowded - clock was the main attraction as well as Prague ham vendors - delicious!
Lovely. Loved this area because of the architecture and all the shops and restaurants. We walked different streets every day and never got tired of seeing all of it!!

Beautiful part of town. This is worth going to even if you don't care for touristy spots. The architecture in Prague is something else and this part of town can get you multiple dramatic examples. Not a bad idea to watch out of pick-pockets. We didn't have difficulty but it is better to be aware or store your valuables appropriately.
Wonderful place. Wonderful large square surrounded by beautiful old landmark buildings. Nice cafes where to sit and enjoy the activity of the people walking up and down, musicians, and entertainers.
Old Town. Must go and just walk around all day, stop and enjoy the sights, and grab some street food as you walk around, or sit down outside and enjoy the views.

Bestseller. It is interesting, that as a Prague born, when I was younger I intentionally avoided the notoroiously touristy places. After living abroad and missing Prague so much, now I actually dont mind the hordes of tourist and come here quite regularly, either for a walk or a pub crawl.The nicest part is around streets Jilská and Husova, altogether with Old Town square. It doesnt matter, when you come, but advent and shoulder summer season are the best. Dont be in a hurry and you will be rewarded by a beautifull medieval surroundings. If you seek for any information, dont be shy to write me PM.

Relive Prague's history. Lovely place to walk around and get a feel for Renaissance Prague--although it can also be quite crowded. Many of the buildings are very ornate and have colorful murals. There are also plenty of shops and restaurants. Don't miss Bethlehem Chapel, a reconstruction of the austere building were Jan Hus (d 1415) once preached before being burned at the stake. Hus was an early founder of Protestantism and a very important figure in Czech history.

Just a beautiful city like a fairyland . We have been to many city squares. I have to say this a really special place. If want good pictures go before 9:00 in the morning not to many people. We just love anytime of the day. There is good security in area

Dynamic restored centuries old downtown with charm and every service. Twice we spent several hours walking the Old Town both in the evening and daytime full sun. The charm of the old buildings well restored and maintained and the merchants selling Czech merchandise awed us Prague is better than the tourist hype. Old town is large with streets meandering from the main square towards Wenceslaus square and out to the river through the Jewish Quarter. The Charles and other bridges open up the view to the castle on the hills across the river. cafes and restaurants abound at all prices. Gelati stands are at every corner. Most interesting are the open stands roasting whole suckling pig Ethic Czech food is easy to find.Wandering the allies and smaller streets one finds food markets, fresh produce, and lots of jewelry stores. The tourist stores are evident also everywhere with lots of Chinese souvenirs.
Feast for the eyes. Most of the buildings are beautifully preserved and since we were ther at Christmas time the added festive ambience made it more special.

Nice and worth to be visited.. A old town of Prague is worth vititing as it contains a lot of historical buildings (nice) and the people in are generaly very kind. English is not a problem. Prices are not exagerated althous they are higher by a factor of 1.5 to 2 compared to nearby restorants or pub in Praha 2 Area.
Amazing. Just go there to see the square, very pretty, very historic, very must see. A bit crowded at times but it is beautiful especially when lit up at night
Lively old square. Great old square buzzing with activities. Lots of entertainment and places to eat. Good for people watching and passing time. Be there for the clock at mid day.

Going back to we it at Christmas. Beautiful fantasy city soo romantic and just mind blowing I felt I wish it was my city so I could be so proud. Never seen such clean and amazing streets. It reminded me of disneyworld fantasy towns like in Disney s Pinocchio

Busy, Crowded, Wonderful!. On the day I was there the weather was a bit cool, spots of rain but, nevertheless, people were there in droves. Wonderful atmosphere and great bargains in the street stalls.
Didn't like it much. Prague's old town is a bit dreary for me..But if you like castles and ancient buildings, you'll probably love this city.

Spend at least three days to look around the areas of beautiful Prague. Today we took a two hour walking tour that actually continued on for three hours. We had Sonjya as our guide who explained the town centre through to the walls around the city areas. We now understand the building structures, how to read street signs for the regions in Prague. I know understand that we need to spend more time in the Old City and Prague as there is too much to see in two days.

You can't miss Old Town Square. Loads of tourists added to the festive mood. Many typical souvenir & crystal jewelry shops, touring companies, great cafes, gelato stands are very popular and historical sites are interesting.
Where the action is.. Everyone starts or ends up at the Old Town Square. Lots of tourists. Had some good food there. Many choices.

A must to see and do.. Unavoidable but worth pressing through the crowds. Visit both day and evening to see the variety, nothing as entertaining as watching humanity in all it's modes! Plenty to do and see at any time

Our Lady Before Tyn, Astronomical Clock. This is indeed a very lively place, with lots of people passing by and tourists taking selfies. There are important buildings / monuments on different sides of the town square, the most notable of which are: the church of Our Lady Before Tyn and the old town hall and astronomical clock, which are on the opposite ends of the square, as well as the monument of Jan Hus.
Don't visit Prague without going here!. Beautiful place to visit - a must if you visit Prague. It has lots of shops, cafes, restaurants and a great atmosphere to simply enjoy.
Awesome. We just love prague and this is all about what prague has to offer.Cant get any better then this, the buildings, people and things to look at.

Beautiful historic area of Prague. Always popular. Horse drawn trips around area available as our trips in vintage cars. Always street entertainers and food and souvenir stalls. Astronomical clock a must every hour on the hour but take note pickpockets are rife.
Can get tired visiting it. Awesome neighborhood with a lot of things to do. Everytime I went I saw a new building to visit or a thing to do.

Fabulous. Tiny winding streets make it easy to get lost but its not a large area so you will find yourself back where you started eventually! Its residential in some parts and has some very expensive shopping in others. Great little restaurants and bars everywhere.

Great place to start or end your day!. The space is expansive! Surrounded by shops and restaurants. As we strolled through, we found ourselves in the middle of a flash mob! Suddenly, musicians with their instruments appeared from the crowd and treated us to a lovely mini concert and as fast as they appeared, they were gone again!

Short break. This is the centre of the tourist area with extensive restaurants and bars around the square. There are also many tourist guides situated here for walking or coach tours of the city.
There were also many street performers in he square. Ideal to sit with a drink and watch the world go by.
Somthing you should do in Prague. It's a great part of the town to walk. Very nice restaurants, interesting people watching. Beautiful buildings.

Must see in Prague. Gorgeous, medieval town square with architecture that will blow your mind. Vendors, music, street performers, and local "fast food" are all there to please and entertain. Don't miss the astronomical clock and climb its tower for great views and some interesting history - especially regarding WWII and the nazis.

Great shopping & sights. Both the sights and sounds of the Old Town are fantastic. We went there solely for the clock but we found so much more. I would not like to say too much other than that if you like good old markets and fantastic architecture combined (as well as a bite to eat!) be sure to visit!

Like watching a human kaleidescope. Old town square is a constantly changing sea of people from tourists to artists to musicians and merchants. I could sit there from the peaceful, quiet early morning hours watching the square come to life through the busy, touristy afternoon hours of people watching, through the evening festivities of artists and musicians. Amazing food, beautiful buildings. Favorite place on earth.
Quick visit. Yes, you must. But spend more time elsewhere learning about today's Prague. Stare Mesto had been shined up and is just teeming with bus loads of tourists.

fun and beautiful city center. The whole area is one big tourist attraction. There are interesting shops, museums and galleries everywhere, but since it's so popular prices are high accordingly while quality sometimes is not. It's interesting to "get lost" between the allies and find some less visited spots probably more known to locals. It's usually crowded and lots of guys trying to lure inside businesses and sell stuff, so beware of that.

Prague's old town square. Beautiful architecture and designer stores. The astronomical clock is an amazing invention that bears testiment to the intelligence that existed. Wear comfortable shoes as the road surface is uneven. There are a lot of souvenir stores available for purchases. Be aware of people trying to sell you currency on the street, use exchange offices.

old town. The Old Town is a wonderful mix of old world and new world . architecture is gorgeous and the squares are each so well adorned with modern shopping . The food in the Old Town is simply marvelous and is very reasonably priced. The restaurant School is fine dining and gives you everything would expect from fine dining and more for not very expensive compared to Toronto standards. We would go back to Prague in a heartbeat
beautiful old town. Very beautiful place for a stroll, climb the tower of the clock for an amazing view of the city. stroll the narrow streets and grab a beer
everywhere you look, it's all awesome!. The people, the sights, wonderfull. We love Praque. We don't like the cuisine, but the beers are great!
Old Town. Love the architecture of the buildings and the street vendors with the delicious food around the square.
First place to see in Praha. Very busy square where every visitor to Prague must come to. There buskers, restaurants, bars, people and more people. Great place.

The heart of Prague, magical!. One cannot visit Prague without seeing Old Town. There is so much history in this place. There are beautiful buildings and old churches, restaurants and shopping. The place is active both day and night
Prague. Main town square in Prague, site of the Astronomical clock, not to be missed. Square is surrounded by cafes and shops.

Great People Watching!. You practically can't avoid the Square as a Prague tourist, nor should you. Always something happening whether watching the old clock strike the hour, acrobats/fire jugglers/Segueway riders/having a cold Budvar or whatever. Many tours start and end there; lots of shops in the surrounding streets, good enough restaurants and food stalls, beautiful old buildings - great for just hanging out.
Beautiful area. Beautiful area, many shops and restaurant and places of interest to visit. very busy can visit every day and enjoy the area.

"Stepping Back Into History". This is a journey into a time and place that I dare say most of us really can not even imagine. These buildings and history are not simply years old, they are centuries old. You can only stand in awe as you try to envision what it must have been like to live in a time and period far removed. The picture included with this review is that of a memorial to Jan Hus, a church reformer, who was burned at the stake in Old Town Square.

Very interesting architecture. The Old Clock Tower and main square are brilliant. The Square was a venue for entertainers and was encircled by a variety of bars and cafes perfect for a seat in the sun!

Charm and Ease. We stayed in the Stare Mesto (in the Maximilian hotel) and we were very happy we did. Old Town Prague is full of beautiful buildings, quiet streets, great little restaurants and bistros. The area is safe and it's an easy walk to everything one could want to see, the Mucha Museum, the Kafka Museum, the Astrological clock, the Dancing Houses... I could go on and on. There's an excellent tram system, that was undergoing renovations when we were there, if walking is an issue. I highly recommend a visit, even if your hotel is not in the Stare Mesto, it is worth a visit!

Must see!. Lots of the most interesting sights are located here and there are also a number of stalls selling food and souvenirs. Worth a visit just to see the Jan Huss memorial, if you're interested in politics/history

Beer, performers, people, beautiful sights....did I mention great beer. Beautiful!!! A great place to just spend the afternoon, having a beer, watching the people and the performers. Do not rush this...slow down and enjoy. Also, come back at night and enjoy the night crowd!

Tourists, go home!. Lovely walking thru medieval town. Lots to see and do. Recommend visiting the Jewish quarter, astronomical clock, castle, Slav Epic (short tram ride away), Alphonse Mucha museum, etc.Go to classical music concerts at night.Downside: city crammed with tourists and British guys who come there for stag parties. Can be loud and noisy. Still fun though.
Great. It's a must visit. It gets crowded all day long. Usually, there are performances of music and theater done by street artists.
Beautiful! . Wonderful to see all the old buildings of Prague. Very busy but understand why! Was reassuring to see such a large police presence too...
stare mesto. Abeautiful place to visit.full of character and a real ly lovely atmosphere.you wont b disappointed.
a must so much better than new town. lovely atmoshpere so much nicer than the old town. full of charm and not so full of stags (unlike new town) glass shops are lovely too!
Beautiful Square!. Beautiful! So much history in the square. Lots of restaurants and shops as well. I suggest the Sandeman' Free walking tour as well. You will learn so much about the clock!
Beautiful. Beautiful old building and churches located here. Definitely have your camera at the ready! Nice for a little stroll around .
A must see. Awesome! so much to see and do, so many shops i couldn't see all of them, loads of entertainment and food on every corner.
Just OK. Charming but a brief visit is it. There more charming sites in Europe but this is very nice. Gets crowded but that's part of the attraction

Beautiful area, lots of places to eat and people watch.. We came here on a Tuesday morning so the square was not very busy. A great place to take pictures of the Atomic Clock and the various architectural buildings. Don't miss the famous Atomic Clock which moves every half hour! New town is just minutes walk south of Old town, so make time for it as well.

Something different to see every night. The Old Town square is a buzz with activity whether it be day or night. At night there is a constantly changing array of entertainers from magic acts, musicians or bubble blowers to keep visitors entertained whilst you wait for the clock to chime so you can witness the Astronomical Clock. There are Blues Clubs just behind the church with the big black spires, there are so many great restaurants catering for tourist palates and in the daytime the tourist buses leave from the square for day tours. Of course don't forget the segue tours on offer also. We used the black spires as our markers to navigate our way back to the square from wherever we were in Prague. Enjoy!

Magical place. The best part of town , so beautiful, great atmosphere, tourists are just everywhere! Right in the centre of everything, Weneslas square is further up which very pretty and definitely one to visit too and Karlov(Charles ) bridge is just few minutes away. There aremany good restaurants around, Staromestka is the one we would recommend to anyone

discovering hidden treasure. on your first visit to Prague try to have a tour guide as you will discover sights that may not be so obvious to a stranger but will truly astonish as to what a rich treasure this place is. To fully appreciate Prague you need at least a week.

Intrigue Around Every Corner. You can’t walk 20 feet without seeing something amazing in Old Town. Our first stop….Hemmingway’s Bar. Try the Cuban Montecristo #2 and a Dirty Martini. You’ll be in heaven. Super unique bars and restaurants everywhere with wonderful faire! Don’t miss the Andy Warhol and the Salvador Dali museums. Their amazing lives were represented in their styles and ideas. We loved this! Cappuccino, chocolates, tours of the clock tour, shopping, a Segue tour of the area or entire town. You can’t go wrong with this entire area. Easily accessed from the metro, Uber or cab.
Awesome old town square. Stunning area that was rebuilt like the original town, pre world war 2, market square full of atmosphere and truly lovely, and very refreshing
Beautiful part of Prague. Gorgeous architecture everywhere! Great site seeing, and Prague is one of the mostfun places to vacation in Europe.

A must see!. The old town square is one of the main attractions the buildings are beautiful there's so many places to eat lots of lovely shops I could go on! Definitely worth spending the day there looking around, we came across places we hadn't seen the first 3 days so you're always finding something new!

"Free Walking Tour with Brian". Just as we were about to take a bus tour, we found some guys holding umbrellas for a free tour....I was like REALLLYYY!!!!! We joined the tour and it was one of the best guided tours....These guys work for tips but its worthevery penny spent....Our guide was Brian and he was really very good....He was very well informed and kept us interested throughout the tour.....It is one of the best ways to explore Prague....these guys meet outside the Cartier showroom at the old town square...Our tour was at 14:30...

Don't want to miss. Awesome! My favorite place. So much to see and do, spent two days there! The clock was worth the trip alone. So many vendors and entertainment loads of excitement and food on every corner. Lots of streets to explore. So many shops I couldn't see them all. Loved the cobblestone streets.

Amazing architecture and culture. Prague is full of beautiful architecture in a style that is quite unusual to the North American eye. Detailed and ornate decorations on buildings. Scrollwork on window frames and balconies. Old Town is full of eye candy if you like old and fascinating buildings.
Hope to return. Such fun, always lots going on. Do be careful of the pickpockets though. Stayed 1/2 block from the square, what an amazing place.
Bc.. The most wonderful place in Prague. Many ancient architectures to see. Museum of European architecture.
Mind your wallets!. Two of my students "lost" their wallets! Two expensive coffee & food compared to common czehc prices. Good ice-creams, awful espresso coffee like everywhere else in Prague:-(

The Astronomical Clock is really beautiful, could stand and look at it all day.. The Old Town Square is really gorgeous the buildings are amazing, but it is very crowded. Lots of good restaurants around there plus art galleries and shops.

A Truly Unforgettable Experience. We decided to spend our trip walking Prague as opposed to navigating the confusing metro system, and as our hotel was located in the Zizkov district, on the outskirts of the centre of Prague, it meant we endured a walk into the Old Town on most days and evenings.As we were based in Zizkov we entered the old town from east of the Vltava river, the scenery during our walk consisted of old gothic buildings housing seedy businesses and tired looking shops, ominous factories no longer in use and the looming highway bridge overhead, the supporting pillars of which riddled with graffiti and litter. However, once this seemingly eerie journey was over the views changed dramatically, a short time further into central Prague and the cold soviet-esque surroundings become an area which really does hold up to it's title of the 'Paris of the east'.Upon entering the old town border we were met with the powder tower gate, the original city gate separating the old town from the new town. Once under the gate you could almost feel like you've travelled back in time, especially at night when the day tourists return to their abodes. However the plethora of souvenir shops and aggressive Romanian street sellers puts a dampener on what could be a romantic and historical walk around this gothic paradise. When you reach the old town square where things really get going, my trip took place over the week leading up to Christmas which meant that markets were in full swing, for a few weeks the old town square is transformed into something out of a fairy-tale, home made craft stalls, local artists and confectionary sellers all itching for you to come in and view what they have to offer. The smell of mulled wine and German meats fills the air rising up above the enormous Christmas tree deluged with lights and decoration provided by the city.There is so much to see and experience it is hard to know where to start, a tour round the markets, a bite to eat in one of the squares many restaurants, exploring a souvenir shop or even having a ridiculously cheap pint (or few) at a local beer hall.A good place would probably be to venture up the clock tower on the edge of the square, you can tackle the many flights of stairs or take a ride in the lift, however once near the top a winding staircase will have to be climbed whichever method you choose initially. This portion of the experience was painstakingly long due to a very nervous woman in front of us who achieved one step every 2-3 minutes but simultaneously blocked the narrow stairwell, not for those who are afraid of heights is my advice.Once at the top you find yourself in the tight and narrow viewing platform which is completely open to the elements on all sides, however this is undoubtedly the second best view in Prague especially as the bright and lively markets run underneath you.In my opinion the best view of Prague can be found by taking the long and steep walk to the castle, there is a point as you are walking up the final hilly approach which is high and open enough to be able to see the whole of Prague, the scale of which cannot be described without visiting. I felt like I could stand their for hours on end and just appreciate the triumphs of those who built this architectural haven all those years ago.My final hotspot would have to be the Charles Bridge, it is amazing by day but even more romantic by night, this old bridge spanning the width of the Vltava houses such emotion and awe that it is almost indescribable. As I walked through the mist past beggars crouched on the sides of the bridge, a mark of respect in the city, an old blind man played old baroque pieces on his accordion, crows stood on the old lamps and statues that line the bridges walls. Standing on the edge of the empty bridge in the early hours of the morning looking over the river was my favourite part of the whole trip.In light of my recommendations I believe that the old town is a place to be wildly explored and not to stick rigorously to a map or tourist guide, and it's even more beautiful when the sun goes down.The nightlife isn't bad either.

Hard to miss. There must be some kind of tourist magnet here since whatever direction you walk in Prague, you're guaranteed to end up in this square. Once there it's also hard to leave since you lose all sense of direction staring at the grand churches, castles, bell towers and clocks all around this beautiful square. There's a lot to see in Prague so try to leave some time for other sights because you'll end up in this square over and over again.

Fantastic on a Thursday...not so good on Friday!. Spent two days in Prague in September. The weather was amazing. Now as I was part of the problem it's only fair to say that the amount of tourists are a nightmare! On Thursday we sat in the square, sipped beer and watched the world go by. Wonderful. Went back on Friday and we couldn't see a thing due to the number of people.The old town is beatutiful but stay clear at the weekends!

Beautiful Medieval Square. Fantastic square surrounded with Medieval buildings in different designs, different colours and a beautiful clock. Many restaurants and cafes surround this Square full of character and colour. Make the effort and get there early to get some great photos whilst it is quieter, you can sample the atmosphere later.
Walking Tour. Do take good walking shoes. Exploring the old city was great fun. Lots of little tourist shops and nobody bothers you to buy and no begging.

Beautiful Prague. Wow. There are many stunning town squares in Europe but this has be one of prettiest! The Baroque & Gothic styles combine beautifully. Lots of buskers give it a great atmosphere and of course the famous Astronomical Clock is gorgeous. Make sure to explore all of the cobblestone alleyways around the square too. The only downer is the crowds.
Mid-week Break to Prague. They were getting ready for Easter when we were there, everything looked very festive and colourful.

Old is sometimes best. I could never get tired of walking round this Old Town, so much to see.....people are nice and the shops are great. We were there just for a short break but we will be going back. It does get really cold.

Magical Town Square. This place is magical any time of day or night. Lots of entertainment and restaurants, historical places to visit, statues to learn about and people watching. Tours begin here. Every town needs a pedestrian friendly square like this! Don't miss the astronomical clock installed in the 1400's - it still works! Just a word of caution though, we were warned when the crowd gathers and your attention is locked on the clock be careful of pick pockets!
Always Worthy for a Walk. Just by taking a walk around this area and even booking a hotel around here can always mean that it's going to be a worthwhile stay in Prague.
Impressive historical. Impressive and historical views, differing in day or evening (illuminated) spheres. A worthwhile destination by itself.
Preserved old Europe character. Charming little streets and squares of the old town are well preserved. It is full of the shops, cafes and restaurants. Maybe little bit too commercialized.
Magical. A magical place all around! Great food, people,history. We could practically walk anywhere and visited all the attractions within 4 days
All day tour with Martina our fantastic guide. Beautiful architecture. The astronomical clock is amazing make sure to be there when it comes "alive"

A maze of little paved streets and amazing buildings and monuments. A wonderful place with beautiful buildings, many of them Art Nouveau or Arte Deco (there is even a cubist one), along little curved, stone paved streets and passages. There are nice shops and places to eat and awesome monuments that take you back in time.
Winter wonderland. xmas markets are amazing, superb streetfood, great sights freindly people never boring. Having a cold beer under a blanket in the snow is an experience

Lively and fascinating. Hard to know where to start when every street corner has a fascinating building. Cobbled streets throughout are very charming and keep the traffic slow but very hard on the feet (and I had a bad foot on our visit!) Watch out for the ubiquitous Segways - some of them zoom round atr breakneck speed. Looks fun though and certainly keeps you off the above mentioned cobbles!

Full of history and activity. The Old Town square has a helpful tourist information office and is the meeting place for the New Europe Sandeman Free Walking tours. We did the free one and the next day the tour to Prague Castle.

Worth visiting. But the Crowds!!. This is a place worth visiting. The history is papplable.But be prepared to be packed like sardines wherever you go and whatever you try to do.We are independent travellers, but it is hard to independent when there are crowds at 360 degrees.There are people, and bus tours ,and people, and bus tours, and people, and tour groups, and people.Well, you get the idea.......

Not possible to miss it. Nothing more needs to be said. There is no way you can miss the Old Town when visiting Prague. Try to get off the main streets and explore a little. Great atmosphere and lots of people at all times!

Beautiful architecture . All of the buildings look amazing! Loads of performers and stalls selling local trdelnik. Mmmm! Would recommend finding a restaurant just outside the square as they hike the prices here. Definitely visit the cathedrals and churches.

Great place to explore. Great for getting around and plenty to see and do. Lots of bars, restaurants and small shops. Lots of cobbled streets too so wear comfortable/sturdy footwear. Wide accessible square, leading from/into lots of smaller winding streets. steeped in history and atmosphere, but well served by trams and buses with Metro access not too far away.
Beautiful Old Town!!!. Great area. Tons of stores with great prices. Wish I had done more shopping. Great restaurants in the area.

Great for history and beer drinkers. The old town was a fun tangle of narrow streets with so much of it not listed on the Internet which forces you to explore on your own and look for fun stuff. Also there doesn't seem to be a policy on open containers and you can buy a beer for about 50 cents and walk around drinking while you explore.

Busy place. You can easily say that it is the center of touristic prague. Always vibrant and busy with painters and artists playing music all day and night. Along with the famous mimes. Lots of restaurants and stores . Many places to buy souvenirs from so remember to bargain the price.

A classic place to visit, eat, shop and enjoy history in a modern country. The prime tourism part of Prague. You have to be a tourist to enjoy it as that is who frequents it. Tons to see and do and is the reason we came to Prague. Found all we wanted to see and there is a little of everything for everyone. Classic car tours, Segway tours, walking tours, beer and a very friendly atmosphere.
Easy to get lost. The streets are cobbled and there are lots of little cut throughs that aren't on the map so getting from one place to another is not easy.

Part of history. The old town is offering an amazing view of the center and you can see the astronomical horloge.The medieval astronomical horloge is working every hour. It is very nice to have a drink on the place.
Old Town --wonderful!. A lovely and historical place and a must see filled with churches, historical buildings and interesting shops.

Worthwhile and plan to take a break in one of the many returants. Very, very busy, but of course you have to see the clock. Easy walking from the Charles Bridge. Lots of restaurants right in the area.
Majestic City Center. Truly beautiful and majestic! Be sure to check out the available walking tours! they give you an excellent overview of the history and the things to see!

Always something going on in the square. We stayed very close to the Old Town square and I think I walked through and hung around there 20 times a day. It was like all roads lead back to the square. Maybe it's because we were staying there, but I enjoyed ending up there all the time. Always different people, different things happening, hustle and bustle. We left the day before the Christmas markets were going to open so we saw them setting that up. Was so bummed that I missed it!
Beautiful old city center. The old city center of Prague, with all the pedestrian streets and squares, made me consider it the most beautiful city center I have visited.
Beautiful old city center. The old city center of Prague, with all the pedestrian streets and squares, made me consider it the most beautiful city center I have visited.
an incredible city. All the city is very nice and pleasant to walk in and sightseing. The people, shops and restaurants are very polite and everything is very easy for turist.

Font Stay Anywhere Other Than Old Town!. Well if yiu are travelling to Prgue with Friends or Family or whatever reason it may be..Old town is the heart of Prague and best place to spend your entire day at. Loaded with major monuments and attractions, street performers and amazing restaurents..this place has a whole vibe to it.

What a loveable city . I have been passing through the city by buss, but was amazed from the architect of city. There were so many fascinating buildings. I would definitely come back again for several days
great history. great shopping, diverse new and old neighbourhoods and lovely architecture. You need a full day to look at everything and then go back at night for the restaurants and nightlife.
Amble round and enjoy. The old town is lovely, lots of small quiet streets as well as the busy square. Take you time, explore and enjoy. Beautiful

Beautiful part of Prague, stunning architecture.. Gorgeous buildings, beautiful city & plenty to see. It's really expensive (compared to other places) at the main squares, so it's worth going down some side streets & you'll pay much cheaper prices in bars, restaurants & shops.The main squares are too busy for my liking, full of tourists but that's to be expected in most large cities. The architecture is stunning. Markets have some lovely traditional stuff in them, people are really friendly & the food can be excellent.Beware of pickpockets, although we were fine. Charles Bridge is too busy & folk bash right into you, it's overcrowded. I didn't do as much sightseeing as I should've as I had very little time.

Old Town Square Rocks. We found the square the centre point for many activities and touristy expeditions. Nice and central and always full of action. Loved the architecture and just sitting around with a coffee.

Touristy but Beautiful. In my opinion, Prague is the most beautiful large city in Europe, and the Old Town is 95% why! I could walk around these winding streets for hours admiring the architecture and history (and I did). Can't wait to return and explore again!
Visit the Astronomical Clock while you're there. Very beautiful and wonderful architecture. Very crowded though so try to avoid peak times like the middle of the day.
Fairytale town. Christmas spirit, joyful and fun. Pretty cold but enough happy people filled with Christmas cheer to warm you. Try the street food on offer, sometimes very sweet but tasty

Magical place especially at night.. Great atmosphere with plenty to see and free entertainment.Restaurants could be pricey and watch out for paying extra for bread which is not always advertised in restaurants.

Just Hopping!!. Wow! Loved the buzz with all the people milling around. The bands, the performers, the bars and restaurants, the horse drawn cabs, lovely little stores and the astronomical clock. The buildings are like something out of a fairy tale, beautiful architecture. Wish I wasn't so tired and had stayed around to see it at nighttime. Visited the square every day of our stay and still never tired of the excitement.
A must visit. Very nice. Make sure to visit the clock. Crowds can be a quite big. watch for pickpockets. Very walkable.

Allways something going on. Great place to people watch and watch all the buskers, magicians, living statues, snake handlers and any other weird and wonderfull sights that gather in the old town square from around lunch time. You will pay a premium in the restaurants and cafes for the view. Most of the restaurants are cheaper to eat inside than sitting outside in the square and the toilets are free to customers. If you want to eat more cheaply go down the side streets a little way from the square or get some food from the local bakery, deli or mini market and eat on the seats by the statue to watch the sights. Lots of tours gather here in the mornings if you hover nearer by you might gather some free info on the clock tower etc. Lots of touts here trying to book you up for tours and people driving around on sedgeways. We found our own way around the sights map in hand. Be carefull of pick pockets in these crowded areas.

Great place. Cozy and stuffed with history. Lots of restaurants of varying quality. Lots of alleys and side ways with architectural pearls. Shopkeepers generally are very friendly and polite. Go visit a deep cellar restaurant!

Very lively You never get bored here. A must see. The square gets very crowded specially when time gets close to on the hour. you can be there any time and something is happening I this square to keep you entertained. Building are amazing. Try to be there night time too it's just as beautiful as it is during a day.

Beautiful but nothing amazing. Old town is the main tourists destination in prague. I went there to see the square and the famous clock. Honeslty , the old town is beautiful but i was expecting more of a place rated nnumber 1 on tripadvisor about prague. Maybe my expectations were bigger and the reality disapponted me. The old town is of great historical value, but do not expect alot to see and then you will like it.

Great town!. Prague is a beautiful place to visit, but not for more than 2 days. If you have to pick a hotel, choose in Old Town or Little Town. Little Town has hilly streets and Old Town is more flat and is better choice for transportation and restaurants. We stayed at Savic Hotel.
Beautiful Old Town. Easy walk through old and windy streets. Plenty of sights, smells, and sounds to absorb. Try not to eat in the main square- prices are inflated and quality of food compromised.

Nice tour!. I was there with my friends, we were really impressed by it. Fortunately we found a lot of bars, where the prices are friendly. If you love to drink beer you better not miss it !
For sure its really beautiful, for to have a look around!
Glowing with Pride. Prague is an adventure! Full of history and beer gardens too! With a great effort from its citizens, it was renovated in all its glory!

in another world. I was really impressed by the old town of Prague, there is a lot of pubs to get in drink a beer ect, fortunately all the bars are reasonably priced.
i suggest everyone to check it!
Money changers. Blue and white "no commission" booths gave me 15.8 to $1.00 when banks gave me 23.6/1 with a small commission. Avoid this set of change outlets!
A must visit. Nice place, nice buildings,My daughter (13) and I really enjoyed visiting this area. So much culture and beauty. A must see..
A Prague highlight.. Probably the highlight of our weekend in Prague. A must see where it's lovely just to have a beer and people watch.

Gorgeous. Prague is beautiful and the old town contributes to that. Take a walk around and remember to look up - lots of pretty things to see on the buildings. Everything is close together and it's a pleasant stroll.
Historic and commercial..... ....it is worth the walking, time and crowds. Enjoyable sites to see, people-watching and fun, little shops. Worth a stop if you're in Prague.

Vibrant and friendly. Full of bars and restaurants, this really is the heart of the tourist section of the city.
All the bars are reasonably priced considering their location, and the astronomical clock is great.

Old town Really great area to see. I took a free walking tour by Sandemans new Prague tours. It was great. This is a great area to explore!!! So many things to see and tons of shops and restaurants. A great place to lose yourself in.

My favorite foreign capital. Been there three times. Every next time was better and more interesting than before. Very much to see - Charles bridge, churches, streets, jewish quarter, astronomical clock etc.
A great place to visit. The old town is a beautiful place to visit. The astronomic clock and the powder tour are really amazing places!! Don't miss this places

Breathtaking!. Absolutely gorgeous and well worth exploring for an afternoon - the square alone is beautiful! IT gets busy so if you want to see all the details in the building etc, get there early. We were there at 9 am and it was very pleasant.
Old Prague. Great place to stroll around, amazing architecture but watch your wallet - we got robbed. Highlight was a concert in Spanish Synagogue.

PACKED on Saturday.. walking towards old town. IT WAS PACKED. I guess it is just the nature of Saturday in Prague, but there was an absolute river of people. We made our way across Charles Bridge without really getting to stop and enjoy any of the vendors (we did go back on Sunday and do some shopping when is wasn't so crazy).
Beautfiul. Make sure you visit the town hall for the very best view in Prague, it is truly stunning and does have a lift although the walk up is ramped and has interesting photos on the walls

Beautiful square, very busy!. When in Prague you have to visit the square. The astronomical clock is a must see! The resteraunts there are much more expensive and I would 100% recommended walking out 5 minutes from the centre to get nicer and cheaper food with more friendly waiters as the ones in old square are very busy and can be a bit rude! Saying that, we stopped once or twice for a drink in the centre and just for one was worth the extra money as was great to be in the midst of it all. There's a few cute things in the centre too like funny statues, live music which all add to the great atmosphere! Beware not to get hit by a Segway and also for pickpockets!
perfect place. great place, nice building, part of a picture, you cant get enough even if you visit it 3 times a day,
Majestic Prague..!!. Majestic is the right word. Old word charm with very well maintained and disciplined approach to the whole area, given the number of tourists it receives all throughout the year.

A 14th Century Fairyland. Prague's Golden Age occurred in the 14th Century and Old Town is where it all began. It's a place for people watching, exploring, sightseeing, dining, drinking, jazz and classical music and very good walking shoes. Narrow streets and paths dominate. It's a place to slow down and enjoy life. The Old Town Square is the hub of it all and is a perfect place to sit down, relax, people watch, dine and drink some of the world's finest pilsner beer. On the hour, the crowd swells to watch the Astronomical Clock put on its show. At night, it's positively magical.

Watch the people, drink the beer, soak up the beauty.... Prague is arguably the mos beautiful city in the world and Old Town is the center of this 14th Century fairyland. During the daytime people watching is fantastic as the crowds surge each hour to watch the Astronomical Clock put on it's show. A great variety of restaurants surround the Old Town Square and you're in the Czech Republic produces some of the best beers (and darn fine wines) in the world. At night, the square is magical. Sit, relax and watch the show.

Great Square. Old Town Square is charming with the Astronomical Clock and the excitement of the square. Many artists performing in the square with plenty of restaurants around to eat at if you are so inclined. Food away from Square is priced much lower but for pure excitement and people watching a don't miss experience.

Great Picture Area. There is so mcuh to see and do in Old Town. This is a tourist area so beware of pickpockets in this area.The square is so neat and interesting. There are singers, dancers and even some crazy acts with fire in the square. This is where you can people watch, walk around or just enjoy an espresso.
we enjoyed sight seeing. loved the old town it was very busy but we managed to see all we wanted to see. there are many bars and restaurants with good value food and drinks

I felt like I went back in time. Appealing historical architecture and ambiance with lots of things to see, taste, and explore. However the abundance of tourists is overwhelming. You must keep your eves out for the gypsies as well, they're harmless if avoided.
LOVE THIS SQUARE!. This is the most BEAUTIFUL square. I feel in love with Prague 5 years ago and this year returned with my husband. Still BEAUTIFUL!
Worth to go... In the Old town district ,you are feeling like you are in a fairy tale. So you should add this location into the your visiting programme.
Awesome. the most beautiful old city for me so far all the buildings and of course the famous clock and its very good to walk in the day and very good at night dont miss it

Amazing day!. The day i spent in Old Town Square is one of my favourite among my time travelling. A selection of lovely restaurants and stalls for food and drinks, very reasonably priced. Street performers actually worth watching, horse drawn carriages and segways gliding by. It was just a thoroughly enjoyable day. Sat under the astronomical clock drinking an ice cold beer was bliss.
My favourite part!. This is an absolute must see, the buildings are so pretty. It can be very busy but it is so worth it. There are lots of nice shops and restaurants u around too.

Tour with the lime green umbrella!. Such an interesting place to see many sites at once! We saw Old Town through a "Free Tour." We planned on seeing it on our own but, the lime green umbrella caught our attention and was the best way to visit Old Town. It was a great way to see the city and learn a lot of history without spending a fortune on other tours.

MUST SEE. This is the area you must see. It is the part that makes Prague one of the most beautiful cities in the world. So many famous buildings and so many not famous building that have plenty of character. A must see!

Not to be missed. Just round the corner from the Astronomical Clock, entertainers on the square and surrounded by beautiful buildings and eateries. Can pick up a horse drawn carriage for a city tour if you want one.
Must visit!. A walking trip around this place must not be missed! Walk around, take in the character of the pace and east the great food in the vicinity.

Lovely. Gorgeous relaxed atmosphere. Great choice of places to eat and some street entertainment to enjoy. Very cheap beer!!Only downfall was the swarms of people trying to get you to buy a go on the Segway rides. Go away...lol
Amazing Place.. Its a lovely,special,wonderful historical place , fully with restaurants and coffee shop.Every one must visit that place its wonderful.

Wonderful architecture and many great sights to see.. Old Town (Stare Mesto) is definitely the main attraction area in central Prague as evidenced by the large mass of tourists present just about every day of the week. If you enjoy taking in old world buildings and atmosphere then this is the place to do it in Prague. You must enjoying traveling on foot as there are few (if any) parking opportunities for cars to park in this section of the city. We took many, many pictures in this section of the city so lots to see. Two minor issues were that there we lots of people it has been "discovered". Also, the restaurants are very overpriced in this section of the city so save yourself a few dollars and find someplace just off the main streets around Old Town Square. The quality is just as good but it's less crowded and less expensive.

A mesmerising place. A wonderfull experience of fabulious buildings a mesmerising clock and good street entertaintment. Obviously the cafes are dearer to drink in but you don't need to sit in them to enjoy the square day or night.

Beautiful old square. We spent hours wandering around this beautiful old square. The buildings are very well kept and there is a lot of shopping in the square. There are many types of restaurants around the square where you can enjoy a nice meal and enjoy the view.

Wanderer. If you just want to wander and have a nice afternoon I strongly recommend a visit here. Bring comfortable shoes cause walking on the the cobblestone can tire your feet. You can buy souvenirs, admire the architecture, taste the Czech cuisine. If you pay attention you will discover hidden things at every corner. Enjoy!
The place to be in when in Prague. This part if tge city is where you should stay and sleep. Beautiful buildings, many of attractions and food places and anything else you can ask for.

Learn the History of the Clock before Viewing. Before viewing Prague's famous clock, I suggest you take the Prague Royal Walk Free Tour in order to hear the history of this remarkable machine. Watching the clock strike the hour without knowing the history can be a bit of a let-down. However, once you know the price Mikulas of Kadan paid when he built this clock in 1410, you'll better appreciate the hourly display.
Beautiful. Great place to just hang out. Lots of wonderful architectureso see. Easy to navigate around the area.

A spectacular part of history. Wandering the streets of Old a Town Prague is a treat. Wear comfortable shoes as the cobblestones are everywhere. There are shops, tourists venues, galleries, restaurants, coffee shops and everything else. Take a map and just wander and wonder at the mix of architecture. It is a most pleasant afternoon. Also, a block or two off the tourists streets, the prices for food and drink are 50% less.

One of the most beautiful old cities in the world. I live in Holland near Amsterdam, so I'm not a stranger to old cities, but Prague is in a class of its own. The cobbled medieval streets meander through picturesque houses. Restaurants and bars abound, there's always something to do. Asian tourists shooting pictures rub shoulders with well dressed locals. On the corner of the street a stag party is in full swing. Never dull, old Prague, I think I fell in love with you.
Nice old town area. Neat old town area with lots of (expensive) restaurants and souvenir shops. Definitely worth it to wander around.

beautiful. It was a ten minute walk from our hotel and it was beautiful to experience .the buildings the peole were amazing! The cobblestone streets hurt after the first day but you get used to it after aehile.
So Picturesque. Buy a coffee in any of the restaurants and watch the world go by, visit earlier in the morning for less hustle and bustle

Prague is certainly worth a visit. I found Prague one of the nicest cities I have ever visited. The old centre of Prague is beautiful. Certainly worth a visit of four days. The city square and the St Vitus cathedral area are very pleasant to walk around. The many terraces on the town square are pleasant venues. The beer is good and cheap. Also many good restaurants nearby.

Beautiful and Stunning. Beautiful and stunning!! Make sure you have plenty of space on your SD card!! Always entertainment happening in the square. Do not be trapped by the restaurants situated around the square as their prices are bumped up a lot!

Beautiful but completely overcrowded. There is a lot to see here, but the place is so overcrowded with tourists that after a few minutes you just want to escape. Attempting to take pictures without being pushed or shoved is a true art form here. People are rude, unpleasant and it didn't feel safe at all, with lots of dodgy characters wondering around.Maybe it was a bad time of year, but this is easily the most crowded city centre I've ever been to.

Almost everything is here. Historically the Old Town is where most everything in Prague except the Castle district is found; or at least near by. There is the Medieval center with the Old Town Square, the entrance to the Charles Bridge, the Astronomical Clock, several churches. But it is also home to the Jewish Quarter and many latter buildings, especially the Art Nouveau era buildings, And for those so inclined there is what a friend called Gay Alley (Parizska St) leading from the square to the river with upscale shops such as Mont Blanc, Cartier, Hugo Boss, Louis Vuitton, Gucci and many other high end stores.Filled also with restaurants, bars, and hotels it is, in my opinion, the place to stay and from where to start your exploring.One of things that is most amazing about Prague in my opinion is the buildings. Not just the old buildings but the more modern with statuary and painted décor. A truly beautiful city.

Beautiful city.... We stayed close to Old Town and wandered through and around it many times during our 5 day stay in Prague. I found it charming and interesting. The architecture is, of course, beautiful. The people watching and energy is just great.

Overcrowded, but a nice experience. I have been to Prague two times, and to the Old Town almost daily. But then again, Im a tourist - and so is everybody else. It can be overcrowded, but you have to expect that in the different seasons. Still, a "need to visit" in Prague.
Beautiful historic square. Great to wander around the Old Town Square - so many beautiful buildings and street cafes. The astronomical clock is amazing!
A must-see in Prague.. Plenty of things to see. Street entertainers. Lots of cafes. Good central location. Easy transport links.
Beautiful Place. Prague is known for beer and beauty if you know what I mean. Very beautifully built and must visit places.

Not to be mussed. Seems to be the heartbeat of Prague. Offers lots of lovely cafes to Sit, drink and people watch. Of course, it's home to the famous Astronomical Clock. Loved the walk up Sausage stalls. Don't miss the Halushky. Horse and carriage rides are for hire. Be careful of the city tour booth on a corner adjacent to the tourist office. We booked a boat ride and they told us the bus would drop us off at the boat and bring us back. There was no bus back. If you walk down the haute couture street, the Jewish Quarter can be found. Do the walk thru the cemetery. It was very interesting to see. Lovely architecture, however, it was disappointing in how dirty the buildings were. It almost made the buildings look gothic.
Amazing City!. Prague is one of the most interesting and beautiful cities. There is amazing architecture and history in this town.Very energetic city both day and night.

One of the few unique European downtown experiences!. This a lively old downtown! I went there in January, the weather was quit cold and it was still full of people! Take more than few hours to explore the area! You will not be disappointed! there are many gift shops and coffee houses in the area as well! Regretfully, I did not eat there, but I can only guess it would be amazing food as well!
Nice and historic.. Very nice and interesting. Several styles through the centuries. The City is clean and so beautiful, worth the visit.

Must be seen!. Very popular tourist spot and is very pretty. Can get very crowded as there are lots of shops and places to eat. Check out the Astronomical Clock and the monuments that are located in the square. Busy nightlife!
Good to see the icon landmark. Very crowded all the time. However, it is a must see spot for tour in Prague. We always started from the Old Town square and found our way to different tourist spots.
Old Town is Great!. You can walk around the Old Town and not see everything in a week! There are so many great places to visit, things to eat with a great atmosphere.

You're bound to end up here- very busy. Almost all roads lead into the old town so kind of hard not to visit. The Old town square is very busy at all times of day so don't expect to ever see it empty. Lots of pricier ( by Prague standards) restaurants and street acts and tour vendors. But you pretty well have to visit and it is very pretty crowds aside.
very interesting architecture. Felt very safe and enjoyed walking around even early in the evening. Very close to our hotel. Good restaurants in the area.
Busy square. Watch the clock striking, sit and have a coffee or a meal, musicians were playing jazz, a busy square! Off season the number of people can be overwhelming, be prepared!

Not so Square. Nice city square with photo opportunities for buildings etc. often buskers/acts in the square and a lot of tour touts etc. plenty of eating and drinkig opportunities around square but as usual with these places you'll pay a bit more for the location

Wonderful Experience in Prague . Old town Square is beautiful, picturesque and breathtaking. The live music, astronomical clock, gelato carts, everything. Had a chance to visit two days in a row. I definitely suggest all travelers visit. We had lunch at a nice Czech restaurant. Lovely place.
lovely place. what else can you say. the main place to go in prague. like a place from fairy tales. great architecture even if you're not a big fan. lots of places to eat and drink

Fantastic . The architecture is amazing in this place just look up.
The is so much to see and plenty of places to sit eat and drink while watching the world go by.
If you visit Prague you will visit this place so enjoy.
Stunning views and historical area.. Stunning views, great food, varied performers. Nice to hang here, but avoid late afternoons on nice days as it gets very crowded
Gorgeous. Old town is simply beautiful and very easy to get to. Pay attention to the musicians playing on the street they are always brilliant.
Close to famous astrological clock. Lots of activity at all hours with restaurants, street performers, tour groups, people watching. Fun place to hang out.

Lively Old Town. A beautiful Old Town, great atmosphere, something for everyone. There's live music performmed in the square every hour by the local talent of all ages and styles. Restaurants, cafes and bars line the towns walls offering local delights and my favorite beer Staropramen, which I'd highly recommend, its cheap, refreshing and doesn't give you a hangover, a no brainer really. If you are looking for a culture injection, visit the Astronomical Clock Tower, Art Gallery and surrounding museum's all located in the Old Town. If you feel brave enough you could even have a guided tour of the town on segway scooters. Or you can just kick back, relax with the local beer, admire the architecture and soak up the sun which is plentiful.

Super crowded.. I think beautiful, you have to do it when in Prague. Keep in mind in gets so busy and crowded . Perhaps start early morning if you do mind crowds.Otherwise enjoy, bring your most comfortable shoes, as comfortable as sneaker, get ready to walk a lot. A lot of things do see as you walk!!!

It is beautiful...go see. Old Town is wonderful, the bell house! Go and visit, see the clock, visit Tye Church and the Kafka bookstore, take in the incredible architecture. Then take a few steps away from the tourist area....only a block or two, don't follow the crowed! The food will be many times better and half the price.We have lived in Prague for 15 months.......leave the tourist lanes....only 1 block changes the experience!
Gorgeous. Old Town is gorgeous. You can walk in day and night. Always something to see. Nice shops, great architecture and lot of fun.

Great to wander. We spent many hours just wandering around the old town in and out of little streets, getting lost a few times but always finding a welcoming bar or cafe to refresh ourselves before moving on again. Lots of tourists and tours in the area but for us the best way to explore is on foot. You never know what you will find around the next corner.The architecture and buildings are all worth seeing and spectacular. Lots to see , loads of cafes bars and shops.

Great Area to Explore. This is a great area to explore. There are numerous beautiful buildings, especially the Our Lady of Tyn Church. There are many stalls offering street food and restaurants dotted around the square. Go a little way from the Old Town Square and you will find there are more reasonably priced restaurants. It is in the Old Town Square that you will find the Free Tours being offered, these are incidentally an excellent way to get your bearings in Prague.

Very buzzy!. The Old Town Square as so much buzz atmosphere ....little cafes and restaurants everywhere ..... seeing the old clock and buildings is well worth a visit as well as the many lane ways leading off the square...food can be a bit pricey given its a real tourist area
beautiful historical town. very touristy. Nice historical building and food is easily available. walkign distance to charles bridge

great place to watch the world go by. could easily spend all day here, sipping a few beers just people watching, great place, gets pretty busy most of the day, slightly less so in the evenings, but plenty of places to eat and drink in old town square

Take a Walk on the Historical Side. A must see stop in this beautiful and historical city. Go early to avoid the crowds and I highly recommend you hire a LOCAL city guide to take you on a walking tour through the city.
