It the best way to experience the history.Guides are licensed and must have gone to University, study history and related fields and be highly qualified to discuss many aspects of Prague. It's worth the small charge you will pay.
Beautyfull. Marvelous square. Visited during the Christmas fair, so it was quite magical.Take time to have a tea or cofee in numerous cafes, it's good for really getting the feel of Prague.

A wonderful Grand Place. Architecturally superb but always heaving with people - particularly on the hour when everyone gathers to watch the astrological clock do its thing. Plenty of bars and restaurants all the way round though you'll pay a bit more here than in other parts of the city.

Simply beautifulll. The prague old town is a city center with a hearth. You are surrounded with history and passion. I spent there days with family and alone and always look forward to walk around and explore its hidden gems.
Mr brady. Well worth a visit. Lots of culture, Art and history not to mention the places to eat ans shop. Lots of street entertainment and a very special clock.

Heart of the city. Old Town square is probably the first major attraction in Prague that most tourists visit, and for a good reason to, because it showcases stunning examples of art, architecture, history and culture that span over one thousand year. Without having to walk any great distance, a visitor can see the town hall with the Astrological Clock to one side, the Gothic St Tyn Church and the Baroque St Nicholas Church. The square buzzes with street performers, amature and professional photographers and people relaxing at a number of outdoor pubs and restaurants. The square is the heart of Old Town. One can reach other points of interest such as Charles Bridge, Prague Castle, The lesser Town, Kafka’s Museum and numerous other sites easily on foot.

architectural as well as cultural paradise. within walking distance lies an enormous variety of architectural as well as cultural gems. In order to understand what you see and not just enjoy it aesthetically, read a bit about it and see it early in the morning when less people are around.There are a lot of interesting museums, artistic-like the Mucha Museum or Social-Political -like the Museum of Communism. The bookshops are superb -from the huge and highly varied Neoluxor to the specific, for scientifically- minded, Academia, the dining places are as varied from superrb indian restaurants like Indian Jewel to the numerous czech food restaurants-coffee places scattered all over

Loved Old Town. The narrow streets and alleys, the architecture, the square and the cafes, equals fun. This is just a great place to wander around and explore. There are interesting shops, restaurants and cafes around every corner.

Time spent in the Old Town was relaxing. The Old Town is a bustling busy place but even with all the tourists, Walking tours, street entertainers and Segway's it is still relaxing and a great place to sit and watch the world and enjoy the ancient architecture. Love it overtime we visit.

Visit to Prague. We stayed at the Four Seasons, Prague, Czech Republic for 3 nights in August, 2015. This is a beautiful hotel with in walking distance of Old Town and also, The Charles Bridge. The hotel is very accommodating,making dinner reservations for us in Old Town, arranging a boat tour of the area as well as booking transportation for us to the airport at the end of our stay. It has wonderful views of the river and the bridge. Our room was delightful. It was a large room with sitting area, a coffee and refreshment bar, and a beautiful bath with separate tub and shower. The hotel has a very good dining room with views of the water from many of the tables and a terrace with tables and lounging areas. The walk to Old Town was pleasant with lots of shops and places to have dinner or just a snack. Some of the streets in Old Town are lined with trees and there are parks with statues and flowers. There is much to see and do there.
Very nice!. Very nice to walk around during the day or night. Restaurants, bars, statues, performers are all around.

Wear good walking footwear when walking in Old Town. We stayed in an apartment in Old Town, through Untour company, and the location was fabulous. We were on many streets in Old Town, on purpose and getting lost, but always found our way home. The cobblestones add to the aura, but good walking shoes/sandals that don't flop are a necessity.

Prague - an amazing city. Overwhelming sense of history with historical buildings and monuments perfectly preserved. Old town is so charming! Everything is clean. Cobblestone streets so you want good walking shoes.
Walking is the best way to know Prague. Lovely architecture, worth walking and walking and walking and always looking upwards. Prague is truly a beautiful city.
The clock in the town centre is a must see.. So historic you won't no where to look next. Wear comfortable shoes as the cobbles are everywhere and can be tiring.
Lovely place day or night. The square always pack of people, especially mid-day and evening. The Old Town Hall & Church of OurLady before Tyn are icons must bee seen.
Buzzy Area. A nice buzzy area to visit with loads of restaurants and bars close by along with shopping. Ice cream stalls and local pastry shops abound. Whatever you want is there.

The Heart of Prague. The old town is the heart of midieval Prague, and comprises a maze of streets lined with beautiful old buildings. The centre is the old town square, with cafes, restaurants and street food vendors, street entertainers and a number of interesting buildings. Not surprisingly, the streets are usually fairly busy with tourists, but felt safe nonetheless.
So classic and different... The classic style of the area and the old buildings look so different to the typical European destinations. It is such a beautiful place..

A great experience.. The main town square is certainly a lively place and when we visited there were market stalls and street entertainers (Easter time). Great for soaking up General atmosphere but if you want to have a more peaceful wander around you will need to pick your time carefully. Took one of the free walking tours which was very good and meant we saw lots of the main sites within a couple if hours and could then pick what to revisit on a subsequent day. Everyone gathers in the square to watch the astronomical clock 'perform' and it is a standing joke with the guides just how unimpressive it is!

There was ran international folk festival while we were there and a parade f nationals in costumes off their homeLand.... Just so interesting...from the famous clock to the little shops and just the gathering area for people....iteas great!!!!
Love Praha. easy to get around and good street food. Vendors are a little touristy but all in all a great place to visit.
Muset see in Prague. Beautiful sites, great but expensive shopping, and great restaurants. The astrological clock si fun to watch.

wonderful!!. i was amazed by the beauty of the buildings in the old town!everywhere you looked there was a miracle of architecture!in the night,the place was full of people,music,lights,it was like a public celebration!i loved it!!
Beautiful. A wonderful square surrounded by beautiful historical buildings.A place to grab a snack from informal vendors or restaurants, relax and enjoy the buskers and artists performing for tips.

beware and bewitched by the variety and beauty of this fascinating town. walking around the old town is the biggest attraction prague has to offer for most people, walk over charles bridge and through the myriad streets with a wide variety of craft and souvenir shop, not all tourist tat but quite fascinating glass jewellery and other quality items plus the oh oh architecture of the town, a rel labyrinth, you won't starve though, restaurants aplenty!

In the midle of it all. Nice, open square. A lot a diffrent eras meats here. Here one can find local food made in smal stands, and resturants made for touriat. Many famous landmarks are close to the square.
Classic old city. Very comfortable, beautiful and nice old city of Prague! Take a bottle of water and have a great day here. But lots of people, selling tour products are annoying.
Well worth the visit. Great place to walk around, see the sites. We enjoyed drinks and snacks here. Typical tourist stuff as well,.

Surprise enter of Old Town, great place to hang. Much wider than anticipated and full of street performers blowing giant bubbles, singing, and playing music. We stumbled onto this by accident and were amazed by how wide the expanse, and even more the variety of crowds it attracted. Really cool surprise center of Old Town. Great for people watching and shopping.

Old World Charm in Old Town. We absolutely loved Prague and Old Town really does portray old world charm. It is so pretty and there are some great shops, so it is worth enjoying some quality time here. If travelling over December period as we were, you will see the Christmas Markets in full swing. Adds so much charm to the place and there are some fantastic food and drink to be had. Can't wait to go back.

Wow!. What an incredibly beautiful area. There was so much to take in that we had to come back several times during our stay. The crowds of people, the restaurants, and the amazing landmarks all added to the charm of the area. Do not miss the opportunity to visit this unique area.
prague. great for wandering.gets crowded .love Prague.visit the ice bar. small but fun ...dont eat near square its expensive.

The true prague. Love the old town square which is a great place for people watching specially on weekends when the amature musicians take their guitar and amplifier out on the streets.The architucture of all the buildings from different periods is wonderful.I would also recommend to take one of the free tours - it made us feel more connected since we knew a little about the history of the place.
great fun. Fantastic place definitely worth a visit. Quite hard walking as the paths are uneven and plenty of stairs.

Very busy. Nice architecture . Prague is a lovely city and would recommend a visit to the square. There are a lot of tour guides available however my wife and I just walked around. Felt really safe fling that. People are friendly. There are a lot of pubs off the Beaton track which you can get a pint of beer for around £1 which was good on my book
Excellent. This place was mobbed with tourists! The astronomical clock was a disappointment but the overall energy of this place was just great!
center of prague. from there its essy to navigate to other cool places and locations that u want to go when u visit prague.

Impressive square. Despite the fact that all tourists seem to gather on this square at the same time, there is still room to enjoy all the beautiful old facades of the buildings all around the square. In fact, coming from any direction, you wlak through streets and alleys that feature one interesting building after another. The whole centre of Prague seems to be built by Disney. Yoy can hardly imagine that these houses are for real and have hardly suffered from wars etc.

Astronomical clock. So much to see and do right here Always hopping with musicians, buskers, history in the heart of the city. Astronomical clock, church, liberty statue. Horse drawn caleches, crowds of people. Fun place
Holiday. Nice vibrant cultural heritage. Good for people interested in history . this is a street dance by a grp of holidayers before andel mall
Old t. Must stop by to see all the shops. Very high end in Old Town. Gucci, Versace, etc., personally like the Mall by the Municipal Bldge better. Better prices etc. However, old town is still cool.

Don't miss the Old Town. I have lived in Prague for many years, and never tire of the old town. Ok, it's set up for tourists now, but it's none the worse for that. It's a beautiful place. Check the prices before you sit down at one of the outdoor bar/restaurants - they are exorbitant by normal Czech standards, but should not disturb most North American and Western European tourists.You'll probably stand in awe before the fanous astronomical clock, but don't stop there. Just amble around, making sure that you look up from time to time.
beautiful. I am thrilled looks, the way that preserve and cherish the beauty of the old town , be sure to walk at least a few times
Prague Square. The atmosphere is captivating. The unique architecture and cobblestone roads transport you back in time.
Nice Town Sqare. Very nice square try to come early to late morning. It gets very busy as the day goes on. Mbeatiful buildings.

Stunning. A lovely and vibrant square, surrounded by wonderful architecture and filled with street performers and wonderful street food carts. We found it fun to amble through the streets to find hidden cafes and other interesting stores.

Old Town Prague. New Time Fun. This is worth the stop to understand the history and watch the people. The old castle with the tower hit by lightening was a great stop, as was the astrological clock. Tons of fun
Historic and atmospheric. Went midweek to avoid the crowds. Enjoyed just strolling around soaking up the atmosphere and mingling with the locals

Wonderful buildings and architecture. I loved visiting the old town and watching all of the people in the square! The buildings and architecture are awesome and on a sunny day it is so colourful. The Church and the clock are well worth visiting. Prague is such a beautiful city!

Wonderful time in a wonderful city. It's just wonderful to be walking around Prague's old town. Plenty to see here: Jan Hus monument, old town hall clock tower, the astronomical clock, Tyn church, St Nicholas church, Jewish quarter and the Estates Theater.

Romantic . To walk in the old Town is always nice and to drink a beer in one of the many pubs or cafe's. Be ware of scams, its very common that you will be offered to change your money on the streets but its all scams!! The prices for food and drinks are very high in the turist area so walk in to one of all the alleys and eat and drink for half the price!
Just a Quick Look of the Old Town. It was worth the sweat and the walk... the old town was a sight to remember with the quaint shops, the old beautiful buildings...

Beautiful historical place. It's a beautiful place but always crowded with tourist. So keep it in your mind - there will be a lot of people trying to sell you something and somebody will get in you frame when you are trying to take a good photo.
Mr. Marvellous, vivid, the historical buildings full of life whenever you pass by it you will discover something you missed
Old Tow Prague (Praha). We visited in Spring and bit cool but wonderful. Lots of entertainers, horse buggy rides and the atmosphere is good

Steeped with History. We toured the old town Jewish Quarter and walked through to the square. The free street minstrels were great to watch and listen too. We wished that we had more time to return, but 3 days in Prague is simply not enough time.
Great place to visit. Great place to come for the Christmas markets. Loads of stalls and entertainment throughout the day. Took a ride in an old open top car around the city which was amazing.
Beautiful Prague. Most beautiful place to visit, lots of history. Must join a guided tour, makes it much more interesting. We joined a Segway tour as well, lots of fun.

Amazing City. This old town was so busy with walking tours, it just had such a great atmosphere and you tended to just get swept up in the hustle and bustle which was just amazing probably even busier than Rome

Oldest parts of Prague filled with restaurants , shops , lots of activities. You should go here early morning or late evening to avoid rush of tourist. As all tourist will be this part of city.You can see nice buildings , shops , restaurants and lots of activities happening in evening time like music , street shows etc.Or just sit on benches watching touristsYou can spend 1 hour or whole day and still didn't feel bored
must go. Old town is very charming, with lots of shops, restaurants, food stands and very lively even late at night. Great for people watching, eats and beautiful architecture.
Beautiful square. This is must to see because this square have a few restaurants, astronomical clock, nice shops with souvenirs and pretty statue of Jan Hus.

Nice place but don't buy from the food stalls. A nice large space with some interesting buildings and thousands of tourists wandering round. Watch out for the stalls selling fast food as the displayed prices for "Prague ham" and "potato with onion and bacon" do not reflect what you will be charged, i had one portion of each and it came to 648K (£21)
Interesting old city. Lots to see & do; street performers in Old Town Square; Charles Bridge is interesting but very crowded. Make sure you have stout walking shoes as it's nearly all cobblestones!
Beautiful place. It is beautiful place to stroll around in the morning, I'm so amazed wit the architecture of these buildings.

Unfriendly and unhelpful . My family and I visited 3 other countries before arriving to Prague. We had horrible experiences in this city. The Old Town was filled with way too many people and the restaurants were super expensive. The waiters are unfriendly and in a rush. Overall the city itself is filled with unfriendly and unhelpful people. Rather visit other welcoming cities.

What a wonderful place. So much history, beautiful buildings, try going up to the top of the clock tower the view is amazing, so much going on all day and night, visit Prague mid week to as void stag parties.

So much to see. Old Town is an amazing place. Every time we walked through we saw something new, and it's absolutely magical at night when it looks like an entirely different place. Great place to people watch, a wide variety of restaurants with outside seating to watch them go by. Even in cool weather, most have heating and blankets. The only thing I did not enjoy were the street performers, who became a bit annoying after a few days, and it does tend to get very crowded at times.
Classic atmosphere!. It felt walking in a old city hundreds year before. It is beautiful. Cafes are everywhere. It is easy to take a break with nice coffee and beer. It was wonderful.
Like a Fairytale. Looks and feels likes youre in a Disney movie. Looks like a postcard its so beautiful. Many great buildings to see. Places to eat and drink. Very special vibe.

Beautiful Prague!. Of the 3 cities we visited (Prague, Vienna & Budapest,) Prague had the best city center. Everything was so condensed that it made for an easy time walking around without transportation. Just beautiful
Easy to walk around. Easy to walk around. You do not need a map; get lost and you ll arrive at the starting point finally :)

Amazing atmosphere. I really like that place with a lot of activities around but I visited prague two time once in summer and one during winter time I parson prefer during winter time with Christmas decoration any way prague it's heart of all the world not only Europe we love prague

beware - segways. astronomical clock, Jan Hus monument, Church of our lady before Tyn. Good street performers, but beware of Segways all over . Church of St Nicolas. The oldest house in Prague has a very nice café behind the art exhibition area

Everything is so beatifull in Prague. In general, I just LOVED Prague!For my opinion, it is one of the best cities in Europe.It has everything - beautiful history, good food and pretty girls :-).The old town has everything I wrote above, near by.

Absolutely amazing!. Most amazing place. Nothing prepares you for the sight that unfolds as you enter the old town. It's almost like entering another world! The clock is a little underwhelming but otherwise everytime you look you find/see somethng fascinating.

History Then and Now. Old Town Prague is definitely worth exploration. Take the time to just wander around the many side streets and enjoy the adventure. There are numerous cafes and restaurants; as well as the typical tourist traps. The historical buildings are a must see. Try to review the history behind the buildings. You will enjoy it even more. Walk up in the clock tower for a great overview of the area.
Allways amazing. Allways amazing to come here - when in Prague. Lots of tourits. Try also to visit in the evening - Night, its A wonderfull sight.
A must see!. It was so beautiful and full of old world charm! We loved wandering the streets and just taking it all in!
Beautiful!. The old town, in particular the old town square, is absolutely beautiful. The buskers there really add to the atmosphere too. It's a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by.

Beautiful architecture, great old world feel, except for all of the tourists. This was a beautiful area to visit. It was the second city on our children's first visit to Europe, so their eyes were wide with excitement to see the charm of Old World Prague. Having traveled throughout Europe before, my husband and I thought it was nice, but we were not as impressed as the kids were because it was overrun with tourists and hawkers pushing selfie sticks.Old World is full of winding streets and can be difficult to navigate. There are metro stops, but they are not particularly close to each other, and there aren't many, so you still may have a hefty walk to reach the tourist sites. We spent the better part of an afternoon just wandering around Old Town and taking pictures of the beautiful buildings and watching street performances.

My holiday. The architecture was beautiful. It was a bit crowded, but then it was peak season! The streets were kept very clean, not a bit of litter to be seen. I didn't witness any pick pockets, maybe I was just lucky!

Definitely worth a visit. This square is definitely worth visting. The bulidings around the square are very picturesque. The astrological clock is also there which is a must. On the hour every hour the clock chimes and little figures come out. Its really bust=y as everyone waits for this so if youwant a good picture youneed to be there 10 minutes at least before.

Good place to start your acquainting with the city. It's better than in Vilnius but worse than in Tallin, I think. In tallin there is a real castle wall all around a place.But still the place is good for walking!Karl's bridge (karlov most) and arches on both ends of it are nice.

Take it all in. Quaint and busy, with a variety of places to sit out and eat, drink and take in the comings and goings on the square. Centre point for the Christmas Markets which can be a crush on the opening night, be warned! Lots of tourist attractions very close by. Give it lots of time to fully enjoy

Picturesque!. Perfect for any architecture lover with a vibrant mixture of Romanesque, Baroque and Gothic buildings!
@instabuilt
Top view of Prague old town. You can take a few minutes to climb the stairs that will take you to the tower top where you can have a nice view of Prague old city.

Don't miss Old Town in Prague!!!. Stunningly beautiful - it takes your breath away.
The historical and old buildings are magnificent.
This is certainly be one of the most impressive Old Towns that I have ever seen.
Remarkable City. I love history and Prague is old and beautiful city full of history. Wonderful architecture. A wonderful place to roam around.

Like stepping back in time - a real gem and beautiful day and night.. Amazing historical buildings, including the astronomical clock which is fascinating. Lots to see and do, whatever time of the day it is.
a must go place. forget all the tourist which are walking at the square and look to the architecture and classic buildings. walking in old town prague is like walking in a museam.

History, nice pubs, beautiful little streeets. I like the Old Town, especially around streets Dlouhá, Kozí and Na Stínadlech where you can find best music clubs (James Dean, harley´s) and also good cafés (Café Ebel) and dark cozy places at night. Magical atmosphere!

a highly varied recent and historical cultural tour. walking by foot without any need of car bus or metro you experience a rich cultural environment that is really varied from old synagogues and churches to different styles of architecture
,from ancient microscope shops to ultra-modern photography centers, from all sorts of art galleries to all sorts of bookshops
from czech food restaurants to indian ones

Hard to see apostles at chiming of Astronomical clock. Old town Prague is a beautiful square, the central point of Old Town. Street signs are all in Czech,so be sure to bring a map if you are walking around and to know the Czech name of the buildings or attractions you are looking for. We waited for the Astronomical clock to strike the hour to see the apostles appear from the little windows as the guide books promised. The clock is absolutely lovely, but the apostles do not come out like a cuckoo clock, they just pass by the window on the inside. You barely get to see them at all. Smartphones will not record this very well unless you have zoomed in on the windows before they open.The entire Stare Mesto area is compact and easy to walk. In fact we walked everywhere during our visit, from the Old Town to the castle, the Jewish quarter etc. We also walked across Charles Bridge after dark, and while the lighting is dim, we felt quite safe. at 9pm
Beautiful. Beautiful old town part with narrow streets, stunning architecture, lots of tourists, expensive restaurants. Definitely worth visiting
Nice place in heart of Prague. Nice old place in Prague! Best historical place in Europe! Nice restaurants, best landmarks in Czech. You can meet people from all over the world!!

Perfect Praha. Outstanding!! Go here and enjoy some mulled wine and trdelnik from the street vendors! Walk around and absorb the long history of this fabulous city. The astronomical clock is fascinating, and the castle tour is a must see!

Everything tou could want. This is where everything happens, from excellent live jazz to living statues and horse drawn carriages. It is a bit expensive to dine in many of the cafes but as long as you avoid the Kafka Cafe beside the church, you should be ok and the concerts in the church at 5pm and 8pm are a delight.
To je Super!. Prague is a Uniq Old Town! Every time in Prague I remember my first visit of this excelent place! Old Squere is the place were I can go whole day!

Go a bit out of season. Loved the atmosphere but as there were so many tourists there was a lot a litter around. We felt that Prague council should have been doing more to clean it more frequently.
We felt that the Jewish quarter was very interesting but a bit expensive to visit the sights.
Wish I could go back!!. Just a really awesome place to visit. If I could, I would live here for a bit. Just an awesome town.

The center of old town. I would almost guarantee you will end up here sometime on your trip. It's the old town square next to the clock - many historical buildings and restaurants. For a small fee you can climb the town hall tower and have a nice view of old town.
Pretty. The old town is very pretty to walk through and just look at the buildings and such. Really enjoyed my time there during december.

Fantastic. A fantastic square with hidden treasures, a real must when visiting Prague. The astronomical clock is a must which can be seen on the hour every hour. The street entertainers add to the hustle and bustle. If you can go super early and beat the crowds the square comes into its own as you get a real glimpse of Pragues past without the people.

Worth a walk through. Best seen on foot. Beautiful buildings, well preserved, works of art on their walls. Cobblestone streets, and lots of little alleys with bars, restaurants and souvineer shops worth a look.
Favorite Place in Pargue!. By far our favorite place to go in Prague! All the diverse people, music and restaurants were so wonderful! Very magical at night. Highly recommend!
Beautiful place. It is a mystique and beautiful place. There are street food and lots of option to drink. You can visit the old town clock and the churches in the main square

Historical Beauty. Beautiful, lively part of Prague! Might want to steer away from the restaurants right in the middle of Old Town, as they are a little overpriced and tourist traps. Otherwise, great atmosphere to take in Prague

Magical walking. This is the part of Prague that transports you to another time. There's an amazing vista around every corner. Look up because the facades are festooned with turrets and other ornamentation. Stop in the jewelry stores selling garnets and definitely sit in a cafe and enjoy a leisurely break from the walking.

Prague is wonderful. From the Jewish center to the Charles bridge Prague is wonderful. Go to the old town square. Have a beer. Watch the people. Check out the Clock.
You are going to love this town.

Incredible!. The Old Town Square is absolutely wonderful! The buildings and the astronomical clock are beautiful and incredible!
The place deserves a visit during the day and night!

Crowded but pleasant. Great place to sit and people watch. Always something going on, music or else. I wouldn't recommend the restaurants on the main place - too pricy, but on one side, behind old town hall, there are a few stands selling food, beer or ice cream. Its very convenient to grab a bite, sit by the fountain and enjoy the day! Really lovely.
Buzzing. What a lovely area. It was buzzing all day with people. Staff in all the centres are friendly and helpful. Lots to see here.

Magical . The old town square is gorgeous! The mix of Gothic and Baroque architecture is beautiful to look at, if that's not your thing you can always pass time people watching! The astronomical clock provides a show on the top of the hour, worth a look. Just a heads up, the uneven cobblestone is lovely but I saw a bunch of people eat it so be careful!... and try not to laugh when someone trips and falls, you'll catch some dirty looks (trust me!).

Beautiful Neighborhood. One of the most beautiful and oldest neighborhoods in Europe, so many old buildings still stand while in other cities they have been torn down long ago. Definitely visit, and check out the less touristy streets.
old town. Great place to walk around and see the sights. Would dine in the off streets and not in the square, There are many local attractions to visit.

Tick tock clock. The square gets very very busy so like any were I'd recommend getting there as early as possible. The clock is beautiful do not i repeat do NOT eat our drink any were near the square they charge near triple for a beer than a place a few streets away. Joke it is. Any were charging over 50 kc for a beer is over charging.
Love there. Really beautiful here especially in sunny day!Must visit the place and you will live hereFood are available!!Nice place to be with children!
Fun to Wander. It was so fun to wander around Old Town with my friend. I always felt completely safe in Prague and even though I got lost on the twisty streets, I enjoyed every minute of it.

Touristy- but worth it. It's so charming in Old town, and sure, everyone will tell you to steer clear of the overpriced touristy restaurants, but sometimes you just want to pay for location. I am a tourist so I don't mind paying extra occasionally to people watch in the middle of the square. Had a great experience here.
Feel the past.... One of the best places on the world to see.. you feel the time, energy of the past, and you get goose bumps to be part of it....

Marvellous!. The Old town is a must for a visitor to Prague. It is exceptionally well preserved and carefully restored. No wonder that is frequently used in historic movies. The main square is the perfect starting point and the Charles bridge the end. Unfortunately, there seem to be quite a lot of tourist trap in this part of the city, so you have to watch out.
Lovely area. Lovely area great buildings and plenty to see and do, just avoid the usual rip offs.The astronomical clock is not that exciting
Beautiful and historic. Old town was completely overrun with tourists, but it is beautiful and historic. I'd love to visit when it was not so crowded. Beware of pickpockets!

Plenty to see and do. The Old Town is a real MUST as it is the most beautiful part of Prague, lots of beautiful facade buildings, various monuments to visit (some are free, for some one can buy a combined or separate entrance ticket), cosy places to eat (and not expensive), all kinds of shops, and above all with most friendly people and very tidy at all places.

Don't miss Old Town Square. My favorite place to be in Prague any time of year! Don't miss out on all the events and activities offered in this historic square! Definitely take time to enjoy all the buildings surrounding the square. I do recommend going off square for meals to avoid the inflated tourist prices!! Have a great time in Prague!

Center of Prague. Stare Mesto is always full life, day or night. I recommend you to visit the astronomical tower which offers a great view of the square! You must try traditional Prague chimney roll, they sell it near Astronomical tower. And of course come by at full hour so you can check out the astronomical clock performance.

Gives me peace inside. I love Prague and Old Town gives me peace inside. My family visitied Prague the first time 2014 and we went back 2015. You see a lof of thing here and the food and beers are great.

Heart beat of the City.. This lively square offers so much to see and is at the cross roads to many of the other sites in the City. Shop, people watch, stop for a Czech beer, eat or just walk around, there is something happening all day. Many tours start here. You'll hear and see street musicians. Check out the astronomical clock or shop in one of the many top quality stores.
Must Visit The Old Town. A must visit when in Prague especially at night. Staying in this area if you can find accommodation is also a great option.
Beautiful!. Old Town Prague is absolutely gorgeous. Lots to see and do, great people watching and very pedestrian-friendly.

Beautiful. Stunning architecture everywhere you look, and more fascinating history than you realise, the Old Town is a must-see on your visit to Prague. Stay away from the restaurants and bars on the square though, they can be quite expensive. And never pay more than 45 Kr. for 0.5l of beer in Prague!

Picturesque plaza with a lot tourist type restaurants. "Free tours" offerings on many languages and a lot of souvenirs. Beautifull Tyn chirch with 2 tower especially beautifull at dusk when lighted. Musicians, street artists, live statues, astonomical clock, and many restaurants .

OK. The market square is surrounded by cafe's and restaurants, in the center of the square there is a long building that houses a host of souvenir shops. Warning you will be asked dozens of time if you want to go on trips, when you say no thank you another person standing a few feet away will know you have said no but this does not deter him from asking again. Horse and carriage rides seem to be a big thing, but again you will walk past say no to the first only to be asked by the one behind, this will carry on the whole length of the line.

Try to avoid bars/restaurants. As usual, quite a price jump the closer one gets to the centre - to be expected of course, but I was openly told by a waitress at the only reasonably priced restaurant on the square that it would be "double the listed price to sit outside"....Needless to say I took my business elsewhere.

Visiting old Town. This is a very nice area to visit and wonder around for hours! There are lots of sites to see and lots of restaurant to enjoy food, and of course lots of shops if you fancy shopping and relatively cheap!

Medieval experience for tourists. Old Town Square - Staroměstské náměstí - is a historial square in the Old Town quarter of Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. It is located in the actual center of the city. The square features various architectural styles including the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn, which has been the main church of this part of Prague since the 14th century. Across the square there is a Old Town Tower a nice place for many shows and weddings.The tower offers a panoramic view of Old Town. Another church on the square is the Baroque St. Nicholas Church. An art museum of the Czech National Gallery is located in Kinský Palace.The square is surrounded by beautiful medieval buildings and in its middle, besides the monument of Jan Hus, the Czech personality of 15th Century, stand according to the season a variety of market booths, are music productions and attractions for kids.
Charming and walkable!. Old town is a great place to spend an afternoon browsing at shops and looking at the wonderful architecture. A wonderfully charming place to visit!
Old but also modern place.. Old Town is very interesting and a huge space with many beautiful views and stylish restaurants. You have to see the old astronomic clock.

Great city to visit. The whole downtown area is restored really nicely. The only thing that doesn't fit right to this city is the whole line of cheap stores. If you watch out you can see the same chain 5 or 6 times. Also the hundreds of segweg should be kicked out of the city.

A must see in Prague. This place is FULL of people and entertainers in the main square, but it is a must see if you go to Prague. The square itself is quite large and has many beautiful buildings for photographs. Just meander here and there, down side streets etc.

A place you just have to visit. It's just one of the many place you have to go and see. But don't be fooled into thinking ifs far from nowhere. One thing you'll see is that This area of Prague is compact and you can virtually walk anywhere. The famous clock is just off the square and any of the side streets will take you on a winding path somewhere worth seeing.You'll probable get a chance to ride a Segway even if it's a trial, it's worth it. Buskers and all that type of thing is plentiful. Have a drink no soak in the atmosphere.

Beautiful - photo ops!. You can not visit Prague and not spend time here. It is beautiful, picturesque! Relax, eat a snack or a meal, have a drink outside and people-watch. Take a photo at the clock, or basically anywhere here. A site not to be missed when in Prague. Very crowded.
Beautiful city. Prague is a great place to just wander and look in awe. Put your walking shoes on and step out with your map. You can walk for hours taking photos of beautiful old buildings.
Fascinating. Enjoyed sitting outside a bar watching the world go by. Watch out for pick pockets and very rude shop keepers in the souvenir shops

Wander the little streets. The Old town is beautiful!!! The astronomical clock is very impressive, but the most exciting part is to wander in the little streets and get lost! That way, you'll discover gems that aren't mentionnef in the touristic guides!

Fabulous area!. A lovely bustling area in a very beautiful city! Anyone could happily spend days just wandering around drinking in the sights and sounds both day and night! A massive range of eateries, bars and shops!

Splendid place. The old town and the place are fabulous. The old buildings, all different, give to this place a fabulous charm. All the monuments are impressive but don't forget to take the little streets around the place (There's less people and its also very charming) and to look up to see all the details around the place.

Simply Beautiful... Old Town (Stare Mesto) is very victorian and yet hip, there are numerous Boutiques with prices for everyone and numerous restaurants and bars even a Starbucks for those of us in love coffee.
Interesting area. Good to just sit and watch the passers by. Also listen to music. The tower above the clock is worth doing.
Charming city. Love Prague and love, love, love the old town. It is so charming and my favorite capital in eastern Europe. Spend a whole day here and fall in love with this wonderful city :)

Beautiful, relaxed, and engaging area. Absolutely in love with old town. Easily walkable with many hidden alleys and streets with beautiful cafes and restaurants. I could have spent days wandering the streets and relaxing in the beer gardens and cafes. Beautiful, relaxed, and filled with friendly people, I highly recommend this area.
Big square full of interest. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants, places of interest nearby, lots of gift shops to choose from and lots to see in the square with buskers, etc.

Must see. Definitely the must see in Prague, sometimes can be quiet crowded, but otherwise amazing place.
Beware of pickpockets.

Wow, it's alive. To say the least, this place is jumping. Everything from the La Ti Da stores like Cartier on one side to sausage vendors on the other. Street performers and people watching at it's best. Right around the corner from "the Clock" and it seems each of the alley ways leading from the square are jam packed with mysteries waiting to be discovered. The outdoor restaurants are a'buzz and from the aromas wafting through the air it seems the fare is quite good. So much to see in Prague, but could have spent way more time enjoying this lively fun center of the city.

Family Fun/History trip. Definitely made more than one visit to Old Town and be sure to cross the Charles Bridge. We did a river cruise...short and only around the Bridge and two (a 73 year old and an 18 year old) did the 3-hour Segway Tour....loved it.

Breathtaking. . This city is so beautiful. The architecture is breathtaking. We loved the shops, the Gelato and even the crowds. We only stayed for one night but I definitely want to visit again and experience the nightlife.

Wonderful. Another must visit while in Prague!!! If you happen to be in Prague during the holiday season, this is really worth a visit. Great Christmas market. So many things to do and see in Old Town Square.

Research the Astronomical Clock (Orloj) ... fascinating (and brutal) history!. Incredibly beautiful square! Lived in Czechoslovakia 4+ years, and Prague stands alone! I lived in Prague proper for about 4 months and returned at least twice a month after moving farther east, and I never grew tired of this square, or this city! My advice . . . spend as much time in Prague as you can . . . even after all the time I lived and spent there, I barely scratched the surface of all there is to see and do in this amazing town!

Nice historic square. Great historic centre of the city. Loved the market area and little shops around thr centre. Didnt eat here as heard the food is expensive. Stayed at the Boscolo Prague were the food was great! Try and go up the tower as it has great views of the city.
Must See!. A lovely quaint square. It is really a must see in Prague. It's near Staromeska metro station. The best pubs in Prague are in the area.

Just Beautiful . Very nice scenery of old town which offers a lot of things to do. Plenty of restaurants, Parizska street (the most expensive street in Czech Republic with shops like Gucci, Dior etc...) and astronomical clock in one place. really one of the most beautiful place in Central Europe.

Very quaint. A really nice old town experience - cobbled streets, old buildings, quaint shops, restaurants and bars. We were not too hassled by people trying to sell things so strolling through the narrow lanes was pleasant enough. The main square houses the astronomical clock which it's worth stopping to watch on the hour.

City Center worth spending some time in. This center is where you will want to spend your time walking around night and day. Try to catch the clock during it's hourly show, but don't waste your money at the overpriced restaurants unless all you want to do it drink. I'd opt for some of the adorable side street restaurants.

Great!. Beautiful city, the old town square and astronomical clock are great, plenty of place to eat, drink and shop. Don't waste time waiitng for the Astronomical clock ''show'' every hour...Also, beware of idiots on segway in the main square...Most of them don't watch where they are going

Must do. Loved the hike up the tower. Spectacular view of the city and all around. Amazing church (Tynne) there but was closed by noon on Sunday so could not see it. Great people place. Lots of crouds, children having fun. Very busy.
Well worth a visit. Charming old town prague is a nice place to visit. Just watch out for those pick pockets and expensive money exchange shops!

vibrant. A great place to soak up the vibrant atmosphere and enjoy the street entertainers. We enjoyed restaurants elsewhere but came here most nights for a drink afterwards, perfect for people watching.

Perfect Old Europe. You can just enjoy the scenery, take photos and savor some of their local food.
The place is even nicer at night. it was very safe even though it didn't initially give the impression to.
I would definitely come back and explore more corners. 2 days were not enough in Prague!
Expected stopover. Pretty but crowded. Beware of pickpockets but enjoy the sights. Everything seems to start or finish around the square. Good starting point.

One of the most beautiful and historical sights in Prague.. Old town in Prague or Phaha is a must see... especially for its ancient buildings and magnificent churches.It is absolutely one of the most beautiful and historical sights in Prague.

Beautiful area full of life. We were within 1 minute of the end of the Charles Bridge with architectural delights, restaurants, bistros, shops and bars all around us. A great base to see the best of the city from.
among top 5 in EUROPE. excellent services, very safe, romantic and still cheap ... you will love it and come back. Try quarter Josefov

Soak up the atmosphere in the heart of Prague. Many important sites are found here, most famous is the astronomical clock. Filled with tourists. Beautiful square with buskers and activities. Street food to try or people watching from the numerous cafes.

Entertaining Public Square. This square is very central and you will find yourself crossing its path several times. Its a great spot to people watch, shop or eat. Choose your restaurant wisely and watch out for the over priced water.

It screams "Europe!". With the obvious iconic view of Prague Old Town with Church of Our Lady before Týn, every building there was very classy and pretty every little streets and corner you go. It really had "Europe" vibe. Pretty with lights and bustle with lots of people at night.
旧市街全体が世界遺産なだけあり、ほんとうにキレイで、いかにもヨーロッパという感じです。建物たちすべてが素敵です！
Visit Prague. Can't recommend this city enough! Absolutely beautiful & so interesting. Book a tour with "The Naked Tour Guide" for the best insight to Prague.
Beautiful! . Beautiful architecture, clean streets, great Street performers... A great place for eating, shopping or just strolling!
loved it. Good people watching area, with street entertainer and relaxed hustle and bustle. Lots of places to eat and drink.
Just beautiful. Beautiful old european town, with countless resteurants pubs, museusm and apparently seagway users..:) You need days to taste all the food and see all the architecture
History. Prague is a city worth visiting. Old and new comes together. Friendly people. Bring good shoes, cobblestone everywhere.

Nice place to spend a day. Went there on a Sunday. Lots of people and activities going on. Street performers, food vendors. Overall a good atmosphere. Lots of cool shops and restaurants to visit as well.
Vibrant and interesting city. The Old Town square, outdoor restaurants, the town hall clock, and the Jewish quarter are all outstanding tourist destinations.
Architectural Attraction. The Old Town is a beautiful collection of architectural magnificence. From medieval to baroque styles, you will enjoy strolling along the cobblestone streets.

The Heart of Prague. No visit to Prague would be complete without spending an afternoon in Prague's Old Town. The main square with the Town Hall the the astrological clock, which people line up to watch strike the hour is worth a visit in itself. There are so many historic and fascinating buildings in this charming part of the city, just walking around the old town, you can see places where people from Einstein to Mozart stayed. The architecture is eclectic and interesting and the restaurants on the main square are an inviting place to sit and watch the world go by.

Old town square. A wonderful square surrounded by bars, coffee shops and restaurants. There are also stalls selling food and drinks which are cheaper and very good. There are horse and carriage rides from here too which is a lovely treat. There's always street entertainment in one form or another. Overall,this is a place not to be missed.

First day. Went to seen the Astronomical clock - beware it gets busy!. Do take the lift up the tower of the Old Town Hall - you get a panoramic vista of Prague. The towers of the Church of Our Lady before Tyn are like something from a disney movie. Go see St Nicholas' Church - the crystal chandelier is truly enormous and beautiful!

Best Square in Prague.. This is one of the best sqaure in Prague. The square features various architectural styles including the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn, it has been the main church of this part of the city since the 14th century, the church's towers are 80 m high. Prague Orloj is a medieval astronomical clock located at the Old Town Hall, the clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.Among many churches, tourists may find the Baroque St. Nicholas Church, while the tower at the Old Town Hall offers a panoramic view of Old Town. An art museum of the Czech National Gallery is located in Kinský Palace.

A must stop. If you are in Prague, no matter with who, you have to visit this place. Is very beautiful and full of nice restaurants and bars. Near from there are the most important places in old Prague town, walking not more than 10 minutes. Simply awesome.
Beautiful. Beautiful area with magnificent buildings.Lots of quirky little shops and plenty of bars and restaurants you can sit outside of and experience the character of the old town square.

Watching the world go by. I had no particular expectations of Prague, but was more than pleasantly surprised by this truly amazing place, sitting in the old town with a cold beer watching the world go by is priceless

A hidden gem. Filled with people eating drinking meeting, acting watching . I you face the astrological clock and turn 100* you see the Terasa U Prince. Go upstairs to the roof; have a drink or even a meal overlooking the square. and watch the amazing clock do its thing. A special treat.

Looking over the Old Town Square. Every tourist in Prague knows how crowded it can be on the Old Town Square. We tend to forget to look up and see what is kept in those beautiful houses. A Czech friend of mine invited me to Amadeus Café. which looks directly at the Jan Hus statue. It was an exceptional experience, good coffee, great waiters and above all: It is really cozy to sit inside and watch this amazing area.
Loved it. Amazing and fun place with a great vibe. Lots of places to eat and almost always has someone performing for entertainment.

An absolute must have on your busket list. What a fantastic experience. I have been all over Europe and the Old Town Prague is in my view the most exciting and vibrant city in Europe. Prices were good, all attractions were easy to reach and the historical significance out of this world.

Mesmerizing and Seductive. I cant stop but falling in love with Prague the City and Old Town the Square.I mean, the entire square looks incredible as if taken out of a well done painting.The quaint elegance, the gothic architecture, the scent of fresh beer, the hoards of musicians and the crowds from different parts of the world together make this a surreal experience.In my weeks visit to Prague, I visited this place ATLEAST twice everyday just to absorb the ambience. Words cant do justice to this place.Wherever you are in the world, if you can , then do pay a visit to Prague and the Old Town to see for yourself !!Do rate this review if you find it helpful

Stunning!. One of the most unbelievable old town squares I have ever seen, Stare Mesto in Prague is simply stunning at every angle. I would recommend having lunch outside in the square on a nice day to take it all in.

One of the best in Europe. This is one of the best in Europe. Magnificent buildings with impressive architecture, clean and easy to walk around. Allow a few days to thoroughly explore this wonderful old town
Europe tour. We walked and walked continually amazed at the buildings and the area in general, you are dragged back in time by the remarkable presence of Prague its architecture is sheer beauty.

Best part of Prague. On of the most beautiful cities in the world and really comfortable August weather make this a place not to miss. This is the key area to go when you visit Prague. Walk along the copious cobblestone streets, enjoy the old shops, and relish the fact that you made it to a place that holds unique charm and brings lasting memories.

Traditional. Lots of cool, traditional buildings within easy reach. Beautiful in the nighttime too. There are outdoor stalls selling various breads and foods. There are also cafes in the square to add to the charm.

Great place to hang out. There are loads of restaurants and bars all around . In the evening you'll be able to see random street shows and enjoy a great atmosphere . You could also observe a minor (in my opinion) tourist attraction which is the astronomical clock that presents a 10 second show of moving figures and sculptures of the apostales and some lame rooster that takes place every round hour (looking at the disappointed tourists might be more fun).

Full of life . The square is alive with hundreds of tourists, and with different kinds of shows at every night in every corner of the square and the surroundings from all over the world❤️You can spend hours without getting bored, restaurants+ shows+ surrounded by historical attractions ❤️
Busy location. It can get very busy so be prepared for crowds especially on the hour when the clock operates. There are some nice cafes around square to sit and watch.

Great atmosphere. Really enjoyed the Old Town, so much to see and do. We went up the astronomical clock and were able to watch it at 9am. It got very busy with tourists but that is what is to be expected. Great food stalls and entertainment. Early morning in the sun was the best time to be there.
The. The old town is full of beautiful buildings and it is well worth going up one of the towers to get a birds eye view of the city. A great variety of shops and restaurants.

Beautifully Gothic. The city of a thousand spires - it most certainly is. I call it Europe's Gothic city. The architecture is so beautiful I can never stop liking it. The Old town Square is stunning- the astronomical clock is definitely a must see. The square has a very nice atmosphere. The cobblestone streets are quite a pleasant experience. It seems like being in medieval Prague - a sensation which i loved.
Wonderful Sites. There were many interesting sites here. The items include the Astronomical Clock, Old town Hall, Powder Gate and Kinskj Palace.

Truly Beautiful. Wonderful buildings, every direction you look is a ready made postcard photograph. I dont think it matters what time of year you come here, everything looks beautiful no matter the weather. Plenty to see and do, cafes, bars, shops, restaurants, perhaps a little too many vendors trying to hire segways.

Beautiful views. . In the Old Town you are surrounded by beautiful scenery and friendly staff. It is a very busy place as it is where tour guides take customers, the bars around are lovely and aren't overly expensive- with the bonus of fantastic views. Great for photography and the Astronomical Clock is a huge attraction.

Historical charm and elegance. A clean and charming place to visit. People very friendly and helpful. We sat and had a beer to take in the ambience. A very relaxing place that really absorbed me in history.
A lovely place to walk around.. The old town is beautiful to walk around - it is mostly pedestrianized and full of interesting buildings, shops and restaurants.
A must. Very pretty and interesting place to visit. The heart of the city and a must for every visitor to Prague.
The Heart of Prague. The Central hub of Prague. Everything revolves around this fabulous historic center. There are lovely bars, cafes and shops around.

See the city's heartbeat here...... Try and stay in this area of Prague, is our strong recommendation. Eat atop the U Prince. Sit and enjoy the street artists that rotate in/out throughout the day. Consume the life that pulses here....

Beautiful square / Overpriced. Very busy as a very popular tourist Area. Right beside the sights :- the clock, Charles Bridge etc. Lots of shops, bars and food places about the area. Very over priced as close to the sights so would advise not to eat/drink here as its a total rip off can go to resturants and bars just off the square get more for far less. But good for a walk about.
Wear good shoes!. Old Town is amazing! My favorite times to visit were sunset and at night. The cobblestone is brutal, so stop to have a drink, relax and people watch!

Nice open public space with lots of tourists, tours, performers and one too many zegways . Beautiful open space with statue of Jan Hus. Public space filled with tourists, tour groups, street performers and zegways zipping in and out with great speed. Good to people watch and admire the great buildings and the clock tower and Tyn churchAlong the side of square is lined with overpriced cafes and restaurants. Sit by the west side of the square along the street food stands side to people watch or next to Jan Hus statue. Overall, a nice public square to admire the beauty of clock tower and beautiful architecture
Great city. Very beautiful place. The weather was absolutely great when we were there. I will definitely go back again!

Expensive tourist trap. I guess you can not really come to Prague without visiting old town. Now I am only referring to old town as the main square, which I found to be a complete tourist trap even going to the toilet in some of the bars where you are a customer you still have to pay. Beer can be as much as 4 or 5 times the price then anywhere else, and not only more expensive but also smaller 0.4l measures.

Must see. Fantastic, but take the time to explore this old part of the city, and one of the many town squares.Plan your trip to avoid the multitude of tourist.Sad that segways have been permitted to add another risk to pedestrians - there will be a tragedy for sure!

Beautiful. What a charming place, beautiful place to take a walk and see the nice buildings and the astronomical clock, stay for a while and have something to drink in one of the cafes nearby. This place gets very crowded so beware of the usual dangers, just be alert and you'll be fine.

Commercialized, crowded, and the result. The place would be nice with quarter of the number of people. The narrow streets have a nice atmosphere, the architecture is OK.Why "Poor" then? The number of people and their behaviour is terrible. Litter and vomit everywhere and the smell... Every half meter someone wants your money, either to steal or sell something stupid that has nothing to do with Prague. I was really disappointed, I'll avoid going back.

Storybook-like. The Prague city centre is one of the most beautiful spots in Europe (although it is true the tourist traps get really annoying after a point). The thing about Prague is that there isn't one or two places that one can look at - the entire city is like straight out of a story book. Do not miss it in your European travel itinerary
Old town. Nice to walk around day or night. Good selection of restaurants. Close to Charles bridge. Tram stops close by.
nice. Nice, mideval town with plenty to see and with a nice atmosphere. A lot of tourists. And I mean a lot. We were warned about pick pockets but saw none. A good idea to be careful though :)

Fantastic. This is truly an amazing old town. To me it is one of the most beautiful in whole Europe. I started from Namesti Republiky, handy place to get off the metro. There is the powder tower and from there I walked all the way to the Old town sq. Architecture is amazing, every building is very well kept and restored. Highlights: Old town sq, Tyn Church, Havelske Namesti, Male Namesti, Karluv Most, Josefov, Astronomical Clock. It is really beautiful. Take three to four hours to stroll here, it is magnificent. Be sure to see the astronomical clock in action, best is at 11 or 12 am. You can even sit at a cafe opposite it, but prices are a little bit higher. I also went to the Josefov, it is preety interesting, fantastic story. Overall, it is packed with tourists, the whole old town, exceptionally the Charles Bridge. City is kept clean and they do care about it. It is truly amazing piece of beautiful Prague.

First visit. Our first time to this great city believe it or not.We spent the entire weekend walking. So many squares with cafes for drink stops.The main square is so lovely with the buildings making great backdrops for snaps.Yes we enjoyed it.

The Wonderful Heart Of Prague. Old Town is beautiful, with lots of attractions to see and patio restaurants offering great Czech food. Suggest you go early as it gets very crowded in the Summer . The Astronomy Clock is grat to watch at 12 noon each day.

Gorj. Everyfin aboot it was gorrrjjj the food is not cheep so watch that but other than that it was grrrr888 the street performers were good some with fire and that type of thing others just too confident for their own good. There's a nice italian tound the corner near the astronomical clock.
Nice atmosphere walking though . Is nice walking thought the town. You can visit the clock tower or just listen to the music or having a relaxing dinner in one if the restaurant of the city.
Beautiful area to explore. Beautiful area to explore. The only real downside was that it was very busy with lots of visitors. Despite this the city is kept clean and we never felt unsafe.

Really enjoyed Old Town. Old Town was a lot of fun for me, as a solo traveler. There was a buzz of activity on this beautiful day when I visited. Thousands gathered to watch the Astrological Clock do its thing (a bit of a let down) at the top of the hour. Street performers were out in full force. The restaurants and shops were busy. There's even a statue of Jan Hus! What's not to enjoy? Others will tell you it's too crowded or over priced...and maybe they're right. But if this is what you like, then sit down, have a beer and enjoy!

Beautiful . What a lovely square this is, architecturally stunning with lots of nice bars, food stalls, cafes and restaurants in it! The church of Tyn is beautiful, especially when it's lit up at night! This is an ideal place to start your open topped car or carriage tour. The astronomical clock is interesting but have a read up on it first as it will enhance your appreciation of it.

Watch the Clock - Watch Your Wallet!. Watch the clock on the hour, watch your wallet and watch the world go by. Very lively square with great vistas in almost every direction. It can get chaotic as the day goes by.

The heart of Prague. The heart of Prague.A great area to walk around leisurely, especially in the evenings.Nice cobbled stone pathways take you to the central square which is a hotbed of activities in the evening.Take a segway tour, watch one of the many street performances going on around you, have a look at the old clock tower, eat at one of the great restaurants and cafes, and get loads of selfies.It is crowded and the air is packed with cigarette smoke. Not the cleanest either, but a must visit in Prague. Architecturally appealing and with many things to do, one can easily spend a few hours walking around the lanes of Prague.
Such a great place!. Lovely place and such an amazing vibe. Lots of places to grab food and drinks. The Astronomical Clock Tower gives a great view of the Old Town Square!
Fantastic. A must go place, and walk around, have coffee and see the beautiful crowd and street show. All surrounding area is worth to visit by walk

Fabulous Square in the Heart of Old Town. Very touristy square. Recommend being there on the hour to watch the Astrological Clock go off. Restaurants and shops on the square are very expensive. Much more reasonable if you can get 100 meters away.
Beautiful architecture. Tourist central but a must see. This is one of the main reasons to visit Prague. Just wandering around day or night was pleasant.

Beautiful buildings but very busy. We loved the Old Town Square with its beautiful Baroque architecture and would love to visit it out of tourist season as it was extremely busy, which made wandering around quite difficult. We had lunch in one of the many pavement restaurants and found food to be pricier than in the Lesser Quarter and also service not as friendly. Beware also, as service, which is included in the price most other places, is added to the bill here as is a cover charge per person to cover bread etc.
Old Town Prague. we stayed a couple blocks away from Old Town. Only drawback is the crowds but that's to be expected. Architecture/buildings are a treat to see.
No trip complete without a visit. My favourite area of Prague, both town hall and church are beautiful. Everyone must go there when in Prague
THE BEST IN EUROPE. I think,that the old town of prague is liike a lie.IS SO perfect that u believe that is in your dream.u must see the old town you must see all prague
A Charmer. This is the essence of the oldest part of Prague. It is also the most charming because of the buildings that go back to olde times.

Cobblestones and crazy segways. If you're not used to the charm of narrow cobblestone roads, then the Old Town has a lot to offer. Be warned though, you'll be dodging crazy tourists on segways the whole time,

Turist central with amazing architecture. Get ready for pressing crowds, lost tourists and people suddenly stopping before your feet. If you can bring yourself to overlook these inconveniences you will get a real treat. I recommend a concert in Saint Clement's Cathedral, a play at the Estates Theatre, give the Marionette Theatre a go and see a more entertaining and child friendly Don Giovanni. For Czech food I suggest going outside of Stáre Méstrô but for pizza, pasta and any part of a pig you will find many places to choose from. You get by well with English in this area but once away from the tourist attractions you should learn some basic phrases in Czech.

beautiful during the day, buzzing at night. the square along with the rest of the old town, is dripping with culture. You can tick of quite a few of "sights to see/things to do" list starting from this square. It's also a meeting/eating/entertainment area which is buzzing till the early hours of the morning.Each street off the square, is rammed with shops and cafes.I loved Prague, but it is vast, and required more than the 3 1/2 days I had to see everything. It would require military planning to cover all places of interest, but to be frank sometimes it's just great to sit and watch the world go by. One thing that really got on my nerves were the numerous and frankly dangerous segways, These monstrosities are allowed everywhere, pavement, road, squares!!...It is beyond belief that the local municiples has issued permits to these ridiculous machines designed for the truly lazy. Don't people realize how idiotic they look, on these so called modern machines, against the backdrop of this beautiful ancient city. Come on...a city is not the place for these modern walking aids for the young and fit!!

Old Town. This is a must see site some great people watching to do here just grab a table coffe,tea or preferred beer and watch the world pass by every language will eventually pass you. It does get crowded but from your very (less crowded Coffee or Beer stop ) you won't mind....
Stunning vibrant pedestrian square. It doesn't compare to any other square. Stunning architecture, colors, history. Vibrant and full of life at all hours. Love it!!
Heart of Prague . Located in the middle of Prague, this spots never fails. It has the so-called Bohemian feels in the place. I recommend to visit here at night

Old Town Square. Full of atmosphere. Sat and soaked it all up in one of the restaurants. Had a few drinks and people watched. Reasonably priced food and drink. The famous clock is there it attracted a lot of people in the hour. Only meant to sit for an hour but stayed and had lunch and a few more drinks.

Beautiful Prague. The old town square is crowded with tourists but this does not reduce its beauty and charm. The astronomical clock is beautiful, the narrow streets, small buildings, small restaurants are so picturesque. Prague is a beautiful city; we will definitely come back.

Fairytale square . The old town is very beautiful. Lots of views and beautiful buildings. The clock is stunning. If you happen to be there on the hour you can see the apostles and the cuckoo chime. Be prepared to hold onto your bags as it gets very crowded here. The street vendors around the square have a good selection of food and beers. I rather enjoyed the potato crisps on a skewer.

Beware of money exchnagers on street. Dont want to get into the normal stuff of awesome place , blah blahEast Europe requires you to be alert and beware of pick pocketers etc. However Prague also offers people who see tourists walking around and offer them better exchange rates for Euros / USD, they handover useless currency and not the Czech Krona, on first glance it looks similar but it's quite different Lost Euro 100 to once such schemester :(
A must while visiting Prague. a must to see. the nicest city in the world and the old town is very different visiting day light and evening. one should do it at least twice.
old town. it is just a beautiful area. lots of sights, good restaurants. it is easy walking to all the old town sights and museums and to the waterfront as well.

Prague in 2 days. We walked the old town, took in a couple of concerts ( pretty expensive at Smetana Hall). Walked the Charles bridge, saw the sights. We really enjoyed the castle. ( bought a day pass on the transit system). Precook taxis if it's raining. We didn't and had to take the metro to the train station, not all that easy with luggage. It was only two stations, but we had to transfer lines.
impressive. Impressive city, where ever you pass you have something to see, old palaces, churches music halls and above all atmosphere

Full of life, love the architecture.. We spent our first day here, just walking around taking in the architecture and the people. A huge variety of things going on all around the Old Town, I would recommend taking some walks down the side streets to find some lovely restaurants and bars. It's like a gothic Disney!! :)
Quaint. Lovely place for a wander, buying souvenirs and to have dinner. Leads down to Charles Bridge. There is lots of restaurants and also night clubs around.

Fantastic sights everywhere you look!. A must see! Come a night to experience it lit up in an almost magical way. View the astronomical clock early in the day to avoid the crowds. The window display the saints precedes the chiming of the hour.Late morning through the afternoon be prepared for hoards of tourists in peak tourist season. If you are not in a tour group, try to stay apart from one.

Very nice building and lots going on. This area is often full of tourists probably the busiest place in Prague day and night. If possible visit in the week day as it's less busy than the weekend. Lots to see and do, there are plenty of places that you can book all sorts of tours

I like old town square!. Great street side food and performances but sit down cafes are overpriced. Overall I loved the vibe of Old Town Square. It's a lovely place to meet friends to start off a fun day together or to sit alone with your book and take in the gorgeous view every time you look up from your book.
Beautiful. Loved the old town of Prague, especially the square, it was buzzing and so pretty. Fairy tail castles, wonderful restaurants and great bars. Loved everything about Prague.

Something for everyone. The square has plenty of restaurants and a wide range of shops as well as plenty of activity going on for all ages within the square itself.
Hot Prague had straight off the spit is wonderful and as you pay by weight you get as much as you want.
Great place to while away a few hours.
Holiday. Was crap rude people not a lot to do to be fair and not very nice places to see as people go on about wouldn't date waste my money and time again in this place

Old Town. Went there over Christmas time. Vibrant and full of character. Beautifull setting and lots to visit and take in.Christmas stalls have a big variety of food and drinks as well as other products for the shoppers in all of us.
Crowded, but a nice place. Very crowded(especially when everybody is gathering around the astronomical clock), but well preserved buildings.
Old Town Prague. Huge area with lots going on at all times of the day & night. Surrounded by historic buildings, shops & restaurants. Plenty to see and do.
Beautiful . The old town of Prague is a typical old town of a Central European city. Beautiful to walk around and feel like you are time traveling.

Amazing architecture. I loved the old town. Everyday we stayed in Prague we found new examples of all different era's of architecture. It is beautiful. It visited in July and there was a great atmosphere in the square at all times of the day.

Great part of Prague. If you are a fan of old buildings, narrow streets and lots of little shops and restaurants - Old town is the spot. A beautiful place that has that historic aura over itself wherever you go.
Mix of beautiful everything . A great mix of amazing architecture and a square with buildings straight out of a fairytale. True center of a great city with so much life in it.

It would be a travesty not to visit it!. What a truly wonderful square. It is the essence of what a old European city square is; that being a sort of nucleus or focal point of the city. Simply put it is breathtaking...and it would be remiss of a tourist not to spend a good portion of their time in and around the square. There are great cafes, restaurants, night-life and shops in the area...in fact one should dedicate a great deal of time walked the old paved streets, wherein one can immerse themselves in Czech cuisine and the old epicenter of one of Europe finest cities. It would be a travesty not to visit it!

Immense, impressive and lively . What do you want to do on this square? Be amazed by the architecture, buildings and facades? This is possible. Be entertained by different artists, music, football tricks, soap bubbles, dancing? This is possible. Wander around with a beer in your hand? This is possible. Take your time and enjoy. Must see when you visit Prague.
Heart of the city.. The place which is always alive, full of shows and people. yes, it inspires! Its a real heart of the city.
Old Town Beautiful. Loved Prague in general and will return. We visited at the suggestion of our daughter and we were not disappointed.
A lot going on.. There was always something going on in the centre of Prague. The entertainment was mainly good and their were plenty of places to eat there.

Amazing architecture.. The bustling Old Town Square is a must see. The architecture is outstanding and the area is buzzing, with street performers, cafes and restaurants aplenty. Don't miss the Astronomical Clock or the fascinating interiors of the Old Town Hall.
Worth the Effort. Pleasant walk to look at the old buildings with lots of small shops, some selling Bohemian Crystal. Well worth seeking out the little side roads.

It was magical. We were there during new years, with all the Christmas decoration it was one of the most amazing places I have been, absolutely buzzing and had beautiful Christmas market
I highly recommend staying or visiting Old Town squate
Stunning. Ok, very touristy but still amazing. Don't look at the food places or the souvenir shops, what is left is a huge square full of music and beautiful buildings. A total must.

Its a must in Prague. Even though it is touristy, this area is a must in Prague. It is beautiful and many landmarks are located here. Don't miss it! Try to find a less crowded restaurant in the smaller streets and not in the main ones.
Amazing place for a short trip. We would return again and again especially when the weather is nice - wonderful places to eat and drink
Amazing place for a short trip. We would return again and again especially when the weather is nice - wonderful places to eat and drink

Amazing but crowded - explore beyond too!. Beautiful and interesting, but heaving with tourists in August. A must see but don't be led to believe that this is all there is to see in Prague! "New Town" is still like 600 years old and stunningly beautiful too. There is lots to see in Prague. I like visiting old town, but I wouldn't stay there as it's too crowded and noisy.
amazing space. massive crowds but the architecture is spectacularwatching street performers and shopping is good herelike most cities the bars here are more expensive, so worth going just off centre
Medieval part of the city. The old town is the a medieval settlement of Prague. Do not miss the Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock. A nice walk that you have to do.

Great Town Center!. Great People Watching with Lots of Activity. You can find many different restaurants with outside seating hopefully in the shade. So many things going on and a great Town Center. Well worth wondering around the area and drifting in an out of shops.
My favourite part of Prague.. If you see one area in Prague, has to be here. Big open areas with many sights of historical significance. Absolutely beautiful. Do not miss.

Lots going on. Among the Tyn Church, the astronomical clock, the restaurants, the shopping, the monument and the crowds of people, this is a fascinating spot. The only negative is you need to look out for the crazed Segway riders who are trying to sell tours and drive through the plaza fairly recklessly (although I did not witness any collisions).

Worth a visit. This square is bustling all day long. It had a mixture of souvenir shops and up market stores, the same for the food of the area. From small food stalls right through to lovely restaurants. The highlight of the square is the Astronomical clock however given the attraction of it being over and done with in less than a minute I would recommend visiting in the morning early on to avoid the crush..... There are a variety of street performers and way too many people selling segway trips in the centre of the square so watch out for pick pockets however thats about as unsafe as it gets... Single female travellers would be extremely safe in this area and in Prague in general.

Worth the visit at least once.. The clock tower is worth the visit. We climbed to the top, there is a nominal fee.This is a historic mechanical marvel that you must see.
