The square however is always packed with tourists and entertainers. It can be quite crowded at times so try to avoid it once you have seen the clock. The restaurants and cafes around the square cater to tourists, the prices are reasonable and so is the food but get off the tourist track and explore local restaurants.

Typical architecture, lovely narrow roads.. loads to discover. Old Town is beautiful starting from the architecture, to the cobblestone roads all around the city center. The Astronomical Clock is one of the main attractions which attracts hundreds of visitors every hour.

Beautiful square.. This is a beautiful square, a must see when in Prague. Do not eat in the restaurants though as they are very expensive compared to elsewhere in the city, beer etc is almost 3 times more expensive, walk a few streets to better food at better prices. I can recommend lokal restaurant great food and beer at very reasonable prices.
August 2015 family tour to Czech Republic. Very clean streets, polite people. Tasty food and a lot of kinds of beers!!! All interesting places are close one to another

Worth a visit ... Plenty happening here .... Just have a coffee and watch the world go by. There's a lot to watch here ! Entertainers , monuments , tourists !!
There's a good number of restaurants so you can sit here and relax ...

The Real Heart Beat Of Prague. The old winding lanes of Old Town took me back some 600 years with its ancient buildings,magnificent churches,roadside cafes,bars,shops to make it one of the most beautiful sights of Europe.The notable buildings that i passed through with admiration, were the Old Town Hall with the Astronomical clock,Tyn & St Nicholas churches.At the center of it all in the square the statue of Jan Hus the social reformer of the 14th century.I walked past beautiful pastel colored Romanesque or Gothic style buildings with fascinating house signs like the Kinsky palace,House of Stone bell & Storch House etc.I sat in one of the roadside bars with a glass of local Czeck beer & soaked in the beauty of the atmosphere with plenty of tourists.
Crowds and distractions. Ignore the 'performers' in the square and look at the Clock and the buildings - all beautifully preserved. Excellent cafes here too.

Great place to walk around. If you are in Prague long enough walk around old town, there are lots of places to eat, especially gelato. There are lots of live entertainment. There is lots of shopping. Watch on the hour for astronomical clock and watch the figures moving. Sit and relax.for more information check my blog Rauhala Ramblers at sharonr1947.blogspot.comPrague sites

More beautiful at night!!. Beautiful Old Town to see, but Prague offers many nicer areas. Expect a massive crowd at all times of day, however night time offers a much nicer atmosphere, and better quality photographs!! A little pricier than restaurants off the main track, but worth it to sit and people watch with a cold Czech beer!!
nice place. It was really nice place to visit. It was very crowded . I was a little bit surprised . Prague became one of my favorite destination from now on

Loads to do and see.. Old town is full of everything you need for a short break.Plenty of attractions free and paid, loads of tours, good restaurants (though avoid those based on the square if you don't want to get over charged).Aside form the graffiti Old Town is very clean and tourist friendly.

Gorgeous. Not only the main square with the old Town Hall, but the entire district is full of beautiful buildings. Too many tourists, though. For a desert picture, you need to be there early in the morning.

Must spend a full day at this place. This is an awesome place to spend an entire day. I was there on July 25, 2015 and it was beautiful. Around 10 AM in the morning, I reached this place and signed up for a day's sight seeing (you will find 2 counters right in the middle of this square). To my luck, there was a carnival that day and people from different countries marched in a parade talking about their cultures. They played, danced, all of it.. It was an awesome experience. A day well spent.
Bustling with live. Beautiful buildings, the time clock with 12 apostoles, a few churches, where they do classical music concerts. Prague is absolutely amazing!
Charming. Loved it! walk through the charming streets. Take the free walking tour at 11a or 2p from the square.
It's really historical . All the culture of Prague In this square. Music groups, delicious desserts and big briefs on the fire and the historical big amazing clock

Beautiful square. We travelled in August 2015. The old town square was one of my favourite places. Beautiful buildings, lots going on, street entertainers were great. At night the building are lit up, plenty of bars and restaurants to sit outside and watch the world go by.
Love Old Town. Full of sights & sounds, this area is a smorgasbord of beautiful scenery, shopping, other things to do, foods to try, & more.
Family trip august 2015. One of the most beautiful sites we ever saw! Every corner seems a scenery from a fairy tale! Strong recommendation!
Cooool. Very nice, but watch out when buying prague ham. The price is per 100 grams, and they give you a big piece.It was our most expensive meal in prague
I love this place. I love this place, even when it's full of tourists. I recommend anyone going to Prague to go there, stand still and just take in the atmosphere.
central to everything. The square is a great place to begin your tour. You can then go to the bridge, to the Jewish Quarter, down Celetna Street, or shopping near Wenceslas Square.

You will fall in love with the city.... Its a visual treat to walk by the lanes full of old and new souvenir shops and eating joints. Place for quite a few Gothic buildings and ofcourse the famous Astronomical Clock tower. The 360 degree view of the entire city is stunning at the top of the tower. There is a entrance fees.

Fascinating architecture. Cafes, restaurants, bar, market stalls.. I only had a few hours on a Saturday, before catching my plane home. The architecture of old town and particularly the main square was superb. However the square was packed making good photos more difficult and making it easy for pick pockets - beware. Loads of good restaurants, cafes and bars, particularly down the side streets and came across an excellent little market area selling gifts, fruit, confectionary and fascinating puppets.A day here is a must for anyone visiting.

You will be in awe. All I can say is that the place gives you goosebumps, it is so breathtaking and historical. Check out the old astronomical clock, every hour it will alarm you with a very symbolical short-story
Exploring. Great place to explore and to get lost. The patios had installed some water hoses and we could escape the hot sun.

You can never be bored here . You can never be bored here, there are so many attractions such as street performers, parties. Some performances are more than just singing or playing, I've seen a reproduction of Our reelection or something from the times of civil war with real horses and lots of people participating wearing traditional suits as for that time. As I said before you can never be bored here.
Excellent place to Stay. I loved easyHotel Prague, it was a west side of a city center with public transportation 24/7, many bars and restaurants,lunch and beer was 4 EUR.

never bored in here. Well, what to say... everyone that knows this place also knows it's worth of visiting. In the winter there is christmas market with many stalls, in the summer there are many interesting events.. there is always something to see. And you can't leave without watching the famous clock with "small people" inside:)

Old Town Prague. Every tourist's must see.A guided tour is worthwhile but not necessary.Marvelous examples of 17th and 18th century architecture. A very busy atmosphere. Protect your valuables, the area has had problems with pick pockets.Walk along and enjoy the small alleys and side streets.
What a Buzz!. Happening place - street musicians, performers, dancers, absolutely electric. Hot and energetic, not for the faint-hearted, but we loved it all!
Great Place!. Great place to walk around. Plenty of cafe,restaurts and bars. Boutique shops. very lively places. Fun place.
Very cousy. Fantastic beer cellars, good food, very narrow and cousy streets. Always full of people. And almost everywhere you come, you feel wellcome
Dreamy Square. A dreamy and historical place... I really impressed at Old Town Prague. Astronomical clock, gergous historical buildings, musicians, little cute restaurants... Loved it :)

Fascinating city. Great place to explore.,go,down the side streets and look up for painted houses and stylised name plates. You must go on a tram, visit the Charles Bridge early in the morning before the crowds descend.
Not to be missed. We kept ending up in this part of town. The architecture is fascinating, so many good cafés and restaurants and shops. You can't come to Prague and not spend time int he Old Town.
you shouldn't miss while in Prague. Lot of people, everyone watch the Orloy. Pretty buildings - everywhere. Shops with puppets, stalls with food, bars, restaurants. And great mood!
Nice atmosphere. Very groudy place expecially every full hour because of the clock but otherwise, day and night, markerplace, streetmusicians, old buildings. Great!

Wander in Old Town. Old Town is one of the perfect areas to wander through in Prague. It is filled with historic buildings/sites, cafes, pubs, and shops. The area can tend to be crowded in late morning and afternoon but is worth dealing with the crowds. Make sure to visit all the beautiful churches!

No one can miss it!. One of Prague's ex-libris. I love listening to music when I am there. Many tourist attraction, like de City Hall, over and Astronomic clock are in this place. here are also very beautiful churches nearby and jazz clubs. The view from the terrace of one of the hotels near the city Hall is really nice and the food and drinks have a fair price and are really lovely.

Ten Church and Prague Old Town Square. The must-see sight in Prague.Enjoy the street performers and the clock of the Council House every hour. My favourite is the Tyn Church, with two towers straight from a Grimm Brothers' fairy tale.

Beautiful.. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Fantastic for strolling through, eating at the many café's and restaurants and relaxing. Although it's busy and touristy, everyone is incredibly relaxed and the experience is fantastic. The architecture is absolutely stunning. We went in summer and it perfect. The astronomical clock is a must see.

Sandemand free tour of Old Town. Sandeman free tour of the Old Town was excellent.
Our guide Katerina was brilliant, and provided a lot of information in a very engaging way.

This is the place to feel Prague. This is the cultural and historical center of Prague. Full of historical monuments, amazing restaurants and tons of shops. Charles Bridge, WWII history and the Czech cultural is everywhere.
OK FOR OLD TOWN. This was nice and a must see when Prague is mentioned. DON'T TAKE A CAB, ANYWHERE! WORST CAB RIDE ever!

lose yourself in history. Beautiful architecture, amazing place to visit, alive with people busking. Middle of the day crawling with tourists and good when raining due to the abundance of umbrellas!! Wonderful just getting lost amongst the old buildings and cobblestone streets!!!
Simply Beautiful. The atmosphere in the square is really something magic. This place is among the "must see it" at least once in your life.

Prague, a wonderful place to visit. We spent 3 days in Prague and enjoyed every minute. Interesting history, lots to see and great places to eat at a reasonable price if you don't eat at the cafes in the "Square"

Beautiful Prague. A wonderful city that needs to be experienced by foot. Word to the wise, don't have your wallet in the back pocket as it gets very busy, especially in the summer months. Beer is cheap, and walk slightly off the beaten track and you will get a great dining experience in the old town.

A long walk through Prague's hostory. Take a guided walking tour - but be aware that they can be quite long (ours was three hours without a break!) and you'll see all the major areas. Then go off on your own and revisit the particular places that interested you.

Best place to relax and get the Prague spirit. This is Prague's most famous square. It becomes an open air scene for performances during the evening. The astronomical clock sings every hour, but it's the evenings which are most exciting. Highly recommended for both families and couples.
Old town. Wonderful city u have to see and if u go prague u need 1 week för stay because every place is wonderful and need see

My favorite place in Europe. This is my favorite place in old Europe!!! If you find time to get there, I mean in Prague, this is the best thing you can do.This two towers you see on photo, its so called "Tinska" cathedral. On the night time its fantastic light show and you can feel all the magic of old dark Europe of 16 and 17 century. I prefer to stay there on night and in winter time. Stare Mesto is wonderful in days before Christmas.I don t know how to express emotion I have when I seat down there in cafe near this cathedral, drink hot tea and have blanket on my legs in a cold night. Soooo good..

Gargoyles, and Spires - Architecture and People watching a must here!. From the spires, to the gargoyles, this was a very cool part of town, to people watch and admire the architecture, and considered the central area, like a plaza where people would meet.

Great for wandering. This is easy for walking. Enjoy wandering around narrow streets with many interesting examples of architectural styles. Enjoy these streets themselves not just as the way from point A to point B. You can appreciate the design of cities centuries ago. Usually street signs are at corners at the base of the second story (first story European numbering). However, sometimes these are not immediately found. However, I usually got where I wanted to go, although since the streets are not straight you have to keep this in mind.

Prague - A lovely bargain. Very interesting area with different kinds of buildings. Their own mix of architectural styles. The buildings are much more colorful than we find in America. The St. Charles bridge has become the latest spot for couples to put locks on the fencing over the bridge. Many statues, good photography of the river and sunsets are to be had. Plenty of high-quality independent stores with jewelry, fashions and much more. Good cafes and restaurant. And it was all very inexpensive - at least 15-20% cheaper than Austria and Germany.

Energetic and bustling Prague.. Prague is a wonderful city with so much history, architecture, and beauty everywhere. Old Town is easy to get around. Obtain a map from the tourist center near the astronomical clock. Enjoy walking, bicycling and experiencing Old Town in daytime and night. We spent three days in Prague and would have liked to spend more time there. Bring your camera and good walking shoes. The subway is easy to use if you want to venture out to the more modern Prague.

Charming area. This is a charming part of Prague with it's old buildings, churches, Old Town Square, Bohemian crystal shops, squares, etc. Take some time to wander through the streets and meandering cobblestone alleys.
beautiful part of beautiful Prague. the best part of prague, a must on your trip to Prague. i would highly recommend seeing the old town square and the jewish town with its unique vibe

Always something new to discover. I really do enjoy spending time in the Old Town. There are many buildings to discover and a very rich history, which can be brought to life even more with the right guide. It is one of the best areas of its kind I've visited, and if you find out about the history you'll understand why. It's also very compact and easy to walk around. The only downside if the incredible number of tourists!

The 17th and 18th Centuries undamaged by war -- a rare sight in Europe. Old Town square began just a block from our accommodations. The square and the cobbled lanes radiating out from it were jammed with clueless tourists from many lands, a walking Tower of Babel. (Flat shoes with rubber soles are a must!) Elaborately embellished Baroque buildings stood cheek by jowl. Statues, friezes, religious and bucolic scenes rendered in paint and mosaics adorned the fronts. Venturing down a side street, we ducked into St. Joseph’s Capucine Church, with its interior done in a more restrained Baroque style – carved dark wood, varnished and adorned with occasional gilding. We also peered into St. Jacob’s, a larger and more elaborate Baroque church and strolled past the Estates Theater, a pistachio-green confection where Mozart premiered “Don Giovanni.”

Nice place to meet. It is very european place to just sıt and watch the performers carrying 5 bottles in their heads or watch to most talented singers perform . Also if your mobile phone doesnt work , it is great place to meet up
Old world charm. Charming highlight of our first, brief visit to Prague. Will definitely return and see more of the city.

ANOTHER "Must See" during your visit to Prague. We visited the square one evening, I imagine there are probably crowds there most all the time. We had dinner in a rooftop restaurant [can't remember the name] with excellent views of the square, church and tower, all beautifully illuminated at night.

easy t get around and always worth a visit. easy to get around all in walking distance. A bit tough to find good restaurants as you have to go quite a bit away from the touristy area. Always worth a visit

Something for visitors of all ages.. The Old Town Square is always bustling. The surrounding building are beautiful to look at. There are open-air food stands selling Czech favorites. One evening we attended a wonderful free concert by a terrific band. You really don't need to spend a lot to enjoy the square.

Take in the city from the square. This is an obvious must in Prague. No trip to the city is complete without some time to loiter around old town square. The astronomical clock may seem a little overrated, but considering how old it is and how long it has been in (intermittent) operation, it really is a wonder. We loved our time just taking in the city from this square.

Beautiful and Busy. This is the center of old Prague and it must be experienced. There are musicians, performers, protestors and lots of people. It is a good place to feel the vibrancy of the town. Cafes are every where and just so much to see and do. Spend a couple of hours and take it all in.
Lovely place. Great place. It was crowded but this shows the popularity of the place. Many eating options. Must visit in Prague.

Interesting blend of old with a blend of tourism. Try to overlook the crowds and massage parlors and imagine yourself in medieval times. The town has a lot of charming shops and historical buildings but it also has developed a lot of tourist type business and street entertainment.The mix however makes this place unique and interesting

The place to explore.. This is a very lively place with beautiful views of the stunning architecture that makes Prague so popular. It is hard to miss the Stare Mesto. Take time to relax with a Czech beer at one of the many little restaurants and beer houses on the sidewalks and on the main square (8 August 2015)
Amasing place. it is a wonderful place with lots of hobbies ,cafe, bars ,restaurants and you will enjoy walking and also watching the riverside scene.

You Can't Say You've Been To Prague Without Going Here. I'm not sure what a rating of the Old Town square really means. But you can't go to Prague and without visiting this place, where modern culture and tourism meets history. Plenty of historical sites, a giant sculpture of one of the most interesting figures of the 15th century, Jan Hus, Bethlehem Chapel, Our Lady of Tyn, the astronomical clock dating from 1410 that puts on a show every hour, plenty of restaurants, horse and buggy rides, street performers. It's all there. And this year is the 600th anniversary of Jan Hus' martyrdom, so July 5 and 6 saw special concerts and outdoor dramas that were superbly done.
Old but gold. Enjoyed the beauty of autumn in the afternoon, a walk to the old town which is visited by tourists from all over the country and visited many interesting shops.

Beautiful architecture but a tad too many tourist.. One of the finest neighborhood in the city but it is batter to visit it early in the morningto avoid the crowds. Highly atmospheric few people around wit hits unique combination of old buildings.
The place to be. Great place to people watch Could do with more street entertainers / buskers though to bring the square alive

Step Back in History & People Watch. Fabulous, very old, very quaint, loved the people watching, slightly disappointed with the Apostles dancing on the Astronomy clock but worth a watch!! Expensive for beers here as you may imagine (100 CZK for 0.5l (£3.50 ish so depends on what you call expensive of course!! Relative to other out of the way bars yes it is!)
Great city. . Lively city. Very cheap however not on old town square. Can be very busy in the summer. Lots of tourists but still worth a visit.
Wonderful City. Although extremely hot a joy to wander around this beautiful area. You could not fail to be impressed by the architecture.
Don't miss Old Town. In Summer this is the centre of things. Lovely street theatre, places to eat and drink, shops and one of the main tourist attractions with the amazing clock.

Beautiful buildings, amongst tourist traps. Lovely old architecture, but swarmed with tourists! A sea of selfie sticks meant that it was preferrable to avoid if possible. A lot of the food places are steeply priced due to the location, and at one of the cafes near the astronomical clock we were informed that the prices shown on their menu increased by up to 50% when dining outside? Lovely to pass through but wouldn't spend all holiday here!

Stunning . Tremendously beautiful square. Packed with tourists. Go early or late. Incredible buildings where you feel you are stepping back in time. Side streets are quieter and also full of splendour.
When in Prague.... This is the reason Prague is the most beautiful capital in Europe. I love wandering the streets of Prague!

Wonderful City. Beautiful old city. A must if you travel anywhere near. Remarkable buildings with churches and entertainment frequently in the open center. A short walk to the bridge over the river and a taxi or bus to the castle over the city. Ride up and walk down unless you are in great shape. Mostly untouched by WWII so the architecture is beautiful. Plan on being there again in May.

Enchanting. This square has an enchanting atmosphere that I have experienced nowhere else. You really could spend at least a couple of hours here and not notice the time going.2 caveats: it was very packed with tourists when we were there ( 1 May). And we did find the place caused some disorientation when we wanted to leave, as the adjacent streets are all quite small and do not show up clearly on city maps. This made it difficult to find our way to Hard Rock cafe even though it was only a few minutes walk. So maybe an idea would be to magnify the google map of the area and grt familiar with at leasta few of the side streets so you know where you are going.Caveats apart, this is an amazing square.

Stunning, but very busy so try not to go in the middle of the day. Easy to get to, most roads seem to end up there! Lots of cafes and bars too, so worth putting some time aside to explore all the little roads coming off the main square.
one of the best places. amazing, beautyfull, definitelly worth checking. you just need to walk around small streets, market square and enjoy this old buildings
Lovely city. Beautiful, loved staying here, worth a visit, there is food shopping wine, culture and beautiful buildings, very Gothic and romantic.
Amazing. Beautiful in day and night. So much history. Worth doing a city tour with a guide. So many nice stores around also

Magical Place do not miss !!. Visited over Christmas and it was magical and romantic. One of the most beautiful places I have ever seen. If you visit Prague do not miss a trip here you will be missing out. The place is steeped in history and local culture. Highly recommend !!
Must visit in Prague. Great area to walk around; really provides a great feel of the beautiful city of Prague. Many attractions are within walking distance of the old town square.

Interesting. This is a lovely old square that has a variety of different old buildings including the astronomical clock. From this square you can venture off to the Jewish Quarter, Wencelas square, Charles bridge and other interesting places. It is a nice place to rest your feet after sightseeing and walking on the cobblestones.

Worth a morning Visit. The old town is a fun stroll when the crowd is not large, I.e., in the morning. Once you have hundreds of people milling around to take a photo of the astronomical clock, it can be a bit much.The best parts of old town were stumbling onto a lovely, very large crystal store ( Erpet) and an even lovelier young model doing a nude street shooting.

Go see it, then get out. Way too crowded, especially on a hot day. Go in, see the astronomical clock (which is pretty amazing, but you really don't need to see it ring as that's extremely underwhelming) and get out.
Fantastic Old Town. The old town is fantastic with great architecture and lost of street performers, the only down side is it can be very crowded at peak times

old magic in Prague. Prague old town is very special with mixture of feeling, ideas, places as history walk thourgh without mercy....some places old town are so busy with tourists, but smaller hidden streets, old houses, shortcuts are very nice and different from usual sites...make sure to have clever local with you, without insights informations old houses are just another old buildings, but if you know more it start to make sense...do you know there are some real water spring in Prague ? can you imagibe another capital with crystal clear water spring ? Have a good time !

Beautiful and Historic. Such rich history and beauty. In a small area, so easy to walk around and seen many beautiful buildings, but a sea of tourists. Not surprising because it is so beautiful, but Prague old town in July is full of tourists. Give yourself ample time to explore and bring a map because you will get lost on the side streets.
Charming. There are so many pretty historic buildings! Get a guide book to know what is what. There are some interesting stories attached to the building. Great place to have a walk

Fascinating Place. Prague is a place of endless architectural beauty. Street after street is a marvel of large, well constructed and designed buildings that all work together. The Old Town is a place that, without a guide, you'd miss so much detail as you wander through.As with all tourist areas, there are numerous stalls and shops selling souvenir tat and food, but there are gems hidden in those places. Don't stop at the first place you come to, explore. Go down the side streets, have a look at what's around the next corner. You'll find some great little places that the bigger, attention-grabbing places steal you away from. We learned this early on during our holiday.I recommend a walking guide if you're fit and able. They show you so much, point out the subtle details and the marvellous history of the towns that make up the heart of Prague. The Charles Bridge is a whole story in itself. Go early if you want to catch it at it's uncrowded best. By the afternoon, it is jammed packed with tourists and sellers alike. An efficient transport system links the various areas of Prague, so everything is within easy reach. Though even on foot, the old town is not that long to walk its length, but all of the interesting places in between is what slows you down. If you like towns with a rich history, great architecture, unique places to explore then you wont be disappointed here.
Beatiful. I went in peak season, but it didn't matter, the place is magical!Best time to take good pictures is early in the morning when there is less tourist entering your way and taking selfies.

Where everything happens. On a summer night this is the place to be to see the street acts and all the people and the clock, and to sit and drink in one of the cafes lining in the square . What do yourself a favor and eat off the beaten track a bit the restaurants here while adequate are overpriced and crowded
Unique town. The decorative old buildings & castle, wonderful bridges & river, cafes & market all make Prague a highlight of our holiday
Hustle & bustle. Its the city meeting centre. Various tours start here (took a car tour and would recommend that)... plqce to grab a pilsner and watch the world go by... lots happening here.
Pleasant walkabout. We found shopping, a large choice of varied restaurants, and a lovey square with turreted towers, including an astrological clock.
Much to see. If you are Jewish you can go to the Jewish community service center and get free tickets to the old synagogues and ancient Jewish cemetary. Otherwise the ticket is quite pricey

Nice square but expensive to eat. The square is really nice and deserves a visit or two. In the evening there are always street artists. I wouldnt eat on the square because ist very expensive and not always that great.

Good to wander around. We went there in the evening towards the evening and were pretty tired by that time and since couldnot ëxplore the place much. Much activity happens at the centre. lots of beautiful buildings around.Recommend going in the early morning so you might get a more peaceful crowd

Medieval feeling. Visited in 2012 on a classtrip. You can't miss it when you are in Prague for vacation, and when you stand there take some time to look around you and take in the architecture and life around you. Especially nice by night/evening.

Well worth visiting. Old Town visit is a must if you are visiting Prague. We visited it three times but a visit during the night as well as during the day to enjoy the grand old architecture of the surrounding buildings is worth the visit. Although quite safe these days but it is worth keeping an eye out for pickpockets who may take advantage of crowded narrow paths. Best to only carry enough money which is required for the day and to split it in different pockets. We did not eat there as it seemed too crowded at places.

Walk and dream. You must visit and walk through the old town, enjoy the architecture, plaza, shops, curious museums, marvelous sculptures, cathedrals, clocks and history behind this. One of my favorite places in Prague. If you are having a 1 day or short visit, do not miss this place.

Busy and Great . Everyone gathers there on the hour to see the famous clock but disperse quickly once the clock has struck and you can walk around the square quite freely. Lots of restaurants but pricey because of their position. Beautiful - just like the rest of Prague.

Beautiful. The architecture is amazing and the little streets nice to have a walk and explore! Eveb though some part are very touristy, try to leave the main streets and find corners that are less crowded and even more beautiful

Astronomic Clock and the tower.. Loads of people go here to see the Astronomic Clock every hour to see the Clockwork. It's only on for a short period of time and according to me a bit overrated. BUT getting up in the Tower located in the same building is very nice. If You're in to making Pictures so is this a nice Place with great views in every direction. Got a lot of nice Pictures from here during our visit and it was Worth it. Don't forget to make shots downwards over the old Town Square.
Beautiful. Old town square is surrounded by beautiful buildings. There is lots of things to see and entertainers in the square. Beautiful little shops, and bars.

A great place to start exploring the old town. A great place to start your exploring. Prices for food and drink obviously a bit more pricy than a few streets back but a great place to people watch. The astronomical clock is located just off the square and is a must to see. If you choose the right taxi companies for your ride from the airport, you can pick up your free tour of the city from here to. A very good and knowledgeable guide who let us split our tour over two days.
Wonderful. There is just amazing, very nice pedestrian streets with wonderful buildings, full of history and like you are walking in tales
Great town. Prague is a great city with a long history, the city is large and has lots to offer. Prague is worth a visit and you could easily spend a couple a days here without getting bored.

For lovers of cobblestone streets and gorgeous buildings this is a must!. Lovely old buildings and winding cobblestone streets plus great views over the river make this a perfect area for walking. A beautiful city, with friendly locals. At times the tourist hordes can become a challenge but persevere as the city is gorgeous.
Loveky. Beautiful architecture and a wonderful atmosphere. Just spend time wandering around and soaking up the history
Very clean and historic. At height of tourist season so very crowded,but great to sit with a beer and watch the passing crowds,Prague at its best

Old Town. Beautiful area of Prague. There are many shops and Restaurants. It is super crowded (we were there mid-August) so I recommend visiting this area early in the morning if you want to get photos of the beautiful cobbled streets and great views.

Great Streets. Nice place to walk without fearing to get lost. You can walk everywhere in old town and for sure it will be nice. The streets of old town and the main square really help to make Prague an amazing city.
Well. It was very satisfying experience, the clock ticking at 12 a.m, same thing - many people, but for this attraction nothing unusual.

Best part of Prague!. Our favorite moments in Prague were spent here. Best time is early in the morning before the crowds arrive. Just walk the square taking on the amazing architecture that is all around you. Go up in the old town hall tower for the most amazing pictures of your trip!

Photo-worthy!. Lively spot in Old Prague with lots of restaurants to choose from, good for stroll in the evenings and sit by the majestic statue of Jan Hus, additionally enjoy the old astronomical clock, the old town hall and the grand 'Church of our lady'.
Awesome. Make sure to visit and walk through at different times of the day - and night. Lots to see and it has some amazing buildings.

Must see when in Prague!. The old town is full of beautiful gothic buildings with a rich history. There is a calm atmosphere even though it is mostly filled with people. Even better if you can get in a free walking tour where the guide can fill you in on the history. You have to come here if you are in Prague. Even if it's just to look at the pretty buildings.

Pack your warmest clothes for December. Get behind the old iron curtain. Prague is a wonderful city untouched by the world wars. We were there during the Christmas Market and the food and trinkets were wonderful. Bitterly cold, but worth any discomfort.

Activty Hub. this is the most happening place at any part of the day. Acts like a central radial to go to various popular spots. the plaza has popular monuments and many restaurants. the central fountain, is a good backdrop for taking selfies.
Must visit AREA. Great historical site, people are everywhere, musicians and street performers add to the charm of the amazing place.
Best cities in Europe. Prague´s Old Town is one of the most amazing places in Europe. Enjoy genius loci, bohemian atmosphere, lots of history, old narrow streets and great pint of Pilsner Urquell.

Beautiful!. Beautiful place to walk around. During evenings there is nice atmosphere. I can also recommend to wake up early and go walk around, it's surprising how empty old town is in the morning! So avoiding crowds, go early :)

Bird's eye views.. Amazing views from the top of the tower. Totally worth the hike up in the heat. There was a sign that indicated the elevator was out of service (not true), but if you take the stairs you have the opportunity to view the old images posted on the wall. The story of the history of the area is written in both Czech and English. The views in all directions make for great photos. The only frustration was the ignorance of other tourists. There is a stop light with a red (stop) or green (go) to go up the last staircase, which can only support traffic in one direction at a time. Additionally, at the top there are clear signs directing everyone to go in the same direction around the top. Ignorant tourists were oblivious to the directions for both, which caused bottlenecks. On the stairs some group has to back up, which is challenging...

Beautiful and crowded. It has the famous church with it bells ringing attracting crowds every hour,plus the square on the side has singers, musicians performing for the crowd every time till late night,there are various eating places spread all over it .A lively place all in all

Like a fairy tale. Sooooo beautiful and charming, but make sure to explore Wenslaus square and the Jewish Quarter and the old town wall and Park( can't recall name....begins with a V).all have magnificent beautiful old buildings and history!!!! love, Love Praha!!!

Old Town. I absolutely love this place!!!! It so adorable and i looks like a little disney movie, the clock tower is so beautiful and once every hour a little "show" comes on! There were so cute gift shops and there were many dolls! It was so fun to walk threw the old town but since its so hot, its kind of hard walking threw all those people.

Well worth a visit. It was very educational,enjoyable and we learned so much. Even so it was the hottest August day in Prague. Our guide was very knowledgable and helpful. The tour operator was all inclusive City Tours.
Beautiful Place to Visit. Visited here on a recent trip to Prague. Beautiful architecture and great atmosphere! Lots of bars and restaurants and plenty to see!
June 2015. This city is the mos goergeos city i never see .Every thing is so close and you can walk and taste all the beauty of this Town. I dont have words to discribed.
Good place for group of friend. Good place to hang around, very crowded. You may plan visit at Night also its quite pleasant atmosphere at night.
Ok if you're into history. Very quaint. Better shopping in Wenceslas Square but well worth a visit. Plenty of churches and old buildings and nice relaxed atmosphere.

Lots to see and do plus eat and drink.. Usual tourist trap but we weren't pestered by people trying to sell Segway tours, pub crawls, etc. Walk a few minutes away from the square and the price of beer drops dramatically.
wonderful and magical. Like a magical fantasy land. The architecture with The astronomical clock was amazing . The clock rings every hour

Must see the heart of Praha! . The most common and recognisable place in Praha. Duty to find and see - nothing more exciting and romantic than relaxing walk on old town. Hundreds places to sit and eat delicious Slavic food, drink amazing beer and buy gifts. I am personal post card maniac - so I found it my own heaven ;) atmosphere and climate of Praha is here - no matter if you visit at day or night. It's Czech 'must see!' - highly recommended to all!!

Great place but BE WARNED...... WHAT a great place.....BE WARNED...most of the exchange shops, even the large ones rip you off with exchange rates, around 27% lowest and nothing unusual with 45-50%, believe me this is very real and once you hand you money over the counter there is absolutely nothing you can do, read the rates first and change small amount first if you are unsure, the police or the government are doing nothing about this, the rates are in the small print, I was charged 40% as I did not read the small print, and people after people in one exchange shop after mother had arguments with the staff after counting their money, do not be filled by thinking it is in the square and a a large shop, a lot of them are at it

Like a Photo. Old Town is as beautiful and historic as all the pictures you have seen. We passed through the main square about a dozen times in our 5 days in Prague and it never failed to impress. Always something new to notice.
Beautiful Prague. We spent 3 days in Prague and it was just beautiful. The building are amazing. There are so many things to see and do and I would love to go back and stay longer.
Picturesque. You can't fault this picture book city. It is what it says on the tin and more. Great spectacle. Amazing old town with good shops and lots to see.
Well worth a visit. Very vibrant part of Prague. Quite crowded. Lots of shops and restaurants. weather 35 degrees no rain.

Just fabulous. Fabulous place to visit. Many restaurants, bars and cafes. People everywhere but just adds to the atmosphere. Always live music or other entertainment being played somewhere in the Square. View the Clock that does its thing on the hour. Short and sweet. Tourist shops aplenty. Join in one of the many free tours and just tip the guide at the end. Wonderful vintage cars to tour around the city, a little pricey, but wonderful. Gorgeous Cathedral and other fabulous buildings. Lots of little streets surrounding the Square to wander around.

A walk on our own through Old Town. We did the walking tour in our guide book. There were many large tour groups but we found it too hot at 93 degrees F to stick with them. Rather we enjoyed a nice respite on a bench along the river and followed streets that afforded shade.
Very cozy and romantic. Very romantic place. Vibrant and full of life. Music, tourists, restaurants and stores. Crowded but definitely you must go there.

Too many tourist "entrepreneurs".. This is one of Europes oldest towns. But this is still just a old town. Stop to see the 300 year old clock, stop to...
The old town is overflowing with tourist traps - you can´t move more than a feet in either direction without have to face a cheap tourist "entrepreneur".

What a fun place!. Not only was there much to see, including the churches, the square and the anatomical clock, but it was enjoyable just sitting in the square sipping a coffee or a beer watching the world go by. Make sure to go up the tower to see the incredible view. By the way, there is an elevator.

Beautiful, busy and a photographers paradise!. The square itself is surrounded by beautiful buildings including the famous chiming clock. Wear a good pair of shoes as the cobbles can be quite wearing on your feet! Keep your valuables close as pickpockets have easy targets when it's crowded.

Gorgeous!. We always find something new to look at when we visit Old Town Square, was beautiful for the Christmas market and lovely when people were spraying us with cold water in the heatwave last week! Be wary of some of the pushier people trying to get you to sit at the over priced bars etc right on the Square.

Stunning architecure. Stunning square to walk over the bridge and visit the town. All the buildings were so different and stunning it is easy to just walk around looking at them all. I did find the main square way to busy but that is the issue of the season not the place. I will return when it is quitter to take more in

The Heart of Prague - A Can't Miss!. If you come to Prague, of course you are going to visit Old Town. It can be crowded, but I have always felt safe. I would still secure your belongings, as this is an environment that might be ripe for pickpockets. The outside dining is very inviting, but prices are much higher here than just off the main square...venture off for better deals. Great place for live (and free) entertainment and for people watching. It is one of the most beautiful squares I have ever been to in Europe!

a sight for sore eyes.. Wonderful buildings where ever you look. Place was throbbing with people at all times. Must be there on the hour for the clock.Opted to eat or drink away from the main buzz - loads of places to choose from
romantic history. i stayed 3 days in prague, every night i go to the old towm to enjoy the lovely history and the special style coffee shops and restaurants.also very nice bars.

Wonderfull Prague. The old town of prague is certainly a delight . The resturants on the square were Reasonable and the street theatre was wondefull . The city is filled with music . We stayed in the Paris hotel , close to the city square . It is the most wonderfull art neavou Building and all the detail is retained . Wonderfull spa and coffee shop or bar . Uber iN Prague was dicey , rather regular taxis
Magical Old Town. What an amazing place that can take you many years back and make you feel as if you are living in middle centuries.

A beautiful treasure trove. Allowing ourselves to get lost in the enchanting, winding streets of Old Town was one of the highlights of Prague. There are so many hidden gems! If you're looking for amazing local cuisine at ridiculously cheap prices this is where you'll find it, I would recommend the Jewish district too. A must see, allow yourself to loose yourself and find amazing treasures!

Fabulous square. This square is lovely. Lots of lovely buildings to look at and nice shops and cafés. Absolutely love the astronomical clock and town hall. It's a very tourist area and I would advise eating else where for this reason. I tended to find that the restaurants away from tourist spots were cheaper ☺
Good times. I love Prague (Praga in my language) I felt good in that city covered with tumultous Hystori and steady present.

Don't miss the old town square, Charles bridge and the powder tower. This is a large, mostly pedestrian area with plenty of touristic spots and historical sights. I advise to plan your walking route, starting from the powder tower, following Celetná to the old town square (church of our lady before Tyn, astronomical clock), and then approach the Charles bridge and bridge tower. Conveniently, you can follow the road up to reach the castle district.
Worth a visit. The square and the surrounding streets has to be one of the most beautiful city centers in the world.

Nice square but better at night. It is a nice old square with original buildings. Lots of overpriced cafes and people hawking Segways and tours. A night it comes alive with entertainment and young people meeting there. Very crowded with tourist day and night. Nicer streets with nicer old buildings in other parts of Prague. I didn't like all the crowds of tourists.
Best square in Europe!. Beautiful square - plenty to see and do in and around Prague 1, perhaps the most historical I've visited! Would recommend a visit!

Visit early to miss the crowds. The Square gets very busy but is great early in the day when not so many people about. There was always a street entertainer to stop and enjoy and a real buzz about the place. A few stalls selling traditional Czech snacks added to the ambience.
Splendid . One of the most beautiful old town quarters in this part of the world. On par with Krakow and Vienna, perhaps even nicer !!

Beautiful. The old town is nice, clean, tidy and crowded, shops and small local markets. It's a very beautiful town, typical. People are nice and friendly, it was beautiful to stay around the old town for some days. Many people don't speak English but they are really friendly and you won't have problems. Recommended, for the famous buildings and monuments as well
charles bridge. Beautiful buildings and Charles bridge. A lot going on. Music playing everywhere and great shops for gifts

Old Town. Something for everyone.. Wandering felt like going back in time. The square though had plenty of people, plenty of entertainment and plenty of energy all surrounded by amazing buildings. Cafes, street food and markets. People watching. An amazing place.

What a way to soak up the European charm. Being here on our first visit to Europe we were able to see pretty much what Europe feels like. This area is very vibrant with the people the activities, food, historic buildings,m etc. Luckily my niece and her family who live nearby were with us to guide us. Reallly enjoyed the flavor of place.

Interesting place. Nice place with lots of cafe, restaurants, and shops. Definitely gave me a feel of getting away from modern structures. All within walking distance so please do not drive there. Instead rent a bicycle or segway if you do not want to walk. Prices of souvenir (even beer) can vary by 100% from different vendors. The only two things I do not like are 1. too many tourists (I am one of them) when I was there in July/August, 2. Inhaling second hand smoke.

Excellent for people watching and having a Budvar!. Loved the Stare Mesto. We were fortunate to stay nearby at the Buddha-Bar Hotel Prague - just far enough from the crowds for some quiet but an easy walk to the center of everything. Enjoy a Budvar and some people watching. Don't miss the astronomical clock.
Magical Square. There are a lot of people in Old Town, but if you go early in the morning, you can enjoy this place in a bit more peaceful way.

Christmas Magic. Such a beautiful square. I would recommend a vist at christmas because it is breathtakingly beautiful. There was a stage with carols, market stalls selling all sorts of food and nuts and gifts. A huge christmas tree filled the square with so many lights. The beautiful buidling decorate the outside. It was very special!
A great place to start.. Just an amazing place to walk around. Good restaurants and shopping. Music in the town square. Grab a pilsner and enjoy.
Hotel U Prince is an excellent way to enjoy a rooftop view of the square.. This was much more beautiful than I thought. The bars and restaurants were very cosmopolitan and the beers were cheap!!
Cool place. Cool cultural place, next to InterContinental Hotel. The Square in front is one of the best place for evening and relax
Great vacation. Awesome place, lots of restaurants, shops and kiosks to choose from. The Astronomical clock is a must see. Beer is not an issue here either.

Plenty to see, plenty to avoid. Like many tourist attractions around the world there is good reason why this is so popular but also a good reason to avoid the many touts and tourists which abound in the Square. Especially annoying the Segway touts.

Crowded. very very crowded. the square sits in the middle of different kinds of buildings. the clock on one side, a little park next to it. in the middle of the square, there is a statue. it is quite something to just sit there eat a sandwich and admire the different buildings and people around

Go!. a lot of historic buildings. Remnants of WWII resistance organisation next to church, Jan Hus, Adam and Eve church towers. Back to modern times with street performers, segways, bubbles, food, fun, cafés. excellent place for people watching.

Impressive architecture and very animated town center. Places to visit include Old Town Square, Astronomical Clock and the Jewish cemetery and Synagogues. The best view is from the top of the tower at the Old Town Hall. The area is very animated. There is always something to see, eat, drink, but some find it too noisy.
Thieves in Prague.. beautiful place but be aware that there are people who are ready to steal your money. be careful. Get your money from an ATM and have someone with you at all times.

Beautiful architecture. The place reminds me a lot about Barcelona's narrow streets, buildings and architecture are really beautiful. When you go few blocks away from worst tourist streets, also the prices will go down.

historic. I particularly liked the decorative features on the buildings, the colours, and the histories to each. While enjoyable strolling on my own, the guided walk certainly added depth and knowledge. But oh!!! the cobblestones. Be prepared for very sore feet, even with the best footwear, if you give the entire day over to walking, as I did.

Move off the square for a truer Prague experience. This was our third visit to Old Town Prague, and each time, I've come away with a distaste for this place. There Czechs allow an unlimited number of tourists to visit here, resulting in huge jostling crowds, many pickpockets, and very high prices. Be sure to secure your wallet and passport, and move several blocks off the square if you want a quieter, less expensive meal and to meet at least some locals.
Full of monuments. A huge open air museum. Where ever you set your eyes you see beautiful pittorescoral houses, and buildings to admire.

Visit here!. Great place to visit first of all, head straight to the square to sample the atmosphere. Loads of places to sit, have a cool beer and watch the street shows. Turn the corner and there is a range of street food to sample. Police presence in the square to keep all safe and give advice, felt very safe whether it was midday or midnight.
Must go to. An awesome mixture of Gothic and reanacance architecture, awesome place to walk and also sit at night, Have a Czech beer or some wine

A Must See. Old town has alot of building from the 1600-1800 time period. Anything older generally was faceliffted. Unlike other cities in Europe the old city was not bombed into rubble or modernized in the post communist "all the charm of a cement parking structure" style. Well worth a look around and you can get your ugly architecture fix on that wonderous tower in the new city.
Great tourist location. Beautiful area lovely for a stroll with great little shops and places to eat. Don't miss it just be careful of bags, cameras etc

Beautiful beyond description.. Stunningly Beautiful! Reasonable food and beverage prices. REALLY CHEESBALL communist holdout PAY TOILETS - The CZECH Tourist bureau really, really needs to get rid of these!!!!!!!
Beatiful. One of the most beatiful cities in the world... everything about it is charming. Also, very small and easy to get around.

Amazing old Europe architecture. Stare Mesto is definitely the top tourist area to visit in Prague. The old buildings in the old town square is a must see. There are outdoor restaurants, the astronomical clock, old Europe architecture and so on. It is somewhat similar to the old town square in Kraków Poland.

Full of history, beauty and fun!. The old town is nothing in the daylight compared to the dark. When the sun sets masses of people come out and socialise in the mesmerizing city center. Bars are opened past midnight and masses of people gather underneath the Orloj clock even past late hours. Definitely take a couple of days to stroll through the city center.

Very Crowded but a must see. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and see the beautiful buildings. Check out the astronomical clock. As others have said don't eat in this area go a little off the square.Make sure you try a Chimney -- its a kind of pastry that is hollow and open on the ends. Great fun and taste!

Prague begins from Old Town.. The old town is the first place to visit when you arrive in Prague. There are restaurants, cafes, and tour guides, so it is a good place to organize your tour while eating some food or drinks. There are various kinds of tour programs such as walking, bicycle, car, and even segway. Make sure that it fits your travel preference and compare to other service providers.
clean and good spot. Nice to sit for a drink. Very busy in august, particularly late afternoon. Very clean and a good place to people watch!

Lovely. If you are in Prague you have to get lost in the Old Town and the little streets and passages! It's perfect to spend an afternoon or morning, to have time to see and enjoy at full. The food market near the astronomical clock has a nice offer to enjoy some of the tradicional and exquisite Czech food. Walk it and taste it!
Very interesting place. We loved Old Town. It was very interesting place with many people and events. We liked musicians who sing there.

Don't spend money here. very very very crowded with tourists....one of our tour guides insisted that we not spend any money in old town square....just go a couple of blocks in either direction and save $$!!

Of course you must visit!. The square is a must see. There is plenty going on and a great spot to have a cup of coffee and relax. Of course going anywhere in Europe in August places are going to be busy (it's when all the students are out of school and people travel!!). But even when it is crowded it is worth it. Earlier in the day it tends to be less crowded if that is an issue. But a beautiful place, do not forget your camera.

Interesting place although a little crowded. Nice to come here during the day to see the clock especially at 12pm to hear the bells but also at night as it has such a nice atmosphere. There are places to eat here and it is a perfect place to take some memorable photos.

The most happening square!!. The most happening place for tourists. This is the main square in which all tourist assemble. the astronomical clock and the old town hall, are the two icons. otherwise lot of activity around. shops, cafes, street performers, horse cards, etc etc. Normally a place where one would come every day on the evening. All roads in the city center lead to this square. A must visit.

superb -but watch the scams. The history of the square is amazing and you get stunning views in every direction. The street entertainment and food stores add to the occasion, but do be careful of scams, con artists might try it on, not all notes that look like Czech crowns are, Belarus money looks similar and is basically worthless.
Best on sunrise. There are many people on August, daytime. On sunrise there were just few tourists and silence. It is wonderful.

A walk through a museum. Forget all the tourists and horrifying souvenir shops. . Walk through the small alleys watch the colorful houses. Take your time and enjoy the surrounding and a cup of coffee on one of the many small terraces.
Lovely city. Very beautiful city.. The old town is full of history. You must watch carefully every details of the architectury.

Not what I expected. Prague is so clean. after having gone to Florence (which we love) we couldn't find trash on the streets or overflowing garbage cans. The city is kept so clean. In the mornings we saw sidewalks being sprayed down and trash being cleaned up. Yes, the main square is crowded but besides the clock - which is really cool no matter how many times you watch it, this is a main artery to get to most all eateries and shopping, bridges, etc. Prague is a city not to be missed for those who love Europe

Very busy square with lots to look at. it is worth a visit to this square just to look at the clock that on the hour comes to life, so woth getting there early as just before the hour it gets very busy. There are lots of restaurants offering food of various cultures and the whole area just busses with life.Well worth a visit
Crowded but beautiful. Crowded with tourists and comparatively expensive. However, beautiful part of the city and there is alot to see!

crowded but interesting. Early "August, the square is jammed with tourist, tour groups and those wishing to make money from them.If you go on your own, read guide books that explain things, otherwise you're bound to miss out on some of the sites this area has to offer.The prices for everything one or two blocks off the square are much more reasonable and the atmosphere isn't as frenetic

Interesting Site but very crowded. Very interesting site. Buskers entertaining and the Astronomical clock. Be careful when buying the Prague Ham from the store at the square, they sell only minimum 500grams for 2 pax ! that is crazy as it is impossible to finish
Look up for great architectural details. It's a gorgeous area of town and can be quite crowded. Wear comfortable shoes and watch where you walk since sometimes, the cobblestone streets can be tricky.

Great experience but crowded. Wonderful town square surrounded with history and beautiful buildings. August is a busy time, so the crowds were large. We stepped into one of the outdoor restaurants that line the square to enjoy lunch, the music played by local performers, and people watching. Everyone happy despite the heat. I would recommend reading up in Czech and Prague history before visiting. Could only heighten the experience.
Loved it. As usual with Prague this area is always busy. There is plenty so see and do and each subsequent visit provides new happenings and entertainment. Simply wonderful
Pretty (and) Interesting. A nice place to hangout on the evenings away from the heat of day. Lot's of street theatre, fire eaters, singers. A lovely city

Amazing! . Prague is a remarkable city to travel to! It's romantic and beautiful. I stayed in Prague for 4 days and i loved it. The old town is amazing! There are many things to do and many things to buy! Me and my boyfriend want to travel in Prague again some day in the future. It's surely a place to return to!

Charming and vibrant old town. Prague old town is approached walking as for quite a distance vehicles are not allowed. Hence it is a delight to walk in the old town which is very nice and preserves the ethnic charms. The town square is vibrant with musicians playing and colourful shops selling bohemian crystals' varieties. Simply enjoying the ambience and doing window shopping can be delightful.
A fairy tale.. No need to introduce this. The center has beautiful architecture, is full of music, images and life until very late. Only beware of pickpockets.

Wander around and take lots of picture. As with much else in Prague, the best thing about this area is just to wander around and admire the architecture. It is crowded - but that's because it's worth seeing.
Beautiful but packed area.. Some amazing buildings and sights, but very bustling and slow moving in parts.Plenty of tourist traps and con artists around too. Worth seeing purely for the architecture.
Praha in summer an excellent experience. The Old Town is a definite must see in Prague. The Old Town Square has many attractions, every side street has something to see

One of the places to see in Prague. This is a small but a great square. Too crowded and sometimes hard to walk or take photos. Avoid visiting there on weekends if you can or go early in the morning.there are many, restaurants and coffee shops as well. charles bridge is very close to this location too.

Old Town best appreciated before 10 AM before everyone throngs the place Nd you can't move.. Way too touristy. A seemingly count of a million tourists at one time is not appealing to us. We went one block away on any side to quieter streets.

Exciting and most cosmopolitan. More people than you could ever imagine and more food available then you could have eat this is the place you must to go for the entire afternoon to enjoy street musicians and the worlds only working astronomical tower as well as a clear depiction of religion and its history as well as its effect on this area with the memorial to Jan Hus and the beautiful Mary Mother of God Church right next door this is a must see

Simply amazing. It is one of the most beautiful city center I have ever seen! With its coloured palaces and the antique clock, it is a pearl of Europe!I only recommend to go to Prague in a possible less crowded time.

Should be your first port of call.. This is the beating heart of Prague,it's were every tourist make's a beeline too,there is just so much to do and so much to see,i've been going to this wonderful,magical city for 20+ year's and the old town alway's throw's something new up.The Old Town Square is magical,especially at night,busy vibrant and alive with activity.Pub's,bar's and restaurant's to suit all taste's and pocket's.The street's around the old town are a maze,again you will find lot's of establishment's for eating and drinking from traditional Czech tavern's to Irish,German and American bar's and pub's,all manner of fast food outlet's and plenty of shop's from top end retail store's to souvenier shop's,there's everything for everyone.The building are stunning,it your a keen photographer you will be amazed at the amount of shot's you take.Street performer's,hawker's selling everything you could imagine .The crowd's here are huge,it's the main tourist route so be on your guard a bit as were there are crowd's there are pickpocket's so just your common sense.Dont buy any money off people selling it on the street's it's illegal and the money is fake;saying this Prague is one of the safest citie's in the world and you will have a great time here.We are back again next July and will be in the old town every night as it is that good.

Perfect time to visit?WINTER. I was there in winter time, around Xmas. Its awesome place to be at Xmas. You will feel like a you in fairy tales. if you haven't been here then you haven't been in Prague. Also I'd like to recommend you to get an apple cider, which will warm you up. Definitely taste that apple cider, you won't taste it anywhere else.
Picturesque. A beautiful place, lovely architecture but the main streets can be extremely crowded. Lots of lovely side streets to explore in the vicinity that are nowhere near as busy.

Wonderful Old Town. Amazing Baroque fronts hide even older buildings. See the Astronomical clock and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere in the Old Town Square. Walk around the Jewish Quarter and visit the very moving memorial to the Jews who were sent to Terezin in World War Two and the old Jewish cemetery with its haphazard grave stones leaning at all angles. Travel on the Ecotrain up to the Castle, or have a romantic ride in a horse and carriage.
worth the trip. Plenty to see and do there was a jazz weekend on in the old town with bands playing all day. Lovely and bars and restaurants plenty of cuisine to choose from.

Hive of Activity. This Square has everything and at all times of the day, entertainers seem to have different time slots for their activities, plenty of bars and restaurants to watch the activities and of course the Astronomical clock

One of the most beautiful squares in Europe.... A must visit. One of the most beautiful squares in Europe. The astronomical clock, although a bit touristy, is nice. The area is bustling with tourists.

This place will amaze your senses!!. You feel like you are living in a different time in history or have stepped onto a movie set here. Charm abounds and the architecture is the interesting, beautiful and amazing. I see why it would be called the Venice of the north. Loved it. You cannot be disappointed here - unless you go to Starbucks. Do not go to Starbucks. Go to a local restaurant and enjoy the inexpensive beer and wine and the delicious local cuisine.

The heart of Prague. A lovely area with many attractions mentioned in other places. Don't limit yourself to here, go the Castle and the Jewish Quarter as well. This is the heart of Prague that tourists want to see

Best old town in Europe. Prague old town is one of the best in Europe. It's so unique and there's nothing like it anywhere else. The colorful building, Bohemian style architecture and majestic main square is worthy to explore in two days.
You simply have to be there. Wonderful architecture everywhere you look. Have to remember to keep looking up! Busy but good atmosphere.

Enerolina melendez. Very nice place to visit ❤️ music,people , restaurants , specially la bodeguita del barrio is fantastic . Food was great and I dance Spanish music . I tray Prague food ( gulah) and I like it

Amazing!. So much to see, so much character. Architecturally beautiful. Entertainment by buskers brings forth an ambience of pleasantry and variety. Plenty of shopping and restaurants. Definitely worth a visit.

Must-go place in Prague.. A beautiful place. The Hub of the Old Town, with beautiful buildings, restaurants, street performers etc. A super spot for sitting over a meal, or a drink and people watching. Great atmosphere, though absolutely buzzing with tourists as the famous Astronomical Clock is at one corner.
tourist centre. Beautiful part of Prag with a touristy vibe. Take some time to watch people and suck in the atmosphere. If you like it more quiet this is not your kind of location.

Essential and entertaining. There's something extraordinary about this square. It's quite beautiful. Eat a slab of ham and potato, it cost us 700K for 2 including beers, a bit decadent for what it is but it tastes great and it's a memory too. Lots of buskers and Segway ride persuaders. Don't miss it on your visit.
Pretty as a picture.. Our first port of call was the old town and square. As it is Summer holidays it was heaving with people. The architecture is stunning and it looks straight out of a postcard.
Interesting meeting point. I loved Old Town in Prague, there was always something going on! Definitely worth a visit, even if just passing through.
Perfect weekend. One of my favourite places in Europe! Feel the history and magical atmosphere of this exceptional city.

Tourists, restaraunts, beautiful buildings.. Busy but great, at night if you're young expect to hassled to go on pub crawls (which are fun), to by drugs or go to strip clubs but the hustle isn't to hard and it doesn't detract from the amazing scenery and restaurants definitely worth a look.

Beautiful at night!. What a wonderful part of the city with music, mimes and beauty everywhere. If you are wondering why the castle is better lit than the surrounding wall, then you have th Rolling Stones to thank for that! When they came to play there, they offered the use of their lighting experts to revamp the lighting to make it more appealing.

Fantastic place. Worth visit here
Just many many visitors here also especially tours
Actually not easy to take a photos alone ,must have many others visitors as background
As a whole ,worth to visit here

All in walking distance - very nice but can be very crowded. Nice walk through old streets and buildings, many places to eat and drink good beer. It can be very crowded so keep in the group, otherwise bring a stick with little flag attached.
Touristy but amusing.. Lots of fun touristy stuff to look at and buy. A bit too many tourists, but it's to be expected. Overall, a nice place to walk around.

Excellent Trip. Absolutely beautiful place to visit. Lots of people go I. Wi get for the Christmas markets but I don't believe you can see the full beauty of the place as in the summer you have the sun, it's more comfortable, easy to walk around with lighter clothing and you can eat and drink outside in the beautiful restaurants which are multiple!
Short break with friends. Perfect!!!!!loved every moment of this trip even though it was only a few days...the history,beauty friendliness of this city is amazing.

Welcome in the "old times" .... An abolutely must to see, if You will visit Prague. Don´t forget also the St. Jacobs church - nearby the Old Town square. On the right side beside the enter You can see a hanging hand - the thief's hand cut off by the Prague Old town executioner, because of that stole in the church .:-)

Prague old town square. Very attractive place in old town Prague, surrounded by a lot of nice stores and restaurants, Jewish Square is around the corner, 10 mins walk to the Charlie Bridge. real hub to various attractions.
lovely. Really liked old town square. Lovely eating places in the square and all the surrounding streets. Some lovely shops in this area too. Much more authentic than Wenceslas Square

Bustling city - but take your walking shoes!. Great old town, but extremely busy! Recommend climbing Tower at Old Town end of Charles Bridge, also visiting Old Town at night if not staying there. View of Prague Castle at night from Charles Bridge excellent,

Fun for people watching. Fun and beautiful area. Good restaurants, bars and crowds. Enjoy the experience. take time to see the clock and the John Hus memorial as well as walk down the street with the top end shops (Rolex, Prada, etc) nearby
Great Place. Amazing place, we had a time of our life! We will be back for sure. Food is unbelievable. People are very friendly and helpful

Beautiful, buzzing heart of Prague.. The heart of Prague. One of the largest old towns in Europe, a maze of streets full of lots of interesting (if tourist oriented) things. Definitely a "must see" not just for Prague but for all of Europe. The only downside, is that it tends to be crammed full of people - on foot, on bikes, on segways - from morning until very late at night. This is not somewhere to go to be alone.

Wonderful square. Full of old buildings of all shapes, colours and sizes this is the reason you came to Prague to see this kind of beautiful scenery! Also there are free walking tours all around to be had which I believe start at around 10A.M if you wish to know the history.

Old Town but Quite hip!. I really enjoy street artists and this was the best kickstart to our tour. We started at the astronomical clock and while you may think that its not worth watching it, knowing the history, the story and the beauty of the clock is an experience in itself. We watched the clock strike the hour and then ended up at the square where there were a lot of people performing, food to be had (at tourist prices of course) but it could just as easily have been a fun evening without spending a penny! My recommendation, spend sometime one afternoon and then possibly come back in the evening !
Highlight of Prague. Awesome place not to be missed. There is so much to see and do that your senses will go in a tizzy. Do choose a tour guide to show you around!

Get lost in old world charm. The old town of Prague had this ancient and evocative feel to it. From the tourist highlights (clock tower) to getting lost in the windy streets, the old town is a place where you can get literally and metaphorically lost, and love every second of it.
lively. it was a very pleasing experience to be around so many people and have so much going all around you all the time.
so much to see. popular at all times of day - particularly we enjoyed in the evening when lit up and entertainment in the square - nice atmosphere

Very nice historical place. I enjoyed it with my family. It is one of the enjoyable places all over city centers in Europe. Many activities and photo scenes. People from all over the world. Street shows from everywhere! Variety of restaurants and cafés.
Fun in Old Town. We always managed to end up in this area. It's great for entertainment and photos here turn out fabulously. Most things to do in Prague connect directly to this area. Have fun!
Great shopping. this area- from the Charles Bridge to the Old Town Square has almost every imaginable shop- but you need to check prices as there is considerable variability.

Wonderful ambience. Again, the Medieval architecture is the amongst the best to be found in central Europe. A must if you're there. The square features various architectural styles including the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn, it has been the main church of this part of the city since the 14th century, the church's towers are 80 m high

Visit offpeak. Lovely area but in the summer plan to go offpeak hours since the alleyways and even large squares fill with people making it difficult to move forward or to see anything. Early morning best since light but late evening lovely too.

Magical Place. Must be one of the finest town squares anywhere in the world. The eclectic mix of architecture, now electrified by restaurants, bars, street stalls gives this place an atmosphere to revel in. I would NOT avoid the crowds but join them in their enjoyment of this unique town square: first revel in its sights, then wander around twice to take it all in and then relax at a nearby restaurant for a fine meal. After all that disappear into one of the little side streets like Dlhoua or Karlova and indulge in some senseless shopping! Do it again a couple of days later--you won't regret it.

Historically and aesthetically beautiful. Beautiful but busy with tourists and the restaurants are over priced. The free tour starts from around here but definitely worth a visit and a wander around if you don't have the 3-4 hours it takes to see everything.
Wear comfortable shoes!. Great architecture, excellent cafes and restaurants. Can be a bit crowded but plenty of places to sit down.
Magical and romantic location. We enjoyed our stay here in the evening. It was really romantic and almost magical at night. Especially walking the small streets on the cobblestones.
Lovely but always packed. This is a lovely square with shops and restaurants on all sides - and no all of them were tourist traps. there is plenty of street entertainment as well. It has a real buzz.

Good for people watching. We went with very hot weather and enjoyed seeing all the people from across the world visiting. I liked the jazz bands that seemed to constantly be playing, and the great view of the Kafka museum across the water.

The most beautiful part of the city.. This is a must-see. On the market there are several performances of all kinds of artists. Stay away from the restaurants and café's here because they are all tourist traps. The best food you can find behind the astronomical clock in the food stalls. They have very good Prague Sausage and Ham.

Historical Area. Beautiful atmosphere whilst adding a very historical and cultural feeling. Street vendors do sell food and drinks, including dumplings, goulash and so on ... Also Hop On - Hop Off also provide walking tours in the old town.

Old Town of Prague has its own charm. We had great fun going into this small old town with lots and lots of small shops and restaurants. Any restaurant is just full of people , each one of them enjoying the drink and the food. Delicious dishes to eat and absolutely fun place.

I love this city. It is the beautiful city in the world, my girlfriend and I have 2 days trip stay in Prague. We both missed this city. We think 2 days were not enough to stay! Nice view, nice people and lovely food. It is good to walk on the street and have a break at the square!

Beautiful in the sunshine.. Visited the area mid September and it was perfect. Glorious sunshine but not too hot. The place is really picturesque. Not sure how it would look in the snow but probably much the same.
A must visit location. A lovley square ,the clock is a must see, (be there on the hour) lots going on,plenty shops,&places to eat. There are entertainers there
People Watching. Another place to grab a coffee, hear and watch the performance in the clock tower, have a pastry, shop, watch the world go by....

Crowds, crowds, crowds!. Packed with tourists and huge tours. Go early as it gets shoulder to shoulder crowded, especially at the on the hour clock display. Touring the town square is clearly a competative and contact sport!
History at every turn. Prague is a beautiful city and a joy to explore. Its very clean and although rated highly as a stag and hen city we saw very llittle of it
Must se!. Downton, really crowded, but essencial to visit! There are lots of walking tours with really cheap price :)

Historical Old Town. Old town offers the history that I expected in our European adventure. I stood in the plaza with my head on a swivel to capture as much history as possible.
