The buildings were pre WW II, not reconstructions. The entertainment was interesting and kept the crowd involved. There were many choices for food with different prices to choose from. Old Town should definitely be a destination stop!

Stunning, beautiful...but expensive!. A beautiful part of the city with lots to see! However, does get very busy and the restaurants, bars and outside food vendors will charge you the earth. Be prepared!

Bring your comfy shoes!. So much to see in this beautiful area of Prague. Around each corner is something new and wonderful. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes as all areas are cobbled. Sit in the old town square and watch the world go by.
Visit Old Town Prague. A city with various different sites to visit in small area Churches, historical buildings, towers to climb, restaurants and shops
Charming and romantic city centre.. Full of restaurants, lovely architecture, good beer, charming christmas markets. You better change your cash for Czech koruna.
Heart of Prague. Very attractive by day and by night. Always crowdy, nice restaurants and monuments. We visited the square every evening of our stay.

Old Town Square has something for everyone. Old Town Square has a lively vibrant atmosphere and is a good place to admire the architecture, watch street performers or see the world go by. The architecture is stunning and as someone who does not spend alot of time looking at buildings - that's saying something. Time flies by as you get caught up in the moment. It can get busy but never over crowded. Old Town Square is also centrally located as a hub to walk to other attractions.

Old Prague... something is lost when something is gained!. You can't go to Prague without going to the Old Town Suare. But it's teaming with tourists and commercialism, like most of the old city areas. Franchise shops and god, if I saw another garnet jewellery shop, I would have screamed...Agghhh! At the risk of contradicting myself, go to Charles Bridge (many tourists) and you can buy great local cafts there... no Russion dolls,Thai massage joints or McFried food. Better still, if you want to see some amazing art deco residential architcture, wander up to Zizkov, just behind the train station and have a look at the top of the Park. There's hardly a sole around - although we did see a man taking his Mountain Lion for a walk... on a robust leash, of course.

a must see. If you're in Prague Old Town is a must. Beautiful architecture, great restaurants, nearby shopping (plus shops on the square) and friendly people. This place is especially spectacular in the late fall just before Christmas!
A must see!. So many different things to see in a small area!! Churches, historical buildings, towers to climb, restaurants and shops!
Like a fairytale!. Wonderful place. Interesting history and the buildings surroinding the old square has a interestinge range of different architecture and history. Love it!

You will find yourself drawn back to here. The astrological clock is the big draw but it is a great stop for lunch or dinner or just a place to sit, have a drink and people watch. There are cafes surrounding the square with outdoor seating as well as food kiosks with a variety of choices at reasonable prices.Remember that the cobblestones in Prague are among the most uneven in Europe so have sturdy shoes that will have a grip should it rain.

The must attraction to visit when you in Prague. This is definitely the most famous area in prague. Whole day you will find a lot of tourists here. Lots of restaurants and pubs near by. You can do all the shopping you want here. Best thing to do is to stay nearby so you avoid walking a lot to your hotel.

Prague the architectural jewel. Prague discovery was a fortuitous fluke for me, an unintended trip that was tantamount to a trip to proverbial paradise. The abound medieval monuments, cobble stone Alleys, eclectic bridges with breath taking adornments and the reflection of the architectural treasures in the Vltava river all left me with an indelible impression about this unforgettable destination. There is absolutely nothing austere, chichi or garish about the Old Town and the lesser town quarters, perhaps a well deserved credit to a propitious and highly revered king Charles IV of the 14th century who is responsible for these resounding aesthetics. The main tourist attractions are concentrated in the Old Town, New Town and the Lesser Town districts all in walking distances. We started our journey from the famous Powder Tower the 15th century gate to Prague, into Old Town square then to Charles Bridge over to Lesser Town and visited many historical sites such as “Tyn Church”, City hall and the astronomical clock, Charles Bridge, St Nicholas Church, Lennon wall, Kampa Island and much more that I can enumerate in this review. A half day visit to Prague Castle (the largest castle according the Guinness Book) in Lesser Town is a MUST, hence please DO NOT leave Prague without this experience. In the evening we visited the amazing Wenceslas Blvd in New Town, a conflation of medieval, Art Nouveau and modern structures interspersed with plenty of shops, restaurants, bars and night clubs (please refrain going into side streets if brothels doesn’t stroke your fancy). For shopping opportunities certainly visit Depo Hostivař shopping outlet (there were plenty of brands often on sale with 60% to 90% OFF), OC Chodov (the exchange Venue here offers highly competitive rates), OC Letňany all accessible by city railway system (metro). If you prefer to shop in the tourist districts the Palladium shopping Mall is in walking distance in New Town in addition to all the souvenir shops around. If you are looking for Rodeo drive or Champs-Elysees kind of shopping expedition, please visit the Parizska Street in the Old Town and while there swing over to the Metronome Park ONLY steps away and visit the giant metronome and get a breath of fresh air. The Czech Republic is known for its Bohemian Crystals; the most top rated brands are “Blue” and “Moser” crystals that can be found around the Old Town Square. The out of town excursion to the Crystal factory can also be a unique experience. Certainly, an evening visit to the lovely “Folklore Garden” for an unforgettable experience of folklore dance, music, full course dinner and all you can drink (beer, wine and soft drinks) should be part of the itinerary. Please be very vigilant of pickpocketting in crowded areas. Currency exchange can be challenging at times, in order to avoid duplicitous and fraudulent situations, always ask them to write the exact final amount of the transaction prior exchanging. Some vendors might try to ream the customer in cash transactions, so counting the returned change before the clerk at the register is highly advised for the accuracy. And finally, GOOD LUCK to you for being smart to choose this destination.
Restraunt. The restraunt around the square was nice. It felt very comfy with lots of blankets. The thing that annoyed me was that insects kept coming.
the buzz in square. absolutely amazing architecture the old clock on tower is a fine piece of historic past the square has lots of good restaurants ,the atmosphere in square is great

City break. The old town square is absolutely buzzing and lively. You will come across a variety of performers from musicians, magicians, puppeteers etc that are quirky and enjoyable! You could spend the whole day just sat there and marvel at these performers. Also, just across from the square is the famous astronomical clock that attracts hundreds of visitors. It is a gem of a clock and oldest working astronomical clock so a visit is a must. You can also climb up the stairs and get a great view of Prague from top. There are cafes and restaurants where you can just sit n chill out
Must see it once in your life at least.. Everything, charming, stunning architecture, people, restaurants, shopping ... everything is a must-do.

Crowdy but cosy. Excellent please. Feels like the living room of Prague. Clean pedestrian area. Big square with nicely renovated buildings and fine restaurants. Looks great in the morning, day and evening. On the west side of the square there were some stands with local grilled snacks!! Lots of live musicians and other street performers. Crowdy, when tourist groups will see the astronomical clock acting on the hour.

360° of spectacular. Words can't do it justice. Nor pictures, articles or stories. You have to walk old town square yourself to experience its panorama of immense historical and cultural significance. That's all I have to say about that.

Perfect little pedestrian area!. The apartment we rented in Prague was located in Old Town so we walked through the square virtually every day during our stay. It seems there was something for everyone here...street performers, restaurants, bars, souvenir shops, higher end stores selling crystal, trdelnik pastries (which we found are actually a dessert originating from Hungary not Czech! - it didn't matter though..they were fantastic)! Be careful on the cobblestone streets and wear appropriate shoes! We got so busy taking in our surroundings that sometimes we weren't paying attention to the street. On the weekend in July, the square was swarming with people/tourists!

Fun and busy place!. Fun, busy place! Lots of restaurants, street performers, etc. meeting spot for walking tours. Recommend walking through but do your eating/shopping/drinking down one of the numerous side streets to save $$!! Visit MOONLIGHT Souvenir Shop at about 824 Zelezna. Very reasonable prices and VERY nice, honest shopkeeper!!
did the walking tour awesome. loved the tour guide very knowledgable he really loved his job and you could tell Charles street bridge is not to be missed

Beautiful city with 800 Yr old buildings. Wow. I have seen most of Europe and still places take my breath away. The only thing that deterred were the amount of tourists and people. The cobble stone streets lined with pleasant artists and vendors, the old historic buildings mixed with the new to the clock tower, churches and the piazza's the city is just a gem. Cross over the bridge and view the castle and take in the magnificent views. Cafes and restaurants are plentiful and make sure to try some gelato from the vendors. We had a guided tour which was great as we learned of the history of the city so I found it well worth it. This is a beautiful place to visit and friendly people and plentifulHistory.

Lovely Old Town. Old town square is a very lively square, it gives the town the spirit of youth where people assemble every day and night to hear music, sing, dance and enjoy a meal in the surrounding areas. The astronomical clock and church of our lady before Tyn give this square her charm and distinction, I advise all people visiting Prague to not miss a night in its charming ambience.
Colourful!. great atmosphere! Full of life and people, something different happening all the time, buzzing with activity and colour

Don't miss it!. We've visited town squares in many European countries and found none more colorful and entertaining than this! Eating, shopping or site seeing - you've got it all. Music and mines are part of the scene too. It's an overload to the senses for those looking for tranquility but heaven for the fun seekers!

Great atmosphere at dusk. This is a place to visit before night fall. The place comes abuzz with locals and tourists alike with most sitting on the square sharing tales, guitar strumming and street entertainment. The surrounding eateries are quite tasteless - avoid.. find a restaurant around the cobbled streets.. far better taste.

Quite vibby and exciting!. Once you get there you'd know it! People seem to come out of the wood, and evertyone's happy and snapping away at their cameras. The views from atop the square are magnificent, and shopping for crystal is so fun! Definitely the ost enjoyable part of my visit. Food and beer throufghout the surrounding areas are excellent!

Reviisiting after a decade. Returned for a four day visit to Prague after ten years. I loved it all those years ago. One could argue that my older age was a factor in my loss of love for the city but I'm not sure. I found the city so over commercialised and in ways, it seems, to have sold it's soul to the old devil that is Tourism. It may be incorrect but I read an article that said Prague was the most visited city in Europe and I don't think this is positive thing for the people who live there nor for the curious traveller. There are only so many souvenir shops filled with tat that one can bear. There are only so many terrible and overpriced cafes and restaurants that one can stomach. The city of hotels, hostels, rentals and weekenders has turned what was once one of my favourite places of all times into a caricature of it's former self. What a shame.
Just beautiful!. Very lively, with something different and fun around every corner. Whether it's a Thai massage, a tour by bus, foot or Segway, I absolutely loved Prague. I will definitely be back!
excellent. The Old Town is very nice everywhere many people everything is perfectly organized no clashes anywhere and I never noticed even a single policeman!!

Nice atmosphere in evening. If you have decided to stay out in the evening, you should visit Old town. It has it's own magic and if you are lucky and evening is really warm, you can image you are waling in the hot streets in Italy or other old, beautiful city...

A great experience.. Pros
+ A lot of pedestrian-only areas
+ A wealth of museums to go to
+ Many restaurants to visit
+ Bustling with tourists
+ Lots of places to try the delicious Trdelnik
Cons
- Prague isn't famous for it's food...
- Not many roads for cars

A great piece of history. This was a lovely place to stroll around and take in all the sights. The buildings are so picturesque you feel like you're looking at a movie set or a little doll's house. You can take walking tours but even just a stroll is good. Recommended.
Lovely to sit and watch the world go by. a square in a fairy tale setting with entertainers and places around to eat or just partake in a beer or a glass of wine

Great place to get a feel for Old Europe!. This is the most pleasant and walkable historic area of any city that I have visited in Europe. Much of Old Town is zoned for pedestrians, making the experience even more pleasant. Shopping and restaurants are in abundance.

Great ambiance!. Great place to visit, with a great ambiance! Many attractions are in the old town: astronomical clock tower, St James church, church of our lady before Tyn, and the public place itself. The whole place is worth visiting during at least half a day!

Atmosphere is everything - and the Old Town is sans pareil.. Take your time - while there are scads of shops and cafés, this is all about the history, the architecture, and the atmosphere. Even more than Paris, this is a place to grab a beer, a meal, and just wander around and watch. Best done off-season, but still worth it.

Unique. The area where all kinds of people and tourists meet, some to just stroll and enjoy the beautiful old buildings, their architecture and uniqueness. The square is spacious and one can just sit, eat in the nearby restaurants or just listen to different kinds of street musicians. Alive during day and night.

Old Town that is really old. Not many new or reconstructed buildings here. All that you see is old as in original...
A great place for strolling, window shopping, and dining.
I loved the feel of the whole place. Watch out for street performances on weekends.

Worth a visit. A very busy part of Prague and one that everyone goes to. The other side of the river is much prettier in my opinion, however this is fun and nice to visit during the week. Weekends are very crowded

unique architecture at the heart of Prague. If you visit Prague you will arrive at the old town at one point or another. that's the heart of the touristic area of Prague and home to the most beautiful architecture in the country. one tip for you guys - look up! the buildings are gorgeous, while the shops are touristic shops that sells rubbish. so just look up at the buildings and enjoy the unique architecture that this area has to offer :)

Magical atmosphere. One of the main highlights of my visit -- I came back everyday at least to simply pass through and enjoy the marvelous, chilled out energy as well as the stunningly beautiful architecture. It is especially nice at dusk as the crowds become a bit less intense and the night pub crawlers haven't yet taken to the streets. Musicians and performing artists of many different types add to the charm. Just plain wonderful ...

One of the best refurbished / preserved city centers.. Every building has something special, when you look at it, takes you to travel back in time and imagine you were there when other people were living there. These buildings breathe history and that makes you special since you are there, visiting, taking pictures, being part of history.
Very nice. Don't go by car, there's no place to park. You can do everything walking. Very nice city. 2 days are enough though
Stunning architecture. Anywhere you walk you are surrounded by fabulous architecture. The detail is unmatched anywhere I've ever been.
Just take it all in.. Fabulous just to stroll around during the day or in the evening. Nice restaurants ans entertainment in main square.

Unique in Western Europe. unlike many major European cities, Prague was not bombed in WWII; consequently, it's historical character is largely in tact. It is a beautiful city with a deep and fascinating history. Take the Naked Tour while you are there--small, personal, informative

Main reason for visiting!. I signed up for one of the hop-on/hop-off bus tours, and to be honest, most of the stops did not seem very special or unique. However, once the bus stopped at Old Town, it made the trip worthwhile. This area just seemed so magical, with the colourful buildings, impressive fountains and clock tower, and everyone seeming so happy to be there. Since this was a hot day, there was a truck that sprinkled water over people, and this gave a sense of fun to the whole experience. There are many restaurants, souvenir shops, and ice cream shops in this area, so there's a ways to spend your time. There are also benches scattered around in case you want to rest and watch the entertainment, which includes dancing and bubble-making. Take the time to explore this area as even the shop windows are interesting! I wish I had room in my suitcase for some of the glassware as they were definitely beautiful.

lovely and lots of entertainment. the buildings in the old town square are fabulous, the restaurants a bit more expensive but great place to sit and watch the world go by. lots of street entertainers.

Old town - scenic and nostalgic. It's really cool, reminds me of Florence. Lots of old buildings and the town center, cobble stoned roads. Very scenic. But typical of the height of summer, it was totally swarmed with tourists! But that's the way it is in most everywhere in Europe. Things are not as expensive I felt compared to most of the rest of Europe.

Beautiful buildings, magical city. If you stay in a Hotel in the centre of Prague, you will not need any public transport as you can visit everywhere by foot. I loved the city, buildings are really nice, everywhere was so cosy and full of history, we had an amazing time. I will add some pictures but I have more in my travel blog where you could have a look of all the places we went to see during our stay in Prague www.travelera.es

Beautiful, Must see. Charles Bridge connects the Lesser Town with Old town and is a must see and must visit attraction. The bridge is packed with tourists and vendors selling paintings and souvenirs amongst other things. The atmosphere is vibrant and full of hustle and bustle with great views of the castle and the river.
magic place. just like it sounds... a magical place, beautiful buildings, awesome squares, fantastic landscapes... just like a dream!unforgetable

Have a break. After walking beside Vltava river , passing by Charles bridge.. I walked until I found the intercontinental Hotel, then turned right walking through all this fancy clothes shops.At the end I reached the beautiful old town square.Take your time there do not rush.Have a look at the historical watch every hour.to see the simple but fascinating show.Enjoy eating from the Kiosks there. I tried Chocolate crepe and it was good.

amazing. Prague is like a Fairy tail, architecture is very diverse, yet intact.Untouched, charming, very nice people, full of history, memorials and of course the astrological clock, created before Columbus discover America!!!!!!.Saint Charles bridge is a master piece, ALL COMBINE WITH A LOT, A LOT OF PEOPLE, prepared yourself and ENJOY IT IS GREAT!
Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful cities I will ever visit. I can't fault the beauty of this city, even the 'boring' areas like New Town are pretty.
Wonderful. Take a walk through this beautiful town with its little cobbled back streets and you will not be disappointed

OMG so love this place. It's like being in another world, so, so pretty. There is an abundance of traditional architecture - horray, thank god no-one has been in and destroyed it. Lot's of delicious restaurants, most have menus in English, if not ask as the Czechs are really friendly. We dined out at every opportunity, the Czech food is very rich but truely scrumptious. We particularly enjoyed the food in the restaurant opposite the clock and the tiny (you could almost miss it) cafe/restaurant at the end of the square. There are lots of interesting cobbled side streets and we explored everywhere even came accross the exclusive 'Bond Street' area with security doors and no prices in the windows! I could go on forever...love Prague and will go back soon before the place is ruined too much more by commercialism.
Go for a walk. Lovely city, perfect for taking a walk. A lot of nice houses. The style is very impressive... an of course: a lot of nice bars!

Amazing!. Many, many times in Prague, but always amazed with this beautiful city! Old Town is fantastic, great food, relatively inexpensive.
Friendly people, always lots of things to do!

Lovely old town with holiday vibe. Beautiful architecture. We were there around New Year, there was a Christmas market in the old town with many places selling mulled wine, roasted chestnuts, hot cocoa etc. We visited many interesting museums in the center- Museum of Vax figures, Sex Machines Museum, Torture Museum, Chocolate Museum etc.

do stop and stare in stare mesto. second visit to Prague, and still plenty to see, things we missed the first time. charming restaurants and friendly people, architecture is outstanding and churches worth a look. As all things times are changing but the whole area still is very charming
Perfect Place to People Watch. Spent a couple of lunches in the square side restaurants enjoying good food and beer while people watching. The sidewalk entertainers are very good.
Beautiful. very beautiful, buildings are old, colorful and beautiful. One of the most beautiful cities I've been to

Beautiful Walks...everywhere. Old Town is like a dream fairy land. So many beautiful buildings everywhere. Great place to get wander and get lost. But it is small so you won't be too lost. Worth a visit. Stop anyplace to have a beer or drink at a cafe.

Lovely Old Town. A fine city to stroll around and enjoy the beautiful architecture, buildings, bridges, cathedral, castle and river.
There is quite a lot to see and visit which can be covered on foot over the three days. There are plenty of fine eat houses in most beautiful buildings.
A super city not to be missed

Restaurants expensive. They take you for granted and the service is so and so!
Food is ok
The waiters are very in a hurry .
Must see place on Prague
great features. very old worldly and full of life in all its guises.All manner of shops,bars and eating places.Winding narrow streets and hidden enclaves.

Full of life. Beautiful area, full of life and activity.
A must if you are in Prague on vacation.
Beautiful buildings.

Carol Bridge. Good expirience
enjoyed it
all family experience
grate people
quite expensive but worth every penny :)
Lots of history. Strolling through this area on the cobblestone streets, you can see amazing architecture on the winding streets. The historic Jewish Quarter is located here.

Small space that covers different eras of architecture. While you're standing at the centre square, you can see the 14th Century Gothic church (Our Lady Upon Tyne), the 13th Century The Old Town Hall (with its famous astronomical clock), and Baroque-era St Nicholas Church. Don't miss a one-minute "show" upon the strike of the hour at the Astronomical clock.
amazing. we travel a lot but prague is only one city with so special atmosfere. We want to go back soon. Prague castle, charles bridge, old town, really great

Very Interesting. Good site from the perspective of interest and history. Get the audio tour which explains the sites, and you can go at your own pace. Watch for all of the annoying people taking family photographs at each and every exhibit, including the cathedral!! Quite a hike up the hill, but a good bit of excercise to start the day off. Lots of restaurant choices in the area for a beer and bite afterward.

beautiful architecture. Lovely to just stroll around, cheap prices for a drink in the bars.i loved to hop on the trams I fihnd a 24 hour public transport ticket fir 110 crowns good value and they run til the early hours, its quite easy to navigate around the city.

Gorgeous something for everyone. Churches, buildings with different architectural styles, shops, massages for tired feet, food, ice cream, museums, art galleries, street performers, all on cobbled streets. Fascinating place you can wander around for hours taking photos. In July it is very busy and it has been very hot but there are lots of places to go get out of the sun. The visitors information centre is right in the old main square and they have free maps ( the railway station made me pay for mine) lovely city
Beautiful Old Town. The buildings are magnificent. The foods are varied. I like the stroll. Please provide sunglasses and/or a hat during the day when it's summer.

Great plase like a maze.... Stare Mesto is the area that should not be split, with the city map. It is very beautiful, but it is like a maze, with many small streets and passages. Place in the city where they are concentrated in one place many architectural styles - Gothic cathedrals, renaissance sgraffito, a Baroque building. One of the interesting buildings with sculptures on the facade is at the end of Karlovo - In the golden house well. Go to the bazaar. Havelskiy ис a very nice place, especially at Christmas. Walk to the Powder Tower.

Disappointing. The Prag itself and the old town is quite interesting to see. But I was shocked to see how natives were treating tourists. The touristic areas of the city has the impression that people are not happy about tourists visits. I have never seen single person smiling. I wonder how they keep on receiving more tourists. It is very disappointing.
Stunning. Walking through the old town of Prague gives you an insight to the grand architecture of Czech republic. The watch tower, the cathedral, everything is enchanting

If you are after Beer, food or coffee this is the place.. If you are after Beer, food or coffee this is the place.
A really friendly vibe in the old square, even with all the tourists around.
At the little food stalls you can find excellent sausages, desserts and souvenirs as well as a great coffee stand.

There is something about..... It is a fascinating place. Something special. In the first 2 nights I visited, there was free outdoor jazz festival (Bohemian Jazz fest). Everyone was having a good time. It is a great place to get relaxed and be local although it gets crowded with group tourists during day. If you can visit early in the morning or late at night, you will feel more like local. Just be aware that the restaurants in the square are very overprices especially compared to other outer places. I would rather get snack and beer from the street venders.

Central Location. Excellent location for walks to Jewish Town, the Charles Bridge, the Astronomical Clock in the Old Town Square Clock. Good shopping at the Palladium and the fabulous shops all around.
Square with tonnes of history. The buildings are gorgeous and the history behind them is even better. Take a tour - it will be worth it!

A Historical Treasure Trove, with fun and food. What is there not to like in Old Town? It is like stepping back in history, while having reasonable cafes and shops. The buildings are authentic historic treasures and in excellent repair. The people speak English and enjoy being helpful. Just lots to do, see, and have fun experiencing
Lovely. Lovely square with lots of cafes. Good food and beer. Nice to sit and watch the world go by. Also has Astronomical clock.
Really nice square. Lots of shops, lots of restaurants, lots of people, lots of street vendors. Seems pretty safe, police always present. Beautiful buildings with stunning architecture.

Beautiful, historic Prague. I had heard only good things about Prague, so my partner and I decided to have a short break there. We both really loved it. It is a very pretty city, with a fairy-tale feel to it. The people are very friendly, and it was extremely cheap to eat and drink there. we shall definitely return
great weekend. great place for weekend break, easy to get everywhere, lovely food, beautiful architecture. worth visiting
Totally romance!. Soooo romantic, like in a fairy tale. Love everything about it. Though crowded of tourists , still a lovely place for weekend or long vakation.

Stunning!. Old Town is absolutely beautiful, with gorgeous buildings and lots to see, We would recommend going to see old town at night, as it looks even more stunning lit up. There are also some great bars on the square, where you can sit outside and admire the view.
Amazing place to visit. Very beautiful architecture and nice people. Prices are not too high for tourists, very many souvenirs and a very friendly ambiance

Fabulous chill out. I loved the old town with fabulous ambience and despite the crowds it was easy to just walk at leisure and take in the atmosphere. Eating out excellent and a great place for a cool beer on a hot day! Loved it.

Beautiful location. The architecture is amazing. Busy square with lots of street entertainers and great restaurants. The bell tower clock is fun to watch on the hour but don't miss going to the top of the tower for an amazing view (there is an elevator). The charge is minimal.

Beautiful square but getting busier. Visited Prague 3 times now but can't believe how busy the square had become, it is a buzzing place and must visit but if you eat and drink dive down the back streets a few hundred meters, it's cheaper, quieter and as good as anything you'll find in the square. Beware of pickpockets and dont ever change money in the street. It's illegal and you'll likely be convinced he's on his way to his bureau de change and will pass you off with Belarus notes which are worthless.

Great Old Town. If you enjoy pictures the Old Town is perfect. If you enjoy history the Old Town is perfect. If you want old buildings ... you get it. The old town in Prague is a fairytale place and one of Europes best preserved historic city centers. Enjoy great beer, excellent sausages, good restaurants and traditional goodies. Love this place.

Old Town exploration. Best way to explore the history of Prague and FOOD! Various food choice would surprise you. Price is also acceptable only if you look carefully on menus which shown in different languages and the surprising service charge on the BILL!Trdelník is a traditional and delightful dessert you must try in the square. you can see stalls are selling hot and fresh baked Trdelník!It is not difficult to find characteristic souvenir although most of the shops sell the same thing.Exchange stores are around, showing attractive exchange rate but be aware of once again, commission which could surprise you again.Most of people you meet there are nice and friendly, they show you how lovely is this land. Locals, children, visitors, buskers, everyone gather in the square and sharing the happiness of this beautiful and historic town.In summary, it is highly recommended to ones who'd love to visit Prague.

Must See. Beautiful town square, Filled with people and great cafes. Don't miss the clock tower. I recommend staying nearby, as we visited it several times as it was easy walking distance from our hote.
Best area in Prague. This must be the best area in Prague, nice and quiet, good old buildings, good restaurants, good cake shops, good bars and plenty of sights to see.

A fairytale!!!! We love Prague!!!!. The old town of prague is just stunning!!! It is something straight from a fairytale. A place where architecture is even more beautiful than you can imagine, gothic styles and beautiful czech architecture are ubiquitous!!!!! I cannot wait to return!!!!!

Very pleasant Old town!. So many things to do there. It's very nice to walking around narrow streets, squares, restaurants and shops. Many points of interest like the beautiful astronomical clock, museums and churches. Don't miss it!

just filter out tourists out of your mind, and you'll see wonderful and amazing place.. A lot of history you can touch, a lot of beautiful architecture. Unfortunately too many tourists (phps including me:) )

a crowded yet enjoyable tourist city. Few cities in EU have most shops open till 11pm, Praha old town is one of them. Explore bookstores, cafes, then walk across Charles Bridge to sign on the legendary Lennon Wall.
Worth seeing. You have to see this place, but see it at night as well, it really is truly beautiful. Sit, eat and relax whilst watching the world go by.

Xmas Markets. One of the best xmas markets around great atmosphere and food. my husbans and i spent on evening just standing around taking in the atmosphere in the old town really magical would go back again

Crowded But Unmissable. Yes, the center of the old town is crowded, but old Prague is such a magical place that you just have to somehow shut out the crowds and dwell in it for a while. The history, the must-see architecture, even some of the street performers make this a spot that cannot be missed. Allow some time to visit the buildings that can be visited, go up the tower (there's an elevator!) for panoramic views, and maybe even sit at one of the numerous cafes and watch the busy scene.
Beautiful area in Praha. Old Town - Stare Mesto is like traveling back in time. Wander around, visit the little shops, have lunch or a beer and enjoy watching.
Bustling square. Lots to see and explore here from the astronomical clock to the guided tours on foot. Lots of restaurants and bars full of character and charm.
Buzzing Place. Such an amazing place to walk around, beautiful buildings with so many cafes and restaurants all with a great atmosphere

You will not get bored there!. The old town during the high season can get veeery crowded. However a little bit later in the afternooon you can enjoy the beautiful square while watching some very talented street artists performing there every day.If you are lucky there might be some festival going on in the summer. Check ahed.Watch out for the pricey street food near the suare. Unles u take a sausage u can get a reall meal inte the restaurant for that price. Its always worth to go 100 m extra ro get a more price worrhy food.
A Very Beautiful Place!. Prague Old Town is place charged with history:- the Lady Before Tyn Cathedral-Jan Hus statue-Astronomical Clock tower etc.Pragues is one my favorite city!

So much to see and the architecture is stunning. Lovely vibe in Old Town Prague and although it was very busy and hot in July 15 it still had a relaxed atmosphere. If you want to avoid the crowds then go at off-peak times. The heat made things difficult in terms of sightseeing so whatever you do take comfortable, flat shoes. Watching the occasional woman tottering over the cobbles (it's all cobbles) was an interesting past time!

Beautiful. Well worth visiting - very cultural, loads to do and loads to see, the Segway tours are great and for viewing a lot in a small time, plus there fun! brewery tours are great too! loads of different types of beer! restaurants around the old square are really nice and relaxed, loads on offer and sitting out supping a cold one people watching works a treat! that if you like that sort of thing!
Lots of history but very crowded. Was great to see all the history and just wonder around, try and be there between quarter And quarter too as the crowd gets crazy to see the clock chim.

Prague Old Town is one of the best places I've been to in my Europe trip. Old Town is such a beautiful place bustling with life. Here you can browse around the many unique shops, sit at a outdoor restaurant, see the astronomical clock tower, and see old historical buildings. Highly recommend.

Loved this area!. This is the perfect area to shop, dine or sit and have a delicious beer and people watch. Do plan on spending at least 4 hours in this area. We loved the churches, the astronomical clock and the outdoor dining. Even though it was cold when we were there in June the outdoor cafes and restaurants had blankets to warm you up. Surprisingly good food at reasonable prices for a tourist area.

A Magical Fairy Tale place day and night.. We walked to the Old Town every day whilst in Prague. Such a fascinating Square, with so much to see and do. The old clock which chimes, etc., on the hour is well worth seeing. It was a safe place with a Police presence at all times in the shape of a mobile office. It was transformed at night with so many lights into a Magical Fairy Tale place.

One of my favorite cities!. An obvious must in Prague! Very difficult to visit Prague without seeing Old Town - it is Prague! Plan on spending days just walking around, getting lost, wandering through shops, restaurants, bars, admiring architecture, etc. It is amazingly beautiful!

Great atmosphere. The old town is nice to walk through and watch people but beware of the money exchange. They all rip you off!
Great views and nice places to eat. Much more expensive than the countryside though.
Fairytale Aesthetics. Gorgeous and iconic architecture - fantastic restaurants and while we were there, the Jazz Festival was lighting up the square. Well worth a visit every day of your trip!

Old Town. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. I really enjoyed strolling through the old town. It is spectacular. There are quite a huge amount of tourists and unfortunately the pick pockets and con - artists are very busy in this area.

Medical conference and vacation . This square is wonderful!!! Such history and a true European gem, but much cleaner than any other square I have visited in other large European cities. We didn't have a bad meal or visit a dirty water closet the entire week we visited. We lucked out and were here during the Jazz festival... It was wonderful to see everyone out and about enjoying the music. We felt very safe, though taking normal precautions to not be too touristy while here. I did not want to come home! Hope to visit again!

The starting place for it all. Center of all activities. Great clock and statues. Perfect for people watching. Free tours start here. Restaurants more expensive than elsewhere, Watch out for cover charge..

Take a combined bus and river tour if possible.. Beautiful historic buildings, shops and restaurants. The architecture blends old Europe with Communist era monstrosities, making for an interesting mix. The old buildings are amazing.

Tables in the square cost extra for everything. By all means, have a beer on one of those restaurant satellite tables in the square if you are there to watch the people. Save yourself a lot of money by going inside for a meal, or better still wander a couple of blocks to find a wonderful array of restaurants offering traditional Czech fare at even more savings.
Beautiful town centre!. Beautiful city centre but watch out for the pickpockets. Grab a table at one of the outdoor cafes and just order a beer or two and spend a couple of hours there
Great people watching. A great place to people watch and the meeting place for the free walking tours. The architecture is amazing.

Lots of history, beautiful but touristy. Even though it's crowded with tourists, it's a must-go place when in Prague. Most tours meet there. The best money exchange, a lot of souvenir shops and lots of cafes & restaurants are there. But for a better view or a better price, go to the outer areas of the old town.

Must See in Prague. If you are visiting Prague, you must go to the Old Town Square. The clock and church are especially beautiful. It's crowded, but worth it. There are places to eat, shop, and people watch.

Beautiful. Amazing city . beautiful place a lot of tourists tough.
Especially in the summer
A lot of things to see . hear . and eat ))
I recommend you to visit the old town
Great place. Must see.. The Old Town Square and the surrounding streets were very crowded.. The best time to visit is morning or late afternoon, then the crowd is not so big.

its magic by night. The ambience beats anything in the world when it comes to gothic style. The old church lit up beats a Disney versjon of the ringer. the small of cinemon, grilled pork and the mideval feel is so alive.

Walk around is a must!. Great to walk around and take pictures. There are restaurants with live piano music just opposite to the astronomic clock that you can eat and see the hourly "show", but they are a little more expensive than the average. Still I would recommend though.
Great. Old town is full of shops and vendors. Kind of like an outdoor swap meet. Lots of unique things to buy

Very special. Buildings are nice and the mixture of different ages of architecture is enchanting. People have a nice vibe to them and there were very many helpful people around to assist a lost tourist.

Magical place of winding cobblestone roads.. Magical winding cobblestone roads lined with beautiful architecture, little shops, street fare, cafes, musicians and artists. I never wandered the same way in or out, never getting lost except for in time. Spend a couple of days in Praha's many sections loving the city and leaving wanting to return.
Crowded but beautiful.. Crowded but beautiful! It's a magical place with the clock and the beautiful church lit up in the background.

Busy and Fun. Old Town Square seems to be the centerpiece for fun, food and people-watching. There are special events that come and go like live jazz concerts, and there are always street musicians, street food vendors that use wood grills, bubble blowers, magicians, horse-drawn carriages, a clock tower "show", several outdoor cafes and thousands of people milling around. The atmosphere is exciting and the surroundings are beautiful, with well preserved historic buildings and statues. A Must-See while in Prague!

Busy and Fun. Old Town Square seems to be the centerpiece for fun, food and people-watching. There are special events that come and go like live jazz concerts, and there are always street musicians, street food vendors that use wood grills, bubble blowers, magicians, horse-drawn carriages, a clock tower "show", several outdoor cafes and thousands of people milling around. The atmosphere is exciting and the surroundings are beautiful, with well preserved historic buildings and statues. A Must-See while in Prague!
Crowded. Beautiful stunning old town OVERRUN by tourists, mostly from Russia and Italy. And a million college students. What a great place, but TOO MANY people!!!!

The heart of Prague. the Old Town Square and the Jewish quarter are really the heart of Prague. Filled with beautiful architecture and a sense of history, this is an area that must be explored. Lots of great cafes and restaurants in the area.

Simply Awesome !. you just simply cant stop gawking :) I mean, I have travelled across Europe multiple times. But I have not really encountered something quite like this.( except maybe, to an extent, the Gothic Quarter in Barcelona) Actually feels like going back in history. And history that is very well preserved ! Mind blowing architecture. Oozing with 'atmosphere'. Great to just walk around. Great to eat around. Great to even dance around ( the main square had a music festival of sorts all afternoon !). And you can get some very very good bohemian crystal. At good prices. ( Do not forget to bargain !)

One of the Best. We have visited many Old Towns on our current European vacation and Prague's is undoubtedly one of the, if not the, best. Great architecture and atmosphere. Plenty of street performers, most of which are entertaining, and we didn't have a problem with too many hawkers / peddlers trying to sell us tours or junk.

One of the best Cities in the World. I've been to Prague four times previously, the last visit was 10 years ago. This city is one of the best places in the world to visit and we may return AGAIN. Each time you touch one of the statues on the Charles River Bridge you guarantee to revisit this incredible city. The people, architecture, food and lodging are ALL very good. DO NOT change money from peddlers on the Bridge, they are ALL crooks, change stations are every where, legal and reasonable, better than ATM's. I've shared lodging, Hotel Nicholas, tours:Wittman and White Umbrella and driver, Mike of Mike Chauffeur on TA.

Nice place . I really liked the old town. It's beautiful :) when you're in Prague you've to go there. Almost everywhere you can buy absinth stuff! One thing I didn't like is the fact that everything was more expensive but that's normal for such tourist attractions.

Quaint medieval city, but very touristy. Very quaint medieval city, but filled with souvenir shops and tourist cafe traps everywhere. Worth visiting, but not as interesting as Cesky Krumlov, two and a half hours to the south.

Mesmerising and beautiful. We spent our honeymoon in Prague - 5 days to explore this wonderful city. It was a great experience, we did lots of walking around and the Old Town was truly fabulous. We walked up the tower and looked out over the whole city.
Historic and full of positive energy. There's something about this square that makes you wanna go back there everyday, while you stay in Prague.

not for the summer. great place just wouldn't want to visit in the summer again, too busy and too hot. it really made a lot of attractions not worth the wait when you had to contend with queues of people especially when its 35+ degrees

Must see. Excellent for just chilling and people watching. Plenty of cafes and bars in the square and the back streets, good food at reasonable prices. The astronomical clock is a must see but can be crowded.

Fantastic architecture & people watching. So much fun to walk around, enjoy gelato, take a carriage ride, or just people watch! We recommend walking to the southern wall of the Old Town Square on the hour to watch the medieval astronomical clock on the which was first installed in 1410.

Beautiful.. this is a must to visit, the market is really lovely the people are really friendly not pushy about selling there goods , it's a relaxing place with loads of bars were you can eat, and have a drink , it dose get crowded with people admiring the clock , but still amazing place .

Stunning. Old Town, centre of Prague, is absolutely exceptional. The architecture of the buildings that surround the square is amazing and really add to the atmosphere. The only thing that lets it down is the numerous people trying to advertise the nightlife and constantly pestering you.
Beautiful Prague. Fun shopping, people watching, nice free street performers. Try the Segway tour, it's fun and a great way to see Prague without killing your feet walking on cobblestone.
Great Atmosphere!. We enjoyed the Old Town the most on our Prague stay. It is quaint and has nice bars and restaurants.

Must visit thousands of people entertainment and food. The chiming of the bells on the astronomical clock on the hour. Everything for hire from bikes, single wheelers, old timers, coach and horses buskers etc etc. Street side food and plentiful restaurants, right next to the beautiful jewish quarter and opposite the cathedral.

Great in the evening in summer.. If you can go to the old town in the evening you can experience local street food which was very good. At least in the summer you can. The night we were visited we ate the local street food and listen to a free Jazz concert.
Great Architecture.. Beautiful old buildings with interesting history. This place had so many changes over the years and survived many conflicts and a world war.
Trip to Prague. Wear good support shoes/sneakers for walking on cobble stone pedestrian center. Crowded area around astrnomical clock so be carefull of pick pockets

Great Atmosphere In Mideival Part of Prague. The atmosphere in the Old Town Square is beautiful and one could just lose themselves. It is littered with numerous stalls and markets in the shade of beautiful buildings such as the Cathedral of Our Lady Before Tyn and the Old Town Hall.

Amazed in Prague.. The Old Town is crowded, so try to be there early. Also, the evening is lovely when the lights illuminate the Charles Bridge and the castle up on the high hill.The Old Town is magical. Look for street entertainers. Shop for Chrystal. Stroll around taking your time. The tram system is excellent. Prices are soooo reasonable, people speak English everywhere, so don't let the language keep you from visiting! Folks are friendly.

Food, Beer and Good Vibes. Four times in Pragues in 4 succesive years and the old town of Prague still appealed to us.it is rare to have a feeling in this popular tourist attraction , that you are not constatly ripped off. I experience the atmophere to be relaxed and not so pushy. The main plaza is the center of it. There seems always be something going on. A jazz festival, other presnters and a crowd milling around. Very likeable.However, the farther you get from the main plaza, the more rapid the prices fall.Beer-index shows triple price in the central plaza compared to 100 m off the place.Food has been good all over the old town, no actual disappointments. It is actually pretty hard to find bad quality / price relationship in Prague restaurants, which ain't such a bad a thing.Also there has been so far no attempts to relieve us of our money without our acceptance or through a scam.In other words, a lot of happy people and and good service.A good place to go, too.

A must visit: best out of season. The iconic Stare Mesto is one of the main sights to see in Prague. As such it, and the castle, attract lots of people. Becuase of this it may be better visiting outside the summer season or in the summer season early in the morning or in the evening. We actually enjoyed the areas in Prague not visited by too many tourists.
Definitely worth a visit when in Prague. Very picturesque square. Avoid most of the restaurants in the Square as they are tourist traps. Has a lovely Christmas market in December
Interesting architecture & river views. Old Town reminded me of Disney World Epcot.Loved the city views (red roofs and steeples) from Castle hill.Back alley restaurants and pubs are best.

Charming. Of course, anyone visiting Prague will want to visit Old Town. It is beautiful (not as much as Bruges, however), safe and clean. It did not strike me as overly crowded, even in July. There are delightful street cafes and entertaining street performers.
Christmas Market in Prague. the Christmas Market it`s amazing here. you can find everything you want. candy, souvenirs and traditional crafts

Grab a map and go. Be sure to book a hotel within walking distance . Residence BolognA close and no frills with breakfast. You won't spend any time in hotel - too much to see and do. Tourist maps show highlights and you can easily self-navigate. Paid tour not necessary.. All roads narrow, curvy and cobblestone. Flat shoes a must. Exchange some money at no commission site. A bit cheaper with Czech money. Asking for something at restaurant can make bill more - like butter for bread or taking away leftovers, so ask if there's a charge. Everyone will try to sell you concert tickets. The Royal Czech Orchestra was worth every penny. Small venues so cheapest tickets are still good. Be sure you know which venue. My hotel gave me wrong location and I missed beginning of concert. Despite reputation, I felt very safe . Looks magical at night . I got great souvenirs for a good price at a little shop right before the Charles Bridge.
Historical Day. Steeped in History, one could walk around Old Town for hours and still find things to see. From Historical buildings to Street markets there is something from everyone.

Unforgettable. Beautiful Prague. I loved romantic walk across the Charles Bridge. Plenty of restaurants, great atmosphere, busy, but I felt safe between a huge crowd of people.
Loved the Orloj and the Old square.
Not as cheap as we were expected.
Lots of walking. walking around seeing the old architecture. all cobble stones. bring good walking shoes I destroyed my flats on the stones
a la mode night. Night life in Old Town can be fun depending on what you're looking for. Different types of bars for everyone and anyone.
People watching. This is a great place for meeting, having a coffee, people watching, souvenir browsing, clock watching, and figuring out what you will do for the day.

Good street atmosphere. . Well worth a visit for the culture especially the astronomical clock which has spectacular display on the hour. Beware of the Enhanced prices for food and drinks in the square. Some of the restraunts in the side streets off the square are much better quality and value for money. Watch out for the sedgeway riders.

Beautiful Prague. Just walk around and soak in the feeling of being in a world so different to what we work / live in - the old town is precisely that, a town within a city giving you a feeling of being in a different passage of time

Gorgeous Architecture. Take a guided tour or simply roam the streets and alleys. We enjoyed the restaurants, ice cream shops and found an open air market. Includes the Old Town Square and Charles Bridge as well as the Jewish Quarter. Lovely shopping or just wander and enjoy the stunning architecture typical of Prague.

Most beautiful city in the world. I have been in many cities worldwide but Prague is just stunning. Everywhere you walk and every direction you turn in the Stare Mesto is an amazing experience. It's enough to soften almost any cynic. I found it to be pure joy.

The icon. The iconic Prague area. It is the reason why everyone comes here. The nice thing is that it is not just a touristic hot spot like many central places in many cities. This are a is full of universities, local cafes, book shops. I have walked the streets of Old Town since my childhood and I still stop and look around when I get to the Old town square. I just dislike the constants stalls with bad food and trinkets that have been there now for a few years.

Lots of walking and lots of fun and history. Like-The history, monuments and building are breathtaking . Be ready to walk, since most streets are only for pedestrians
Disliked-nothing
Beautiful Place. Worth the walk, great experience in Prague. Beautiful place and structures, the history of the place and the country was wonderful.

Fabulous and quirky. Beautiful, beautiful. Prague. We loved the old town and all the quirky buildings and artwork everywhere. When we were there the Easter market was being set up and the trees were beautifully decorated with balloons to look like eggs. Can't wait to return.

Brilliant place except for tourists and Western fast food. The word "stunning" is much overused these days, but is entirely appropriate to describe the utterly magnificent architecture, especially in the main square. The down side is that there are far too many tourists here. We were there midweek, thus missing the weekend drunken hordes, but it was still too crowded for our liking. There are so many Costas and Starbucks that it was hard to find a Czech coffee house. To be fair to Costa, their styling really tries to blend in so that it almost appears to be a local operation. Likewise McDonald's with their understated "McCafe" branding. However, Burger King and Subway were unwelcome visual intrusions - worst of all was KFC, a ubiquitous blot on the otherwise magnificent streetscapes.

Enchanting Old Town, Prague. Old Town Prague is enchanting because of the welcome, the buildings, the church, the music and the theater. Do not miss a classic concert at the Clementinum Glass room, a dinner with Mozart at the Mozart Café and the hour-toll in the main City square. Amber goods, garments and antiquities are nice and cheap.
Just go. You need to visit this country in general. It is a country of peace with villages and mountains to enjoy - the prices are very good and fit most budgets.
Pretty Praha. Large and lovely with the astronomical clock in view. A great meeting place with all shopping and food posibilities close by.

the Czechs Do It Right. This is a bucket list Top 5 site-- fascinating history, outstanding architecture with Czech- unique touches. A great vibe resounds in Stare Mesto--great beer, good food, lively & lovely people.
Jewish Quarter. Loved touring the old Jewish Quarter, and going to a classical music concert in the Spanish Synagogue.

A meeting place. It's nice and huge, the place to go for one evening to see the famous clock and grab something to eat or a dark draft beer. Very crowded in the evening, though, and lots of performers
Wow. Beautiful during the day and night. I would highly recommend a romantic night walk or a carriage ride.
Charming plaza where everybody meets. Central in Prague, there is the astronomical clock and many other attractions. Many good restaurants are in the neighborhood too.
Beautiful and historic. It's similar to other Eastern European towns. It has it's flair, it is a beautiful and historic place. Walk around, grab a bite to eat, visit the market, lots to do.

lovely. Easy to spend your time here. Lots of street performance going on surrounded by excellent cafes.
Segway, Vintage car rides , walking tours all begin here
A must see in Prague. A beautiful square in the Old Town. Great place to take photos of the beautiful buildings. Stop at one of the cafes for a drink and people watch.

A different time. Lots of tourists and some tourist shops here -- but if you can look past that, you can imagine what it would have been like here many years ago, thanks to an abundance of well preserved architecture. Even in its current form, there are lots of activities and restaurants to enjoy in the area. Narrow streets are fun to explore, and there are occasionally unique shops to see. In the evenings in the square, there are definitely lots of crowds and energy sometimes -- something to experience for sure.

Soak in the culture. We enjoyed walking through the Old Town taking in the sights and sounds of the local history and culture. We enjoy exploring on our own and this experience did not disappoint. From the unique architecture to the shops, and side walk cafes, it was an unexpected jewel in our European holiday!

Simply Magic.... One of the most gothic and dark Old Towns of the Region, this place its a great place to enjoy and have fun. Yes, its crowded but at the same time it has lots to offer with small streets, cafes all around, restaurant of all type and great attractions. A must see within the local circuit and a great place to finish in your afternoons.

Old Town and its main square. A very pretty square with lots of winding streets leading to and from it. The square is always very busy and there is usually a musical event going on. A main attraction in the old town is the astronomical clock. I rated the area as very good and not excellent due to the high prices in the shops/cafes in that area. Not only, but a particular cafe in the square actually tried to overcharge us and only when we threatened to report him did he refund the extra charge.

What is there not to like.................?. Well for starters, the sheer amount of graffiti and the fact smoking is still allowed in restaurants and pubs etc (although I believe that changes next year?) is something not to like!The airport transfer drive seemed to take ages and maybe public transport is quicker? We were a stag party staying for 5 days at the top of town (hotel EA Downtown) and you had to traverse a small park near the Muzeum metro with down and outs/drug fiends before hitting the main part of town. The city is packed with tourist hordes during the day and pimps by night. However, there is a lot to see and do and check out my other reviews which cover some of the pubs and restaurants we visited, activities and zoo etc. A long weekend will not be sufficient to get around. As the Czechs are not in the euro, the cost of food and drink is quite cheap (and there's a lot of competition) - I was pleasantly surprised at just how little I spent (but then again my wife was not in tow!).Would be happy to return once the smoking ban kicks in!
Energitic. IT is famous for its historic value. The atmosphere these days add more value to it. Astronomical clock is on one side of it. I will say a must go place.
Great area, must see. Beautiful buildings, alleys and town squares, nice little shops, just take a walk around the area and feel the vibe of the area

Atmospheric. Beautifully preserved and clean! Garbage trucks seemed to be everywhere, tidying up litter.
Lots of things going on - street entertainers, music (heard a brilliant jazz band playing in the Old Town Square). Loads of cafes, bars, and restaurants. Friendly and not pushy shop vendors.
And, most of all, stunning architecture.
Wonderful!

Loved Prague!. Prague was quite a pleasant surprise. Some beautiful architecture and a lot to see and do. Definitely recommend staying in old town where everything is within walking distance. We stayed at the Marriott in Old Town which was perfect.
Magnificent. if you are into history and Bohemia, this is the place to visit. Its rich in history and culture. The architecture is very breathtaking.

Stare Mesto - Narrow and Confusive paths. Nice vibe with a lot of tourists and great charm. Very old and well kept architectural features (all different), and great historical sites within the perimeter. Awful mapping and lack of signs that make sense for the visitor. I visited 4 information centers 4 times to find out how to get to a place and how to identify the number of the building (two #'s of two different colors per building). The last thing I heard from the rep at a information center was: numbers are not important, you see the building in the map (a tiny drawing) and you know it is the one when you get there. DAh! I asked her what is the method to recognize a street or avenue, but she nodded and said, "that's not important". I said, "it is, I am lost". And she said, "look at the map". Believe me, everyone there carries a map that is so hard to read. Most visitors end up paying guides (prizy). Anyway, be prepare to struggle is Stare Mesto, especially is you don't speak czech!
Beautiful. Despite being dense with tourists, an absolutely lovely place. Beautiful square. The Mint bar sells top beer from tanks.

Wonderful architecture. Well worth going on a walking tour of the Old Town if possible on your first day which over 2 to 3 hours will cover most of the highlights and giving you time to revisit in depth next day.
Must do. Gorgeous and defiantly need to be seen more than once while visiting the city. It is lovely to just sit and people watch. It also has an excellent tourist information centre here too.

beautiful and very entertaining.. the old town was just gorgeous and well preserved. We just walked around and had a great time. It was exttremely hot which apparently is unusual for Prague. We found the restaurant and cafes reasonably priced and the services we got in all of them was amazing to our North American standards. People are always trying to help. We felt very safe too.

Amazing atmosphere. Absolutely lovely to sit and have a drink and watch the street performers. This is almost Prague's equivalent of Covent gardens and is not something to miss, although you will pay slightly more for a drink in the square it is lovely to spend some time watching the world go by here!

Fantastic architecture. This is THE place to be. Most of the tours meet somewhere on the square and the clock is always a joy on the hour when the chimes and the characters come to life. There are often street performers and lots of yummy food vendors. The hot spiced wine was most welcome on a chilly February evening.
Fun. We went to old town many times during our visit based on where our hotel was located and it was always filled with fun sights and entertainment.

The heart of Prague. This is the real heart of Prague ... rich in history, lots of landmarks, churches & rich history. Take one of the free tours from Discover Prague Tours to explore Old Town.Lots of great restaurants to enjoy local and international food and drink, lots of concerts in churches and theaters ... my personal favorites are the innumerable Jazz bars around old town. Need at least a couple of days just to soak in and enjoy the buzz of this place.

Short City Break. Lovely city to visit, so much to see. Lovely buildings so well looked after. People so friendly, public transport brilliant. Lovely shops... Just great to walk around as there is so much to see. Hope to go back some day and see what we missed on our first visit

Prague's atmosphere. Go to the old town to walk around the streets, feel Prague's atmosphere and taste the typical food that is sold in small cottages all around the city. Do not miss the Havelska market! It has very typical souvenirs and food that you can buy for very affordable prices
Beautiful part of the city.. We stopped by mid afternoon to see the astrological clock and ended up eating at a great little restaurant. Be sure to stop here while in Prague!
Lovely short break.. Very attractive and pretty with Christmas markets. Easy access via trams system. Easy city to travel around and sites are achievable in a couple of days.
Over-the-top architecture in every direction. Choking with tourists, but who can blame them? Don't miss seeing the Astronomical Clock strike the hour.

Would be a great sight to visit, if not for the million tourists.. Old Town is such a lovely Prague point of interest, but it's just so overrun with tour groups and tour busses that it honestly takes away from the overall experience. We went several times throughout our stay in Prague, and it seems to always be very crowded. I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to go there, but if you're already there...why not?!?! The area does have several cafes with outdoor seating, which is nice for a break. There are also several food trucks with an assortment of local cuisine. Be warned, food is sold by weight in these trucks...not a flat rate. So when you see them stacking the sauerkraut on your plate, keep in mind you'll be paying by the gram.

Take a few hours.... ...and just let yourself get lost in these old streets. You can do this over and over and always find some interesting part you have missed on your prevoius arrivals. Take your time and enjoy.
cute. Small but cute, there was a music festival with local music, very interesting. Beware of restaurants nearby, not very good and expensive.
Interesting. Lots to see around the town square but quite a few homeless people sitting around on benches. there was music festival on with orchestra fabulous to see

Ancient and beautiful city. I went there in the beginning of summer, June 2015. The weather was perfect, sunny but cooling. Old town square is very nice to walk. Although the astronomical clock area is very crowded, but I walked down the small alleys and behind the Bohemia crystal shop (opposite astronomical clock), there's a market which sells cheaper souvenirs and fruits.A must go place if you are in Prague!

Fairy tale.....!. The best way to visit all Prague is walking, old town has many place to visit, my advice is to take the free walking tour to have a real experience, and don t miss nothing, is amassing and not tired, you can go to the visitors center near the famous clock, all the mornings at 10, and choose the language you speak, the guides have umbrellas, ask them . Jewish neighborhood is near, don t loss it, is the most oldest place of the city....!

Fun place but VERY crowded--watch your pockets!. There is everything from the municipal building clock (performs on the hour) to concerts to very good restaurants to all kinds of shopping to the Charles Bridge to great beer joints to a statue of Jan Hus, burned to death by the Catholic church for heresy. It would be easy to spend days here just watching the crowds!

Loved it!. What s great place to wander. Beatific buildings and loads of shops and cafes. People from all over the world enjoying the atmosphere. Great entertainers and if you are really brave segways. If not horse drawn carriages. Great cafe in the Galery. Transport on metro easy and cheap. Prague is s great city to visit and soak up the atmosphere.

So beautiful. The square is so beautiful and full of restaurants and bars. When we were there food vendors were in the square selling traditional Czech food. Gets crowded with tourists waiting for the clock to perform.

Beautiful. The old town is beautiful lots to see and is say the reason most people want to visit Prague! Plenty to see and lots to do. All old its like stepping back in timeIt is expensive though as its the main tourist spot.
A must be. like the atmosphere. there is a free guide tour ...try to take it you'll enjoy two hours of little bit knowledge history of prague /

Great City to visit. The city of Prague offers any number of fabulous attractions one being the Old Town Square with it's wonderful time peace. To walk around the Old Town in particular is a joy to behold and something that should be experienced. An evening stroll round the old pubs where the intellectuals and writers visited before the Velvet Revolution is worth doing.
" Just breathtaking". Ive'd been to a lot of places worldwide but I can say that this is the most beautiful place to see! beautiful architectural buildings and scenic places to explore.

Beautiful Old Town. The Prague old town is beautiful and it is worth to go all parts of the old town by foot and all are walking distance. Especial beautiful places are the Charles Bridge and the Old Town Square.

Buzzing. The main square is so fun. There are so many food stalls and restaurants, street acts, musicians, dancers, etc. You have the views of the amazing architecture, and such a great atmosphere. There are some museums surrounding, i went into a Tim Burton exhibition in one of them, which was really good.

Very picturesque with plenty of history and plenty of places to eat.. A huge number of historic buildings - almost too many to take in! The area is generally well preserved. Generally a free and easy ambiance with plenty of people from all round the world although it can get a bit too crowded at times!. A good selection of restaurants including Kosher.

Beautiful. Definately worth staying I this location. There are so many attraction close by and the view I the evening is fantastic be sure to get a Prague card and a transit pass from the municipal tourist office..

Expencive and crowded. The neighbourhood is worth having a look at and has most of the sights in in. Lots of restaurants with touristy prices. So many people though, sometimes hard to move around. Beautiful old buildings.

Wonderful architecture.. The buildings around the square are a delight. It also a wonderful place to sit and people watch.
The astronomical clock draws the crowds when it strikes on the hour.
Do not go in July/August. Well, the old parts of Prague are really worth a trip. But during the summer months it seems that there are more visitors than on 5th Avenue.

So Pretty. Old town is very pretty. lots of lovely architectural buildings to see and admire. Its nice to sit and have a drink or ice cream on the bench on a hot summer’s day. The Astronomical clock isn’t too fat from here too.
Plenty to see and do. This is a fantastic meeting place with always plenty going on. Lovely bars and restaurants around the outside. plenty to do day and night.
Going back in time. It is beautiful place where you can feel you got back in time place is full of nice restaurants shops, you will enjoy spending time there.
Beautiful Place. Beautiful place but it was raining when we were their so spend most time under shelter. The Street food was amazing specially some sausage thingy (cant remember the name).

Beautiful ancient place, full of charm, beauty and mystery.. Prague's Old Town Square has remained virtually untouched since the 10th century. Notable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. Across the river Vltava connected by the Charles Bridge is Malá Strana.

A must when in Prague. Old Town offers so much to see and do that only one day won't be enough. Get lost in he cobbled lanes, pace yourself in the main square, get inside in one of themany pubs and sip one the the greatest beers in the world.
Amazing!. Historic, and easy to walk many great sites to see! Use the apps for walking and visiting key places.
lived up to the expectations. Picturesque and everything you would expect of a bustling town centre. The lovely weather made it so easy to appreciate the sights and walk around.
Prague crowded area. Old town is the center of Prague by the famous clock-it has a very nice feel, but be careful if you have children or elderly with you-very crowded and easy to get lost

Beautiful part of a beautiful city. It was not difficult to find and not difficult to get to, lots of things to look at and to discover. It is a nice little place to spend at least a whole day in. The prices of the souvenirs could've been lower but I find myself thinking that anywhere. Definitely worth a visit if you find yourself in Prague.
Visually beautiful old town. You can wander and just enjoy what you see or target some of the specific stops. Compact enough for easy walking.
Beautiful city, great beer!. Go to the small streets, check the river, and the most important, try the small bars with special local beers!

Beyond beautiful. The old town of Prague is one of the most beautiful city old towns you will visit. The architecture is magnificent. It's maze of narrow winding streets are full of charm and mystery, reminiscent of medieval times, its walls steeped in history.The astronomical clock is a wonder of the Middle Ages, almost like the iPad of that time. The beautiful synagogues and the grim reality of the Jewish quarter and its cemetery are must sees.The Church of Tyn on old town square is probably my favourite building in Prague with its slightly off sized towers, it seems to watch you as you cross the square.Of course it will be busy so visiting in the early morning is a great time to avoid the main bulk of tourists.After nearly 5 years of living in Prague, I still never get tired of passing through the old town.
Beautiful. Cannot be over-rated. One of the most beautiful squares in Europe, but it is very touristy. Just off the square are many other eating and drinking options.

Bustling, Historic Must See if Your in Prague. If you're in Prague, how can you not spend some time here. We had a personal guide who provided much historical context to the square. Don't miss the astronomical clock at the top of each hour. We did not try any of the restaurants, so can't offer up any suggestions.

Nice atmosphere. Enjoyed our visit to the square. We were a bit disappointed with the clock. I guess we had higher expectations as to what it was, but once we did the tour and heard the history of the clock we had a new respect for it.

dont miss. beautiful area with lots of great picture opportunities and rester aunts…. a lot of people on here have said overpriced… but i thought they were very normal…. and the atmosphere is amazing….

Overload: Beauty, history, people, everything!. Overwhelming how much beauty and how many interesting places there are to visit. It's also incredibly crowded with all kinds of tourists and groups. Visit key attractions early if you can and carry water in the summer!

Full of charm, definitely no1 attraction. Loved every minute of staroe mezto. Went to this part of Prague every day just to soak up atmosphere. The best time to go is at 9am. From 10 the pace is overrun with tourists.

Heart of Prague. Walking the streets of the old town is what Prague is all about. Just taking in all the buildings, squares and cobbled streets is a wonderful experience. Karlova Street is packed with tourists but there are loads of other little streets if you want to avoid a bit of the crowds.

Great old square. The Old Town Square is beautiful and with lots of restaurants and shops. Centrally located so getting any where is very easy. The Astronomical clock was my favorite thing. The fescos on the buildings are beautiful.

brilliant people watching. had a great time basking in the sun watching all the goings on can go to the restraunts all around the square for refreshments just superb looking at all the lovely buildings
Lots of Tourist Traps but pretty. Very pretty square with a lot of different sights. There are a lot of tourist traps in this area. There are some free tours that are are very nice and we enjoyed.
History. Lovely place to visit plenty of History, architecture, resturants, shops while we were here they had the square used for singers on the stage.

Really lovely, lots going on. Great place to start in Prague. Lots going on while we were here, stools selling food and horse cart rides around the city. Performers during the day and of course the clock. Which people gather around to see. Lots of restaurants but they can be expensive! A little further into one of the streets and you can find somewhere cheaper to eat

Don't miss. Visited the Old Town yesterday on foot in sweltering heat! Well worth the walk as the place is just a visual feast, with something different around every corner. However service (and prices)were not so good in the squares' main hostelries, with prices almost 100% more than half a mile away.
Interesting. Lots of history all over Old Town, prepare to walk a lot but it is surely worth it and you will not be disappointed. Lots of crowds, however.

Heart and Soul of Prague. Old Town (Stare Mesto) is the heart and soul of Prague and is always a little overwhelming. Day or night, Old Town is packed with tourists, party-goers, vendors, performers, and everything in between. The character of the place certainly changes depending on what time of day or night you find yourself there, but there is always something interesting to see or do. During the day I found myself mostly visiting historical landmarks and museums, and in the evening, experiencing Prague's exciting nightlife scene.
