I wouldn't suggest exploring any part of Prague at night with children, but during the day, Old Town can be fun for the whole family.

This is where the heart of Prague beats.. Lovely lively and lilting. To me this is where the heart of this marvellous city beats. Catch the medieval singing band if you can. Just sit down here and absorb the spirit of the place. Superb experience.

Missed once missed prague. That square with so much activities around, buildings from yesterday era, astronomical watch, eateries, tit bit. Shopping, dear it's all in all a family paradise.all on foot, yet don't remember if we were tired, yes late evening it was all foot sores, and search for massage but worthy it was
One of the World's Most Beautiful Cities. Lovely old town dating back centuries. Not bombed during .world .war II. The Jewish section is especially interesting.

Lots to see. The Old Town has so many components to visit from the Astronomical Clock and Old Town Hall, to even a great Starbucks (one of the best in the places we have traveled. Everyone was friendly and English works very well.

Better during the night. The first thing I need to say, that I am a citizen of Prague, so my oppinion will probably be little different from tourists... The Old Town Square is amazing according to historical view, but especially during the days it is really crowdy. There are many ostensibly czech attractions like "living" statues, parrots and other crap. The restaurants are overpriced and not so good as anywhere else in Prague. If you want to enjoy the "old" and calm atmosphere of Old Town, go there during the night. It is magical.

Old Town. We went early winter time so hardly any tourist around with only locals.There were no crowds,no queues and we blended in with the locals.It was lovely to walk around all the cobbled streets and admire all the historic buildings at peace.

A hub of activity and THAT clock. This is a beautiful area were we spent a good bit of time with many beautiful buildings and restaurants/cafes. There are many food stalls with a little tree and bench area at the far side were one can cool down and have a tasty treat. It is always buzzing with tour groups and gorgeous horse drawn carriages. (And darn Segways)Naturally it is a popular place as this is where the famous astronomical clock is. Well worth a good staring at but we didn't bother with going up to the top of the tower, it was a bit busy. I am sure the view would be stunning though and a photographer's dream.We were there in June, I can't imagine what it would be like at the height of the tourist season. Oh and seriously - can't stress this enough - wear comfortable shoes!! The traditional cobblestone roads and footpaths are unforgiving :)

Old Europe, cobblestone streets, period architecture, experience a different era.... Very few cities in Europe have maintained a period look, and Prague's old town certainly has it. Whether by choice or simply slow at it, Prague has not modernized this part of the city thereby enabling travelers like ourselves to experience an old Europe feel. The architecture is over hundred years old, so are the streets. The restaurants are ok, nothing great, but fun to hang out. Street food is avoidable. Look out for shows in the market place. all in all a great hang out place.

The Hub of Prague. The city centre of Prague. The market place through the centuries and especially for Christmas. So much history. Every Christmas you have the Christmas markets crowded with tourist and locals wanting to come out for Christmas. (This review a bit late, but be good to see the other side in the summer, and this might help if you’re planning your trip for Christmas, an ideal time to visit Prague. Hint: Christmas here is really celebrated on the evening of Christmas Eve, so a lot of merriment, and rather ‘all over’ on Christmas Day.)Visit the famous centuries old Astrological Clock. Old buildings and churches. Join a walking tour that will reveal all the history and charm of the area. Also a good starting point to walk to the other tourist areas.

Story book charm. Prague is probably the best preserved Eastern Europe city. It did not get bombed in WW2 so everything is very much original. Old town is wonderful, you can do it on your own, but a private guide will bring this to life for you. www.tomastours.com is an excellent choice for a personal guide!

See Something New Every Time. We stayed in an apartment just off the Old Town square so walked through many times in our 3 day visit. There are so many interesting buildings with intricate features you see something ne eveytime not to mention the constantly changing street entertainment and people watching. We really enjoyed the $1 per scoop gelato which is everywhere. Take time to explore and really enjoy this piece of history.
Beautiful Old Town. The Old Town is a must see, lots of stunning buildings plus many restaurants. The square is buzzing with street performers to entertain the crowds.
Beautiful. Fantastic architecture and history here! We visited during a ridiculous hot spell, but it was still very busy.

Very interesting. Beautiful buildings, lovely coffee shops, very crowded especially at the weekend and on the hour when people gather to watch the Astronomical clock. Take care of your valuables although there is always a police presence

Nice place. Beautiful buildings, street performers and people watching. I could easily spend hours here just hanging out. The restaurants in the square are expensive, so cannot recommend those, but thankfully food is not the only reason to come check this place out.

The beating heart of Prague. If you haven't been here, you haven't be in Prague! This marvellous square features some iconic monuments like (the remainder of) the old town hall, the astronomical clock, the baroque Kinsky palace and the impressive monument of Jan Hus, who was burnt on the same place because of his progressive religious ideas. The gotic Tynn church where he preached is only a few meters from the market place.

Cafe in the dark. A couple of weeks ago we returned from a city break in Prague and came across this small cafe outside the Palladium shopping mall.The cafe was charity based and occupied a small 'portakabin' run by the blind. We were escorted inside this pitch black interior by a blind guide who showed us to our seat .and we were served drinks completely in the dark using tokens as credit. (Not a glimmer of light). We could hear the voices of other customers but could not see a thing! After about half an hour, drinks finished, we were escorted outside into the bright glare of the sun.This cafe was only there for about a week and apparently travels around to other cities.What a wonderful but unnerving experience. Thank you to all for this real 'eye opener'.

Scenic and beautiful. Take your camera and wear good walking shoes. Antique buildings and cobblestone streets. Old town main square is spacious and wonderful. Churches, shops, street vendors, street performers, outdoor cafes--a real treat!

The most beautiful part of any city I've ever seen. This area is wonderful! The restaurants are great and the sights is simply impossible to describe. Its a great pity so many of the shops are the exact same kind of tourist traps selling the exact same stuff. This area is great to view the architecture and eat out. Some hidden little jewels amongst all the tourist shops.
charming. History and old buildings of this town are spectacular. This is a very touristy town, but I never felt overwhelmed with crowds. Lots of Americans. Very clean city

Touristy But a Must. Visit the astronomic clock and watch the artists and have a beer (though the cafes in the square are expensive). It is touristy so you don't need to get here every day of your visit, though somehow I always ended up walking through it to get to other sites.
Not to miss. Breath in the history and sights - guide a must not to get lost (very disorienting) or miss something. Important sights every few feet - literally!

SEE THE HIDDEN CORNERS OF PRAGUE OLD TOWN!. We had a recommendation on a tour guide in Prague and it really paid off. We were traveling with Viking River Cruises from Berlin to Prague. We had toured the Castle with a Viking guide but did our town thing for three extra days in Prague. Marteka showed us out-of-the-way niches we would have never discovered on our own or with a large tour group. The real value was in her discussions of what it was like to live in Prague under the former regime and how, as a teenager, she reacted to the enormous transition that took place in 1989. A fascinating discussion! Reach her at marketa.crf@centrum.cz (she is a licensed Prague guide). Have a great trip.
Prague is lovely. Prague is a great city to visit with numerous interesting points of interest. The old town square is a great start to enjoying the city's offerings.
Old Town. Old town of Prague is must see for anyone....Normally in every EU country, old towns are must visit locations. Very nice things to see, local shopping and authentic food :)
Nostalgic feeling in History. Its really felt nostalgic when i visited Old town in prague. Our guide told us about the world war history about the place and it felt really amazing to be there.

REALX AND STAY TO TAKE IT ALL IN. There is so much to see and take in, in this historic gathering spot. We love going there late in the day with the sun low in the sky, The colours that radiate from the surrounding buildings is magical. Just go there and take it all in, listening to the various buskers, watching the giant 'bubbles' with kids running around going crazy, or just sit by the fountain and people watch. Take some time to closely observe the astronomical clock. It is too easy to look at it, wait for the hourly bells and march of the apostles. But you have to look closely at the clock face and marvel at all the information that is presented.A great way to start the day, take a break in the middle, or wander around after a long day of touring. Outstanding.
Must see. This is a must-see in Prague. It truly is the center of everything in Prague - dining, meetups. Wonderful central location.
Must See. This is a must see location in Prague. Everyone that travels to Prague will visit this location.Loved it
A trip back to 1500.. Well, you just have to there. If you visit Prague and don't see the old town you've missed the point. Make sure you see the clock.

Architecturally Magnificent. This is an old town steeped in history, you need to remember to also look up as well as where you're going, there is so much to see and do here, so take you time and take it all in.

Packed with tourists. The buildings are magnificent, but the square is completely packed, especially around teh clock, with tourists. It's hard to even walk around. The first day we arrived there was a huge concert set up with scaffolding and a stage so we were unable to navigate at all. The second day it was gone and although the area was much easier to enjoy there is a general lack of free seating just to enjoy the beautiful sights.

Need to see in Prague. Stare-Mesto (чеш. Staré Město (Stare Mnesto), that is "The old city", at first чеш. Pražské Město, "The Prague city") — the historical district of Prague in the area Prague 1 on the right coast of Vltava, also includes the Streletsky island.Historically independent settlement (city) grew from small settlements which arose at the important intersection of trade ways between the West and the East and along the coast of Vltava in the VIII century. In the IX century the first Christian constructions are mentioned. In the X century Przhemyslovichi already lodged in Prague. In century trade was actively developed here. The city was on other coast from the Prague Hail that gave it some freedom. Stare-Mesto settled down in the low territory, in "The Czech chronicle" it is told about a flood of 1118 which carried away many houses.

Old Town. I liked the old good looking structures and architecture there. Lots of shops and restaurant. They are littlebit expensive than others away from centrum. No need to walk longway out that u notice theres lot cheaper. Only thing i hatet there was tourist masses. But still good place to visit, do shopping, eat and drink couple of beers
Tourists, Tourists, Tourists. Walking Prague is fun, but found there were too many souvenir shops in the Old Town area. Loved the small side streets and admiring the buildings.
well worth the stroll day or night. Beautifully preserved, lots to see, not too many tPurists that you can't enjoy it. If you visit Prague then you must visit here
Very famous bridge. Plenty of room but gets very busy during the day. Go early morning. Stalls selling souvenirs along the whole length.

beautiful old town easily seen on foot. Spent a whole day walking around the old town and can honestly say it is one of the most beautiful parts of any city I have ever visited. There are a huge amount of bars,coffee shops and street entertainers to keep all ages enthralled. Prices are what you would expect in any city but certainly not exorbitant, moving off the main streets can really be worthwhile as prices drop considerably, good food can be got for a very reasonable price. We had done some research before getting to Prague and had a rough idea of what we wanted to see but didn't stick to any real plan and managed to cram in such a lot. Beware of the guys and girls on Segways trying to get your attention can be a bit irksome but a really good day out in an amazing city.

Picturesque. A very good picturesque place. Old town charm. Sit at the cafes around and enjoy. Take a buggy ride from there, you will really enjoy it. Beware of fraud goons giving high exchange rates in the street.
Great fun with lots going on. Great place to sit for hours and watch the world go by. Lots of street performers and places to eat and drink. Take time out in this amazing space to sit and chill.
beautiful. the old town is beautiful, a lot of souvenir shops and restaurants. I recommend to travel there at day and at night too and of course to wait and see the astronomic clock

Nice stay at old town. Many visiting issues in a compact centre of the old town. Warnings of local people fot thieves if driving foreign cars. However many excellent opportunities to have a great dinner of looking for a good restaurant
Something really special. If I had seen only this in Prague, I would have gone home well satisfied. Glorious old buildings kept in good condition and almost magical.

Start Your Prague Journey Here. This is a great kick off point to your visit to Prague. Vendors, street performers, shops and restaurants give a great flavor of Prague. The Old Town Square, Old New Synagogue, and the Astronomical Clock make it a must. It is also very close to several other key landmarks.

History. The old town is a point of gastronomy, hand made arts and music ! A very family area and you can eat a traditional pork in a roll and have a Prague Bread with Nutella as dessert when you watching the most variate kind of street artists. I fall in love with this point !!

many restaurants and each of them is diffetent.i cold go from one to another.prices are reasonable. Beautifu &l most wellcoming. Very exciting to watch the clock
moving and the square itself is very unique

Old Town Prague - "A Sight To Behold". There are so many sights to behold surrounded with such rich history. Old Town is a medieval settlement of Prague, Czech Republic. It was separated from the outside by a semi-circular moat and wall, connected to the Vltava river at both of its ends.The moat is now covered up by the streets (from north to south-west) Revoluční, Na Příkopě, and Národní—which remain the official boundary of the cadastral community of Old Town. It is now in Prague 1. Notable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. Across the river Vltava connected by the Charles Bridge is Malá Strana ("Lesser Quarter"). Josefov is located in the northwest corner of Old Town heading towards the Vltava. According to ancient records, the city had around 13 gates, and a huge moat, providing strong defenses.Old Town (Stare Mesto) Prague, Czech Republic has so very much to offer. It is truly filled with exquisite beauty throughout this centuries old region. To me it is not only one of the most beautiful regions in all of Europe but also one of the most interesting. Your senses will come alive as you walk through this enchanting region of Prague.

History and charm!. Charm and history....in old town, Prague. Just loved the energy and the quirkiness on the streets. My best experience was having lunch in the Medieval Tavern Restaurant. What an awesome experience! Old world charm, candles only, great food and live music. It felt like I was back in time. I just want to go back again.

That's the stuff!. I could walk around here for days without getting bored. So much magical architecture and beautiful stories to accompany it. Get a guide to get the most out of it, but wandering along without any specific direction is also worth alot!
Old Town. Go early to avoid huge crowds - interesting architecture for sure - visit the little independent bookstore in the corner!
Beautiful Stare Mesto. Amazing views, beautiful spot to walk around with great restaurants and old city charm! Can't wait to return.
Beautiful. This is the centre of Prague for all tourists... You'll find the astronomical clock on the main square in Stare Mesto!

Lovelovelove. Nothing makes me sick of going back to the Old town square whenever I am in Orague. It's such a beautiful place and a wonderful place to see how diverse Prague can be. However, nowadays there' s a lot of tourists crowding in the clock and it can be a nuisance at time.

Prague Museum Night 2015. I have visited some interesting places like Government Lounge at the Prague Main Railway Station, Postal Muzeum, Vysehrad National Cultural Monument and New Town Hall. Transport connections between places were provided by special bus line.

Buzzing Centre. The square in Prague's old town seemed to have a constant buzz in both the morning and evening. The welcoming atmosphere made it very easy to enjoy the enchanting buildings, astronomical clock and sampling the many bars and restaurants in the area. A must see for visitors to Prague.
Prague my lovly city. back to the old days feelings , people from every where in the world around you , weather was amazing we went on May

Beautiful!!!!!!. Loved this place!! The best place to people watch. My husband and I would walk up here in the evening before dinner and sit at one of the bars and have a couple of drinks and watch the world go by. Every evening you would see all these people standing in front of the old clock waiting for it to chime. We just love Prague and would go back there in a heart beat, everything thing about Prague is magic!
Great place. Lovely square. Kept going back during my stay. Great atmosphere, bustling with activities and of course tourists.

a delightfull vacation. old town prague is relativly small in size and feels cozy. it is not noisy at all despite all the tourists, it is beautiful and intresting and the locals are very nice and helpfull. prices are fair. the general impresion is true calm delight/
Old Town. Absolutely loved the Old town. Second visit. Fantastic architecture. Nice place to sit and have a coffee.

Worth a two or three day visit. Nice urban landscape with many beautiful buildings and of course the amazing clock. Very crowded at peak tourist season, almost frenzied. Definitely visit off season. The city tours are a must do to fully appreciate the city and its history.

Endless quartes of history.. Prague old town is a jewel for anyone interested in old architecture. It´s full of stunning old buildings and some highlights near the town square. Just wander around it aimlessly and you´ll find something interesting around every corner. The area is also full of shops and restaurants, so you´ll have plenty to fill your bags and belly with. Should not be missed!

Good People Watching. Like all the big cities in Europe with town squares, this one is full of tourists, average sidewalk cafes and entertainment from local artists. It's quite crowded in the summer and you can pick up any kind of tour you want from this area.

Beautiful place with loads to explore. Compared to Tallinn (where I live), Prague's Old Town is sprawling and there's a lot more ground to cover if you want to see it all. The place can be a little disorienting at times, evn if like me you have a good sense of direction and aren't put off by crowds, and in that sense a little more signage in English would be appreciated. (There are plenty of the universal brown signs pointing you in the direction of tourist sights, but those I saw were all in Czech.)

One of the best parts of town. I really love this central square. It's interesting, it's beautiful, and it's where I have my one good memory of Prague while it was still a Communist country. Be warned, though, that it is JAMMED in the high season. I mean, it's literally difficult to move. Be sure to catch the clock while you're there. It's worth the effort.

Simply Wonderful . Despite its communist past the Old Town is remarkably well preserved and well developed at same time. The streets are mixed with old and new facades in much appreciated harmony. The area was vibrant with young people everywhere. This indeed is the heart and soul of Prague.
Wonderful wandering. Well, even with a map I got lost time after time, but who cares? Everywhere you look there is something new and beautiful.

Old Town Prague is Fascinating and Fun. The buildings architecture is amazing - statues adorn many, painted in beautiful colors, lots of details in the designs! Mimes, people, music, restaurants and shops - you can spend hours walking and exploring. The clock tower is fun to watch. Don't miss this interesting and fun area! We keep going back every few days!
excellent place. It definetelly worth to be explored by foot. Enjoy the buildings, atmosphere, people. Can be crowdy during summerdays and around the hours of astronomical clock representations.

Just awesome. This is such a magnificent place. The shops, restaurants, pubs, street entertainers, it is all there. I loved walking around for hours, stopping and people watching. There is something for everyone. It is tough for anyone with a physical disability to get around as all the streets are cobblestone. Almost all bathrooms (WC's) are downstairs with no elevators.

Lovely architecture. Plenty to explore. Concerts every night, and music in the bars.. Liked the lovely shops and cafes. Lots of tourists to navigate around. Found the segways annoying! Restaurants excellent and prices very reasonable.

Trip with daughter. Old Town is a wonderful place to visit. The buildings are absolutely mind blowing. The old tower is a must see and the Gothic Era church is just amazing. We spent a lot of time shopping, eating, and just looking at the buildings and all the different performers. We loved it in Prague.

excellent... Old town Prague is the highlight when visiting Prague. It is nice to walk those streets, to mingle among al those tourists- to see the astronomical clock (although few people really understand it), to see the old town square, then walk towards Judish quarter, have a coffee on some of those terasses. If you like night life- that is really the place for it.

Gorgeous area and must see. Love old town because to me it is the centre of Prague, and has the most lovely stores, restaurants, and a great square. The clock tower is amazing, and the general atmosphere here is beautiful! Must see to me.

Edinburgh St. Andrew's Castle equivalent. Was there in November 2013 when it was quite cold. The old town has many different restaurants, souvenir shops and the clock tower(town's clock/church) in the centre! Friendly people are everywhere and cordial vendors selling some of the most delicious foods around...I certainly loved eating my hot dog with the biggest, juiciest polish sausage sizzled)) Nice!
Happening place with lots of people. Lots of shops for tourist; does get very crowded at times, but is a lot of fun to sit around and spend time. Must try trdelnik - a specialty of Prague.
nice place. A lot of tourists and free tour agency, so a little crowded but it's one of a few wide place in the city, all the rest is narrow.

cobblestone routes. An amazing part of Prague, with narrow alleys, good beers, delicious markets, small souvenirs and of course with the City Hall and its glockenspiel in every hour. A bit crowded at the same time, but if you find the not so popular parts, you will love it ♥
Lots of attractions to see. The outskirts are busy and focused on tourists but move away from the square and you will find lots of things to see. Wenceslas Square was a dissppointment.
Go Early in the Morning!. Lovely area but gets so crowded. We loved going early in the morning when not many people were around. The clock tower is enjoyable to watch on the hour.

Must visit. We visited there on a Sunday. Its was a splendid festival activities. People are very friendly and cheerful. There are many street vendors served popular Czech snacks
like the BBQ Pork and Chicken and great Beers. People are dancing everywhere
yet its well organized and orderly.

great people watching. we stayed at the hotel connected to the airport because we had an early flight. no problem the airport has a bus that takes you to the light rail that takes you to the old town area. it does take about 30 minutes but gives you a chance to see the city. my best photo is off the light rail stop and looking back towards the old church on the hill with homes and their red roofs. OLD town itself is great to watch people and see how beautiful it is. lots of places to eat, drink and watch.

Boys weekend. This provided good choices for 12 people on a Stag weekend. Don't believe all you hear about Prague and Stags. This was a lot quieter than most City centres in the UK. I saw only one person worse for wear and he had his friends with him. Shame about the people pushing tickets for entry to bar etc etc.
Good to see. Good to see but has become very touristy since our last visit about 10 years ago. Had lunch not very friendly and food just ok.
loved it here. lots of shops eateries, street acts etc but i loved the old buildings as seemed quaint and felt you were being transported in time

Wandering with friends. The food and drink was abundant and the buildings were lovely, well preserved and artistically touched up. There were a large number of stag and hen parties on the weekend which added to the festive atmosphere

Charming. At day, be sure to watch the Astronomical Clock at the full hour, you'll have a surprise. Visit the galleries and explore every street nearby. Be careful with the food - there are a lot os tourist traps around. At night, the square is equally beautiful. Can't miss it!
exquisite. One of the prettiest places to see. The social hub in my opinion. Go for a relaxing walk and soak up the atmosphere
One of my favorite cities in the world. I love, love, love Prague. Everything is within walking distance, there is old world charm, and everyone is friendly. Lots of history!

Amazing History!. From the Astronomical Clock to the Statue of Jan Hus, history comes alive in the Old Town. Every corner unlocks a new perspective with amazing architecture. Indeed, many buildings go back some 800 years. Take your time and simply stroll around the area taking in all the sights!

One of the greatest old cities in Europe. If you are in Czech Republic, you have to walk through old city in Prague. Astronomic watch & market square with all old buildings around. Don't miss the time, when the watch rings the bell.
HAVE TO BE VISITED
Old history in friendly town. Very nice old town. Not so big so you can do all by walking. In the evening plenty rstaurants with delicious food, friendly people and nice prices.
Old town mixes well with the new.bbbbbbbbbbb. Lovely square surrounded by churches and walking roads with shops, cafes and tourists. charming and beautiful.
Old town mixes well with the new.bbbbbbbbbbb. Lovely square surrounded by churches and walking roads with shops, cafes and tourists. charming and beautiful.
Center of Prague. Great place for people watching, a morning coffee or afternoon drink. The clock tower in the church is worth waiting for the hour to strike.
Finding the past. We went to find properties that my husband's family owned pre-war. Found them! Loved the square, but it does get crowded.
Amazing part of Prague. Area full of live, many things happening there. Manye tourist, sometimes overcrowded. It is a must to visit when you go to Prague.
Truly breathtaking place. The Old Town Square of Prague took my breath away, as simple as that. Haven't seen a more beautiful city in the world before this.

Hang onto your wallets and bags here. Lovely old square but lots and lots of people. Many pick pockets and bag snatchers are always in this area so always be aware of what is happening around you and behind you. Many people in the shops especially the tourist souvenir shops are happy to short change you and also on the food stalls as the currency is very hard to understand so take care with your change and money
Charming, great 'medieval' ambiance.. Easy to walk all over the place - take a map - and enjoy the magnificent buildings and centuries-old culture.

Centre of Activity in Prague. Today there was an Army Marching display, we arrived as an army band was playing. There seems to always be something on here. Puppet. Displays. . Magic displays, carriage rides
More beautiful and cleaner than Paris. While tours aren't essential they are helpful for perspective. A thousand years of architecture is a little whelming.
So much to see. A great place for everything and anything. Do not miss the astronomical clock every hour on the hour. Try a walking tour with the guide.
Favorite square. This is my favorite part of my favorite city in the world people. This is so calm, yet so wild. So romantic, so much going on too.
Beautiful. Great for masses of people. The buildings are spectacular. Too much "tagging" everywhere is a problem. Takes away from the experience.
Must see. You can't spend any time in Prague and not go to Old Town. See the bridges & go through the area on foot if you can. Too much to see to even describe it, must be experienced.
gorgeous. the architecture is lovely but very crowded at times Charles bridge is difficult if you are disabled.

nice soroundings and good pulse to the city. A lot of high class restaurants to a very affordable price!
The best way to explore Prague is by feet, a guided tour should be taken by foot or Segway.

Lots to see.... Many buskers to entertain you while you sit at one of the many cafes that line the square. Don't forgot to stand in front of the Astronomical Clock on the hour to watch the 12 apostles pass through the small opening.

Old Town Ambiance!. Was there earlier in the day so not "quite" so crowded! Enjoyed exploring the square and various buildings....and had lunch right in front of the clock!! Sure it is for tourists but I enjoyed every minute of it!! ( And the food was good!!)
Magical. I love this place, very festive and the ambiance sets the mood! Very Magical, they have kept the old town look, preserved the structures and the small kiosks for food were excellent!

Don't miss this place!. This area is a must-see. Lots of history and a shopper's paradise. BEWARE of pickpockets and con artists who wait outside money exchange places and offer you a better rate. But they will give you worthless currency for your $50.

Worth seeing but protect your wallet. Medieval town with lots of character & tons of tourists. I would suggest picking a weekday because on weekends it is impossible to move from one end to the other.
And keep an eye on your wallets & bags..... Pickpocket haven
So romantic1. This is a beautiful part of Prague. Small streets filled with restaurents. coffee shops and small shops. great to simply walk around for hours.

Beautiful!. I could spend all day walking around the old town. There are quiet, small, winding streets, plenty of cafes and restaurants, and the people watching is fascinating. I can't say enough about Prague, just go and give yourself time to walk aimlessly around the old city.

Like a theme park only real. Everywhere you turn in Stare Mesto there is something strange and wonderful to look at. It's a real medieval city center, just over the over the river from a real medieval castle and cathedral. You couldn't invent this place. Statues, music, cafes everywhere, plus old bronze statues and new modern art installations all chock-a-block but harmonious. When we go again, though, we'll not go in June or any of the high season - remember this was TripAdvisor's #5 tourist destination for 2014, and those medieval streets are narrow! Crowds aside, though, it was not to be missed. Plan at least four hours just to walk around and gawk, and stop for the occasional refreshment when your feet hurt.
old town magic. the old town is beautiful,well worth a visit.spend time just chilling having a coffee or a wine and just soak up the lovely atmosphere.
Beautiful but too Crowded.. Its beautiful no doubt, day and night. Surrounded with bars and restaurant. Its too crowded and crowd make me tired.
Medieval. This historical district will make you feel like you're back in the medieval times: horses and carriages, pebble roads, and great food. Worth a visit!

Gorgeous. Put on your comfy walking shoes!. Stare Mesto is certainly a sight to behold and well worth exploring off the beaten track too. Though one myself, the sheer pressure of tourist groups being shepherded is forbidding, though having a guide take you around on foot - nigh on imperative. All food and drinks in the main square are up to triple the cost a few blocks away; but the views... Shops, bars, etc seem to cater to the median to lower average denominator, with some exceptions. Don't hurry, try to take it all in slowly.

A real treasure in spite of the tourists.. One of the great old towns. Of course it is crawling with tourists, but, hey, you and I are probably tourists or we wouldn't be on TripAdvisor. The wonderful clock draws thousands of tourists every hour; it only lasts for 29 seconds, but it's pretty cool. We found the shops to not be total ripoffs. The jewelry shops begin with fairly high prices, but are polite in haggling down to about the same prices as you would spend away from the square, and the quality seems quite good. The nice thing about Old Town is that it is visually stunning, having not been damaged (much) during WWII. Also, it's nice to just relax, have some ice cream or beer or one of those round pastry things and enjoy the day.

Don't miss. Old Town looks like a place in a fairy tale. Make sure you check out the little side streets; they are the real gems. Don't buy your souviners here though. They are ridiculously overpriced and made in China. It's a great place to walk around but be sure to stop at one of the outdoor cafes for a Czech beer and some people watching.
Very pictureasque. a lovely place to people watch and the buildings are very impressive. Lots going on and many nice restaurants in the area
small but big. it is small to walk around and also big with the narrow side streets. You can find you self lost while walking around the side streets. It is a great experience

great town. great place, a lot of things to discouver - wonderfull architecture. wifi almost everywhere!
that's why there are tons of tourists :-)

Halusky and a beer....Perfect!. This really is the heart of old Prague. Find a place to sit and enjoy. I would recommend the local dish of halusky and a beer from a local vendor. Served in a little dish, sitting outside and just enjoy the whole scene.

The heart of Prague. If you get up and head here early you will get some GREAT pictures! Anytime before 9am the square is nearly empty. The different architecture makes a very eclectic look. I would not eat here - it caters to tourists obviously and is overpriced. At night, there are street performers and a police presence even though its just preventative - it was very safe and lively.

Things to do in Prague. Make sure you see the Astronomical clock, appears to be quite ordinary and indeed the chine on the hour seems a bit of an anti climax but once you hear the history on a walking tour it makes it far more interesting
City Center Prague. Walking around City center Prague is absolutely amazing. It feels like a fairytale. Prague is a must see.

Lots of magical places. Old town has lots of magical places to visit and feel ambience of history.. Squares, old streets - Řásnovka, Jilská, Anežská.., churches, jewish cemetery, monastery gardens and so on.

Totally spoilt by a huge stage dominating the Square. If possible, check if there are any open air concerts organised in the Old Town Square before you plan a visit to Prague. This most atmospheric and beautiful Square has been totally ruined at the moment by a huge stage, lighting towers, port-a-loos and security fencing. How the City Fathers can approve of such an eye-sore is unbelievable to me. As it is the heart of the Old Town, and everything spreads out from here, it now adds even more congestion to an already tourist packed precinct. Its impossible to appreciate the true beauty of the surrounding buildings, the statue and the gardens at present.
Lovely but SO crowded. I realize I'm just one of the tourists causing the glut, but it really was difficult to enjoy he old town with what seemed like thousands of other people.
oozing with history. amazing vibes throughout the old town, so many little cafes, bars, shops and things to see and watch from street performers, street food venders to horse drawn carriage rides

Must see, hard to avoid. You cannot visit Prague without visiting the old town. The architecture is stunning, we were overwhelmed. We were constantly on watch for pickpockets and had a couple of shady types approach is but overall enjoyed our stay. The cobblestones streets, the street stalls, it didn't seem over commercialised which was good and there's still a few parts where you truly feel like 'this is what East Europe is'

Full of history. Stare mesto is a most vibrant place - old city centre of Prague that surely you won't miss when there. Worth a visit, nice building, full of stories and historical background, packed with tourists and good restaurants, monuments, galleries and pubs. Go there!

A nice change. Beautiful buildings especially at night fabulous food and bars but Another good thing about prauge is the prices in the tourist areas never one did we feel we were been ripped off a little more expensive than out of down sure but not excessive which is a very nice and welcome change we actually came back with money and unlike Paris London or Rome we never felt like we were been over charged just because we were tourists
Centre of Attraction. You can spend days and nights watching life flowing by . Full of shops , restaurants , magnificent buildings .
Medieval feel. The square offers a modern feel with restaurants and cafes with a medieval vibe. The dark tower with the astronomical clock is very impressive.

Beautiful architecture dating back to 12th Century. This is one of the most beautiful historical sights I have seen in Europe.The Old Town Square dates from the 12th century and is a collection of ancient buildings and magnificent churches, There are restaurants and bars with outdoor seating and many attractions such as musicians and mime artists. If the weather is good and you have time, you could spend a whole day walking around, eating, drinling and generally enjoying yourself.
Nice. Well-maintained, just got a bit too touristy over the years. Small streets, nice architecture. Pleasant walk when not too crowded/too loud
Antique car tour. Rode in an old 1927 Prago convertible and saw the old city. Saw the Prague castle and crossed the river to see lots of old buildings, very nice city.

A step back in time...magical, historical and original...absolutely beautiful. A casual, and I do mean casual walk through "Old Town" is a step back in time. From the Astroniomical Clock (a must see) to the architecture to the "feel" one can relive a bit of history. The clock is a must see and pay attention to the figurines. A skeleton on the right (death) will shake his head "yes" while all the other figurines shake their heads "no" (we don't want to die"). Goes off every hour, no need to stand in line and wait...can be seen from many vantage points. The church the square.....all spectacular. A definate stop to spend some time and go to the roof of the Hotel U Prince right by the clock (might consider reservations) for a great sky view of the square of Prague (good deserts...and food). Walk around, enjoy the sights and very close to the Charles Bridge.My guess is even kids would enjoy the 30 sec show by the clock. Depending on the time of year it could be very crowded but worth it. Coffee shops and cafe's all around and if hot...shops that are air conditioned. Bathrooms available as well with a nominal charge.

A true picture of life in old Europe. I took the tram into the old city. Walking the cobbled streets, looking into homes and shops in buildings that were built hundreds of years ago. I have traveled much of Europe and seen period European cities, however in many cases these areas were devastated by war and rebuilt after the war.Old town Prague is authentic, having been spared the ravages of war and this is a treasure for those of us interested in eastern European history. Come to the principal square and gather by the famous clock on the town hall. Enter the visitor center and climb the stairs to the tower for a view of the buildings surrounding the square. Looking for unique gifts or something special, visit the many shops that line the various streets.Interested in visiting a classic jewish ghetto in Prague, which used to be one of the largest jewish communities in eastern Europe and see an up close look at life in the ghetto.

Lovely huge square, typical of many European cities, offering cathedrals, shops and restaurants. Lovely square, so typical of many European cities, offering a cathedral, the Astronimcal clock, restaurants and shops. Shops include the Czech crystals and garnet jewelry at very reasonable prices.

A Medieval Disneyland. This was one of the biggest travel disappointments of my life. Old Prague is truly one of the most beautiful cities in the world, or it would be if you can stand being caught up in a shoulder-to-shoulder crowd as far as the eye can see, with hucksters lined up along the edges trying to pick off suckers as we all push forward, or get pushed, between the Old Town, across Charles Bridge and halfway to the castle.

Alot of activity and attractions. Expensive drinks!. Be3 careful at ATMs - we were approached by a strange man who firstly asked a question about the ATM whilst we were withdrawing money and then offered to change our 1000Kr notes with his 500. We refused...apparently some fakes around. Also we were approached by a middle aged man who flashed a badge at us and asked a question. We made sure we did not understand.. Again this is quite common as they will attempt to extract money if you don't show a passport. Ask for a photo ID and challenge to go to nearest policeman for verification. Scary and really should be stamped on by the authorities.
Worth a visit.. Lots of great old architecture and central to a range of tourist attractions and eating places. Trams and subway lose by.
Magnificent. Strolled down the different allies at my own pace. Shops, restaurants, historical structures all worth time studying and exploring.

Old, but Just Gets Better. The scenery may not be lush green or colourful flowers but the buildings, streets, paving stones, signs, decor and atmosphere all lend themselves to a unique moment in time - enjoy the walk, even among the crowds. Break away from the flocks of people wherever you can and you will enjoy the sights even more. All a part of Prague, a must do and see.
Heart of Prague. Very fun place with great food, people watching and history. Lots of fun shops, and several nice outdoor areas to eat and soak in the ambiance.

Great flavor of old Prague. OK, so it is full of tourists, but that is only because it is such a neat place to visit. The astronomical clock is the big draw...every hour, and it is not really a big deal for its 60 second show, except when you consider it was built nearly 1400 years ago. The square itself has beautiful buildings, street performers (beware pickpockets) and lots of dining options. Really is a must see spot if you come to Prague.
Beautiful place. Great atmosphere and extraordinary architecture. There's nothing better than walking through the old town and getting lost in this beautiful place.

the Belle of Central Europe. having been to Prague on a number of times in various guises , stag do,s , family breaks etc, I would highly recommend this beautiful city as a must see, you must do the Mediaeval night, found at the bottom of the steps from the Castle,brilliant entertainment,great food & drink , a tip book at least a day , as it can be very busy, the old town square is an historic marvel, with the Huss monument central to its history.Do not miss walking the Royal Mile from the Castle to Wenceslas squre, which incorporates the old town ,Asronomical clock and markets along the way,do make time to visit Hotel Lucerne shopping mall to see the Upside down Horse sculpture hanging from the ceiling. A recent piece of history for those of a certain age who can remember the fabulous 60s on Wenceslas Squre is a plaque set into the road , commemorating Jan Palach who burned himself and sadly died in protest at the russian invasion in 68 , and Jan Marin who did the same a few days later. this wonderful city is a must for any Bucket List , go, sample and enjoy.

Super Lively Evenings. The Town Center is not only Beautiful, it is really a hapening place with lots of lively restaurants and bars. Also, it is one of the BEST LOOKING CITIES out of the several European Cities I have visited
great. always something going on and the restaurants are excellent with the food being hearty with the Sq full of entertainers and all the tours can be booked hear

So walkable! So engaging!. Just wander and enjoy. The shops are interesting, and Prague is clean and feels very safe. There's a large pedestrian area with cafes. Europeans smoke a lot, especially in the cafes. So try to choose where you sit. Downwind is good.

As far as OLD Towns go, it was just OK. The old town seems a bit, mixed in terms of Old mixing with new and different periods of architecture- plenty of graffiti on the walls, and not the really good arty sort, just ugly "tags" which are not nice at all. We had just come from Dubrovnik which has am amazing Old Town area which is very well preserved- so this probably influenced this review. There are some very nice photo's to be taken though!
Beautiful town. Prague is a beautiful town with romantic, nice buildings, fine sausages, good beer and exciting nightlife

I love Squares in Europe. There is not as much activity here as, let's say Krakow. However, it is fun to people watch. The cafes that surround the square all seemed to offer a satisfying menu. One particular café (sorry I did not take down the name) was very welcoming. Coyotes was the exact opposite: rude, inconsiderate staff. The astronomical clock is certainly an attraction not to be missed.
Beautiful Prague. Prague is a beautiful city but perhaps a bit over-rated as the best in Europe. We enjoyed the city and it is well worth the trip.

Interesting tourist destination. This place has all the potential of being a wonderful tourist destination. Unfortunately many of the monuments are in a bad state of repair. If one can ignore this negative feature as well as the thousands of tourist, then it is worth visit.
Great section to see in Prague. One of the best areas to tour in Prague. Take the metro to get around. The cobblestone streets make driving very dangerous to the unaccustomed visitor.
Magical city. What a great way to really start off your Praha visit. You can start a Segway tour, walking tour or a bike tour from one of many tour providers in the area.

Stunning Old Town. Prague is such a beautiful city- so much to explore! The only downside is that I feel customer service is still stuck back in the days of the "iron curtain". It does feel that the locals are irritated by tourists, which I totally get working in the travel industry for over 20 years myself....tourists can be pretty ugly, however, when you are in the service industry, you must be able to put on a happy face! Aside from this observation, the city is wonderful! Wear comfy shoes.If you must take a taxi, ask how much before you get in the cab...drivers DO take advantage of tourists and do NOT exchange any money in the cab...many drivers will offer this.

Another Beautiful Czech Attraction. This place has so much character--beautiful buildings, fountains, sidwalk cafes, carriages, and food vendors. Go up into the tower to get a view of Prague. It's awesome!

Old town square. This was a very busy square to visit, made busier as many people come to see the astronomical clock, which is beautiful. The square is a hive of activity, street entertainers, wedding parties, and a lovely place to people watch.

Centrally located!. One of the nicer things about my recent visit to Prague was the proximity of the major attractions to each other in Old Town. While I was planning my trip I must admit to having some anxiety about getting around on the tram system. No need to worry-everything in Stare Mesto is no more than a ten minute walk away. As a matter of fact, the trams do not operate in the old part of the city. Most streets have become pedestrian oriented.Most of the sights and shops that I wanted to see I ran across simply by perambulating. Touring in a casual state of mind...that is a holiday.
Nice for lunch in the town square. Touristy spot in the town square. The food and service are good enough when you need a break. Nothing special.
Prestonman. The buildings are lovely. Lots of choices regarding where to eat. There is usually some street theatre and the surrounding area is buzzing.
Lovely time. I loved the old town. It's lined from side to side with shops, restaurants and of course the iconic buildings and astronomical clock. Watch out for segways!
Amazing. Such a brilliant place. The atmosphere was amazing. Loads of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. The architecture was amazing as well.

Fantastic. The eclectic architecture of this city is pure beauty, gothic, baroque and art nouveau live together in perfect harmony. It's a city where you cannot stop looking up in wonder... All buildings have something to mesmerize your soul.

nice walk in the morning. it is nice to take a walk in the morning. during the day it is crowded and it is hard to experience it. the houses and palaces and churches are beautiful. there is a lot of street performers and small interesting cafes for coffee, breakfast or cake.
Lots to see and do, but eat elsewhere. This was a very bustling square -- definitely a "must see" -- but eat elsewhere. Prices just a block away are much more reasonable.
Great place to visit. Do not forget to visit this part of Prague! You will have fun people watching, shopping, and having fun!
Must visit. I spent two days in old town. It is really amazing place. You will definitly enjoy walking there and making shopping. You will also enjoy staying in the coffee and food shops there.

In a fantasy world. Its like those fairy tale movies or old final fantasy type video games. I like this kind of setting and architecture so I enjoy to walk around. I guess its a romantic setting also. I only come to Prague in Summer and it really is a nice area to walk around on a sunny day. Tourist prices in the pubs/clubs etc so beware on that though. But doesnt cost anything to walk through :)
for young and old,all of you will find beauty in this city :). It just breaths with history there is soo much to see and in each corner you will find something intersting.It's breath taking city.
Wondeful atmosphere. The buzz, the people, the clock tower. The food in the restaurants and generally just the whole experience.
Happening Place. Its a proper tourist place. You find lots of tourist & some kind of activity going on. Its worth visiting this place daily you are in Prague
Beautiful but crowded. Very beautiful and charming but absolutely swarming with tourists. I'd definitely recommend going but maybe try going at dawn or something, when there's less people around?

Nice to walk through. Everything overpriced. . A great way to spend an afternoon. The food and souvenirs are all way overpriced, walk a few streets over to find quality yet less expensive restaurants and souvenirs.
So much to see. Loads of great architecture and places to eat. Very busy area with a great buzz and plenty going on.
Nice old town. Nice but very crowded with people. Nice gift shops and ice cream parlour. Stay away from pick pocketers. Try ice cream for sure.

busy. well indicated, cheap food and beer, good concerts
do not go there july-august, too many people, tourists on the street
they put a bigger price when I bought cherries from the market

Dont do it without a tour. We walked around here for a couple of days but ended up doing the Free Royal Walk Tour and couldn't recommend that enough as we really took in the depth of history that this place is about.
Walk through here to experience . Come through here to experience the architecture and the atmosphere. Can be a nice change to the busy main roads that surround the town.

Busy, busy, busy. My wife and I are just back from a 4 day visit to Prague. The old town is beautiful with many lovely buildings. It is a very busy place with lots of people trying to take pictures of the sight and the inevitable 'selfies'.It is difficult to say when is the best time to visit but around about 5.30 - 7.30 it feels a bit quieter.

Old World Charm at its brilliant best!. Right next to the Astronomical Tower and the Old Town hall, you are suddenly transported back to the medevial era. This is the place where you can experience the charms of the old world and also see several historic landmarks through the ages.

Marvellous job in restoration but retaining the atmosphere. A maze of street and court yards all in filled with activity. There are crowds of people but the Old Town absorbs them with ease. Most styles of architecture are evident and seem to blend in together. There are many interesting shops as well as the usual tourist traps. It is just a lovely experience to find various ways to walk down to the river.
An atmosphere all of its own. This must be the most tourist crowded square of any city and why? It is just simply beautiful and cannot be missed.

fantastic. A must see on your Prague visit. You can enjoy the every minutes of fun and laughter of the Square. Just wander around this delightful area. The old town square is where the astronomical clock is situated and wait till it strikes the hour.

Beautiful - Especially When Sunny!. Old Town Square is undeniably beautiful, especially when the sun is shining. However, what made this square stand out in comparison to others is the fact that there is always something going on here - whether it be people singing, dancing etc. There's also plenty of places to eat, drink and shop although beware that these are somewhat more expensive than other less-touristy areas.

The Lunar & Universal Clock. Make sure you take time out and visit the Old Town Square.
Admire the Lunar and Universal Clock and the history which surrounds these master timepieces.
Must visit. Such a vibrant and historical spot. A must see on your Prague visit. It was made even more interesting by the informative facts shared by our free walking tour guide.

Fascinating old town. This was one of the best old towns I have ever visited. I loved everything about it, I kept walking and walking and could not have enough. It makes you feel like you lived there before. That's a great feeling.

Great Place to meet. The Old Town Square is a great place to meet, as it would seem that no matter where you go you are never more than a ten minute walk from the Old Town Square. If you are meeting anyone in Prague or if there is anything going on in Prague it would seem that this is the place. We were only there six days and we walked everywhere but nearly always either started out from or ended up in the Old Town Square. There are Bars and Restaurants all around the square all catering for every age and every budget. Great atmosphere in the evenings around ten o'clock

Stare Mesto wandering. Just wander around this delightful area & soak up the old world ambience. Something interesting around every corner - churches, buildings, history. When you get tired grab a local beer in the central square.

a must in your prague visit. The square is full of life anytime of the day, specially ejoyable in sunny days. With friends, couple or alone with a great book, just sit there and stay a while. You can see the astronomical clock show each o'clock, visit the tyn cathedral for free, take maps from the info office, and do the free tours of the city (i recomend the purple colour, in spanish though!). To go up the tower avbsolutly worht it (you have a reduction if you are a sudent!). I fell in love with this place. Only one thing not good: the subways! they run fast all over the square and doesnt fit the atmospehere of the place.

Beautiful and historic. The Old City has a lot of history; it is one of the few cities that were not destroyed during World War II. There are tons of tourists and lots to see so a guided tour is probably best.
Wonderful. Quite compact and filled with tourist especially in the evenings. Most of the sights are located within walking distance leading to the Charles Bridge. Beware of pickpockets and drunks.

like going back in time. The old town square is where the astronomical clock is situated, when you step into the old town square, you will see little stalls selling souvenirs and food, horse drawn carriages and street artists. Excellent place to eat, but can be expensive compared to places off the tourists' main track.

A must see. Great vibe in the square but tons of tourist. Some nice restaurants surrounding however beware of the pricing, they actually state on their menus that sitting outside costs about 50% more than sitting inside the restaurants. The old astronomical clock runs every hour, but nothing significant so really not missing much if you don't see it.

Old Town Square. No doubt can get very crowded at times. Go early in the morning when the square is coming to life or later in the evening as things are settling down. Explore all the laneways that lead to new sights and areas. A great central point to many key attractions and atmosphere is fun even when busy.It is really a MUST see for all visitors to Prague although difficult to see how it would be avoided with so may beautiful buildings and of course the clock tower.
Take a walk into History. The architecture and sights were easily found in this pedestrian city. There are so many interesting buildings and shops.

Nice Place to visit. i was there on December and it was too cold. very lovely place to visit . but at the winter we need to go to toilets . unfortunately this place there are no toilettes public. a hotel nearby serves the toilets but we have to pay.second thing is prague you should NEVER NEVER change money from out side vendors. because the Russian currency and Czech is apparently very close. but not the same value. so be careful and use a bank or an agent for change currency.

The heart of Prague. The hub of the old town has it all- great buildings,loads of restaurants,tourist tat,cobbled stones,the astronomical clock....Wander around a bit for the more atmospheric streets off it,particularly at night where the lamps light up narrow alleyways- that was the bit I enjoyed with my camera.

Quirky maze of entertainment. Bustling maze of streets with entertainers,places to eat,shops and lovely buildings.Music in the main square with the astronomical clock to admire and wait till it strikes the hour!!gorgeous roof top bar with fantastic views.
Strolling. Beautiful place that has so much history and wonderful places to see and visit, or just sit on the square and admire the crowds.

Beautiful Old Town Square, Prague. Never knew there would be such a beautiful place. It a tourist MUST visit place. Atmospheric Clock as landmark, shop till drop for brands all along the streets : Prada, Gucci, Rimowa, Hugo Boss, Jimmy Choo, Louis Vuitton, Dior, Porche...etcIf have time, experience for a horse ride or in classic old fashion car. Packed with tourist during summer time. Can see many artists doing show in the square from time to time. so many cafe, restaurant to rest your foot anytime.Wonderful trip!
Beautiful Place. Loved all the world charm, didn't care for some of the street performers. Say its a bad place for pick pockets, we didn't have any issues but we followed the guidelines to be safe.

Photo Op With Every Step. My husband is an amateur photographer who absolutely loved the Old Town of Prague for all of the photo ops he encountered. Great place to walk and just soak in the incredible architecture of the buildings lining the area. Food, drinks, shopping, photo ops, the Old Town has something for everyone!
Good expirience. The city especially the old town how people keep it and earn money on that many restaurant good food many nice people of course the old town himself
Prague. This hotel was very close to all the shops and restaurants. It was about a 5 minute walk to the Atmospheric Clock and the stores that sell Bohemian Cut Crystal

Of all the touristy places in the world, this is one of them. But go there, anyway. Seriously. There's a reason tourist traps are tourist traps. Because they are worth seeing. I go to Prague as often as I can, which is sometimes four times a year. And I still go to Stare Mesto. Why? Because it is drop-dead gorgeous. One of the prettiest town squares in the world, in the most beautiful city in the world. At least that's what it says here.

Wonderful place as long as you don't only walk Karlova. (main route to Charles bridge). Excellent part of the city, with small, narrow alleyways everywhere. Some are dead ends while others are really surprising. So some times a shortcut isn't always a shortcut, but no worries, good tip: When you're in the old town, look up and see if you can see TYN for example, then you know where you are. Besides, "getting lost" is nice here, since there are small shops almost everywhere.
Old town. Old European square. Astronomical clock is amazing. Singing and dancing in the square until the wee hours.

Memorable. The Old Town is beautiful. It was well worth the trip, although all the curio shops are exactly the same and like any popular destination, price of food and drink, more. All the same I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The architecture is stunning with cobbled streets. Looking forward to a return visit. Only downside, the ice cream venders serve the smallest scoops! which were expensive.

The oldest part of the City.. The most famous sights of Prague are located in the Old City , including the Old Town Square ( Staroměstské náměstí ) and the Prague Astronomical Clock . Through the magnificent Charles Bridge , the Old Town is connected with Mala Strana. Besides many monumental buildings there is a large variety of restaurants, cafes, plazas and intimate shopping streets.

Incredible Christmas markets. What a great place to see just before Christmas with the markets! Very interesting WWII history as well. Not to mention parts of Mission Impossible starring Tom Cruise were shot here and in many other places in Prague!

Most scenic European city. It is probably one of the most scenic european cities. You can walk around town in a day. The old town square is a good place to start and walk from there. Beware of pick pockets though.
Beautiful place. breathtaking def overwhelming love it try the food on the little stands on the side amazing. The famous clock is on the side of the tower it is notas big but it is def impressive.
Prettiest old towns. A must see for all tourists - one of the prettiest old towns in Europe. Do check out the jewish quarters and the clock tower ;)

Good for a wander. This is one of the main "areas" - the name sort of gives it away. The buildings in general are very impressive and I'm not big on that sort of thing - but credit where credit is due - the city on the whole is very beautiful.

Recommend Getting Lost. Best to see early morning or late evening once the crowds (there can be lots) from the tour groups and river cruises have departed. Try hard to get off the main walking paths and see the city and there you will find great places to eat, drink, shop and watch the people that make the city fun. Take a walking map, your GPS phone and get lost.

Old Town square. It is lovely to walk around all the little lanes around the Old Town, there is sometimes live entertainment on in the square. If you want to see the Astronomical Clock chime make sure you arrive about 5-10 minutes before the hours as it does get busy. If eating try to find somewhere off the square for a more authentic meal.

Very good. . Seens like Prague has never been touched since the old times. The architecture and buildings are awesome and the restaurants in the middle of the square makes it look even better. Worth the visit to the center and heart of Prague.
one of the most beautiful place in the world. it's very nice to walk in this position. the shops are expensive but you have to visit this place to see the clock and enjoy a coffee break
old town. well worth taking some time to wonder the side streets here and have a drink ,,,,lovely. from the old square to the river is a lovely walk in the evening

50th birthday 4 day break. Brilliant place too visit so much too see and do !!! Lots of bars restaurants etc which all cater for everyone. The shops are good too even for those that don't do shopping. The only down side is there are a lot of beggars which some are quite scary !!!
Beautiful Winding Streets. Loved the feel of the old town with the winding streets and old buildings. Lots to look at and yummy sausages to sample.

Old Town. Sightseeing old architecture, great restaurants... take a boat ride or visit the castles. There is a delicious vegan restaurant and half block away from the hotel, fantastic food!!!! ATM also half block away...

Be Young in Old Town. I loved the Old Town square of Prague. The music, restaurants and street food are fun and diverse. The cinnamon chimney cakes are really yummy. At night the Square comes alive with young people, lights and music.

Architecturally Top Level. Prague is to my wife and me the most beautiful and fascinating of Eastern European cities. Fortunately for Prague it never had to endure being bombed during WWII, except for one American mistake when it was confused with Dresden. Almost every building has architectural distinction. The history of the interactions among the Czechs, Germans and Jews is a thumbnail sketch of the modern struggle to integrate diverse cultural groupings.If I were visiting, I would not stay in the old town, but the much more active and interesting other side of the river.

WOW! Most beautiful city area in Europe. We thought the old city in Vienna was gorgeous but the old city area around the river (either side) is spectacular. It is SO well preserved and not as over-cleaned, over-styled and packed with Designer stores as in Vienna. It feels more real for lack of a better term. Cross the Charles bridge from the south (Old City) and the other end is like walking into a town 500 years ago. Much too crowded during peak tourist season of course, especially on weekends. Would be ideal in March or September perhaps, when it would be less packed with tour groups. (See my other review about the Charles Bridge for a hint of a perfect viewing spot, high up above the crowds). Everywhere we walked, it was WOW! We'd turn a corner, look up, and another WOW!

Very vital part. I like it so much, very vital area, tourists are everywhere, luxury fashion shops, restaurants, coffeeshops, crystal shops, & souvenirs.. Many monuments & the Jewish quarter is few steps from the old town.. Sure you will not miss this area on your visit to prague
Awesome Architecture. Great architecture in the surrounding buildings. Lots of tourists in the area though, which can make taking good pictures troublesome.

Wonderful atmosphere. It was great to be surrounded by so many beautiful buildings over such a wide area. There is always lots going on in the main square and it has large numbers of open air restaurants.
Prague Old Town (Stare Mesto). Classic Old European town square. Beautiful! Restaurants, shops; plenty of options. See the incredible astrological clock.

Prague Perfection. Old Town Prague is always bustling with activity , The streets are clean and all the buildings are well preserved . Should you find your way to the old town square you will find great eating places , entertainment in the form of buskers and beautifully preserved buildings . The astronomical clock is a must see . My advice to those wanting to photograph the clock minus the hoards or tourists is to go around 6 am in the morning . There are generally a few people around with the same purpose in mind but it will give you the opportunity to photograph it minus 100s of unknown people . The same goes for the Charles Bridge. While visiting the square or the entrance to the Charles Bridge on the Lesser Town side you will notice vintage cars that are available for hire , including the driver for around 50 Euro . This is a great way to see the city of Prague in style . The driver will take you from the square up to the castle and back while sightseeing all the places in between . Great way for an introductory crash course . I found that the store owners , buskers , etc are not too pushy . You never feel overwhelmed by them . They don't get irritated if you don't tip them , even though it is appreciated when you do . Everyone we spoke to from Prague showed great pride in their city . This all helped to create a wonderful holiday experience . I would highly recommend Prague to all . One good piece of advice -take good walking shoes !
great shows and great area. in this area you will watch great show by street musician (like Bohemian Bards which I like the most) and you will enjoy the Gothic atmosphere and the astronomical clock

Awesome shopping and dining. The many restaurants along the edge of the square all seemed delicious, and I highly recommend El Toro Negro for a great lunch. There are so many shopping opportunities, but the prices, because of the touristy location are very high. I would also highly recommend going up into the tower in the center of the square, which provides great views of the city's twisting streets and famous landmarks.

Absolutely fantastic! . This is a must see when going to Prague. The Astronomical clock is amazing at night time as it's lit up. Do be aware of pick pockets in the dark though. When I visited there was an Alphonse Mucha exhibition opposite, which was great. Slightly pricey, but it had lots of original works and they didn't seem to mind you taking photos which I liked. Generally, just wandering around and taking in the atmosphere and amazing architecture can take hours and there's so much to see :)

Everything you want. The Old Town is a large walkable area. The Town Square is there with all of its restaurants, entertainment etc. Close by are multiple shopping areas - one street with the high priced stores - Prada etc. - another leading in the other direction with H&M type prices. In a third direction are more restaurants and the Charles Bridge. You can easily spend days here walking around - stopping to watch entertainment, having a drink or an ice cream while at the same time soaking in the beauty and history all around you.

Interesting place. Take the time to stroll around this area, the cobbled streets seem to join each other and there are lots of colourful little shops offering different things of interest. Lots of opportunities to take photos of this beautiful place to remind you of your visit. Prague is indeed a beautiful city. The new town surrounds the Old Town, isn't that interesting?

A Must to Stare. Cities come alive in their public spaces and are defined by them. This ancient space has been a focus of life, promenading and civic activity for centuries. At the intersection of roads and lanes it unfolds into grandeur, overlooked by an imposing gothic church, a grand tower and a wealth of restaurants, galleries and shops. So this is the ancient centre and its a must see.
Amazing. Exceptionally well restored and maintained. Most of Prague's parts are really beautiful, but the Old Town is indeed something exceptional

Very entertaining square. The square is full of fun entertainment and the cafes are lovely don't miss the clock and take a stroll through the Jewish quarter. the architecture is amazing and the sidewalks works of art in themselves

of course you must see it. Old town in Prague is one of the nicest in whole Europe. Perfectly preserved, very well taken care of, colorful, vivid, just splendid. Narrow streets, small passages, secret places, elegant boutiques, restaurants and beer gardens. Alltogether that makes a unique ambience. Of course you must see it

Always Eclectic Acts. Fun to go down to old town square anytime, but in the evening is more entertaining to have something to drink at one of the sidewalk restaurants and watch people. Always eclectic acts going on.

Beautiful City. Really enjoyed Prague, Old town is beautiful, I loved the spires. We enjoyed sitting on an evening in a restaurant in the old town opposite the clock having out meal and drinks watching the world go by
Nice. Prague is a beautiful city with lots of atractions. The old town is crowded with tourists nut def a sight to see.I love Prague.

Best part in Prague!. I was in Prague for 4 days, and every day i returned in Stare Mesto! The architecture is overwhelming, the streets are filled with delicious boutiques, tourists everywhere, very cosmopolitan!
Lovely atmosphere beautiful buildings and shops. Love the old town atmosphere, wear good shoes as cobble streets hard on the feet, lots of walking to see everything.
Majestic. Thw old town square has a beautiful architecture which must be seen if you are visiting prague. The square is very colourful and lively with live performances and bustling crowd.
Fascinating old town. This is a wonderful area to walk around in Prague with so much history, beautiful buildings and lots of restaurants.

History. The hidden squares and markets to be found off the main walk ways. Also the variety of shops. You can walk to the canals and visit the bridges that cross them and learn of their history and relationship to Prague. The square with the Astrological Clock is a must see. This clock was built almost 1000 years ago, and is a remarkable piece of engineering.

A Real, Baroque Town. There's nothing like the Old Town of Prague to conjure up all that is beautiful, Baroque and wholly mid-European. Just wandering the streets, day and night, transports one back in time, to the 16th, 17th, 18th or 19th Centuries. One can only imagine what the city must have been like in its "hey-day" when Mozart, Bach and Beethoven were roaming its streets and the elegant carriages of their patrons were rumbling over the cobblestones! Yes, this part of Prague evokes another time and place, one that we've all seen in period "Hollywood costume dramas" or in Disney movies. It's all here, there and around every corner. Explore, get lost and take in the atmosphere of this amazing real, vibrant and old part of Prague.

Must see in Prague. The old town is fun but crowded in the beginning of June...I cannot imagine summer...watch out for pickpockets like anywhere crowded..see the astronomical clock and learn first about what is does and how old it is...

marvellous. This town is a open-air museum,: the old town with the Grand-Place, the very smart Pariska but also in other streets whoseAll the houses are beautiful for people who like the architecture of the beginning of 20th century...Don't miss MUCHA's museum in new old Town for a meet with a painter of the czech spirit... Worthseing to : Josefska with the jewish old streets , their Synagogues and especially the old Jewish cemetery (the audioguides gave us good explanations in our linguage to find the most famous stones , lost in this labyrinth of tombs ) The tavern Kolonial in this area serve local and international food .very good and good prices!The walk I do prefer is to start at CHARLES BRIGDE and go on the quays along the river til you see the GINGERand FRED HOUSE as they tall tjis modern glass inclined building you see on the left All the houses are worthseing with their statues,,the deircorations of their facades " Art Nouveau".Prague is a real museum in the open-air ...
Alive. Plenty of things to do here, from shopping to eating to sightseeing. Walk around and take in the culture.

A must visit for anyone coming to Prague. This is the best area to stay in the city, as it is surrounded by any good restaurants and places to shop. It is also beautiful, with a wonderful atmosphere. Don't miss the changing of the clock in the square.

Very pleasant. Old Town is a lovely place to walk around, especially on Sunday when there are street musicians and performers and a fun atmosphere. If you are looking for Czech made items, go to Manufaktura and vendors on the Charles Bridge.

Watch out for pick pockets. Lots to see and do, just be mindful that pick pockets are here in droves. If you're a guy - strongly considering picking up one of those man purses that everyone seems so fond of over there.

don't miss it. like: the historical buildings, churches and many local shops
dislike: too many tourists, too crowded
Fantastic Architecture. Really fascinating experience, the architecture is absolutely amazing and there is loads of lovely bars and restaurants in old town, A definite must if visiting Prague

Very photogenic. The square is great for taking some holiday snaps. My friends and I also stopped off at a cafe and an english bar situated behind the church. We visited in winter and the snow just made it even more scenic.
lovely place to visit. there are lots of places to eat and drink very cheaply. It feels very safe walking around at all times, quite a heavy but friendly police presence.
Absolutely lovely. A real nice way to wander around and take in the atmosphere and surrounds. Buzzing place to site eat and drink!
Wonderful. The old city is wonderful, the buildings, the atmosphere, the street artists.. the cobblestones invite you to walk around and get lost in Prague.
Wow!. We were enchanted by this amazing place. The architecture in this place is jaw dropping. There are cafes to sit and enjoy the atmosphere sites.
