Good Location. I stayed in the Old Town and found it convenient for restaurants, shopping, and general positive energy. It was fun. There are a lot of tourists and they hang out around the clock tower/astrological clock, so be prepared for humungous crowds. However, I loved being in this location and would happily stay in the area again.
Excellent walking. Really nice to walk around the Old Town and see the sights, especially the square. Food and drink is considerably cheaper than other European squares too.

fairytail. Prague is the coziest city in Europe! It is worth to see at every season of the year! During the summer I like to take the boat and to look at the old city from the river. During the spring and autumn it is really nice to attend different excursions even if you live in Prague.During the winter just walking and drinking hot wine and do shopping for the Christmas
The Best. One of kind...very beautiful, fascinating, the most beautiful alive city in the world i definitely going back there again.

Stare Mesto. A beautiful and historically rich part of the city, well punctuated with cafes, bars and eateries. There is so much to see and do that you could spend weeks here and still not get through everything!
Nice view and atmospher . Going up the tower is fun for kids.My five year old daughter loved the telescope on top of the tower.Very touristic and packed with people of all ages.

Historic and cosmopolitan. The old town consists of the main square and narrow lanes containing souvenir shops , bars and restaurants and historic houses all very interesting along with this are the wider roads with all the designer shops. All this area is accessible by foot
Nice Old Town. So much to see and do here. May be too touristy but that's the heart of Prague so that's understandable.

Old Town is made for walking. Just walk! That is my advice to Prague tourists, because Old Town and most other tourist spots are within reasonable walking distance of one other. Keep in mind that this is a medieval city. There are trams and even a subway, but "tourist" Prague is made for walking, not riding, especially for the keen - eyed visitor who enjoys poking around in out of the way places that surprise and delight. .

Stunning sights. Excellent area, with so much to see and do. Don't forget to look up to see the beautiful architecture. It can get very busy and the food around is expensive, so I tended to go to a little quite side street to eat. A definite must see!

Stunning Old Town!. Atmosphere is charming in the day and magical at night! Something for everyone .. kids will enjoy the various shows going on at all times .. music, dance, magic shows, jugglers etc. Adults can soak in the atmosphere .. great food and drink options all around. Watch out of the Segways .. and of course the hourly chimes of the Clock tower are always fun to watch
Crowded with life :). Swarmed with happy people, street artist, outdoor servings and lots of impressing architecture and buildings. A must go place when visiting Prague!

Watch out. Beautiful and historical.
A place where you could sit and do some people watching with a trdelnilk in hand.
Watch out for segways and pocket pickers!
Very lively. Lots to do and see. Beautiful old buildings, cobbled streets, olde worlde atmosphere with a buzz, lots of choice of restaurants and shops.

Never ending love with Gothic notes. AS for my Prague is a perfect place for few days runaway for calm and Gothic romantic atmosphere not standing with that mostly it's a business travel for me. Almost perfectly saved old city with numerous historical sightseeing's will be interesting for tourism lovers, nice cafes for hipsters and alike ) old churches and temples for god-seekers or prayers and restaurants for those who admires tasty and harmful food with awesome no-other place mat BEER ))AS well nightlife has all scale of seductions for those who are interested.
Place to go.. Great place for sitting and chilling. Watch the world go by. Very busy place with so much happening.

Full of energy . This area of Prague is great, we were so glad our hotel was just around the corner from it. The area around the stare mesto is always vibrant with plenty of free entertainment. If the weather is good then this is a nice place to sit and soak up the atmosphere whilst looking at the surrounding beautiful architecture.

One of the kind. You can walk for hours there and discover new things. Stop for beer and knedliki ,have a shot of becherowka and walk again. There are very cool wine places around as well, I would try one of those.
Full of history and charm. Can be crowded but worth it for the charm, avoid souvenier shopping from overtly touristy shops and do go for the smaller interesting boutiques
Free walking Tour with guide Angela. It was a great tour.Angela was really amazing. Funny and a lot of historical facts.I would do a tour a tour with her again!!!

Free Walking Tour with Guide Angela. An awesome tour, leading along many sights of prague's old town. Our tour guide, Angela, has been an awesome guide, making us learn a lot about prague, bohemia and its history. The tour is totally free and worth every single minute!

Lived it!. We loved the Old Town. We went up the tower as well, the views are just amazing. The clock is very good to see although it does only last for about a minute when it chimes. The restaurants around it are slightly over priced. We ate in one and got charged per person were eating there on top of the service charge.

The Heart of the city!. You cannot come to Prague without visiting Old Town. As I mention in the title, it is the heart of the city! There are tons of things to see and do, and would highly recommend visiting or even lodging there. (I highly recommend The Intercontinental Hotel!)

Old Town Square with lots of modern fun!. There is year-round outdoor dining at the many restaurants rimming the square (thanks to gas area heaters and lots of umbrellas). We stood in amazement at the Astronomical Clock. How is it possible? There are a lot of high-end shops on the Square, and plenty of affordable tourist shops as well. Follow any narrow street leading off the Square to find excellent jazz venues. Evening and night time on the Square makes it feel like 1989 all over again!

Very busy square. Range of street theatre and atmosphere. Restaurants tend to be more expensive than just a little out of town. Astronomical clock is very pretty but it's done and over so quickly, it's a little over rated

STEPPING BACK IN TIME. The heart of Prague's historic city center was a wonder to behold. We stayed in a small apartment just a few blocks away and walked in, around and through Stare Mesto a number of times every day. Whether day or night, sunshine or rain, on a clear day or through a morning mist, it was a joy just to be there.

absolutely stunning !. If you never been to Praga (in English - Prague) then definitely go see it. Old part of the city is a short trip on the tram from the airport (make sure you stamp your tram ticket in special machines installed inside tram carriages, otherwise you will be fined if controller catches you...)Gorgeous old town will blow your breath away, so will do the famous castle, located on the other side of the river. There is also very interesting Jewish area so make sure you don't miss it.However if you want reasonably priced food avoid the are where the famous old clock is - they are crazy expensive compare to restaurants located 15min walk away so have a look first.
Lovely Neighborhood. The buildings are simply beautiful and the neighborhood walkable, though take it slow on the cobblestones!

Marvelous place - don't ever take taxis. Taxi prices are too high and drivers will even take longer ways only to charge you more! Once you are in Old Town, New Town or Mala Strana, you can easily walk everywhere. Metro and trams can also be used even when carrying luggage, because there are escalators and lifts.
Nice. the architecture is beautiful. Some very goo restaurants. A good starting place with other attractions very nearby.
Beautiful. Take a chance to visit this place, everything about it marvelous. It is a masterpiece of urban architecture from the past.
great views while walking around town. If you can, stay in old town so you can walk everywhere. We stayed at the hilton and it was perfectly located

Must visit . There is a lot to see at the old town square. It's a big square and can get crowded at times, especially in front of the astronomical clock. If you don't like crowds get here just past the hour as most people will move on after seeing the 12 apostles on the clock that come out every hour. One day we also passed through around 8.30am and there weren't many people around. I recommend going up the tower for better views of the square and also the city.
Go in the morning, beat the crowds. You can have a great time strolling the streets if you can beet the crowds - go early in the morning and enjoy.

Walking Tour. So much to see in the Square from the architecture to the Astronomical Clock to the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn. A great vib in the Square but would not want to be there at the height of the tourist season if this is how full it gets in May! all credit to Prague for being such a popular tourist destination. It deserves its place as somewhere on needs to see.RegardsBob& Lynne Adey (Malta)

Like Paris in Eastern Europe. Prague is wonderfull. Especially in evening, when lights are on... beautifull churches, the amazing Karol Bridge and City hall tower with the clock. Nice restaurants and brilliant beer.

Wonderful Old Prague Square. If there is one place that all tourists congregate, it is the Old Town Square in the centre of old Prague.It teems with tourists, small and large groups. Cafes and restaurants do a roaring trade. Tours leave from points around the Square.It can be enjoyed at any time during the day or night.The square features various architectural styles including the Gothic Church of Our Lady before Týn which has been one of the main churches since the 14th century. Prague Orloj is a medieval astronomical clock located at the Old Town Hall with the clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.Among many churches, the Baroque St. Nicholas Church and the tower at the Old Town Hall offers fabulous views over the Old Town. An art museum of the Czech National Gallery is located in Kinský Palace.It is worth enjoying the Square early in the morning or at dusk as the buildings light up and illuminate the glorious history the Prague offers.

Beautiful old city full of life and history. You find yourself thrust back in time in the middle of a large square. You see a large cathedral, the town hall with a clock tower and glockenspiel, many shops and restaurants and lots of local people entertaining in various ways hoping the tourists will show their appreciation with money. Streets enter the square from all sides in no particular patterns. Every hour the glockenspiel goes off but it's seems to end very soon after it starts. It's kind of disappointing. All in all its well worth visiting.
Gorgeous Square and Great shopping. That said - don't waste your time buying souvenirs, because the same shops are in the airport! with the exception of Moser. But we saw a few we recognized.
Lots going on. Food stalls, famous clock towwer and don't miss the Bohemian Bards if they are there. Can be quite crowded though.
Historic old town. Beautiful, but very crowded. When we visited, which was on a weekend, there were so many other visitors that it was difficult to enjoy the beauty
Can easily spend 2 or 3 days exploring. Best to get accommodations in old town and walk your way through history and fabulous sights.Only dislike was price for everything including WCs everywhere

A must visit in Prague. A trap for tourists who all wait for ages for the Astronomical clock to strike on the hour. The door at the top opens and the 12 apostles pass by before the door shuts again as the skeleton rings a bell. As I say a must see but a bit of an anti climax, especially if you have waited for ages. But the cobbled square is nice, with plenty of restaurants, often a jazz band playing. They also hold many festivals there with nice wooden stalls.

Touristic square. You won't find any czech people here, but the ones trying to sell you something.Anyway, you have the astronomical clock there and good views in this spacious area, so it's really nice to get a trdelnik in one of the stands and take a walk around in a fresh night.

Time Travel. If you could time travel, this is where it seems to happen! The quaint streets and shops are full of wonderful things to discover. Be aware of the toursits traps. There are many souveniers that are much cheaper in the streets further out from the Old Town. If you want to buy any "Mole" or "Krtek" cartoon character memorabilia, buy it in a general toy store like "Sparky's" to get a better price
Really interesting to look at the buildings. Loved the age and look of the old city, very, very crowded with tourists,school children. Shops were full of cheap souvenir stuff.
awesome. loaded with history and incredible architecture. traditional czech cuisine was amazing and delicious. The Astronomical Clock in Old Town Square is a MUST see

Beautiful city.. We loved visiting this city. We were here for 5 days. It is all very beautiful and so much fun. One of our favorites was walking on the Charles Bridge. Don't let the crowds keep you away. Before 10 am is a good time to visit. Metronome park was another favorite area. The view is fabulous and it is an easy walk with all those steps. There are lots of things to do here. We didn't get them all done.
centuries old.. For me, second most historic attraction. The communist s wisely maintained this jewel. Many, many fellow tourists there. Have lunch in old town. Its a nifty experience

A must see. If you're going to Prague you have to visit the Old Town. It is beautiful with lots of character, lots to see and lots to do. Make sure you try a trdelnik from one of the local vendors. They're super good!

fantastic city. When you entertainer Stare Mesto you will discover all the beautyful buildings in the streets. Fantastic decorated and All so well restored. Try the man restaurants and the fantastic drak beer.Sit and look at the people on the streets and enjoy the atmosphere.
Very nice. Historical and very pretty town square. A place to do tours from and lots of hustle and bustle around the place.
Magical. Architecture and preservation of old structures is on amazing level. Restaurants have good offers for more or less fair prices.

beautiful area. great buildings and sites to see.
Charles bridge and the Palace.
lovely atmosphere there and everyone so friendly and helpfull
Beautiful, colorful and lively. Loved just roaming around the old town. Most lively old towns in Europe I have been to! Streets with loads of interesting shops!
Cosy, harmonious and vivid. One of the most beautiful and harmonious Old Towns I've seen! And has the same cosy small town feeling about it though being in a large city, well quite crowded, too.

Beautiful cobbled streets and pavements, imposing Art Nuoveau facades.. Wear proper walking shoes, bring a blister kit, because you will walk and walk! However, it has plenty for everyone, no matter your age or your interests. The Astronomical Clock is charming. Look up good restaurants in the area on this website, otherwise the area is chock full of touristy places.
great place. old town has alot of good places to eat the food was good in all the places we ate at there was nothing we disliked about old town theres a tram that will take you to the castle
Must see in Prague. Fascinating walk back in time. Wear shoes with the thickest possible treads for the cobblestones or you will bruised and battered but the Old Town is such a gem.
Historic. Historical place, lots of people all year long, mostly tourists. Great place to see old Prague, markets with wide range of budget

Prague on foot. There are so many sights to see. The food on the square is great as well. You never have to go into a restaurant.
The exchange rate is awesome too. You don't have to spend much money to enjoy a lot.

Wonderful historical buildings, churches, areas close to Charles Bridge.. We walked quite a bit and it was enjoyable seeing the many shops, museums, churches and restaurants.
We enjoyed a concert by a string quartet.
Easter visit. Beautifully decorated for Easter season. Great food. Easy to navigate. Especially enjoyed the chocolate museum.

beautiful old part of Prague, interesting square. Great part of Prague, lots of history. Clock chimes on the hour and is worth capturing on video...good vantage point - outdoor restaurant with heater that serves delicious Goulash soup in large hollowed out bread roll. However, lots of interesting stall selling food, eg BBq Pork, type of ring doughnut. Easy to get Segway here, negotiate the price and time. Good to start a walking tour here with a guide. Lots of interesting shops, bought some pretty jewellery here. Good value in February as not so many visitors.

A Must Foodie Experience!. Prague is full of fantastic restaurants so enjoy them all, but I have to say my best food experience was the Old Town Square. Read about the attractions elsewhere but my best experience was visiting the food vendors on the square near the Astronomical Clock. I was roaming around looking for a place to eat and ended up at a vendor roasting a pig over an open flame. They cut off a hunk, weigh the plate and, toss on a wedge of bread. Everything thing seems to come with bread their. I also had a local Pilsner and went to one of the bar top tables nearby and just watched the hundreds of people going by or the various entertainers. All totaled it was something like $6US. The tables are shared by other locals and tourists and it is a great way to meet people. The food was great, the people better and with a feel of centuries gone by no better place to hang out. If you prefer a sausage, there are options. My friend had a kielbasa, also served with a hunk of bread. Don't like beer? Have some hot wine. Kids? Have a local sweet called a Trdlenik. I don't effusively write about eating experience but if you are in Prague, do as I did. Skip the tourists "value" menus, roll up your sleeves, grab a plate and take it the sites and sounds. I promise you will enjoy it.

Cobbled streets and lots to see!. Its lovely wandering around the cobbled streets of the old town and absorbing the atmosphere of this busy, beautiful city. Lots of interesting shops to look in, as well as the tacky tourist ones! Reasonably priced items too - something for everybody.
Dreamy. I liked the old town.The bridges.The castle. The gardens.I didn t like the weather ,when it was raining suddenly and I had no place to be hide.
Beautiful and lively. Buildings were amazing, people watching is always fun. Prices were steep, so probably just have a coffee and eat elsewhere.
beautiful. the old town had a great atmosphere. the absence of much traffic added to the relaxed tone and the castle area was superb.

Old Town.....Beautiful. While in Prague, you need to visit this beautiful area of Prague. Very crowed & busy most days, but it's the Prague experience that you want. Of course it's touristy, but just "go with it". Plus, you can see the very interesting & beautiful Astronomical Clock while in this area!
Kids love the street performers!. While it's a bit crowded in the afternoon I think my children will remember the street performers in the square more than anything else about our trip to Prague.
Like a Fairy Tale. Old Town is amazing, the architecture looks straight out of fairy tale. View is breathtaking and rich in culture and history.

Beautiful Area. I would highly suggest you see this area. It was beautiful. The vendors were very friendly as well.
This is a great place to stop and have a glass of wine of coffee.
Amazing ambience. The old town is fantastic. Quaint buildings. Great atmosphere. Loved it. We loved the restaurants there. The buildings are beautifully kept. A walkers paradise

Awesome. the old town is really something you could live in, very clean, very big and very interesting if you like history. The prices are not that friendly, but that everywhere in the center of the city
busy but interesting. clock striking time is busy with big crowds and tour groups but the square is big and interesting history with little lanes to explore - need a map for Prague !
Beautiful. Prague old town is amazing. It is a lovely town to walk around and enjoy the atmosphere. The beer and food is great.
Don't miss. This is the center of activity in Prague. A wonderful place to have lunch after you see the sights. Enjoy the plaza restaurants and be sure to see the astronomical clock.

Center of it all. near the Karlov Most to go to Mala Strana and up to the castle; along the river, the 14th Century (or thereabouts) with the hourly appearance of the apostles--the center of the wonderful buzz that is this great city, and shopping too, the glassworks, my wife was crazy for the marionettes

Charming. So much history! Enjoyed the ambiance of OldTown. There were many shops and restaurants. Many with open air seating. We were here early in themorningbefore the crowds. We were told that crowds become quite huge as the day goes on.
Very deep and strong feelings. Despite many tourists, it's really magic place to visit. We were walking through all this history and were charming by its real magic atmosphere.
Great place to relax and have a beer. Very typical European square with great cafes, antique buildings, street performers, and excellent people watching. Grab a beer, sit back, and enjoy.

Go there. Mostly packed full of tourists, and twice as expensive as the rest of Prague, but you can explore for hours and find many nice, quiet streets as well as reasonably priced pubs and restaurants. Wherever you go, at least the streets will be beautiful and full of history.

Interesting Experience. We decided to walk from our hotel Lunik and walk through the Old Town to the Charles Bridge and I am so glad we did. We had a detailed street map and via reading the name of the streets we managed it really well.On the way we looked at the shops selling Czch goods plus of course the beautiful glass wear and pottery which remained us of the German Dresden China.We walked across the bridge and had a really lovely cup of coffee at a really nice restaurant. Like most it looked austere from the outside but very homely inside. Also the prices had not been hyped up for the tourists.We walked back along the river and took the most direct road back to our hotel.

Crowded but romantic at night. I love visiting the bridge at night, it's just so romantic with the castle view on top of the hills. We also took a boat trip during the day which was okay as we had walked a lot that day.
Sit and watch. A meeting point , a place to dawdle and explore. Big beautiful and historic . Be there at mid day and gaze at the Asrological clock
crowded bridge. Beautiful bridge but you can barely enjoy it due to the crowds and the street stalls with souvenirs. best to get really early morning!
Magical mini metropolis. Plethora of cultural,activities - Take only the yellow taxis ...Loved the feeling that the city hasn't become over urbanized
great area and square. crowded but worth seeing, easy to find, and hard to miss! THe Clock is really something! Easy place to use as a landmark and lots of history.
Old Town square is a mess. but the rest of the old town is pretty awesome. Especially after dark...or early in the morning, but the tourist crowds on the old town square are a bit too much.
Fantastic. One of the best spots in Prague! I never got tired of it during my visit to Prague. Wonderful central location with loads going on.

Old town square. There is always something happening in the square. The Astronomical Clock made me laugh because I remembered what our tour guide Ion told us the day before on our Sandeman free city tour. It was almost more fun to watch all the other people watch. Most of the entertainment was pleasing. The food made the experience at the square memorable. We made lots of memories.

Fantastic but crowd. Meet your oldest ancestor before you were born in the earth in Old town square. I disliked crowdedness and rudeness for many travelers from far remote coutries. Maybe this disorder would be inenvibitable for trip.

Heartwarming old houses and history. It is absolutely charming to stroll along the narrow streets of Stare Mesto and enjoy the lively athmosphere, I loved the old streets, old houses and the people were awfully nice, although the best restaurants were italian

Old Town Prague. Sightseeing. We were amazed at the architecture. To view the Clock is a must. Charles Bridge was amazing too.
Had boat trip while we were there.

super romantic place!. เมืองเก่าของปราก เป็นเมืองที่โรแมนติคมากๆ ช่วงที่ไปมีร้านขายของเล็กๆตั้งอยู่กลาง old town ใกล้กับหอนาฬิกา ร้านอาหารเยอะมากๆราคาและคุณภาพ+รสชาติอาหารพอๆกันหมด นาฬิกาดาราศาสตร์จะมีรูปปั้น saints ออกมาโชว์ตัวทุกชั่วโมง
went there on April and it was SUPER ROMANTIC place. Very nice for couples. The city itself is beautiful, colorful in the same time. Nice restaurants with, clubs and some art museums. Highly recommended to visit there on evening.

I was not prepared for this level of beauty!!!. I was in Prague for four nights. I literally cried tears when I walked out of the Old Town square for the last time. At first it is so overwhelming, but eventually you examine all the little nooks and crannies and see everything. I was in absolute awe. The Segway people are not allowed to advertise on the square which keeps it so genuine. So they ride around in regular clothes. DO IT!!!! It was the BEST part of my Prague trip... riding the Segway ALL OVER!!! It was easy and so so so so much fun. I could make it go super slow like walking, as I went through crowds of people. I am a 66 year old woman and it saved my legs from walking too much. I did it everyday for three days. Ask for the "Russians" They will take good care of you! They are extremely nice young guys. My guide kept turning around to make certain I was okay and went at my pace. You will find the guys on Segways all over Old Town Square. It is such a fun way to see Prague. I was castled out as I've been traveling for a month, so taking the Segway up to the top was just perfect. Find the hidden garden! A must. It is a little entrance right outside the Malostranska Metro Station. We parked/locked the Segways and went inside to find an exquisite garden with a white peacock! This garden is super beautiful and takes only a minute to see. In old town square behind the TYN church is The Indian Jewel where I ate everyday. It is that good and so easy to find when you are tired. I had NO IDEA Prague would be so fascinating!

LOVELY. you should walk a round, enjoying the street performer, watching the dome and eating the Czech most famous cake (Trdelnik).you can spend as long as you want also you can set at any cafee in the square.

Day trip to remember. I first started on my way to Stare Mesto from the train station, they have lockers for bags, and I only had a day which made this a perfect start. Old town is actually not too far away from the train station, & there is much about the town to soak in along the way. Prague (Old town) is so grand & majestic that you literally forget what is going on (around/in life). I wish I had more time in Prague, but I now have a reason to go back. Everything is awesome! (no puns related to lego movie)
Mesmerising. lovely place to see, so different to what we are used to. Many old buildings and very vibrant . Will be returning
Charm, cafes, and cobble-stones. The Old Town is a charming combination of architectural gems and cobbled streets – truly a walker’s paradise replete with cafes, curious shops, and bookstores.

People watching. Everyone passes through here several times during the day and evening often something going on entertainment etc and if you sit at one of the restaurants a great place to watch other tourists

The heart of Prague. A touristy area close to the Charles Bridge. You can get good exchange rates here for converting Euros into the local currency. Try some of the local street food and gulp a few beers in one of the many cafes.

Best Part of Prague to visit. Walking around old town is amazing a fabulous city with lots of culture.
Lots of historical buildings, shops and cafes loved just walking the streets and soaking up the atmosphere.
If staying in Prague try to stay in old town district much better than other parts of city.
Fairy Tale Like. This is a must see. Even in the rain it is a delightful square with such fun architecture. Don't forget to be at the clock at the top of the hour to watch it "perform".

Old world charm. Has a quaint charm - its a pretty walk around with lots of interesting shops - you can walk right up to the Charles Bridge which bustles with buskers, where you can buy little sketches and some bits and bobs to take back home. There is also an old world tram that takes you on a little tour to the castle, and of course the astronomical clock dominates the landscape
Be prepared to bump into others from looking around!. One thing about this place is you can look in any direction and find something beautiful and interesting to look at! I loved it.
Prague Castle. It was a waste of money paying in. Unless audio there is no information anywhere of the history etc. It's was expensive to get in

A great place to walk around. We walked around here, and even witnessed a pillowfight en mass (bizzare really) I loved it though and would reccomend coming here, especially at Christmas as then you have the Christmas markets, Trdlo are especially nice sweet treats

Best part of the city other than the castle. Lovely to walk around although the signposts to other areas were sometimes difficult to follow. best to ask if you get confused otherwise you could walk for hours! Weather was great so very comfortable to walk around without coats.

Quaint, Busy, but with plenty of options. Of course, it's a must see/do when visiting Prague. It's a very busy place there, but if you can stand the hordes of people there, there are some live shows/entertainment taking place there that may be of interest to you. As with any other high-traffic tourist place, the immediate area of shops and restaurants are pricier - worth walking a few blocks in, in any direction, to get something of equal or even better quality, a stone throw away. Bring very comfortable shoes as just about every passage/walkway is cobblestoned. At night, Prague is known to be central Europe's party centre - so there will be some drunkenness and people walking with beer bottles in their hand - although at peak times and crowds, there is local police there, although maybe not enough for the hordes of people that gather there.

Incredible!!. The old town is amazing. The building are beautiful, and the layout really gives you the feel of going back in time. The amount of people here though is kinda crazy, like Times Square in NY. Go early in the morning to beat the crowds, and be sure to visit the shops, and restaurants. Night time is great for taking pictures, the lighting is excellent on the buildings and in the square. Plenty to see and do. Make sure to visit the Astronomical Clock during the top of the hour. One safety tip we got from a regular visitor, watch out for pick pockets, don't keep items laying about, and hold your bags at all times. Stay away from people trying to exchange money for you on the streets near banks or ATM's.

Incredible!!. The old town is amazing. The building are beautiful, and the layout really gives you the feel of going back in time. The amount of people here though is kinda crazy, like Times Square in NY. Go early in the morning to beat the crowds, and be sure to visit the shops, and restaurants. Night time is great for taking pictures, the lighting is excellent on the buildings and in the square. Plenty to see and do. Make sure to visit the Astronomical Clock during the top of the hour. One safety tip we got from a regular visitor, watch out for pick pockets, don't keep items laying about, and hold your bags at all times. Stay away from people trying to exchange money for you on the streets near banks or ATM's.

Stunning. Like most of Prague squares the Old Town Square has loads of historical buildings. Food from the street vendors is of a good quality and competitive price. The sit down restaurants are more expensive.
charming. Tyn Church is beautiful. Live performances in the square make for an exciting time for kids. Have ice-cream at one of the many parlours while looking up at the astronomical clock.
Wonderful place. I loved the Old Town. It's unique! There are many things to see, to buy, to enjoy. Although prices are a bit expensive...

Awesome old town. The old town of Prague is probably one of the most beautiful we have ever seen. It is busy and interesting to walk around during the day and should definitely be viewed from the top of the clock tower. Don't miss it with the lights all blazing at night and the street artists.

warm atmospher. lots of people - but buildings around are lovely and there was steet performer ther most time of day with lots of talent, nice spot to sit and have a coffe/ beer and watch the world go by
A walking city. Great place to stroll, see the activity and browse stores. Prague has been discovered, so it was already very busy in early May.
Beautiful. Old town is amazing, the buildings are beautiful and there's a really nice atmosphere!There's lovely places to eat and drink spread around with great prices and quality.

Pretty, but crowded. It is definitely picturesque, but it's hardly peaceful. It is very crowded and there are lots of tourist shops everywhere. Walk around and see it, but you might want to go early in the morning or late in the evening to avoid the worst of the crowds.

Must do in prague, Obviously. Take your time, walk around the area, explore all the small streets at your own pace. Visit the shops, enter one of the small cafes. It is better enjoyed, while doing it sloooowly. No rush

Late night visit at the Old Town Square. During the day thousands of visitors are walking shoulder on shoulder around at this marvelous square at the center of Prague. My Tip "Go after 23.00pm"..far less people and noise...Old street lamps bathe the whole market in a nostalgic mood, hidden beauty of old facades emerge and let you dream what it was hundreds of years back ... feel the tranquility of the ancient beauty and let yourself be swept away in the small streets all connected hatch on this old market. I myself love to stroll around midnight at this ancient market, every time I see details that I have never seen before ... like in a brocade lace dress with thousands of beautiful colorful steentjes..When ever you go and after comeback ... it's always a new amazing experience. Prague at midnight
Sightseeing. I attended the old town and was amazed with the culture and the vibrance of the area. The range of places to eat was nice especially on a nice day

History Stands Before You. Old Town is a world's treasure to behold, and thankfully spared from the destruction of 2 world wars. A bustling place with the energy of the tens of thousands of people from around the world who come to experience the grand beauty, history and traditions of many centuries. Do as my wife and I did earlier this month....purchase an ice cream cone and find a place to absorb all that this World Heritage site offers. you won't be disappointed.

A GREAT PLACE TO GET LOST. The Old Town of Prague offers everything imaginable - great shops, restaurants, attractions, street buskers, off-the-wall sites, historic places, astronomical clock and a vibrant feel. A great way to spend the week or weekend!
Atmospheric. There was so much going on it was difficult to know where to look first! There are bars and restaurants as well as mime artists and the famous clock.
Beautiful. What a huge magical square filled with activity. You can feel the history surrounding you! Grab a beer and soak it all up Not to be missed,

"Naked Tour" Guide. Alternate tour highlighting key historical spots in Old Town and Jewish Quarter. Prague has the best "feel" of capitol cities. It is old, yet peppered with Art Nouveau treats. Would come back again.

A must see location. While it tends to be crowded, even into the late hours, it is definitely worth the visit! I found the evening hours more enjoyable because it was a smaller crowd and the lighting really set the mood. Day time offers a ton of things to do with vendors everywhere. The tower was worth the wait to climb and the cathedrals are nice to go and see.
Walking tour. Very busy during holiday period. Plenty of food stalls and souvenirs. We were warned about pickpocketers but saw none.
Crowded in a good way. Lovely town square which is perfect for sitting down in the sun and drinking a beer. Never empty and will keep you entertained.

Breathtaking at dusk!. This place is mesmerising, we tried to visit other tourist attractions but inevitably ended up here. Fabulous, almost surreal square with beautiful buildings all around. Watch your handbags! We got to sit around with hundreds of others as the sun set here and watch live music.. Stunning and possibly my favourite 'old town' of many cities I've visited.

Beautiful is Prague...much of it is in Old Town. Prague is one European city where one landmark/attraction doesnt dominate.The whole Old town area in Prague is essentially its biggest attraction and show piece. This part of town was lucky to have survived the world wars and hence retains its beautiful and charming old fashioned building all over the area. Due to numerous pointed gothic style spires and churches all-around, is is rightly called city of 100 spires.
Wonderful outdoor space. Loved the feel of the Old Town - enjoyed walking down all the roads off the square to discover places. Tourist restaurants are OK to eat in and not expensive.
old town prague. beautiful old town with interesting architecture ad cobblestone streets to stroll down and window shop

Not to be missed. Some call the city The Heart of Europe! The area of the city is extremely pleasant and yet the uppersit as well. For the first look it seems compact of tourists, partly because there are so many atraktioner lying side by side, as well as souvenirs, glassware and jewelry. It is REALLY SO overwhelming .But the district iites also offers several small detours through gates leading to other more peaceful streets.
Charming!. Old Town is amazng....cobblestone streets, street performers, tons of restaurants, amazing architecture.....we walked for hours in Old Town!

Beautiful!. My husband and I loved walking through Old Town Prague. While many buildings are housing souvenir shops or overpriced restaurants, the architecture is beautiful and there are many hidden gems along the side streets. The path from Charles Bridge to the center of Old Town was crowded with tourists, but the scenery was great and there were a lot of nice restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, etc.

Full of character.. The Old Town Square is the centre of Prague.The old buildings are beautiful and entertainers draw the crowds.Also lots of people gather to see the famous clock chime on the hour.I would recommend going up the tower because you get amazing views of the city.

Beautiful city centre, full of tourist attractions though. We spend one week in Prague during Eastern and we loved the city centre. We found it a pity though that it has lost its charm because of the touristic stores, massage stores and non-typical souvenirs stores... a real pity which decreases the beauty of the place.

Full of character. Lots of atmosphere and must be seen at different times of the day.This is where you could spend lots of time just watching and exploring. Plenty of places to relax and watch the world go by.
Lovely place . Its a delight to walk in old town square cobbled stone streets with cute little art shops n plenty to eat!

A great area. The cobblestone streets and interesting architecture made our morning walks a delight. You feel as though you've stepped back in time, and then you come across a modern shop, restaurant or bakery.
Beautiful. Filled with georgous buildings, and lovely cobbled streets, filled with beautiful little shops, and eateries.
Great adventure. Full and Rich in history. Well worth the visit . The castle the church the food vendors its something to experience
old town. Quaint AND touristy! Loved every bit of it. Food, people-watching band shopping. Walking and holding hands were perfect!
Delightful. Entertaining, great food, historical. A wonderful way to spend the afternoon meeting people from around the world and enjoying the essence of Prague.
Very picturesque. Beautiful buildings. Bustling and busy but most areas are pedestrianized. Lots of restaurants to choose from.
Beautiful. Beautiful buildings lots of people but still room to walk around and enjoy .nice cafés and restaurants .

Lovely to wander around.. Loved wandering the lanes to Charles Bridge. Enjoyed homemade cake and tea in crypt cafe of Baroque church - beautiful surroundings. Lots going on, music, entertainers and people watching.

Tourists But Fun. Filled with tourists (but then again, I am one), but great sights, eateries and people watching! The shops can be a bit dicey and some of the stuff being sold is far from authentic, but it's fun to poke around and see what is for sale. As with most crowded tourist areas, just watch your belongings.

Amazing Ambiance. As soon as you arrive at Old Town square you are drawn into the many activities going on around you, from the musicians playing there folklore music , people just enjoying the Al fresco dinning/ drinking at the many restaurants surrounding the square to the impressive architecture around you...... It really is captivating. You can hire a coach and horse to take you around the old town from here, or an impressive vintage car, a modern hop on hop off coach or for the very adventurous a Segway !!!
Fairytale town. Medieval town with narrow alleys and historical buildings.it is well kept with nice colors very busy with tourists and very nice cafes and restaurants
A highlight in Prague.. I really enjoyed a little down time in the square. It is a place to see as part of your visit to Prague.
The dity's meeting place. The architecture spans the ages from Medieval to mid-twentieth century. Architecturally, this site is better than Disney World or Las Vegas... and it is the real thing!

Stunning. Well laid out and plenty of atmosphere sit at one of many bars and just people watch or try one of the many restaurants which serve authentic polish food some are a bit pricy but what the hell enjoy yourself
Historical downtown. I have been already six time in Prague, but Old Town is one of the most beautiful part of the city. Right place to take photo.
Art Nouveau at its best. Other cities claim to be the the Art Nouveau capital...but Prague truly is..it is filled with beautiful architecture.
very lively. Mostly I just walked in and around the Square and was amazed when it seemed as if every day the 'theme' changed.
Nice overview and a drink. U Prince has a roof terrace.Go there instead of getting seated at the square.Great view of cast'e,Tyn and rooftops
must do!. prague is fantastic and old town is very charming- definetely recommend a walk around it to see all that it offers!!
A must of course. You cannot go to Prague without visiting the old Town and its great intact landmarks, shops and huge number of tourists...

Lovely square lots to see. I thought the food was very starchy and a bit uninteresting. Mind you, I'm not a meat eater! Hard to get nice fresh food but we found a lovely Veggie called Clear Head but the staff all looked so sad??? Food was nice though.

Charming but crowded. The old town as in case of most European cities is beautiful. However, Prague is thronged by tourists all year round and can get super crowded. It is a must see and a walk though the side lanes is recommended to experience the quieter side of the city.
Great area. So many buildings to marvel at...was pretty crowded but we went back in the evening to take advantage of all the little shops and searched out some great little restaurants...

Touring the old town. Very interesting architecture
Lots of small cafes and a variety of shops.
There are many means of transport: bus, car, Segway
Buzzing with life and Amazing sights. When you walk on to square the sights strike you imediately! We sat in the sun with a nice cold beer admiring the sights for hours.

beautiful square. Just an amazing place a must see. So many different shops, restaurants,bars and cafes to visit. Lots of walking tours and such fabulous buildings. Great interest around the astronomical clock great just to seat and people watch.

Old Prague. Visited on May Day, local public holiday, everywhere extremely and uncomfortably crowded, difficult to find a reasonably priced eating place, but having done so food was good. One thing we found was that most places present a slip stating "no tip included 10% recommended" this is a con!

Lively. Easter market/talking with the stall holders and other locals/ Sampling local food.
Weather : Cold but sunny, then sudden change to snow.

Lively and busy squares. Busy major city squares. Lots of activities, restaurants and great shopping. Many attractions that you can easily walk to. A variety of categories of hotels with attractive pricing.

Just stunning - the clock tower has lifts so anyone can do it!. Try and get a table at the roof terrace restaurant - spectacular views. Linger with some street food and absorb the atmosphere with the musicians in the square.

Great sights old and new. Loads to see in the old town with beautiful buildings including the astronomical clock and bell tower. Also lots of great designer shops and restaurants and cafes. We enjoyed wandering down many of the little side streets and exploring.

Very impress. Lovely small city , the town centre you can walk or take the tram, I prefer to walk ....so I could do cover every single corner of the city, the architecture of the city is beautiful, the astronomical clock is just amazing, people are very friendly, everybody speaks English, the street food is great and cheap like hotdogs good quality and cheap, you want to eat in a romantic place plenty of restaurants next to the river and what a view of the city stunning.
I would get lost in here!. There are lots of beautiful well designed building that really amazed us! I really would go back here again and again! Super view!

Lovely olld buildings. Prague is exceptionally clean. The pavements the roads everywhere. We didn't like the graffiti and were all quite shocked at the extent on many buildings. Other only gripe was the toilets charge everyone is pay on entry, 'guards' guard the door and give you two pieces of tissue on entry. Just great if you havn't any change, are desperate and your husband has gone walk about with the cash!

600 year's old piece of art. Visit at 9 or 10 am sharp to watch the clock's spectacle without the tourist crowd. Astronomic clock which performs every hour from 900-2100. After 1100 it get's really crowded there, so be early!

Great Place. This place is situated on a five minute walk from Staromestske (Green line) metro station and has flood of tourist at any point in time you go. We explored the 1-2 miles area and narrow streets on foot and cannot recommend it enough due to the colourful shops, food and drink options and overall party ambience. There is also a good locals market near Mustek station and a halal Kebab shop called Gyros
Beautiful and wonderful to walk. Prague is a beautiful city and the architecture is amazing. The Old Town is well worth seeing. People everywhere, eating and just hanging out. Fabulous city to visit

Better parts to see in Prague. And don't really see why there are so many people in the Old Town. There is a lot to see in Prague and of course this needs to be seen. I could not feel the history here like the rest of Prague.
Beautiful. I love how the buildings have not changed and they are so pretty! We went for the marathon and I loved the vibe of the city!

Go early to avoid crowds of tourists. Beautiful and very old buildings. Impressive but try to make it during non-peak hours as the crowds of tourisrs are a bit overwhelming. Also, beware that anything you will buy there ( food, drinks, souvenirs) will be a lot more expensive than anywhere else in the city. Just wandering this part of the city was really nice as everywhere you look there are beautiful things to look at.

easter market. there was an Easter market when we visited, but there is plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, and the main shopping area is only a 10 minute walk one way and Charles bridge is a 10 minute walk the other way, if you are not drawn in to the variety of shops through the lanes.

Visual overload. plenty of beautiful buildings, the astrological clock and markets with food. buzzing with tourists. if you order the beautiful ham at the markets make sure you tell them how many grams you want, or they will give you a huge quantity which will cost a bomb and you wont be able to finish
Beautiful old town. This is truly the heart of Prague and must be seen. From the astrological clock to cafes to churches to shops, this place has it all.
Prague Old Town. Lots of History in this medieval town, plan to spend a half a day to see it all...definitely worth the trip!

A must but too touristic.. Waited to watch the ringing bells at the church by the old town, while everything else looks like a funfair. Try walking around the small streets around, quieter. Had a bad experience with one of the restaurants which display a different pricing once you're seated at the courtyard. Better get a meal on the street. Tripadvisor downloaded map is a great app. Just switch on the GPS without data and works accurately.

an architectural wonder. Entering stare Mesto by walking over Charles bridge you can discover the old town. Smal streets, with many booby-traps for the tourists, are leading you to the Staromestska (big place ).Just look around and admire the beautiful facades(house fronds)in differant styles. Don't forget the gastronomical watch that will give you a spectacle each full hour. Be there in time cause it's very crowded.

The Center of Old Prague. Walked over the Charles Bridge to make our way to Old Town. Stop and take pictures at the medieval gate. A warning, the walkways are very narrow and when choked with people and restaurants on each side, it can be difficult to walk. Everyone must see the astrolodgical clock, it's amazing. The buildings and architecture combined with the twin towers of the Tyn Church are truly impressive. Explore the narrow back streets, they reminded us of Venice.

Beautiful area. Loved walking around. So many restaurants and things to see and do. Felt safe the entire time, even late into the night. The mornings were especially nice, since people seem to stay up late and sleep in late.

Tours of the Old Town. the Old twon area is fabulous. We did a walking tour with Prague green tours, an American guy called keith who lives in Prague. He was fantastic, meet him at the Astronomical clock most days at 11.00am. the tour is free but if you like the tour tip him, he is worth it. So good we did a paid tour of prgaue castle with him the next day.

Setp back into time. Shopping center plus historic buildings. Street food, cafe, nice restuarant all in one place. A must visit while in Prague. Good to take photo both day and night. Prague is so picturesque. Everywhere you go is guarantee the good shot and main attraction all in walkable distance.

Tyn Church - Johannes Huss. This is an amazing square, we spent many hours here taking photographs and absorbing the centuries old history. We studied Johannes Huss with our children before coming, and it is very noteworthy to understand the Czech history and persecution. Don't miss the big statue in Huss' honor. We framed our sepia photo of Tyn- one of our favorites and possibly the most architecturally interesting and picturesque church in Europe.

Lovely square . Added bonus of the Easter Market with some great entertainment and historical buildings. Great access ti the rest of the local attractions. Tourist bars are obviously more expensive especially near the clock tower. The only gripe was the stalls selling ham over charge you - if you don't tell them to stop loading your plate they'll charge you a fortune for what they've piled on.
Just how you picture it to be. Such a beautiful square with lots to see, although getting asked every 10 seconds if you want to do a segway ride gets annoying
Interesting. Very interesting all round history and interests plenty of places to walk round and many places to enjoy the food.

Do not miss. Great site for taking pictures, but beware of pick pocketers. Do not wear high heals because ground is bumpy. Prices in bars are a bit higher, avoid exchange offices on the very site as they offer extremely low exchange rate

Incredible architecture, beautiful place to wander and browse. This is truly the heart of Prague where there are beautiful souvenir shops and restaurants to visit. You can wander the streets for hours. It will be very crowded so watch your belongings but make sure this area is on your list of must see!
Praha in under 5 days. Loved the crowds of people. Watch the clock on the hour. Stroll down the lovely 'Paris Street". Go to the Jewish Quarter, stroll the Charles bridge.

Wonderful atmosphere. The square in the old town is absolutely brilliant. A bustling mass of activity which varies with the season. The square is lined with some very nice shops, cafes and churches, giving a huge amount of variety.
Beautiful. Wonderful place to wander around and view history. You will not be alone as it is very popular with all who visit Prague.

old town prauge. Hi,like any old town part of any European city you get exactly what you would expect.lots of bars and restaurants, street entertainers. Don't get me wrong it is a fantastic place to take a breather from all the walking. you can while away a couple of hours people watching, and believe me there are lots of people to watch. the numbers swell just before the famous weather clock chimes. but in between all the tours it's a great square with lots to see. The architecture like the rest of the city is awe inspiring. There are countless places to eat and drink, I would recommend the Irish bar in the top right conner of the square away from the weather clock, the staff and food are top draw my wife and I eat there twice over our 4 day stay and were never disappointed. It's a different story at night and is a very tranquil place were you can enjoy a stroll amongst the churches and winding streets.

Tourist. Architect, excitement Like it all also relaxing in bars and restaurant and watch the world walk by , you can see the old town clock, only a few minutes from the river and Charles Bridge , then a walk up the hill to the castle

Touristic eye candy. Stare Mesto is a very beautiful square. You will watch the buildings with an open mouth. Especially the Thyn church and the Astronomic watch are candy for the eye. There are a lot of buildings in Jugendstil. The statue of Jan Hus, one of my favorites of the square, is also a perfect example of Jugendstil. Just go here and enjoy the view of the square. Try to ignore the mass tourism that surrounds you.
Must see. A must see place. Very nice, can shopping , eating, everything u want

The Place To Be. On a beautiful day this is the place to take a stroll or find an outside cafe, order a local beer or wine. Sit back and listen to the music, watch the street entertainers, and the passers by. Don't forget to take taste the local foods from the street vendors.

All the town, not just the old town. Old town, new town, lesser town - all of inner city Prague is a dazzling walking experience. Four centuries of architecture rubbing shoulders on the same 4-5 storey scale, well preserved and renewed facades offering a multitude of design details - baroque, classical, nouveau, deco, modernist, all blending together. An absolute delight, whether in the squares or wandering through alleyways.. And that's before delving inside.
Nice and great place to visit.. This is a must - great buildings, nice to see.Dette skal opleves, flotte bygninger og masse af kultur.

Stunning Old Town. Loved everything, the architecture, the Garnet jewellers, the cafes, & I found a puppet in a marionette shop I had been searching for for 10 years! But best of all the Street entertainers. The Jazz band, the "Cute BABY" & the exciting (& very handsome) leather skirted whirling dervishes with their Pipes & drums.

Awesome place. This is a must see part of Prague. Whether it is the National Theatre on the edge of Old Town or the Old Clock if you are in Prague you have to check this area out. It is where old meets new, with hip stores and classic restaurants you won't be bored. Street performers will keep your attention when planning your next steps and the amount of museums are sure to keep you busy. One of the best historic cities in the world.

Beautiful. Prague's old buildings are just so beautiful. The area is walkable within a day though I suggest to use many days and discover the small shops, pivovars (beer houses), restaurants and cafes.

Centre of the city.. Go there for the Astronomical Clock and a walk up the tower for the wonderful view of the city.. Some great street entertainers and horse and carriage rides. The buildings are lovely.

Good atmosphere . We went in December so we could experience the Christmas market stalls and the atmosphere. The live performances on the stage where good and nice entertainment whilst having something to eat and drink from one of the many stalls.The astronomical clock is worth watching but it does get crowded so if you've got children make sure you allow plenty of time to get a good spot to view the clock. There's plenty of restaurants around the square but they are expensive.
Excellent guide of Jewish quarter. We had Neil, a guide from City Bus Tours, give us a very informative and interesting walk around the Jewish quarter. Brought the history to life for us.
Like a fairytale!. Gorgeous architecture, lots of places to eat and shop. It is quite crowded though, particularly on weekends. Highly recommended!
Cafes and bars. Beautiful surrounding, with lots to see. While we were there, there were lots of activities on due to upcoming marathon and IIHF. Great atmosphere
Magic Center. The old town city of Prague is really amazing. You can walk around the little roads, hear some music on the street, eat something traditional and drink some local beers
Good attraction. Nice historic spot,fun to visit like these busy places always.And i like the food here.People are friendly here,i liked it,
So much fun. Loved the way the fun starts building up in the evening. Don't miss the astronomical clock chiming when it strikes every hour.

Wonderful old town to explore. Built around the Prague Square this old town oozed history ... with a number of opportunities to climb towers and look over the city ... the views are amazing. The free walking tours are great for getting an overview of the history of the city.
Fantastic visit. Great place to walk around for hours. Everything is nerby and you have so much to see and many restaurants and shoppings to explore. A must do if you are in Prague
so. many. tourists.. got a bit annoyed by the quantity or tourists stumbling around (and an equal amount of party promoters/tour guides trying to get your attention). gorgeous place tho.
Very very busy. Lovely square, but not half as nice as the other side of the river. Lots of groups of men getting drunk!!

Magnificent beyond description. One of the few places in europe that are so imposing! You are entering another, fairy-tail era. You feel you could stay there for ever. You can even forgive the fact that thousands of tourists (like yourself) are flooding the place, pushing you and getting infront of you and all these frustrating things and yet it is magnificent beyond description.
Wonderful. Full of people, great atmosphere, lovely buildings. Good food and Drink. You wouldn't spend hours here, but a must see.
History Culture and Fun. My title says it all, a cosmopolitan mix of history and bars and culture and shopping an eclectic mixture of old and new working together in one fun place.
Prague is Prague. Definitely old town (downtown) don't need any words. One of the best, nice, city on the world. Just enjoy and feel it;-)

A Must See Area. I know you will visit this area with its many attractions and places to eat. Sit and watch the world go by while having a fair priced meal.
Normally entertainment going on too especially in evening.
Very interesting. Brilliant! A very nice place which is a MUST SEE when visiting Prague! You shouldn't miss it no matter how much time you spend in the city!

Prague Old Town. Steeped in history and a must visit. So many historical attractions in one place, friendly locals and cheap food and drink, highly recommended, Charles Bridge is a definite should you go here.

You will learn so much. Prague has so much history that is fascinating and beautiful. There are many things to do just walking on your own, using public transit or paid tours. Whatever time you spend will be time well spent.

The heart of Prague. This is the heart of Prague. We were lucky to be there just before Easter so enjoyed the buzz, festivities and the Easter markets. It is surrounded by Astronomical clock and a couple of churches and looks really good. A climb to the clock tower is a must do. A visit to the town hall is also recommended.
Needed to see in Prague. specially you should go on xmas time, but most of a time there is a possibility that you can find traditional markets and street show.

Excellent. Old town is amazing and, excellent location. I has seen this place in photographs but, going there and, seeing is different. Tynn church, Astronomical watch, the tower, the whole area is worth to see...
Dont miss!. This is the area to see!! It is the hub and dont miss the clock on the hour. It is easy to find and where the action is!

Prague Old Town. Actually a nice area with all the old interesting buildings, lots of shops, cafe, restaurant and other things. But this place is super crowded. At that time there is somekind of Easther Market there, where people selling lot of delicious food,hot wine, souvenirs and even a pony stand where kids can take picture with the pony.Becareful with pickpockets in this area. Be very becareful, because they dress up well enough that you dont think they are pickpockets.

Re: museum like. We started walking around in Old Town bec our hotel was in this area. Restaurants, cafes, sights like astronomical clock are in here. Just looking at the buildings and architecture feels like you're in a museum.

Wonderful town. We had so much fun at Prague Old Town. Plan to be in front of the Astronomical clock at noon. It gets crowded. We made a few wrong turns and got to explore the quaint streets. Just have a good map and it's easy to return to Old Town.. Charles bridge was a huge disappointment. Years ago it was nothing but vendors but now they control who can sell and trust there were only about a dozen artist and jewelry. The cafes have outside seating so people watching is amazing---they provide blankets on cold days. Such an awesome idea.

Old World Charm. Prague "Old Town" is full of local markets and buildings with "old world charm". It is a strange mixture of new and old but the "old" is breathtaking. Plenty of old buildings and churches to see and the old Jewish quarter is definitely worth visiting.
A must. The old town is a must no trip to Prague would be complete with out a visit. We spent all our time here.
The Old Town Square. the buzz of the square any time of day or night the street entertainment and the food and drink available from the stalls around the square
centrally in Pragye 1. Close to the metro station. Is has a small market. The are plenty of people trying to offer a swegeway tour.

Great! . It's a given that this is a must see and if the old square is too busy for you then head down one of the many quaint alleyways. Many jewellers so if you want some Czech garnet there is plenty of competition so try and barter.

Sightseeing in the Old Town. We liked the meandering little streets, with little courtyard bars and coffee shops. The Old Town square was a 'must see' for the Astrological Clock, the town hall, and the statues, but full of tourists when the clock did its thing on the hour. We also went to a concert in the St Clement CAthedral, which has lovely acoustics - a tip - the ticket sellers are open to haggling over the price of the tickets is they are struggling to fill the place.
Fantastic place. Beautiful buildings, good shopping nearby (not the souvenir shops), very reasonable prices in the restaurants, lots of different cuisines, carnival atmosphere - really good.

Super crowded, but probably fun at night... I was in Prague on a quick business trip for a day, and decided to spend the rest of the day (after my meeting) at the Old Town. Now agreed it wasn't dark before I had to head back to the airport, but during daylight the Old Town seemed extremely crowded. Sure - it seemed like a Party-Paradise - with its many Beer bars, and pristine food places in the Old Town. It's probably a lot of fun hanging around with friends here - but that review from me will have to wait.. :)

place is full of action. very energetic place- fun. Lots of performing groups just set up shop for donations or not. Carriage rides are available here, people watching is great. Surrounded by lots of cafes and bistros for every taste and budget.
Beautiful. Loved this place - spend some time just people watching with the incredible scenery. Great food places and warm wine to buy and drink!
Got to see. You cant go to Prague without a visit to Old Town great alleys and lanes to explore. a wide selection of restaurants and bars with a wide range of prices to suit everyones pocket
Hard to stop admiring how beautiful the place is. City scenery is breathtaking. Hard to stop admiring how beautiful the place is and how well preserved everything is.

Central Prague. Too much to do, so little time! People come for the weekend but really the castle could take two days. So much genuinely beautiful architecture as well as wonderfully friendly people. Recommend a 4 day stay. Very small town, walk as much as you can, but ladies, bring flat shoes as all streets are cobbled.
Very interesting.. Brilliant loved the buildings. Didn't dislike anything about the Old Town. Make sure you go and visit the Special Effects Museum in the Old Town as you will have lots of fun.

Although touristy, fun to wander the curving, cobblestone streets!. There are stores, restaurants and bars all over the Old Town. It can be easy to get turned around, especially on a cloudy day. I suggest carrying a map in your pocket to help keep your bearings. And, invest in good walking shoes with thick, sturdy soles. Your feet will thank you!
Old Town visit is a must do.. How ornate and beautifully maintained the old buildings are, Astronomical Clock, how clean everywhere is.

Old Town & Walking... You definitely need to pack comfortable shoes when visiting this area as you could walk...I loved just wandering the streets and exploring the different neighborhoods...Buildings beautiful lots to see.

Beautiful Square. Busy, loud, people going up and down, this is the heart of Old Prague, take the time to read and admire the surroundings, the old history about medieval times up to WWII and how everything changed, visit the astronomical clock tower, visit the church of Our Lady, the entrance in going thru the cafes, drink a beer or coffe and enjoy the view and the atmosphere

Old Town Glory. So much history and fantastic buildings to explore. You definitely need to pack comfortable shoes when visiting this area as you could walk around and explore all day long - amazing. The main attraction of the astronomical clock can get very crowed coming up to the hour as everyone gathers to see the show but generally you can stroll around at your own leisure

Very nice city center. I loved just wandering the streets and exploring the different neighborhoods, from the exclusive shops around Parizska (Paris) street, to the quiet Josefov (Jewish) neighborhood (probably because it was Saturday). And then there is the main square, which is quite a sight to see, not because of the buildings and definitely not as nice as Brussels or Bruges for example, but just because of the hustle and bustle of all the tourists. The tourists seem to congegrate on a couple of streets, so once you go off the beaten path, you basically have the town for yourself.

Lovely place to walk. Buildings beautiful lots to see. Prague is quite compact lots of walking. Need good walking shoes, gets very busy as well lots of lovely little streets to explore. A lot going on with street band and human models.

Charming square. The astronomical clock is one of the main attractions. There are a lot of interesting buildings around the square, people watching, many shops and resturants. The square takes on a different look after dark. Tons of Italian restaurants which was a nice surprise. Food is reasonably priced compared to France or Lindon. There is a local farmers market. If in Prague, definetly check out Old Town.

Busy, but worth it. Go early- by 11:00 the square is extremely crowded. The astronomical clock performs every hour on the hour, but it only lasts about a minute. The 15 minutes beforehand, that area is packed (watch your pockets just in case). The architecture is lovely all around the square. Yes, it gets very touristy, but what interesting place doesn't nowadays?

Great Atmosphere. Lots to see and do, we were there for the Easter markets so the place was full of people and it was great to sample the local Czech food. Lots of historic buildings and museums, plenty to do, I would advise you to take a guided tour by bus so you can see the castle, unless you don't mind a long walk up lots of hills!!

Loads to see. I loved this town, so much to see and do. I highly recommend going on a tour, we found a guide (Tom) giving a free tour round the old town. He was brilliant, very knowledgable. Make sure you see the clock when it chimes but watch out for pickpockets! It gets very crowded.

Plenty to see. Lovely area to just wander around and look at some of the very beautiful buildings. Old Town square and some of the streets leading to it are nearly always busy except for early in the morning but it is easy to find relatively quiet areas just of the main drag and there are really nice cafes and restaurants dotted around this area
Very busy square. The main attraction of the square is the clock which makes the area below the clock super crowded. Otherwise the square is pretty spacious.

A must do..... Old Town is brilliant. Steeped in history and architecture. The buildings really have to be seen to appreciate them. Loads to see and do - and don't miss the Ornamental Clock. Great cafe bars all around.
museum. if you like a romantic place and if you are history lovers you cannot miss this fantastic part of the europas
must see. the clock ,the music acts,the food stalls,the atmospher the lovely buildings and all the great little side streets leading off the square.

The clock. The clock in the square is one of a kind especially on top of the hour. I had to adjust my location to get a nice view. The whole square is heart of Prague and it flows with history and harbours the best architecture one can see in town.
Beautiful but VERY overcrowded. I found old town so crowed and touristy that I could not really enjoy it. I know many love it but it was packed, even in April.
Old town every day. Must see: Orloy (clock working without break 600 yrs), Obecny Dum (old , Powder Gate (tower was built at the request of Vladislav II Jagiellonczyk).

Fantastic. The Old Town of Prague is one of the most beautiful and interesting I have ever visited. Full of historical buildings, churches, theaters and monuments to visit or just look at and enjoy. Small, narrow streets to walk around; plenty of restaurants and cafes, and shops selling goods in crystal and other souvenirs. The buildings as well as the streets are clean and well cared about. Thanks to the tourists from everywhere, the Old Town is vibrating with life. There are pickpockets to be careful of, but no violence. However, you need a good map not to get lost., but most places can be reached within 30 minutes by walk.
Wonderful experience. Excellent place to start your tour the old streets full of character, the shops and unique architecture. The monuments and items of interest.
Prague. pub on square ,good beer and jazz band playing immediately in front of us. Nice atmosphere and ideal for people watching
Majestic. Everything was surprisingly well kept and clean. Magnificent old and new buildings everywhere. Totally recommendable
Great for people watching. View from clock tower was fantastic. Bars and restaurants in the square can be more expensive but great for watching the world go by.

Social cultural arts trades facilities in a historical context. Beer and coffee is great, street art is always there are usually more than one event that would attract your attention in the area. Restaurants are good the atmosphere is great. It is the experience of becoming a member of an international society a very netural aspect of place.

Must-see romantic small streets. Just get lost walking this beautiful centre, a mix of architecture, history and European flair. Put away the map for once, go where the city takes you, eat the delicious sweet Tredelniks from a street vendor, take a break in one of the numerous small cafés for an afternoon coffee or their famous beer.
Back to the future. Very inspiring: segway tour to the hillsLess inspiring: cheating waiters in the old town; beware :-(

Beautiful architecture. Plenty to see, stand in the main square near the clock on the hour and watch the apostles appear at the windows (get there a few minutes early to get a good position). Have lunch or afternoon, or just a coffee from Hotel Prince, up on the roof terrace

Beautiful and moving. The architecture is breathtaking and history is very moving. I would recommend going for an early morning stroll to take in the beauty while avoiding tourists. There are lots of streets coming off Old Town to explore. Karlova is one of these streets and is very touristy, it reminded me of the tourist streets in Amsterdam. And please please please do not pay to have your photo taken holding doves down this street. It is very clear that their wings are clipped which is so cruel.
Nice place. Astronomical Clock tower was brilliant but the place was over crowded.lots of shops around the area and nearer to Charles bridge

Old Town. Seemed crowded, but guides said would be much more so in the summer. Cobblestone streets charming but hard on the feet. Many options to stop for a cup of... The Astronomical clock should not be missed.
Stunning. This was by far such a beautiful location to sit and people watch. The buildings are so beautiful, the markets have such lovely crafts and it was so relaxing to ramble around

Step into History. ...well, allmost. If we could forget the existence of circus performers and street vendors, this would definetely feel more historic.All in all, Old Town Square is lovely, and the Astronomical clock is astonishing - but to be able to enjoy it in all of its beauty, one needs to be on site at least ten to, in order to get a nice viewing spot.Do not forget to visit the nearby Týn Square (follow the narrow alley next to Týn church - the dark, high-towered one). It is the only place a Medieval visitor would have seen of the city, and it definetely has its own charm, plus some nice shops.

History in front of you. We enjoyed Old Town as our home base for a week. We rented an apartment literally looking out on the Church of Tyn. It is as if you are looking at a fairy tale, I city still holding on to the romantic look and feel of the 19th century. The buildings represent their history well yet the convenience of today's world is available to you (yes Starbucks is right off the square). The music was excellent and the food and wine were available to you. They know how to brew beer here, I would recommend forgoing a glass of red every so often for a pint of beer. Enjoy

One of the most tourist friendly cities in the world!. Narrow and windy cobblestone streets lined with restaurants and shops and bars.... safe, friendly, happy, English speaking, prosperous, American friendly, hip, eclectic, historic, vibrant. We ate and shopped until we dropped.

You could come here 10 times and have 10 different experiences. The small streets of Stare Mesto are so vibrant and every corner opens up a new opportunity for food, drinks, souvenirs, entertainment or a new encounter! I love the Old Town of Prague!

Classic old town. Prague's Old Town Square lives up to its billing as a top attraction. The square is full of life day and might. There are interesting buildings, galleries and shopping in all directions (as well as typical tourist shops and touts). It is indeed a "must see" destination in Europe.
VERY QUAINT. nice place to walk around and feel the atmosphere so loved the place and felt i had gone back in time

Medieval Times. The city is beautiful, has a medieval planning, full of alleys arcades that lead to fantastic places.The historic center is very small, one afternoon can see everything.I advise you to visit Prague on foot!Another piece of advice, take many pennies as in Prague have to pay to go to the bathroom at all sites, even in museums where ever you paid a ticket (expensive by the way).
A walk through history.. The architecture and the ambiance were wonderful. The quality of the food in most of the restaurants left much to be desired.
Prague Spring 2015. Wonderful place to get a view of a beautiful city. Restaurants on the square tend to be overpriced, but great for people watching
Moving around. Wow it wonderful place to move around. It is full of shops on both the sides of the road .its really nice shopping area and tourist destination

One of the most beautiful cities I have ever been. I love Prague it's one of the most beautiful cities I have ever been to. Loaded with historic buildings churches synagogues bars and restaurants. Also lots of music being played everywhere. I dig it the most 😄
very crowded. even with crowds still beautiful. even some decent priced souvenirs. Found someplace to eat on a side street that was less touristy

Wonderful, historic old town ! MUST SEE !!. You feel as if you've been put in a time machine and gone back to 1830..... amazingly well maintaned architecture and buildings. So much to see - the highlight of course, being the Charles Bridge.
It's pretty crowed though and not so easy to find anywhere to park,so if possible leave the car at the hotel and go by tram.
