Never ending sights and attractions. A beautiful part of the city, just to stroll around, sit down for a coffee (or a beer) and enjoy the time pass by
Great part of Prague. Many places to see and lots of things to do. Make sure to visit the Square with the clockwork tower. There are also many side streets that you can get lost in and explore.

Heart of Prague. This place has a special ambiance of its own, a warm and cozy feeling. It is at its best during the Christmas or Easter markets but is a joy to visit nonetheless anytime of the year. Many food and drink stands are around. Unfortunately, not all Czechs are easy to deal with. Lots of old buildings and streets surround the Old Town and you can easily wander around discovering new experiences and shops along the way.
And shop..!. A great place to shop till you drop, stop for a cuppa and slice of cake, watch the street dancers and musicians and absorb the atmosphere - esp on a sunny afternoon..! Fabulous..!

Worth the walk. It is one of the best view and vibes you will get in Prague.
The little streets will leads you through the charming little town. There's a lot to see, mostly a store and cafe for tourist but everything was beautiful and charming.
It's something that you just need to do here in Praha!

Old Town. Beautiful site. The old town is magnificent. There are plenty of restaurants there. Some of them are little bit expensive (cappuccino is about 4-5 euros) but definitely worth being there couple of ours.
Beautiful place to visit. many things to see, good food and drinking, there is a lot of music in the air, many places are in walking distance of the K+K hotel
Amazing. Walking around the Old Town is a joy. Getting lost and wandering around cobbled streets and finding the hidden corners of the town is a brilliant way to spend an afternoon

Beautiful square but too many segways. When thinking of Prague you immediately think of the Old Town Square; particularly the gothic Church Of Our Lady Before Tyn. The square itself has seen a number of invasions over the ages, with the majority of stag do's now migrating deeper into Eastern Europe the void is now filled with segways. You cannot move across the square without being offered a "free try or a tour" on the 2 wheeled vehicles. The problem is worse on the Charles Bridge exacerbated by its narrowness with segways weaving their way between the mass of pedestriansPS: I tried to find a photo of a maniacal segway rider brutally ploughing into a group of innocent children to illustrate my point. Disappointingly though no photo exists

Great place to visit - No. 1 thing to do in Prague. Come here any time of the year and you will have great experience.The architecture of the buildings surrounding the Old Town Square is fantastic and breathtaking. The Old Astronomical Clock is over-rated but still an attraction not to be missed. Go there and see the small (show) every hour. Anytime of the year is good to come, however if you don't want to miss the markets, come during Christmas or Easter season.Don't miss the this (Old Town Square), Prague Castle, Charles Bridge or the Petrin Tower while you're in Prague!
Beautiful. The clock is over-rated! However the view from the top of the clock tower is fabby. The Christmas market is good, great atmosphere.
Very busy. We travelled at a good time - there were lot of stalls selling souvenirs and food and it was good crowd)

The Place You Should Stay!!. This is the place you want to be if you want to see Prague. The area is very safe, has great shopping, good hotels from botique to large, a variety of food and beverage establishments from low cost to high and from snacks to fine dining!!
Must see. It's the heart of Prague but be warned: very crowded, even in off-season. Good restaurants, but pricier than ones a little off the beaten path.
Join the tourists. A must see while in Prague, and everyone does, some on Segway some following tour guide umbrellas. Lots to see, lots to eat, no real values.
best old town in Europe. I always recommend going to Prague just alone for the Old Town. It is so beautiful and no other city compares!

Fairy tale ambience and charm. The old town square cannot be missed in its essence and character. We went during the Easter period and the festivities, little shops selling souvenirs and local food lent the square a beautiful flavour of history. Coupled with the crisp wintry air, the smell of hot chocolate and cinnamon with the astronomical clock and Tyn church looming large in the horizon, the square especially in the evenings was magical.
Great Medieval Coty. Really interesting to walk around a city undamaged by major recent wars. Beautiful architecture, good reasonably priced restaurants. A 'must do' if in Prague.

Great city but crowded with tourists. Prague is really nice. Great architecture, friendly people, but avoid the peak time. To explore the city you better get up early. After 1300 it gets crowded with groups of tourists.

Prague's Old Town. We were there during Easter and we enjoyed shopping for souvenirs in the Easter market. My daughters were able to try some of the local eats such as the warm wafers. There are souvenir shops around the square but we found our best value at the market. My daughters did have a nice time in the candy shop that they found on the square

Way too touristy. Too many people, too much kitsch, crowded - tried to avoid this place. Perhaps on off days early in the morning the square would be nice to walk around, but in regular hours it's too busy.

A Charming Old Town. I've visited many Old Towns and this one tops them all. During the day it gets pretty packed, especially during peak tourist season, but it night it becomes quite peaceful. Old Town is perfect for couples during the evening. It is really romantic. Make sure to walk along the narrow streets, where there are hidden treasures of Prague. Avoid most restaurants in this area, as they will really rip you off. But purchase you souvenirs here! Other places will actually cost a bit more... unusual, but true. :)

Very nice enjoyable place. I don't know what this area is like at other times of the year but we were there at Easter and there were Easter market stalls and bands playing. We definitely preferred this to the other squares.
Interesting Site to Visit. Lots of wonderful restaurants and interesting things to look at. Very vibrant with visitors. Clean and safe.

Prague Old Town. Not many cities are famous for their old towns. Prague is one you must see !! The entire city looks like an old town. Every tiny wall and building has a statue on top or a painting on it. AMAZING !!

A historic Plaza that does not Disappoint.. Charm deluxe.
You really feel you are in a bygone world here.
Watch out for the marauding segueways and the plethora of tourists. All coffee shops here are overpriced and the fare is disappointing but when in Rome....
Great area. Loved this part of Prague - a must see for every visitor. Lots to see and do, great places to eat, fabulous market and astronomical shop

Great Way to Spend a Morning. Walked to Old Town Square from Hilton, a pleasant 10 minute journey. Enjoyed the sights, sounds, smells. Musicians, dancers, booths with food or crafts. People of all walks enjoying a gorgeous day in the square. Highly recommended!

Amazing place. I stayed near the old square to be able to go there frequently.The place is just amazing with all the beautiful old arcitecture , churches , jewish quarter & astronomical clock.The food is good ; I tried the local food with people selling pork and sausage fresh out of the grill in the square.The place at night is more beautiful .I loved walking in the small side alleys to explore more.A must see when in Prague

Awesome. What a joy to walk all over old town until I can walk no more. Enjoying the sights the people and the amazing archtecture. I can't forget the beer, cheap and pluntiful. Take a house drawn carriage ride, it's charming.
Lovely. the old town is a lovely part of Prague. It's is very cultural with lots of little shops and restaurants.The architecture is very surreal and beautiful
Amazing. Amazing place to visit . me and my friends liked it so much it was alot of fun and the location was amazing too i would love to go there again

Excellent place. My hotel was very close to Old Town, so I passed every day next to it. Attraction is very interesting, like a fairytale. I have been on the top of Astrological clock, view from there is fascinating. Full of people from all parts of the world, you can hear all languages.Only bad thing is that down the clock is full of pickpockets, so it is possible that someone could stay without his wallet. It is logical, because all tourists usually look look up at the clock and they don't pay attention to their belongings. So, if you visit this place, just be carefull.
Time travel. I liked being transferred in time! Cobble Stones a bit hard to walk on! Would not advice handicapped to walk, seems better with a weelchair
Busy and friendly square. This is a busy square with lots going on , plenty of bars and quick food . I suggest you peel off the main square if you are looking for some nicer restaurants.
Heart of Prague. Beautiful buildings and streets, Astronomical Clock (where you can find just married couples taking photos), artists and lots of restaurants.
A visit with History. It was a wonderful visit! the Market area was outdoors with beautiful handmade crafts, food, close to subway and walking distance to many areas in Prague

Feels like a fairytale. It honestly felt like i was walking round disneyland, not only because of the crowds but just because it all seemed so surreal! Architecture is beautiful and so colourful, this really is a capital with a great feel, its almost like going back in time! The only thing i didn't really like were the cobbled streets! Dont get we wrong it all adds to the charm but my feet will never forget them!
Bee Hive of activity. Lots if good food and drink, artisan booths and craft huts. A truly fun place with the astronomical clock a few steps away. Great place to relax and watch the people.
Beautiful place. Great place to visit and such a well preserved. Really worth a visit with a lot of attractions around. So much to see and the best part of Prague for me

Old Town. A lot to see, but to be familiar with what you see you need a guide (we had), got a lot of information and a very nice expirence. A lot of people (tourists) smart to be up early in the morning. Sprigging clean everywhere - one thing for sure : need to go back to reach all to been seen !
Beautiful. Fascinating and beautiful architecture. Some excellent places to visit ( plenty of walking) and hearty, inexpensive food.

As it used to be in the UK.. Just so many little streets, restaurants with decent prices for good food. Great surroundings no matter where you go. The trip up the clock tower gives one a superb view of the City and helps you get your bearings for further excursions. Another issue that took is by surprise is the fact they recognise other citizens from abroad as senior citizens if over 65. This means you pay less for the same amenities. Although I feel young at heart it was a surprise to see a man about 45 get up from his tram seat to offer it to me, because of this respect they show to Senior citizens.

Charming. We were there at Easter and the weather had a bit of snow blowing about so we felt like we were at the Christmas market. It was very charming like a storybook. Little shops and many old buildings, tiny cobblestone streets snaking through the old town led to its charm. There are plenty of shops selling everything from garnets, scarves, hats, crystal and t-shirts. Enjoy the stroll.

Lots to see. Old town was easily within walking distance of our hotel which is useful. Old town square can be very busy though especially heading towards the weekend. The Astronomical clock is something of a non-event though - better to do the tour of the actual town hall itself and you can see the apostle figurines up close and its not expensive to do. Also quite an interesting building - tours given in English. There are a number of good restaurants in and around the square - well worth using and many of the tours start from here including walking tours / cycling and bus tours but be prepared to be literally run over by the numerous sedgeway tour operators trying to secure business - they are relentless not to mention dangerous!
A must. Nice old town with huge selection of restaurants, atmosphere and music shows. Interesting museums, cathedrals and more.

One of the most interesting old towns in Europe. The old town in Prague is very interesting. It has a lot of history and many different buildings. Highlights are the astronomical clock and the old town hall.
Must go from Prague. This place is a must go, since it is the "turist place", but make sure you will walk around and get lost around the city, that is where you will really see the best places.

You have to see this clock. You have to stop by and see the Orloi (Astronomical Clock) It's one of the most amazing clocks in the world. It can get really crowded though. I suggest checking things out early in the morning when they aren't overrun by tourists. And then later with tourists. It gives a nice contrast. We had the clock all to ourselves at 7am. We caught the sunrise while we were crossing Charles Bridge from our hotel.

Absolutely gorgeous. . The Old Town Square is glorious fun to stroll through. Lots of market stalls, spacious cobbled area, delicious foods at the kiosks, Jan Hus Memorial, and you can take horse carriage ride. Every turn is wonderful for taking pictures {and finding bars}. Tyn Church presents a glorious backdrop for the square. Also gorgeous when snowing. Definitely a place not to miss in Prague.
A lively square. Don't miss the Astronomical Clock on the hour. The saints peak out the doors, the skeleton rings the bell, and the rooster crows and flaps it's wings.
Interesting. Had a free tour which was Brill!Had a guy called Derek who was very entertaining as well as knowledgable.He took us all round the Old Town,and gave us a taster of what else to see.

so beautiful. nothing to dislike the mpst picturesque city i ever visited. The square was the main place to go all streets ended up here. clock tower, tour guides. famous clock. loved the market stalls selling food painted eggs etc. the unusual fried bread potato chips and circular bread coked pver an open fire was worth travelling there for. locals so friendly and helpful. really couldnt ask for more
Beautiful. Stunning architecture and Easter market. Lots of people but atmosphere was great. Go in the evening to get nearer the clock.
Great atmosphere!. Really beautiful, however it is quit crowded at the popular places. So I would recommend to stay in Prague in the quiet season (i.e. not during the holiday period)

Transported back in time. Even though Prague is the capital city, strolling around the old town ensures you forget this. U will be transported back in time with the market stalls and street foods in the cobbled main square, surrounded by churches and old houses... one can easily spend half a day taking in the sights and sounds and sampling the local cuisines.make sure you dont eat at the restaurants on the main square though - they are tourist traps- venture into one of the alleys and u will find far more authentic local cuisines and lower prices.

Most Happening Place in Entire Czech. Like any other important European city, Prague has similar stuff in offering. They have the Old Town Market Square. It is not so big at the center. But it is connected every important part of the city.There are global fast food centers at each of the corners of the square. A huge food place on the entire square. you get traditional food as well as their national drink.Hot Wine and Beer are found at every nook and corner. Czech hot dogs are pretty tasty.There is astronomical clock and Teen Mary Church at the square. You will hear to some of the legends if you are on a free walking tour.

Charming square. A mist see in Prague. Filled with lovely restaurants, bars and cafés most with inside and outsides eating areas. Lovely architecture and filled with market stalls selling traditional Czech food, drink and souvenirs.

Gorgeous market and the gothic church is ace. Definately recommending the old town its so pretty and although its busy it doesnt feel rushed or aggressive like other big cities. The gothic church is gorgeous and worth a peak inside too. Bought lots of gifts in the market and the music and food were good too. You gotta go!

Must see. Come on, its the Old Town of Prague, walk around, soak it in, grab a pretzel and people watch. There is a ton of food stalls and souvenirs. Good starting spot for several tours (ie. Segway tour).
Old Town Square. Really enjoyed the Easter market on during our visit. Lots of food and drink stalls and stalls selling Easter decorations. Really pretty and very busy!
A crowded cozy plaza. I am pretty sure nobody will miss it. Just don't eat there, is too expensive and not worth the money. Instead you could eat street food, which is another great experience.
Pretty area. Great little area, good for walking around. Little restaurants and cafe's are fairly cheap and offer good service, food, and beer

A fun stroll. The whole ambiance of the place is different and maybe it is the best grounds in Prague to absorb in the feel of this beautiful city. Undoubtedly beautiful and sparkling in every corner, the old town is a treat for its visitors providing so many options for them. The place is surrounded by buildings decked in architectural beauty and shining the whole gothic feel of the place. Lots of restaurants, shops and attractions making it a worthy destination.
Things to see. This is a great place to go, both in daytime, and night. Sometimes there is some market there, with a lot of differents things.

Preserved and Unique. Praha has such a rich history and is one of the few old towns that wasnt fully destroyed in a war. From the clock tower to its famous homes and districts theres something here for everyone

Cool place, nice buildings. You will go there anyways, so there is no need to write more, this is mainly bulk words in order to add another opinion to the thousands already written. Why are you reading reviews from the place? You seriously need to know another opinion in order to go to the #1 attraction of the city? It's free! Now give me a helpful vote and move on to search for another place that might be worth seeing.

charming. Prague is beautiful and charming and everywhere you go you find a quirky little shop or corner or building and it amazes you every time. i had a fantastic time strolling through the old town. Full of cafes and restaurants to have a hot chocolate to warm up on a winter's afternoon or an ice tea in the summer sun. must visit!

Love the feel of history. I particularly enjoyed the market in the old town. The astronomical clock is also quite interesting although to be honest i did expect more. I like the gothic feel of the town.
Charming old city. Cobbled streets, cosy bars, candle lit restaurants, ancient feel to the city which gave it loads of atmosphere.. felt like Split Old Town or Rhodes in Greece! Loved every minute..
Beautiful. Just walk around the old town, it gives amazing views. The Synagogues and Churches can offer great treat for architect lovers.
Nice walk. Good shops and resturants in this area. Easter time have many markeds and extra things to do in the are.

Easter Market. Old Town is probably beautiful any time of year, but my husband and I were there during the Easter Market and it was very pretty and fun! LOTS of crowds, but tons to see and do (and taste!). Enjoy!
a MUST of Prague. I loved the Old Town Center! It was very crowded, but beauty in every direction! The (Eater) markets in the center were really great too!

Beeautiful and a must see in life!. Old town is an amazing area of Prague. It is beyond description. I find it hard to put into words the beauty of this area. There is so much to look at and take it that you need multiple visits to the area to fully take it in. There are so many historical sites and beautiful old buildings that you feel like you have gone back in time. The restaurants and shops around the area are all in old buidings or in the traditional stalls so they do not look out of place. Yes there are the typical touristy trinket shops but no one bothers you to come in, so you just ignore them. The fact that every day there could be something different going on in the square made each visit that much more interesting. There was always someone or some group acting, singing, performing or displaying something that would catch your attention. You could spend hours just watching and wandering and not get bored.The atmosphere in this area is just beyond words. You feel welcomed. You feel almost 'at home'. We were in Prague for 3 months and must have been there a dozen times and each time you found something different and awe inspiring. I really recommend this area, but especially for those that appreciate thousand year old buildings and history. A must 'must see'!!

Beautiful square. I enjoyed the square more on a weekday--Saturday was very crowded. We loved trying the different foods and just hanging out. We thought Krakow was a little more scenic but loved the way the streets just winded around (although you might get a little lost). Wear good shoes, the cobblestones are tough on the feet.

Old Town has it all. I loved the Baroque architecture and the fact that there are plenty of places to eat and relax. Sure, most of them are staffed by Russians or students but that doesn't matter. Cobblestone streets mean that no traffic goes very fast and its surprisingly quiet.
Prague Old Town. lovely old town, just think about when to go there, there is loads of other people enjoying the beauty aswell!

Beautiful buildings. Lovely atmospheric place, tons of stalls in the square selling all sorts. There was an outdoor stage with live music during Easter and various nationalities enjoying the atmosphere. However PLEASE NOTE, I dropped a finished cigarette and was threatened with a 4000 kr fine by some extremely aggressive policemen, who demanded identity proof, who threatened taking me to the police station and they eventually allowed me to pay €12. There were no bins, there were other cigarette ends. They wouldn't allow me to pick it up and when I asked them about their laws, they told me I should have read up on all the bylaws on the internet. First time in Prague. If there had been a bin I would have used it, but their attitude means I will never return v

Must visit. One of the most beautiful places in the Europe. Perfect for tourists, lots of attractions and good restaurants. It will be expensive to do something there, but if you want some lovely moments, it's definitely worth to spend an evening there.

Excellent in March. Not great weather but no crowds or lines. Everything was open and easy-going. Shopping was easy, take it or leave it - have your own experience. Lots of interesting legends of the history.

Extremely cozy. The place is dripping with old historical atmosphere and is a must-see in Prague. During Easter the town square is filled with cute little shops that offer a great variety of food, souvenirs and local goods.
Easter Markets. A great town centre was the stage for the Easter markets surrounded by very old and amazing architecture. Amazing.
Nice to visit. Especially during the Easter festival.the square was decorated and there was folk dancing shows.nice walk at all hours

the old staff is nice.... Prague's flair with the old buildings, fine architecture and even the old cobblestones street where you slip sometimes is really unique! (Be sure to leave the high-heels at home unless you want to walk like an idiot.) Take your time and just stroll around. Do not only focus on the tourist-sights.

Much History Here. Lots to do and see in a compact area from the Old Town Hall with its astronomical clock to the Church of Our Lady before Tyn to the Church of St Nicholas. Street food vendors were aiding in the experience by the small of mulled wine and wonderful foods cooking. There were street performers in abundance; and they were quite entertaining. It was cold when we visited; but we barely noticed the weather as the atmosphere was so warm and inviting. The Jewish historical area and Letna Hill were within walking distance so it was quite easy to spend a whole day in the area.
Amazing. Loved everything, so much history and beauty, we were lucky enough to experience local markets- great experience

amazing & beatiftul. beautiful and amazing. prague is a world class city like none other. a definite must. kids and adults would love this old town. i would stay closer to the astronomical clock side of the town rather than the Prague Castle. Old town is the center of the city.
Starting point to a Prague Visit. Here it all starts, you must visit Hotel U Princes Terrace Restaurant, visit the clocks tower and cellars tour and enjoy the market place in christmas and Easter

Lively & beautiful buildings from different eras. The square is very busy, packed with tourists and entertainers. You will notice that the buildings are all slightly different, built in different eras, making the square a fascinating place to visit and look at. With the beautiful cathedral in the center of the square, this is a postcard scene -- must visit
Nice Clock and Crystal shop Near by. Erpet Crystal First floor is awesome. Small shops around open in late till 10pm. And lot of Crystal shops around
lovely. the old town is lovely. the buildings and architecture is just stunning. it just oozes history. the old town would be lovely in the summer.

Be careful you don't walk in circles!!!!!. Seeing the shops inside and out is a treat and stopping to look up and around makes one feel indeed like you're visiting Europe, sometimes in the Middle Ages. Don't miss this self-guided tour.

Beautiful city . I took my partner to prague for her 30th birthday and we absolutely loved it. Such a beautiful city with so much to do and see with the bonus of none of it costing very much. Weather your on a budget or have money to spend, you will fully enjoy your stay. The old town is the hub of the city and everything else is within walking distance or an easy tram ride. Would go back again and again.
Old Town. This is a must see. We were lucky to be here during Easter and were treated to very special music and hand blown eggs.

Interesting locale. We visited Prague just as they began their Easter Market in various areas of town. Old Town's component of the Market was a fun introduction to the artisan foods and handiwork of the Czech people. We ate at the booths and bought lovely souvenirs--beautifully painted Easter eggs, both real and wooden; toys; needlecraft and such. The Astronomical Clock is an interesting display and be sure to go to the top of the tower (via elevator) for the view. Surrounding the main square are all manner of restaurants, shops and bars. All workers we interacted with were friendly and helpful.

Lovely and fascinating history. We took a walk over the Charles Bridge - fascinating with all the old sculptures (some of them are black because they have been such a long time exposed to wind and rain) some of them have been exchanged with imitations. A great tip for al history lovers.
The most beautiful town centre in europe. Just wonderful. This is my 3rd visit. Especially amazing this time as its the Easter weekend. Just amazing
lovely. Lovely place, great atmosphere, but crowded but what city isn't. Must see the astronomical clock and there are loads of restaurants/bars to eat and drink in
Great place with lot of history attached. Big square with lot of history to understand. Ancient building with mix of different architecture. Several free tour guides available to explain details.
Busy little square. Easter markets and food stalls a plenty. Lively square with lots going on. Right next to the Astronomical clock. Crowds of tourists but don't let that put you off.

Fantastic. And this is why it is a world heritage site. Wndring through those small alley is like a time travel. Of course they put everything for the tourism but it doesn't loose the charme. Also a perfect starting point to explore this wonderful city.

So many historical sites.. The world heritage site is all cobbles trams and so many and varied old buildings that it is almost impossible to see everything. Old spires abound everywhere and history is with everything.

we followed the trail in the Trip Adviser and enjoyed every minute of the tour.. We were traveling with a 8 year old and she enjoyed navigating through the old city liked the Astronomical watch beautiful buildings

Great place to people watch. This was a wonderful experience of typical Czech products. Great place to people watch as it has cafes and restaurants all around it and stall selling just about everything in the middle. A great experience that I wouldn't have missed.

Interesting. This square is full of attractions. It has the astronomical clock, Old town hall, old churches, market, medieval musicians, shops... There is a tower you can climb to see the square from up high.
One of the most beautiful places in Europe. Prague is all about architecture and history. There is everything to like and to dislike maybe only some overpriced restaurants

Absolutely beautiful!. Stepping into Old Town was like stepping into a fairy tale. All the buildings were in such good condition and beautiful. When we went to Old Town, there was an easter fair going on and that added more magic to our visit. Try to come here when there is a big holiday or event at the Old Town Square!

enjoyable place. I disliked only there were too many people there and I didn't have space to take photos.
It's a beautiful place.
Charming Old World. Time and time again we found ourselves at the magnificent clock in Old Town. There was so much street life, shopping stalls and street music we kept going back to this area
Old European charm. Full of beautiful statuary and architecture. Excellent street performances. Clean and open. Street vendors helpful, no hawking. Variety of dining opportunities.

More than just the Town square. The old town is just wonderful. Full of historic buildings and old pavement. It is much more than just the town square. Walk around away from the town square and around every corner you discover more beautiful old buildings.On the toqn square you'll find everything for food and drink, but if you turn some corners you will find lovely bars and restaurants and with even better priced food.
Beautiful area of a beautiful city. The Old Town is full of fantastic buildings, places to shop, eat & drink as well as a wealth of history.

Great place to wander round. This is a great place to wander round, but it is all cobbles so make sure you wear a good pair or shoes, all the streets and roads are cobbled everywhere, so many cafes and restaurants to choose from but everyone we tried was very good, but prices any vary a lot for the same thing, we ate a Motzarts house and the soup in bread was incredible, lots of shops with lots of jewellery shops, they had a lot of Garnets here, very cheap.we went in and meandered for hours

History comes to life. Amazing that the buildings are still there for all to enjoy
Do a free tour to get the most of your visit
Meet in the old market square
Free wifi in most areas as well is a bonus
majestic. majestic monuments and landmarks. Definitely a "must visit". Street performers are entertaining, outdoor cafes serve delicious beer.
always lively. we didn't get to see the center of the town square as it was so colourful with market stalls ready for easter. loved the town hall clock and the 'ringing of the bell'

Get lost, its great!. We wandered around the small winding, cobblestone streets and were very happy. The architecture is magnificent and the "hole in the wall" shops were a delight. We hunted out chocolate shops and were delighted every time. The chocs were delicious.
Old Town Easter Market. Don't miss the Old Town Square, especially during the Easter period. Similar to a Christmas market stalls are set up and there is a great atmosphere.

Amazing architecture. The old square and all the little streets around it are full of glorious architecture.The Easter market was in full flow when we were there and this added to the buzz of the place. We found ourselves in the square every day and you see something's every time.Just watch out for people just stopping dead in front of you as you walk.

Old Prague is worth Unesco heritage. All the old Prague - Stare Meso - is now renovated with nice color on the building frontage Secession style small restaurant and some really animated (a bit crowded sometines) streetso many baroque decoration in churches

Stunning architecture. This is a given on a trip to Prague, the first time it takes your breath away as you soak up your surroundings. As a previous reviewer mentioned you need to look up and try not to run into someone, or block a photo being taken by one of the thousands present. Good idea to visit early of a morning when it is not crowded and you can click away to your hearts content. Easter markets selling decorated eggs, lots of food stalls with lots of customers. A pity that with so many smokers the cobblestones quickly become littered with butts.

Bohemian Beauty .... This beautiful city is a prime example of architectural imagination and workmanship. That man was capable of such craftsmanship, building beautifully detailed structures that have withstood the centuries, simply using a few simple tools is amazing. The Old Town offers an abundance of cafes, bars and restaurants, many of which have outdoor seatings to people watch. A street musician or two can often be found in the main square or take a stroll around the market or stores, soaking in the ambience and the history. Language is not a problem, particularly in the stores and the locals are friendly and will make an effort to understand you. If you like walking and soaking up history, Prague is the perfect location. Ladies, I suggest you wear low heels or better yet, flat shoes. Cobblestone streets are everywhere in Prague and can prove hazardous with heels, turn your ankle and ruin your trip. The tram system is cheap and very easy to navigate. If you have an opportunity, do take a trip outside Prague - many of the small towns and villages are interesting and some quite picturesque.

A wonderland.. As well as the main square, there are so many small streets and squares to see around it. We were there for the Easter fair which added to the atmosphere. We have visited twice previously, and the whole are is a buzz.

Even when busy it is pleasant. The Old Town square was holding it's Easter market selling lots and lots of food - all good quality and cheap. And even during busy times with tours you could find a place to relax.During the evening when tourists are milling around and the area is lit up, it is a great atmosphere - we felt safe at all times.For food, go down a side street rather than the main square eateries, e.g. street opposite astro-clock has a great Pizzareia (2 Pizza and 2 drinks (1 prosecco)) - £13.96 including a tip!
One of the most beautiful cities in the world.. One of the most beautiful cities in the world.tip: Look over the heads of the crowd. The real beauty ia above on the houses and buildings.

A must on a trip to Prague. A lovely square surrounded by beautiful buildings. The Easter Market was on when we were there, lots of stalls selling beers and traditional food, plus gifts. Great atmosphere. Surrounded by lots of restaurants, mostly touristy but try Mincovna to the side of the Square, great food at really good prices.
Old Square. The old square is lovely to see and visit...lots of stands - food, wooden toys, antiquities, etc. Is a very busy spot....watch for pick pockets, and some lovely photo opportunities.
Good location and shopping. Lots of activity. You can eat and sit and people watch. There are small shops and all kinds of people just hanging out

Must see. Period!. One of the most beautiful cities in Europe. Definitely not to miss it. Walk through the narrow streets, have some food from the food stands, have a talk to the locals, watch the astrological watch and have a famous Czech beer. And don't forget the Charles bridge. And by the way: the city is even more beautiful in the night!
Nice. Nice architecture and nice walk, it might be a bit crowded, independently of the time of the year (been there twice)

Old school Europe. Experience the calm and old European tradition in this part of the town. Really beautiful area with the old school town square. We were visiting post Christmas and the Christmas markets were still fully functional bringing a lot of color, delicious food and a vibrant environment worth experiencing.

Beautiful. You can not miss seeing this. Old Town is a magical place and deserves several days to fully appreciate all there is to see. Slow down enjoy a beer you'll live longer for coming here and relaxing
Spring in Prague. There was nothing I disliked. Everything was amazing. It is worth spending time there and taking some time to explore.
Excellent. Excellent the modern joins the past, in harmony. Find a bar with outddoor seating, Get a beer and a watch the world pass by.

Easter in Prague Old Town. Th markets in Old Town Square were in full swing for Easter. Eggs, rabbits and chocolate everywhere! They were fantastic with so much colour, vibrancy, choice, food, drink, and everybody has some English which was great.
Prague's must. It's a must for every tourist... You can find local markets, have some delicious meal, a brew beer... and maybe take some souvenir home.

A shame. We had so much to look forward to nd unfortunately this was a let down. I know it's a sign of the times and tourism is how the money is made, but the erecting of numerous wooden huts for the market sellers was being undertaken and really broke down the full view of the square.

Can't miss this on your visit to Prague. The streets are filled with vendors selling many items and food. I especially liked seeing the man making scarves on his old mill. I purchased one and it is beautiful.

Historic and beautiful. Charles Bridge and the views from it were amazing! Daytime and nighttime both have their own charms. Of course, tons of souvenir shops, but the architecture of the buildings, Old Town Square, the Astronomical Clock, the churches and concerts were all amazing. Completely by chance, we were able to see the Carnival Parade.

worth the trip. Jump on the 26 tram and head out to see this. We were astounded at the scale of the paintings and the brochure, in English as well as German and Czech if not more, gave a thorough overview of each painting. Wonderful!

Very Nice. Not to miss. Make a tour of all the small streets and squares, bars and restaurants.
U medvidku, Karlova street etc.

A Must Visit. No trip to Prague would be complete without wandering around the old town. Full of character, charm and beautiful buildings. As a general rule, stay away from the main square for better prices for food and drink. A definite must visit.
A great place to wander. It is a great place to wander. Enjoy the people the shops and the vendors. It's a must if your in Prauge. Don't miss it.
Beautiful city center. Beautiful area with lots of shops and places to eat. Be sure to see the clock strike the hour. Lots of sidewalk cafes and places to sit and watch the crowds.

Watch out! Pickpockets!!!. Prague s old time has become heaven for pickpockets.
Enough people with open bags, mobiles or purses in their bag pocket.

WOW! Stunning!. We couldn't stop looking at everything. It's so beautiful in the day or night. The building are amazing and look like they are part of a movie set. The food around Old Town is good. We like getting snacks from the vendors on the street, so we can get a taste of everything.
Great atmosphere. Its a wonderful place to wander around and lose yourself in all the little streets. Lots of intersesting little shops cafes and restaurants.

Relaxing place full of history. The old town is fascinating. Much better than the modern areas of Prague. There is so much to see and the churches etc are fantastic. A wonderful choice of concerts to attend too if that's what you like doing.
Winding streets. What an experience, do NOT try to navigate without a map. Even some locals get lost when trying to explain the way.

Energy. We walked to the section of town called Old town and also houses the astronomical clock. Similar to the energy of the Charles bridge we were enchanted. There were many more people congregating in this area. Many families were there enjoying the sights and sounds... and the smells. It was last November and there were many festivities going on,and many of them including cooking various delicious foods for sale.As we were with the Charles bridge we were charmed by all we saw,experienced and tasted!

Where the magic happens. I always feel magical on Prague Old Town. It's like going through an amazing story, that started in X century and lasted till late XIX. The only thing I really don't like is crowd. I'm dreaming about the day when there will be nobody to interrupt the experience of history. I strongly recommend this place to everyone that love old buildings, is found of beautiful places and just enjoy the view and commune with history.

Feel the Czech history. This is the number one place in Prague you must definitely visit. Almost all of the historic architecture has been well preserved, so it is possible to experience what it was like to live in Prague a few hundred years ago.
Unreal Sites!. This was wonderful with warm friendly people, great shops and food! Find a tall landmark to be able to tell where you are, as it is easy to get lost...

Love love love it. Just looked the old town, full of life and soul, lots of things happening, great food unreal mulled wine and them sweet bread things.. The buildings are amazing the atmosphere is very cool and the little cobbled streets are so cute

Spend Some Time Here and Experience Czech Culture. The most interesting part of the Old Town centers around a nice square off of which streets filled with shops, restaurants, and other places of interest radiate. On one part of the square are little "shacks" selling traditional Czech food. Don't miss the Astronomical Clock, but do watch your possessions while taking in the clock, especially if you're there at the top of the hour when the clock shows off. There are public restrooms in the area.

Just beautiful!. Could never tire of wandering round the Old Town, very walkable with many places of interest close by. Beautiful old buildings well taken care of, plenty of restaurants, bars etc. A visit to see the astronomical clock a 'must' and a trip up to the top of the tower for amazing views.

Lost and loving it!. Take a map with you. It's easy to get lost. The little streets curve and go in many directions. If you do get lost. Always ask which way to the Charles River Bridge or the water as point of reference. We got lost a few times and always stopped in a pub for a drink and a look at our map. It's fun getting lost in Prague!!

The best place to Visit in Prague. You can spend days in this old town square, with fun. Many Resturants, Bars, Meusums, Old tower clocks, and amusing people who present their artistic aspects in public. Dont forget to taste CULUCH meal when in Old town square.
Walking and exploring. The city was historical and beautiful but I suggest you take some money with you cause things can get costy if you wanna visit all

Beautiful but too crowded. The old town of Prague is beautiful, most buildings are historic. Many streets are for pedestrians only and the center is compact. That's also the downside. Because there're many cheap flights to Prague and all the tourist come to the same area, it's way too crowded. And I visited during a 'slow' week.Although I liked the city as such, that is the main reason I will not return with my family.
History comes alive. shops, shops and more shops, restaurants, history, tours, street entertainment. Trips up the tower to view Old Town Square.
Old town. It was nice to liven up my stay in Prague. There were a lot of sights and we enjoyed a nice view of the old clock.
Such a charming part of Prague. The cobblestone streets, the fascinating architecture, the mulled wine and trdelnik, the shopping - probably my favorite place in Prague.

Prague Fairy Tale. The architecture of the Old Town in Prague represents nearly all styles in history.Colorful, thoroughly restored buildings create unforgettable ambience. I was in Prague at least 50 times with my clients, they always loved it!
Just wow!. Beautidul old town, especially small streets with less people! You can find small cafes on Noby Svyt street.
Exquisite Architecture!. It is like an Adult Disneland of Architecture- Gothic, Baroque and Renaissance all together. Do Not miss the CLOCK in Town Square when it strikes on the hour- big attraction!

Stand in the centre and admire the history. It is just a square, but the surrounding buildings are beautiful. I don't believe March is a busy month for tourists as it wasn't overly busy, however there were always tour groups being taken around and the odd segway speeding past (which I highly recommend!). Tip - the food huts are expensive, especially the Prague ham! Can only order minimum 300g, yet the price for 100g is already 85czk, and half of it is fat! You can find cheaper meals and pancakes a stones throw away in a nice restaurant.
Just old square. There are many other things which should get credit. There is nothing great about this square. Walk from bridge to square is more interesting.
step back in time. go here to see the amazing 600 year old Astronomical clock. Also, don't miss St. Nicholas church with it's painted ceilings.
Great atmosphere. We really loved the vibrancy of the place. While it is filled full of tourists, it does not feel like other overcrowded European tourist locations. A genuine Czech feeling.

Like a fairytale. An amazing city with such a lot to see. You could imagine characters out of fairy-tales peeping out of the windows of the old buildings. Walking over the Charles Bridge at night is very atmospheric with all the shadows on the statues, If you have tie, the Petrinska park is also well worth a visit with it's great views over the city.
what a great place. the squares,the palace,boat trip on river ,the people,the short flight from uk.eating out was very reasonable and the drink was cheap.

beautiful. March is a great month to visit Prague, because it is a lot quieter - the tourist season starts in May, really. And in March you can actually enjoy it more, I think. The weather is great for sightseeing.

Wonderful!. Best idea is to just stroll around the Old Town, in no particular direction. Soon you will pick up on the vibe of this historic centre, and will most probably find some very interesting things along the way.
BEAUTIFUL. A real must... It's sooo full of history and charm, and the views are gorgeous... The atmosphere is so happy and fun
Historic and rich. Prague is simply beautiful. Impressive in every way, filled with history and landmarks, one of my favourite european cities.

Best Xmas Market in Europe. most scenic and romantic Xmas market i have ever seen...affordable and tasty hot wine, hot honey liquor and xmas sweets and some food as well....the xmas tree and the view with the atmosphere is absolutely magical!!!!!

Beautiful place. It was like a time travel, so clean and colorful. You've go to see this, I'd spend all day our there just waling across the streets :)
I wish we had such well maintained places.
Great Square. This is a busy square with several street shows and performances going on! A very lively square and most crowded!

What to do when it is cold and rainy. Always bring an umbrella and best to use a messenger bag to keep your hands free. The square is quite crowded specially near the Astronomical Clock . A lot of good pubs, coffee shops and restaurants. The flea market is not a good place to buy souvenirs because items are more expensive than in the stores nearby.

Beautiful historic centre. Beautiful historic centre of the city, lined with restaurants and cafes. The old town was the backdrop for our stay in Prague.
Far too many Segways in the main square, I lost count of the number of times I was offered a go. No thanks.
Cobbled streets that are unchanged for centuries - a must see.
Historic , lovely square with character. Street artists perform,food vendors sell lovely snacks in addition to outside bars and restaurants who keep their outside space heated and supply blankets.

awe inspiring. The old square had a celebration for the Chinese New Year when we were there and as such the whole square was brightly decorated with loads of people all having a great time.
The architecture surrounding the square is brilliant and still intact despite years of Communist rule.
AMAZING. Loved it! The location is perfect, loads of little bits to see and do and plenty of pubs for the evenings.

Old Town Square. Good open space with plenty of street entertainment. There is a good atmosphere. The surrounding building are very interesting. Always look up in your walks.
The astronomical clock is well worth seeing on the hour when it always draws crowds
Impressive. Impressive architecture. Great to wonder around either during the day or at night. Many places to eat close by but you will probably pay a premium to do so
Old cobbled stoned streets with historical buildings. Nice atmospheric old town with lots of historical buildings and even more shops and restaurants for tourist

Fantastic. Prague city center make you fly back over the centuries!
So nice, so clean, so Beautiful! All around the square is really unbelievable. and it is the starting point to visit all the major attractions of Prague. Recommended!

Old Town. LOts to see especially the clock which we saw chime many times
the different local cuisines as well
Both my wife and I would really recommend this area to start from.
Stunning. Tons and tons of Beautiful buildings and amazing architecture that will keep you 'wow-ing' for your whole stay!!

Beautiful square but.... ...it is full of Segway touts and those annoying statue men who obviously went to the same training school of making bird noises. Annoying. Lots to see around the square don't miss the chiming of the astrological clock or the trip up the tower to take in the view. There are a few food stalls selling ham, the donut things called trdenik (spelled incorrectly I think!), hot wine, etc, around the place. Just keep your wallet safely in an inside pocket as we were warned by our hotel that pickpockets love this crowded square, but don't let that put you off visiting.

Keep looking up!. Loved walking round the old town and seeing the beautiful architecture. You have to keep one eye on where you're going, and the other upwards to appreciate the beauty of the architecture and one rather fun hanging man!
Beautiful. beautiful clean Old Town- great ham vendor! fun to watch music - vibrant, lively musicians - make sure you watch the CLOCK
Very beautiful. the building is beautiful and in the street you can find a lot of interesting things. It is something that i recommend to see it.

good atmosphere. Beautiful square with a few market shops and food stalls. Music playing and the usual human statues. If you take pics of them be sure to drop a few coins in the collection. The only down side to it were the incessant segway promoters bothering you every few minutes! Just be polite and say 'no thanks' and they won't bother you anymore but there are different companies.

One of my favorite parts of Prague. We loved wandering around the winding cobblestone streets, ducking into junky tourist shops and finding our way back to the main square and the astronomical clock. There are a few authentic restaurants, pivovars and the like on the side streets, but quite a few tourist traps and junk shops. Make time to wander around and keep an eye out for the authentic architecture and quaint city design.

The Beauty of Prague. When I first arrived in Prague, this was my first stop. I was totally mesmerised by the buildings and architecture of this Old Town. The main beauty lies on the concentration of uniquely designed buildings in one big area; I just could not stop being immersed in this classic town.
always a pleasure. Old town Prague has just the right mix of old and new and its clean and quaint and pleasant. And just the right size-always a nice stroll.

very touristic but worthwhile. The old town is full of old buildings, small streets, stores of all kind, bars and restaurants, etc. I find it a little commercial, but walking around there for 1-2 hours is interesting.
Great. Must visit day and night to get two different atmospheres.Good artectiure. Must look up at buildings and not just at shop fronts.
So Gothic. Buzzing day and night, must visit at night when all the gothic buildings are lit up and you feel like you are in another world, quite magical.

Old town square. What a fab Bohemian place to visit and chill out in. Plenty of street artists, musicians, Prague spit roast ham (A MUST HAVE!) and Check beer to be had whilst watching and listening. Wonderful!

Beautiful, historic and not to be missed. The Old Town is the heart of Prague and it would be difficult to imagine anyone coming here and not visiting Old Town. Make sure you bring comfortable shoes as the cobble stone streets can make walking long periods a bit difficult.

So much beauty and history. Great place to go shopping and eat Czech food. There are plenty of shops to get souvenirs. But I really recommend if u find something in that area look around in 4 or 5 shops and make your deals
Classic square with good place for a lunch. Nice square and you can get a decent priced lunch on a excellent location. Can't miss this square in your visit to prague

birthday surprise. what a wonderful place ! if you,re thinking of traveling to Prague don,t hesitate ! There is just so much to see ! my wife organised a surprise birthday trip and i absolutely loved it. The architecture is amazing............ don't hesitate just do it !!!!

Lots to see. Mind the appaling Segways.. This is a very vibrant area. There is lot's to see, and generally a band or exhibitors in the square. Very child friendly though we were saddened to see one of the numerous 'Segway Sales People' crash into a young kiddie. Until the Prague authorities ban these parasites we will not be returning. They are everywhere.

Heart of the City & A Stunning Place to be!. I have visited Prague four times now, and after the first visit based myself around this area, as it is truly the beating heart of the city. The architecture is awesome all around you, the maze of cobbled streets leads you past many tourist shops, pubs, bars, restaurantants, cafes - I would say this centre is my favourite city centre anywhere, purely for the architecture, the charm and the buzz arond the area.

The Place to Go. All Prague is very nice with an abundance of superb architecture. Old Town is particularly good but beware ladies, streets and paths are cobbled so not good for heels. Plenty of places to eat at reasonable prices but try to get off the main tourist route if you can. Lager is around 40Ck for half litre (exchange was 35Kc to the pound). You will find the people most polite and helpful.
In love with it!. Very romantic place and beautiful too! Prague is very affordable and easy to walk. Must visit if you come to Europe.

Fabulous, but Crowded. The old town square is a must see, the architecture is wonderful, good street food and of course the clock tower. We were there in early March and it was crowded, would not want to go in high tourist season.
Buzzing. Enjoyed the atmosphere, lots of people and a variety of entertainment. The architecture was amazing.
What a gorgeous city. We stayed in the Stare Mesto for 3 days and have decided that we will have to return. The food was exceptional, the sites unbelievable, and the history interesting.

Redolent of Old World Charm.. When you walk through the streets of the Old Town of Prague you feel as if you are walking through the pages of a fairytale. Cobbled streets and historic buildings abound. The streets are well supplied with cafés and pastry shops which are ideal for the necessary regular pit stops! Day or night we felt safe at all times as we walked around the Old Town. There are warnings about pickpockets but thankfully we did not have any bad experiences. In fact there were no pushy touts trying aggressively to sell you things as you tend to find in many European cities.
Must See. Flea Market. Tourist shops. Local food sidewalk vendors in controlled environment. Cafe's everywhere - Indoor and outside. Entertainment 24/7 (almost - exception mornings). Fun is the word.
old town. fantastic architecture, plenty of bars,restaurants and shops. Easy access via Metro, The food and drink is expensive in the town square but off the beaten track it's very reasonable.

Worth seeing. The Old Town is definitely worth seeing. The astronomical clock is very cool to look at and every hour it has a little mechanism for a show. The food around the area may not be worth the price but the food stands are not too pricey and are good local snacks/food. Bring a camera and walk around but you could get cheaper food elsewhere though the scenery would be nice if you have the money. We stayed there for about an hour or two.Tagline: Stop by spend and hour looking around the area definitely worth the look.

Amazing. Old Town of Prague is amazing, beautiful, but more expensive than the rest of Prague, since this is where all the tourists hang out. Come here and walk around, maybe have a beer at triple the price compared to everywhere else, but eat and drink the rest someplace else. Unless you want to pay more than necessary (still cheaper than a lot of other places in Europe), and you do get the experience and view of Old Town.
The Astronomical Clock. T.e time of the year being Christmas/ New Year, the greatest attraction was the Christmas markets and the variety of food

The Prague old town is magnificent. I love the old town in Prague. You can walk on foot all the day. Numerous historical buildings, greenery, friendly people, nice restaurants and the climate of the place - those are the advanteges. Definitely a must see place for everyone!

The center of old Prague. This is the place to go in the center of Prague. There is always something going on--unfortunately, there are also too many tourists. The locals don't frequent any of the cafes on Staromestske namesti because the food and drink are overpriced and the hustle and bustle of visitors waiting for the astronomical clock to strike is too much to bear sometimes. Still, it's a gorgeous square and definitely a must when in Prague.

One of the best old towns in Europe. Lot's to see within a small radiuos if you like to walk. I love Prague. The warmth of the Slavs mixed with western europe. A city that has not been bombed. Every thing is original

Prague's medieval heart. The Old Town is Prague's medieval heart. With recently restored baroque and renaissance buildings, narrow, cobblestone lanes, churches (don`t miss Church of Our Lady before Tyn), shops, bars, clubs and restaurants on every corner and the famous Astronomical Clock (on the hour the representation of Vanity, Greed, Death, Pleasure and the 12 apostles are set in motion and presented to the curious crowd) this place is unique in itself. And if you are lucky enough, you may also enjoy some quality music performed by talented young street artists.

Amazing. You can't go to Prague without going to Old Town. It is a very beautiful area which many great things to check out, whether it is the architecture of the buildings, the shops, and grabbing a bite to eat.

beautiful buildings. Spent all day in old town today. Everywhere you look is beautiful architecture. I saw a lot of mucha throughout old town! Lots of places to get souvenirs in this part of town as well. Favorite part of prague so far.
getting around. Always got lost, even with map but was good fun. lovely cobbled streets with plenty of restaurants and shops
Beautiful. The buildings are amazing. Went on a free walking tour so we could learn about what we were seeing. Well worth the couple of hours :)

Architecture....... The buildings are just amazing. Do not just visit the clock there is so much more to see in the little side streets. By the way do not miss the pancakes on the square, they are huge, good choice of fillings and great value.
Enchanting. Beautiful place to visit with the Astronomical Clock being the highlight- spent a lovely couple of hours exploring & people watching from Oliva Verde outside cafe. Well recommended
Beautiful. The most beautiful city. Old town is great fun to explore and view architecture as well as other sights.
Historic. Beautiful buildings. Astronomical Clock is interesting but really expected more! Street entertainers are amusing too!
Lots to see. Good place to start your visit of Prague , everybody seems to meet there, loads to see from places to people.

One of the place MUST TO BE VISITED. Atmosphere, architecture, street life. Good beer, several nice restaurants/pubs
Crowded street-life (sometimes to many tourists, like ourselves...)
Stunning & Gothic - great atmosphere. Beautiful, absolutely stunning Church in Gothic style and the square itself is so pretty. Lots to do, atmosphere is buzzing!
Julian& Dawn. Full of amazing architecture bars and places to eat and relax. People very friendly and helpful. The clock tower especially amazing.
Most beautiful city. Really, the most beautiful city I have ever been!!! Just to avoid tourists, go at the main places like old town square, castle, charles bridge by night or after 8pm :)
Wonderful walk. Obligatory stop to sightseeing. Lots of cafes, shops and cultural buildings. One day to spend in the old town

The dream of old Europe. Though very popular and filled with tourists, Prague's Old Town is large enough to find just about anything you could want. Picturesque alleyways, fascinating and beautiful architecture, quaint shops, great restaurants and bars, tacky and endless souvenir shops, Old Town has it all.
Fantastic. The architecture is amazing. So much to see and do in and around the square. The astrological clock not be missed.

Lovely Square-fantastic buildings. Such a nice square-great buzz always something going on, don't miss the clock every hour. just to stroll around is good, avoid restaurants pubs etc on the square better if you wander a few streets back to eat/drink.

You must stay here!. From the moment we walked in the door, we were treated like royalty. Frank, Victoria, Natalia and Tomas should be so proud of the product they deliver. When Frank found out I am 1/2 Czech, he brought kolaches the next morning...just like my Babi and auntie made. Wonderful breakfast! This was a 3-night stay at the beginning of our 18-day Europe journey. Hands down, the best hotel experience on the trip!
beautiful. Beautiful and full of History. Make sure to do the walking tour and eat something in the Old Town Square.
In the town centre. How clean it all is, no litter, no chewing gum mess, busy, vibrant , lots of shops and restaurants and museums

old town. a lot of character and historical significance with great architecture
The Jewish quarter was steeped in historical significance the synagogues were architecturally supurb
Busy but interesting architecture. Lots of groups of young people from many nations. Wouldn't eat or drink at cafes on the square as the cost is high. Go to the streets further back
Amazing and worth wandering. Take your time, I think we saw it all but it's twisty and turns with beautiful squares and endless beautiful buildings.

Ease of walking. It was our first day in Prague. We did not raise our hopes much as been throughout Europe cities ,more than 5 countries. This is top of our list and well, it did not disappoint much. Only minus is the astronomical clock which could barely raise our interests.
Old Town in Prague. Very romantic and old style place, nice to visit as couple but still great place to jump on with couple friends to have some noise party.
Magical!. we walked around and there was something new to look at at every corder. It was beautiful! the people at the stores were friendly. the architecture was magical and art was in the air!
Old Square,Prague. Astronomical clock,churches,restaurants,cobbles,car free,jazz band,market,pubs.No stag parties.mime artists,cafes.Ladies[or men!]dont wear high heels due to cobbles.

I lived in Old Town and later near Old Town. Perhaps the most beautiful Old Town in all of Europe. Walk the route kings took to be crowned. See where Mozart's play premiered. Visit the church on the square where Tyco Brahe is entombed. See the Jan Hus memorial. The site where protestors were executed. The Astronomical Clock. Prague is a must visit city of Europe and Old Town along with Hradcany and Mala Strana must visits of Prague.
A must for all. The architecture the shops and concerts / lots of beggars spoilt it to a certain extent Lots and lots to look at 130 churches

Nice place to walk and see different sights and views over the city from the castle. I liked walking around the old city. It had nice atmosphere and you can stop for a pint, coffee or food. If you like architecture I assume you would like it. There are couple point like for example the castle where you get nice view all over the city.
Chinese New Year. Fantastic display for the Chinese New Year. A real juxtaposition in the middle of this beautiful square.

Old buildings for good photos. Like its name, its the old town with lots of history. Buildings of different centuries are around it and the church and town hall are excellent backdrop for your photos. It's a good place to spend a afternoon, but not very exciting.

Best place. I have been at prague a week ago, and almost every day we was at the square couple of times. Its a central place, that all the roads some how lead to it. Very beautiful place, with street food and usually there are great street preformers. A lot of people so beware from thiefs!
Enjoy!

Old Town Square. Fascinating by day, magical at night. Lots to see and do. Always some form of entertainment going on, stalls selling food and drink (try the hot wine!). A maze of old streets branching off just asking to be explored
Awesome Place to See. If you dont want to see a new old town anymore, you dont have to go there, it s typical. But it is so good. I advice.
must do in Prague. beautiful, old, great ambiance. it is worth to walk around. If you are in Prague, this is where you start.
very impresive. all nice aritecture shops and histioric buildings castle the old time square nice city charles bridge all in all a great city
Great area. watch the performers and visit stall and seep up the vibe of this yet another great square surrounded by amazing architecture
Fairytale scene. Great buildings, exhibitions, shopping all within minutes of each other. Good food and drink. Great street entertainment for all ages.
Gr8. A must if you're in Prague. We were in Prague for a week and went almost every day for the food and views. Only bad thing are the selfie sticks and segways.

beautiful. Of course old town square is a must see for everyone visiting prague. it's beautiful, quaint, and was nearly (not entirely) untouched during WWII. It borders the Jewish Quarter and is within short walking distance to several metro and tram stops, delicious cafes and nice restaurants for decent prices if you know where to look!

Absolutely charming. I found it to be a great experience to walk the streets of the Old Town. It is also worth reading about the many stories related to the old places and buildings. This is a place where one really feels and sees something historical, charming and beautiful. Absolutely charming!
Must visit. A must for any visitor, always something happening and worth looking around the shops etc on the little side streets.

Kafka Museum. Kafka Museum is near the river and good location.
Gardens sculptures are pretty. But I thing the museum is a little bit poor Not yet for Kafka.
There is some photos and books and someting from his life.
May be more creative.
Stunning!. Make a point of being at the clock tower on the hour when all the figurines pop out. Enjoy a coffee in one of the many pavement cafes and watch the world go by.

Amazing square . had lots of fun here. Need to read about all city Hall and astronomical clock. Also the terraces over there with heaters have gre8 food. If it's sunny just grab a coffee and sit on the bench lovely

Fun and romantic. I cannot put into words how much I loved it. Great street food, great tours start from here, wonderful ambiance music, delicious and romantic restaurants, and picturesque buildings. In the evening, we went to the restaurant by the astological clock in Old Town square. I sat with my love by a cozy propane powered heater, covered with a blanket. The square is gorgeous when it is lit up in the evening. It has to be one of the most romantic setting I have experienced. I will never forget that evening. <3

The best I've seen. Amazing place to walk and learn about the history of the country. It's a magic place.Go early in the morning if you want to avoid crowds of tourists.Look up and down... you will discover many details in roofs and sidewalks.Take a walking tour, there are many details and info you miss if you go on you own. I took a tour with Sandemans in the morning [guides provide plenty of information], and another tour to the castle in the afternoon.Watch out... pickpocketers.
very fantastic. shops and restaurants really good.... the history buildings ...walking from the Charles Bridge near ..must be visit prag city

Beautiful place, shame about the vagrants. Absolutely beautiful area, with so much history and photogenic buildings. So much history to see.This was let don by the many beggars and vagrants. The main place they reside is on the sunny side of the big statue in the centre of the square. They will pester you. We were witness to an act which shocked us both. One of these 'gentlemen' pestered a young man next to us for a cigarette, then walked past us to the waste bin where he proceeded to urinate into the waste bin. No more than 1 metre from us both! Absolutely disgusting behaviour. One of his compatriates pulled him away, as he continued to urinate in his trousers. The police who are stationed on the square seem to do nothing about this.

Beautiful views. Lovely area & views especially at night.
Cheaper bars & restaurant of the main square roughly £1 a beer :-)

Step into the past. Try to look past the tourists taking selfies and the segways flying around and you'll see one if the most picturesque town squares in the world. I especially love the church of Mary in tyn poking out behind the smaller buildings.

home from home. the history - buildings -art - local restaurants and the beer it was all very cheap but good. the only dislike was the fact that some of the places were closed for repair or redecorating but ST Nicholas Church made up for the dissapointments

Touristy, crowded, but still beautiful. Old Town on a Saturday night, crowds of tourists, junk shops selling...well,junk. But the buildings are old, and beautiful, everything is clean and safe. We walked for hours. Lots of open places to get food and beer. We had trdelnik pastry, street food, fried pastry on a stick--so so yummy.
Lovely area. Great shops and restaurants got a really good vibe to it . Worth a visit to the u prince top terrace really reasonable and great views

Old Town Square - Prague. My 'Prague in One Day Sightseeing Tour' (arranged on line through viator.com) ended there. Being during the Lunar New Year period there was Chinese Dragon Dancing on a specially erected stage, and other displays of a similar theme, in the Square.Don't miss seeing the Prague astronomical clock, or Prague orloj, which is a medieval astronomical clock located in the Square. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working, See the display at the 'top of the hour', it's cute and makes it worth the visit.

Not as expected. I visited Stare Mesto on my first night in Prague with my partner, walking from the Charles Bridge up to Wenceslas Square at around 11pm. There weren't many tourists around at this time, but a fair few dodgy-looking men, often in groups. It just didn't feel like a safe place, especially after we were approached by a group of 3 drunk Praguers who were not very friendly! The mulled wine we bought from one of the stands was really awful, and we didn't really stick around for long to take in the sights. I was hoping the old town would be as enchanting as Krakow, but it isn't.... not even close.

Lovely to wander around.. What struck us most is the lack of cars. Almost the whole area is pedestrianised and even where it isn't you hardly see a car at all. Makes for a very relaxing and peaceful time. Lots of lovely architecture to see everywhere, nice shops and good resturants and cafes.

Something's Always Going On. Of course, you just have to go hang out there. At night there are performing artists with fire, etc. During the day there are singers, drummers. There's always something going on there.
lively interesting area. Just brilliant, always something going on. We were lucky as it was Chinese New Year and had Chinese performers.
Mooching round the old town. Lovely architecture, wander through the streets, lots of bars, restaurants and cafes to stop for a coffee or a beer to two, quite busy on Saturdays.

Such a cool city!. One of the hypest, coolest cities in the world :) Architecture is amazing as well as the people. Not to mention the finest beer in the world. Especially drinking it in one of the local watering holes with your friends and bunch of other happy people. I had so much fun visiting this place! I'm sure I'll come few more times :)

DO NOT EXCHANGE MONEY HERE. The currency exchangers are absolute charlatans and quote their rates on almost half of what it actually is. The rate of Euro to CZK was 1 to 28 around February, yet the exchangers at this tourist attraction quoted at 1 to 14 and justify it by saying they have no commission fees. So, I strongly suggest to either go to the bank or walk to other places with better rates (watch out for commission though). You have been warned :)

Surrounded by famous sights and bars, always something to see or do.. Surrounded by famous sights and bars etc. A photographic Challenge day and night and if photography isn't your thing just take it in. In the centre of the Old Town you are almost certain to pass through it. Good to view it from the Old Town Hall Tower as the lights come on.
brilliant for just getting lost. loved walking around the cobbled streets and getting a feel for the city. Its a good starting point for all sight seeing and good for getting to grips the location.

Part of the trip. When you walk around Prague you will come across this area. It is worth walking up the side streets poss more than the main areas as this is the old and unspoilt Prague that you have come to see. All of it needs to be found so you get a real feel of what it's all about. A quick stop at one of the street vendors selling various types of sausage in a bread finger roll for about 40/60 czk (£1.50) is a must.
Beautiful. Loved this, they had a Chinese New Ceremony on and it was excellent! Loads of pubs and restaurants but go back from the main square for better prices, although none are that bad!

Old Town Prague . Full of life and energy! We went during Prague's Carnivale season and there were lots of hot wine stands and street performers. Plenty of pubs, shops and attractions very centrally located. Be sure to visit Our Lady of Tyne Church. So amazing!
A Time Warp. You'll go here so I won't babble for long. We went while the Christmas markets were going on so everything was all dolled up but I imagine this place is magical year round.

Idyllic way to spend a day. Lots to see and do here. We spent most of our first day in Prague wandering the streets and shops of the old town. We saw the astronomical clock and went up the tower to gain a splendid view. Many places to eat - the Italian place next to the town hall building that has a freeze on it did the best gnocchi and risotto we have ever tasted. Explore the churches and keep looking up or you will miss some amazing architecture!

club it with charles bridge and palace. it is a must visit place. very lively both in day and night. lots of eating outlets and a tourist office to help as well. there is history of socialism all around which can be experienced best with a tour guide.
Stunning place. Simply a stunning place, with a new camera opportunity around every corner, along with welcoming bars and cafes.

A great place to get a taste of Prague. The central square in Prague offers many insights into what an amazing and beautiful city Prague is. From the dramatic architecture including the buildings upper floors, so make sure you look up when you’re walking around. The hustle and bustle of the local markets is a flavor of Czechs, the local street fairs and street food vendors, selling breads, pork and stews make sure to try it out. Watch out for the expensive Segway tours, if you like them sure, but they are a bit of a pest, all offering a free Segway ride…

Picturesque medieval square. The square is sourrounded by marvellous buildings. Remain in front the astronomical watch during hour change in order to see the action with the minatures. Unfortunately a lot of begars and homeless people, trying to pick up any food leftovers by tourists.
Old Town. worth a stroll up from the Jewish Quarter to Old Town Square past the lovely shops and avoiding the tacky side.
Lively and interesting. Astronomical clock has a fascinating history. Make sure you watch it when it strikes the hour - look out for the 12 apostles and the skeleton!
Historical interest. Lots of very picturesque buildings with loads of bars and restaurants to enjoy the buildings whilst eating the wide range of Czech specialities
Excellent. Chinese New Year also as a bonus,square has lots of foodie stalls around it,and the clock of course,what out for loose stones on the floor and dog mess

Running through historical Prague. I recommend, based on my own experiences, to try jogging in historical Prague during the night. You will remember for rest of your life your running over river on Charles bridge and up Nerudova street to Prague castle.

Historical square. Prague's Old Town is full of sights to see. There are some beautiful churches and buildings to enjoy, as well as fantastic restaurants that look out over the square. Fantastic for absorbing the atmosphere of one of Prague's must-see places.

Old Town is heart of Prague.. Nightlife is comfort, good restaurants, nice buildings and if having a good guide, can enjoy even more.
Visit the old town several times, in diff hours.
Pavement is horrible.
