old town prauge. Like any old town in any city you get what you expect. But old town Prague has something extra you just cant put your finger on. It is very crowded no matter what time of year it is, but the crowds don't put you off, I don't think we ever went to stop anywhere for a drink or food, were there was no room for us. It is absolutely magnificent in it's splendour, you do get transported back to a time long ago and cant help but imagine what it would of been like.It's definitely a must on a trip to Prague, I don't think you could avoid it anyway.

All roads in Prague lead here. When in Prague my friend said "always look up". Old Town Square typifies this. Everywhere you look it's hard not to be struck by the age and beauty here. A few locals and a tour guide told me 'this is the heart of Prague'. Beautiful architecture, quaint roads and monuments are features of this very historical and significant place. If you're looking for a tour, there are plenty on offer from here. My tip is to ask for one that is certified. From here you can go off in many directions and discover lovely cafes, museums, gift shops and more. The further from here you go, the cheaper the prices so shop around before committing to a restaurant or retail purchase.

Five minutes walk from Old Town Square to st. James church. Old Town is my favourite place. One can find there plenty of interesting sights, nice churches from romanesque one through gothic to baroque. You can also find many nice houses that were rebuilt and you can see romanesque or gothic cellars and renaissance facades. typical example is Old Town Square. During the construction of one of the houses under the main gothic church on the square (Týnský chrám) builders discovered original gothic facade hidden under modern rennaissance facade. The house At the Bell (U Zvonu) was kept as it was built originally. You can discover also nice and quiet streets and yards inside the old houses, and many other sights. Do not forget to visit Ungelt, one of the few renaissance palace behind the St Tynus cathedral). You can virtually pass couple of centuries in five minutes. Just start between U Zvonu and st. Tynus cathedral (gothic), pass the narrow street to the Ungelt (renaissance), go through the Ungelt and end the walk at st. James church with its baroque interior and famous organ. You can of course visit st. Tynus cathedral where Tycho de Brahe, famous Danish astronomer and predecessor and colleague of Johannes Kepler rests in peace. You can also visit gallery At the Bell (U Zvonu) and if you are lucky enough, you can stop at st. James church and hear nice organ concerto. The walk from Old Town Square to st. James church can take you 5 minutes, but also couple of hours. And it is just one small part of the Old Town. Other directions have other attractions. Enjoy Prague. Vb

The best of Prague. Old Town is heart of Prague. It is love of mine life. You can see Old Town in many ways through the eyes of tourist as one of the most romantic places in the world. As student of history you can see thousend of spires from the tower like Jindřišská or Petřín and any architectonic style you can imagine. As a pilgrim you can visite hundrets of churches, chaples or rotundas to satisfy your soul. But if you looking for quite place try not use Celetná, Karlova street and Old Town squere. Go in the back alleys like Kožná, Kamzíková, Řetězová, Zlatá, Maltézké nám., Tržiště, Nový svět or passages in Lucerna, Světozor or Kotva, Slovanský dům. If you want to enjoy this area take your time 2- 3 days the best :) visit some museums, galeries, towers and one day live for relax at some of the cafes, pubs or clubs (Imperiál, Orient, Slávie, Tricafe, Červená židle;Lokál, V kolkovně, U zlatého tygra, U Dvou koček, U chlupatýho ducha, The pub, Mincovna, Dejavu... If you are looking for local people than you looking in wrong part of Prague try try Prague 2 Vinohrady, I P Pavlova. If you don´t like crouwds, Czech republic has nicer towns like Telč, Olomouc, Kutná Hora, Český Krumlov...
Amazing city. I have to visit Prague again. It is too many thinks I do`t saw jet. Specialy Karles bridge and Old town square was amazing.

History. Old Town is a whole quarter, so there is something for everyone. Museums, churches, historical monuments (christian, jewish...), galeries, theaters, restaurants, walks. You can spend there one hour or a week and still there is something to explore.

Dark and Magic. Prague is such a charming place, and its old town is probably the most beautiful and captivating that I've ever visited, with its black towers and the very interesting history and mixture of styles. The art hides everywhere, in every building and statue, in every square in its ancient carved stone. And in contrast with that eastern tenebrous style, there are some other gorgeous constructions and galleries of Art Noveau, with floral motives and golden details. There is much more than the clock and the bridge. The whole city seems to have a spirit, something unique, that I can hardly explain, but that deeply touched me. Warning!!! At least when I was there it was under a massive tourism, with tons of people with cameras pushing you around, horrible music from the standard touristic stores, street sellers trying to make you buy stupid made-in-China stuff..... and the ancient charm of Prague was hardly to be seen. My advice: Try to start your visit very early, walk the side streets, search that silence that will make you get in contact with the spirit of the town, read about it's history and about its art and its symbols. That's why this annoying issue doesn't make my opinion of Prague any worse.
lovely area. We walked to here from our hotel every day and it was a very nice place to see. Lots of nice shops in the area

Watch Out when you're looking UP. Looking skyward for the 23 seconds that's need for the full cycle of the Astro clocks figures, be aware of the pick-pockets lurking around. You could find yourself light of a wallet if you're not careful.
Old Town Square. Loved walking in the square, seeing all the beautiful buildings, architecture, musical performers and tourists, people walking in square.
fantastic. you just can't go to Prague and miss the clock especially on the hour and the square great atmosphere street performers

On the hour. Really crowded when the hour is going to strike on the antique clock. The square a bit confusing - we couldn't, for instance find our way into one of the major churches overlooking the square!

An OId Fashioned European Square. Old architecture never looked so good in Old Town. We found a coffee shop that had a black- board with half of their menu written in Czech & the other in English. The service was terrific with great humor & grace. We walked around the town and felt we were transported to a different century.

Lotsa History and beautiful Square. Being one of the oldest town squares in Europe, obviously it has a lot of history. Ton of stuff about the origin of Czech republic and the bohemian tribe. The square always has some activity. We went during Christmas so there was a beautiful Christmas market selling food and glue wine.There was an amazing Christmas choir performing late into the night. The Square is always lit up beautifully and it is easily accessible by tram.

Historical part of Prague. One of the most well-preserved places in middle Europe. You will see there baroque and renaissance noble palaces and houses, even some in Romanic style. Lot of churches. Lot of pleasant restauraants and pubs with characterfull atmosphere some of them with a view at Moldau river
Worth a visit. Interesting square with lots of touristy attractions. The clock is interesting one time. Found a good restaurant nearby

hell for tourists, heaven for pickpockets. Very nice historical place, full of live-statues, soap-baloon makers, home-made musicians, hungry tourists with cameras and, sure, pickpockets. Local people avoid this place, however at night, when most of tourists are sleeping, this square looks fantasticly. The fabulous point to see this place from birds fly is the balcony of Prince Hotel (entrance is opposite the Clock).
Wery old architecture in large area. Super tower clock on the old town hall, but to much people. You can easy imagine the life in middle age.

A beautiful labyrinth of beer. Even after living in Prague for 4 months, I would still get lost in Old Town. There's really a magic there, and beauty will sneak up on you at every turn, especially as you get away from Old Town Square. It is worth taking some time to just wander around and get lost, walk in and stumble out of a hospoda, sit down at the window of a kavarna... And if you get too lost, it's ok - Old Town is bordered by the river on two sides and Narodni on the other two, which both make it easy to get your bearings.
Amazing square!. When in Prague you have to see this place. Great views, events, sights, sounds, and plenty of food and drink. And a great place to people watch!

Fairy tale. With the Tyn Church towering over the square and the Astronimical Clock Tower across from it, it just was a wonderful experience. The food was very good and a great variety. Wandered through the many shops

Busy, but great place to pick up a guide. This is the historic centre of Prague - and quite stunning. The Square is a hub for tour guides. We were fortunate to find Ross from Airport Transfers guides. He was ultra informative and gave us a brilliant insight the the history of the town, the people and culture of this wonderful city.

Walk through history of Czech Republic. Everything illuminated and therefore supersafe. Shops are open long in the evenings. Small Pubs in Czech Style are everywhere, the less spectacular they look the more "real Czech" they are.

Great place - interesting. Went here for weekend and spent time in the square. Lots of interesting things to see. Great atmosphere bars and shops galore. Beautiful buildings and small courtyards to explore. The place is wortg visiting and go back at night as well as day as the buildings are lit up - lovely place

Charming Time. These neighborhoods are a true delight to be walking through with watching everything that is charming to the old part of the town. One of the major attractions is the astronomical clock followed by various other architectural masterpieces around these roads. The restaurants and the street performers keep the fun quotient intact around here. It’s a different atmosphere altogether and a worthwhile place to visit while in Prague
Prague city. Lovely atmosphere visit the clock tower and underground rooms and the castle is a must especially at night when it's lit up
Fabiluous place. Wonderful place for relaxing and historic sight seeing. Astronomical Clock at 12 o'clock presents 15 minutes presentation
The astronomical Clock. Let you hang out in the square where street performances are rich and varied.In a few steps you can inspire the bohemian charm, fronts of houses, crystal...
Busy & beautiful. Very beautiful and historic. All of the buildings design are so intricate and detailed. A must see!!!
Pretty square. Lovely busy square. Sat in a restuarant and had a drink and watched the world go by. Astronomical clock is beautiful.
History all around. I love Old Town of Prague. You can really feel the history here..you must visit the Old Town Square and Jewish Cemetery!

Thieves. there seemed to be an issue with rogues selling money on the streets and they can be a nuisance just be aware and note there are lots of plain clothed police and cameras every where. Just be sensible. But enjoy this amazing city!!

Lovely but ruined by tourist hordes. The architecture is incredible. The views are lovely. The astronomical clock is interesting albeit a bit overrated. I visited on a weekday and it was much nicer as the crowds weren't too huge. On Saturday, that all changed. My advice, wander round on a weekday. Don't get caught in the tourist traps on show. Eat at places away from the main square of the old town. I hope you enjoy the astronomical clock more than I did.
Quaint and interesting. Nice range of tourist shops and some interesting architecture. On street entertainment makes for a good atmosphere.
Historic old town. Great for people watching and coffee culture. Good variety of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. Take a wander off the main square to find more reasonably priced venues,

Just Walk and Enjoy. The whole area is a real rabit warren of small alleys, squares, and places to explore. You dont really need a map as ists pretty difficult to get lost with the area bounded by most of the mmajor thoroughfares and the River Vltava. The architecture is divine with buildings of all ages cheek by jowel with each other. the real joy - for me - is the multitude of art nouveau design places which abound and which have been lovingly maintained. The area of the Old Town Square is always very busy and you are likely to get regularly accosted by locals trying to entice you into their restaurant. Most of the major roads through the Old Town are busy with other tourists and there are plenty of shops sellling from complete tut to quality Czech glass and jewellery based on the local garnets. The best outlet by far for quality at excellent prices is Manufacktura with a number of outlets around town selling hand made toys, ceramics and toiletries. The biggest problem is the burgeoning number of Segway tours as these morons seem to think everyone should give way to them in the sometimes impossibly narrow streets. They should be banned to the benefit of all
weekday trip. the quaint side streets and bars i could not fault anything there was entertainment in the streets very nice
Beautiful square and lots to see for free!. Wander around all of the little streets and be astounded by the different styles and colours of the buildings!

What a beautiful old town!. Stare Mesto or Prague's Old Town is amazing. A nice square with loads of beautiful old buidings and the fanstastic and famous astronomical clock (Prague Orloj) in the tower of the old city hall.
very busy, even in February. fabulous old buildings, great atmosphere. wide selection of bars and restaurants - the beer was wonderful!

Step back in time. We have no idea of history in Australia - our mere 200 years or so are a drop in the ocean compared to this beautiful town. Make sure you have enough time to just wander around, You will not regret it
very impressive. It was well worth to walk up to the cathedral and the windows and structure was breathtakingly beautiful,. A real treat to see and walk around in. Can take pictures
Huge buildings. It's great and the biggest castle in Europe, I guess. I liked it a lot, you definetely have to go there, if you are in Prague

Nice to walk round astronomical clock is overrated and don't eat or drink anything in the restaurants on the square. Some beautiful buildings to admire and once you have waited with the hundreds of tourists on the hour to see the astronomical clock strike your wonder what all the fuss is about! Word of warning about the restaurants and bars on the square avoid and go find some in the side streets so you don't pay inflated prices. the quality of food is not great your get much better elsewhere

Great little area. Beware of restaurants right on the square itself, one day we accidently paid €40 for 2 bread rolls 2 drinks and a portion of chips! Loads of lovely restaurants down the side streets and alleys, have a wander and you'll always find something. As for nightlife we had to research bars as there's none really visable from the square, but they're all just off in the side streets

our fav area. this area in Prague really has everything. Loads of lovely shops (both brands and independent), stunning landmarks, great restaurants and fantastic street entertainment. If you get to this place in the afternoon you can definitely lounge around for hours which is great as the square looks even more stunning as the sun goes down and the array of lights are turned on.
Nice place for a coffee. Nice to sit for coffee but really crowded during Christmas holidays!Good local food to taste at the christmas stalls.

Enchanting and really quite unspoiled. I loved the fact that Prague's Old Town is not some Disneyfied, dandified tourist hell. Real life - commerce, synagogues, public transport, posh haute couture shops, offices - is going on all around you as you gawp at old frescoes on buildings or sit with a hot chocolate and watch the world go by beneath a medieval portico or crenellated buttress.A lovely quarter to just wander with a camera. Honestly you could spend a whole afternoon doing nothing but photographing interesting windows or something.Don't bother planning a route, just follow your nose from Parizska to Wenceslas Square and then amble back on different streets.

Obligatory visit. Cleary this is a must-do for any visitor to Prague. The square is beautiful and bot just for the major landmarks, the adjacent buildings are also lovely. Just beware of the beggars, pedlars, gypsies, and other lurkers. The tour guides and Segway drivers are also a bit of a pest.

Travel back in Time. Loved visiting this historic area. The architecture is fantastic and you can't go wrong spending a day getting lost in all of it. Street performers, cafe's, and art make for a wonderful experience of culture. I really loved watching the "performance" by the clock, as it is a true work of art and science.

Magical. This place is one the most spectacular historical places that I have seen anywhere. The cathedrals the squares the streets are just stunning. Lots of fantastic pubs with a lot of charm. This place is a favorite of mine.

Well preserved old town. Great old world experience and great beer to go with it. Great shopping for Crystal glass at Erpet.
The local entertainers make it even more special...dont miss the clock striking the hour and the figures coming out.
History lovers unite!. It's hard to walk ten steps without bumping into a cathedral or museum. The pubs are great as well as the people watching.

Did Prague inspire Disney?. As you stroll around Prague you just get the feeling that Disney was inspired by this place. Lovely small cobbled streets and beautiful buildings give this place a special feel.

A Walk in the past....... amazing architecture,the feel in the atmosphere is completely different.it would be good to wear some comfortable shoes walking on cobbled stone street could be quite challenging and tiring.........
City Break. General ambiance of old town square.Charles Bridge and castle via the vanicular,evening boat trip was great,the zoo was interesting too.

old town magnificent. architecture, cobbled streets, the beautiful buildings and the feeling of being back in time! Did not care much for the big businesses on the main street, kfc, mc donalds, burger king, debenhems etc but hey that is progress I think!
Old town. Liked the history but didn't like the cobbled stones as made our feet ache.....but very attractive!!

Simply beautiful. Visited with my husband and friends many times.There is always something going on in the Old town. Markets, parades, displays...you can just wander in the streets, watch people from all around the world, shop for souvenirs or sit down at some little pub or cafe. Whatever type of a tourist you are, you are going to be happy and content in Prague Old Town.

This is Prague. Period.. Just this.. this is all of Prague. If you don't have a lot of time in Prague, spend what time you have here. The astronomical clock is right around there, and this is also where they host the Christmas Market. Brilliant ambience.

one of the nicest original old towns in Europe. worthwile to walk around through all the streets (stone bricks ground. As the downtown is really big i would recommend to use a seagway. the best view from the hill in the park close to the downtown.
Great food and good prices. Comprehensive menu with food freshly cooked. Polite and helpful staff, so ended up going there 3 times.

Beautiful place. very beautiful place but highly recommended in Christmas time. i recommend do not book hotel near new Prague because more beautiful and historical is old Prague after the Charles bridge not old town.

Heart of Prague !. Its must go in Prague!
There's astronomical clock in there, which is one of most popular tourist attractions. Good connections to other parts of town, lots of restaurants, museums, facilities.
If you are in Prague for a first time, you should start your trip from there !
cobble time. wear good well broken in walking shoes, and a map is also a good idea, because you can easily turn a corner and be lost , but I suppose that is the charm
Old Town-Christmas Markets. Old Town was wonderful - and the Christmas Markets with their sights and smells (yum) will always remind me of the wonderful time I spend in Prague
Beautiful Area. Beautiful touristy area ... unfortunately prices to match. Try and go more off the side streets for better value.

Beautiful city. Just walk around and appreciate the atmosphere. All the city center is beautiful. Lot of things to be discovered in the north part of the town in the Jewish district. Charles bridge is a must to see night and day
Fantastic. We are in Prague right now in February, weather is really winter, frozen, but we enjoy the whole atmophere of the Old Town, fabulous city

Amazing city. We spend only two days in this fascinating city. The many old buildings and the architecture are just breathtaking. We walked around all day and enjoyed looking at all the beautyful buildings and sites.
Great Stop. Get some mulled wine and enjoy a nice stroll through Prague. Plenty of food and shopping options all around you.

Try and not go during high season. Lovely place, worth walking all over, avoid Karlova street and take all the side passages and narrow streets, to avoid the crowds, the tourist traps and prices and get to see a lot more of Prague that way.

Great Sightseeing and Cheerful Crowd. More often than not, I have not been disappointed by the turnout of crowd on the early weekdays during my Europtrip. This was definitely not the case with Prague. People around us seemed to be generally having a good and enjoyable time, with many busy behind their cameras trying to capture that perfect snap. Call it our good fortune, this was the place where we ran into the Segway guys and struk a bargain with them. Twenty Euros for an hour long guided tour of Prague! We were back here at around 7:30 PM and hanged around at the Starbucks nearby to look at astronomical clock turn an hour. This however did come out to us as a little overhyped.
Clock Tower display a disappointment.. Lovely square, beautiful buidlings but watch our for beggars and dodgy characters trying to sell you money on the street!
Lovely. One of the 'must see's' when visiting Prague, very pretty and lots to see when there.This is a must do and see.
holiday. amazing beautiful place loved prague though very busy with it being holiday season, loved going at christmas as it was very cold and all the wooden stores set up , will definatly go again

A must see!. The Old Town is an absolute must when visiting Prague. There's loads of different things to see and do, plenty of places to eat and drink and even some entertainment, when we were there, there was a great jazz band playing! If you are feeling lost, there's a tourist information shop just across the road. Beware of segways and people posing as strange looking statues! Also home of the astronomical clock.

Overwhelmingly beautiful!. It is absolutely stunning to see so many art deco, cubist, gothic buildings in such a small area of a city - it was terribly romantic and the snow and cold only adds to the experience.The astronomical clock as many will tell you is easily the most over rated sight in the old town square - if you're passing by it and happen to watch it chime then stay and watch - but if you dont get a chance to pass on the experience you're not missing much - after all the clock was built many years ago.The street performers at night are well worth stopping by for and the musicians are top notch too, only adding to the romance of this great city center! The closest metro station to the city center is just behind the big cathedral building a hop and a skip from the national art gallery and the Tyn Cathedral - the high street and the old jewish district is very close too!

Amazing!. The old town is really beautiful, full of restaurants, small souvenir stores and nice views. The small streets have a medieval look and the Old Town Square is full of people anytime, tourists are numerous, even during winter time. The views from Prague are the most beautiful I have even seen!

A place to start in Prague. The open cobblestone square began as a marketplace for merchants from all over Europe. King’s processionals to the elaborate palaces, public executions, and widespread rallies have taken place in Old Town Square since the 11th century.The great Astronomical Clock built in 1410 is fascinating. Its Apostle and skeleton figurines dance at the top of each the hour, and large crowds gather to watch the show.For more, and photographs, visit http://www.jenniferlynking.com/2015/02/03/6-places-see-prague/

Love the streets, loved the Salvador exhibition. There are two exhibitions on two different floors : Sakvador Dali, and Andy Warhol.If you like these artists, you certainly should go and take a look....:-)

Beautiful. Beautiful part of Prague, so much to do and see. Cobbled streets with phenomenal architecture at every turn. Certainly something for everyone, whether you're looking for culture or to party you will find it in old town.

zlata Praha is the most beautiful city in the world. I hope not too many people would disagree with the statement that, Zlata Praha is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. You cant describe it, you just have to experience it. Walk the Squares, parks and centuries old streets, stop by at the places Josef Lada and Franc Kafka described. Who knows, you might actually run in to bravi vojak Svejk.

Prague Visit. We liked everything and have no adverse comments other than the Restaurant Melankova close to the Infant Jesus Shrine at the Church of our Lady Victorious which had great atmosphere but exorbitant prices

A must visit on any trip to Prague. As per the title, every visitor to Prague should have this on their list. The buildings surround the square are beautiful and include restaurants, churches, hotels and museums. The astronomical clock is located here, and there are performers, stalls and many walking and segway tours start from here. Lots of good places to eat.
Okay. I'm not one for history and old buildings and stuff like that. The whole experience was good as to see the difference from where I'm from.

Most picturesque and lovely. A place in a particular situation of beauty with a medieval quality and mix of architecture and pastel colours contrasted with old stone, by a wide river and a castle on a hill with elevated parklands in the backdrop. Stunning and absolutely loved it.
pleasant atmosphere. Liked the live food stalls, musicians on road, souvenir shops, the oldest clock.disliked : currency change shop that charges 25% commission

Look into Medieval times. Old Town Square and City Hall, great X-mas tree-huge,but "assembled" together by branches (!)at least they were real.Too frosty streets and lack of prevention - sands or....so people will not fell on their behinds...Lots of chocolaty-heaven shops for lovers of this fantastic food.

Great Place to Hang Out and People Watch. This is the most ideal place to people watch it Prague. All the locals and tourists merge here so this has the best of everything from street pedlars to restaurants, to bars. Though, it has too many tourists, I still loved hanging around here. The square is very pretty.

A fun hang out. So much to do in this little part of Prague, this city and this area Is known for being a party town, but the city is essentially what you make of it, there are small markets, plenty of shopping and loads of little museums to do and see. What a little gem.

one of tge best site on europe. one of tge best site on Europe
for my is a one of the most beautiful part on prague
recommended in the night
Magical. One of the most picturesque views of my whole trip, and also full of history. Definitely worth more than one visit!
Is a dream. Is like going back in time a live history again. Love it will recomend to all age travelers is someting for everybody to do.
Beautiful. Walking around the Old Town feels like a fairytale. There is so much art and music around, and even with all the tourists, the place is amazing.
Not to be missed. amazing building, cannot be missed, better during the day cause there is not a lot of lighting during the night
Beautiful Christmas scene. Beautiful square with thewonderful astronomical clock chiming each hour. Hotel U Prince wonderful hot chocolate on the roof terrace overlooking a Christmas snowy scene.

Full of history and very interesting. Lovely hidden corners or alley, with very interesting building, nice cafe, boutique.....don't rush and take your time to browse, the perfect spot of sight, sound and smell of the town,. In love with Jazz band at the square. Not to be miss.

Tour de Martin of the old town. I loved it all as we mixed old with new. Martin was very knowledgeable and delivered history with an interesting style of a young man that enjoyed his work.
This tour was free but we were happy to dig deeply and pay up with smiles on our faces.

Enjoy the sights and sounds. My wife and just love walking around the Stare Mesto, shopping, eating and just plain people watching. You need to go there at different times of the day. It is a must see in Praha.
Old square is amazing . Speechless about how the Europeans maintain their heritage. Amazing. Spellbound. This is synonymous with Prague.

Steeped in history. Loved all of this little town steeped in history and plenty to see. Beautiful gothic country. People are friendly and reasonably priced . Have visited this place twice and will definitely come back again.
perfect. Clean so much to see loads of interesting things to do. Loved all of it . shopping sightseeing taking in refreshments

Not to be Missed. Prague has one of the best Old Towns in Europe. Amazing architecture, great shops, excellent food, and awesome people. You can see it all in a day or so, and then go on to Budepest. Also not to be missed. The dollar used to buy a lot here, but the Euro has spoiled that somewhat. Still, a good value and some of the oldest history anywhere. Stay in the old town if you can and look for a smaller place or B&B.

Picturesque town. The Old Town has hundreds of characterful buildings and many are decorative. We enjoyed the Town Hall Clock Tower very much, you could get a lift to the top of the tower where there was a fantastic view over the Old Town.

Obviously you're going, but look for the free tour. A number of free tours leave from this area, so make sure not to miss out on one. We joined the airport transfers tour, and there were so many aspects of the area they pointed out that we would have missed.Also, try and show up 10 minutes before the hour so you can get a good spot in front of the astrological clock. It gets very crowded for people to see the mechanics at the hour, but you should see it at least once. For another take on this, climb the tower and take some pictures of everyone gathering around down below during the chiming.
atmospheric. Liked everything. Charles bridge is stunning. Great street entertainment too. Try out the chezch cuisine and also the waffles!
Very lively, day and night.. A nice location to spend the evenings when you are in Prague. Lots of restaurants and bars where one cane spend a good night out.
Sweet Astronomical Clock! and more!..... ...the beautiful facades of houses, the baroque style, the quiet atmosphere without cars, each corner so picturesque !
worth seeing; find something new on each trip. Never ceases to amaze me how many new buildings, etc. I notice every time we go to the Old Town. Try to eat at restaurants off the main streets/squares.
Great for a mid week break. So much to see and do will have to go back again to fully enjoy everything we were there during a celebration of freedom which was fantastis there was so much going on
simply amazing. one of the places you must see, Prague old town is one of the few places cities with super intresting places to see.

Nice to walk around.. Old town is nice. Lots of sidewalk to walk around. If you see the pastry on a coal fire that looks like a coil with cinnamon and sugar on it, get it. They are yummy. Lots of restaurants and stores to see. Just pick a direction and go. We had our 15 month with us and he loved seeing all the people. Stroller friendly area.

Very good to wander around shops, houses and cafes. We spent a lot of time in the Old Town. There are some beautiful old buildings, friendly cafes and really good shops. The puppets and games shops are good as is the market [ try the fresh strawberries twice the size of U.K. ones but tastier!] good for jewellery and garnets too. We loved it.

Lovely and Quaint. Great transport system that enables you to see lots within a reasonable time! Loads of restaurants to choose from, so fnd one to fit your budget! It's great to see an old town and buildings still looking good! Wear sensible shoes as there are lots of cobbled streets! Shop around for bargains and negotiate, even for your bobbled hat! We had a drink at one of the palace museums and though the view and service as great, it would have cost half the price at a small coffee shop 50 metres away, and still with a good view! But the toilet facilities there may not have been as nice!We loved walking round the Old Town and hopping on and off the tram to get to wherever we wanted! Use the guide book if you are pushed for time, as it has good recommendations!

Old town square. Great in January when few tourist around and no queues of attractions, cheaper pubs and restaurants a few streets away from the ones to be 'to be seen in' on and around the main square

Beautiful even in the drizzle . What a beautiful city with amazing architecture. It was just fab. Lots of tourists around and plenty of places to drop in or out of for a beer or a coffee! This clock is definitely worth seeing and next time I'm in Prague il go at night time! It was beautiful during the day even though it was drizzling rain.
Very beautiful. We visited when the Christmas Market just opened and it was magic. Food, drinks and atmosphere are fantastic!
Impressive. Definitely it is the most impressive spot of Prague and you can it on its best at night! Please, spare some time here and help yourself with a czech beer.

Unique. Walking in the old city you thing that you belong to another world.
Very clean and well organized.
You can easily walk everywhere in a couple of days and you can explore castles, old churches see events.

Wencelas Square,astronomical clock,Christmas markets. Our first visit to Prague and it was wonderful. We stayed on Wencelas square so it was a short walk to old town square and other attractions. The architecture was amazing aaand the Christmas markets made it a magical stay. The astronomical clock is very unusual and a good crowd gathers there. Will visit Prague again and try a different season. Definitely need to buy a fur hat to be part of the crowd.

Jaw Dropping architecture. SO well preserved and immaculate! Was so impressed with the detail, the colours, the contrast between gothic and baroque. The culture of food, drink and cobble stone work made this place my favourite city in Europe
Prague. Archtecture, always crowded, many interesting people to see,a bit disturbing the devote posing of beggars in the streets
It deserves the walk. Get yourself lost in the Old Town. It is worth the time. Find new passages and shortcuts, and lovely stores and restaurants on the way.
Beautiful. A lovely square with stunning architecture. Loved the astronomical clock which draws in crowds on the hour.
Old Town is romantic and very nice. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in Europa. You should visit Old Town, if you have possibility. And very nice time for visiting is Christmastime.
Old town Sq. the astronomical clock, the many churches and the cobble stone square. Great atmosphere around at time carousel.

Beautiful place, busy season. Prague is a lovely, magical place. Just keep in mind over the winter holiday season it can be quite busy! The streets and main square by the clock especially. That being said, it was one of our favorite Christmases!
Old town. So many places to go with medieval architecture, Lovely clock face and extensive square very near Wencelas Square and Jewish Quarter, worth a visit

Beautiful old town. Lots to see in and around the old town square, nice to just wander round. Lovely shops and cafes, lovely churches, powder gate, the municipal hall. Beautiful at christmas, second time back for the christmas market.

fantastic christmas atmosfer. Great to get in a Christmas spirit! Lovely market with lots of Christmas lights, fantastic big tree in the middle with life Bethlehem (donkeys..) And a tower clock (orloj) which moves every hour is a must!!!!
Fantastic. Very nice spot in Prague. Lot's of nice small restaurants and nice old buildings to see. Really a must to go when you'r in Prague.
Stunning Places. Make sure you see the Astronomical clock and the church lit up at night is also just stunning. Do one of the ghost tours which meet at 7pm under the clock very interesting!!
Beautiful. Loved the whole atmosphere. Christmas markets, food, shopping and especially the hot chocolate! Everyone should try this

A lovely place. i have been prague lots of times.. Summer or winter always backed of tourists. This place is so nice and located at old town, few min away to charges bridge. I always recommend prague if you are thinking about next vacation trip:)!

Just Beautiful. I absolutely fell in love with the city of Prague - it is so beautiful! Every corner you turn, you are greeted with more stunning architecture. The sheer scale of it all is impressive. The old town is really lovely, and full of character. I can't wait to visit again!

Brilliant Architecture. Typical old town square - larger than most. Untypically the Architecture is as spectacular as it can get. Prague is very old and feels it. I have read bad reviews about the cost and standard of restaurants in this area but found I could always find somewhere that suited my needs.
Lovely Square. This is a beautiful square with lovely buildings throughout, including the Astronomical clock. Its a must see area with lovely pubs/restaurant all close by.

Disappointing Christmas markets Old Town Square, Prague. Disappointed at the Christmas markets in December 2014. Thought there would be a lot more home-made, art and craft type things to buy and take home as presents, but the majority of stalls were souvenirs that you could find in all the souvenir shops around the Old Town Square.
A fairytale. It is hard to believe that this area is so well preserved. There are so many things to see here...a must see if you visit Prague.
Beautiful.. Such a lovely area with incredible architecture. Perfect for a stroll to just take it all in, plenty restaurants and places to get a coffee and relax.

Fairytale Heart of the City. This is the historic part of town, often referred to as District 1, that every visitor must visit to experience a fairytale on Earth. The best way to arrive here is to take Metro Line A (green) to Staromestska (Old Town Square) in the city center by purchasing a 24-hr transit pass for 110 crowns ($5) at any metro station machine. Old Town is located on the east bank of the Vltava River, connected to the the Lesser Quarter (Mala Strana) on the west bank by the famous Charles Bridge. Many major landmarks are located in Old Town, such as the Tyn Church (the inspiration for Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle) and the Astronomical Clock (the oldest working clock in the world) in Old Town Square, the National Theater, and the Powder Tower (the gate to Old Town). Old Town is great for a stroll through Medieval times and enjoying the architecture as you grab a bite to eat from the street vendors and window shop at the various novelty stores, but don't buy anything since everything here is overpriced for tourists.Lodging in the city center is expensive, so find hotels in the nearby neighborhoods, such as Districts 2 or 3 to the east and south, District 7 north of the river, or District 5 to the west, then take the metro into town.

Medieval dream. I've been in Prague a few times and never disappointed me. The old town is a Medieval dream, with the astronomical clock, sharply towers, stone streets and a food market in the centre. The entire city is a sweet in your eyes with the Cathedral on top of your views, the river and The Old city centre in the middle. A must place to go with friends or specially for a romantic trip

Well worth a visit both by day and night.. Various interesting shopping streets and exhibitions an and around th large square. Plenty of eating and coffee shops.The famous astromical clock is the center piece with moving figures that pop at on the hour.We did the WW11 walking tour which lasted around two hours and explained how the Czechs started their resistance and how the war evolved for the local population. Our guide, Marek was very knowledgable and showed us where the resistance were hiding out underground.
top top. The Old town of Prague is superb hightlight! Really great city with long history, very amazing, when I have a next trip in Prague have to see more there

history on the go. So many places to fidn and see here. Many nice and small streets with local galleries, souvenir shops, restaurants and cafes. Built in Bohemian style, you cant find modern building.

Nice to see, not much to do. Old Town Square is just something to have to see but there isn't much to do there. Mostly eating and drinking, it is however lovely and we found that from here the surrounding streets held all the fun. Go but don't hand around for too long.

Praha around the World. The fairy-tale city with its Old Town Centrum is beautiful especially during the Christmas season.Vendors sell their wares, Christmas lights sparkle and the tantalizing aroma of mulled wine permeates the air. The Romanesque and Baroque facades, iconic Astronomical Clock and cobblestone streets add an old-fashioned mystique to the city.

Just wander to your hearts content!. What a perfect old town. Beautiful, untouched and complete. It really is a special place and should not be missed. Warning ladies - wear flats only. Those charming old cobblestones were not meant for heels!

Beautiful Compact Old Town. We were in Prague for the christmas market.....Prague should be on everyone's list if they love christmas markets. Everywhere you turn was just beautiful - from the specialty puppet shops, to the crystal shops, enhanced by centuries-old buildings and structures stooped in history. Then the food and selection of restaurants - not too pricey but excellent choices all around are the toppings to your visit.
Beautiful. Stunning place-walking is great - you get to see the astronomical clock and make your way to different locations plus shop some souvenirs

Unique!. This is a very unique Plaza, with traditional czech food cooking on every corner, delicious Pilsner Urquell in every pub, traditional dances being perfomed as well as music. Lovely czech dolls in every store, museums, art galleries, nice eastern european architecture and a lot of places to sit and take it all in, its so pretty during the summer because the weather is perfect!
Stunning architecture. I went in January and it was pretty busy, so I would going in the summer because of the crowds. Astronomical clock and surrounding churches are mandatory for a trip to Prague

Magical during the Christmas market. If you have a choice, visit the Stare Mesto in the run-up to Christmas. The market still retains many of the artisan stalls that have been replaced by sellers of 21st Century plastic junk elsewhere in Europe. The stallholders are friendly, with plenty of tasty foods to try, and the crowds include many people who are clearly locals, as well as the obvious tourists. But is the setting which makes the old town magical. The twin spires of the 14th century Tyn Church, the Astronomical Clock beside the Old Town Hall Tower, the bars and restaurants in historic buildings - they all combine to put Prague near the top of any must-see list.And if you have 800 Czech Koruna to spare after all that, spend it on an evening horse & carriage ride around the town. You won't regret it!

Unmissable even in freezing cold weather!. Walking in Old Town especially in the evening when everything so beautifully lit up and seems almost magic is an unforgettable experience - a must do when in Prague! Enjoy the architecture which is so unique!

Splendid Old WorldTown with Lots of Charm. Prague's Old Town is a great walking district. It is relatively flat over mostly narrow, cobbled streets. The buildings are all painted in different pastel colors, and because they are only 4-5 stories tall, the district has an open feel to it. During Christmas, the Old Town Square has a Christmas market that fills nearly the entire square, perfect for strolling and people watching.
Wonderful. We loved Old Town! So much history, beautiful buildings, so many restaurants and the clock tower! Go there!

Unique!. The Stare Mesto is the centre piece of old Prague. There is nowhere else like it in the world. Its centre is the main square with lovely medieval buildings the the twin spired Tyn Church. It is an area of crowded narrow streets thronged with people and activity. The atmosphere is wonderful.

Christmas Season Fervor. The cobble stoned streets and walks, the architecture, the bakeries, restaurants, shops, and Czech people came together to proclaim a free and enterprising people ready to learn again the meaning of the Christmas Season.
Wonderful Gothic Buildings. We really enjoyed the old town with its rich architecture particularly 1200 to 1400 AD gothic buildings. It is the heart of the city and definitely worth seeing.
Must visit. A must see tourist sight. feel the atmosphere of a medieval city. Only disappointment was astronomical clock which is an anticlimax .

Beautiful. The most beautiful buildings, you have to walk looking up or you will miss so much. Prague is well worth a visit, a very beautiful city with plenty to do. It was cold and when we went and I had to buy a hat to keep warm. Loads of nice places to eat and drink.
Christmas market is nice. been there in the christmas market time, nice place to visit with lots of food and drinks, dont expect too much from the astronomical clock.
Lovely setting. Beautiful Sq. with xmas market stalls still selling hot food and drink. Nice atmosphere. Most places are off of the square

Absolutely stunning, amazing Christmas markets. Can you think of a better place to spend Christmas than Prague? I cannot. Everything was amazing. Old Town is so beautiful with it's old, blackened buildings, looming church spires, astronomical clock, and of course, the red topped Christmas Market. Everything about Prague was magical and amazing. A must visit.

Just wander..... Get lost in the winding cobble streets, discover galleries, shops, museums, markets and bars.
Full of character, straight out of a film set- good idea to use tripadvisor to sort the good from the bad for dining.
Don't miss it. Nice place to look around and enjoy the local food. May choices for restaurants. Gets little crazy late night.
Stunning, amazing. It was love on the third sight. First two times, it was bad weather... this time, I fell in love with Prague historical centre. People were very friendly and helpful.

Fabulous food and entertainment. The Old Town is the best place to stay, so many historical building and also the restaurants were great. The all day street entertainers were fascinating right up until 10pm, well worth a visit.

magical. lovely place to be, lots of wonderful places to visit when in Prague. This is one of them... Prague is full of interesting places to visit. It is rich in history and it has so many wonderful old places.
Nice walk.... Beautiful historical place. Old town have a nice atmosphere which you can't find in other European cities!
Great for Christmas market!. Great decorations and many good vendors....entertainment provided just have to be there, can be crowded and cold weather...want to visit again in spring

Main district for tourists. Prague's Old Town is beautiful. It is pedestrian area with narrow streets made of stone. It has a lot of shops, bars, restaurants, main Prague attractions and a lot of tourists. In the center of Old Town is famous Old Town Square with famous clock and Gotic church. Be aware that Prague is full of pickpockets and they are always on main touristic places.

So pretty!. That atmosphere which covers the whole old town makes Prague truly special. Just get lost in this area and you will find that magic of the city ! Definetely do not miss it if in the city !
cute and touristy. No signs remaining of communist greyness and neglect.It is clean, pretty, cute - wall to wall trinket shops and rammed with tourists - its like Disneyland Eastern Europe style.

Magical Old Town. I absolutely love Prague's Old Town. There are many places to eat, or simply just sit and have a drink while you people watch. From here you can truly get anywhere you want or need to go. It's a wonderful mix of tourists and locals.

Charming. We went when the Christmas market was still there and the atmosphere was lovely.The square itself is beautiful with some very old buildings around it,vaulted cafes and of course the Astronomical Clock.Well worth a visit.

One of the most romantic towns. Prague is a beautiful city, particularly the Old town. Its a blessing all the Czech involvement in skirmishes hasn't seen the town ruined like many others in Europe.We found ourselves continual comparing it to Paris - the romance of the place shines through just like the French capital.The beautiful square was even better for us as we had the pleasure of the Xmas markets. They themselves are nothing special - just a city market but they added to the romance of the place. The cobblestone streets and interesting little lanes makes the place a pleasure to wander in.We must have been lucky in that we didn't find the crowds a problem, with the possible exception being the regular clock event

Don't miss the tower!. If you can only go one place in Prague, this would be it. This is one of the most stunning squares I've visited. But the best view...is from the top. Some people may be daunted by the high of the tower and not wanting to climb the stairs to the top, I was one of them! However I resolved to do it and see the sights and was shocked to find you could get to the top by elevator! Be sure you go to the top, and considering doing it at night! All the landmarks throughout the city are well lit.
Really nice. The place itself is really nice but if you have visited any other city of the former Austro-Hungarian Empire suddenly they all look the same.
Such an amazing experience!. Love the old buildings and the clock tower! The Christmas market was lovely and so many restaurants and shops to keep you busy for days!
OD Town. The scenery of the city is beyond beautiful with its Eastern European elegance. It would be hard to find a city that is its equal.

Great Place to Roam Around. Just roam around and this is one of the best place to get lost. Try the food you find on the way, take pictures of the beautiful old town hall. You can spend one day just roaming around here.

Outstanding!. The most beautiful cathedral in the world. Top 1 to see in Prague.
Minuses: a lot of people. Can be cold in winter.
A must see site. A mist see site. The old town is beautiful, architecture is amazing, reach history, lots of attractions.

Just remarkable... -BEAUTIFUL old town, really magic scenes, remarcable old buildings and all perfectly preserved.. reason is that Prague was never demolished, because of peaceful attitude of Prague locals, through the violent history of europe(for example Belgrade is thousand years older town than Prague but completely leveled more than few times in last couple of hundreds of years)-It is also BEER lovers paradise with simply best beers in the world.PUBS are also great with few exceptions (tourist-traps, like ''U vejvodu''..)-Which lead me to LOCALS.. they are just not thrilled with tourist and everything, they want money but for less effort if posible, in some pubs they prefer locals and there is nothing u can do about it, just accept them as they are, little moody..-Everything is little over-priced so look around old-town for better deals.-And last money exchange offices are preposterous. they will try to robe you for even 50% of your money..All in all one really wonderful place
Nice. The Old Town is well preserved and cute. Really worthwile seeing & being there especially after the dark.
Great place. Explore the city and every single building is history. Enjoy your time with a simple walking. Valuable point to spent time.

If you like Italian food....... Seems like the best choice when in Prague. Was surprised at how many Italian eateries there are. Found a good one called Il Mulino. Had a good pizza and fabulous langoustine linguine over a couple of visits. On last day found a Japanese place on 1st floor of a small shopping mall which was excellent. The bento box was very good, especially the tempura prawn and veg pieces. Sorry can't remember the name of shopping centre!

Great Place to spend a few hours while discovering Prague..... The Old Town Square is a great place to enjoy a nice leisurely hour or two, taking in unbelievable views from all angles. From the clock tower to the statues, sitting at one of the street sidewalk cafes watching all the action was absolutely fabulous. Taking time to really enjoy being in one of the most spectacular cities in the World while having a local beer was a highlight of the trip.
Prague Old Town. Truly a step back into a bygone era, the buildings are fantastic and superbly maintained.The architecture is simply breathtaking
must visit. It is one of the most beautiful old towns in the world. You can meet histori at ever step you do. Wanderful houses, churches...

Can't miss old city. Old town square with the Tower of Astronomical Clock (nice view on the top) ,the Tyn Church and the famous Jan hus monument is one of the best place you have to see in Prague,but don't worry you can't miss it as you can see the two towers of Tyn church from nearly everywhere.This Place is very close from Charles Bridge.

Old Prague. Prague city centre is beautiful, an almost perfectly preserved17th / 18th C city. Having escaped the ravages of WorldWar 2. The commies presumably had no money so it never got knocked about and tastelessly rte-developed in the 1960s//70s 80s etc. Explore on foot, there is no other way worth doing it. The Astronomical clock is a tourist must see but is a bit of an anti-climax. Actually the one in Wells UK is much better !! but go and see it anyway. Masses of excellent street food and drink everywhere. Lovely restaurants surround the old Town Square but be prepared to pay for the premium spot.
Beautiful place. The Old Town is full of beautiful old buildings, pearls of architecture and hidden secrets. It is for sure worth to take a walk there
Amazing city. I was in Prague few days and I love this city. Yo can find there everything what you want. Old town have great atmosphere. I definitely wanna visit this city again.

The Brilliance of Prague. the Old Town of Prague is the reason to visit the City. You can spend 3 days or 10 days or a month here and still have new palces to find and now experiences to go thru. While its very easy to do the touristy stuff and see all the places as per the guide books, there is so much more to be discocred on yoru own which cannot be covered in totality on paper. of course do indulge in your touristy side by taking ahorse carriage ride around the city on a sunny day, or maybe get adventurous on a Segaway. The best moments are at the Charles bridge and around the Old Town

Charming and historic!. Easily accessible by foot across the Charles bridge. Here there are quaint shops, restaurants and the glorious St. Nicholas church. We were here during Christmas and New Years and it was very busy with tourists but they also have charming street stands with food and plenty of hot mulled wine!
Beautiful. This is a lovely old part of the city but to see it at its best get up early and get there before the crowds.
fabulous. it has a great atmoshere in all time of the year, mysterious place with own specific character, very interesting

Busy holiday market. The holiday market was fun, with lots of little stalls selling food, drink and trinkets. Nearby churches, restaurants, shops, and the astronomical clock made this area fun to explore.

What can I say. Old town Prague, the place to vissit, there's the old town square with it's old clock mounted in 1410, the Tyn kathedral from 1256 and the church of St. Nicholas. From the squar you can take a walk to the famous Carlsbridge from 1356 wich takes you to Mala Strana and is only open for pedestrians. In the heart of the old town food and drinks are expensive, but if you walk just a little outside of the center things are a lot cheaper.

Safe, clean and friendly. 10 years ago Prague had the reputation of a dirty, dangerous city. Filled with pickpockets, muggers and prostitutes - after dark visitors were advised to be very careful.A decade on and Prague could not be more different. Its safe, inviting and has been cleaned up. People are helpful, pleasant and friendly. This city has completely changed and now has to be on of the top places to visit in Europe. There is so much to do and so much to see. Sophisticated restaurants, upmarket shops and lots for romantic couples, families and cultural travellers. Walk round the old streets any time of the day and feel safe (unlike other European cities like Paris); marvel at the beautiful old buildings; have a coffee in a cafe and imagine you are still in the 18th century; - there is so much to do.......
beating heart of Pragues. To be seen absolutely when in Pragues, beating heart of the city, but always crowded with tourist, amazing looking at Xmas!

Lots to see and do...and lots of people!. Old Town offered quite a lot to see and eat! The Christmas Market there was absolutely incredible! However, be prepared because there are a LOT of people and in the evenings it gets very busy!
Beautiful. This is a place of beautiful buildings, beautiful architecture.There's so much to see and do, and plenty of free tours available.

don't waste time on the clock. Don't waste time waiting for the hour announcement on the astronomical clock, it is rather underwhelming. In stead, get lost in the winding streets of the old centre. Nearly every building is worth a look, there are dozens of bars and restaurants and shops to enjoy and the atmosphere is very lively.

Lots to see and do.. The Old Town and the Square were very quaint but a guided tour is a must if you want to get the most from your stay. There are plenty of free tours starting from the Old Clock. These are excellent . There is a multitude of cheap bars and restaurants in the area and the architecture is beautiful.

Beautiful!. Loved the Christmas Market and we stumbled onto a great concert in the Old Town Square NYE 2014~The clock tower is a must see and if you are lucky enough to be there during Christmas, be sure to have some hot mulled wine while you stroll the beautiful Old Town.
BEAUTIFUL. What an icredible place with astrological clock and beautiful old buildings. We walked around and every second there was something to watch or to taste!!

Amazing architecture. I absolutely love architecture so maybe I'm biased but just looking atPrague is amazing. Everywhere you turn there's another Street you want to turn down to see another cool building. You could spend all day, but half a day is enough and on the tightest schedule, you should probably set aside an hour here
Amazing!. Best place to be during Christmas time! Great, brilliant, beautiful, stunning... People of Prague is so friendly and smiley. Would defo go back!

Quaint. So beautiful and full of history, it is something you really need to see to appreciate. I found that you really feel your in tis city by all the old buildings your surrounded by and the way in which the people are.
Christmas atmosphere!. Great Christmas atmosphere in Old Town with Christmas Markets, lights and great delicacies to eat! Crowded with tourists but it's definitely worth a visit.

Christmas heaven. The only place to visit for an authentic white Christmas. Beautiful tree, decorations and food / craft stall. Night time is the best which all the lights and back drop to some of the most awesome architecture in Czech history. You just have to see to believe yourself.

A real life maze. A great way to lose yourself in this maze like area with everything from high end shops to tacky tours stalls on the side of the street. Don't worry about getting lost eventually you will find your way back to the town square or the riverfront but just enjoy the sites and sounds of this real life maze.
Old Place. historical areas, cobble-stoned pathways all over, xmas market was very nice. typical wares from their area. Food was great & cheap!

Stunning architecture - so much to see. The title says it all. We were in Prague for 6 days over New Year, and stayed in a hotel in the old town. There was so much to see within minutes of our hotel and many restaurants and bars to suit all budgets. At any time of day and night it was very safe T

Old Town. What gorgeous old town! If you like amazing architecture and winding streets, Prague if perfect for you. There are great, cheap bars and restaurants throughout the area (as soon as you get off the main squares.

Good atmosphere with lots of old buildings. The Christmas markets were ongoing and tons of people were in the area generating lots of atmosphere. The surrounding buildings were filled with nice architecture and souvenir shops popping up everywhere. Nice city that impressed us.

New Years Eve - Old Town Square. Good Music , Rock Bands , Fireworks were beautiful started an hour before Midnight - Backdrop was amazing for Photo buffs. Food in one of the restaurants around square was superb with excellent service
Christmas market a must. This is by far the best Christmas Market in the Old Town Square with a beautiful Christmas tree as a central feature. + All the old buildings make a perfect place to visit

Fantastic area to explore. A great place to wonder round and take in the history of Prague. A trip to the top of the clock tower is worth it to take in the views of Prague. Loads of restaurants and bars around although they are pricier than in the surrounding streets. For better quality/value food look in the side streets a few streets away from the main square

Great location during Christmas. Christmas market and the snow made the old town an amazing place to visit during Christmas holidays. Some snacks are great where they sell traditional food Bbq and dessert
Atmospheric Christmas Market. So much history, such great architecture, and lovely Christmas markets in the Old a Town square. Lots to explore.
Surreal. Very surreal, like a fantasy. Many castles and very unique as one of the few places in Europe that were not destroyed or damaged by war. Only if the people were nicer. Pretty city though.
Beautiful!. Old Town was like a fairy tale. The architecture was amazing. Musicians were playing in the square. We quickly learned that all the streets will take you back there!
Amidst crowds, a cheap, delicious dinner. When you're tired and can't find a table at any of the packed restaurants, get a hot dog and hot wine during the christmas market season! A lovely treat

So much to see and do. The history literally oozes of roofs and walls of the buildings.This place has so much to see and do, it caters for all budgets, from the budget conscious to the big spender.Get in on one of the Free Tours, we did an amazing one with Sandemans New Prague tours, and from there you can decide what to else to do and see.Oh and don't forget to try a beer or two or more ;-)
Great atmosphere. Very busy due to time of year, New Year but great atmosphere with the Christmas stalls, food and gifts.

The perfect place to be in Christmas. It is definitely the perfect place to be during Christmas. The old city scene and the Christmas markets, together with the crowds of tourists make an ideal destination.

Prague Old Town. Very interesting and beautiful area of the city, especially the Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock which has to be seen when it strikes the hours, but beware the crowds if you want a good view!The Christmas markets were interesting and less crowded than I had expected. The mulled wine and roast pork are great, but again be a little careful when buying food as often there is no fixed price - it depends on weight and can be a little on the expensive side

Christmas in Prague. We visited Prague in mid-December when Christmas market was in full swing. Market was not one of the best we have visited (Vienna is still best) but Old Town Square is still a must. Care when having a drink on one of the cafe's as they charge well over the odds due to location.

Even with throngs of tourists, it's still a magical sort of place.. Prague was not what I expected at all. It's a mix of a beautifully preserved city, new technology, trendy restaurants, horse drawn carriages, iconic tourist locales, and a mass of tourists. Mardi Gras style tourists. All squirming through the crowd to get to another tourist spot in another part of the square where you can squirm some more. Sounds lovely doesn't it? But it's really pretty cool even with the plethora of downsides that accompany it.....and with all of that, I don't think I'd really enjoy staying anyplace else when in Prague.
charming!. This area is full of history.The great philosophers, writers, and musicians all come alive for you as they are still so very alive through the culture and historic monuments.

Must do, but tourist central .... There are lots of great buildings to see and winding streets to wander, but be prepared for significant crowds in streets lined with shops and restaurants catering solely to the tourist trade. We far preferred to get over the other side of the river to the lesser town and the lesser crowds.
great place. nice atmosphere at Xmas. xmas market; wonderful at new year's eve! the whole of Prague gathers here.

A must see, look out for the best tour guide ever his name is Ross and can be found in the square with the Astro Clock. Prague is full of intrigue but my best advice is get a tour guide there are free 2 hour guides from the square with the astrological clock or do what we did and get the full day tour which includes lunch boat and tram ride taking in Charles bridge, Prague Castle etc. Prague has so much history and a tour guide brings it alive, Ross was our guide he is Prague born and bread but speaks fluent English. Absolutely fantastic day from start to finish.

Amazing at Christmas and New Year. Brilliant atmosphere over the Christmas and NYE period. Beautiful Christmas markets. Slightly overpriced but, hey, it's a central square in a popular tourist city. Loads of attractions in and around the Square. Beware overpriced public WCs and their slightly dictatorial toilet attendants!

Go early if you want some great photos. I went between Christmas and New Years and it was very crowded. There was a nice festive market which may have added to the congestion but if you get there at 8am you will find it quiet.
Pretty. Very pretty!!! Its wonderful to roam the streets of old town with the Christmas Markets Churches Charles Bridge side Paris Street lovely!

Magic at xmas. Wow, what a wonderful place. Lovely atmosphere with all the market stalls and bustling with people enjoying the festivities. Lots of sweet, handmade souveniers to hang on your Xmas tree. Highly recommend a festive visit!!
Gothic.. Gothic. It is very nice. Very medieval... Love the architecture.. I was there right after Christmas. So it was too cold to appreciate it. But i can say so many tourist around that area.
Christmas Market. Stunning christmas market with gluewein and all the christmas trimmings you can wish for! Live street performers, huge christmas tree - we loved it!
Crowded but nice. Nice square with a lot of places to eat. It was so crowded we couldn't even walk! Must see the 2 churches there and the clock tower.

Breathtaking . It's my second time to Prague, my first was 12 years ago!
Nothing more to say than ITS MAGICAL!
Christmas time there makes it even more beautiful!
I LOVE PRAGUE

evening concerts. It was lovely to attend a concert in a monastery in Old Town in late October. What a wonderful experience to sip champagne while listening to an amazingly good quartet plus a soprano in an beautiful art nouveau decorated hall.

Beautiful buildings. A wonderful setting.
We visited in December - the christmas market was disappointing, though it looked pretty. Stallholders not very friendly, lots of tacky tourist type products and very crowded... not the best side of Prague, but I would love to return outside Christmas Market season!

Simply Beautiful . Understand why this is #1 attraction. One of the most unbelievable places I have ever seen. Everywhere you turn you are amazed. Christmas was a special time to be there with the Christmas market and throngs of people. Don't miss it at night.

Magical Christmas !. Wow.... The old town square is truly magical at Christmas time , it really doesn't disappoint. Great Christmas market, lovely social atmosphere the building surrounding the square are beautiful. Loved all the narrow cobbled streets and a nighttime ride in a horse and carriage is highly recommended, as is a walk up the clock tower which gives you amazing views of Prague. Comfy shoes are needed, so much to see.
Old Town in Prague. Loved the Old Town Square, the historic buildings are really picturesque and well maintained. The local bars are welcoming and prices reasonable.

Impressive. History + Design all around.. Access: The Old Town is accessible to Trams and Metro Lines. We used the Green Line or Metro A to get to the Starometska Station. It's about 5-10 minute walk to Staromestske Namesti or the Plaza.The Old Town is full of nice places to visit. We got a Prague Card which covers any cost for transportation and most of the popular sites and attractions to be visited — if not free, they’re discounted. When you purchase a Prague Card, there’s a booklet that comes with it that guides you to tour around Prague and whether that attraction/site is free or discounted. It also contains maps, etc. The Prague Card can be bought in the Tourist Info Center in Old Town, it's door is a few steps from the face of the Astronomical Clock. It's on an Orange Building Façade.The whole town is picturesque. It seems like it’s a scene from Disney Cartoons where houses are colorful and beautiful. There are several cafe’s, restaurants, and museums within the old town. Everything is adjacent to one another. Get a Map and familiarize yourself with which place or museum you want to visit so as not to tire yourself from walking on the cobble stone paths. Wear comfy shoes as usual.NOTE: Be careful on money exchange kiosks in the area, they may have a sign that says "no commission" but their exchange rate is really low (19 CZK to a Euro). So try to compute the lowest exchange rate you can accept for those establishments without commission. While we were there, the common exchange rate was about 26-27 CZK to a Euro but these establishments have a max 19% commission. So we computed that if we desperately needed CZKs, the lowest we can go is an exchange rate of 22 CZK to a Euro with 0% commission. With this computation, we can get roughly the same amount as that of the one with commission. So be careful and don't be hasty. Luckily, we found some forex kiosks that offer 5% commission or less with an exchange rate of about 26 CZKs to a Euro. Just be patient and you'll find one. Also, save your coins and don't get rid of them! These are useful for Toilets (WC use is often paid for in this side of town) and Gold Coin Souvenirs (50CZK) in those little machines around town. You'll see these machines on either entrances or exits of popular buildings or churches. The cheapest toilet we've seen in Old Town (that's not Free for use) is the one inside the Building of the Astronomical Clock, right beside the Elevators on the Ground Floor. It's only 3 CZK.
Old Prague. Lovely town, especially the Charles Bridge and Christmas markets. The only downside was the crowds, but even that could be fun at times!

Wonderful Christmas Atmosphere. We visited the old town at Christmas and it was truly amazing. The Christmas market was fantastic and there was a great atmosphere. The food and the mulled wine were amazing. Not sure it would have the same feeling any other time. There are so many restaurants to choose from and we found an Irish and an English pub tucked away in the corner - both were excellent. I didn't find anywhere that did children's meals, but places did offer to do half a portion, for half the price.... although in one restaurant, although they said this, they didn't do it! (Both the English and Irish pubs did). Just off the town square there are hundreds of shops and winding, cobbled streets, they are very narrow and crowded.Definitely worth a visit.

Astronomical clock is grossly overrated. The crowds were unbelievable and we couldn't figure out way. The little figures pass by the windows on the hour. They don't even come out of the building as they do in most places. The Christmas markets were fun and made it worth going - just leave before the top of the hour!
very tourism"ish". Its the old town square. Its definitely worth the visit at least once. Dont go for the cafes on the square because are too expensive!

Wonderful place. You could walk around for hours and be in awe of it all. The Christmas tree and the astrological clock are awesome to see. Plenty of shopping areas and outside vendors to choose from.
Charming Old Town. Especially right before Christmas. It was nice to stroll around the Old Town in the chilly December weather with a cup of hot beverage in your hand and enjoy the sights.
Prague at Christmas. We loved every thing about Prague markets amazing hundreds of people gathered to see. Clock on the hour it is amazing shopping wonderful it is a great place to buy shoes and bags

Great xmas atmosphere with the markets. Wear good shoes all prague in cobbled stones , buildings are so beautiful one would need more than a week to see it all . Have to be honest am not crazy about the food but then we cooked in our apartment but it's a personal choice
very crowded, narrow streets. It's a very romantic and picturesque area, lots of little shops, winding streets. Just relax and take your time getting lost there
Must see. As well as Charles Bridge and Prague castle, there is no real way to be in Prague and not go through or see this. It is beautiful and impressive. A must see place.

Mysterious walks and pretty buildings. We were bedazzled by every building in Stare Mestro aka Old Town, every nook and turn we came across a pretty structure. Not just the architecture, but even beautifully painted walls. Read more http://julie-kanvinde10.blogspot.co.uk/2014/09/prague-tales-discovering-dark.html

Best at Christmas time. The Old Town Square is blossoming with attractions and tourists all year round. However, the best time is at the end of year. The richly decorated Christmas tree (with over million little lights), the kiosks selling Moravian Kolbasi, mulled wine, decorations, Czech delicacies and a little zoo for kids are amazing. They bring the holiday mood to every visitors' heart.

A must see.. We were in Prague to see the XMAS markets which were in the old town square. A must see very colourful and vibrant.
The whole area of the old town is lovely to wander about.
Great Atmosphere. It was great fun to wonder around the old town. It can be tricky to find that popular bar your looking for though.
Old Town. Beautiful and architecturally stunning buildings. Many different styles of buildings and lots of shops.

Genuine Old Town. One of the best old towns in Europe. Old buldings, cathedrals and houses look very harmonic and authentic.
A bit touristic though. Very cool looking in the evening after rain (you will see reflection on the pavement).
Old Town Square. Lots to do and see - excellent shopping - Christmas markets great - food to suit every budget - fun place to go

Glorious Grandeur...Go at Night for the Real Magic☆. The lights & Architecture...Most Excellent+Joyful♡A Carriage ride is a Must...really Special! The Cafes are cozy & provide the opportunity for hours of people watching! High quality street performers with something for Everyone!

Christmas markets. We recently went to prague at start of december. We enjoyed coming to the old town square. It was full of christmas stalls and was busy with tourists. There are many czech restaurants around the square which vary in price. I think it would be alot different in the summer as you could sit in one of the bars or restaurants and watch the world go by. It is difficult to assess the square at it was so busy. I would recommend you come here as there is a great atmosphere.

Great Christmas atmosphere. Huge tree and lots of stalls! Highly recommended. We took a bike tour and learned lots about the clock and we also had a great time looking at some of the street performers
Christmas streets. Christmas streets and markets are very beautiful , especially at night.Рождественские улицы и ярмарки очень красивы, особенно вечерами.
Amazing!. We fell in love with Prague here. The architecture is just breathtaking. It's actually one of our top cities in Europe. Don't miss it.
History walking. Here you can fukkfill your history Dreams and meet the Hussites, the Counterreformation, the Beginning of the Thirty years war, The communist Coup of -48 and velvet revolution of -89
Wonderful. As it is Christmas time, the old town is full of people visiting Prague.It is also decorated with many lights,you can eat or drink something. I adore the style of the buildings out there.
Nice Cristmas athmosphere. Huge Cristmas tree, plenty of street food boutiques and restaurants, a lot of people, street music bands - all this make this place a fairy tale.

Spirit of the old Europe. Place is amazing, smaller than I was imagining but totally impressed me! Tiny streets, monuments, great landmarks and city full of people from all over. Great !!! You can easily find a lot of nice locals to eat or take a caffe. We have been there in summer but I heard that now i Christmas the place is even more impressive thai in summer time:) For sure we gonna spend our next Christmas in this City!!!!!
