smaller than thought. Only nicer part of prague they have lovely buildings but ruin themny writimg al, over them amd opening seedy massagearlours everhwhere . Also I found the people to be very rude and miserable

Really Good. Really Good..the Streets , Monumments and landmark are great
Especially the Astronomical clock and the whole area around it.

Entrancing heart of Prague. The highlight of Prague's Stare Mesto (Old Town) is undoubtedly the imposing and ornate Tyn Church, but the best views are the ones from the top of the town hall. Ascend the clock tower for expansive views of the city, as well as to see the intricate astronomical clock.Make sure you take a rest from sightseeing by enjoying a traditional hot wine drink in one of the square's restaurants.
Chrismas time. Prague is a great place to spend x-mas with family. Lovely markets great decorations and cheap prices compared with the rest of europe. Just the people could be a bit friendlier.....

wow...... the old town was so amazing, we were here just before christmas so got to enjoy all the markets and festivities, the whole place was a hive of activity. We were also able to sample traditional Yule foods and drinks.....only disappointment was we only had three days to explore.....

Fairytale. The Old Town (Stare Mesto) is like a wonderland for anybody who likes history, architecture, unique places, cathedrals, antique and souvenirs shops, restaurants, the choices are endless. Definitely a walking town!
Magic with Christmas fair. The Old Town Square is alive and bustling at Christmas fair time, especially at night when the lights give it an old world look.

Thriving with youthful energy. The town square is packed with people from around the world speaking many languages. There are entertainers at all ends keeping everyone happy. There are numerous restaurants with outdoor seating - most have great beer, duck, pork, and wursts.
Awesome!. Beautiful setting! Close to the downtown area. Lots of shopping stores around. Watch for people selling fake Czech curreny.

Look upwards - amazing architecture, nice markets. Speaking for December, the thrill was to visit the markets. To be honest the markets are nothing special (aimed at tourists) but still delightful and the ambiance is wonderful and it's a cracking way to get into the Christmas spirit. The real star is the architecture; look up and around 360 and you will be blown away by by the stunning array of turrets, spires, leaded windows, masonry etc. It really is fabulous. Have some cherry wine and gnocchi at the same time and won't fail to be enchanted.
must go. It is the best place to get lost at. Its an amazing labyrinth full of colours, music, history and arts.

The most beautiful city. Prague is just awesome. By far the most beautiful city in Europe I have been to. Old Town square is one of my most favorite places, although it is crowded as hell, but filled with so much history. It is best during Christmas.
The Best Old Town in the World. We spent days here wandering the delightful maze of twisting streets. At every turn you get a surprising view that stuns your senses.

Christmas Markets. Great atmosphere day and night, loads of kiosks and stands selling everything from souveniers to hand made locally manufactured gifts.
Lots of variety of street food and hot wines and meads.
The whole town square buzzes every 15 minutes in anticipation of the town clock chiming with its huge flock of onlookers. Amazing this time of year

Christmas magic at the Old Town Square. If you want to experience the Christmas ambience in Europe, visit a Christmas market. Better yet, visit the one at the Old Town Square in Prague, where you'll get to sample traditional festive foods and shop for local festive decorations in pop-up stalls along with thongs of local and overseas holidaymakers. It's chilly and sometimes wet to be sure, but the atmosphere is truly special!

Great place to see one of the world oldest clock!. The prices in the surrounding restaurants are high but if you walk few meters in the side streets it's much cheaper. However, for that spectacular view, it's worth it.
Charming and beautiful. I was amused by the old town hall clock and the old square where is the Christmas market take place.

Beautiful. Old Town in Prague is something you never can't just past by without being amazed. Architecture, surroundings, historical buildings is simply something that you can't take your eyes off. The best time personally is to visit Prague at Christmas as it is beautifully decorated in Old Town with huge Christmas tree and Christmas markets. However, never eat or drink in local restaurants over there. Prices are split per locals or tourists, it's expensive compared to other nicer places and nothing tast good. Avoid if you can, we have been in Prague many times, so we experienced .... :-)

magical at christmas market time. When the Christmas markets are on this square is magical. the church of the Lady of Tyn is like a fairly tale castle, with lights up in the turrets. Food is cooked in the square at the various stalls, on wood fires - old Prague ham, chestnuts, pancakes and especially TRUDLO! There are also stalls with mulled wines and hot chocolate, and usually some kind of free entertainment - jazz bands, medieval stroller/players, and on this occasion dancing on a stage with people in traditional dress

Beautiful Square. Old Town Square was absolutely beautiful at night. I was disappointed with the little shops there. Almost all of them had the same items for sale. I was looking for unique Czech gifts and these were not it. Looking out over the city at night from the top of the clock tower was absolutely amazing. Well worth my 110 ck.
Christmas Market Excellent. Excellent with Carol Singers stalls mulled wine what else do you want. No dislikes great place to meet and enjoy a glass or two of mulled wine.

Classical European City. Prague is a fantastic historical city filled with amazing architecture and has been so important in the development of European History. It is an easy city to walk around and we attended most of the sights and many restaurants. We undertook a walking tour with Anna and were a little disappointed there wasn't more information about Pragues journey through the 20th century up to and including the Velvet Revolution. Christmas markets were fun but sadly the weather was quite mild and we didn't see snow which was one of the anticipated attractions. What was really disappointing is the plague of grafitti in Prague. In a city of such historical importance and beauty, local authorities should be acting more swiftly to remove this blight from the buildings.

Old World. Enjoy the timeless history of the bohemia days spanning back to the early 8th century. The christmas market was splendid with lots of festive mood. Together with St Nicholas Church and the old tower (astormonical clock), the square is a timeless part of czech history.

Shopping. If you are looking for local shops and the high end, the Old Town has some of your best options. The narrow streets and walkways meander through the Old Town giving you easy access. There are also nice restaurants and sidewalk cafes for when you need a break.

XMAS markets in the square!. Well the XMAS markets were busy and interesting for all age groups.A great variety of local food and drinks available pretty much all day. The Xmas tree is terrific.We visited day and night as it looked different at all times. Some local band troupe played which gathered a good crowd.A great event!
Beautiful. Try and avoid Saturday evening during Xmas market. Incredible buildings, very picturesque, Eat elsewhere it's less expensive
Must visit this place. Lot of tourist, amazing church...cute little shops...in december you can feel christhmas atmosphere. Good beer :)
Like a fairytale. Some of the views are like being in a gothic fairy tale. then there are the art nouveau buildings let alone the cubist blocks. An absolute joy to walk around.
A Must see. The old town is a definate must see when in Prague but nowadays its very over run with tourists and all that brings. Try to come out of season when the crowds arent as bad.

Extraordinary. Take your time to explore Prague's old town. It's beautiful. The churches, houses, palaces, squares really show all the beauty of the city. It is especially beautiful in the Christmas time. Everything is in a walking distance. The restaurants on the main streets and square are a little more expensive. So, if you want to save some money, go to one of the side streets where you will find restaurants with local food for a good price.

Surrounded by Gothic splendor. Wonderful old buildings, old cobbled streets, roof tops and towers amazing. Definately a fairtale town. Worth getting a Prague Card to save money on seeing all the sights.

Simply marvelous. You cannot go to Prague and not visit the old town and old town square. It's a very well-preserved medieval town that takes you back in time with its colorful buildings and churches. The astronomical clock, the Tyn Cathedral, the Christmas markets (during Christmas), the lights, the shops and restaurants make this area vibrant and romantic at the same time.

Wow! what beautiful buildings. Such beautiful buildings, full of intricate details, like a fairytale with all the spires. Old Town Square had a lovely festive atmosphere although a lot of tat on the stalls some at inflated prices. Fantastic huge Christmas tree and lots of food/drink stalls but not much variety in what was on sale.

Christmas at its best.. A little pricey, but not a ripoff. Would recommend. Very pleasant experience for my family and me. Very good walking and mostly pleasant people. Lots of tourists and lots of English this time of year, but can't blame them for being there!

It has the "wow" factor!. Every single building in this square is beautifully preserved and maintained. Yes there are lots of tourists there ,you will be one of them if you visit it,but for me this adds to the atmosphere.

What a Christmas Market!. What a great place, the Christmas tree is fantastic, lights alone the whole branches to the trunk. People just standing around staring at the tree. I got a liking for hot honey mead, it also has herbs in. Very sweet, hot and hits the spot when temperature is below zero. Hot wine is good as well, saying that try any of the food stalls fantastic. All the building as lit up. We loved it. The City itself feels safe and friendly even at night waking around and using the metro and trans.

Great Medieval City. This is a beautiful old town to stroll, with winding streets. We enjoyed having a drink in the main square. We toured the Old Town one day and the Castle another day. Be careful as it is easy to get lost.

Idyllic. Probably the best of all old town's Iv seen in Europe so far. Pit stop / destination / starting point for many conducted tours, IMO, unless you want all the details of who built what when and why, a lazy walk through the myriad streets are enriching on its own. True, commercialization appears in every nook and cranny but if you can probably just filter out the modern springings, you can see the beauty of Prague old town, splendid. Even the modernization has added its own charm. Ensure you walk through as many winding lanes as possible, even if there are no throngs of tourists, the combination of art noveau and bohemian architecture, the cobbled streets, the feel of having stepped back in time is wonderful. Though ofcourse, the cobbled streets can leave your feet screaming. (But then, there are zillions of Thai massage parlors to help you with it). Don't forget to look up down right and left to take in the entire scene. The restaurants / cafes in the side streets are predictably less expensive than the ones in the core. A holiday well spent for me just walking by the old town streets.
Fantastic. Spent the day wandering around the old part of Prague, admiring its beauty and history. Looking forward to the Christmas market tonight!
Interesting with nice atmosphere. Great to walk around the Old Town Admiring the wonderful buildings.However be prepared for the crowds and expensive coffee!
Prague architecture. Beautiful buildings, always look up as the best decoration is usually higher up on buildings. The veiw from the clock tower at night is fantastic.
A historic pearl. A must see - only historic city in europe to survive ww2almost untouched. Hisorical monuments from the middle ages to the present day stand side by side.

Old Town. At this time of year, it simply captures the essence of the Christmas season better than any place I've been. The main square is full of happy faces, has a beautifully decorated and enormous Christmas tree, and kiosks serving the best street food in Europe. A choir is on stage in the afternoons beautifully singing traditional carols. The ambience is poignant, resolutely suggesting that our Western Christmas traditions might have started here.

wonderful. The old town is just as pictures depict and is friendly and in October not too crowded Even Charles Bridge was not too overcrowded. Restaurants were not too busy but evenings needed to be booked if you wanted a good table Food in all the places we went was excellent from burgers to prime steak cheap to very expensive . Tripadvisor customer recomendations were very good and true so would not argue with any particularly the local food suggestions .
Magnific city. This city is amazing. Every corner that you look has something spetacular. It is a nice trip to enjoy with family and or your partner.
Vibrant city life. This area of town is where we spent the bulk of our time. Great architecture. Christmas market (they really are everywhere) and lots of cafes.

Great Place to Wander Around. Prague is such a beautiful city, and the old town is just perfect. Beautiful buildings, lots of winding cobblestone streets, lots of shops. You can spend several hours just wandering around enjoying the place.

Amazing. Prague old town is simply amazing, you can not really express it into words. It is one of the most beautiful cities in the world, I can spend days there just walking around eating and drinking their wonderfull beer!
Beatiful. Loved it.Excellent architecture.Magical Christmassy feel.Wonderful Christmas tree.Took loads of photos.A great place to have a wander and leave a look at the Christmas stalls

Real old town! You are in the past centuries!. Very interesting place with nice Christmas markets, restaurants, astronomical clock and views ! Old and new Buildings are close together! The view from clock is unique! You see castle and bridges; whole city, esp. at sunset is very nice! Do not forget to make coins with city design!

Christmas Markets in Old Town Prague. Festive, crowded, smells of Christmas adorned with a giant tree beautifully decorated. Terrific honey wine, great sausages, beautiful churches, what more could you ask for?

Beautiful place. We are leaving Prague now and I am glad that we have been there in the winter time when Old Town Christmas Market is available.I recommend you to try one of the special foods like Trdelnik/Trdlo or local sausages, which are really tasty.The Old Town is beatufiful place with lots of architectural and historical sights pleasant to see. You can also find a perfect bookstores and obviously a lot of souvenirs shops there. A little disappointment was that the city is overcrowded but nowadays it is probably normal.
Got to see!. Most highlights are in walking distance. Spend an afternoon exploring the old town and experience the atmosphere of Prague.
loved it. me and my wife visited we loved it its magnificent work of art love do visti its glory of paraha.....
Like it!!. I liked the old town a lot... I enjoyed walking there and seeing all the sightseeings...I liked the gothic side of the city!!

Lots of shops selling the same. Go and have a wander through the alleyways its a very safe area with shops selling a lot of the same stuff but don't let this put you off as it's well worth getting lost and making new discoveries
Loved it. What a lovely place to visit with so much lovely architecture, nice authentic restaurants and lots to see. Really enjoyed walking around.

Classic way to enjoy the old city. Very easy to walk to. Take Sate Mesto subway/tram stop and walk three blocks. The Christmas markets are good in the square. Also a fine tourist info office there for advice to what to see. Classic building and cobblestone streets.

Old Town Prague. Just returned from a trip to Prague, a bustling place especially at this time of year, as everywhere, everyone is enjoying the festive season. Their are lots of xmas markets, mulled wine lingers in the air. There are lots of restaurants and eateries and places to take shelter from the cold, whilst sipping a hot drink and watching the people pass by.Prices are very reasonable, Christmas markets and festive decorations are lovely, the only thing missing was the snow.

Amazing, but beware of Christmas Ham!. Old town is unbelievable pretty. Like something out of a fairytale. Not to be missed if you're in Prague. We came to Prague specifically for the Old Town Christmas Market which is probably the best I have ever witnessed. Quick word of caution, if you decide to grab yourself some "Old Prague Ham" from one of the market vendors make sure to ask for a very small portion to avoid contention, otherwise they will attempt to sell you half a kilo of ham for the equivalent of $25 (charged per 100g)! Don't be afraid to say no and move on to the next vendor if you get caught out! On the flipside the ham is absolutely delicious.

Beautiful and diverse architecture. Amazing buildings. Astronomical clock incredible. Lovely facades.Vibrant Old Town Square - stalls, food, live musicBrilliant atmosphereChristmas decorations very well done.Loved it.
Lovely and charismatic atmosphere. Restaurants around this are inexpensive at lunch, a bit more pricey at night, heavy Italian influence.

MUCH BLA BLA BLA. Smell from old CZ and people are like zombie to drink your blood
I don't go any more to CZ and you have to think well because have many similar Cities and safety
Walking in history. A walk friendly old Town with small Winding streets and Squares, littered with restaurants with cheap food and drink.

Fairytale. I lived in Prague for a year and this is by far my favorite place in the entire city. The architecture is unlike anything I have ever seen before in my life. Avoid all the tourist trap restaurants, but make sure you walk around the entire square and explore every angle.

Historical & quaint main square. Lovely old square, church, tower, monuments, astrological clock, short walk to Charles bridge. This is one of the most charming old-town squares we've seen in Europe. Must see for historical significance.

Well worth a visit. We went to see the Christmas market and weren't disappointed. It was beautiful, especially at night, and very atmospheric. Prices were very reasonable given its prime location. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby with other markets just a short walk away from the square. Tip: Ladies do not wear heels! The streets are all cobbled and can be very uneven in places. Flat, comfortable shoes are a must!

Gorgeous part of Prague. Part of the attraction to this area of Prague is the Astronomical Clock and the Old Town Square. But just the streets and buildings themselves are enough to warrant a visit here. The architecture is beautiful, the colors vibrant, and the atmosphere magical. This area is a must-see! And once you're there, be sure to just get lost in the streets for a while. It's worth it!

Lots to see and do. We visited the town square in December when the Christmas markets were in full swing. It added so much to the atmosphere and also,gave us so many food options. Everyone should try the ham on the spit and the mulled wine. Lots of great buildings around the square ( including the astronomical clock) and if you can, try to get a local guide to give you the the history of the square as that makes the visit even more interesting. Around the square are lots of cafes with outdoor heaters - essential when it was -3C - as well as shops selling crystal and garnet.

A cosy square. Go see the Astrological clock - every hour on the hour people gather just below the clock to see the "show" We were here in December and the square was decorated for Christmas. If you want that Christmas spirit you go to the Old Town and I am sure that you'll find it.Tyne Church in the background is beautiful and does add that little extra.

Kitchy but cool. The Astronomical clock is not to be missed, so you need to go. Just beware there are lots of tourists traps and just seems if it was left to its natural beauty would be more a place of reflection and awe than a bit of an assault to the senses, with every other person who walks buy trying to sell you something. Still very cool

Beautiful old town. This and many others in the close vicinity makes this bohemian/Czech/ Moravian city worth visiting. The square is a highlight. The sights, Xmas decorations, huge tree, street food, music and entertainment adds to the beauty of old town.

You need to experience the Christmas market. Simply great experience. Friendly people. The terraces can be used also in December, because there are glass walls and gas warmers. Reasonable prices for food and specially for beer :)

Wonderful place to be and experience the Christmas market.. Town Hall is a wonderful place to visit, especially during the Christmas markets. So much to see, do, and eat! If you don't like crowds, avoid the tree lighting/grand opening ceremony. We were almost crushed in the mass crowd trying to exit the center square when one of the streets were closed off.
Great architecture and buildings on the square.

Wow, if you like architecture!. Beautiful is the only word that comes to mind about Prague. While the U.S. and allies bombed Germany, they did not destroy Prague in the Czech Republic. What splendid sights in this area. Old Town and it's Christmas markets are nice for shoppers, but just letting yourself explore back streets was great.
Beautiful. The famous prague clock and all the culture around it. Prague is so picturesque. This is quite a city

Old town square. This is one of the most popular places in Prague. Place in the entire city center with markets happening during the year. Each December there is a xmas market with roasted chestnuts, traditional czech ham and hot wine. You can see local craft marketers and get nice traditional gifts. Location is very easy to get you can walk around and enjoy the beauty of historical city center.

Our Travels. We really enjoyed Old Town and what is has to offer. The only thing was with all the days walking around Prague we found it hard to fully enjoy. But we are hoping to return to prague to enjoy some more.
Step back in time. It's beautiful and you must visit and look at the amazing architecture. Nothing to dislike and off this square there is a shopping centre with 200 shops! Something for everyone.
Can't miss in Prague!. The best old town situated in city centre of central europe! I enjoyed every step in my visit and will definitely return to it!
History. very historic, lovely cityhas a lot of things to dovery famous for the clocklovely restaurantsfriendly people
Absolutely lovely. Was here for the switch on of the Xmas lights and market. Plenty to see and lovely bars and restaurants.
Xmas sparkle. The square was buzzing with xmas stalls and tourists but as it got dark it turned into a magical experience with the 60foot tree taking up the centre of attention. We loved it

It's lovable. The architecture reflects their ancient history. It's transport one to other ages. The only drawback is the public transportation. We try to use it, but the names was only in check language and the maps wasn't helpful. Since most of the people only speak check we didn't take the risk to use the tranvia or metro

Awesome city. I like every thing. Actually there is one thing you have to be aware. First thing you have to be ready to fight with this taxi driver; they hide the meter to charge you more. As much as 5 or 10 times more. Do your math before and see how far you go and how much is it and you ask the driver how much is it, by that time you know already how much is for real and give them what is normal. Never give them your money and expect to have it back, not one returns your money in Prague. Take as this; THE LAST THING YOU DO IN PRAGA IS GIVE YOUR MONEY. Street food looks good but is very expensive. look for a restaurant where you can eat better and cheaper.
Atmospheric Christmas market. Beautiful historic buildings, quaint streets, lots of restaurants, and buzzy Christmas market in Old Town Square

Xmas shopping in the Old Town. Quick review here...just a fantastic atmosphere coming up to xmas.. the smells of roasted chestnuts.. plenty of traditional food, lots to buy and very cheap indeed.. lots to see and experience here in the old town of Prague. Just a short walk around and see lots of art shops and plenty of glass workings, crystal and garnet.Cheap flights..and accommodation for 4 nights..a lovely break. Come and enjoy it here!

Lovely Czech chocolate and cakes. Brilliant Cafe/Restaurant Pavlina - hidden in a lovely small garden off a Panska passage; had brilliant coffee, chocolate and cakes, excellent service. would recommend.

Amazing Christmas market experience in the heart of the city!. I visited the Old Town from 3rd to 6th December for its Christmas markets.The atmosphere was lively, with festivities in the air. The market was lovely too- with stalls selling hot mulled wine, honey wine, chimney cakes, chocolates, sausages and much more. In the evening, there were also choirs singing carols and kids doing plays on the stage that was set up near the huge Christmas tree. The astronomical clock is a stone's throw away. Every hour people would crowd up to see the clock's works. Right next to the clock tower is the tourist centre. It has all the brochures- state opera, breweries tour, music concerts... you can find it all out here. It has a washroom too.The people at the centre were helpful too, with the directions as well as bookings that I made to a Mozart concert at the Municipal House. I would strongly recommend to everybody to buy tickets to the top of the tower (about 110 czk koruna). The views one gets from the top are simply mind-blowing. Just like in the movies, just like in the postcards! Your camera will run out, but the photo opportunities won't!There is also a lane nearby, inside which you can find a nice place to convert your Euros to koruna without commission.There are lot of good eateries, pubs and bars nearby. Do walk from here to the Charles Bridge. The route is lined with souvenir shops. Do buy carefully after visiting at least 5-6 shops.

Stunning architecture. The Old Town square is a fabulous part of Prague. It is quite stunning. The whole square is alive with activity and the buildings are superb. Highlight of course is the town hall with its astronomical clock and the tower but the other architecture round about definitely has the wow factor. We were there early December when the glorious Christmas tree was lit up in all it's finery and the Christmas stalls were doing brisk trade. Various other lights around the square made the whole place magical.

Love just watching people in this old town area. great coffee and food here and lots of interesting people to watch. My second time here but still enjoyed watching the astronomical clock. Prague is a walkable city .. love it winter and summer

Best Part of Prague. We were in Prague for 4 days and spent most of our time in Old Town and New Town. Old Town is beautiful and where you will find most of the historic sights. You can spend a whole day winding through the streets and visiting the shops, bars and restaurants. Walk around and enjoy it!

Lots to see and do. If I had more time I would have spent a couple of days absorbing everything the old town had to offer. The atmosphere in the evening was much different than in the morning. Wife only had enough time to shop at half the shops. The clock, church and building architect were amazing.
Center of attraction. This is the place with all the action - the large square is where people gather...... Has the famous astronomical clock, old churches, restaurants, palaces and museums
The essence of Prague. Much to see from the architecture, clock, churches and many unique and quirky shops, this is a wonderful place to spend the day and see the real Prague.

Great sightseeing. The old town is filled with plenty of stunning buildings to look at, as well it has a vast array of shops, cafes and bars to explore.It des feel like you are walking around in circles but you will always find your way back to were you started. If you go in winter I would recommend wearing a good sturdy pair of shoes/boots as the cobblestones can be murder after hours of walking.Also there are ample opportunities for taking photos.

Great cultural experience. Such a breath-taking view from above. The church is beautiful and the historic details of the architecture make you appreciate such building. with many guards on sight, you feel very safe within the vicinity. the food places there are quite pricey so i recommend you eat before you get there but besides that, I have no negatives.

Gorgeous Tree Lighting. We timed it just right to see the Christmas market light up the last Saturday in November. Stunning with all the old buildings. Crowded and festive. The kids adored it and those cinnamon things (Trdelník)? TO DIE FOR.
A must. wonderful, a perfect sense of beauty, culture and timeless history and come together here. Walk the streets around the old city and embrace the city... A must

Safe historic place to explore. Old Town is actually quite large in area tthat goes back to at least the 800's AD and seems to be most famous for the King Charles IV (Karel IV in Czech) who was also known as the Good King Wenceslaus about whom we sing at Christmas time. King Charles has many things in Old Town named after him, besides his statue, including the King Charles bridge. King Charles eventually became head of the Holy Roman Empire making Prague one of the most important cities in Europe. The complexity of the marriages, alliances, and deals made with other countries and with the Pope are very complicated, but King Charles seemed to be happy. His is one of the few statues you'll see where there is a smile on the statue's face. Our guide for a walking tour of Old Town Prague and the Palace across the river said there were different stories about why the statue is smiling, but basically he was a good king and was happy. One thing to note in your visit to Prague is that Czechoslovakia has only been out from under the iron fist of Russia since 1989 when they won their freedom starting with demonstrations on Freedom Square. This year marked the 25th anniversary of the Velvet Revolution on November 17th. This was an important celebration as it has only been 25 years since the Russians were in charge. The guide told us that the Russians told them that they were coming in to liberate them, but what they did was liberate everything from everybody and take it over. The results of so many years under the Russian culture so recently has left its mark on Prague. While people are generally friendly, their role model for how to operate were the Russians who may be the worst example of how to provide Customer Service in the world. While there are always plains clothes security people in large stores in the States watching for shop lifters, in Prague, in many of the stores, the "plain clothes" security were dressed in gray or dark suits and looked just like KGB agents probably looked when they used to watch over the population. These KGB looking security people stare at you when you come into some of the shops and sometimes follow you to see what you are doing. Since nearly everyone is dressed casually now, they look incongruently like hold-over models from how the Russians used to provide security. The point is that the farther Prague gets away from its Russian role model, the more they will likely change in the future. At one restaurant, the waiter seemed to be issuing orders in a low growly voice when he told us to go inside. It turned out he was doing us a favor because the prices were cheaper inside than outside, but it was still so different from what you see as customer service in the US and in France, Spain, and Germany. So just be aware that if your role model on how to behave were the Russian KGB and you lived under them for many years of your lifetime, then tone and body language may appear to be cold, but it seemed clear to us that the people were trying very hard to be friendly. Prague Old Town was a great place to visit and with 4 days and 3 nights, we did a lot of exploring and never had any question about safety. We felt safer walking around Old Town at night (not late at night because we need our sleep,), but it is a great place to visit.

Great People Watching Spot. Lots of neat shops, super architecture, good food. Was within walking distance from our hotel, Art Deco Imperial. The clock tower was unique and attracts crowds on the hour.

Breathtaking!. I was absolutely in awe! We did walk quite far to save on transport - real budget travellers! Also went into the gardens below Prague Castle and worked our way down with incredible views. A must see!

Quaint. Full of tourists but well worth seeing hard to get through the crowds
lots of little shops and museums

Market. Christmas market just started. Really good however a bit disappointed that there were so many food stalls. The area around the market is very interesting and full of history. Felt very safe and the locals were very accommodating.

Every turn a new discovery. The old town is great. Very tourist oriented, but great. Plenty to do, shops to enter and look in, and even buy glass, bags and hats. The astronomical clock is something to see especially when it strikes the hour. The old town comes to life in the evening.

Great to be back. 13 years on the old town square is still a wonderful place, especially in the run up to Xmas with the tree just up.
A must see if in Prague

If you want to walk in a big museum outdoor this is the place.. Filling like walking in a big museum outdoor this is the place. Beautiful streets, buildings, the houses. The Jewish area is important to see and visit

Book a guide from Caput Regni private tours to get the most out of your visit!. We were shown around this area by Marketa who runs Caput Regni Private tours and would highly recommend contacting her if it is your first time in Prague or you have limited time to see the place. We booked her for half a day and after a few emails back and forth, we had a tailor made tour of Vysehrad fortress (close to our pick up) parts of New Town ending up in Old Town. We visited all the main sights, she gave us plenty of tips about what to do with the rest of our time and left us in a local restaurant which served superb food! She even gave us a full day itinerary suggestion (free of charge and based on our requests) for our first day on our arrival (unaccompanied) with details of Catholic Mass times, transport stops etc which meant we maximised our time and got to see things like the Wallenstein gardens and the thought-provoking limestone wall, that we probably would have missed.

Most appreciated with a local history lesson. The square is beautiful in and of itself, but you get the most out of it when you take a tour or do some reading on the history of the square and it attractions. I took one of the free walking tours that started in the Old Town square and got so much more out of the visit after having some good historical reference to color my visit.

Lovely. I can't wait to go for the Christmas market. This place is charming and wrapped in history. Full of tourists all the time. Good restaurants and coffees around, picture perfect as already said by other people.

Astronomical clock!!! Wonderful & amazing!!!. You will not believe that historically people had such amazing architectural, artistic & technical abilities.Must watch Astronomical clock at Staromestske.Not to miss during Prague visit.
magic prague. you may not know what to look at.... so many corners and magic places here... take your time to go through all the streets with your nose up...

Old Town Christmas Markets. We visited Prague mainly for the Christmas markets and were a little disappointed. There are many stalls but they are all just repeats of each other. The same food being sold, the same baubles being sold - we expected lots of different items That aside Old Town Square was lovely. Beautiful gothic buildings, great atmosphere and hot mulled wine for 29CZk (if you search!) about 80p per cup.The EkoExpress bus on the far side of the Sq. (528CZk) is a good hour's tour of the city.The Chocolate Museum is a must visit just off the Sq. for its delicious pastries.

Old Town Square perfection. Old Town Square is really beautiful heart of Prague. Go there and enjoy the nice buildings and the famous Clock. The Clock is very ancient system so do not expect any super effects going around, but it is lovely to see (considering the centuries behind it)Aaand don't go to restaurants there, very touristic prices ;)
Old Town Square. Seems to be the heart of Old Town. Astronomical Clock and lots of shopping! Plenty of side streets lead in and out of the area and lots to explore!

picture perfect. We were here during the Christmas markets and everything was breathtaking. I recommend eatjng at the stands one night, the food is fantastic. Hot wine and hot mead is great, andi definitely recommend checking out the kimgswood cider garden. They serve fold and hot kingswood cider, beer, hot wine, and sodas and its part of the market, but youre in a heated tent. Also the restaurants on the sides of the market are mainly ran by hotels, but you forget you are outside due to tbe heaters at your table and the blankets for your lap. Its great to eat, drink, and people watch!

Wrapped in history. As you walk across Charles bridge to the old town you can imagine the previous travelers trekking across the cobbles to sell their wares, visit the local hostelries and socialising. The buildings are a delight with well thought out streets and imposing houses. I loved it, there are houses with ornately carved walls that are so well done they look painted. Shops selling hand made glass baubles for Christmas you just have to risk bringing one home for the tree. I hope you enjoy as much as we did.
What a place. This location is Devine. Historical and beautiful. Excellent shopping and food. Amazing little cobble streets. Could not get enough of it. Can't wait to come back

The place to go in Prague. This is what people see when they think of Prague. It is a beautiful, if crowded, walk through Old Town. There are many shops, the Charles Bridge, and people-lots of people! Also, be mindful of the numerous shops selling the same old souvenirs. None of that is made in CZ or even considered local by the locals themselves. Get away from the pack for a more authentic taste of Prague.

Beautiful especially with the Christmas Market. It looks magical at the moment with the lovely Christmas Market, Christmas trees & lights in the Old Town Square.However there is one thing that spoils it & that is the taxi drivers, that really try to charge tourists exorbitant fares, we paid 300 & 400Kr & some tried to charge us 500 - 600Kr. We eventually (on the last day) managed to find an honest one, that charged us by the meter & it was 132Kr!!! Our hotel was 7-8 mins away from the Old Town. Beware of them, they are nasty as well as dishonest! They marred our trip with their attitude!

same as before but so very different. We visited Prague for the second time in three years and it has changed so much. the old town has not lost its charm at all and there are buskers braving the cold at all hours for you entertainment. great way to spend the evening, but beware there are some dodgy characters who will relieve you of your hard earned holiday money.all in all a nice way to spend an evening

like a fairytale. The buildings, the small cafe and the restaurants. Try to avoid periods with big crowds, you can not walk in these cases because of the people! Climb to the tower to enjoy magnificent bird eye's view of the city

Excellent. I highly recommend you go and visit the Old Town which includes many rides. Beautiful pictures. I went in June so weather was ecellent. You can rent a bike and ride in the city. It is very pleasant.

Fascinating. Really interesting but very busy so a couple of visits is enough. Loved the clock, the trams and the cobbled streets as well as the shops selling puppets and original Christmas decorations. Did not like the crowds at weekends and evening.
The read deal. Loved exploring the old town as it was one of the highlights of our trip. The place is really old with some buildings dating back to the 13th century.

Prague the only city I did not enjoy. During a 3 month hiking then city visiting trip through Europe, Prague was the only city that disappointed me. There were two reasons: 1. with the exception of the Astronomical clock and main square, no attractions lived up to expectations 2. I observed Czech people being unfriendly and unhelpful many times. If I had my visit to plan again, I would allocate one day to Prague, and not visit the inside of any attraction.

You can't buy atmosphere. The old town quarter oozes an Eastern European Charm and Eccentricity that you could not buy. At night, without having to pay anything you can sit in the square and feel the passion of life around you. Buy a mulled wine in one of the many open air cafes and enjoy it with a cigarette without feeling like a leper. Soak it up.
Not to be missed. So much to see and explore. Easy walk from our hotel, the Art Deco Imperial Hotel. Many great places to eat. Each time we went back, we discovered more.
The central attraction. All things gravitate around the Old Town Square. Beautiful buildings, viewing points & a great place to sit & watch the world go by!

Great place, skip the paid tour!. Old town square is awesome and big, with tons of ally ways to walk down on the cobble street it will get your senses going. Do not pay for a tour when you can get a free walking tour.

People watch. Sit outside at a bar and enjoy the free entertainment from musicians, bubble artists and Segway riders. The Bohemian style buildings and the hourly chimes of the Astronomical Clock make this an excellent place to watch the world go by. What's not to like?

So Worth It!. Old Town is so much fun. Tons of shops that offer every kind of take home gifts that every tourist buys. The narrow streets, the square, the architecture, the food, the hot wine all make this a top attraction. I have been to many cities over the past few years and this one has got to be one of my favorites. Truly a destination that should not be missed.
A medieval delight. Easy to get lost! Not as crowded in November so felt quite spacious. Enjoyed seeing Xmas decorations going up. Clock is a bit disappointing.

Such a beautiful city. Spend some time walking around the Old Town area. It's so beautiful and very unique. Visit the small shops...not just the tourist souvenier shops, but all of them. You will love it!

Exceeded expectations.. Amazed at how great Prague was as a capital city destination.Architecture exceptional.Cafe and restaurants of all sorts at correct prices.Abundance of public toiletsLots of museums and galleriesAll cafes and attractions warm.Staff great and welcoming.Easy to see all the best attractions on foot from any central location.Huge amount of street entertainers, the bands were especially good.The only beggars were a few supplicants and there was no aggressive begging.Everywhere felt safe ay day and night.

Picturesque. lots to see with plenty of camera opportunities near the astronomical clock, be there on the hour to spot the moving mechanical parts and figures. Plenty of warm inviting cafes on a cold November day. See also the adjacent interesting Jewish quarter.

Beauty all around you and Russian shops everywhere!. Prague became my favorite place in Europe to visit. No doubt. Old town square with all the side streets is pure beauty. Anyway I would expect more of Czech original things to be sold on the streets. Everywhere Russian stores!

OldTown not to be missed. Old town is great. Numerous church's to visit, the clock tower, and shopping. Shoul not be missed. The clock chimes on the hour. It lasts only 17 seconds, so don't blink. Watch the skeleton pull the rope to ring the bell.
Beautiful. Bit crowded at times, as expected, but really charming. Some of the best restaurants are around here.

Relaxing place. very amusing interesting to watch people and street entertainers it was so funny this Angel entertainer was all dressed in white & smoking a cigarette so funny .it a very vibrant place with lots of places to eat worth a visit.

Just what you expect and want to see.. Narrow cobbled streets, amazing architecture, chapels, shops, cafes, bars, spend some time wandering around stopping occasional to stare. This is what a gentle holiday is all about.
Art of Buildings. Even if you do not appreciate architecture, you will love the Old Town. It goes on and on and around every corner something different. Not overly garish, just awe inspiring.

Beautiful. Simply beautiful. Take at least 3-4 hours to just wander. I brought a "Prague city guide" with me and identified different points of attraction on the way. Try to blend in, although the atmosphere is very touristic, not local, but it's nice anyway. I never felt like it was over-crowded or tiring (but maybe this is due to visiting in November which is not high-season). Just take your time and walk the streets, stop for a hot wine (the terraces are open in November and they have outdoor heating systems and blankets, which is really romantic and cozy). We challenged each other to find a single place to call ugly or dull. Guess what? We failed! :)

Lovely place. The old town gives you quite nice feeling, you'll always be amazed with the historical architecture and beauty of the place. It's perfect for walking around and have a nice czech dinner in one of the great restaurants nearby!

A beautiful area. The Old Town in Prague takes you back hundreds of years. Both during the day, and at night it is a beautiful place to visit - lots of fascinating buildings, small cobbled streets and a lovely friendly atmosphere.

A luxury tourist trap. A must visit, wonderful old architecture, excellent sights, but saturated with expensive tourist shops, all selling the same stuff and very bad food vendors. Use your imagination to think away the bad and the ugly and concentrate on the good
Beautiful Area to Explore. Lots of churches, museums, and high end shopping. We spent a good deal of time in the Hewish Quarter which is not to be missed.

Old towns in Europa are in most cases interesting. The Old Town takes up the area around the Old Town Square (Staroměstské náměstí). It is not easy to list subjects of that old town. Therefore only in short: The National Theater, The Estates Theater, The Rudolfinum,The Powder Gate, The Municipial House,churches (for.ex. St.James), palaces (f.e.Clam-Gallas), The Carolinum, The Clementinum, The Charles Bridge, The Old Town Bridge Tower,... Architectural styles: romanesque, gothic,renaissance, baroque, rococo, neorenaissance, classical, historical, art nouveau

Magical.. There are not enough superlatives to describe the awesome jaw dropping beauty of historic Prague! Every building is a work of art. It had been well recommended and I knew it would be good but it far surpassed all expectations. Both during the day and at night it was a magical place. So many little cobbled streets and squares, shops, attractions and steeped in centuries of history yet with all the modern conveniences and comforts that make it an absolute pleasure to visit. Loved all the music and street cafes on the squares and streets.
Lovely area of the city. Lots of lovely interesting buildings, restaurants & small shops with a very nice atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit.

Great area to take in the sights and shop. There is so much to see and do in this area that it is hard to list all of them. There are many historic works of art that any direction you turn to you will find some. We walked all over the place trying primarily to see the old buildings and art work, but there are lots of shops and restaurants down every street you take. One thing I did not like was that out of all the places in Europe I've visited, Prague seemed like the 'most out to get your money' city that I have been to. Everything from the exorbitant taxis to the fake money exchangers to all the street hustlers, made it less impressive than it really is. This are is so impressive that if you're not from some other impressive old European city, you have to spend some time here; just hold on to your wallet!
Really relaxing. The old town square is excellent with guys playing music there lots of restaraunts and just a great atmosphere in the run up to xmas really enjoyed it
great to wander around. we stayed in old town. really liked the area. We will be back. We came in November and it was COLD, however, we bundled up and enjoyed having less crowds!
Historical. A lot of history in Prague, definitely worth taking a free tour of the old town, because they give you the background about certain historical buildings in the old town.

Glorious architecture. Words cannot describe how beautiful this is. The intricately woven designs on every single monument will just wow you. The Baroque influence is so loud you will travel back in time after visiting the old town. Definitely by far one of the most beautiful European experiences.

The heart of Prague. The beautiful Gothic architecture is what I loved about Prague, walking the winding streets to take in the views is what all the tourists look to do and I really enjoyed it. Simply essential for your trip.

A must. It is about the only place we hung around for the two and a half days we were in Prague. One needs at least 4 to 7 days to see it all and grasp the beauty, historical/architectural wealth this town has to show and offer.

The place to be in Prague!. My wife, mom-in-law and I stayed in the Hilton in Old Town during our 10 day visit to Prague, and spent most of our time in Old Town, visiting the sights (the best: Municipal House, Jewish Quarter, Mucha Museum, Gastronomy Museum, Decorative Arts Museum) and eating lots of good (if perhaps too rich and overly abundant) food. We also took a culinary walking tour with Eating Prague that spent lots of time in Old Town, visiting spots like the Choco Cafe (great hot chocolate, baked goods and chocolate bars).
One of my favourite destinations. Can't beat this city - is beautiful in the day and even better at night. So much culture & places to eat and drink. The old bridge and palace has to be seen!

Great Place to spend some time. This will be a place for a nostalgic movement as you will be transported to 16 Century to be like the people of that time. This place is always lively full of action and fun

Great city. I loved how easy it was to get around the city. I found the tram system excellent and even though we got lost a lot is was still easy to find our way back to our hotel. Getting lost was kind of fun. We discovered a lot of places that were off the beaten path. The buildings are amazing and the food was great!
the city. well worth a trip if your visiting prague as it really is a great city to see and if your there for a short time this is the sort of trip you want to do..
Beautiful old town. Beautiful place, but so easy to get lost in this maze-like place. Never fear though, because that's when you find the coolest places!

Excellent but shop and eat elswhere. Well worth a visit to toodle through the cobblestone streets and look at the buildings and people. We seemed to transit through Stare Mesto all the time and the scenery never got old. The shops and restaurants are very touristy and you can find much better throughout Prague. Prices for beer are about double the average when compared to outside the square.

One of the Great Town Squares. Everywhere you turned in this square, there was something to see. We went back twice to enjoy the sidewalk cafes and the people watching. There were bands performing and an amazing clock tower. The only downside was the segue rental operation.
great plaza, ambience. feel like you are in the 15th century with a great modern beer garden. No auto traffic, large walking zone with many small shops.

A large town square with a great Astronomical Clock. Like most European town squares, Stare Mesto can get very crowded with people. The Astronomical Clock (third oldest in the world) is worth the crowds to see it in action at the top of the hour (noon is very good). There is art and many street performers in the square as well as historic churches and buildings ringing the square. A short walk from the Charles bridge, it is central to much of the sites to be seen in Prague.
A must for Prague. You must go to the square, it's beautiful, lots to look at & take in. Loads of restaurants & bars around the square. It's perfect to sit & people watch & take in the atmosphere
Lots to see. The square is busy with entertainers, hot food and drink stalls around the edge. It was bustling with people but not too much to make it uncomfortable.
Not to miss. My wife and I were there for 3 days on a tour. A lot to see and do. Plenty of tourist trap type shops on some streets but overall charming with excellent places to visit.

Memorable walk in 2006!. I went on a solo trip through Berlin, then Prague and finally Budapest in 2006.It was an interesting experience to walk through Old Town Prague ... almost like going back in time. The architecture is all very interesting and there is a real café/beer bar culture in Prague which is prominent in Old Town as well.I enjoyed this walk very much even though it was very cold as it was wintertime.
the beautiful of history. during my trip i had an education from one of my friends and local of the old and new town of Prague. this country is full of history and beauty all around.

Beautiful old town. The old town is a real beautiful maze of streets and squares filled with churches and nice buildings. A real indispensable place to visit some time in one's life. The only problem is the big amount of tourists who invade every square feet of the old city.

Stay near and fully enjoy life in Prague. Old Town square is simply beautiful and active. The gothic buildings are even more beautiful at night. Don't miss the astronomical clock, stroll around the shops, and try the local faire. Magical.

Beautiful. So atmospheric, it really is a must see. The astronomical clock is amazing. Beware of pick pockets whilst you are watching it doing it's thing on the hour. Also, ladies make sure you don't wear high heels, you will end up breaking you neck!!!! Also, wear shoes with thick soles as the cobbles can really hurt your feet. Don't change money on the street, as it is a con.

Majestically. Very beautiful architecture. Unique feeling. MajesticallyMany tourists in November. It's hard to find a toilet - there you have to pay. Better to go to the nearest bar - along with beer to drink.

Beautiful but unauthentic town. The old town is undeniably beautiful but is overrun with tourists and kitschy shops. There are more tourists than locals, more English spoken than Czech, and the atmosphere is more of a picturesque Disney World than a real city.

Getting more like Disneyland?. Though the majority of the Old Town is preserved, the worst is to see the lack of control over the growing menace and danger of SEGWAYS and the agents driving around at high speed touting for business (usually to the young crowd who may think it is a cool lazy way to see the city)! Sad. You cannot beat walking in the historic centre if you want to enjoy the maximum and appreciate the wealth of buildings, sites and colours.  Also they have allowed the restaurants to take up more space with their tables + street performers, + guides touting for business etc.Perhaps bribes secure the freedom to publicise your business or gain more space on the square. You can only enjoy it in peace without having to avoid the segways at night when Tyn Church is mystically lit as in a fairy tale.Strange that since Starbucks managed to set up in the prime location near the clock tower the square has got more commercialised than ever!To end on a positive note, it is encouraging to see that with all today's tech distractions one of the oldest working mechanisms in the world (the Astronomical Clock) continues to attract 100s of wondrous and curious onlookers each hour!
Lots to see. You have to visit the old town in the both day and evening so much going on there. Great views of the square fron the clock tower

Full of beautiful sight. Walking around Prague old town for the first time is an unforgettable experience. In every corner, to every angle you may see beautiful buildings and scenery. Nice shops, restaurants, cafes and crowds.

Everything you would want here. The old town is easily navigable in a day and you can see so much public art and unique pubs and restaurants. Signs make it easy to get back to the square each time. A trip up the clock tower in the square is a must and just a few euros. Inexpensive restrooms are located there and at the Starbucks and Erpet store in the square as well. The information desk at the clock tower will get you where and doing whatever you could want. Perfectly safe to navigate at night and check out the Charles Bridge and go over the castle. Take some time to try to get lost here and see all the statues and characters throughout the old town.

Pleasurable. Nice place to see. I recommend one of the tours then you will learn more about clock, main historical statue in the middle of market, towers and many many more :)
If you would like to try Czech food there are small wooden houses which offer different meals from sour cabbage, grilled sausage to sweets.
Atmosphere. Loved Old Town Square. It was always a hive of activity and is stunning at night. There is a great restaurant that sells pork knuckle which was just amazing.
Stare mesto charm. Great place to relax and take in the environment. Know your history so you can enjoy what you are looking at as you people watch.
1st visit to Prague but not the last. The architecture, music, views opera and cuisine were wonderful. Only negative was too much graffiti on beautiful buildings.

Just beautiful. for me,prague is one of my favorite cities,the stare mesto is beautiful,you can walk in the small streets,take nice pic,eat and have ur coffee...so many things too see there.st.nicolas church,the astronomical watch etc
Fun to walk around. Great to walk around and sight see kill time and see what else you will find. You seem to always find something new every time you walk around here.

Wonderful at night, a fancy invasion of Oranje-fans. I visited Prague to attend the Dutch squad soccer match against the Czech team. In the hours before the game, the Staremesti was filled with people dressed in Orange - our national team's color. In the evening, the old town square gives an almost fairy-tale view. A very special place to have heen at once in you lifetime. The same holds for seeing the old town as a whole and the other famous sites, the Castle and the Carl's Bridge. Apart reports on these site may appear soon.

Cosy Old Town - Stare Mesto Prague. If you look for a hotel in Prague search one near or in the Old Town. Very cosy to wander around the small streets, to have a drink on the Old Market, lots to do, lots to see and everything can be visited on foot. Every where you find street artists who, with their music and thier acts bring cosyness.

Gorgeous. Go up the Astronomical clock tower for awesome views, it is worth the few pounds they charge. For luxury shopping there is one street near the Jewish quarter which is choc full of top end designer shops.
Great historic place. I love the Old Town, good bars, great old buildings, just gets very busy when the Millenium Clock goes off in the hour!
good. it was great but not alot of travelers in winter. i like the food there. i dislike the people get infront of u.
Lovely!. Lovely narrow streets and fantastic buildings, but a lot of tourists. The shopping was OK, not more.

Astonishing. Built in the 14th century the Old Town and the Astronomical Clock are two attractions that should not be missed while in Prague. Their architecture and beauty cannot be described, you must see it. There is a lot going on in the Town Square, music, great restaurants and amazing shops. Czechs are famous for their Bohemian crystal and you will find great deals and amazing prices.

Beautiful but Commercialized. Very pretty Old Town area with a lot of upgrades since my first visit some 8 years ago. But with the upgrades attracting more tourists the area has become too commercialized. Too many stores selling the same things, hard to tell the good from bad stores. Also all the people trying to get you to do something - rent a segway, join a tour, etc. and too many "street performers" with loud speakers or instruments detracting from the peace. Even hard to sit out for a beverage or bite to eat without we accosted by vendors or the noise. It is a shame as it is so pretty!
Beautiful. Ouah. Nothing to say, you have to visit it to understand my feelings.It is uncredibly the most beautiful city I have never visit.

Its what you visit for.. Lots and lots of little streets, nooks and crannies to explore. Shops for eveyone, all levels of expense. We loved wandering around here, it's what you visit the old part of Paruge for.
Breathtaking. This place is just beautiful. Easy to get lost but in a very good way. My only dislike is you can still smoke inside pubs/restaurants. But still a great place to spend some time
Loved prague. Travelled with my husband by train through many city's ..this was our favourite . I can't say anymore than " GO to prague " history , beauty, music .....I will return
Great Walking Area. Old Town Prague feels like a medieval city.It is very walkable and beautifully kept up.,The tour of the Jewish quarter is a must.

Great shopping and man wonderful places to ear. Prague is a wonderful city filled with great shopping, good restaurants and the old twon has it all. The Czech Repubic is in the Eurpoeon Union but uses the Krona (20:1 US dollar) so things are relatively inexpensive. This is the area to visit to make your money go far. Interested in hand made toys? This is the wherethe world's best are made / sold. Pastries - second to none!Very cosmopolitan, polite people and they make you feel welcome.Great architecture as Prague was not destroyed during WW II.One of the world's must see cities and this area is a must.
Well preserved. Walking through old town was a pleasure, enjoyed the architecture and the buzz, despite being November it was very busy, could be too crowded in main holiday season.
Ok, but a bit expensive. Try just going a bit farther, you will find better prices, quality and service! Eventhough nice to stay around to enjoy the atmosphere of the square!
Beautiful city center. The city center is breath taking. I love the atmosphere, but without the tourists, it's much nicer. Beware of pickpockets!

Beautiful town square that is definitely worth visiting. A visit to Prague will not be complete without visiting Old Town Square. The buildings are beautiful and you will also see the Astronomical Clock. There are a lot of dining places plus you will surely be entertained by the array of street artists performing in the center and at every corner.

Full of life. This is the place to sit and stare, take the time to watch the world go by. There is always something going on in this old town square. Street performers; artists, musicians, dancers. There are some lovely cafes and bars along with street vendors, so this is also a place to stop for a drink or something to eat. Some places are pricey, but some are very reasonably priced.
history all around you. it is best to visit early in the morning, when all the tourist traps and souvenir shops are closed, then you can definitely experience the best of it.

Beautiful, but won't go back. Such a beautiful area of an amazing city with a very long and interesting history. So much commercialization and pushy tour guides and others made this a place I will visit only once. That was enough.
So beautiful. The whole old town is incredibly beautiful and cozy! the restaurants in this area are over prized so go find a typical czech restaurant instead
Really nice area. Was a really nice area, lot's of shops and places to see. I would skip the clock, nothing special about that.
old town. beautiful town square with excellent street entertainment. spent a lovely couple of hours there, watching the world go by with at one of the pavement cafes.
Beautiful place!. I like this place. It's full of history, lovely and charm. It is nice if you have a chance to visit it in the mornings. Not crowded as in the afternoon.

The heart of Prague's Old Town.. The heart of the old town, it is impressive to walk around. Very colorful, the variety of architecture and the astronomical clock makes it a very pleasant place to visit while you are in Prague.

360 beauty. There is history all around! When you walk through the arches with the armed guards it feels like you have entered a fairy tale land! So beautiful! Do not miss the St Vitus cathedral is beautiful inside and out! The courtyards are so pretty, as are the palaces with music being played in courtyards

Amazing Architecture. We took a guided walking tour which was really good. Saw all the wonderful historical buildings and learned about the history of Prague. We also visited the Jewish Quarter and heard about Franz Kafka and saw his statue.
beautiful architecture. Cafe Mozart. Wonderful setting on the first floor, right in front of the astronomical clock. Lovely coffee and cake.
Gorgeous. If for no other reason go for the varied architecture. Get a map, it helps. If you are there for a few days, pick two or three buildings in the Old Town to visit. Clock is the least of it.

A Great Walk. Lots to see--enjoy the architecture, the people, the places to eat. If you are with a tour, and are looking to buy something, I suggest asking your guide where to make your purchases. Many of the shops are tourist traps, and you can get higher quality and more reasonable prices outside this area

Fascinating. A maze of narrow winding streets with restaurants, and shops as well as historical sites. It is very easy to lose your way until you get your bearings, so a map in hand is essential. A very walkable city for those who enjoy doing so.
Unique and beautiful. A wonderful area to walk around, filled with interesting corners. Possible to get away from tourists out of high season.

Must go there, but not because of the Clock. Old Town is an historic place, worth a visit, and maybe staying there for a some time, for a beer while you take in the historic atmosphere. The Astronomical Clock is a famous attraction there, and hundreds of people gather around it each hour to watch what I classify as a not very interesting attraction. But climbing (there is an elevator) the Powder Tower just at the side of the Clock is a must do activity. From there you have marvelous views of Prague, and a good idea of how the city developed, besides taking a look at the various historical buildings.
Getting a taste of old style Praha. People of all ages and types are drawn to the older parts of any city or town and Praha has no exception to this. There's plenty to see, eat and souvenirs to buy.

Wonderful place to stroll around, buy souvenirs and eat good food.. Nothing to dislike about this place.
Was a wonderful experience, great beer, good food and friendly service.
They really cater to tourists and I felt safe and happy going back again the next day.
You can also buy souvenirs there. Be careful about cashing currency with anyone. Go to a reputed place to change your money.
nice city centre. It is worth to see. This is the o;d town center of the city with many attractions. I can recommended.

Old town. The old town the old part of the city, can't say is not beautiful adding excellent colors to the whole landscape.nevertheless i think you'll visit dozen of times,it's worth it.Take as many walks as you can and enjoy

It is what it says - and thats good. Many cities have these quarters they call 'old town'. Makes a difference to find one that actually is old - and all that comes with it e.g. character , atmosphere ; yet has still managed to control the necessary evils e.g. people , tourism. A credit to Prague.
Typical Prague. This is the best place we found to absorb the energy and vibe of Prague. Vibrant and always interesting thing going on.
Simply amazing. So huge that it seems like it doesn´t have an end. This makes such an atmosphere which i have never felt on any other place, must-see place in Europe, not only in Czech republic

Magical. Old town is magical --- we have been there 5 times and we still love it ... its a city where we feel so safe and comfortable ... its so full of history and beautiful sites ... it should be top of your list of places to visit. We love Prague.
beautiful but hard to enjoy with the crowds. architecture was splendid, but with the heavy crowds it's hard to slow down and really enjoy the city's grandeur.

Beautiful place . This is an amazing place to wander around and try all the great tasting traditional meals and pastries. The best part is that it's a great price compared to many other popular European destinations. Especially the beer and fresh pretzels, Mmmm.

Stunning architecture and a festive atmosphere. We spent hours just wandering through the old town. Stunning buildings are everywhere. There are lots of visitor attractions, but we found the city itself is enough.

For the architect.... and the souvenir shopper!
Old town is beautiful visually (apart from all the back ally graffiti) but it is very much aimed at the tourist now with nothing but restaurants, souvenir shops and Thai massage parlours everywhere.
Definitely worth a visit if you love history and architecture.

Very nice but beware.... It's a very nice place to visit. Just be very careful of pick pocketers & shady people selling drugs. Always watch your belongings. keep money & C/C in a hidden money bag/pouch & tucked under clothes. We were ok as we were extra carefull!
View from above. View of the old city from the high you can have from the tower of Astronomical Clock (Czech - Orloj) or from the restaurant U Prince. It's an experience!! Good townscape!
Old Town Square. You must not miss this. The Old Town square is very large and surrounded by the most beautiful buildings including the Astronomical Clock which is a must see on the hour.
old town. Very beautiful and historic place.... some times a little too much people. reasonable prices even for tourists and good service

Prague's Old Town. Awesome! Beautiful architecture, great people watching, interesting food, yummy beer, and music and entertainment all in one place. You can just sit there for hours and not need to do anything else!
A real slice of Europe. Old town has it all; restaurants and shopping and lots of people. There is a great laser light show at night and all kinds of activities on the square all day long.

Old town. A busy town full of life & entertainment,brilliant time. A must for anyone on a city break.
Lots of restaurants to try,plenty of entertainment too.
By walk must see. I can recommend go there by walk than some pub or with children you can feed swans or duck in vltava river

Not what it seems. Just note about Stare mesto. It was rebuild at the end of 19 century so in fakt the buildings at the New Town are acttually older.
+ the picture fo this is not the old town, it is the front of a St. Vitus cathedral at the Casle district.
Centre of Prague. This area is very busy with lots of tourists, many interesting buildings, be sure to wear comfortable flat shoes as most of this area of Prague is cobbled streets.

Oldie Worldie Prague. If your planning to visit Prague, I would suggest staying near the Old Town Square. This is where Prague really comes alive. Even late at night there is plenty going on here, Loads of street performers, restaurants & museums & the Cathedral is something else altogether... Just stunning.This is a place for everyone to enjoy of all ages. There is constantly something going on. We went late October,so it was getting dark quite early, but thats when the Square really come to life.And its a photographers delight
Astronomical Clock. It's a must see. There are free walking tours going through the square too. Just look for the umbrellas advertising this.
Beautiful Architecture. The astronomical clock is a must see. There are many souvenir shops, although most are selling the same thing. Street venders sell local foods, very nice.
wow. wow, what an amazing old town square, very pretty with loads of old buildings to look at, prices a bit dearer in the main square, if you want a drink step up a side street for better value.

speechless. The old town just takes your breathe away. It seems like a fairy tail although there are tons and tons of tourists. Visiting this romantic city during the fall makes it special but I am sure that any time of the year the visit will become a wordless experience.

Don't miss it. A main reason to go to Prague. We took a private tour arranged through a guide we found in Rick Steve's Czech Republic book. Wasn't cheap but worth every penny. Highlights are the old Jewish section and the Old Town Square.

Beautiful town with a lot of pubs. Old town is beautiful place full of gothic architecture, great pubs and a lot of shops with souvenirs, beer and tobacco. But, be aware of the big exchange places. They tend to take provision up to 27%, which is nothing else but robbery.

Beautiful Square. This is a lovely town square and doesn't feel like much has changed in the last few hundred years. Whilst it is relatively expensive in comparison to the rest of Prague, the food and drink is well worth the money for charm of the place.
Beautiful venue. This was a lovely old square filled with performers, didn't stop here long...so much else to see and do!

Very Nice. Very nice Old Town (Stare Mesto) and a lot of stores.
I will come back some day ans see more of Prague.
Great. The entire old town is beautiful and the history is felt at every single step.. Prague really charmed me..

A beautiful place, historic and atmospheric. Wow - this square is a lovely place to spend time - especially at night - loads going on but not hectic and crazy like some cities. Prague seems to stay chilled whatever is going on. This square is very central and in each direction off from the square brings a new adventure. A lovely place just to sit and drink a Pilsner beer, to eat an expensive English style meal or a cheap Czech meal - choose wisely. Worth trying food from the traditional stalls. A must-see at night when all is classically lit up!

Beautiful place... Watch for food $$. This is a must do for Prague visits... A wonderful location, locals play music at the plaza. One word of caution: food prices at stalls (they seem cheap) are really high... For example they show "Prague ham" at 89 csk per 100g, but they give you what they want in size, so you end up paying a hefty price.., the "trdelink" are nice, but without other "sides" you cannot experience the whole Czech experience...

Charles Bridge, Prague Castle and the big clock amazing. Just make a walking tour through the city. Up to Prague Castle, and using the Charles Bridge. Also have a look to the big clock at the square in the center of the city. Many people will watch with you! Very nice old city.
Nice and beautiful. I've been in prague for one month and it was the most beautiful city in europe. Prague is city with long and interesting history.

Beautiful. Climb the clock tower, try the roof top restaurants,listen to the music of the Bohemian Bards ( if you're lucky),stroll around the shops,gaze at the architecture, enjoy the Charles Bridge,watch the hourly astronomical clock changes...Very safe and highly recommended place to visit.

Great place.. The Old Town square is definitely a place to visit. There is a great view and many attractions over there. There always some people who perform anything musical at the square and a big selection of restaurants.I went there at the noon when it was fully crowded and in the night so I'll would be able to take a lovely panorama shots.Don't forget to visit the old clock tower!! :)
Best main square in Europe!. No words needed, you must come there and see it for yourself!Everything there is beautiful; the architecture, people all scrounging is breathtaking

Old Town Prague is definitely worth a visit.. Prague is an incredibly beautiful city with buildings that leave you in awe of their architectural beauty. The Old Town square has shopping, good food, historical interest and the incredible Astronomical Clock. If you visit Prague, you must go to Old Town.
Very nice. It was very noce and historic. We liked the Christmas season food stands. And we will come back soon

very quaint. Prague is a nice city. It seems bigger than Budapest and more crowded and the old town area, especially just passed the Charles Bridge, is very touristy, but the prices are actually cheaper there than on the other side of the bridge.
Old town. For me, it just ressembles other Eastern-European towns and cities. It didn't leave a memorable impression. But maybe I just saw too many places like this one.
Never ending charm. In our first visit to Prague, we were pleasantly surprised by the extent of old, historic buildings throughout the city, even off the tourist's beaten path.

History and so much more.... The square is the heart of the old town. Every facade is so different and has a story to tell. Winding lanes that take you to so many interesting places - churches, museums, interesting shops, street vendors, talented musicians. Loved Prague.
Buildings and churches. Walking around the old town was a very nice experience. I recommend to visit the main church and eat in a restaurant wich is very close to the church

Not to be missed. The Jewish quarter and Synagogues were unbelievable. It was so sad that a brilliant culture of some 45,000 people, who had contributed so much to Prague's history was wiped out by the Nazi's. Disappointed that the trip to the Palace excluded one to the inside of the Palace! Loved seeing Kafka's house there!

Wonderful City. It's a great place to visit,fine building from many centuries, some wonderful examples of Art Deco, quirky little back alleys opening up to interesting squares, very enjoyable to wander arround, especially in fine weather.The local tram & metro system offers excellent access and is very economical.Prague doesn't really have an off tourist season, it was still busy when weI was there at the end of October.So many must see places
