just beautiful!!. Full of gothic buildings, restaurants, artists, nice little streets paved with stones, no cars, many turists and a lively, romantic pulse

Great eating, drinking, shopping and siteseeing. Prague is like 3 cities all in one. The Old Town has little, winding streets that seem to lead you to fascinating areas. The cobblestone streets are well maintained so walking is easy. Every church is a like a museum and the architecture is gorgeous. Don't miss the Town Hall Clock. Take close looks at facades as they are all elegant and elaborate

Historical Delight. A Lovely area , many many ancient buildings with much character. Lots going on, tourists, street vendors, plenty of cafes and restaurants. Lots of charm especially near Charles Bridge.

So Pretty!. The Old Town is just so pretty! Not only are the architecture around very pretty, the place is so vibrant with many things happening. According to a tour guide that we overheard, the Old Town is one of the most happening squares in the world. When I was there, there were musicians playing and singing at the square, 'statues', people just basically doing what they like and it was quite fun. But do only visit when the weather is good and it's not raining. Otherwise it might not be as pretty and lovely.

Prague Old Town . This is a very historical area. The Astronomical Clock is the main feature but the hotels and restaurants and shopping are all right there. The street performers are fun to watch. This is a great location to stay in Prague as you are a short walk to most everything except the Castle. The only disappointment was the Tyn Church due to no photos allowed. Be sure to go to the Jewish Quarter and see the memorials with all of the names who suffered and died during WW2.
Stunning. Just a great Christmas spirit in the town square - go see the tree lightning festival and all the shops - wonderfully fun!

A favourite place. We've been to lots of European cities but we especially loved Old Town in Prague, it has a lovely atmosphere, although extremely crowded at peak times, especially around the Astronomical Clock. We felt very safe everywhere, there's outdoor cafes which are nice to sit and have a drink and watch the artists and musicians performing. It's a great place to shop for Czech hand cut glass and Bohemian crystal but beware of non genuine crystal shops. We shopped at Erpet for genuine crystal as our tour director recommended it and prices weren't bad.
Nice culture. Old Town was full of tourists but still maintains it's old world charm. Street performers, historical landmarks, street markets and more. Very safe and fun environment.

Great Place to get Lost. Stare Mesto consists of curvy lanes, cobblestone streets and covered walkways. It is a great place to walk and people watch.Many great places to see for us the highlights were the Old Town Square and the Jewish Cemetery, both are well worth visiting. Such a popular place that it is full of tourists and very busy. Best to come early morning or late afternoon and avoid the crowds.

nice area. The old town is a center of Prague, one of the beatiful place where I used to be. If you travel to Prague you should visit it. There is a nice atmosphere. Often you can see the markets, musicians, artists and etc. There are a lot of cafes and bars around, a lot of tourists :)
fun for all age. beautiful to watch. you can see the figures around the clock moving, doing a little show, every whole hour. i wish it was longer.
Enjoy a walk here. Monuments,statues,architecture,shops, just take in the ambiance. There are buses,taxis and trams, but just take a walk and enjoy the discovery around each corner.

beautiful place. I know that if tourists didn't exist, this place would not appear on sites like this. But somehow, the appeal of this amazing location is surpassed by the number of tourists. you can hear a multitude of languages, clicks of the phones or camera, the explanation of the guides and for a moment you just wonder what it would be like if this place was empty. No people, no restaurants, just the amazing narrow streets, the buildings, the history.I bet it would be amazing.
Smell the history. This is my favorite city in the world! All streets all places are really nice and full of history. The bridge is just perfect to walk and have a view on the nice city....

Just look up!. Beautiful architecture everywhere you look, but remember to look up towards the tops of the buildings where you will see the most beautiful architecture of all! Just lovely walking around and seeing the beauty of the old town. I never felt unsafe the whole time I was there.

Land of enchantment. Everything in old town felt like a journey into a magic land. The food and wine were delicious, the people were charming, the stores were full of beautiful art glass, the buildings were so colorful. No wonder so many famous musicians and artists found Prague the city of their dreams. And the desserts! A chocaholic's dream come true!
Have to see. Not too be missed , especially your first time in Prague. Way too many people, as you would expect in such an interesting place.

Lovely but REALLY crowded. The old town, especially the old town square, was lovely, filled with 18th century buildings, but very crowded, which diminished the appeal somewhat. It was also filled with tourist-focused shops and overpriced cafes. If it was that busy in October, I can't imagine what it must be like in the summer.
Atmospheric, always something new to discover. We thoroughly enjoyed wandering at random around the Old Town - it's full of interesting shops, beautiful buildings and unexpected views.

worth seeing. Beautifully preserved. We especially liked the Art Deco interiors of many of the public buildings. do not miss the municipal building which is a treat. it often has very interesting exhibits.
It's lovely. A wonderful place to get lost in your thoughts, dreams and associations - as well as to admire the architecture and to catch the spirit of Prague.

Not to miss in Central Europe. With bad press from recent years, this a a bustling place in the autumn...which is when I came...a 5 minute walk from the famous Wenceslas Square an worlds apart with fine shopping for all tastes and budgets.... From souvenirs to diamonds.... They are not great at making coffee here but Czech beer is incredible...remember if you ask for a large one it is 1litre..Architecture is a mix of medieval gothic French Renaissance and German Austrian with stunning attractions with much puppetry and music.......All prices comparable to the uk are art from food and beer which is still around half of what you want would expect to pay back in Blighty!A must see at night.All customer servants put us to shame with their multi linguistics!
Old Town Square - Prague. This beautiful plaza was just as quaint and beautiful as I was led to believe. For a major European capitol, the prices were quite reasonable.

Stunning architecture. The Old Town of Prague is one of the most romantic places in Europe. With stunning architecture, great restaurants, culture and shopping, it's a tourist's dream. It can get very busy over the Summer 'though.
Beautiful. Prague is a wonderful city with endless beautiful buildings to see. Try getting out early to avoid crowds.
Prague Old Town. Big square full of tourists, street performers, hawkers & food vendors. Nice if you like crowds. Surrounding architecture is nice

Try very early or late. To get a different perspective from the tourist packed area during the day, try to plan a walk through either really early in the morning, or as the last thing you do before heading to your hotel for the night- you might be able to enjoy it more.

Lovely area..... We really enjoyed our time in Prague. Wandering the streets, looking at all the wonderful old buildings. Enjoyed our Urban Adventure walking tour, really set the stage for our visit to Prague.
Beautiful to walk around the winding streets. Beautiful to walk around the winding streets. Lots of restaurants and interesting buildings. They want more characters.

Just wander........ So much to see and admire. Every time you walk through an area you've already been in, you see something new! Fantastic architecture and every building seems to have something special about its look.
Walk!. This is a great place to explore on foot. No need to take a taxi, even if you have to walk 10 blocks to get there. It's so interesting and the sidewalk cafes are wonderful.

Penta Hotell / PRAGUE / Czech Republic. "The Old Town Square dates from the 12th century and started life as the central marketplace for Prague. Over the centuries buildings of Romanesque, Baroque and Gothic styles were erected around the market, each bringing with them stories of wealthy merchants and political intrigue.The most notable sights on the square are the Old Town Hall Tower & Astronomical Clock, Tyn Church and St. Nicholas Church."

Ashley,the free guide. The Old Town and its wonderful architecture was impressive during the day but even more beautiful by night.A nice surprise in the afternoon was the free guide tour with the point of departure the Old Town Square. The guide was Ashley,a charming young australian who made the walking under the ancient walls and through the narrow streets very amusing,moments that are hard to forget in such a great athmosphere.

prague. i liked everything,but watch out where you change your money the commission rates change very much. it was nice that you can do all the attractions by foot because their very close to one and other.I don't think it's a city for people in a wheelchair though.

Old Town. You can visit most of the attractions in Prague old town by walking, which is what I did. You can walk to the Prague Castle via Charles Bridge. Along the way you can enjoy the beautiful views, building and churches.

Best Old Town in Europe. Old Town Prague is awesome. Very busy/touristy, but for good reason. Architecture, shopping, sight seeing, scenery, is incredible. The pedestrian streets leading to Charles Bridge are filled with shops, cafes, and historic buildings. Follow the roads down toward the river and back up to the city center. Quite hard to get lost. Area is fairly safe due to all the people. Night time is also happening in Old Town and most shops are still open. Get your handmade Czech glass sculpture/vases; and a good selection of artwork. Artists set up shop on the Charles Bridge which has amazing scenic views. One of the most beautiful European cities.
Graffiti. Everywhere we went the walls were covered in graffiti. Perhaps my expectations of Prague were unreasonably high but I found the city to be dirty and unimpressive.
Old Town Sq. The old Town Square with its bars and street entertainers. The Astronomical clock and the architecture, the buildings were lovely.

A Walking Delight. The Old Town is compact but you need a good map and plenty of time. Just viewing the outsides of buildings is a day in itself. But go inside galleries, churches, the Jewish quarter and many others and you need to build in more time. More restaurants than you can possibly try on one trip. TRIP ADVISOR is very helpful in selecting the restaurants.

Fun area with everything close. The old town is an easy walk and there is something around every corner. Good for shopping or just looking at all of the old architecture. Lots of hidden restaurants in the winding roads so walk and discover.
Beautiful!. Fantastic architecture, beautiful buildings wherever you look, a castle, churches galore, street-side bars and cafes. You have to go!!

Wonderful place. Love the churches, towers, architecture, though it can be very very busy with tourists. The streets and squares are very clean, and there is lots to do and see. Bit over run with tourist shops, and the cafes in the main routes can be more expensive than those just off the popular areas.

The reason one vacations Prague. Let's be honest, The vast majority of tourists are coming to Prague for the historical value. While the outskirts and communist era buildings are interting in their own right, it's more as to see how communism failed in doing anything beyond mediocre here. Our hotel was in the old town about a 5 minute walk form the square. We spent the majority of our time in the square dining and sightseeing. We regularly passed throught the square on the way to the charles bridge and the castle area. If by chance you are not nearby, you should take the time and energy to go visit. Plenty of restaurants and little shops. carriage rides. The clock tower. The cathedral. The old jewish area is a block away. High end shopping towards the river. Street artists. Public shows. etc.

One of the most beautiful places in the world. Stare Mesto is certainly one of the most beautiful and best preserved places in the world. A must see on every European tour. We can suggest doing it with "The naked tour guide".
Historical. Very interesting with wonderful buildings which we liked very much.Visited a great medieval restaurant for lunch

Relaxing in spite of the crowd. We felt simply great wondering around Old town streets. In spite of being always crowded and lively it is still relaxing, and safe. We didn't feel any city rush. Simply walk, enjoy the beauty of old buildings and the colorfulness and shining of Czech glass master pieces in many shops on your path, smell of domestic specialties from restaurants or enjoy the taste of homemade cakes.

You will go. We spent the majority of our time in the Old Town. For me, it was the prettiest part of the city (at least the amount of city that I saw) and with the most historical buildings, restaurants, and shops. In the old town, we saw the Astronomical clock, took a tour of the clock in the old town hall, Jan Hus memorial, 27 crosses memorial, Tyn church, and the Klemntinum. The Charles Bridge is located in the old town and a short walk to the Jewish quarter, so most of the tourist attractions are within walking distance, which is nice. The old town hall has information on walking tours, which I highly recommend. It also has information on any tourist attraction you want to see. Prague is a walking city and one should not be cooped up in a bus. Oh and there is a Thai message parlor in the old town square that was fabulous for our tired and aching feet after a full day of walking!
Must see. Best entertained at your own pace, without the need of guide or organized tour. Make sure you have enough time to peek into all the curiosities of the place.
Breathtaking. Words cannot really describe it. It's straight out of history. Almost reminded me of a Disney movie. I had to keep reminding myself it was real and not part of some theme park.
Busy Old Town. Reputed to be the most beautiful square in Europe and lives up to its reputation. The architecture was stunning and the square lively

Excellent historical trip!. If you are a traveler you cannot miss this stop. You will find that the historical buildings, streets, and bridges have been remarkably well kept to reflect the rich history of this city. Please plan on spending 4 days to adequately tour this city.

Great. Very kozy, we had a great time at the old time square. A lot of restaurants and shops in the area nearby. People playing music, lasershow at night, astronomic clock and not so far to walk to get a tram or bus.

Perfect. If the weather is good this town is so lovely! Walk around the beautiful churches and buildings and feel like 200 years ago. Walk down to the river for good views and enjoy a nice czech beer on one of the terraces on the main square.
Great old city!. Prague Old Town is very historical and interesting. It was not damaged much in WW2. But very busy in the summer, so keep your wallet safe!..

Stunning. this must be one of the most picturesque city centres in the world, packed with architectural gems, shops, bars, eating places.
Very crowded, so get there early in the day.
Nice atmosphere. I believe Prague old town is one of the most romantic area on earth. Though very touristy, the place is still reasonable and charming.

History in Real Life. Old Town is a great way to experience a piece of Czech history in modern times. There is so much to see and take in. Personally enjoy seeing the buildings from the past and the stories behind them. Lots of people around and shops to step in and out of. I would say a negative is that the souveniers more expensive there; however, our helpful tour guide from Sandeman's Free Tours helps to point that out so as to not get taken in.
Fantasy land. It is a wonderful place to get yourself a seat in a cozy side walk café and just take it in. This is a blend of witches, folklore, and religion. You can see and feel it all.

Quaint Little Town Square. At a short walking distance from the Charles Bridge, the old town square is home to the Astronomical Clock, Town hall and a large number of restaurants and bistros making it the perfect place to spend an afternoon, gazing into the nation's rich history. Must visit, while in Prague!

Magical place. Stare Mesto in Prague is one of my favourite places in the world. In April 2012 I spent 2 wks there just ambling the streets, taking photographs, sitting down for a drink, walking some more. It was my 2nd visit here, and yes, I'll go back again. Every metre there is something to see! You need time here;don't be hurried, just soak it all up. It's a not too miss - a destination to add to your bucket list immediately if you haven't been. And time, take your time here.

Always something going on.. Climb the tower of the town hall, see the mechanical parade of the astronomical clock on the hour, sip and beer and watch the tourists parade by. Street performers, activists camped out. Something always happening. And keep close guard of your valuables. The crowds draw pickpockets too. And if you want to visit Charles Bridge, just follow the tour groups. It is easy as anything you can imagine.

Old Town in Historic City Area. Marvelous place to shop or people watch. My husband and I hired a sightseeing rickshaw which was terrific. The driver pedaled part of time and used motorized support at other times. Great city views with narration. Our tour guide was a student of history. Perfect.

Jordanian guest. Very interesting historic square you must see when you visit Prague and it's so beautiful during the night and daytime as well resturant there are nice but so expensive actually its great experience must visited
Lovely Old Square. Lovely Old Square with plenty to see and do. Worth going up the clocktower and seeing the Astronomical clock in action.
Great sights and people watching. Loved the vitality of the area, the old streets and buildings. A bit crowded for my taste and too much graffiti.
Simply beautiful!. Prague is a beautiful city and both during daytime and after dark the Old Town is a magic place! A lot of narrow streets with small shops and a lot of restaurants.

Got to visit. So much history, surrounded by shops and bars and restaurants. So full of life, music and entertainment. Got to be seen. Only minor thing is the amount of tourists, but then you are one of them, so put up with it lol.
Old Town Square. Great place to visit, can get a bit busy though.Lots of tradional Czech bars and restaurants in this area.
Staro mesto - heart of Prague. Vivid city center with many attractions, cafes, restaurants and pubs offering wide selection of local beers..

Old Town district. Safe feeling and clean. Nice atmosphere with lots of food options. Very busy with tourists. Watch out for the segways and segway tours that are everywhere (they are a pain unless you are on one of course). Night time in the square was great with street performers to keep you entertained and traditional barbecue ham and crepe stalls.
Beatiful area. A very beatiful area, best in europé and a must when visit Prague. Best time to go there is in October in a early morning.
Wonderful. great architecture, very touristy and often crowded, live music, but a great experience. It is best to visit in the evening.

Great architecture, great tourist spot.. All the stores for your knick-knack needs, Bohemian Crystall and Czech food you can possibly want. Good street performers. Bring good shoes. Ladies get ready for some serious cobble stone experience.

beautiful place to visit. we loved this section of town for shopping and touring. We did not take a hotel here, and I was not disappointed. The people, food, music, and all the sites are awesome. You must visit
Worth a visit. Lots of lovely buildings . Pubs and restaurants everywhere. Lots of shops and lots to do and see. Quite compact and easy to walk about .

Worth a Visit. Must see areas of old town area are the Jewish Quarter, the town square and the backstreets to Charles Bridge. First, walk the uniquely tree-lined Parizska ("Paris") street, near the Jewish Quarter, and ending up in the town square. The buildings in Jewish Quarter in Prague, known as Josefov or the Prague Jewish Ghetto are part of the best preserved complex of Jewish historical monuments in Europe. Walk to the Old-New Synagogue and the Jewish Town Hall. Highly recommend going inside of the Spanish Synagogue and visiting the Old Jewish Cemetery, with jagged tombstones jutting upward in such a crowded plot. Of course, we had to join the many tourists to watch the Old Town’s Astronomical Clock, built in 1410 and once the envy of all of Europe. Also recommend that you head down Old Town's winding lanes, which were carved out long before cities had rectilinear street grids (a big part of the city's charm). Naturally one must make the obligatory “Stroll Across Charles Bridge, the 600-year-old crown jewel of Czech heritage. IF you return to the square, consider stopping at the Klementinum and other small churches (which we also found quite nice)

This is where to go!. Old town is where the history lives in Prague. This is a vibrant city with much to see and do. There are many vendors and plenty of places to eat and hang out. The epicenter is Wenceslas Square. This makes a great point of reference for walking around Prague. On the subway system just look for the stop marked Staremeska.
Old Town is full of history and culture. A must see for Prague travelers. Shopping, restaurants, people watching, Old Town has something for travelers of all ages.
Amazing Architecture. Lovely to stroll around the old town with the square as a base. Short distance to most things.Markets, shops and various entertainments along the way.
Old town. One of the most beautiful old towns i have ever seen. You should go there and look at the architecture. Its a brilliant idea!!!

So Much To See.... Great shopping and lots of historic buildings including churches, restaurants, clubs, and of course, the legendary Astronomical Clock. Within walking distance of the Charles Bridge and the palace across the river.

Amazing !. Just sit and Enjoy a nice cold beer and watch the crown, music and all the street shows! There is a starbucks around the corner if you are a coffee addict
also watch the old Clock tower ...It is like where all the action is!
Beware of Pickpockets when you are looking up on the tower clock though!

Beautiful square in old town Prague. This square is the heart of old town Prague. You can eat, drink, ride a segway, listen to live music and wait for the moving clock to do it's thing! Great people watching! Not to be missed.

so fun at night, and so easy. Everything in Prague is easy to get to. Stare Mesto is in the dead center of sites, everything within a 20 minutemnwalk at most. The food is often more expensive here, and caters to the tourist, but there are some gems to ferret out. Tourist sites, though, alone can fill 5 days solid! Just go see everything and oogle at the beauty and history!

Excellent, but CROWDED. Old town square is a MUST do. Gorgeous buildings, hundreds of restaurants/cafes, shopping all around, however, there are INSANE amounts of people from breakfast hours through late evening. Great streets performers to watch while grabbing a bite and/or drink.
Worth visiting. There's no chance to miss it!!! Should be seen for sure. Loooots of impressions. Feels like real European city with mediveal and gothic odour

Loads to see and do. Great place to wander - and get lost in! Once you have your bearings though it is a fab place to wander in - loads to see and do - we went to a concert - good shopping and some great bars, markets and restaurants

A must-see in Prague. A huge open square with lots of restaurants and bars, attractive architecture, and the famous astronomical clock. There are far too many tourists but there is a friendly and unthreatening atmosphere.

Beautiful place. It's interesting just to walk around. Like any big European city, it's like a museum. Every few steps there is an interesting piece of history, architecture an art. I recommend taking the time to get to know this place in Prague. We didn't have enough time there and it's a shame.

Great to wonder around. Some interesting gothic architecture but be prepared to force through the crowds. You can see most of the old town in a few hours. I'd avoid the Segway rental agents- we saw some people arguing with them on their return.

Great historical old town area. Enjoyed the historical old town area with many fine buildings & monuments. Plenty of little restaurants to have a meal & rest your feet. The only thing I did not like was the graffiti which spoils the town & city generally. The local authorities need take more pride in their city & clean it up. Other than that, great place to visit.

Beautiful Town. Very vibrant town with multiple attractions including various architectural delights, historcial places, quirky museums, ghost tours, street performers and lots of pubs and restaurants
Romantic stroll. Old town of Prague is a romantic winner. We loved strolling through its tiny streets, old buildings, bridges and enjoying the riverfront.
Spectacular. Just magic both by day and night. The architecture, history, colour and sounds were unforgettable.There were interesting little shops and a great choice of bars and restaurants.
Interesting. It is always interesting to see the buildings and hearing the story about that district. This is going to be the answers to all that I saw.

Crowded. Beautiful building around the area but always many many people and crowded if you want to take a good picture you might have to come early in the morning. Lots of restaurant and shops around and there are some construction side around when I visited so the feel of old historic charming seem to disperse.

beautiful town. You can easily walk fron New Town to The Old Town Area. Number one attraction is the Astronomical clock in the city centre. Tourists can even go up to its tower using stairs or lifts.
Architecture in the buildings is Marvellous and churches are very richly decorated.
Beautiful. Must see at the evening, it`s really beautiful. the tower bells are ringing every hourly time, you need to see that.
Quaint view into medievil history. So easy to imagine what life must have looked like when you walk around the tiny streets. Buildings have beautiful decor. The history can really come to life.
Beautiful Stare Mesto. What a beautiful area! The view is exceptional and the history fabulous! Seeing the old town and the cemetery was a fascinating!

One of Europe's - if not the world's - most beautiful squares. Touristy but timeless! Restaurants vary in price but it is possible to find some fairly authentic ones with decent prices. In any event, even the more expensive ones are not pricy by British standards!
Old town. Loved it plenty of places to see and restaurants to set and very reasonable shops and a market too stayed in the Jewish quarter in a traditional hotel
The best city center ever. This should be #1 here and not escape games. :P The city center simply breathes life and there so much history and spirit around that it's simply breathtaking.

A busy hub of activity. A busy hub of activity, sometimes too busy, but a nice place to relax and watch the street performers and generally watch life go by. Plenty of places to enjoy something to eat or drink and fantastic historic buildings.

Just lose yourself. Just lose yourself in maze of little streets, go window-shopping, you will find something for youself - history, architecture, art, shopping, food & drinks... something for everyone.
However, crowded - go to Lesser Quarter for more peace...

Very nice place. Such a shame it gets so very busy around the o'clock time.
But having said that I'm very glad we have been here.
You can't visit Prague with out coming here it is as simple as that.

Plenty to see and do. Great atmosphere Praque is a young people's city with a strong cafe culture really enjoyed spending time in Jewish quarter. But most of all the Lobkowicz is fantastic. If you like classical music concert s are every night
Do not expect to do everything it's impossible,pick and plan Just people watching is great
Very Beautiful. This is a wonderful part of town to explore. It is very pretty and full of history, but be warned, it does get very crowded during the day.

Historical and Beautiful. Amazing old houses, gothic churches, the Astrological clock.
A lively street scene with lots of places to eat.

Beautiful Architecture. So much to see. Beautiful buildings , street performers and value for money in all restaurants and bars. Lovely time had by friends and family but we did not stay in the Old Town much after 10.30pm

Interesting. Good way to spend a day! Lots of things going on and brilliant shops all over the place. The houses are very beautiful and so many of them are really old as Prague did not suffer much damage during WW2.

GREAT PLACE. An absolute must in Prague, this very historic and busy sight seeing attraction has a serious sense of history and life at it.
Lots of great restaurants and bars surround it and great for people watching.
No doubt you will find your way here and enjoy a very historic sight in Prague.
Great Italian restaurant opposite clock as well.
Enjoy.
Great but expensive. It's a must for any Prague traveler but restaurants are a bit expensive. Lunch with beer and desert range from 20 to 25 euros.

So much to see and do.. If you love local culture and architecture you much visit this place. Prague is just excellent. A mix of Bohemian style, gothic architecture and modern shopping. A brilliant mix.

Be careful. Don't eat in central old town restaurants they will over charge you.
For example, 1 scoop ice cream 20 crowns 2 scoops.... 45!!!!
Must-see. Favorite part of the square were the views from the top of the old town tower - free to use the elevators and there were no waits when I went.
Awesome Place!. Really enjoyed Old Town Prague, Amazing scenery and rich in tradition and History! We would highly recommend visiting!

Walk around! Engulf yourself in the architecture!. Just walking around the city was amazing! Each building looked like a masterpiece! Look even closer though, there's a massive spider community in the city. Seriously, watch out for spiders! They're a little more obvious at night as you look at the street lights.
fine. i liked it so much, especially shopping really big range of shops and inexpensive i would say. it is have to go place

Authentic. Prague retains its own character and retains its old world charm. Most of the city survived numerous wars with little effect. However, be careful of the food vendors in the main square. They sell food by weight, and try to cram as much of it into a bowl as they possibly can. We stupidly paid $50 for a lunch of ham and halusky. We had a great dinner in a nice restaurant in the old town for less!

Beautiful Unspoilt townscape. Strong Baroque influence and also an impressive Jewish quarter and even a Cubist building. Don't miss the World War 2 tour of the old town. Outstanding presentation and very informative.

One of my favorite places. This is one of the most beautiful, charming and romantic cities I have ever been to. The Old Town is not very big so you can walk everywhere, no need for transportation. Even when it´s raining, it´s beautiful. The town square with the Astronomical Clock is a great place to sit and have a coffee (in winter) or beer (in summer).

Beautiful part of Prague, Czechia. The Old Town of Prague is one of the best prerved places in entire Europe which a magnificient collection of amazing historical buildings, it is not only the main square with the astronomical clock and the Jewish quarter flooded by tourist. I would suggest to explore the more hidden parts away from the main routes like the Agnes monastery, there you can still feel the old, romatic Prague, amazing capital of Czechia
Best view of Prague.. If you can time it right to miss the crowds get ticket for town hall tower next to the astronomical clock for the best views of Prague. You won't be disappointed.

Loved every bit!!!. I fell in love with the city as soon as we came to the river. When you look around, you do feel like you are inside a fairy tale. You feel like the mind is playing tricks on you since every where you look, it feels like someone took a brush and painted a picture. All the pictures are postcard like, and I will most certainly remember those views as long as I live.

Can tour much of old town in three hours. Old Town Square & the Astronomical Clock as well as the Old Jewish Quarter are very interesting. In fact we discovered a free 3 hour tour given by a young Czech man named Filip and offered by a company named Sandmans New Europe which was excellent--only need to tip if your enjoyed it. We thought it was one of thew best tours we ever had.
Prague is like a museum. Walking in Prague is like walking in an outdoor museum, so beautiful. And the Charles Bridge is very romantic at night.

Definetly a place worth visiting. The Oldtown is often bulging under the weight of tourists and there are plenty of shops and restaurants that cater to the crowd. But the Old tower, Tyn Church and Jewish Quarter are worth visiting.

Unmissable gem. If you are still pondering whether or not to visit Prague stop right now. It is a gem. Magnificent architecture in every direction, great shopping, good public transport, excellent cafes and restaurants. Better to go for a week than a weekend, there's so much to see and do. It should be on everyone's bucket list.

Superb. Superb architecture, so many monuments to visit. Count 2 days to explore the most important sites, and don’t miss the municipal house.A few things to be careful with: - the money change: depending on the shop, you get from 960 to 1360 Kr for 50 euros!- The food stand on the central square: they proposed some roasted and potatoes with bacon. It looks cheap, but they cut minimum 400 to 500 g of ham, and the serve for potatoes is 500g. At the end , it cost you the price of a lunch in a good restaurant!
Breathtaking...beautiful. Loved the stonework, cobblestones, richness. The history.The crowds are another story. Would love to be there when all the other tourists aren't.

Worth a visit to Prague. Visit the Old Town on foot, plan on a full day with pauses, use a guide (a booklet, not a guided tour) and do it on your own. Everything is within reach and to be able to do the visit at your own pace adds to the pleasure.The city is beautiful; I dare say that it is even more beautiful than nearby beautiful Vienna or Kraków.Enhance the pleasure with dinner at one of the several good restaurants or ale houses (my advice would be U Fleku; you will need a taxi after all that beer and food, though).

Just what you'd expect. Lots of tourists, tourist traps, and yet, fun. Go see it once, climb the Tower for a high-level view of Prague, have dinner on the rooftop restaurant at the U Prince Hotel (overpriced, okay food), and watch the dance of the clock characters.
wonderful. I love the Prague Old Town, beautiful buildings, wonderful atmosphere. i have been there only once, but i will come back

It's a square.. Busy, bustling centre of Prague with tourists, street vendors, shops, churches, cafés and entertainers. Especially busy on the hour for the striking of the clock, but always atmospheric.Lovely place for a stroll or to sit and watch the world go by. Like any big plazza in Europe, so find it hard why anyone would give it negative reviews.Saw no evidence of pickpockets or scammers, but keep your valuables secure anyway.Only negative point I would give, which is nothing to do with the square really, is the rise and rise of the Segway.They loan them to anyone, and many people I've seen can't control them - especially in a busy city as Prague. Do yourselves a favour and avoid (a possible lawsuit when you run into a group of tourists on one!).

BEAUTIFUL, BUT BUSY. I like the nice old buildings and the large choice of restaurants and bars. I did not like the fact that you had to pay at least double if you wanted to sit on the patio as opposed to indoors.
Majestic. So much history, saw many wonderful buildings. lots of walking but worth exploring. Enjoyed experience.
A beautiful square!. The atmosphere in the Old Town Square is magic! The architecture is exquisite....don't miss the Astronomical Clock when it strikes on the hour.

Busy but still a city to experience. Having returned to Prague after many years I expected it to have become more busy but it was horrendously so, even at the end of the tourist season. But that said it still is a city you must visit and experience, so much to see - naming but a few of Charles pedestrian bridge, bastion powder tower, Prague castle, Wenceslas square, Municipal house, Jewish Ghetto, numerous churches .... avoid eating in the main square areas and head for the food carts on Wencelas square but great food reasonably priced.

If you go to Prague, you MUST go to the old town.. As someone who has been to numerous countries and cities, few live up to their "hype". Prague is one place that defies description. It is an amazingly beautiful city, and the old town will make you grateful for digital photography. Everywhere you turn is another delightful photograph. Enjoy.

Tourists galore.. Tourists galore and I was one of them. The astrological clock is nice to look at but it really does nothing on the hour. Everyone stands at least 20 deep to watch it but only a few figures move around and that's it. Last for about a minute. Pick pocket paradise. The food is so overpriced as is the coffee. The square is lovely it really is and everyone needs to look at it but get out as soon as possible and start heading for the lovely alleys with the ornate fronts on the buildings that lead you to amazing places in prague.

beutifull old bildings. Very nice old squere.
Too many tourist. Local service at center Prague is not good at all. There is a feeling that you are not wellcomed at this town. It is probably good for young peaple?
Awe inspiring. My wife and I really enjoyed Old Town. It has lots of character (and characters), great food, terrific shopping and charm. It's one of the highlights in a city full of highlights.

Bohemian rhapsody. "There are a number of pointed objects in league throughout the skies of the Bohemian capital: the Cathedral pierces the thorax of the heavens with its spires, as does the magnificent belfry of the Old Town Hall, the Powder Tower, the towers of the Týn Church, the Water Towers, the towers of Charles Bridge and a hundred others. It is no accident that Nezval compares the towers in the clear night air to a 'gathering of magicians' The Prague sky recovers from these pinnacle pricks by resting its cheeks on the soft cupolas of the Baroque age, though their marshy emerald conceals an admixture of witchcraft: according to Seifert you can hear the croaking of frogs in the verdigris when the moon rises." (Angelo Maria Ripellino, Magic Prague)We spent a week in Prague, staying in an apartment overlooking the Františkánská Zahrada (Franciscan Garden), close to the Staroměstské náměstí (old town square). The city of the Vltava is, simply, magical - especially at the golden hour, as the sun is going down. Dominated by the Gothic Týnský Chrám (Tyn Church) and the famous, medieval Orloj (the astronomical clock), the Staroměstské náměstí has been Prague’s main market place for more than 1,000 years.A labyrinth of narrow, cobbled streets radiate from the square, where - along with the throng of your fellow tourists - you can get lost in the sheer beauty and almost palpable history of the place. After a day exploring the Staré Město, jump on a bus up to the Letná beer garden for unrivalled views over the town, with its tangle of red roofs and those sky-piercing spires.

Packed with tourists. This area is always buzzing with tourists, BUT avoid the restaurants on this square - bad food, over priced, terrible service and rude waiting staff. Best to find restaurants away from this area....we learnt this after doing some walking & exploring. Also be-careful when using the Money Exchanges, they can rip you off with commissions - so check first what rate they will offer you & commission % charged before exchanging money.....oh, and be prepared for non-existent customer service & rude staff!
Terrific architecture and ambience..... Tons of people which is to be expected. Great activity of street entertainment and seeing the famous clock strike Noon. Really enjoyable.
Too noisy. Too noisy... Too many tourists... Too much drinking...Kafka Museum is the only reason I would go back to old town

Amazing old town square. This place reminded me a little of the Great Place in Brussels, but is much bigger. It is the place you always run into to find your way back to your hotel. The astrological clock tower is amazing, similar to the one in Bern, CH. You also have to see the cathedral at night as the lighting is amazing, especially when it is raining.

Magic City!. Prague is absolutely magic city in day and night ! The scenery and buildings are full of absolutely mind blowing beauty ! Not to be missed! The best is to avoid the crowds on mani walking streets... Go early the the morning to Charles bridge and old city!
A bit touristy - but worth the visit. Get a drink in one of the small restaurants on the square in the evening and people watch! Its worth it after a day of exploration!
architecture, design, atmosphere. I just like it. The varied building styles of many centuries, the folkloristic atmosphere, the world clock, cafees it is all there.

Crowds and more crowds.. ah well. So Many wonderfully preserved historical sites. Great vibrant atmosphere.. Wide range of venues for 'refreshments' and watching the passing parade.. Street performers and segway riders everywhere.. A Must See
Must See. One of the best town squares! Learn about Jan Hus, see the famous clock. Tyn church. Find the 21 crosses and the history of them. Have a drink and people watch. Beautiful restored building.

A Small Old Town. Prague's Old town is wellknown around the world. I think the beauty of Prague is a little bit overrated. The government (or other tourists) is doing a very good marketing efforts for the city. Old town was just like any other old medieval town in Europe. The place is easy to get around because every sqm is dedicated to tourists to spend (mostly cash) in Old Town Prague.
Enjoy a beautiful old city. We particularly enjoyed the parks, Hradcany, wandering around the old town and the Trade Fair Museum
Lovely open square. Lots to see and do as well as the Astronomical Clock - weddings and top politicians with police escort whilst we were there. Plenty of live free entertainment as well
Essential. You must visit the Old Town, but be prepared for hordes of tourists and tourist shops, which do detract from the wonderful architecture. A bit too Disneyland.
nice place. you can see nice view beautiful architecture . it is very pleasant to walk in the there i liked the place

Crowds, views & history. What's not to like. There are views around every corner + food & drink. Lots of other tourists too. Don't miss the square, astronomical clock & Charles bridge. Lots of good restaurants too.

Beautiful Historical Square. Large Square- Great for historical sights, shops & people watching.Visit the Square at night to enjoy well lighted churches and historical sights... Festive Friendly Night Life
Don't under estimate the hourly clock display. Although the display is over in seconds look into the history of the clock and the science etc behind it. It's a real eye opener.
You just... have to go there!. It's the neighborhood with the Old Square Center, which is just the best place in Praha. Lots of places are near that place, or in that place!

A must for all visitors. The main reason most people visit Prague is the Old Town. An absolute must of course and allow a day or two at least to explore everything the old town has to offer. Beautiful pedestrian malls, walking streets and stunning bridges.

Beautiful Buildings but Crowded and a Bit Over-commercial. One can wander the cobbled streets of Prague's old town for hours just gazing at the fabulous 17th and 18th century architecture. Closer to street level, however, the multiplicity of souvenir shops and exchange booths tend to be a bit annoying as do the hordes of other travellers. Best to explore early in the morning.

Something for everyone. History at every step. Restaurants and outside food vendors galore. Reasonable prices. Check opening and closing times yourself as those in travel books not necessarily current. Have a list and work through it. One hour concerts at the various churches are a real treat. (Hesitate and you'll usually get a better price. If it's an organ recital, take a cheap seat as you won't see the organist anyway -they're in the back balcony.) Sit back and enjoy the various street performers. Please tip them. They're good entertainment and make for a great atmosphere. Beer's great.

It is the reason I am there. It is my 4th time in Prague, not because of the people or the food, food is fine and people are usually unfriendly. I was there for the old town. I just love it with its old colourful houses, renting a carriage with horses to tour around old town and this time I tried the Segway tour around the town, it is such a beautiful place and I don't get enough from it
Eastern European foray. Lots to see and do. Interesting history. Better at night!Very busy during the day. Good restaurants off to the side.
The Old Square. This square is very touristy and can become very busy recommend that you go around the back streets to get away from the crowds!
Old world feel. The square is surrounded by churchs and beautiful old buildings,however it is very crowed with tourists, vendors and panhandlers. A must-see in Prague.

The most lively square in Europe. Full of character, I believe it is the most visited square in Europe.There is so much to see, art, history, tradition, the astronomical clock that strikes every hour on the hour, bands playing music, horse carts touring the old town, you feel you are in another era!

Walking tours. My husband and I spent four nights in Prague last month and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. After reading various guide books and internet postings by earlier visitors, I decided to go with the popular recommendation of booking a private guide for walking tours. As we were only at the start of a three week long trip, we decided to take it easy and opted for tours lasting 3 hours each day and used the service for two days. I booked this through Personal Prague Guide. We also booked a car to meet us at the airport when we arrived and the same driver picked us up for our departure flight was very early, at 0530. PPGuide arranged all that and it made life really easy.I was very impressed by their prompt replies and flexibility in tailoring the walks to our requirement. Our guide, Alzbeta was knowledgeable and was able to answer all the questions we threw at her.
Cobbled Sreets. No dislikes . I liked the narrow cobbled streets ,the beautiful restored buildings and the many restaurants andbars .

Beautiful City. The architecture in Prague is gorgeous, there is so much interesting detail everywhere. The Square is a terrific people watching spot, and there are always a great selection of street performers here. A huge crowd gathers in front of the clock at the top of each hour. For the price of a couple of cups of coffee, we enjoyed the clock from the comfort of the cafe across the street in mid-afternoon.
history alive. Prague has seen a lot of history pass through its boundaries and the old town captures the essence of centuries

Amazing. Went with my guide group and it was amazing would like to back again as there is much to see. Be aware for pick pockets though and carry your bag on your front. We where told about this by the company we went with and the coach drivers. That they attach them selves to tourist and enforce you know it your passport/money has gone.
Only place to stay. We researched and found many opinions on where to stay.....hands down...old town...anywhere close to the main square. Small city so never too far away. Old town is where it is at.
Charming touristy and crowded. Could have spent 2-3 days here. Pedestrian only, so many things to explore. Jewish quarter, old town hall tower ascent, churches, and more
Fun shops. A lot of shops to wander, some rip offs. Be careful! Sit at a café for a while. Watch the clock change and the street actors.
Nice spot. Prague Astronomical Clock is worth-visiting. However, it comes lots of tourists in vacation days, making it hard to have a stroll.

must see.. outdoor entertainers excellent, clock great but restuarants in square very overpriced. the church in ghe square is also worth seeing. it has that wow factor as you enter. very different to any other i have seen. spend time in square just to soak up the atmosphere

Perfect city for a long weekend. So many things to do and see. But make time just to stroll and get lost a little. Prague is much more than the castle, the bridge, the clock tower, the river, the churches, the museums, opera houses, art museums, cafes, etc.....
Beautiful but too crowded. Do your homework first, go early and avoid the crowds. It is terrible at midday: you can only look up because it is a sea of people all following someone on a walking tour

Wonderful old world charm. The old town at Prague is a wonderful world of cobbled streets, picturesque churches and buildings and street performers. The crowds can get a bit much during the day but it's worth a visit to soak up the feel of the place. Do have a look at the clock at the change of hour, its not the most spectacular but worth seeing once for sure. Also the narrows streets off the tourist tracks are worth exploring and getting lost in. The church of Our Lady before Tyn is amazing and medieval.
Busy. People gather to see the clock as it strikes the hour. Pretty square but full of tourists and segways and currently the sculpture and st Nicholas church are surrounded by scaffolding (sept14)
THIS IS WHAT YOU CAME FOR. This is the City of Prague. One of the great capitals of Europe now being lovingly restored. Just walk around and see the belle epoch elegance wonderfully preserved.

Soak up bohemian chic!. Prague offers hours of strolling, exploring, shopping and street entertainment in a wonderfully diverse environment, where every street and building seem different. A long weekend did not seem long enough!
wunderfull atmosphere. Interesting buildings, manour houses, cafes and restaurants. Very beautyful is the park of paradies.

The beauty of this area .... it was a great experience and worth the trip. For my kind of traveling you really do not need a lot of days here. If you are into all the museum etc then you will need time. The architecture of this city is memorable
Historical Place. Too many tourists around the square. Nice restaurants, souvenir shops. Nice place to walk around and take photographs. The Clock looks great.

Beautiful. Old town was crowded but not so that it interfered with walking around. The walk to the town and the area it's self is so full of interesting buildings it's worth a long weekend, romantic visit. The astronomical clock is an amazing build dating from the 15th century. The restaurants are pricey, but the hot chocolate is nice to have walking whilst walking around.
modern and the ancient. Its possible to mix modern and ancient. We live by some old traditions. Some of us are prouder than others. Feel a part of Prague and blend into the countryside

Spend some leisurely time here. Walk around, be there for the clock on the hour, enjoy the free entertainment, walk up and town the streets and enjoy some shops. Eat some food you may not have had before. Soak in the history and people watch. Definitely worth your time!

Give it time, soak it in. Love this place!!, recommend to spend some time just to sit there and enjoy the surroundings.
If you're a Starbucks fan, there's a Starbucks here in old town, but I would recommend getting the city mug (if you are a collector) somewhere else as we found the price here actually more expensive (about 50czk) more than some others.
nice. beautiful square! but the restaurant near-by used old prices on menu outside, and higher service fee.

Must see location. Absolutely must see for the architecture all around. Lots of people walking around with the guides. So many sites that I cannot begin to name them all but the astrological clock and the Charles bridge have to be the most seen.
Historic and crowded. Prague would be more charming if fewer of us were there at the same time. The architecture is grand and the buildings in wonderful condition.
BUSY. very busy and full of tourist - was told to becareful of pickpockets! You can find the free tours there. DIdnt eat at the old town as it looks like its for tourist.
Astronomical Clock. Worth a visit, the square is beautiful and the clock magnificent. Get there just before,the hour to see the figures appear as the clock chimes.

Feels like Vegas. This place is so full of history and interesting stuff. Every kind of architecture seems to like the square.
As does what seems like every person in Prague. It is very very touristy to the point of being unattractive.
At night the buildings and square uncannily feel like Being in the shops at the Venetian!

Worth visiting. The town has a lot of interesting buildings and attractions. There are shops everywhere, it being a tourist area, and kept clean and secure. Charles Bridge especially worth a visit.One small warning: the pavements are cobbled and so not smooth, so it is important to wear good shoes with good cushioning. Also, there are places where the cobblestones have disappeared leaving holes in the pavement, so be wary.
Beautiful. A gorgeous place to sit and people watch. So much to see and lovely little winding streets. Worth just walking round and exploring.
Pleasant. A charming place day or night just to watch the world go by. Can get rather crowded though even in September.

a square for all. this is aplace for all so full of history, and people enjoying life, buetiful buildings all around you ,go there and just stand and soak it all in, you will be better for the experiance
A must see. This city is simply beautiful. Not Paris but not too far behind either. the old clock tower is worth a walk up with views superior to Bruges' belfry.

Cheap carnival. Cheap market environment... Trinkets, souvenirs, tee shirts, beggars, snake charmers... Tourist trap for low end. After you have fought the throngs of people on the bridge and seen the clock... Get out of there.
You would love it if you like old town. I do! I enjoyed very much strolling through the narrow streets filled with shops, antiques, cafes and restaurants.
Loved this historic centre!. I loved walking and soaking up the atmosphere in Old Town. There are many shops and restaurants to enjoy in an historic atmosphere.

Old Town experience. This was an amazing place, the clock has to be experienced. The tower and the bridge are breathtaking. We spent most of our time in this area and could have stayed longer. The carriage ride for 60 minutes was the best, and the driver had many tidbits of information for us. We loved this part of the town. Our guide was aknowledgable, and added the details to the visual.
Beautiful. The entire old town is an interesting place, pubs and bars, beautiful buildings, like a maze. NBavigator is a helpful thing there.Not to mention the bridges.
lovely place. Lovely place to see.This part has beautiful historic streets, pleasant atmosphere and good restaurants. I recommend walk there.

Stunning. If you like fantastic old architecture, this is the place for you. The buildings are exquisite yet so varied. It's almost impossible to look anywhere and not see something wonderful. There are memorial plaques on the footpaths, wonderfully ornate doors, old signs marking houses, various coloured buildings abutting each other, the wonderful astronomical clock, a spacious town square, tiny yet interesting lane ways. The list goes on.Well worth a visit.
Touristy as advertised. Although crowded with tourists even on rainy days, we enjoyed the sights of the astronomical clock and wandering the streets.

A great hotel in a great city. The wonderful restaurant; the quiet room; the over the top but lovely decor; the helpful concierge; the wonderful restaurant. I had the best onion soup there I've ever had, in the US or in France.Since I can't get to the items below, I highly recommend the Lobkowicz Museum in the Castle. It is a hidden jewel which is difficult to find. I wouldn't even have known about it if a friend had not told me. The whole castle district was fascinating.I also attended an opera at one of three opera houses, which was beautiful. The opera wasn't well presented, but the official season had not yet started.
Fascinating Squares. Extremely interesting architecture and history. Disadvantage is that Prague is VERY crowded, so it is best to try to do most sights early or late.
Breathtaking. Go up the Clock Tower. It´s one of the best views in the world. It´s worth every cent to go up there and watch the entire city.

Centre of Prague. This square buzzes from early morning to well after midnight.There are places to eat or just drink a beer and watch the world go by, and it does! There are entertainers of all kinds depending on the day. You can get a guide for the free walking tours or some of the other tours which meet by the Astronomical Clock. There are horses and carriages for hire for about 800 ck for 20 minutes. If you want to take a more laid back tour, you can opt for the segway tour, also available from the square.

Lovely old city but BEWARE on the TRAM!!!. Lovely old city of a thousand squires. Retains old world charm with its cobbled streets and older model trams creeping under arches and only just clearing them. When you go up to the Castle, (keep in mind that this is quite a steep climb, something to consider if your mobility is impaired or you have someone in the group whose mobility in impaired) look out for stunning views of the city from several angles. After walking past the Castle (if your lucky you may witness a changing of the Guard( ensure you walk past to St Vitus Cathedral and see the spires from which the darkened Gargoyles peer. The Gothic Architecture with large Gargoyles who have water spouts in their mouths is truly something to behold. This Cathedral is honestly larger than life and you can feel the age and gravitas surrounding it. Most people turn back here but if you proceed further you will come to Golden lane, where on a small corner you find miniscule houses with doors which are dwarf sized. It is said that Kafka lived in one of these houses, although I find it difficult to believe that he wrote such dark pieces living in this beautiful area! The little souvenir shops on the road leading up to the castle are worth a visit. The paintings and the ceramic replicas of the little cottages of Golden Lane were my favouriteSADLY our Prage experience was ruined by what happened on the Tram on our way to Infant Jesus church for Sunday mass. We had bought 4 tickets (with continuous serial numbers which proves all four were bought together) While stamping it for time one ticket had not got the stamp printed on it. Upon getting down at the church we were pounced upon by two persons who were dressed quite shabbily and told us they were ticket inspectors. As we were advised that there were fraudsters in Prague who prey on tourists we were very weary and wanted to meet the Police. They agreed to call the Police but kept threatening us saying that the fine will then be more whilst making a public scene in a crowded area. We were extremely upset and humiliated and our whole trip to Europe and in particular Prague was totally ruined. Some people in the area did say that these inspectors travel incognito. We then tried to speak to them and tell them that we were tourist who had purchased four tickets as demonstrated by the continous serial numbers, and if the print out didnt happen it was not our fault. Also that we had come to mass to church and were leaving onward to Munich so had no local currency left. However these two so called inspectors were extremely rude and aggressive acting in callous disregard of what we were saying. We finally gave in and paid the "fine" but the magic of Prague was lost. Great shame, make sure this doesnt happen to you

What a beautiful city. We strolled for hours through the streets of this historic city, with its Gothic and Renaissance buildings. You must experience it to fully appreciate the beauty. Clean, safe, and lined with tourist shops (perhaps unfortunately), it's a great way to just soak in the culture. And with a concert nearly every day in September, we took full advantage of our time here.

Beautiful, but so Crowded. We loved walking around this beautiful city. Our hotel was ideally located to explore Prague. Crowds were dense and pushy in places. It reminded me of trying to get to the theater in Times Square. I kept missing the famous clock with an elaborate chiming mechanism in the town square. But, on balance, everything you have heard about Prague is true. It is a tourist destination that is not to be missed.

You are in Prague! the best architecture in the world. This is it! this is why you came from all over the world: to admire and contemplate this architecture that survived wars, catastrophes, Communism, Nazism and so many other devastating economic hazards. And yet, the wonderful Czechs managed to love, and keep their buildings for our pleasure. Pay close to attention to all details around you! Renaissance , Gothic, Art Nouveau you name it! I loved the doors, facades and frescos!

Simply beautiful!. It is easy to see why Prague makes so many lists of the World's most beautiful cities. Sit in an open air restaurant,have a meal and a beer and soak up the atmosphere.Take a walk across Charles Bridge and enjoy more of this beautiful city on the other side. Yes is can be packed with tourists through the summer months but there is a good reason for that. Along with Paris and Venice, it is a must see city!

Historic and hip, a wonderful walk. Took a free walking tour of the Old Town. One of the world's best walking towns with history, restaurants, and you can always find a stop for some of the world's best beer. Amazing stories emanate from the Jewish Quarter and views over to the Prague Castle are iconic.

Okay!. The square has some beautiful building in it but it's really just a square with pubs and restaurants, of course you still need to visit it though and on a nice day would be a great people watching place.

Extremely busy & maze like. Very easy to get lost as the streets don't run to a grid, open out into plazas at every turn & some are extremely short, running in between & some not particularly noticeable at all! Main tourist areas are continually packed with large tour groups except perhaps on a Sunday evening. Walking is not something you can do with your brain in neutral or you'll get run down or trip over something as the areas are very uneven. You can almost get overload there is so much to see & will certainly get neck ache looking up at all the spectacular architecture. Traffic moves quite quickly even on tiny back lanes with parking allowed along most roads so there is a need to stay vigilant even when caught up in the whole sightseeing thing.
The Must See For Prague. A lovely area just oozing charm and character.Lots of activity particularly in the evening.Plenty of choice for meals.

Very Interesting. We enjoyed walking through Old Town and viewing the architecture of the old buildings. We found it easy to follow the map and also found people very eager to provide assistance. There were plenty of entertainment provided by the street performers.
Beautiful. Liked everything about the place. Food, shopping, and sight seeing. Safety was evident which is nice to have.
Excelent. The food is excelent, the location is great, the value is affordable. U Prince is next to the old city hall
Past Times. Lovely old feel with great architecture and ambience. The Castle and grounds are a must visit, also the Home brewery.
A lot to do. We have travelled a lot in old town Prague and there are planty of things to see around there, You should go to the Jewish quarter and see all of the synagogs and many shops,

Must spend time here. Obviously every one who comes to Prague will come to Old Town Square but it must be stressed that many hours should be spent here soaking in the vibes and admiring the splendid architecture. Be sure to see the astronomical clock figures on the hour on a couple of occasions. Very important that when one enters the square for the first time they enter via melantichova which is this narrow very typical prague street which then opens up into Old Town Square. Try and have dinner or lunch here, there are a number of lovely restaurants serving wide ranges of cuisines and its lovely just sitting down and watching the world go round in this gem of a square.

Fabulous old town square. You will be among throngs of tourists but this square is truly amazing and worth exploration day and night. At night, given the wonderful lighting, it looks magical. The photos posted give a good idea of the area. Do go see it. The restaurants, despite the tourist flavor, serve pretty good fare. Enjoy!

Amazing square. Beautiful building surrounding the square that give the medieval feeling of Prague. A must visit for any visitor to Prague. Try out the trdelink (sweet cinnamon hand made bread) along the street.

A Beautiful Old Town Prague Area Worth a Visit!. We found the buildings in this area nothing short of stunning. From the cathedrals to the squares, this large area is a great place to explore and people watch. Yes, it does have many tourist trap shops. but that is to be expected where so many tourists congregate. The real beauty in this area is the people and the wonderful architecture. It is also a great place to find a nice street side cafe, enjoy a delicious Czech meal and a good glass of wine, while people watching! Highly recommend and would definitely return!

Is kitsch a Czech word?. The old town has alot to offer in beauty and food. But,there are zones of it though that are so full of store after store of tourist trap crap that leads me to wonder why the city of Prague allows anyone who wants to sell trinkets stink up so many streets. I suggest there should be a permit process and a limit to the number of shops that sell kitschy stuff. Kitsch must be a Czech word. And the hawking and renting of Segways to anyone was annoying and disconcerting when pilotted by the novice near you. However a little extra walking and you can get away from all that and enjoy what Prague residents enjoy.
Old but nice. I liked the old buildings and the Castle unbelievable,I did not like the Graffiti everywhere they see it as an Art form I just dont like it.
A MUST VISIT. incredible area for food and entertainment and scenery prague itself is a BEAUTIFULcountry a MUST see!!!!!!!!

Old Town Square. A true focal point in the old town. Many street artists shops and ancient buildings to explore as well as the Astronomical clock. Many tours depart from here. The square is also kept extremely clean and litter free - a real treat!
Nice city centre. Make sure you watch the clock show on the hour. It's not a long show, so be sure to get your camera ready
Amazing old city. Nice places to walk and to have glass of beer with perfect view. Even in high touristic locations. And really not overpriced.

The most interesting city I've visited. Prague's old town has History in every corner, that's why it's good to have a well informes tour guide to walk you through it because you sometimes are not aware that you're stepping or overlooking important pieces of History.
European holiday. This part of Prague is fantastic lots of shop, and very impressive buildings. Beautiful bohemian glass and wonderful suvoniers
great place. we went to the senate building and we have enjoy it very much it is like a big free museum with many attractions

Great place to wander around in the day. The most beautiful area in Prague, plenty of places to eat and a nice atmosphere to go with the fantastic architecture.
Not so good at night as you are constantly pestered by club promotors, but they can be avoided if you keep your eyes open.

Beautiful buildings. The architecture is stunning, and if you go on a free tour they help you identify signs of what period each building is typically from. Just a beautiful sight, alongside the astronomical clock, just a definite must when visiting Prague. Only down side is the restaurants that surround that area are obviously more pricey than others, so it suggest moving into the streets when looking for somewhere to eat, or researching before hand where you'd like to eat.
Nice place to people watch. It is a good base to explore the city. There is great people watching here, plenty of buskers and a plethora of restaurants and food vendors on site.

Amazing Old Town square in Prague. Old town square in Prague is one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe. You just have to go and see the architectural history, ancient buildings of Romanesque, Baroque and Gothic styles and magnificent churches. Beautiful during all seasons but our favorite is winter time full of charming Christmas markets with all kind of Czech specialities, life Christmas music and relaxing holiday atmosphere.
Nice old town. Great square, with beautiful and well preserved buildings, nice restaurants to eat and great shops to bargain.

Happening place!. This has to be one of the most happening city centres around...people everywhere, activities everywhere, things to see/do evrywhere! Was lucky to see some amazing artists perfom there :)

Most beautiful square we've visited. The old town section of Prague is beautifully restored with many fine restaurants, cafés, gift shops, museums, music venues, and just plain eye-popping architecture. It is alive with happy tourists, street musicians, food and festival-like mood. We like Budapest and krakow, but Prague is so much more developed and restored that it just takes first place.
Well preserved. A brief introduction to Prague and local history. There are some interesting buildings and it's on the main circuit so you really can't miss it. Stuffed with tourists but obligatory.
nice place to visit. old town in Prague is nice place to visit a lot of old biding around you and don't go with high heels :)
Beautiful!. Lovely big large square with wonderful architecture, shops and outdoor cafés. Usually several types of street entertainers.
Beautiful. A beautiful city with great architecture. The heart of the city and the main square is fantastic for people watching, eating and shopping.

Full of characters... Great place!. Beautiful square with full of life and colours. Streets and buildings are awesome. Surrounded by churches, shops, old buildings etc. Stone throw from the Charles Bridge.
I woke up early in the morning. So found the place almost empty. When I came back from Castle, it was full of tourists.

Lively. Loved the hustle and bustle and street musicians. Restaurants excellent and although a little more expensive than back streets not extortionate, London could pick up a few tips. Dinner for 8 with wine and beer £25.00 each
A place where I could feel médiéval myself.... Amazing astronomical clock,a place with animation, cristal boutiques, old cathedral, art galleries...surrounded by old paved narrow streets.

Prague Old Town. Good place to walk, we took a tram to the Castle and enjoyed seeing around it, then walked down and across the river via Charles bridge into the sold at own, beautiful buildings and lots of character!!

Old Town. Its just everything you have read about it plus more.The streets and buildings are from another age.The shops on the streets are so different with a lot of local crafts for sale.The prices are reasonable as well which is another plus factor.
Great place. Old town Square is a great place -it has loads of atmosphere and is always interesting. It is worth travelling up the clock tower to get a fabulous view of Prague
very beautiful place. very beautiful place The hotel is close to everything in Old Town (Stare Mesto). We walked to most sights and others were an easy metro stop away
Funicular a must!. For the best view of the city, take the funicular to the top then walk downhill to the next stop. It's a gentle slope, suitable for elderly, mobile travelers.

Old charm. Very pretty area with lots of places to eat and shops for browsing and presents. Recommend going up the tower for great views across the city. Prices are highest on the square but if you just go down the side streets you will find prices drop considerably.
Charming. A pleasure to walk through... There is so much to see and absorb; with there being no end to the architectural marvels and antique masterpieces. A must-see...
OldTown and surrounding area. Busy but beautiful with lots to see and do. Got lost in the side streets. Some tourist tat but also beautiful genuine goods
Walking Shoes. Bring them!! Great place for restaurants, bars and the usual cafe society sit outs.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Varied Architectural Styles; Be Prepared for Crowds. Many interesting examples of varied architectural styles at every turn, the streets of Old Town are part of what gives Prague it's Old-World charm. There are dozens of shops and restaurants, but you'll also find things like Thai Massage, quirky little museums, fine jewelers, Bohemian crystal, street food, small hotels, buskers, and pubs. The only way to see Old Town is on foot, be prepared for major crowds and cobble stoned streets. There is some vehicle traffic for the small hotels in the area and deliveries to the restaurants. I was out very early one morning as were many others with tripods trying to capture scenes without the seas of humanity. Don't be afraid to explore some of the "back alleys" and side streets in the area - all offer unique perspectives on how the locals live and work in this area.

Get Lost!. Reminiscent of many of the old towns of Europe but this one is quite large and you can truly get lost as you walk through the districts - many lovely shops and tiny museums and music halls along the way. Just pop in where you like and pass the rest. Just bring a map!

Very Much Under-rated!!. We had high expectations for our visit to Stare Mesto but they were exceeded by the astounding mix of architectural styles, cultural pursuits, restaurants and activities.Yes, parts are very touristic, but in a nice way (no pushy touts)! Transport is not a problem into and out of the precinct but the only way to travel in Stare Mesto is on foot - otherwise you could miss too much. Pros: Absolute menagerie of architectures, no shortage of activities, people watching is superb, food is great (and generally cheap), great place to get lost (even the back streets hold interest) and no-one will try to rip you off! Cons: None!We enjoyed our daytime visit that much that we went back for the after-dark shift and enjoyed that even more.Great part of a wonderful city - very much under-rated!!
Crowded. This place is full of tourist, it is recommend to visit this place early in the morning to avoid the crowd for the clock tower.

Old Town Square with Astronomical Clock. This is an extremely nice square with well preserved buildings. The climb to the top of the clock tower is on an easy ramp - there is also an elevator - and the views from the top are spectacular. Unfortunately, it gets very crowded

Fun fun fun. It's fun for American people to see the how people used to live in those days. There were lots of things going on. Music of all kinds and performers of all kinds. Watch out for pickpocketers.

you need a day just to see everything here. Amazing place.Simply put .A lot to see and do.Cafes ,restaurants,Museums .It's all here.I would recommend 1 day just here to see and experience everything Architecture simply a photographers dream.Beware of locals trying to change money.They are a complete pain.

beautiful and musical and interesting. anywhere you look around there is something amazing and beautiful and historical to see. if you can, go too see the clock on sunday or holiday, they also have trumpet playing. also, there is always something happening on the square: live music, piano players, dancers, actors.. we were warned about shoplifters and kept backpacks in front, but didn't notice anything suspicious..
Unmissable if you go to Prague. Great place to visit, its worth taking a trip up the tower in the old town for the views of the city, about £5 each.

Time In A Bottle. Everything you would imagine an "old town" to be....charming, quaint, but full of life. Great shops, especially the marionette stores and plenty of Bohemian crystal. Prague is a major tourist destination so be aware.... it can get crowded.

Absolute historical and cultural fun!. Very beautiful heart of Prague. The old architecture, history and cultural experience cannot be bought with money and must be experienced. Food for every taste, beer in abundance, frienly locals and lots of tourists. A very safe place to be.

The Old Town Circus. The Staromestke Nam. ( Old Town Square ) is just a short walk from the Karluv Most ( Charles Bridge ) and the Vaclavske Nam. ( Wenceslas Square ). All three locations are a passing parade and a circus all rolled into one. Fashions from midieval to cutting edge punk, artists of all media, performance artists and just plain tourists can provide hours of interest for people-watchers. The historical features, such as the famous clock, and the ever-resonating events that these areas have been witness to over the centuries ( finestrations in Staromestke Nam. and the most recent revolution that brought democracy to the Czechs starting with a student march in Vaclavske Nam.) lend a dramatic air to this old city center.
Like a fairytale. The buildings are amazing, loved walking and watching. There are a lot of inexpensive beer bars and restaurants, and the most delicious old-Prague ham.
Very beautiful place. Beautiful Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, nice streets, a lot of tourists, is climatically and wonderfully, I recommend :)
