as we say -"something from a different planet". everybody knows that Prague is a lovely place to visit. first of all, it´s very clean and safe. people are friendly and very helpful. everything is reasonably priced. certainly you will get it, what you paid for. get a good pair of shoes, a lot of walking is waiting for you. forget taxi, take a walk, you won't regret it. have a nice trip.

Old Town is Just That - You Must Walk through it!. It is incredible when you see the old architecture of the buildings as you walk through the old town. It is great if you don't buy anything because things are expensive in the old town, even in the fast food places. I would suggest that you walk around and window shop but eat before or after you walk around the Old Town to save a few bucks. You must go into the town center and take a photo of tyn church, which is synonymous with Prague and watch the astronomical clock, even though it was a disappointment when we saw it at the top of the hour. The energy from all of the people in the square was just electrofying. There are also quite a number of tourists on the segway tours so be careful.
Beautiful. It's a very nice center of the city with lots of souvenir shops, restaurants and you fill like you are in a fairytale, it's soo amazing lived the streets and the buildings. Must see!

Excellent walks. To walk around the old town is just unbelievable the views of the buildings and the architecture is something else you can just let the history of the old town seep into your thoughts

So beautiful, worth a visit!. Prague is definitely one of the most stunning places I've ever visited! The old town and the square are both beautiful and definitely should be visited by people in their lifetime. Just prepare yourself to be approached by people trying to sell you bar crawls if you're quite young and also, if you plan to eat or drink in Prague, the nearer the square you are, the more expensive it will be!
amazing architecture. there are a lot of things to see in the Old Town area, and a mixture of Architecture spanning 1000 years. Lots of fun shopping
Prague is Glorious!. Since the city hasn't been bombarded during WW2, it is very well conserved. It's easy to wlak from one attraction to another. The history is quite amazing.
Old Europe. Amazing architecture. We were there at Christmas time and loved all of the town squares. Wonderful food and shopping, easy to get around
Beautiful. The whole region around is very beautiful, really worth walking around and discovering it. Small streets, the castle, everything is so amazing.

One of the most interesting spots in Europe. This has many similarities to St Mark's Square in Venice. The striking of the clock draws a huge crowd at noon. There are plenty of places to sir and enjoy a Czech beer.

Beautiful Old Buildings. I like visiting Prague because of its old buildings and breweries. You may compare it to Old Towns in Vienna or Budapest. Beautiful experience to walk hours and hours through Old Town of Prague. Highly recommend it.
Great to explore but very busy on weekends. Great old buildings , very busy on weekends , a lot nicer when you have more space during the week when the crowds have gone.
Walk around and explore.. There are often crowds in front of the astronomical clock. If you want to avoid this, just try it during a non peak time such as just after breakfast for late at night.

Beautiful square. The square is always filled with music and entertainment, in a nice way. The restaurants on the square are a bit on the expensive side (and too many tourists), however, in the vicinity of the square are many nice restaurants.

Always wonderful!. I love the energy of Old Town, the cafe's and the churches. It is always a bit crowded but that adds to that energy. The trips up to the tower and inside the churches as well as the beautiful buildings are worth the trip.

Gothic fairytale delight. Gothic architecture make the Old Town unique. There are details on each road for those with an eye for it. Beautiful in the day and evening, and wonderfully preserved. A delight to take photos around the Old Town, and fun walking the cobbles for any history lover.

Where does one start?. There is so much to see here, you can get a crink in your neck just from looking at the buildings. Lots of cafes and restaurants, though it is better to ask a local to avoid the tourist traps.

Beautiful old buildings. Enjoy the architecture but be careful. This place attracts a lot of pickpockets (especially around the clock) and tourist traps like high prices on food and drinks. Eat somewhere else a few steps away from the old town square.
Old square. Loved every minute I spent there....fantastic restaurants ...beautiful architecture ...fantastic market
Simply amazing!. I´ll never forget the first look i had when i get to the Old Town, it´s simply beautiful!!! I guess it´s Always crowded, but it Worth a visit.

you need days in the old town. One needs a lot of time to explore the old town with the nice old square, Staromeska Namesti with the famous clocktower, the beautiful Tynje church and Nicholas church and on the square lots of artists. Very crowded in summer!!

By far the most beautiful. Although I have been in several old towns and historical centers in Europe, the Old Town in Prague is by far the most beautiful, despite the obvious difficulties to cope with maintenance and restoration.

What is not to like!. This old city centre is the hub of life here in Prague, not to be missed. The architecture takes you from Gothic, Renaissance to Baroque. You cannot help but be in awe of this place.
explore it. the old neighborhoods are what give Prague its unique character. Just by walking through them, you will immediately fall in love with the city.

Beautiful City Center. Between trams and walking (we mainly did the latter), you'll often start in the Old Town. It's like a step back in time. The buildings that make it up are beautiful - some ancient, some wonderfully art nuvo. You're surrounded by history and beauty.
Lovely Town. Lovely old town, old buildings to visit. Go and visit the Astronomical Clock and see the clock also you can get a chance to go up in the tower too.

The core of Prague. This could be the place where the visit start. Very pleasant walking through Old Town streets up to the Old Square. Many historical buildings full of history to enjoy. A 10 kzc toilet available in front of Tyn temple. The square is unfortunately rich of people that tries to sell you something. Particularly pushing can be the segways renters, while segway users can be dangerous, since the town is frequently very crowded. On the other hand, there are several kind guys who offer free tours of the city in different languages. It is pleasant to sit and enjoy a drink in one of the bar/restaurant facing the old town square.
Elegance surrounds you. Take a stroll around Stare Mesto and feast your eyes on architecture and sights. Be prepared for loads of tourists, but it's worth it!

Beautiful old town. Very intersting with all those squares, buildings etc. There are several architecture styles you can see there. It's always crowded, even if it's rainy. The way from the Charles bridge to the old town has some special atmosphere.
Well worth a visit. Loved it all ! Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !

center of the old town. see and feel the spirit of old times, to be missed.When you're there, you have to reassure and let the spirit felt, invisible floss time.invisible threads that we perform when we get there
Old Town. Outstanding restaurants in every direction. Arguably the most beautiful capital city in Europe, likely the world.
Melange of architectures. You can experience the renaissance buildings along with medieval and gothic architecture all the way to Art Deco and cubist houses.
Old Town Prague. Very very interesting. Very crowded but don't miss it. Access via Charles Bridge is the best route. Very crowded!

Beautiful place that should be on everyone’s itinerary. The best thing to do is to start walking and then loose your way, then try to find your way back through old winding cobbled street. I like it especially during late afternoon and early evening when the street lights are one. This time of the day you get more of a medieval feel. Winding streets, restaurants, coffee shops, boutiques blend with authentic architecture spanning many centuries. Beautiful city that should be on everyone’s itinerary.

Fascinating. You could spend ages wandering round the old town. So much history down every turning. Beautiful architecture. Lots of bars restaurants and shops. Take time to sit in the Old Town Square and watch/listen to the many performers there.

Marvellous. Old town with it's cobbled street, ancient architecture, winding lanes lined with beautiful restaurants and shops will leave a permanent mark in your hearts. Old town square, Archeological clock, powder gate tower, the old town house towers give you the classical medieval feel right in the center of Prague. Visit old town during day as well as during night to get the complete experience.
Old Town Square. Very interesting. Beautiful buildings and plenty of street entertainment going on. The clock itself is worth going to see.

Popular landmark. A busy location with plenty to see - the Astronomical clock, St Nicholas church, Art Gallery, Jan Hus Memorial, Church of Our Lady Before Tyn and lots of restaurants and bars. Price for food and drinks are reasonable. The Square offers a meeting place of people of all ages. Happy and buzzing atmosphere. One of Prague most popular locations.

A Photographers Dream. Fantastic area to slowly stroll around taking in the views and the history. Of course don't miss the square and the astronomical clock. It is of course busy with visitors but you can find quiet spots and quiet places to eat quite easily. Do a bit of research before you set off as there is so much of interest to attempt to take in. There's usually quite a bit of free street entertainment especially during the evening, of which some is quite good, some is average and some is best missed.
beautiful !. full of history and liked it everything about it but passing through the bridges, walking on the old town streets especially !
Beautiful old town. The old town of prague is really nice. Most of the attractions are there. We stayed mostly in the old town 6 days and could have stayed longer.

You could not possibly miss.. It is where you find all historic attractions. It is protected by UNESCO as a World Heritage site. The Old Town Square is where tourists start their tours (by foot or segway). The Astronomical Clock attracts the crowd every hour. St. Nicholas Church and Tyn Church are also there.

Astrological Clock and Stare Mesto. This is one of the most emotional square I ever visit. I suggest you to visit it during the night for the first time and enjoyed the Astrological Clock Ballet. The Tyn Tower is amazing and worth thousends of pictures and Selfie.

Boringggg!!!!. The old city's square is considered one of the most important attraction in the city. I agree that the surrounding is a nice. However, the main element, the clock, doing a strange performance. Maybe in the old days it was exciting, but today, this king of show DOES-NOT-INTERESTING. It doesn't worth the pain of looking up for a few minutes or standing in a crowded place with the danger of being pick pocket. The restaurant in the area is looking like a tourist-trap. Nor me or my husband found it interesting.
Old town, must see, but touristy!. Of course its touristy but some of the culture is lost as a result but equally of course you have to go there, just not my favourite part.

Prague at its best. This is a must see when visiting Prague!! The square looks like something straight from a fairy tale and is great to see both during the day and at night. Take the time to watch the clock at one stage on the hour, it's a cute little show and is typical of some of the quirkiness of Prague, if you take a tour make sure they explain the story behind the clock too. There are a number of excellent street performers who give the area a great atmosphere. The restaurants around the square offer a great opportunity to sit and people watch, however they are expensive and you are more likely to get better food that is cheaper with better service in one of the surrounding streets.

A given on a visit to Prague. Fantastic architecture. Try and go early morning or late evening when there are less tourists about. Take in one of the hour long early evening classical concerts in one of the churches (price is negotiable).

Old town best part. Old town square is definitely the best part of the Prague.It´s like a meeting point for all the tourists, you can watch the Astronomical clocks like everyone comming especially for this. A bit expensive restaurants around but it ´s city centrum like in any other big city in Europe.

Great historic landmark. The old town is always a very busy place filled with tourists from around the world. The historic buildings are in a great condition and there are a lot of restaurants. The astronomical clock can be seen there and the Church of Our Lady before Tyn is nearby. There are also a lot of souvenirs shops. The prices are a little high however both for the food and souvenirs.

beauitful!. a must see! there is so much going on in this area, from the beautiful buildings, to the human statues, the bubble blowers, tour trams, and the lovely street food, you couldnt get bored here!

A must see at night. A beautiful spot for people watching, listening to music, having some wonderful food (especially the street hot dogs!) and just enjoying this magical space. The architecture is amazing, the history is important and being in that space only adds to the joy of being in this beautiful city.

Great place to forget time and just get lost!. This actually is my favorite thing to do in Prague, just walking around and getting lost in these old streets, being surprised where you come out, discovering new coffee shops and restaurants and enjoying streets and buildings which are many hundreds of years old. Also, within a few turns you will be away from the hordes of tourists descending on the Charles Bridge and the Old Town Square. So go there after you have seen the main sites and just enjoy what this old city has to offer.
Pleasant old town. Pretty but very touristy... so expect the usual tourist traps... Nice atmosphere all the same, and pleasant to wonder around the area.
Beautiful with Lots of People. It was absolutely magical during Christmas season, however, the crowds are tremendous, shoulder to shoulder, but I believe it is worth the effort.
old town. great buildings and architecture , some nice coffee shops and interesting events going on all around but it can get VERY busy in the summer with lots of people milling around.

The Old Town is a must. Anyone visiting Prague has to see the Old Town. The history (and hords of turists) just speak for itself and you will see magnificent achitecture as well as small little houses and the downtwn rush. One of the three spots I would reccomend to see in Prague (the others being Castle and the Charles bridge)

Just lovely!!. Great for watching the world go by whilst having coffee or lunch; lots of lovely restaurants and a very pretty area. Having been to Prague in the winter last time we went, there is a big difference around the square, it is very packed in the summer months and it was filled with segways trying to get through the crowds; this was very impractical as the segway tour people offered the hire of these things but I really dont know what benefit people who rented them got from trying to whizz in and out of crowds; in fact one lady ran into the back of my leg as she couldnt drive it properly!!! For me this spoilt the square; they are not needed to get around.
Beautiful part of town. Beautiful part of town at any time of the day. We visited it during afternoon and night time. Busy at all times but very pleasant none the less.
Beautiful. Beautiful place with small paved streets that leads you to ancient buildings and monuments with lot of history. Almost every little street and park has it's own unique style and story.
pretty. What a pretty city. loved to explore. very romantic to walk around. Traditional settings, lanes and street things going on.Many restaurants and tourist just getting on with their trip.

Horribly Crowded. Went here at the end of a 10 day central European vacation, was my least favorite thing in Prague, I loved the rest of the city but old town was an awful experience. Even though it was off-season (September) the place was packed, pretty much standing room only. Everything was crazy expensive ($8 coffees and beers) and everybody was very rude. Went to a money changer that ripped me off, we were later informed by a local that all the old town shops are run by the Russian mob. We went 2 blocks over and sat and had lunch and watched 3 guys trying to chase down somebody who stole a girls purse.Overall the least desirable place I have ever visited.

Need i say more. this town is magical, but I personally loved Lesser town more. It has a town square, we had tea at the u tyna cafe and just looked at the tourists and the baskers in the area. Astronomical clock wasnt the greatest thing, and it had a million tourists near it, other than the charles bridge.

excellent atmosphere.beautiful Swarovski..good food..... your nights there will be realy romantic if you want... it's an enjoyable feeling. only the lack of English understanding was a bit of ahindrance.

Romantic style. Small streets, ancient buildings and a lot of history. This is the Old Town in Prague.For a cultural trip or for a romantic escape in the city, that part is really perfect. A place where you can feel the soul of the city.

Nice buldings and facades but packed with tourists - get there early.. It's an old town with lots of beautiful and old buildings.Just walk around and observe.If you're not into crowds, get there very early as it was getting packed with tourists from 11am (in August)
Beautiful place to get lost. Pretty place to get lost even when there are loads of tourists around! Great smells, sights, and music

Skip it, unless you have lived all your life under a rock. Prague is like a beautiful bride, tall, bellisimo, perfect body but dressed by sex workers in a Bangkok brothel on pat pong street. This is a city of ten thousand souvenirs shops. In 2014, this city reeks of huge tour groups, beggars, homeless people and every inch of land available occupied by cheap trinkets and souvenir shops. If I did not know the average income of Czech people, I would have mistaken their lack of civility to smile due to Botox injections they have taken. English is very much non existent and not understood on the street and cafés. Money grab for use of bathrooms is not only shameful but down right in human. At the Monastery, after paying for my wife and son to go to the rest room, I turned around to find a 70 year old Italian women being harassed by the rest room attendant because she did not have 10 KC (50 cents us). I handed 10 KC to the attendant to let the elderly women pass and go to the restroom. If you have been to any of other places like Paris, Vienna, or Budapest.....Prague will be a waste of time. Even though it is beautiful , the mayor of the city looks like has moved to some other city and left this place open for grabs to anyone who wants to hawk cheap trinkets.
City full o history. Very nice Old Town full of old historic buildings. Enjoy your time in little streets, coffee shops or with traditional czech beer.

The most beautiful square in the World. This is the most beautiful piazza in the planet. It kept me drawing to it. No matter what I did on a specific day in terms of activities, I always ended up back at Old Town Square. I needed to admire that beauty, endlessly. I would spend my life admiring that square, the people, the art, the music, different languages, artists from all over Europe!!A must, to do and see before you die!

Awesome!!! A definite Must-See !!!. Many shops here, with the famous and elegant Na Prikope Street, ruling the subject! It is the "Champs Elysee" of Prague. A night-walk here, could be a romantic & memorable experience. Whilst a day-walk, can make your wallet flirt outrageously with bankruptcy, as it is hosting so many nice and elegant shops. You can even find kiosks there, selling even souvenirs, apart from classic stuff. When you find yourself lucky enough to be in Prague, for God's sake - and your own! - do NOT, by any means, miss a visit to the Old Town!
Make sure to eat the cinnabons. Czech 'cinnabons' that cook on a stick, were delicious! I don't know what they're called. They were in the main square, next to the church.
Great Place to Get Lost. Simply fun to explore the old cobblestone streets. You never know what you are going to discover. Loved the architecture.

Just wander around and be impressed. There is the astrological clock, cafes with great cake, old churches, street performers, and a wonderful ambiance. I've been to many cities in Europe but I love Prague.

Energy levels are high; great place to people watch. I stayed at an airbnb in old town. I highly recommend the area. Wonderful pedestrian friendly areas and lots of people enjoying the area both day and well into the night

Stunning!. Compact, oozing with history, culture and amazing architecture. Facades of buildings were impressive and colourful: each one had a story of its own to tell. Streets were clean considering the volume of tourists.
Really beautiful. Certainly the most beautiful part of Prague. Just be prepared for the hordes of tourists wherever you go.

magical place. a must visit place in Prague... u can t be in Prague and not be in this place all time music playing bands people tourists and guides
don t forget to see at each hour the astronomical clock show

Check it out and keep going. Ok to visit but in all honesty is similar to squares in other parts of Europe. You need to be careful with the pricey cafes around the square as some will sting you with hidden mystery costs at the bottom of their accounts.
Charming. Prague is an amazing city and the old town is equally amazing. We enjoyed one of the free walking tours and it was great
Fun to walk and take in the sights.. Lots to see here. People seem to be enjoying themselves just wandering around. Many restaurants, old buildings and shopping.

Just beautiful!. Area that looks like came out of some rare painting.
Very clean streets, colourful buildings and rich history.
Worth visit at night as well! (Don't miss it)
A must!. This was well worth a visit to see the Christmas markets , have a mulled wine and wander around the old town. Lots to see, do and eat1
Lovely Buildings. Lots of fine buildings to admire. Loads of attractions. Food and drink are a bargain! Will keep you occupied for hours as you wander the alleys and side streets.

Old Town not so old. The area was demolished and rebuilt in the old town motif about 10 years ago. There are many shops and lots to see,
but quite tourist-ty and overpriced.

Lovely Prague. Don't like so many people on Charles Bridge and the streets towards the Staromestske Namesti .also the food in the countryside is so much better,even that there are some gems to be found...and too many souvenirs shops.Love the architecture and the views across the river both sides,great city walks,jazz bands playing ,concerts on offer and more and more people speaking English and being nicer in the shops.Maybe finally,they are leaving their old system behind...

plenty to see. This is the place for just wandering round, lots of narrow streets, small squares and plenty of shops, bars etc. In fact you could wander around for a whole day and not see the same thing twice but it is also very difficult to navigate even with a map.... you are never sure where you will end up.

Beautiful buildings. A lovely place with old buildings. Lots of things to see and a medieval settlement of Prague. This is a must go to place when you are visiting Prague. It is vibrating from history and there are so much to see that you can spend hours and hours there.

nice square. Its a lovely place, classic European style. Street performers, segway tours, horse riding and the astronomical clock make it even better. The only thing I disliked was the bad smell. Oh, and beware of pickpockets, you wouldn't want the perfect holiday to be ruined.
Amazing. This is a beautiful old town, the buildings all look the same style the streets are all small cobblestones the atmosphere is electric and the clock is the center of attention.

Best explored in the morning with children. The Old Town is charming and an essential visit but more so in the morning when you can spend time looking at the sites, musicians and souvenirs without being swept up in the crowds. Early evening seemed especially packed with less than salubrious bachelor party revellers.

at times charming, others disgusting. Its a really nice place. Beautiful buildings, nice history, nice music from time to time. What it could do without are the guys at night who bother you to go to their brothels, the pub crawl promoter girls who greet you like little prostitutes, segways and the Russian souvenir shops! Why are their Russian souvenir shops in Prague?? Don't go home with matryoshka dolls or ushanka hats! Its not Czech! The Russians militarily occupied Czechoslovakia for twenty one years and looking at celetna street, you'd think they never went home.
Must see. Historical prague is one of the most beutiful place where you feel history on. It so romantic and when snow is faling it is litle bit more nice :)
Prague is beautiful. Architecture Ease of getting aroundCheap to eat outMany museumsGo out at night to see the sights A great place for walking and sight seeing

really old town. If you like old towns and cities, come here. Then you can walk for days and days and days and you will always find something new, hidden, unexpected. I am doing so for more less 29 years and I do not have enough. Even now i can find some unknown place, building, house, street or cobblestone. Or something else. And if you think you know it all? Then you are wrong! So many changes in those 29 years, new buildings, new restaurants, new shops, new cafés, new bars. And new people. Always new people. I like to travel, but always always I like to be here again.

The best place. I am in love with Prague, these city is the best, very good food, very good beer and it is cheap, I would recomend restaurant U Fleku and Pivovarsky klub :) well you can also eat very expensive :)

Magical Place. You can walk here for a month and still find something new everytime you pass the same place. Try Trdelnik, buy a souvenir at Havelské Tržiště Market, climb Astronomical Clock for beautiful pictures.

Best city I've been to. . I have been in Prague 7 times. It is by far the most beautiful and nicest town in Europe i been in. Far better then Paris Barcelona Madrid Rome etc.. Nice prices and very much to see. The property is very friendly. So if you get a chance to visit prauge. Just do it. The best way to see you're around is a guided segway tour. Fun and easy.

Clean and easy. Town is very clean, alltough there are many many travellers. Thats a big plus. Town is easy to navigate. And if you some how get lost, in restaurants and hotels they speak good english.

Old town. A lovely place to spend hours and people watch. It was very busy and the crowds gather in the 100s to view the Astronomical clock strick on every hour. All cobbled streets so flats are a must!!
A Must See On Any Trip To Prague. This is where all of the "Prague magic" happens. Plan on spending at least the better part of one day exploring the Old Town.
Lovely. When you come there you will see why it is proctected by UNESCO as a place of unique medevial beauty. Must see and enjoy it.
A great place to see on your bus tour.. The city is beautiful and we started our bus tour in this area. It is by the river and you must look at all the beautiful bridges
Cozy area, a must see!. Very beautiful area, nice buildings and cozy streets to walk around. The city is so pleasant. Must visit the clock tower.

beautiful buildings but packed with people. Lively place with great archeticture. lots of restraunts, souvenier shops, churches, astronmical clock... You can spend hours here visiting the sights, eating, & people watching It is clean and safe but be aware of pickpockets by the clock Definetly a must while in Prague
Awesome. What a square people watching at its best. Over 1000 people jammed in to see the clock. It rings an then they all disperse at once. Lits of great people watching
The old Prague. We enjoyed the old town of Prague. The buildings were magnificent and there is a lot to see. Great memories for us!
Busy with tourists but, a Must see. Nice old town style with nice cafes , restaurants and souvenir shops and narrow allies to walk through where you can escape the croud.

Classic medieval old town. The old town of Prague is an easy place to explore on foot. Cars are reduced to a minimum in the narrow cobbled streets. You could start a short walking tour at the Powder Gate, the eastern boundary to the old town. For 90czk you can go up the tower for a view over the old town. Continue down Celetná St which was once a royal coronation route. Today it is full of crystal glass shops and takes you directly to the Old Town Square. Overlooking the square is the fairy tale Tyn Church with it's twin spires. On the opposite side is the town hall and the famous Astronomical Clock which puts on a mechanical performance every hour. Leave the square via Karlova St which will take you to Charles Bridge. You can get to the Jewish quarter if you exit the square via exclusive Parizská St.
Excellent. Old Town is lovely. Has beautiful buildings and the square is nice to have a drink in and watch the buskers play music, dance etc.
Stunning!. A great great place to visit. Full of life during both day and night! Every single architectonic detail works towards Prague's magnificence!
Old Town. Great square for fun, but too many people. Felt safe, but watch your valuables. Great place to rent a segway and wee the sights around the city.

Packed in like Disney!. If you're looking for where everyone is, and if you're looking for something to do a 360 degrees around you, hit up the Old Town Square! To me, it really felt like being at Disney---thick crowds and beautiful buiildings. There are (overpriced) restaurants, plenty of gelato stands, Souvenir stores, and historical sights to see. You'll want to make sure and go up in the Astronomical Clock, the view is awesome! Just ask the ticket taker how long the line (queue) is right then, and maybe go back in the afternoon for a shorter line. Hotel U is great; go up in the rooftop terrace if possible. There are lots of street performers here...yay! This place is PACKED OUT but there's a reason for it!
A must. many things to see. Astronomical clock, memorial monument, galleries, St Nicholas church . Ambience wonderful.can be very crowded during the day go early.

Amazing Location. When you are a traveler this is what you dream of when you arrive to your destination ( well of course if you are interested in culture and history ). Town is wonderful and wherever you look you see something amazing. Lots of cultural heritage, historical values, museums, street performers ( lots of good ones ), street food. Vibe is fantastic. Visit Prague and youll love it.
Old Town. Very picturesque, very popular so sometimes quite crowded, plenty of shops and restaurants catering for all tastes. Possibly too many Crystal glass shops.

A Happenin' Place. The Main Market Square (Rynek) in Old Town is a charming, but vibrant place. It is busy both day and night. It is a beautiful spot with beautiful churches, the ancient town hall tower, the Cloth Hall, with its shopping stalls, and the Underground Rynek, a very interesting museum. My wife and I spent a lot of time in this square during the ten days we were in Krakow -- and we love it!
Like clock work. The astrological clock is a must see. To realize it has been functioning at a high level for 500 years is mind blowing.
Classic Prague. Fun place, especially int the evenings when everyone, it appears, congregates for sightseeing and dining.

A must see..... Very crowded and very touristy, but you must stop by here for a drink and snack and watch all the people. This is truly the heart of Prague and there are some spectacular views of buildings. Restaurants here are average and so many better options just off the square offer much better food and service. The buildings are beautiful and the area is clean and safe to walk around.

Very crowded, very touristy!. If you go in the summer it's very busy with tourists. And typical of most high tourist cities in Europe, the locals peddling their wares to tourists are pushy and you feel bombarded. The restaurants around the square are pricey and the servers unfriendly. Watch for undesirables in this area. Since it's a must see in Prague, walk through take some pictures and walk out!

Stay close to this spot. We were at the Hotel UPrince - you really want to stay in this area - it's close to everything and safe. The square itself is quite unique. I wont go on about the clock and all.... but generally this readlly is the heart of it all and if you had to choose between the various locations, the Stare Mesto would be it!

Energy and beauty. We stayed in the Old Town/Stare Mesto area of Prague and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance. The buildings are beautiful and the market, activity in the Square and wealth of shops and restaurants make it a place to enthrall. We loved the musicians, festivity and people watching! It is necessary, of course, to beware of the usual pickpocket issues in a place where people gather in large numbers and tourists are taking photographs, but we had no problem at any time and cannot wait to return.
Verve. Loved the energy - Noisy and teaming with visitors and locals; alive with great music all the time. SAt times, it gets too crowded

A definite Walk-around. You really shouldn't go to Prague and not at least walk around the Old Town. Quite pretty and has some interesting historical sights. From there you can see the Charles Bridge and the Castle across the way.
Astronomic Clock. it is no much impresive but the legend about it is very interesting , also when you can see an one specific hour how the figures go out and move

Very charming city especially, if you like walking and sightseeing around town.. Had a wonderful time in Old Town. Beautiful buildings and the shopping is quite good. Overall, the city is quite walkable. Lots of musicians and other street performances. Be sure to try some local farmers' markets foods!

Crowded but super impressive.. One of the best I ever been to. Impressive architecture. Open and friendly place. I need to admit that is super crowded but it wasn't disturb me this time at all. Really recommend it. Is so much things to see there.
Very Happening. Yes it's busy with tourists. But a lovely area to eat and people watch. Some great architecture to see.

Beautiful town in Europe. We walked about 20 mins from Red and Blue Design Hotel. Very impressive the old town city. The old look incredibly amazing compare to other city in Europe. Its a must for trourist in Czech Republic but be there early because it is very crowded at day time. There is a lots of pub and bar around the old city. We can walk around old town only 2 - 3 hrs. Sunset at 9.30 pm, begining of Jul. This city is not expensive when comparing other city in Europe. The old city night light is incredible as well.
The center of Prague. Beautiful place to visit. Lots of people and lots of attractions on the same place. Do not miss this place if you visit Prague.

Love Old Town Prague. Visiting Old Town Prague was part of a tour my wife and myself took last year. We have taken many tours to Europe over the past 10 years and this area is one of the greatest places to visit. There is so much to see in this city and the Old Town plus the Charles Bridge stand at the top of our list. We found this area to be extremely busy and there was lots to see. I think we could have spent an entire day. Before we went on this tour, friends were wondering what in God's name we wanted to see in Prague. After visiting this city I would recommend it to anyone, as being one of the top area to see in Europe....
Amazing. An eclectic mix of nationalities seemed to be gathered in this amazing area which is filled with churches, museums, bars, restaurants and so much more.

Gorgeous old city. We were visiting Prague in June. Weather was very good and not too hot. The old city is full of bars and restaurants (be careful, prices may be high because of that). If you look at prices before you seat, you can find quite good ones to rest and to have a paint of beer. It was very crowdy but it was expected from a city like Prague. The most spectacular that you can expect are the building architecture and the astronomical clock

Picturesque city. The old look incredibly amazing compare to other city in Central Europe. Its a must for everyone in Czech Republic. Get off at station call Staromestka on Green line. Theres good exchange booth next to the exit of the station. Be there early because it is very crowded at day time

Open air museum. The old town is really amazing, it's very beautiful and homogeneous, there are very few ugly buildings in between the old ones. Moreover, it's not "dead" like in other cities, but very lively with lots of people and street musicians.

Must see in Prague. You cannot miss it: this is in the heart of this beautiful city. Very touristic but still very enjoyable!First this is where you will be able to view the famous clock. Don't miss a trip up the belfry on top of the clock so you can enjoy a full panoramic view of the city and the whole Old Town Square.Full of restaurants around the square for all tastes - very touristic but you'll be able to enjoy people watching and take in the atmosphere of the plaza.

Its astonishing. I recommend the tour guide old town and jewish quarter in TA city guide app - its a great day tour of the old town. add kafka museum at the end- when you reach charles bridge - and u r all set
Very pretty area. Very busy area but lovely old buildings to look at photograph. Nice to listen to the musicians playing there and sit and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening!

Gorgeous place.. Prague is one of my favourite cities and the Old Town is the best bit. You will suddenly understand where Walt Disney got his inspiration for his fairytale castle. Astonishing, amazing, jaw dropping beautiful architecture. An absolute must if you are nearby.

A must see!. You have to visit the old Town when in Prague. A little tip though, don't eat/drink on the square as you will be ripped off. There are loads of little side roads with great food at half the price - cheap beer = cheap food, but still with a great taste!

I live here and love the vibe. I have an apartment on Parizska (commuting between Zurich and Prague) and love this part of town. The old style vibe mixed with tourists and street vendors make this a genuine alternative to Paris.

Lots to see. Everything is a Maze in Prague. My husband reads one map and I another and eventually we find it. Loved watching the apostles come alive on the hour. As did everyone else. So many beautiful old building. Can visit most churches but they close around 5pm.

Prague's Old Town - A Cultural Treat. If you ever go to Prague, it's a must to take a walk through the Old Town. Here you'll find wonderful architecture, winding alleys with local restaurants, the famous astronomical clock, the also famous Charles Bridge and much more. When your legs are tired of walking, you'll find dozens of nice outdoor restaurants where you can try the local cuisine or just have a beer while watching people passing by. A walk through the Jewish quarters to the Jewish cemetery is also very interesting, and you will often be reminded that Prague was the home of the great writer Franz Kafka.
What makes Prague Prague. This area of Prague is what draws visitors over and over again with its architecturally magnificent buildings and many fine eateries and souvenir shops.

Beautiful city - we will come again. The city is quite stunning, it has a wealth of historic buildings and plenty of choice for eating, drinking, shopping and cultural activities. The city is small and easily walked round, apart from the castle which has a steep climb to it. It is well worth a visit. Sadly it is a popular stag night destination for UK travellers but has so much more to offer. The people are friendly, English is widely spoken and there is enough choice of places to eat and drink to satisfy everyone.
Too crowded. An amazing place with a great atmosphere. Best to go early morning as its busy well into the evening.
Historic. Beautiful.. Beautiful and atmospheric. We did not see any stags, hens or drunkards. Travel Sunday -Weds for a short break, avoid party goers!

Explore facinating Old Town. At the center of Old Town is the City Hall and Tower with the Astronomical Clock. The view from the top of the Tower is incredible, with the Prague Castle complex in the distance, all the red roofs of the surrounding areas of Old Town and a view of the nearby Church of Our Lady before Tyne. A tour of the Town Hall includes the basement of the building which was built as the ground floor in the 14th century. There are many restaurants and opportunities for shopping along the narrow winding streets.

the clock. the clock is quaint and picture worthy but don't waste your time waiting for the famous 'show'. not worth it unless you happen to be there at the time, no pun intended.musicians in the square are worth stopping for. they also sell their CDs. 'Paris' street near Tyn church has as much Gucci, Prada, Armani etc as your plastic desires.
Impressionable!. Beautiful well preserved medieval cobbled streets and squares with a surprise around each corner. The crowded restaurants which led to bad service and mediocre food.
Main attraction is the clock!. I liked everything less some unpleasant waiter on one of the main place's restaurant. We had to insist to be served as we wished.

The old town plaza has such a buzz, morning, noon and night!. We literally spent almost a day just wondering the old town, the restaurants, cafes, ice creams, shops, food stalls, beers, musicians, street artists, money exchangers, designer stores, you name it, they have it. It is lively and full of energy. The Astrological Clock entertains the tourists on the hour. If you have seat in the cafe across from the clock, you will be charged a certain amount of money. It will be better to use local money in the plaza ( or anywhere in the tourist area), the exchange rate used by the merchants were not good at all ( either Euro or dollar). ATM works a lot better, even the hotel exchange rate is better than what the merchant will give you.
Brilliant!. This section of Prague was my favourite. It is very quaint & there is always something happening here. This is where the astronomical clock is also so a good tourist spot! A must see.
Old Town Prague. Scads of character. Loved Wenceslas Square because it isn't. people watch with a pint from the Beer Garden at the Castle end of Charles Bridge.
Beautiful. A pleasure just to walk around. It is beautiful, clean and full of nice shops. It is cozy and feels safe.
4 from Texas. Loved the history and the river cruise old town was very interesting and we just do not have anything like it in Texas. The shopping was wonderful.

Really nice place, but too crowded. Even though it is a large area, we sort of stumbled upon the square through a passage which brought us into a great view of the Astronomical Clock. But around the astronomical clock, you might be harassed by the Segway drivers who want you to join them on a bar crawl.Don't get me wrong, Segways might be a popular mode of transport one day but they've been around for a while now and I haven't seen many outside of this bit of Prague. We didn't go on a bar crawl, but if there's anyone I don't want to go on a bar crawl with, it's some guy who comes racing up to you on his little Segway making other people dodge him on the way.It was also quite hard to explore because of all the crowds and you can't find a proper seat to relax except in bars, but it is definitely worth visiting - you could probably spend a whole day in the square and its surrounding streets.

Nice to stroll around. I was always lost in Old Town no matter how many times I've been there and felt like I never used the same path to reach the bridge. The old town is busy with tourists and souvenir shops and restaurants. But somehow the ambience is really nice. You can always sense the antiquity of Prague from the cobblestone and narrow houses around it. It's really beautiful. Enjoy and don't be afraid to get lost!
Memorable. Loved the architecture of the buildings around the square- I walked around mesmerised in the sheer beauty of it all.

Crowded but beautiful. Last time we were in Prague, July 2003, it didn't feel so crowded. I hope the economy is good there, because everywhere was packed with tourists! Tried to avoid the square as much as possible.

Fun bit of history. Really interesting area, something is always happening. Our second visit, we were caught in a sudden downpour, but it was easy to find shelter and sustenance. The square can be crowded in the summer, so go before 9 am, when the hordes descend.
Nice and famous place. Very historical place, clean and interesting. Must walk from start to end and have to visit local breweries.
Dawn is the best time.... We walked the old town at dawn and it was magical in that Czech light and no crowds, allowing us to admire the buildings, streets, statues, etc in peace

Ahhh Romantic Prague. I stayed a week in Prague's Old Town in a little rental apartment, just a few steps from the Old Town Square, I love, love, love this place, and would go back in a heart beat. The Old Town square is surrounded by beautiful old buildings and of course the Astronomical Clock being one of them. The smell from the roasted pork legs on the spit, the musicians, the different languages of many many tourists, the beautiful shops and restaurants, the cobbled streets en route to Charles Bridge, all makes this place unique and buzzing with activity. And then there are the many bridges spanning the river the main one being Charles bridge of course, I crossed it several times during my stay and never tired of it. This is one country I want to go back to again and again.

Gotta go. This is a beautiful area of Prague. You have to go see the astronomical clock do its special routine on the hour. There are lots of opportunities to people watch, eat, or just to walk around. There is also a visitors center that is a pretty good size next to the Cartier.

Beautiful. The Old Town Square was absolutely gorgeous & clean with people hanging around doing performances, drinking, shopping & eating. I also felt very safe of my belongings & not under threat of being mugged like most European City's. The Clock tower is amazing.
magical. every corner of this area is picture perfect, i love European architecture so this place is the best
Old Town Square. Historical sites are mostly found at the Old town & Prague Castle is a mere hike after Charles Bridge

Walked for miles!. Prague on foot with a really good guide is what I would recommend - I cannot remember the name of the company, but they have red umbrellas and my guide's name is Filip - he was entertaining, and extremely knowledgable - tour was free - they get tips only and he certainly deserved his money.

Living History. This is where the time stood still and history talks to you on every corner. Do not rush, walk slowly, look up and you will enjoy the experience. Indeed there is a sign on the Old Town Square showing a house where Albert Einstein played violin to his friends when teaching at the old Charles University...and that is a new sign...the others are hundreds of years older.

Lovely day out. Coming back to Prague after many years was lovely as the town is as beautiful as ever. Really disappointed that everything one wants to visit is charged for. There is not one thing which can be done for free apart from walking around and looking. I really appreciate living in London and having so many opportunities for free.

Great Tour from Benjamin Tours. The old Town is a must to visit for the first time traveler. Karolina of Benjamin Tours of Prague showed us the "Real Prague" during our five day stay. Karolina was excellent.The old Town beams History every where you look.

beautiful but overcrowded. The Old Town is lovely, but in the past 15-20 years it has become grossly overcrowded, much 'tat' being on sale, and one is jostled almost constantly, whilst hen and stag parties attempt, quite often successfully, to plumb the depths. Strike off into side streets, many having buidlnig worth seeing.

Very nice. it is a nice place to visit,there are plenty thing to visit,the square,the church,the streets,the little venice,the little bridge with all the love locks,for the couples,the peolple are very nice and they can understand some english

Very nice, but a lot of people. Prague is one from the nicest european town. There is the big concentracion of time-honoured monuments on the small place. It means for Old Town, Prague Castle and so on. But terible traffic and a lot of people too. Don't use a part of private taxi drivers, better is taxi service f.e. AAA and others. In Prague is the range of very good restaurants, but these are not by the monuments. You can see on www.grandrestaurant.cz
amazing days in old town. everything is beautiful, lovely, amazing. You must be there to feel the place and everything around.
Early morning is best. If you want to take your time and enjoy walking the old town do it at 06:30 in the morning. Buy a breakfast fresh from baker and walk the nearly empty streets.

Unique. Archtiecture is like no other city we have visited. Eating out in immediate vicinity of Old Town Square can be expensive but is very good quality. Avoid Kafka coffe house as it is very expensive and the serice is terrible.
Always the place to be in Prague. It is were everything happens. street performers, the clock, sawsage and trdlnik stands are all over the plaza as well as hundreds of people from all over the world.
Very beautiful. This is a very beautiful town, with nice Middle-Age buildings. The only problem - a lot of people. But you cannot do anything with this.

The charming center of all the activities. Old town is a great place to see all the various colors which Prague has to offer. The classic architecture, the eating joints, the music and the overall ambiance. Take a moment and just stand there to soak in the overall environment and you will love it.

Buzzy!. All the activity in and around the square
Proximity to all the major sight seeing opportunities
Good restaurants in the area
Fun. Really enjoyed this wonderful location, elegant and pleasant ourney. I would return as the label is accurate.

A Site To See. Most of the centuries old towns have preserved their original towns. Some have added "New Towns". Prague is not like this. Old Town is its main focus. There are many tours to do on your own or with a group. Walk everywhere if you have a lot of stamina. Wear really comfortable shoes with good soles. Eat off the main square... it's cheaper.
Get here early !. Beautiful & definitely worth a vist, does get very busy.Benn here twice & cant wait to go back again.

Historical Beauty. The square in Prague is absolutely gorgeous and the architecture is unbelievable. It was a short walk from our hotel and we went every day we were there for food and entertainment. It can be quite crowded in spots, but nothing too bad. Prague is such a beautiful city with storybook places. I want to bring my children to Prague to step back in time.
Busy but interesting. Lots of atmosphere and interesting shops, bars and buildings, but too many lines of people following guided tour leaders.

prague castle by night walking tour. Recently took the prague castle by night walking tour,guided by a lovely young lady calledSilvi,she was very informative and great to be with.Worth the priceRecommend
Beautiful but very crowded. The old town centre is really beautiful and has loads of character but, at least in July, is very crowded.

nice but crowded. it is lovely. The architecture of the buildings is wonderful. I found myself looking up all the time and it was magnificent. The only problem is the crowd, so many people everywhere!
Wonderful. Lovely old square, clock very interesting and had to return several times to watch it, spending the intervening time in the nearby chocolate factory, cakes shops and on local walking tours
Great Place. Fab place beautifully preserved watch the clock strike the hour and sit and take a drink on one of the street cafes and soak in the atmosphere, wonderful.

Must see. This is one of the spots in Prague that everyone has to see. Restaurants, shops, etc. The architecture is awesome. This city survived generations of European wars quite well. Truly one of the most beautiful human creations on this planet.

Prague city break. Great vistas tiny cobbled streets lots of history, do the tower on the hill behind the castle ,buy a 72 hour travel ticket and you can use it for trams, buses, metro and the finicular railway that takes you up. We were paying £1.40 for a pint of beer. .

Amazing Atmosphere. Lovely, amazing magical atmosphere. Definitely the place to go. I have never seen such a beautiful atmosphere and nice, old architecture. Go there take a coffee and just watch what's around you.

Prague - a wonder capital. One of the (if not THE) most beautiful cities I have ever visited!
I strongly recommend you take from 3 days and more to visit it..
Heaven!. What else you want to see, when you are in Prague? Just explore every corner of this magnificent place.
Old Town Square. Yes, centrally located, but similar to Bourbon Street in our home town of New Orleans. Tourist Ground Zero!
See during the day - Return at Night. Wonderful vibe with great shops and food all around you. Seeing the local shops will inspire your purchases and avoid the souvenir shops.
Absolutely Beautiful. The best: this mixed environment with baroque and gothic buildings. It´s heterogeneous but does´t loose that esthetic sense.

Scenic and bustling.. Bustling, hordes of people, but don't miss the unique twist on medieval architecture. The best view of the astronomical clock is from a lunch at Olive's, across teh clock, protected from the bustle.

Astronomical Clock. Not to be missed the skeleton on the hour pulls the chain for the 12 apostles to come out in turn.
Its just like a Fairy Tale the old square with the old buildings and statues, and the Gold Madonna overlooking.

world-class must see destination. There is a reason that tourists flock to Prague. This historical city is beautiful and charming, and it miraculously managed to emerge from WWII relatively unscathed. The Old Town is perhaps the most impressive of Prague's several must-see tourist destinations, with its iconic landmarks, and many bars, restaurants, and shops. If you have little time to spend in the city the Old Town is, along with the Mala Strana, the place you must see.

Just ... Beautiful. The Old Town of Prague is full of tight, narrow streets, bars and small shops and the architecture is astonishingly pretty. In a city with such beauty, the Old Town is a real jewel. Staromestske Namesti (Old Town Square) in winter is particularly pretty. Recommended.
gorgeous attraction. The landmarks and architecture of this place is amazing. It's like fairy tale come to life. It's also right in the middle of everything in Prague.
Must-see site. Very touristic but historic site. Watch out for pickpockets and don't be fooled by sweat-talking guides.

Beautiful City Center Square. The city center square of Prague is so beautiful. It is large and spacious with buildings that were untouched during WWll. The astronomer's clock is a must see at least once during the hour on the hour. There are street performers and outdoor cafe's for entertainment.

Great!. The Old Town is a great place to visit with so many things to see and do. Look out for the local bars which are a lot cheaper than the tourist ones near to the main square. You can wander around the Old Town for hours, just watching and visiting nice places.

Stroll the Old Town Square. Get to the the Astronomical Clock about 10 to 15 minutes before the hour to get a nice space. It is quite quick for the Apostles to come out and the show is about 1.5 minutes. The walk up above the square was worth all the steps and fee; great views of the square, Powder Tower, and different streets below. Watch for the parade of Russian couples getting married (that is what the a guide stated) and the street musicians are always out. Great place for people watching, but it does get quite crowded. A stroll through the Old Town and on to the Charles Bridge from the square at night topped the perfect Praha evening.

Magnificent. Old Town (Czech: Staré Město) is a medieval settlement of Prague, Czech Republic. It was separated from the outside by a semi-circular moat and wall, connected to the Vltava at both of its ends. The moat is now covered up by the streets (from north to south-west) Revolučni, Na Příkopě, and Národni—which remain the official boundary of the cadastral district of Old Town. It is now in Praha 1.Soon after the city was expanded in the 14th century by Charles IV with the founding of the New Town, the moat and wall were dismantled.Notable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. Across the river Vltava connected by the Charles Bridge is Malá Strana ("Lesser Quarter"). Josefov is located in the northwest corner of Old Town heading towards the Vltava.

Very crowded, but interesting. Due to the fame of this area, expect crowds. There seem to be plenty of tours in everything from a horse drawn carriage to an antique car, and these may be the best way to see this area, they know where to go, and how to get there. Fascinating side streets and markets.
old town square. A must for all travellers to visit ,nice scenery bustling bars and restaurants plus plenty of shops to choose from

Unbelievably stunning!. A beautiful centre of a gorgeous city. Culturally charming and visually enhancing. It was an amazing place to visit. I have already decided that this is the place to get proposed to!

Totally wonderful..... That's really impressive city. Old and mysterious and so beautiful. U can find here a lot of attractions not only architectural one. The only disadvantage is that this city is always crowded no matter when you arrive summer, winter, spring.... always full. so better be prepared of that. Thats the city which never fall asleep.

Gothic Wonderland. Walking into the square just takes your breath away - so much beautiful architecture and the Astronomical Clock is right there. Stunning. Add to that all of the creativity and street performers and it's a bohemian paradise.
Extremely charming. I liked everything: the astronomic clock, the old town square, the narrow streets, the churches, the artists performing in the streets and squares.
Visually class. The buildings will make you wonder were all the money came from there is so much detail in them, it doesn't represent the bad times Czech Rep has had, it shows the good ones.
amazing. We spent hours walking around the old town in the summer heat. it was just an amazing experience for us.

Buzzing place. The Old Town Square was buzzing and vibrant. Lots to see and reflect upon.The entire place surrounded by restaurants and cafes. On the weekend many kiosks offering specialities like roast pork etc also available. Enjoyed doing the Segway ride and the Vintage Car ride from here. Good options to view the city instead of buses.
Get lost - it's the best!. Walking around the old town is a trip on itself! So much history. We got a 6 hours guided tour, which was great to keep exploring later on
History abounds. Twisting winding streets, interesting stuff everywhere in the old town with plenty of modern shops in the main part of town

Amazingly beautiful. It is breathtakingly beautiful and makes you stop and stare. It really is mind bogglingly how these beautiful buildings were designed and built with minimal equipment all those years ago! We have a lot to learn about architecture
buildings are cool. It's very touristy, and pretty expensive for a snack because of this, but still a must-see for the buildings!

Cobble stones are hard to walk on. The streets wind around and the streets are cobbled stoned.The shops can be tourist traps but the buildings are historically original. Prices for goods can be 50 per cent more expensive than elsewhere however the experience of seeing the medieval streets are amazing. What is around the corner.So if you are going to Prague make the effort. There is a metro stop nearby, so it's easy to get to.
very beautiful. this area is very beautiful, with all the buildings, you can witness a wedding in here.the caffes are nice as well.
Must see. Absolutely stunning. It can get very busy and crowded but it's worth it. There are always street performers that are incredible. Prague has very talented musicians.

Beautiful, with many important landmarks. Worthwhile see it at day and night. This was the first spot we saw of Prague, you get a first glimpse of all the city. The churches around, the Astronomical clock and the market where you can get really good local beer, some creative spiral fried potato chips on a stick. Loved it!

Lovely buildings etc. but very busy!. I visited the Old Town several times during my Prague stay, twice in the daytime and once at night. It really is a beautiful place, the architecture of the surrounding buildings and the clock are all brilliant. However, it is so busy! The first time we went, you couldn't get to the front of the clock, but had to stand quite far back because of the many tour groups hanging around. Even at night, it was very busy, especially in the surrounding streets. If you can put up with pushing and shoving, which you should, then you will be rewarded with brilliant architecture, lovely restaurants and art galleries. Speaking of which, there was a brilliant Tim Burton exhibition at one of the Old Town's galleries.

Tons of interesting shops,cafes and restaurants. Every house tells the story here,truly. Just lift your head and looking at house signs you can enjoy guessing who lived there in times when houses had no numbers.There is plenty to explore,even if you get lost,unfortunately lots of tourists in summer but great place to see if you in Prague.
Enjoy. Just enjoy walking around. Get off the main drag and explore this magical city which is full of surprises around each corner.
Great place to see. Make it a stop while there. There are lots of shops and restaurants. Take in the local food fare too.
Too many tourists. Better to visit in late May or early June. The crowds made it difficult to get around. The Charles Bridge was packed from one end to the other.

A must-see. There's a lot going on here, some is truly weird. The architecture is fascinating and there's just a lot going on. If you're lucky you may learn something listening in on some of the tour guides.

History, character, music!. Old Town in Prague has now become one of my favourite places in the world. Loads of cafés, restaurants, beautiful churches (most with music concerts daily) as well as lots of free entertainment in the square. My favourite was the guy playing keyboard, wearing a gorilla mask, with a sign saying "to buy an engagement ring" propped up next to him.
Old world charm. Loved the old world charm of this area - cobble stone roads, narrow roads, architecture. So many places of interest in this area.

TAKE YOUR TIME. Yes, there are lots of tourists (heck, we were among them!), and yes it is overpriced, but don't let that take away from the pleasure of drinking in the Old Town. Take your time...stroll along...look up...look down and then do it all over again. Every time we went through it we saw something new that we hadn't noticed the first time. This town is centuries old and yet is still here and in such good condition. The buildings are stunningly beautiful, beautifully embellished by art and sculpture and some with lots of colour. Notice the doors...and how 'short' they are compared to how tall we are today. It is an amazing place to enjoy.There is always something going on...buskers, music, horse drawn carriages clip clopping away.Close you eyes and imagine how it was way back when...

Wonderful. Fabulous! The square is lovely with lots of restaurants and quick food, Trdlo (?), to snack on. The clock is beautiful and the view from the top gives a great overview of the city. Lots of street acts as well as horse drawn carriages there. Also walking distance to everything.

Visit Old Town before they add an amusement ride. Visiting Old Town is a must, as that is the only way to see the Old Town Hall, the Astronomical Clock, as well as churches and other structures, dating back to the 13th century. That being said, Old Town has become more like Times Square with the tourists, souvenir shops, cafes, and street performers, than a historical site. The historical beauty is somewhat lost to these elements, so you need to look beyond and see what it looked like centuries ago. I might be kidding about the amusement ride, but you never know as money makes the world go round.

A tourist magnet. Make sure you visit the "old town" as early as possible in the morning. This area is packed by lunchtime. A lot of history and some wonderful buildings and clocks to keep the camera shutter clicking.

Amazing atmosphere, very busy in July. Lots going on, groups playing, people posing as statues, other quirky little entertainments. Site of the astronomical clock where crowds gather on the hour to see the the disciples going round and hear the bugler. Very busy in July.
Beautiful. Prague's Old Town is the loveliest city I've ever seen, and an absolute joy to walk around (even for an Australian who automatically looks the wrong way when crossing roads).
Old Town. Do not plan just , walk the streets , great vibe and atmosphere , architecture and houses , small food places , consider this time of year the weather was great

Magical!. This is a special place! We stayed at a hotel on the square and were lucky enough to experience the Square at various times of day. Peaceful and quiet in the early morning building up to a fun exuberance at night. There is music everywhere, and some very funny, talented street performers. Watch for 'Baby Man'. The cafes do indeed charge a premium, but totally worth it if you dig people watching. Sit on a bench, have a gelato or coffee and exhale...life is good.

Picturesque, but way too touristy. The architecture is stunning, but there is so much touristy stuff that it is hard to focus on the beauty of this neighborhood. Food and beverages are overpriced for the city. It's only worth a short trip.
Full of Life. Old Town is full of life, no matter what time it is. Wherever you turn your head you see something breathtaking.
Surprising views at each corner. one piece of advice : look up. The buildings are all different and very beautiful, allow yourself to walk through curious small passages

Permanent congestion cancel any pleasure. Old Prague has become a WaltDisney attraction: flocks of tourists, invasion of souvenir shops, hotels and pubs. The beauty of the buildings, streets and markets is compromised by commercialism. Late evening or in the morning at sunrise are ideal times to have the joy of discovering a jewel.
Magic can born here. Fully loaded with tourist,sellers and beautiful architectural buildings.Jaw dropping buildings around.Very magical,day or night.

No, this is not Disneyland!. An amazing place that is full of what I refer to as the people of the world should not be missed. This is the heart of the Old Town and it swirls with energy and activity. The buildings are in fabulous condition and have an air of perfection that had my husband comparing it to Disneyland. I had to remind him this was real, not fantasy, and all these buildings have been here for centuries!

One of the best places in the art. You can find bigger old towns or more ancient ones but you will never find a perfect one as Prague old town. It is not huge, but every single centimetre of Prague's one is so amazing that is impossible even to be described. Be ready to live in a dimension of beauty far from ugly things of normal life!

Beautiful. It is really beautiful. Just walking around, being there is so unique. Cobblestone streets…. Cathedrals, castles, beauty all over…. Amazing. Great to be there. There are hundreds and hundreds of tourist from all over the world gathering here to enjoy. Numerous cafes are inviting you to sit down and taste their great coffee, or beer.
Great place. Packed with foreign tourists but great place, a must see for any traveller. I would rate this place as heart and soul of Prague

Beautiful place but too touristy. The Stare mesto is a lovely place- especially the central square is just wonderful. However it is so crowded that you hardly can walk. The crowds and the noise make tiring an experience that otherwise would have been so charming. Also, I m afraid the mass tourism has destroyed the authentic atmospere- I love the medieval, a little mysterious old places with the narrow streets, but the crowds, the shops and the thousands of street musicians, entertainers and beggars make it to lose a big part of the magic. This does not mean that I dont recomend a visit to Prague- but it would have been better to choose an other season, with less tourists.

Lovely old town.. Very crowded in all areas of the town after 9.00am, but worth the crowds, only thing that spoils this place is the graffiti. Pity the council can't clean it off, the Old town hall is worth the trip up the tower for the views, Astronomical Clock lovely on the hour.
Old Town Square is great day or night. Great place to hang out and people watch over a nice meal. Incredible buildings and huge mix of people.

Old Town is Old. Old Town is beautiful and old. We traveled to other old European cities but Prague is unique in that it was not bombed in WWII so the old buildings are preserved. Go to the square and pay to climb the Clock Tower. The view is great up there. I have an etching of Tyn Church and the Clock Tower, that I have had for some time before our trip. Its even more beautiful in person. Only complaint is the cars. Walking the cobble stone streets can be dangerous with cars racing along the old narrow streets.

Beautiful, but much too crowded, and commercialised. Well houses and monuments are beautiful. But it is so crowded, we tried to avoid it.Also - too commercialized: all stores are the same, duplicated. many segway and guided tour - makes it hard to navigate.
Nice. .Must see when in PragueCrowded but many things to see and do.Go up the tower to see the view.The streets are beautiful at night.
Very interesting spot. Took a tour through Old Town with a young and active guide. He was very knowledgable about Kafka, a shared interest, and really brought the town to life.
Fairytale. This place is like for a fairytale. Prague is the most beautiful city I have ever seen. Take time, go to small streets, enjoy square, sit by river. Feel the streets.

People Watching Central. The Old Town is a must-see in Prague. There is lot to see in the area. Aside from the actual square, try to branch out and discover the treasures that wait you on the side streets. There are so many markets, bars, cafe, shops, and galleries to choose from.
Take an Antique car tour. Old Town is quaint. Replica old cars do a 45 minute tour for 1500cz or about $75...reasonable when divided by 6 people and goes where the buses cannot go.

One of the most beautiful places. i liked everything except the pickpockets
just travel around and get lost
you can find great shops as well
Stunning architecture and atmosphere. Lots of amazing buildings and outdoor street life - steeped in history. Little cobbled streets to wander round at will - plus the main squares teeming with life.

Old Town. Very interesting old town. Cobblestone streets - wear comfortable shoes - easily walkable. Take the tourist map from your hotel. Be sure to walk over Charles Bridge, see the Astronomical Clock on the hour, the white Hussite church, the Jewish quarter and cemetery ($15 and well worth it)
Must see with all the main sights of Prague. The main square is beautiful with the Astronomical clock, the church and plenty cafes to watch the world go by.

Old beauty. The most important thing not to miss is when the astronomical clock strikes. This happens every hour, and the figures wil start a little show, that lasts about a minute or two. You will be suprised by the beuty of the houses all around, and you won´t be bored walking around here.

Prague's Old Town is the Heart of Prague. Prague's Old Town is a breathtakingly beautiful part of the city. It is filled with historic building from the Middle Ages to the Twentieth Century. My only warning is that the tourists are thick in high season and the areas around the top tourist sites can be grotesquely commercial. Still, don't let that stop you from coming here.
love the architecture. do not look at the tourists just look up at the buildings. the architecture and paintings on the wall are very interesting.

A wonderland of cobble stones and spires. Rather crowded during the summer but a worthwhile visit non the less. The narrow streets are crammed with interesting stores and timeless arcitechture. An array of different cafes and restaurants are available to sit and relax at while taking in the passing people

Beautiful architecture, lots of tourists from all over the world. Beautiful buildings just like all of Prague. Parts are crowded with tourists, but that's to be expected. Outdoor cafes every hundred yards. Some beggars on the sidewalks, but not a lot of poverty visible in general. Not very much litter. Way too much graffiti scrawled all over the otherwise charming facades. I wonder if that is tolerated because it was one of the few forms of expression during the communist years...?

Something for Everyone. A very popular part of Prague, everything from Jazz bands, cafés, restaurants, carriage rides, food vendors and street entertainers. Wonderful pastel coloured buildings, and of course the Jan Hus Statue, all roads lead to another historic venue in this beautiful city
You can't miss it. If you are in Prague, you would be visiting the old town. One can't really miss it, This is where all the museums and old buildings are. It beautiful.

A Must visit. Loved the old town. The town square has a market with all kinds of food vendors. Very lively and enjoyable. The city itself is very safe and well organized. Many restaurants and activists in the area.
Great for people watching. Lovely buildings all around. Lots going on and several restaurants to choose from in this area. Even visiting it in the evening it felt friendly and safe.

Overall, great atmosphere!. Old Town Square in Prague has a great atmosphere with amazing buildings and good street performers. There is an abundance of restaurants in the area. The place can get very crowded at times, but it is worth visiting when in Prague.
A great Square. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. A great atmosphere here and always so crowded. Also, you can find alot of activities around all the time.

Be very careful at Old Town ATM's. Old Town is terrific, but be aware of a very common tactic by thieves at Old Town ATM's. We were there a few weeks ago and had this happen to us two of four times using an ATM. Being careful we only used ATM's in highly visible locations. On two occasions, just after concluding our withdrawal and turning to walk from the ATM a man was standing in our path holding a roll of money. He then asked if we could make change. We did not, but learned that if you agree, the thief then quickly counts from his roll of money the equivalent of what you hand him. Then he walks away and you learn you either have color copies of Czech money or have been short changed. Hope this makes your trip safer.
Christmas Markets. Praha in Christmas lights, filled with people braving the cold, delicious food, really puts you in the mood for Christmas. Not your usual tourists
What an amazing place. I loved the cobbled streets and square, the many restaurants, souvenir shops...... actually everything.......

Beautiful. This place is stunning in the evenings full of lots of alleyways for adventures.
If you get the chance definitely take the bike tours and see the Jewish quarters
Great atmosphere. Wander around and admire the amazing architecture, take a seat at a cafe and enjoy the cheap beer, be entertained by the crazy street performers or just people watch.

Vibrant town square. Day or night this town square in vibrant. Here you can catch a free walking tour, get a taste of the street food which is delicious, listen to live music, and watch the buildings light-up towards the evening

Pretty old town. Pretty setting in Prague medieval old town. Lots of history and nice cafe bar culture. Found to my detriment frequented by the odd pickpocket so be aware. Next to the Charles Bridge for the essential tourist box to be ticked.
Pretty, interesting, commercial.. The historical and architectural aspects are amazing, but as is usually the case it's also full of modern commercialism. Brilliant if you're into shopping, as well.
Busy town square. Nice place to sit at dusk and watch the town lights come up. On a warm Summer evening, it is jammed with young people milling about.
Classic and relaxing. Romantic Charles Bridge with very affordable shops nearby. Avoid the large restaurants and shops at the main streets (they are much overpriced) and explore the small streets!
Positivity everywhere. Beautiful architecture and lighting with lots of positive energy and happy faces. Do try the Ice cream from one of the stands, yummy!

Beautiful buildings. This area of Prague is fantastically beautiful! The streets are cobblestone, buildings unique, and the shops and restaurants varied and interesting. We enjoyed two days in this area and would return again.

Amazing City. The history, the people and the foods of this city made for a wonderful trip; without breaking budgets and without the normal hassles of European vacations. The beer of the Czech Republic needs no attention added; it is the best in the world! Truly, Prague is a destination that all should visit and I would venture to say that you will fall in love with all the city and people have to offer.
Nice. Part of our Prague trip that must be a part of any Prague trip if only to see the crowds and the astronomical clock.
