Touristy. It is nice to see the old buildings, especially since Prague was one of the few cities that had not been completely destroyed in WW2. Just get ready for tons of tourists. And bring an umbrella. it always rains.
Old Town Prague - quaint and walkable!. What a nice area to visit and tour, easily walkable with hundreds of restaurants and beautiful buildings to look at and take pictures of. Loved it.
A must see!. Full of history, take the walking tour with Adam with the green umbrella! Prague's Old town is well preserved and is very beautiful. Check out the astronomical clock.

very Cosmopoliton. this is a pedestrian area where you can sit at a cafe and watch the world go by The Astrological clock seems to be the meeting place for pictures to be taken and all the newly married couples come here to have pictures taken.
Oldie but goodie!. Just a very interesting and bustling part of the city, with markets and lovely old buildings-heaps of atmosphere

The Largest and Best Old Town in Europe. We visited Prague after Vienna and Budapest. While both are great cities Prague has by far the best Old Town. It is the largest with many fine restaurants and shops. Just across the Charles bridges is Lesser Town, with its own uniqueness. We did not have time to walk the all of old town and certainly would like to return again sometime. I think one could spend a couple of days just exploring all the Old Town and Lesser Town. We were there in the middle of summer and it was packed with people.
Beautiful. Prague has the most beautiful old town I've ever been to. You can walk there for hours and not get bored 'cause there's always something unique.
Lovely buildings. The architecture was lovely and there were street performers during after noon and evening. The food prices here were a bit more than elsewhere.

Great place to chill and people watch. Yes, its a little touristy and a bit more expensive than other parts of town buts thats what you should expect I guess for one of the best places in Prague. We liked to get a beer or coffee and just people watch, its cool just chilling watching the world go by surrounded by fantastic architecture and talented street artists.
Must go see this area. Utterly beautiful, magnificent architecture, way better than any other area for the old spirit of prague.
Old town. it certainly is wrth the visit, but beware of your stuff as it can be very crowded! Do try to walk through all the backstreets with some extra's!
So much fun!. Plan to spend an afternoon just people-watching! There are cafes all around the square and no one hurries you while you have a beer or dessert.

Full of historical architecture.. It's best to have a tour guide - recommend Sandemans for the walking tour and various other tours on offer. Their knowledge is great and they answer any questions you may have.

Historic charm. We only had a few hours to take in sights but we did catch a few sights, fantastic mall and food. So many means of transport to chose from. As we dont have trams back home we chose this novelty and was suprised as no checks if you've paid and no ticket booths anywhere so we took a naughty chance :) I was so glad we spent our small amount of time as the surrounding areas off the town are very run down and I wouldnt feel safe to walk about.
Red roofs,cobblestones,Prada,and Jimmy Choo. Cool, lively, eclectic, hip, and rich combined with history, culture, and architecture. Something for everyone.
somewhere to chill out. Lots going on in this square. Lots of entertainment and outdoor restaurants and lots of side streets to explore.

So much to see in Old Prague!. Old Prague offers a lot to see and do for the tourist. The Prague Card which gives discounts for the transit system, museums and much more. Begin by just walking around the "stare mesto" to gain an appreciation of so much history packed into this old town. From the Astronomical Clock, The Powder Tower, The Charles Bridge and much more there is no shortage of things to see and do. To go beyond the Old Town the tram and subway are close by and easy to use. The Czech language is quite difficult but fortunately most people in the touristy areas understand and speak English. I never had any problems. Also a visit to the Prague Castle is a must and only a short ride on the tram system. I really recommend Old Prague as a destination.
Lots to see and do. So much history and architecture in such a small area, still reasonably priced compared to home too.

the place to see. you have to go there just to have a walk or to take a drink, the small streets are so beautiful...we go there everyday and walk around in this small street where all buildings are in art deco style: so beautiful
lots of architecture. Too crowded in the mornings and early evening especially on Saturday. There is a lot of wonderful architecture to see and a lot of history.
Great, but crowded. It's very nice... very european. If you can walk to it, you're better off to really explore. Very touristy. A lot of cafes.
Get away from the center. When you walk around in the Old Town, Take a walk on the Small stresses. there are less people, A lot to see, cheeper prices. and better atmosphere

'Worth the crowds. Of course it was crowded, but we were part of that crowd!! Take a couple of walking tours. Our guides were wonderful, so knowledgeable and passionate. One problem we encountered when we took the 'Communist 'tour was that we ended up long way from the centre of town and the guide didn't tell us how to make our way back. Still that wasn't a big deal.

The quality of the stores was better than downtown.. Nice little shops and not the hustle of the town square area. Take the small boat for the canal cruise. When visiting the castle, start at the top and walk downhill. it is much easier for us old folks.
Lots to see. A beautiful place to take a stroll there is so much to see you need to wander a few times to take it all in

A Must See but overrun by visitors and crooks. If one is in Prague to sight see you have to visit. The place was so crowded when we visited that we had much difficulty appreciating its architecture and history. We had a very knowledgeable and experienced tool guide. When she warned us that the place was riddled with pickpockets, we felt very threatened and were anxious for the tour to end. I guess I can day I was there but really have no good memories. It is a crowded place where you have to spend your time protecting yourself and your possessions from all the folks who are out to rob you. As another note, one of the members of our group took a bad fall during our tour and was nearly stampeded owing to the crowd. Even more telling, there was not a lot of concern to help her.
the heart of Prague. Wandered around both at night and in the morning of the day of leaving, enjoyed the history and the present of the dynamic city and definitely had impressive memories.

Old Town Square. Likes: architecture, history, food,souvenirs are pricey, got to compare prices.like going early in the morning, not too crowdedDislike: too crowded, street food vendors will try to sell big pieces of ham and will tell you it's the standard size, so you'll pay more, but then they will give locals, small portion. Potatoes and ham is by weight. Meat only taste good with ketchup and mustard, otherwise it's bland.
Awesome riverview. The river and its banks are so beautiful that you can spend the entire day strolling there. However, some of the old structures in the old town need looking after.
wonderful place. I would like to visite this place again, it is wondeful ancient place with architectural masterpieces and and unique style
Old Town. The architecture, history and and shops were great.Most tours were sub standard.some guides were great, but a few were not making it interesting.
Amazing. Amazing place to visit. Impressive details, stained glass windows. I would like to back there one day.

Spend some time here. Great area to walk around, located at the end of a street with high end luxury stores. Lots of vendors for food and crafts. There are also street entertainers and music playing, wonderful atmosphere to spend an evening. Flat cobblestones, easy walking, no hills or steps.
Old Town Square. Brilliant- plenty of stalls to eat at. Entertainment in the form of living statues.Its very high going up the astronomical tower but well worth it...you can take the lift!

Must do. A must do. In particular, avail yourself of a Trdelnik (yeast dough wrapped around a metal spindle, cooked over coals and rolled in crushed sugar, vanilla and almonds. While you're munching on that stand below the astronomical clock - if you're there on the hour or half hour, when the bells sound you'll see the doors open and the procession of the apostles.

Great Experience. The Old Town has a great deal to offer from sitting in the Old Town Square having a leisurely drink to visiting the many Churches and Synagogues to just wandering the small side streets. This area is very walkable
Architectural promiscuity!!. Loads of different styles -all appealing.Try to get a good walking guide.Many,many significant buildings
lovely atmosphere. great place to visit and enjoy the town square the Astronomical clock, the shops and just watching the world go by ,
Beautiful city!. Such a beautiful place - a photographer's dream. I'd say it's the Paris of Eastern Europe, and feels very historic.
Don't miss it!. Such a great place to sit and soak up the atmosphere. Lovely in the daytime - stunning at night when it's all lit up.

Beautiful piece of history. What can I say about Praha. A truly beautiful place, wonderful architecture, history and the city has a great atmosphere and buzz about it. Wonderful restaurants, bars and attractions for all ages.
Nice walk. Nice walk, lots of beautiful buildings, great atmosphere.The only downside is it's quite crowded, esp. with large groups of tourists.
Fascinating city!. Fantastic architect , history, don't forget to look up! As well as around you. There is so much to see you won't be disappointed!
Terrific. We visited during a Friday and Saturday evening. We walked around both nights enjoying the scenery and the people. Perfect. I felt like I was in a movie.

Amazing architecture. Very well preserved Old Town, you will meander through its alleyways and side streets in awe. Many touristy shops does dampen the atmosphere somewhat although your trip will not be complete without purchasing a Czech Garnet for your loved one.
Classic.. This is a giant square with lots of restaurants, inside and out. Great gathering place - central to everything. Fun electric atmosphere.
Great part of town!. Check out this area and you will not be disappointed. Yes, it's touristy but it is pretty cool and different if you ask me!
It's an old town. We walked around a bit. It's great in the winter when there's a festival of sorts going on. Definitely worth a walking through.

Must see if you like art and architecture. Loose yourself in old Prague. Walk around and just take in the grandeur of a great city. From the main squares and the churches to the old Jewish area-- historical.

Wander the streets and soak up the atmosphere of Stare Mesto (Old Town Prague). It easy to wander the streets for hours. There are many cafes, bars and restaurants at which you can have a wee rest, while nibbling some of the local food and people watching. Every street is crammed full of gorgeous old buildings. there are various churches (Old-New Jewish Synagogue for example) and notable buildings as you move around. I recommend starting at the Old Town Square to view the Astronomical Clock and Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn, then walk onto Powder Tower gate and wander up and around Old Town from there.
must go there. if you would like to visit Prague you should pass by old town. There are many place to see & I'm sure that you'll enjoy.
The architecture...the vibe.... Just a beautiful part of the city with a with a marvelous atmosphere! Loved it and cannot wait to visit again.
Old town square. Great architecture and very atmospheric. Full of visitors as usual. Unfortunately, music was far too loud.

Fantasic buildings. The Old Town is of course a "must" when visiting Prague. The atmosphere is special with tourists from all around the world. This is a place just to stroll around and admire all the fantastic old buildings and when tired stop and have a good Czech bier at some of the hundreds of bars and restaurants.
Very interesting and much to see.. A lot of beautiful buildings. Worth going up the clock tower. The views from up there are breath taking!

Prague in the past. Beautiful buildings around every corner, a bustling thoroughfare.The friendly citizens make you feel welcome even when browsing.There are plenty of cafes to while away the time at reasonable prices.

Beautiful Old Town. Beautiful old city, architecture is fantastic. Lots of shopping and plenty to see. There are lots of restaurants to choose from as well as street vendors. The square was a jumping place with lots of activities from musicians to acrobats.
great walk. Enjoyed the walk along the streets and the shops, the little cafes and restaurants. Quaint buildings.

Great architecture. The Old Town is a must if you are visiting Prague. With its narrow winding streets opening up into squares the history is all there to see & explore. However the touristy nature of the place & the inexplicable multitude of Thai massage slightly spoilt it for me. Overall a good place to visit but cannot compete with the likes of Florence, etc.

Amazing architecture. One of the best things I enjoyed about Prague was the architecture. Unlike most places with some really nice buildings, here you will find that every building is a nice building. Just walking around the town will be very enjoyable, though the square is where it is most crowded.

Very crowded!. Very nice place, the one of 'must see'. I think that the best time to go is the beginning of fall. I was in May - and it was so crowdy there, lots of turists, it is even so that it is hard to moove! So my advise is to visit Prague during fall.
So much history. We absolutely loved old town. We went back after our tour and had dinner. Very vivacious and a lot of history. Old Town is the place in Prague
Beautifully Preserved City. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities we've visited. Very walkable, very clean, no hassles at all.
What an astonishing place full of history, art and fun. Liked its character, architecture and sense of being so contemporary through her history, And yes this absinth place
I could spend a lifetime here!!. Everything. The Places. The People. The Restaurants. The Music Chambers. The Souvenirs. The convenience of getting there. The Boat Ride on the Vltava

very crowded. too crowded and some real wild people but enchanting at the same time. All the buildings are marvelous. But beware of being cheated in foreign exchange conversion. People are too shrewd and I have seen maximum beggers here compared to any other European cities.

Disneyland in Prague. Was very surprised at how touristy the Town Square is in Prague!
Crowds of people!
Lots of open cafes, gelato stands, a real wood fire pit/grill where you could buy sausage or chicken on a bun....a real medieval feel to the Town Sqare.
thanksgiving in prague. Such a great atmosphere-felt like you were back in time. Great culture. Have to take in all that is offered.
Wonderful. Wonderful place to visit at least once in one's life! I have been wandering there for hours and never felt tired or bored given all what is available and worth seeing in downtown Prague.

A nice place to hang out with the crowd.... This is a nice place to browse shops, look around and feel the ambience of prague. You will have the opportunity to look at the architecture of downtown and also experience different and good food choices.
Brilliant. Brilliant, well recommended. Lots of choice and very popular place to go. We will be sure to be visiting again

Nice and crowded. Nice place to walk around, enjoy your coffee and stare at the crowds! The clock tower is the main attraction and the meeting point for the visitors. I was lucky to visit Prague in Christmas (2011), the main square in the old town was decorated and there were many events throughout the day. Definitely a place worth your time and attention while you are there.

Old Town Square. Most visitors to Prague start their Prague visit at the old town square and rightfully so. The visit to this square sets the pace and enthusiasm to other sites around Prague as most of the sites of Jewish quarter and old town are within walking distance of this square. The entire area can be covered within a day leisurely with plenty of food stalls and cafes to suit all tastes all around. Do not miss the Astronomical clock, Town hall Tower visit, St Nicholas Church and Church of our Lady before Tyn that are within meters of Old Town Square
Sean2013. Wonderful classy and old city. Old city awesome and new very classical. Check out the cathredal in the palace - wonderful|

Annual family visit. This is my country of origin, and like many visitors, I like it for its historical beauty and an unspoiled old town architecture; I just wish that the great churches would be full of worshipers, not only tourists.
Nice place to visit. Old town in Prague its a dream, nothing like walk in the old town and visit old buildings, the views take you to the medieval age.
Very attractive area. Beautiful buildings and cosy alleys. Love all the buskers playing Jazz everywhere and of course there's a lot of tourists, but hey…what are you going to do....
go for a walk in the evening!. It has a stunning view from the bridge . wear comfortable shoes and no heels, as the square is of stone spongy pavements.
An absolute delight. I love Prague's Old Town as it is mostly a vehicle free area and has some lovely shops and kiosks to but nik naks to take home
Great Place to Wander Around. I really enjoy walking around this historic old town. The Old Town Square is the centre of all activity, with street performers and food stalls.

Full of character. Disliked nothing....Loved everything. Wonderful architecture. The cafe's and bars have a great selection of food and drinks. Best to relax and eat when the clock is about to chime....well worth waiting for.

Crowded but fun. Lots to see, despite the crowds and the tour guides it is easy to look at all the attractions. Easy to walk around too. Plenty of shops and bar/restaurants. Charles Bridge, the famous clock, Jewish Quarter.

Each block better than the last. 13th century buildings and architecture to die for. History overwhelms in this fairytale City. The statues and churches and towers go on and on. You can't stop saying wow.

Something for everyone. Great spot for people watching, taking in the beautiful architecture, checking out the shops (rather touristy)...Keep an eye out for boutique museums--Sex Machines Museum, Museum of Communism among others--nestled within. The Astronomical Clock from the 1400s is a must see. Many street musicians and performers, eateries. A fun area!
Lovely Place. This is a very charming, and beautifully maintained area to visit. Much to see, and all within walking distance.
Normal. It is a typical old town with a traditional big square and a number of narrow roads. A lot of historical buildings all around
Beautiful!. This is such a beautiful area. You don't want to miss it. The astronomical clock is a marvel and the architecture is lovely. It is a very lively area.

Atmosphere of medivial ages. This place provides an opportunity for feeling the spirit of old ages. I fell in love with magnificient towers. Walking on Charles Bridge and watching the beautiful river is a must. The statues are also another beauties in the old town.
historic square. antiquities , disliked large crowds. photographic dream and get a feel of history so well preserved.

Perfect for people watching. A lively, fun place with plenty pubs and restaurants. Lovely and clean. Was fab to sit and watch the world go by.
Neg - nothing

The place to stay in Prague. This area is awesome. You can spend hours walking around the old town. We stayed right in the old town square and it was the best place to stay. We could walk everywhere and found lots of great places to eat nearby.

Tourist central for a reason. Easily one of the most beautiful parts of one of the most attractive citys in Europe, there is a reason it feels like every tourist in the Czech republic is standing in the square all trying to take picture of the same sights at the same time, a visit to Prague that doenst include the old square isnt worth making, the choice of place to eat and drink is large although not the cheapest and there is no better place to sit and watch the world go buy, ideal for either day or night.
Interesting. This part of town was lovely, really interesting with museums and lots of interesting places to see. Lots of little restaurants and also bars

Beautiful!! Free tours!!. This is a beautiful place with amazing old buildings. I could not stop photographing them. The best is to walk around the old town on your own or to take a tour. If on a budget, you may use the free tours. they are given in several languages and were there on Sunday. I am unsure if they go every day.
Lots to see - a must. Great architecture, lots of bars but very busy. We attended a wedding at the Old Town Hall and it was fabulous.

There is nothing free in Prague. Prague is a lovely city with lovely buildings and interesting spots;How ever, each touristic spot, museum, place, view, church you have to pay and every where is 10 Euros; More or less....Never in my travels I have seen a country making tourist pay for entering an active church. Other then that the thing that made my trip even more terrible, you go in a restaurant to eat, and you need to pay 2 euro to wash your hands; the best thing is you even have to play in McDonalds and you know you have to wash your hands before eating there.Second, you go to exchange money, believe me use your MASTER CARD better then changing to local money coz the exchange office will literally rob you...if the people on the streets don`t do it firstr?!Really unsafe city, specially round the parks and even in the center of the city you can find people trying to sell you drugs or maybe even sell you a girl or a human heart (didn`t like to ask); The police is 10m from them and they don`t do any thing.You like to have a rest go and enjoy a Czech PUB, and get a BEER (Czech BEER was the only thing that made this trip to Prague not so terrible) ...but if you like to get the beer on your table you need to ask 10 times before they actually bring it to you...the waiter would like to actually e-mail you or slam the glass from your head;After this, there is no need for an other visit.One thing is for sure, its worth seen at least once in your life;

Just Wander!. Wander the streets and soak it all in. The little meandering alleys and lanes, the shops, restaurants etc. Loads to do and see. Old town square, Astronomical clock, towers to climb, food to eat. Make sure you look up. The architecture is divine!
Great place to visit.. To be honest I can't say I disliked anything,but I have to say..anyone going to Prague,Get The Trip Advisor App,we found it invaluable.

Great medieval cluster of buildings. Some classic medieval buildings and astronomical clock around a cobbled square. Good it's pedestrianised, with booths selling roast Prague ham, sausages, potatoes, and of course, beer (pivo).But spoiled somewhat by noisy buskers (who appeared to be Scottish rather than local). Very crowded, have to watch your wallet.
PRAGUE. Interesting old buildings, but very crowded with tourists in July. Go out of season to enjoy it more.

Amazing architectural designs. Amazing architectures. You need a comfortable walking shoes. If you can book a hotel nearby its better. It was packed and so busy when I was here but its still beautiful. A lot of shops for souvenirs and restaurants.
Step Back in Time. Prague is lovely. Having never been bombed during the WWs, it's very well preserved. It's easily walkable. Lots and lots of tourists but immaculately clean.

Worth seen but isn't the best. Is a nice place but isn't the best city in the world. I don't go to the castle yet so neither I can tell if is the best area on Prague but for me that one would be the riverside near the Jewish town. What a view!Is wheelchair friendly and you can eat at a reasonably price.
Incredible!!. I didn't know what to expect of this area but it was so vibrant and filled with so much history and beauty that it will be hard to forget. Everyone should try to visit it at least once.
Fairy Tale City. The most beautiful city I ever visited and probably ever will. loved it so much I want to go back as soon as possible :)

You can walk for hours. This is the area too spend time in in Prague. People watching, eating, small shops old town has it all.
Finish in Wenceslaus square with a sausage from one of the street vendors for a great finish.

Nice. Lovely old square, useful to have a guide with you - we didnt. The clock is especially useful to have a guide for because otherwise its not worth waiting around for. All in all, beautiful old square, lots of history, food around.

Lovely. The churches and buildings are beautiful and the image of the square will stay with me always. Cultural and historical it is one of the best squares that I have visited in Europe. Bonus: eating in the stalls for a quick lunch is so cheap!
Who care if it is touristy?. One of the nicest places to visit - it is touristy for a reason- great Central European historical capital - oozes charm
Atmospheric. Excellent start to our sightseeing. Easy and free access to all attractions. Tourist information available.

Enchanting little slice of Prague. Loved every minute I spent here. Beautiful buildings steeped in history. A magnificent skyline. We were lucky to go on a sunny day. The place was bathed in golden light and everything looked like something out of a fairy tale.
My only regret is that I wish I could have spent more time there.

What can I say?. This is the heart of Prague. Beautiful town center, lovely architecture, great restaurants everywhere. Probably less crowded in Fall and Winter. Summer visitors take note: you have to be able to deal with crowds and people.

Beauty comes first. Lovely to walk through but very busy, especially around the clock.
Lots of animation.
Nice to be in the evening.
Loved it. The weathwe helped make our visit just perfect. Whats crazy is if u walk 50 meters from the market. Its 1/3 of the price compared to price on market, were u can buy almost everything.
Beautiful!. The Old Town is worth visiting several times, the lights at night transport you back to centuries ago and during the day the bustle is intoxicating.

Never disappointing!. What can I say? There really isn't anything to dislike about Old Town Prague. You can walk everywhere, there's always a live music venue, the people are friendly and the views are spectacular - both for people-watching and for the architecture!

Free tour. Very informative guide and handsome cost is very affordable you pay as much as you think is wort it . I paid 200 korun . He will give you suggestion what to do next. You will see the amazing places.

so many historic things. The churches, the exterior of buildings. The utilized spaces. Its awesome to think that buildings can stand that long . The energy of people even though a lot of them were tourists.

Good.. Beautiful place to visit. Though there are many tourists there, the lines get big and you have to wait sometimes.
The place itself is fantastic. There are several activities to do and many shows happening at the same time. It is a must see in Prague.

Beautiful square full of things to see. The square is surrounded by stunning architecture and contains one of the city's most unique attractions - the astrological clock. The middle of the square is filled with a huge variety of vendors - we had some delicious pastries and sausages. And there are a multitude of impressive street artists - we saw some great acrobats, a pair with a didgeridoo and drums, and many more. And the square is of course surrounded by cafes/restaurants with outdoor seating for you to sit and people watch to your heart's content. A must see if you go to Prague.

Magical, Charming, Interesting. Walking through the old town with no particular purpose is a wonderful experience. The sights, colors, vibrant atmoshpere and endless curiosities make it a great adventure. One of the best old towns in Europe.
Can go back again and again. This is just one of those areas that I don't get tired of going to. It is my third visit, and I am happy just to wander the area and soak in the sights.
Great area, not so good to eat. We loved the history of the town, however the locals do not seem to like tourists, we were chocked with such bad treatment.

Beautiful!. The Old Town was a 10 minute amble from our hotel. With winding alley ways lined with gift shops, small museums, bars and restaurants, you could easliy spend the whole day here. The architecture is stunning and make sure you get to see the old Town Hall clock strike the hour! We spent a long weekend in Prague and it seemed the whole world decided to join us so we shuffled around at a slow pace. Restaurants are aplenty but the menus are pretty much all the same. Shop around though, a neighbouring one is often cheaper.Day and night there are street performers ranging from traditional music to spectacular acrobatics with a touch of comedy thrown in. The atmosphere was amazing, we spent three days quite happily sitting with a drink and people watching after a day's exploring.As with any big town or city, pick pockets are about. Keep your bag close and you have nothing to worry about!

Beautiful Area with Historic Square. The Old Town area is full of historic buildings, nice restaurants/cafes, and the Old Town Square. Beware that the restaurants around the square are much pricier than those a few blocks away. You are just paying for proximity. I'd recommend having a drink there, but not much else. Walk a few blocks further for actual dining.

Something happening round every corner, and SO beautiful.. Full of life, amazing architecture and a real sense of history. Well worth taking time to wander round this fantastic part of a beautiful city.
Beautiful!. It was fun watching the astronomical clock, but always crowded on the hour! There was much to see. The building are very old and beautiful.

Charming and crowded. Noisy, bustling (August) full of old world charm. Old town requires some footwork to get the full flavor. Several "typical Czech" restaurants worth "czecking" out. -- Lokal and U Parlement U.

Lovely old town. Prague is a very pretty cityThe old town is one of the best aroundThe big clock is very interesting Have a good walk aroundBe aware of pickpockets or people trying to get you into rip off strip clubs Good city to visit though
Exciting and romantic city centre. Exciting and romantic city centre. Prague is definitely one of Europe's most beautiful cities! Also great place to stay in the winter, but cold!
Enchanting. A beautiful Medieval town square full of wonderful architecture and a vibrant atmosphere. A must see in Prague
Old Town Square. Must see in Prague, very crowded, artists, musicians, etc..but has its own feeling. You have to visit the tower, too.
A must!. The architecture is amazing, and each building is prettier than the last. Prepare to walk, and enjoy all the window shopping!

Magical place that never gets old. Old Town is beautiful part of Prague filled with visitors from all around the world. Old buildings, churches blended with great restaurants and their different cuisines. Old Town Square, Clock Tower, St. Nikolaus Church, Jan Hus Statue, little streets with this great atmosphere that never leaves. Through the year there are seasonal markets (Christmas Market, Easter Market, Summer Events and much more). Walk! Do not use any form of transportation in downtown. Prague is the Capital and it is big but the historical part is so beautiful that you don't want to miss any of it. Get yourself some treat in Old Town and soak the atmosphere, you can walk any direction (Vltava river, Parizska Street, shopping mall at Namesti Republiky or Vaclavske Sq.) and you will see beauty. What you probably wont see is typical Czech citizens, but for City lovers this is the place to be. History, food, beer, clubs, party, art, Prague and Old Town especially is got it all! I love that place and no matter how many times I have been there and how much time I have spent there, I will be coming back. It is so beautiful that I got married in St. Nicolas Church <3

Best part of Prag. Take the subway to any stop in "old town" get off and start your own private tour. You don't really need a guided tour, because there is way too much to see and if you don't just do it yourself you probably will see too little of too much to be able to remember what you saw. Get a map from your hotel, and spend a few Crowns on a guide book, and read thru it in the evening. You will thank yourself over and over. There are so many places to go it is unbelievable.

Everything lives here!. Everything is beautiful! Walk across all the little streets, see the churches, the lovely random buildings, the concert halls, the little shops (jewellery is overpriced. Little bit a negotiation gets you to around 50% of the original price) and little food shops gives you the real Prague experience. I can do this over and over again! Love it!
Prague Old town Square. The atmosphere was awesome. When the Tyn Church was illuminated at night it was like a magical fairy tale!

Steeped in culture and history. If you know the history of Prague, you can appreciate the city & especially the old town a lot more. It is beautiful, viby, amazing. Good shopping at good prices, interesting food & lots of entertainment.

Beautiful city. There is no way else to describe Prague besides unbelievably beautiful. The old town has to be a stop on anyone's European holiday. It feels like you can't pass a single building without stumbling onto some fascinating piece of history. The only downside is that in summer during the tourist season... anything close to the city center will be absolutely choked with people and very large tour groups. In the middle of the day it was nearly impossible to get through some of the main streets. I stuck to traveling at meal times and in the evening to avoid crowds.
It's Fun. It's the heart of city with hundred spires, very crowded but many things to be enjoyed like lots of food, of course with hundred kinds of their famous beer. Amazing and beautiful place.
Old Town Prague. Beautiful buildings and architecture. Variety of styles and ages as well. Astronomical clock was very interesting. The red trolley on the square gives a good overview.
Old Town Square. If u go to Prague, it's worth the extra $$$ to stay in the Old Town Square. Lots of restaurants and always something entertaining going on in the square.

A must see area!. This was one of our favourite areas since there are an abundance of little streets with bars, restaurants and shops. At night it is buzzing with atmosphere and all the buildings are lit up.

Beautiful bussy romantic place to be. Lots of people walking on the street, cafe shops. restaurants and gift shops. You can see people from around the world which make this trip even more interesting.
Centre of the city. it is quite busy and all roads that lead to this centre seem to be packed. Nonetheless; beautifull and full of history :)

Market vendors. Yes prices are great in Prague so don't waste your valuable vacation time checking each price for the same article. Are you really that concerned about a few pennies? Czech dollars seem overwhelming 10 cheaper here. 15 cheaper there but you're only talking pennies so buy what you like and don't price shop. You're only wasting valuable site seeing time. Have fun and good travels.

Beautiful old Town. Typical place for tourists! One of the most beautiful of Prague. Essential to see for the 1st visit of the city. Best place because its proximity with the other important places of Prague. Typical bars, music bars and old shops close the Old Town that we need to visit.

Well worth a visit. Lovely walk over Charles bridge o the old town, very quaint , lots of street peddlars artists statues, look out or pubs and restaurants away from he hustle and bustle a lot cheaper

Nice Square. Spent 4 days on Prague with my girlfriend and could not miss not one single day that I didnt pass through it. It was in July, so it was crowed. But even with all those people on the street it is really nice.
Walking tour. You need to see everything in Prague...amazing! This is a very beautiful area and wonderful to visit.
Excellent Place. Full of great old monuments and amazing athmosphere with all its music. I wish to come back soon, for more detailed visit.
Beautiful and fun. Many beautiful buildings and architectures to look at . Very crowded but lots of fun . So many things to look at with all kinds of food to sample. It 's a really enjoyable place.

cute but very touristy. I enjoyed walking in old town but it was a bit too touristy for my taste. I have been to Prague many times about ten years ago and it didn't used to be as touristy as it is now. I preferred that peace that the city used to have especially in winter. Now it feels like going to Venice.:-)
A must see location. You can spend the day walking the Old Town. Excellent atmosphere, great restaurants and many sites to take in

Charming. I love the cobbled streets, and old buildings.
I dislike that all streets are not closed to
pedestrians.
Tradition:). Old Town was a great place to go! you can feel the tradition of Prague in the air! Architecture, buildings, streets- its a 'must' when you go to Prague:)
Brings me back to old times. liked the cobbled streets, the old houses/establishments, everything for me was the best experience of my life that made me in love with Prague.

Full of character and history. Old Town square is perfect both during the day and at night to spend some time. During the day you can get a good look at the buildings, and at night time the square comes alive. We went there on each night we stayed. Enjoying a drink whilst live acts performed. A great little spot to get a real Prague experience.

Touristy but still beautiful. The old town is robbed with tourists but if you avoid the main square during lunch and dinner times you only have to walk a few streets away and it becomes more normal. We visited the square early one morning about 7am and it was great, but the astronomical clock does not perform that early. Great just to wander the streets and alleys looking up.

Lovely square. Lovely place to visit, and see all the sights. It is worth sitting at a little inn/café to watch the world go by, and take in the scenery. Make sure you're at the clock on the hour, and watch the chimes. Also, go to the top of it to see the sights around Prague.

Non-touristic parts are much more lovely. I love Old Town, but the most touristic places (Oldtown Square, Charles Bridge etc.) are terribly crowded. I'd recommend not to follow the tourist paths but wonder around and feel the real Old Town.
NICE TO KNOW THERE. it´s a wonderful area to know. full of interesting things. Old buildings but very beautiful. Very safe

outside the tourist spots. Visited here many many times just be prepered to spend a lot money, athought if you take a short walk towards the jewish quarter and away from the tourist bits prices are cheaper,lots of history if thats what you are looking for.

Beautiful buildings. Expensive shops and restaurants. Was lovely to be in Prague and it is a really a beautiful city. The shops and restaurants are, however, even for European standards very expensive. Service is not with a smile and our experience of most of the tourist services were that you being done a favour so just grin and bare it as the local just wanted to get it over and done with. May have been a bit of a disappointment after being to Krakow in Poland.

Worth a visit. Old town is well worth a visit but go early as it is a tourist haven. The clock in the square goes off for 1 minute each hour so don't miss it. The tower is also worth a visit but be there before opening at 11am with your ticket as is very busy.There are also many lovely building surrounding the square but do your eating and shopping away from the square as much cheaper.

Old world Epcot Center. Every building is beautiful. The architecture is amazing. The golden roofs and friezes on the facades make Prague one of the most attractive and well-preserved old cities in the world. But they know it and cater to it...I felt like I was swimming upstream against a river of tourists. And the shops/restaurants all cater to the lowest common denominator with multi-lingual menus, dumbed-down selections which taste like overpriced Stouffer's dinners. In the middle of it all you'll find wild disco scenes spewing drunken, dreadlocked backpackers into the streets. My advice: go off the beaten path and find a less popular locale like Dresden or Bratislava or a more authentic city like Budapest.

clock. It was good to see from the outside but don't bother with going inside as there are two windows for looking out and two little windows for seeing the clock mechanism besides that a lot of plaques to read.

Fabulous history. Beautiful architecture and wonderful history, but get a bit away from the main square to find some good shops that aren't just tourist traps. Good luck finding a public toilet, though!

20 years later. I was a bit disappointed when I saw this olace 20 years later from my first visit beacuse it has lost a lot of its innosent old charm and turned into a big tourist attraction with some things that really don't belong there as Thai massage for example!

touristy "medieval settlement". Be there in the morning -summer - time when the tourists are not packed! It's beautiful to walk along the narrow streets, adore the buildings and surrounding area. I got a chance to have a close view of Astronomical Clock when there were only few people around, enjoyed the Starometska while the sun was about to rise, and superb stroll to Charles Bridge. In the evening time, the lights will create new panoramic view of old town. Amazing!
My new favorite city. Old Town is marvelous ... just as is all of Prague. Just go and soak in the city, the culture, the food, the people and the sights.

simply beautiful. I liked all the buildings that surround the city, the cathedral and churches, the tower, the narrow streets and all places of interest. The shops are open till late, and there is many things to see and buy,

An Enjoyable Walk!. Walking Old Town is a must when in Prague; the winding streets and town squares are a delight to see and experience. Full of shops and architectural treats, each street is filled with history and culture. After taking a walking tour, just spend some time on your own, wonderfing about. You will find interesting shops, pubs and wonderful opportunities visit museums, galleries and concerts. Old Town is safe for strolling; take your time and enjoy the many sights.

Impressive architecture. Prague and the old town where largely untouched by the events of Worl War 2 and as a result retain a lot of its original buildings. For those that like exploring old towns then this city is perfect.

A must do. Come and hang out here.
Have diner or an ice cream. It is the touristic place to be.
The restaurant and bars are nice and the surroundings are nice and full of snapshot to capture.
tourist mecca. so many shops and so much to see. The colour and flavours of the old town is just wonderful,all Prague promised was delivered.
a feast for the eyes. You can spend hours wandering around the old town and delight in the amazing architecture. Definitely plan to spend a lot of time in the Old Town.
Beautiful & scenic. We spent half a day in old town and liked it very much.There are also a lot of building to visit in old town.
Continental european flavoured tourist trap. Quintesential european town square. Nice but under-whelming. Very touristy. Worth visiting if passing by.

Beautiful town square. This square became the highlight of our 3 day trip in Prague. Everywhere you look, there is another amazing building to see. The best part was our last night there. We walked for almost 2 hours, and were delighted by the incredible lighting there and on the bridge. I felt like I was at Disneyland!

Beautiful city. We spent four days in Prague and it is now on my list of favourite cities. It was packed with tourists when we were there but we still enjoyed it. There is a lot to see and it has some interesting history.

Main Square. likes - buildings, space,everyone gawping at the clock
dislikes
giant bubble blowers
crap living statues
Street entertainment. Great street entertainment, also good for people watching, my wife spotted an actor from the TV series THE BILL, restaurants are reasonable just check the wine prices.
The Old town. The astronomical clock is the main attraction. Nice views from the clock tower that can be reached by steps or two lifts from inside the town hall.

Lovely building. The best thing that you enjoy and understand the historical place in old town prague, join a free walking tour. there is guide that will show you around and explain you every single thing.. no fee but off course at the end of the tour you have to give some tips, just about 10 euro.... it is worth to join, it takes for 2 hours, start from 10:30 am.... all historical building are amazing and the guide are very knowledgable with a good english... dont miss it!

A "magic" place :). The old town is certainly a pearl of Prague. Comming to Prague reserve at least one day for walking the cobbled pavements (wear comfortable shoes!), admire beautiful tenements and hunt for the souvenirs. If you want to know more about Prague's history and legends you may join a free tour. They start everyday at 11am, 2pm and 5pm on the Old Town Square. If you finish with the Old Town early and still have the will and energy to see more, you can cross the Vltava River walking through the Charles Bridge and sight seeing another old Prague's district - Mala Strana.

Lots to see and do.. Lots to see and do, plenty of shops bars and restaurants. Lots of quiet places as well. The Old town square is worth a visit for the Astronomical clock and other beautiful buildings. It is the starting/meeting point for almost all of the tours be they motorised or walking.
Love it. Just great to walk around and every turning there is something new to see. So impressed by how they keep it looking so clean with so many tourists around. Very impressive all.round
Awesome. Amazing in every way. My jaw probably dropped open involuntarily when we walked into the square. We went to the top of the town hall which has great views of the city. We recommend it.

Welcome to Old Town Prague. Quaint, charming, bustling and superb architecture.Walk around, take photographs, eat ice-cream, take your time to soak it in and you'll surely enjoy yourself.Beware of the cobblestone old-town street, it is not friendly to your ankles & knees; so wear a comfortable shoeBut aside from this you will have an excellent time; lots of Restaurants, Bazaars, shops and many things to see.

Loved the old town square. What a lovely place. We went with a five year old and she enjoyed as much as we did. It was just as I expected it to be, an ode of joy to the senses! We found typical food, very inexpensive beer, music and some free acts on the town square which captivated our little one. A great place to be to enjoy the buildings, the architecture and the weather. Word of advise, it is extremely hot right now. You must drink fluids at all times, and preferably alternate between beer and water. Yes, beer is cheaper than water, but beer will contribute to dehidrate you.Its crowded towards the astronomical clock, but the rest its ok. It is the heart of medieval prague and its so well preserved its truly a jewel.

There's always more to see. Wherever you turn your head there will be something nice to see and several little details that will make you fall in love for Prag. Just try to avoid weekends and holidays when everything gets too crowded with tourists from all over the world.

Old Town, Prague. This is a charming part of Prague, full of old buildings and narrow streets having a "genius loci". You can meet there a mix of modern and old architecture as well, if you would like to be lose in history, it could be done in a moment. Then you could be thirsty or hungry so you can find a welcoming restaurant to make you comfortable.
lovely old town which is very walkable.. Loved the architecture and charm of old town. Listened to music at the municipal house which was beautiful.
Historical Center. I am from Prague, I love the square, I recomend t avoid the restaurants directly there, better go further from the touristical areas

Heart of the City: today and back in the past. Open air gallery! Several centuries of architecture in one place! Each building tells it´s own story. Lot of overpraised restaurants with the great view! Lot of street artists with acts like you never seen before! Drunken and dancing Indian in pyjamas (not Geronimo) or stand-up comedian so bad that even you city´s worst act will be Academy Award performance!
A must see and experience. Take your time to walk the streets and look at the architecture. Sit in a café and watch the world go by. Visit the sights.
the magic and mystery that you can touch. Prague is just wonderfull and should not be missed, the Old Town is a real treat for romantic walks after dusk, You will just love it and love her/him

OLD TOWN PRAGUE - Czech Republic. Establishment ofThe territory of today's Prague has been inhabited since prehistoric times. History at is best. Walk to the old town square through the small streets with shop it will take you back in time. When you finally enter the square is a buzz with activity. Artist and vendor abound. One of the best time is during the holidays with the Christmas tree and of the handicraft stalls selling Czech original wares. Have a coffee or adult beverage and watch the squares clock show the history of Prague

So much fun to be had... Had an awesome time in Old Town Prague. Lots to do and plenty of places to stop for food or drink and all are reasonably priced!You can't go wrong as it's close to most things!
History at its best. You can't take your eyes of the buildings churches and statues.It's hard to stop taking pictures all the time.You feel you are going back in time but still doing it today.
must visit. come on, who would go to Prague and not visit the Old Town? you gotta do it. It has so much to offer. surely you don't need me to list everything.
One of the nicest places in Prague.. Just a really cool place in Prague. Few days in Prague - this is a must! Old architecture, various restaurants, souvenir shopping....

GREAT HISTORY. Our Tour walked around the Old Town with a fantastic local guide.. He had an incredible knowledge of history and a great sense of humour. I highly recommend this walking tour of Prague, it as quite easy and lay back

Packed!. Last time I was here, it was very busy. Ten years later, it is completely packed. The square in the middle of the town is probably one of the prettiest you'll ever see. (That's if there weren't so many people around!) The winding streets are great for finding gems and there are many.

It would be Even better without the Tourists. Yes, I know I was one of the many people in the square so contributed to it being packed, but if you could imagine it with half the people it would be even more beautiful.

Lovely area. Prague Old Town is full of interesting buildings, squares, streets and lanes. The area has lots of bars, restaurants and cafes and is a wonderful place to wander during the day time or evening, although group tours can get in the way sometimes!
Enjoyed Prague. Lots of things to see and do. Looks like walking through an old movie set. Lots of shops and street performers.
Pretty. It's just pretty, and a nice place to visit, lots of tourists and tourist prices but worth a visit- of course!

Unforgettable!. Old town is extremely beautiful and truly unforgettable! It does not matter where you look there is some architectural marvel that makes you say “wow!” It really helps to participate in a tour to get the most out of it, but even roaming around by yourself you can soak yourself in the beauty of the place. Even if you do not have your own tour guide you can easily get closer to many many tours passing by and catch an explanation of something. One needs many hours to truly appreciate the architecture, and in summer, at least when we were there this summer, it was blazing hot. So, you necessarily need to rest in many beer bar/pub, which I found made you even more tired or rather sleepy. So, you need a couple of days to cover it all.

Spend hours exploring!. Each cobblestone road led somewhere new and interesting... good thing because it's easy to get turned around! Be sure to hang out in the main square, sample the ice cream, and wander the bridges listening to street musicians and people-watching.

Lovely. The old town has lovely architecture, with some very nice shop and restaurants. Although it was very busy and some restaurants seemed very expensive the nearer you got to the old town square. There is an aquarium in the old town underground 85K, we were then going to go on the underground tour 400K, the aquarium is part of the tour along with two other buildings basically the same but lacking in fish... a tip would be just go to the aquarium, then maybe one of the other many tours.
you must go there. the best old town in Europe, unique atmosphere, beautiful buildings and great beer, you need a few days to see all atractions there,

Cozy, well preserved, nice for a stroll. The old town is a lovely place to just walk around taking in the history that surrounds it. The only downside is that it is packed with tourists. Anyway, it is a good place to spend a couple of hours just walking around, having a coffee at a café, a beer in a pub or something to eat. There is also a lot of shopping around, mostly tourist oriented, so you won´t get any bargains.

very Pretty and old world charm. this is the old part off the city with the lovely old clock and old church builds and market stalls. It is a nice place to have an drink and watch all the action going on around you.
Most beautiful but very busy. I love Prague, but this July it's just way too hot and packed with tourists. Last time I was here in October and enjoyed it much more.
Time to relax, watch and listen. A square large enough to watch the world go by over a cold pilsner. Amazing architecture all around you. Good atmosphere

Great for a walk. Prague has a great inviting pedestrian zone made for strolling. You can come upon many fascinating and beautiful architectural masterpieces by walking down the streets of this ever impressive city. The masses of people can dampen the appeal in peak season, but even with this, the old town of Prague is a great place to spend your time.
Visit the market. great place to walk around. Visit the market in the area for great finds and cheap prices. Lots of tourists in July but a fun walk.
GORGEOUS architecture but.... Be careful where you eat. There are many better restaurants outside of this super tourist center. Use the Metros ! They're easy fast and clean

A beautiful place, but overrun with tourist crowds on summer weekend. The Old Town is well-preserved and charming, but in my visit over a weekend in July, it was uncomfortably mobbed with tourists. All its restaurants and shops cater to tourists. Food in this part of town isn't outstanding; it doesn't have to be. Waiters are very pleasant, but seem to automatically say, "Service is not included in this country" when picking up your check, even before checking to see if you've tipped. Taxi drivers demand a minimum $10 fee for even a 1km ride. I would recommend it more in the off-season.
Great place for walks. You will love to get lost in the small streets and find very interesting lokals. Yo can find Hard Rock cafe there as well and try the brewery By trhee roses!

In my Top 3 Cities!. A brilliant blend of history and lively restaurants and shops, the atmosphere is electric. Very busy, but this added to the vibe, and there were plenty bars to stop for a well earned beer.

History all around. We did a three day trip to Prague and this was the first destination that we went to. Old town is filled with so much history and things to do... From horse driven carriage rides to feeding the pigeons, there is something for everyone

Old Town - The Heart of Prague. The Old Town is sort of the 'heart' of Prague and is probably the most heavily visited district within the city. This is the area east of the Vltava River and includes Charles Bridge, the Old Town Square all the way to Namesti Republiky. There is much to see and do in the Old Town and it is very easy to to spend much time in this area of Prague. Highlight attractions of the Old Town include the iconic Charles Bridge, which is easily one of the most famous bridges in the world and something that no visitor to the city should go without seeing at least once if not twice during their stay. Visitors will also find the world-famous Orlog, also known as the Astronomy Clock. This is probably the most easily recognisable clock in the world and something that visitors should try to see a couple different times during a trip to Prague. Additional attractions at the Old Town Square that are worth visiting include the nice Baroque church by the name of St. Nicholas (not to be confused Church of St. Nicholas located in Mala Strana), the Jan Huss Monument and the fairy-tale like Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn whose towers boast fantastic Gothic spires. It is also worth visiting the Old Town Hall building where you find Orlog and the beautiful Goltz-Kinsky Palace in the old Square and perhaps finding the nearby Ungelt, also known as the Tyn Court, not far from the Old Square. We also very much enjoy the Municipal House building which is a great Art Nouveau scene in Prague at the far end of the Old Town, found next to the historic Powder Tower. We also enjoyed looking at various interesting statues in this district like the odd Kafka Monument near the Jewish Quarter and the Hanging Out Statue near the Bethlehem Church. Various small walkways, sidewalk cafes, coffee shops, local eateries, bar and souvenir shops can be visited, making this a very active area of the city. During our recent trip to Prague, we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Praha, right on the Old Town Square and had a decent stay. We tried a few restaurants, cafes and coffee shops in the area, some of which we were quite pleased with. These included breakfasts taken at the Cafe Mozart, which is directly on the Old Town Square. We very much enjoyed a coffee stop made at Cafe Ebel and found our dinner at U Medvidku and lunch stop at Tonino Lamborghini Pastacaffe to be decent. Other meals taken in the area weren't worthy of recommendation. Overall, we have always enjoyed spending time in the Old Town during trips to Prague but are now preferring the Mala Strana 'Lesser Quarter' and the Hradcany 'Castle' districts on the other side of the Vltava River a bit more. However, can't imagine visiting Prague and not spending some quality time in this area of the city.

Beautiful Historic City. This place reminds me a lot of Disneyland, only that this is real. The atmosphere, scenery and tour was excellent. Though most of the people here struggle to speak English, but there is no problem getting around in Prague. There is just so many things to visit here. From Castles to Clock Towers and Museums.

Beautiful buildings and lovely atmosphere. We loved this area! So many beautiful buildings and churches to see. We strolled through the narrow streets and it was very pleasant. It is touristy but still enjoyable.Don't miss the cathedral, the astronomical clock, the opera, the bridge etc. and go to the old town square in the evening as well, the atmosphere is lovely. Restaurants there are a bit pricey, in Prague standards, but you can have a coffee or snack...
Hitoric buildings galore. A wonderful part of the city with many historic buildings. A pleasant place to walk and explore. Perhaps the downside is the number of shops selling tourist "tat".
We'll come back. We need more time, we love ths city. We'll come back in another season. There is so much to see. <3We loved the musea and the beautiful view athp the bridges and upon the hill.
Great piece of history..... So fun to look at all the buildings, the statues, the streets leading off the square. Fun to just spend time to watch the colors change as the light does, the people, etc.
Great area to explore. We loved it. Great atmosphere, lots of nooks and crannies to explore. We loved the entire area. Go in the evening

Fairy tale. Beautiful buildings, fantastic gothic church and great astronomical clock with great views of Prague. Loved the relaxed atmosphere and street entertainers. Disliked the fact that buildings have been built in front of the church. Have a drink on the roof terrace at the Hotel u Prince for fantastic views and not too pricy for the location.

Super Touristy. My wife and I found this whole area to be very touristy with very little redeeming qualities. The astronomical clock is 20mins of my life I'll never get back, the restaurants in this area are pricey (at least in Prague standards) I'm sure visiting you'll have to make it into this area no matter what. Just don't expect too much

The heart of Prague. You have to stroll through Old Town. Go early in the morning if you want a leisurely walk to see the architecture and get unobstructed photos. At about 10am the souvenir shops and restaurants open and by 11am itcis packed with people.
beautiful. beautiful but very crowded, and a lot of people trying to sell tours. Buildings are an absolute delight

Walk through historic streets. Prague is unique and it's architecture even more. Walking through the streets of the old town feels like walking through history with wonderful atmosphere all around. Almost everything is well-preserved. Good for an nice evening walk.
Lively, good beer and cafe. good food, but expensive so find the ones far from old town if on a budget. We found near charles bridge going north

so many wonders in one place. The Old town is full of all kinds of historic buildings and treasures. You have to see it for yourself. The churches are magnificent and everyone gathers every hour for the tolling of the Astronomical clock
Stunning. The old town is stunning, even more beautiful than you'd expect. Make sure to grab a 'pivo' and do some essential people watching whilst admiring the architecture.

great history but beware of pickpockets. wonderful sights within a few feet of each other. But beware of pickpockets and thieves- even our local guide had her bag stolen a few months earlier from this very spot

Center of the Prague. This is the place on the main city square that captures the city atmosfere in a best way. Gothic architecture and large square, many bars and shops of all kinds around. You might lose a couple of hours here.
Beautiful. 1 of the prettiest town squares in europe as a lot of the buildings are preserved. The clock, people watching are all must-dos
Tick Tock Clock. Good Value dining, beautiful buildings.Bohemian atmosphere, Al Fresco... Catch the Road Train to ride up to the Castle and back... take a cushion
Beautiful!. Unbelievably beautiful, from the main sights to the smallest buildings! Something to see/do for everyone. It gets very crowded, but then we did visit in high season.

Great Sightseeing and People Watching. Old Town was just as I'd expected, beautiful small cobbled streets, old buildings, small cafes, little bars - tons of people. Its a really nice atmosphere. We walked around for hours, found food to snack on - sat in the square did a bunch of people watching. Its a must!
interesting old and delightful. So much to see, so many things to fall in love with, loved the castle, astronomical clock, river cruise, views of the city, shopping and of course great beers!

A Must-See when in Prague. This is a really worthwhile spot to visit when you're in Prague. The central point is the market square, a large square full of entertainers and cafes and lots to see. You can climb the tower and get a great view of the square below and you should certainly stop by one of the cafes for a slice of Apfelstrudel and some people watching. The only slight critique might be that the area completely caters to tourists and all the shops are souvenir shops, which sucks away a hint of old-world charm.
"beautiful". The Old Town is just beautiful, with plenty of bars and restaurants. The Architecture is amazing and you really need to see it for yoursel.

Awesom-est place :). The old town is typical of what we find in the main cities of Eastern Europe, cobbled streets, lined with churches and medieval buildings, art galleries, souvenir shops, roadside restaurants.... The feel of Stare Mesto Prague is amazing.It has most of the must-see of Prague that would be in your itinerary. There are no vehicles allowed inside the old town (barring Police cars) and is bordered by metro stations & Tram stops on all sides.The main square has all beautiful must-see buildings - Lady of Tyn church, Astronomical clock, etc.

Nice Square. In this part of Prague you will find lots of buildings which are key to visit in Prague. Because of this reason it is also full of tourist and (expensive) tourist shops, which reduces the magic of this nice square a bit. Anyway when in Prague you still need to visit it.

Best spot in Prague. Great view of the astronomical clock while you enjoy a meal / beer or coffee. Great restaurants and cafes around the old town square. We watched a few weddings, concerts, good bohemian crystals and we took a 3D picture inside a glass prism which is a lifetime family souvenir to keep.
beautiful. one of the best place in the city! all those nice buildings and architecture! only one bad issue: too many people always trying to sell you something at any corner
Prague. Loved the walkability with lots to see. There were so many beautiful shops and lovely cafes. I enjoyed the friendliness of the people.

Beautiful view, a must visit place. You will get many beautiful pictures even if you're only sitting in one of many cafe, theres so many attractive things going on in this area, and one hour is just not enough to absorb the beauty.
great place. I loved the atmosphere, but it was hard to see all the beggars and poor people. Felt like there should be some kind of help to help them out. Poor people.

People watchers paradise. I spent most of the afternoon just hanging out in sidewalk cafes watching the huge numbers of tourists with smart phones. It was actually too hot and too crowded for walking so a beer break in the shade seemed to make lots of sense!
Lots of good photo ops. We saw many interesting shops and beautiful architecture. We were able to use public transportation to reach the area, which we found very convenient.

A Prague Must!. We walked through several times on our 4 day vacation. Excellent people watching. It's also fun to watch the clock tower performance at least once. The square is very crowded and the restaurants are over priced, but just eat a couple streets over.We were delighted to find a collection of Salvador Dali prints currently on exhibit in Old Town Square. Even more pleasantly surprised at what a nice collection it was! This is a temporary exhibit, but definitely one to check out if it's still available!
Go in the off season!. A lovely old European place...just too many tourists. And it seems like the locals have caught on to all the tourist 'traps'.
Fun!. Street artists, music, beautiful architecture, the clock tower, St. Nicholas Church, food! Side streets that bring more fun. Don't miss it!

the whole town is an open air museum. Take your time and enjoy the everywhere present art nouveau , not only de places listed as "must". Avoid the locals offering you "the best rate in tonwn", changing money isn't a fair business in Prague streets and you could get uselees exotic banknotes

Great arcitechture, lots of tourists. It certainly is a beautiful old market square, it feels like all of it is a museum. Too bad the atmosphere is ruined by hordes of tourists wanting to see the clock, tacky souvenir shops and overpriced restaurants. While we didn't eat there, I saw that a beer could cost 90 CZK in the market square, whereas in mala strana and other districts, you could get it for 30 CZK. However, it's not just all about the beer. The old town of Prague is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen, and is of course a must visit in Prague
This is what your here for...... We think everybody comes to Prague for the ambience of this cities old town. Its worth it and you can quickly see why people love this place.

Beautiful, Old Spot. Old town had a huge, old square area. Near the center was a statue of Jon Hus. There were lots of little restaurants and shops all around, and the huge clock was interesting. There were throngs of people milling about and there was always some entertainment going on.

Must see the old clock show at 7pm. This is a bustling area that you can easily navigate on foot. The area is filled with the typical tourist shops and dining spots. Best to stay away from this area for meals since they just cater to tourists and are not particularly good. You also have to watch out for pick pockets, so keep you valuables in a zippered compartment of clothes and not in a purse. I suggest taking a guided tour of this area which will be included on any tour of Prague. It is a good way to get your orientation of the city.

Very European.... Cobbled streets, old cathedrals and churches, cafes spewing out casual yet promising aromas...a myriad assortment of street performers from gothic rock bands to an old man on a cello...and an air of relaxed holiday spirit. When its sunny its great...when there's a drizzle it is romantic...the old town square is a fabulous slice of Prague. We spent all day roaming the different places...but come evening, this was were we came down for the quintessential taste of Prague. The astronomy tower and the cathedral are add-ons to a fabulous experience...
Wrong map direction. This place is not where the map shows. Be careful. Please fix it. The old town and the astrological clock are really beautiful.

architecture and shopping. Neat if you're into architecture and shopping. With young children there's still a lot to do, but it wouldn't take but a day. My kids were excited about the Art Gallery for Children, the carriage rides through Stare Mesto, and the Chocolate Museum.

Quaint, charming and good for people watching. This is Prague at its best. This is the best place to people watch and just take in the old buildings, clock tower and the occasional street performers. I would be careful at some of the restaurants surrounding as they could be rip offs for tourists.

Feels like home. I absolutely love the Old Town. It's so walkable, manageable, and simply beautiful with its cobblestone streets and soaring church towers. Take the time to explore this area on foot, and don't forget to look up!

Must see, but as touristy as it gets. The Old Town was by far my least-favorite part of Prague. Too bad, since the architecture and history of the place are amazing. But the crush of tourists, and the mass of accompanying hucksters and shills selling cheap souvenirs, turned me off. Nonetheless, anyone visiting Prague for the first time needs to see and experience this part of the city.

Get a tour with "tours by locals". We wanted to get an overview of old town, the Jewish district, what to do and see, so I looked on line and found "Tours By Locals". This site puts you in touch with Prague locals who will take you on private guided walking tours of their city. There are several guides to choose from at various prices. We choose Willy, who showed up at our hotel promptly at 9:30 am and took us on a five hour walking tour of Prague. His knowledge of the history of his city, advice on where to eat and what to see later on our own, his information on all the major sights was great! We got a good orientation to the city, got recommendations on what to see later, got taken to all the major sights, like churches, town hall, monuments, clock, Jewish district, and learned so much about everything. This made the next two days easy to get around, take in more sights and feel comfortable in the city. I highly recommend taking a tour with one of the "Tours By Locals" guides. It helped us feel comfortable in the city.

City center, a must in Prague.. You have to go here if you are in Prague. Way too many tourists, but that is the whole city. Huge square with many street performers, tons of cool buildings to look at, museums, the clock tower is also a must see. Got a lot of warnings about pick pockets, but use common sense. Do NOT eat here. Way over priced!!! Looks and smells delicious but super expensive. This is where the action is. Nice place to visit, lots of history and good people watching.
Old Town Prague. Beautiful! This area of town is so easy to walk in and around. Lots to see, do, and buy! Bring your camera as you'll want pictures to bring home!

Beautiful. The Old Town in Prague is absolutely lovely. Perfect to spend an afternoon walking about, having lunch in the square (the delicious sausages from the vendors down the side are a personal recommendation), and just enjoying the atmosphere.
Must see. It's so crowded with tourists, but there are shops and restaurants galore, the beautiful clock and the Charles Bridge.
Ultimate quaint. This must be one of the quaintest places in the world: the 15th- to the 18th century frozen in time.

A magical old town!. Have you ever dream yourself walking around a old baroque town with gothic buildings one after the other, on a stone street made for horse carriages with gypsies wagons selling folk art? That is Stare Mesto, visit the place buy an antique, a Bohemian glass souvenir or a dancing puppet so you can revive your wonderful memories each time you spot them.

One of the most beatiful squares in all of Europe. Gorgeous square, usually lots going on. Astronomical clock is a must see here. Very expensive to eat on the square, go a few streets away. Had an orchestra concert one night we were here. Can get very crowded at night. Beautiful, fantastic buildings of many colors and a church on the square itself.
Disneyland in Prague. What a treat. Fabulous architecture. Building from the 1400s. Take a walk to the top of the tower and have a panoramic view of Prague.
Perfect place to see centuries of culture & many cultures.. Weather was unbelievably awful for June 24, 50 degrees, rainy & windy! Teenagers & 50 somethings still loved every second of Prague.

just awesome - cant miss it. visit both day and again at night. this place is just magical - the history and the architecture -- its all unmissable really. just avoid the restarants on the square they are super pricey!

Wear comfortable shoes!. Great walking around in the Old Town. But as almost all the streets in Prague are cobblestoned, comfortable shoes are a must!
Lots of history here, and we loved just wandering down streets and getting lost (which isn't hard to do since the Prague street grid makes no sense!)
Stay here.,!. Should stay in old town.. Everything will be at a walking distance and you'll not waste much time and money in taxis and travelling..

The heart of Prague. As soon as we got to the hotel, we went there. It will give you the idea of what to expect of Prague. We watched the crowds, had some dumplings in one of the chafes and watched the crowds. For the clock try to get 15 ' before because huge crowds gather and you need a good spot. The actual show I didn't t think it was worth it but everyone goes. At the square there is a stand that sells trdelnik ( a local pastry) . Don' t miss it. They have them with cinnamon, coconut.

Old Town--A must see but brimming with tourists. Great to visit while in Prague, but very touristy. Beautiful in the rain too! Be sure to see the astronmical clock at the top of hour to view it's full show. Great photo opportunities.
Too beautiful to comprehend. Lots of time is necessary to fully explore this wonderful area, browsing shops, visit ancient little places with very modern areas in between.
Big crowds, costly beer. Arrive early for the clock -- by 10 mins before the hour; crowds are dense every hour. Don't be late; shows over 1 minute after.

Wonderful and peaceful. Old Prague is a wondeful place, full of history, attractions, buildings, etc.We visited the Dali museum, an outstanding place. We had drinks in one restaturants at the square while we appreciated the crowd.

So much more cosmopolitan than I expected. Though touristy and full of shops hawking Italian leather, Russian nesting dolls, and Middle Eastern kebabs, Old Town is a great a place to people watch and just wander. The astrological clock is fun to watch every hour. Just be careful of pickpockets while you are looking up and are distracted.

Take Time to View the Architecture. The square itself is fairly typical of old town squares in eastern Europe. We were fortunate in having checked out the "DK Eyewitness Guide to Prague and the Czech Republic" and skimmed through it. The book provided detailed descriptions of the facade of the buildings around the squares and of the astronomical clock. The reliefs and decorations on the buildings are fascinating if you are willing to take the time to look.As another reviewer posted, the food vendors will try to rip you off. Czech ham (which is actually very tasty) is listed as CZ 89 for 100g. They will slice off a chunk with a big piece of skin and fat attached and charge CZ 400 for it. Just say "no" to them.
How Prague went to my heart. walking from hotel to Old Town, visiting, taking pictures, Charles Bridge, little restaurants, food, people. I disliked to have to leave......

road works. it will be ok in a couple of years after the work on the metro is finished now a nightmare heavy lorries flying about so pavements get really full please be careful if you go at peak times and some of the attractions are close but those that are open well worth a visit so dear reader enjoy

Old town history. Excellent historical buildings and lots of great photo's. probably the busiest old town square with lots of people, so try and come early before all the tour groups arrive. Souvenirs and clothes are good prices, but ensure you duck down one of the many lane ways for food and drinks at half the price only around the corners and much more serene.
Amazing Structures. One of the loveliest city I've ever been , but the tourist attractions has the tendency to be overcrowded especially the Charles bridge

Exciting. Street performers were wonderful! Different performers everyday. View from the Tower was great. Food stands had good food but must make sure you know they weigh the food.
