But men attending these stands were quite quite rude. We had other unpleasant experiences with other service providers - no patience!
Great. We thoroughly enjoyed walking through old town. Hit the square, go to Josefov, and walk up to Wenceslas square. All easy to do in one day.

Very old worldly and quaint. We visited at easter time and enjoyed the easter markets with its carriage rides, treats of sweet buns?, old prague hams, sausages and hot mulled wine. the place had a magical air to it and was very lively especially in the evenings.
like most central squares. Nice things to see but all restaurants are well overpriced. Look for a better option in the surrounding streets. The astronomical clock is ok but not "wow".

Fairytale. Beautiful buildings surround the Old Town Square with tons of cafes, shops, people from around the world. One can spent hours just walking around this place. We were lucky and on one of the summer evenings there was an outdoor concert of classical music. Everything is in great shape and very picturesque.

Prepare yourself for a long walk. The city is not a big one, but the streets are laberintic and each one will surprise you.- I recommend you to take a long walk in this part of the city, you will not regret it.-
A great place to have fun and to see many fine sights. Street shows, good food, fun place, full of people, so if you doNot like crowds, this may not be for you
lovely. It was beautiful and there was so much to see and do in all directions. From shopping and museums to pubs and street performers.
Beautiful Old City. Prague is a gorgeous city and its Old Town is amazing. Fun shops, plenty of people watching and lots of beautiful buildings. What more could you want??

Big Square. Nothing really fantastic about this Square other than the number of street artists. Nice to sit and watch the crowd, but remember to watch your purse and wallet as there's plenty of pickpockets!
A gem. This city is one of the most beautiful I've ever visited & Old Town is a gem! The streets wind around & it's easy to get lost, but the architecture is spectacular.
Beautiful but crowded. The old town is so picturesque, but it definitely caters to the tourist crowd and there are TONS of tourists.

Amazing !!!. Probably one of nicest city centres all over the world. Very nice, very clean. I was told that we have to pay attention on pick pocketing by we did not have any problem. Just in case, keep that in mind.

Quaint streets. Loved the restaurants serving traditional cooking, beer cellars and low prices.
You need to wear sturdy shoes to manage walking on cobblestones.

Old Town. You need to pick your time to come here, always filled with tourists. Particularly around the clock. But the area is spectacular in Summer or Winter. Great place to sit and enjoy a beer or coffee but eat elsewhere or face inflated prices
Amazing!. Festive atmosphere. Definitely try the "pastry" that is cooked in a roll with a hollow center then rolled in cinnamon sugar.

Beautiful architecture. Beautiful house, cozy restaurants, fun things going on at the centre all the time. Just a shame that people try to grab you all the time and get you on tours, get you into the restaurants and so on.
well preserved historial downtown. Really beautiful cobblestone windy streets with bars and restaurants every couple of steps. Great way to get lost one afternoon/evening

Must see place. Fantastic place full of tourists and history.
However bars and restaurants expensive here just go 20m down side streets for value for money drinks and food

Old town. Beautiful buildings. Very pretty. Great architecture. Many many things to see, astronomical clock being just one of these. A true work of art. Has lots and lots of different features. Worth seeing. Many eating places to choose from. Salvador Dali exhibition on at moment. Muchq exhibition well worth seeing. I personally like it. Shops from tourist to designer. Very relaxed look around.
Wonderful. There is a nice restorant and a dancing club above ,named "Duplex". Excellent place to eat and club.

Must see but overloaded with tourists. It's beautiful and great to see but packed with tourists. I was happy to find the Alternative Tour of Prague as a way to get away from all the masses of tourists....
Excellent. Really great atmosphere nice buildings and decorations. The narrow streets leading from the square are also filled with nice architecture.
Beautiful little city. So much to do, so much to see.A night at jazz club. A concert in a beautiful hall (Mozart). All these restaurants. Shops. Cafes. BEER!
Wow!. What a lovely place. Unfortunately it rained the whole four days we were here so we saw this through a heavy mist. Well worth getting wet for.
Atmosphere. There is such a lot to see in such a small area. Initially we thought it might be too crowded, but we enjoyed wandering down the narrow streets.
Full of crowds but worth a visit.. Try to stand away from the clock tower at the hour and you will have a better view and feel less squeezed.

A must see in Praha. We were there at least 4 times over an 8 day stay. The Astronomical clock is great and the excitement and ambience of the place rocks. We even had a Thai massage. Did a lot of shopping and had several beers at the outdoor tent bars set up all over. It's close to the Intercontinental Hotel where we were staying. Wear jogging shoes. Don't dress up.
Worth a visit. Very pretty town square that is definitely worth a visit on a trip to Prague. It is always busy and packed with people but has a lovely atmosphere. Nice photo opportunities here.
Crowed but an absolute see. You can orient yourself to the whole old town from this square. Don't miss the astronomical clock's performance on the hour. Often great acts in the center.

Very nice. It's the first thing to do when visiting the city. I recommend going there before visiting the Palace. I recommend to walk around and spend minimum 5 hours. Eat the traditional dishes. A lot of tram stations nearby.

Pretty sights, don't eat here. Beautiful Art Nouveau buildings, the Astronomical Tower is very cool, with the little figures that pop out of the windows every hour on the hour. Restaurants on the square were overpriced and had bad service.....worth it to eat even just a block off the square, way better.
Old Prague. Old Town is great, beautiful places, good beer (says my husband), delicious cech and international food, good prices

Not that crowded in the morning. Somebody said if there's a nice when this area is not full of tourists? :) Yes, it is. I was in this area aroung 9 a.m. and I enjoyed the area, then I was back at 2 p.m. and was surprised of the amount of people.One the best attractions in town, you need to take 360 degrees pictures. :)

Charming. Old lanes and streets,clean,with no hassle,no stray dogs or cats,lots of tourists type shops .Locals friendly and helpful,worth getting away right into the back lanes -tucked away good eating places e locals use.
Charming as usual. Is there a time when this place is not full of tourist ;-) people r nice and just to stroll the small charming streats is sooo fun. prices still resonable
Great area for historical sites.. Prague is the least clean of the cities 7 cities we have visited in Eastern Europe. Graffiti and cigarette butts greatly detract from this wonderful city.
showtime. don't miss the hourly astronomical clock show and enjoy the street performers and the majesty of the square
Things to do. Great place for people watching while having a coffee or beer.Try the segways easy to use and great fun.

WOW WOW WOW. It's so beautiful and stunning that I just didn't know by how much until I was there. U can sit for hours at the coffee shop Orin the square looking at the multiple places in the old town

Gorgeous. Old Town was just fabulous. Although it was VERY busy, Old Town is large enough that we never felt overly crowded. There are plenty of side streets and alleys to explore if you want to break away from the crowd!

Spend a day at the square. The square is beautiful with chucrches, monuments, and restaurants built all around it. This is very busy place and be aware of pick pockets here.Lot of different group of people play music and sing around the square. The tower has three different clocks dating from 12th century.Every hour there is a little show on the hour where a skeleton ribgs the bell and some characters on thr top run around.It is fun to visit the Old tower.
OLD TOWN PRAGUE. Breathtaking architecture, friendly people, nice neighborhood restaurants! It felt very safe at night and was beautiful.

A maze of delights. The Old town is a myriad of small (and cobbled) streets with a very good array of shops, eateries & entertainment areas. Even the churches offer great viewing and lovely entertainment with concerts from string quartets and choral music. You can see a different concert every evening if you like and the performance of Don Giovanni at the Marionette theatre is a must see night out.

Like visiting another time.. I adored Prague. The architecture is amazing, and there are lots of quirky surprises. There's so much to see and do - it feels like there's always something happening. Wandering through the streets in the Old Town is a great way to see Prague. There's a great atmosphere around and wherever you look, there's something interesting to see. It's like stepping into a fairytale.
Worthy to visit. Fantastic quarter with a lot of places of interest. Local restaurants are expensive and full of diners. However, it is a good oportunity to get a traditional Czech meals.
Brilliant Scenery!. It seems everywhere you look is another photo opportunity, just loved everything about Prague! There is plenty to do and allow yourself plenty of time to see it properly
Food and entertainment.. I liked that a lot of free tours start at this location. Food is in abundance. Underground tour is right there as well. Take the Tower tour for a 360 degree view.
amazing. excellent place to visit, historical and typical in a visit to prague, restaurants with good atmosphere

This is the entire reason to come to Prague. This city is absolutely breath taking. We ate and drank at several nice restaurants. The best however are the little stands. I had a sausage link and my wife had "old prauge ham". Basically it's a giant piece of ham that has been smoked. It was more than my wife and I could eat. It was roughly 6 bucks for all to include two beers. There are bathrooms scattered through out the city for small fee
Crowded, but beautiful. Loved the architecture, but hated the crowds. Shop a little away from this area as the prices are definitely higher here
characteristic central square. characteristic central square in the old town of prague. Nice old clockwork at the townhall of the old town. Nice houses surrounding the square

Stare mesto.... The most beautiful part of beautiful city is Prague 1.The most beautiful part of Prague 1 is Old Town.In Stare Mesto you will find very pretty pebble streets,a lot of nice restaurants and cafes and beautiful buildings with really special architecture.It was cold when we were in Prague,but Stare Mesto was always vibrant and interesting.Everything is more expensive there,but it is something you could expect in part of the city occupied with tourists.Worth visit and spending a lot time there for sure...
Beautiful but busy. It is such a stunning place, with beautiful architecture and great vibe. The crowds are crazy, however, especially around meal times.

Pleasant and unique. Prague's old town offers a pleasant place with unique architecture and "organisation". Not like the traditional old towns, in Prague the streets are not straight, building its uniqueness. If the weather is good, those restaurants and pubs can be enjoyed in the streets and until late at night, with long summer days. Be prepared for paying twice the price as in the rest of the city, though.
Multi cultural. A really entertaining and happy place to be at any time of the day or night. Buskers were different and entertaining. Restaurants a bit pricey but plenty 0f choice and good service.
Wonderful mix of architecture and history. Totally walkable old town filled with buildings and history covering many centuries. You can find something to interest everyone in a small area.

Charming old world square. Although very busy the stunning architecture, and traffic free delights of the Prague Old Town square have to be seen to be appreciated. From the Disneyesque design of Our lady of Tyn, to the baroque grandeur of the Kinski Palace centuries of buildings surround the square providing a cornucopia of sights.
beautiful city. a wonderful place to visit. great architecture throughout the entire city of Prague. we enjoyed just strolling around Old Town and taking in everything.
A Must Visit for All. This is the main stop for all visitors to Prague, it includes the main square, the clock tower, and many restaurants and bars.

Beautiful Central European City. Although we chose to stay about 15 minutes away from old town to avoid the tourist hordes, my wife and I found ourselves passing through it a few times each day.
The architecture is beautiful.

Gorgeous!. The hype surrounding this square is justified, it is absolutely gorgeous, as is every street you walk in Prague. We first went to square around 9:30 AM on a rainy morning in May and it was empty and an amazing first to see the square. We passed the square several more times in the middle of the day when it was much more crowded. It emptied out at night as well. I suggest seeing the square both when it's empty and not!

Intensive nighlife. We really enjoyed the intensive nightlife and the openness of the locals. There are hundreds of bars, pubs and souvenir shops all around this area. The architecture is really nice, it seemed to me that nearly all buildings are in really good condition.
Wonderful!. We enjoyed walking through Old Town. The buildings are unbelievable. We were in ah of all of the sites.
Beautiful City. This is a must visit place but can be very busy with tourists.Go on foot through the old town to enjoy those lovely buildings.
beautiful city. Prajue has it all....magnificent churches, buildings, shops, and people. from the Charles street bridge to John Lennon's tribute wall, everything was amazing.

The fun center of Prague's downtown. Every European city has its town square. This one is the heart and soul of Prague, with a variety of entertainers and musicians performing almost around the clock. It's the home of Prague's famous astronomical clock, several fountains and beautiful buildings, eateries and, mostly, people, people, people. THE place to be and visit. It's not Prague without this unforgettable site!

You Could Spent our Entire Visitt Here. Just sit and watch the world go by in the old city square. There is a people show everywhere you look. There is history all around you. More outdoor cafes than you can count.
Ham and beer.. At lunch time, near the clock, try the local beer and the well coocked ham. Do not take a chair. Just stand to enjoy the view.

Truly stepping into a fairy tale. Take a breath, sit down, and just relax in the beautiful setting. The musicians are talented, the food amazing, and the locale simply restful. Wander the streets and step back in time. Be sure to have plenty of time to wander and not rush - the joy is in the enjoyment.

Amazing Prague. Loved the square and the whole community feel. Heaps happening and a buzz at all times. From the smell of the BBQ meat to the bands and magicians...there is always something to capture your imagination.
Loved Prague. An amazing city and a must

Tourist lane. If you want to pay inflated prices, by all means, buy here. If you are willing to go a bit off the grid, walk down the road to the left side of the Palladium to find niche shops with one of a kind items--handmade one of a kind purses!!!

Prague , Old Town. The Gothic architecture of Old Town, is very good. There's also great organs inside the churchs which has their domes and a lot of concerts everyday inside them.There are good Cofees besides the river , where you can taste the famous beers and local food (the steamed duck is delicious). To reach them , you have to walk under a gallery for one block.

Beautiful area but be careful. The buildings and streets are really amazing. But it is very crowded and we found it hard to relax and enjoy it. One lady in our group was pick pocketed while buying gelato. She took her mind off of her wallet for one minute. Prices are high for everything. Charles bridge and the astronomical clock are super.

Prague in 2 days. Prague was marvelous.Very nice, quiet, clean.A real advisor to do the trip.Food on the street, good restaurants are not so expensive.For all budgets there is something.Please take your walking shoes with you.The whole inner-city can be walked

How lovely!. We had heard so many positive things abour Prague before we went there. - And it was all true! Absolutely one of Europes lovliest cities. Bring real comfortable shoes and start walking aound!

lovely city,careful of rip off by money changer. We visited charles bridge and the old town which is lovely.One of my friends spotted 2 young ladies trying to open a backpack of an old couples at the bridge why they will busy taking photos.I could understand why now there is so many pickpockets at the bridge cos the scenery is breathtaking and most tourist will be busy taking photo without noticing.For those who need to change money I advised to just draw at atm cos the rate at old town money changer are mostly same better to save your time for the attraction.Those prefer to shop for branded goods will have to turn left and walk straight along the road when they face tyn church.Walking straight towards Tyn church on the right side narrow road all the way behind Tyn church will lead you to the shopping mall call 200 shops.Those who need free toilet breaks can use the bohemian store near the astronomical clock tower and you can even request a voucher to exchange for a free drinks as this is for tourist visiting the store,
Not to be missed. The architecture is outstanding. The streets wind in and out-- but it is not hard to find your way. Don'tmiss the astronomical clock.

Center of everything. Like: it is a square where you'll find souvenir shops, restaurants, historical / iconic buildings, coffee shops, tour services. With all sorts of people, locals and tourists but amazingly, it is still somewhat "orderly." Though there are lots is people, they are polite enough to allow you to take pictures (give you space) and I never encountered being bumped by anyone (compared to Beijing)Though you need to pay to use the toilet/WC, I like it since these are clean and at least these are abundant and readily available (unlike in paris).Generally, don't expect Czechs to be all smiles even those in customer service. But they are polite and helpful.Dislike: found 2 shops named as tourist service, but they sell maps (50 and 80 CZK). These aren't really the tourist information center. Ask or check it in the square and you'll get the map for free.
It's all about Old Town. Pretty much everything to see emanates from Old Town. Be sure to visit both at night and in the daytime as it is magical at night.

Crowded, over priced. We found bars and restaurants 2 or 3 blocks off the stare maestro for 1/3 the price. Many of the cares in the stare maestro had additional fees where the food costs were 50% higher if you sat outside than if you sat inside the restaurant. Don't eat here, walk 2 or 3 blocks for higher quality and lower prices

Lovely city, pity about the rip off's, be careful. visited Prague for the 1st time, beautiful city.Unfortunately absolutely spoilt by the rip off prices in some of the tourist precincts (9 Euro for a double espresso - come on), taxi's with no meters and no prices, and the gouging on the currency exchange.If you want tourists to come back, this place needs to wake up and get rid of the spiv's and con men cruising around selling dodgy currency, and the currency exchanges that advertise one rate and sell at another.
25th Wedding anniversary in Bavaria. Like stepping back in time. Do a walking tour and get a good bit of the history that way...worht the price!!
A Good Stroll. Just walk around, enjoy the road side cafes, shopping in the small alley, sometime you find surprises!

Nice to spend time in the square. Brilliant and vibrant place to spend time. Also there are some amazing and economical cafes to eat and drink. The evenings specially pleasant and you can most of the tourists hanging out in the square

the best city center in Europe. We have visited Prague on 2013, beginning May, the weather was wonderful, the atmosphere the lights created, the beautiful buildings arround, it was like a dream. Everybody had a smile on their faces, the people, local and tourists alike, were very kind, no shoving, no pushing. I bought hand made mugs for coffee and tea. I recommend the natural soaps also. It is a very vibrant city, tones of architecture to look at, many charming street, mesmerizing views of the city from a high point. I especially enjoyed the dancing house, it is a breath of fresh air, surreal, and oddly fitting with aged buildings, where you will feel everything is possible.
Cute little square. There's a famous clock tower right in the middle of the square :)We tried one of the "horn" pastry. It was awful! It smelled really good, but the taste was another story.

The Heart of Prague. Old Town is the heart of Prague. It's a set of stunning buildings, alleys and a beautiful square where every tourist converge. Restaurants along the square are a bit (not much) overpriced, but sticking to the alleys excelent restaurants at a reasonable price are found.

beautiful place!. Buildings, streets, shops, places...ect everything is really really beautiful in this area of Praha.
This could be the start a/o end of your day trip, because you get easy access by walking to the castle, to the Jude area or even to the venceslas square.
Everything is on hand (market, shops, banks, bar, restaurant...ect)
Unforgettable!
old town. interesting, many good restaurants - beautiful view of the city from the top of the clock tower. near to many places of interest.
Fascinating. Wandering through the narrow streets there is something to amaze you at every turn - wonderful old houses, cobbled streets

One of the more impressive Old Towns. There are of course Old Towns all over Europe, but something about Prague is compellingly different. Perhaps it is the varied styles of architecture, or the wonderful astronomical clock. Definitely worth a leisurely stroll.
Stunning. That part of Prague is charming and stunning, with beautiful buildings all around you. You should deifinately explore it, highly recommended!

Gorgeous place. As soon as you arrive in the toow square and you begin walking down the cobble stone streets, you feel transported into another time. This gorgeous old town has been impeccably maintained and restored, through so many years, governments, rulers and wars. It is such a gem to have it be in this state...treaure it Prague!! Not all cities were so fortunate. We took several organized tours to hear about all the history, timetables and origins...but over it all I think our favorite thing was to just get lost and explore those charming streets. Do not miss this old town!
Just wander and let yourself get lost.. Wonderful place to walk around and explore. Many shops and cafes, and don't forget to look up - the architecture is amazing. Enjoy!

Always amazing. Whenever you come, day or night, winter or summer, this is the place to visit. The architecture is stunning, the passing times are almost palpable... Just let yourself loose and wander the streets. There is something to see, hear or enjoy at every corner. Be aware of cobbled streets and choose your footwear accordingly. Don’t avoid other tourists, they are just the part of this charming city.

Must See. You have to see this in Prague. it is an amazing neighborhood that combines culture and modernity.As you walk down the streets you can enjoy the buildings, the culture, the heritage, and the touristic atmosphere.
Mini-Vegas. So crowded, that its hard to enjoy the beauty of the place. go early in the morning to be able to see anything

Magical Christmas Market. We really enjoyed the Christmas market and the stalls, decorations, entertainment and lights were memorable, especially at night. This is definetely one of the most attractive sights in Prague and the surrounding shopping (tourist shops being exceptions) was interesting and varied.

Loved roaming the streets of old town.. Just returned from spending 7 glorious days in Prague and simply loved wandering the streets of old town. Around every corner there is stunning architecture and something wonderful to explore.
Among the more notable places we visited in Old Town were Josefov, Old Town Square & Astronomical Clock & the Charles Bridge.

Fairy tale wonder land!. We have visited Prague on 2012, beginning December and the Christmas market was already in place, the lights created a surreal atmosphere and unlike in any other period, I welcomed the crowds. Everybody had a smile on their faces, the people, local and tourists alike, were very kind, no shoving, no pushing. I bought hand made mugs for coffee and tea. I recommend the natural soaps also. It is a very vibrant city, tones of architecture to look at, many charming street, mesmerizing views of the city from a high point. I especially enjoyed the dancing house, it is a breath of fresh air, surreal, and oddly fitting with aged buildings.Prague is a city which I would definitely choose to come back to, it is the story we all need one in a while.

flat shoes a must as cobbles .. the resturants are not too expensive on main square but look down the side streets . dont miss the astronomical clock on the hour, good underground tours from main square.

A 1000 years of architecture within walking distance ... Old Town Prague is the place I've visited during my many travels where you can experience the aesthetic and operational beauty of 1000 years of architecture by walking only 1000 meters. If you're able, I highly encourage you to see this fabulous section of this wonderful city for yourself. I'm very confident you will enjoy the experience, as I've down three times over :-)
A consentration of history and beauty. There were a wide range of walking guides which were "free", but they were of course based on generous tips.

Stunning Architecture. What beautiful and relaxed city, stunning architecture. Quite easy to get disorientated and lost at times - but that was part of the fun as new places are always discovered when you just let yourself roam, and you always end up in a familiar place eventually.
beautiful walking area. the jewish quarter is not to be missed. the synagogue and cemetary will move you. there are also wonderful squares and shops to cheer you.

freakiest statues!!. the library is famous, the Castle is imposing. the clock must be seen, food was cheap and good, cool street musicians of different types. no one begging for food or money, very economical with everything, people all very nice..no kidding at all here
Great place day and night.. The architecture and scale are amazing, great atmosphere and lots going on. I really enjoyed just chilling by the benches and taking it all in.
great cafes , restaurants and shop. fantastic place for tourists to see the great buildings, quaint streets and relax and watch the world go by

Good but not as good as I'd imagined. Prague has been on my list of must see places for 10 years or more, largely based on a series of select photographs that are used as representative views of the city. While there are some nice views, it's not as pristine or as uniformly old European as I'd imagined. The place is crawling with tourists. We were told that the Czechs were overrun by the Austrians, the Nazis, the Communists and now tourists. Compared to Vienna, Prague is still a cheap place to visit.

Night or day worth a visit.. The atmosphere is great. Lots of stalls and entertainers. Plenty of bars and restaurants. Lovely in the evening with some buildings lit up. The clock was disappointing though.

Where you will love to go every day!. As someone else says, this is the heart of Prague! Indeed! Lots of shops, cafes, street performers, etc. It's also well lit and safe to walk around at night and has a festive atmosphere. Ok, some of it is quite touristy (T-shirt shops, etc.) but you can also find some nice ones, too. There is a Thai Massage (with a fish tank in the front) that is great for weary feet! We used it twice! I recommend that you find a hotel that is within walking distance from here. Like I said you will want to go every day (or night) to find a great cafe, watch the magnificent clock or just to people watch! Great area to for families, too.

Interesting and beautiful especially at night. The open town square gives one a great feeling. The buildings around the square are beautiful . The Church of Our Lady Before Tyne looks magnificent at night when lighted up.Nearby is the unique Astronomical clock . One must wait for the hour when the clock will chime. Look out for the figures around the clock that will move.Many restaurants and souvenir shops can be found nearby. Well worth a visit! .
The Old Town Square. Enjoyed watching the world go by from the pavement cafes, beer and soft drinks not too expensive either. Superb buildings and atmosphere.

The Heart of Prague. Stare Mesto is the heart of Prague because it is surrounded by many historical places and very close to other tourist attractions such as Charles Bridge.Many buskers at the squares provide various entertainment spots. It is a pity that it is so expensive to eat and drink
Very interesting place. A lot of history can be found here along with buildings that have seen many years of use. One should visit here to get a feel of Prague history.

Of course it's nice. You have to visit the place when you're on holiday in Prague. You won't need me or trip advisor to tell you. The only useful advice I can give is to not drink/eat here. Just a couple blocks away the prices nosedive. It feels a bit disneyland, a bit like Venice, it's all tourists or people making money from tourists. Just go a bit further and things get cheaper, more genuine, and overall nicer
absolutely beautiful. expensive to eat & drink, better off going off the side streets for food and bard whicha re just as good
Nice location with friendly staff, good food. Nothing to complain about ,very nice place, we enjoyed our evening very much and would go back should we return.
Thrilling. The old buildings are fabulous, especially at night. All major attractions are within walking distance.
You have to see.. Atmosphere is perfect. If you are planning to travel prague you must take this place in your list. The astrological clock is near by this place.

very unique. My friends and I really liked this area. The astronomical clock is beautiful along with everything else and loved the local food stands. If you choose to eat there, make sure you try the bread they wrap around a pole and rotate over coals.

It fit my conception of an old European square surrounded by old, interesting architecture.. If you like cobblestones, this is the place, which, of course, you can say of most of Prague. It's a big square with all kinds of old European architecture, statues, street performers, cafes, food vendors, horse carriages and mobs of people. Prague is confusingly layed out, but all you have to do is follow the biggest river of people to find the attractions.

excellent district to stroll along. We loved the entire feeling of this place- It was so beautiful during the day and very electric in the nights. But what I didnt like is that most of the money changers here rip u off. So its a good idea to change money else where before you enter this place.

This is the place to stay for sightseeing. The Old Town is most attractive; it can be noisy and crowded, so best to stay here November through May; later it may be just too crowded for some, but I'd still stay here
Old Town-Prague. Old Town in Prague was fascinating. Definitely worth visiting, including the street market and Wenceslaus Square.
Attractions. There were a lot of people so it was sometime hard to navigate through the crowd. Really like the astronomy clock tower. The view from the top was incredible.

Old and New comingle. It seems ironic that Old Town would be home to Prague's version of Rodeo drive, but here you'll find Parizska street lined with names like Hermes, Prada, Tag Heur and on and on as you enter into the Jewish Quarter (Josefov). Beyond that, Old Town is home to a plethora of smaller shops, cafes, bars and eateries.

Lots of history crammed into it. Lots of history in a small area, fun to discover :) Busy, bustling space. The astronomical clock is so cool and there are lots of cool stories to be found through the monuments and old buildings alike

lovely. Old Town is an entire neighbourhood to just walk around, be careful though, your neck might hurt from all the looking up at pretty buildings :) I would suggest this place to be the first to go in Prague, to get the feel of the city as a whole before visiting smaller attractions. It is fairly crowded though, so don't get surprised by what feels like thousands of tourists. P.S. it is strange to see St. Vitus Cathedral as the main picture of old town, as it is not exactly in there, it is on the Prague Castle which is an entirely different attraction.
all you dreamed. Prague is a well known city for great sight seeing and the old town will amaze you all you need to find and i mean everything

Wonder place to wander around.... This was exactly as gorgeous as I thought it would be. Lots of twisty old streets to get lost in and a million things to take pictures of. Can get very busy, but it's worth it. Make sure you wear flat, comfortable shoes, those cobbled streets may look lovely, but will destroy your feet and ankles!
Winding streets with beautiful shops and pastel buildings. It was near all of the attractions, but quieter and away from the Old Town Square which is very touristy and noisy.
Town Square, great atmosphere. The other historic buildings were amazing. some gothic the black spires of church looked spooky. The Astrological clock fascinating. Nice to sit and people watch.

walking around. no surprise we had to carry by hand our e-bykes , nowaday all famous places are expected to be overcrowded : but it was worthwhile. I most appreciate the attitude of local people to valorize their inheritage and how civilized they are towards foreigners.

fantastic city. one of the most beautiful cities. i have been there on serveral occasions and it is stunning every time. the entire city center is renovated and there is vertually no new buildings. no matter where you look it is picture perfect.
interesting. fairly roomy; unique interest in square. amazing clock which is actually 3 clocks but difficult to interpret.

A central point for walking the old town. The old town square is a winding walk across cobblestone streets from the entry gate. This is a large open area from which you can access either the Charles Bridge or the Jewish Quarter. Around the area are lots of really nice restaurants from the expensive to café style and most boast open air seating. This is also the place to find a number of walking and the Segway tours.

Every Building a Feast for the Eyes. Sitting in the middle of Stare Mesto is the most ideal way to enjoy the great architecture and history of the city of Prague. If you can ignore the crowds, the really bad street performers, and unsavory types (drunken revelers and assorted scammers), you can absorb all the ornate decoration and imagine the centuries of history that took place on that very spot. It is not easy to find a place to sit, but it is well worth the wait, and eventually people do vacate their benches.

best bit for night out. this is a very pretty bit of prague has a lot of cafes and bars in this area but this also means it attracts lots of groups ie stag parties. Can be quite expensive in this area but nice to chill with a drink and watch the world go by whilst surrounded by beautiful buildings.

Very clean and quaint. Lots of street entertainers. cobbled streets small shops and lots of bars and restaurants.It was quite crowded as the streets are very narrow. The atmosphere was very happy safe and friendly.
Night and day. Few cities can brag night and day walks which are equally breathtaking. Too many tourists for my taste but the city is safe laid back and full of life. A real stand out.
Beautiful Old Town. Old Town is fantastic. The buildings are well preserved from before WWII. The Astronomical Clock is not to be missed.
Watch the world go by.... Find a spot and soak up the Prague atmosphere! Lots of people, very touristy and some good street performers. Make sure you visit both during the day and at night.
Lovely. This is a lovely square that has the famous astrological clock tower in it. Lovely ambiance with plenty to discover!!

What more is there to say?. I love European old towns! They are almost always the most interesting places in a city. Developers have been stopped in their endless quest to knock down an rebuild modern rubbish and old towns are now major areas to visit. Prague old town is a stand out space! Have a gander at the stunning architexture, churches, other buildings and the statues of the old dead guys. Grab a beer, sit back and watch the world go by. The old square is crowded and noisy. Beware of the two levels of currency exchange...don't get ripped off. Take a tour...I recommend the Prague Free Tour which starts on the North side of the square. Enjoy.

crowded. crowded but nice, very artistic, yet young in spirit. people are from every race imaginable, makes your trip a very nice one. salvador dali exhibition right in the midst of it all makes it even nicer. enjoy the food carts over there, go for the sweets, since the salty foods aren't of highest quality
Don't miss it. Very nice and a place not to miss visiting. Very turistic, of course, but you are one of them, right?

An area full of life. Wide open square surrounded by beautiful buildings. Open air cafes, food stalls and restaurants as you would expect, street entertainers, A place to linger and watch the world go by.

Stayed in the heart of Old Town. Unique experiences awaiting you at every corner of narrow streets… which will lead you to the square with famous Astronomical Cloak, the best Museum on Jewish heritage in Jewish Quarter, Charles Bridge and St. Vitus Cathedral
Delightful area. I love to walk the streets of Old Town and visit the shops. Lots of small cafes where you can find anything to your liking.

Prague, the place everybody should see at least once.. All the old town has been kept in pristine condition, you can walk for hours and never get bored. Architecture, colors, when you look up you forget you are in the 21rst century. When you look down, you see the thousands of tourists and the overpriced souvenirs.
Full of character. Great traffic free location with wonderful almost fairy tale-like architecture. Town hall and clock well worth visiting.

Old Town, Prague. Prague was exceedingly nice; especially the old town. The free walking tour by Ashley was wonderful. He was hilarious and kept the attention of a group of around 40. That aside, if you are looking for souvenirs, the cheaper ones within Old town are the shops in front of the New Old synagogue in the Jewish quarters.

numerous interesting places. guides tour in the Clementinum, very intersting. You have to climb steep stairs up to the Astronomic tower. Guides tours in Czech, English, and by option, in German. And: Bethlehem chapel, were Jan Hus prayed. Now a lecture hall for the Technical university.
pretty streets. lovely area to walk around the old cobbled streets and discover new areas. many restaurants and cafes are hidden in the streets and tend to be cheaper than the square

Beautifully Preserved but Jammed. Beautiful buildings from the many eras of Prague crowd together in winding streets with charming or quirky sights around every corner. Lots of interesting shops, and not all of them are tourist traps. Jammed with people day and night, so be patient as you work your way through the crowds. But simply not to be missed.

A old charm well maintained.. We stayed in a rented apartment at Kozna street. It was a real experience. Get down from the apartment walk left in two minutes you reach the clock tower and cathedral. Take right you reach the market with brand shops as handicraft market. Best is that prices are reasonable.

Walk and Get lost in the back alley's. Quaint village life in the heart of the City, great tea, Ice cream and wine bars, stop at any and the service is humble and very low key, you buy a drink you own the table. Super clean W/c's city wide.
Great streets to wander. Old town streets and atmosphere is a big draw on a fine day. Check out the street markets and if there are any wine and food festivals - Wine for 30CHK (and really nice too).
Amazing Place. Here you can find most of the interesting Churches, Museum,Restaurants,it's filled with plenty of Arts because of the beautiful features and that,s why it's also interesting.

Great place to get lost. We loved this part of town, every street is amazing...
Easy to get lost, much more interesting to splinter off the main drag

Unmissable while in Prague!. Having kept the savor of the old Prague, The Old Town is an unmissable place for every traveler that goes to the Capital of the Czech Republic!The Old Town has a lot of attractions, museums, churches, a lot of old buildings, very well preserved, also a lot of pubs & bars & restaurants and many souvenir shops. The street musicians also bring their contribution to a wonderful atmosphere. That's the place you can feel the SPIRIT of Prague!
Bucket List Material. A must see in our books. A fabulous example of a old, old city. So much to see through the winding lane ways - beautiful!

can't miss this. It's hard to imagine anyone would visit Prague and not visit this square. The astronomical clock, Tyn church, St Nicholas, and the buildings surrounding the square are a delight to view. It does get very crowded but there is ample space and lots of street vendors as well as cafes in the immediate area.

Explore Prague Old Town on foot. Prague Old Town is compact and filled with interesting buildings and places to explore. It's easy to get around on foot though there are other options from horse-drawn carriages to (replica) vintage cars as well as public transport. The town square gets crowded but disperses as soon as the clock has chimed so if you don't like crowds its best to go just after the hour. There are numerous concerts - many playing virtually the same programme so check carefully before booking - unless you like comparing performances of the same pieces. We found it a safe city but did witness a mugging. There was a quick response from 4 guys who came running from all sides of the square, apprehended the assailant, returned the stolen goods and everyone went on their way. We found that interesting restaurants tended to be away from the main streets but the tourist places are reliable and not too over priced. Vegetarians will struggle but there is usually fish available.

a beautiful place to explore. The old town is always busy with tourist but is still delightful to stroll around looking at the beautiful buildings and stopping for a break at one of the many bars and restaurant.

This Baroque city is beautiful.. This is the busy and lively heart of Prague. We wandered the streets and spent much time on the square. If you visit Prague for a short visit you must visit the old town.
Busy but very pretty. It is lovely to wander through and have a look but is very busy. We stopped and watched the Astronomical clock chime and moved on.

A Fun Place to Hang Out for An Hour. The Tyn Church, Astronomical Clock & St. Nicholas church are here. It's a large square with lots of restaurants, cafes and shops. (If you're looking to save money, don't eat in the square. You can get all the same food much cheaper outside of the square). There were a few strange "acts" performing when I was there, e.g. a guy blowing giant bubbles and some (seemingly drunk) guy dressed up as a Native American dancing in circles.

Lovely, Romantic, Charming. I prefered walking around Old Town rather than Malá Strana, but I guess the staggering amount of people during the day might be overwhelming for some (think New York during Christmas).
OK..YOU HAVE TO GO. to the square to see he clock ON THE HOUR and then buy a sausage from one of the street vendors. It's part of Prague! (You'll buy a second sausage...the other color.:)

Amazing atmosphere and great sights. Went to Stare Mesto in the morning on a not so sunny day but were not disappointed for a second with all that we saw. Old town square was bustling with people and music and all kinds of shops and souvenirs, the atmosphere was amazing and the place was a real treat with the astronomical clock, the Tyn church, the church of St Nicholas all located around the square. We went to the top of the tower to get a view from up above and that in itself was a great experience with views across to the castle as well as to Vysehrad and the outer districts of Prague. Tyn Church is a truly stunning church once inside and is an oasis of quiet in the otherwise bustling square. The jewish museum is not too far from the square and can be walked to comfortably.Try catching lunch and a drink at one of the numerous cafes on the old town square and sit back and enjoy the atmosphere of this beautiful place.
Outstanding achitecture!!. The Astronomical clock dating from the Middle Ages is extraordinary. The buildings and churches around the square are very special. While there go to a concert!

Don't buy Old Ham from Old Town Square. We were charged $618 for two pieces of ham and a few slices of bread, we asked for just half the portion but the vendor firmly refused, apparently the customers don't get a say in how much we wish to purchase. The ham was OK but too much and too salty, the bread was not so tasty. As a result we were too full from the meal and the water we drank to wash it done and we didn't get to try anything else.

Beautiful. The architecture is just stunning. The Orloj clock is worth a stop. I didn't appreciate all the money change booths and trinket shops, but it is a worthwhile stop to sit and have a Czech beer.
city break. Always very crowded bars expensive atmosphere excellent, loads to see.Guided tours are very informative.

Could use some more zoning regulations.. The old town is really beautiful. No question about it. Absolutely stunning, especially from any of the numerous vantage points around town. So I really wanted to like this part of Prague. Walking in the streets themselves, however, leaves something to be desired... there are innumerable money changing booths, (junky) souvenir stores, and costumed actors asking for money. More than I've seen in any other city, by far (e.g.; more than New York, London, Vienna, Tokyo, Budapest, etc etc etc). Unfortunately, there is not very much interesting going on in this area. Seriously, how many times can one person change their money to Crowns or buy trinkets to take home? How about adding some specialty stores that sell identifiably Czech things? Limiting the money changing shops to one or two per street? Despite all this, you really have to at least see this area to imagine what it once looked like as it is, in its bones, one of the most beautiful cities around. This is why I still give it 4/5 stars. Maybe someday it will be more pleasant to walk around here :).

Gorgeous architecture, historical value. The only negatives regarding this square are the pricey restaurants, that seem to all have the same menu of "traditional Czech food", which as a vegetarian, was not a possibility.(See my review of Maitrea Restaurant if you have an interest in a solid vegetarian restaurant) The buildings are beautiful, and right out of a fairy tale, and the Astronomical Clock is a big draw for its on the hour ritual. This is definitely where you'll want to start your trip and hang out in the evening.
Good atmosphere to sit with a drink. Always enjoy people watching and some good street entertainers. Scrumptious foods from stalls (sausages and enormous crisps on a stick). Nice just to 'hang out'

Prague Old Town. The old town in Prague is probably one of the most visited tourist attractions in the city. The main attraction being the clock in the old town square. Lots of restaurants and bars serving good Czech beer

Prague adventure. fabulous and varied architecture; many concerts at 5 or 7 each evening; must see: Jewish Museum (actually several fascinating venues); Museum of Communism; castle; St. Vitus Cathedral; Golden Lane; St. Nicholas Church in Old Town Square; Mucha Museum; Modern ARt Museum; easy place to travel alone; good shop for reasonably priced Czech made goods-Manufactura;
weekend break. quaint, cobbled streets, good atmosphere, plenty to see and do. easy to get around. Good local transport which we used a lot with a 3 day travel pass
What is not to love?. We had a fantastic trip with our children.. so much to see & do. We took a tour on the first day to help us get out barings

Beautiful anytime of day. The Old Town area of Prague is so lovely with lots of beautiful buildings and little streets. At Christmastime it is truly magical, especially if it is snowing. It's one our favourite city centers in Europe. All of the different styles of buildings and the lovely features make it a real treat to just walk around and enjoy the view.

Fabulous architecture. A lovely place to wander around and see the wonderful architecture in Prague. It is very crowded and beware of beggars and pick pockets. Don't eat in the surrounding cafes go back a few blocks and enjoy real Czech cuisine and save a fair bit of cash in the process.
Clock the clock. It's approaching the hour but you're too late for the best spots to see the clock doing what it does best. Get there 15 minutes before the hour to see it face on.
Very interesting place to see .... Very interesting place to see, especially the Clock Tower - it looks like form B.C. century:), it has so historical feeling, TD

History and charm. Nobody visits historic European cities to look at the new squares or shopping precincts. OK, maybe the latter is not true for some people, but surely most people go for places like this - history all around you and a distinctive feel of old Europe.
Just a townsquare. Nice town square, but whats more is it really? Good spot as a junction for further strawls in the old town.

Not to miss. The true feel of old Europe that has been squeezed out of London and Paris. I love cities that have a deep sense of time and Prague is clearly one of them. Seeing centuries of time and architecture in a single eyeful is inspiring.If you are in Prague, not likely you will miss Old town but give yourself a chance to just walk around on your own and soak it in.

Great place to hang out. This is just the most exciting place to visit. Besides being beautiful, with all it's rich history and architecture, there's something for everyone. There's the wonderful little shops, great restraunts, entertainment inside and out, lots of places to sit, order a drink and just people watch. It's so open, and amazingly clean, you just want to head back every evening of your visit and soak up Prague and the people. Love seeing all the youth just sitting around on the ground hanging out and staying out of trouble in the evening.

The best city in the world. The city and people is just the best in the world. Fantastic value for food and drink. The hospitality is second to none. Everyone is so helpful despite the language barrier. By far the most romantic city knocks spots off Paris and Rome.

Lots of fun!. Great food stalls, people sitting outside restaurants watching the world go by, a swing band, living statues, an alternative new wave band, an escapologist and some truly magnificent buildings. Oh, don't forget the horses and carriages and the vintage cars offering tours... or the 6 person bicycles and the electric rickshaws and segways... fascinating!
Charming. Beautiful, quant town centre surrounded by buildings with many different architectual styles. Go early to avoid the crowds.
worth to visit .. lot of tourists there and worth to visit the clock and all the curches and towers around the square and bridges.

Wonderful.. The old part of Prague is a beautiful combination of churches, squares, houses and monuments.You can literally spend hours just strolling along its beautiful streets.Since it's not that big, make sure not to miss any of the numerous attractions.A 4-5 hour walk through this part of town is enough to experience its lovely atmosphere.
Old town. Too busy with tour groups and prices are very high in this tourist area. May be better in off-season
Zlata Praha!. Zlata Praha means Gold Prague refering to its beauty. I've visited the city so many times and Old Town in Prague never disappointed me like love at first sight.
Overcrowded and full of downmarket tourists and touts. Town Square was so full over loud tour guides and touts for various attractions. Avoid overprices eateries.

Worth a visit. Great place to sit and people watch. Fantastic street food and drink which is far cheaper than the restaurants directly on the square. For better value, just go back a couple of streets and you will find some beautiful reasonably priced places to eat.
Good insight. A big difference to the new town part of Prague but here is where the history really is. Great insight into the city.

Old Town. Great old town sector. Way better than vienna's. Something not to miss. Go to the old town hall and watch the clock show played every day on the hour. Winding strees old stunning architecture and wonderful food. You have been whisked back 200 years. Enjoy it!
Old Town. Was bitterly cold and snowing when we were there but still managed to get around, felt very safe and people were very helpful.

must see. Beautiful beautiful square. Many tourist sites there (the clock etc). As an aside beware of pick pockets - a lot of people hang around Old Town Square getting up to no good! Its a tourist haven but as a result a trap!

Stunning Architecture, lovely atmosphere. Just back from 3 days in Prague, we were based in the New Town, to be avoided at all costs. However the Old Town is stunning. Winding streets, beautiful buildings and innumerable amount of bars & cafes. Really enjoyed my visit.We had some lovely food, However be careful some of the cafes are charging outrageous prices for coffees & water etc.

absolutely stunning. amazing views from every angle. try to research a bot of the history before you check it out. you must catch the astronomical clock tower shows on the hour, every hour. not very fascinating by todays standards, but amazing when you consider when it was created.

Like it says, old town, nicely preserved. There are many tourists there, which really isn't surprising. And many many shops, bars, restaurants serving the tourists. And being a tourist, we had nice couple of days wandering around this beautiful old town, had a cuppa, a cold beer, light meal there. And took a lot of photos. But mainly enjoyed us.
Nice athmosphere. Nice city to visit. If you take hotel from old town most of the attractions is walking distance from Hotel.

great buzz. Great architecture combined with lots to see, and good places to eat. Prices are a bit more here and it is worth walking just a few streets away to find beer at half the price, but this is the hub of Prague.

A truly beautiful place. The old town of Prague is a wonderful place. The views from the top of St. Nicholas cathedral and the tower on Karluv Most are wonderful, but you have to climb quite a few stairs to get up there. Here are some photos of the city.

One of the best old town area in Europe. We walked down the Charles bridge (starting from the side on Malostranské náměstí ) towards the old town square. After crossing Charles bridge, we took Karlova and took the U Karpa street to reach the old town square. We did this in light and after the sunset. Absolutely fantastic experience. Check the style in which some of the street names are marked. Especially, the U Karpa street.
Crowds. Lots of people, fun and great places to eat. Got lost a few times a streets from square are narrow and twisty

Just as we imagined. The crystal shops abound, but most of them are made in China. Only the Preciosa brand is made in Czech Republic. Prices are all negotiable for the Chinese replicas. the buildings are spectacular and are well preserved
beautiful archhitecture. Lots of winding streets and lovely buildings. Easy Old town to walk around , but beware cobbled streets so flat shoes are best

Quaint Old Town. Have a good stroll, take a long walk, go through the cobblestones alleyway, browse the bazaar, take your time, enjoy the atmosphere/architecture etcTHIS IS OLD TOWN PRAGUE.To avoid crowds try early mornings

Watch out for the trumpeter on the hour.. Loads to see. Busy activities going on all day. Artists. Bubble blowers! People statues entertainers musicians. On Saturday we were also entertained to about 1000 Slavia Prague football fans marching through the square escorted by riot Police for the local derby with Sparta. Great atmosphere and what pictures! As a place to see things there is plenty to see but save buying food and drink for somewhere a few streets off this expensive food location

just keep walking. this is one of the places to get lost. Get an app or a map so you don't wander away and just keep strolling. The further you get from the bridge or the main square the quieter and more magical it gets. head into the Jewish quarter, down to the river then wander back in.

Prague Cathedral. Able to visit only a part because we forgot to get entry tickets. Impressed by architecture and size. Prefer this to the Milano Duomo! We admited the stain glass windows and frescoes.

everything is so well kept. amazing architecture!. Don't change money there!!! wspecially at the western union branch right at the square. the guy is a thief, on the sigh the rate was good but it says there not in English.. that you need to exchange a huge amount to get this rate. when we got 1700 instead of 2300 he will not return our money. after yelling at him he added some more so we ended up getting 2200. it really made us feel bad.
Not a good value for money. Restaurant was recommended by hotel but food was way too expensive and under average. Staff pleasant though, but it just wasn't enough.
Beautiful architecture. fantastic place to admire gothic, neoclassical and even cubist styles...lots of places to eat and shop.

A city that rivals all of the greats!. The old town itself durign the Easter Market was phenonmenal- just eating with street vendor food and enjoying a beer was a stand out in a long excurision. The city feels so safe and is so reasonable. All are welcoming and proud people. Many tourist shops on the side streets- yet such good deals to be had- and not too many hard sellers!

Fascinating streets and sites. As in all big cities, the old town area of Prague is the most fascinating area to visit, leading from the Charles Bridge through small streets and squares to churches and on to the Jewish quarter and the Wenceslas Square/New Town area - in comparison, the latter is just shops and more shops without the charm of the old town.

Packed with tourists. Lovely square although can get a bit packed as the large groups congregate in front of the clock.The clock is worth the wait, it chimes on the hour and saints rotate round. Finally the rooster crows- all is good.
Walkable magic. Very walkable and loved the various little streets with treasures to be discovered!Be sure to wander around at night as the city is at its most Magical.
Old Square. We caught the last few days of Easter celebrations. Great fun with live music and performing artists in the square

town square. don't miss the clock chiming every hour - very busy but worth the wait, even in the cold. Market stalls in the square - some are a bit tacky, but still worth a look. restaurants here are a bit highly priced.

walking around all the time. what else can you do in the old town? walking and admiring all these buildings,despite the cold,let your self wandering around and often have a stop in a local to have a cup of cofee.

Quaint and Original. Numerous places to sit and watch the world go by, no building more than 9 stories and very clean. Worth visiting over Christmas or Easter for the big markets in the square and if you are a millionaire and ideal shopping street exists just down from the Cechuv (Most) Bridge.
stunningly beautiful. Thebuildings are just wonderful. The street scapes are clean and very accessible. Most museums are closed on mondays

Great Beautiful Shopping. Totally a Tourist Destination, but the quaint little streets are fantastic to wander around looking for souvenirs. The souvenirs in this area include the typical plastic things made in china that every city in the world has but also exceptionally beautiful unique things you can't find anywhere else.

Worth it. My wife and I walked around the old town several times, as it is filled with shops, bars, restaurants and cafe's. We even stumbled upon a food festival that took place in the main square in front of the famous Church. The narrow streets, man paved roads are very cute to walk through and safe at night. We enjoyed our walks there both during the day and the evenings, though it was rather cold when we were there with temperatures ranging from 1-2 centigrade in the evenings to a maximum of 9 in the mornings and we did not see the sun throughout our stay there during the third week of November. The old town is definitely a worth while destination which we highly recommend to any Prague visitor.
Charming. Even tho it is flooded with tourists, it is just charming to walk around the old streets. A bit touristy shopping but fun any way.

Easter market in old town. We were very lucky to catch the last day of the easter market in the old town square! It was good fun and we ate loads of stuff. The old town also has the beautiful tyn church as well as the astronomical clock which we only understood after the guide explained to us.

Narrow pedestrian streets that are actuallu lived in by locals. The best part was that the locals were there - not just us tourists. Saturday afternoon, groups of young and old wandering the streets. In the old suqre were booths serving local foods: chesse, hams, sausages, and the fantastic cake cooked over coals on rotating skewers - great studd. Then there is the beer or, given very cool weather, warm wine (!?!).

Yes, go here. So many cool things here. Grab a map or a guide book and have at it. There are several "free" (work for tips) tour guides. I tried the ones wearing the Yellow shirts and thought they were ok.
romantic old city. it is wonderful sightseeing! romantic walking! excellent food experience also!it is wonderful sightseeing! romantic walking! excellent food experience also!
Charming. Lovely cobble streets charming building lots to see & do in this area plenty of hotels, bars, coffee shops places to eat, lots of shops & theatres.

beautiful old buildings!!. Prepare to walk!!! No transport drops you off in old town, except for subway. It was Easter, so crowded, but full of food and craft tents. Book a walking tour, so you get the lowdown on all the architecture, it spans many centuries. Very clean area in spite of all the people.
Wind your way to Wenclas square. Wenclas square was great as was the astronomical clock. Great Thai foot massage place, helps with tired feet. Easy to get lost and street directions are not perfect.
hell on earth. only good bit was the flight home. nothing to commend the place at all. Bitterly cold, icy underfoot. have they never heard of snow and ice clearance?

Full of History. The Old Town is home to some of the most beautiful architecture in all of Europe, it has some truly breathtaking buildings. Get a tour of the Town and immerse yourself in Czech history.

Street food, shopping and souvenirs. We walked around down town for a while we were in Prague, and we ended up finding good restaurants and bars while in the area, that were not too expensive. The buildings and architecture in Old Town are to die for. But beware of pickpockets, and falling trap into just hitting the name brand stores that line the streets, unless you are into that kind of thing. Make sure to grab a string of potato chips or a fried cheese sandwich from one of the local street vendors. You can't go wrong.
Fabulous. Fantastic, Easter markets where on. Very traditional and cultural. An excellent time of year to visit.
Just beautiful, especially at night. It still had the easter markets which were great, for both foods and presents. Loved the castle spires lit up at night.
romantic old town. It´s so nice, charming, romantic...I love it in night. It´s the best...the lights make more romantic. ;)
excellent. plenty to do and see although prague is very expensive now,at least same as prices in britain. had market stalls which were nice

Great area of the city as long as you are careful. Great area of the city as long as you are careful and dress appropriately for the weather - it was literally freezing the week we were there and we'd expected European Spring temperatures and had packed accordingly.Prague 1 is beautiful and if you can avoid the worst of the crowds and few negative aspects of the area (actually less bad than other major euro cities) then you will have an amazing time! We stayed for 5 days and still didn't see everything we could of as we concentrated on the main sites and one or two exhibitions, didn't do main museums.
So much to see . . .. We took a walking tour and saw such a lot of fascinating sights. The architecture is quaite overwhelming. Prague is a beautiful city!
Graet place in the heart of the city. Great place to spend your day in, all the sites are walking distance and the atmosfere is great.you can sit anjoy good food and great atmosfere

Typical European town square. As with any tourist attraction - visit at peak times and you're going to get harassed and annoyed due to the large number of people in a relatively small space. But go back when it's quiet and you'll have plenty of time and space to marvel at the amazing architecture.Make sure you wander off down the nondescript side streets and alleyways (it's a very safe place) to see stuff the tourist books don't tell you!
Old Town. Amazing. Like walking through an open air museum. Slow down and reallymtake in the sights as this is classic Europe.
Brilliant Place. It is a magical place brimming with fantastic architecture and has a really nice atmosphere. We were lucky because there was an easter market on which just added that bit extra :-)

best hotel in town, near to the nice sight seeing.I enjoy staying at this hotel, it's super good, good breakfast, when w. I would always come back to this hotel I enjoy staying at this hotel, it's super good, good breakfast, when we comeback at the night there were nice delicate food at our room's table, nice and best information from the hotel staff, especially Mr. Martin at the front desk, good service and best service from front desk for example, as my flight has been cancelled, Martin called/inform me at the Düsseldorf airport and prepare for my next shuttle service. It's an excellent service. I had never ever got this service from other hotel. I meant, if my flight has been cancelled, it's not interest for the hotel to inform me and called me in Germany (long distance from other country). Well I have no idea what is the best word for it, better then BEST :) If I visit Prag again, I will surely chose this Hotel Pod Vezi, Mostecka 58 / 2, Prague 118 00, Czech Republic, Last but not least, I still have a small Improvement for this hotel; it might be nice if there is a ramp for wheelchair, in front of the lift?? so the this will comfort disable guess to find the lift without help :) .Wheelchair accessible. I'll come and check in a view year later :)Anyway, its the only small proposal, only for disable guest. I think, the most guest are able body, so for the able body, the hotel is the best of the best :)Lily Anggreny, Germany

Sightseeing. Astronomical clock in the city hall is very impressive. Everyone was waiting in front of city hall at every hour to see how the clock was moved. I highly recommend to visit city hall with tour guide. We had very nice guide that he was speaking four languages and telling every small detail about the building. İt is possible to climb the towers and it is very nice especially at night. We were there at eastern and there was very nice open market. There were plenty of churches around, if you have less time you can just walk around and see nice buildings.
Great place to visit. Great to take a lot of pictures. One piece of history just around the corner. ideal to walk and take a beer in a bar.

Easter in Prague. A treat awaits you with this lovely city, fabulous old town and castle, the Ultimate Prague trip with Nina is fantastic and fun. A ride round the old town and jewish quarter is really special. The Charles bridge is crowded but worth going to. Excellent boat trips and Trams

Easter break.... Old Town Square was a happening spot. There were so many restaurants and bars and vendors that we enjoyed it. Usually when walking to different attractions, we always ended up passing Old Town Square.

MAGICAL. My favourite historical square. A 'must see' if you go to Prague ! Visit the church, and go to the top of the Astronomical Clock Tower, for amazing views. Watch / listen to the clock, on the hour. Drinks etc, are more expensive in the square, but worth having at least one, to soak up the atmosphere of the place.
busy busy busy. a tourist trap, some sights to see. cant really see much unless later in the evening or early morning. crowds are thick as nails otherwise.

The best area of Prague. Of course, this place is why Prague is worldwide famous. Just take your time to stroll around in the majestic square and the small alleys, have fun, eat a trdelnik and enjoy the feel of taking a trip back to the Middle Ages (the good part).
:). you cannot miss the visit of Old town during your stay in Prague!! I live in Prague for couple of years but I love to walk around the city :)
Packed. It's packed but some great buildings to look at. The 'market' was a little on the kitsch side and there are plenty of people pestering you as you walk around. I did like U Tri Ruzi though.
very pleasant area. Good for a walk. Busy with tourists. Lots of tourist tat. Not the best, but pleasant enough for a couple of hours maximum.

Great place!. Great architecture, incredably tall buildings, very romantic. Strolling through the dark alleys in the night is beautiful during christmas holidays. Shops, streets and squares are all decorated.

Very pretty. You can spend an afternoon walk around with your love one. So romantic. There are some art and design sculpture. The view is very nice, good for traveller to take lot of picture days and nights.

Outstanding!. The Old town is amazing - we loved the beautiful old streets, ancient buildings and the church. We spent there more than 4 hours, so if you are going to visit most places and the church, please plan your time accordingly. We were here during Easter and we loved the Easter markets! Here is the special food to try - trdelnik (sweets), hot wine, sausage.
The heart of Prague. Fantastic architecture and pretty clean. An American colleague remarked on the graffiti, but as a European this hadn't impinged on my consciousness.

Very nice but full. We went here with family and it was so nice and the historical buildings were amazing but there is one problem with it: the streets are tight and there is a lot of people there. But altogether it's so cool.
Xmas Market. Xmas decoration and tree excellent with a wide range of stalls all willing to 'Haggle'. Varieties of food available a reasonable prices.
Awesome old town. The old town is charming, full of little shops, cafes and restaurants. Feels very cozy, boisterous and welcoming
Lovely buildings. Very impressed with Old Town, lovely old buildings, liked the various stalls, lots of restaurants in the vicinity
not too crowded in March. Loved the Mucha exhibition and found a very friendly cafe beneath it where staff spoke excellent English and offered me a seat when I was standing waiting for my sister.
Must see in Prague. Old town is a must see in prague. it is preserved as old town. Many good restaurants.many attractions nearby

Best Prague attraction. The must-see place to visit, especially st. Vitus cathedral. Don't miss the small streets around the Old Town - nice and very atmosphere place. Inside the Town you can find many nice buildings and churches.

A must. I really don't think you can go to Prague and not visit the Old Town. As much as there is to see, try to tour around the other neighbourhoods as well. And probably everyone understands that the best pubs and restaurants are not in the tourist streets. You should try to avoid shopping there as well since the prices can be double. Just walk around, see the Old town square with the famous clock and take in the atmosphere of the narrow streets and beautyful buildings.

You can't miss out on this part of town. You can't miss out on this part of town if you are visiting Prague. The old town square is a hub of activity in Prague. It is just a few steps away from the astronomical clock. Be sure to go to the top of the tower in the Old Town Hall, this is the most nice view of all old areas of Prague.

Magical city.. Prauge is a magical city and Old Town is a must see. We had the hot wine that kept us warm because it was very cold. Lots of stores and little market place to purshase souvenirs and restaurants to eat.

beautiful place. Truly truly a beautiful square with so much character. A must visit locstion BUT do beware of the hot food stalls. Their prices are very confusing and some seem to take immensr pleasure in fleecing tourists

Lively. We visited during hockey season and the czech team was in the finals. Old town was full of fans and supporters watching the game on giant outdoor screens, their were beer stands everywhere and the chanting and cheering was intoxicating. So much fun!

Stunning City, Charming Cobbled Streets, the Best!. The 'Old Town' of Prague is an amazing place. It has everything, from a bustling central square to lovely quiet cobbled streets, and little archways, and tunnels leading you through a maze, to Charles Bridge or Wenceslas Square in the other direection. Big market was help during my latest stay, which sold everything from hot hearty czech dishes, to cold glasses of Pilsner (the best :) I loved to go 1 or 2 streets out from the obvious tourist routes, to see the czechs view of their own city. You reduce your costs hugely, and you get the czech experience you are hopefully looking for. I never get tired of Prague, and I will surely be back.

Loved the Old Town. This was the most beautiful part of our trip. We visited the old town 3 or 4 times. During the day & at night. The Architecture is beautiful, there are many shops and restaurants. The Square is alive day 7 night. Must see...
nice. Wonderful Place With great charm and character, and lot of historical buildings and history. Need to be seen.
Quaint with a mideviel feel. Town center was nice, the architechture was beautiful and the restaurants were fun. Nice to get a cocktail late in the day and people watch too.
Pretty but.... . Pretty, love the architecture and all, but found a lot of graffetti on some of the streets. Really pulls the place down, unfortunatelly really.

Wonderful. There are just so many buildings to admire, such a large area were everything is historical with little alleys here and there but also large squares and wide streets. Loads of churches to visit..Too much to list here JUST GO THERE!

Unique and beautiful. It's hard to believe that so much of this magnificent city has survived the ravages of time, especially the last century. I'm sure that the previous communist regime would have flattened the place out of spite, had they had the money. But thankfully they didn't and this extraordinary civic landscape survives in all its glory. Now of course a UNESCO World Heritage Site and rightly so. If you stay for a month you won't see all of it, but soak up what you can while you're here.
pretty. Lovely they have a fantastic easter market. very pretty. Please watch out for the pick pockets and ask to see the menu of any cafe you go into.
niceeeeeeee. fantastic place.be careful to false change and overpriced shops and restaurants in this place. i reccomend one trip on the top of the tower

The heart of Prague. The architecture is so varied and interesting: you never know what you're going to find round a corner, stunning churches, museums, a concert hall, a row of ornate, multi-coloured houses, upmarket shops, a street market, cosy cafes and restaurants. The list is endless. The atmosphere is vibrant and friendly. There was nothing to dislike apart from graffiti but you get used to this.
Full of tourists (although not surprising!). This is a good place to visit if you want to see the normal tourist things. Lots of people and quite crowded.
Interesting but touristy. Interesting area but the main bits are very touristy with prices to match, go off to the back streets for interesting buildings and better prices.

Cool sites. A definite stop if you are traveling! The Old Town area has phenomenal restaurants, bars and nightclubs, I strongly suggest visiting in the spring because you will have more time to travel and take in the true beauty of Prague.
OLd Town prague. The Old Town was really good. The sites are excellent and the resturants are good. Girls do not wear high heels as you will break either your ankle or heel.
Very Picturesque. Every attraction you could visit without paying for a Tour guide just buy a tour book in any of the shops or in the tunnel leading to the Charles bridge!
Easter time. Really nice to be there during Easter, the market was great and lots of vendors and food and music! They had a huge stage set up, and the kids were having a blast!

Super service as expected. Very good placed Hilton Hotel Old Town in the centre of the historical part of beautiful Prague. Clean and quiet rooms, good services and really professional and pleasant service of executive lounge. Will turn for sure when nextly in Prague.

Free entertainment. lots of entertainment going on day and night for free, or donation if you like.Its the norm in these places,you know live statues ,jugglers,music etc, they all add to the feel of the place,I became very fond of the singing and music of buskers "Jazz no problem" in the afternoon while sipping a cold beer.
Beautiful!. Although it was very busy (we went in the middle of July) I still had enough time to take lots of pictures of the place. Lovely architecture.
