Jewel among the European Old Towns. Old Town is definitely must to see! Explore the narrow streets twisted one into each other! Here are top attractions: Tyn Cathedral, Jewish Museum, Astronomical Clock and Clementinum!
Astranomical clock was the main attraction. Lovely place to visit, very crowded and the bars are so very expensive. But a must when you vist Prague

Fascinating!. You can't miss out on this part of town if you are visiting Prague. There is history all around you and beautiful buildings and impressive architecture on every corner. Make sure you dont spend all your time in the old town square, but take time to venture through the narrow cobblestone streets stretching all over the old town.

City Centre. This has a lot of history around it, you can see age old buildings and architecture, there is an astronomical clock and you can walk around the narrow lanes to explore Prague. You can walk to the prague castle from here, its about 10-15 mins walk.

Explore away from Old Town Square. Whilst the Old Town Square is surrounded by beautiful architecture, it does become crowded and I understand the restaurants are quite expensive there. Try rambling down the side streets, the buildings a just as impressive and the eateries far less commercial and expensive. I don't agree that it is difficult to get lost, you can usually find your way to tourist spots by following the brown tourist signs.
Amazing place. Just go there and see it foe Your self... The walk there takes You to the past times and history... Prague itself is amazing and worth to visit
A lot to see!. A lot of little side streets to explore! The prices of meals and drinks tend to be a lot cheaper if you choose one away from the main squares and attractions
What a clock!. You'll get lost but that is part of the fun wandering around Old Town. The square has an amazing astronomical clock, the saints parading at each hour are hard to see
beautiful square. lovely architecture, amazing clock and the view from the clock tower was fab. don;t forget to explore the surrounding lanes

Atmospheric and lively. The best part of prague in my opinion. Lots of shops but please beware do not change any money from anyone that approaches you as they give you russian money. I am afraid it happened to us.
Must see. Beautiful and full of history, definitely a must see. You can walk around as everything in Prague is very close.

Incredible Beauty. The old town was only a 10-15 min walk from our hotel and was our 'base' for our holiday, there is plenty of cafes/restaurants/tourist shops in this area.
Amazing Buildings and architecture. All the tour guides seem to start from this area so it is a good central hub to start your history of Prague

The heart of PRague. I loved the old town, specialy because there was a chrismas time, and the squares were full of Czech pastries, good food, warm wine etc. Old buildings and the old spirit give the old town the flair. Just a pleasant place to be.

Really gorgeous old town.. Not really much to say other than its beautiful. Loads to see & do.Spend hours wondering around & enjoying the sights, just one tip the stalls selling hot food is charged on weight so ends up pricey, think a bowl of potato, ham & onion was around £6.00! Shocking when you can get a main meal in any decent restaurant for the same but then it is in tourist area & it did taste fantastic!
A european gem. fantastic architecture-a photo op every 20 metres reflecting Pragues history as the central city of europe in the days when architects were artists not accountants

the most beautifull city of the world?. We have visited many cities all over the world but the centre of Prague seems the most beautiful and interesting. The old architecture, the way everything is preserved, the atmosphere and vitality and the reasonable pricing of restaurants, taxis and public transportation and its frequency are outstanding. A must for everybody.
Charles IV Bridge 1531. Its amazing that the new town is from 1531 and the Old twon before that, Prague is so rich in history, culture and spectacular mix of arquitecture.
amazing architecture. Great atmosphere around old town. the buildings are stunning. the area has a number of good eateries

Nice to walk around and shop for souvenirs. Liked the walking around, seemed safe most of the day and late evening. Astronomical clock is the free show here. There were always musicians in the main square. A lot of restaurants and cares in the area. Shopping streets a block away on either side of square.
Not to be missed. Centre of the City, so much to see and enjoy! Has a wonderful historical feel to it, is unspoiled with modern amenities just around the corner.

Always something to discover. As I am living currently in the old town I can say you can always find here something interesting whether you look for eating out, clubbing, historical sites or just hanging out that's the place to be.

Lose yourself (in a good way) in the maze that is Old Prague. I loved wandering aimlessly around the cobbled streets of the Stare Mesto. The architecture in the old town is wonderful and there are countless pubs and restaurants to choose from with great food and beer that is very cheap. Don't be too frightened to walk up quiet little side alleys off the main tourist strip as it's quite safe and well worth doing just to discover something less touristy or mainstream, such as shop that sells and makes violins, cellos etc. or some little freelance art gallery.

History, history and then more history!. What an incredible place - there is so much history here, and there was a Christmas market on while we were here, so it was even more beautiful! Just wander around and take it all in!
Old town of Prague is simply the best. The old town of Prague starts at the prague castle and goes to Orloy, the old clock of prague. Very nice place to visit and recomending to everyone
Plenty to do. lots and lots of things to do all around the square. the czechs are very industrious people and know how to enjoy themselves
Excellent. Stunning buildings ,not to busy plenty of places to rest and eat .hated the lack of toilets ,charge for these
Too many people any time. You can come here and hear russian and see russian and what great about it? But, hell, old town have empty streets, almost empty, look for it - they charming.

Enjoy many little quiet streets aside of main touristic paths. As a native,living almost 50 years in Prague, for me the escape from main touristic roads is the way I can still soak in the genuine atmosphere of the beautiful center.Do not bother too much with searching for the Czech souvenirs . Most of the things you can see on the way around you (except the glass) have nothing common with Czech country.

The center of activity. The old town square is a hub of activity in Prague. It is just a few steps away from the astronomical clock. Be sure to go to the top of the tower in the Old Town Hall - preferably at night - for the best view of all og the beautiful areas of Prague.
The Beautifulest place in Europe. It is very beautiful there. The architecture of each building is unique and worst seeing. There are a lot of small and friendly restorants there.
Take time to get lost. With the winding streets, leave your map in your pocket and take the time to get lost and enjoy every minute

Do the tour of the Town Hall. Great tour of the insides of the Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. The whole of prague was raised a story and took 80 years to complete and in the Town Hall you get to go in the cellar and see the lower ground floor and roads it's fascinating as is the chapel and views of the apostles from behind. We got to see them going round on the hour. Well worth a visit.
if you are in prague, you must visit. What would a trip to Prague be without a tour of the old town; if you only have a limited time, then add this to your list of "must see" things to do
Charm. its charm, beauty and magnificent buildings. also the market stalls roasting pig on a spit, sausages and hot wine
old buildings,street acts and junk food. a little disappointing having been to Krakow Poland.tourists head for the astronomical clock for the hourly display.
Visit once. This is the where it all happens, or seems to. Even in the depths of winter there are jazz bands, buskers, cafes open everywhere, a real holiday atmosphere in an ancient city

Come taste the heart of Prague. Prague's Old Town does not only have the Clock Tower as an attraction. It is central to a lot of activities you can do. There are good restaurants where you can try typical Czech food and pubs where you can witness how the Czechs amuse themselves in their free time. You will find it certainly does not take a lot of money to Czech this out.

lots to see and do and within easy walking distance of all attractions. Quite area but with plenty of restaurants and bars and very local to everything. Some superb views of the castle from here and very close to the Charles |bridge

Stunning. Loved this city. The architecture, history, food, drink were all just amazing, so glad we went. We spent many hours wandering the cobbled streets and lanes, getting lost numerous times, but enjoying all. Great hot chocolates and hot wine to be found in winter to warm the insides & great beers to refresh.
Old Town Square. Worth the journey just to see Church of Our Lady Before Tyn. Avoid the Ham Sellers, Ham was cold with no taste and staff rude.

Just beautiful. One of the most beautiful if not the most old cities in Europe...Stare Mesto is just the right place to spend a day of two while visiting Prague. Many cozy pubs to enjoy a Czech beer or catch up with friends.
amazing. you must go on the tour of the old town and hear the history, the people are passionate and the buildings are astounding

Going in the Winter? Try the hot wine!. Old town is gorgeous, a bit of a maze at times so take a map and you will get asked about 20 times if you want to go into a Restaurant but genuinely go look at everything you can because it's truly amazing. Then go find a pub or sit in the square with a blanket and have some lovely hot wine. Prague in Winter is freezing, yes, but possibly best enjoyed then. If you’re there with your mates, I’d recommend using the tram in the evening only, walk around in the day as much as you can as you can find some really quirky bars and shops along the way.

History on Tap. The town centre is alive with people and the centre piece is the astronomical clock. There are pleny of building & things to see & do. You can spend a goos 6 hours here just looking at the many shops & sights
Wonderful!!. A must for all tourists in Prague, this part of the city is really beautiful! But try to go early, as it gets really crowded in the middle of the day...

Fairy tale town. Surrounded by so many beautiful medieval structures! Lovely small shops all over...though one cannot see local people..only tourists can be seen which is a pity!The place is highly commercialized which may only help to lose its charm!

Get lost in the little nooks and crannies in Prague.. We didn't plan specifics in our visit to Old Town Prague, but rather walked around aimlessly absorbing the atmosphere and architecture. There are many little places that one can explore and get lost in a seemingly different world.Most streets are quite well lit at night, so safety should not be a concern. Although nothing happened to us, nor did we observed anything, one should be aware of petty crimes like pickpocket in Prague.
Beautiful. Quaint and atmospheric full of bars and restaurants. Fabulous buildings and home to the famous astronomical clock. BEWARE of "dodgy" money changers.
Great place to walk around and enjoy the environment. Very romantic place, its is nice to walk around and see the buildings with its old architecture stile.
Very romantic place. Very romantic place to spend your honeymoon there, especially shortly before the Christmas day. There is Christmas market, music is everywhere etc.

No Stag or Hen Parties seen!!!!. Walked all round the area at day and night expecting to be dodging the British drinking parties and associated horrors but only saw one (well behaved) group in 4 days. Stay away from the bars and touts in Wensceslas Square at night - expensive, hassle and strictly for the drinking groups.
old town. Only had a short time as on business but intend to return, its spectacular!!!! however beware of the pickpockets and alcohol use< keep valuables well stowed
Old town Sq. Good place to chill and loads of reasonable bars and restaurants close by. Clock tower worth a climb.
Take your camera!. Beautiful! Great people watching as well! The much photographed location will not disappoint! We had sunny and soggy days, and it was always wonderful!

Beautiful place!. One of the oldest (u don't say) squares in Prague! Surrounded by lots of ancient buildings. Very impressive and inspiring. Come here in the evening and just walk around a little bit.
Picturesque. More than typical of a central European city. Very picturesque and tourist friendly. Our visit was in February but I fear for the crowds that visitors will encounter in the summer.

Worth the walk. Outstanding architecture and amazing buildings.
Very cheap and well worth just walking the city and getting lost.
Every turn was a new adventure.
Beautiful. This is such a lovely place to view amazing buildings and take in the wonder that is Prague. You must try the hot wine from one of the stalls.

Fantastic place. If you hesitate - visit or not Prague - stop doing it. It's a fantastic place in any season of the year. For the first time I veseted it in March. In my native Saint Petersburg there was still snow but in Prague it was +15 and the sun was shining and its buildings and streets were good-looking . Lately I was there in January - wonderful and picturesque lighting of buildings made Prague like a fairy-tale fabulous city!

Well preserved old city. The old town is a tangle of narrow, winding streets filled with shops, restaurants, bars and dotted with churches and sculpture. Lots of people, even in cold February, but not overwhelming. Getting to be a little over-touristy with souvenir shops and night clubs every couple of feet.
Fairytale. The whole Prague experience was like a fairytale. Wonderfull buildings, a mix of different architecture styles form a wornderfull scene. A must-visit place!!!

Winter Walking in Old Town. The architecture of the older buildings and the general Old World atmosphere in the area were exciting to experience. People watching was interesting when walking by outdoor cafe seating area. Do be careful watching where to walk though! Many of the walkways are ancient with cobblestones and slightly uneven walking areas. There is a very helpful visitor information center next to the Astronomical Clock tower (free city maps and activity pamphlets for use). If you stop in a shop to view items remember to take a business card (usually near the cash register) so you have the address in case you want to back and purchase the proper souvenir.

Pretty even in the Winter. This is a must see and not to be missed. A wonderful slice of history, well preserved. It is breathtakingly beautiful. Take your time, stroll slowly and take in all the sights. Ignore the cheap and worthless souvenir stores, ignore the guys who offer to change money at favorable rates ( which they are not ), don't get drawn into one of the tourist restaurants. We were here in February, it was cold but we had blue skies. The advantage is that there are far fewer tourists than in the summer season. A place to remember.
old told. We kept walking into bad area's, some area's are nice, but go in the day not night! Absinthie was good there...advised to visit!
Fantastic to walk around. the old town is very well preserved, easy to walk (and can only walk to explore it), and has lots of small charming cafes!

Beautiful but Commercial. This is a beautiful place no doubt but the restaurant sidewalk extensions and cheap souvenir shops tend to distract from what is one of the nicest old world city centres in Europe. Best view is at dusk when the spot lights come on yet the sky is still light before dark.
Very Clean and well Kept. Very convenient, easy access. Hop on Hop off drops of at the square. Make sure you arrive on the hour to see the Astronomical clock

So much! Go in December. If you can manage it, going to Old Town during the Christmas holiday season is really a treat. The market that is up all year turns into a Christmas market full of lights, mulled wine, tasty treats, and cool trinkets. The whole area is very traditional feeling, and the church is beautiful to look when it's dark out. Bundle up, though!Visited Dec and March 2008
Loads to see.. Lots to see and do, with greats bars and restuarants hidden down in the old cellars.Try the fantastic choice of local speciality beers.
Get into the Prague mood. Easy to access, near by attractions, chill atmosphere when we visited a carnaval was in the middle town.
heart of the old city. Beautiful old sqaure in many ways unchanged from centuries ago. Had drinks at Hotel U Prince with a great view of the square.
We liked it a lot. Liked this a lot. Very Pretty and very old. So nice. I would recommend going, but I would stay away from buying a lot here. Pricey.
Pricey in places, but stunning and full of atmosphere. lovely old buildings, history all around you, but the drinks in the bars are expensive - check the prices carefully
Old is gold. Always something new to find in the back streets. Some of the nicest bars are in the Old Town if you're looking for somewhere not too noisy.

nice but there were other areas we liked better. old town is perfect, very perfect. Many tourists and very crowded, high prices as well. Just venture out a few blocks and you will be sure to see real prague. We found fantastic restaurants and shopping outside of old town. No issues anywhere, very safe city, just be mindful like you should be in any city. Be a smart traveler and you will have great experience.

Went during Christmas Markets, Wonderful. I would say that any other time when the christmas market wasnt on the old town square would be a great place to be but its something else when they are there. There stalls were quaint and the place was busy but not crowded. You could spend an hour their looking at the music, have lunch, buy a trdelnik!Apart from the markets there are all sorts of atractions, especially the astronomical clock where newly married couples seem to spill out of the doors every half hour. There is too much to actually put in a review, when you visit prague you have to pass by the Market every day at least twice.
Must see. Markets are fantastic a must see at Christmas time, people friendly and the pubs provide excellent food

Very charming. Prague is a very charming and beautiful city it doesnt have outstanding individual buildings and monuments like Rome but it has a collective charm and is very asthetically pleasing to the eye and i think going in winter added to the charm

Old Town Unforgetable Charm. It is a trip worthwhile. It has it's charm and beauty that makes Prague Glow. The beautiful buildings is truly of beautiful architecture that one will appreciate. We came during winter and we will certainly came again soon on another Season. I have pictures that i will treasure for a long time

Just like many other squares... Some nice buildings in the area and a fascinating clock, but not much else. Naturally the restaurants around the square are more expensive than those just a little way away from the square. And way too much salt in the food..
magical. magical place....if your going there book at least for one week because u have alot to c....and dont forget to keep a good place for the souvenirs since you have alot to buy....
very nice. can say that there was nothing to dislike, enjoyed it all, lots to see, and to photo so make sure you take one

Wonderful town even in the winter. Prague is a wonderful town and Old Town is just so unique. I never felt unsafe in my visit, and I was welcomed in all the shops and restaurants I went into. Lots of small streets but I didn't ever worry about getting lost. You could spend hours and hours just wandering and visiting the shops and churches. I would highly recommend attending an organ concert in one of the old churches.

Nice atmosphere and architecture. Well-preserved historical monuments, always very nice to stay and look. Maybe a little bit overcrowded, if you don't like crowds of tourists, try to visit in the evening.
Awesome!. So beautiful!! I was in awe just walking around. It is especially beautiful when the Christmas markets are on with all the lights and atmosphere. Memorable :)
Beautiful Baroque architecture. Beautifully restored and maintained neighborhood, with an excellent Jewish quarter. The Old Jewish cemetery is a must-see.

Have to go there. Lots to see and do around the Old Town, including churches, galleries and the town hall. Inevitably lots of tourist shops and people trying to make money out of visitors, but it's a place you have to see.
Beautiful.. Avoid the popular tourist areas for meals and drinks - twice as much as places in more 'authentic areas'.

Beautiful old town. Fabulous architecture. Stroll around, or do one of the walks which you can find in travel guides to make sure you don't miss any of the highlights.There is so much more to see than the clock and some of the main buildings.

Great place to spend a few hours. Gets a bit crowded and the restaurants along the "tourist path" are about 2-3x the price of those a block away. Best to walk around and enjoy the sites. Consider going to the top of the clock tower for a view, but the view from St. Vitus Cathedral is a million times better.

Beautiful!. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe! It is easy to stroll the streets, admire the architecture, the little shops and cafes. I suggest you hire a guide to explain the city's fascinating history. Don't leave Prague out of your route!
Beautiful old town. An absolutely beautiful city. It is old and unique with colourful buildings and architecture. The church and the old clock are must sees as well as the jewish museum.

Amazing. It was like stepping back in time. The stalls sold the traditional crafts and food. It made Christmas time very sepcial. We went on the Horse Carriage ride which was great fun. Trotting around the town, at dusk, lights twinkling everywhere huddled under a blanket because it was very cold and being snapped by photographers as we went along.
Lives up to its' reputation. Gorgeous Old Town. Gothic structures, wonderful small garnet shops, tasty food and outdoor cafes (and a Christmas market in December!)

great place for a hot chocolate. Have a hot chocolate at one of the cafes on the square !!! they are the best ever, and in the winter they give you blankets for your knees and heat lamps to sit under. Brilliant place to watch the world go by.
Fab!. Lots of lovely little shops and restaurants, especially on the sidestreets which are a bit quieter tourist-wise and nicer to visit. Worth a browse!
Charming, cobbled stone streets and little passages. Love the feeling, ambience and the style of the Old Town. Wanddering aimlessly and with a purpose were a joy to discover this gem of a city

Lots of small shops with unique gifts. Walking in this area is a real treat for North Americans, you see lots of old buildings mixed with lovely sidewalk cafe's. We checked out some neat places to eat on the official walking tour and went back later in the day to dine - fantastic.

Something for everyone. Fabulous architecture, lots of cafes and restaurants (and no more expensive than a UK city, despite warnings from the guidebooks). Avoid obvious tourist traps and remember to keep looking up to appreciate just how beautiful the buildings are

Architecture abound!. One of the most beautiful town squares that you are ever like to come across. The Astronomical Clock is stunning and great to catch at 12:00 and 6:00. Whatever you do, look up, and keep looking up, the sculptures and the details are stunning. Could spend hours in the square alone! While we were there a string quartet were playing "When September ends", magical. Would like to see it snow bound in winter too.
A must see. Like everything in Prague its a must see. put it on your list . Lots of great markets which is great during christmas
Lots to see. Just like everywhere else there are lots of sites to see. Lots of stores selling touristy stuff ifthats your thing.

Avoid buying food here, but great architecture!. Great to just have a walk around. The architecture is beautiful, plus there are icons such as the church of Our Lady before Tyn and the Astronomical Clock. However, food is way overpriced here!! Have a 10 minute walk south toward Zizkov and get some cheaper, more authentic food there.

Wonderful city and excellent hotel and staff. It was my first time in Prague. As everybody had told me, it's a wonderful city. There is a treasure of architecture to admire. Kind people, nice food, and the best beer of the world. It was a pity we could not visit the National Theatre, it was under reparations. I hope I will return to this beautiful city.

Beautiful Christmas Market Venue. So magical especially on the evening of 5th December when all the children were about to see Santa Claus and the Angel and Devil characters great choice of market stalls for gifts and food and great mulled wine
One of most beautiful city centers in Europe. Many say it's too touristy, but I found it charming with a lot of local, authentic options if one choose correctly. Beautiful architecture.
Very atmospheric. lovely, old, well preserved buildings in so many different architectural styles. Loved the Church of our Lady Before Tyn, you will be wowed by the amount of gold used.
Beautiful. Very nice place to visit a must go if your in prague. Gets a bit over crowded with all the tourists but that's expected for a place as beautiful as this one.
Postcard perfect. Great to walk around the old town, have a giant beer in one of the pubs in the square and people watch.

Romance in stone. I traveled to Prague with my wife in jan 2013.This place has its own unique charm. Every European major and old city has its old town, but from the cities I've visited I liked Prague's the most. The amazing architecture is not limited to the main square or a small number of historical buildings - its everywhere. The inner and side streets have the same charm.We visited during snowfall and everything was covered by a white blanket and it was once again magical.Prague is beautiful in every dress.

WWII Underground Tour. We met Martin at the Powder Tower and were fortunate enough to spend 2 hrs with him - learning about WWII, visiting the Jewish quarter, exploring underground etc - excellent and well worthwhile

Old Town Square. Totally charismatic. The photography exhibition is well worth a visit. If dining in this area, look for the places hidden away in the nooks and crannies, these are by far the best quality and best deals.

Christmas Magic. Never has Christmas seemed so special and magical. From the giant tree to the vendors to everyone in wonderful spirits, everything came together to make the most memorable holiday ever.

Cobblestone walkways and beautiful buildings. Very interesting but overcrowded with tourists even in winter. The astronomical clock was mesmerising satisfying pentup enthusiasm as the crowds waited for the 12 apostles figurines to appear for just a few minutes on the hour.Cobblestone walkways are pretty and romantic but not good to walk on especially after a few days. Bring good walking shoes esp on rainy winter days.Restaurants add 10% service charge to your bill if you pay by credit cards

Beautiful but Busy. With the Christmas markets, Old Town gets very busy but it is a truly beautiful area to visit. Every street offers something new to see and there are plenty of great restaurants and cafes to visit too.

Don't miss. Chrismas market was still taking place when we were there; Georgeous decorations. Many food and craft vendors, .Wide variety of restaurants, A bit pricey, but less expensive fare is available if you go jsut a block off the main square

christmas atmosphere. happy atmoshpere,traditional.Beautiful medieval square that makes a beautiful .centre.Lots of history.Good for coffee and people watching.Not sure if the restaurants are any good...they must just be real touristfare so we ate away from here.
simply stunning. Gorgeous architecture. Lovely restaurants. Be careful though pickpockets are everywhere and easy to spot when you sit and watch.
Christmas Market. Excellent Christmas market, MOST festive tree I've ever seen, and stalls open on Christmas Day for a glass of hot wine and freshly cooked crisps or a cinnamon bread twist
Breathtaking. There's no words to describe the old town. Go there when you have the chance and see with your own eyes. Simply beautiful.
Unique medieval maze. Visit after the "usual" tourist hours and maybe even season. Or if you can not , choose early evening and just wonder around.
Atmospheric and Christmassy. We just arrived as they were taking the Christmas things down but there was still a magical atmosphere about this Medieval square. A must see if you visit Prague.

The mysterious air of Prague. The Old City Center is absolutely incredible being one of my favorite. It's perfect to visit if you want to discover the mysteries of Prague described in universal literature. Also, you can take superb pictures with the old buildings and people.
So, a visit to Stare Mesto is always relaxing and full of new things.

Just Beautiful!!. if you are in prague you should first go to this place and feeling that you are in the prague.if it is winter you will not see much people but in summer time just too many people.Just be careful this money changer people on the street.keep your distance from them.
Amazing!. Great for strolling, eating, and of couse. drink beer! In december, the christmas market is big, with hot wine, food and crafts, making it even better.

Wonderfully festive at Christmastime. First time I've visited Prague when the Christmas markets are on. They fill the old square and many of the adjoining roads right through to Wenslasas Square - just incredibly festive. I recommend it at any time of year but when the markets are on it's unmissable.The Christmas-time street food stalls are amazing too and very good value and of course there is warm wine on every corner. I particularly recommend the tredlnik or tredlo pastries. Simple sweet bread with sugar and sometimes nuts in a spiral. The traditional Prague Ham is divine - juicy and flavoursome.TIP: Also at the food stalls (see photo) be aware that you can just order 100g portions if you wish for about £1. Ordering several smaller portions means you can try a variety of dishes between you ;)
Great old European capital. Great feel of an old European capital. Not noisy, wide streets, plenty of historical places to see. Take in the Charles ridge and a wooden boat river trip.
Beautiful!. Old amazing buildings like picture postcards, great atmosphere and cultural centre! Several shops and coffe shops, excellent restaurants!

Lovely Walking. We enjoyed the whole experience of walking in the Old Town,
the buildings, the people, everything was great and so easy to get around.

Timeless Old in a World of Age. Contained, encapsulated at Christmas with throngs of familes and travelers and locals and all, in some sad strange way, passersby to buildings that have survived tyranny after tyranny to at long last come to rest, sentinels to a young nation struggling forever to be born.

Best Area to Stay in Prague. Old Town is central to everything in Prague. We stayed in Old Town and if I went back would do so again! I highly recommend visiting in December when the city full of Christmas Markets!

lovely christmas market still in january. I thought all the market would be gone as visited on the 4th - 8th January but it was still there! Made the square really magical, but I guess you couldn't take in the architecture as well!

Beautiful...but somewhat disapointing. When I decided on Prague as the second leg of my Euro adventure, Old Town was one of the most talked about attractions. Although very beautiful and the Astrological Clock is something everyone should see in their lifetime, it was kind of disappointing at the same time. It's basically like a town square with a church or two and a lot of restaurants around the perimeter. The only thing that was exciting was when they erected massive screens to watch Eurocup which my friend and I enjoyed immensely. In summary, you should go, but don't expect more than what I have mentioned.

A must visit. Great buildings and the famous astronomical clock has to be seen. Looks lovely at New Year with the gorgeous Christmas tree and market stalls. Square does get very crowded and of course restaurants are more expensive.

Magical during the Christmas Holiday.. I love that Prague keeps their Christmas Market open even after Christmas, not like Nurnberg that closes at 2:00 p.m. on Christmas Eve. Lots of foods to try, trinkets to buy, warm wine, and our favorite treat the pastry Trdelnik! But be aware, there are pickpockets around. My sons friend was getting pick pocketed as she was looking up at the Astrological Clock. My sons other friend just happened to look down, saw they guy reaching for her wallet, he caught the guy, elbowed him, and he took off running!

Fantastic Fantastic. Prague is so historical place. We visited Prague our first time but definitely no last! I love the history of this city and beautiful buildings. People here are very nice and helpful. Food is amazing and places to visit and see is so much. Definitely this year we have to come again!

Most beautiful old-town.... ..I have ever seen. The old-town of Prague is in a wonderful shape and the number of historical buildings is astonishing. Just a few monuments: astronomical clock, church of our lady before tyn, charles bridge, etc. Try to walk through the old town of Prague late at night or early in the morning, otherwise it is quite crowded.

Lovely quaint area. always a great visit (astronomical clock etc) and Christmas markets here are EXCEPTIONAL. The mixture of cobbles and Bohemian buildings and spires is infectious. I have visited several times now and love returning to this fairytale part of Eastern Europe
fascinating architecture. Have plenty of time and a large card in your camera - every building is awesome. The only dislike are the crowds of tourists - the secret is well and truly out.
A charming facade but a lot of junk shops inside.. Charming architecture, fun little cobbled lanes - a photographer's paradise. But too many junky souvenir shops.

nice buildings and a good atmosphere. We visited in Jan 2013 and the xmas market was still going, so that was pretty. The xmas tree is the best we have ever seen, its lightsmake it look like it was crying tears. The clock tower is impressive too and it chimes and does a little show of figures on the hour, well worth a visit. It is easy to find and you can do the jewish quarter at the same time.

Take time to explore. Prague is not a place to be rushed. Take time to explore the streets, there a surprises everywhere you look. The buildings are beautiful & ornate & every now & then you come across sculptures or fresco's.The people are lovely & helpful. If your new to the city, take a map with you as you can get so engrossed in what your seeing that you may get a little lost but if you see signposts with the word 'moste' on it that means bridge & will take you back to the river which is always a focal point for finding where you are.

The heart of Prague. You have not seen Prague if you have not been here...there is so much to see that one week is not enough to see the Stare Mesto, Prague Castle, new Prague....and when Christmas rolls around in the Square, it is ferric.
Lot of Walking. Old town is great if you do like heritage and cultural venues. This part of the city was my favorite, I remember do a lot of walks around every corner
Very pretty at Christmas. christmas market and tree are stunning. Tyn Church is fairytale. But be cautious about your belongings, this touristy place felt like pickpocket central.

A christmas fantasy land. One of the most beautiful parts of Europe I have seen. Around every corner is another incredible church, palace or historic building!!! And the Christmas markets were exciting, delicious and magical.

Fab. Great for relaxing and watching the world to by. Tip - on the 7th floor of the U Prince Hotel - there is a lovely bar and restaurant - with the most amazing views of the clock and skyline of Prague
Beautiful, Well Preserved. Worth a trip to Prague to visit Old Town - it is the quintessential old European city. Just walking around and seeing the classic architecture was worth the trip.

Fantastic!. You are in the real medieval city with its crooked narrow streets. We stayed in the nearby hotel and walked across the Old Town all the week, but we were never tired of it and every day we found something new and interesting - houses, churches, signs, museums etc.
Prague is amazing. Prague is a beautiful city with much culture and history! My husband, son and I love it! We definitely will return!
Picturesque. Beautiful old style town square. Nice Christmas Market as well. Very very very touristy, but to be expected.

Old Town at New Years. Excellent Christmas market, atmosphere and street food. Easily one of the nicest, cleanest and most well organized places I have ever visited. There were easily over half a million people there on New Years Eve and while things got wild, the police presence while there were not overwhelming. We are a middle aged couple and enjoyed mingling with kids, families and older folks. Most interesting was the fact that New Years Eve there was trash and broken glass everywhere from the revelers. The next day the place was spotless. There are ample public toilets which are clean and found everywhere. There is lots to see and do and we were'nt bored for a moment. See the Clock Tower and take a walking tour. Everything here is price worthy and a good value.
Go at Christmas. Lovely old square with all the authentic food sellers-absolutely stunning decorations-truly beautiful
One of the must do's for Prague!. Feels as if there are few places in Europe like this, very easy to walk around and just admire the buildings

Magical! Amazing Christmas markets!. This was the first place we went after arriving in Prague and wow... It's just magical! We went in mid December when the Christmas markets were there and liked it so much we went every day. It's got a really quaint feel to it and at night it's really really pretty. There was lots of amazing food at the Xmas market huts and plenty of mulled wine etc. I would definitely recommend going before Christmas. Amazing! Just be careful of the ham stalls as they charge by weight and will put a LOT of ham on your plate!
Old and new combine for European Beauty. Gorgeous architecture, Salvatore Dali exhibit, Starbucks, Astronomical Clock, Underground Tour, Black Angels Bar and Old Town Hall are must sees!
Xmas Market. Great market and very pretty, amazing sites to be seen, very busy and had a very nice feel to the place

Great sites but even better atmosphere. Prague during the Xmas season is spectacular. The smells of mulled wine, ham on the fire, and cinnamon were amazing. Lots to do and friendly people. One of the best experiences that we had in Europe.
Christmas Market. Christmas Market was wondrfu and the holdiay weather was awesome I bought Christmas gifts and it was lovely
Awful smell. Watch your nose, it smells crap! To many horses. I've been in other Eastern- Europe cities, and it's the similar smoke around the squares there too.

Must See. We loved walking around the square and enjoying the sights and sounds of the market. The old buildings are beautiful! Be sure to watch the clock on the hour, it is a marvel. We visited the square several times during our visit and it was always busy except early in the morning when it was quiet and peaceful!
Magical at Christmas time!!. The most amazing Christmas tree I have ever seen and a lovely Christmas market! Fantastic for strolling around and enjoying Nutella crepes and hot wine!
Lovely. Feels like your in the middle of a fairy tale with all it's beautiful buildnings. Lots of market stalls when I was there around Christmas. One of the most beautiful squares in the world.

Heart of Europe. Prague is the capital city of my country. Even when I came from another town I´m really proud of it. Especially Old town is one of the most beutifull places in the world. There is always lots of people but the atmosphere is amazing. We visited Prague just in time when started Christmas Market Prague and it was even better. You can buy here mulled wine,traditional sausages and many christmas gifts. Christmas Market is situated behind Old Town City Hall with Prague Orloj. This is national culture historical sight signed in UNESCO. Very nice place.

Must see in Prague. Nice old town very well preserved, small cobbled walking lanes, good food dozens of nice restaurants, pretty square. When we visited the Christmas market was setup with lots of lights and plenty to do.

Beautiful. So lovely! The Christmas market was still there and looked wonderful. The different architecture and buildings are incredible. The church went from different denominations over time and you can see their different additions.
Lovely. Enjoyed our first visit to Prague and especially enjoyed the old town for its historic buildings and lovely food.
unique atmosphere. Whatever season or time of the day you wont be disappointed by this place. Try climbing up the tower and enjoy the view.

Old Prague. The old Prague compared to other Eastern European old towns is HUGE, as it wasn't destroyed during the WW2. There are loads of tourist stores, but of course they price you more than they should, so my recommendation to you - try to buy things in shopping malls. Prague is gorgeous during the Christmas period, festive spirit is at its highest point over there.
Beautiful Place!. One thing to watch out on is that any resturant around the Old Town Square they double the price of what you order if you sit on the ground floor or outside.

Crowded for a reason!. The old town is really one of the most beautiful places in Prague. The charming small streets and the magnificent architecture are worth seeing! Yes, there are crowd of tourists, too many souvenir shops, the pubs are not so authentic probably, the prices are a bit higher, just like every popular touristic place. The difference in the Old Town of Prague is its unique charm and fairy-tale like atmosphere. Definitely a must see!!!A useful tip would be to avoid big bags and be extra careful as pickpockets are common. Visiting the Old Town do not miss the chance to get on one of the towers (either the clock-tower of the one at the beginning of the Charles bridge). They offer really nice view - a sea of red roofs and the silhouettes of Prague's 100 towers :).
Fascinating. Beautiful and stunning architecture and lovely little winding streets in which to get lost as you explore the delights of the old town and all its history

crowned and drunk people. my first impression of stare mesto (or Old Town) was a little bit shocking, but I had to consider it was NYE, usually downtown in europe spots the most number of bar and I guess by the end of the day (or end of a extended weekend, considering NYE was on monday) the place was already taken of people: czechs, polish, russian.there is plenty of place to go, indeed. try an early morning (before 9am) and you might see or do a sight-seeing of the Old Town, better than in peak-hours.

A beautiful old town of a very beautiful city. Easy to walk, but easy to be lost. If you are new there, you can go around and around and miss the spot you're trying to get to. Lots of shops, souvenirs, sights. But metro coverage is limited.

Prague is one of my favorite towns!!. My wife and I have been twice to Prague (honeymoon in Aug-08 and vacation in Des-12). The town is stunning. The town is quite small, so in a week you can cover most of the "normal" tourist sites. The old town square and the castle area are fantastic (with a LOT of tourist). The restaurants and the shops in the most "tourist infested" areas are overpriced. The shopping center Palladium at the Republic square is big, and have a lot op shops if you wanna go shopping. I reccomend the Hotel Kings Court opposite the square.

A magnificent place. So much to see... Put on a pair of good walking shoes, the colberstones are everywhere...Do not be afraid of exploring, a lot of small streets with great old houses with small gardens inside. Be careful about pickpocketing... Keep your valuables close.
Art Nouveau Capital. Great art nouveau architecture with wonderful winding streets. Nice Christmas market and many good restaurants

Fantastic in Christmas !. I think it is a fantastic place to go during Christmas, it was like a magnet for a lot of people during this period , including families with children. The place is woth seeing during daytime and also in the evenings, crowded with good restaurants and during Christmas also with a lot of "street food" and Christmas accesories. A must for every tour !
Not to be missed. We visited the Old Town during Christmas time and it was fantastic with beautiful decorations and market stalls. It was not too crowded, which was also great.
Excellent for a walk. Enough attractions for a full day's visit, or perhaps even two days. Join one of the free guided tours which work on tips.
Cozy old buildings. We had a great experience in the old town, the square is amazing, very nice buildings and good musea. Avoid the weekend days when you do not like huge crowds, like I do.
My Fav!. I loved it here! All the old buildings and cafes... I was in heaven!! It really does not get much better than this...

Loved It. The building structures, statues etc were all lovely, so much to see and take in. A lot of walking but it was all very much enjoyed. The food was yummy. Shopping was in the area but I found myself sightseeing and not wanting to shop.

Beautiful, Historical, and the Clock is Amazing. Old Town Square was one of the highlights of our Prague trip. The architecture alone is worth the visit, and be sure to look for the amusing little anachronisms that come with the passage of time. For example, buildings that are several hundred years old in every way other than the satellite dish mounted on the roof.Be sure to see the clock chime on the hour ("chime" is quite the understatement) and see it again from the top of the clock tower. There's an elevator and you can stand right next to the bugler in period costume who goes to each side of the tower and blows a melody signaling the time.Another star of Stare Mesto (Old Town) is the spectacular Church of Our Lady before Tyn. Its spires tower some 250 feet above the square and no Disney princess castle has anything on this 700+ year-old structure. It's truly magnificent.Prague is a wonderful city to visit and Old Town Square is one of the many highlights.(Note - Our visit was in November 2010.)

Beautiful old town !!. We were in Prague for last week of December also to celebrate the new year eve in Prague. We spent most of our time in Prague's old town. The history of the old town goes back to 13th century with many beautiful old buildings, the astronomical clock, the cathedral the old market & the most important Charles bridge. So it's a must visit place when you are in Prague. W still had chance to see the Christmas market in the square of the old town. The streets were so narrow and it makes your walk around the town more romantic.
Straight out of Disney Epcot world locations. The architecture was unbelievable & when it snowed the Christmas market was brilliant & festive. I trip up the clock tower is a must.

Prague Personified. The Old Town area of Prague is a sight to be seen. The city's wide diversity of cultures is encapsulated in the square and provides visitors with an easy way to really become involved in Prague. There are fantastic restaurants to eat in and brilliant sights to see - most notably the old clock tower. Provides a great meeting point and also a place to pass away the hours in great company and cuisine.

Christmas in the Old Town.... At Christmas the Old Town Square is still full of visitors, but it has the added bonus of an enormous Christmas tree with sparkly lights and decorations. There is a huge Christmas market selling all kinds of souvenirs as well as mulled wine, hot dogs, roasted meat, pastries and cakes. There are all manner of street performers and visitors of all ages from all over the world. The large churches around the square are free to enter and see the beautiful Christmas displays. It's a great place to sit and watch the world go by and there was a temporary ice-rink in one of the side-streets during our visit.
Stunning. It's a little bit of Hasburgiana Fairy Tale. Tourist central but the best of its type. Totally safe at night.
A place to look and wander. Another place easily served by trams, but mainly a walking thoroughfare. Take the time to wander and watch, many tradesmen preparing items, cooking items etc.

Fantastic old world charm. We visited Prague in December to experience what was said to be the best Christmas Market in Europe.We had been to Lille the week before and found this to be a disappointment, very small and crowded.Prague on the other hand hit all the right buttons, spacious in the old town square and although busy not overly crowded.This made for a great atmosphere and a perfect experience for my Aussie wifes first northern Christmas.If a Christmas market is what you are looking for, get to this one.You have to try a Langose, this is carb, garlic heaven...lol.
Crowded bu great. Obviously any visit to Prague must include the Old Town. Take your time, and I'd recommend taking one of the free tours to find out the history behind the buildings and sculptures.
Old Town. Very historic part of town that is a must see if you visit Prague! The buildings are some of the most impressive that I have seen in Europe

Beautiful but Crowded. Travelling to Prague in December we - along with everyone else in the city - visited the Old Town area of the city. It's definitely worth a visit to see the many beautiful buildings. The main streets are generally packed with people, tourist shops, and restaurants that charge 3-5 times more than the rest of the city. Go, see the buildings, perhaps have a beer in the square, but then get out or at least stay on the smaller side streets which are less crowded, less expensive, and have just as much great food and drink and things to see.

Amazing historical site. Would definitely recommend you visit at Christmas time. so beautiful when the square is covered in snow, sipping on hot wine and eating 'prepared as you watch' ham sandwich from a spit.
Charm of history. Historic place, very well conserved, full of Gothic and Baroque architecture. One of the coziest old town in Europe. The Jewish Ghetto deserve a full day on its own.
Great place to visit. Very clean and a great atmosphere. Plenty or cafes and restaurants. The street entertainers make for a great time expecially at Christmas time.

Charming, but take a little care. The sites here can be overwhelmingly beautiful, especially the astronomical clock and churches. However, keep your passports, wallets, etc. in a money belt or neck wallen and keep purses small and close to your body in front. Pickpockets will spot gawking, starry-eyed tourists and are quicker than anything!

The heart of Prague. The old town is the heart of Prague. There's lots to see as you walk around the old town. however you'll never be able to get away from all the tourists. There are lots of shops selling the usual tat and souvenirs. The restaurants are also overpriced, but you can find a few hidden gems if you look for them. The Old town is actually quiet small and you can easily cover it in a day.

A must.. The hub of the city, full of history, go on a guided tour to get the best out of it. Some problems with pick pockets , be careful when in crowds. Go to the top of the old clock tower, don,t worry theres a lift !! awesome veiws of the city.The astronomical clock puts on a great show on the hour , every hour.

Great sights very busy. The old town square is a grand sight to see with history everywhere you look, at Christmas its full of stalls with decorations and hot wine and all kinds of treats very festive! Incredibly busy and picturesque look into the churches and if you can climb the tower for awesome views of the city
Love it!. Windy streets, good shops and restaurants. Great for wandering and experiencing the city culture. One of the best parts of prague!
Good walking area. Pretty quick to walk though unless you stop for photos (which you probably will do) and its a must of the things to do in Prague to see how things use to be.
Beautiful!. We went just in early December. There was a lovely little fair going on, with food, music. Lots of people from around the world. beautiful building and overall a great vibe.
touristy and overcrowded. cobblestone streets, old buildings, wall-to-wall souvenirs and tourists. worth walking through...once...

Perfect for Wandering. Old Town is a picturesque maze of cobblestone streets, tiny shops and restaurants, historic landmarks, and so much more. If your itinerary allows, spend some time just wandering around.
Prague Down Town Christmas. Good atmosphere, nice cottages with refreshment (wine etc.).Too much people.Good information from domestic staff (except local language they can speak almost english).

Must do. Lots of tourist shops, small streets, beautiful buildings.
Friendly people. Easy to get there using tram, train, or even walking

Charming Christmas Market and Accessible Old Town. We loved the Christmas Market here as it was sent against the beautiful Old Town Square. Although the market's contents were not terribly unique, it was one of, if not the most, picturesque I've seen.
Very Picturisque. Love the sights on the way to the old town and all over the town, I must say. Every building, shops just are so beautiful.
Town square. Historic buildings excellent restaurants friendly helpful people. Enjoyed shopping at the market and many side street shops

Amazing architecture. I love the architecture of the Old Town. Sad it's so full of tourists. Many souvenir shops, but the vendors are quite passive, they are not aggressive or annoying like in some other parts of the world.
Awesome. It's been a while that I wanted to come to visit Prague and I was not disapointed at all. This place is really awesome.
Tourist's dream. It's beautiful and great but there are always alot of tourists and most of the restaurants around it are very over priced.

Memorable. Walk, walk and walk. Old jewesh town, old town, small town, Charles´bridge, etc are delightening.
There are homeles in the streets

Too many tourists. The Old Town in Prague is interesting but it is very touristy and really busy (around Christmas when I visited). Much nicer areas of the city outside the Old Town where you can see how the ordinary people of Prague live.

Christmas magic. We travelled to Prague in December, and the old town was filled with Christmas merriment. I really loved the atmosphere of the Christmas markets, lights and local charm.
The buildings surrounding the square were just fantastic. I would recommend going up the tower clock for a great view over Prague.

Excellent area. Pedestrian area that should be explored and appreciated. Lots of thgings to see...climb the clock tower.. Drink on the top of the hotel... Visit a museum.... Shop for souviners.... Not to be missed
Czech Charm. I love the Old Town area. Great shops, cafes, restaurants, bars, etc. Walk around and experience the different winding streets and get lost in the old town charm.

Must see. One of the nicest in Europe. Great for photographs. Great atmosphere. Great Christmas market.
Lots of people there during the week, beware when going with little kids.
Christmas Market. We felt that this was the best location of the three markets we visited although the number of stalls were reduced from previous years, we understand.

Picturesque, great at Xmas, crowded, watch out for pickpockets. The Old Town is great. Phenomenal historical buidlings, the great Town Hall, the surrounding buidlings known by the pictures on their mantel pieces and the Christmas market make it a must visit. The scenery is marred by US-style crap souvenir stores and by deadbeats and vagabonds who are out to fleece you. So be aware and enjoy the awesome scenery. Good street abounds too.
Great zone to walk. You can just walk through the streets and it's enough. It's a totally must do in Prague. It's full of little streets with hidden restaurants and symbols.
Christmas Market. The tower the Christmas Market Mulled wine hot dough rings freely cooked. The choirs on the stage and wow what a christmas tree decoration.

Great to visit at Christmas. We visited just before Christmas which was the ideal time to visit. The square was full of lights and the sights, sounds and smells of Christmas, Carols, mulled wine, local cakes and a large Christmas market. Even at other times of year the square is definitely worth a visit for the architecture, not least the fascinating astrological clock.

Pretty. The Old square has got history everywhere you look. From the Our Lady of Tyn church to the Astronomical Clock (quirky to watch the musical statues and the trumpets player but guess its not worth going up to the top). The atmosphere was lovely and the Christmas markets delightful a very pleasant walk and sightseeing day.
Lovely. The city centre is beautiful and filled with pretty buildings and music. The best views are from the hills and the bridges. I wish I'd visited sooner.
Nice... if you like that sort of thing. Interesting architecture but sadly wasn't really blown away. Great markets when we were there though and lovely to enjoy a mulled wine in the square!
historic and beautiful, but crowded. lovely restored building, strong sense of nationality, lots of tourists just like me. A little too much commercialism for such an historic site.

Municipality has done a good job keeping and restoring. I visited just on the limit of the Christmas season beginning, and it was very interesting. The place was fully decorated with lights Christmas lighting and kiosks for local/typical food. it was outstanding.

A lovely town!. I was in Prague with my boyfriend for 3 days. Prague is a really romantic and lovely place, perhaps the prettiest most beautiful city I have ever been to! The Christmas market was at the old town and no doubt it is easily number 1 in Europe!
Great place to sit. So much fun to sit and have either a glass of wine or a hot beverage to see the people. There is s much going n there..shops, restaurnts, ery good ambiance

Fabulous setting, but Christmas Market disappointing. The old town square is enclosed in beautiful buildings and was the most amazing setting for a Christmas Market. However had we gone to Prague just for the markets, we would have been very disappointed. The atmosphere was great with a jazz band playing & hot chestnuts, mulled wine and lots of bavarian ham to tempt us, but apart from the food, nothing special to buy, many stalls selling the same goods.
Great. If you love all the old and mysterious, then you are exactly like that.YOU MUST SEE THIS PLACE!!!))

Busy at Christmas, but epitomising the magic of the festive season!. You can't visit Prague and not go to the Old Town - the place was even more magical at Christmas! The decorations and authentic markets helped make our time feel even more Christmassy. Not sure what the square is like outside of the festive period, but there was plenty going on and carriage rides were aplenty - a really nice way to see the city in a more old-school way!
Nice, but too many tourist shops. Very nice city centre, but you tend to get tired of all the shops selling crystal. Apart form that, great city to just stroll around in.

A fairy tale!. Despite the big crowds during the Christmas time, the place is magical, both during the day and at night. Christmas fair with its wonderful smells of trdelniki and mulled wine, cheerful people, gorgeous xmas tree all surronded with architecture of exquisite beauty. Definetely a place to be!

Lovely to while away the hours. Lovely buildings and nice to sit and have a coffee. Some of the hotels and restaurants have roof gardens so I would like to go back in the summer and while the time away with a few Prague beers.

Overrated. But good place to meet up with others.. Crowded whatever time of day, especially with the clock strikes during the day hourly.
Not my cup of tea I'm afraid.

Must see. Prague has a beautiful history and the old town square has a lot,of must-sees during your stay. We went during the Christmas period and Prague is even more romantic during this time of the year!
Christmas in Prague. Very pretty and enjoyed the Christmas market. Make sure you are wrapped up warm and beware of the tourist traps with the bars. Look where the locals go
Fascinating place to visit. There is lots to see in this old town area. Quaint streets and the birthplaces of famous people. Everyone goes there - so you won't miss it.

Full of fun. Always full of people who can entertain u....we saw great guitarist, we saw biggest water bubble maker, we saw greatest prank-guy sitting over head of another person without any support below totally suspended in air!!!Best is to stop to watch Astronomical clock...the clock strikes hour in most dramatic manner and people gather to applaud it....n u never know if u r lucky there will be group of young guys n gals offering free hug ;)
beautiful. We wandered around the Old Town in the snow with all the Christmas lights on and decorations up and it really felt like Christmas

A trip back in time... Make sure you read about Prague and its History before taking this trip. Prague was not destroyed during the war. MOST of the buildings still stand and look exactly as they did many years ago..

old world charm. Watching the astrological clock perform on the hour is a must and the views from the tower are worth it. There is a lift if you don't like stairs. Try the Hog roast- one between two is enough. There are a number of small reasonably priced cafes just off the main square.
Old Town. Beautiful. A different site around every corner. Nothing to dislike. Full of architecture,bars,restaurants,shops,old churches.castles etc.

Christmas market visit. We particularly liked the architectural different styles,baroque renaissance and gothic.
We thought the transport system superb, so easy using our 72 hour pass purchased from the nearby metro station.our only negative comment was the cold and icy paths! Our return visit will be in springtime!
off the beaten track. There are a lot of corners which are unexplored without cheezy tourist shops where tourists do not go so often. Find those and you will be rewarded by Prague at its best

A must see... but overated. Although the history of this square is central to the city, the place is very small and literally overflowing with tourists. Even the Christmas market is one of the worst I have seen in Central Europe. I would suggest passing by.. but not more.

Memorable. Absolutely stunning particularly in December with the Christmas markets etc. One of the most beautiful squares I have ever seen. Beware of the waiters in the restaurants/cares around the Square who seem to expect a tip for everything even though it's already included in the bill. This is however a must see sight on anyone's bucket list.

Very beautiful - full of culture and history - beautiful ancient buildings & landmarks including the astronomical clock. Liked the architecture - beautiful character buildings - cobbled streets (may be slippery when raining/snowing)
Charming surroundings........ but........... The restaurants were crowded and very expensive and the waiters not very friendly. Liked the astrological clocks and the area there.

Festive Fun. Fantastic Christmas Market, especially pretty at night time with huge tree and the entire square lit up. Children singing Xmas carols, smell of mulled wine and hot sausages can't fail make you feel very festive.
Worth spending a day mooching. It's simply a great place to wander around shops and cafe's - loads of souvenir shops, glass/crystal goods and cafes/restaurants for all tastes

Absolutely fantastic .. Numerous wonderful buildings in excellent condition, old churches
narrow streets full of history , monuments , clocks and squares
Out of this world. We went there when it was snowing.The tree was lit up the market was in full swing and the choir was in full voice amazing

Shops.. Shopping around here proved interesting as there were plenty of shops and stores to visit along with numerous small arcades. The souvenir shops could do without the sales people pressurising you to buy things and following you around the shop watching what you were doing all the time. Must be used to shoplifters there!!!!

Fairytale. Easy to walk. Fantastic architecture. For a capital city Prague is very cheap but many restaurants will try to rip you off. Beware of added charges. For beer drinkers it is a paradise. Find a small back street bar where the locals drink. How about 2 large beers and 2 large glasses of wine for £6 ?

nice, but crowded. don't go in summer, it was hot - heat wave about 38C and very crowded with tourists. Join the underground tour was interesting, but pricey. Little places with shade, so hat or umbrella is best

Very picturesque. Xmas markets make a trip to Prague extra special.Loved Old Town square with the Astronomical clock and the climb to the top of the clock tower is worth it for the views..but wrap up warmly!.
Love places to have hot toddies and people watch !
Beautiful. So much history abounds. The old town is the jewel in the crown. There is so much to see and do. You wil find you spend a lot of your time here.

A must when in Prague. This is the heart of Prague a wonderful area of narrow alleyways and cobbled streets. Plenty of things to see and do, just by wandering around and stumbling on fascinating little shops, squares and churches. Plenty of coffee shops to stop off at but they do get more expensive the closer you get to Old Town and Wenceslas Square.
Crowdy but worth a visit.. Everything you need can pretty much be found in and around this area in terms of food and drinks. Well worth a visit.
Magical. It's magical. So much is now beautifully restored, the old town is still a maze - you can walk fro hours. Just leave the main tourist routes and discover quiet, stunning places.
great at night. Lively Christmas markets and street food. Our Lady church wonderful when lit up --- a touch of Harry Potter

Very busy. Old town square has to be a must when in Prague, but we were there for the Xmas lights to be turned on and it was manic. Couldn't move, but that was only for a couple of hours. Xmas markets were nice but the stalls sold the same stuff. Eating in the restaurants was nice but didn't like the way I was told by the waiters very time I asked for the bill the service wasn't included.. If the service is good enough then I will tip.

Lots to see. you will find the old town are at the top of wenceslas square and it's definitely worth a look and it's where you will find the lovely christmas markets and the famous astronomical clock.
Visit it!. It's a very beautiful place and you need to visit it if you are in Prague. Take care for the "tourist traps" as restaurants and pubs. Also, it's don't walk in here in the night.
Cobbled delight. I loved this charming town, with its cobbled paths and charming buildings. A delightful experience just to walk around in the snow.
Absoulutely Gorgeous. A beautiful,atmospheric square to spend a couple of hours just wandering around enjoying a drink or a meal.
Lovely. Picturesque with painted buildings, lots of places to eat, little alleys with good shops - well worth a visit

This is why you go to Prague.. It is without a doubt one of the most magical places in Europe, i actually don't have much to say about this, just enjoy this photos and go there. It's a must see in Europe.

Amazing. A beautiful historical city with so much to see & enjoy .It is possible to walk to a lot of places but we did book a tour through the city to the castle & the tour guide was so intersting & full of information great value for money .
Old Town. Bristling with energy and superb architecture. We were there for the Christmas Market and were delighted with the stalls and the decorations.
Need to see. Its nice part of Prague with a lot of suvernier shops. Be aware of pocket thiefs and a people that want to exchange money on the street (dont get fooled by them)
On The Square. Astronomical Clock perforns every hour with characters revolving amidst chiming. Much like a cuckoo clock, but still different. Street with $$$ shops ends/begins right at the square
Old Town Square. Lots of stalls in the festive market within the old town square. Entertainment, food and drink all readily available. There's lots of unusual things to try and buy.

Shopping near Old Town Square. A real secret for unique Shopping, away from all the "touristy Shops" which you see on every corner, is the area around the MICHALSKA STREET. It is located directly in the center with direct connection to the old Town Square. When you are standing on the small Square right before the MICHALSKA STREET, to your right you can see a small Market with local products and small cute Souvenirs, it is a joy to strall through the nice szene. Entering the MICHALSKA STREET to your left you will find one of the most unique Shopping Opportunities; the Store is called "Gemory" and has a great variaty of gem stones in different modern settings. It is a joy to finally see something different than all the classical garnet and amber all around. The prices are very good and the Quality high. Across the Street from the "Gemory" is a typical czech wine Bar where you can find lots of locals and musicians drinking their wine while singing Songs and creating a nice atmosphere. Further down the street you will find one of the most exclusive vintage Stores in Prague where you can find rare and Special pieces from Chanel, Dior and so on. Also along the street you will find small Galleries and typical czech handycraft Stores. The small Passage on the end of the MICHALSKA STREET will bring you right down to the Old Town Square and the astronomical Clock.

Excellent!. Prague old town you should visit once in you life!When you are just standing and looking arount you will feel yourself in couple centruies ago with the building arount!it is just beautiful!

Old town. A 'must see' place! put on your comfiest walking boots and start walking. The old town is an amazing mix of old and new nestled side by side, loads of little nooks and crannies, hidden little gems down passageways, shops and museums, churches and even a grave yard watched over by a Golem

Old Town square at Christmas.. First week of December. Crispness in the air. Beautiful Christmas trees, wondeful Christmas market of food, drink and handicrafts. Try some of the specialities on offer, but you may need to find somewhere to sit and eat it.
busy. This was our 4th time in prague for the christmas markets Love the whole atmosphere. We was there for the lightening of the tree this year, and was the best I have ever seen
One of the world's great places. Prague old town is a now well restored and beautiful place with lovely buildings around every corner - everyone should visit it at least once!

lively place. we visited prague for a 3 night break. the old town was our favourite part . lots of places to eat and drink very cheap and the mulled wine from the stalls is fab! the building are amazing especially the church which crowds gather around on the hour to hear the chimes and see the figures move. all the little streets are cobbled stones and full of shops and a great buzz. will def return to prague its a beautiful city.

Beautiful Architecture and Vibrancy. This is a great area to begin your introduction to the city and experience a good part of its past and present culture in a walkable radius. The food stalls are definitely worth the money and make you feel like you're a part of Czech culture. The Astronomical Clock is here and also a fan favorite. The food here can get expensive, however.

Worth a visit if convienient. Compared to many other European centers, this is nothing special. There are all of the high-end shops and a lot of crowd. Some older buildings, but nor really good historical feel.

Lovely!. We were mainly there to visit the Christmas Market. The atmosphere was nice. In addition to the Christmas Market, there were other attractions there as well which we visited. Overall a lovely place to visit!
Picturesque. Best part of city to eat/visit. But many 'odd characters' around. Not sure I'd feel safe after dark!

Truly amazing!. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities that I have visited and should be in the top-3 of anyone travelling to Europe. The old town is magnificent, with its many different building styles and many preserved buildings. A joy to walk through these streets!

Prague. Beautiful city - visit the Terrace restaurant in Hotel U prince - Old Town Square - you dont get cold - plenty of patio heaters and blankets even in minus 2 degrees - food and service xcellant - nd a view to die for
Terrible crew. We tried this restaurant with my friends, and were like "what the hell"? The crew was really unkind, food wasnt good and the price was so high!! I will never come bak again.

Old Town Square. The quintessential storybook location. Prague is beautiful and the square is one of a kind. This is definitely a must while you're in town. Restaurants with authentic Czech food, amazing architecture and castles galore!
Nice walking tour. Nice shops, easy to get to, beautiful architecture, upbeat atmosphere, good restaurants, all lead to a nice vibe in the old town.
Ambience. Love the old town on chirstamas. Walking around and grabbing mulled wine. It was definetely a good idea to go during week, not weekend as it gets really crowded.

Best place to hang out.. All the great sites are here on the square, and you can get the best of the street food - crepes, sausages, hot mulled wine, etc. There are carriage rides, shops, street cafes, famous landmarks, etc. We were there in winter, and it was the easiest place to spend the day.
Beautiful!. If you have one day to spend in Prague, spend it in Stare Mesto and visit the Prague Castle. You won't be sorry to see the old buildings, glass paintings in churches etc etc.
Well worth the visit. It was bustling and full of wonderful buildings and for me it captured all that is beautiful about Prague.The Christmas decorations and stalls are no to be missed

Beautiful. Stunning architecture surrounds you in every direction. Watch for hiked prices for food in the square and on main streets between Charles Bridge, and Wenceslas Square. They are higher than elsewhere.

Nice Area. The old town square is a bustling area where everyone visiting Prague comes to in order to soak up some of the lifestyle. The Astronomical Clock is a must see and this can be followed by a visit to many of the surrounding bars and restaurants.

The most beautiful city I've been to yet. There is so much to see and do in this city you could take a week to see it all. You will be walking a lot so wear good shoes. Lots of cobblestone. Check out the Old New Synagogue , if you have children you could tell them about gollum. Tip good first thing in the morning, it very busy all year around and morning are much quieter.

The most beautiful city I have ever visited. I have visited quite a lot of the most beautiful cities in the world, but for me, Prague is the most beautiful one. Despite the fact that it doesn´t have a very unquestionable famous monument, in the Old Town, I fell in love with its buildings and streets´ harmony, everything is in its right place, and there is nothing that you can call ugly. It´s a must visiting the Charles´ bridge and to have a walk by it, also amazing the castle, the town hall and its famous astronomic clock. It´s a city for walk, and walk and walk to admire completely...
A must place to visit. Everyone was so friendly, the prices were good and the local food was excellent. Make sure that you see the astrological clock at the town hall strike the hour.
Magestic. Very history & architecture rich, try one of the tours (I went with the amazing New Europe guides) who give a great summary of the place during the Free Tour.

Very nice. This place was really nice - at this time of the year it's full of christmas decorations and markets. Unfortunately we were a bit early so a lot of the stalls were shut and they're still setting up the Christmas tree. Plenty of food and drink though!

Nice, but in need of a little love. The old town sure beat Wencelas square. It has some lovely, pollution stained buildings and churches. I have heard so much about Prague being simply beautiful, and don't get me wrong, it is lovely but in a weary, tired and neglected way. The old square is so rich with history it is just so sad to see the buildings decaying under pollution past and present. I'm not expert, but couldn't some of the monuments be cleaned? The other downside is the rampant commercialism of the area. There must be 500 souvenir shops in a 100 metre radius. It really detracts. Prague could learn a lo from Paris
Wonderful part of the city. Its a must-visit definitely: wandering on small cozy street full of souvenir shops and sitting in pretty cafes is the most romantic thing one can do in Prague.
Square at night. Went at night, busy, safe and friendly. All the Christmas decorations in shops, although we were too early for the market.

excellent. like everything just lovely Christmas everywhere you go so festive.
You could feel The Christmas spirit everywhere.All the boots with food was just so nice

Beautiful!. The most beautiful Old Town in Europe! I love to come back to Praque everytime I can. Restaurants, bars, museums, shops, you have everything here!
There is one disadvatage - huge crowd durring mostly summer season :(((
It's the must see when you are in Praque!
A must. you cannot go to Prague and miss this! everything about it is very old and historic. Too much to say on here but you must spend at least a day there.
in the midst of golden prague. the wonderful astronomical clock and huge open plaza, fabulous spires of Tyn church. Unfortunately, spoiled by masses of tourists.

Really worth the trip!. We spend most of our weekend walking around the Old Town. There are so many historic buildings and little churches! The architecture is quite different from the west European countries and there is a very pleasent atmosphere in the streets. The astronomic clock is really beautiful, but dificult to read unless you read how it works! I would defitetly go to visit the clock tower at night. first of all there is less queue and the views are beautiful!
