My favorite part of Prague!. Beautiful area and the street vendor foods are delicious! Make sure the eat the ham and the potato/cabbage/ham dish too!
Great visit. Part of a walking tour day. Lots to take in and learn about. It was worth a visit, a guide is recommended but there are many free tours to choose from.
Very atmospheric place. Did not dislike anything about it really, so much to see and do, I have never seen so many old buildings etc, and so many unusual and grand carvings and stonework.
Make sure you visit!. Great for a stroll through the historic centre of Prague, Also try as many of the local snacks along the way as it adds to the overall experience.
Do not miss!. Art, music, history, culture -- it's all here. Even original scores and notations by Beethoven and Mozart
beautiful. beautiful buildings and this is where the astronomical clock is. the restaurants and bars are obviously more expensive in this area but wander down a side street and you find cheaper

excelent place. very central place; you can relax there and eat something.
there are several places around stare mesto, beautiful churches for example

Amazing!. This was probably our favorite city during our European tour this summer. It is absolutely beautiful and is a walking city, which is a plus. We didn't have a bad meal, we were not pickpocketed (although we were advised by our wonderful hotel host how to avoid it), and we loved all of the shoppes. Had my best souvenir shopping here...found wonderful items that weren't "imported" and were reasonalbly priced. The historical sites abound. If you go to the town center, it may be crowded on a football night...there is a huge tv in the center to watch the games and people from everywhere attend. The great thing is that you can sit back at an outdoor cafe or bar and people watch in such a beautiful historical setting. Definitely hope to visit again!
Loved it!. Loved the buildings and the history. We ate out at a restaurant with heaters in the crisp air so romantic.
Beautiful and historic. As much history as you can absorb. Lots of walking required and cobblestones are sometimes difficult.

Old Town in Prague. The city and sites were looked very interesting , but the crowds made it uncomfortable and hard to get around. It was also intimidating, because we had been warned over and over agin to beware of pickpockets. I was very disappointed I was not able to enjoy this site on our trip.

Stare Mesto is wonderfull. The old part of the city is fantastic to walk through. Lots of fantastic buildings and monuments. Many fine places to get a good beer as well. Prices are higher than in the outskirts, but compared to denmark still fairly cheep. Everywhere it is vey clean. There is a tendency which is not so nice: Everything costs something. You cannot visit many places without paying fees. But the old city is just wonderfull.

Early Mornings. If you get a chance, visit before 9am before the crowds arrive. Some wonderful sites, great architecture, and plenty to see and do. Stay away from the restaurants in this area unless you want to over pay for your meal/drink. If you have a few hours, try to get lost in the winding streets behind Old Town Square. You'll find some interesting shops, history, and sites.

Fabulous. We chose Prague as a pre-Christmas treat because it looked fabulous and we weren't disappointed! From the lovely historic buildings to the Christmas markets everywhere, we just couldn't fault it. The local people are friendly, everywhere is beautifully clean and tidy and we found some really good local restaurants. Oh and the black beer is superb!! Don't be afraid to poke your head round the door of the many little churches dotted around, some of the interiors are stunningly good. Can't recommend it highly enough and we will be going back again sometime soon.
Delightful area. This is a must-see are in Prague and worth staying in hotel nearby if you ar only visiting for a weekend/few days
Tourists tourists tourists. Tooooo much tourists but beautiful! Its like a fairytale, but the only language you dont hear is czech...
a must see. there is a lot of history here, sad and good, the jewish getto and cemetery are here, with a guide you see and learn a lot
Interesting. Wear good shoes, cobbled stones everywhere which made it awkward on your footing. Pace yourself as well, trams are located near but part of the centre you will need to walk continuously
History all over!!!. Charles Bridge, the Astronomical Clock (the view from the op of this amazing building is outstanding!!!!)

Old town square - lots of history. Loved the architecture! If you want to see the old square itself between the hours is best as it gets very busy for the chiming of the clock. Seeing the clock itself in action (you have to), go earlier in the morning as it is less crowded. The square itself has a fascinating mix of different buildings. I recommend doing one of the Sandleman (free) tours to get a grip of the history of the square and the surrounding area.
Beautiful architecture. Very nice and interesting old town particularly when lit up at night. loved the astronomical clock.Particularly enjoyed our walking tour of the old Jewish district.

One of my favorite cities in the world. I heard from many people how amazing it is, but you do not realise it until you are there by yourself. I went there for a long midweek holiday and I had proper time to see everything. However when I was there I still didn't have enough time. The city is impressive, romantic, historical with a lot to offer. I can recommend this place to everyone, you have to have seen it at least once in your life. I am definitely going back there!
beautiful area. very cool little back streets running through the city. you will wander through it on any walk around town.
Old Town in the early morning. I love the place especially in the early sunny cool morning. The streets are clean and quiet. I enjoyed every moment!
A must!. View the astronomical clock on the hour and then climb to the top of the clock tower for a great view of Prague. Going at dusk is amazing!

not so old. great place that combines history and modernity. The monuments, Cathedrals at the place itself has a very rich history but has caught up with modern times with the establishment of restaurants and cafe's

Beautiful small ancient town. Please take a map with maximum details because GPS is sometimes mistaken for such a small scale ;) no parallels streets. The same street in the morning, afternoon and evening look different. There are special silence and the beauty around 8 am and 22 pm.

old world charm. this is a well preserved historic area of Prague. You feel surrounded by history as you walk the narrow streets and look at the historic buildings everywhere. The main square with its famous clock and statues and fountains make it a photographer's delight. There is a festive atmosphere as crowds of tourists and locals alike stroll about or enjoy themselves at street cafes and bars.
Nice place to roam around. A little of everything for every taste. Very youthful atmosphere all around, good behaving people and lots to see, hear and taste...
Don't miss. Very busy, but amazingly beautiful! The clock is a little bit of an anticlimax, but still a must see

Place to watch and be seen. This is the Leicester Sq of Prague, its where all the tours start and they have the best food stands where they serve chunks of spit roasted leg of ham straight off the bone with a heap of cabbage and rye bread - so rustic.You'll go here sometime as all avenues lead to this spot.
Magnificent. Loved the amazing architecture of the ancient buildings. On the downside, there are simply too many tourists.
Prague...better than Paris!!. Prague is a very romantic city. I personally think that it is better than Paris. The old buildings are just beautiful!

Love this place. My first time in Prague and hadn't used tripadvisor before to plan my holiday sight seeing but thought I would give it a go and glad that I did. This place is number 1 on the list and I can definitely understand why. Warning huge crowds around the astronomical clock around the hour mark. Not as exciting as expected but the clock is great in general.

Lovely views. Avoid the food stalls like plague!!!!!!!!. Lovely atmosphere no matter day or night. We had the wits to avoid the expensive restaurants, but don't be fooled by the food stores selling "old prague ham". They sell it by weight, and charge sky high prices! Rip off!!! By the time you pay you might as well eat in a comfy restaurant! Not street prices at all!!!!!!!

Must do !. Fabulous area for walking around and people watching. Don't buy Spit Roast Pork rolls from wooden chalets along side of square- lots of stories about overcharging and being given skin and fat etc....
Recommend the free walking tours that start by clock- we did Sanderson New Europe Walk- excellent.

Amazing city.. Prague Old Town is a fantastic place to visit whether you are interested in it's long and interesting history, it's amazing architecture or if you just appreciate a good beer in phenomenal surroundings.There are many "must sees" like the astronomical clock in the old town square (the last working example of only three ever made in the world), the Charles Bridge or Karlov Most (possibly the most romantic bridge in the world) and the Church of Our Lady before Tyn, a fine example of Gothic architecture from the 14th century.Getting around on foot is easy if not a little confusing at times, I would strongly recommend getting a guide book, we used the TimeOut guide which we found to be excellent.There are many tourist shops selling cheaply made in China, over-priced tat but if you are looking for souvenirs I would suggest a visit to the daily market in Havelska where you will find all the usual bits and bats but lower prices and stall owners who will haggle.Bars and restaurants are everywhere and prices vary vastly from establishment to establishment. Price does not give any indication of quality as most places are selling exactly the same beer and food, the only difference seems to be the location. As a rule of thumb, I would check the price of 0.5l of beer (pivo). 30Kc is good for the town centre and the food will be reasonably priced too. If you pay double that for beer, expect to pay double for the food too.Wenceslas Square, which is not really a square but a long and very wide main road, is the site of many big-name shops such as M&S and Debenhams and also the annual Christmas market but has unfortunately deteriorated over the last ten years into a red-light area. It is still safe enough to wander about but single men and groups that look like a stag party will find themselves harrassed by prostitutes and drug dealers. Take more care in this area after midnight. A local told us that the area was run by the police during the day and the mafia by night. As in all main cities, be vigilant, especially of pickpockets.
History becomes palpable. Just walk about in this romantic part of Prague, take your time to enjoy and have a look at all the details of those wonderful old buildings.

Just get lost. Not easy to plan or even to identify highlights but if you wander around the area between the main train station and the river you will see some amazing architecture, good shopping, and places to eat and drink for everyone.The buildings have been a big benificury of EU funds. They have been cleaned and restored so you dont need your imagnination just your camera.You will find all sorts of shops from gawdy souvenirs to bohemian crystal. We bourght all sorts of things from dolls in Australian footy jumpers to handmade string puppets.The food wasnt memorable but there where heaps of good cafes and bars to have a break and put the bags down.Later we did a pub crawel (stay away from the guys in the red shirts).
Fun time. A nice central location; despite the prices it's a good place to get a coffee, shop, etc and wait for the top of the hour and astronomical clock.
Beautiful. Nothing like it anywhere we've visited. A must see. Worthy of anyone's bucket list. The astronomical clock is fantastic and the views are fantastic in every direction.
Old city/across river. You can easily walk and explore this picture postcard, city. Filled with cultural venues,museums etc. great

Totally awesome. The old town of Prague is a must. That's beautiful! This place has a special ambiance, it seems that the landscape has not changed since the Middle Ages. It is really a place to visit once in their life.

Beautiful, but Beware. Old Town square in Prague is beautiful, full of architectural and historical marvels, BUT it has become very crowded, and is now dotted with many junky 'souvenir' shops owned and operated by non-Czechs. Worth a visit, but go early to avoid the mobs.

Charming Town Square. THis square ia a beehive of activity, very lovely, great cafes and the amazing clock! Horsedrawn carriages line one side of the square creating a romantic sense of history. There are often musicians playing lively music and this adds to the fun.

Beautiful during the day, Amazing during the night. We arrived in Prague on a slightly foggy evening. After walking down the beautiful Charles Bridge we eventually got to Old Town. We were so amazed by its beauty. The lights, the buildings, the atmosphere, everything is breathtaking. There are restaurants and small cafes everywhere, a lot of sovenir shops and if you walk throgh old town eventually you find a rather big shopping centre, mall.

Old Town Prague - amazing. It was one of the few business trips that I managed to get out of the hotel and Prague Old Town and its surroundings are truly great. Enjoyed coffee while looking over to the Astronomical clock, managed to have a beer "u medvidku" At the Bears Pub, so I tastet one of the worlds greatest lagers so really made most of my stay here.
Beautiful city. Lots of beautiful buildings and little shops. Street music was very entertaining. Enjoyed the Hard Rock Cafe. Lucerna art deco arcade worth a visit, off St. Wenceslas Square.

A jewel. There is no doubt that the Old Town of Prague is one of the most magnificent places to be en Europe and fully deserves the UNESCO World Heritage label. Each street, each corner, each building... is a beauty in itself. You can stroll around one and again because as daylight changes, the old city seems to wear new colors and shapes. Travelers will appreciate that the old city is kept very clean (hopefully Paris and Rome would follow the example).

Couldn't believe it would be so beautiful!. I had heard Prague was a beautiful town, but until I saw it for myself I couldn't have imagined it was so amazing. We were only in Prague for 23 hours but were really glad we made time to fit it into our vacation of Germany and Krakow.

Fantastic. Lovely, full of history and life. I recommend to "get lost" in the small streets around the Old Town Square. It's not big and it is very, very nice. There's no traffic, so you can walk easily.

Busy, but relaxed place. Very busy with plenty to see, but also quite relaxed, with everyone just strolling around taking pictures and talking. We had good weather, so it was perfect for strolling, and people watching.

Such a cute!. The Old Town brings you back to the medieval years. Every building is so very well maintained! The Astronomical Clock gatthers crowds each hour even when the figures just come out once a day, the square is a meeting point where tourists and locals can enjoy the sun (for the lucky ones that are travelling in Spring and Summer), beer or one of the cafes and restaurants around. A place to be known walking!!

Prague Old Town - picturesque but busy!. The historic Old Town in Prague is worth visiting for the picturesque scenery and interesting historical attractions. I would recommend going on a weekday as it was (almost unbearably) busy at the weekend!Historic Prague covers a surprisingly small area so you will need less time than you think.

Historic. Easy to get about and plenty to see and do. Only thing is beware the restaurants on the Old Town Square they all have a cover charge. The cobbled side streets are very atmospheric and are usually a lot cheaper.

Lovely square. Beautiful square, lots going on and the gluwin helped keep out the cold!! The bars and restaurants were lovely, but for cheaper options so down a side street to find real authentic Czech food
History. History and architectural marvels everywhere you look, from the hop-on, hop-off bus tour to wandering on your own.

Best area to stay in Prague. Loved it all. The easy access to see other parts of Prague. The buildings are still preserved and unspoiled. It is a busy place with stalls to eat from and there is a concert from the stage near Christmas time. It is a good place to view the Ancient Clock and to wait for the chimes on the hour.

For a lot less,simple but comfortable.. Liked everything for the excellent low price with nice food
and well staffed.
The rooms are clean,not smelly and good heat.

wonderful city. Amazing arquitecture and colurs, wonderful landscape views, lovely not expensive restaurants. We didn't like the Palace staff, there is a very unfriendly, unkind person at the Palace Entrance and we found the Interior of the Palace uninteresting as there were no furniture inside as one would expect.

Star attraction in Prague.. I guess this and castle area are the two most important and beautiful areas in Prague city. Quite a few sites within walkable distance. Equally enjoyable both in daylight and in night. Lots of traditional Czech food in the street-side stalls. It is hard to find right words to explain this place but let's say it is a typical European old town scene with a Czech twist (whatever that means) to it.

Excellent tours. We did two of the tours - Old Town with Monica; and the Castle with Ross. Both were incredibly knowledgeable, friendly and entertaining. We would use this service again on any future trips to Prague! The service was included in our airport transit.
Historically fascinating.. Loved the buzz, the buildings and statues. The clock was a little disappointing but the little lanes and shops around it were wonderful to explore.

No cars. Love the warren of little shops and streets with no cars. Easy to get to the old town. You can get on a road train tour from here or hire and old open top Ford Car with a driver for about £10 per person for 4 sharing. Worth visiting the jewish quarter and old synagogue.
Beautiful. Bustling lovely place to see and to all the little cobbled streets to wander around, the buildings are a beautiful sight especially at night

Wow!. There was a celebration of Czech food, craft and wine for the whole week I was there in addition to everything else. It was like being in a chocolate shop and not knowing what to choose next ( Well I was actually in one fantastic chocolate shop in Prague...meant to bring my treats home as pressies but ate them instead). I love the whole place and everything in it...the music, ballet, opera, castle (and Petra our guide), boat cruise, narrowest street and the restaurant at the bottom....Jewish Quarter and Lesser Town .....underground tour and sooo much more
Fairyland. This is one city that lives up to its billing. The art deco buildings don't quit. Hard to believe it was seriously damaged in WWdeuce.
Beautiful.. A must if you're in Prague, the buildings are just beautiful and there's so much to see. You can even get a horse-drawn carriage to tour you around.
Old Town Square. A very large square with a great fountain, lots of room for the crowds, oldest working astronomical clock in the world and fascinating architecture to enjoy.
Gorgeous. Beautiful, lots to do and see. Not bombed during the war so I suppose one of the prettiest cities in the world. Just go.
Old Town Square. Beautiful place, very very busy but to be expected, look up at the buildings,make sure you try the Old Prague Ham, part of the experience

cool area Every Tourist will Visit. Old Town (Czech: Staré Město) is a medieval settlement of Prague, Czech Republic. It was separated from the outside by a semi-circular moat and wall, connected to the Vltava at both of its ends. The moat is now covered up by the streets (from north to south-west) Revolučni, Na Příkopě, and Národni—which remain the official boundary of the cadastral district of Old Town. It is now in Praha 1.Soon after the city was expanded in the 14th century by Charles IV with the founding of the New Town, the moat and wall were dismantledNotable places in the Old Town include the Old New Synagogue, Old Town Square and Astronomical Clock. Across the river Vltava is the Lesser Quarter, called Malá Strana in Czech. These two parts of the town are connected by Charles Bridge. Josefov is located in the northwest corner of Old Town heading towards the Vltava.The Astronomical clock is an amazing piece of engineering and is over 500 years old. Sipping a hot chocolate in the cafe opposite while watching it perform is one of those sublime moments - the hot chocolate was also very good.you can spend the whole day in this place. it is so nice and alive. many restaurants, bars and nice settings all over the square plus the old clock every hour they have the show on the top of it.It's going to be the place everyone visits.

Old Town. This a must see. The square is large and surrounded by beautiful architecture. There are open air restaurants (with heaters in cooler weather) where you can sit to eat orha ve a drink and take in the beauty and the bustle of this area. Great place to go at night since there is a lot of activity and it's fun to sit and observe.
Beautiful and Breathtaking!. Fantastic square that captures the essence of Prague. Great to visit both day and night~lots of lovely cafes and restuarants. Wonderful architecture and great atmosphere!

Beautiful but a tourist inferno. The old town of Prague is beautiful, the buildings are extraordinary and have been very tastefully renovated. It is a pleasure to walk in those small streets, or at least it would be...if there were a bit less tourists or if the city had a better organization for receiving so many people. We were there the last week of October, and all streets around Old town square and all the way down to Charles' bridge were so packed that it was difficult just to walk through, and this at all times of the day and even worse in the evening. Thousands of souvenir shops with portable stereos at their doorstep yelling bad music, drunk groups everywhere from early in the evening, the whole place smelled and felt like tailored for low class tourism. What a difference with Vienna!I cannot start to imagine how things must be like in really high season!As a conclusion, I'll say "I'll be back"; maybe in a few years when things have matured and I'll try to find out if there is something like a low season there, because that's when I'll be going!
Atmosphere plus!. Loved the atmosphere, walkability of Old Town, gracious buildings, variety of architecture, buskers, surprised at the number of beggars...

This is Prague at its best. Old town is what Prague is all about. The biuldings, the history and the beauty of the place is not lost on anyone. I loved this city and would definately go back. I would recommend one of the free walking tours to really appreciate the history and culture of the place.

very atmospheric. If you like visiting cities then the Old Town almost certainly epitomises what you are looking for - cobbled strrets, attractive architecture, atmosphere - especially at night, plenty of bars to sit at and so on. Be prepared, though, for the fact that you are not alone - the first night we were there it was crammed with tourists, though to be fair after that it wasn't too bad. Also in some streets there is too much tourist tat - close youe eyes and walk through it as fast as you can.

Makes me feel like going back again.. Truly amazing despite all tourists, didn't bother me as the the church of our lady before Tyn put me into a spell and I was so taken by the gothic towers, went back again and again during our stay of a week just to look at it, day and night when it's lit up. The clock and all the building around are great to look at, takes you back in time. side streets, hot wine, pastries, great food at the Indian jewel just great. Up the clock view great, inside our lady of Tyn and st Nicholas church good too. Must visit The church of st James great interior and more, check it out you will see what I mean! Easy walk to jewish quarter and the must see museums.
old town. pretty much untouche dduring the war the town retains is charm andquirkiness a joy to visitors worldwide
Wait to see the clock strike on the hour. Crowds gather early around the clock so make sure you get there 10 mins to the hour. Don't stop for a drink here as you will be stung.

Fascinating buildings. Lovely to wander around the cobblestone streets but like any major tourist spots, eating here is not the best choice - you will do better heading a little further afield where you can rub shoulders with the locals rather than other tourists.
Christmas is a must time to visit..... Horse and cart ride, traditional market, HUGE christmas tree..... So Festive.....It snowed and just added to the magic... This city is so beautiful...

Don't go by car. Beautiful sights, buildings, mostly clean streets (with many construction work), really worth to spend at least one day by walking through the old town streets. Don't forget to leave your car in a safe parking lot because parking in the center is almost impossible. Parking places painted with blue is only for the local inhabitants, in other places, if you can find any, you can leave your car for only 2 hours.

Picture Postcard pretty. Lots of lively bars & coffee shops among the picturesque old buildings.Nobody rushes you to finish your food and move on.
Ideal for people watching

Crowded with tourists. Beautiful architecture in terms of size and space planning. but awfully crowded in Summer, a tourist trap. Observed a huge number of Koreans and Polish. I'll return, only, perhaps, in winter

Town Centre to visit. This was certainly a busy place bustling with tourists. Plenty of food stalls, restaurants so that you could sit and take in the town square. The buildings have been beautifully restored and painted. The Tourist Centre was a very good place to go to get ideas and advice on where to go.
The centre of Praha. The history of the square and the city. The square is alive most of the day and evenings with a variety of choice from the many restaurants and hotels.
excellent place to visit. The history, the architecture, the fell of the very old town center is a big attraction. The drawback – the multitude of tourists and sellers.

Old Town Charm!. Despite the tacky crystal shops, there's a picture to take around every corner. Churches and gorgeous architecture abound, it's a real pleasure walking around the Old Town. Even better if you take a carriage ride (and get proposed to while inside!) Very romantic!

Old world charm at it's best.. We love Old Town...only Innsbruck, Austria has similar appeal. What is interesting is that more English is being spoken in Prague than last time we visitied. This made our trip even better.

mediaeval square. A perfect place to relax and have a coffee if the weather is good.
The buildings surrounding the square are beautiful and a must is the astronomical clock.
The Old Town. The Old Town was very clean and very wellkept.. The only issue: Beggars although they did not bother you, you were aware of them

Enjoy the walk !. Wonderful buildings and architecture,mostly well preserved and maintained. Check out as many small lanes & alleys to keep away from the busier routes and the main attractions at peak times.
Old Town Square. This was great-go up the tower for a grea view of the city. And make sure you get the history of the clock, AND the clockmaker!
Lots to see and do. Lots of small bars and restaurants. Lovely atmosphere to wander around and discover.Find the cafes that are a bit off the main tourist route for better value.

Certainly beautiful.... That being said, beautiful places definitely suffer from their own hype. Old Town would be SO much better if it wasn't jam-packed full of tourists and littered with shops (and such) that catered specifically to those tourists. When visiting, try not to follow the crowds... break away, follow all the side streets, find something authentic, you'll be much more satisfied.
:). What a great spot to just relax and grab a drink or a bite to eat. This is exactly how i envisioned Prague. Gorgeous
The best place in the world. For me it is one of the best places in the world, I come always when I need it, so I need it quite often.
wonderful, but very crowded indeed. We loved the town. Shame about the huge groups following umbrella-bearing guides clogging up every narrow street.
intriguing. It is fascinating to look into the shops in old town and to watch the tourists waiting for the clock to do its performance on the hour.
Beautiful Place!. Scenery is amazing! everything around you is live, alot of shops and cafes. A bit over priced since in the town center but it's fun to be there.
charming center. cannot miss this...fun to amble around the medieval streets. fall is a great time to go....still crowded but was manageable.
When Old is Good. History of Prague on show. It is a bit crowded and you need to be smart about purchases. The local taxi industry could not be described as reputable. Be careful if paying in Euro's.

Overrated. I have traveled my whole life and have seen much of Eastern Europe. I can't get excited about the old city of Prague because there are just too any tourists! I don't feel this in other major cities like Rome or Paris, but is Prague I feel the influx of thousands of people so you there is wall-to-wall humanity at the clock or on the Charles Bridge. Definitely it is an attractive city, but after two visits I can't put it on my "to do" or "return to" lists. People are not overly friendly, and the food doesn't appeal to us. We had much more gratifying experiences in Eastern Europe in the grand old cities of Poland.

Worth a visit. The Astronomical clock is an amazing piece of engineering and is over 500 years old. Sipping a hot chocolate in the cafe opposite while watching it perform is one of those sublime moments - the hot chocolate was also very good.

Must see.. Tourist Attraction. I were there already once.. But got a bad bad weather....My second visit was much much better... Great weather with lots of sunshine...I am able to take lots of beautiful pictures.....This place is a magic... sad.... lots of stories.....

amazing. you can spend the whole day in this place. it is so nice and alive. many restaurants, bars and nice settings all over the square plus the old clock every hour they have the show on the top of it.

Every Tourist will Visit.. It's going to be the place everyone visits - from tourists to Stag parties will pass through at some stage. We had our online booking for the City Sightseeing Bus Tour turned into a voucher here for our Bus Tour.Make sure you take a camera with you for the Prague Astronomical Clock!
Short Break. Beautiful buildings, friendly people, clean and very reasonable to eat and drink. Make sure you visit the famous clock on the hour.
Old square. Beautiful historic buildings and magnificent clock. The photos we took both day and night do not give a true picture of the magnificence of the old town square.
prague. We enjoyed all the things that Prage has to offer. The people were wonderful, the tours were informative and memorable. The Segway was great!
a must. going up to the old town is probably something nobody should miss when in Prague: there's a lot to see and you should reserve several hours for this experience
So European, what a joy. So many wonderful things to enjoy in the Old Town, and whatever you do, if you like pork you'll love the smoked shoulders.
Beautiful sights. Be at the clock tower at the hour to see the interesting "performance" ! Beautiful old buildings surround you everywhere.
Such a wonderful place. Wonderful place,maybe best in a Prague.I traveled to Prague a few day ago.Oldtown square is beautiful.

The Old Town Square. The energy, the showcase of culture, the people, everything a town square should be. Located so close to the Hotel, it also houses the famous Erpet Showroom. The Astronomical Tower was good, though the crowd could have been managed
Beautiful at Christmas. Fantastic big Christmas tree all lit up at night, concerts, hog roast, mulled wine- great atmosphere
Old Town. Great to wonder around and see the beautiful architecture. There are a lot of souvenir shops, but there is still a real charm to the place

Beautiful City. Prague is just an beautiful, enchanting city that is easy to get around on foot and filled with fantastic sights. The churches and buildings, the Astronomical Clock, Wenceslas Square, the Vlatva River are just wonderful. The city is mostly pedestrian mall. It is worth the trip.
Good fun. Lots of little historic old streets - only downside was the number of other people, but that made it all the more lively and happy a place to visit

Many fascinating buildings and streets. Many interesting buildings, churches, restaurants, streets etc. All within easy walking diatance & we enjoyed the trams and Metro to get around and sample the city
7 DAYS IN PRAGUE. We like all plases in Prague. It is the best city in Europe. We stayed at Green Garden hotel. Good location, good service
Beautiful City. Make sure you wonder down the little cobbles streets to find some jewel cafes, restaurants and bars. Better food and drinks for less cost
Old Town. Everything about the Old Town was wonderful and we had an apartment on Jilska Street so very central
Amazing and beautiful centre. I've been to Prague twice and loved it the second time around just as much as the first, amazing architecture and very historical
Great for people watching.. Go to the top of the clock tower, great views over the entire area. We were there after a light snowstorm just beautiful! Well worth the admission fee.
Walk all over and enjoy the ambiance. Wonderful history but BUSY, even in October. Go out early and enjoy everything while the City is waking up.
historic Prague. The history, the square, the restaurants, the widely diverse architecture.For a first time visitor, a local guide is,if not a must, a of great help.
Old town. Very nice like ferry tale story.I enjoy visiting all the monument around the square and all of them have especiall histoy that can attract you completly.
We loved the clock. This is a beautiful old square, however, it is very busy and the restaurants are very expensive by Prague standards.
So much to see. Whichever way you look -there's beautiful buildings, street performers and a feeling of being part of history. The astronomical clock is fantastic -especially the on-the-hour shows.
Enormous variety of buildings. It isn't just that there are old buildings (very well preserved), but that there is such a variety of wonderful buildings to gawk at and visit!

Excellent area to hang out in the night.. Great vibe, ambiance, lively. We went there pretty much most nights, before retiring to the hotel. We sat at one of the local restaurants at their heated outdoor seating, excellent gluh wines, appetizers.
Praguewalker tour. Wonderful part of the walking tours we took with our personal guide Tereza, she pointed out features and history no guide book could ever cover.

Beautiful. The square is lovely and there is a great atmosphere with the jazz buskers and all of the horse and carts. Ice cream was a disappointment but the hot chocolate is delicious, really thick and creamy (and yummy with a shot of something in!)
Come and see the artists .... On this location you can meet many artist doing their own art... playing on unusual instruments or creating an old school tricks...
Perfect location. Convenient, great atmosphere, centrally located re: main attractions. Fab restaurants, amenities and would def recommend
Nice half day walk. Very Busy, but walking away from major route, tourist and shopping, shows interesting architectures.
Full of history...but full of tourists !. What more can you ask ? If you like history this is the place to go...but you wont be alone. Prague is a nest for tourist !

eh. The gothic-style architecture differentiates this place from many other popular tourist cities There is a lot to see & make sure you bring a map because it is pretty easy to get lost. I found that some maps try to translate the Czech roads in English & this screwed me up a few times. Get a Czech map with substantial road detail and you will be fine.I hate to sound like a travel snob but Prague overall for me was a bit of a let down. Even putting the castle aside which was the biggest disappointment, the old town area wasn't all that special in comparison to many other cities in Europe. I would also go further to say that it was the least clean & well kept of all historic cities I have seen so far. This city also goes down as the most annoying that I've visited as it was packed with large tourist groups at every turn and you are bothered every 5 minutes by either a street vendor or a beggar. Architecture aside, all the negatives reminded me most of NYC. One can see why many American kids come to study here.When in Prague, old town is obviously a must - but overall I think there are better places in Europe to spend your time.
The place to go. This is the place you have to visit if in Prague. Buildings are in better shape than in many other towns of this age, but still preserve the right athmosphere!

As good as old Europe gets.... This is simply one of those places you have to visit over and over. We loved walking around in daytime and at night. Only wish our SD cards could hold more pictures... loved everything about it!

Wonderful Square. Beautiful Square w/ so many sights. If you love architecture, be sure to notice all the different types right together. hundreds of years of styles all in one spot. As with all the tourist spots in Prague (including on the metros and trams), be very careful of pickpockets! They are artists to the hilt!

Beautiful Old Town. Beautiful Old Town in Prague. Lots of good places to eat and shop (although one or two pubs might try and rip you off, so beware of what they're charging you). Love the outdoor heaters so you can sit relaxed on a cool evening/night. Always busy which shows it's one of the best places to relax in Prague.

History with a slightly tacky side. We stayed in Mala Strana (Lesser Town) and crossed into Stare Mesto using the Charles Bridge. There's definitely a mood change on entering the square leading from the bridge, with people offering you restaurants and boat trips. That aside, the Stare Mesto is very atmospheric - and there are some good deals to be had: the boat trips sold by the guys in white sailor suits right by the Charles Bridge being a case in point; informative, with free drink and leberkusen-style gingerbread!

Surreal. I did not dislike at thing about Old Town. It was quite beautiful. NIce places to eat and shop and the out door pubs, restaurants had the heaters and blankets in case it was a bit chilly. Truly enjoyable.
The Prague Experience. Beautiful place, you won't mind walking for hours. Hungry? There are many food stalls selling variety of food at affordable prices.

Night & Day. Recommend you go there for night and day pictures. It's like a storybook and most sights are an easy walk from here. You can even eat in the Square and watch the Astronomical Clock change on the hour.

Very very romantic place. Old town is the very beautiful and romantic place.Everything around me look very classic.Weather is very good. Suit for the people who love to take photo.I went there with my brother than I intend to go there again with my family.
Magic City. Well preserved beautiful architecture, good food, good service. The historic center of Prague is beautiful. Irresistible and magical

Hustle and bustle. Very nice area, head off the square to find hidden gems in the way of bars or restaurants that serve great food at a more reasonable price.Town square is great for a coffee and people watching, I like how warm they like to keep you with outdoor heaters and blankets :)

This is Prague. Tons to see here and lots of fun. Charles Bridge is a hoot and the entrance to Old Town. There are street mimes floating in the air, musicians, concert halls, beer pubs and anything you would ever want here. Truly one of the destination locations in the world. If you see a concert be sure to negotiate the price... they will come down a good amount. Be sure to bring your camera!

Beautiful and Breathtaking. Prague is amazingly beautiful. Reminds me of Paris, the architecture is beyond amazing. The food is great and the sightseeing is very easy because the public transportation is top notch. Loved it you must go!

I spent most of my time here. From old town, you will be able to walk to all of the main attractions Prague has to offer.
The area is littered with excellent photo opportunities, as well as souvenir shopping and cafes. I can't really imagine anyone going to Prague and not stopping here.
walk around & lose yourself. If you like walking this is the place, just walk & you will see many churches but you would think they are all castles,

A Surprise Around Every Corner. It's easy and fun to get lost in Stare Mesto. Lots of galleries, restaurants, touristy stores, narrow alleyways, etc. Every time we thought we were heading toward Charles Bridge or the Old Town Square we found ourselves somewhere else....and the bonus was we always found something exciting and interesting to see before arriving at our intended destination.
Beautiful!. Like most of the city - Old Town is beautiful. A lot of shops and restaurants. We walked through almost daily as we stayed very nearby. Thoroughly enjoyed it!
Great historic European city centre. Very nice city centre, cool astronomy clock and nice places to have coffee. Good for walking around and picking up the Czech atmosphere.
Love it.. I have fallen in love with the Old Town and having visited twice this year am looking forward to my next visit.
Loved Prague Old Town. Loved it, so close to where we stayed, lots to see and do. Very easy and safe to walk around. Lots of restaurants and shops, interesting history

Does not dissapoint.. The Old Town of Prague is exceptional and truly does live up to the hype of being one of Europe most well preserved and beautiful historic districts. Expect a lot of tourists and souvenir shops, I would recommend visiting at night to be able to stroll at your own pace.

Too much of everything. You have to do it. You have to walk through it. But, then I absolutely had to get away. I intentionally walked around the square to avoid it after having gone through it once. If you've been to any other Square in Europe, then you've been to this one. I completely endorse going through and seeing anything that you might be interested in. But, there is no reason to hang out or buy anything/eat anything on the square. Brussels, Krakow, and Bruges all do it better.The souvenir shops around the square blare loud, weird rap music which is off putting, and they're not selling anything interesting. We opted for the off the beaten path parks in Praha 4, and the more realistic part of town - New Town.Glad we did it, no need to go back.
Another town centre. Interesting old style town centre. A bit of a maze, like most. Since I was often lost, I am not sure I saw everything.

Very beautiful. Old town is very beautiful, but also very touristy - the ground floor of every building seems to be touristy shops and restaurants. We enjoyed walking around and exploring all the twisting, turning streets. Make sure you have good shoes as most of the streets and sidewalks are cobblestones. It doesn't seem like many locals are in old town - just the tourists. I heard a lot about pickpockets, but did not witness anything, although we did keep a good handle on our bags. There are a lot of police walking around - I'm not sure if this made me feel more safe or worried.
Old Europe. Got the feel of real Europe. Old well maintained buildings.Clean streets, good connectivity by road and metro.

SPECTACULAR. Great for people watching, cafés and churches all around. At times it was very crowded and easy to get lost. We went to a concert in St. Nicholas church which we enjoyed. They had theseall over.
Great to walk around. The area is easy to walk around and get to and it is really pretty. The Jewish Museum was very special, and the architecture in general very beautiful.

Old world charm. Well-preserved, unspoiled area where everything is within strolling distance. A pleasure to walk around. Lots of historic sites and buildings. A very interesting place. Don't miss the Astronomical clock on the hour and the old town square.
Historic and entertaining. All the bus and walking tours to places of interest start from here. The street entertainers are great.
Wonderful buildings. Full of atmosphere,buskers and tourists! The surrounding buildings are beautiful and you can pick-up a free walking tour to get you orientated at the start of your trip
Beautiful!. Definitely worth exploring, just walking the side streets and exploring away from the crowds! So many beautiful buildings to see.

Defining Romance. This square truly defines romance,,,, amazing architecture, great food joints,, ametuers and professionals playing amazing music,, small narrow lanes with selling gem of artifacts... easily a person can spend a full day here.. and in the night,, when the square lights up,, it is jaw dropping... great place to be at prgaue

Historic center, wonderful buildings, sculptures, and clock!. Even in October, many crowded places, but despite that, Prague was fascinating and full of interesting things to do. Walking everywhere, getting to know the quarters, enjoying our tour of Jewish Quarter, Little Quarter and all around the square to the river.

Historic center, wonderful buildings, sculptures, and clock!. Even in October, many crowded places, but despite that, Prague was fascinating and full of interesting things to do. Walking everywhere, getting to know the quarters, enjoying our tour of Jewish Quarter, Little Quarter and all around the square to the river.
Beautiful. The astronomical clock - wait for the hour chime during the day!!!! The whole area architecturally is just amazing.
Beautiful but very touristy. The title says it all. A must see, but super touristy. The stores around the old town are generally overpriced and sell the same tourist fare at high prices.

Lots going on. Historic buildings, delightful ambience, many choices of restaurants, nice shopping but there are other places for less, loved the various music entertainers on the sidewalks and evening concerts in churches.

The most famous place in Prague. First time I saw Old Town Square (Staroměstské Náměstí) only two weeks ago. It's really magnificent. I frequently visit building near Old Town Square and see a lot of people siting there, talking, having a rest and so on. It's really great!!!
Simply Mesmerizing. A stroll around the old town square is mesmerizing. The architecture of the buildings is breathtaking and transports your mind to an old world charm.

nice part of Prague. Nice and beautiful part of Prague. You can take the 'free guide tour' at the square and that is very interesting. Very good guide that lives of tips from the touristst. You pay him what You like. Tour takes about 3 hours and is a 3 km walk and You see the whole of Prague with extra inside information

good place to hand around.... good place to hang around..the famous astronomical clock tower is located here. Charles Bridge is also not very far. its about 10 mins of walk. you will find the shops that sell paintings and crystals too.
Good views,. Very well kept, and clean! very tourist orientated no real Czech food unless you hunt it down. Lots going on until the early hours in the morning!
Unspoiled and spectacular buildings - wonderful!. Colourful, vibrant and unspoiled. The architecture is wonderful with lots of variety. Take a walk round and take it all in.
Easy access. Great city, easy to walk, and mostly no need for cabs. Some great restaurants, and walk to the Castle not far.

Prague is a Joy to Behold. We loved Old Town, so quaint, even though the Town Center can become quite crowded with tourists, especially a the hour when the Astronomical Clock does its thing. You really get the feeling of a Medieval Town, with the Gunpowder Tower as the gateway into Old Town, and the Gothic Church opposite the square. Don't miss the clock, it is a main attraction, however, make sure you are aware that this is the perfect spot for pickpockets. The Church of Tyn, is also something to see. In Old Town is the Hotel Prince, and if you want an experience, go up to the roof terrace for a capuccino and a breathtaking view of the city. The food is nothing to write home about, but the view is worth spending a few crowns to have a bite there. See the Town hall it is also beautiful. There is plenty of shopping for those who are so inclined. Don't miss it, the people are friendly, speak English and are absolutely wonderful.
In the heart of Europe. Famous historical part of Prague with small streets. Lot of monuments - Astronomical Clock, Old Town square etc. Very nice!

Nothing else quite like it. I first visited the Old Town in 1988 - it had come through centuries of war and peace and was still perfect. Then there were few visitors - now there are many but it retains its style, history, and brilliant townscapes. Add to that its famous astronomical clock and you have a unique place.

Walk into the past. This is a very well kept part of the city that retains its old world charm. It can be touristy so first thing in the morning or later in the day is best. All parts of Prague look different during the day and then in the night- 2 cities for the price of one!
Glowing. Besides all the prostitutes late at night, this is worth the wait for everyone to leave. The late night stroll gives you the time to stop and actually see the detail of all the buildings.

Beautiful. What is not to like. Picturesque everywhere. Bring a map as it is easy to get turned around. The clock is beautiful and a big meeting place for tours. There are some great restaurants along the square but you can find great meals much cheaper on the side streets

Old town. Packed with people, too many of us. Wonderful buildings, very romantic. The astronomical clock is amazing, specially after knowing it has been working nonstop for the last 600 years and that 70% of the pieces are original still.

The Clock. The astronomical clock was the most interesting part for us. Pretty amazing how old that piece of equipment is (first installed in 1410). Lots of other architecture to look at including some churches. If you eat or drink on the square it will cost a little more just for the location but it’s worth it to have a drink and people watch.

Beautiful architecture. Very pretty architecture. This is one of the only cities in Europe that was not completely ripped about in WWII, and the buildings are very attractive. The area, as you would expect, is pretty touristy and there is now disappointingly a significant Western influence, but overall it was a fun place to visit.
Beautiful old town. More history than you can take on board in a short visit but stunning views and places to visit everywhere I went.

Beautiful and real, not rebuilt!. Prague escaped most of the destruction caused by WWII and thus it's buildings are the original thing, not a rebuild. This square is one of the best in Europe. Beware that the cobblestones can have their effect on your feet over time. You'll be doing a lot of walking. The sights are wonderful and the Czech people are a delight. You can just hang right here for hours and watch the world go by.
Lovely. A lovely little place with alot of beautiful buildings to look at and lovely little market stalls, a bit of a maze to get to so a map is reccommended
Stunning and Historic. A gorgeous town square, dominated by 14-century architecture. Enjoy the views while snacking on street food!
Great place to eat & people watch. Large, old, town square with lots of people and lots of out-door restaurants. Besides the bridge, this is the happening place in Prague.

delightful and authentic gasthof at the foot of the mountain. Stare mesto old town is a labyrynth of small streets and the odd wee square, centred on the main square with the astronomical clock and Tyn church. Many restaurants, shops and small inns, but can be crowded. One of the best such areas anywhere.

Some great stuff to see here. The town square is a must, some great restaurants and the Jewish quarter is just to the north. There is also a nice restaurant - Staroměstská restaurace. Great prices unless you eat outside and extra is added to your bill!
Lovely city. We had fun strolling the old, cobbled crooked streets. Great architecture to see! Cafes were fun. Very crowded. Glad we did not visit in the summer tourist season!
Nice. Very Nice! Very detailed and has lots of history. The walk and halls are great! Friendly environment and great places to sip on a nice chilled beer, such as KOZEL!

Typical Europen old town square. Europe has so many old town squares, and Prague is very typical. A large square with statues in the center, restaurants and shops surrounding the square, local performers and lots of people milling around. The atomic clock is the big draw in the square. Outdoor dining at the restaurants where you can be seated as well as local food from take out stands that you can get an eat on the go. Very pretty, and a must see while in Prague.
Jaw dropping. Living history....breathtakingly beautiful and perfect for a romantic walk and dinner. Try the mulled wine in the winter time....
AMAZING. Do not leave Praha without visiting Stare Maesto, if you are lucky you can hear astronomical clock every hour ringing
Best old town in Europe. Many remarkable old structures, palaces, and churches. Very clean, friendly locals with good English.
Gorgeous. It's so big, you can walk and walk or hours and there will e till things to do another day or trip to prague
Amazing!. It was like stepping back in time. Jaw droppinginly beautiful! Best place to take a walk and take in the beautiful scenery!

Picturesque square. Fantastic astronomical clock which 'performs' every hour Beautiful buildings, stunning old church overlooking the square. Great place to sit with a glass of wine, soak up the atmosphere and people watch.

A few magic hours. You can easily spend here a few hours, admiring architecture,history, colourful touristic crowd. You may enjoy an ice beer at one of the restaurants at the square or take a cup of coffee with a piece of cheese cake at Starbucks. Don't miss the Clock performance - without it you can't admit that you were in Prague

Heart of the city. You can't miss visiting the heart of prague where u can take very nice pics visit the astronomical clock and some other historical churches near by you can find one of the most popular shopping malls ;)

Wonderful Bohemian like City. Very clean and busy area while visiting in August. The Astronomical clock was definitely one of the highlights, but all of Old Town as well as the rest of the city is incredible. Defintely worth checking out and just walking through the maze of streets and seeing all the wonderful architecture makes it all worh while!Much of the architecture and buildings appear to be untouched after what the country went through for many decades. Very Bohemian and rather Medevial like. Definitely a must see if you have not been to Prague. So many wonderful places and museums to see, including the famous "Charles Bridge" which seems to be busy all of the time.

Too Crowded. Although I found Prague to be a beautiful city, I found the overwhelming number of tourists traveling in groups a bit disconcerting. Most of these groups travel like a herd, pushing their way through and not exhibiting any manners at all. It really got old after a few days. We had traveled in other cities during this trip and although crowded, the pure volume of groups made this area hard to navigate.
beautiful. just what i thought it would be- beautiful buildings, endless cafes and souvenir shops, not tacky though. astronomical clock is a wonder, especially on the hour!

Beautiful. Liked - the old astronomical clock
Disliked - having to pay to use a toilet in a bar where you have just paid over the odds for a drink.

Fun food and preserved architecture. The preserved architecture is everywhere to be seen. Enjoy some of the free standing food concessions for hot wine, local pastry, potatoe chips on a stick and other fun foods.

Charming!. Very clean and quaint. Many wedding parties seen during our visit!
Astronomical clock was the highlight for us, but entire area was interesting!
# 1 sight. The buildings,food stands,clock tower tour,crowds were all fabulous to see and watch. You must take one of the walking tours starting from this square.

Maze of streets. Wonderful place to wander thru. Streets twist and turn with no discernible pattern. Many little shops and restaurants for the tourist. Enjoy. Look at the architecture and look at the people and realize people have been walking here for over a 1000 years!

Look up on Top of the various buildings.. The secret of visiting Old Town is look at the top of the buildings to see the ornaments. On the food stands in the center of the squares, the pork can be very expensive and it would be better to eat that cafes instead.

Love the architeture!. What a surprise the old town square is in Prague. The architeture is just amazing and mostly orginal with Prague not being destroyed by wars. The astronomical clock gets a little crowded around 11am. Watch for pickpockets!
Best town square. What a wonderful atmosphere with 3 magnificent attractions but with stall and shops and entertainers - really good!
Delightful. One of Europes great central squares. Wide open surrounded by restaurants, plenty of entertainment, safe but be careful.

The largest liveliest and best public square I've ever experienced. Old Town Square should be on everyone's itinerary in Prague. Loaded with outdoor cafes, shops on the perimeter and a small green space inside along with the old court house tower and clock. Fromthe tower you get an unparalleled view of the city

Packed with tourists. I was last here before the end of communism and we almost had the old town square to ourselves then, but it survives the bus-loads today and you don't have to walk far to find quiet old streets which look as though they have a story to tell.

The heart of Prague. Unique architecture, narrow streets and historical buildings. The area to start seeing in Prague. Recommend to do a walking trip, as listed in one of the sites (tripadvisor, etc).

Crowded but a nice place to walk around. This area has beautiful buildings and charming cobble stoned streets. Don't overlook side streets - you may miss a good restaurant or bar. There is plenty do see and do in this area. It's also easy to get lost but just look up and look out for one of the main attractions - you will find your way.
old town. Very busy place, but felt safe. Don't be afraid to explore several blocks around this area, lower prices and great selection in the smaller stores.

Lovely square but be wary. Nice square for people-watching and relaxing but be wary of the restaurants. Most are over-priced and even the stalls will display prices by 100g but then serve large portions.
Can get very busy as tour groups usually set off from here.
Old town with a vibe. Loved the ambience around Old Town, most of the restaurants are a bit costly but you may find some that are reasonably priced.

a lot to see. the place is beautiful . in every corner you see historical buildings with beautiful architecture.you can walk around discovering nice spots and coffee shops.just avoid the coffee shops inside the square because you can get a bad suprise with the high prices...just nearby we disovered caffe Rembrand where you can have coffee and home made cakes with reasonable prices
Something special. Prague is a beautiful city and the old town square is a must see! The astronomical clock has crowds around it every hour so get there early but don't expect too much.
Old Town Square. Loved the place the history and the old beautiful buildings .. so many restaurants to eat and taste the czech cuisine, so many crafts and souvenirs shops .. just amazing city

Brilliant. Saw a bride everyday under the famous clock, got a free hug!
First time the people noise was incredible, lots of tour groups that day
A must do visiting Prague. Great atmosphere although some of the restaurants a little expensive in the main square, but a worth while experience.

Every place where you turn your eye into is really beautiful. In the small roads reaching the old town square there are perhaps too many tourists and they become crowded but the ambiance and beauty of the place let us forget it all.

Old Town Prague. Lovely area to look around , shop, eat and people watch. You can spend days exploring the area. It is a real tourist area, but you know that and it is worth while going early morning to beat the crowds.

We did not touch the suitcases. Great apartment situated place. All places walk reachable. Very comfortable large and big size rooms. 100 meter is really 100m that have inside measurement of the apartment. Tall, nice ceiling of exclusive old made apartments. No one from the office bother us during the vacation and all keys deals good arranged. In latest day just put it on the kitchen table , close the door and go away.Our back flight was about at 23:00, but checkout at 11:00. We were offered to leave all suitcases at apartment and the office took care of all transportation. We did not touch the suitcases at all and staff transported and then transported us with suitcases to the airport. It was very pleasure. Very recommended and reliable office.
YAmazing worth coming here once. It's beautiful lots to do and seeLots of shops and restaurants and coffee shopsIt's October and lots of people here so I cannot imagine this place in June july August

Beautiful. Just stand in the Old Town Square in one spot and no matter where you look, all you will see is historic stunning architecture from a number of eras and empires. There is so much to see, do and eat. You can enter St Nicholas Church and look around for free. The interior is breathtaking. There is regular musical entertainment in the heart of the square and horse and cart tours.Walk down any street leading off the square and the sights get better and better. You will need more than one day to visit to tour the whole neighbourhood, It is so much fun to discover little passageways which open lead to plazas, parks and gardens.
Amazing ! worth visit. good atmosphere , good food, and lot to seeweather was nice, so we walk .....(take care form local thieves!!)

Quaint. The old town was a huge square surrounded by restaurants, an english pub and shops. Lots of buskers in the square.The Astronomical clock is a must to seeThere are lots of jewellers also, some quite reasonable, garnets are the stone of Prague and really lovely.

walking,drinking,romancing. Prague's old town is meant to be walking around. You will get to see,eat,drink ( great local beer ) and bump into nice people.Sad that the prohibition was on during september 2012.

Expensive but unique to the world. Old town square was great to walk through and was very unique beauty! I loved it there, however everything including the restarants, hotels, shops and even the street food were more expensive than other places
The Watch. The watch from 1300 ac, the history tell us that the emperor order this watch and then paid the watchman and made him blind just that he never could build one again.

Stunning City Square. Visit here on the first day of your trip and tag along with one of the 'free' walking tours. They are very informative and all the tour guides ask for is a tip at the end. Well worth it.
Incredibly beautiful. the old part of the city is just astonishing. Beautiful old buildings everywhere. As someone in Prague put it it's like a great museum.

The most beautiful town center I have ever seen!!!. Gorgeous, complex, large part of city center. You can walk for hours and be stunned by the architecture, concerts, restaurants, bars, pubs, museums and shops. Many concerts every day. Gorgeous Parizska (Paris) street with the most exquisite shops, buildings from 11th century, world famous tower clock Orloj, Jewish Quarters, Jewish Cemetery and Synagogues, Kafka, Dali & Mucha museums, just so much to do.............also a must to see it at night. Looks amazing.
Lots of People. Nice, nice one of the most Gorgeous places I ever been, wasela squeare it's also very closed, everything is like on a line nice place to go and had all the fun in the wold
bustlin'. Can't miss, if you come to prague you have to visit the old town, take a free walking tour to really get the place to come to life.

Good to have a guided tour. The Old Town Square is a place where all the guided tours met, so it was crowded and a bit confused at the beginning to most travelers, especially for those who were in a rush.You learned more about the Astronomical Clock with a guide who provided highlights on the landmark and made looking at it much more interesting.
Beautiful Square with Interesting Architecture. Definitely a must-see when in Prague. Beautiful, completely interesting and unique buildings with a wonderful European square surrounding them.
old town. There are many eating places, most with reasonably priced choices. Astronomical clock is worth a look

Fantastic place and a must see on a visit to Prague. It's great to sit at one of the outside cafe's with a beer (or a coffee) and do some people watching. The food stalls are great to look around and they have traditional yummy food on offer

Take a leisurely stroll. We spent a few days in the Old Town and found it well worth just strolling around, enjoying the atmosphere and coming across little back waters and side streets. It's worth planning trips to the major attractions (many close on Mondays, for example) but we came across numerous interesting places just wandering. Take a good map!
Wonderful view. We had an early dinner out in the middle of this area, the price was higher but the view was amazing

Great atmosphere any time of day. The old buildings around the main square are kept in great shape, the street food tastes great and there are many cute shops in the serounding streets. History comes to life if you take a tour: walking, biking, segway, carriage...

Wonderfully haphazard. The Old Town is the complete opposite of the right-angled grid system of many cities. It is a delight to walk down narrow curving streets and alleyways and be taken by surprise by what is round each corner - just wander about, but have that map in your pocket for when you get lost. Much of the architecture is fascinating. Of course, it is heaving with tourists ... just like you.

Beautiful area of town. The Old Town is beautiful and historic. There are great Restaurants and if you are their on the hour you can see the astrological clock in motion and with the horn musician - but be ware it is very touristy so - pick pockets!
just walk around and enjoy. Everywhere you look are nice buildings. Just to much to see. I is a place to explore and look for the nice spots.

GET OFF THE BEATEN TRACK. Like many capitals, there is the well worn tourist track and yet just a few metres away, there is the "off road" experience. Do not miss the river walk and the Jewish Quarter. Down the side streets are the ostensibly grotty pubs, but they are the genuine article and food and wine there is simple, authentic and cheap. If the Czechs are eating and drinking there and the menu is only in Czech, do it!
Enjoy the view despite the big crowd around you.. Beautiful architecture; rich historical monuments. But the crowds are thick, and too much commercialism all around.

Steeped in history, pricey for attractions. Beautiful district with lots of things to see and do. It has the usual tourist shops/bars/restaurants but also plenty of architecture/buildings etc steeped in history, however interesting can be pretty pricey as admission is charged seperately for each attraction.

A great full day of wandering.... Wandering is the name of the game here. You need to carry a good city map and be willing to put it in your pocket and wander to see what you stumble upon and then find your point of reference on the map. It is great fun and there is something to see no matter where you go.Look for the free city tour guides in red t-shirts. If their group is in your language, you can tag along at no charge and drop off at any time. They have great history and facts about the people and place.Learn that there are three subway lines as well as bus and trams. The system allows you to buy a three day pass for 310 czk but you really need to ride at least 5 times a day to make it pay. Instead get a single pass for 24 czk which only starts when you first validate it inside the station or tram. You can then ride for 30 minutes which gets you nearly anywhere you need to go! We use the system to get us back to our hotel at the end of the day once we are exhausted. Just ensure you go with coins as the automats in the stations do not accept bills or credit cards.There are tons of great things in Old Town. My favorites: Old Square, Charles Bridge, Jewish Quarter, Wenceslas Square, Maiselova Street is like the Champs Elysee with highest end shopping.Don't eat in Old Town!! It is far too expensive. Instead, snack around buying from street vendors. You can get a great sausage in baguette for only 60 czk (USD 3) and many other reasonable foods.Look for the WC everywhere if you require a toilet. You will need to have 10 czk coins for them but if you pay the facilities are usually clean and worth the small cost.

This is as European as it gets!. Everything about Old Town is beautiful....lots of places to explore. Easy to walk around (wear comfortable, flat shoes since the whole area is cobblestones), continue across Charles Bridge to lesser town and Prague Castle. Would recommend the 360 views from top of the astronomical clock tower--very affordable and not too crowded before noon. If you need to exchange money...DO NOT USE THE EXCHANGE KIOSKS in old town. They are a RIPOFF!! Go to the bank or go to the exchange kiosks in the lesser town area....the rates are much better!
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful and stunning site. Be sure and visit during the day and also at night. Magical!

Old Town never gets old!. One of my favorite places to go to in prague! Walking around, just watching the people and going into stores can take up several days. There's everything here... puppets, souveniers, great food, the Astronomical Clock, speciality shops, etc. I recommend goign to Manufaktura which sells some beauty products (soap, hair gels, shampoo, etc) made out of beer and wine. U Prince restaurant which has a rooftop terrace restaurant with an awesome view. There is also the amazing architecture to watch, what I love about Prague is that anywhere you look at, there's something to see!
too busy. We found Prague too busy, we have been to other busy tourist destinations but Prague was in a different league

Beautiful architecture. Prague old town is full of historical streetscapes. Row after row of beautiful buildings that appear to have escaped the bombings of WW2. The old town square is massive - much bigger than I expected. You can sit for hours just taking in the atmosphere and beauty of the surroundings.

Charming. So nice! A bit crowded with tourists, but still able to take advantage of the historic sites. Lots of restaurants and shops. Many have the same types of goods. We liked the variety in close by neighborhoods as well.

Heart of prague. The best part about prague, specially in the night do take a look from the top of astronomical clock, and besides the touristy stuff sit in some cafe and just look and the people around and listen to the music played by people
A feast for your eyes. The old town is filled with beautiful buildings and churches with stunning facades. Spend the time to wander the streets of the old town.
Beautiful. Amazing architecture. It gets crowed but very nice place to walk around, have a beer, coffee, dinner or lunch. During my 3 night stay I went there teicez definitely recommend.

Tourist paradise.. Stick to the Old Town and you don't really have to go anywhere else. You can walk everywhere. Plenty to see, eat and do. Definitely one of the most impressive tourist areas of Europe. I expected it to be nice but it surpassed my expectations. The buildings are breathtaking. Your hotel should be in this area.
Old Town. Lovely little streets, especially away from Wenceslas Square. Plenty of small cafes and restaurants to while away an hour in the sun and watch the world go by

Lively ancient city square. So many people out walking about and lots of activity. Great combination of modern life and amazing history reflected in beautiful buildings - former homes, shops and churches

Pretty but crowdy. +Pretty Old Town, intact by WW
- Very crowdy, eso. Charles Bridge and Old Town Square
- Charging you on every step, you need to buy ticket to almost every church, synagogue and museum
Old Town Prague. The Best of Prague Walking Tour explores the main sights and attractions of this enchanting city, and includes a walk through the Prague Castle complex.

Our Favorite Town Square. Enjoyed the vibrant crowds, the restaurants surrounding it, the astronomical clock and trumpeters. We spent days and evenings wandering the square and immediate neighborhoods.
fun old town area. we spent the day walking through the old town area it was so crowded that it was at times too much you must be able to handle cobble stone streets and crowds fun and historic
Clock Tower is a work of art and science. The highlight is the clock tower; highly recommend waiting for the hour to turn to see the figures come out of the windows on each side of the clock.

Just too many tourists. it is the end of September and the Square was still swarming with tourists. It was a bit uncomfortable at times, especially in confined spaces such as churches. There was barely room to breathe. I cannot imagine what it is like on the weekends
Crowded, but delightful!. It was fun to watch the astronomical clock on the hour and to also go up into the tower for great views of Prague.

Old Town Is Prague. If you see only one place this Must be it. the building are beautifully colored and restored. especially when compared to last visit 25 years ago when the country was in the soviet bloc.
One of the most spectacular public places in Europe. The architecture is wonderful and unique. This is one of the most pedestrian friendly cities in the world.
views. beautiful buildings, exceptionally lovely Tyn church with a lot of ornate gold work, lots of little streets with some good shops, but a lot of tourist tat.

Every place connected with history. Certainly, a lot of historical information related to ebery place and building there. It is better to have a good guide to have really full impression of this place.
Old Town. So nice to visit with all its winding streets and little shops, you could easily get lost in here all day without a care in the world.
Great town center. Surrounded by historic buildings and filled with people. Stick around and watch the clock strike the hour.
Beautiful But Full of Tourists. The Old Town is quite lovely and interesting, but it is full of tourists and lots of tourist type places and shops. But lovely nonetheless.
Must do. Beautiful town square. The architecture is interesting and authentic. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants. Street musicians throughout town. Quite enjoyable

Enchanting old city centre. I liked wandering the small alleys and streets full of history - they give you such a magical feeling. There are historical buildings everywhere and, although it may be full of tourists, the city centre offers a variety of entertainment options for every taste.

Magnificent fairy tale old city. There are no words to explain the beauty of the Old Town, you have to walk around the stone streets, look at the synagogues, buildings, the plaza, the monuments and of coarse the magnificent and impressive astronomical clock when it rings at the hour. A must do when visiting Prague. Very safe to walk around, lots of tourists around and shops and restaurants.
Straight out of a Storybook. Well preserved old town may be overrun with tourists but the gorgeous buildings are worth the effort.
beautiful old bilding. evrithing is amazing,speciall old clock with a beautifull terasse on a top of the billding.From there you can see allmost all town.
Lovely. Yes, beautiful, but avoid the weekend. It was so crowded that we felt like salmon swimming in a stream of people.
Dream :)). It is very exciting to see big cathedrals, amazing buildings everywhere. But you have to pay attention to your bags when it is too crowded.

old town. great old buildings, great place to met, where all the tours start and end, the astronomical clocks was very good, beggers are everywhere but they do not bother you, square is quite expensive
Quaint, charming city. Prague is almost like being in Western Europe! Beautiful, old buildings, charming sidewalk cafes, wonderful, unique shops.
Must See and walk around. This and the Castle Complex are Unesco world Heritage Sites and not to be missed. Take lots of fotos and snack and drink on the street as you go

The heart of Prague. So much history packed into this spot and the surrounding buildings. Make sure you see the inside of the Hess church and take the free morning tour with the guides with the yellow T-shirts.

Lively Old Town Square. Well worth the visit. Out door patios, live busker like entertainment, shops and lots of tourists and locals. The clock draws a massive crowd as the apostles come out every hour on the hour. Good fun and great ambiance.
Do not miss. Exceeded my expectations! Very beautiful with may surprising views. It seemed like story book land! I wonder why more Americans have not decided to go there.

Best of the best. This historical section of Prague takes the cake as far as I'm concerned. I'd put it up there with London and Paris when it comes to sheer volume of European history and tradition. With all of the additional quirks, it makes for an unforgettable experience like no other. If I had to chose, I'd go back to Prague over any other major city in Europe.
Worth a Visit. Lots of historic buildings - great place to people watch. Get a tour guide to get the most of the visit. And a good map - the place is very confusing.

Excellent architecture. Brilliant architecture worth getting a guide many of which are free. Save your legs and get on one of the tour trains. The only thing I didn't like was the fact I was sitting out side a restaurant and a man started doing a scissor picture of me without asking first and then demanded payment which made me feel very uncomfortable.
