Excellent trip though never been in the summer before last time was the Xmas markets which were brilliant. Would definateley return.

Great place to wander. The Baroque architecture was almost overwhelming. Many buildings have painting details, or gilding, or some other unique feature. Many, many buildings have flower boxes in their windows. Lots of small side streets to explore
must see if you go to prague. best to see in early mornings when is not too crowded, you will enjoy the atmosphere much more than during the day.

Old Town Square. Old Town Square was really lovely but on the first day it was very rowdy with lots of police there monitoring all the heavy drinking and smashing of glasses and singing. We loved the Astronomical clock and St. Nicholas Church. The cafes and restaurants were all nice, a bit expensive we thought, one waiter was a bit aggressive when he thought we weren't giving him a tip. But we did return to the Square nearly everyday at some point to watch the horses and carriages and music entertainment and many wedding couples just married paraded throughout.
variety of sights. there are many monuments and historic sites with great stories. Concerts are available any day you choose. Expensive to sleep or eat there.
Wonderful architecture. Easily walkable and all flat? Lots of interesting things to see and places to eat. Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Gorgeous. I loved walking around Prague. Everything is lovely in the Old Town and while it is, of course touristy, it's managed to keep its charm and appeal. It's lovely at night all lit up. I would suggest comfy shoes because the cobblestone takes its toll on your feet. Also, try and find places off the beaten track to eat. It will be much cheaper. Definitely make a point of seeing the Charles Bridge and of course, Prague Castle.
Try to get there early. As with all tourist cities, it can get very busy with organised groups. Be prepared for the crush at the astronomical clock.

magical!. everything is magical!
eat in the street food,its tasty and beer is fresh
amazing exprience!
has many shops and many cafes

Gorgeous. Not only is this area beautiful, it smells great too! Ham cooking on an open flame made for a delicious smell and got everyone wanting a taste! The area was quite busy, but I enjoyed the festive atmosphere.

old town prague. well worth seeing, the astrological clock and buildings were wonderful to see gothic creations straight out of fairytale books and the people very friendly, plenty of places to have a quite drink of some very enjoyable food

Good but take care. Very nice and well maintained. Watch out for your wallett - pick pockets around and I was offered drugs on many occaisions. However, clock is fantastic and food and drink is still reasonable for the location

very nice place to visit. I would definitely recommend to visit the Old Town Square and also go up at the Tower to have views over Prague in the evening. It is worth to see. If you dont fancy too many tourists, just strall at the side streets, they have lots to offer too.
Spectacular buildings but where are the Czechs?. I know tourists have no business complaining about other tourists, but this place is a zoo. Waaay too beautiful to miss but not a place to hang out.
great old town. Gorgeous buildings, great restaurants, nice during the day as well as at night. Lot's to do on a riany day also.
Street entertainment. There were local musicians playing in groups, excellent to hear the local music. The 'buzz' of the surrounding areas created a great ambiance.
It was old!!. Bustling centre and great atmosphere, very crowded by The Astonomical clock. It was so crowded we passed through but observed many cafes and bars being well used
great place. lots of character and so much to see and do. lovely wandering the cobbled streets, having a Czech beer or 2 and snacks throughout the day. so much choice and great prices
Old Town - What Fun!. Shopping and restaurants and museums! Sitting in a cafe in the middle of the square watching the world go by!
How can you not visit!. Fantastic old town square with the astronomical clock around the corner, and just gorgeous and definitely a must see for the buildings, history, and bustle of the square.

Must visit place in Prague. ThisMedieval Old Town was amazing - it gives you a glance of what it looks like back in the days. The cobble stone roads and the stone houses are very charming. There are numerous restaurants (old and new) and souvenir shops around the Old Town to suit all kind of mood or your likings.

Try to get of the 'beaten track' in small alleyways. Old Town is not that crowded in September and when the weather is nice, it is my favourite time of the year.
Beer gardens are still open and it is easy to find a spot with views.
Lovely Old Town. The Old Town has beautiful old buildings and good atmosphere. The town is clean and has lots of narrow roads. There are lots of hotels to choose from in various categories.

picturesque streets, lovely medieval buildings and something to see every meter. the walk from the hotel to the state opera house took only about 10 min. all along the way there were things and interesting people to see. THE clock, of course. Buildings with more character than imaginable.

Beautiful!. Beautiful, esp around the astronomical clock. Nice restaurants and gorgeous views and paths all around. The square has lots of little passage ways and my favourite was the one next to the Square of Tyme (beside the Adam and Eve church). Loved the little crepe place there!!

Place one could spend numerous evenings!. A happening place with numerous attractions/distractions! Always there are street entertainers, the astronomical clock always draws crowds particularly on the hour, numerous outdoor restaurants to choose from & lots of people to watch go by!

old town is fantastic, best ever. I liked everything about Praque's old town! Great place for dinning. However, if you do not like it very busy, you may want to consider going to smaller towns outside of Prague which are quite beautiful also.

Convenient!. Stay in Old Town for the convenience of the best sites in Prague. From here you can visit the clock, attend musical concerts in a church, see the Jewish museums and other monuments, shop and dine on delicious Czech food. It is the center of much of what you have come to see!
So much to look at. Absolutely worth a few hours just wandering. i felt so safe and would recommend everyone to visit Prague at least once.
visit and enjoy. just a great day to spend the day, people watching, coffee (beer) drinking) admiring the beautiful building all around the area.

Prague Town Square. This is a place to go and just soak up the atmosphere. There is always people around, sometimes there is entertainment. Grab a cold drink or a coffee and just enjoy watching the action.

Prague is still Prague. Prague is art, order, tourism and love altogether.Every building is a piece of art and is lovely to have a walk also during the night.I came here in summer and also during winter, but Prague is always wonderful. Jewish zone is full of story and wonderful buildings (+expensive shops :-). St Mary in front of Tyn church seems to come directly from a fairy tale, it's umbelievable. The castle is wonderful, all little streets hide a story and wonderful places. Charles bridge is a place to visit. Old breweries are wonderful too. Visit Prague and its old Town and you'll come back for sure.

ok but not as nice as the archteture in budapest. well prague itself seems to be more updated in refubishments but for me,us,i think because so far our experience,generally speaking..has not be so pleasent..I do prefer also the mix of archteture of budapest,+++what a wonderfull!!!people..

In love with Prague. Loved everything about it. It's full of culture and concerts and theatres are everywhere and very cheap. I particularly liked the national black light theatre. It's a clean, safe and very friendly city

The heart of the historical city!. It is the area to visit if you are coming to Prague. It very compact and secluded therefore, very much walkable. It contains all the most visited turistic spots, including historical buildings and shopping streets like, Old Town Square, Wenceslav Square, Charles Bridge, the Synagogue, National Theatre, Parizska, Na Prikope, etc...

Been back many times. We always go for the Christmas market, usually at the beginning of December. It has changed over the years as more people visit, but its still a great start to the Christmas season and the old town has really lovely architecture that we never tire of. There are loads of classical music concerts to attend, and its a great place to walk around, very photogenic. They always have a press photography competition in the old town hall at this time of year and we always find it interesting and a good opportunity to reflect on events in the year. Don't miss climbing the clock tower for the views ... its ramps not stairs so easier.
Great atmosphere. Too many tourists.. White Old Town Prague has some of the most beautiful sights and buildings I have ever seen, it is overrun with tourists almost all day.

wenseslas square. such a lot to see here would need to take a page to write review. if yu have time take the under ground tour. amazing. then there is the apostle clock and the trumpeters around the tower. climb the tower and see the city from above.
well renovated facades,. we were overwhelmend by the diversity of architectural styles and historical richness. There is more to Prague than Charles Bridge.
Free walking tour. Jana was very informative and helpful? Also informed you about local restaurants, and hints on changing money
Astronomical Clock. We were delighted to witness the cermony of the clock in the Old Town Square. Go beyond the square and find the old cafes which give better value for meals and drinks.
Great. Was lovely and vibrant and full of lovely sites and people during the day ..... A few dodgy people however during the later hours.
Prague. Rivals Paris for the most beautiful city in Europe. Excellent restaurants, good museums, and the architecture was amazing.

A MUST in Prague. You would love this place which is in a very central of Prague. Crowds of tourists. Very nice iluminations and lights by night. However, be a bit carefull with prices in restaurants and keep your wallets well attended. And ONE BIG MINUS: All is closed already by midnight !!!! and still you have a plenty of tourists there. So no chance to have a glass of very good beer or very so so wine.
Lot's of beautiful buildings and tourists.. Stare Mesto is teeming with tourists which makes it a bit of a chore. But you have to do your chores...
Lovely place to be. Watch out for rip off OLD Prague Ham sellers.Smallest portion is 300kc (£10) and they give you a piece with a large piece of fat

Like nothing you have seen before. Old town is amazing. Incredibly diverse architecture that is breathtaking! We walked around all afternoon visiting art shops, jewelry shops, just looking. It was very crowded with tourists but still worth every minute

Hard to walk away from. I must have been in Prague hundred times by now and not once missed Old Town. You can walk narrow streets and passages for ever and there is always a new amasing thing you discover each and every time.
fantastic. loved the old town, it is so cosy and welcoming! people are pleasant, lots of things to see, places to visit, tasty food and a huge variety of souveniers!
Cafe culture. Had meal in cafe cellar on old town square and listened to a great band (Alice Springs). Food ( tiger prawns ) was great and good value
very nice place to visit and see the famous church. There was always something going on, but beware of taxi's we were ripped off, use airport transfer taxi's

fantastic!. the area is beautiful, you can wait for an hour to watch the astrologic clock. its very crowded but a funny show. you can eat anything you want around the place. the garlic soup is special to this country, and its tasty. afternoon you can sit on the area and have a drink, its so nice to see and chat the people near you come around the world. you can walk to charles bridge, also shop and you can only photograph the gothic buildings. people are kind but not very hospitable and genial.

Romantic place to spend an evening. There is a lot too see and do in this area the astronomical clock, churches, old building to admire statues to gaze over and food and drink by the plenty and a romantic horse ride
Buzzing place. The astro clock - the place was amazing. Be careful of prices if you sit for a beer waiting for the clock to come to the hour. There are cheaper places to eat and drink.
historical. Great to travel round Jewish part and the tiny cobbled streets with some lovely buildings both old and new
Bustling and eclectic mix. The square is beautiful and a good place to plan out trips and have a light bite to eat and watch the entertainment, weddings, people and the astronomical clock!

Great spot to visit around this area and/or just people watch at the many restaurants.. Great feel and lots to see and do in the area! There were lots of activity and a little market. They had a marathon running on the night we went so the place was abuzz

Wonderful square; everything eminates from here. I'd highly recommend staying close to the square -- and Arcardia Residence is the best. But stay away from the ham vendors in the square; they post a price of 90 per 100 grams then put 400 grams on your plate. When told you didn't want that much, they say "you want it or you don't? That's how we sell it." Very obnoxious.

Beware of prices of street food sellers. The hams that cook on the square look amazing but beware the prices - they are for a certain amount of grams and when you get a portion it's much more expensive that you expect. Other than that it's beautiful.

Kind of a tourist trap. The old town square is very nice, but you can barely see in front of you for the abundance of tourists, food stalls and horse carriages. This place just felt more like a tourist trap to me. We bought overly expensive food from the stalls, and looked around at monuments almost completely blocked from view by restaurant signs and facilities.

very romantic spot. this view and place is very romantic. although in summertime the nice terras all over the place looks inviting, I would suggest to have a drink somewhere else, because the prises are four times more than in other streets or squares. if you take the time to walk 5 minutes away from the square, you will find other squares, quiet and cheep.

Great people watching & Astronomical Clock view. Lots of space to watch the Astronomical Clock once the hour's right and the figurines come out.Sometimes the views are obstructed by the outdoor seating for restaurants around the square.You can often take great pictures of several historical and significant sites around the square.Very much commercial.
fantastic architecture. Loved all the old buildings and the square, most of all the Astronomical clock, easy to get around on foot, lots of places to sit and take it all in.
Beautiful. I loved walking the narrow, winding streets of Prague's Stare Mesto. Great, relaxed vibe. Amazing architecture. Lots of history. Nice restaurants and cafes.

A FAIRY TALE. beautiful, breathtaking, easy to explore on foot even with young kidsamazing architecturestreet artistscultural eventspublic services at handmany city sightseeing services at offer to choose from
Praha the beautiful. Many cities in Europe should envied Praha the Beautiful. You can turn your eyes in any direction and all you see is beautiful architecture..colors...and so on
Good start. Lots of history, lots of restaurants, lots to do in the evening. No trouble with binge drinkers. Not harrassed by people selling trips or by beggars.

Lovely Old Town Prague. Walkable city, fun to get lost in. Worth doing a little research to appreciate the history and the architecture. We were able to find our way easily to sites we visited, but wandering around added to our enjoyment.

Amazing Architecture. The color and architectural features of the old buildings in Prague are unique and priceless. Be certain to visit the Municipal House (Obecni Dum) it is a fabulous display of art deco architecture. Have a coffee in the cafe, dinner in the restaurant downstairs or a nice dinner in the main dining room. The art deco is outstanding.

Old Town deserves some time. Incredible buildings and history. Astronomical clock was wonderful as is the history of the square. Highly recommend a guide to get the most out of the different styles of architecture.
Praha. Great sights, so much to see, 4 days were busy but I saw most things. I recommend Prague highly. A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

A must see. Beautiful old buildings and architecture, very pretty. Lots of places to eat and drink. have a wander around the streets to get the real flavour of the place. Can be very busy wth tourists!

full of culture...............on par with paris and rome!!. just to wander around this beautiful old town square is magical. full of atmosphere and a great buzz to it. you just don't know where to look as there is so much to see and every back street leads to another. there is a big cafe culture here and plenty going on. wish i was still there!!

Just one word to describe the experience. It is WOW!!. THe way heritage is maintained and the cleanliness is amazing. When I went to Praha, it was Christmas time so a lot of decoration and street shope were their. The Gluewine is an amazing drink to be tried.

Beautiful, historical, well preserved!. The buildings are a study in design and architecture. Without much crowd, one could fully study and appreciate the history and stories behind the structures. However, tourism is important to the preservation of the city and a driving force in its economy.

One of the Best Places to see in the World. Europe has many great cities and sites and this part of Prague is about as good as it gets. The crowds can be thick but there is a reason everyone is here. There is so much to see in this small area. I'm sure if you go to Prague you will explore it but if you are not sure where to go on your next vacation I definitely recommend coming here.
Great place to see, relax and enjoy the culture!. Take some time and enjoy a meal or cafe in the square...just people watch and enjoy the culture! You will remember it forever!

A lovely place to sit and watch the world go by. Stare Mesto is a beautiful square that one could just sit and watch the world go by. While we were there was an adorable band playing quite an astonishing tune using some "instruments" we never thought one could play with - like a washboard! We sat around with their music in the background for a while and ended up buying their CD back home. It is also in the middle of many of the attractions so its definitely a great place to rest and grab a cuppa coffee while soaking up the amazing old town atmosphere. Try the U Prince cafe for tea breaks!
Fantastic architecture. A beautiful city with a wide variety of types of architecture in good condition. A real treasure with many working streets of cobble stones.
wow. A truly lovely place to visit . I could spend days in there.Full of nooks and crannies absolutely awe inspiring . so much history
clock. look out for the clock on the hour the figures that move and also the trumpeteer right at the top of the tower

Old Square. very nice, lots of space for walking without traffic and surrounded by bars and restaurants. Close to some beautiful historic sites. Downside it does attract a lot of buskers who are less than average in the talent stakes, and groups of students who like to gather late at night and can be quite boisterous.
Beautiful Square. Great atmosphere, Lovely buildings,Lots of space to sit and people watch, Restaurants and Bars more expensive due to location. Find Bars away from square.

Very touristic, but historically rich.. Old Town is one of the most crowded touristic place in Prague. As guides would tell you: careful about pickpockets. But the buildings and the small, tortuous streets make this area of Prague a great stroll.

Crowded but atmospheric and fun. Lots of smokers in Prague was one downside for me, and also the constant watchfulness for extra charges like the bread at the tourist joints. Otherwise a lovely city, and very easy to navigate, public transport is like a dream

surprising. Prague has architecture to die for! It is also clean and surprisingly reasonable price wise.
Watch out for pick pockets - lots of professionals around. Steer clear of ALL taxi's - their sole purpose is to rip locals and tourists off!! The tram is King! Cheap as chips and abundant
People watching. Great place for history buffs, lunch or just people watching. St Nicholas church was amazing. Took a horse and buggy ride from here and loved it.

Visit to old town square. Really enjoyed my visit to the old town.very pretty and the architecture is beautiful.There are plenty of roadside cafes and it is truly like being on a film set.The astronomical clock is lovely, makesure to be around on the hour when it chimes!!

Tourist Trap. Beautiful centuries-old buildings but clogged with tourists and over-priced restaurants and souvenir shops. Felt a bit like Disneyworld. Good for a half-day of picture taking and starting a free tour in Old Town Square of the city.

Don't miss it. I can't imagine a visit to Prague that wouldn't include a walk through Old Town. With the main square in the middle and the surrounding alleys filled with restaurants and shops, it is a great way to spend an afternoon or evening. Using a guide book or an actual guide will give some context and history to the beautiful buildings.

Pretty, but overcrowded. The Old Town of Prague sure is a charming place, surrounded by buildings of great historical value, and a great place to hang out too. If you take free walking tour, or ghost tour late at night, you can discover many interesting facts about this cool place.However, i really didnt appreciate numerous groups of tourists with loud guides, taking pictures of everything and everyone, standing in your way all the time and such..it can be very frustrating! If you want to take a good picture of Astronomical Clock, either come earlier before the groups, or wait a lot

A guide is helpful. We used an excellent guide to show us all of Prague. In the 4 hours we covered many sites. That gave us a great, and detailed, insight into the Old Town. Many of the attractions are reviewed seperately.
Great atmosphere. Check out the fantastic clock and wander the narrow streets to Charles Bridge. I really liked the buskers

Pretty but please, more English. So Prague is definitely pretty and interesting but they need to start writing infos about museums and public transportations in English or other understandable languages too. Czech is not an easy language to understand, not really and it makes it hard to go around town.
Prague Has a fantastic Almost Disney-Like Old town. Prague has a fantastic almost Disney-Like old town which is brimming with legions of tourists and young people drinking lots of beer

Take your time here. We stayed in a hotel in the old town area. The first thing that impresses is the colour, architecture and design of many of the old buildings with statues and gargoyles that are a photographers delight!.Strolling around is an excellent pastime. Rather than just rely on the free tourist maps, I would strongly advise to buy yourself a good street map of the city that lists all the street names as they can be confusing and so you know where you are.The city takes its street cleaning very seriously, so it is clean and tidy and appeared to us to also be a safe city- I say this as a person who is from London UK. The general advice we received was to be aware of all the taxi fare scams and also the risk of pickpockets.

Wow. Don't miss a walking trip to the Old Town. It is a walk through time with a feeling of also being current and part of a global community. I am grateful for the opportunity to see such historical beauty.
Beautiful city. Prague is a beautiful city. Very clean, safe, charming. It is worth a day or two walking around, checking the buildings, cafes and monuments.
beautiful. absolutely stunning fantastic buildings galleries and shops my only complaint was the rudeness of some of the staff in the shops
Old Town. Everything was close at hand to our hotel, attractions were wonderful, and the atmosphere was super.

Wonderful facades. _ In the old Prague, all the houses are beautifully decorated, even when there's nothing "special" inside, it's a very cultural places!_ Be aware of the prices, restaurants are more expensive in this area: even if you can eat very well for 10€, you can leave the streets full of people and find places where you'll pay 5€ for the same thing. _ If you want to have a drink in a nice place in Stare Mesto, you can to U Prince, near the astronomical clock. This hotel have a terrace on the 6th floor, you can see the clock, the square of the old town and the caslte from here. You'll pay 139czk (less than 5€) for a cocktail.

Too Touristy. I didn't like this section of town much. What we were told was once an excellent place to shop for crystal and other tidbits has now turned into tourism central. It felt like our pockets might be picked at times and it was too crowded. This may be a better place to go in non-peak season as we were there admittedly in mid August during good weather.

Beautiful. It's a tourist center, but it's with good reason. The buildings are beautiful. The astronomical clock is located here. We sat and ate dinner at one of the outdoor restaurants on the square, and while it was pricier than restaurants off the square, taking some time to sit and admire the view and people watch was worth it.

Charming. The entire city of Prague is just charming. Old Town is lively, and we stayed for the astronomical clock 'show'. We also went to a one-hour concert at the St Nicholas Church (right around the corner from the clock) - organ and violin music;$8 per child. Enjoyed it.
Old Town Square. Plenty cafes/restaurants to choose from. Being the summer a great atmosphere with musicians and street artists giving a lovely atmosphere
Beautiful. Its my favorite place in Prague, very nice area, crowded at day n night but still better n safe than New Town (Nove Mesto).
Well worth a visit. We were first timers in Prague. Had a great time. Do make use of the free walking tours of the city centre. They seem to collect tourists at about 11.00 am
wonderful. Blend the charm of Rome, Paris and Lisbon, and compress into a smaller area. and make it affordable. voilà.
Not to be missed. Good atmosphere, in spite of the many tourists. Beautiful views from the bridge, very nice walk en many places to sit and dream. Or think.
The place to be. Really nice buildings, good to people watch. But lots of tourist trap restaurants so just walk a little further away to get good value

Picturesque to say the least.. Absolutely fantasatic.
Visited Old Town Square everyday and was still speechless when entering due to the beauty of everything within it.
Loads to look at.. This is one of the main tourist areas, loads to look at with plenty of places to eat. The buildings are outstanding, well worth a visit.
Beautiful but crowded. Almost entire Old Town is increadibly beautiful but because of it it is also very crowded with tourists. Very many interesting sights.
Old Town Square: Not Square!. The Old Town area has lots of cool shopping and sights. You will definitely will not be let down if you go.
vey nice city!!. go to the Old Square and wait in front of the City Clock (built and running since the XIII Century) until a the next hour begins. It's an amazing thing. Go to the Jewish Cemetery.
So old, genuine and beautiful!. Can you ever imagine that this city was totally communist grey 25 years ago? Now almost all houses in the centre are beautifully restored!
Treasures to explore around every corner. Astounding architecture and history but VERY crowded in August. Apparently, that's the busiest month for Prague.
Busy but picturesque. Lovely area of Prague but very busy in the evening. Resteraunts a little more expensive on the square.
Beautiful buildings. Amazing astronomical clock tower, gorgeous buildings and a romantic horse and carriage ride. Only downside was the service in most of the restaurants on the square was very poor.

Awesome. The old town square is the heart of Prague and is a definite place to visit for any tourist to the city. Lots of restaurants and bars in the vicinity.
Prague's Old Town is most noted for: the Astronomical Clock, Old Town Hall, the statue of Jan Hus, and St. Nicholas Church.
Not So Old Town. A must see but very crowded and not easy to find your way to adjacent spots. Restaurants in immediate area over priced. Underground tour beneath the Square however was great.
Interesting. The buildings are lovely and the history interesting. The friendly people added to our stay, prices were good too
Great!. Beautiful and so fun! And to walk around with a beer?? Amazing! Lots of great stores, magic shows, bubbles, etc.
Winding Streets up to a Castle Cathedral. The charm of the old streets winding up to the castle and cathedral with all of the churches and river views was remarkable.
beautiful buildings. Loved the variety of beautiful old buidings- so easy to miss things -look up as well as in front of you! More "touristy" gift shops then I expected. Lovely just to wander.
Characteristic. A characteristic place, with shops, old buildings, churchs, a sigth of the castle, great... to be seen.

Atmosphere. Beautiful architecture and full to the brim with atmosphere. Lots of little shops surround the square and plenty of eating places available providing lots of choice. Not as expensive as we were led to believe.

The Square to see. It might be "Old" town but this is the place to be, statues, Tynn Church, the astronomical clock, all the walking tours that start here. Close to everything. It is also a great place to find a seat, have something to drink and watch the masses of people that wander around here all day and into the evening.
very pictoresque. Easy to manuever. Very pretty with wide squares, plenty of cafes, and alot to see. Don't miss the astronomical clock.
amazing place. filled with tourists... very alive... truely a youngsters city... jazz concerts at night are amazing... be careful from people who want to exchange money illegally

City Delights. Breathtakingly beautiful city with wonderful Architecture around every corner, a real delight.
very crowded, reminding me of Venice in High season

Beautiful history, stylish modernity. Beautiful places, lovely women. Old Town Prague has beautiful historic buildings, the clock tower, the cobble stone streets, pleasant people. Excitment, activity and a few side streets too.

Amazing architecture, every building is a gem. There are many squares, walkways, cafés worth exploring. The architecture is incredible. Almost every building has something unique. Make sure you have a lot of storage space in your camera!

Must see!. Very beautiful architecture. Check out the small booths that sell food and crafts. A visit inside the church is not really necessary but nice. The clock is very lame but something everyone should probably see while in Prague. The free tours leave from the square as well and provide a nice overview of the square and Prague generally. Avoid the Vivaldi concert sales people. The concerts are not worth the price.
Stroll trough history. The buildings in this area are amazing. Try an catch the show from the clock tower in the old square.

Enjoy the moment. This is one of my favorite squares. If you are there to look at the Astronomical clock, come before the hour or you will get caught in a huge crowd of other tourists who are there for the same thing. Around the corner from the clock is a nice place to sit and put your feet up. Drink a bier, relax and watch the people. This is also the spot to check out the horse drawn carriages. I love to come here during the winter also.. Great place to enjoy a traditional Christmas Market.
Buzzing with excitement. This is definitely the center of all activity. A place to find all sorts of good food and drink and listen to music.

Spectacular sights and prices!. Went on a 4 day weekend city break here last weekend, me and my partner were immensely impressed with the sights and the range of bars, shops, attractions and restaurants available in central Prague (and the prices).We visited 2 fab restaurants, one next to Charles bridge (superb outdoor dining area) and a restaurant adjacent to the clock tower , the food was exquisite. If you can, buy an icecream from one of a few ice cream chain shops , delicious! Starapromen beer is usually around 40kc which is just over £1. Wine is also a good price! The all in one tram, metro and bus ticket is highly recommended as they are cheap and take you into and among the old town and as far as you want within Prague! We particularly enjoyed the Gastronomy museum which is situated east to the square, run by a couple whose mother and father were famous czech cuisine recipe book authors , excellent value for money and lots of amazing facts about the progression of food, dining and cooking (and if you're lucky the owners show you their amazing high tech kitchen and offer you a free refreshing glass of ice cold water from their high tech refrigerator! )The National Czech museum is not bad although the older museum building across the road is closed until 1916! Some good things to see in the modern building about prioneer Czech inventors. A highly recommended city break !! :-) Me and my partner are both 24 and we think Prague is perfect for any age and all types of travelling groups.We would recommend that if you wish to travel to Prague in the summer it may involve long walks in the hot sun, we found large bottles of water from mini stalls on the large shopping street in front of the old national museum building, one stall sold water for 25ck for 1.5 liters :-)
Historic Center Worth Seeing. Many wonderful sites in the Old Town Square including the famous Astronomical Clock. Great cafes to stop and people watch.

Nice but not really big. Unless one has seen an old town before, this one is not as great as I had heard. It is beautiful of course but I was a bit disapponted to see that it was quite small taken for granted all the great rumors about it. I've been in all towns in Germany and they were equally-if not - more impressive without being so much well known.
wonderful. So much to see in such a small area Museums art gallery buildings and more, best to walk a little out of the square to eat, much cheaper
a must visit. Brilliant, must not be missed.Liked everything about it, the buildings, bars and restaurants all great.
Must see. Must see (especially clock), but there are too many people. Lots of cafes and restaurant so thera are no places to sit and enjoy without buying anything.
Picturesque. Lovely little square with lots of boutique style shops for souvenirs. Lots of bars including a British and an Irish Pub.
Atmosphere is great. The old church and clock, climbed the church for a panoramic view, lots of greta eating places and other old buildings

A Magical Square. This is one of the nicest town squares in the world. A great place to watch the world go by. Sadly, all the cafes cater for tourists, and charge the earth to sit outside. Staromestska Restaurace is better place to sit as they serve Tankova Pilsner (this is unpasteurised beer). I last went when the Christmas market was up and running and it is a great way to start the Chirstmas festivities. Their tree looked great.

Disney. The place has been turned into a jumble of cheap souvenir shops, or really over-priced shopping. There are no good values in this area. But there are lots of good values in other parts of Prague.

Too crowded. In August, this area is a touristy nightmare. Americans, Japanese, Germans, French--you name it! If you wander away from the named sights, which are crawling with visitors, you can find a bit of peace. According to one man, a native of Tunisia who is working in a souvenir shop near the Charles Bridge, there is no longer an "off-season" in Prague.
Fairy tale beautiful. This is by far the most beautiful city on Earth - amazing. The buildings have a fairy book quality. Charles' Bridge is amazing. Must visit the castle. Czech's should be proud!
never gets dull. Just walk around, have a coffee or a great Czech beer and watch the show. Fabulous buildings, loads of people, shop until you drop.
The reason people visit Prague. Incredible historic neighborhood. Enjoy wandering and likely getting lost. It's like stepping back in time.
Sooo beautiful. Amazing architecture. Perfect place to sit, eat, drink and people watch. Seems less seedy than prague of 10 years ago
Absolutely Enchanting!. The Old Towm is just magical... you can breath history, and everywhere you look there's something to be seen

Top attraction of Prague. Walking through Old town was the highlight of our trip to Prague. The old town square is fabulous, especially in evening.The environment gets magical with all the music,people,Czech beer & ice cream.
Tourists!. Prague is turning into a Disneyland. It's beautiful and well-preserved but the number of tourists makes it unpleasant
Stunning views. Pay to go up the tower, the view of the city is wonderful and you can finally use the panorama feature on your camera!!
beautiful. the old town is a spectacular place to visit. it can be very busy at times especially when the guided walks are taking place.

worth a look. very nice area lovely buildings and food stalls selling local food.
bit crowded near the clock but worth a visit

Like a fairytale!. The old town is perfect for long romantic walks with its lovely pedestrian streets, its beautiful buildings, its cute souvenir shops, its traditional restaurants and its street performers (during night time). It certainly is the best thing in Prague during daytime as well as night time.

Beautiful. Very beautiful, shame it seemed very quiet in the square at night. I would have liked to have seen more of the cafes and bars that are open during the day to be open late in to the evening, they weren't.

Beautiful center of beautiful Prague. This is a beautiful and historic center of Prague. It's got a lot of tourists, and in some places, a lot of pickpockets. But, it's a great place to visit, see, and experience. If you're in Prague, you have to visit this area.

Such a beautiful place. You need to go there to see with your eyes.
Not just the clock but everything nearby, and the romantic atmosphere.

Old Town Prague. The Old Town Square is a charming and beautiful medieval town square in the center of Prague. There are several nice cafes and restaurants where you can stop day or night to relax with a Pilsner or a snack surrounded by beautiful churches and town halls. I enjoyed the view and the food at U Prince in Old Town while there on my last visit.

Great atmosphere. Loved sitting and watching the world go by. Some beutiful architecture too. The Irish bar and Geroge and the Dragon next door served some very nice reasonably priced food. Best full breakfast at the Irish bar.
Praha. Lots of tourists, but best area to stay when in Prague for walking, restaurants, etc. Charming buildings and shops, with cobble stone streets.
Beautiful. You gotta see the astronomical clock. Square is also the site of the Christmas Market. Love it a must visti every time we go.

Stunning(-ly overcrowded). Absolutely stunning old town, unfortunately also absolutely overcrowded and full of tourist-traps. (But what do you expect coming to Prague mid-August?) However, a must see.

great historical center. The Charles Bridge, the Old Clock - classic historical Prague - not to miss, especially on a sunny day when you can sit and wait for the clock figurines to come out and do their little show

Quintessential Prague. There is so much history here that its almost overwhelming processing it all. Such a great area of Prague and the center of it all. We tried to go into almost every building in this area. Our trip to Prague was almost overshadowed by our excitement of good cheap beer. And while it is pricier in this area, its great people watching.

Enchanting historic City Center. Amazingly well preserved historic city center. Easy to walk and experience. We felt very safe during ourtime spent here and roamed freely. The clock is intriguing in its construction and I always marvel at how something so old and intricate can continue to function. If you are near at the top of the hour it is worth watching but I wouldn't rush accross town to watch. We had fantastic pizza at the outdoor restaurant accross the square from the clock. Watch for the guys in sailor suits recommending a river tour. We went and had a good time. Be sure to tour the underground chapel at the end of the boat tour.

Stepo into the past. While away the hours by getting lost in time and wondering through the alleyways, browsing shops, and sitting down in the many restaurants and eating places. A really enjoyable way to spend a morning, afternoon or evening.
Interesting Old Town. All square is one of the most beautifull we have visited; Josefov is very interesting to visit; Charles bridge is very good, but with to many people on it.
Not like what I thought. It does't look like what I thought. I dreamed that it should be a really big square with fountain and violinist.

HISTORY comes alive. Tere are 10 centuries of history laid out before you - take a tour or a guide book and learn what has happened here. Listen to all the languages being spoken. See architecture from many eras. Smell the food at the sidewalk cafes. This was a feast for all our senses. Just wandering with no specific destination brings you the past - it's a lesson in the appreciation of the history of the people of Prague.

Transported to the past. The Old Town is very well maintained and it is a lovely place to walk around and enjoy Prague. The children loved running in the square and if you are lucky enough the bubble maker will keep them entertained as they try to pop the giant bubbles. The clock was incredible! Definetely wait for the hour.
A great spot to people watch. People watching was fun and the views are spectacular. There are nice spots to eat and have drinks. Quite casual and relaxed.
Beautiful centre. The architecture is beautiful. There are too many toursits on the Charles Bridge in June. The views from the Charles Bridge are lovely.

Lovely. Very nice and lovely buildings good food a bit crowdy but i loved this part of Prague. Visit restaurang Lokal nice staff and good andCheap local food the gulach will i remember for a long time
Great walking tour. You can walk forever checking out the old architecture. This is an awesome area to explore on foot. Beware of the money changers that may approach you on the street.

Fun to walk around, great architecture. This is what people think of when they think old world europe. Intricate architecture, fabulous churches, and of course tons of crystal shops and places to buy absinthe.

Unlimited Charm. Every time I stay in Prague, I have to walk the Old Town. Make sure you read about some of the history behind the clock tower and find the "X"'s on the sidewalk. You have to try some of the food being sold in the square and you must be sure to catch the Apostles clock on the hour!!
Great tourist area. Busy but lively, lots to see. Loads of tourist shops, some great and some not so great. Places to eat everywhere, unfortuately we picked a bad one.

Pictoresque. The square and its neighborhood was beautiful. The little "show" running up each hour over the top of the astronomical clock is a must see. Give a try to Prague's ham, but be careful: specify the weight of your helping, or you'll end up having the guy serving you 500 g of ham, and it's not cheap at all (however, it's worth all the money!).

One of my favorite European areas.. So many things to see and visit. The old town of Prague is a personal favorite of mine, and would gladly go back and visit again. Great shops to explore, interesting architecture, and wonderful cafes.

Shopping in the Old Town. If you follow the pedestrianised cobbled tourist route off the Charles Bridge that winds its way through the Old Town Square then at the end go right and follow on to Wenceslas Square you have covered the shopping area. If its Bohemian Glass then just about every shop sells it and some actually make it. Best buys apart from glass and ceramics are the usual souvenirs and they are in abundance.In and around Wenceslas Sq you will find all the usual familiar stores but check out in Wenceslas Sq the massive 5 story Bata shoe store for a dizzying array of shoes and styles and prices across the board ....you will find something you like.There is also the Palladium Shopping Mall which is just like any other modern Mall .... the only good thing about it is the Food Court on the top floor which is cheap (mainly western food) ... the escalators are annoying and you have to cross from one side of the Mall to keep going up or down ...... the Palladium is just worth dipping into then out again
Atmospheric. Beautiful buildings, great atmosphere and of course, good value. You cannot miss the old town on your trip as this is the heart and soul of Prague.

Beautiful city. This is a beautiful walking city, and I loved meandering down the cobblestone alleyways. Although it has certainly become more commercialized over the last 20 years, it is affordable. Definitely a must-see city.

Crowded but worth the visit. he population of Old town square increases dramatically as visitors gather to watch the astronomical clock ring in the hour. If you seek a clear view while resting your feet try one of the sidewalk cafes direcly across from the clock where they roll back the roof canvas for a nearly unobstructed view of the short but not to be missed ceremony.
Visit don't drink on the main square. lots of pubs, don't eat on the main square, take a side street 30 feet away from the "tourists" beer and food is cheapter
Go!. The best European square! Wonderful architecture, nice places to eat and a lively atmosphere. The place to be.
history. Underground trip beneath Town Hall was very interesting as town was originally 8 metres lowerand was raised to avoid flooding

Beautiful Old Town Prague. I have never seen anything like it anywhere. The old town was a busy place where all the tourist come to experience the real Prague. The buildings are amazingly stunning as the world's heritage. I admire this place so much!
picturesque. beautiful buildings and lots to see, do not bother with the old lane expensive and not much to look at

Atmosphere like a music festival-withou the rubbish and drunks!. I loved the number of different languages you could hear - including from the numerous tour guides. It was busy, but this was never a problem. We went up the clock tower in the evening and were there on the hour so got to wave at the crowds below watching the clock. The buskers were generally great. The street sweepers seemed dedicated - I saw one guy spend ages getting butt ends off the cobbles. Must explain why it is so clean.
Our second visit. No evidence of street crime, nor pushy street vendors. A busy area with cyclists weaving around. Plenty of lovely buildings of architectural interest.

Great vibes. Great place to sit & chill & watch the world go by. Plenty of shops & restaurants to choose from - sometimes best to go off down side passages to find a real gem of a place to eat or drink. Street entertainers abound - some good some really good!

Luggage and a Little Coffee. Gorgeous place to visit, adn you may wish to get a flat to stay a while... There is so much to see in this wonderul old city. And yes.... I bought the most wonderful new piece of great leather luggae in old town. The coffe shops are fantastic and the food is spectacular... Happy Hunting!

Prague - Too many tourists. Very interesting to see the historic old town with the original buildings having just come from Dresden where it's lovely but the downtown is all rebuilt with little original. Don't visit in July unless you have no other choics.

Amazing Location. Old Town surrounds the main square.The square will be the default location but the area around it makes for a pleasant walk. The only flaw is that there are a lot of tacky tourist shops on most of the streets.
Great atmosphere and buildings. Fantastic buildings with opportunity to attend one hour classical concerts in churches and other public buildings.

Stunning. A beautiful place to visit. Walk out from the centre to find cheaper drinks and food though.
Also before paying a fortune on tours look for the free tours where you leave a tip. Must better!

The place to be. always very crowded but nice, want to avoid the tourist masses try to get into the side streets, sometimes you find here some nice coffee houses with better prices then on the main streets

Prague is crowded. I've traveled a lot in Europe, but central Prague wore on me. There is a leve of mistrust among the shopkeepers in Prague that left me cool. Its like they start from a point of distrust and then go from there-

Beautiful and it has Hard Rock Cafe!. This place was so awesome. All the shops are in one vicinity. It is near impossible to get lost. The public transportation system was the best bet after "Pat and Joe" (feet). My kids and I had a wonderful time here. I have made the trip twice in as many years just for the Praha Half Marathon; however, I am going this month with my husband (he's never been) so he can enjoy all there is in Praha! All the restaurants were fabulous. They all accept Euro, but they give you change in their currency....Hard Rock Cafe will try to give your change in Euro. There is plenty to see and many places to shop. They are open till late on Fridays and Saturdays, too. There is a pasta place right as you are looking at the clock in the square that has the best tortellini! Watch out for all the cobblestone, though. They will not honor law suits...this is not the U.S. Lol.Enjoy!
Atmospheric. Wandering about the old town streets was great and took you back in time. Well worth just having a wander.
You can't miss it!. If you haven't seen Old Town you haven't seen Prague ;-) Make sure to look up a lot at all the beautiful buildings and their decorated walls.

See the astronomical clock. Remember to get there about 15 minutes before the top of the hour so you can find a good spot to watch and see the chiming of the hour. The square is large and has a number of incredibly beautiful buildings. Take time to see it all.

Fabulous architecture. Great place to wander about, many interesting side streets off the main square and a nice shady square behind the astronomical clock to escape the heat of the day. Must be a great place to visit in the lead up to Christmas

Awesome!. Was in Prague about a month ago and the Old Town was definitely a place to walk around and sight see. A lot of activities going on, plenty of cafes and restaurants to hang out as well. There were many small streets/alleys to wander around and got lost and be amazed by what the city has to offer. My friends and I went up the clock tower and had amazing birds-eye view of Prague.

Stunning. Both by night and during the day (although a lot more crowded and hot during the day, especially in the summer), the square was my favorite place in Prague. The history itself is enough to keep you there for the day to learn, the gorgeous buildings are just icing on the cake.

Plenty to see here.. Plenty to see here and many restaurants with outside eating. Great people watching place. People really turn out here to see the Astronomical Clock with parade of the Apostles every hour. Really good older man with his saxaphone and singing as sidewalk entertainment,
Try to wander in the lane ways away from the town square. The main square is great but after a few minutes viewing its better to wander in the back streets away from the tourist traps.
Great architecture. Plenty of places to eat and drink and cheap too.Use their money,it's easier to work out.lots of way to get around form trams,buses,old cars and horse drawn carriages.
Quaint, European, vibrant. What a beautiful old city, gorgeous architecture, twisty roads, street entertainment, and small enough that everything's close and quick to walk to.
Feel yourself in the medieval age. I like the city .I dont like some of the people of prague they behave to the tourists as the money machine.

entertaining. The buildings are beautiful and awe inspiring. Great people watching and there are always street entertainers to listen to. Very crowded so wear a bright color in case you and your companions get separated
Beautiful city. I would recommend a trip to Prague to anyone who loves Europe and its architecture - just brimming with history and good cheap beer!

Feels like medieval times !!. Walking in the old town streets make you feel the times of medieval times. The town has been frozen from 13th Century with roads, houses, chapels, cathedrals, pathways, town square, vendors....all give you very nostalgic feeling. It is amazing walking on the streets and getting feel of real Praha. The clock is astounding and amazes us.The town is well preserved and indeed would strongly recommend any one visiting Europe, PRAGUE is a must !!

A must. This is what you it's most about.
See the spendid buildings in a variation of styles and enjoy.........

An Old Beauty. Only saw this place briefly (got lost and ended up there) but from what i saw it was magnificent I knew some of the history behind it which is a real plus, it makes you appreciate it more
Unmissable. Crowded, but an unmissabke part of your visit to what is arguably the most beautiful capital city in Europe.
pretty weaving streets. Felt safe even for solo girls. It's a bit of a shame to see so many big brands and stock standard souvenir stores creeping in.
Quaint and beautiful. Wonderful place to visit any time of day or night. Clock is interesting and square is busy with people from many places.

Very interesting. Lof interesting old buildindings in this area. Astronomical clock is over-rated though. Crowds of tourists make it almost impossible to get past and really not worth stopping to look at
Awesome. Loved the architecture. Cobblestones galore, cheap to eat n drink. Recommend doing tours to hear the history of the place.
Fairy Tale town. it´s like been taken from a children´s story book. It´s magic. Just walking on the streets, sailing in the river or driving on the tram are really a delight!

Incredible Architecture. This is one of the most beautiful and historic places on the world. We were awestruck by it's atmosphere an the sense that the city cared about preserving it's history. Do not miss the clock tower on the old city hall.

Must Try Grilled Cheese if Available. You have never tasted any this good. They really grill the cheese (I posted a photo). The Church of our Lady before Tyn is one of the best-looking places in all of Prague. Also, in colder months there are people selling hot honey wine. There are plenty of vendors around Christmas time. I loved this place.

A Young at heart Old Town. The town is so energetic with tourists all over the world and the age group was so wide that it made you so enjoyable to see them as part of the attractions at the town. Moreover, it's so clean that surprised me since there are so many tourists. Really nice place to go!!
Wonderful Hotel. Very lovely section of town, small narrow streets take you back. Very clean and tidy section of town

Lovely Atmosphere. The Old town square was full of Character. Great Architecture. Plenty of very nice restaurants surround the square where you can sit and have lunch or a beer and watch the world go by. The one negative was the customer service. We were served by a very bad mannered waiter. In general the only negative I have about Prague was the poor customer service. Tourists bring plenty of money to their economy they should treat them better
Nice little streets. Prague Old Town is very nice, with a lot of little street with pavement. The architecture is nice and well maintained.Worth a visit.

great place to people watch but watch your wallet. this place hums with activity from early morning till late at night. Great places to eat surround the square... sit down at a restaurant and watch the passing parade...or grab something from a take out stall and walk and eat and mingle with the crowds...but watch your wallet, it is a pickpocketer's haven
Summer outing July 2012. Wonderful architecture and views. Good restaurants with excellent service. Clean streets. Lots of interesting tours.

Wander the back streets!. The large squares of Old Town will look great in your pictures, but are crowded and the food and souvenirs are a lot more expensive than they are just a block away in any direction. Head off and just wander the streets, looking at shops, cafes, churches, and gardens. There's a lot to see, eat, and drink in Prague and some of the best parts are on the smaller squares and side streets! Bring comfortable shoes-- even in good hiking sandals, by the end of the weekend I had a bad case of "cobblestone feet" :)
Beautiful old town. We liked about sunny weather and old town, it was worth to travel to PragueThere were lot of tourist all over the world.
Amazing!. This is the heart of Prague. Beautiful old historical buildings. You can't get enough from it. You will see the Astronomical clock which is not very impressive!
Beautiful a must see. Amazing and beautiful! Full of interesting things to see! Make sure you try the local beers too! Keep your belongings close though
A must-see!. Architecture and historic buildings are fantastic! A must-see. Be sure to go into St. Vitus' cathedral, see the clock tower, the other historic church, and browse around the plaza.

Lose yourself. Just wander and discover all those beautiful old cobbled streets of Prague. The old Jewish quarter is particularly fascinating, but avoid all the usual tatty souvenir shops and the obvious tourist restaurants. Instead discover the quirky independent art, funky fashion and jewellery designs. Support local artists and artisans and keep Prague vibrant and alive.

So Beautiful. Great atmosphere and lovely restaurants and just a beautiful city.
The buildings are wonderful. The transport links to get there are great and really quick.

Amazing Old Town Square. Every time my wife and I walk into the Old Town Square, we are simply in awe of its beauty and architecture. Great restaurants and shops on all the streets that lead into the square. One of the prettiest sites in Europe.
Incredible Town. Definitely visit the Prague Castle and take a tour around the Old Town Square. Definitely visit the Prague Underground and go to Kutna Hora and see the Bone Church as well.

Spectacular Plaza. Horse carriage rides, many restaurants.Disliked: the Prague Ham vendors are a rip off. They cook ham on woodfires which smells great. Beware of pricing: 89 CZK per 100grams, but they cut huge chunks and include lots of unedible fat which you pay for. A lunch snack for 3 persons cost us about $50 and half the meat was pure fat.
Fantastic town. Many people everywhere, but it is a lot of places to see. Just walk around and relax. Find a place to eat og drink a glas of wine.

Wow. This is a place that you visit some time in your travelling adventures. The Astronmical Clock is amazing and if youre there on the hour it is great to see, with trumpeter as well.There is something to see in every direction and we just walked and got lost in the small streets which was cool, found all sorts of shops and pubs and lots of souvenir shops. Always look around for a bargain and barter a bit as well.There are horse and cart rides, old car rides, bike rides just about anything goes. We even found a bar with large beds to lay on and have cocktails and watch TV !!Watch out for pickpockets, we didn't have any trouble but you just need to be aware where your bags are. We chose to walk everywhere at our slow pace and enjoyed just being around the history, the cobblestone streets are a bit hard so you would need to wear good walking shoes. We found Prague to be a bit expensive but there are bargains out there as well.

Beautiful square. This is a must see - turn up at the clock for the hour to see the bugle player. Also lots of transport options for tours start here, by foot, horse carraige, vintage car or segway (we did everyone but walk!) Also try some of the local food stalls by the tower!

Old Town Charms. Prague probably rates in the minority of Europe's capital cities that wasn't badly harmed by WW II bombing. The old city of Prague is a showstopper of centuries old architecture and a city and its residents in love with the entire package.Musicians were everywhere although I'll bet the summer months promote this and late fall and winter wouldn't. Even Prague's tourist shops in the Old Town seemed to have very unique inventory.

Festive and fun. Loved the excitement festive ness and fun. It was packed with tourists but that is simply to be expected. Great restaurants all around. You do have to watch out for pic pockets, though, but no different from other big cities. The astronomical click was fun to watch striking on the hour. Old Town is a great spot as a base.
the place to be!. Just wander around as it is all very pretty. the clock goes off every hour and a man play a trumpet on the top of the tower.
More to see if you walk. The buildings and the atmosphere. We did a lot of walking in the Old Town. The clock tower was beautiful as was the walk along the river to the Charles Bridge.

Prague Old Town. Beauty and history. A visit to the tower on a clear day is worth the money and effort to go up. You can wait for the elevator (long line) or claim up. It is just a few steps the rest is a very comfortable ramp to go up or down.

Hyundai disaster park. A beautiful historic architectural ensemble completely spoiled by (a) crowds of tourists shipped in with apparently no idea of what they were looking at and (b) the appalling Hyundai Football Fan Park, erected on the old town square and consisting of hoardings, temporary sausage sizzle booths, giant TV screens and a stage, completely blocking out said historic architectural ensemble. A plague on you Hyundai! PS they did the same around the Brandenburg Tor. which we visited a few days later in Berlin. I enjoyed the Euro football finals, but not in either of these venues.
Great.. very clean . Good shops and the buildings were very good to look the contrast between old and new. Lots of bohemia crystal shops to have a good look it. Nice walks on the cobble streets.

Just wander round. We started off with a guide book in hand but soon decided it was better to just wander round as every corner reveals something wonderful,the buildings all looked very well cared for, it is of course very crowded but very enjoyable
A must see. Vert pittoresque and just brings you into the right ambiance.The architecture is magnificent and also the restaurants you can find there

walking tour. Our walking tour guide, Keith (look for him - he's the only American tour guide there) who lives in Prague is an excellent tour. His knowledge about the places he's taking you to is encyclopedic. Its a free tour and you're not obliged to tip but after the tour you'd feel what you're giving is all worth it.

Excellent town square. Anything one needs is available including those Starbuck's coffee addicts. Since I prefer to take a coffee to go & stroll around, the take out concept was perfect. Bakeries were available for fresh bread. Everyone was friendly and helpful with directions so it is an easy area to navigate.
Good browsing. Colorful,lots of people, shops, reasonably priced restaurants - the Astronomical clock is very interesting, quite a crowd pleaser, markets are interesting,lots to see.
Beautiful city. The streets were safe, nice and clean. The buildings were all renovated and colorful. We could take excellent pictures. Most of the sights were located close to each other.

Wonderful buildings, astronomical clock and terrific atmosphere here.. Liked it all. Did two walking tours, and a jazz boat trip at night. All excellent. Went to mini Eiffel tower and gardens by bus. Visited the old jewish ghetto area, most interesting and sad.

Magic as Prague. Something amazing in Prague it's the incredible variety of possibilities. You'll be amazed at every corner, hidden secrets are waiting for you, amazing gardens, relaxed cafès, characteristical musics. Stare MEsto is the perfect example, get lost in its gates, and enjoy every single meeting. Young americans playing music and telling stories, visitors willing to share their prague experience, locals that wide open their arm to you. great Prague!

Beautiful. Beautiful - but don't spend long in the Old Town Square - too touristy - or go there very late at night or very early in the morning. The network of narrow, winding streets nearby are wonderful, though.
Fantastic atmosphere. This little snippet of Prague matches the rest of it. Wonderful! Prague is a city that should not be missed in your European trip.

Beautiful area!. The area has been restored and is absolutely beautiful. Wander around and get lost in these streets. The area near Old Town Square is very busy as is the area leading to Charles Bridge. Avoid these areas and go off into the side streets. You'll be glad that you did and it's even more beautiful off the main stretch.

An Enchanting Treat. We made two visits to the old town and the market square just to make sure we saw it all. We saw the clock, the old ornate buildings, shopped in the stores and people watched beneath the Jan Hus statue. We were there on a sunny afternoon and on a rainy afternoon. We then walked down towards the Charles Bridge and stopped along the way at the Restaurace Karlova to relax. It was an enchanting treat.
The GRISWALDS.....the Hilfogs ( Aussies). Go to the astronomical clock & see the guide - Keith the American he is a total book of knowledge you won't regret it

Lush with history. The Old New Synagogue, the narrow streets and sumptuous architecture, the Clock tower, the whole place pulses with life, so different from 50 years ago, when there were few tourists, the vibes were grim, and the communists left a pall over the community.
Beautiful Ol Town!. The Old Town was absolutely lovely - thoroughly recommend visiting it. The buildings were so beautiful, very picturesque! Very crowded!
Amazing. Even prettier at night! Great meeting spot, all of the tour operators are there. Loved the local cuisine
Old Town. I always like the side streets. Try a pizza place called Don Giovanni and a wine bar called the Monarch.

Beautiful and historic old town. We all had a great time traversing throughout the entirety of the old town square. From patronizing the many shops and stores and trying the different foods, old town square was a staple of our entire Prague trip.
Must visit, lots of great stuff to see here. Especially the Astronomical clock! We joined a beer tour near here and it was excellent. A real hub for meeting people.
Nice town. Full of history, old buildings, churches. Sadly, if you don't have a guide, you could miss a lot of valuable information.

Heart of Prague. It the place where everything happens. You can see beautiful old buildings, some churches and the astronomical clock that goes off every hour. Most walking and city tours start here. Sometimes there are live concerts at this square.
weekend in Prague. old town is beautyfull,too crowded at weekend.Nice place to walk with friends and to taste local beers
Great center. The Stare Mesto is the center of Prague tourist area, with many of the activities and fun restaurants of central Prague.
It's good. The heart of the city, a must see, nice at night time.
Stunningly Beautiful. Everywhere you look in the Old Town, there is either a piece of architectural beauty or an item of historical interest to see...

Very nice square. The square and the Old Town contains a lot of very nice buildings and surroudings. It is most beautiful to walk around the Old Town and see all these very nice buildings.It is also very nice to be free from all kind of street sales people, selling crap, like in Roma and Barcelona. They seem to not excist in Praha.

Worth a wander. The Old town of Prague is filled with beautiful old buildings and lots of places to eat and have coffee. Try climbing the tower above the clock in the centre. The views of the city are awesome. Wander over the bridge and fossick among the market stalls where local artists display and sell their wares.
Must Visit. A great place to people watch and soak up the culture

Guided Tour. Excellent guide with great information. There was difficulty hearing her because of the general noise. She scheduled a three hour tour and we asked her to shorten it, because we were weary after two and a half hours of walking.
Great City. Loved it all and most places were central or easy to get 2

must see when in Prague. This town square is really cute. There is a church, and the atomic clock and lots of restaurants. Just sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere. Be careful of prices at restaurants. Many charge double for eating outside rather than inside. Also, they will give you bread that you think is complimentary, but then they charge you.
Lots of Nooks and Crannies. Beautiful. Romantic and atmospheric. Lots of tours go from this area all modes of transport including beautiful horse and carriages.

Most incredible place I've seen!. There are too many great things I could say about old town and I can't type them all so all I will say is GO! Go and see for yourself this amazing, historical, medieval, beautiful place!

WOW. Although ver busy the old town squre is a pleasure to vist, whether just for a stoll (day or night), for a leisurely drink at one of the many restaurants or for a meal.the square is vibrant without being too noisy so just take a seat and "people watch" or see the Astronomical clock with the trumpeter playing on the hour

relax in the square. this is a really pretty square with lots of cafe and resturants and bars. The clock Tower attracts lots of visitors who gather to look at the clock on the hour. Its a great place to people watch.

A week in Prague. Full of history, plenty to see & do, was there in July 2010 & prices still very cheap compared to other places in Europe. There are warnings to beware of "pick pockets" but I personally didn't feel threatened at any stage. The women are absolutely beautiful :-)

Beautiful area of Prague. Cobbled streets, beautiful buildings and lovely little restaurants. This is one of the nicest areas of Prague where you can wander the winding streets of people watch from the numerous cafes in the area. In July when we were there it can be quite busy, especially near the clock tower but don't be put off. Amazing.

Well preserved. I don't think I have seen a better preserved town in Europe, only Bruges comes close but this is much bigger. Only disappointment is the amount of grafitti - needs cleaning up and severe penalties for those caught vandalising these beautiful buildings and monuments

the heart of Prague. If you've seen any of my Prague reviews, you can probably tell that I love the spot. Walk through the square, old town, any part of town at any time, and I believe you'll enjoy yourself!
Full of surprises. The variety of buildings cover many centuries and is simply awesome. Amazing that it survived the war almost intact.
Cobbled Together!. Great charm but don't go in the height of the tourist season...wall to wall people!
Everthing is amazing. It is my second time in town and I love to walk in this part of the city looking the buildings and the architecture.
Relax with a cocktail. The buildings surrounding the square a beautiful, why not sit back with your favourite cocktail and watch the world go by.
Worthwhile to visit.. Historical and charming. But during my visit, the square was taken over with several sound stages

Must see in prague. The view 360 degrees is amazing due to the beautiful architecture !during my visit , there was concert going on and the place was like a big party with many pple and a lot of activities/street food /etc happening ... it was almost a carnival .This is again a central part of the prague city and walkable to most places to and fro
lots of fun!!. loved the shopping, boutiques and the feel of the area
Excellent!. Wonderful just wandering around the town. Don't forget to look up to get the best views of the buildings (forget about an Affair to Remember!).

Mostly ruined. Little else but souvenir shops, agressive peddlers and jacked-up prices here, though you can't take the beauty from the houses and the town square is impressive enough if you can fight your way through the crowds.

Toll. It is one of the most beautiful old city. When the weather is nice and sunny, a lot of tourist make the city colourful and living.. The Charles Bridge is a must. The small cafes near the river. The castle.. The glass trinkets are the symbols of prag.

Historical place with exquisite architecture. I found the Old Town of Prague completely captivating by all the exquisite architecture (notably the numerous historical buildings and churches) in Baroque, Gothic and Renaissance styles. I especially enjoyed walking through the bustling Canvas' Makers' and Charles' Lane & admiring the many shops & beautiful historical buildings.
Worthwhile. The architecture and history of Old Town is mesmerizing. Well worth a visit.

must to be seen. Charming, in the evening looks like a feritile. you can walk through Parizska street to refresh yourself to Vltava river or spend interesting time in a Juwish part or to go roayl Karlova path directly to the Prague castle. All in one spot to start.
Lots of other tourists but totally worth it. A "must do" in Prague, enjoy a nice walk up to the castle with extensive view over the city
Walk around history. Something to see around every corner; use a travel guide to find out what you are seeing
Must do. I greatly enjoyed learning and experiencing old town! I was able to get great souvenirs and jewelry as well!

Decent yet too Croweded. We spent some time in the Old Town Square. It was always packed yet we enjoyed the astronomical clock and walking around. We enjoyed the excitement on the hour both from the ground and up from the tower. After reading reviews we didn't really eat in the area. Must see the area, but explore other areas of Prague, too!

most beautiful Old Town in Europe. My husband and I have travelled to several European countries, but we both agree that Prague has the most beautiful and charming Old Town among the European cities we have visited. We visited the Old Town every day that we were there, soaking up the ambience and the atmosphere.

Picturesque!. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities I've ever seen. Everywhere you turn there is something for the eye to take in. We purposely avoided public transportation because walking was so enjoyable and allowed us to see more, even in the rain. The Old Town is in the heart of the city and is obviously the main draw. I will admit that even in April it was VERY crowded in some areas (I can't imagine what it's like during high season!). This was the only downside. However, it's popular and everyone loves it for very good reasons. The architecture is old, colorful, ornate, and well preserved. There are restaurants, cafes, shops, and cobblestone streets. It's truly a delightful area, despite the touristy vibe at times.To make the most of your visit, I recommend visiting the Old Town in the evening. After dark the crowds start to dwindle and the city takes on a romantic ambiance. Also, the farther you go from the centralized areas, especially the Charles Bridge where everyone seems to gather, the fewer the people. Spend some time wandering around and distancing yourself from the main sights - I guarantee you'll end up taking photos of things you didn't know about!Although the Old Town is wonderful, I also suggest visiting the Lesser Quarter, Castle District and Jewish Ghetto. There are three amazing areas of the city that also shouldn't be missed. They're not nearly as popular, but they're just as great and offer completely different experiences.One more thing I'd like to add: As I mentioned before, we were there during early/ mid April. It was the week after Easter and their festival was still taking place in the Main Square... What a blast! There were live bands playing music and dance performances as well as local foods and desserts. The area was crowded but still fun. It was a great time of the year to visit.

great at all times. stayed in prague on several occasions,the old town is like a magnet,its fine resturaunts ,quiant shops,famous town hall and astronomical clock add to its splender. worth a visit at night when all illuminated.i was lucky and also visited one christmas when the square was filled with market stalls ,large christmas tree and various carol singers and bands.to sit outside hotel prada with heater and first class meal on christmas eve was really fantastic

Beautiful historic city with spendid old city centre. Only had time for a walk in the city centre. Really cool Jazz festival with good bear (cheap) and food stands. The President of the Czech Republic was there amongst the tourists and youngsters watching the concert as a normal person. Very cool on his part and an amazing show of the country's progress towards a democratic and simple lifestyle after 40 years of Soviet Domination. This country has a lot to teach to us, "old" democracies of Europe... Clean streets, efficient public services, excellent tourist infrastructure, very low corruption (even compared to our "old" democracies)... in short a small gleaming beacon of culture and civilization. An example for all.

Fun place, good restaurants and bars.. The Old Town is where many of the bars and restaurants are, but not too many to attract the hen and stag night brigade, which is good. Easy to walk around, and Prague is still relatively cheap comparead to many European destinations, particularly those that have gone over to the euro.

This is what I came to see. I had heard that Prague largely escaped the devestation of many other European cities in World War II, so we would be able to see a lot of the original architecture. This is true - especially many baroque & art deco buildings, and "layers" of development - modern over art deco over baroque over gothic - very interesting to see.

Most beutiful city in east Europe.... This place is so nice. We couldn't stop taking pictures. There is so much to see and enjoy. There are many cafés and restaurants around to have a coffee, a beer or a glass of wine. This is truly a topical European city, probably one of my top three overall Europe.
Great place to people watch. Beautifully kept buildings, very clean streets old time charm
Relaxing area. Very friendly area to either sit and drink/eat or just to walk around
