Great area for walking and gawking!. Loved the buildings, bridges, cafes, history. Excellent way to spend a day. Be sure to have a beer or lemonade and watch the Astronomical Clock at the top of the hour
Great with nice view. We been to this place wonder full! You must walk on all the cobbled streets!

Nice place. This is a nice area with some nice buildings around, but I didn't find anything to be spectacular or breath-taking about it. It also has the astronomical clock tower which goes cuckoo every hour.
Charles Bridge was interesting. Lots of people and vendors on Charles Bridge and funny to watch all the people posing for photos... lots of diversity of people!
Architecture will blow you away!. Awesome, breathtaking architecture - do not miss this! I couldn't stop snapping pictures of the Old Town Square.
Loved the Old Square!. Loved everything! The atmosphere! The restaurants! Loved it!
amazing history. Beautiful old town with cobbled stones and unbelievable buildings all with history and a story to tell.
Cant be missed. A quaint area of the city to explore with something for everybody. Churches, towers, galleries. Cant wait to go back!
crowded and noisy. better areas to visit but walk through at night and day

Old town has a secret around every corner. There are tons of things to see and do here. Hundreds gather every hour at the astronomical clock to see the clock in action and hear the trumpeter. Be sure to go up in the tower to get a front-row seat for the trumpeter and amazing views and photo ops of the old town and it's many cathedrals.

We couldn't stop taking pictures!. Prague is a beautiful city!! . It's mysterious, historic, exciting! In summer it is always crowded with tourists from all over the world and traveling students. Winding cobblestone streets that may take you a different place than you intended or provide a shortcut. No matter what, it is a great adventure! Eat outside at one of the cafes that line the square. Our family loved the fruit crepes. And the view while eating....and it was even raining. Go up in the clock tower and view the city from there. Go at night and get ice cream to watch the clock change. The architecture is beautiful any time of day. We couldn't stop taking pictures!

Astronomical clock. The old Town Sq. is where the Astronomical clock stands...also where the tourists congregate and brides & grooms come to get their pictures taken...many of them were Asians. The clock is one of the wonders of the world.....
wonderful area. some restaurants slightly higher in price in the square. great place to people watch. underground tour was fab
Great walk. Prague is a wonderful city for walking and exploring. This is a great area for seeing sites as well as people watching from side-walk cafes.

Majestic Old Town. Prague's old town was one of the best old town's I have been to. The whole old town is like an open air museum. There is beautiful buildings and architecture all over the place. I understand that Prague was the only city not destroyed during the World war and hence the buildings still have the old charm. Just wandering in the old town itself is fun. The old town got extremely crowded during the day ( till late evening), so the best time we enjoyed it was early mornings ( upto 10 AM) and late nights ( after 10PM).

Europe, in essence. It is a rush of images: Baroque, Gothic, Renaissance architecture, a statue of a burning Reformer, a bride and groom being photographed in front of a 600-year-old and still ticking astronomical clock, outdoor cafes (and a Starbucks for the diehards). Free tours start from here (they ask a donation at the end of the 2-3 hours; well worth your time and money), and, for those who love pork, buy an exquisite ham sandwich cut right from the rotisserie at a street vendor's.
History Personified!!. The markets were packed with sightseers BUT it was most difficult to find a Public Toilet.

Just great!!. Old buildings and views are worth, despite the overwhelming number of people. The only point that called my attention as negative were the amount of baggers on the square and surroundings.
Beautiful old square. Beautiful old square, lovely when there is an Easter or Christmas market on.Slip down the side streets to get cheaper and tastier places to eat.

Old Town - very pretty. The Old Town is pretty, especially the area around the Astronomical Clock and the walk across the Charles Bridge. Also worth visitng Hrcadny if you're visiting Prague Castle. Lovely views day or night.
Beautiful city. The only downside was the weather, which was extremely hot.

Great. Prague is the most beautiful city in Europe. It is no coincidence that so many movies are filmed there since medieval, belle epoch, baroque and 19th century styles all coexist. Only complaint is the crowds of tourists that stuff the square during the summer months.
Beautiful city. This city is very beautiful and there is plenty to see and do. I've been to Prague 5 times and still love it.
Beautiful!. The Old Town is absolutely beautiful. There are lots of things to see and enjoy.

Lovely place to wander for hours!. Loved Old Town... a feast for your senses, as the buildings are spectacular in design and ornamentation. They have been cleaned up in the last 20 years or so and the natural beauty shines, along with gold gilding! Wonderful shopping and prices are very reasonable.
Lots of tourists. Many cafes and souvenir shops. Good for people watching on a pleasant evening.

Great place to visit. This is place which is smell. The market on the main square is full of all kind of beautiful food. You will be able to see here all kind of characters and faces from around the World. Millions things to see and photo opportunity on every corner.Plenty small shops with amazing souvenirs - maybe highest in quality than in many places we have been to.I little bit crowded, though, which is understandable.Little advise - don't wonder around side streets at night.

Beautiful!. We took a free walking tour of Prauge that was 4 hours that took you all over the city. It was amazing!! It really focused on the old town which was good because there is a lot of history/buildings that you may have looked over.
Xmas is Best. The little wooden market huts, hot wine and the finest hot sausages and of course the amazing clock in St Wenceslas square.

Amazing. Every time you turn around there is another amazing site to see. The history is fabulous and the colors and sounds are fun. Be prepared, it doesn't seem to matter what time of day or what day and there are LOTS of tourists. Walking is sometimes a little tedious as the streets are all cobblestone, I would recommend good walking shoes. Also, because the area is mostly stone, drink lots of water or you can easily dehydrate.
Dont Miss It!. You hardly could'nt even if you tried. Its central, its majestic, its the place to be!Have a beer on an outside terrace, and people watch... Its what I did for 3 days straight!
Worthwhile. It is worth the visit, just very busy over a weekend.

As Times Square is to New York City, Old Town Square is to Prague. A must see, featuring the famed Hall Tower and Tyn Church, both very impressive. Plus, it's a lot of fun to see the crowd of tourists and locals milling around the square.

Get lost. The Old Town Square was great, if a little commercial with a Hyundai booth dominating it at the time, but the real fun was walking through the old town and getting lost down interesting looking streets. Bring a good map, but only use it once you absolutely have to get home.

Lovely place!. This is a lovely area to just "chillax" and grab a bite! If you have time pick one of the restaurants in front of the Astronomical clock and have lunch or dinner there! Although bear in mind though that these little cute restaurants are quiet expensive...but if you can treat yourself it is worth it! :)

Excellent place to visit. The old town square is an excellent place to visit and to relax by drinking a Boemian Beer in the esplanades.You can see a lot of people from different countries and you can visit The old town tower where you can take beautiful panoramic views of Prague.We recommend that you wait for the change of the hour in the astronomical clock, just to check the little figures moving.

Beautiful city. Fantastic place to stroll and pop into any attraction that takes your fancy.One of the amazing things to me is that all of this is original, unlike so many of the sights in Germany and other parts of Europe where entire cities were bombed and what you see now has been rebuilt since WWII. Do look out and wear "sensible" shoes. In the 4 1/2 days that I was there, I never saw a street or sidewalk that wasn't cobblestone.I do agree though with a lot of the reviewers that there were way too many people. I was hoping that I would be in the shoulder season (May) and that the hordes of folks weren't there yet.
Beautiful but so overrated.... and also overpriced for the city standards. Actually all these medieval and gothic buildings are not my thing. Too boring...

Magical!. Great place to people watch, eat, drink, take in the atmosphere and of course the clock tower! On the hour the crowds congregate to see the clock chime. One of those things you have to do by day or by night.

A photo opportunity around every corner.. It's a different world, full of history from different eras and very beautiful. It was pretty busy but not surprising as it has to be popular. Still possible to find quiet spots by wandering around.

charming but contrived. it was as what my friends who had been before had told me - its very charming and you will fall in love with it. Unfortunately i did not. Charming it was, it felt like a tourist hub entirely and lacked the spark i was looking for.

Too busy. I visited Prague in June 2012 and it was far too busy for my liking. Although I can see that the Old Town has very pretty streets and buildings, it felt like a tourist trap.
Probably better to visit outside the tourist season.
great buildings. The buildings and architecture are stunning and the areas were very clean and tidy, disliked the number of Italian restaurants
Beautiful!. What a beautiful town. All the old buildings, churches, sqaures.

Good for a stroll. The Old Town a great place to take a walk and enjoy the architecture and atmosphere of Prague. Be sure to make it down to the waterfront park below St. Charles Bridge - its a wonderful place for pictures, picnics, or just relaxing.
Pretty and full of history!. Restaurants and bars are a little more pricey round here but its beautiful and buzzing with atmosphere!
Prague highlights. Beautiful old buildings, lots of people in the square cooking food and selling wares, a very bustling place.
Beautiful but.... Too many people, too many weddings, annoying people whose job was to advertise several attractions.
breathtaking. For people who likes history thats really worth recommending... for sure will come back
Across the bridge. Interesting and beautiful buildings. The clock is a must see.Classical music concerts are regularly held and easy to get tickets for
Most interesting part of Prague. Many historic sites, any many charming cafes. Jewish quarter quite interesting.
Great meeting place. This is a great place to meet up if you are travelling with other people. It is very crowded around noon as tourists wait for the Astrological clock to chime.
A wonderful old town. Very busy in June 2012, but a great place to stroll around. The central square was spoiled by an Hyundai stage for Euro 2012.
No word to say.. Just walk around that is enough to see history. Take a map and go everywhere on it. No car, no bus, no train. Discover Prague within walking.

Beautiful and Lively. Old Town is one of the many "must see" attractions while visiting Prague where you will hear an array of languages taking in the stunning views. Leading up to the majestic square are quaint and winding paths of clothing stores, gelateries, jewelry stores and souvenir shops, among many tucked away restaurants and outdoor patios. The clock tower is gorgeous and there will be a crowd on the hour every hour to get a peek of the skeletons and apostles that come out from the clock. You have the choice of going up inside the Old Town Clock Tower (for a few dollars) for a view of the square and beyond. It's also a great place to meet up with friends to people watch.
Great place to wander. Quaint, historic, a great place to wander around. Don't try to drive, though.
Wonderful history. Why would you go to Prague and not see their wonderful historial sites? So beautiful and well preserved. It would take a long time to learn all the history of these streets.
This is my favourite place to visit. Loved the ambience of the old town. Buildings all beautiful, lovely shops and Restaruants.
Prague-beautiful city. The architecture was stunning, the shops interesting and the people very friendly.

A Lovely Historic Place - Must See. A lovely square in which placed many beautiful restaurants , historical architecture and romantic environment.
there are so many couples walking in different times of the day and night. you feel the essence of different eras by exploring the Romanesque and Gothic architecture.

Beautiful, but CROWDED. It's just one of those things, you have to see it, but it is sooo crowded
and beware of rip offs. Beautiful lit up at night.
A must see. Always something going on and a focal point for all our exploration

A charming part of the city.. If you can overlook the hoards of tourists with their impatient guides, you can get a look at 17th century buildings, churches and towers and appreciate what a magnificent location this is.

Beautiful architecture, OTT prices. Obviously while in Prague, visit the centre of the Old Town and soak up the architecture. However, by walking 200 yards down any road from the Old Square, you can pay far less in restaurants and bars. £5 a pint in the Old Town Square. 80p a pint two minutes walk away.
Amazing place. Its really amazing place with lot of architecture museums cafes. You can feel history all over the place.
Lots of history!. there is lots of history here so stop and look for the free tour guides while you're there!!

Beautiful Old Town Centre. The Old Town has beautiful old buildings and is very easy to walk as not many cars in city centre. Lots of nice shops and reastaurants but beware some very pricey. For better prices at restaurants or shops venture away from the main tourist places. The town is packed with tourist groups so for best photo opportunities visit very early

Worth seeing. Architecture in Prague is simply stunning though old town is comercialized and full of people and it makes rather hard to enjoy it. Really nice in the evening while you can take stroll through small narow streets.
Fantastic, Must See. Plan to spend at least an entire day here and wear comfortable shoes!
Very commercial town center. Prefer Brussels for ambience and freedom from commercialization
One of the best sights in the world. Old town is breathtaking. You cannot go to Prague and not see it. Words cannot describe how amazing it is!

Wander amongst the maze of streets and lanes of this old town. Something for everyone, even the touristy parts are inter. Liked the history, noise, people, life...
disliked -nothing to dislike!!
Beautiful old town. We really did enjoy Praha, and especially the old town. We explored Praha on foot, and old town was absolutely beautiful.

Stunning architecture. The architecture in the Old Town Square is beautiful and everywhere you look there is an attractive view. Well worth doing is taking the lift to the top of the old town hall for fantastic views. Also check out the church of Tyn and the old baroque church which are both on the square. Only negative is the expense and quality of the food in the restaurants on the square. Best to have a drink here but head to Apostila or Indian Jewel restaurants for food which are just off the square.
Old Town. It is a must see around here. It does get packed in with people so going in the morning may be better.
a must see!. a mix of hustle and bustle from tourists, and the laid back welcoming of bars and restaurants to sit and watch everyone go by and soak up the atmosphere
Nice. The Irish Pub was fun for watching a soccer match!
Great for a Wander. See the sights but leave yourself enough time to wander and lose yourself. Go down that alley, snoop around that courtyard - you never know what cool stuff you will find.

Many Shops and Churches. An interesting place to spend an afternoon wandering down to narrow streets and checking out the local shops with usual souvenirs and many unusual handmade items, e.g., marionettes, wooden toys.

Very charming. Cobbled streets, narrow lanes, great little restaurants to discover.
Try to go to one of the concerts in the church but be aware that you can haggle!
Beautiful Prague. Not sure I would eat at the Square, very touristy and probably expensive, but the architecture is amazing. Well worth a stroll round.

Time warp.. Loved walking around the narrow, twisty streets.
Didn't like being approached by currency-exchange characters.
To BIG!!!!. It's amazing but really big!!You have to walk and walk.On the top is a stunning look on the city especially in night!

Everything we thought it would be. Prague is beautiful - especially the Old Town. It has a lot of character in is beautiful. Even if you don't enter all the museums or historical sites in the Old Town. A relaxing stroll through this part of Prague is priceless.

The centre of Prague. This is where it all begins, and sometimes all ends. The beautiful old town square is the centre point with a host of attractions, shops and restaurants. From here there are myriad roads to walk down and explore. This is essentially the best way to discover Prague, by getting lost.

Great views and historical perspective. The EURO 2012 soccer games were being played on a big screen, provided by Hyundai, while were there. Lots of activity, shopping and food. I loved the clock that chimed there on the hour, too.
Picturesque city. I like the overal atmosphere of the city. Especially the cosmopolitan visitors from all over the world, good value for money etc.
Wow!. Despite being a bit touristy, this place has many great historical and contemporary things to see, taste and enjoy.

So beautiful. Amazing place! small old streets, great buildings, lots of coffee shops, souvenirs stores...
One thing - be careful of pickpockets!

Beautiful. Need more than a day for this. Don't be put off by the hordes of people. We did a visit on a Monday and it was mad. We went in again the next day and it was much more pleasant with less crush!
Old town Square. Old town Square was loaded with shops and attractions, tons of places to eat

Old town. I disliked the fact that you have to bargain for everything (wich means that they are overcharging you and that at the restaurant they tried to charge me for tab water!!
What I liked the most was the Jewish neighborhood/quarter and having coffee by the water.

Just Amazing. There is so much to see and do here, we left after two and a half days and have so much more to explore for next time. The whole of Prague is very flat so getting around is really easy. It's great to just wander the streets and see what is round the next corner. The astronomical clock is a sight to see. Every hour a huge crowd gathers to see the mechanical men come out. The stalls selling food in the centre of old town are very expensive.

What a fantastic place!!. We spent hours in this area checking things out. From the restaurants, the buildings with many different architectural styles to the Clock Tower...there are so many things to see. We spent almost a week here and got married around the corner. A week really wasn't enough time. We still had a few things we wanted to see in the city itself and never got a chance to, let alone the day trips that we could have taken. if you go I would suggest spending a little more than a week or plan on two trips.
Old Town. Plenty of things to see, 2 days are defo not enough.

Excellent. You can spend so much time in Old Town! Enjoy the small streets, eat some good food, and take some great photos. The square has some amazing history as well and is haunted. That is what the locals say and my friend and I captured something resembling ghosts in one of our pictures. Old Town has a very unique feel to it at night in comparison to other Old Town's in Central/Eastern European cities.

Lovely. Amazing buildings, loads to look at, the cobbled streets, horse-and-carridges and people singing and playing music gave it a lovely old fashioned feel. Id just add that the town square is very very busy with tourist, so id advise to eat elsewhere to save a lot of money.
Old Town - heart of the city. beautiful, many interesting historical sites in one place,
very old. See the clock tower cookoo and old churches. Food was good.

great atmosphere and superb places to take photograph. church tyn, astronomical clock and other buildings has an impressive view that you can't take taking photos. the square is full of people and has a cheerful atmosphere with salesmen cafes street shows etc.
Old Town busy but lots to see. Lots to see with some beautiful buildings particularly around the old square. Wenscalas Square, however, was a little disappointing.
So Beautiful. Love walking around the square and taking in the sights. The clock is amazing
Beautiful Buildings- intricate detail. Keep looking up - is amazing the decor details on the buildings just beautiful! Old world charm - almost like a "fairy tale village".

What a gem!. For anyone who hasn't visited Prague - what are you waiting for? The prices are more reasonable that most of Europe and the atmosphere is what old Europe was like. The buildings were not bombed by the Nazis and so the architecture is beautiful and original. It is a safe city with wonderful arts.
Loved it. Loved all of it,stopped at a brilliant restaurant (lamborghini.sk) soup, main meal, pud, latte and a jug of water 280 Kc

breathtaking views. The area is very safe to walk at night. There are so many things to take pictures of as the view is phenomenal! I just wish the restaurants were open after 11:00 p.m. (some of them were, but many were closed). Also, not all restaurants accept credit card so one must really ask before receiving any service, otherwise it could be an uncomfortable experience.
Brilliant.. Love it. Love the idea of exploring and soaking up the atmosphere.

Many things to see.. So many things to explore in this areas. Be careful restaurants can be expensive in this area so go closer to the Jewish Quarter and check the menu prices before being seated.Make sure to take the tour of the Clock Tower and ruins underground. Well worth the time. So much history.
beauty. nice beautiful place, definite must see in prague. Close to our hotel and women of prague are beautiful.

This is where the action is!. Large crowds gather around the Astronomical Clock on the hour, when the clock chimes and a bugler stands on the rampart announcing the hour. It is well worth the time and fee to go up the Clock Tower for panoramic views. (Go near the top of the hour while everyone else is standing in the square). There's a valuable Starbucks on the same square for coffee, bakery and free W.C. Also left of the Clock is where the tour companies' employees stand with colorful umbrellas hoping to sell daytours in various languages. If I rented an apartment again in Prague, I think it would be on a quiet street near Old Town to be near the sites.
Nice but pricey. Old square is lovely cafe's are pricey for drinks though so you don't stay long
The town. B e a u t I fullJust walk itSpeak with the locals and enjoyGood positive welcoming and interesting nation
Lively. Lots of activity and interesting things (buildings, etc.) to look at. Take the time to sit in the square somewhere and have a drink and just watch the people and activity!

A definite must see while in Prague. One of the places that any traveler will not forget in Prague is the Old town square. The building are up to 600 years old!!! They look great and they have been recently renovated in the last 10-15 years. There are beautiful building designs and painting on the building. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants.

Beauty in the heart of Prague.. Traditional historical markets take place at this location during the year. Great food and good location to buy authentic gifts with czech history. Just look around you as each building brings you a different story from the past.
A charming walking tour. Forget about time and get lost in this charming quarter, wandering around the small streets stop for a cafe or a bottle of Urquell (the most known czech beer).

Prague, Jun 12. Walk around and enjoy the flavor of middle Europe. Plenty of places to stop and have a beer, or a coffee. It was crowded when we visited. They had a huge screen set up in the square to watch Football (soccer). Definitely worth it!
Only OK. The day we were there it was set up for some kind of event with a stage in the center that pretty much ruined any views.

Be sure to go there for a walk!. If you are fond of historic centers, this one will not disappoint you. Great mash-up of old and modern. It is truly the heart of Prague. By day or by night, great place to go for a walk.

Clear the clutter and touts!. For sure a beautiful, unique and historic square with a wealth of architectural styles from Romanesque to Art Nouveau! Also some unusual features like Tyn Church with the facade blocked off by an old building in front....very unusual but the same goes for St.Vitus. You have to be a short distance from the entrance and the facade to look up and see all of it. Anyone know why the houses do not break in front of Tyn Church as one would expect?In the last years the crowd of tourist agents, guides, restaurant promoters and touts has increased to spoil the magic of this square. And now even worse you have these cool young 'guides' riding around on their SEGWAYS using the tourists like a slalom course to zig zag around! Best to use your feet in Prague and get the maximum from your stay!

Medieval feeling amidst a modern town. The narrow alleys and the old-looking houses make you feel you've traveled 400-500 years back in time. Yet the modern times is always in front of you, be it the cars or the smartphones the crowds in the street carry with them. This mixture really blows your mind.
Of course you must!. This is one of the reasons you go to Prague - to see these beautifully preserved old buildings. Loaded with tourists but a lively and lovely scene.

Like Disneyland but real!. This city is so beautiful and the Old town Square is another spot to not miss...every building is interesting and beautiful...make sure you allow enough time to tour this city.
Prague old town. It's hard on your feet so wear comfy shoes. Sitting outside for a drink doubles the price.
Historic and Great Fun. Watch your wallet but do visit this grand, historic city center and enjoy the architecture, the clock, Kafka's House and all!

Beautiful city centre!. Beautiful and very clean city centre! Every house is wonderfully different: variation in colours, architecture etc. Try to go to the top of the old town hall - wonderful and open (we were very surprised!) view! Not for people with acrophobia/vertigo though!Then try some Prague ham with Langos and beer at one of the stalls close to the tower - lovely!

This is amazing but overrated.. If you love Gothic architecture or even interested in different buildings, or maybe you are not. Prague is well worth a visit for its amazing scenery and defiant architecture. When I clicked on 3 stars I was fighting with my finger to give it a full five as Prague does deliver on the panoramic views.Where it falls short however is the tourist mine is a bit exhausted. Hotels are expensive and tourists are invading from every direction, it is difficult to get a true sense of culture or authenticity of this place due to the way Prague caters for tourism. Most places you will have to pay for, even churches and to bring your camera into the National Museum. Just be cautious that you will have to pay a lot for all the tourist sites which is a shame but Prague will still attract you not for the lust of going to a place off the beaten track but to tick the box.
Careful. Great, but watch the bar and restaurant prices in the square. They take your eyes out !!
Surrounded by Beautiful Buildings. Amazed by this city. Everything within walking distance and keep looking up at the buildings so you don't miss all the beautiful architecture.
Touristy, but lovely and old!. Great streets to wander up and down,toot shops but you can ignore and focus on the glass and jewellery! Good for people watching!
Fascinating architecture. Sights both interesting and gorgeous around every corner!
must place. many tourists groups are walking,and you can join one group that is your language and feel better the place. go to concerts !

Gorgeous, and overcrowded. Loved Prague, but it's over-run by hordes of tourists, hard to see much without being surrounded. It hasn't killed the dear place yet, but there's signs of it...go now before you can't see a darned thing.

"Old" means Old!. History is here! Seeing such old buildings, churches, statues is truly why one comes to Prague. Beautiful, majestic, awesome are just a few words which came to mind when we walked through this area. You must not miss this area.
Beautiful architecture. What a beautiful city! Amazing buildings - so much to see, so little time!

The heart of Prague. Every tour book, guide, and website will direct you to Old Town when visiting the Czech Republic's crown jewel, Prague. There is an electric atmosphere there with tourists from every country being seduced by the offerings of vendors and the man made beauty of the structures. You must go and bring a camera.

Beautiful square. A nice square to take a break with a drink and watch the people passing by. I was there while EK2012 was going on and there was a big screen and lots of performances of bands. A must when you visit Prague
Great for walking. From the best sightseeings, you can walk and take a look at the souvenir shops. The architecture of the city fascinates!

a must do and see. Always something happening and interesting people watching venue. Medieval beauty, feel and history. After coming down from the city hall tower, treat yourself to some of the best food, drinks, atmosphere, and views on the top floor outside restaurant at U Prince.

Fascinating and beautiful to walk around and see the magnificent, colorful buildings.. The Old Town is full of beautiful, colorful buildings, with amazing architectural features. It's like a museum come to life, and it is, indeed, bustling with people at all hours of the day and night.

Must see!!. Fabulous buildings and an atmosphere quite unique. The bars around the square are quite expensive but it is worth a bit extra to sit and soak up the atmosphere. Watch the astronomical clock. Not sure how brilliant it is but everyone wants to be there when it goes off on the hour 9am t0 9pm only!
Full of charm. A charming city, friendly, beautiful scenery, surprisingly green and the unesco park delightful

this place is quite magical. the collection of medieval buildings are simply wonderful .
the cafes opposite the astronomical are quite pricey hehe .

magical trip back in time. I think you should see Prague once with your girlfriend and once with your mates!
Definitely worth to have a walk during night and enjoy the old town till the bridge..check out the castle as well! I recommend Prague old town a must to see in east Europe!
just so lovely romantic and breathfull and beauitful. it was just so different from any thing we seen before
Time Travel. I felt as though I traveled back in time. Its absolutely quaint and picturesque. Not to be missed!
Amazing. Very interesting, nice buildings. I was impressed by the astronomical clock, the oldest one working in the world. Tyn Cathedral also wonderful. The best old town in Europe.
Clock. The stare mesto has the famous astronomical clock with a little play enacted each hour. A live trumpeter heralds the hour in with a fanfare performed in four directions from the tower.

beautiful and amazing,. the old buildings in the old town are Most beautiful
and the nicest in Europe evrey building is more interesting than other' nice and pleasant, and lovely restorant and copy shop.
When you are lost in the old world charm. i liked the old town with its many Baroque style bulidings, the Jewish quarters and the oldest active synagogue in Europe.
old town. astronomical clock is amazing, go into tower & see workings & underground tour

Beautiful Old Town. The Old Town of Prague is truly a treasure! The mix of architectonic styles and art makes it for a very special place. Prague has never been destroyed during wars; even if slightly damaged here and there, Prague allows you to walk back in time and visit different periods of History. There are lots of museums, concert halls, theaters, stores, cafés, bars... there is literally something for everybody. I absolutely loved it!
Historic. Historian lovers. Nice museums. Plenty of alfrescos at side-walk. Tourist heaven complete with horse rides for tourists. Hate the cobblestone pavements. Injured my ankle
sights. good restaurants and bars, dont fall for the automatic service charges. if you sa no they will take them off
wonderful history. Lovely just to wander through fabulous archetecture
Must see. You cannot miss the Old Town in Prague. The Cathedral, the Astronomical Clock, Prague Easter markets are all here!

Romantic Strolls even in the Rain. This is my second trip to Prague and I just love the old town. This trip was during winter just following Easter and even in the rain this has to be one of the most romantic places to stroll around. Even with kids in tow!

Disappointing. I didn't enjoy this place much at all, I think it is very overrated. It's charm has been overshadowed by Brits on stag do's, overpriced goods, scam artists at stalls and restaurants, very crowded streets and tacky museums (for example the absinthe museum).
Amazing. it all great Have a walk stay in Starbucks, go the shopping street that have Cartier on the head of St
old town. i did not like the cafe's trying to get you to eat in their cafe. all very easy to walk around and many places to choose from, but all the food was very similar
Beautiful!. Stunning architecture, cobbled streets, museums, restaurants and shops, very busy though.
Our Star. My friends & I kept going to this place as its exciting. Even though our hotel was in business district, this palce was a magnet for us. You will not be disappointed.
Interesting but touristy. All out to sell to the tourists, but some good architecture and amazing astronomical clock.
the place to sit. the place to sit and watch the world go by. Loads of bars and eateries among the sites including the astronomical clock and teh old syagogue
So pretty. can walk the streets for hours and hours and never get tired of it
Super. The nicest place of the world, its a must to visit Old Town when in Prague

A must to see. The old town in Prague is very nice, and is a place where to spend time, get impregnated of the atmosphere. Stare Mesto is sweating History, and the feeling of Ancient Ages is present everywhere
People watching in the square!!. the old square is a bustling wonderful place where you can sit and eat or just have a cocktail and watch the world go by
Old Town Prague. Fantastic - so much to see. The city of spires. The old town clock, the Tyn Cathedral.
City centre. Loads to see and do. Plenty of history or just pleasant to wander around.
Classic "old Europe". A must during a visit to Prague. Plan to walk lots and see even more. Tourist heavy area. Heads up - like many large "touristy" squares in Europe look out for pick pockets....

A nice place to wander through. The old town is quite small in area but you can wander through at a leisurely pace and take your time.
The centre of Prague is remarkably well-maintained and retains its old character well - recommended
Nice to wander about in. Lovely variety of architecture - just don't shop or eat near there because of touristy prices!
Absolutely adorable. Just start walking and you will be amazed at the architecture and culture that you find. It is just a beautiful section of town to wander and sit in a cafe and people watch.
Eventful. One of the main places to be in Prague really. There are a range of restaurants, museums, tourist shops, market stalls and general shops in and around the old town.
Great atmosphere. The atmosphere was great. We loved strolling throught the old streets
Great little bars and Restaurants. Best place to go for Goulash and Beer!! so much cheaper that the main square!!
Nice old square. Really nice and wonderful clock if u are in Prague this is must see....

Lovely place to spend a few hours. When we visited Prague in July 2010, the Soccer World Cup was on and they had a big screen up showing the games. It was a great atmosphere, even though most of the people were tourists.When you step back and look around, all you see is history and one can wonder what did that place witness through the years.Great place to go and explore the food carts - that's what we did and thoroughly enjoyed it - and local artists selling their products.

Not bad. Old town is literally old town.. great to have a wander and see how life was, they seem to have great buildings which lead up to the town square.. you couldnt get lost as its all linked- although when you are there first time round you do think you will.. but with walking around it is a great place to wander.

The place to visit. Full of culture and totally unmodernised. The atmosphere is electric with not only the hustle and bustle but also with the sound of different languages from Europe and further afield.

Architectural delight- allow time to enjoy. Very crowded- particularly Charles Bridge. The Astrological Clock performs every hour. Relax from walking with 55 minute trip on River Vltava- NB prices of trips vary

Great cosmopolitan place. I love Prague's Old Town for the cosmopolitan atmosphere it has. The international crowd, that is visiting this place, is fantastic addition to all these old buildings, museums, galleries, the Castle, and... restaurants. Come and feel it yourself!
cute old town. loved old town, but once we ventured out it was a little scary?

Walk and be amazed. We loved the old town. We walked through it and around it every day for 4 days. One day it was our major destination. The other days we walked through it on our way to other parts of the city. We often ended up walking the Charles Bridge. The architecture is very well kept up, and there is so much variety and such history. The square where the astronomical clock is found is bustling with people and full of life.

first time in Prague. liked the cheap travel on the public transport though I prefered to walk ever where. Beware of the money exchance scams on the street.On the whole nice people but most business is conducted in cash!
lovely. Liked every thing but watch out for cover charges on the restaurant food bills
lots to see. Loved everything, several different types of archeture

Stay awhile.. It is crowded all the time, but if you stay a day or longer it is a different city at night. There is still alot of visitors, but the city views are worth it. Also early mornings are the least crowded, great photo ops if you can manage 0700 am.
Great to walk round. We got the Prague airport transfer which comes with a free 4 hour walking tour of Prague, it was a brilliant way to see Prague old town

Star-e attraction. you'll find beauty and inspiration in every direction. The city centre is easy to navigate with a plethora of fine buildings just waiting to be discovered down every alley you turn into. Don't pin too many hopes on the Astronomical Clock; you may be left wondering what all the fuss is about and the additional of a bugle-er on the balcony is a pure tourist gimmick. Frankly, Prague doesn't need that sort of cheap trick.
stay here if at all possible. this is by far the most interesting, charming, and desirable place to stay...and not all the hotels are too expensive. Hostels are fine too, well kept and clean.
Crowded. Beautiful, marvelously preserved, a piece of history but Prague has become such a tourist spot that you may feel in a thematic park for such a crowd everywhere (even off-season like May).
Crowds of people. I have never seen so many people. Would suggest visiting out of season. Prague is beautiful and suffers from so many people because of it.

lots of markets. the old town square was very busy, lots of markets, but worth a visit. short distance from our hotel (Boscolo) and we used this as a central point daily. from here you can access every part of Prague centre, We didnt use the public transport as walking wasnt an issue, clearly sign posted. breathtaking city,
history at its best. Large, fun, don't miss the astronomical clock! One of the prettiest places in Europe.

Wow!. The place to be. So many interesting sights to see here. There are many free walking tours that meet here which was a good option and a great way to get a good feel for the city at the beginning of your stay in Prague.
Beautiful. The Old Town of Prague is stunningly beautiful and you are surrounded by beautiful architecture.

Watch out for Western Union currency exchange.. The woman at Western Union Exchange at the old town gave me 1700 CZK instead of 2700 CZK and no receipt for my 100 euro bill and and some euro coins. Unfortunately, I didn't discover the shortage later.
good old town. liked every thing around. just be careful if people on the street offer 3 or 4 Chrono currency per Euro more. it is cheating. use one of many many money exchange centers all around
Wonderful.. Beautiful, clean, easy to get round and felt very safe. Very, very busy but that didn't mean it lost any of it's charm.
A million of your closest friends. You have to see it, as does everyone else. Crowded, but if you come to Prague you'll see it and the Charles Bridge like all the thousands of other tourists.
Nice architecture, but too crowded. Great architecture but I found the area to be overly crowded. We spent a day there and the rest of the time found the Lesser Quarter to be more to our taste

Very nice and cosy. The streets are worth seeing and worth have a good look at, because they are too nice just to be passed aside. there are plenty of places of interest there - towers, museums, etc. - must see while you are in Prague.

You will come here - you will love it! :). Just don't eat / buy ice-cream in this square, double the price of the neighbouring streets! :)
Be sure to go up the Astronomical Clock, especially at sunset, the view is spectacular with the sun setting behind the castle.

Must see. A building from the beginning of the 20th century is nothing unusual. So a building becomes interesting in Prague when it is from the 19th, 18th, 17th century or even from before of that. There is so much history and culture to see. The best part is to see how great the people in Prague managed to update the infrastructure within the last 20 years.
REAL DEAL. This is real deal old Europe without the usual hucksters and pimps. The foods, etc. are all without compare. Make it.
Spectacular at night!. Make sure you wonder around old town at night and get some spectacular photos of the illuminated buildings.
Just like other middle-ages cities. The old town is just like any other middle-ages city and only identify itself by the numerous street activities happening both during weekends and weekdays.
Better than Paris!. You can't turn around without seeing something amazing! This is my new favorite place in all of Europe!
one of the most beautifull old town. Nice old town. I loved this mixture of styles, buildings and the main square.

Beautiful architecture. I fell in love with this area of Prague. The Old Town square is just amazing, especially at night. I definitely suggest visiting this area to discover the real essence of old Prague.
Great site.. Lots of historic sites, very well preserved, and safe

Take your time to enjoy every detail. This area is full of life. It has restaurants, cafes, shops, historical buildings, musicians, artists. You can sit here for hours and let the time go by without a boring moment.
Beautiful Area. An interesting area with plenty of old and beautiful buildings. Many cafes, restaurants and interesting shops. Don't miss the famous clock.

Exactly what you imagine. Old Town in Prague includes a square and assorted narrow, barely-more-than-pedestrian roads emanating from it. The streets are lined with cafes and shops, but don't miss the side alleys that lead to other, tucked-away restaurants that are a little quieter than those on the street.
Lots of history. Castles and churches were great? Cobbles stone walkways made it necessary for comfortable shoes.
Beauitul Square. Very charming with activities at the center of the Square however since Prague is a top destination you must fight your way with the tourists,
You have to see it. I just love Prague. This place is so romantic and historical and Old town having so deep and beautiful athmosphere.
Beautiful. Enjoyed a concert at the cathedral. Beautiful views. Great Crepe vendor on the West end.

Great place to walk through. Lots of shops to visit... pick up some great glass ware that is unique to the Czech Republic.
Restaurants can be touristy but that is also part of the appeal if you like to watch people.

Just a magical place. The square is beautiful at any time with its mix of medieval buildings, statues and cosy feel. It has a vibrancy brought on by large numbers of people gathering every hour to see the astronomical clock perform. But it is particularly beautiful at night as the lights play off the spires and rooftops.

Lots of people being led like sheep. Not my style except for the Municipal building. The sense of the place is that it is old and somewhat dusty/dark, with not a lot of architectural interest. I expected more art nouveau and didn't find it.

Astounding astronomical clock. This is well worth a visit particularly on the hour when the clock strikes and the statues move. A trumpeter strikes up a tune from the top of the tower. There are some good restaurants facing the clock which are reasonably priced.
Lovely fast food. Loved the spicy sausage and Halusky from the stall sellers
Beautiful. Wonderful at night!!! Nice place to stroll and people watch...
Beautiful architecture. Beautiful old buildings and street entertainers. There was a market with various food and drink stalls.
Amazing old buildings. The buildings are amazing and somehow even in the Old Town Square the modern street vendors don't appear out of place among the antiquity.
old town. Full of lovely little shops and pretty streets. Well worth just taking a nice stroll round.
Fairy-tale!. Beauty and charm and history- but after two days it can get a bit much!

Do yourself a favor and get a private tour. Prague is so beautiful and so easy to walk, however, do yourself a favor and call Marketa with Caput Regini Tours and take a private tour. It was one of the best that we have had and we have had one in every major city we have toured. Our tour guide was Vida and she was excellent. Not only did she tell us about the city but took us to parts of Castle hill that we were totally without tourists and so enjoyed the beauty of the area. Then she shared with us her life story and that of her family and the hardships of the war-including Auschwitz. You will miss so much if you just try to do this on your own.

Most beautiful medieval city. full of historical buildings.. Notable places of Prague's Old Town include the Old Town Square, Astronomical Clock and Old Town Hall and Charles Brides, Lesser Quarter which are connected by Charles Bridge. Together with Prague Castle, Old Town is most visited place in Prague and alway packed with tourists day and night and summer and winter. Buildings of Romanesque, Baroque Gothic style were built over the 700 years. Number of restaurants, cafes, shops, galleries in Old Town
Wonderful place for great Czech beer as you sit in the plaza and people watch.. Surprisingly great musicians, many performing good New Orleans Jazz.

An array of colours. One of the things that I love about Prague is that all the buildings have colour. Mix this with some beautiful architecture and this place is a must to go see. Worth an hour or two to just walk around.
A Must. This is really the beauty of Praha. Just wander round taking in the sites. A bit commercial now but still worth the walk. Don't forget to get to the old clock and watch it on the hour
beautiful, clean, colourful. Intimate city where everyone is having a good time and where you can stroll everywhere.
Historic Centre of Prague. A place t spend time and wander down the streets and allyways admiring the architecture
Really nice. Possibly the most interesting part of the City would return here anytime
Noisy but fab. Really pretty, avoid restaurants right next to clock, walk to the right of clock to restaurants at top of square, both much cheaper and very good
Don't miss it!. If you only visit one square make it this one! The coffee is pricey but its just great to sit and what the world go by.

All of your fairy tales come true. This medieval town is full of interest . Statues abound, churches almost everywhere, but the true marvel is the twisting narrow streets, suddenly opening up into magnificent squares. Go there and stand open-mouthed, you'll love it.
Nice place. Dont miss this palce. Its like a movie...Everyplace you see... you can see historical places..

sol12. its history how peace full and relaxing it was nice stalls and very nice food at good prices a very enchanting place a great walk to the main centre had every thing old and new people genaraly friendly the only dislike was being hasseled to buy things you dont want but you get that in most places i shall be back
Beautiful Old Town. The Old Town of Prague is very beautiful, with excellent architecture, churches, narrow cobbled streets, restaurants and shops.

perfect. Perfect, value for money. Easy transportation to the old city of Praque with bus (nr 3 or 12) at 200 m from hotel. Nice little (boat) rooms and very friendly service. Good breakfast buffet and meals.For golfers a + due driving range in front of hotel

An old European city with lots of character. Worth seeing: Prague castle; the funicular up to the park on top of Petrin hill. Overrated: the Charles bridge. It is a historic landmark, to be sure, but spoiled by gimmicky tourist traps (caricature drawing stands, silly T-shirts, cheap jewellery). Still, it's worth a walk across just for the views.

Lovely spot, great atmosphere. Disliked the taxi drivers who would try to charge us double the fare and then ask us what would we like to pay instead...Disliked the restaurant who added random things to the bill
Good, a little crowded. Small, try to be there in the morning to avoid crowds
Loved Old Town Prague. Clean, great architecture, well kept, great shopping, lots of wonderful restaurants
Old Town Prague. The old town square is where it all happens, fantastic bars and restaurants, the astronomical clock, horse and carriage rides, you name it Prague old town square has it all.
Fun place.. Lots to see and eat. Most people speak English and are friendly.
History and sheer beauty was great. Loved this area. Fabulous cafes and shopping. So beautiful!
great in day and night for walk and enjoy the maze of streets. great in day and night for walk and enjoy the maze of streets

One of the reasons to visit, but....... No one can come to Prague without strolling and gawking at the magnificent old town. Don't miss it. That being said, Prague has become so popular over the last 10-15 years that you will be among thousands of other tourists also strolling and gawking at the magnificent old town. Once you've checked Prague off your "bucket list" I suggest you investigate other, less touristed, cities in Eastern Europe like Bratislava for example.
Nice atmosphere. The best time go there is early morning, until 10 am, after is full of tourist.
Always so much fun. The old town is full of energy any time of the year. It's full of beautiful buildings great places to eat and wonderful things to buy.
magnificent!. the best area of Prague! Really romantic and cute!
Lovely walk. Have a nice stroll around in this beautiful little town with all the very artistic building

slightly disappointing. As with many things in life, expectations are not always met. It was depressing to see just how much of a tourist magnet Prague had become and this overshadowed the wonderful architecture and history of the city. However, once away from the walkabout tourist groups, up in the parks in Lesser Town and the castle (a good walk but very rewarding) you can sit down and relax, have a picnic and enjoy great views over the Vltava river. Whatever you do, avoid the junk sellers on and around the Charles bridge.

Wonderful architecture. Cobbled streets everywhere in this fascinating old town of sky-piercing spires and gothic detail on an assortment of different coloured buildings. Stood and watched the Anatomical Clock chiming on the hour with its procession of the Twelve Apostles while Death rings its bell. Make sure you look up at the tops of the buildings as well as eye level and then you won't miss The Hanging Out Sculpture - a figure casually dangling off a pole above the street. Take your camera as theres so much to photo.
loved it. great sites, bell tower cathedrals and cafes all intertwined together.I love prague
Old old town. Dates back to very early times, great buildings to look at and admire, no downsides

Beautiful city. The beauty of the Old Town is something you read about but it really hits you when you enter the square. Take time to absorb it and enjoy the experience. We did the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour and we were delighted with the quality of Guides
Great historic place. One of the top visit points in Prague. Packed with tourists.
Must see. See it in person and wait for the clock to trike the hour.

Interesting walk through the little alleyways. When visiting the old town, do get off the main streets and explore the little alleyways. You will be pleasantly surprised with what they have to offer off the beaten track. Most tourists stick to the main thoroughfare. The prices are also cheaper and the shops do not appear to be ripping you off.

The heart of the town. No matter what anyone says this is the main place & a starting point for sight-seeing Prague as few key tourists attractions are there - I included Chech names as they are crucial if you ask for directions - The Old Town Square (Stare Mesto) with its Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock (Staromestska Radnice), Church of St. Nicholas (Chram svateho Mikulase), Church of Our Lady Before Tyn (Kostel Matky Boží před Týnem).Few minutes walking from the square there's Charles Bridge (Karluv Most) There are hundred small bars, restaurants, pubs, shops so you can't walk hungry or bored.We just loved walking around & admiring the amazing buildings.Tip: if you get tired you can find some benches in a small park outside St. Nicholas Church

Hotels here are within walking distance of all key sites. The architecture and medieval cobbled streets couldn't be more perfect. While the streets now house restaurants and tourist shops, the history still emanates from the surroundings. If only the walls could talk! We stayed at the Marriott nearby and ended up walking through the streets and main square several times a day.
Been there done that. If you have seen any other old town in Europe you've seen this one. My boyfriend however liked it very much, he said it gave him a feeling of being back in time.
Party town. Lots of action especially for young people. Many nice cafes. Found some good Jazz at a local club. And the beer is both good and cheap.

Nothing Special. If you are looking for souvenirs then this is your spot. Lots of tourist shopping and very crowded. It is really similar to any other touristy part of town in any other city. Of course there is beautiful old buildings and lots of photo opportunities, it just didn't "wow" me.
vibrant. very busy but beautiful, loved all the restaurants and shops
Nice but SO many tourists.... Just so many people but Prague is ridiculously beautiful.
This is it!. This is what everyone comes to see. It can get very crowded but it s always festive with lots of wonderful sites and restaurants
Magical. Anyway you look at it, from the Cathedral of our Lady Before Tyn to the Astronomical Clock..it's breathtaking!

Old Town Square. The clock is the main attraction make sure you see it chime the hour. It is also one of the has an elevator to the top, very nice are walking around the town and castle all day. There are lots of little shops and restaurants to enjoy. The food is cheap and beer cheaper but be careful about the Bar-b-Que in the square. They charge by weight and prices add up quickly.
Get to the clock as crowds stand watching it to strike the hour. Lovely area to soak in the atmosphere and every sort of restarant you can think of

Old Town is a good start. This really orients you to start. We took a tram tour which went through the town (castle area , jewish quarter and back to old town) It was an 8 on a scale of we made the mistake of getting a plate of ham and a plate of stuffed potatoes at a stand nearby, They charge by weight and loaded the plates. We were hurrying to catch the tram tour so didn't have a chance to argue,
History and Culture Abound. Where ever you look there is a page of history and you feel that we are all just passing in time.
more then i excpected. the old town is verry clean and the buildings are well preserved.
Nice place. Has an old feel to it. Charming and fun to explore. Obviously everyone who comes to Prague visits here.
Charming and beautiful. Architecture fiend and historical Buff's haven in learning about Prrague. Wonderful center square with clock tower!
Best at night!. The way Old Town was lit at night, created such a magical atmosphere.
No visit complete without a visit. You absolutely need to spend sometime wondering round here to get the most of your time in Prague.

Fantastic architecture. Loved the cobbled walkable and clean streets. So much to see - historic, cultural and architecture. Disliked the begging - not overpowering but irritated to see fit young men on their knees begging.
Just walk around history. The old town, on most parts, will make you feel you live 300 years ago. Very beautiful and original houses all around this area, you can wonder 'round for hours.

Not enough words to describe the beauty.. Can words describe how beautiful the Old Town of Prague is? You can endlessly wander down the beautiful cobble streets and view the sites and architecture. The shopping is also good and the ice-cream I still dream about. We chose not to stay here, but within close walking distance, so that we can spend time here. There is a lot to see, do and experience here and you can attend the most wonderful concerts. A great cultural experience!

Beautiful. The buildings are gorgeous, the cobblestones are great for atmosphere and that old-world feel, and the whole time you're there you have your pick of restaurants, people watching, and sightseeing. Love it!
May 2012. Spectacular architecture. Varied choice of restauarants and shops. Spotlessly clean despite the number of people passing through.

So much to see in such a small area. Really picturesque, spent ages looking at the architecture. Looked at the astronomical clock and climbed the tower - nearly 300 steps but worth it. Visited the Tyn Church which was lovely. Visited the St Nicholas church, looked at the Hus memorial. Ate some freshly cooked pork from one of the stalls

Nice place. The old town of Prague is a nice place to rest... The buildings surrounding the square are very beautiful and the architecture is amazing! Be careful if you buy food from the people at the Kiosks (or whatever it is called). The wooden little houses where you can buy sausages, meat etc. They are very unpleasant and want to take as much money as possible! For the ladies, do not forget to take with you your comfortable shoes because the streets around the old town are cobbled and it is going to be an unpleasant experience for you if you do not feel comfortable.

Superb. I love the Stare Mesto (Old Town). Its great to walk around the meandering cobbled streets (getting lost is all part of the fun). One minute you are down a narrow street, the next you are on a beautiful square. I love the Old Town square, but my favourite is sitting in Bethlehem square with a delicious beer on a Summer's night. The Old Town is not all about tourists. It still has some gritty old pubs for the locals U Zlateho Tygra (Golden Tiger) and U Medvidku (The bears), but there are also some hip cafe/bars such as Duende. For shopping, pop into the Sparta Prague football shop. It hasnt changed in years.The Charles Bridge is a great way to enter or leave the Old Town. You could spend days walking around this ancient place and still not see it all.
Starting Point!. Start your sightseeing here; lots of tours start from here, lots of shops, restaurants, and the architecture is grand

A must-have to see. I really envy if You have not seen this old town, as You have great experience awaiting... the easiest thing is just to walk, anywhere - walk and look, shoot a photo or two... have a beer or wine and walk again. Just go ;)
The best place to feel the real Prague. Narrow streets with beautiful architecture.. The best place to feel the real Prague. Narrow streets with beautiful architecture.

Beautiful Square, overlooking fantastic buildings. Looking at the historical buildings and the astronomical clock in Old Town Square was amazing, getting into Old Town Square meant you were close to seeing other sites of Prague.

Wonderful !. The square if filled with classic Czech architecture. well maintained and with lots to see , hear and taste. The food stalls serve traditional foods and at reasonable prices. plenty of cafes and bars. Excellent high end shops nearby. something for everyone.

The beauty of Prague. I adore the city centre! It's so beautiful with old buildings, narrow streets, lots of everything for tourists, the river and the statues on the Karlov bridge. It's very nice to walk around, enjoying the views, even lots of tourists add something very special in the atmosphere.

Classic old Europe. This is what old Europe is about. Be prepared for the crowds that gather quickly to see the Clock Tower. If you go early in the morning then you will have the square to yourself and only a few others. If you have kids, there is a good toy store not far off of the square.

Easter market. Jewel in the crown of Prague; you can spend hours here wandering around the two cathedrals, taking in the views from the clock tower and sitting eating or drinking in one of the many cafes.
Great (and crowded) place for a walk. There is a lot to see. Its a great place for a walk, despite the huge ammount of tourists. I believe this was my favorite neighborhood.
Beautiful day & night. Great place to walk around with plenty of attractions.

Everyone comes here - so much to do and see. So many churches, shops, cafes, beer halls, statues, and Prague Citizens and Culture. Easy to get turned around in the small streets. We used a GPS, which worked well so long as we could get a good signal. Most people don't want to advertise they are tourists, but that's about all that is around, so use the map to stay cognizant of where you are and where you want to go. Much to do. Suggest taking a guided tour to catch the history, see many things you would likely miss, and answer your questions, which will be inevitable.
Exciting. The energy in this square is contagious. The buildings have you agog with their beauty.
Good Sqaure for bars and drinks. Drinks and food. A must see for any tourist. Near all attractions
Very nice!. Never like plenty of shops with cheap suvenirs of a low quality! Always like - views from observation points:)

Compact area with a lot to see. The Old town has a lot to show and most of it lies within walking distance. That makes also that a lot of tourists are on a small area which gives a very busy impression. The risk of pick pocket is therefore higher then other cities. There are a lot of cobbelstones which makes walking a bit tiring (so wear good walking shoes). There are not many straight roads and some are very small together with passings under buildings which asks a bit more attention to find your way. At the same time is this a charming aspect of this city.
Historical but busy. Beautiful and historic but very busy with tourist parties
old own prague. buzzing with people ,, great atmosphere lots of street sellers cooking traditional prague cuisine
Beautiful to walk. I had a lovely time walking Old Town. To be able to see the history in this city and how lovely it is was a wonderful opportunity.

Great for walking around. One of the most picturesque areas of Europe. Lots of guilty pleasure from just walking around and checking out the beautiful architecture, stopping for coffee or a bite to eat, and visiting all the shops. Loved the beautiful glass objects.
“Super beautiful”. The Old Town Square of Prague is really breathtaking.
Beautiful. Lots of nooks and cranies to explore, beautiful buildings, some great places to enjoy a beer or hot wine outside in the fantastic surroundings. Truly the centre of Prague.
great architecture but crowded. too crowded but great to look at. Definitely avoid high season!
Beautiful. Not to be missed. Gorgeous architecture. Tons of restaurants around. Very busy with lots of tourists. Toilet facilities available.
History. Nice area. A lot to see. Several outdoor restaurants to people watch and relax in.
Spend time here. You can get fantastic gelato, lattes, see incredible miraculously unbombed architecture, Kepler astronomical clock, and shop shop shop
Nice to walk around. Prague has old charm, you have to walk around and exsplore it.

Loved it.. Just strolling around as there were a lot of vendors there with good food.
Shopped, bought gifts to take home.
The pearl in the oyster.... Pleasant space on which you can safely walk around. You can look everywhere and see beauty. I have said more than once about Prague that "it is so pretty you want to cry."
Historic and beautiful. Prague is a city I could spend a lot of time in, especially the old town.

A must see when you are in Prague. The atmosphere in the evening escpecially is lovely. Beautiful towers surround you and there are many lovely terraces where you can have a drink and enjoy the atmosphere. We would not recommend to sleep here as it is the busiest part of Prague

Spectacular and unique. The Old Town Square of Prague is really breathtaking. It is unique among the great cities of Europe in the variety of its architecture, which mow has been mostly restored after decades of neglect under Communism. Unlike many other cities, Prague never suffered destruction by bombs. The buildings are really unforgettable. Although there are crowds, it is still possible to look up and forget them while contemplating one of the most glorious collections of buildings in Europe.
Super beautiful. This part of town is the best.You have to see it really.Rickard+ family A.
Amazing. So many nice buildings, so many monuments, restaurants, people strolling around until late. Wonderful
Unusual History. Beautiful to watch, all built before industrializaton.
Go to the back of the clock. We have been to Prague before and discovered you can visit the back of the Astronomical Clock for a modest charge, worth doing.
Well worth a visit. Bustling - always something going on. Very clean and safe

Loved the atmosphere. Lovely place to walk about but very busy, good friendly atmosphere. we were lucky to have some fantastic weather so we could sit out and watch the world go by. The shops and cafe's are more expensive here though.

The age and grandeur take your breath away. The architecture and colour a highlight. It was tipping down rain and 50,000 other people had the same plan as me. Walk up one of the bridge towers for a great view.
Really cool. Nice place to relax and mingle with the locals.....you can do the tourist thing or your own thing....get amongst the locals for a good laugh

See by day AND night. Enjoy this wonderful part of Prague. Treat yourself and eat at a restaurant across from the Astrological Clock where you can sit in comfort while you wait for the clock to chime and work its magic.
Geat architecture. The famous clock was fascinating and the variety of architecture was fascinating
Historic Prague. Beautiful buildings, more glorious in the sun, but main toewn square is heavily impregnated with some rather unlikeable tourists and the risk of pick pockets. It deserves better.
Magical atmosphere. You can smell the history, and with the well maintained historical buildings, and the constant croud buzz, you feel youseld immersed in a magical atmosphere!

fantastic views. The sights are fantastic, but the crowds can be a little muich, if you need a break on your walks, go down many of the side streets for your lunch coffee beer etc as its quieter and alot cheaper
Very Gothic. Nice for a visit but very commercialised. Some lovely architecture. Very busy as expected.
Perfection. it is a must see historical heart of the city. alot of art and beauty
Popular with tourists. It's a great place to wander around, have a coffee, relax and enjoy this old city. Unlike so many Prague was not badly damaged in WWII
Beautiful Tyn Church. This is a great new-style gothic example of a church.
Atmospheric old town. The old town was quite unique and had a great atmosphere

Beautiful. This is what you came to Prague for right? Put away the map and just wander. A little touristy in spots, tons of souvenir stands and gimmicky restaurants, but still amazing. One of my favorite spots in Europe!

My beautyful Praha. Most beautyful city in our world. Invisible magic of Praha will lead you thru this city street by street, and romantical spirit that is present on every corner, building and window will makes you love Praha for the rest of your life. I love you my dear Praha!
You won't find anything more beautiful than this!. The whole area of Prague Old Town is just wonderful. You won't see anything like this anywhere else in the world. Simply beautiful.
Old Town Square. The buildings are wonderful and this is a great place to have a drink and people watch!
The Best Place to Get Lost. Completely disorienting, in the best way possible.
Tops. Lovely architecture, beautifully lighted at night.
Massive history. A very large area to cover with history going back to 10th and 11th century.
historic. Amazed at all the historic buildings. A lot have needed to be reconstructed since ww2

Shoppers Paradise. Great shops, great prices, awesome selection of beautiful glassware, crystals, high fashin...anything you want, it's there!
And they have their own version of Champs Elysee
Pedestrian heaven. Quaint, old Europe. Lots of shops, eateries, and people watching. Great way to relax while soaking in centuries of history.
Charming place. The castle, Carles bridges, the small streets and welcoming restaurants are reallly appealing. Worth a visit !
worth a look. good area to walk,the buildings are amazing,go see for yourself

Well Worth a Visit. Very interesting and very colourful!! The Jewish Quarter (Ghetto) is particularly moving. We attended a concert at the Spanish Synagogue last night and were overwhelmed by its beauty and its history - if only the walls could talk!!
scuere with soul. great view at astronomical clock, great sausage, Krusovice mh mh mh

intersting old town. the many old houses, the various monuments, the cafes,
the variety of souvenir shops, the Easter markets etc.

Beautiful!!. We've been living in Prague for 3 years now. We live outside the city, further down to the south. Everytime I need to run errands downtown, I try to find an excuse ( or not ) to walk past the Old Town Square and Charle's Bridge. It's simply beautiful! And everytime I'm there I realize how lucky I am to be here in Prague.
History and beauty. Surrounded by beautiful buildings full of history, but lots of cobblestone streets, don't take your heels girls, but still go!

Lots to see and do. This was my first visit to Prague in about 10 years, and much has changed - mainly the cost of everything. But there are many more restaurants, bars, shops and coffee joints in the Old Town. Not to be missed is the old clock tower and beautiful fountain in the middle of the square. There are a lot of tourists, but that didn't seem to be a problem anywhere we went.
Old Town. Buildings were wonderful but the large numbers of visitors and commercialisation spoiled the feel of the place. Choose an early morning to visit.
what a wonderful city!. There is really nothing you cannot adore! Old town is such a wonderful place!
Christmas market. High prices, very colorful and positive atmosphere.

Easter madness!. The old town square was beautiful. We went at Easter time and it was decorated wonderfully. There were concerts on in the square all day. I loved the architecture and we had some lovely cake at the grand cafe Praha.
Quaint. A very quaint, picture book slice of history. Visited on a very cold January day - I'm sure its even better in summer
Plenty to see and do. So much to see and we only 4 days to try and do this. There is so much history so try and plan beforehand what you want to do first.
Beautifull!. Although very crowded, the site is amazing! A must see for sure!
Impressive and a little magical. The Old Town is beautiful and incredibly well preserved. While there are plenty of touristy shops lining the streets, it was still easy to imagine another time.
The Heart of Prague. The most historical, interesting and liveliest place in prague
Old Town. We spent a lot of time in Old Town. We were there during Easter, and there was a wonderful market with gifts, food, drink, and entertainment
Great buildings. Loved the architecture. Disliked the crowds but off the main thoroughfares it was much more peaceful.

The is the old town square of all old town squares!. After you have stood on Charles Bridge to plan your visit, go to Old Town square to have a coffee and then hike up to the top of the town hall tower and take some more pictures.
Old Town. So much fun! So many shops to look around in. It was like a festival throughout the whole city.

Picture Perfect. While this can get very crowded with tourists in the high season, it is still such a picturesque place! It almost doesn't seem real, but people actually do live, work, eat and play here. A must see on your visit to Prague.
Overrated. Nice to see once but greatly overrated... And overpriced!
heart of old town. The Heart of the old town, lovely by night and day, highlight is the clock, the trees are lovelty too and no traffic
Fortuna City Hotel. I liked the City but it was a bit drab. A lot of history. Maybe it would be better in the Summer
Old Town Sqaure. Just a gorgeous, vibrant part of the world and I'd happily go again
Charming old town. First time visit in East Europe, attracted by it's beatuiful buildings and quiet enviornment.

Charming and historic. Narrow cobblestone streets wind through Stare Mesto. Allow yourself to explore; you won't get too lost! Check out some of the many small locally owned restaurants offering Czech cooking. The old buildings are beautiful; don't forget to look up to see statues perched on roofs.

Beautiful and picturesque. The old town square, or Stare Mesto, captures all the simple beauty and elegance of old Prague. Although it can sometimes get crowded, it is worth spending the time to visit in order to just stroll around and soak up some of the old world charm that epitimises this part of the city.
History all around. Plenty of streets and buildings that told about the Prague history. Coul you imagine that city at the X century? Prepare your camera.
old town clock. visitors must visit the old town square clock on the hour, its worth the trip but get there early.
Beautiful old town. Lots of interesting buildings, streets and squares. A lot of the souvenir shops sell stuff which is actually worth buying.
Architecture. Beautiful old buildings with and it reminds a lot of Paris and Budapest
Worth a visit. Full of atmosphere. Interesting mix of architecture. Good bars.
Astronomical Clock. Great to see the clock and loads of cafes in the square which all gave a wonderful atmosphere.
old town. nice clean small streets with beautiful old houses
much to see many folk. Too crowded, many many tourists. Very nice authentic architecture beautifully preserved.

Another Old Town. Even though here is where all tourists go, the "old town" of any city is nice to visit. In Prague's case it was really nice. It is a big old town, with small shops, cafés, restraurants, sights and tourists. We strolled many times trough the cozy little streets, ate great local food, even drank lots of beer (normally I go for wine!), sipped coffee in classic cafés like Café Louvre.

Architectural treat. History, architecture and interest at every corner, and you can see the renovation to Renaissance facades, and old cobbled roads and pavements everywhere. Lot of investment in restoring to its former glory.
fascinating. wandering around in the streets, viewing historical buildings, drinking beer in a pub or cafe
Very exciting place. There were lots happening when we were there because it was Easter, made for a fun place to be.

Lots of windy little streets. The Old Town area is great for wandering around to look at the architecture and to do a bit of souvenir hunting. There is a fair bit of pedestrianisation which makes it ideal for families with small children. It can be very busy though!
old town beautiful. nice historic buildings astronomic clock always attracts the crowds,excellent restaurants tasy food

Old town, how we think Prague might have looked. This was my second time in Prague, and this time I spent a little longer than the first time. In three days I've visited all the must-do tourist attraction, avoiding some of the most obvious tourist traps. The Old Town looks very pretty, but it's far too crowded with tourists. At day, herds of tourists everywhere, at night, you keep on meeting groups of drunk tourists (even if the streets much less crowded). Both at day and night the city is fascinating. I suggest a visit to Prague and expect to see the most of the tourist attractions in a few days. Also keep calm as all those tourists standing before you in your picture will test your nerves. I loved Prague, its food and scapes. So, I suggest, at least once, a trip in this city.
Prague Old Town. General architecture is brilliant. Great stalls. Lots to do, but very expensive if using pounds to czech koruna
Fun place to get lost. Lots of pubs and little market shops in this area. Really enjoyed wandering around this historic area.

Stare Mesto. Be prepared to walk a lot. This is a beautiful city and each corner reveals something else just as beautiful and interesting.
