There was an Easter market in the Old Town Square when we were there. We enjoyed a delicious lunch in one of the many al fresco restaurants in the square. Don't miss the Astronomical Clock as it strikes the hour when the figures perform. Keep an eye on the tower above! The Old Town Hall is entered just to the left of the clock tower. Nearby take time to go inside the Church of Our Lady before Tyn with the amazing gothic twin towers. So much to see, not enough time!
Beautiful. Must see in Prague, wonderful architecture and interesting sights on every corner. Typical of Prague
nice impression. i like to watch the Astronomical Clock which is very interesting.All the people waiting for the clock to chime at the square
Beautiful!. Lots of people at all times, you should be careful by pickpockets, but tottally worth it! Just for a nice stroll, beautiful at all times of the day! Do not miss it!!!
Full of history. disliked having to pay to get into all the historic places. liked the squares and all the history attached to it.

Do you like crowds? Tchotkes? Feelings of loathing and despair? This place is for you!. Went here during Easter Weekend (bad mistake). Along with the usual stag partygoers we were swimming in a sea of tourists. Any character the town had was painted over by the array of tourist shops selling marionette dolls of FC Barcelona footballers, cannabis vodka, and "Bohemian crystal".
Avoid like the plague.

The astronomical clock is worth seeing...that is about it.. The astronomical clock is worth seeing. Get there a few minutes before the clock does it thing, watch it and move on.
Other than that a few of the building are nice. The food in the square looks pretty nasty...lots of flies, hornets and bugs on it and it seemed really expensive for what it was.
Wasn't really impressed...

Wonderful but already "too touristy". Several times I had the feling some natives tried to "take advantage" of tourists. The worst were some "illegal cab drivers".
We enjoyed a very simple czech restaurant at the Hastal Hotel, next door to the Maximilian Hotel. Good food,honest prices and a very friendly barkeeper/manager (an australian called Peter)
who made us enjoy beer,food and company !

Beautiful/rustic. Old town square was beautiful. Do not eat food from the square as you will be overcharged. Luckily me and my partner didn't buy food from the there due to reading reviews and being per-warned.
so crowded,. Beautiful, ethnic and festive, but so crowded and there really are pickpockets.

Second to none. I was lucky enough to visit Stare Mesto at Easter when it was filled with Easter market stalls. The buildings, atmosphere, markets and experience were all amazing! I enjoyed a hot-dog, hot wine and a crepe from various stalls. I will most certainly return to Prague in the future.
Easter Markets. We visited at Easter and enjoyed the market. You have to try the trdelnik a sort of doughnut cooked over coals. The stalls of hand painted easter eggs were beautiful too.

a walk in the old town is like wandering in a historic museum. Defenitely worth wile strolling around. We 'climbed' (elevator available at no extra charge) the tower of the old town hall. Spectacular view !! Make sure to follow the 'royal route' to the castle.
Start here. Center of the trip. Charles Bridge, Jewish Quarter, outside Markets, Very Parisianne.
visit. the town was interesting the people friendly interesting things to do
Nice center. it's very easy to walk and there are fantastics buildings, gardens, pivo-bar, great meals, ...
Street upon Square of great architecture and history. Liked the buildings, sense of history, astronomic clock. Disliked huge guided parties and the abundance of tourist tat - keep looking upwards

Market Place was fantastic. Try the roasted pork cooked over a wood fire and the sweet dough bread rolled in sugar and a. You need to see the Astrological clock do its thing every hour on the hour and the walk over the Charles Bridge to get here was really cool.
Beautiful, lovely to wander. Beautiful, lovely to wander around. Great atmosphere

A good place to see history of the Czech Republic and the Jews. So much history here. Midevil, Renaissance etc. I would recommend a tour guide as I missed my tour and had to stay behind one. I was told to be sure to go inside the synagogues too,
Great sightseeing walks. The overall atmosphere of being in Prague in the Old Town was just awesome.
Christmas Markets. Excellent loved the Christmas market, the ambiance of the place was amazing. Prague was such a friendly place. The food was good lots to do.
Great place to wander. Many small streets and unique places to look and get lost. Lots to do, and many places to eat. Enjoy the atmosphere and architecture.
Walking In Prague. The old buildings and shops were very nice. Easy to walk around. The beggars were unnecessary.
Beautiful old town to explore. Spend at least a day to explore the old town. Beautiful building, a lot of history to learn and a lot of beautiful building and monument to explore!

Easter Market. Couldn't really add anything that hasn't already been said extensively except to mention the Easter markets which reminded me of the Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park but with an Easter theme opposed to a Christmas theme and without the theme park rides. As with most of these markets, the majority of stalls are made up of fast food stools but the experience is fun and intriguing. There was also a live band in the square which was a Brazilian samba beat which felt a little odd and misplaced but was still fun all the same. The locals certainly appeared to like it judging by the amount of hip shaking, foot tapping and head nodding anyway.
2 days in Prague. Beautiful City, Nice for dinning, walking and shopping

Lots to see, even with the many tourists. Very easy to walk, lots to see and easy to get to all the sights, we took the Müstek stop (A/green line) and walked in. The main street to the bridge was crowded but it is easy to step away from the tour groups.
Interesting. A very interesting place with nice streets and lots of shops. Interesting easter celebrations were on in the main square.
Easter market. Lots of unique shops and plenty to eat and drink. The Easter market was great to wander round. The astronomical clock was ok big crowds so get there in time

Incredible!. Loved the history. Try the Czech cuisine as it is delicious. We were at the same time as the Easter markets. There was constant local entertainment on a stage in the Old Town Square. Terrific!
Lovely atmosphere. The old town square has a lovely atmosphere and you are spoilt for choice of where to eat/ drink. The easter market was also good.

Crowded!. This apparently is one of the must-see sights of Prague, so I'm glad I went to the Old Town Square. The "performance" on the hour of the Astronomical Clock was disappointing and crowded. The square just off the main square on the way to the Powder Tower was quiet and lovely and much more in keeping with the true flavor of Old Prague
Very pretty. Very pretty city. Different architecture, sites, restaurants, hotels. U Prince Hotel have a terrace at top of hotel, views of city and delicious sundaes!

Gorgeous! Everywhere there is some impressive detail to be seen. Classic European where the ground level is plain but the details are seen above this level. I recommend going up the clock tower to get a great view of the city.

Attractive, touristy, crowded. We stayed for a week near the Old Town Square, passing through it and the hoards of students several times a day. I'm not sure what the attraction was, but the crowds in the square and on Charles Bridge rival those I've seen anywhere - including in St. Mark's in Venice. Tacky souvenir shops dominate the retail scene. Beware of pickpockets and scam artists who offer high exchange rates on the streets outside the official exchange bureaus. I've never stayed in a hotel with so much street noise and we were several blocks off the square. Be sure to have a detailed map with you.
easter market. try the honey wine- excellent!!! it's only avail in the czech republic
Beautiful place. Loved the buildings, the polite waiters, disliked the beggers.

Great history, architecture, food and music.. We stayed the an Old Town hotel right on the square, close to the astronomical clock. Suite windoes opened to square, hardwwod floors, updated bathroom with basin sinks, heated floor, excellent service.
Wonderful city!. Wonderful city to really get into, all these little streets and big squares and clubs and dining.
amazing. It's the ancient heart of Prague. It seems time has stopped there.

WONDERFUL ATMOSPHERE. No visit to Prague would be complete with seeing the Astronomical Clock. The square is lovely, the atmosphere was electric. Very crowded though and the Easter Market was on whilst we were there, met two people that unfortunately had been victims of pickpockets, but with so many people, it is bound to happen. Hot mulled wine very welcome, ham/pork be careful the price given is for 100g and of course they load your plate and before you know it they want 600kr instead of the 89kr you thought you were paying. Easter entertainment started every afternoon and we saw some wonderful childrens choir and dance and some lovely folky groups, all for free. So go enjoy but be a little careful.
Interesting but not too special. The history was interesting but some of the architecture very ordinary
Most beautiful place I've ever visited.... Prague blew me away. More magical than I ever expected. Cannot wait to go back for a little bit longer (4 days was just enough to scratch the surface)
Viewed by tour bus. Very interesting architecture and shops. No chance to walk around but would have liked to.

Great place to see. The old town architecture is lovley it was a very bussy place , with pleanty of Restants and shops and of course the astogical clock is there which goes every hour .As we went in dec the christmas market were there. Prague is a lovley place with some great building . But as gone very pricey over the years .

Lovely square. Been here in different seasons and it is lovely what every season. In the winter it has free standing stalls serving food and mulled wines, in the summer it had live music and horse and carts, great place to visit
Exceptional. Wonderful atmosphere and plenty to see and do. Our guide was very knowledgable and interesting and very helpful.
Very clean and lots to see.. Loved the diversity of the architecture, the merchants and the music. Very busy and was concerned about pickpockets.
still beautiful,very touristy. more crowded than ever,more expensive than ever.i had difficulty walking around due to the throng
old town. lovely old square,with restaurants around the edge,bit dearer than those outside the square, and good place to watch the astological clock, which chimes every hour
A slice of history. Do take a tour so a guide can explain the history - we would have missed so much without this.
Lovely. Lots of lovely quaint stores. Excellent condition of old roads, buildings, etc
amazing city. This is a wonderful site. There is so much to do and see in the old town. The restaurants are great. The old town is worth the visit!
Historic, impressive architecture. Lovely old town square, there was an Easter/Spring festival on whilst we were there. All very impressive
loved it. I loved the architecture, churches, astronomical clock,etc - easily accessible by tram
Beautiful.. One of the most beautiful cities in Europe. I love Prague it has such a raw beautiful edginess to it. Old town is great to sit and enjoy a drink and soak in the history.
busy place but needs a bit more benches. very busy good place to people watch but needs more seating.
Interesting. Very interesting city. Make sure to see the Astronomical clock when it goes off.
The heart of the Old Town. You must visit!. An iconic Square with beautiful churches, markets and many other attractions for tourists. Great restaurants and cafes.
Perfect at Christmas. stalls with sausage, potatoes, cakes, beer, wine, singing, christmas trees - so festive and very beautiful!
Beautiful. The old town square is lovely, well worth a visit. Definately climb the tower, brilliant views.
So nice early in the morning. Not have a chance to visit, only an early morning in the old center. This is super !
Lovely old town!. Just a great old town, I loved wandering around, shopping for souvenirs and eating delicious food around every corner! Big and sprawling and nice throughout!
Take the walking tours - a history and architecture lover's dream!. Beautiful buildings from the gothic, art nouveau, cubist and baroque traditions. A troubled but fascinating history to explore.
Amazing Architecture. I'm extremely impressed with the architecture of Prague in general. Well-preserved gothic buildings.
Beautiful buildings. The Old Town is a feast for your eyes. Each building is a delight, and walking the streets is a delight.
Old Town. Nice traditional market and places to eat, lovely buildings too. Quite busy.
Excellent Break. Beautiful. full of life. Musicians (not buskers) playing in square. Vibrant with visitors
Astronomical clock - wow!!!!. The old town was full of atmosphere, amazing gothic church, and astronomical clock
Visiting in Prague. Prague is beutiful The wether was exellent. The stay in the hotel was exellent.
A great place to people watch. It's a very nice square with the astronomical clock ,lots of restaurants and outside seating for a nice drink. Beautiful buildings and a gothic church.

Oh, Old Town. Well it' a tourist trap, but a beautiful one, full of history and architecture. The people working there didn't seem to be too friendly (except for the guy who did my tattoo) but then they're dealing with thousands of tourists every year. Going for a ride on the Vltava River was great fun (free beer and ice cream) and just wandering those uniquely European streets and shops. Just wandering along the Charles bridge for the first time I realized why people hang out there at night, beautiful.

Hustle and Bustle!. Plenty to see. The astronomical clock is not to be missed as it strikes the hour. It is on the Old Town Hall. Lovely restaurants surround the square.The Easter market had just started and runs through to April. Lots of lovely food and drink and gift stalls.

You must visit Old Town Square. Great place to visit and have a look at buildings and the clock tower. You must go and see the clock on the hour to see the display. Very entertaining, however its a very popular place for tourists. one of the best places to visit in prague
Beautiful location. Able to queue on the hour to watch the famous mechanism. Can become very crowded at times

Beautiful buildings in a lovely setting. Take a free walking tour to discover the history of the beautiful buildings. Look for the yellow umbrella in front of the tourist office next to the clock in the Old Town Square. Diana was a great guide.
Great vibe. Brilliant just brilliant! The food on display was unbelievable, tne friendliness, the beer oh the beer....

Enjoy a nice day sitting down on the floor at the old town square people watching. Very relaxing just to sit down on the floor of the old town square people watching. There are many stores nearby selling snacks such as sausages...etc this is the place to people watch as the astronomical clock and Tyn Cathedral is located at the square. Other attractions are very nearby and can be accessed via foot.
Really pretty and great atmosphere. Really pretty and great atmosphere and lots of places to sit and have a drink, chat and people watch!

lovely, lots to see. great cheap meals here as well. Can get very busy on the hour tho as people flock to the clock when it chimms as then a soldier appears to play a tune as well on the trumpet. Its good to watch it you can get a front seat in one of the resturants
Public transport good most things you can do by foot.. The people are friendly, nice scenery, old town expensive to drink but go in to any side street and you get the same drink for half the price.

Buzzing!!! Click!! Click!! Click!!. So much going on and atmosphere buzzing!! The Astronomical Clock and Tower is such beautiful workmanship. Be there on the hour to hear the trumpeter in full regalia giving it laldy! Different figurine appears at window above clock when the hour strikes, so get those zooms ready. Lots of bars and restaurants surround the Square, gets very busy day and night. Setting up stalls for easter just as we were leaving on Fri 23rd March so might have been opening on the Saturday 24th. Decorated trees, huge easter eggs & chickens, decorated cabins, fairy lights etc. Would be amazing for young and old.
beautiful. just beautiful to potter around - restaurants are a bit more expensive, but some good ones and some great bars.
Great !. Be there on the hour to see the 12 apostles in the tower.

Nicely Preserved. Great historic district, well preserved and very compact. A walking tour is a must. We took a free tour offered by Prague Airport Transfers. Ross gave an excellent tour and was very knowledgeable. He is also very patient.
Wonderful. Is a beautiful place to visit with wonderful buildings.
Old Town. Too crowded!!! You will feel like an ant being pushed through the small streets.
So charming!!. DEFINATELY climb to the top of Old Town Hall! Great view of the area!!
very clean streets. lovely to walk around on an evening . not too busy and noisy

beautiful. Czech History definitively reflects in the buildings. You can see that the pre-communist emparialism influence is present and it meets the historic path the country went through withb Russia's invasion. It was def an experience!
pure greatness. everything..the architecture and buildings older than you could imagine
Beautiful!. Beautiful but very much a tourist trap with expensive and over priced shops and restaurants.

Like Budapest. It was like Budapest a bit, but much more walking streets, and much more quiet like Budapest.
And the quality of the air is very good:)

The first place to visit in prague. Great place, nice shops, live music (was easter when we came), good local food and nice smell everywhere. Nice place, go on foot, dont miss it! Don't forget to hide your money, sometimes there are thieves, always be alert! watch your pockets and enjoy the place!

Beautiful, Amazing, Breathtaking and Romantic. if you have an eye for historical buildings, seeking a good relaxing place, or a fantastic walk, this place is the place for that. you will never get bored there, there are a lot of restaurants and cafes there. this place is a must, don't consider you visited Prague if you missed this place. my wife and i used to have a daily walk there, every time you will see something new

Great place people watching but watch out pickpocketing. The church is one of the most magnificant churches. Go there both night time and daytime. Great musicians playing at the square, nice outdoor cafes. It is crowd so just be aware!
safe and bustling. really worth seeing and great atmosphere. restaurants and bars very pricey compared to pubs 50yds. round corner.
nice atmosphere. Nice atmosphere, beautiful houses, small streets. Nice to walk around and enjoy the place.
Love the old town. Atmosphere is great, love the cobblestone streets, the buildings are absolutely gorgeous.

Beautiful square, lots of places of interest just off square. We did the free walking tour (more later) and spent a lot of time here. So many places of interest within walking distance and of course you have to see the chiming of the clock.

The heart of Prague. The reason to visit Prague is entirely wrapped up in the Stare Mesto district. We rented an apartment in the area, and filled an entire week. The history and beauty oozes from every cobblestone. Just stay out of the way of the drunken UK weekend partyers, and you will have an enchanting time for a really moderate price.
Beautiful Old Town, Prague. Architecture and astronomical clock highlights of a beautifully kept open area - quite superb
Inspirational. Beautiful buildings, great to be able to sit out and watch all that is going on. Lovely people.
Full of atmosphere. Brilliant - beautiful architecture. A wonderful place to explore - go round all the little roads and discover hidden churces, cafes and shops
astronomical clock. Went to Caffreys Irish Bar and watched the sport. Helpful in exchanging Euros
Beautiful buildings and sculptures. Beautiful buildings and sculptures. Lot of history to see.
Marvellous. I very much liked the old buildings near the new ones, it has a super atmosphere.

The mandatory, crowded bit of Prague. Every tourist in Prague has to do the walk from the old town square to the castle, and it's a beautiful, although crowded walk. If you decide not to worry about the crowd and the amount of humbug on sale, it's very enjoyable.

Shopping & eating street. A lot to see and do on this street, with the famous Old Town Clock and many souvenir shops and lots to eat around.
Very near to my hotel - Green Garland
great atmosphere. The best time of year in the Old Town, is when the Christmas Markets are on, but there is a great atmosphere all year round.The buildings are just amazing.
birds +++. Lovely to visit, food stalls, roasting ham, local dishes smelt lovely, some tables to eat at but lots and lots of pigeons so put me off
Amazing architecture. Sat in the square watching the world go by with a delicious coffee very close to Astronomical Clock. I was bowled over by some of the architecture.
Plenty to see & do. Plenty of shops & restaurants, but most importantly some great historical & religious buildings.
head up!. charming, beautiful buildings, streets, you have to see it!
It was ok. too many vendors trying to get us in their stores.
Interesting. nice walk in the Old Town - advised to all. Do not hesitate to use small parallel - side streets.

old town square prauge. The old town was lovely, the square has lots of restaurants and bars, as well as open stalls selling sausages, prauge ham, sweet bisuits and hot mulled wine, have the cherry punch it was lovely, main attraction was the astromonical clock, and lots of lovely building and statues to look at., a very lively place at night to wander around
Old Town is Stunning!. Loved the feel and smell of this area. Lots of fun things to do as well. Don't miss the square!

Just incredible architecture all around. Try seeing it at night too...very special as the buildings are lit up. People & cafes & shops & cobble stone strees and an amazing feeling just being there. Wear sensible footwear as you will be walking quite a bit and on cobbled streets, which are not compatible with high and narrow heels. So much to see, so many side streets to explore. Try the Maitrea restaurant for a nice vegetarian meal (just behind the cathedral). Walk from the square to Charles bridge. Lots of cheesy souvenir shops to buy junk from if you are so inclined. Some jewellery shops too, a bit more expensive than those away from the tourist area, but they seem to be offering genuine stuff. Garnet is very popular. Czech crystal is also well known, and many shops offer a splendid variety...
Historical centre. Very nice old fashioned narrow lanes, decorated faces of the houses, a lot of eating and souveniers opportunities.

One of the most pleasant places to simply walk around. Outside of Grand Place in Brussels, Prague Old Town is the best maintained area in all of Europe. I loved walking around and just seeing everything. Go without a time table, and you will enjoy it more.
Great!. Really beautiful and lots of eateries!! People walk everywhere and we found it to be very safe. Streets are cobbled Stone so beware if you have a walker or wheelchair.

Clock watching is fun. Very nice square.
Don't forget to watch the clock as it strikes the hour
to go. when sun is shining so good to stay in one of the cafes on the Staremestska square!
Great for glass!. The shops were great - especially good for glassware and glass beads
Great buildings. Go up the tower where the clock is the views are amazing
Great palce to hang out. This captures the essence of Prague. Have a beer in one of the outside bars and watch the world go by.

surprising city center. small streets with nice buildings, better conservation than I was expeting....mixture of different epoques....
a discovery.....nice shops, crafts.....bohemian glass...ummmm
Great City. We have been 3 days in Prague, and we just love the citym the old town is a must do
Great. Beautiful buildings and the clock tower well worth a visit

The best place in Prague- historic and charming. A trip to Prague would not be complete without visiting the old town; it’s got some lovely cobbled backstreets, and courtyards, with some charming little shops and restaurants. The old town square is the main hub of the town with the impressive astronomical clock and tower, and tyn church, go up to the top of the tower for great views of the square.But beware the square and the people who sell from the stalls there can be very expensive, that goes for the restaurants too, wander around the backstreet a little and you will find plenty of restaurants at much cheaper prices.The astronomical clock is amazing, not to be missed, and if you feel upto it there are ghost tours you can book that take you around the old town, we did it and it was very interesting, and when the square is all lit up at night the tyn church looks amazing.
Beautiful historic town. Loved the traditional architecture, all the curved alleyways and delightful little cafes on every corner. The old town is just so beautiful.

Avoid the old Prague ham vendor!. The square is definitely a must if you are visiting Prague. Be careful of the food vendors as they are out to overcharge. I paid 510 cr for a lump of salty meat and a bowl of tasteless cabbage, which I promptly dispose of by giving it to one of the many beggars kneeling around ten square. The churches are beautiful. Take a guided tour for a complete eerie nice.

Great location for vacation or just a great dinner. This is one of my favorite places in one of my favorite cities. This has a charm that cannot be beat. It's where East meets West, and old meets new. You can hear cathedral bells during the day, and disco all night.

Old Town-Very Old. Yesn You need to see old town. It has amazing history. But a little disappointing is the astronomical clock. I thought it was going to be a few minute display. There are lots of good places to eat and beautiful buildings to look at.
Very nice square, beauty of the place does not wear off. Avoid the ham sellers near the clock tower! Expensive and very rude...

Perfect city for walking and exploring. Start at the square itself and walk your way around the entire Old Town area - the center of Prague is built for walking, and is one of the highlights of Europe. When you eat, try to avoid the main square itself (Staromeske Namesti), and instead find a place a block or two off - the price will be 30-40% cheaper.

nice touch of history. there is no proper visit of Prague withou visit of the Old Town. specific narrow streets and old houses tell the breathtaking historical stories.. i recommend just to walk and breath the genia-loci
Stunning Old Town Square. The astrological clock & the figures popping out on the hour with trumpeter, beautiful buildings. St Nicholas Church you have to see the chandelier.

Beautifull and very well mantained. Is incredible, everything is clean, well kept and people are really nice to you. There is always a lot os people and specially during easter week, there is a fair with tipical food and dance. Really amazing!

ok. i believe that the old town has gone downhill since my last visit 13 years ago. it is a lot more commercialised and is extremely busy. BEWARE OF PICK POCKETS. my friend had her purse removed from a handbag that was clutched tightly to her and done up.
Old Town Square. The central Old Town Square contains a magnificent central fountain, beautiful architecture but beware the expensive restaurants.
Walking through history. Just wondering about looking at buildings and cultural influences is amazing

Get lost in teh alleys. Give yourself extra time to walk the narrow alleys and allow yourself to get lost without worrying about being somewhere on time. This way you will see the real beauty and enjoy what it is really supposed to be enjoyed for.

Best part of Prague. Every street, every building, this part of Prague is the best.
You can spend hours to walk there and feel the history.
Historic and romantic part of Prague, must see.

A place for shopping, eating and people watching. Old Town is the place to shop for souvenirs, grab a bite (as there is a lot of cafes/ restaurants) and people watching. It is sort of like a square where one part is connected to the Charles Bridge. We had a chinese lunch in one of the restaurants situated at one of the narrow streets. There is also an open area with stalls that sells a variety of souvenirs, caps and beanies, wooden toys at very reasonable price, at least much cheaper than those in the shops. From Old Town, we walked to Wenceslas Square where the high street brands are located at the Na Prikope street. For high end luxury brands, head to Parizska street.Toilet tips: There is not much free ones out there, McD charges per visit, but if you purchase something from them, they will give you a chip to access the toilets for free. Some cafes still provide toilet use for free.
Rich in history. There are so many historic monuments to see from Bohemian past, but prices ...
loved the little streets. Brillant! loved the old town lovely little cobbled streets where you come across little quaint restaurants, shops and bars.

like walking into a movie set. The old town is much like it was 500 years ago as far as the buildings and street goes. Even though there are lots of tourist shops, they are not quite as tacky as some cities, because they are all quite small and on the cobbled streets. The best thing to do is get off the main tourist trail streets, and find the magic, which is very much there.

unforgetable place. I recommend the city center .. the Stare Mesto.. is wonderful and breathtaking. plus yull always find something tasty to eat, something beautiful to appreciate and a lot of inspiration.
Beautiful Place. Full of character and charm, old world, historic, bohemian
lovely square.. right next to hotel, beautiful buildings and resturants. good selection of bars.

Stepping back in time. It was easy to imagine what it must have been like in medieval times because this area has been kept in a good condition. There were always new and interesting sights and buildings coming up in view. There is nothing I disliked!

Sit with a drink and chill. Great place to see the world pass by. Pull up a seat (complete with blanket and heaters) and sip some mint tea, all freshly made with mint leaves and limes, and do some people-watching!

lots in a small space. There is a lot of little shops to look into great if its cold! There's museums like the torture and chocolate one. The old town square is very pretty. I would eat here as the restaurants didn't look that good but its a perfect place to get your souvenirs
Wonderful condition and architecture!. People line up to see the the astronomical clock! It also offers great venues like Carnival, and many little shops and restaurants. Great place to people watch!
Old Town/Astronomical clock. Lovely buildings, churches, town hall and astronomical clock. Worth being around the clock for chiming on the hour and listening to trumpeter
Interesting. The old town is a must to visit, it has so much history and historic buildings as well as many galleries and museums, need more then a day to visit everything.
Prague a step back in time. The old town is magical with all its quirky buildings........one thing that saddened me was the amount of graffiti on these beautiful buildings. prague is a treasure
be sure to visit. a sight to behold breath taking buildings absolutely fabulous to see and photograph something to remember

Old Town Prague. During the day, lovely City to wander, interesting Secret Police museum over McDonnells !!! not known to many tourists, we were practically the only ones there.  The City is not so lovely by nightfall.  Noticeable presence of police, due to so many Stag and Hen parties !
wonders. it was clean and tidy,no rubbish on the streets.Narrow cobbled alleys made it feel special.
very interesting,but we did 2 waiking tours on our 1st day so you can get yours bearings which is far easier than keep r. far too much to see and do you need a few weeks here not a few days
Great to walk around. You can walk around here all day. Enjoy the many sites, bars, restaurants, buildings etc. Lots of stuff to do and see. Just a great place.
Old Town Centre. The historical buildings were absolutely breathtaking. Guided tour was good. Not enough signs and directions though.
Could spend hours here. The old town is absolutely beautiful with lots of places to eat and shop.
beautiful architecture.. Wonderful. But heavily thronged with tourist even in a cold February. But this does not detract from it's beauty. Bigger crowds on the hour for Astrinomical clock display.

An architectural delight. For architecture lovers, the Old Town is a veritable sampling of many eras/styles. Most buildings have been cleaned and restored so that the original details shine. You may also find luxury retail and upscale restaurants in Old Town to tempt you and lighten your wallet.

A magical and inexpensive place to stay!. We stayed at a lovely hotel, basic but clean and welcoming, The Cloister Inn in the Old Town. We found we could walk everywhere from that base, but the streets can be a maze so take a street map! The food is generous and if you try the local food and local beers, which I recommend you do, the prices are very reasonable as long as you avoid the most touristy places, just one street back from the old town square and the prices for food and beer were 50% to 60% cheaper! the locals were friendly and the town utterly beautiful under a cover of snow, but make sure you take sensible shoes and wrap up well in winter as it will be very cold! we went everywhere in walking boots and would have struggled otherwise. I cannot wait to go back to this lovely city.
Wonderful. There is a traditional Czech food stall in the main square near the Astronomical clock that is excellent. Try the roast meat!!!!

A wellspring of vitality and colour. Fabulous architecture and vibrant colours. It seems that the greyness of communism has given way to a frenzy of gaiety and inventiveness in painting - really worth taking the time to gaze upwards and admire :-) Beware restaurants that offer one menu in pictures and another with linked prices, the 'extras' (including if the waiter takes your photo with your camera) can be exhorbitant!
Cute. Very beautiful, like a little labyrinth, but very nice!

Prague - great city...but beware. An excellent way to spend a day - the Old Town is fabulous, but have come away thinking that most people are trying to rip you off as a tourist. Especially be careful with taxis...we had 6 or 7 totally different quotes for a journey ranging from 116CZ to 650CZ!! Beer is expensive, more expensive than the UK and street vendors tend to sell their food by weight and you get very large portions!! You also have to pay for most public loos too (except KFC!).It's a learning curve of a city...but unfortunately an expensive one! Be wary :-)
Interesting place to visit. Very diverse, much to see, interesting buildings, old, new, historical abseloutely amazing.
Medieval Europe at its best. Probably my favourite city in Europe and one of the best kept architecturally.

Delicious town square w lots of things to do and see. The churches , the clock, the big clock tower, the old town hall building, the roasted ham, the restaurants, the shops, the lights at night, everything is wonderfull !
Old world charm. Soooo beautiful... I am enthralled with the ages and architecture.
A romantic walk!. It's a place taken from the fairy-tales! Beautiful buildings, nice restaurants and shops full of souvenirs!

Beautiful Prague Old Town. If one can get to Stare Mesto early in the morning to avoid the large crowds and to benefit from the better natural light of the place that enhance the beauty of the architecture around Stare Mesto (on top of having it all for yourself) then this experience shall be unforgettable. Trust me.
Brilliant!. Definitely go up the old tower in the astronomical clock!
Must do. Buildings, people, shops, restaurants, concert hall. Everything we did was unique and most enjoyable. Can't go wrong with this city.
Staremesto. It was very cold while I was there (-16°C) but felt a very warm atmosphere

Amazing Landmark. A must do to fell Prague's spirit, get yourself surrounded by all amazing architecture.
Can be a bit crowded sometime, but early in the morning or late at night, this was one of my favorite spot in town.
Great buildings. Signposting was poor especially at castle but made good map important.
must see. a good place to go and watch central prague nice towers and restaurants
Old Town Square. Stunning but exceptionally crowded, especially on the hour with likeminded tourists waitng for the clock to strike
Clock. Atronomical clock, good area with street food! Nice cafe's, had a nice hot choc with rum to warm up!

Atmospheric heart of an intriguing city. Liked all that you could see and do within immediate vicinity - didn't like pick-pockets clearly preying on tourists who naturally were focussing attentions elsewhere (keep your money and personal stuff held securely!)

Must Do in Prague. Quieter in February due to the season, not quite what I imagined from the bars, and every shop is full or tourist tat. Take in the scenery, and architecture, and avoid the stag do's.
Very romantic city. Prague is a very romantic city, lovely restaurants, often with live music and of course you can't miss the Old Town! Go for a cruise on the river as well, maybe with dinner?
nice. i was there during christmas so for sure christmas market in old town is good u can enjoy it ....... hot wine grill pork and czhez sweet
A must. Go to the top of the clock towe the views are fantastic we went at christmas and the decorations are wonderful
Charming. Very picturesque with some beautiful buildings. Pedestrian only.
Old Town. Just lovely interesting buildings and history would love to stay here in the future and explore more in summer months

Amazing architecture. The history here, the age & preservation of these buildings is jaw-dropping. You're in danger of tripping as you're constantly staring up & around. The astrological clock is amazing & photo ops abound. And if you need a break from serious history, check out the Sex Machine Museum.

Trink a real Budweiser. Trink a real Budweiser, get a Tchech girl friend, go to all the concerts, bars, discos time and stamina allows, chill out outside of Prague by a lake, go to the Prager Burg and confess
beautiful. Clock was lovely, really worth watching over and over!
The Best city to get around. Just loved Prague, Stunning, beautiful, easy to get around. Want to go back.
very busy!. lots of lovely restaurants around here and a few bars, lovely way to spend the day/evening

Worth a visit. There are some stunning buildings to see in Prague and the old town it very picturesque but the city is mainly targeted for fridge magnet buyers and binge drinkers. If your up for a weekend of partying this is the place for you. If you prefer a trip whith a bit more culture try somewhere else.
Beautiful. ten times more expensive right in the square, just go a couple of blocks out to eat and it will be cheaper
best time to visit is december when Christmas markets are there. the best atmosphere, lots of coffee shops looking out onto the square. Christmas decorations are amazing
classic. fantastic area of town in close proximity to the hotel metropole.
Tyremarxx. This is a lovely part of Prague. The architecture is fascinating and the people are friendly. Gets crowded in summer but it is worth it.
Historic. Lots of lovely buildings, a feeling of spaciousness and history, yet quite upbeat too. Everything is in easy walking distance.
beautiful city , great culture. this city is lovely, so much too take in, very historical, lots of nice restaurants and bars, if u look further in you will find cheaper places to eat or drink.
entertaining. quite busy but well worth the visit lovely restaurants and cafes
Lovely culture. Genuin european culture. Great atmosphere. A must see

Probably lovely without tourists, tatty shops and money touts!. We didn't linger in this area very much. Very crowded with hoards of tourists (of course, we were tourists too!) and there are lots of the usual shops selling "souvenirs" and people handing out leaflets for events. We didn't like it there at all and tried to avoid. Also you get approached from people wanting to change your money. It seemed quite a tatty area - beautiful architecture and surroundings ruined by too many shops selling rubbish and too many people trying to encourage you to eat in their restaurants.
Very quaint,. We loved the Astronomical clock, beware of the expensive restaurants, there are some lovely more reasonable ones if you look down the side streets.
Beautiful in the snow. A beautiful area to wander around, view the astronomical clock, but don't forget to climb the tower!

So living!. Old town is a very living place! You can taste different flavors on different counters near Astronomical Clock! Streets are very clean and the cafes are smal and nice. You can find lots of different attractions!

Heart of Prague. You could spend all day just in the town square here. Gorgeous!!
Clock tower, church, old buildings, restaurants, plenty to keep your interest. Another Kodak moment spot.
An Adults fairytale. food and drink prices in old town are incredible. SO expensive. turn corners and walk down alleys and you will find authentc czech food and drink at much better prices.
great. everything a beautiful city, we really had a great time, even with cold weather we found a lot to do.

Avoid the height of the tourist season. Plenty of art galleries, bookstores, shopping opportunities and restaurants/cafés, in addition to the historic buildings, churches and too much to list. Go and discover for yourself, it's totally safe. Just beware of touts and shoo 'em away in Swahili or some other language nobody understands or make up your own ;-)
Like Paris...but with colour!. A feast for the eyes - a photo opportunity at every turn!
Great but packed. The small streets can get packed at certain times, so it is a bit hustle and bustle, but it all adds to the romance of the city.
Beautiful. I like atmosphere of the narrow streets, historic architecture, I dislike ever-present shops with fake Bohemian glass etc, mostly owned by people from the former USSR.

Clock tower.. Here there was shops and places to eat. The clock and the clock tower was here also. There are people offering tours some free, you will recognise them by their umbrellas. The tower is open to the public (for a fee) but whenever we were there it looked closed. Streets were clean of litter but had a lot of dog mess. There is also a little market in the old town which was nice.

Festive at Christmas. Lots to see in the area during the day (Old Town Hall, Astronomical Clock, Church of St Nicholas, Church of Our Lady before Tyn). Area also nicely lit at night. Night market adds festive atmosphere at Christmas with stalls selling local food and drink and the usual gifts and souvenirs. Information centre also on the edge of the square.
Very Central. Very close to the Hotel and used it as a central spot to get our bearings

fairy tale. This square is like from the fairy tale. Beautiful churches, astronomical clock, wonderful buildings... Cafes and restaurants are all around. You can here Mozart and classical music almost everywhere!
A sight to behold. A truly wonderful mix of colour, architecture, and history unfolds before your eyes.
Old Town Square. Loved this quaint town square. Sampled the foods and enjoyed the view from the tower at the top of the Astronomical Clock

History on place. Around The Old Town's Square it is a sheer pleasure just to look at the buildings from different times and be reminded of history and try to understand how this city experienced different epoques from Hussite reformation the start of The Thirty Years War to Communism and to nowadays capitalism that probably saved the city and all the living monuments from all times.
Convenience. If you can stay near here you are very central to walk to all the main attractions.
Beautiful!. We liked the atmosphere there, in summer, very nice and warm place!
Great experience. We did a walking tour here and had a great guide. Loved it, there was nothing we did not like. Because we come from a young country, we love places with history.

Stunning architecture!. Only one way to describe this part of Prague - truly mediaeval with buildings from small to grandiose. It is one stunning location set around the cobbled square and numerous streets leading off to find other delights!One word of caution though - this is where locals get their coin. It is very expensive to dine & water & we opted for hospitality a bit further away....
souvenir shops +++. do not bring a travel bag with wheels as it is all cobble stones
Stylish and interesting. The restaurant we went to around here did not disappoint. Generally my favourite area of Prague.
Old town. Must see it! It was located next to our apartment and we saw it many times
Pretty location. Very pretty location but many tourists and resultant souvenir shops. Cobbled streets everywhere therefore you need have comfortable shoes!

Easily my favorite district in Prague.. Loved bartering for goods on the Charles Bridge as we crossed over into old town. Great little shop on the right hand side just as you enter through the arch that sells very well made and very fair priced Pashmina scarves. Do barter as I knocked a bit off of two from the already cheap price. As you walk up the main street, there is a little eatery directly across from a guard manned door to the church (man in red uniform ever present at it). The food was AMAZING and extremely well priced. It was a place with about 4 outdoor tables and a large indoor seating area. Wish I could remember the name but we will be going there repeatedly when we come back next year. I just remember that we sat directly across from the guard at that church door. In my opinion, the buildings here (if you love old ornate wooden/carved doors, you will love this district) and decor are the best in Prague. Not to say the rest of town isn't pretty awesome. It's just that here, you feel the history. It's palpable. This town itself quickly became my favorite in Europe thus far. If you happen through Wenceslas Square, there is an Asian massage/spa across from McDonalds (opposite end from the National Museum) that has silerfish in tanks displayed in the window. My daughter and I walked by several time and were fascinated by the people with their feet dangling in there. The fish were all over their feet. On our last day we decided to see what this was all about. Our feet were KILLING us at this point. We went in, paid and plopped out feet in the tank. After the first minute or so of tickle, it was great! Once done, my feet didn't hurt in the slightest! Weird as hell, but I would do it again in a heartbeat!
Magical at Christmastime !. The atmosphere is unreal ! Like being a child again enjoying all the sites, sounds, and smells in the old town square. Plenty to do and see.
Historic old town. Loved the .Old Town (Stare Mesto) of beautiful Prague. Magnificent buildings at every turn It's an unspoilt area steeped in history.

Amust if you visit prague. Although very cold, the many colours of the buildings in the day time are fantastic, the clock truly is a work of art. Not so keen on the many cafe's or restaurants as they charge 2 or 3 times as much for many things, but overall a great spot for the camera.
Beautiful and historical. What a beautiful city. We really enjoyed everything about it, from the cobblestone streets to the fantastic food. Will definitely return one day!

In my Top 2 Favorite European Town Squares. Christmas time is fun & lively, though the square is beautiful any time of the year. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in the world (definitely in my top 5), and I keep returning time & time again. I love the architecture, the beauty, & the energy. The city was virtually undamaged during the World Wars, so you feel like you're stepping back in time once you set foot in the Stare Mesto!
The best square in the city.. The Astronomical Clock at mid-day is well worth seeing.
Romantic. You have to see it to beleive it. Wrsp up warm for the cold winter.
Great architecture. Lots of interesting buildings, churches, shops, restaurants & nightlife.
Lovely!. Lovely old buildings, little cafes, lots of interestings shop but lots of cobbled streets! A nice experience walking round and getting lost is the best way to explore it.

Must see. A real time warp. Walking the streets of the old town in Prague is literally like going back in time.
Gorgeous at night.
Just watch out for pick pockets.
Old Town a must. This is a must for all visitors to Prague. Prepare to just stroll through the narrow streets seeing beautiful churches, stunning architecture and details and great shops!
Lots of interesting shops and beautiful buildings. Beautiful place, bring comfortable shoes. Also cold in the winter, bundle up

Lovely buildings. Everything is very compact and accessable and there are loads of places to sit and eat/have a drink and watch the world go by. The metro map has all the sights highlighted at the appropriate stop and then there is a legend giving you all the details. It was lovely to just wander about and it is very easy to walk from the old town to the main square.
incredible atmosphere. This is what Prague is all about... an atmosphere like no other place. And the Old Town is the essence of the incredible feeling you get there
Fab. A must see for any visit to Prague. Very interesting historic centre with lots to see and do, and great places to eat and drink

Still as nice on my second visit. Old Town was very quiet on this visit compared to our last visit in October 2009, however it hadn't lost it's charm. There weren't any street vendors or the glass blowing exhibits though so this did spoil it a little. The Astronomical clock was also a little disappointing as not all of the parts of it were working and was not how I had remembered it. It is still worth visiting but I would recommend a visit in the busier seasons.

Average. After visiting 'Old Towns' in other countries, i was a bit disappointed with Pragues'. There are a few attractions worth seeing (Jewish Quarter/Charles Bridge/Astronomical Clock etc) but mostly it is a mixture of tourist souvenir shops and high end designer boutiques. Once you had seen the attractions, there was nothing to bring you back.
Interesting site. beautifull atmosphere, tiny streets, interesting site

Speechless!. This has got to be one of the most beautiful towns in the whole world. The architecture here cannot be compared to anywhere else. The entire Old Town can be accessed by foot. You can even walk up to the Prague Castle. Prague has the best beer in the whole world! Climb every tower there is - Prague has a few on offer. Get a caricature done along Charles Bridge. Prague is the best!
MY TOWN. I live in Prague - Like most locals I avoid this place if I'm in a hurry but it IS the heart of my town.
Hauntingly beautiful.. Just walking around, stopping for a warm drink in a cafe, dining in old-fashioned restaurants a little out of the way.

It is compact and wonderful to walk around. We went to see the X'mas market and loved it. There is a lot food stalls with interesting fares such as their rolled pastry, ham cooked on a spit over coal etc.

Well Preserved History. This is an amazing place to walk around, it's absolutely gorgeous. When we went to Old Town it was during the Christmas Market so that added an extra bit of character. Do one of the guided tours if you go, you learn a lot and they'll take you to places you probably wouldn't find otherwise just strolling around (Prague has a lot of stuff that is literally underground).

Magic heart of a magic city. Wonderful mix of architectural styles and sites. Key site is the looming St Vitus Cathedral and beautiful churches also in the square. Christmas Market was great and is held up to first week of January.

Magical Xmas Markets. We first wandered into the square at night and it was just beautiful to see. Not sure what it would be like without all the Christmas markets and sparkly lights but we will never forget Prague in December!

Great athmosphere within all this old buildings. The are is very nice for a enjoying walk between nicely restaurated old buildings. Its a main part which made the city of prague that famous. I really enjoyed visiting the churches and just walking around in the middle of these historic buildings. In the summer many restaurants offering seats outside, so you can have lunch or dinner while soaking the history of the buidlings.

I enjoyed it a lot!. it is a magical place... the sights are fenomenal, the old town is absoutely breathtaking! a wonderful place to walk around, shop, eat... there are lots of legends that are very interesting. and overall the history of Prage is fascinating! loved the experience! thank you

There are so many wonderful sites, the Jewish cemetary is quite interesting as is the Town Square. So many places to visit, great shops, great restaurants, easy to walk around. Don't miss seeing all the Churches and Cathedrals. The Bridges are facinating as well
Great atmosphere but watch the prices. Old Town is not to be missed but it's a tourist trap pure and simple. Spend your money in bars and restaurants away from the square.

Back in time. Breathtaking! You really feel like you have stepped back in time. The architecture is some of the most amazing I have seen.
The Astronomical Clock was amazing and the trip inside was worth the ticket price which includes touring below the city streets.

Very nice, but toursity. Its was beatuiful but we were there during the Christmas Market and was touristy. Food stands price gouged any customers. We spent more for fair food then at nice restaurantes with several rounds of drinks.
Gorgeous. We used this as our meeting point with a friend every evening. Brilliant places to eat and the sights were amazing, esp at night

2* and a half - rude crowds, scams and a fake look.. My experience there would have been really good. The well-preserved buildings and the artists who play instruments/dance/paint/draw were appealing.However, it seemed to me that most of the Old Town are traps especially-arranged for tourists:@ I only saw one ATM (so you have to change money at exchange offices)@ Many businesses do not accept credit/debit cards. Only Czech Koruna in cash.@ All the exchange offices show a big ''ZERO% commission'' while actually they have commissions (I have used 4 offices and the situation was the same!!!)@ Many streets around Old Town are full of hostel/hotels/restaurants, which would be good if they wouldn't charge you 10£ for 200g of pizza.@ Many streets are full of souvenir shops or beautifully-named ''art galleries'', which look very posh with their crystals/pottery. These shops make the whole place look like a colourful kitch. - look in the dictionary@ Celetna, the street which links the Tyn church and the Powder Tower is ''The queen on kitch'' @ Many of the tourists I saw were Czech/Slovak and they don't really care about the others. They shamelessly kick you without apologizing, in any language!@ There are virtually no benches to sit, should you be willing to admire the surroundings!I am truly sorry to have written such a review. I met some wonderful Czechs in Prague, but this is my genuine opinion on the Old Town..a carefully-arranged trap around The Old Square!
wow. blown away i just love the history of the whole place woul love to go againg some day
New Year. Lovely atmosphere in the markets great food and drink, good concert and entertainment
Unmissable part of the city. Possibly the most complete and authentic Old Town of its size anywhere in Europe.
Historic old town. Wander round and enjoy the amazing architecture and stop for coffee and cake or maybe a wonderful Czech beer
Oozes history. Beautiful cobbled streets and historic sights, astronomical clock is a must to see. Take the little side streets and find a traditional Czech cafe.
so much architechture. What a fabulous place to see we went on a short bus trip round the city with an audio guide which was an excellent way to learn a little about the city and get your bearings.
old town. Very interesting, in good condition. There are a lot of historical buildings.
Beautiful area and traffic free. You can walk for ages around traffic free streets. the souvenir shops are a bit unsightly

Visiting Prague without visiting this place is an incomplete experience!. This beautiful stretch should be traversed walking and on the way you will find some amazing jewels to explore including the Astronomical Clock, beautiful architecture and typical Bohemian food. This place truly represents Bohemia in a nutshell! Be careful about the food, it is comparatively expensive to the other parts of Prague! End your journey by walking through the Charles Bridge making it an overall unforgettable experience!

amazing walk around the old city, it is spectacular!!. The walk, was amazing the guide was very good and knew the history very well, the only thing bad was the lunch in an old cavern downstairs, the food wasn't good at all nor was the wine that was included in the lunch price.

Beautiful, picturesque, like being on a theatre stage. I really like the Old Town part of Prague - the Old Town Square with its dominating Gothic Tyn Church, the tiny medieval streets around as well as the classy Parizska street and the fashionable surroundings of Dlouha Street / V Kolkovne / Dusni with trendy bars, shops and restaurants housed in historical buildings. The Old Town offers a unique blend of architecture from the early Gothic to Renaissance, Baroque and also classy Art Nouveau. I also like the atmosphere, it is always buzzing and in the summer full of street cafes where one an sit and watch the world go by. At night it becomes a magical place when all the beautiful buildings are illuminated and one can really feel like being in the middle of the theatre stage in a fairy tale like setting. What I don't like, are some of the tacky souvenir shops selling tasteless stuff and totally irrelevant to the Czech culture (all those Russian dolls for example...). Also some of the pubs and restaurants are very touristic and overpriced. In my opinion there is a huge potential in making some of those lovely streets more elegant and classy instead of being full of this kitschy stuff.

Must see. Old town of Prague is a must see if you are here. I recommend starting in Hradcany as this is on the hill and walk down towards the river and city center. Nearly all of the buildings are renovated and there are many museums and sites to see. The only minus I would give is the amount of tourist in Prague. As Prague is small sometimes it becomes really squeezed in the small streets :) but still it is worth it.

xmas market. the xmas market in the old town is by far the best i have visited in europe so far, wonderful atmosphere, lovely cafes with heated areas to sit and sample the gluvein,loved the xmas lights and the buildings lit up at night .
the history the place. i visit here every time i go to prague i just love it

Historic. I cant think of a thing why you would dislike Prague, it's a beautiful city with friendly people with a very Europion cosmapoliton feel about it , no one would feel out of place there and i for one would go back
wonderful. Beautiful buildins lovel people watching area good quality cafes.
Centre of old Town, with mulled wine on tap!. There was a great jazz band busking on Sunday afternoon. Italian ice cream and great Czech beer, all at approx £1.
What a beautiful city!. Gorgeous section of town, great restaurants ad shops - be sure to check out the astrological clock!
Beautiful heart of Prague. LIked the Architecture and the atmosphere out of time. Disliked too many tourists like me :-P

A medieval jewel!. Ok, there is a lot to see here! First kick off in Prague's old town square. There is a church with twin gothic towers. I think its name is Tyn Church, Also Saint Nicholas Church is there and the Old Town Clock Tower. In one its walls is the famous astronomical clock. There is also a nice monument in the middle of the square but I can't remember the name of it.Again, please be alert if you are among the crowd watching the astronomical clock. Pickpockets are watching who is distracted.
Beautiful and what you expect Prague to be!. Lovely atmosphere and much nicer than modern parts

Good atmosphere, but could be crowded and noisy. The atmosphere is great, there are some nice little cafes and a bookshop here and there. However, most restaurants are overpriced and the food not good. It could also become noisy, come lunch and dinner time.
Old part is beautiful. it was windy day but it was close to get there.Old part is beautiful. we saw lot's of old buildings which were built theousands years ago
nice. Be aware of too expensive restaurants that place food on your table that you did not order and yet have to pay.
a city of fairy tales. a liked the fact that it was like a turn back in time

Nice!!. We liked the restaurants and bars. Tried a couple of traditional czech bars but they were mainly male dominated and quite busy plus, loads of people smoke inside so it was a bit like going back in time where you go home reeking of other peoples' smoke. We tried a couple of restaurants and found the waiters friendly and down to earth and the food plentiful and tasty. We sat in a bar called the Black Bull right opposite the astronomical clock and watched as the crowds gathered each hour to watch this clock do its thing whilst it chimed the hour. Again, the waiters were friendly and attentive.Quite busy at times as we went in December when the xmas market was at it's height - sometimes you couldn't get close enough to the stalls to have a look as there were so many people trying to do the same thing.The food on the stalls was yummy but could be quite pricey unless you tell them when to stop filling the container as they sell the food by weight.
Prague Old Town!. Amazing place to visit, lots of tourists, but well worth to see, especially at night with the lights on!! beautiful!!

In the Christmas spitir!. Being at Old Town and in Prague generally at Christmas is so wonderful!You can stroll around the Christmas markets, you can marvel the Astronomical Clock, you can sit around the Christmas tree.....Beautiful....!

So crowded in winter, summer must have ridiculous crowds. Was a nice area, but felt a bit disappointed...maybe it was the crowds. Hard to fully appreciate the area when you have to concentrate so hard on avoiding people. This was after Christmas, so summer would be worse i guess.

Exciting attraction. The Old Town has a real buzz to it. Everyone seems to be enjoying the wonderful views, people walk around quite safely and there is so much history that blends in with the daily rush of a living city that one can really feel the "buzz".
First place to visit. Very short and simple!If you visit Prague, it's the most important place to visit!

Old Town Square. The best bit was the view from the clock tower, The astronomical clock is very popular with people arriving close to the hour to watch. The bars with the outside seating and heaters were ideally placed but not cheap. Around £12 for 2 coffees!
We liked it more than Vienna. We recommend a walking tour with a guide, the atmosphere is great, but it's even better if you have somebody to tell you about the history of the beautiful buildings.
Beautiful Old Town. Old buildings with great architecture, lots of turists and place to eat and drink.
Amazingly cultural. Loved this area of Prague, culturally and from a tourist point of view the place had a lovely feel to it
Praque is magical. Loved the old buildings and just walking in the narrow lanes. Cafes and restaurants always made the total of the bill more than it should be.
Pretty Buildings, Expensive "Tourist" Food. Its good for a walk amongst the beautiful buildings but the cart food is pricey.
old type medieval square. The square was lit up wonderfully for new year,and there was always plenty bars and restaurants selling mulled wine,and lots of New Year Experiences

beautiful. the architecture is superb, the ambience and atmosphere are excellent. The clocktower is lovely. Try the stew and dumplings at a pavement cafe, delicious. Walk over charles bridge to visit the palace and wind around the streets on the other side of the river too.

Awesome during Christmas time. We were in Prague just before Christmas & lived just off the square. The buildings surrounding the square is just remarkable as well as the Tyn Church. The atmosphere is just indescribable. We enjoyed drinking our gluwhein & eating crepes on the square and the smoked goats cheese was delicious. You must go up the old clock tower, the view is just breath taking.

The amazing old town of Prague. The old town of Prague was truly one the most impressive place to see in Europe. You can feel the grand medieval history of this city as you walk through the beautiful blocks. Try some traditional delicacies sold from all the tiny booths around there and enjoy the atmosphere. I really liked the place.Only thing bothering was that it was really difficult to find restaurants that would have been completely non-smoking. Most of the cafe`s and restaurants had only a non-smoking area. This is the reason why I can not give this rewiew a 5 star opion but everything else was very very impressive.

History. There is a nice place to know, you can take a free tour from there, and learn of the history of this beautiful city. The people is not so kind when they are working, and you can get better prices out side of the old town.
Beautiful. Its a must to visit Old Town Square, sit in a street cafe and watch the world go by
Breathtaking. The only thing which could have added to the magic would have been snow.
Excellent for sight seers. Well signposted. The area was attractive and well kept, with many attractions within the area.
Quaint area. All the old buildings and shops were so easy to spend hours walking around. Great place to buy amber and garnet jewelry.
pretty and unique. very crowded near the clock and old square, so go early in the morning if you like to take photos without the crazy shoulder to shoulder crowd.
