Lovely atmosphere. The Christmas markets and lights- especially the tree made it very magical.
Seeing as much as possible in the short stay!. It was the Christmas Market season, everything was bright, joyful, beautiful and thoroughly enjoyable!
Christmas Magic. A must see at any time of the year but with the sights and sounds and smells of Christmas it was magical.
Festive Magic. Full of Christmas market type stalls typifying all that's written about European cities over December/January.
old town. beautiful place, especially as we went when christmas markets were on & everything was lit up

Favorite area for sure. I came to Prague to spend the holidays with my husband and daughter. Stare Mesto is simply amazing. At every turn is another amazing building and something to look at. You can just imagine the people of the ages walking around, horse drawn carriages, etc just happening here. A rich culture and friendly people make this area the place to be. I can't wait to be here in warm weather. The only downside is that although it was colder weather so maybe I didn't seem them, but the cobblestones may be difficult for wheelchairs and strollers. I am lucky I do not have to be concerned with that.

Superb. It is big, and you can find everything there. The surrounding old buildings are so breathtaking. Many good bars, cafe and restaurants. Shops? just name it from souvenirs to branded items all in the. It is a one stop sight, the festive atmosphere was incredible

Incredible setting, but overly touristy Christmas market. The Stare Mesto buildings and skyline were unbelievably beautiful.. It is definitely a must see. But, I wouldn't bother going during the Christmas market again. There were about 6 different vendors that repeated over and over. Literally, the same paintings were sold in many many stalls within a block of one another. If you are looking for a lovely Christmas market go to Budapest.

A wonderful place to get lost!. Just wandering about in the Old Town was an experience to savour, taking time out to have coffee and cake or a meal really made this even better! Remember to wear good walking shoes, the entire area is cobbled and heels are a no-no! Also look at the prices, some establishments are very expensive and some very reasonable but there seems not to be any consistancy to this.
very pretty christmas decorations and lovely atmosphere. lovely atmosphere the tree was beautiful. plenty of places to eat
Very walkable part of Prague. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Old Town Square has many vendor booths and outdoor restaurants.
I'll be back here when it's warm. Architecture is great. Grab your camera and enjoy!

Magical City - take your walking shoes. The way to see Prague is by walking and the Old Town is amazing. Each corner is a beautiful sight.Take your time, savor the ambiance and architecture. Plus stop for a pivo here and there....
Magical. The sheer size and beauty of the architecture, the views over the city and the cathedrals.
Nice place for shopping. Nice place for shopping but you will need to bargain for some of the goods.
Nice place for shopping. Nice place for shopping but you will need to bargain for some of the goods.

Magical Prague at its Christmas Best. We stayed in Prague over Christmas and sitting in the Italian cafe in the Old Town Square sipping coffee and watching the world go by was one of our delights. The Christmas market was in full swing, there were singers entertaining and the smell of hot wine and roast hams in the air. At night, with the buildings lit, it was like a real life Disneyland, with fairytale buildings all around. Beautiful!

Amazing place. Like stepping onto a Harry Potter set inclusive of a Death Eater at the bottom of town square. Can be on the expensive side to eat at christmas market though i suppose you expect it being major tourist area. Still love it though just make sure u budget for it.
Stunning!. Gorgeously preserved architecture, covering many centuries and styles. Ambience is as pleasant as classic tourist places in Italy and France, but cheaper and more relaxed.
Christmas markets. The markets was in good festivity and added great atmosphere would like to visit again spring/summer to experience the difference

Wander the side streets. This area is the heart and soul of Prague. While the Charles Bridge and clock are worth seeing at least once make sure you take time to lose yourself in the winding streets of Old Town. We discovered an open air market, a sex toy museum, chocolate museum, and more restaurants than you ever need. Oh and plenty of souvenir shops and money exchange places. Need something more fancy? High end shops like Cartier, Gucci, Mont Blanc, and Versace are between the old town square and the Jewish Quarter. Stay clear of the outdoor cafes in the old town square as they are a rip off. Check out the cozy and wonderful restaurants hat serve great food.
Under Restoration. The old buildings are beautiful after restoration,
Easter is the best time to visit. The old town square was crowded when we visited last Easter but I enjoyed it. Lots of stands with goods and goodies on sale. I enjoyed the gelato stand the most.
Historical Dining. Outstanding atmosphere and very good food and service. We really enjoyed, and suggest is a part of being in Prague
Great. Great conditions, feels like you are living in another century.

Absolutely gorgeous and amazing place. The Old Town of Prague is one of those places where you have to visit in your life time; it's one of my favorite spots in all of Europe. When you explore the narrow cobblestone streets, pay attention to the architecture and ambience. Stop at a pub and drink one of the many delicious Czech beers. It's a beautiful and romantic place everyone should have the opportunity to see and is well worth the visit.

It is indeed an old town. See my review of the Mandarin hotel for more detail....I think this is trading on the good reputation of Prague, but why it has such a reputation is beyond me. The Old Town is nice to look at but has no soul. The only shops seem to be shops selling tourist tack - marionettes (yes, millions of them); T Shirts; mugs; etc etc, of the type of thing you wish you hadn't bought within five micro seconds of having bought it. Touts hustling for your business (psssttt, hey, do you fancy going to a concert tonight???). Having been there, I wanted to ask: "is that all it does???" A quick skip around it in an hour and you would be done. Do not, under any circumstances, think that if you go a bit out of the town centre it will be interesting. It isn't, unless you have a desire to see endless amounts of graffiti plastered on every surface that is accessible to those with a head for heights and a can of paint.
Walking back in time. It is really nice to just stroll around in this part, it feels like you are walking in history;just enjoy!
Best place!. Very cultured place, definitely the highlight of our trip!
A city walker's paradise. If you like to walk, stop, look and walk on . . . this is a great place.
Christmas Market. It is so beautiful and festive, lots of good food and many interesting things to buy. The lights at night are wonderful and the people are very welcoming.
Charmy. Charmy place... very romantic! eveybody should go there once in life!
Old Town and Square. Easy walking with lots to see and experience. Astronomical Clock a highlight.
Enchanting. Lovely old town square full of history and beautiful architecture

Best seen at Christmas?. The Christmas market here is fabulous and unlike most of Europe, runs until Dec 31. Great shopping, food, drink and a fascinating clock tower. Top five sight in Europe in my opinion.

Beautiful. Old town was a great place to visit, particular while the Christmas Market was going on. It is charming, beautiful, and just a fun place. Venture just outside the square though to find decently priced food.
splendid. old town was great we were able to enjoy the christmas markets at this time of year.
Very nice. We were during the Xmas markets...So it was very nice decorated

fantastic a must see make sure you visit here it really is amust see place.Its best to go at night soak up the atmosphe. nothing a great place to visit. night time is the best to go here some nice places for food and drink and it will not bee too expensive on the pocket.
Beautiful medieval square. With the church at one end and the astronomical clock tower at the other you felt as though you were in some kind Grimm faery tale world. An excellent place to visit.

Just the tonic needed at the start of winter. Just returned from a fantastic 3 night break away in this wonderful city, for the traditional Christmas market. By European standards the city is small, so it's easy to learn your way around in a weekend. Walking is by far the best way to soak up the atmosphere, but there is an efficient tram, metro & bus public transport system. You can buy tickets at stations & at the airport's information desk, which also has a detailed English language guide to the system. For a taxi, I would recommend City Taxi.Start on Wenceslas Square; still the centre of the modern city, it is, in fact, a wide avenue lined with shops. It's a good base to get your bearings. Ambling through cobbled streets, walk down to the majesty of the city's Old Town Square, with its brightly coloured baroque facades overshadowed by the vast Gothic twin towers of Tyn church. A market place since the middle ages, the Square has many of Prague's most beautiful buildings, as well as the 16th-century Astronomical Clock on the Old Town Hall.Along Karlova the medieval 14th-century Charles Bridge is probably the most photographed sight in Prague.If you want to go shopping you can head for the lively market on Havelska. Alternatively the tree-lined Parizska Street is Prague's equivalent of London's Bond Street.For contemplation, Europe's oldest preserved historic synagogues & the Old Jewish cemetery are in the Josefov quarter.Finally, there is Obecni Dum, a vast art nouveau complex in Namesti Republiky.Top tip - avoid the tourist crowds along Karlova & the Charles Bridge with an early start.

Brilliant. The Old Town Square was filled with Xmas stalls and lots of music and celebrations. The Astronomical Clock is here and small lanes leading of in different directions to lovely cafes bars leading to Wencelas Square or King Charles Bridge.
Christmas Market was a BLAST. Walking around with mulled wine eating the best pork products on the planet. Fantastic!
Amazing. This part of the city is fantastic. The Astronomical Clock is great. The narrow streets of this area and the whole atmosphere bring you back to other periods. No one can´t miss it.

Fab!. Went in December and all the Christmas Markets were out in Old town and around the square - such an amazing Christmas feeling walking around the markets and having some hot wine and doughnuts from the food stalls... The buildings around the old town and the narrow cobble streets are amazing... something to experience!
Just great!. Very nice walk-around, especially at night. Lighting is perfect and adds so much more to the atmosphere.
Traditional Xmas. lovely xmas atmosphere,traditional mulled wine, roast ham,great smells.
Always a pleasure to walk there. It was the first time that I went to Prague during Christmas and I loved the atmosphere. The various Christmas market shops add something to always lively Prague.

Old Town. Christmas tree was fantastic! Our favourite place for a hot wine hot choccolate and beer was the Music Club 24/7 (can't remember its name), near to the Charles Bridge, in the narrow street. You can people watch, and they give you soft red blankets to keep yoour legs warm (and great chocolate cherries)!

cultural. Loved the architecture of the Old Town, just a shame that as any other tourist attraction, everything revolves around tourists being ripped off! We took our grandson on a caleche ride, it cost about £10 each and we literally went round the block!
Amazing history. superbly preserved buildings - but everyone knows that, it's what Prague is famous for
Christmas markets and real festive atmosphere. The biggest christmas tree I have ever seen, lovely atmosphere in a truly magical setting
Amazing. A great spot and we were there for the Christmas Fair which was lots of fun and quite yummy!

Nice architecture. The Streets are filled with life and people, good shopping area for suveniors. Nice Architecture and beautiful building.
The street could be cleaner but the human traffic is too much to be able to keep it clean and free of littering
Christmas Market. Magical, probably the best Christmas market in the world.
Stunning Christmas market. Just amazing, lots to see and do. Take the trip up the clock tower too.
Excellent venue. the festive atmosphere and cleanliness could wander and shop with no hassle plenty of decent food outlets
Beautiful. best to explore this area on foot, it's just so pretty! Make sure you go down the lane ways to find those hidden gems!!
You feel as you went back in time. Charming, with little winding streets and small cafes.

cozy and authentic christmas markets, overpriced food. Old Town is fantastic, the Christmas markets offer travellers and locals traditional mulled wine, honey wine and handicrafts. But beware the stalls with ham and local delicacies such as dumplings with cabbage- we paid 450 ckk for a small meal!!!! And once the portion has been prepared for you there's no turning back. Good food but for that price we could have had two full meals with beers at a restaurant. Besides this Old Town is spectacular

Beautiful buidlings on every street corner. It is very touristy - there is constant stream of tourists between the Charles Bridge and the Old Town Square, the streets of this route are lined with souvenir shops, but the buildings are so beautiful that you can overlook this. There are also a lot of things to see on the quieter streets and many great little restaurants.
Those who like old cities.... Great to roam around the old town, old buildings centered around Praha 1.
Very pretty and different place. Really nice interesting buildings and lots of trips to do, lots of history and we went at christmas time so it was busy which made it better I suppose.
A must do. You can spend the day on foot exploring. There are a ton of things to visit while you are exploring the Old Town. Stop and check out the Jewish Cemetery or go to the Castle!

The most beautiful civil centre in the world. Been to over 40 countries worldwide and this must be by far the most beautiful, picturesque town centre ever (specially Christmas time at night!) tops cities like Florence, Budapest, Venice, Vienna and even Barcelona and Paris. A surprise in every corner!

Old Town Prague. Very Mitteleuropean (should be as it's in the middle of Europe), lovely human scale architecture. Would have liked to have seen it before it became as tourist oriented as it is now. Christmas markets were great, standing in Old Town Square drinking mulled wine and eating Czech sausages listening to concerts was fun.

Chrismas lights in Pragues. The magnificest buildings , the colours and forms and shapes... all out of this world.The jewish quarter is moving . Facinating. The big square is fun, exciting, especially now on Christmas week.You hera so many languages, so many tourists.
Christmas markets. Brilliant to see and lovely atmosphere here, the markets were good and the mulled wine was lovely. Very busy on the Sunday afternoon.

Stately and good at Christmas time. The Christmas markets were a bit of a rip-off, over commercialized compared to ones in Vienna. But it was a great atmosphere and we went back a number of times over our four day visit.
Wonderful in December. The tree was tall and beautifully lit. There were tasty food stalls everywhere and it was just a pleasure to walk and look around.
Beautiful architecture. This area is really lovely, the architecture is stunning. It was good in December as it was very festive.
Amazing!. The Old Town Square is stunning! This was such an amazing way to spend Christmas. Perfect balance of charm and romance.

Absolutely Wonderful. I was there over the christmas season, it was beautiful. Try and climb up the tower on the main market square to oversee the whole city, and visit some of the old churches, which are of course still in use today. A walk around after dark will show you a completely different side of the old city center.
One of the best cities in the world. The architecture is second to none. The history, the food and at Xmas it is truly wonderful.
Great options for eating, sightseeing all around. The old town is obviously a big part of why you are traveling to Prague - enjoy wandering the streets, the markets, and the food!

OLD TOWN / Prague. The entire area of old town / Prague was wonderful to vist and we did each day of our short visit. The Christmas Markets were magicial, and we loved all of the attractions. The local dining was also a major part of our experaince, as was outstanding.
Beautiful architecture. The streets, buildings, and architecture are incredible. They have maintained them very nicely.
beautiful. Very beautiful part of town, only 10 mins stroll from Hotel yasmin.
big, all nice. Must go, so nice, buildings art-deco, art noveaux, fantastics, gotics...woof

Fun. I loved searching the Christmas markets. Found wonderful Christmas gifts. Barter a little bit they will go down a little in price.
There are duplicate offerings, so you can look at the same item more than once and just buy the lowest price one if you do not like negogiating.
Lively with all the Christmas market stalls. Many people made the place lively. Traditional foodstuff sold in the Christmas Market. Fun talking to the locals.

Great for walking. We love to walk around looking at beautiful buildings and it would be hard to top Prague in that department. Old town is a maze of little streets with more interesting architecture than you could possibly absorb. The main square is most impressive but almost every street has something worth looking at
Old Town Square. Make sure you go up the tower in the old town square for some excellent views.

Lasting memories. Photo opportunities abound - amazing architecture at every turn. In December it has all the magic of Xmas. Great atmosphere, lovely bars & restaurants. If you're into 'classical' - concerts everynight in lots of places. Downside - except for designer stores, the shops are mostly full of tacky souvenirs
A must-see in the heart of Prague. Medieval city square, old Town Hall, magical Tyn Church ( especially at night) - Astronomical clock. and wonderful Xmas market.
old town. everything is spectacular avoid sqare coffee shops ...rip off
christmas markets. Very busy, friendly but on the expensive side go outside the square and buy the same goods cheaper

Prague Old Town Xmas Market. Xmas market was very dissapointing with the majority of stalls selling food - better markets in the UK !
Cafe culture was howver very good and great food
Old Town. We went here while the Christmas Markets were set up. It was quite a festive atmosphere with lots of people and great street food.
Tourists meets business + overprised souvenirs. Some nice buildings,streets.Plus hidden gem - Basilica of St.James and some really nice restaurants!
Interesting and historic. Very historic and the buildings were well kept. It was a great area to just wander around.
Beautiful. Beautiful, colourful, atmospheric. Easy to walk around.

Great place to stay when visiting Prague. We chose to stay in the Stare Mestro while visiting Prague. It is conveniently located within walking distance of all the sites we wanted to visit during our week in Prague. We were lucky enough to find an apartment rental with views of the Charles Bridge and Prague Castle. This area of town is quiet, quaint, and historic. You will be a stone's throw from St Nicholas Church (and square), the Charles Bridge with its historic towers and lovely collection of statues, and lots of shopping, restaurants, and colorful beer gardens. The area is also close to trams and bus stops if you're not up to walking all day. While the Old Town Square is buzzing with tourists at all times of the night and day, you will find the Stare Mesto to be quiet and romantic, especially after dark. I highly recommend this area when looking for a place to stay, and it's a lovely place to spend a day taking in the shops, churches and local sites - including Prague Castle.

Excellent atmosphere here during Christmas markets. We visited in December 2011 when the Old Town Square was full of stalls for the annual festive markets - the stalls and backdrop of the Old Town added to the festive spirit. The main points of attraction are the Astronomical Clock and the 'Adam and Eve' church.
Loved it. We love wandering around the old town looking at the lovely ornate buildings. There are plenty of shops to look in too and plenty of photo opportunities
Picturesque site. I love walking around the old time. I was particularly enjoying the condition of the old houses, this part of the town is picturesque.

A beautiful history. Though it was freezing outside (I went at the beginning of December) you really dont mind since you can drink some hot wine in the streets and see the beautiful views of the city and architecture. Really worth it. Ive been all over europe and this was easily one of my top 5 cities for beauty and culture.
Old Town Square. The town square is a beautiful example of some of the amazing architechture that Prague has to offer , the astronomical clock is the centerpiece and makes a stunning photograph.

Beautiful but touristy. Very touristy and busy but equally beautiful, the Old Town is worth many visits to discover the its little nooks. Avoid all the "museums" legit or otherwise since they often cost much more than they are worth.
perfect before Christmas. you got to try their donuts and sausages :) kids love walking the Square and watching at misc kiosks on what they sell and what they do.

Like travelling back in time. We went there in december and I have to say, the christmas markets were astonishing. You could buy all sorts of czech traditional things on the market. We especially liked the trdlo, or trdelnik, a sweet pastry on "rolls". I would absolutely recommend a visit, we would like to go back some day.
the shops. since going last year we have found everything has more than doubled
Magical Christmas location. At Christmas this place is quite magical (except for the crowds!). Highly atmospheric and beautiful to behold.

So much to see. Old Town was like travelling back in time. The cobblestone streets required tough walking shoes, but are a pleasure. Virtually every style of architecture can be experienced. My favourite was Tyn Church near the Old Town Centre. The detailing on the buildings was amazing, even relatively ordinary buildings had amazing statues and carvings over doorways and on the roofs. Random statues appeared all over. A little girl sitting on a building ledge, reading a book. A man hanging from a pole protruding out over the road. You could spend a lifetime there and still want more.
Christmas treat. At the time of the Christmas markets the atmosphere is great. Try a slice of pork from one of the stalls where you can see it being cooked on a spit.
Christmas treat. At the time of the Christmas markets the atmosphere is great. Try a slice of pork from one of the stalls where you can see it being cooked on a spit.

so quaint!. Take a walk back in time and admire the unique architecture of this old city. Enjoy the tastes, sights and ambiance of the Christmas markets. Enjoy the roasting chestnuts, mulled wines, delicious foods and more. Celebrate the season by watching the performances on the live stage. Stop by a little pub (there are many) for a great Czech beer or a delicious snack.! Definately would love to go back!
christmas magic. beautiful olde worlde feel. set up for christmas market, and had donkeys and sheep and goats to feed. kids loved it. Most beautiful christmas tree i have seen in my life!
the old clock tower was amazing. yhe attitude of some of the shop assistants.some of them were quite rude
Magical Old Town. This compact, clean and magical place was even better with the Christmas Market and wonderful Christmas tree.
Christmas markets. Christmas markets are wonderful and sell lovely hot wine and mead which is great on a cold day

Beautiful historic buildings. The old town has quite a few other tourists in it but that adds to the atmosphere. There are beautiful historic buildings to look at on the outside and inside. Plenty of restaurants around with seating in cellars which used to the old Prague, before the current Prague was built on top of it. The underground tour is definately worth going on and starts in the town hall next to the astronomical clock.
Just near. Just cross the charles bridge which is near the hotel, and there you are in the Old town square :)
Prague in December. Historic interest, friendly and fascinating buildings. Some good food and shopping as well

Old Town. Beautiful buildings and loads of history. We went on the Ghost Walk which is brilliant value and gives you a great insight into the history of Prague as well as the buildings in the old town without being "dry". Shame about the graffiti and the attitude of so many of the shop and venue staff. There seemed to be a general attitude of disinterest and in some cases, downright rudeness. Prague needs to think about improving customer service and teach those who are in contact with the tourists to smile!
What A Beautiful Area. Thank God the Soviets left. The Czechs have restored this city to its full glory.
Historical Centre. Beautiful architecture and surprisingly clean and well maintained

Amazing ambience!. Old Town is an amazing place to walk by every day. The narrow streets are full of life, with almost a open shop in every door.Streets are usually crowded with tourists, so be aware of pickpockets and possible schemes with exchange of currency... Notice the decoration on the façade most buildings, as they are are full of wonderfull details.I'll give it a 4 out of 5.
Wonderful part of town. No dislikes, the old town is really great, there were christmas stands at the old town square, a lot of people but not overcrowded, plenty of great little stores ...

well preserved. the old town is really nice to strowl through with all its old buildings. Loads of shops and people as the really lovely x-mas market was on the main squar which is really worth going to. Loads of wonderful churches you can visit (for free) and nice caffes off the main road were there are not as lot of tourists. Just go around and try out the coffeehouses and you will find loads of nice places. I´d also recomend the Grand Cafe. Also try out the specialites on the x-mas market.
Christmassy but busy. The Christmas Market here was great, but very very busy at the weekend. Visit here mid week if you can.

The Prague of my expectations. Old Town in Prague is what I was expecting from Prague – old buildings lining even older streets. Gothic features dominate the streets, creating an old and dark atmosphere. Old Town contains ample attractions for a trip in itself – Old town Square, Powder Gate, Na Prikope, Smetana Hall… A fantastic place in Prague. Must see.
Loved the Christmas market & decorations. It was nice to try the different foods & see the holiday decorations
Christmas markets. Lovely this time of the year good shopping plent to see and do. The Jazz boat trip was a bit expensive but was very good. We were lucky with the weather which help.
Beutilful buildings. A lot of historic buidings and churches. All very well kept. Because of the christmas market it was overcrowded
This is the place to visit. A square with lots going on, crowds gather around the astronomical clock. Very popular square.
Xmas Spirit In Prague. Beautiful Decorations, Excellent Hot wine, HUGE amount of toursist - still.Congratulations to Prague on managing to exceed itself year on year.
We are the same people wherever you came from. The astronomical clock is a draw with the tourists and those beautiful cafes make the place so inviting
Even better at Christmas!. Wonderful architecture, plenty of shopping if you want it.
Stunning. We loved the Christma markets, restaurants were delicious and the views and buildings were stunning. Well worth a visit.

Spent hours there literally, it was breathtaking!. I loved the whole place! From the square to the little shops to the Astronomical Clock to the Churches surrounding the place.
Try going to St. James Cathedral which is a few meters right outside the Old Town square (you can consult the Information Center to get directions).
Looks like a fairy tale.. Well worth a hot wine and just soak in the atmosphere.

A walk in the Czech Middle Age. I started the walk in Old Town (Stare Mesto) from the Powder Tower (Prasna Brana). Close to this tower I’ve admired the beautiful Municipal House, and Hybernia Theater.The walk continued on the narrow streets of the old town, where I’ve admired Municipal Theater, Carolinum Chapel, Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn, Old Town Square, Clam – Gallas Palace, Marian Square, Carol Street, Clementinum Complex, Knights of Cross Square with the monument of the emperor Carol IV, Smetana museum.Visiting Old Town Square I’ve seen Kinsky Palace (A part of the National Gallery of Art), Old Town Hall with the Astronomical Clock, Jan Hus Monument, The Minute House, Church St Nicholas in Old Town.Also, in Old Town I’ve seen a lot of ancient shops, restaurants, and houses. There, the souvenir shops are very well represented.For visiting Old Town Square, the nearest metro station is Staromestska.Enjoy the walk in the Old Town!

Great!!!. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The Old Town (Stare Mesto) is fantastic place. Every next step in the city takes you to something interesting. The the sights of the town are on every corner. You have to spend at least one day to the old town and it still be nothing.
Full of Christmas cheer !. A beautiful square surrounded by churches and other spectacular architecture. The markets, decorations etc. added to the festive atmosphere.
Great atmosphere and good music!. Loved the food and hot wine, disliked the prices and quality of goods on offer - could have done better.

Christmas Markets. We went the weekend the markets opened for the holidays, it was a lot of fun to hear the carols being sung and to see the traditional handcrafted Czech items. The Astronomical clock is phenomenal - read up on it before you go so you understand all the various skeletons, angelic figures and such. You absolutely have to be there at sunset going into the evening to see the gothic Tyn Church glow in the night sky. We were taken back by that. I wish we would have gone inside St. Nicholas Church after we got home I saw the baroque faccade inside and I regretted not visiting.
Lovely. It's dificult to find another city like this one. Everything is absolutely beautifull and so well preserved.

Plenty to see and do. There is a lot of history in a small area in Prague - the Castle and Cathedral are easily accessible via Karlov Most (Charles Bridge) and a short but fairly steep climb up the hill.Don't miss the Old Square, with the Astronomical Clock, and the many churches and cathedrals, but also explore the small streets just off it where you can find craft markets and the Hard Rock Cafe.Wenceslaus Square is a bit of a tourist trap, so if you are shopping you know what to expect, but most shops are happy to indulge in a bit of bartering so don't feel that you have to pay the marked price!
Pleasant holiday spirit. We were there the first weekend in December and the Christmas decorations were displayed. Nice festive atmosphere with lots of music events in the old town.
amazing. as rest of prague thsi is amazing , everywhere you go , you will find yourself taking pictures as it that type of place
Fairytail Appearance. This was at Christmas and everyone was there. Lots of lights at night and simply an enchanting fairy tail in appearance.
Christmas in the city. They just started their Christmas markets in the square...very festive.
jewish heritage. all the old synagogues, jewish cemetary with the grave of the great Mahral, and jewish museums

You've got to see it to believe it!. I found Old Town quite by mistake...it was like walking into a whole different world. It was sunny and late in the day and it was just gorgeous. I highly recommend visiting Old Town!

must see Christmas illuminations. fantastic atmosphere, magical! An enormous Christmas tree, carol singers, floodlit historic buildings, hot grog and freshly cooked local food. Plenty of restaurants and late night shopping too.
Bars tend to be a little pricey. AVOID the restaturants and bars that line Old Town Square - they are an utter rip off! Better value over the bridge in Mala strana (lesser town)

Nice to get lost. Sometimes while travelling you take a wrong turn and a little seed of panic starts to grow until you catch sight of something you recognize and reclaim your bearings. This is one of the few places I have been that knowing where you were was not important at all, I was too busy being captivated by the architecture, shop displays, and people watching. Weave your way through and don't forget to look up!
Grand and beautiful. The Old town at Xmas is a fairy story come real. The magnificent architecture surrounding the Xmas markets and incredible Christmas tree will take your breath away.
Good city area. Excellent area to stroll, taking in shop windows, street markets, architecture, and atmosphere.

picturesque. Like the rest of Prague very touristy and crowded Take your photos VERY late at night when its all floodlit and much emptier .It fells very safe even in the small hours of the night. seek out some cellar jazz venues nearby too!
Christmas Markets. Market in Old Town square was biggest and best. Enjoyed sitting under the Christmas Tree drinking Hot Wine or just ambling among the stalls
worth a visit. we stayed in the old town and we loved everything about it
Lovely Place to Visit, esp with Christmas markets. Beautiful Place to visit and walk around, much to see and do. Christmas markets currently going on are marvelous! Very festive.
beautiful city!. it was really beautiful with lots to do. The Christmas market was just kicking off in the square. I found a new favorite treat! Trdelnik!
beautiful and atmospheric. glorious buildings and architecture; only the tatty souvenir shops let it down
The place to go. Lot's of shops, little restaurants. Very historic as you might imagine; cobblestone streets, cool architecture, museums
Hauntingly Beautiful in the Fall. Beautiful architecture. Must see the clock. Have some hot chocolate and a sausage and beer on the street.
Old World Charm. Old town is RICH in history! The architecture and charm of the city is unequaled!
A wonderful old town. The whole town is restored and the beautiful houses are like pearls on a string.
Pretty and full of history. so pretty and loved the astonomical clock and climbing the tower . The visit to the tower coincided well with the change of the hour. Brill
loved it. really enjoyed our walks through the old town with its lovely shops and restaurants

Well preserved Old Town. Had a wonderful tour of the Jewish area including the synagogues and musseums as well as the cemetery which dates to about 1650. It was a 3 1/2 hour walking tour which is not overly strenuous and given by the Wittmann our company.
Old Town in Praue. Lots of narrow streets with interesting small cobblestone patterns, shops, restauraces (restaurants), historical sites

Nicest Square in Prague. There are a lot of food stands where you can have dinner for €5. If you are able to spend a little more money, I recommend you to have dinner in some of the restaurant that are in front of the Astronomical Clock (Orloj).

Picture Perfect. Easy to navigate, clean, many food and beverage options nearby.
Be certain to visit in the evening as many sights are nicely illuminated.
So Pretty. Standing in the town square was like being in a fairytale. The Tyn Church looks like it is straight out of Harry Potter!

My favorite attraction in Prague. Eveytime I come to Prague I need to go to the Old Town Square - it has a sort of mystical impact on me, particularly seeing the old Tyn Church looking behind the newer buildings on the square. I try to avoid the clock tower which draws hordes of tourists for the changing of the hour.
Worth the time spent viewing. The buildings were mostly untouched by WW2 and are quite ornate but getting a bit ratty round the edges.
History at home. all streets are full of history. take a guide at first and after you can choose whats best to see more of
Good, not great. A warren of small shops, mostly of little interest. Overrun with tourists.

Compact and walkable. Such a variety in a small area, you can't beat the characteristic medieval town plan for making a purposeful journey or a random stroll into an enjoyable event. Apart from the obvious big draws there are some excellent lesser ones to be discovered. Music and architecture, food and drink, all (usually) of high standard. Not a tourist trap either.

you are here. cobbled streets everywhere,we got 'lost' nearly everyday..fabulos place to get lost tho! there are some fantastic buildings to be seen,and they look even better at night when they are lit up!
Excellent!. The old town it's a great place for shopaholics and those looking for great food and entertainment. You can't be in Prague without visiting the Old Town. It's a must!

Remarkable. A gem, when you go here you will know why they call Prague is the Paris of the east. Follow the medieval cobblestones and alleyways, take in this truly unique architecture, and browse the shops but don't get too sucked into tourist traps. There are some good restaurants in Old Town but expect to pay more in this area. I’ve been to Prague three times in four years and this is one aspect of the city that keeps me coming back.

great historical center. good historical center, showing a nice piece of european history. the center might be a bit too crowded with tourists, but that’s to expect in such a main attraction. Many restaurants and shops are available nearby, and metro stations are easily accessible, where you can easily reach other parts of the city, like for example the historical castle.
Prague Old Town. Beautiful, big square with breath-taking buildings all around. Great views from the Old Town hall tower

A spectacle. Wonderful views of exceptional buildings in all directions. Go up the clock tower. Listen to the trumpeter announcing the hours. See inside the Tyn Church and do a lunchtime concert in St Nicolas' Church.
Avoid eating in the astronomical price restaurants all around. Look for the FREE guided walks - there are some!
Extraordinay. We like the history, the art, the legends, the people.
I like it. Historical centre was close to Hotel Suite Home. 10 minutes walk.

Wonderful Prague. I liked all, it was very clean, friendly and nice.
It was a little crowded.
Astronomical clock. Astronomical clock, you must see it. There is a nice game every hour happening on the clock's.
Pay up or just look. Disliked the fact that all the attractions charge for entrance even the churches. They seem to have the tourists by the wallet and they know it.
Must See!. Beautiful!! Do not miss this place!!! Its like stepping into a fairy tale world!! I miss it already!! hehe

A must!. I liked the feeling of being a storybook character. I felt like this the whole time I was in Prague. Look up and breathe deep and just take it all in. The views were astounding. Make sure you wear really good footwear though as walking on cobblestone gets really tiring after many days in a row.
Amazing!. Every time you turn around, there is another photo opportunity. The Charles bridge and its surroundings are just amazing.
Fairytale. I love Old Town in this city. It's so romantic! I feel like I'm in a fairytale when I look around, the people, the buildings, the smell <3 The best place in the world for me.. <3
november fog. go there in november and be there before 8 am - you will not regret early wake up, not crowded with tourists and you have the fairy tale for yourself :)
Rip off. Do not buy the food from the stalls. They will rip you off
If you miss this, you missed Prague.. busy, and very touristy, but a must see-- if you want to, be sure to go up the clock tower, elevator up.. ramp down.

Oldf Town. We loved the sense of history as we walked through the streets. The architecture of the buildings that were centuries old was magnificent, and wherever we looked we saw beauty both natural and manmade.

Amazing!!!. Old Town Prague is something that must be experienced as words cannot capture its beauty or its soul. It is truly amazing and a feast for all the senses. I know I will return and savor it again and again!
Old Town. Old Town is a beautiful place. So many different types of architecture and a beautiful place. We spent part of each of the 3 days at Old Town. LOVED IT!
Very Historic. Good to see, especially all the archtecture. Very well kept and clean and tidy. Lots of tourists in the area and plenty to see
What could have been.... Prague, was barely bombed in the wars, the result of this is amazing architecture in every direction..

Magnet for every tourist visiting Prague. Also where newly wed couples have their wedding photos taken amongst the crow. Liked the opera, ballet, jazz and classical concerts. Did not like the cost of living! Two mid-morning drinks cost Euros 10.- and an evening meal of one main course each and a bottle of wine was at least Euros 40.- Tickets for a three-course tabel d'hote dinner menu with jazz - but without drinks - was £50 each (Euros 55.- per person)

Delightful Old Town. Very clean and well kept,the buildings are amazing. Close compact area be bold and go off down alleys and side streets to see what you can discover. We found really good cheap Pubs selling excellent beer and good food, best Burger I have ever had said my partner at 1 place. Serve your own beer from on table taps, now that is an experience.
A must see. Really like the architecture here. Very impressive.
Clean streets, but graffiti on lots of buildings. Lots of graffiti all over prague's buildings, which is a great shame.
This is a must do. There is so much to see and do here. So beautiful and clean. It can get very crowded with tourists, but it is utterly charming.

Throw away the map. Just let your eye determine where you go - follow a street that looks interesting. But be careful - you have to look up to admire the wonderful architecture and those cobbles can trip you up! You can find delightful cafes and bars with few to no tourists and have a true local experience.
Kept drawing me back. OK I had a good map but part of the delight was the discovery of new narrow streets and buildings to visit. Lots of churches - sadly not all of them open for visitors.
Enjoyable Walk. Always great walking through Stare Mesto, looking at shops and grabbing a bite to eat.

Best Old Town in Europe. Small enough to walk around even for those with limited mobility, and a music lovers dream (Jazz). Take your appetite, and enjoy some of the best beer outside Bavaria. Of course it is right next to Bavaria, but that's why the beer is so good

Praha City Tour in a Skoda. What a fantastic way to see nearly all of the City of Prague! Were unsure how reliable or comfortable the old Skoda vehicle would be, but the whole experience was great. Our driver and guide - quite a character with a wealth of knowledge on Prague's history, was most informative and very entertaining. Highly recommend this experience. Excellent value for money.
OK. The old town is nice but can be confusing to walk around in. Make sure you get a map and refer to it often to avoid getting lost.
Wow. Please do not forget to walk around for hours to fulfill the mood of ancient.
beautiful but crowded. a cross between the beauty of Paris and the feel of Times Sq. (lots of tourists and souvenir shops
Excellent. Loved the old town - beautiful buildings, interesting history, lovely cobbled streets.
Wandering. Just wander around and absorb the place. You see more by taking it slow.
The Old Town. Brilliant, so photogenic, shops, eating establishments to suit all pursestrings, could spend all day on the bridge
A must in Prague. You haven't been to Prague until you've been here.

Keep on walking. You can walk round here and just enjoy the narrow streets and all the shops and the beautiful architecture, my only complaint is there are a lot of shops selling the predictable holiday souveniers which spoils it a bit but we've all got to make a living.

Narrow streets, lots of little shops. We thoroughly enjoyed walking around Old Town. Lots of narrow streets (with no traffic) and little shops selling all kinds of stuff (and a good number selling tourist tat!). Worth a day strolling around camera poised, with the occasional stop for a beer!

A sense of reliving the late middle ages. Almost every building we came across was well kept and had the feel of a true rellic.The majority of the turist shops were "soliciting"all kinds of Absinth bottles and accesories to this notorius elixir and the turists came in droves to buy them.The Jewish quarter and cemetary are a must to see.

Historic and Charming. The old town section is a great place for strolling through the narrow streets with charming buildings. You can feel the history and medieval era. You can find decent restaurants and good ice cream while strolling. We did a 6 hour tour the first day to get our bearings and learn some insights. It was very helpful and it included the castle district. Most of the strolling areas are cobblestone or small square stone sidewalks. So you need very comfortable walking shoes with well-padded soles. You also need to be careful while walking because some of the sidewalks have portions of the stone missing and need repair.

This is it. This is Prague. This is the place.. The small winding streets, the Old Town square, the medieval clock, the market stalls, the bars and restaurants, the Bohemian Crystal shops; this is the Prague you came to see. Stop and tarry a while. Buy some food, have a beer. Watch the tourists. Be bohemian.

WOW so much history to see. Loved walking through the old town of Prague. In our 3 days in Prague we went there several times to feel the atmosphere of the history. Loved all the cute lane ways. Enjoyed listening to the hussle and bussle of the crowds.

A great old town. Well Prague old town is one of the most beautiful old towns in Europe and of course a must do thing in Europe.Many towers you can go up in and get nice pictures from. Museums, churches and so on.Marketplaces.A lot of nice buildings, cafes, bars, restaurants. Always full of life but of course mostly turists.

Neat spot, but touristy - be careful. We live in Prague and have been here many many times. The markets offered at different times throughout the year (especially Christmas!) are an extra treat, beyond the other sights that tourists come for in Old Town.That said, the prices are astronomical and the food/drinks offered in the area are usually of average to poor quality, with the exception of the fresh food stalls that are set up when they have the marketplace laid out. More importantly, because it can be quite packed with tourists, pickpockets weave their way through the crowds, and on multiple occasions we have seen the pickpockets running away, the stunned tourists shouting, and the completely unaware individuals checking their pockets and purses because they think they've just misplaced something.Enjoy what this place has to offer, but pay attention to your surroundings!

Centuries without war mean a wonderful old town. Europe has been a continent torn by wars over the centuries. Prague has been lucky enough not to have been touched in any material way by this for centuries. Only in the last days of WWII there have been some minor fights. Couple this together with the lack of resources in socialistic time which meant no big changes and a tschech government that has seen pretty early the touristical value of the old town and renovated generously you do come to an old town which has survived the centuries pretty well and gives a good insight into how this city was built, dozens of architectural monuments, statues, paintings, interesting old cafes and restaurants, small hidden streets and attractions, a lot of old churches with the old glass paintings mostly still intact and a more or less unique atmosphere. Additionally the gastronomy has picked up so you can have a good al fresco meal in the summer at dozens of places. Take your time to enjoy it but beware that during high season it is packed and in the old town you do of course pay higher prices that just a couple of hundred meters away. Also be aware of scums when it comes to currency exchange. Read the signs of the exchange offices carefully.

you have to spend some time in Old Town. We were in Prague for 7 days and we went to Old town 4 different days. Each time we went we were passing through but there was something great going on and we had to stop and see. We first took a tour which was the best way to understand the clock and the other structures in the old town square, it is important to know about the flood and reasoning behind why the structures are a certain way so please take a tour. The other times we went to have some street food and watch the performers. There were jugglers using fire torches and people in costume walking on stilts. This is a great place to hang out and just people watch as well. The food and hotels right in this area are priced higher then other areas so be sure to eat a sit down meal outside of old town so you can get a great deal and not so touristy food. Old town is just plain good fun.

Touristy but definitely worth the walk around. Quite touristy but good for a walk around doing some window shopping and taking in the style of buildings you are surrounded by. Worth the foot trip.Food & drink is very expensive around this area so go a few streets back and you will get just as nice food for half the price.

Beautiful city. The old town is huge and great. Actually, all over Prague there are very well maintained old buildings. The square in the old town has a great atmoshpere due to all small restaurants and cofee shops and it is always full of people. Enjoy czeck dark beer and great food.

very touristy but very cool to walk around. We traveled in the summer and Old Town was a little overwhelming just because it was so crowded but the narrow cobblestone streets and cool architecture made it fun to walk around. There are also tons of shops and restaurants so it's very tourist friendly. We saw the astronomical clock and wandered around taking pictures of all the interesting buildings. Then we went into way too many shops and probably spent way too much but there was just so much cool stuff. There was tons of artwork, glass art, and puppets that kept catching our eyes. This is a great area for walking around and doing your souvenir shopping.
